review_body: Our weekend at the Hyatt to celebrate our wedding anniversary was filled with surprises. The hotel upgraded our room, gave us a pass to the VIP Lounge and a couple of complimentary drinks to mark our special occasion. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, professional, courteous and gracious. Couldn't ask for a better way to make this an anniversary to remember.

We stayed here 4 nights the standards met were higher than expected. The location was fantastic - couldnâ€™t get much closer to Union Square. Our rooms were spotless, very roomy and bed was extremely comfortable. View from window in15th floor was fab. We were allocated interconnecting rooms as we had requested and both rooms were lovely. I used the hotel gym which had an amazing view from 34th floor. The hotel staff were very attentive, friendly and made us feel very welcome. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again the next time we visit SF.

The Hyatt is very central and convenient to walk to most places in the city which is a huge plus. However it wasnâ€™t the best stay Iâ€™ve experienced by far. The room that I was first allocated had 2 double beds (for just 1 person), was cramped and you can hear the street noise. This was particularly evident because of the current protests happening at several hotels in the area, it is very loud and disturbing so be aware that this is going on all day and night until about 10pm. Ask for a room on the Stockton st side. Itâ€™s a shame that the receptionist didnâ€™t mention anything about this when I checked in. I asked to be transferred to another room on the 2nd day, and it was rejected because they were booked up. On the 3rd day I asked again and the gentleman on reception transferred me straight away and was extremely helpful, even when I went back to check the room for my passport. Overall the king suite was very nice, the bed comfortable and the amenities all great. However there was a very bad smell coming from the drain in the bathroom that you could smell as soon as you walk in the door, luckily I spent most of the day away from the hotel, but it was very unpleasant. The room service food was pretty bland/average as well so Iâ€™d recommend going to a restaurant in the city or nearby as there are much better options available.

This hotel is in a great location. The hotel rooms seem very dated and the bathrooms have no counter space to get ready because the sink is too big. The showers have a hand sprayer instead of a big shower head making the shower just ok. There is a strike at the Marriott across the street making it very loud at times from 6am-10pm. The Hyatt tried their best to accommodate this. Overall, the hotel was ok because could use some improvements.

The location doesn't get much better than where the Hyatt is, next to union square, close to restaurants, shop and anything your heart can desire.The room was as you would expect of a luxury hotel: spacious, clean, large tv, good shower, electronic blinds and a spacious closet. I was up to the 7th floor and didn't hear many street noises, only in the background.Upon checkout, it appeared there was a mistake in my booking and they had expected me a day sooner (one night more). The staff was so kind to arrange things for me to get that night off the bill after I showed my paperwork. The only comment is about the breakfast. No complaints about the quality but it was incredibly expensive. A breakfast buffet is 34USD without tax and without tip. It came as a surprise to me and with a total cost of a whopping 43USD, the most expensive breakfast I have ever had anywhere in the world. Not worth it.All in all, I would stay here again...and get breakfast somewhere else.

Dirty hallways, loud rooms, terrible restaurant food, over priced wine, treadmill didnâ€™t work in the health club. Not worth the money. Lots of other great hotels around. I will stay somewhere else next time

Right by Union Square, can walk everywhere or take the trolley right from around the corner. Lots of food options. Hotel is nice and service is great. Don't do valet parking, not worth it since self parking is just across the street.

Brand you can trust to deliver a superior experience. Great location with access to business centers, shopping, and fine restaurants. Staff went well above my expectations. With so many choices in San Francisco, I plan to look here first.

We stayed in room 2124, an executive suite. The room was nice with a separate bedroom, electronic blinds and two bathrooms. Clean. Two robes and two sets of slippers. The tv in the living room wasnâ€™t working and they replaced it within the hour. The service is what youâ€™d expect from a premium Hyatt property. But I asked for a quiet room and this one is directly next to the elevator shaft. Not quiet. Also the room faces west and the Marriott hotel which currently has the most obnoxious protestors banging drums and screaming into megaphones from 7am till 9 or 10pm. Thankfully we sleep with a white noise machine regularly so between ear plugs and two phones blaring ambient sound we were almost able to drown out the constant audible assault. I have never been so happy to check out of a hotel. Sorry Grand Hyatt SFO but we wonâ€™t be back.

Typical Hyatt and nothing wrong with it. We got our rooms on time though the check-in process was a bit slow. We had a very noisy room the first night and heard all the elevator movement. After we told them in the morning, we got moved during the day and they took care of everything while we were touring the city. Very good handling and customer service.Hint: order a quite room upfrontThe location is great for everybody who likes to discover a city on foot. You can walk everywhere from China Town, downtown, the cable car stations and even all the way to the Golden Gate bridge.

The location is great, I stayed here for a conference and was able to get to all the local bars and nightlife no problem :) It's downtown SF, so it's crowded, noisy and you'll need to watch where you step, but this hotel is in the center of it all! Food and drinks in the hotel restaurants were notably bad, seriously, not even basic drinks were right, so you'll need to get out in the neighborhood, but you didn't come to SF to eat at a Hyatt anyways. Rooms v average, look like every other Hyatt, staff exceedingly experienced, professional and available to help with every detail. Valet and motor lobby well managed considering the challenge created by their location.

Booked here with work and I know I can expect the same level of experience with Grand Hyatt no matter where I go. Check in was smooth and the room was great. Complimentary late check out and everything was lovely

Room was very clean and people very kind, we did not use ac system because was very noise, really we did not need. The most important thing is that room was very clean. We request to change towels daily and they did. Bed was very clean also

we stayed a total of 6 nights over two periods during our trip. We were only informed of some benefits when checking in second time example bottled water can be provided, high speed wifi access and phone calls including international calls can be made at no extra charge. please note also there is a potential problem in design flaw in your room table. there is a gap adjoining the wall and table which a piece of paper or small items such as earring can drop through which cannot be retrieved as the table is fixed and dropped items cannot be picked up from floor or side of table. A piece of paper fell in but unfortunately i could not take it out.guests staying there should be aware.

Staff was very professional! Concierge service was friendly and exceptional! There was a little bit of a noise which the Hyatt couldnâ€™t control as it was due to protestors at The Marriott! The quality of service was great! Really made the stay so much nicer and I would definitely stay at the Hyatt again!

We had a Bay view from our Room and that definitely was the highlight of our stay. The room was listed at 312 sq. ft., however it did not seem that large. We had the Sunday Brunch and were terribly disappointed. The price was $34.95 per person but the quality and variety of the food was very disappointing, we do not recommend eating at the hotel.

Great location and very nice hotel for SF weekend. Friendly staff and clean hotel. Some other hotels had union strikers in front banging out catchy tunes beating on 5 gallon water jugs. Glad we were not affected at the Hyatt. The Grand Club option was very nice and would definitely do that again on my next visit.

We have stayed here three other times and prefer this hotel to many others in the SF area. The location is great (right above Union Square) where you are in the heart of Downtown SF as soon as you walk out of the hotel. Our first experience was great because we drove up to SF from the LA area. We were tired from a long drive and arrived earlier than our check in time. They noticed that and welcomed us and upgraded us for free to the King Club Access room without us asking for it. The Club Access rooms are only on floors 30-35 (highest five floors) and give access to the Club Lounge where you can have free drinks, water, appetizers, and a 360 view of SF. The rooms are modern and clean and the beds are helpful after touring SF. Check in was easy through their app, and you can also request room service from their app as well. Valet is right across the street in a garage for about $40/night. We chose to self park for $30/night. I've never experience too much city noise at the high floors. Staff has always been friendly and easy to work with and we are planning to stay there for a fourth time at the end of this year. Great location as you have Starbucks right across the street, and access to the trolley on Powell which is the next street over. Not that far of a drive to almost anywhere in SF.

I had stayed at many Hyatt hotels in the US & all over the world and gave them excellent reviews mostly due to great customer service. The Grand Hyatt SF is the very 1st Hyatt that disappointed me. Customer service sucks right from the front door to the front desk, to room service. Hotel & room amenities do not reflect the word "Grand" Hyatt. Rooms are small and there's constant noise that sounds like a subway underneath. No slippers or robe available in the room. I asked for slippers, water, and more toiletries on our 1st night. Waited for almost 3 hrs. 2nd night, I stopped by the front desk before going to our room after a long day of touring SF w/ my family to ask for some bottled water for me & my family. BTW, we booked 2 rooms for this stay. The answer I got was that I could always call to order the items from my room. I said we just walked back in. The front desk lady repeated that I should just call from my room but that she will make the request to bring them up to our rooms. Waited for hrs until I found out from a family member that the items were brought to just 1 of the 2 rooms. Maybe they were short staffed? Or maybe the culture of the environment is just different? Or maybe we looked too plain or tacky that we didn't deserve the attention or service? All I know is that this hotel experience was far from grand from a Hyatt hotel standard. I will continue to book a stay at a Hyatt Hotel in my future travels but won't come back nor will recommend Grand Hyatt SF.

No customer appreciation! We stay here several times a year and they still do not acknowledge that fact. We paid for a city view room and got, not the east side financial district city view, but the back of the building where there are loud protesters picketing at another hotel.When I called to relocate to a room with the view we paid for, we were told that this side of the building is a city view as well. Well, it is not. So beware, their upgrades are not worth the price as they bait and switch you to a lower grade room even though you pay for a view. They are more interested in their "new eco-friendly" practices than customer appreciation or service. Upon checking in, we did not get a "welcome back, we appreciate your business". All we got was a speech about eco friendliness and that we now have to pay an extra 25$ destination fee and all we got for that was a few coupons that we can't use and a map.We will now be staying elsewhere from now on. The Grand Hyatt San Francisco just lost a very loyal customer.

Very poor sound isolation between rooms, especially in the corner units where there are three rooms with doors facing each other. One can hear every coming and going. Also, a surprising number of rooms are connecting rooms, with even normal TV usage being audible from your neighbour. Definitely ask for a non-connecting room here. Rooms are also getting pretty dated and could use some updates. Were kept clean though. Wifi was awful and had to use my phone tethering and chew through the data.Staff was a plus. They dealt with a 2am moaning/groaning wakeup from a passionate neighbour and promptly moved me so I could sleep and getup for my conference next AM.

Fabulous fabulous fabulous as always and a real treat and when we left forward to in San Francisco!We are always treated like special guest and the rooms are spotless and the service is excellent and the food is something we always enjoy.

Was pleasantly surprised at how great this hotel is..Great location on Union Square and was clean and updated. I've traveled and stayed SF many times and live not far away and this hotel exceeded my expectations

Fine hotel and great location. Grand Club was excellent as was the restaurant. I really appreciated the wide variety of free newspapers in the Grand Club. This hotel will be on my short lists for future stays in San Francisco.

Stayed on 27th floor great city view. Classy place, comfortable bed. Shower and bathroom nice. Modern look, newer feel. Union Square is central to many places you would want to go. Sound from outside the room and neighboring rooms did seam to penetrate into our a room a bit loud.

Nice location close to CVS, Starbucks, Apple Store, within walking distance to Market Street and Moscone Center. But if they assign the restaurant to go for breakfast and you go to a wrong restaurant, they will impose additional charge to your room.

Large rooms, with lots of nice touches. I liked the vanity area outside the bathroom and the bowl-like sink. It felt luxurious. Great location near Union Square. Surprised by their additional tourism fee. So include that in the budget. It's not in the cost of the room advertised.

Great location-smack in the middle of Union Square. From one of the higher floors, the views are amazing. Other than that, I was underwhelmed. The hotel is badly in need of updating. Rooms are large but old and dingy. At $700-800 for a single room with 2 queens, I expected nicer accommodations. Room service is limited to â€œto goâ€ù style prepackaged items. For this hotel, itâ€™s all about the location and not much else.

Very comfortable hotel room with great location on Union Square. NEar major shopping, Powel Street cable car line, China town, restaurants. A great location for touring. Service was very good. Refrigerator ,coffee maker in room. VA let parking with also an option to self park in garage across street.

I stayed at the Hyatt for work. The experience couldnâ€™t have been worse. First I was charged a more expensive room to accommodate for my check in. Second I was given a room on the 29th floor that was dated (from all the refurbished rooms). Third there was never complimentary water on a 350 usd a night plus tax hotel stay. Fourth breakfast was not included. Fifth the room cleanliness was non existent, towels smelled like humidity and sheets smelled like unwashed. Sixth the key never worked so I had to go back down every day to have it fixed. Seventh thereâ€™s been a strike for 3 weeks from the Marriott hotel and since 7 am you can hear the demonstrators scream because walls and windows are paper thin. Also you can listen to water in the pipelines and the small minibar be turned on and off. I definitely donâ€™t recommend staying in this hotel.

The hotel has an unbeatable location right next to Union Square, thus allowing you to get anywhere by any type of transportation you prefer. It is also precious for anyone wishing to walk to very good restaurants and stores right at the heart of downtown San Francisco. The staff was always available, they would always offer you free bottles of water. A special mention goes to the ladies at the concierge who were very kind, professional, and full of invaluable directions for our days as eager tourists. Really a great stay in an unforgettable hotel for anyone who wants to be comfortable and at home when visiting the city.

I have stayed at this hotel several times. It is a great location on Union Square walking distance to many of the San Francisco sights and Moscone Center. The hotel rooms are clean and comfortable but a bit dated. The closet dresser is not really big enough to unpack your clothing. The hotel staff was great. They get the grand prize for the biggest bathroom sink I have ever seen in a hotel!

hotel has a good location with close proximity to amenities such as pharmacy, restaurants,Stores etc and service is generally friendly. room is decent size. Nothing spectacular but it will fulfill all the basic needs. Visited the bar at L2. Happy hour rates are very reasonable.

We arrived in town before noon and they were able to accommodate early check in luckily. There were protests at several hotels from another brand and the front desk staff warned us about that when going over room choices. The location right next to Union Square is great. The 1 thing I found confusing was that I only found free coffee in the lobby on Thursday morning but not the other 2 mornings. I might have drank coffee that was part of a convention I suppose. It seems like everywhere else I've ever stayed offered at least a cup of coffee.

We just returned from a long weekend in San Francisco. It was suggested to me by a friend who used to live in SF that we stay in Union Square. She was right. This location is close to many high end stores, restaurants, bars, CVS, the Big Bus stop, etc. We arrived at the hotel at 11am and to our surprise, they had a room ready. They also offered us bottled water, a $30 food credit and a free upgrade for internet (we just had to have them take off the charges at check out). The ladies at the concierge were FANTASTIC - super friendly and gave lots of great ideas. There was a little food cart with drinks and pastries in the am which was convenient. Benches were out friend if you were waiting for an Uber or wanting to smoke. A nice, clean hotel and we would most definitely return. The location was wonderful as it was pretty central to everything and in a nice area. Being from out of town, my husband and I get nervous in a big city, but we had no problems getting around here.

Annoying demonstrations from other hotel employees at Marriott/ Westin et al. All day and most of evening noise made it difficult to rest. The construction and trash and homeless/ begging on the streets while walking to convention was very disappointing.

As frequent travelers, we have stayed at plenty of hotels. However, our pleasant experience at this property from the kindness of the staff to the quality of the rooms have made us loyal Hyatt guests. Our five day stay made us feel right at home. I highly recommend this property to anyone visiting the area.

The room itself was decent, the mattress was a bit worn and very hard. What was not pleasant was the outside noise of protesters all-day-long starting at 7am each day of my stay. The noise proofing on the room was pretty light, and this was not a great wake up call. Made the business trip difficult to get any rest. The location around the hotel was a bit sketchy, but that might be a description of San Francisco in general.

Satisfied with experience. View of city from room was not that great. Sleep was not that great as the traffic sound was audible in the room which was disturbing the sleep. Room aesthetics was quite good.

Itâ€™s taken me a while to write this review. But here it goes.I only stayed for one night, during a very long layover. The staff is amazing!! Great customer service, theyâ€™re really attentive to your needs. They also help you with extra stuff. Since I spent 24h in San Francisco, they helped me sort out fun activities for the day. The food at their restaurant is delicious!! A bit slow, but itâ€™s worth the wait. The hotel is located super close to the airport, but itâ€™s also rather close to downtown, so you can get around easily. Uber was a great choice for me. The beds are very comfortable; the rooms are fine. Itâ€™s not a vacation resort or anything. But for short stays is perfect.

We stayed for 4 nights at the end of our LA to SF holiday. Check in was fast and efficient and we were soon in our room on 32nd floor. A good view from the room.We ate breakfast each morning. Although the restaurant is not large we were always seated promptly. Very good service and a good selection of hot and cold foods to start the day.We had a couple of drinks in the bar and the service again was excellent.The location is good for Union Square, although there is large amount of redevelopment going on around this area so it is a bit of a building site.Easy access either via walking or short Uber to all the sites.From the back entrance of the hotel you can walk straight into the Apple Store.Would stay again.

Great welcome on arrival; the receptionist was really friendly and on seeing how exhausted we were promptly gave us free bottles of water and a voucher for a couple of free drinks at the bar - great start to our holiday.Our room on the 11th floor was fabulous - large, with two fabulously comfortable double beds, and a great view. It was spotlessly clean with linen and towels changed every other day, more often on request. The bathroom was a good size with a great shower and very nice toiletries, which were re-stocked on a daily basis.My one complaint would be that on one night we were unable to use the bar as it had been blocked off for the exclusive use of a conference group. If you wanted a drink you had to sit in the restaurant area and had a very limited choice of drinks - bottled beer or house wine. I expect better from a hotel of this size and quality. We like to round off our day with a drink in the bar and this was a disappointing end to an otherwise fabulous day. A small irritation but worth noting. I appreciate that conferences provide a good revenue source for large hotels but this shouldn't be at the expense of other guests who have paid good money to stay there.

This is a wonderful hotel in an excellent part of downtown. It is walking distance to several great restaurants and shopping. And the cable car stop is within the same block, making it very easy to get around the area. Itâ€™s also a beautiful and well kept hotel. Highly recommend.

I don't think anyone is reading reviews for this hotel because they wonder if it's sketchy or not. Spoiler: it's not. The bigger question is probably whether or not it's worth the money. I'd say it is. There are certainly cheaper hotels in San Francisco but you might not get a bathroom, or the location might be weird (the Tenderloin is right off of Union Square after all). After looking into prices at all of the nearby hotels, the Grand Hyatt actually isn't even the priciest, and you know you're getting a nice hotel.Check in was quick and friendly. I booked under two reservations due to using Hyatt points for one night and they had already combined the reservations with no issue. They gave me several bottles of water and let me know I could come back and get more if needed any time. I like that! Though the tap water actually tasted perfectly fine to me so I didn't end up grabbing more.The room was actually bigger than I expected for the location. I know hotel rooms in the Union Square area aren't going to be huge. We had friends over and the room was plenty big enough for 4 adults to sit comfortably. The only weird thing with the room was the fact that there was no light upon entering. There was a light switch near the door but it wasn't actually connected to anything. Since we checked in late the room was pitch black and we had to open the door to get enough light to try to find a light in the room. We just didn't turn the lights near the bed off after that, so really not a big deal; I just felt it was an odd oversight.Aside from that, the hotel was perfect. The location is great, right next to Union Square. There is a large convenience store (CVS I think?) right on the corner next door, which was super handy. There are a million food options nearby and a Bart/Muni stop just across the park.I will just mention that I think the "destination fee" is a giant rip off but I realize many hotels in many cities are charging it now. I found very few hotels in SF that weren't charging one so this isn't particular to the Grand Hyatt. On a better note, you get a food and beverage credit here, so if you actually use it you can mitigate the fee.As I said, I do think this hotel is worth the price tag. It's not the cheapest for sure, but it's also not the priciest, and you know you're getting a quality room and an awesome location.

My wife and I were traveling for a convention. The hotel is within 10 minutes-walk to Moscone Center. Safe and very good location. Rooms are clean, comfortable and hotel service was above average. Good food.

One of the best experience we had at this hotelStaff, customer service, location, rooms everything was perfect will definitely use this hotel if we every cisit san francisco highly recommend this to everyone

I have stayed here many times in the past 12 months. While currently undergoing lobby renovation, you would not know it. It is quiet, clean friendly. I highly recommend this hotel for its great central location.

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco is in the perfect location in Union Square. Stayed there for 5 days on business trip, staff in various departments was amazing, very attentive and polite. The Rooms are very spacious and kept clean. Hotel can get very busy at check in, but they do a good job in expedite the process. Hotel is very close to Macy's, Apple store, various high-end boutiques and Market st. Hotel have a nice lobby to relax. Donâ€™t forget to check out the 36fl for the view of SF. If you are visiting or have an event, I would recommend the Grand Hyatt SF.

Overall stay was ok, given its Grand Hyatt and the price I paid, expectation was higher but I must say the house keeping was prettt disappointing as the service during my 1 week stay was inconsistent- either missing the floor towel, 1 less bath towel or not replenishing the shower gel though was empty! Room delivery is expensive (USD7) - of course I didnâ€™t not want to pay!

Our check-in experience was great. We were notified immediately when our room was ready. Upon coming back to get into our room, we requested our luggage from one of the gentlemen who handled the bags and he was extremely rude. He took the tickets and just said "What colour are these?", I told him one was grey and the other black and before I could even detail the luggage, he left me speaking to myself. He came back with the bags and I said "I wish you would've stayed so I could describe them to you to make things easier". Mid-sentence he cut me off and said "That's fine." and just dismissed my comment. No more dialogue was interchanged. Someone working with guests this closely should have more tact and be courteous. This was the first thing I remembered about my stay and it did not reflect well on the Grand Hyatt.

Picked the Hotel mainly for its location and it was well worth paying that bit more .We'd booked a king room with bay view which was comfortable and clean albeit a bit tired , views from 23rd floor were great.Staff and check in were efficient but check-out was chaotic and took around 20 minutes and that didn't include any time waiting in a queue . That said it wouldn't deter us from staying again or recommending the Grand Hyatt to others.

Our family booked a bayview room for four nights. Very good location in the union square and the view from room is very beautiful especially at sunset. However the room is quite small especially the bathroom, for us with two young kids. Fairly clean room, but you need to call for bottle water supply. It happened the Marriott staffs cross the street were on strike that week and they started their protest at 7am every morning, very annoying, but at the checkout the front desk lady gave us a credit of $40 as gesture which was still very appreciated. For valet parking it's expensive for over $70 daily, just as tips for those who need the parking, there is a public parking right cross the street which costs you only the half.

Rooms are very spacious and modern, the staff is friendly and has a lot of expertise. Drinks and food can be consumed on the 1st floor in a very attractive and modern / urban set up. The hotel is located in the very centre of the city, with the financial district to be reached within 5 minutes and Nob Hill about 10 walking minutes away from the main entrance. Another advantage (besides a very friendly staff and prime location) is the fact that you are able to safely park your vehicle with assisted self parking just around the block.

Pretty good overall experience, nothing out of the ordinary but as expected. Everything works and is clean, food is what I extended to the price same with service. I stayed during dreamforce, and the location was key

I stayed in the grand Hyatt San Francisco from the 3rd I have never been to a hotel that doesnâ€™t have a slipper or a bath rub in the room You have to ask for everything even the shower cap I spent more than 20 minutes waiting for that Thus is a main thing to be in the bath room I canâ€™t understand why itâ€™s like this Itâ€™s so so annoying.

Located right in the heart of downtown San Francisco, it is not cheap but for Frisco itâ€™s a bargain. The accommodations are nice. Not fancy but much better than most chain hotels. The lobby is graced with beautiful artwork and if you have access to the concierge room it is exceptionally nice with wonderful food. The best part is the bed; first class.

Hotel was clean, but soul-less. Staff were minimalistic. Breakfast room sits approx 30 people, for a 34-storey hotel! No time to stand in line for breakfast, we have Meetings to go to! Kitchen breakfast lady swearing at guests in Spanish as if no one understands...

We stayed 6 night at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco in September. Excellent location and Hoel staff are super friendly and very helpful. The housekeeping staff does an amazing job to keep the rooms spotless. Located just a stone throw away from Union Square and China Town. You will find good shopping and restaurants closer to the hotel.Check in & Check out process is seamless. The doorman's at the front door is very helpful. I had to use the business centre for 30 minutes on a weekend and the front desk staff were very professional even accompanying myself and my wife to the 2 nd floor which is closed on weekends. They made our stay very comfortable. If you can get a bay view room, you will have an awesome view of the San Francisco Bay from your room. We will stay there again on your next trip to San Francisco.

Disappointing - very noisy, you can hear everything from the neighbor rooms!!! room rate differences between booking confirmation and folio - very annoying and took a long to explain and to get the understanding of Front desk staff.

When a hotel get's it right it's hard to babbler in a Trip Advisor Review. But since there can't be a ten I would have to say the breakfast restaurant is rushed, there were 100 waiters, ok maybe 50, alright just ten but they were always on the go and the food was so so...........everything else was great. Nice staff-even the 2,000 waiters at breakfast were nice. My room was immaculate, clean, everything worked-even the TV for those who read my yuck Viceroy review. Elevator was quick and OMG I was able to speak in the elevator on a call-ok that's a but rude but it worked. Definitely would stay here again.

let's talk about waht was wrong, the door to the bathroom could be completely closed.the light at the foot bed is not working.And it is so noisy from the street and clim....I think it is not at the level of the price

The Hotel is very central to all places of interest. The Concierge Staff is extremely polite and knowledgeable. I was disappointed by the size of the rooms and the weird sliding bathroom door made of glass, with no lock. Disturbing for co-occupants at night.

My girlfriend and I loved this hotel. The bed was the best we'd slept in for a long time. Huge and comfortable. The staff were onhand and always happy to help with little bits and pieces (printing a document, borrowing an HDMI cable etc.). We were only as high as the 8th floor and even then the views were quite good. Judging by the viewing deck on the 36th floor, the views from higher rooms over Union Square must be amazing.There were even some nice little touches like housekeeping arranging our toothbrushes and shoes in little rows. Not something I'd expect nor is it a big deal but little touches like that are always noticed and welcomed.Ronald on reception was great and very friendly.One thing I would note as I'm sure others have, our booking (via booking.com) made no mention of the $25 per night resort fee that we had to pay on top. You do get some small benefits (namely $10 credit per day at the Starbucks/restaurant) but it would have been nice to know this up front.In any case, it has made me much more likely to stay at Grand Hyatt hotels in future. Felt well worth the money all round; and the location right on Union Square is perfect for walking around the city, getting a bus/cable car/BART etc...

Hotel is well overdue for a major refit.Disappointing for a Grand Hyatt.No restaurant at our time of stay. Food at the bar very limited and poor service.Great central location and close to restaurants, shops and transport.

Very disappointed with the reservation process, the room (no robe, no slippers, lights not working properly, no view, no amenities). Hyatt is resting on laurels of years gone by and have become so corporate and heartless for the guests. The new loyalty program is so confusing in name and trying to use the benefits or free nights is nearly impossible. We have decided to change to other brands as it seems Hyatt does not value the customer but rather looks at profit over quality.

Always looking for something bad, but couldn't find it at the Grand Hyatt. Asked for a quiet room and got it. The automatic shade was way cool. Great Union Square location. My stay was absolutely outstanding!!!

Great room in a great hotel. Our room was quiet and was clean - overlooked Sutter St. Larger than some rooms in SF. Location is superb - in the middle of the Union Square area. Plenty of nearby restaurants and shopping -- close to cable and trolley lines. Doormen were a great help in entering the hotel. Would definitely stay here again.

Excelent location near Union Square, restaurants, ideal for shopping. Walking distance to most locations. I would recommend to anyone visiting the San Francisco Bay Area. Great views from rooftop. Excelent choice!

We stayed two nights at the hotel. The hotel is located in Union Sq. 5 min, very close to all department shops and 5 min from Powell Brat subway station. We were party of four. The room with two queen beds can accomodate two adults and one to two teens. Sturback cofee shop is infront of the hotel to take your morning breakfast.

The hotel is at a perfect location, everything within walking distance and when you walked too far, easy enough to get a cab. The hotel has a nice bar on the second floor if i recall well. We rented a car while we stayed there, which i regret, it mainly stood parked in the parking garage next door for the 3 days we were there. Make sure you take plenty money SF is expensive and don't trip over the homeless people, sadly there are many.

We stayed here beginning of sep for a week , we were on the 17floor hotel in great location to everythingRoom big and adequate althoigh didnt like adjoining room nxt doorStaff pleasent &informativeI would say rooms need updated but didnt spoil our holiday, over all i would give it 3 stars

We visit San Francisco quite often and the Hyatt Union Square is always our hotel of choice. The hotel staff is excellent--registration, luggage assistance, Club level service. Whenever we travel with grandchildren they request the Hyatt as a treat!

The location is fantastic, the staff beyond exceptional ( Ira Trinchera, lounge staff and concierge). Hotel itself needs to be renovated, does not have the Grand Hyatt feel. The staff made the stay better than it would have been. Club lounge not too big but excellent staff, breakfast in the restaurant good. If the hotel matched the staff quality this would be an exceptional hotel.

Hotel is at a great location, very walk-able from the BART station and close to other transit lines. I was at the airport at 4:30am that morning and arrived at the hotel at noon. I was allowed to immediately check into a room on the 6th floor. The room faced the back of a building and was beside the ice machine, but neither affected my one-night stay. At this point I valued the extra time to rest and freshen up more than a view!I returned early in the evening after checking out some of the city and ordered room service for dinner. The lady whose name I forgot but starts with "M" was delightful and we shared a laugh when she thought I ordered "chicarron" when I really just wanted ginger ale. Dinner was promptly delivered, I was advised I could not add a tip to my bill as it was hotel policy, which left me to tip in cash which I did not have enough of. Ended up tipping just under 10%, which considering the expedited delivery, warranted at least 15%. I hope they reconsider this policy, I hate short-changing good customer service.I needed a shower before heading out to an event later in the evening, however the shower head fell off the handle when I turned on the water. Called downstairs and the agent was very apologetic and less than 10 minutes later, maintenance came up and took just 2 minutes to fix the shower! Came back from my event and had a wonderful sleep, perhaps the best I've had in weeks. Check-out the next morning was quick and efficient. I had breakfast at One-up and had a side order of sausages, lovely scrambled eggs and a slightly overpriced, but otherwise tasty smoothie. Service was courteous and efficient.All in all, stay was great, I'd love to come again and stay longer.

Nice hotel and very friendly and helpful staff. I loved the location and we were able to walk everywhere we decided to go. The price was comparable to others that I felt werenâ€™t as nice or located right in the middle of everything to do. The city view at night was fantastic.

The location of this property couldn't get much better if you want to stay close to EVERYTHING in San Francisco. The hotel staff is very friendly, helpful and curteous but it's crazy expensive to stay here. We were there for a conference and, for instance, they wanted over 1 100 USD for coffee for 14 people (we decided to go to Starbuck's across the street instead) and when we needed a HDMI cable for the conference room that we had rented, they charged us $335 for LENDING us one. They cost around $15 to buy ... Of course the $335 included a guy that brought the cable to the conference room and two pieces of duct tape used to tape the cable to the floor to prevent us from tripping on it. Still, the extra $ 320 felt a little like a scam.

We were here for two nights and it was a good location for the Union square area. The rooms were a decent size but a little outdated but the staff was great. The front office manager, Polina, was nice enough to give us an upgraded room to celebrate our anniversary and a bottle of champagne. Great service!

We just loved this hotel and its location to everything. We were greeted at check in by Neil and he gave us his business card in case we needed anything. That was a very nice touch. The room was nice with amazing views. The club room was very nice and the food and drinks were great, but the deserts could have been better. The only complaint we had was that the elevators were very noisy in our room. It didn't bother us during the day, but at about 6:30 in the morning it was tough to sleep because of the noise. We will be back, but hopefully in a different room next time.

We stayed here for 3 nights in Sep 2018. The rooms were spacious and clean and the staff were great. We ate twice in the restaurant (once for breakfast and once in the evening) and really enjoyed the food. The hotel is conveniently located, making it easy to get around the city on foot. Although we really enjoyed our stay here, we did have to move room due to noise on the 1st and 2nd night. We were in a room with a door connecting directly to the room next door. You could hear every movement and noise from the room next door. When we spoke to reception, the staff were polite and helpful in finding us another room. they also pointed out that it was a known issue with the rooms (thin walls).

What a location on Union square.Very cooperative & efficient staff.Conceirge service is very helpful.All major stops for hopon hopoff & cable cars very close.Shopping areas,Restaurants,Pubs are in close proximity

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco is a fabulous location. Its very central to the city centre and shopping centres. We found it very easy to gain access to transport and it was a short walk to tours and dining experiences. The staff were all genuinely friendly and amazingly helpful, they couldn't have done more to help us. The concierge desk went above and beyond with their service, friendliness and helpfulness and provided some fantastic suggestions for entertainment and dining experiences. The same can be said for all the staff we interacted with. Overall it was an amazing experience.

The door staff were fantastic went above and beyond to help us with luggage and local restaurants. At first I thought we were in the wrong hotel as the foyer looked like a 3 star hotel.The female desk clerk (who was not wearing a name badge) that checked us in was rude and abrupt. I explained that my husband (who was with me) was a member and could she please add his membership number to our booking she said we had the cheapest room and would not add the membership number to the booking. Obviously she wasn't looking at our booking because we were in a Club Room which is NOT a cheap room highly overpriced I would say compared to other hotels with clubs. She also said this rather loudly so other people behind us could hear what she said making us feel very small indeed.Our room was great and had a great view of the fog rolling in every afternoon. The Club staff were unwelcoming. Other hotel clubs we have gone to the manger of the club has always approached us when entering and shown us around so we are familiar with everything. This manager couldn't even say hello at anytime we were there. Breakfast was ok nothing outstanding here and the coffee was so strong the spoon stood up in the mug, disgusting. On our second morning there were no tables, so we waited 30 minutes and went back up and still no free tables so we went without breakfast on that day. Not once did the staff approach us and ask us for our room number so they could call down when there was a free table. This would have to be the worst club I have ever been in and they couldn't have made us feel less welcome if they tried.This was the first leg of our month holiday and I felt like it had already been ruined by rude staff. So glad we were getting on a ship that day or I would have checked out and gone to another hotel.

The location of this property is fantastic to access the best sites of SF. The cleanliness and service is great! We have stayed at this property a couple of times, and will continue to book this property for future visits to SF. The concierge desk was helpful in booking a couple of experiences we had not had an opportunity to experience on past visits. Their recommendations were perfect!

No problem with the Hotel (currently the reception is being renovated so check in lines are long).I am a Hyatt Explorist and spend about 50 nights a year in Hyatts.Unfortunately they have introduced their "Destination Fee" of $25 per night as an added cost. For this you get nothing of value and have no choice of opting out. They offer up to $10 food/beverage discount (I don't always want to eat drink at the hotel, premium internet (I already get this as my explorist status, discounts on bikes (I'm 62, here on business, and I don't ride bikes!!) Etc. The list goes on.Basically it's a con.To counteract this "Fee" should I decide to utilize any hotel service I will nop longer tip at the hotel. I explain to the staff that this is not a reflection on the service I have received and add a note on the receipt that the hotel should pay the tip out of the "Destination Fee"A shame on Hyatt for implementing this con.

Excellent hotel to stay at if you visit San Francisco. Fantastic customer service and delicious breakfast. Highly recocommend as option to stay at. Location extremely good gives you the chance to walk freely to Union Square, China Town and Little Italy

Modern room design with automated lights and shades, feels luxurious. Located on union square next to the flagship Apple store. Short walk to the cable car, upscale shopping and financial district. Full service hotel with all the amenities, staff provides fast check-in and luggage assistance as well as valet parking.

Restaurant closed, no room service, food service limited to a few bar snacks at certain times - hardly a 5-star hotel. Certainly not up to Hyatt worldwide standards. Location ok, clean, comfortable room.

Nice staff greeted me as I checked in. They arenâ€™t overly pushy, which is nice. The hotel room is spacious and the washroom was clean. Room service is overpriced, as is the restaurant. Itâ€™s a better idea to eat out. Fitness centre was small, with only 4 weight machines and several treadmills and ellipticals.

Absolute bad price performance ratio. Very old fashioned. Rooms in the 70s style. Bad service. Very noisy rooms. Unfriendly check in. No recognition of membership. Concierge absolutely unfriendly and without any service.

If I could give this hotel 6 stars I would! We stayed here 4 nights and the hotel is very modern and spotless. Very comfortable feeling and vibe at the hotel, not like a typical 5 star when sometimes Iâ€™d feel like everything is a bit try-hard. The staff: Every single staff member couldnâ€™t be more friendly and helpful. A gentleman at reception helped me print my boarding passes off for my flight when I was struggling, the door men helped me with what I was looking for when all the receptionists were busy, the house keeping staff arranged my cosmetics on a towel next to the sink and left my bed untucked as they noticed thatâ€™s how I liked it but kept my brothers tucked in. Every staff member is ready to help you to give you the best experience possible.The room:The room sizes are excellent and always spotless. The WiFi worked great even when steaming videos, the rooms had coffee machines with Starbucks coffee, a decaf option and tea options, the supplied toiletries are good quality, the hairdryer and iron are good quality. The rooms also have automatic blinds which is a nice touch so you can look at the city whilst still lying in bed.The TV in the room allows you to connect your phone to watch Netflix or YouTube to stream movies and as I said the WiFi is great to use for streaming. I didnâ€™t realise until our last day so didnâ€™t get a chance to do this but itâ€™s a great option for a night in! The hotel:The location of this hotel is literally right in the middle of everything! All of the shops, department stores, bars and restaurants you could need are within walking distance. Less than $10 in an Uber to get to/from Fishermanâ€™s Wharf too.I canâ€™t comment on the restaurant or bar as we didnâ€™t use this. There was chilled complimentary water bottles whenever you wanted them delivered to your room or you could run down to reception to get them. The gym has all the basic equipment you need and itâ€™s on the 35th floor with amazing views! Overall: Amazing hotel with excellent and attentive staff members that go beyond what is expected, this is truly a 5 star hotel! If I ever visit San Francisco again I will 100% be staying here, I couldnâ€™t recommend it enough.

Unfortunately this Hyatt in San Francisco did not deliver what we expect from the Hyatt brand.Pre-made food delivered to your room off a limited menu with no options.Loud corridors and rooms that security did not address.Just not what I've come to expext from the Hyatt brand.

Having arrived on a long flight from the UK, my wife and I took the BART from the international airport to Montgomery Street and then had an easy 10 minute walk to the hotel. We were quickly checked into our room, #2816.The room was spacious with lots of storage and a great view towards the sea (past other skyscrapers). There was a desk, 2 easy chairs, foot rest, large bed, TV, iron & board, safe, fridge, electronic blind and a single-cup coffee machine. The lighting was good, particularly each side of the bed. There were also motion sensitive night lights each side of the bed. Despite having a request for a quiet room on my reservation, we were given a room with a connecting door â€“ certainly not conducive to quiet conditions as we were disturbed by noises coming from the adjacent room. On one occasion they returned at 0200 and on another day had the TV on until past midnight.There was a separate alcove with a make-up/dressing table which led to the bathroom. This had a sliding door which left a gap of 5-10mm at the end and therefore did not seal off the bathroom properly from the rest of the room. The bathroom had a shower over a bath and a ferociously flushing WC! Toiletries were green tea and cucumber scented. We found the bath a little springy when having showers. Also contortions were needed to access the toilet paper when sitting on the WC!We had chosen a rate which gave us access to the club lounge on the 32nd floor. This was excellent, helped considerably by the helpfulness of the pleasant staff there (particularly David). Breakfast included yoghurt, fresh fruit, scrambled egg, sausages, bacon, breads, pastries, bagels, super smoked salmon and cereals. The only minor criticism is that the scrambled eggs quickly got cold. There were coffee urns and hot water for tea. The temperature of these was always hot but the hot water was never boiling and not really hot enough to make a good cup of tea. There was also an excellent coffee machine which used fresh beans. Hors dâ€™oeuvres in the club lounge started at 1700 daily, until 1900, and changed daily. These included various salads, meat loaf, sausage & pepper casserole, beef & pasta, chicken/beef fajitas, dim sum, etc. This food was tasty and plentiful but could have been hotter. After ~1925, cakes became available. Despite the hotel being full, we did not find the club lounge too busy. One of the best features of the lounge was wine at $3 and sprits at $4 â€“ both bargains considering the price of them in nearby bars/restaurants. The only negative aspect of the lounge was the background noise being overloaded with competing noises from the 2 TVs and taped music. The lounge was also open during the day for small snacks, soft drinks and coffee/tea.Wifi was good and it was great having USB ports, good for recharging devices, at the bedsides.Bad points worth mentioning are finding a half-open bottle of water in the fridge when we arrived and housekeeping not doing our room until after 1600 on two occasions (out of 5).The hotel was a 30 minute walk to the waterfront and 2 minutes to Union Square.I would stay here again without hesitation.

Beautiful hotel, staff all very friendly beds comfortable rooms lovely we were a group of 6 and had 3 rooms really recommend this hotel. Thank you Sandra at Time 4 Travel for organising our amazing holiday

We usually stay at the Hyatt Regency Embarcadero when we go to San Francisco, which is several times a year. Last weekend, the Embarcadero hotel was fully booked of reasonably priced rooms, so we decided to try the Grand Hyatt on Union Square. It is in a more urban environment than the other hotel, yet ideally located if you like to shop (the new Apple Store is next door, and Nike is across the street). It is also a longer trek from the BART station if you like to use BART to get around. There is also a 24-hour CVS store across the street, which is a great convenience.As for the hotel itself, it was really lovely, very clean and chic looking. It has only one main entrance, which is a plus in terms of keeping the place secure for guests. We had a king-sized room, and it was spacious with a desk area and sitting area. There are night shades which are controlled at the door entrance and at both sides of the bed. I must admit it took us a bit to figure out where the controls were. There is also a room safe and small refrigerator. The bath has a modern look with a visually interesting oblong sink. I also like the lower bath tub side, which makes it easier to get in and out of when you shower. We had several meals and drinks in the One Up bar and the food was very good and a nice retreat from the very busy Union Square area. We had breakfast in the restaurant and it was very good, too. We were very happy with the stay and probably will use from time to time. I was very tempted to reserve the Executive Suite, which has two baths.

Vacation was great and the staff was nice. The bar was great and the view was outstanding. I would recommend this location to others and I also would recommend that you not force people to make comments.

Grand Hyatt SF Has a great atmosphere, I felt like it was very clean & safe. Loved the Bar! Our room was a disappointment bc we were located close to the elevator, the nosy and vibration had us waking up frequently! We both had terrible interrupted sleep all night long:(

We stayed at this hotel for three nights, and it's incredibly convenient the rooms were on the small side but Fantastic decor Hyatt minamalWell kept and extremely clean .Great pillows high floor has great views Walked to China town. Walked to MOMANo problem Close to union square Great hotel

Situated on union square this hotel is ideally located for the retail & commercial centre of San Francisco. Rooms are clean & well appointed. We booked a city view room which had a panoramic view of the downtown area.Staff at the hotel were courteous & attentive. Check in & check out was quick & easy.The only downside & not a fault of the hotel were the large numbers of vagrants in the surrounding area were intimidating. Unfortunately, this is appears to be a common feature of many urban cities in the world. I would consider staying here again should I visit SFO in the future

First time my partner and l have stayed, very happy with hotel.Location was our number one priority and this hotel ticked all our boxes.The money spent was worth it just for the view.29 floors up and wow,amazing views of san fran.Great place to visit,great place to stay

After a horrible delayed flight to SF, I finally went to the hotel to check in and immediately received a seamless and friendly check in at the front desk. And their customer service kept getting better. I originally requested a microwave and they delivered in a few minutes. The next day I requested a humidifier and again, received it in a few minutes. Housekeeping came and cleaned up every time I requested it. The staff will greet all their guests and even on the elevator, they will ask to see how was my stay. This is one of the best hotel stays I have experienced and will reserve next time I visit SF.

Lights did not work, Baton Door was off hinges. and many other things was wrong with this room. The hotel is an excellent location in the city, you will like the location, the hotel is clean and staff is nice. YELLFY SPORTS APP

It is so rare to find a place that gets high marks across the board. The rooms are spacious, the beds comfortable, the bathroom is great with plenty of towels. Extra nice touch is the motorized shade for the window.The staff are welcoming, responsive, and focused on the needs of their guests.The conference facilities are wonderful. I was particularly impressed by the level of service and the delicious quality of the food and drink. My only regret was no Diet Coke.

It's a good hotel rooms are big for a good price and the staff are friendlyI would say my only complaint is that I have to pay for parking which i think it make senseBut overall the location is perfect and many places around it to enjoy

Located right next to Union Square, this hotel provides easy access to shopping, dining and transportation. It is within walking distance of China Town and a short ride (or, if you like to walk, a slightly longer walk) to many other parts of the city. We took advantage of Cable Cars, Trolleys and buses to get us to the places we needed to go. The hotel is also located a few blocks from two BART stations, so that form of transportation would also have been easy to use.To a person, the hotel staff is welcoming and accommodating. They were immediately responsive to any request we had. The Concierge staff is one of the best I have encountered, with special accolades to Joanna Husk.Our room was small, but suited our needs. The only reasons that I do not give this hotel a 5-star rating are: 1. No real restaurant to speak of. If you want to have a drink, it's adequate as a bar, but don't plan any major meals there. 2. The bathroom in the room lacks towel racks. The only place to hang anything is on two small hooks -- not enough to accommodate two regular towels, two hand towels, nor anything on which to hang a piece of clothing or a robe if you choose to change clothes in the bathroom.

No mobile app room key. Was congested only in room. Loud doors all night. Weird sink and antenna lights. Convenient location. Creaky building from "wind". Couldn't go to 36th floor for views but it lets you try in elevator.l

I was here for a conference last week and after I checked into my room, I found UNCLEANED hair all over my bathroom sink and counter. It was disgusting. I contacted the front desk and the front desk said they would send someone to clean it. They were not planning on upgrading me to another room or provide any other service to counter the negative experience. I waited 20 min and nobody came. Then I called the front desk again and asked them to send the manager. In the meantime the cleaning guy came and took a look at it and said that the manager should look at it because it was pretty gross. The manager finally came and she apologized but only advised that she can have the guy clean it up and that she won't be able to move me to another room because they are all booked for the night. Ok, that's fine. She DID mention that she may upgrade me to a room tomorrow and that she would also give me extra bonus points on my account. First of all, she never followed through with upgrading me to another room the next day. All in all, I don't think the customer service is that great. Clearly, it's not ok to leave uncleaned hair in a brand new room you check into and it doesn't seem like the employees here were that remorseful. Except the cleaning guy. He was very remorseful and kept apologizing to me. He was the sweetest. But other than that, everything else sucked. I've only had one other situation where a room was not clean when I checked in and it was a 3 star hotel. They were so sorry that they gave me and all my guests free room service breakfast for every morning I was there, upgraded me to a bigger room and gave me bonus points. This place is a 4 star hotel and I say their customer service when things go wrong is mediocre. Not would you would expect from a 4 star hotel.

Great hotel to stay when you want to walk to the stadium for giants game, centrally located in San Francisco, bar is open late, and rooms are normally pretty comfortable, lots of other good restaurants and bars nearby

We did extensive review of hotels prior to our SF trip, the Grand Hyatt didnâ€™t disappoint us. The staff was so friendly and accommodating. I requested a 12 oâ€™clock check-in and the hotel accomated my request. While checking into my city view room, I mentioned this was my 1st time in the city, the clerk changed my room to give me a higher view. The only issue we had was the hotel ran out of face size towels for 3 days but we used hand towels and made it work. Thanks Hyatt.

Whenever we visit San Francisco, we always stay at the Grand Hyatt. The hotel is modern, clean and in a great location. Staff is very friendly. The doormen greet you at the door as you check-in and when you return to the hotel after a day of sightseeing, they open the door for you greet you with a "welcome back." We never stay anywhere else.

I stayed here in April, 2017 and provided a mediocre review then. Being a loyal Hyatt guest, I decided to try again. Sadly, there have been no improvements and this is the last time I will stay at this hotel. I would encourage others to avoid this property as well. Given an exceptional location (on Union Square) one would expect a special place, full of unique design and excellent offerings. Sadly, it is the polar opposite of that: dull, ordinary, and completely devoid of any acceptable food/beverage. The rooms are worn and noisy, very disappointing overall. The food and beverage is barely adequate. Perhaps this is not a concern given the location and surroundings, but it is inconvenient if one has to stay in to work. Frankly, the hotel feels budget in all aspects except for the meeting spaces. Having given this hotel two tries, I will make a different selection on my regular trips to San Francisco.

No quality control in the rooms. Shower didnâ€™t work properly. Room dusty causing allergies. Bedside lamp didnâ€™t work. Our room wasnâ€™t even made up one day although we were out from 9-6:30. Front desk doesnâ€™t pass on messages to other hotel departments. Vegetarian options food wise non existent.

We had a great stay here in San Francisco. The Grand Hyatt is a fabulous place to stay. All staff we came in contact with were polite and helpful. Being Hyatt members we were fortunate to receive an upgrade and our view from the 30th floor was spectacular. We took advantage of the Grand Club access and everything in there was fresh and well prepared. The rooms are nice sized considering this is a big city hotel. I love that our room didnâ€™t have carpet. The room was nicely furnished and the bathroom was modern with good use of space. Housekeeping did a fabulous job (donâ€™t forget to tip your housekeeping staff) maintaining our room. When we mentioned the first morning there that the toilet was making a very loud noise when flushing it was repaired by that afternoon. The location here is perfect - so convenient to everything . We used Uber a lot so didnâ€™t have a car that needed parking. We are sorry to leave this beautiful city and hotel - and we hope to be back some day soon.

Booked using some of our rewards points. Rooms are of a good size, bed o.k., views good, shower over bath in a 4 star plus hotel is cheap.Service & menu here is really poor for the price. Restaurant menu for dinner was of veryaverage quality and expensive. Bar service, again considering price, was ordinary. Breakfast service is a farce with parts of orders forgotten, my wife told off by chef when told by waiter she could select 2 pastries as part of her order. We would not return to this hotel, San Francisco has so many alternatives better priced and no doubt with better service.

The reception and the room was great, nice and quiet. The location at Union Square is good since its close to everything. Only disappointment could not get the next the Iphone charger I left behind. Staff gave me a website to go to to get shipped back. Could not hold it for one day!.

Had to change rooms. Was traveling with 19 yr old son who would be on his laptop and desk chair was dirty, old and very squeaky. In the next room desk chair was just old and tattered. However, when we pulled back sheet on one of the beds there was a large yellow stain on the comforter. YUCK. On the positive side, great location and the staff is very accomadating and friendly.

Hotel is modern and room small but well furnished. Modern bathroom and adequate gym on 35 floor. The best thing about the hotel is the location. Itâ€™s in a busy neighborhood. Chinatown is behind it and within walkable distance. Lots of eatery around. Lots of luxury goods store around hotel too. Parking in the hotel is $36 self parking and in the $60s gor valet. We park diagonally across the front door at sutterstockton public parking. Itâ€™s $2/ hour. Actually works out about $10 cheaper for us bc lot of time we were out and about in our car. Downstairs in lobby thereâ€™s a small bakery that sells breakfast item at reasonable price. Would stay in this hotel again when we visit SF.

This hotel was great! Right from check-in to check-out. Very clean, staff were extremely welcoming and made me feel as if I was the most important guest there. Would definitely recommend this hotel and am looking forward to a return stay.

We stayed here couple of nights on the final leg of our honeymoon.Good points... room decent size, very clean, great location and the staff were exceptional friendly and helpful. Bar was great and again staff were notably great.Now the serious downside. The rooms have adjoining room doors with shocking sound insulation. We were woken by some ghastly women with a mouth like a fog horn who seemed to think acceptable to have her child also shriek and run around like being in a playground at 6am. Staff were super apologetic and moved us next day. Even with a quiet couple next door in the new room you could still here them talking.The cable noise from the lifts also transmits to the rooms.Shame poor / dated structure of the hotel diminishes the stay.At the start of our trip we stayed round the corner at the Nikko which on the face of it is a similar offering. No noise issue there and would stay there next time due to the structural issues at the Hyatt.

Donâ€™t be fooled by the glossy pictures - this place is dated beyond belief. Decor is hideously old fashioned and cheap. Overpriced and underperforming. Great location but severely in need of a revamp. All in all - very very disappointed

Perfectly situated just off Union Square. An excellent hotel experience with great service and very comfortable accommodations. Excellent breakfast severed in One Up restaurant, prices are reasonable for big hotel and location. Close to shopping, food, culture and entertainment. The Grand Hyatt will not disappoint.

We have stayed at this Hyatt for over 20 years. Over the years they have made many changes -- and in our opinion not all for the good (we have found this true at many of the Hyatts we stay in). Several years ago there was a beautiful bar and restaurant on the top floor. That was replaced with these services being moved to the mezzanine. Now the only breakfast choice in the restaurant is a $34 buffet or an unattractive coffee and small selection of pastries in the lobby area. From what we were told, the restaurant will be closing and there will only be a grab and go sort of thing. For a relatively nice hotel I think this arrangement is very unappealing.

We lobed this hotel. The view from the room was perfect. The furnishing in the were immaculate. The bed were perfect for a great night sleep. Walking distance to all shopping. Apple store. Nieman Marcus. Barney's. Nike. Westfield mall. Parking close by for $35. Highly recommended.

Had stayed here before and enjoyed it. Has a great location near chinatown and Union Square shopping. Rooms are large and nicely appointed. Service was excellent. Only gripe is the $34 breakfast buffet. We actually thought it was a free Hyatt Place breakfast since there wasn't much more to choose from.

We have just completed. Fabulous staff here. We were lucky enough to get a room over looking Union Square. Room was clean tidy and with great air on. Hotel is a perfect location. Close to union square and shopping. Close to China town and the Trolley car terminus on Powel. The staff were all fabulous from the door man who greeted us, the reception staff and cleaners. Would definitely recommend staying here.

Got a bayview room and the view was spectacular. Coit Tower, Alcatraz, China Town right in front of us. We pulled chairs over to the window and just sat and looked. Very friendly and helpful staff from the doormen to the bellmen to the front desk to the maids. Service was instantaneous. Great restaurant recommendation from the concierge. The rooms were very nice and well appointed. Assisted self parking was the way to go. We would definitely stay again.

Fabulous location on north side of Union Square, next to all nationAlly known shops and best restaurants.Service is impeccable. Concierge service has all the answers to any question you may ask. Club floor is worth the extra expense if you want superb service. Been staying here every year for past seven years.

Stayed in the Grand Hyatt San Francisco for six nights in August 2018. Great Hotel in a great location, right next to Union Square, we stayed for six nights, room only.All the staff were very polite and helpful especially the concierge, rooms good size and cleaned every day, beds comfortable and complimentary tea, coffee and water in the rooms.The hotel is a great location to visit the Pier 39, Golden Gate Bridge and all the attraction, my wife loved all the shops. We used the public transport to get around and found this great value for money,Really enjoyed our stay at the Grand Hyatt

Actually stayed during Pride in June. Great Service and Support for the LGBT Community. They even had an arch made of balloons in rainbow colors at check-in. The only con was not enough option for late night food at there little gallery.

The staff is very helpful and kind. Everyone I encountered was willing and happy to assist me when needed. The hotel is very typical for a Hyatt, but rooms are on the smallish side. The hotel is in an excellent location, close to Union Square, but 1/2 block away to not be crazy busy outside the main doors. I had a room near the elevator shaft and that wasnâ€™t ideal. It sounded like a constant windy day with the swoosh of the elevator, but it could have been a lot worse/louder.

Quick weekend getaway for us and grabbed the G. Hyatt at the last minute. It worked out perfectly as a base very close to everything we had time for. Nice rooms very clean, efficient check in and check out excellent staff inside and at the door. Had time for a couple drinks at the lounge again very nice bar staff and good drinks. All in all a good choice. Would stay at again.

We really enjoyed staying here as it was a great base for what we wanted to do. Our room was really spacious compared to UK hotels of this size which was brilliant as we werenâ€™t on top of our luggage etc. The room had a large TV and a fridge which was really handy for our needs. The coffee machine supplies were topped up everyday which was a nice touch for us as we were room only and it was good to start the day with a coffee in our room. The housekeeping of the hotel is up there with the best that I have seen and the hotel staff were very friendly, efficient and willing to go that extra mile. Some of the local attractions nearby that interested us were, Union Square, Tram cars and China town. Macyâ€™s and Saks are a few minutes walk away for those that enjoy shopping. Recommend

This hotel is located in a great area (Union Square). I found it a great vantage point to check out all the tourist spots around town and shop at the same time. I was able to do a lot in the area and it was a really nice area to be around. Staff are also really nice and accommodating.I would definitely check your rate that you pay though. I originally booked a standard refundable fare and the price lowered 2 days before my check in and saw that they had lowered the price and made a quick call into World of Hyatt to update the pricing.Some Cons:Lyft/Uber is a bit difficult to use because the drivers tend to not know where the entrance to the hotel is. Sometimes, I had to jaywalk across the street to reach my uber/lyft.There are not that many elevators, and most rooms are hard to get to via stairs. I was there around Christmas and they had the University of Arizona (?) football team there for a bowl game and so the elevators were definitely crowded. So depending on when you go, you might have to wait for an elevator.

Nothing really stood out to me as bad or great. It was fine, but only fine. I could have received the same care/treatment at other less expensive hotels. The rooms were clean, the staff were friendly, but no one went out of their way.

I won a free stay at a work conference. The hotel was conveniently located by Union Square, Little Italy and Chinatown. Staff was always pleasant and very accommodating. Would definitely staff at the Grand Hyatt again.

This Hyatt property has discontinued room service so if you are traveling for business and want to work in your room, better bring take out. Also on windy days and nights, the building creeks loudly. The upper floors are the most unsettling; you cannot sleep well. Finally, valet and door service can be tardy if not frustrating at times. All that said, the hotel offers comfortable beds and staff are pleasant. Fairly safe with a few homeless folks around which is par for course in San Francisco these days. Make sure to check the Union Square Concert schedule before booking this property unless you want the added "pleasure" of a rock concert in your room. There's also construction in the area with drilling starting at 7:00 ish in the morning.

Only have great things to report about his hotel. The location is ideal. Check in was courteous and efficient. We obtained connecting rooms as requested. The rooms were perfectly clean and the beds very comfortable. Nice view of Union Square. On Saturday AM we called to complain about a noisy AC fan. A technician arrived within minutes. He returned to change the fan motor at a time convenient for us. Now that's service!

Pros- Location - so easy to get to the main attractions and excellent food and shopping at the doorstep- Service - attentive and courteous service at all times- Nice, neat and fresh room- Good bed, good pillows- Effortless check-in/check-outCons- Our room on the 28th floor (upgraded) had a shared door to next room and the neighbouring noise came through such that we had to call front desk to request they intervene, twice. Which to their credit they did, promptly and firmly. I think and upgraded room shouldn't be sharing a door to another room unless its adequately soundproofed.- The Aircon fan made a clanging noiseI would stay here again without hesitation.

We stopped here as a family of 4 in August as part of a 4 week long Californian adventure. We have 2 young children age 6 & 4. It is everything you would expect of a Hyatt. The front of house were friendly and informative, plenty of people to help you will luggage, valet parking (which was super quick) a superb breakfast selection, or a quick snack selection in the lobby area if you preferred. The hotel is situated one row back from union square, right behind the Apple shop. Amazing location. The rooms were small, but exactly as you would expect of a city hotel, they were clean and the bed the comfiest I had ever slept in. The rooms were serviced daily. Would definitely stop here again if I visited SF.

Nice hotel , well situated in Union Square, SF. Rooms were updated with artsy furnishings.Staffs were nice and helpful. Would stay here again except parking is ridiculously expensive.Location is excellent though as it is close to lots of trendy shopping places in SF.

We arrived at the Grand Hyatt late morning and the front desk staff greeted us warmly and allowed an early check in. Off to a grand start! Unfortunately, the room was dirty and seemed as though it hadn't been used in awhile as there were hairs and dust in various places. Once again, the front desk staff was great and sent a housekeeping representative who offered to tidy the room but because it really needed a thorough cleaning I asked for a room change and was graciously offered a much better room than the original. Throughout our stay, we found the staff to be grand; amazingly friendly, helpful and gracious, without exception. That being said, I've stayed in other Grand Hyatt's and this one is not so grand any more. I'm sure it used to be but it's a bit run down and needs some TLC. The rooms are decent sized and the beds were very comfy. The online room description said we would have robes and a fridge in the room but we had neither. There's also no room service as they are changing their food selection options. The location is very convenient. Overall, I'd stay there again because of the staff and location but just be aware that if you've stayed, for example, at the Seattle Grand Hyatt, you may be a bit disappointed.

I have been to this Hyatt multiple times and this is one of my favorite hotels. The hotel is in a great location, right on Union Square, accessible to Moscone Center, dining, shopping, and trolly cars. The rooms are clean and very nice and the staff is great. All the food I have had at the One Up Restaurant has been excellent.

We visited Grand Hyatt and were happy with our check in process; however, weâ€™re a little disappointed with the cleanliness of our room. Our toilet was extremely dirty and I ended up cleaning it myself. We also found staining in our desk chair and the coffee cup on the counter had hair in it. For the price that we paid we had hoped for a cleaner room. However, the lobby and conference area was beautiful and we enjoyed San Francisco and the location of the Grand Hyatt.

This is a very good hotel to stop in while in San Francisco it is centrally located and easy to get to and from the rooms are very comfortable and quite they were also very clean only one thing they need more tea facilities not everyone drinks coffee and a supply of milk would be helpful although there are lots of places to get your own close by. it was close to the cable cars and most of the tours company I would recommend this hotel

I stayed at The Grand Hyatt with my two boys in July and loved so much about it! Elaine, at the concierge desk, was incredibly helpful in putting together great excursions for us! Our room felt like a little slice of heaven after a long day of walking; comfortable with awesome beds to rest tired bodies. The hotel restaurant has delicious options for late night dining and the location worked great for us! Two blocks from the gates of Chinatown and a short uber ride from the piers (walked one way & Ubered back).
