Well placed in the heart of SF. Rooms felt a little tired. Limited amenities in room - ask for them! Parking is difficult- even concierge parking can have quite a queue.It seems you need to keep asking if you want things - not your normal Hyatt pro-active help.

Stayed in June 2018.Staff were very welcoming on check-in, we booked a king room but unfortunately were told their system was incorrect so they didnt have one available for our first night. They put us into a double room for the one night and offered us cards for free drinks at the bar for compensation, very friendly about it and organised to move all our luggae into the king room the next day.Bar/restaraunt was quite nice, we didnt eat there but we saw the food and it looked delicious. Location was great, close to union square and shopping was a couple of minutes walk away. Staff were great on check out, offered us a later check out to accommodate us as we had a very late flight out. Had a nice view from our room, out to the city.

The hotel is centrally located in Union Square and right outside you can catch a cable car, walk to shops and restaurants or catch the Big Bus around the city. Everyone is very helpful and love the doorman.

This hotel was close to many things & ubers were easily obtainable for the far away things we wanted to see. The rooms were very neat and tidy, the employees were very friendly and helpful. Now if they could only insure the weather!

Went to San Francisco for a conference and stayed at the Grand Hyatt. Can't say enough about how nice our stay was. Hotel is clean, rooms are quiet and it is centrally located for a lot of shopping and muni bus and BART.

This hotel is in a great spot, close to a lot of shopping, restaurants, and things to do. They offer you free bottles of water which is nice. The front desk is very attentive and whenever I asked for something, it was delivered within twenty minutes each time. The reason I don't give them five stars is because of hidden fees. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.

The location is excellent as for all hotels in Union Square.However the rooms are a bit small for a "grand Hyatt". For the same price the rooms at the Hilton are more spacious. Only a small restaurant in the hotel, but being in Union Square perhaps you don't need more....

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco for my husbandâ€™s birthday in August 2018.The Good:1. Our Executive Suite was very spacious with two bathrooms! Having two bathrooms saved so much time getting dressed each morning.2. At check-in, they saw it was my husbandâ€™s birthday on his ID. They surprised him with complimentary champagne and fruit! Additionally, at check in, we were given vouchers for free drinks and appetizers at the OneUP restaurant!3. Housekeeping was thorough and punctual.4. The hotel is in a great location. Itâ€™s close to dining, shopping, Union Square, China Town, and other sites.5. The bed was very comfortable.6. We loved have the ability to control lights and window shades with a touch of a button!7. There were comfy robes in the room.8. There was a small fridge in the room to keep our drinks cool.The Bad:1. NO ROOM SERVICE! We were so disappointed to learn that this Hyatt has no room service. Room service, especially for breakfast, is one of our favorite things of staying in a luxury hotel. Iâ€™ve learned that Hyatt hotels are phasing out room service. This was a huge disappointment for us. Had we known, we never would have stayed here. We had a long day of flying from the east and were exhausted. We were looking forward to room service. They offer food you can purchase in the lobby but that just isnâ€™t the same.2. Our room (2024) had water dripping from a vent in the ceiling. We called the front desk and someone was immediately sent to our room. He explained that it was condensation from the air conditioning unit. He wiped up the water. The water continued to drip after he left. Thereâ€™s a water stain on the wood floor that suggests this has been an ongoing, unresolved issue for quite awhile. The next day, the front desk called to find out if we still had the leak. We didnâ€™t.There were many things to love about this hotel. However, we will not stay here again because we enjoy room service, which is unavailable at this hotel.

I stayed three nights at the Grand Hyatt. The location is perfect for San Francisco, you are one block from Union Square shopping and no more than a $10 uber/lyft ride away from key sights! The front desk team is on-point, check in was quick and the staff manning the door were always friendly & present to help. The room itself was clean & smartly furnished. I visited the bar which served quality cocktails and had a good selection of beer & wine. The fitness center on the top of the hotel is a little small but has fantastic views. The only area of improvement would be the elevators, it sometimes took longer than I'm used to for one to arrive. I would recommend staying at the Grand Hyatt.

We enjoy coming to the Bay Area and staying in San Francisco. The Grand Hyatt and Centric Hyatt are both very convenient and fun places to stay while heading to AT&T for the games! With friends and/or family, we always feel welcome.

The hotel is conveniently located a few minutes from Union Square. The cable car drives right by.The hotel offers valet parking which is important given the hotelâ€™s location.I was allocated a room on the 32nd floor - the same as the Grand Club.The selection was good with an evening honor bar and generous opening hours from 5:30 - 10 AM.A good business hotel right in the center of San Francisco.

We spent a couple of nights here at the end of a Central California road trip. It was the perfect place to round off our holiday - central location yet hotel was peaceful, the staff were so friendly and helpful and the club lounge facilities exceeded our expectations - would definitely return.

I have stayed here many times but after paying 500.00 for a room, last minute reservation, they tell me they are in transition and they no longer have room service, I will no longer be staying at this hotel for the price of the rooms one would hope to have breakfast or coffee brought to your room.

Stayed in the Hyatt for 3 nights on a business trip. Good clean room and bathroom. Good toiletries and vanity kits. A tad to pricey and not a single bottle of water provided. Excellent staff - friendly, courteous and pleasant. Will definitely return for a business stay.

Great location off the Union Square block and right next to a 24-hour CVS pharmacy store, which makes it super convenient for traveller to get things which they forgot to pack on the trip.Room is clean and comfortable. The club lounge offers great view of the city too.

the location is prime. The customer service is great! The rooms are nice as well. I highly recommend it. It's close to all the shopping. you can walk everywhere. it is centrally located. the hotel is nice and clean as well.

Just came back from San Francisco and my favorite hotel. They make each person feel special and go out our their way to make your visit special. Itâ€™s was our anniversary so they said we had a gift for you and we were able to pick it- we chose bottle of wine and fruit. They gave out complimentary water bottles every day (as many as you wanted). The room was very big and we had a small vanity sitting area. I would definitely come back. They made me feel like I was home.

Hotel staff very engaging. Location was central for our purposes. City View, high floor was spectacular. Stayed at hotel over 20 years ago, also stayed at Hyatt Embarcadero. Both great properties. Would revisit!

We were greeting pleasantly and with a smile and it continued throughout our stay. It was a great property, super comfortable and excellent location. The staff we extremely helpful and most attentive. They made sure we all felt at home.

Location was good, I suggest self parking if you have a car, cheaper and literally right across the street. Right next to union square and shopping if youâ€™re into that. Walking distance to china town. Would I come back? Yes, but probably next visit to SF Iâ€™d try the Regency right next to embarco to check that Hyatt hotel out.

Easy to get around the city, bellhops are the best, housekeeping was great. I'd always recommend to friend/family. If you haven't been to SF this is a good place to stay to be able to see the entire city

Great place to stay. Perfect location with a close commute to all attractions in SF. Just a short walk or inexpensive Lyft/Uber ride to anywhere in the city. Staff was the highlight of the stay and their professionalism and courtesy despite being very busy was admirable.

Stayed here three nights over a weekend and had a lovely time. Very close to Chinatown and other attractions. Check with the concierge for city maps and a written tour of some things to do near the hotel on foot. Cable car is very close, one block over. There is a hot dog and pretzel cart toward Macy's if you want a cheaper snack. The grand club was very nice. Food was good and plentiful. We had a bay view king room on the 27th floor. Amazing view! Would definitely stay here again.

Front desk very rude. I forgot my key in the room and was told by Spenser to get in the huge line of customers checking in. Bad business!!! Stay away. Please train your employees to do the right thing and go above and beyond the customers expectations.

I really liked the hotel. The view is AMAZING, even better at night! . The rooms are quite big and clean.....love how close it is to everything.. loved the location as it is close to many shops and malls.

Stayed here for 4 nights over a long weekend. The hotel is located on Union Square and near Chinatown so conveniently located for shops/transport. The hotel is very busy but despite this generally speaking the service was excellent and the check-in/out was quick and efficient. The service in the hotel bar was efficient but not very affable with poor communication from the staff. There are plenty of bars close by so I would recommend those are used instead.Used the gym which was very clean with modern equipment and fantastic views over the city. The only problem is the gym is far too small for the size of the hotel. It was difficult to get on any piece of equipment never mind those you want to actually use.The room was great. Clean, contemporary with a large flat screen TV. Housekeeping was good and the bed was very comfortable to sleep in. The only slight disappointment was the poor water pressure on the shower.Overall this is a large, busy and efficient hotel but lacking any charm and personal touch. I would recommend a stay here for those happy with this type of hotel and would rate it as 3.5 stars 'good' in between Trip Advisor's average and very good ratings.

My wife and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 6 nights whilst on a recent business trip. For my wife, it was a marvellous location as it is near to all the major shops and boutiques around Union Square. For me it was quite convenient for business meetings in and around the CBD. Getting out from there to the Silicon Valley for meetings was not that difficult depending on the time of day. The hotel room on the 25th level was modern with a very comfortable double bed, has a coffee machine, and a safe deposit box. The bathroom has a shower. We did not take breakfast at the hotel as there are many restaurants, whuch opens early and close late around the area to choose from. Staff was friendly and helpful.

We stayed for three nights and thought the hotel was great value. The room was a little on the small size but was very well equipped and housekeeping did a great job.The concierge were very helpful and we made use of the complimentary water in the lobby.We didnâ€™t eat at the hotel so canâ€™t comment on the restaurants.If having a high floor and a good view is important to you then pay to upgrade. We didnâ€™t and were given a room on the third floor without a view, didnâ€™t really matter to us though as we were out and about a lot.Would recommend this hotel.

I usually avoid staying in hotels, but the Grand Hyatt reminded me of why hotels can be such a positive part of travel. The central location is within walking distance of many major attractions. The room was well-appointed and comfortable, and the service was excellent. It's not cheap, but neither is visiting San Francisco, and the Grand Hyatt delivers.

Im sad that i had to check out today after our 5 day amazing stay in Grand Hyatt. Front desk Steve was very kind and helpful.Our room service lady Anna is the best. Thank you Anna Such a kind lady does her job to the top notch. We will be back again.(I regret booking Hyatt Regency for our next two days)Wish i had booked Grand hyatt for all 7 days instead just 5.Customer Serviceâ€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”Front desk great. Room service great.Check In and Check outâ€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”-Quick and easyRoomâ€”â€”â€”Amazing viewClean5 star qualityBathroomâ€”â€”â€”â€”â€”-Clean, Clean , Clean5 start qualityWe loved the place.

Good business hotel in the middle of the city where most places are walking distance. Room size is average and room amenities are limited compared to most hotels in APAC. You had to request a lot of things from housekeeping whereas most hotels would have it in the rooms as a standard.There's no swimming pool so I wouldn't recommend this hotel for a family vacation. But an ideal location for shopaholic.

Well appointed hotel, nice, small rooms. Everything was clean and service was fine, location is pretty good. Booked through Luxury Hotel Collection so were able to check in early. We were assigned a ADA room which was a bit odd, but fine. Bathroom door are barn doors so they dont lock.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 4 nights this past weekend, for my birthday celebration. The hotel is incredible, with sweeping views in every direction of the downtown skyline, and beautiful art installations all over. The staff was excellent, the first night we got there there was a large crack in one of the windows. We didn't think anything of it, but the next morning room service noticed it while cleaning and called someone in to take a look. They ended up apologizing profusely, and said they were going to take care of it right away and gave us the option to move rooms. We got upgraded to a bay view instead on a higher floor, and when we finished getting ready and was leaving the room not even an hour later, we saw the new pane of glass sitting outside in the hall waiting for us to leave so they could replace it. Talk about being on top of things! The grand club lounge is included with certain rooms, and it was also a wonderful benefit. We enjoyed free breakfast every morning, and snacks / drinks throughout the day as well as very cheap (honor bar) cocktails in the evenings. Loved that! The rooms are well appointed, and you can connect your phone to the TV and play your own content, which worked very smoothly. The hotel is in the middle of downtown SF, centrally located to everything and very walkable. Very deserving of 5 stars, we will most definitely be back!

We recently returned from a trip to San Francisco. Our stay at the Grand Hyatt was superior. Our check in was seamless. Everytime we had any question about whereabouts, or directions, the staff at desk and lobby were very helpful, always providing a map, and good information. Upon checkout, Hyatt offered a shuttle to the airport for $55, only $5 more than taxi service. We wouldâ€™ve requested this service had we known it was available from airport to hotel. The location was great, and very safe. So, he price was well worth the overall experience.

We ended up with two double beds in a tiny room that did not have space for a 2nd chair; that meant the second person was either sitting in bed or on a small stool. This is why it gets the 'poor' rating on the room.  Other than that, this hotel has a great location, the staff is friendly and attentive.  We were unaware of the Grand Club, which another guest explained for us - the extra fee would make it worthwhile, covering breakfast, an evening happy hour with snacks, and access to a printer.

This hotel is well located, near China town. It is at a walking distance from very nice restaurants too. Staff is helpful, rooms are clean and functional. We did not hear any noise coming from adjacent rooms.

For the past seven years, we stayed at the Taj hotel, located across the road from the Grand Hyatt, which we thoroughly enjoyed, particularly for its excellent and very personalised level of service. This year, I decided to try the Grand Hyatt for a number of reasons: favourable feedback from friends who had stayed there; more competitive room rates versus the Taj; and our growing frustration with the very poor quality of the gym at the Taj, which I had complained about every year for the past seven years, but to no avail. I was impressed with the Grand Hyatt, which ticked several boxes: check-in service is fast/efficient and the front desk was able to check us into it our rooms early; rooms were a decent size and well laid out; concierge service is excellent; good hotel bar; last but not least, the gym is bright and airy (with great views of the bay from its high floor) with a broad selection of cardio machines and weights machines. My key area of complaint was Housekeeping, which failed to provide evening turn-down service on three occasions despite my requests. This aside, the overall experience at the Grand Hyatt was very favourable. Indeed, I rate it as a superior hotel to the Taj despite the latter's higher room rates. We'll be returning to the Grand Hyatt on our next trip to San Francisco.

I stayed at this property for the Inman connect conference 2018. Great location, very centralized to all of the activities events, shopping, dining for the trip. Breakfast at level up was outstanding. Bell service was very helpful. Traveling on business as a female I have to be very careful about staying places that I feel safe and connected to everything that I need to do. This property served that purpose at a very high-level.

excellent location service and staff were very helpful their support in looking for us for every small small requirements made us feel very comfortable it was like we were in our own home thank you to all

This is a great location. I was in SF on business. Starbucks is served in the lobby and a full-service one is right across the street. The food is very good and shopping, entertainment and dining options are all close by.

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco was the biggest rip off - overpriced hotel Iâ€™ve stayed at. My gosh. The lady at the front desk was very fake. She deceived us when we asked â€œDid we get a nice roomâ€ù. She replied â€œYes, itâ€™s on one of our highest floorsâ€ù which was true but didnâ€™t really answer our question whether the room was nice or not. You can be on the highest floors but have a crappy room. We did the paperwork and everything and got to our room. We were a party of 4. Room was tiny. We had 2 double beds and were barely apart from each other. The room was very old school and was not up-to-date. Not to mention the amount of money that we paid for that one night, but Iâ€™ll get to that later. Bathroom was very old and out of date. The water pressure in the shower was very low, it felt like you were showering in the droplets that come out of the shower head after you take a shower. Horrible. We were traveling from the other side of the world (over 20hrs on planes and waiting at airports) and we barely ate. We were very hungry so we called the front desk and asked about getting room service. The lady on the phone told us â€œIâ€™m sorry, room service closed 10mins agoâ€ù. HOW THE HELL can you be an international hotel that accommodates people that likely come from all over the world arriving at different times of the day, and have the room service close at a certain time. Unbelievable. All of us were enraged by this. We did order delivery pizza which we had to call ourselves as the hotel didnâ€™t even offer to take our order. Horrible service. After 40mins of waiting we got our food, it was decent. It tasted good since we were hungry. We then went to bed. Bed was comfortable, thatâ€™s the only thing thatâ€™s earning this hotel a 2 star rating from us. We all agreed before going to bed to get up out of there early the next morning, as the hotel was so bad. We woke up, packed our stuff and went to the reception to check out and got the bill. Online, our bill was already a high $659 for one night which I AM EXPECTING was including tax. No, no no. We got a $778 bill. We were lied to by the hotel. Unless if the hidden taxes for the hotel was $119 which is hard to believe. Unless if they charged us for the water that they gave us upon check in. I was very disappointed with this hotel and itâ€™s value for money. I will never stay at this hotel again unless if I had to choose between motel 6 and this. Nor will I recommend it to friends and family. Never again.

The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. They helped me to collect package posted to me at the hotel. They even forwarded a package which I did get it before I left. Very reliable staff and impressive service. Highly recommended.

Two things you have to know about this hotel. It is very very expensive but you will also have the best and most comfortable time. From the staff to the interior to the restroom facilities (which I always pay extra attention to) everything is on a high level. Also it is perfectly located.

This hotel has a great location right at Union Square. The staff is very helpful and courteous. The room had a great view with floor to ceiling windows that included Union Square and the bay. Beds were comfortable, the restaurant food was tasty although the menu wasn't very extensive. The concierge and doormen were especially helpful in hailing cabs and offering tips on dining, etc. The only complaint my grandson had was regarding the bathroom door. It was opaque glass, so when I got up early in the morning and turned on the bathroom light it disturbed his sleep! We walked to Chinatown and other locations that were conveniently nearby.

Great location. You can walk to many major sites. Eateries, cable cars, excellent shopping, Chinatown all within 1 mile radius. The hotel offers beautiful views on high floors. The gym is well equipped and the beds are very comfortable. Highly recommend for couples.

The hotel is conveniently located tp Union Square and Chinatown. The lobby and bar are beautifully decorated. The Concierge staff was exceptional. The rooms were a clean design, comfortable, and cozy.

fantastic location and views of san Francisco...service is excellent however if you need help or suggestions talk to any of the front office workers....close to cheap eats and five star restaurants...easily walk to many famous landmarks....great sour dough pizza!!!

Very good hotel right next to union square. Quick walk from Montgomery St BART. Great views over Bay from higher floors. Restaurent serves very good food though bit pricey. Good quality rooms, good service.

1. The location is perfect.. a block from Union Square, Starbucks across the street, CVS on the next block, McDonalds around the corner, a couple blocks to China Town, easy walk to Pier 39, also walked to AT&T Park. It was a block to catch the Big Bus tour bus. 2. The hotel has a super nice lobby and entrance. The people who checked us in and out were very friendly and helpful. 3. The view from our room was amazing. 4. The room was clean and the bed bathroom were nice. It was a little dated and starting to show some wear in the carpet. 5. A lot of other places I looked at before visiting didnâ€™t offer air conditioning. I thought this would be a problem and picked Hyatt because it has air conditioning.. turns out you donâ€™t need it. After visiting Iâ€™m sure the other places wouldâ€™ve been fine. It is cool there and a crack window was plenty. 6. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It met all of our needs and we enjoyed it. On my next trip I might try another hotel just because I like to see new things.

We checked in and were given a room right opposite the ice machine. We knew it would be a problem. Not sure what the fascination is with ice machines here - not like anyone does mini bars anymore. Anyway of course someone was partying all night and kept refilling their ice til 2am - it was so loud we recorded it. Needless to say we asked to switch rooms and they gave us a lovely room overlooking union square. Also the layout of the bathroom was much nicer being away from the bed so more privacy. Very lovely room and comfortable bed. Good amenities and very central to shopping and restaurants. Nice bar for a cocktail. Really enjoyed the rest of our stay.

Would I stay here again? Only if I have business in downtown San Francisco. It is a nice modern hotel with all amenities. However, there are just too many tourists, i.e., chaos. Probably one of the smaller more exclusive houses might be a better place to stay around Union Square.

We stayed at this hotel and the hotel Nikko- both in great areas of San FranciscoI thought the Hyatt's room was nice. There was not continental breakfast, which was something hotel Nikko offered- and it was really good.

Alyssa was excellent who put her heart into our event- she took complete control and put her heart into the event both professionally and personally. Alyssa- you were amazing and wonderful- Thanks Alayssa.

This was our first time in San Francisco. This Hyatt is located in Union Square and is within walking distance to public transportation, shopping, restaurants and the visitor's center. We bought the CIty Pass that included public transportation so access to public transportation was important to us. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful . We used the concierge to help us navigate public transportation and plan our itinerary.They offered great tips. Our room was clean and a nice size. The restaurant was a little pricey so we chose other nearby options. The gym is located on the 35th floor and has great views of the city. We used it daily. We would stay here in the future.

Stayed for two nights in this very nice hotel. Excellent located on union square with everything within walking distance. Booked club rooms with lounge access which turned out to be a good choice. Everything what you need for breakfast and snack/light meal during the day:afternoon/evening. Excellent staff in all areas, friendly and service minded with a smile. Would for sure come back.

Very trusted hotel and pleasant stay for our large family. The rooms were very comfortable and had quality design features. The breakfast was a bit pricey but was included in our package. The kids loved it!

First time staying at this Hyatt, GREAT location for 4 nights 5 days. We did not rent a car to sight-see and with this location, all public transportation was very accessible. Our room was big, clean, had tile floors (I wish all hotels would convert to tile floors). Great views, we were placed on the 30th floor. The Grand Club Lounge was a perfect ending to a long sightseeing day a a nice wake-up call each morning. The cleaning service was efficient, when we left to get breakfast, and returned the room was clean and serviced. I used the gym facilities every morning, even the gym had great views along with towels, water, and plenty if disinfecting wipes.I would definitely recommend when staying in San Fransisco!

Stayed here for 3 nights. Good location, shops and subway/Bart nearby. Secure lobby, access to elevators is being monitored. I experienced a very fast and courteous check-in procedure, very welcoming and friendly staff, my luggage was brought upstairs in no time. Was very happy with my room nr. 2918 (2 double beds): good size room, clean, very comfortable beds, aircon worked perfectly and also the window could slide open a bit for additional fresh air, fantastic city views, good size bathroom, reasonable room rate (it was in a weekend), very reasonable costs for self parking ("assisted parking" as opposed to "valet parking"). Didn't eat in, so can not commend on that. Would stay here again. Highly recommendable, ask for a high floor room.

Stayed here 5 nights recently in an Executive View Suite while visiting family . We had a living room with a sofa, work table, and small fridge and a bedroom with a king bed. Our 2 teenagers slept in day beds (one in the bedroom and the other in the living room). The views of the city were fantastic! The room was modern (electric controls for blinds/lights, motion sensored nightlights under the nightstands, individual climate control in each room), clean, and comfortable. Housekeeping was excellent, and the rest of the staff was very friendly. There is a CVS and a Starbucks right across the street, and the hotel is walking distance to both Powell and Montgomery Stations. We took BART from the airport (30 minute ride) because it was easy lugging our carry-on the few blocks to the hotel, but it might be harder with larger suitcases. There's plenty of great shopping and nice restaurants nearby. Loved the hotel some much that we will be returning for our trip next year.

This hotel was one of the more affordable options on our trip to San Francisco and were happy with our stay.PROS: Location (on Stockton Street which is a main thoroughfare in San Francisco, has a Starbucks, close to upscale shopping and a great toy store, and very safe and clean neighborhood)Extremely clean hotelGreat, friendly staffMultiple, quick elevators (it is a large hotel)Food options on siteFree bottled waters daily (a life saver!)Modern and decent sized roomsCONS:Far away from a lot of the more touristy sitesWater pressure in shower was absolutely terribleNot many great dining options within walking distance No pool (would be nice with kids!)But we would definitely stay here again!!

The location is great! You have StarBucks across the street, The Apple Store is 30 seconds away.. Macy's, The Cheese Cake Factory, Saks fifth avenue. And more! All are less than 5 minutes away on foot!The staff is friendly, they have a small sports center (I wouldn't call it a gym) on the 37th floor (I think) with an awesome view.However the room service was less exciting.. had to call 3 times within one hour to get a heater...

Stayed at this hotel on our way to Hawaii. I had stayed here once before, around ten years ago and decided to come back again but this time with the kids. The hotel has a great location close to stores and restaurants. Would stay here again!!!

As others have noted, this is a nice place. The Grand Hyatt checks all the boxes (gym, restaurant, consistent house-keeping, central location) and the front desk staff is efficient. I didnâ€™t rate it as 5 stars though because the hotel lacks charm and could use a few small tweaks. To be specific, most hotels of this level provide bottled water in its rooms or leave a chocolate / nice note on the bed side. The Grand Hyatt is extremely impersonal in this regard. Moreover, the vents in the room and the bathroom need a thorough dusting. They were very dirty, which was in sharp contrast to the actual room (very clean). All in all, Iâ€™d stay here again if I got a good deal on Priceline, etc.

Great location and great hotel right in the middle of Union Square. Highly recommend this place. Just a walking distance from lots of eateries and shopping. Thereâ€™s a Starbucks in the hotel, and another one right opposite the entrance. A CVS convenience store is located 2 mins away, in case you want to pick up sundry items. The rooms are fairly big, comfortable and well equipped. Modern. Clean. Loved the art works in the hotel lobby. The hotel staff is friendly. The concierge desk gets a double thumbs up as they were a great help for us in deciding what we wanted to do around the city and how to get to places.

This is a very large hotel. So expect it to be very busy and hence, you won't feel the personalised service here. Nevertheless, staff are efficient and polite. Location is excellent. Near to Union Square. The rooms have been refurbished a few years back and are still functional and ok, but certainly the wear and tear are showing. Breakfast was average but the staff were all very efficient.

If you are looking for a convenient location for tourism or business, this is ideal. I lived in SF for 28 years before moving away, so I had no reason to stay at the Hyatt. The room was decent, however, the location on the other side of the elevator was not good. We could hear a constant wind tunnel whenever the elevator moved. Please make sure you ask for a room that is not in that type of location.

We spent 5 nights here and our experience was great. All the staff was all very friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable and clean. We ate breakfast in the restaurant and it was excellent. The staff in the restaurant were all very friendly and quick to take care of every need we might have. They were constantly watching for any indication that we needed something. Not to the point of being over you all the time, but offered refills for drinks etc. They would ask about your day or where your were from, showing interest in their customers. The host and hostess were also very helpful. We were traveling with our teenage granddaughter, who likes to sleep later than we do, so we would go down for breakfast while she was catching an extra hour of sleep. When she was ready, we would take her down and all the staff were very helpful in getting her a delicious breakfast to take back to our room. I really can't think of a better experience we have had anywhere. I would definitely stay here again. It is located just three blocks from Chinatown. We walked there several times. The streets felt safe when we were out. It is next to Union Station, which is good if you are looking for shopping. The tour buses all stop there, so you are close for pick up if you use a "hop on hop off". The concierges were very helpful getting tickets or information. They gave us excellent suggestions for restaurants. The cable cars are one block away. You can ride all the way to the wharf, piers or embarcadero. We used Uber a couple of times and they were very efficient at getting us where we needed to go in a timely manner. All in all it was an excellent experience. You will see some posts about the homeless. There are homeless in San Francisco, but we did not feel threatened by them. They did not stay around the hotel. I read reports from others that they saw them in the hotels and even up on the floors where they were staying. We did not have that problem. Felt very safe the entire time we were there. If you stay away from the Tenderloin area, you should not have any problems. Our room had two queen beds and a partial bay view. It was very nice to look out and see the sailboats on the bay and the twinkling lights at night.

Just spent a 3 day break in the city & would recommend this hotel for it's location both for amenities & arriving from the airport with just a short walk from the BART. Handy also for walking distance to the cable car & bus links, Chinatown & down to the Bay area. Will use on a possible return.

I decided to stay in this hotel because of the good reviews here, i was little bit disappointed when first got in the room..very average furniture,no toiletries,no bath robe,no slippers,no water boiler, ...nothing at all..!Lobby is very small..Donâ€™t think Iâ€™ll come here again.

Great friendly service and fast! Room was perfect and so was view. It was quiet and we slept well. I would recommend this place to anyone that likes to shop or dine. The area is filled with high end stores and restaurants.

After a long flight from the UK we got the warmest welcome when we arrived at the Grand Hyatt. Loved our room with amazing views over the Bay. Coffee maker and a fridge in the room were very welcome. As were the bottles of water available from reception. Hotel is well located next to Union Square and a short walk from the metro, cable car turnaround and F line bus for Fisherman's Wharf. Front desk staff and concierge were extremely friendly and helpful. We had no problems with Wi-Fi and there is a facility for printing out boarding passes. Would definitely return.

This hotel has all the quality of a grand Hyatt which you expect but what sets this apart is its location at union square, considering the room rates itâ€™s very good value for location and the staff are very efficient We opted for a bay view which was well worth the small extra price as the view we had was spectacular If you are looking for a nice hotel in a great location we would certainly recommend the Grand Hyatt

This is one of my favorite Hyatt Hotels, when my family comes I always ask for a high floor overlooking Union Square, & I put them up in the nice big room so they can enjoy the city views and take in San Francisco! This hotel is slightly bigger than me Regency Club, but the Hyatt Regency San Francisco on the Embarcadero is also another excellent choice if you want to stay in a Hyatt property, and be close to tourist spots like the ferry building. The Hyatt Grand is a great hotel, and they have breakfast in the Club level on the 32nd Floor I believe, which has delicious omelettes, sausages & fruits, with an honor bar for your drinks, as well as all of the juice, cereal, oatmeals & milk that one could hope for while staying in a hotel. Great friendly staff who are always very attentive and welcoming! Like most downtown San Francisco hotels, there is no pool or sauna per se but there are nice fitness centers at both the Hyatt Grand and the Hyatt Regency. Consider joining the world of Hyatt rewards program as it certainly provides you with better options during your stay such as free Wi-Fi upgrades and numerous points for every dollar spent at Hyatt properties.

Our stays at the Grand Hyatt have always been first class. The staff is extremely helpful. The rooms are distinctive, clean, and very comfortable. The club level dining experience is excellent, especially the breakfast offerings. The location is perfect for shopping in Union Square and I always feel safe there. I can't wait to stay there again.

Best location ever for a visitor to SF. The service was great. Spenser was very cooperative on check in. Parking is 35$ but it seems this is the norm in SF. Extra taxes were added to the bill !! Other than that it was just peered the stay.

Visited 6/14/2018. As usual, service and condition of property was excellent. Wonderful location. Hyatt provides aconsistently satisfying experience. Hyatt points are easy to use and website is user friendly.

Stayed for four nights. The room was very spacious, loved the controls on the wall and beside the bed for the lights, blinds etc. The furniture in the lounge section had chips in it and is looking a little worn it just sort of took the room down a little. The bed was very comfortable, two bathrooms which is great for getting ready in the mornings. Shampoo etc topped up and the room cleaned well on a daily basis. The staff down at breakfast each morning were lovely, you know it's like little things like on the 2nd day it was "Welcome back ladies" and with the amount of people coming in each day I thought that was nice that we were recognised and greeted warmly. The other staff were attentive and had a great attitude as well. Fabulous location in the city, 5 minute walk to Chinatown. I'd recommend staying here. If I'm back in the city, I will be. There isn't water in the room, but when you're heading out just ask reception and they'll give you some, same when coming back in - too easy. Concierge was also great with maps and directions, taxis were called for us by the doorman when we needed them. Nothing was a hassle and it all just went really smoothly. Our bags were held onto during the day as out flight was at 9pm and there was no issue retrieving them. Thank you for an enjoyable and very comfortable stay.

Stayed for two nights during our sixteen night tour of USA. This hotel is nice but definitely our least favorite of all the hotels we stayed at. The lobby and rooms are nice but the bathroom goes back in time with a shower over the bath with a curtain....arggghh my worst nightmare, so gross and un hygienic!!. The soundproofing between rooms was pretty bad and we could hear the toilet flushing above and people chatting early morning next door!!. Breakfast is the poorest I have ever had traveling worldwide for many years. It was so tiny with minimal choice and food at hot buffet was merely warm. The dining room was also really small and cramped. The staff however throughout the hotel were always very helpful and friendly and can not fault them the only exception being house keeping attempting to service our room at 8am on the day we were due to check out at 12noon!!. We had good views from our room if the bay in the distance and the location of the hotel is great right at Union square. I wouldnâ€™t return to this hotel again though, there are many options nearby that I feel would offer better value and amenities and no shower curtain!!!!

Long flight in from Japan and had a 12 hr. lay-over. Last minute booked on Hyatt App, fast and efficient. Hopped Shuttle and was checked in and sleeping with an hour.Great locations and good for that pre and post stays to traveling.

I have reviewed this hotel before and rated it poorly due to the wind effects on the building [sway and noise]. I recently stayed again on a lower floor [3rd] and would give this property a much better review. Location is terrific, staff are friendly, great amenities including a good fitness center, and rooms are spacious. I would definitely recommend it but stay at the lower levels. You can enjoy a great view from the fitness center or meetings rooms on the top floor.

I was given a handicap room with a very non functional bathroom. The bath towels were hanging on the Support bars around the toilet. I was given another room the following day and the tiloilet stoped working. Overall not a very good experience. The management addressed our concerns begrudgingly and not in conciliatory tone.

I stayed in this hotel for a week while traveling on business. I had a room on the 11th floor overlooking Union Square.Firstly, the location and the view are perfect. Very central, right next to loads of tourist attractions and also travel links if, like me, you are on business. Staff were generally really helpful and friendly, I had to contact them about a few different things and always sorted my problems.The gym is on one of the higher floors, great view and relatively well equipped. Its fairly small but it was empty every time I went in so that wasn't an issue. Food is what let this hotel down for me. Badly.On my first night I ordered some room service and this made me violently ill foe the next 2 days. Very very bad as it meant I had to rearrange planned meetings I had. Later on in the week I went to the restaurant for breakfast. The layout is very cramped and the seating very uncomfortable. It was $34 for the smallest buffet I've ever seen, looked very sad and unappealing. Overall, I'd definitely stay here again but the food needs massive improvement.

used to stay here regularly, but stopped many years ago, as the great location could not compensate for the very worn room conditions and the generally unappealing public areas. am pleased to say hyatt has done a lot, and this is a fine property now. room was sleek and modern, but still felt confortable and not stark. bed was very good. water pressure was good. had a small frig that we did not use. plenty of elevators, too. a big deal in a high rise. the public areas are very nice, lobby fireplace, and mezzanine bar and restaurant. great location, would reccomend

Recently stayed here. Nice and close to Union Square and China Town etc. Staff very friendly and helpful. We found the food a bit over priced and average to be honest. Number of homeless/ beggars around the hotel - mainly across the road. Close to a Starbucks.

Customer service was excellent the entire stay. Upgraded to a room with a view of Union Square but curtains malfunctioned so we weren't able to enjoy the view. Contacted the concierge and maintenance fixed it right away. A few hours later the curtains were not working again. Didn't have time to contact concierge again.

This was a 5 day stay to complete our recent East to West Coast trip of America from the UK. After not having a very good experience staying at the Grand Hyatt New York at the start of our holiday we were a little worried that the end of the holiday would be spoilt. No worry there, from the moment our car door was opened we knew this was how it was meant to be and what we are used to.Kimberley on reception was wonderful and checked us in quickly and efficiently, with water bottles handed to us as soon as we got to the desk. A bellboy escorted us and our luggage to our spacious room and showed us how everything worked (we knew but it was nice to receive the extra attention).Our room on the 30th floor was large, clean and spacious with a wonderful view across the city and to the bay beyond. The bathroom was smaller than expected with the size of the room but still had a good walk in shower so no issues at all.The Grand Club Lounge( 32nd Floor) was very good with a good choice of horâ€™doevres in the evening and a reasonable choice for breakfast. Staff members in the lounge were helpful, friendly and obviously enjoyed their job, especially David and Jimmy (we miss you!). The view from the Grand Club lounge looks over the city and â€œThe Rockâ€ù which is Alcatraz, and was a lovely place to wile away a few relaxing hours at any time of the day.Hailey the Concierge did an excellent job for us arranging a limo to take us on a city tour, and was very enthusiastic to hear how it all went. She also assisted in changing our collection time for a pre booked car to take us to the airport for our return home; nothing seemed to be too much trouble. Each concierge we came into contact with was just as nice and helpful. We even had one of the house keepers and a maintenance man ask us if everything was alright and how were we enjoying our holiday. After our wonderful city tour we had a very pleasant couple of vodka martinis in the OneUp Lounge, thanks Zak and Mitch, again two great members of staff.This was the perfect finish to our wonderful holiday, and even on check out Ira again proved that the Grand Hyatt San Francisco has some wonderful staff members. We have travelled around Canada many times including Vancouver where we stay at the Fairmont Waterfront on their Gold Floor, and we love the place, San Francisco and the Grand Hyatt is now our second love. I have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this wonderful hotel and must go back.

Lovely room, great views, really lovely skyline from the 26th floor overlooking Alcatraz in the background. Pillows were uncomfortable and its another one of those hotels that favours a sliding bathroom door that doesn't seal, which is my least favorite kind if you'd like to pee with dignity. Short of that, a very lovely hotel, great location next to Union Square, lots of very expensive shops around and only a short taxi ride to Pier 39. Recommend Fog Harbour Fish House, very nice food but book with ample notice!

This hotel has a good location and excellent facillites Nice and clean and well servicedMy son and I stayed there for 3 days in may 2018The concierge was very helpful with showing us how to get around

Our stay at the hotel was a great experience the staff was professional and accommodating .I would strongly recommend this hotel to both couples or family.Comfortable rooms good food and close by to the major city attractions.

Stayed for 8 days while attending a conference and visiting my daughter. Every aspect of this hotel was excellent. We order room service twice. Both times the food was delivered promptly, it was hot, and of excellent quality. Housekeeping services were excellent. We had drinks in the bar several times and found them to be attentive and friendly. Even the doorman was very accommodating. All in all, we were very pleasantly surprised by the service and professionalism of everyone we dealt with.

We stayed here for a business meeting. The location just off Union Square. Chinatown is a few short blocks away and much is within walking distance, including the Moscone Center. There are numerous excellent restaurants close by and many high end shopping venues. The prices are definitely above what is reasonable for the rooms which are cramped and older. The elevators are a bit slow and the fitness area is rudimentary. The persons working there are tops. They are, to a person, friendly, helpful, and courteous. Other than the price, this was a good hotel.

Ideal location beside Union Square where the HOHO Bus begins. A block from the iconic cable car that goes to Fishermanâ€™s Wharf area, GreyLine Bus Tours, and couple more in different directions to shopping, restaurants and China Town. Our room was spacious, very clean, and had an excellent mattress. The staff were courteous and professional. Overall, a well managed hotel.

We had a pleasant and early checkin.. we were given water which was complementary anytime.. the room was decent size with an amazing room, it was quiet although close to the elevators, the porters were courteous and helpful, the room had excellent view of the San Francisco skyline, the hotel location is amazing, itâ€™s well connected, and there are loads of restaurants and food options available around from street style to fine dining.. shopping malls and designer brands were all walking distance

This hotel and staff were outstanding. I particularly want to recognize the concierge desk: Elaine, Vanessa, Liz, Hailey and Joanne. They know their business and were extremely helpful in their recommendations. They were professional and friendly. Also, Tan and Jaime in the bar were fantastic....extremely welcoming and kind. Finally, Mac, the gentleman who has worked for the Hyatt for 50 years. He was very warm and friendly in his greetings in the lobby. All in all, rooms were comfortable and the experience was terrific.

This hotel is in the middle of Union Square. Centrally located within walking distance of China Town and the Financial District. The service staff here is excellent and tries to cater to your every whim. Be sure to connect with Vanessa at the concierge desk, she was most helpful.

The hotel is very well located. The rooms are spacious, clean and well equipped. We had a great view from our room. The staff were courteous and helpful. Considering how big the hotel is, you did not have to wait long for the elevators.

Convenient location in Union Square, next to Chinatown. Really enjoyed the restaurant/bar - the bartender there was so delightful. Always am pleased with the Grand Hyatt brand. Would highly recommend.

Good convenient location to get around and shop, catch rides on cable car, restaurants .We had fun time seeing all the sights from great hotel service from very helpful staff every day. Weather was perfect.

I really enjoyed my stay here. San Fran is a very expensive place to stay and it was 200 bucks a night which was meant to be reasonable. But price aside I really liked the hotel. The bed was super comfortable I shared with a mate but it was so big it did not feel like sharing a bed. The coffee machine was a good touch and being on the 34 floor the views weâ€™re phenomenal. I found the staff helpful and it was really peaceful after a busy day exploring. I donâ€™t normally stay in big hotels as am more of a small guest house man but I really enjoyed the change. It was nice to spoil myself.

I had the room on the 30th floor . The views were good, room was clean, mattress comfortable. Charging plug points bedside, remote control to open / close the shades, coffee maker in the room. Stay was just perfect. Location wise - close to Union square, most designer stores.

The property is conveniently and centrally located next to Union Square and the cable car lines. Within a 1/2 mile radius, one can shop and eat until you drop. The staff is friendly and accommodating.

Hotel is well located with great view from higher floors. Very good quality food and room service. Shower could be better and rooms lack mini bars. Refrigerators are empty. No water in rooms which is most surprising.

We always stay at Hyatt Hotels if they are available. We travel a lot and understand that each Hyatt experience will be different. There is a certain level of professionalism that you expect when staying at a Grand Hyatt. I REALLY dislike the check in process. Why they decided to get rid of a traditional "hotel front desk" is beyond me. No one knows where to stand to wait their turn, the kiosk style check in makes the lobby look like a mess. The computer screen blocks the view of the desk clerk (I can't even tell you what my guy looked like. He didn't introduce himself, we weren't offered water, he was VERY uninterested in checking us in). It was a big disappointment. The concierge staff were wonderful. That is why I still gave them 4 stars, instead of 3, but any interaction with front desk personnel was lack luster to say the least.

You never miss with Hyatt. Always dependable and takes the worry out of business travel so you can concentrate on why your really there. Great hotel in a great city. Really enjoyed myself. My second time in San Fran. I hope to return again someday

I was visiting for a long weekend and found the hotel a great choice. Itâ€™s an easy walk to BART, Union Square and SFMOMA. Wonderfully comfortable bed and very roomy space. Iâ€™d definitely stay there again.

Property location and rooms are absolutely great, especially if you're coming for a shopping or sightseeing trip. The historic San Francisco tram line is right on the adjacent street. The staff can do with a little more training.

A great location next to Union Square; close to BART, restaurants, grocery stores, Chinatown, cable cars. My view room had spectacular view overlooking Union Square and also the cityscape, surrounding hills, and the bay beyond.

Like many hotels, this one that claims to care about sustainability and conserving water by allowing the guest indicate when they want towels to be replaced. However, despite all of my efforts to clearly indicate I wanted my towels not replaced by hanging them up, they were replaced anyway.

My partner and I recently stayed here for 11 nights, on first impressions it is quite a grand hotel and definitely suits it's name sake.We were greeted on arrival by the doorman who offered to assist with our cases, check in was smooth and stress free.We took the lift to our room which was like a rollercoaster ride as the lift was so swift and fast.Our room was really quite nice, lovely big and comfortable bed, which is always a concern for me as having a congenital back condition I worry about the comfort of the bed, I didn't need to worry as it was divine.The room size was more than ample, overlooking the city.There was plenty of drawer and wardrobe space with a lovely big bathroom.What I did find bizarre was the electronic window blinds would randomly open at various times in the night. I should have reported this but I forgot and to be honest I thought it was funny and wasn't an issue for us really. Room service is excellent and very swift, the staff who ensure your room is clean and tidy do an excellent job and are lovely and friendly.Every time we got into the lift with a member of staff they always asked we were and how is a room and did we need anything, nothing was too much trouble. We frequented the bar for drinks and a small bite to eat, the food is lovely and so are the cocktails. What impressed me the most is the way the staff helped us when we were met with an unexpected predicament while on the city tram. Just to be cautious as a tourist do not take your eye off your handbag for a second as there are pickpockets on the trams.Liz on the concierge desk immediately sprung into action for us by contacting the local police and arranged for them to be brought up to our room.We would like to thank Liz, Stephen and Jason for their attentive care towards us, despite what happened it would not put us off visiting again as it could have easily happened anywhere. This is an exceptional hotel and you will not be disappointed with your stay here.We are looking forward to coming back again very soon.

A Grand Hyatt in name only. While its location is great, and it serves the corporate/function market very well, this is a poor choice for holiday travel - and we had 9 nights there.The guest room (KIng) we had was high up on the 29th floor overlooking Union Square as per our booking. We were paying extra for that

Easy walking distance to Moscone Center and located right in the shopping district. close to Chinatown as well. Enough noise got through the windows even at level 10. Rooms are updated and good sized. Would stay again

My hotel stay was punctuated by my realization that I had left my jewelry in the room safe several hours after I had departed. My call to the hotel was met with such incredible professionalism. The Security staff had not only located my jewelry, but had inventoried the items and placed them in the hotel security safe. This morning, I was greeted by the Hotel security staff where I was able to retrieve my jewelry. Everything was exactly where I had left it, not an item was missing. I will be sure to return and when I do, I know the security of me and my personal items are at the forefront of their hospitality.

The Grand Hyatt is located next to Union Square and is thus a great place to start exploring the city. Check-in was a good customer experience, and overall, the staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are big enough, well-equipped and comfortable, and if youâ€™re lucky, offer nice views on the city skyline. Breakfast is not included in the price, which makes a stay at the Grand Hyatt not exactly cheap. Breakfast is good though, and so are the bar on the mezzanine level and the other amenities. The only negative is the internet: I stay in a lot of great hotels and too often I find the internet to be very spotty and faulty. The Grand Hyatt is no exception which is rather frustrating when on business travel.

I did not appreciate being placed into a room that was next to the service elevator shaft. Bad move, i will not be returning here again. Felt like i was sleeping next to a subway. Hotel location good but Room was shabby and tired.

Grand Hyatt offers the best location for travelers who want access to the shopping district, Embarcadero, Fishermanâ€™s Wharf, Chinatown, and North Beach. It is also closer to laundromat services (Peteâ€™s Laundry is the best!). We have stayed in Parc 55 in 2017, which was also a good hotel, but we much prefer the location of Grand Hyatt.Service-wise, I would give them a 4.5 rating. Most staff are cordial and helpful. Some are cold and rude.

Room expensive with no added value vs a normal hotel.Premium price not corresponding to any differentiating service$450/night not including breakfastNo amenities in roomPersonnel not friendlyI won't choose again this hotelComparable to any 3-4 less expensive hotels

Central to the Financial District or on the Cable Car line for pleasure, this hotel is just the right fit. Incredible staff available at all hours of the day to help with questions, directions or even suggestions on food. One of my top Hyatt hotels in the world
We stayed 4 nights in a Grand Club King. Check-in was very friendly & welcoming.Comfy bed & pillows and good shower. However, air-conditioning duct was continually noisy even with a/con switched off.

My husband and I stayed 2 days in a regular King Room (#1511) to attend a conference. The room was very clean, comfy, with newer furniture. On Friday (5/10/18), we were able to watch filming from an adjacent roof top. Pretty cool. The homemade bbq potato chips served at the bar were unique and a real treat. Also, ordered room service which was delicious. Staff were very courteous and helpful. Upon arrival, I really appreciated the quick response from valet staff. Yes, itâ€™s costly, but we didnâ€™t want to deal with self parking across the street. The conference was held at the lowest level and staff were very professional. There was some side talking from the servers during the breakfast presentation, but I believe it was because attendees were arriving late and the servers were try to serve them. I would definitely attend a conference here again and will stay overnight. Very safe location and lots to see.

Guest room: excellent condition, overall hotel: excellent. I am less likely to recommend Hyatt hotels in general due to problems with Wi-Fi connectivity. Once connected, the service keeps dropping every few minutes and one has to keep going through the log-in process. Frustrating to say the least. Hotel staff were very helpful and connected us with Hyatt IT in San Diego to attempt to solve the issue. Long story but finally unresolved issue and IT person said it is a problem with Apple devices. Uh, hello Hyatt corporate; most travelers are using Apple products these days and connectivity is paramount. The problem lies with the internet service provider that Hyatt corporate has chosen. Same problem in Indian Wells, Sacramento, and Hyatt hotels in general. Also discussed with other hotel guests using Apple, same issue of constant dropping out of service connection so not just my device. Your competitor hotels do not have this issue. To the Board of Directors: Do not let Hyatt go the way of Wells Fargo. I like Hyatt hotels.

Great location in Union Square. Check-in was smooth, lobby and reception were well staffed. My room was on the 21st floor, simple design but cozy and warm. No lounge chair, but not a big deal. The cleaning crew was great, but the overall room service could be improved. Few calls to housekeeping were not picked up, bathrobe and sleepers are available only upon request and it took 20 minutes and a follow-up call to have them delivered. It was a bit annoying waiting to take a shower after a day of business meetings. Dry cleaning was delivered late and again after a follow-up call. I could not enjoy the rooftop because that day it was closed for a private event. To be fair, this hotel is 4-star, so not comparable with the 5-stars Grand Hyatt in Asia,but the overall experience was positive if compared to other San Francisco hotels.

The actual STAY at grand Hyatt was good. Comfortable bed with minimum noise, nice view. However Communication between staff and customer service NEED A LOT OF WORK. The night before our check in I called at 8:45 p.m. To make sure that checking in early Friday morning would not be an issue as we would be arriving around 4 or 5:00 a.m. Gentleman confirmed and thanked me for calling to let him know to get the room ready. We arrived approximately 5:45 a.m. the next day and was told that our room was not ready, Even though a note was placed on the record. We had to wait over 6 HOURS for the room. Tried to get some rest on the couches in there Lobby lounge area, in which we were approached by staff two separate times to ask us if we were guests of the hotel, as to suggest that we were loitering in the Lobby. Mind you, there were people that had been in the lobby longer then we had been, and they WERE NOT ASKED ANYTHING. After checking with the staff at the front counter the person returned apologetically stating that our room is continuing to be readied. After the first time we were approached, I asked if there was a simple standard room we could get some rest in while we waited for our Bay View room to be ready. They were not able to accommodate stating that I would be stuck with the (standard) room for the length of my stay. Eventually, once we were notified that our room was ready, the clerk stated that she had placed me in a â€œnicer roomâ€ù. Come to find out it was the same room I had paid for in the first place. One thing I will say is Gliezl, a front counter attendant did make Sure we had water and was able to comp. Our breakfast for the day, which they almost charge me twice for once at breakfast and once at check out. So all in all, the biggest issues we experienced where lack of communication and poor customer service. Definitely not what I would expected from a reputable Union square hotel.

The location of the Grand Hyatt is pefect, directly at Union Square. It takes 30min walking to Fishermans Wharf and within 10-15min you find everything for shopping, lunch or dinner.The rooms were clean and everything you need was there.

We loved just about everything about this hotel! The location was great right in Union Square, so it was close to everything. Parking was very easy in a garage right across the street. The room was clean and the layout was easy to navigate. Beds were very comfortable, too! The hotel restaurant, One Up, had excellent tomato soup, though it was a bit pricey (but expected given the location). The only issue we had was that we stayed in a joined room next to a family we didn't know, and we could hear their conversations and kids very easily through the closed joined door. Otherwise, absolutely no complaints! Highly recommend!

The hotel was perfect. Great location, great service and staff. Highly recommend staying here for business or pleasure. Upgraded without asking. Room with a view. Enjoyed the restaurant and bar. Safe and secure.

Stayed in this hotel on a recent vacation. Fantastic location in Union Square, close to shopping, transportation and dining. The staff was accommodating and friendly and the rooms were clean and comfortable.

Room was quite nice but not amazing. We had a club floor room. Room was no different to ordinary rooms but you get access to the club lounge on floor 32. This means you get free food EG breakfast and dinner. Don't pay for bed and breakfast, go for the club room, you get a great breakfast included, bacon, eggs, sausage, fruit, cereal, smoked salmon, bagels etc etc. Food in the evening between 5 and 7, choices during our week included chicken, beef, mousakka, Mexican dishes etc, and lots of other stuff. We only bought our lunches during the week we stayed as we were out sightseeing each day. Great value. Drinks are basically free too. Beers, spirits, wine etc. You're supposed to fill in a card for what drinks you have and then they charge 3 dollars per drink but nobody did this! So great value all told!

The best thing about this hotel is the location near Union Square. Also it is modern and comfortable. The room was nice but lighting strange and hard to use. The restaurant is very basic. The lounge is nice. At $500 a night it was expensive.

We were charged extra for an upgrade the moment we came in. I thought maybe we get a better room for that. But were given a corner room, while the view was ok but the noise in the room next door wont let u rest. The rooms are small in size and really it doesnâ€™t have the class of a grand hyatt i have stayed world over. A bad experience and would strongly not recommend this hotel. Not for the price and the extra paid by us

Basic room not as nice as anticipated.Noise from dart all night like a whoosing noise. Made to feel inferior to more expensive rooms. Good service from people on the hotel door though.Wouldn't visit again.

Hotel was immaculate but the staff makes this place the outstanding hotel that it is. Everyone goes the extra mile. It exceeded all of my expectations. Rooms not overly large but adequate. Amenities nice. Food delicious!

The hotel is beautiful! Staff is great and makes you feel welcome from the first time you check-in and throughout your stay. Great location to Union Square, Starbucks is right across the street which is very nice :-)

Great location looking over Union Square with shopping, dining and transportation nearby. View over the square was fun and other side had bay views. Room was not large but was efficient and clean. Staff were personable and extremely helpful

Business meeting in SF and stayed at Grand Hyatt SF. Excellent location. Condition of hotel showed its age or it needs some updates. Atrium is small and staff level is low relative to the number of guests. As a Hyatt member, room preference was not honored. Staff seems hurried. AC unit was loud and temperature not stabled. Room with a connecting door, which was bent and leaked next door's conversation into ours.

Iâ€™ve never had a bad experience at a Grand Hyatt, and this property didnâ€™t disappoint. The staff are all very friendly and helpful, and all areas of the hotel I was in were clean and tastefully updated. The location is great: Starbucks and CVS across the street, numerous bars and restaurants in walking distance, plenty of shopping nearby, a few blocks from Moscone, and just a few blocks from Chinatown. If you want to explore San Francisco by cable car, that too is just 2 blocks away! If being in an area thatâ€™s walkable is important to you, and thatâ€™s always a huge thing for me, this is a great location. An added bonus is they have complimentary bottles of water at registration. The only downside Iâ€™d say about the room itself is that thereâ€™s no full length mirror. One of the walls has what looks like the designer tried to use as a full length mirror, but the bottom is only a few inches wide so definitely does not constitute a full length mirror. (You can kind of see this area in the photo with my suitcase) Might seem minor but knowing this hotel has so many business guests due to the close proximity to Moscone, seems like a miss to me. Other than that, the room was great, and I would definitely stay here again.

The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are small but clean, nicely decorated and comfortable. It was nice to have a small refrigerator in the room with the coffee maker. It is very conveniently located and walking distance to the Union Square attractions and great restaurants, cable cars, bus, etc. We took Uber around and the prices were very reasonable. The best part was having Starbucks and a CVS right across the street. We have stayed here before and will return again!

I stayed here for 6 nights with my husband and 2 children in April. We really enjoyed our stay. Here are some highlights: Location -great location - unlike many hotels which advertise being on Union Square but are several blocks away, this one is separated from union square only be the Apple store. Itâ€™s in the heart of the shopping district and also close to Chinatown.The room - we had booked a 1 bedroom VIP suite. This room was large and very well appointed. It has a large lounge and dining area and a separate large bedroom with huge ensuite bathroom. There was also a separate toilet off the living area. We had 2 rollaway beds for the kids and there was ample room for the 4 of us. We really liked our room. The only downside was we could hear the elevators going up and down all night. It was quite a loud noise which was disappointing for the amount we paid. (We were in room 3411). The service - excellent service. We had a friendly and efficient check in. We arrived before check in time but they put a rush on housekeeping for the room for us so that we could the room as soon as possible and contacted us when it was ready. The concierge was excellent. Everyone we spoke to was very helpful. When we first arrived we spoke to Joanna and she gave us maos if the area, a list of recommended restaurants and a suggested walking tour route. We saw some things we would not otherwise have seem. Thanks Joanna and Team! This is an expensive hotel but we found the room, location and service all excellent and Iâ€™d definitely stay there again

Warm welcome and pay attention to details concierge informations were very specific and helpful. Room cleaning service was outstanding Only one thing that could be improve is number of homeless around the hotel.

After my experience at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco this is now the only hotel I want to stay at in the future. I was amazed how the staff went above and beyond my expectations and how staying there felt like home.

Stayed here for 5 nights while attending a wedding. My room was super clean and quiet (on one of the corners where there are only two rooms; not all rooms may be this quiet). Location was great - a quick walk to the Powell BART station.

Overall I was very pleased with the hotel. The hotel staff was outstanding! The concierge desk did an incredible job of recommending restaurants and personal services. And the technician who came up to repair my TV, Willfredo, was great! Very polite, attentive and accommodating. The hotelâ€™s location at Union Square is desirable and convenient, but as in any major city, you have to be keenly aware not to stray into adjacent sketchy areas. The bed was a little too firm for my taste; Iâ€™m sure choosing a mattress firmness is one of the biggest difficulties for a hotel. No question, I would definitely choose to stay at the Grand Hyatt Union Square again!

I picked this hotel because of its reasonable rates and seemed like one of the newer places in Union Square. However those who are used to Grand Hyatt standards in Asia should know from the start that this is not on the same level - something that is reflected in the room rates - and is more of a business hotel.It started well. I was warmly welcomed on check-in and was given a room and a free bottle of water despite arriving at 1pm (check-in time was 4pm!).Like most hotels in Union Square, the hotel was not that new but it was very conveniently located near Union Square - and the Apple shop. The room and bathroom were reasonably large. The sheets and towels were all greying, making the room feel a little jaded. More horrifyingly, late in the night I discovered a brown stain which looked like diluted blood on my duvet cover and one of the pillow cases. Not only that, I also found a small shard of hard ragged plastic under the duvet on top of my sheets!Too tired to deal with it that late, I went to the front desk the next morning to ask that all the sheets and pillow cases be changed. I was assured by the front desk staff that it would be taken care of. I go out and return 3 hours later to find that nobody had come to make up my room, much less changed the offending sheets.When I went back to the front desk to ask, I was told that they had made a mistake and changed the sheets in the wrong room! They offered to either change all the bedding or let me change rooms and gave me two drink vouchers to use while I waited. The matter was quickly resolved after that, with the head of housekeeping calling personally to apologise and to offer to waive my nightâ€™s rates. I had also asked for laundry to be picked up in the morning and had to wait for almost 30 mins. When I called after 20 mins to ask when they would be coming by, the person on the phone defensively said with a raised voice: â€œHe has 25 orders to pick up this morning! I didnâ€™t forget!!â€ù I donâ€™t really think the staffâ€™s workload is something the guests should be worrying about when they come stay at your hotel. I also needed to get a data SIM card and asked the (unfriendly, and ultimately not very useful) concierge where I could get one. She told me to go to the Apple store, or the pharmacies which didnâ€™t really make sense to me - of course none of them sold SIM cards. Eventually I walked four blocks and finally found a T-Mobile shop on my own.The rest of my 4-night stay went fine. I appreciated Kinga dealing with the matter decisively and the personal note I received from the housekeeping manager after my stay.

Just finished up a weeklong stay here. I liked the view from my room and the selection of food each morning in the grand club. The fitness center was adequate and not too crowded in the evening. Aside from that, there isnâ€™t much else to rave about. First impression was lackluster. At check-in, I didnâ€™t get a thanks for being a Hyatt elite, just the room key. Despite being an Explorist, I wasnâ€™t offered a room upgrade, but there were two higher categories of room (below suite) showing available on my Hyatt app. I also had added a club access award to the reservation but there was no mention made at check-in of where the club room was located or that the award was active. The room was mostly clean and the bed comfy. Unfortunately, the automatic shades were broken or defective, as the motor would lower the shades well past the window such that the shade started piling up on the floor. Also, the June Jacobs amenities are terrible...I wish Grand Hyatts would upgrade from these products. I probably wouldnâ€™t return here for business again since the price was equivalent to staying in a 5 star resort, but the property didnâ€™t really offer much more than a good location off of Union Square.

This was my first time ever visiting the Grand Hyatt, I was greeted with a friendly smile, valet person told me to make sure and get my ticket validated otherwise my charge would be extremely expensive. My meeting took place on the very top floor, direction was a bit difficult but managed to get to the top. The food and beverage selection for breakfast was excellent, fresh and savory, with service staff that filled my coffee and juice, bacon was crispy and flavorful, an array of danish and croissants, breads with hot and cold options. The meeting room was again complimented with incredible views of San Francisco, provided Herman Miller chairs for the meeting which was incredible and the PM snack as well displayed with a variety of options. Excellent job to the banquet team and the culinary skills.

My boyfriend and I stayed here the day after Christmas. We were upgraded for $25.00 to the 17th floor? With a view of union square. Absolutely worth it!! The women at check in was so friendly, I wish I got her name. Room clean and comfortable as always.

I am a mature business woman who travels frequently. Due to the airport being closed, I checked in at 2:00 am. There was no on-site parking. When I parked in front of the hotel for a few minutes to try to determine where the parking is, I was intimidated by aggressive street people. As I was surveying the reception main door area, it had no signage as to where to park, no after-hours telephone number to call either the front desk or the valet. After trying to call the hotel, and, getting lost in a web of "dial this number for this, or that", i finally put may car in the no-park zone and ran into the reception desk (again with street people lurking and being assertive. I was very scared!. After speaking to the front desk, I was told that there is off-site parking and the address. Duh, I am visiting from out of town, and, I had no idea where that address is. After I asked the receptionist about a safer alternative as I felt truly unsafe, I was told that there was valet service. After I pried that tidbit out off the front desk clerk, a young man came running through the streets to take my car. Again, no name tag or identification--I went back into the hotel to acknowledge that this is indeed a representative of the hotel, and, I was giving my car to a responsible source. I did speak to the manager on duty on Friday--not sure that she "got" it. I mentioned that they should consider some signage for after hours--her response "we don't have a sign".
