I reminded her that there are places who can make a "sign". It should be noted that I am from a big city on the East Coast, and, I travel to other large cities, who have their share of homeless. However, I see security everywhere in the form of hotel employees or police at those other cities and I have NEVER felt as unsafe and unsure. Two positives--Randy and the valet service and Elaine at the Concierge desk. All else aside, the next time I will stay outside of the city at a Hyatt House or similar. They generally feature people who are warm and caring, parking and much nicer rooms. Really, Hyatt? This is upscale? Really?

Great location and lovely hotel. Convenient to assess to main attractions like union square, market street, cable car, Chinatown. Room has great view over the Bay and make sure you get a room at 20 something floors to get a beautiful view. Go to 36 floors to see a better view of the costume and Bay. Room is clean except no daily water is provided. The level 2 lounge is great with reasonable price and choices of wine. The Starbucks is just right opposite of you are a Starbucks drinker..

Location wise it is very good and located in Union Square where all all the shopping is nearby. Room size is a bit small but the room is very new. Tastefully furbished. Bed is comfortable as well. The bathroom is very small but it is very clean and functional. Overall, no complain here and would come back here again.

Everything was a bit pricey for this hotel. The room was pretty small and valet parking was more expensive than other hotels. The room was updated and clean, with a decent view of the city. The restaurant in the hotel was really expensive too.

I am an active and loyal Hyatt customer and am disappointed with my current visit to this Grand Hyatt location. While the hotel is well situated and nicely appointed I feel some strange choices have been made that detract from the experience. First, the coffee machine in the room is the cheapest type (akin to what a motel 8 would have) and no morning coffee service is available in the lobby; unless you choose to pay for coffee at their cafe. At a four star hotel you should be able to get a basic cup of coffee without an extra expense. Second, they have a sign in the room that they only change the towels and sheets every other day unless you specifically call the operator and request this. I would not mind this if they contributed at least part of the savings to a conservation group. But instead the pocket the savings; put the onus on the customer to request service and serve it up as a commitment to the environment. Thus, still a quality hotel but the service/amenities could be more customer friendly.

We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights over spring break. The room rate was a bit expensive. However, the room was lovely. We ordered room service on one night which was excellent. Staff very friendly and helpful. However, the room was noisy at night so I couldn't say that I had an great nights sleep. The hotel did have a sign in reception advising that due to the weather at the time that this could occur. Hotel is a good central location for visiting the city.

Amazing location in the heart of San Francisco. Well-kept, modern hotel with all the things one would expect from a Hyatt. Excellent service, tourist recommendations were made thoughtfully and with insight. Well done.

I read the reviews of all the hotels in Union Square before selecting one. I wanted a nice stay in great hotel for my friends-weekend in San Francisco. The Grand Hyatt was perfect. The lobby and check in process is well managed, friendly and attentive and perfect Hyatt service! The food in the restaurant is very good, I ate breakfast there each day with my friends. Also used the bar once and the service and quality offered is excellent. The best part are the great rooms--I was in 3007 and had the most perfect bay view including Telegraph Hill, Alcatraz and the Transamerica building--and despite some monsoon weather the other day it was still spectacular. The king bed was comfortable and firm, there room had wood floors and excellent lighting and electronics-plenty of places to plug in all your technology or stream to the TV all your subscriptions if you wanted to. Housekeeping was friendly and attentive, great water pressure, modern huge bathrooms and dressing area. Also visited friends' room and their Union Square view also had a water view as well. So perfect. Next time I will try and get two adjoining rooms and bring my kids. The automatic blackout curtain really does let you wake up with a big flourish. I loved the trip.

This hotel has a good location..near to many things and the bus stop is across the street. The hotel is kept well, staff is friendly and accommodating. Rooms were nice, short on drawer space, but very modern and updated.

Booked an executive suite for our recent San Francisco stay. The hotel location in Union Square is great and the view from our 23rd floor windows was also awesome! The staff is very efficient, polite and extremely helpful. The suite was very roomy, with many electronic upgrades (motorized shades, etc). There were also two full bathrooms. Suite was very clean but there were some signs of wear. My only issue with the room was that it is advertised as sleeping three, which I assumed was 2 on the bedroom king size bed and one in the living room (on what I assumed would be a sleep sofa). The sofa is not a sleeper, which only left the one bed. On the plus side, management supplied a rollaway bed at no charge. Still seems a bit weird that this huge suite with 2 bathrooms only had the one bed... I would recommend this hotel, for the location and view alone..

After 3 days in Palo Alto .. and before 3 days in Napa, me and the family staying in SF. The checkin is quick and easy. The service superb and friendly. The in house , called One Up I think , is adequate without being too great. The most disappointing thing was the room. There was nothing Grand about it. This should just be called The Hyatt. Or the regular Hyatt..It was once again adequate, like a business hotel. Plain and efficient. Few toiletries. Zero luxury. Also the valet parking was expensive. In my view.. I'm not a local so not sure on comparisons. But it was close to 70 usd per day. Gym was small too but had 4-5 new running machines which was nice. Location great for food, museums and china town. Probably wouldn't stay here again

I stayed here a couple of years back and wasnâ€™t impressed with this hotel. It looked tired. But late last year I started staying here again and have come back a lot more often. They did a really good job with the renovation. Iâ€™m a globalist and so have access to the lounge. Pretty good food at night and varies every day. The best part is the $3 honor bar. Wine, beer or mixed drinks for $3. Canâ€™t beat that. The only complaint I have is breakfast. Itâ€™s the same items every single day. Yes EVERY day. I feel like weâ€™re being discourage to come back lol. But overall I highly recommend this hotel. Great location, rooms with really nice views and is next to lots and lots of high end stores and close to Chinatown. And itâ€™s next to the new Apple store.

I was in San Francisco for a meeting at the Palace (a very storied, grand old hotel) and moved to the Grand Hyatt for the weekend. The contrast between the two could not be more pronounced. The Grand Hyatt is modern and chic (almost W in feel but not quite to that extreme). There isn't much of a lobby to speak of, the check-in area looks more like the checkout counter at a local Apple store; there is a living room-esque area off of the lobby with an electronic fireplace (it still looked comfortable), books on shelves, and some interesting, modern artwork and sculptures. I was accommodated on a high floor but had a view of the city that wasn't the most appealing, and unfortunately I could hear the drone of the elevator banks nearby. The furniture in my room was a bit worn in places but I found the space to be otherwise very comfortable, the bed particularly so. The bathroom continued the modern feel of every other room and had a large walk-in shower, a bowl type sink, and what I can only describe as hip, bold colors. The exercise room is almost at the every top of the hotel and this space has wonderful, sweeping views of the city. I could not help but get distracted during my workout with the view of skyscrapers at eye level and an equally beautiful view of the bay. I did not dine in the hotel but there was a restaurant on the mezzanine level that seemed well attended for breakfast and dinner. There is also a Starbucks open during the morning hours in the lobby, but there was literally a dozen other Starbucks (as well as independent coffee shops, diners, restaurants) right outside the hotel doors. Being in Union Square, there is no lack of dining and shopping to be had as well as easy access to MUNI and other mass transit options. I did not engage with many of the hotel staff, but those that I did chat with were friendly and personable. I expect to return to San Francisco again, hopefully in the near future, and would definitely keep the Grand Hyatt on my list of properties to stay at.

I had a great stay at the Grand Hyatt. It's location is great. Smooth check-in, nice doormen, helpful housekeeping, and a laid back environment. My room was very clean and spacious. Way better than all the smaller, boutique hotels in the area. Plus, great views. It's the only location I would recommend.

This was our first time in San Francisco, and we had a great time. Admittedly being a little nervous, especially from what you see about SF on the news. The hotel was great and conveniently located to Union Square and the various modes of mass transit. The hotel was clean, and was available for early check-in as requested. The room was a comfortable size, though we spent little time at the property because we were always going somewhere. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

I had a great stay at Grand Hyatt San Francisco. The location is great! I love the service and location here!!! I had breakfast at the hotel. The food was great and the service at the restaurant is OK

Very nice place to stay in downtown San Francisco. Close to all major attractions and transportation. A little bit pricey, but worse it. I think from three major brands we have stayed during our California trip (Marriott, Hilton, Hyatt), Hyatt is the best one.

The bed was like sleeping on cement, way too hard. Everything else in the and the hotel was good. Too much light coming from the hallway for sleeping due to the space under the door and space between the sliding shade.

I had a conferrence there and stayed 2 nights. It was super cool. The hotel is big and in the core center of the city. We had a party in one of the last floors and it was super! Very nice views from above

Less well maintained than I expected for a Grand Hyatt.The attached photos show mold growing on the bathroom ceiling and the fan in the bathroom. For the brand and the price I expect better. I have stayed before and not noticed the mold.Heading to the Hyatt Regency Tamaya Resort and hope it is in better condition.

Iâ€™ve stayed at this Hyatt several times before this week - despite my booker requesting a quiet room (letâ€™s face it, it really shouldnâ€™t be necessary to request this) I was given an interconnecting room backing onto the lift-shaft - after having flown from the UK and around the US before arriving in San Francisco, this was pretty disappointing - the lifts were very noisy and ran all night, as were the next-door guests - will take myself and my team somewhere else next time - avoid 2501!

We must have tried most of the hotels in the Union Square area, and the Hyatt remains a favorite. Situated at the back of the giant Apple Store in Union Square, with a common outdoor garden area in between, the Hyatt is conveniently located in the corner of Stockton and Sutter. There is a CVS and Starbucks just across the road. Union Square is one block away. There are also 2 self-parking, in and out, garages nearby (with priority access for hotel guests) if you don't want to hand keys to the valet.Check-in was fast, with excellent service. The only thing that got me was the $5 charge per package delivery. I was unaware of this charge and I had so many orders that came in from Amazon. So imagine my surprise with the bill!Club floor rooms are spacious. My only problem is the noise. Walls are not well insulated and so you can practically hear bedroom activities next door.Club lounge has great food. Just go early or there won't be any seats left. We ended up taking out some of the food sometimes.With all these it still remains a favorite, though.

First and foremost -- reserved a VIP suite and was pleasantly surprised at check in to be upgraded the Presidential Suite.The city views from the floor to ceiling windows and 2200SF for my family to spread out in truly made our trip. The private sauna was over the top and amazing.Staff was excellent from check-in, valet, to room service.Quality of room service breakfast was amazing, and made it easy when we had early morning plans.Two items for negative feedback:1. Suite linens are dark brown in bed and bath, prefer standard white.2. When leaving for the airport, requested a taxi and was advised by the doorman the "house car" Lexus was available for the same price as a taxi. As this was a better option, I accepted the offer only to have the driver pull away and demand he be paid in cash -- he went so far as to tell me if I didn't have cash we would need to pull over at an ATM to get cash. As a woman traveling alone, this was EXTREMELY disconcerting as I was forced to get out of a car several blocks from the hotel and leave my luggage in the car to use an ATM outside of a night club. Either be up front about cash requirement for use of house car or accept credit card.

I stayed in the hotel for business. I had asked for a room with a view of the park, and got a room that had a partial view, which was nice. The bed was comfortable, my room was quiet despite being near the park, and the staff was cordial and helpful. The hotel itself was pleasant enough, but I didn't feel like the hotel was anything special (at least, to warrant five stars).

Check was quick and easy. The front desk was so welcoming and friendly. He answered all of our questions, gave us suggestions, and was fun to talk to. The concierge helped us choose a few activities, and suggested one of my favorite activities of the trip. The Hornblower Dinner Cruise. Our room had a great view, was clean ,modern decor, very comfortable. There was a nice area with a vanity and makeup mirror. No issues with the room. We had snack and drinks in the bar, they put together a meat and cheese tray for us that was not on the menu. Staff was very friendly, professional, took good care of us. My only complaint is that the advertised skyline view on 36th floor was closed for private events every night. Overall we had a great stay.

Stayed at this property for 2 nights in March, was a given a room on the 29th floor which had quite a nice view but that's about it. The room furniture was dated with the closet doors not being able to close completely. Had access to the Grand Club on level 32 which was always crowded especially during breakfast..! Annoyed with the service standard which was generally pathetic and a blatant double standard of service by one of the female staff. This is one property I would avoid at all cost unless you're willing to pay just for the location. A VERY "UNGRAND" Hyatt..!

this is a perfect location to stay with or without family. walking distance to shopping center , coffee shops, restaurants. rooms are small but clean.right front of union square, we were here between Christmas and new year. you can feel the real Christmas!

We had an excellent stay with our extended family at this hotel. The location is the best for shopping, cable cars, Chinatown and eating. We had very nice rooms on the 27th floor with a beautiful city view. The rooms were attractive and very clean as was the servicing of the rooms each day. We were there for 5 nights. Breakfasts were good with enough choices to keep everyone happy. Everyone we encountered was very friendly and helpful. The Concierge - Vanessa was extremely helpful and really took the time and the effort to make sure we had a good day at Alcatraz.

How much time do you have?If you are interested in being deceived by your hotel, ORIf you don't want your hotel to be open, upfront and honest with you, ORIf you want to be kept up all night by creaking walls... then stay at this hotel!Otherwise.....STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!!To begin with, I was told I would be able to get an early check in. I was to speak at a conference there and our flight was delayed. So, I needed to get into a room to freshen up and change. When we got there, our room was not ready. They tried to give us a lower quality room (no view) if we didn't want to wait. We decided to wait.While waiting, we decided to go have lunch upstairs at the only restaurant. The food was ok, but the restaurant management was more concerned about meal presentation than functionality. My wife's salad was on such a tiny plate, all the contents kept falling off onto her shirt, lap and all over the table. According to the waiter, they had been told about this several times previously....Later that night, we went elsewhere for dinner. We decided to go back to the hotel for dessert. At that same restaurant, we let the host know we wanted dessert. We were told to go into the bar! The bar was crowded and noisy! AND we don't drink alcohol!!! All we wanted was dessert! We told the manager that we just wanted to sit down and have a dessert. The manager told us to go into the bar if all we wanted was dessert!!!!! Seriously??? Are you kidding????When we went to bed, we kept hearing a creaking noise in the closet. It was loud and very annoying. It was not a "rhythmic" noise; it was very random. But neither of us were able to get to sleep. We tried for over 2 hours to get the noise to stop (we thought it was the closet doors creaking because they would not close properly). Nothing we tried got the noise to stop. We finally realized that it was inside the walls and ceiling of the closet!!!We called the front desk and spoke to the manager. The manager of this hotel told us this:- They know about the creaking- It happens when there's bad weather- It happens all the time- It happens in every room in the hotel (which , by the way was sold out that night)We asked why we were not told about this before (while) making the reservation. She said that they 'sometimes send out letters'!!! Are you kidding????? We told her we never received a letter and she could not confirm if we were sent one. However, they did have our correct address.Then she changed her story and said that this storm 'creeped' up on them'!!! Again, do you take me for a fool??Then the manager of this HYATT hotel said the most appalling thing:"There are ear plugs in the bathroom" Again....ARE YOU KIDDING ME????This is not the Motel 6! This is a flipping HYATT!!!! I expect a LOT better from a HYATT brand hotel than, "there are earplugs in the bathroom"!!!This HYATT hotel room was over $700 for ONE night, PLUS TAX!!!! And there solution is earplugs????? WOW!!!!!!This obviously PROVES they were aware of the issue but failed to notify us before or while the reservation was being made.So, they generously (kidding) offered to take $50 off our room rate! That was sooooo nice of them (kidding). It was not until my wife became very upset that they very reluctantly took half off our room rate. To which our response was, "We are not going to get half a nights sleep".... And we didn't.We go no sleep! So, we got up extra early and checked out of the hotel. As long as I live, I will NEVER stay in a HYATT hotel again!!! EVER!STAY AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!!!! (You were warned!!)

Reserved king suite for 3...two adults and one teenager. Very roomy but the couch for our son was not a pull out. Would have had to pay additional $30/night for rollaway bed. Fortunately, couch was fairly comfortable and he has his own space and bathroom. Beware of room near elevators because of constant â€œwhooshingâ€ù sound. Really, our only complaints. Hotel is ideal location....for walking to attractions, shopping and restaurants, also convenient for ride share location. Will return.

I read about Grand Hyatt as the best place in Union Square to be. I booked it for my wife. It turns out to be a rip off. The price advertised on booking.com was around US$ 1,300 for 4 nights... The amount blocked on the card by the hotel is almost US$ 2,300 and the man at the reception says the system showed the price and did it! Is this hospitality! Trust me this attitude would have meant the property would have been out of business. My wife is travelling alone and this amount blocked on second day if a long trip has put her entire trip in jeopardy. I hope tourists to San Fransisco avoid this hotel as they are just shamelessly unapologetic about their conduct.

I decided to stay at the Grand Hyatt last weekend, because I've had pleasant experiences at other locations. The check in service was quick and easy, the location is central to all the shopping in the world, and hotel itself is very nicely kept.I'm not sure what I was expecting for the price, but I wasn't overwhelmed by my room, but it did get the job done, and was quite comfortable. The Wi-Fi was slightly slow and spotty, but it's also free so take it for what it is when +100 people are using it ;) The TVs are a bit slow, but you have access to plenty of channels, and the possibility to connect to your streaming services.The gym is quite small, and spills into the elevator lobby. In fact it's quite odd that they have equipment in the lobby, when you still have to have a key card to get into the main part of the gym.All and all it was simply an okay experience, and I'm still on the fence if it was worth the value. Something tells me I could've saved a few hundred by staying elsewhere having received the same quality. Perhaps I'm an outlier, but I'm just trying to be honest about how I felt staying here.

Nice hotel in a good location. Has a small area in front of hotel to pull over for loading and unloading. Did not use valet as we returned rental car same evening we arrived. Very close walk to Chinatown and other shopping located near Union Square. Elevators were quick with little wait.Used this location as a base for seeing the sights around San Francisco. Took Uber or Lyft as needed.Starbucks and CVS across the street. McDonalds next door. Numerous other shops and restaurants within close walking distance.Area seemed safe and no issues while we were there. I would stay here again if in town.

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco is in the perfect location in Union Square. The hotel is extremely well maintained with a a superb staff - from the valet to the front desk to the restaurant! I enjoy returning to this property and have never had a bad experience.

This is a lovely hotel, and a great location in Union Square. Centrally located in San Francisco close to shopping and many restaurants. Perfect for all there is to see in San Francisco. Great views of the city in many rooms. Our room was on a higher floor and we looked out to the east, really beautiful. Loved opening the curtains via a switch from our bed. A big â€œta daâ€ù to the day. Our room was very comfortable, not real large but it was perfect. Super comfortable bed and pillows made for a great nights sleep. When I said quiet that is because there is construction going on in the center of Union Square and inside the hotel we didnâ€™t hear any of that. A really nice plus if youâ€™re on the go and donâ€™t have time for a sit down breakfast, they have coffee and breakfast and probably lunch sandwiches already made they can heat up and actually theyâ€™re very good! On one of the first floors near the doors that are across from the Apple store.  Everyone is so friendly at the hotel and at your service. Nice being offered water when you arrive and having a quick and smooth check in. A nice Hyatt property in San Francisco.

This was a hotel that we chose for its central location . The room was fabulous with a double walk in shower, kept very clean and superb views.We actually stayed here as we were getting married at City Hall and the hotel gave us champagne on the day .They were extremely helpful in anyway and the cleaning, bed making etc was all to suit, if you wanted a lay in they would come back later.I would definately stay here again.

We stayed for 3 nights and the VIP suite was amazing. Large lounge , dining area and a separate bedroom. The views were beautiful. MY biggest disappointment was that we paid for a VIP Suite and we didn't get the lounge included in the room. I would expect paying this amount for a room it would be included.

I have to stay Iâ€™ve never stayed at a place other than Disney world where people were so friendly kind and went out of their way to provide great service. It has to be a culture thing there for it to be absolutely every person. It made a an average stay into a great one!

This is a fantastic hotel, right in the centre of San Francisco on Union square. The restaurant is expensive, breakfast was 32 dollars each but there are lots of diners nearby so you won't be stuck. Great location for venturing out to Chinatown, the Italian quarter or down to the water front. The shops and cable cars are just outside the door

Came in at 2 am after driving from L.A. and upon arrival, the Front Desk agent, Jessica I believe that was her name, was very accommodating. Service was great from start to finish at this Grand Hyatt. Acess to the Club was also provided which allowed for free continental breakfast and drinks all day.The restaurant food was quite good as we didn't feel like venturing out on Saturday night.

Stayed in room 2411 and it was noisy, was next to the room where the staff kept supplies and it was very noticeable. Room service was good, except there was not much room left when he brought the table in. Staff was friendly. I thought it was a horrible bed as it was so hard and that is personal preference but if you like a softer mattress this wasn't it. Granddaughter tried to take a pic out the window and it was filthy. Did have free wifi and that was a plus.

I stayed here for a quick business trip (2 nights). They welcomed me back, my last stay was a few years ago. Early check in, comfortable beds and centrally located,adjacent to Union Square (starbucks across the street for those who care), plenty of plugs and outlets in tue room. The staff was great, room service menu varied and delish. Fitness area well equipped, but gets busy in the morning. Would stay here again.

Fantastic location on Union Square and 3 minutes from China Town. The hotel restaurant was very good as was the bar. The choice and quality of food was fine with good quality. The bar had a great selection of cocktails, craft beers and ales. The staff were welcoming and professional. There were many excellent bars and restaurants within a 10 minute walk with the Cable Car a few short steps away. The views from the Bay View rooms were excellent but would suggest as high a room as possible. The bed was really comfortable a bit on the harder side which would be great for bad backs. Overall a great well located solid 4 star hotel.

I stayed in a king bedded room on the 21st floor while in town on business. The room was clean, comfortable and stylish, and although not large, it wasn't cramped either. The room was generally quiet and I slept well. The "tub style" sink in the bathroom was very original, but needlessly cut down on usable counter space (see photo). My only minor complaint was that I could hear the TV in the neighboring room through the connecting room door. It wasn't overly intrusive, but it was noticeable.The location, just a block north of Union Square, was excellent. There are no shortage of shops and restaurants within a short walk of the hotel.Hyatt is not one of usual "go-to" brands. That may need to change.

The hotel itself isn't bad and is probable exactly what one would expect from a Hyatt hotel. However my room, 2211, was right next to a staff room and you could hear the door opening and closing so night. Very annoying . Would not advice staying the that room or any adjacent rooms

Room was clean and beds were comfortable. The cleaning staff were loud. I was on a work call and the room next to me was getting cleaned. They kept hitting the wall with the vacuum. I checked in after midnight and no bellman was outside. I waited for valet parking over ten minutes, called the hotel operator to get someone outside to take my car. It was raining. There was a bellman standing inside but he was not paying attention to hotel guests arriving outside. The front desk staff and bellman (late evening) lacked in attention to detail and good service.

The staff are very helpful and sweet . Check in was easy. Breakfast was great. Only problem is the room . I wish after I am Hyatt member and part of other membership, I should have a better room.Wish it is better experience

Very nice staff and front desk. Offered check in before standard check in time and baggage storage. Hotel location is really convenient to any SFO attraction. But the parking was a rip off :) Tons of stores / restaurants in walking distance.

My husband and I regularly stay here and this trip didnâ€™t disappoint. Reasonably appointed rooms with incredible views if you can get a high floor on the bay side. The club is so good you could easily enjoy dinner there if you were too tired to adventure out. I dislike Hyattâ€™s mediocre bathroom product choices (June Jacobs? Trade up to something good!) so I do bring my own toiletries.

Great staff and amazing service Love the location and great viewsRooms were clean modern and maintained so well.They have the longest tenure Hyatt Associate at the door. Great man and keeps giving that great smile

Got an excellent rate for the weekend online. Chose because it was close to Union Square but it had an even better location than we anticipated, literally steps from everything. Staff were friendly and very responsive. The gentleman at check in was efficient and professional but maybe a tad curt (definitely not rude). The room on 18 had a great view over the city. The decor looked like it was from the 90â€™s or 00â€™s but has been very well maintained so no problem there. In room dining was usual hotel fare. Would certainly stay there again when in San Fran and enjoyed the city!

We enjoyed the stay .Because if its location, it was easy access to everything !Clean and comfy , quiet rooms , supply of bottled drinking water whenever needed .Housekeeping did a good job Everyday.Front desk personnel were friendly and helpful .The way the rooms were arranged in the building , we didnâ€™t get much disturbance by people walking or talking or rolling their luggage along corridors .I would recommend this hotel to my friends

hwsteinOrinda, California This review was initially posted in error as a review for the Hyatt Regency. Different hotel completely. Sorry.  San Francisco has the most spectacular urban view in the country. Iconic buildings, bridges, Bay Views with Alcatraz. One of the best ways to drink this all in is to book a Bay view room at the Hyatt Regency on Union Square. We live just across the Bay but stayed recently to share a four way birthday bash with my wife, sister and brother-in-law who flew up from Los Angeles. Our rooms were nothing special (except for the view). The bath amenities were cheap. No minibar or fridge. No glasses, except in the bathroom. The electric shade was a nice touch as was the floor level nightlight that went on automatically when you left the bed and turned off when you returned. The location on Union Square is great for walks (San Francisco is a great walking city), great for shopping and surrounded by a number of excellent restaurants. We were on the Concierge Level with access to evening canapes, inexpensive (honor bar) cocktails, full buffet breakfast and, of course, an amazing 32nd floor view of the Bay. The check-in was a pleasant experience owing to the extremely cordial service of Ira (a woman) who was charming. If you're local, it's a nice place to hang out for celebrating that special occasion when driving home is the last thing you want to do. For tourists, you can't go wrong. It's not a luxury hotel (the city has plenty of those), but its other qualities make this a fine choice.

San Francisco has the most spectacular urban view in the country. Iconic buildings, bridges, Bay Views with Alcatraz. One of the best ways to drink this all in is to book a Bay view room at the Hyatt Regency on Union Square. We live just across the Bay but stayed recently to share a four way birthday bash with my wife, sister and brother-in-law who flew up from Los Angeles. Our rooms were nothing special (except for the view). The bath amenities were cheap. No minibar or fridge. No glasses, except in the bathroom. The electric shade was a nice touch as was the floor level nightlight that went on automatically when you left the bed and turned off when you returned. The location on Union Square is great for walks (San Francisco is a great walking city), great for shopping and surrounded by a number of excellent restaurants. We were on the Concierge Level with access to evening canapes, inexpensive (honor bar) cocktails, full buffet breakfast and, of course, an amazing 32nd floor view of the Bay. The check-in was a pleasant experience owing to the extremely cordial service of Ira (a woman) who was charming. If you're local, it's a nice place to hang out for celebrating that special occasion when driving home is the last thing you want to do. For tourists, you can't go wrong. It's not a luxury hotel (the city has plenty of those), but its other qualities make this a fine choice.

We spent one night in this hotel. The location near Union Square is simply perfect. Staff was super helpful. Hotel price was quite steep but pretty much ok for this location. Our room was not really spectacular, but all clean and ok for just one night. I would recommend and go there again.

Great location in the city. Staff is very helpful, polite and accommodating. We came in on the red eye and got to the hotel after midnight. I called ahead to make sure they kept our room and there was absolutely no problem. They gave us a beautiful room on the 25th floor with a great view of the bay and the city. There is a doorman during the day and early evening who helped us with directions, getting a cab, helping with our luggage. The room was lovely, bathroom modern and a separate sitting area outside the bathroom to put on your makeup or dry your hair. The bed was comfortable. We were busy most of the day, touring the city, but it was nice to come back to a comfortable room.

Spacious rooms, great location - choose a high floor if you can. This hotel lives up to its reputation. Itâ€™s also energy efficient, so no unnecessary bath robes, waters etc, but all available on request.

These days, whenever I stay at a Hyatt, I think about how the brand has transformed from state-of-the-art in the 70s and 80s to rather nondescript and dated today. The Grand Hyatt in San Francisco is no exception; built in 1972, it will never deliver on architectural flourishes or room decor "wow moments." I didn't find the bed particularly comfortable, and after staying in hotels with luxurious bedding most nights of our trip, the older mattress and thin blanket at the Grand Hyatt was a letdown. We did get a room on a high floor, and the view was amazing... definitely a highlight. We paid for it, though, and the price tag veered into the "luxury" range, even though the accommodations were really not.In summary, I'd say that it's good for one night.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for two evenings over the weekend. Itâ€™s an excellent location! A centrally-located hotel always wins in my book. I was able to walk to both Union Square and Chinatown. The service was good and my room was quite spacious and clean. (I also had a nice view, always a bonus.)

When I first entered the room, it looked clean but very soon, I was really shocked. I could stand The black dust on the bed but there was someone's fingernails on the bed!!!! OMG... It's the worst hotel ever !!

I stayed here a couple of times in December, just before Christmas. The check-in both times was fine and the staff were friendly, although a bit distracted at times. I was in a club room the first time and a standard room the second time. The club room was larger with a nicer view and it was on a higher floor. It also gave me access to the club lounge, which was a nice bonus but I'm not sure that it was worth the extra money. The food was good but there was a fee for the alcoholic drinks (honor system) plus it was pretty crowded during my visits. The rooms were good, nice beds, nice bathrooms (club room had a more spacious bathroom while we had to get the bathroom cleaned in the standard room since it was not cleaned when we arrived). My biggest complaint about both rooms was that each of them had an LED light that came on when you rolled off the bed during the night. It was a good idea in concept but it was pretty annoying since the light was bright enough to light quite a bit of area and there was no way to turn it off until it went off after about 10 seconds. The location of the hotel was outstanding as there were a ton of restaurants in the area and it was about a minute walk to Union Square and about ten minutes to many of the other tourist areas. The exercise room was on a top floor but it was pretty small and very crowded. It could definitely use an upgrade. All in all, it was a good stay, 3.5 out of 5. For the location alone, I would definitely consider staying there again.

Great location! But breakfast is expensive and hasn't many options... Besides, they charged my card US$5 for each mail Item delivered (both the packages and the letters!). As the Union Square region has many other lodging options, I would advise trying another one...

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 5 days for business. Check in was wonderful and I was even offered as much bottled water as needed for my stay. The room was very spacious but dated. It was located across from Union Square and easy access to anywhere. My one complaint and a bit disappointed with the hotel is that one day I had no house keeping. It was my last day/night and I was gone from early morning until just before midnight. When I returned after a long day, all I wanted to do was shower and get into bed. I wasnâ€™t calling down to the front desk so late. When I checked out the following morning, I told the front desk and they did apologize. They asked why I wouldnâ€™t have called to have them up to my room. I explained the time etc. I thought perhaps they would have offered to adjust the price or a voucher or something. They did not.At any rate, despite that, my stay was comfortable for the price and I would consider staying there again if the price was right.

5 stars for the uncomfortable desk chair award. 1950's rust orange with an emitting heat that transforms your seat into an uncomfortable scratchy itch. Since it does not move up or down, the only way to sit at your desk - even if you are 6 foot 3 like me - is to put pillows on the chair. Even then it is unworthy. This fact alone is enough for me to switch hotels. Is it to much to ask for a $100 adjustable walmart chair when paying $350 for a room?

This is an excellent hotel for a city break or business trip - the hotel is well maintained and in a good location. The rooms are really comfortable and at night they are dark and quiet. The staff are very friendly and polite. Iâ€™ll continue to use

I stayed here for a couple of nights and so glad I picked this hotel. It was my first time to visit SF and it really was convenient to stay at a place where itâ€™s right in the middle of all actions and in close proximity to the different tourists attractions. Not to mention the room itself was super nice and clean and I was very happy with the customer service as well. Iâ€™ll definitely stay at Grand Hyatt again when I go back and visit sometime in the future

Fantastic stay at this hotel. Best location for getting to each area, really central. Love the decor, the view was gorgeous, had wine and nibbles at One Up which was fantastic. The gym is great- helps to keep running when the view is so good. Highly recommend this hotel.

Thought this would be an OK hotel to stay as the 'cosmetics' look good, however, the interior now dated and worn. Paid extra for a suite 'with city views' - the 'suite' is just two rooms where the door has just been opened and a couch put in one of them (it has two bathrooms.. As here for a three night stay and went to ask for a room change due to the 'underground' (next to a lift well) noise that is 24/7 (even trains stop for a limited time), told that no other 'suites' available. City View in this hotel also means looking out onto two monolitic grey buildings. Horrid trying to sleep with the noise. If you have options take them.

Huge Hotel, Fast Checkins and a really central location.. this hotel is everything a hotel needs to be! It's close to all of the piers and transportation (bus or HOHOs, etc) and they pay a lot of attention and care to the guest experience. We used their restaurants as well as cocktail lounge etc and everything was absolutely wonderful :) Overall a great stay and could do it again!! :)

My stay at the Grand Hyatt was very pleasant. The room was clean and comfortable me with plenty of desk space on which to work. I enjoyed the fitness center and its spectacular views. Most important, though, was the welcoming and helpful staff. If you are looking for a good business hotel in SF, you cannot go wrong here. An added plus: a nice view from my room.

This is our go-to hotel in San Francisco. Great location, great staff, and comfortable accommodations. Splurge on a Club Level room and enjoy a beautiful breakfast and happy hour daily. It's also an easy walk to shopping, restaurants, and China Town.

Located in the middle of union square with shops such as cvs, starbucks, mcdonalds, walgreen, 7-eleven surrounded it. Sears fine food just a block behind the hotel, easy to have nice breakfast before starting your day.Concierge staffs were friendly, always on standby to open the door for you with a smile. Reception staff was ok, standard friendly but nothing over the top. No queue in front of me during check in but staff was fast to get us a room. The check-in was done in 2-3mins.Stayed in an Executive Suite with union square view. Big and clean room. Comes with 2 bathrooms (of which 1 with comes with a tub) which was useful. My husband and I could use the bathroom at the same time without having to wait for each other.Ordered room service one night - roast chicken, fries, drumletts & cheesecake. Order delivered within half an hour. Served with bread and butter. Chicken & fries was nice. Couldnâ€™t care for the drumletts, did not enjoy the spicy marinate. Cheesecake was ok (could have better ones at cheesecake factory at macyâ€™s just across the street). Staff who delivered the food was quite friendly.Would say that Grand Hyatt is a clean hotel with friendly staffs (no exceptional service encountered in my 3 nights stay). Location is good, with easy access to lots of retail shops, restaurants and transportations (cable car, street car, etc). While a few homeless people can be seen around the area, none was seen at the front door of the hotel. Still feel pretty safe when walking around at 9pm+ around the hotel. Would recommend to give Grand Hyatt a try when visiting San Francisco.

Fabulous staff, very nicely decorated property, and awesome room furnishings, and amenities. And of course you canâ€™t beat the location at Union Square to BART and MUNI, restaurants, shipping etc. and if you get Club access, youâ€™re in for a treat!

I just spent 3 nights at the GH on Union SQ. I am a Hyatt Rewards member with several hundred thousand points, so I almost always stay with Hyatt when I can. I was there for a conference on business travel. I've been to SF dozens of times throughout my life, in fact, I lived the the Bay Area as a child and have fond memories of visiting the city while in grade school.My stay at the GH mirrored my overall experience of the city. I don't think I'll plan another trip to SF ever again unless my business absolutely requires it.The good about the hotel: - Clean, quiet, and generally a pleasant atmosphere. The not so good: - Service attitude was very inconsistent. In some cases, irritating at best.In one encounter, I received excellent attitude and service with a smile. In this case, I ordered a steak Medium, it came well done, the bartender insisted that I return it and made a very genuine effort to ensure my satisfaction. It felt great to have someone really care about my experience. I liked him, he was warm and genuinely friendly.In another encounter, not so much. While sitting at the bar the next evening, I had to endure what appeared to be a middle manager and bartender complaining incessantly for about 5 minutes about their unsatisfactory work situation. I was trying to enjoy a glass of wine, but standing right in front of me at the bar, with their backs turned to me, they insisted on loudly complaining. It was pretty second rate. Especially after earlier having a drink at the bar at the Four Seasons (down the street) where the service and attitude was impeccable. Comparing the quality of service and attitude - just depressing, there was no comparison.Also, in the morning I went to check out, I tried to go up to the World of Hyatt Counter, but I encountered the same thing, two employees moaning about something, and one of the men turns to me and abruptly (and somewhat abrasively) says "give me a few minutes". Whatever - So I checked out on my phone and left, knowing that I wouldn't be back. I hate it when you pay $400-$500/ night for a room and get a "Motel 6" service attitude. Union shop, I'd guess.Anyways, the title "Left Depressed" comes not only from the attitudes I encountered at the hotel, but the completely abhorrent homeless situation all around the Union Square area. It's completely depressing to see mentally ill homeless people suffering in the streets as people shop at Tiffany's, Sacks, Gucci, etc. It's eerie and depressing. SF has really turned into a terribly strange place.

I have a thing for Grand Hyatt Hotels: I usually love them. This one in San Francisco is very nice and did not disappointed. The rooms are very large, the bed is extremely comfortable and the breakfast is really good for both quality and choice. Concierge staff is very helpful and the location in city centre is perfect. I would love to come back.

The hotel is in a great location! We were able to walk to Chinatown, North Beach, Fisherman's Wharf and back from the Golden Gate Recreation Area. The staff is super friendly and the rooms very comfortable! We had a bay view room on the 19th floor. For our next stay, I would request a room on a higher floor. Be sure to head up to the top floor to see the amazing view of San Francisco!

Truely a five star experience. From the time you pull-up until the time you pull out they take care of everything. Absolutely the best location by far downtown. Great prices and great accommodations. I would highly recommend this venue for business, pleasure, shopping or any other reason to go to San Francisco.

Middle of the everything in San Francisco. Good Stay. We enjoyed our stay and had a great view of the city. Recommend taking tours from here to wine country, Alcatraz, Muir Woods, and Yosemite Park.Enjoyed all.

Very nice hotel, very clean and convenient location. Shopping centers are around the corner and very nice restaurants are not that far away. Chinatown is couple blocks away. it is very ideal place to stay.

Quiet hotel with good location.Rooms are small. Front desk very helpful but concierge service was not up to expectation. Asked for the name of a seafood restaurant and was given the name of a steak place. They seemed more interested in arranging tours etc then answering basic questions.

The location was the only impressive aspect of this hotel. In desperate need of a heavy renovation. Room walls are made out of paper. Hi can hear the person next to you go to the bathroom. The hotel bar and restaurant was 3 star hotel standard at best. Rooms were extremely weathered.

I spent a lot of time researching and selecting a hotel close to the Moscone Center. The Grand Hyatt was perfect. Close enough to walk or a short cab ride. Concierge was outstanding. Highly recommend. You will not be disappointed as I wasnâ€™t.

Easy checkin, great bars, beautiful view. I thoroughly enjoyed my vertigo inducing view amidst the high rises in SF, the balcony was top notch. The gym was small and a pool would be appreciated. Prompt service for everything, a typical Hyatt experience.

Already stayed here twice. It's always been my hotel of choice whenever I come visit San Francisco because of it's accessibility to everything. It's in Union Square, so basically once you step out, Starbucks is just across the street and CVS too. Just a few more steps Macy's around the corner, where Cheesecake Factory is on the top floor. Then you wouldn't want to miss the chance to ride the street cable railway and the first station is also just a good 5minute walk. Shopping? No problem! Express, Gap and a few malls are everywhere. It's just the perfect place to stay at. And before I forget, the view, the view is just as outstanding as the location, and the rooms are spacious with two double beds, good for 4 pax to stay conveniently.

The hotel boosts a wide range of art pieces and sophisticated interiors, perfect for business travellers and couples alike. I appreciated the unique and not-your-typical front desk which looks like a business centre, in a very good sense. =) Different experience indeed. Staff are helpful and warm.

i was so pleased with the Grand Hyatt. The location in Union Square makes walking to shops and restaurants easy and enjoyable. Te rooms are beautifully appointed. A panel nest to the bed controls all the lights and window shades. A night light goes on automatically when your feet hit the floor. Great emphasis on safety.

The check-in process took a while but all good otherwise.Beds are comfortable and everything in the room was in working order.Perhaps a good idea to include a small amenities kit (razor, earbuds and cotton wool)?

we arrived a bit late and once we went out from our car .. the hyatt experience started ..everything from the entrance all the way into the room was great ... we stayed for 3 nights and watching people ice skating at night at Union Square was wonderful.inroom dining was great .. and the location even better ... usually i try to avoid staying at downtown but not when staying at Hyatt ...a bit expensive if you have a car but again ... parking is expensive in SF ..

Nice hotel on UnionSquare. Good location for shopping, restaurants, walking to sites/museums, close to public transportation, etc. Lobby has an inviting fireplace and good restaurant & bar. However the registration area is ultra modern - just standing computer stations. Not very personal - difficult to converse with staff without everyone hearing. Rooms are clean and modern, but a bit small. Modern furniture and accessories makeup a lot of living space. Huge bathroom sink takes up all the counter space. Good lighting in bathroom, nice to have a mini fridge and large flatscreen TV. I would consider staying here again if I were in the area.

I have Hyatt Globalist status and have stayed at all manner of properties within the Hyatt portfolio. My stay here was for 4 nights on a combination of free night certificates and World of Hyatt points. Overall:- The property, while well-located and generally satisfactory, needs renovations throughout and suffers from inconsistent service. I would not stay here again until it is renovated. Pros:- Although Union Square isn't my preferred part of the city, the location is certainly convenient location for most visitors- Service was generally friendly, although not always excellent (see below)- The Grand Club had pretty good offerings - multiple hot food options, inexpensive honor bar selections, and lots of coffee/water/juice/soda selections.Cons:- Renovations are needed everywhere - elevators, furniture, windows, etc.- The design of the bathroom was also curious - an enormous sink leaves little counter space, and the shower door opens out, requiring you to get wet in order to turn the shower on.- The restaurant and bar are configured strangely, on opposite sides of the 2nd floor with the elevator bank between them. This means both spaces frequently end up being too small for the crowds they serve.- Service at the bar was mixed. I arrived around 11pm after a late flight and wanted a drink and a bite to eat. Despite closing at 1am, the waiter decided on his own that "last call" was 90 minutes before closing. A manager overruled him but offered no gesture of compensation. - Speaking of overcrowding, the Grand Club is far too small for the demand at peak times. On multiple occasions there were zero seats available, and on one breakfast occasion there was literally a line out the door. Staff appeared unable or unwilling to adequately police the admittance of guests in excess of stated policies, as there were clearly some very large groups. Also, the hours of Club service are not posted outside of the Club itself, which was frustrating.- On the occasion of the line-out-the-door breakfast, the front desk agreed to comp me breakfast in the hotel restaurant instead. Unfortunately it took 3 tries to get the charge removed from my folio. - Doormen were frequently absent and/or inattentive in helping guests in and out of the property. - Union Square has really gone downhill. There is trash everywhere, and the homeless and "busker" situation is borderline out of control.

My girlfriend and I stayed here just before New Years. The hotel was unbelievably busy during our stay. We initially checked in in the morning and said we would wait for a room on a higher floor. When we returned in the late afternoon our room was still not available. We did not get into our room until after 5 pm. The front desk was very apologetic for the lateness of the hour and compensated us quite fairly. I checked out via email and had to call the hotel back to have my rate adjusted for this inconvenience. Unfortunately the notes in my file were not accurate however I remembered the name of the person who had taken care of the situation and it was rectified immediately. Our room was quiet considering it is the city. You still hear some city noise but it did not disturb our sleep. We did not hear any hallway noise. We had a room with two beds and it was spacious enough for us considering we had two luggages and did some shopping. The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows. There are great black out shades and I love that the button is next to the bed. There is also a sensor light for when you get up in the middle of the night. This is a plus and negative when you are sharing the room with someone else. The room was very clean which is a big plus for me. We used the services of the concierge on a few occasions. One lady was very nice and accommodating. There was a second concierge who was not that friendly and seemed to be put out with our questions. Overall this was a great trip. Given we were here over a busy period I appreciate the hotel giving us late checkout on our last day. I would stay here again next time I am in town.

GH continues to set the standard in hotels. Iâ€™ve been to several locations around the world in 2017, and unfortunately have only got to experience GH in Melbourne and SF. I missed the opportunity in Waikiki and the Maldives. So in 2018, my first trip to SF was always going to include GH. He team have never disappointed.Great service; central location; awesome views; and comparable rates to like hotels in the area. Definitely will be back when next in SF. Iâ€™m just hoping to experience GH in another location.Thanks again.

I stay at Hyatts all over the world. I booked a month in advance. Check here in is like going to a Apple Store and same result... stand in line... and everything is fully booked and sold out, you are lucky to get an extremely small room with a view of some ugly building for only 425USD. The club lounge was nice but way too small. Great service and food at the lounge. No idea why the charge for the wine here and it is a nice wine. Hint they have nice coffee out and everyone stands in line for the machines. I had problems with the room and the maintenances guy from Laos (I think) came and did a great job of fixing it. He even used a wet towel to clean the ceiling covers so dust did not fall down on the bed.The pay breakfast was very nice and the manager was very nice. Overall the property is just to overloaded and small for the price.

From the moment you walk in, you are greeted by a very attentive Gliezl, making you feel so welcomed. Then, you meet a fantastic concierge, Elaine, who really cares about providing you with the best experience of San Francisco! We felt at home and very cozy in our beautiful room. The bed is super comfortable and the linen is great! One Up was a fun place to go to for meals and wine, especially with the nice atmosphere that the staff create! Thanks Mitch for our nice chats! We are totally happy we chose the Grand Hyatt to celebrate our 25th anniversary! Thanks to the friendly staff everywhere in this so-well located hotel! We would definitely come back and refer people to experience this Grand Hyatt!

This hotel is right in the heart of downtown SF, right on Union Square. It is an excellent base for exploring the city, with nearby access to public transport and cable cars, plenty of shopping and food around as well. The hotel itself is well-kept, has friendly staff, and a high-quality restaurant on-site. Comfy beds, spacious bathroom, in-room wifi etc, all make the stay comfortable and easy.

This hotel is ok. Bell boys were great and eager to please. Found the check in process a little sterile with only men checking guests in. The noise at night from the lifts was unbearable. As all the rooms are located close to the lifts it doesnâ€™t give to an option to move. Would think about another hotel less noisy!!!!!!

Stayed four nights on NYE and we had a blast in San Fran. The hotel is centrally located at the Union Square. A walking distance to Market Street station if you want to catch a ride on cable car. Also very close to Chinatown and bus stop are right in front of the hotel in case you need to go somewhere else. The hotel was very busy at times during check-in and check-out. We arrived early around 11:30 and there was no room available for us and had to wait until 3:30 before we got a text message that our room was ready. This hotel is great for business but not so for family as it doesn't offer any other amenities.

Here for a girls weekend, starting on the day of 'Santa-con'...so lots of activity, and the staff was great. Courteous and helpful. We were on the 21st floor with Bay views...Transamerica building and Coit Tower made for great pics - day and night...room was great, modern look. Located right off Union Square, great location. Enjoy

Good location to Union Square. Enjoyed the hotel. Would prefer a room higher up in the hotel around 30th floor.Check in was quick.We were offered a bottle of wine complimentary. However, that bottle never arrived. :(Other than that everything was fine. Rooms were a good size.Room was spacious enough.Clean for the most part.Good gym. Has everything you need for a decent work out.Great location.

I stayed there with my family for 2 nights. First night I asked for upgrade to the club room and was told that it is sold out. Second night I asked first thing in the morning to upgrade and they offered to upgrade. I really enjoyed all of my stay. I enjoyed the club access as well. I wish that they would serve the desert with the appetizers so that we wouldn't have to wait or come back for it. Also, first night I went on the very top floor (floor 35) because it was labeled as a spot where you could check out the sunset/nice view in the elevator. When I got there, the door guy told me that it was a private event and I could not enter. He told me I could come back tomorrow to check it out. Next day, the 35 floor button wouldn't work. I found out from the front desk that the top floor is only reserved for private events. I think it should be open to at least your guests who are staying at the hotel.

Hotel staffs (concierge, reception, housekeeper) were very nice and helpful. They all have great service minded. The hotel location is very convenient. Close to shopping malls and union square but still quiet and peaceful.

Stayed her for 3 nights post Christmas I am a World if Hyatt Globalist (highest member level) and spend many night per year in hotels. To be frank this Hyatt is pretty average. The location is great, the one up bar / restaurant is nice (but itâ€™s the only food option). On the down side the hotel is very tired and needs renovation and the gym is terrible. Overall - itâ€™s average. By no means the worst hotel around, but as a grand hyatt itâ€™s down the list

I had a terrible allergic reaction from their toiletries. My face was literarily turned beet red from using their soap. I went down to lobby and talked to the manager in charge if they could help me. He just pretty much shrugged his shoulder and said there is nothing he could do. He didnâ€™t even looked concern. All he offered was to give me a different toiletries.

I travelled on business to SFO and stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel are spacious and comfortable. I enjoyed my stay here. The people are very hospitable and the restaurant is nice. Perfectly located if you want to sight see.

The Grand Hyatt was the perfect choice for our one-night escape. We shopped in Union Square, walked to a great restaurant, indulged in a nightcap at the hotel bar, caught a cable car, and enjoyed a beautiful view from the 32nd floor. Ira in reception checked us in and could not have been more welcoming. We felt special thanks to her special attentiveness. Well done, Grand Hyatt!

We travelled to San Francisco with our four young adult kids for a reunion with two other families and ski trip to Lake Tahoe. We chose the hotel as a group based on location and value. The hotel is nice, modern, with decent rooms. The walls are paper thin and we heard the loud antics of our neighbors one night. A nice pounding on the wall got them to quiet down. Great location, we walked everywhere and took a cable car. Parking was conveniently located around the corner with quick service and not too pricey for San Francisco. Unfortunately San Francisco smells strongly of urine and marijuana (skunk smell) so not too pleasant when walking around. It is still worth it to enjoy this beautiful city.

Stayed here for a week in December and had a great stay!Rooms are a little dated but no chips or rips just not fully modern! The rooms, bathroom are big with plenty room in them. I loved they have a French doors as window so got a great view of the city and of course Macyâ€™s and the square where there was ice skating going on with the Christmas tree. All staff were lovely when we seen then, but the doormen were just lovely and so helpful. They greeted you at every time, first time this has happened in any hotel so this really stood out to me!Great location for anyone, bar is lovely and warm, on the smaller side but modern and you can sit back and enjoy your drink! We had a great stay and thank you! Would recommend anyone going to stay here and enjoy your stay!

Grand Hyatt and westing have the best locations for any Union Square hotels. Am Hilton Diamond member and was so glad I didnâ€™t stay there - quality not up to other Hiltons and its 2 blocks in the wrong direction - homeless all over the sidewalks there and the street just smelled gross. Hyatt is on the right side of Union Square with the great shops and views in all directions (ask for higher floor). Staff lovely and helpfull. Whislt it didnâ€™t feel â€˜luxury 5 starâ€™ (decor more 4 star to me), it made up for that with the excellent location and staff service.

Stayed here because my sister thinks grand hyatt is the only place in SF. Only the female receptionists is nice. I book 4 rooms for 3 nights. And the room reservation is also nice, they did place us all in the same floor, we traveled with baby and elderly. The very nice and warm female filipinos reception said, Do call 0 for anything you need from water to extra blanket. She was the only reason I am giving another extra 1 star here instead of 1. And when I did, wowza the lady who pick up the phone need some attitude training. She was super rude lazy and tells me you ask for water just now and you want more? when I called for extra water. somebody give her some small change please!No amenities is in the room, just soap shampoo.I really dont know if anyone notice here, but the room in hyatt is very very dusty.We always use the bell service and the worst bell service during my stay is always the same, grand hyatt SF. The room size is also small for the price paid, compare to some other hotel nearby and offer better service with a competitive price point.

The Grand Hyatt in SF is beautiful. The staff is very attentive and prompt to make your stay very enjoyable. Perfect downtown location close to everything with a Starbucks right across the street. Self parking was inexpensive and right across the street.

- Location: It's located right at the union square. Good amount of shopping mall/restaurant within walking distance.- Parking: Valet is quite expensive, they have self assisted parking as well at the garage across the street. $40 for 24 hours is about the price you get in the city.- Service: Staff is friendly and helpful. They offered room amenity for my special occasion as well which is pretty sweet. One hiccup is that they didn't deliver it on time and I had to call the front desk to request it, which could have done better.- Room: Stayed at the 29th floor with Union Square view. Floor-to-ceiling window with modern decor. Overall the room looks really nice, one minor thing is the tub is quite small, but kind of expected due to the location- Grand Club: Definitely one of the best I've been. Had Risotto and short rib during the evening treat and chef did an awesome job. They also have a good selection of wine there for a minimum charge of ~$4.Overall this place is definitely recommended.

Let me start off with the positive. Staff is on point and awesome (doorman, front desk, and club room). Room service was good, food delivered was tasty. Rooms were modern and I liked the large bath. Careful with the sink, too much water at once will cause it to overflow. The location is great especially to Chinatown to walking distance to wherever. We opted for Lyft most of the time due to some credit received. But loved the fact that everywhere was within walking distance if needed. Negatives...I'm short, how am I supposed to reach back and down for the toilet paper without hurting myself?!! We asked for maintenance through the bell man on the first day to change a lightbulb on one of our lighting that never came. Paid extra for club access. It was extremely overly busy as we expected, was more so on Dec 29, Friday. There are a lot of rude and entitled members in the club room. It seems those persons know it's busy with families and couples but still throw their jackets on seats so no one would sit next to them. I've worked in tower rooms that offer the same at a five star resort so I was disappointed in staff that they can't tactfully watch and communicate with those guests to help others. Club access offered the same breakfast 3 days in a row? Really?!? The late afternoon offering had pasta but on Friday night they stepped up and went with the BBQ ribs, still preferred to go else where. I'd stay again only for location but maybe not pay extra for club access.

This property is huge. We arrived at the same time as 4 bus loads of football players and family members so it was chaotic waiting for elevators. The staff did a good job managing the chaos. We had a one bedroom suite and it was ok. The room as clean but it needed to be refreshed with worn furniture and nicks on the walls. My encounters with the staff in all departments was positive. The high point was the club level lounge. The breakfast was plentiful and had a good variety. The evening hors were very nice. The view was beautiful overlooking San Francisco Ban and Alcatraz. Overall, I would stay here again because of the location and the club level lounge but it lacks overall wow factor.

Our King room with a view of the Bay and Coit Tower was worth every penny. The room was clean and modern, the bed and pillows were comfortable and the staff was attentive and friendly. I brought my two teen kids here last summer and stayed in a room with a view of Union Square. It was fabulous then and it is still fabulous. The central location is unbeatable. The bar, bartender and waitress were also awesome.

Worse visit ever...we never recommend to anyone....itâ€™s better to stay at home rather than Hyatt...chairs were dirty...quilts were not properly washed....according to price location were not good....there were no microwave....itâ€™s hard with kids.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for five night from the end of December to the start of January and we found the hotel didn't quite meet our expectations. There were positives though which included the location, close to union square, the comfy king beds and friendly staff. The negatives however overshadowed the positives for us. The first night we were placed in a room which had a noisy air conditioner unit so that it made noises whenever the rooms around us turned on their air con. We didn't get much sleep and asked for a new room as soon as we woke the next morning. They said this was fine and told us to prepare our luggage ready to move. We then had to check multiple times throughout the day for if the room would was ready as our bags were never moved and it wasn't until late afternoon when we returned to find our old room being cleaned but the new room not ready that they found a different room for us which we ended up moving our own stuff into. We were then disappointed to find that in the new room the sound of the elevators going up and down was very loud. We were disappointed in the service as we clearly wanted a quieter room but were moved to a noisier one. After expressing our unhappiness, the next day concierge showed up unannounced at around 6pm to take us to our new room but sleeping in a third room in three nights seemed too much and we were not prepared for the move at the time. In addition to the noise, we were also disappointed with the bathrooms. Both rooms had showers over a bath with a cloth screen which is not ideal in a honeymoon setting. The rooms generally lacked all the usually items such as shower caps, bottles of water, milk, etc. Overall, we have stayed in many Hyatt's around the world and this one left a bit to be desired. I would encourage couples looking for a romantic time away or a honeymoon to look elsewhere.

I booked a city view king bed room for four nights over the new year. According to the confirmation the room would be located on floors 20-29. When I arrived there seemed to be some kind of problem and the check in assistant had to go and see the manager. I then got a room on floor 14 with a less good city view. The view from the rooms was the main reason for booking this hotel so I was quite dissatisfied that Hyatt could not meet this expectation.The room could need better cleaning and was quite worn down. Location is very good and the staff was very friendly, but I will choose another hotel the next time I visit San Francisco.

This is a decent hotel in close proximity to Union square. However, the hotel is dated and staff are not friendly. Food is reasonable. I have stayed here close to 10 times but this time I felt I was not welcome. Being a Hyatt member has no additional privilege in this hotel.Overall, low on value and great on location.

This is an unbeatable location, it was easy to access everything and moments to anything. The room was a good size & we had an amazing view. The staff were friendly and helpful. Because of the location the hotel is obviously very busy and the lifts did take a while to come but itâ€™s worth it for the location and conveinience. I would definitely stay there again if I went back to San Fran. Monica Shor

We were upgraded at a minor cost to stay in a VIP Suite. It was a wonderful room, wonderful location, well cared for. We thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. When we've made trips to San Francisco, this is our hotel of choice over the past fifteen years. We love the location next to Union Square and all of the shopping available in the area. The hotel food is excellent and overall we consider it to be the best hotel experience for your dollar in the area.

*WARNING* - The staff at this hotel is unprofessional and gave us nasty customer service. There should be a rating of zero to fit in this hotel. We stayed at this hotel to celebrate New Years in the city. I had forgotten a few toiletries and called the hospitality staff to provide some of these items which were complimentary. The lady was SUPER RUDE and even questioned when I was checking out. The items were NEVER brought to our room. The staff could have been more accommodating, especially for being a premium class hotel. I even complained to the staff who checked me out, yet nothing seemed to be done to rectify the issue. Seriously, these workers should be educated on providing better customer service. This experience was utterly disappointing and ruined my trip. I will take my business elsewhere! We will not be coming back.

Spontaneous getaway with our college age kids home for break. Found Hyatt Hotel on Union Square to overlook Christmas decorations...walked to fantastic dinner. Hotel was reasonably priced and perfect!

This is our third visit to Grand Hyatt San Francisco last 5 years. Excellent location especially if you get rooms facing Union Square. Check in process extremely quick. Concierge desk is very helpful especially Elaine - she gives you wonderful ideas to explore the city, car rental, athletic games, etc. Breakfast buffet is nice too. Food variety could be expanded to include some Asian fare, although Chinatown is 15-20 mins away.

Great location. In the heart of Union Square. Great area for shopping for branded stuff. The staff there are great and make my stay really enjoyable. Great view from the room. Canâ€™t ask for anymore from Grand Hyatt SF.

The soaring main lobby of the hotel is beautiful and the exterior viewed elevators add to the character. The staff was welcoming and accommodating. The hotel is centrally located in the business district, but also a good location for tourists in the downtown area. We took the BART (rapid transport) from the San Francisco airport directly to the hotel. The rooms are on the small side- think city hotel. However, they are very clean and appointed well. We ate breakfast at the restaurant in the main lobby twice and felt that the ambience was rather cold. I think because the restaurant is enveloped in the enormousness of the lobby. Other than that the food was good and the server pleasant.

Rudely greeted on checkin, very noticable noise from neighboring rooms (little sound insulation), hotel restaurant is very Un-Grand with poor service and rude reception and poor food. A hotel without a proper lobby.

The location is convenient for many things. I think I walked to so many things and dinner. Was at the hotel for a week long conference. The gym is great - on the top floor of the hotel with great views.

We recently had a 6 night stay at the hotel with our 4 & 8 year old. The hotel had a beautiful Christmas feel and we found check in very easy. All the staff were very helpful especially Joe who was so kind to our son. The room was great & the bay view was amazing. With easy access to union square & Starbucks across the road it was perfect for shopping & quick easy breakfast.

Just returned from a quick one night stay at this hotel. The location is excellent, adjacent to Union Square, and only a few blocks to walk to the BART station (line directly to SFO). The hotel was packed, however check in at the World of Hyatt counter was quick and efficient. I was upgraded to a suite on the 27th floor, which was very spacious and actually quiet during the night. I really appreciated that the bedroom window would be opened slightly for some fresh air. The club is on the 32nd floor, with wonderful views of the city. Food offerings were decent, with a couple of different pastas, soup, salad, and usual array of veggies and spreads. Overall, I very much enjoyed my stay.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during our stay in the wider SF area. We wanted a great standard, centrally located hotel, so we booked a club room at the Hyatt hoping for great things. Check in was terrible. A line the length of the lobby, total disorganisation, suitcases abandoned behind the counters, chaos everywhere. When we got to check in, bearing in mind we pre paid, check in took at least 15 minutes. No idea why! We requested a quiet club room and were given â€˜the only one availableâ€™ which was opposite the ice machine. When we got to the room we were underwhelmed. A camp bed was left in the room when we hadnâ€™t requested it, the furnishings were tired and dated, and worst of all everywhere looked like it just needed a good scrub! After 3 nights there, all of the stuff we left out became coveted in thick dust. Such a dirty room. The club lounge itself was very crowded most of the time. There are often times you need to line up for a seat - not exactly a relaxing experience. As soon as any food is put out, everyone crowds around and grabs it. Itâ€™s like feeding time at the zoo! On check out we asked to leave our bags for a few hours. The best they could offer us is to leave them right in the centre of the public lobby, where anyone could come and take them. The bag room was full. Elevators are a nightmare - there are never any to take you up or down and everyone seems to be waiting all the time. Positives for this hotel are the location - very central. The breakfast in the club lounge was adequate - it met our expectations where most other parts of the experience didnâ€™t. The views are also good from high floors. On reflection I would have preferred to take my $370+ a night and stay at a proper hotel of a decent standard. If Iâ€™d paid for a cheap chain then I wouldnâ€™t grumble, but this isnâ€™t value for money on any count (unless you take root in the club room and eat your own body weight in snacks - which some seemed to be doing).
