This hotel should be rated 3 star as itâ€™s tired, dirty, dated and more like a constant free for all for everything - breakfast, check in, elevators, check out. Boring. Not what you want on a break!

We had a marvelous stay during Christmas time. We booked double beds Union Square view, given a room at 25th floor and truly enjoyed the view of the Christmas tree & ice skating rink at Union Square. The beds are firm, pillows are standard but overall comfy. Room comes with coffee maker & fridge which is really nice. I love the spacious closet with drawers. Beautiful bathroom sink/vanity, with generous counter space. I appreciate that slippers were provided and free Wi-Fi, high speed to me. The fitness room is located on 35th floor fully equipped & nice view. Great customer service from the doorman, bell man, front desk, to the concierge. The lobby is very cozy, decorated with multiple Christmas trees. Thereâ€™s a charging station overlooking the front of the hotel which is nice to people watch at the same time. Thereâ€™s a garden between the hotel & Apple store that is great to take pictures. The hotel is centrally located near shopping, restaurants, cable cars, & China town, just walking distance. Sightseeing tour busses stops at Union Square. Tickets are available at concierge to purchase at discounted price. I could go on and on. This is one of the best hotels we stayed at. I highly recommend Grand Hyatt SF most specially during the holidays. It is just so festive everywhere. Thank you Hyatt!

My daughters and I spent Christmas here. We had a great time in the City. Loved it! The hotel however is average to me compared to other grand hyatts. It is though a great location ! Definitely must get a room with a view of Union square or the bay. Otherwise youâ€™ll want to keep the drapes pulled.

Great location!!! Near Union Square, walking distance to public transportation, Westfield Mall, Embarcadero...etc. If you enjoy walking, it's pretty much in the middle everything. From SFO, take the BART and exit Powell and just walk to the hotel. You really don't need a car when you're here. One thing I wish the hotel had was a bar with a view. The bar was on the 2nd floor = no view. Besides a mixed up with my room, it was a good stay. The person who checked me in was helpful. Some rooms in the hotel needs an upgrade. As long as the room and bed is free of bugs and is as clean as can be, I'm happy.

We love the Grand Hyatt on Union Square. You can't beat the location. The service is top drawer. We love the Club Room, beautiful view, great food and drink. Jimmy and David the evening attendants are incredible.

The hotel has a great location. We had a room with the Union Square view. The view was amazing! The room was very clean and quite. The staff was very friendly. We did self parking for $39 per night, which was challenging. If you don't mind paying about extra $30 per night valet parking probably worth it.

Nice clean property. For anyone visiting sf, to me the location is the best, it's right in union square and walking distance to Chinatown. The rooms are on the small side, but very well appointed. My only issues, and they are slight are the lack of hot water, warm water yes, but no hot. The beds were also on the uncomfortable side. Also, it was xmas time and although a couple of xmas trees, it wasn't very festive. Would I stay again, sure, for the right price.

We had has such a wonderful time staying there. The location is perfect, very close to all attractions. DO NOT MISS THE BREAKFAST. That was by far, the best breakfast I ever had in the US. The views were just stunning. Highly recommended hotel.

Stayed here for a few days whilst travelling for work. Hotel us well located and is right on Union Square. Food venues were ordinary but the rooms seemed to have been refurbished recently. SF is an expensive city so I guess this place offers reasonable (relative) value for money. If given the choice I would prefer to find a less â€˜big chainâ€™ hotel. In short it did exactly what it said on the box, so nothing to complain about, just nothing to get excited about either.

Updated, clean, and quiet hotel room!! We did not pay the extra for a view, so our room was on a lower level. Not a problem though -Great room if you donâ€™t want to spend the money for a view. It worked great for us. Comfortable bed. Big bathroom. Quiet room which made sleeping perfect. This hotel is very Easy access to union square and a cvs located across the street. We will stay here again.

The hotel was beautiful my whole time there we had an overall great experience the food a bit pricey but it is San Francisco and itâ€™s basically close to New York City what were used to staff was amazing

The room they put me in should never have been a room for rent - wedged between a housekeeping closet, elevator & ice closet. Basically, it sounded like jets were taking off from my room every 3-5 min. The lighting in the room is terrible for working (as I needed to do). And, there is a "nightlight" that is a strobe light under the nightstand that you cannot turn off without engineering (as I learned the hard way). The location was fine and the staff were very nice, but otherwise I would pick any other hotel besides this for your SF stay. I did get an email apology from the hotel (again showing the good quality staff), but that honestly doesn't make up for how poor my stay was.

Back at the Hyatt after a number of years, and much impressed with the upgrade and general appearance of the property. We had an amazing view from the 26th floor, which came at a modest upgrade. Also, right in the middle of this Wonderful City of SF.

In the past, Hyatt's in my far-from-limited experience tended to have gorgeous public spaces and only-okay rooms -- the Grand Hyatt New York being a good example. The Grand Hyatt in San Francisco suggests that they've been paying attention. Reception was high tech. Our room was very modern, well appointed, had fridge and microwave, powered shade, extremely comfortable bed with lovely duvet, and a fancy TV system that we didn't use. Food and drink are expensive (as they usually are in this kind of hotel) but we really loved our visit.

A Christmas stay at the Grand Hyatt is a holiday tradition for us for years. Many rooms at the hotel have incredible views of Union Square and the holiday decorations and festivities. The staff is welcoming and the location can't be beat. This is a San Francisco must-do!

Visiting San Fran for 3 nights from Australia. Long standing Hyatt members. Got a higher floor as requested and on our profile but still only 20 out of 36 with no view at all, so no real bonus there! Room is a decent size and supposedly refurbished but the colours and styling are quite dated by at least 10 years!! Ordinary. 3*.There are chips and scratches everywhere with a worn desk chair. The carpets are clean. Bed comfy but small pillows. No throws or cushions anywhere - misleading pictures on the web site - as these make a room more "homely" and inviting as well as adding some colour. Hideous, very old fashioned vase in entry blocking the mirror. As the weather in SF is varied maybe a cute coat rack would have been more use?? Had that in our last hotel and thought it a great idea.Makeup area outside of the bathroom is good but needs better lighting. Nice robes. Bathroom basic shower over bath and single vanity but clean. Fridge is useful but not one glass to drink from with only glasses in bathroom! 2 paper cups only so had to keep rinsing!! Horrible plastic blinds - like those placemats you can buy - seriously - never seen anything like them in all my travels! Nice small lobby/seating downstairs with fires.Overall ok just nothing special at all - really not much beeter rooms than a Hyatt house for the money. I feel there are nicer more atmospheric places to stay here. 31/2*

We stayed on the 5th floor in a double room. Very nice layout and had everything we needed. Hotel staff was excellent. I love this location as it's so close to everything. We typically stay in Nob Hill and it was great to be so much closer. Beautiful hotel - I would definitely recommend staying here. Not a single issue.

Room was modern, clean and serene. The pillows were absolutely wonderful - do you sell them? Slept like a baby. Food in the onsite restaurant was excellent. No lines to receive a wonderful, tasty meal. Slight wait at the front desk but not bad. Wished for a better view of San Francisco.

This was only my second time visiting San Francisco for leisure, not work. In other words, I was on my own dime. I had stayed at a few of the city's luxury hotels & was looking for something that'd be equally comfortable & reliable (especially since this was my first big trip with my boyfriend & we were traveling cross country) but more reasonably priced.The Grand Hyatt proved to be perfect for our needs. We had an Executive Suite which had a separate living room with a comfy couch, arm chairs, TV & desk in addition to the main bedroom. Best of all, it had 2 full baths. The room, which was at the end of the hall (rm 230_?) was very quiet & clean. The bed was just right & the sheets were nice & soft. While the Hyatt, like all major hotel chains, has adopted environmentally friendly practices, it still has great water pressure in the showers.The hotel staff at check in & check out were very friendly and welcoming. This was more important to me than usual this time because (1) we were arriving at 12:30 AM and (2) this hotel has a "desk-less" check-in desk.They were renovating the mezzanine level bar/restaurant area but we weren't impacted by any noise & it appeared they were doing the work at night.A special shout out to Elaine, the concierge, who gave us some great advice & directions for what turned out to be a perfect day of sightseeing.This property will definitely be on my list for future visits to San Francisco.

My husband and I really liked the hotel. The room was comfortable, with a lot of space to relax and organize three large luggages. There was a mini fridge at out room, which was very useful. The bathroom was big, clean and nice. The only thing that disappointed me was that there was too much dust in the room and it was visible, on the night stand, on the corners of the carpet, under the bed. It bothered me because I am allergic to dust and I couldâ€™ve beem more comfortable if the room was cleaner.

Very expensively priced like most US city hotels; No value for money; Late checkout also denied. Not a very hospitable experience for me.So possibly stay at a Airbnb or a lesser priced hotel as this hotel does not offer much.

Can't beat the location. I chose a room overlooking Union Square and WOW! Macy's lights and xmas tree, a festive ice rink and sparkly palm trees. Such a nice way to start the holiday season, even though I was there for business. Convenient Starbucks right across the street. Close to great shopping, including the Apple Store. GREAT Customer service that made things right. Bustling lobby but rooms were peaceful. Would stay again.

most accommodating and polite staff. Great location , easy on and off highway 80. Just a few steps from Union Square and other major stores in San Francisco. Gave us an extended stay of two hours after checkout to pack and leave. Not everyone does that.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt, arriving on Thanksgiving and checking out on Saturday. One of the best things about this hotel is the location. Great shopping is only steps away and, if you want to do some touristy things, Chinatown, cable cars and more are nearby. We also had wonderful service during our stay, especially the bellstaff! I would definitely stay here again.

The hotel staff and location were perfect for our annual girls trip. I would recommend this hotel for any occasion. Some of the staff I have seen year after year when I come. Excellent customer service.

Located 1 block from Union Square, this hotel is in an ideal location for get out and about. The hotel itself is nice enough and the staff friendly. The rooms are ok, mattress on the firm side. The thing that dominated our stay and rating was the doors - 2 things - we were at the end of the hall and there were 3 doors withing 2 feet of each other, so everyone coming and going were right outside 2 other rooms, and the noise was very unpleasant. Second, the doors are not soft close doors so every close was a slam and it echoed through our room, as I'm sure it did to the others in their rooms. Late and early door use was frequent and disturbing and kept us awake the first night. We should have complained but were too tired to move rooms. Poor design and consideration of the effects of having the doors so close together.

The CSM and General Manager at this hotel take their jobs to please high level execs to heart. They made several last minute things happen for my group and I could not have been more pleased with the customer service! Thank you Grand Hyatt SFO!

Our primary reason for choosing this hotel was location and it didnâ€™t disappoint. This is a well situated hotel for Union Square and all the shops / restaurants and services surrounding it. The hotel is feeling a little dated and could do with a bit of refreshing - but everything was clean and working. There is no â€˜drive-inâ€™ area when you arrive which makes luggage drop off a little bit challenging if itâ€™s busy. The motion activated night lights in the room are too bright at night but otherwise the room was clean and well appointed. The housekeeping staff were very friendly and accommodating. We were on level 27.

Stayed over Black Friday weekend and hotel was crazy busy. We arrived late but our room still wasnâ€™t ready. Staff was very nice and did everything to fix the problem including giving us access to the Club. Club is very small much smaller than in other Hyatts, and food selction was disappointing. Room was nice but we could hear elevator noise. Excellent location, but woukd probably chose another Hyatt next time.

My stay at the Grand Hyatt was awesome. I would highly recommend it for anyone thinking about staying in the Downtown San Francisco area. The location was great, and the staff was phenomenal. Anything that I needed during my stay was taken care of in an urgent and quick manner.

Great location, near union square. The Starbucks is just opposite the street. While the room is just ok I think. The cleanness is expected to further improved. Room service is great. The concierge is quite friendly helping me look after the luggage.

I recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt Hotel to attend a large conference. I had an upgraded room, but am not sure exactly what was upgraded about the room. Anyway, the room was spacious and well furnished and the bathroom was similarly spacious although it still has an old fashioned tub-shower combination with a shower curtain. The criticism I would have about the room, and the Hotel in general is that once inside the room or the hotel for that matter, there is nothing in the decor, art or otherwise that speaks to the location of the Hotel - the iconic City of San Francisco with the Golden Gate Bridge, Cable Cars, etc.

Very nicely located hotel for shopping, events and views of Union Square. Congestion and traffic can be challenging but if your into walking and the weather is nice, the hotel is in a great spot for access by walking to many key spots in the financial, shopping and Embarcadero areas. Parking by valet only and parking fees are high. Very good for adults with nice dinning and bars at the top and lower levels of the hotel. The rooms are updated with awesome bedding and good space.

Small and smelly rooms. Found hair in the bathtub and pubic hairs on the restroom floor. Requested a fan and I was only brought a small fan that did not blow air. Requested another fan and I was informed that the hotel only had 2 fans!!!

Perfect location in the center of everything with easy access to all manner of public transportation and public parking across the street. Very clean and modern rooms and common areas. Slightly more expensive than the older, dingier hotels nearby, but well worth the extra $25. Highly recommended for a great SF stay.

Terrific view and location. Beds were too hard. Only one chair in the room. No local newspapers. Had to go into the lobby to do any reading. Don't know if I would stay there again until the beds are better. Told they were getting pillowtop bed shortly.

We loved our stay at the Hyatt SF. First of all, we had an amazing view of the Bay Bridge and the city. Breakfast was good, location was perfect. We walked to the Ferry Bldg, only a few blocks away. Our room was comfortable, clean and warm. Even though remodeling was taking place, our room was quiet.

You cannot find a better place to stay in SF. They make every effort to make sure you are taken care of. The staff is amazing and the location is perfect. The food is very good. We love the fact that they know they are there for you and they make you feel like that.

Stayed for 2 nights in a club level room around Thanksgiving holiday. Upgraded to club level with points, which I felt was a great value for my family. Club level provided some very nice views both in the room and in the club. Breakfast and afternoon snack options were good, and it was great to have a place to go back to after a long day of walking to havr a drink and relax. Service was excellent on all levels- front desk allowed early check in, accomodated rooms that were near each other for my family, and all staff were professional, friendly, and courteous. My only complaint is that you could hear the elevator from the room, so not great if you are a light sleeper. Bathroom also has a pocket door which provides more space, but removes privacy- especially since the pocket door did not close all the way. Agree with others that for parking, use the valet lot across the street (next to CVS), or there is also a self park deck across the street as well. All in all, it was an excellent stay and I would certainly select this property again.

Another good stay at the Hyatt in a somewhat noisy but convenient location..near good restaurants and museums as well as Chinatown and in a positive way, excellent Curry at the Taj Campton across the street.

Great location and friendly staff here. Wife and I took a weekend trip and researched over 15 hotels and ultimately chose this one. Very satisfied with the choice. We felt safe here and liked the vibe and feel of the property. Room didn't have that great of a view, but luck of the draw I guess. Rooms could use a big mirror too when getting ready. Otherwise, great place and comfy. Check out the bar on the 2nd floor too. Prime location in Union Square.

Bring earplugs. I was told by reservations that over 90% of the rooms in this hotel have connecting doors to other rooms. I was unlucky. My next door neighbors were noisy. Next time I insisted on a non-connecting room. I got it but this time it was the elevator noise that did no let me sleep. Sad since the service provided by the staff is good.

Stayed there for 2 nights in late November for a Christmas visit to San Francisco. My room was on the 25th floor with a stunning view of the city with the bay beyond. Every employee, from the doorman and parking valet to the check-in clerk and bellman was the perfect mix of friendly and polite. The room was clean and modern. The lighting in the bathroom was the best of any hotel I've experienced. Also appreciated the nightstand motion sensors that turned on floor lights in the dark, plentiful outlets for recharging devices, and the bedside switch for the windowshade. I will definitely stay here in the future.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for three nights over the Thankgiving weekend. High marks for the friendly and helpful staff, nice room with a east view, great bed and pillows and breakfast (included in our room rate). Our room needed a large mirror - the only one was in the bathroom. The Union Sqaure location puts you in the heart of The City. One criticism: the elevators are really slow, especully if you want to go to the mezzanine restaurant and bar.

I travelled many times to San Francisco and I really enjoyed this hotel and the location of it , it was in union square which all the shopping stores and cafes around you . The lobby was great and has lovely couches and fire area around , the rooms were very clean and has great views . The sizes of the rooms were great and comfortable,

Not well managed, very crowded, club room is a free for all, not a luxury experience. Location is good but will book at marriott next time, just not worth it. Hyatt rewards program is not as strong as its competitors.

Everyone at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco was very nice and accommodating. I would stay there again when I am in SF. Rooms were clean. The elevators were a little slow. Conceige room was somewhat crowded however the staff was very responsive

Small roomsNo microwave No free parking at the hotel - you have to park at a walking distance and itâ€™s expensive otherwise you take the valet parking for double the price of the hotel parking. So nervous that they have not mentioned that at the website neither the operator told me.

Apple flagship store is next door; beautiful. A small park between the hotel & store. Easy walk up Grant to Chinatown. Easy walk to restaurants. Convenient for grandma & grandchildren, parents. Clean. Well appointed. Used the Concierge, doormen, car service; late night dining; everything worked.

Located in the heart of San Francisco, great especially if you donâ€™t have a car. Nice high-rise building, nice rooms (though the lovel floors can get pretty noisy due to traffic & people in the streets). Reception is somewhat weird (floating desks with Macs) and staff could definitely be more friendly.

We have been visiting San Francisco for over 26 years as my husband was born here. We moved to Ashland Oregon and need our city fix as Iï¸è am originally from NYC. We have traveled the world and though we are realistic we do know that we love great customer service. We stayed at a few hotels around Union Square and though we enjoyed them the customer service wasnâ€™t what we expected. We compromised thinking this is the new normal. Iï¸è finally suggested we try Grand Hyatt and we were blown away in every direction from reception, room service, bar, business office and more. Iï¸è personally want to thankAnthony Flores and Steve Reyes for taking care of our personal and important business needs. We stay in the city at least 5 times a year bringing family at times with us. Iï¸è am so happy we found a new home. Thank you all for superior customer service. The service is a 10!!!

As a family of four with two young children we stayed in a room with two double beds, had a great view of the city (25th floor) and bay during a short short city break in SF. The hotel is perfectly situated for walking to the various sites and great for local restaurants. The staff were friendly, helpful and made us feel welcome.

Great location centrally located in the heart of all the Awesome shopping San Francisco has to offer. Many Great restaurants near by. The Hotel was clean, staff was friendly. I was impressed with the light feature under the night stand. My second time here, will return soon

Over-all solid. Facilities are starting to feel dated. Check in kiosks are awkward. Doormen, valet, and concierge were excellent. The view from the treadmill and elliptical machines in the very clean and well equipped workout facility will inspire you to workout longer and come back again. Wish the top floor restaurant/lounge was open for business other than conventions. Would really appreciate a jacuzzi

San Francisco was a sadly experience. City is completely dirty, huge homeless problem. Me and my family didnâ€™t feel safe in the hotel area and proximity. Drug addicted is in every were and the city is smelling drug and dirty. Very sad to see. I regret been there.

If you are looking for a comfortable hotel in a prime location of Union Square, the Grand Hyatt hotel is perfect for you. The check-in and out process is very smooth, drive up to the curb and you will be in your room in less than 10 minutes. The excellence of my previous trip was dwarfed by the lack of concern for guests (elevator malfunction, noisy neighbors, misleading room description), but I hope you will give Grand Hyatt a chance and receive more excellent service than I did. Be sure to confirm you have a view of Union Square (ice rink) prior to booking, and request to speak to a manager should you have any issues with your accommodations.

I had a very good experience, Service quality was very good, and They are a very good variety of Breakfast.I recommend this place to everyone.Location was awesome.I stayed there 15 nights and I am very happy with the service.

This is my favorite Union Square hotel location. Definitely like the convenience of the club floor rooms. Breakfast is good and the view is great. The staff are very customer oriented which makes you feel very welcome here.

The people working at the Grand Hyatt took pride in their job and looked like they were having fun helping people. That is what makes this place feel like home. Get a floor higher up to avoid the traffic and city noises closer to ground level. A south facing room will have a view of Union Square and the ice skating rink around Christmas time. Parking is expensive at $39/night which is across the street and it is not self-parking but still valet. Plan on about 5-10 minutes to get your car from leaving the hotel. This hotel has plenty of outlets to charge laptops, phones and other gadgets. Great for families.

A 3 night business stay in San Francisco at the Grand Hyatt was great. Check in, room service and porter service all friendly and efficient. Room was large and clean with very comfortable bed. Gym was well equipped with a fantastic view !

The review about the Grand Hyatt SF is mixed. Once a jewel among the business hotels in SF, lost its upper scale status as a business hotel. The service - as usual at Hyatt properties - attentive, friendly and welcoming. Sleep quality â€“ excellent. The hotel grounds are modern and well maintained. The gym is great with modern equipment.That said, the rooms are on the downside: even the ones on the higher floors: no central switch for lighting, not enough light on the working desk to work with a laptop, the desk chair torn and uncomfortable, and decoration start to age. Since I value quality of service over quality of rooms, my overall score is 4 stars, but for that high rate per night, the rooms are no more than an average 3 stars.

Excellent location, staff and value; the best hotel in San Francisco for business and pleasure! I have used this hotel for over eight years for both business and private functions and have never had an issue.

I normally stay in a Marriott but there was a really good deal on rooms going at this Hyatt (almost half price). We were given a room on the 4th floor 'the highest floor of the standard rooms' according to the check in person. We could have been on the ground floor with the windows open with the amount of street noise. We could distinctly hear words in conversations as people walked past the hotel and the number of hot rod cars which zoomed past the hotel. My last memory is of one of the valets, who stood there watching us struggle with our suitcases to get the door open to exit the hotel (all of the door attendants were busy with other people) and didn't move until I gave him a really nasty look. Not what I would expect from a Hyatt at all. I'll continue to stay at Marriotts in the future!

I have been to quite a few hotels in San Francisco. I have to say that this is one of the best ones. While large, it has captured a boutique style. The lobby is inviting and the staff approachable. I also really like its location. I can easily walk to Union Square as well as to Chinatown. The Apple Store is next door, and my sesame buns, the other direction, through the tunnel. My hotel room was modern, clean, and well appointed. I have no complaints. I'm sold. Hyatt knows the product and delivers it.

I will always remember how caring and wonderful the staff was to me during my emergency evacuation from the Sonoma Wildfires. It made it so much easier to have compassionate staff all around me during the months I needed to stay here. The only drawback is the noise of the construction around Union Square since my room faces that direction.

Conveniently located and elegantly decorated, this Hyatt is a great place to stay when you want to visit SF for a day. It's central and accessible to everything - boutique shopping or in Westfield, enjoying a pastry and coffee on Union Square, nerd-ing in Apple Store, lots and lots of cuisine choices around the neighborhood. Let me not forget to mention the impeccable rooms and hospitality Hyatt is well-known for!

Enjoyed our stay here while at a conference. Room very comfortable with the latest technology including being able to stream my Netflix shows live to the room tv! Close to lots of great shots, restaurants and attractions. Great customer service.

Upgraded me to a room with a beautiful view, remembered my name everytime I called front desk, provided prompt and fast service. All in all, amazing experience. Will try to stay here every time I come to SF.

I had room 3019 in front of the square. Noise reduction was very bad and I heard all traffi and city work noises during the night. It was impossible to sleep without earplugs. This ruined my all stay. That is a shame as I specifically asked for a quiet room and was confirmed the room would be very quiet.

We enjoyed our stay here. The bed was great and the roller blinds were good. The foot sensors by the bed were handy at night as the blinds make the room pitch black. Elevators are fast and the wifi is very quick. Only negatives was the slight gap under the door so we could hear the ice machine nearby at all hours, and our shower pressure was not ideal. We didnâ€™t eat there, $32 per person for a buffet breakfast is not cool. Great location and lovely staff.

We booked a harbour view room which was on the 30th floor. Great views but known for the foggy city it was often hard to enjoy the views. The room had two double beds but for the price I think two queens would be more realistic.. Location was fantastic and perfect to enjoy restaurants and shopping. We travelled with our 10 year old and great room service for kids if after a long day they are fussy. Rooms were clean and big big tv in the room was nice. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend to everyone. I used the concierge and they were very helpful with sightseeing tips. We enjoyed looking at the pumpkin carvings made by the staff for Halloween. Thanks for a wonderful stay.

This trip we were upgraded and wow... what a room! 33rd floor with incredible view and beautifully done spacious suite.Steven Reyes went beyond the call of dutyto make as feel like royalty!The location canâ€™t be beat and the recent remodel is to die for.Lobby is super inviting and hip.I highly recommend the property for a stay in San Francisco!!

Extremely average hotel. The hotel is in a great location, right next to Union Square, where the Macy building it. Only a 10 minute drive from the piers. Location wise, it's great. The customer service was good, they were friendly and wanted to help, and the hotel looked nice, it was kept up well, but that's about where it stopped for us. We payed 80 dollars extra a night for the Grand Club. Not worth it. Take your 80 dollars and eat out. The food is below average, the staff did not seem knowledgeable, and there was extremely limited variety. The room was pretty dirty when we checked in as well. There were hairs in the shower, stains on one of our pillow cases, things left in the cupboards from previous guest, and soap scum left on the shower door.

We had a week long event at the Grand Hyatt SF. The team effort that pulled our event together was fantastic. They were easy to reach in multiple different ways email, conf. app or by phone. As soon as we placed a request they deliverer quickly. Even with the last minute requests we had they still accommodated us and did so with a smile and compassion. Everyone at our event raved about the food and this comes from a health conscious group. Thank you Grand Hyatt staff for making our event such a great success.

We had a wonderful time at this hotel. The location is great. You are close to everything. Check in was flawless. Our room was a great size. It provided everything we needed. It was also spotless. Every employee was there with a smile to help whenever needed.

Came to stay in San Francisco during Dreamforce and really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. I've been to quite a few hotels in this city and this has been the most enjoyable. Right from the online check-in through to on-line check-out everything was a pleasure in this hotel.

Great location, comfortable rooms, loads of space & very friendly & helpful staff. Just a tad pricey, but then everything in SAN Francisco is, just market rates really.Conveniently right next to the Apple store . Great Starbucks across the road for brekkie.

Probably one of the nicest hotels I have stayed at in a long time. As a tech person I loved all the high tech room features. Hyatt club was great with good food. Really enjoyed my time there. Staff was super friendly and welcoming.

Spent 6 nights at the Hyatt as our headquarters for our vacation in San Francisco. Great staff, comfortable modern rooms in a great location for sight seeing. The price was fine and could even park our car for what I thought was reasonable just around the corner.

Im traveling from indonesia and stay 1 night in 3 room with friends in this hotel, the moment i got there the lobby and the receiptionist is very nice althought we are confuse cause the receiption is not like any other receiptionist desk, its only 4 imac with 5 people standing in front of it. The room is ok with electronic shade window but we are put only in 4th floor soo theres nothing to see in the window and the information from the receiptionist in the lobby not to clear regarding whereâ€™s the breakfast what i get if i stay here or is there any restaurant in the hotel for dinner or lunch. Soo not what i expected in grand hyatt sf

Been a few years since I stayed here; it is vastly improved, with a nice contemporary renovation. Room was huge, with a nice view over Union Square. I particularly like the discreet and automatic night light that turns on if you step out of bed in the night - handy feature. Room is clean, but unfortunately, walls are very thin, so you can hear much of what goes on in the rooms next to you. Housekeeping staff are very friendly. Hyatt's much-talked-about app-based mobile key doesn't work.Valet parking is, however, massively overpriced.

Stayed there for a couple nights. The concierge was really helpful to organize our daily trips into San Francisco. Did not try the food outlet but had a drink at the bar and was not disappointed. My high floor request was respected and offered a nice view overlooking the streets.

Have been staying at Grand Hyatt in San Francisco over many years. I have to be in San Fran for business and usually arrive worn and tired from New York. Every single visit - I am greated by a smiling face - my room is in perfect condition, everyone working there is super helpful and just seems happy. It can not be easy for a big hotel chain to maintain this type of consistent performance! They are for sure doing everything right!

Did I say perfect lol 3 nights this week on business 27th floor over looking Union Square.Room had added extras that I do not normally see!Electric window blinds Torch in draw Huge sink in bathroom my favorite was the motion detector night light, its a very faded blue beam that comes on under the bedside table, so when you get up in the night the light comes on enough to see but not blast you awake.My view was amazing room was spacious and clean. I requested a Microwave (No extra charge) always a plus to heat something up if need be.Valet guys are AWESOME super friendly. Parking is $69.95 a night BUT if you go around the back of the hotel the parking garage with a Valet is $39.95 a night for hotel guests.See you again soon you just became my favorite hotel in San Francisco.Thank you SR

We stayed for 5 nights to explore SAN FRANCISCO after our son wedding: The hotel its located very conveniently in the heart of the city, but for the price and renown , was less than expected ;kind of rundown and lack of expected amenities , like pool and steam room.The staff was very good for the most part. So overall , we were disappointed.

this hotel is very centrally located and is affordable. Always nice and clean. Bed & pillows are ok but not great. Staff is very friendly. Bar makes great drinks. Views of Union Square are wonderful, Bay view is another option.

We always leave smiling after our short visits. Great downtown location along with fine rooms and service. We opted for club level this time to enjoy easy access to food and views. We recommend asking about the assigned room so you are aware of what your going to get before you open the door into the room. We would like to see improved security for access to floors with guest rooms by requiring a coded key to move the elevators or staff person asking to show your card key. Good value.

Lovely hotel, great food and atmosphere but room 507 was extremely noisy with street noise and room fan. The higher up I would assume the more quiet. Please avoid rooms facing Sutter, adjacent building had roof equipment that created noise all night.

We started out at one hotel that was in a terrible part of town, with a very unsafe environment inside and out. We immediately started making phone calls and came across the Grand Hyatt. The staff were amazing, they went beyond to help us with our transition over to their hotel. When we arrived it was a breath of fresh air! We felt extremely safe, staff very friendly and the rooms were very clean and relaxing. Would highly recommend.

Great experience from the moment I checked in to the guest room. Very cool sensor lights on floor when you stepped out of bed. Rooms were very comfortable and overall lighting was very nice. Usually hotel rooms are very dark.

Good stay at this quality hotel in union square convenient to many locations right next to apps store and Starbucks shopping also good parking options........... until next time time... Great views on 36th floor

Very helpful staff from the second you pull up to the curb. Room was clean (except windows but it's SF) Nice bathrooms with good water pressure. Uber is easy to catch or a cab. We have stayed a few times and would stay again

Hotel is conveniently located by Union Square. Adjacent to CVS, Apple, Starbucks and Nike Stores. Friendly staff, clean and bright room. Our bright room overlooks Union Square and the south Bay. Public self parking across street at Sutter/Stockton garage. Free EV chargers available in basement.

This hotel is located in the center of everything, and if you treat yourself to a city view, it's fantastic. The rooms are very nice - well-decorated to look mid-century, but with a modern feel. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are always clean. The staff will treat you well, too. If you're looking for a great place in the city, this is it!

I've stayed in other hotels at lower rates that provided better in room amenities. Such as welcoming message with water bottles, an in room safe, snack basket, and better room presentation. This didn't have that. Plus the shared room doors have little insulation, so sound easily travels through. Staff was limited in greetings. Nothing special about this hotel.

fast checkin. great location. great views (we were facing Union Square). The rooms don:t have a lot of room for luggage, and the double beds are doubles, not queens, so small. The bar is nice, but pricey, as is valet parking. But you are right in San Francisco so we expected that. No in room coffee, you will have to venture downstairs for morning coffee.

The hotel location is perfect. On the Union square, next to Apple store. Walking distance to most restaurants, shopping areas and sight seeing. The room was comfortable though it wasnâ€™t as big as I used to have in USA. The problem was with the noise coming from outside early in the morning or in the middle of the night. It is a side effect of being in the middle of the city. Also the elevators were always full.

This is a Hyatt that has kept up with the style and function of upscale living. They staff is very friendly and will personally take care of your questions. Nice to see that they are first class still.

Staff at hotel is very courteous and professional. Check in and out were very quick. We encountered the doormen the most since we were in and out a lot and they were very nice. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, the room and bathroom were a good size, and there was a handy table and mirror outside of the bathroom to get ready at in case the bathroom was occupied. The a/c worked well - didn't have any problems adjusting it. There are mechanical shades that did a great job of keeping out the light (and you can adjust them from bed). Plenty of electrical outlets to charge the gadgets. This is the first time staying in a hotel in the city where I was not awakened by street noise. It could have been the location of the room (we didn't have much of a view) or the quality of their windows... not sure, but I've stayed in several other hotels in SF, and this is the very time I did not hear car noise, street sweepers, or people yelling. Location of hotel is walking distance to many things and it's easy to catch a Lyft or Uber out front since the hotel is right on the corner. They also seemed to have security out front at night.

On paper a 5 star hotel but travelling with a group of 7 almost everyone had experienced issues with the hotel over a two night stayNoise transfer between rooms , rattling windows , room lights not working and losing s booking for s guest for 1 night. Lots of positives, but at this price point should be better

Great location for bringing family on your business trip. They will find plenty of sites, shopping, China town and tours within a block. Union square is right outside with many activities including an ice rink during winter. The location is what makes it. The hotel lobby is bustling with people and the rooms what you would expect. The dining is ok but with all the great restaurants so close, no need to eat here unless you just don't want to go out.

We stayed in a great room with a view of the bay.The hotel was within walking distance of Chinatown, big bus tours and shopping! The hotel's bar had decent drinks, however the restaurant offered a great breakfast. Two small problems, no towel racks in the bathroom and only a pocket door closure in the bathroom that didn't always fully close.

We travel for work a lot and after a week of boutique hotels around California, we were glad to be on familiar territory- a business hotel. All your typical luxuries of a good bed, amenities and an efficient service from check in to check out. What we found to be lacking was a central switch to turn on the lights in the room. Each light had to be individually turned on. A bit of a pain at night. Otherwise you'll be sure to get your regular business comfort in this hotel.

Stayed here for 6 nights whilst attending a conference. Lovely hotel in a good location. Almost on union square, easy walk to shopping areas and only 10 mins to Moscone centre. Rooms were large, clean and the gym on the 35th floor provided great views as you worked out. Overall a great stay.

Great hotel and location which got spoilt by arrogant staff. Obviously poor management who are not aware of ground level performance. I would have given this a 100% rating if it werent for a few staff members.

great location, comfort, and quality hotel. The hotel is practically located at Union square which is close to the main scene. The rooms are holistically designed and positioned so that sleep quality is at its best.

Family of four stayed here for three nights during our CA vacation. Room was small with two double beds, but typical for San Fran hotels. Nice room and view was great even from lower floors. Convenient to Starbucks, public transportation, etc. Did not use the restaurants in the hotel, too pricey. Service very good. We requested QUIET floor and indeed got it. This was one of the only hotel stays in years I can say I did not hear floor noise and/or door opening and closing.

The location of the Hyatt Grand Regency is superb. I was walking distance to everything. The hotel staff is very accommodating and attentive. The food in the One Up restaurant is consistently good and the service is excellent day or night.

Our stay was for 2 days and without question, the service at the front desk, the interaction with concierge was welcoming, pleasant, and professional. Professional not in the sense that responses were robotic and routine, but with a personalization that made you feel welcome. Aside from the great interaction with staff, this hotel is well located in the heart of San Francisco, just a stones throw from Union Square and walking distance to hundreds of restaurants, China Town, and lots of shopping. From Powell street which was one street over, you can catch the street trolley to Fisherman's Warf which takes 15 minutes (you can buy tickets $7/person each way at Walgreens on Powell). Back to the room, it was current and had comfortable bedding and pillows. Overall, we couldn't of expected anything more from this hotel and would definitely recommend.

Very attentive staff, quiet rooms, comfortable beds. We stayed on one of the club floors. Club rooms include access to the Club Lounge for breakfast, appetizers in the late afternoon and desserts in the evening. We only used the lounge for breakfast because we were out of the hotel most of the day. The Lounge was on an upper floor with an amazing view of the city.

It's beside Apple which is location in the heart of San Francisco, between the shops and the big buses trips and the rooms is clean and big enough but the staff is not really helpful and you will find some difficultly to deal with them , they need to enhace their way and unify their respone since some of them replies totally different from his colleagues, the price is a bit high , the wifi there is amazing , the hotel is excellent

I recommended the hotel to my friends coming from Brazil. Everything went smooth, the had a great stay! Hotel is super well located, great service, super clean'. For the shopper crowed it is perfect, right next to good shops, Macy's, Newman Marcus, Saks, close to the Westfield Mall and Powell St. lots of good restaurants in the area, as well as art galleries, SF Moma, Contemporary Jewish Museum and Yerba Buena Art Center....

very convenient place to stay. near the tourists spots and a lot of restaurants around the place. When it comes to the room. We stayed in a deluxe room. It was pretty standard and basic. The service was nice. overall, it was a good place to stay for tourist who would like to go around places.

I'm thoroughly disappointed with the housekeeping attendant we have attending to room 1114 in the morning shift. Firstly she cannot comprehend English so simple requests like come back after a certain time lapse is disregarded. The last straw was after asking her to come back after an hour she proceeded to advice me that her shift finishes at 3 so it will be the late shift who will clean then deliberately implied for me to rush my departure so she can do the rm before her shift finishes. She even peered inside the room looking above my head to see the inside of the rm. I've never had such a rude, unprofessional, abrasive attendant. Begs the question as to why she was forcing a clean perhaps due to the tip quantity she wants to meet everyday. I told her I'll just call front desk to advise when I want the rm cleaned. She is also so miserable there is no courtesy, no pleasantries & has a sad energy about her. The hskp delivery person who gave us plates & cutlery we requested on Thursday oct 5 (evening) had knocked twice 5 seconds apart and left within 30 seconds so by the time we arose from bed to attend to the door he had vanished. Shortly after guest services request called to ask where we were & I explained he vanished abruptly. When the guy did come back I've never met a more apathetic older man who literally scorned when he gave the plates as if we had ruined his entire night by making him wait longer than his allocated 30 second wait. This is pathetic. Service like this is expected from a motel not a 4/5 star hotel that cost $360usd/night. What is with this missing must haves - why aren't majority of this automatically available in the room upon check in & replenished accordingly like all other hotels? This projects such a cheap approach to service provision. In addition in America where tips are necessary. means every request is matched by a tip so essentially you end up paying for the must haves again via tipping. Perhaps this notion has been overlooked in the implementation of this system. I'd suggest indicating on the card that tip is not necessary when requesting additional/multiple must haves. Overall a below satisfactory experience so far in grand Hyatt San Francisco. Only consolation Front desk - helpful & courteous. Hskp & room attendants are a disaster definitely not worth tipping. No service, no smile, no communication skills, not professional.

We really enjoyed our 3-night stay at the Grand Hyatt. The main advantage is the location which is perfect, just off Union Square. The room was good, nothing special but very comfortable.Important to know that it's very expensive. In addition to the price, there are 4 (!) different taxes added so it ends up more than we'd thought.Staff were very good.Breakfast was exorbitant so we just went to Starbucks across the street.

For the price I paid for this hotel during Oracle OpenWorld 2017, the Grand Hyatt San Francisco was not worth it. Might as well stay at Motel 6. Room was small with crappy Internet speed. Do yourself a favor. Find another hotel.

The Grand Hyatt in San Francisco is a modern, beautiful hotel with old fashion customer service that is so rare these days. From the moment you stop your car you are greeted from the staff outside, to the doorman , to check in. It is all that you expect from Hyatt and more. They make it look easy, which means they have worked extra hard. I highly recommend staying at the Hyatt when visiting San Francisco.

What a delight to sleep in a comfortable bed in a quiet room in a location next to Union square. They also have an excellent fitness center with a killer view. I didn't eat at their restaurant, but did attend a three day conference, which was well handled, efficiently and courteously. Even the elevators come quickly. You won't be disappointed here. It's not a romantic resort, but for business this hotel gets the job done.

Great hotel, very clean and service was the best with knowledgeable staff. Would highly recommend with a geat room, convenient to everything in the San Francisco area. Located in the safe part of town, convenient to parking.

Wonderful property with excellent location. Hotel was in great condition. Very well kept. Staff takes great pride. The only disappointment was the room. Decor is very dated. Based on the room price paid, expected much more.

We had a nice room with access to the grand club launch on the 32th floor. The room was very nice, generous space, wonderful beds, well serviced, good bathroom products.The grand club launch was great, nice breakfast, every day different hors d'oeuvres dishes, free soft drinks and inexpensive alcoholic drinks. Exceptionally nice and friendly staff everywhere (especially in the club launch). We had a wonderful stay (8 nights) and will definitively come back.

Stayed here for 2 nights (Fri and Sat) for a conference being held at the hotel. Hotel is in a great area, right next to the Apple Store Union Square. Good overnight parking in the Stockton Sutter Garage ($36 all day flat rate) right across the street. McDonalds and Starbucks within 100 feet of the hotel. Hotel is always really busy and there are always people in the lobby floor. Room was on the smaller side, but was clean, and bed was firm. Powered window shades that can be controlled from the bed was a nice touch. Bathroom had a very long sink. While it looks nice its not very functional (doesn't have a sink stop to collect water) and it makes the available counter space very limited. Free WiFi was faster than any that I've used at Hilton properties. Didn't try any food from the hotel restaurant because there are plenty of good restaurants around Union Square. Hotel also has a nice card that lists all the stuff you can get from the hotel that you fought to bring (like a razor, comb, cotton balls, etc.) which is a nice touch.Negatives is that I checked in at 10:00 pm Friday night and had to wait 30 minutes before I was checked in. There were a lot of foreign travelers that were each taking a long time to check-in despite there were 3 hotel employees working (although there are 5 available check-in locations). If I was the manager and saw such a long line of waiting line of obviously tired guests, I would have opened all 5 check-in computers and/or had a separate line for guests who already had confirmed reservations because it only takes a 1 minute to check in those guests (like myself). The AC in my room always seemed to be running when I set it to AUTO (it doesn't reach the desire temperature and then stop like it should). The noise didn't bother me but might be an issue for light sleepers.Overall, I would stay at this hotel again based on its location and comfortable, clean room.

the hotel the location and the service was excellent. The staff are very friendly. The room was so comfortable and neat. close to the picture in the website. I recommend city view it was amaizing. the map provided concierge was useful.

San Francisco was completely booked for a series of conventions during a time I needed to conduct business around Union Square in The City. I was fortunate to catch a room at the Grand Hyatt Union Square and had an amazing experience. From Gilizi and Steve at the front desk to Liz at the concierge desk, I felt like a VIP even though this was my first visit to this property. The room was very comfortable and quite. I upgraded to the Grand Club level to be able to use the Grand Club on the 32nd floor (staff and food offering was exceptional). I am in the retail industry and I greatly appreciate being made to feel like a welcomed visitor.

Helpful online check in, immediate text response to questions or requests . Good location, friendly staff and comfortable room. Hyatt member benefits were notable..... expedited check in, early and late check in/out, free in room internet and bottled water at check in.

We arrived late due to plane delays and still our check in was a breeze. Very friendly courteous young lady put us at ease right away even at midnight. The location of this hotel is key, it's located right next to Union Square, tons of shopping and restaurants. Check out Lori's Diner go early to avoid a wait or before bars empty out. I even tried out the hotels gym one early morning, saw the sunrise over the city. More equipment than your usual hotel so give it a try. What a view!Our room was clean and quiet. Although there were some revelers around 2AM getting off the elevator. They carried a loud conversation for close to 5 minutes until we yelled out our door to shut up and go to bed. That seemed to have done the trick! :) The long hallway that the elevators empty out is all tiled so sound carries. The hotel does have signs up about quiet timeframes and to be mindful and respectful. Although my guess is when you're drunk and coming back to your hotel at 2AM the last thing you do is be mindful and courteous. :)The wait on elevators took quite sometime but considering it's a large hotel in the city I guess that's to be expected. Several times we had to wait for another elevator as they were just too full. Very busy hotel so if you are looking for something more quaint or quiet this hotel may not be your first choice. I however had a nice stay as it was close to everything.

First off, the hotel amenities are great. But, while we stayed we had people yelling next door, a basketball team staying there, etc. The one thing is that the cleaners threw out personal items that where worth hundreds of dollars. No accountability, no help from staff. They said they will look into it, but nothing. Nothing stolen just thrown out. A dental appliance is not garbage.

Stayed in a King Club Room that offered breakfast, all day coffee/latte's, and evening snacks. The room was a nice size and the bed was super comfortable but we felt that it could have been cleaner for the price of $550 CDN per night. It was in the heart of Union Square and within walking distance to just about everything we wanted to see. Great shopping, restaurants, and sight seeing. I would recommend eating at The Session in Presidio. Amazing food and on the way to the Golden Gate Bridge.

Beautiful suite on the large bedroomfloor of the Grand Hyatt San /pantry Francisco. Large open floor plan with 2 seperate keyed entrances, , half guest bathroom and huge marble master bathroom with an enormous shower.

This Hotel is a Jewel > > i want to keep it to myself. Pleasant & Helpful staff / Location to Union Square & downtown and up to Nob/Russian Hill . Good restaurants all around . A Lovely Hotel !! Will stay here more often !

This hotel comes at a premium in a premium location w average service and indifferent service. Perhaps we expected too much, but they only met the lowest of expectations. Seriously eat breakfast elsewhere. Bland food and high prices w indifferent service....

Clean, comfortable room with efficient check-in and check-out. Friendly, courteous staff. Fitness room felt a bit cramped but had sufficient number of cardio and resistance machines as well as free weights. Excellent location near Union Square. Overall, enjoyed the stay.

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco Hotel staff was very attentive, the hotel was in great condition and all leisure needs and shopping are convenient in the Union Square area of San Francisco. I would stay again when visit the city.

Stayed in 2015 and repeat stay in 2017 because I like the great location and the room is of good size. At USD325 plus taxes a night, it ainâ€™t exactly cheap but it is lacking of essential toiletries. To be fair it could be the case of hotels in US. Maybe I have been to pampered with hotels in Singapore, toothbrush and toothpaste, comb, shower cap, bottled water are basic items. These are non existence. Be the disrupters by providing these items to differentiate yourself.

Stayed 2 nights in room 319. If you put the temperature to where it's just right, plan to be scalded and alternately lukewarm. If you put the temperature a bit less hot than you want, you won't be scalded, but you will have parts of your shower being cold. Don't know if it's just this room or the whole hotel. Anyway, beware.

This hotel was simply beautiful inside. The art work was very inspirational. Everyone was very nice. Our room included the lounge which was a nice touch to our trip everyday we were able to eat breakfast hors dâ€™oeuvers and desserts and it was a full breakfast and the hors dâ€™ oeuvres were like a full dinner and the desserts were very tasteful it was a nice surprise and well worth-staying in the room that provides this I would highly recommend this room. The only downside was the room was a little small but not bad for a couple. The view was amazing especially at night with all the lights of the city. Very reasonable price for all the amenities that we had. In the lobby there is beautiful artwork and 2 beautiful fireplaces. They also have a variety of restaurants and a bar. It is also kid friendly if you bring your children along. It is close to shopping and all the tour spots around San Francisco. Would highly recommend staying at this location.

So glad we decided to stay here for location & views. We stayed Club level and really enjoyed the access to lounge. Great variety of food and nice service. Travel a lot and appreciate convenience to get coffee and breakfast first thing without having to decide where to go. Nice to have this option for evening also.We used the hotel self park across street. Convenient with in/out privileges.Glad you could crack door a bit for fresh air.We brought our own fan/white noise since comments about noise. It was a bit noisier than other places stayed. Guess it depends on who's next door to you.

Centrally located to attractions and shopping. Room interiors tired but excellent customer service more than compensates. Nothing is a problem or bother for the staff we came into contact with from the doormen to check in desk to housekeeping.Designated smoking area just outside the front entrance - a touch I think is very thoughtful and considerate of smokers.Would recommend.

Hotel is centrally located to everything in San Francisco. Facilities and room were clean and modern. My room offered a fantastic view of the city. The hotel offers a smaller footprint, and even though I was there for a meeting, the meeting rooms were in the basement, so you didn't feel like you were at a large meeting hotel.

Fantastic hotel. Caring staff. Great business stay hotel, convenient location. F&B is worth enjoying. You don't need to leave the hotel, but if you happened to want to do so, there are an unlimited number of restaurants, a CVS, a Walgreens, a Starbucks, and an Apple Store immediately outside the hotel.

The staff is very professional yet personable. They all smile and say hello and ask if you need anything. The hotel is maintained excellently. Everything flows from the time you walk through the front door until you check out. They always remember you and make you feel welcome and important.

We were in San Fran for vacation and this hotel just made our visit easier. Check in was a breeze, the room was clean with a comfortable bed and a fridge.We never had to call down because something wasn't right, they give free water, and when we wanted to park our rental in front of the hotel for a bit, it was no problem. They just asked us to leave the keys and they would move it if necessary.The location is fantastic, the staff were friendly, professional and helpful and our stay was worth every penny.If you go here, be sure to go up the 36th floor. It's an amazing view.

Good hotel. Excellent location. Staff polite. The room is not comfortable for 4 (myself, my wife and two kids), a bit small. The shower is horrible! Overall, it is a good hotel but for sure is overpriced for what it delivers.

it is a very trendy and yet friendly hotel, located right at the center of San Francisco downtown. You can experience the happiness atmosphere of SF around this hotel.Nice faculty, impeccable house keeping, excellent club lounge as wellThe only minor thing is the toilet flash hook is loose, I need to open the cover and put it back from time to timeI have a three day stay this time, really hope to stay longer with such a good team and propertyCongratulation to this hotel! I think I just find a second home here at this Grand Hyatt San FranciscoWill I be back again? Sure, we have a great time and will be here over and over again!

We stayed here for 2 nights without any issues or hiccups. On our first day we discovered that one of the blinds was slightly torn and the bathroom door was stuck towards the end of its rail and difficult to close but this was attended to almost immediately as soon as we notified the front desk so no complaints there! Access to Union Square and Powell street BART is very easy, also a Trader Joe's a 10 minute walk away for any groceries that was recommended by the concierge. Staff are friendly and attentive. If you are after tours of San Francisco, ask the concierge as they are knowledgable and have good discounts. Rooms expensive but worth the price as they are luxurious but not over the top with a fridge and big comfortable beds. Would definitely stay at the Grand Hyatt again!

Very impressed with everything in the hotel from check-in, during the stay, until check-out. Room was comfortable and ambience was great for a quality rest after a long day of outing. The interconnecting rooms worked very well for travelers with family. Location of hotel was good with many eatery joins and shopping malls around. Safe environment for family vacation.

I have stayed at this property a few times. I was remembered nor was my loyalty to Hyatt referenced. My intention for this stay was a "get away" weekend with my husband. I was hoping for a first-class experience and didn't receive that. The check-in process was slow and not overly friendly. Employees in and around the lobby made no point to engage or say hi. The bellmen and door attendants were talking more to each other than guests. The gentlemen in the lounge was lovely and super accommodating. Although he never used my name nor conversational engaged with me, he was friendly and kind. I was extremely unhappy with my room. You can hear everything in the room next door. We had to call the front desk and complain about the noise. The guests in the room next to us never stopped having a party. We heard them until 2 am. It was the least restful night I have ever experienced. All-in-all, this wasn't the weekend experience we hoped. I am just disappointed by the customer service and response to our noise complaint. We had other options but hoped staying with a brand we are loyal would enhance this weekend retreat.

Excelent hotel in Union Square. Excelent localization ( close to market street, malls, cable car, restaurants, bart) . Very good service room, check in/out and concierge. The room is big, beautiful and very confortable. I really appreciated it and strongly recommend.

Spent a week in S.F. And really enjoyed the location of the Grand Hyatt. It's 1 block from the actual Union Square, close to great shopping and great restaurants. Even liked the convenience of the CVS across the street. All the tourist spots are a short Uber/Lyft ride. The is a great base hotel to enjoy San Francisco.

This hotel is perfectly situated for the business traveler or for vacation. It's close to BART and the cable car line. Right in Union Square for shopping. Hotel is very clean and recently updated rooms. The lobby and lounge areas are open and modern. Food and beverage at the lounge are very good. Note if you are driving and need parking,use the off site option-it's $39/night vs $60 for valet and is literally across the street!

Located by Union Square, easy walking to restaurants and shops, and great hotel amenities made this a perfect downtown hotel for us. Top notch casual restaurant, wine bar, coffee bar, and plenty of cool seating around the lobby with WiFi. Short cab ride (or short uphill hike) to Top of the Mark at the Mark Hopkins hotel for the best Sunday brunch and 360 degree views of the bay and city...but instead of the tiny bathrooms and musty old world charm of the Hopkins, this Hyatt has bright energy, spacious bathrooms to accommodate a couple getting ready together, and a womanâ€™s favorite little touches like a makeup mirror and plenty of storage drawers etc.

Great hotel in a perfect location 100 yards from Union square, we upgraded to the grand club at a cost of $75 a night for the two of us and it was worth every penny. The room was perfect on the 31st floor with stunning views of the city. The Grand Club on the 32nd floor is brilliant. Excellent selection of breakfast foods hot and cold plus a great selection of evening food again hot and cold eaten with the best view of the city from two different angles. There is a Honour bar in place at $3 for a wine or beer $4 for a spirit, and thats for a full glass of wine. Trust me at well over $10 a small drink in the town this is well worth the little extra.A special mention must go to Dave and Jimmie who work the grand club in the evening, the perfect hosts.

I am a big fan of Grand Hyatt in San Francisco, very good locations, nice rooms, cordially staff and the best Breakfast in town. Their policy to accept Pets is also a key differentiator for our family

The stay though brief was a perfect getaway to see family and friends. Hyatt was clean friendly and enhance the whole experience. Staff friendly, the property in a perfect location was clean and room was spaceous and had a great view. Breakfast in the lounge was perfect with a good choice of food, clean are and great views.

We stayed in Grand Hyatt SF for the Labor Day weekend. Even though it was quite busy the wait to check-in was relatively quick. I was disappointed that I never got an email update to tell me my room was ready even though I checked in online. Valet was quick and as others have said tell them you want to self-park it requesting a voucher. Well worth the savings. Plenty of restaurants nearby. Loved Tacorea which is just a five minute walk from the hotel. Also some other fusion restaurants nearby. You can easily catch the trolley from the hotel to Fisherman's Wharf. I upgraded our room to a junior suite. If it's in your budget I found it well worth it as it comes with a connected living room with work desk. Bed was comfortable. Housekeeping was awesome in keeping the rooms spotless and replenishing our bathroom supplies since we were here for several days. The phones have a built in usb port to charge your devices which is very convenient. We didn't have a bathtub but the pressure from the shower was awesome.We had a slight incident with the parking garage which was not fault of this hotel. The hotel manager instantly called the garage and had them give me a call. It looks like it was just a misunderstanding but really appreciate Hyatt's service and management trying to solve issues. We used the concierge a few times. They were friendly, efficient, and got us to where we needed to go. I would have given this hotel a 5 star but since space is limited I didn't find them to have much dining options I would expect from a hotel this size (have bar & restaurant but small). Our room was located next to the service room with elevator so could hear it when it zooms by. It didn't bother us much except to wonder where this sound was coming from. Also I would suggest they consider taking the top floor and renovating it to a bar/restaurant. Hint: Go to the top floor if not being used as you can get views of the SF Harbor. Unfortunately we didn't realize this until the last day when it was cloudy. Will definitely stay at Grand Hyatt SF again due to location and its awesome service levels.

The hotel is easy to find and the service on reception was very good and welcoming. We were offered free bottled water when we checked in, and were able to check in early. The room was massive compared to European hotels I'm used to. The bed was enormous and extremely comfortable. The TV worked very well and the little fridge was handy for keeping bottles cool. I couldn't figure out how to operate the safe in the room.The bathroom felt quite fancy and the shower worked well. Toiletries were provided and replenished every day. Everything was kept very clean. my only minor criticism was that the maid started running the hoover round (either outside our door or in the room next door - I wasn't sure) at around 8.30am some mornings. This seemed a bit early to me as it was loud enough to wake me up. But I guess with a 36 storey building they've got a lot of rooms to get through.Reception were helpful with any queries I had and we ate in the restaurant on the mezzanine level twice. The service in the restaurant was excellent and the food extremely tasty. One night we arrived quite late (about 9.45pm and the restaurant is only supposed to be open until 10pm) but we were warmly welcomed and did not feel at all rushed. The prices were a little bit on the high side, but the quality was very good so it was worth it. The menu isn't massive but there were two vegetarian options which was good. Overall - recommend eating here.

I really appreciated the 'home away from home' feeling with the generous service of providing additional items free of charge if you forgot something (example - deodorant, hairspray) and or borrowing larger items for the duration of your stay. (example - hair straightener, kettle) Having travelled from Australia on a long flight it was wonderful to be checked in 6 hours early. Perfect location for San Francisco - close to walk to everything. Would recommend - loved staying here!

I had a suite and an experience that was almost great. Great view, terrific living room and dining area, two bathroom, small kitchen area. Check-in and valet service was excellent. So why wasn't it great? After all, San Francisco is expensive and there are far worse! True. But I don't think Grand Hyatt is going to respond to this and say that my expectations were unreasonably high. I'm not trying to convince anyone they should stay here. The San Francisco market is tough and perhaps they don't need to make more of an effort to do very well. Money comes in, keep costs under control? That's business I suppose, but doesn't make a 5* hotel experience. A few notes. Some may help you decide on the place. Others may help the Grand Hyatt should try want to go the extra mile. 1. You expect a certain noise level in the city, but I definitely heard both city noise outside and elevator whirrs inside, even though we were on the 32nd floor. There were earplugs in the bathroom, so I think they know people often react this way. They can't do anything about this, obviously, and I'm sure most places in S.F. would be the same. Other than maybe the Lowes? I haven't tried the Ritz or the Four Seasons in S.F. 2. The kitchen had two small refrigerators, a microwave, and a Nespresso machine. That's it. No cutlery. No mugs or proper expresso cups or glasses or wine glasses. No plates. Only paper travel coffee cups that didn't even fit under the nozzle of the Nespresso machine. That's pretty sad and is easily fixed. For the price and given the space, I don't think this is an unreasonable expectation. It wasn't worth my complaining -- minor annoyance given my needs, but strikingly different from other experiences I've had at this level. 3. Yes, there were two bathrooms, but they were uninspiring. Standard 4* chain hotel bathrooms with shower stalls, and not large. Lacking the same range of amenities that frankly I enjoyed at the Marriott Marquis (yes, really!) the night before, which I found very surprising. Yes, they are stuck with the space as designed, but I'm pretty sure the Grand Hyatt wants to be seen as one of the best with respect to the smaller details. The Grand Hyatt in Seoul? Wow. San Fran? Ok, fine, very nice. Not 5*. 4. The double-door between the bedroom and living/dining room was locked on both sides when we arrived. It took a few minutes to figure out there were multiple entry doors to the suite, and then to figure out how to unlock the doors. They didn't make me feel like they were ready for me (at 5 PM?) and had prepped the room. Fine for a 4* experience if that is their aspiration. They could do better with what they have with very little extra effort.

I have stayed in a lot of hotels and yet the entire experience of this one was next level. Service went about and beyond. I can not recommend this place highly enough and will be making it my first choice if I return to San Fran. I did upgrade to a view of union square for $10. Was well worth it

Great location. Clean and quiet. Fast elevators. Staff pleasant. Good club room for breakfast, recommended. Only drawback, expensive; however, San Francisco hotels generally fall into that catagory. Would stay again if I have the means.

It was pretty much like you can expect on a Grand Hyatt. Nice and clean quiet rooms and friendly staff. The location close the Union Square with all shopping etc was really good. They also have a nice bar and restaurant on the first floor which is definitely worth a visit.

We went to San Francisco for my birthday We stay in Grant Hyatt hotel I rate 5 plus ,excellent service My special reward to David conciergeHe assisted me and my husband in all the tour around cityHotel location excellent Staff services excellent We really recommended this hotel We love San Francisco

great choice if you have a good deal. modern, clean, excellent serviced hotel in great location, 5 minutes walk from union square.expect a $10 charge if you order something online with the delivery to your room: a parcel will be stored at the bell boy's facilities, and the hotel will charge you for receiving/storage.you won't get loyalty points if you book thru booking.com or other similar platforms.

I recently spent two nights on a business trip in this very quiet and well appointed hotel. It was clean and updated - even had a light-up magnifying mirror :) Very business-woman friendly. The bed was super comfortable and the room temp was easy to adjust - making for a perfect night's sleep. The staff is exceptional - from the folks at the curb, check in and the restaurant. Great experience.

This Hyatt offers wonderful service from the curb valet service, front desk staff and in room services. Conveniently located to shopping, lots of restaurants & the Cable Car! Lobby offers a Starbucks and the Level 3 bar is very nice.

The Grand Hyatt off Union Square is a beautifully designed architectural space and the service is splendid. In my case, I encountered problems with the advertised Chromecast connection of YouTube to the TV despite quick help from an engineer. Otherwise all was splendid, including the 35th floor fitness center with the panoramic views that is so popular that you have to queue for elliptical machines at 6:30 am.

Used the grand Hyatt as our base hotel for our San Francisco wedding. Had the premiere suite for the girls to get ready the day of the wedding. Had the VIP Suite for the guys to get ready. Was PERFECT. The Hyatt took care of every request.. from steamers for the dresses to extra mirrors and extension cords. Friends had the chef prepare snacks and cheese trays for the rooms. The chef even came up to say hello. The Hyatt supplied our own go to person who did an excellent job. The rooms were clean and updated and ALL the staff were friendly and caring. I would recommend the Grand Hyatt in a heartbeat!

The upgrade is well worth it. Breakfast was tasty. Dinner was so good with rotating menues. One night was Indian, the next night was thai, and our last night was fried chicken, mac & cheese and cole slaw. The desserts were fabulous. Add in the honor bar and the best club staff and it really seals the deal.

We spent two great nights here at the Grand Hyatt. The staff really could not do enough. to help us. Check in was a breeze, the room spotlessly clean and the house keeping staff very pleasant and courteous.The beds were very comfortable and the air con easily adjustable to suit my needs.

We stayed for 10 days as we were staying put in SF for a holiday (from AU). We had a king suite with city views on the 26th floor.
