We were really happy with the good size of the room (especially for SF), the great view and the bed was very comfortable. The fit out was what you would expect from this type of hotel (pleasant, contemporary, clean), although I must say some parts of the room looked a little worn however this was not overly noticeable. The daily clean of the room was also done efficiently and earlier in the day. The location of this hotel is excellent, you are in the centre of it all and can uber easily and cheaply anywhere around the city. We were only unhappy with a few things in the beginning. When we arrived I noticed there was no mini bar, no kettle, no toiletries you would expect like shower cap, no robes etc... I did not expect this. Not great after travelling 17 hours. I then discovered a list (called the 'missing items from your room') on the bench that required you to request basic things that would be provided at any other hotel of this nature. We have stayed in hotels around the world and I've never come across this before. I was very annoyed so we rang up and requested the things we would need for the length of our stay and they brought them up with no trouble...so in the end it was ok. Still, I don't understand this and I think it's a bad move. It's been a while since I was in the US but I doubt this is common place. The other thing was the quality of the daily breakfasts...they were ok. The variety was generally good but the quality of the food needs to be improved substaintialy (particularly for the price). I've stayed in quite a few Hyatts over time and the breakfasts have been better than this one. That being said, I would stay again for all of the positives I mentioned. All of the staff were lovely and friendly. Just wanted to warn you about the list of missing items so you know!

We had a great time staying at this hotel. It's in a great location with a lot of shopping and everything you could want within walking distance. There were a couple hiccups, but they were quickly rectified by the staff, which is why I'm still giving 5 stars. The staff were amazing at making our stay incredible. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it.

Very well-located hotel. Close to Union Square and to Chinatown. Modern, clean hotel with helpful staff. Very expensive breakfast. Go to Starbucks across the street. Quiet, well-appointed room, but could use better lighting.

This is a beautiful property right in the heart of the city. The view from your room are excellent as is the service of their staff. The club is attractive and comfortable with a host of beverages including alcohol you can purchase in their honor bar. Beyond the hotel, you are literally just steps away from world class shopping, restaurants and theater.

This hotel is well kept, has wonderful staff, and is located adjacent to Union Square. So easy to get to with so many tourist attactions, shops, and wonderful restaurants nearby. You can just park your car and walk or take a cab.

This was our main hotel for my daughter's wedding. Alyssa Keast and Karoline Huber were my personal contacts for needs and did an incredible job. The rooms were amazing and all our wedding guests were taken great care of. We had a bridal suite for the girls to get ready in..the hotel brought in steamers, mirrors, extra extension cords, ...everything that bridesmaids would need to get ready. Also, friends had the hotel bring in food for the bridesmaids...wonderfully served and presented! The hotel through Alyssa was very attentive to all of our needs. When the rehearsal could not be at the venue (fort mason general's residence), Alyssa quickly booked a Bayview Conference Room on the top floor that proved to be an awesome place for the rehearsal. The hotel delivered all the guest bags to guest rooms promptly and took care of any detail we needed. The housekeeping staff was friendly and also seemed to really care that we were all satisfied. The hotel itself was conveniently located to many areas of town that our guests could walk to. I can highly recommend the Grand Hyatt for any big group gathering, especially wedding parties and the bride and groom!

we stayed for 5 nights the hotel was clean and comfortable. All requests were handled efficiently. It was central to restaurants and bars near union square and not too far from fishermans wharf. We were on the fifth floor which was quiet, no problems

Hotel is centrally located. Rooms are a little tired and buffet breakfast ordinary. Although, staff are friendly & welcoming. Complimentary bottles of water & fresh fruit daily is a nice touch. I would consider staying at this hotel again.

Hotel has a beautiful location, rooms and views. proximity and access makes this one of my favorites in San Francisco. i would recommend getting to the 32nd floor for the view of the city which is amazing.

Had to stay at the place twice in the past year. Nothing special - typical Hyatt mid-level business hotel with bland dÃ©cor. Rooms close to the elevators can be noisy. Nearby streets typical for downtown SF - a fair few homeless people with a definite urine odor. Good internet service.

Stayed overnight in SF on the way to an Airbnb in Mill Valley. We stayed in an executive room which gave us access to hors d'oeuvres and breakfast in their "club". Our kids stayed in another room. Both rooms were beautiful, clean and spacious. Bathroom was great. The staff was welcoming and helpful. Breakfast and evening snacks were delicious and there was a great variety offered. Staff there was friendly and helpful. Hotel was in a great location and we walked everywhere. Valet parking courteous and efficient. No negatives here- would stay here again anytime.

We stayed at this hotel for five way too short days this summer. Our travel agent got us connecting rooms and we really enjoyed the wonderful rooms, And best part of all is the central location to downtown San Francisco. We could easily walk around the area to many restaurants, coffee shops (Starbucks right across from the entrance) Apple Store on the same block, and so much shopping too! No need to take a taxi to eat or drink. The rooms are big, comfortable, ours had automatic window coverings and big bathrooms. Will stay here again for sure

We had the most wonderful stay at the Grand Hyatt. The rooms were incredibly comfortable and the views over the city are breathtaking.But it's really the personal service that blew me away. On our first night we were gifted a complementary breakfast in celebration of a special occasion. This was so special and a real treat.During our visit I also received the most excellent service from Ira and she made our stay extra special through a very kind gesture.These people care about their guests. You do really feel that you take first priority and that your custom is valued. I cannot recommend staying here enough!

The Hyatt on Union Square is the very best location in San Francisco. This hotel has been remodeled and is very comfortable. The staff (from the fellow at the front door that minded my bag, to check-in and check-out (at 5 am) and particular the waiter in the restaurant who helped my customize my menu selectins) are attentive and well trained. Every aspect of the stay was enjoyable.

Being a Hyatt member, I received an offer of an upgrade at 50% the normal daily rate to a room with access to the Executive lounge, which offered daily continental breakfast starting 5:30am in the mornings with horderves between 5:30pm and 7:00pm, which I consider extremely good value.

Perfect stay in the best hotel in San Francisco. I would recommended this hotel to my family, friends and colleagues. I will definitely stay here again next time, but for a longer time, because San Francisco is a wonderful city.

Big room for a major US city. Bed comfortable, furniture slightly quirky with a 70s vibe (in a good way) but room a little cold. Although I cranked the heating up high (80 degrees) the room didn't appreciably warm for my entire 3 day stay.Had flown in from the UK so was too tired to eat in the restaurant or go out so decided to order from room service but was astounded to find room service menu offered NOTHING gluten free. I even rang down to check, and frankly they couldn't really have cared less. I have never stayed in an international chain hotel (much less a Californian one!) that had no GF options! I've been a coeliac for 19 years and this is a throw-back to the US of old (15 years ago I really struggled to find anything GF in the states). During this trip I also stayed in Georgia and Indiana and encountered no such problems in Hotels there.

Our stay at the Grand Hyatt was very enjoyable. Clean, comfortable beds, convenient to everything. They had a nice restaurant in the hotel that had great drinks and food. I would recommend this hotel. The only down side was no balcony.

in the heart of the financial district in walking distance from many of the city's main attractions. but also not completely tidy, mediocre service and overpriced. SF is obviously a very expensive place, but there are certainly much better deals than this.

There are lots of hotels to choose from on and off Union Square -- this one is very hard to beat in terms of value. The rooms are excellent and plush, the staff is supremely attentive, and the place is quiet and tranquil.

I had a nice experience staying here. Room was clean and I had a great view of the city. Food in the lounge was good and the service was great. Enjoyed some tapas and some wine while I did some work. Front desk folks were very helpful.

We had a room with bay view on the 27 th floor: amazing view on the SF skyline and Alcatraz.The room was very clean with nice bathroom, but the room was not sufficiently illuminated.Room quite expensive.The bar of the hotel is not well situated (1 st floor) and not worth a 4 star hotel.

There is a parking garage next door with a 39.00 daily fee With in and out privileges. They partner with hotel. Safe and professional. Hotel is a block from trolley that will take you to fishermens wharf and union square is the best place to be.

We recently stayed at the hotel for 6 nites with our teens. Hotel is located right opposite union square. One block away from Powell-Hyde cable car route and a couple of blocks from market street where there are more transit choices. Hotel was very clean - only disappointing aspect was the ripped bed sheets. Concierges were very helpful and knowledgeable with directions and tourist activities. Great fitness room on the 36th floor. There is a tiny breakfast bar that's not included with your hotel cost but there's a Starbucks directly opposite the hotel. We would definitely stay at the grand Hyatt again!

This was a great location for our short SF getaway. It was a short walk to Chinatown, to the cable cars and to shopping. The room was fine. For some reason housekeeping was petty all 3 days. We had 3 in the room and they would leave 3 bath towels but only 2 of everything else.

Stayed one night, great location, nice quiet room, provided the air conditioning is turned off, the view from the room wasn't all that exciting but I was only on the 3rd floor, guest parking is located across the street but there's no validation but definitely cheaper options than other places nearby

good to great location. room was small for the price but probably inline for being a block to Union Square. Buffet breakfast, which was included with our package, was at least 6/10 and they didn't charge us extra for our 10 year old.

We stayed two nights here at the end of our honeymoon. We got the upgraded bay view and it was worth it. Beautiful view of both the city, the water, and almost Alcatraz. Room was very clean, very modern, and had everything we needed. Staff was friendly and there are some great places to go within just a few blocks. It's a little pricey, but I think that's the theme of San Francisco, so I'd recommend staying here if only for the views and location.

The Grand Hyatt at Union Square is similar to most hotels of its ilk..good service, clean if uninspiring rooms, excellent bar. Its big plus is its location; Union Sqaure, Market Street, restaurants , Cable cars, etc.

We truly enjoyed our stay here. The entire staff was gracious and helpful. The suite we were in was well appointed. The grand club is great with wonderful views and the staff there were extraordinary. We were surprised that a hotel this size does not have a swimming pool. All in all, we had a great stay, and we would certainly return.

stayed here August 2017 prior to flight from SFO. Clean, modern hotel. Spacious rooms, with free wifi, aircon, coffee maker, and blackout blinds etc. Good quality bathroom and shower. Had breakfast included. Good selection of hot items, cereals, fruits, pastries etc. Ideal for SFO, 10 minutes by complementary shuttle every 15 minutes or so. Would definitely stay again.

The staff was very courteous when we needed information. Close to Union Square and the Piers. Very clean, and walking not bad at all. Restaurants all around, I found people just getting their business done, no problems at all. We enjoyed every bit of it, as well as the tours and the responsible parties. They gave us information we didn't know of San Francisco. Loved it. Thank You.

I booked this hotel as the room was significantly larger than other hotels in SF. I was not disappointed. There was a king size bed with lots of room on either side, a long bench to either place things on or to sit at. There also was a small bench and chair with a mirror just outside the bathroom. The sensor lights next to the bed side cabinets would light up the floor as soon you you got out of bed - really good idea.The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, especially the concierge with all their suggestions, especially the market at the ferry terminal on Saturdays.The hotel location is close to china town and in a good position in Union Square. It is not as frantic as Powell Street, but still busy.

Paid the extra for a Bay view and was not disappointed! 28th floor, awesome view. Be sure to check out the 36th floor observation area. Staff was brilliant. Great location - walk or ride, bus stops and trolley nearby. Recommend visiting the local tourist information location nearby. Great staff and lots of info. Gave us time saving tips on getting around. (Go for the buses! Trolley was always packed and took forever to get to destination.)

Wonderful hotel! The room was beautiful with a great view! Staff was friendly and very knowledgeable. I would highly recommend this Hotel to anyone. You don't feel like you're a guest, they make you feel like you're at home.

Located where Union Square segues into Chinatown, it was extremely convenient; very close to any kind of transportation. The rooms were clean, comfortable, quiet, & fairly large by SF standards; the beds were exceptionally welcoming. I did find the frosted glass sliding bathroom door to be less than ideal for privacy and noise containment (flushing sounded quite loud in the room). The staff was all very pleasant, courteous and helpful. Valet parking was $68/day, but well worth it, as driving is chaotic around there. We stayed on the 5th floor fairly close to the elevator lobby, but as already mentioned, it was very quiet. The (free) Dasani water dispenser next to the ice machine was a very nice touch & surprise, most hotels charge $2 for a small bottle of water. The elevators are very fast. I think most people would enjoy staying there, we certainly did.

Good sized clean rooms in great location . Breakfast only included 2 and there were 3 of us and was an additional 32 dollars for the buffet. Although other choices on the menu which were cheaper by the time you added a drink you were nearly up to the same amount as the buffet. Appeared cheaper to order room service for our teenager ( her choice ) and when her pancakes arrived there was an additional 5 dollar delivery charge and taxes on top - again , not much difference than the cost of the buffet breakfast . There is a Starbucks right opposite the hotel which we and a lot of other people were visiting as was much cheaper . Other than that all good , concierge good , especially the very helpful gentleman named John . Also breakfast staff friendly especially Tho who was so helpful . Not much equipment in the gym but all were recent models and a great view over San Francisco and was very clean .

We needed one night in SF prior to our flight home to Sydney the next evening. Hyatt gave us extended check out time, looked after our baggage after checkout, staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel is clean and modern and located in good position in Union Square, a nice 10 min walk to BART station.

From check-in to check-out, it truly seemed their goal is to keep their guests satisfied. From Betsy who checked us in, to bellhops who were always ready to help, and house cleaning staff who were there in a jiffy for every request, they made our 4 night stay a great one. Tip - try to get a room on a high floor with a view of the cityscape.

I you go to San Francisco..... u gota stay here ! Gray hotel, perfect location , close to everything, great staff, beautiful room great view, close to China town, 39th street piers, and the Cliff house......we will be back

Outstanding, over the top, BEST hotel stay ever! Wonderful location. You can walk to Union Square, shopping, great food and BART/other public transportation is nearby. Best hotel staff I have ever encountered. Clean, perfect rooms. We can't wait to go back again!

Excellent hotel and great location. Checking in late at night was seamless. The room had a great view, clean, comfortable bed, awesome shower with the best toiletries. The lobby was welcoming and we were always greeted with kindness.

First visit since the property was remodeled. Very pleased with the vibe, the aesthetics, the fit/finish of the rooms. HighlightsLocation, quality of room, Grand Club food and beverage options, speed of elevators, amenities in the room, views from the GymThings To ImproveGym is too small, bed needs a mattress cover, surrounding streets are kind of noisy, reception is a little chaotic, cover charge for drinks in the Grand Club is a nuisance and a detractorOverall I am a fan and will return

Loved this hotel. Room was perfect. Electric blind was a nice touch. Staff could not do enough for you. Just off of Union Square and Chinatown. Great location. Cable Cars run a few minutes from here.I could not recommend this hotel more. Made our stay in SF that much better.

Really enjoyed our stay at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco. Had not been to San Francisco is some time and really Luke's how the hotel common areas and the rooms were redone. The vessel sinks are nice but not always very practical. Also miss the bath robes. But the staff could not have been nicer or more welcoming. We will come back.

Easy to find, very convenient location. Parking is typical San Francisco, $67 a day for on-site valet, $39 a day for covered valet right across the street. 24-hour CVS directly across. Reasonably Quiet at night with blackout powered blinds. Excellent shower and generous sink. Very nice beds and pillows. Easy and efficient temperature control. Nice TV. Fast room service. Fast free Wifi. Limited menu, but all good. Small but important, for a huge hotel, the wait for an elevator is minimal, because they have six cars. Very fine gym open 24-7. Staff is well-trained. If you want trendy boutique hotel or Michelin restaurant in-house this isn't your spot. But it's a fine, hassle free place to stay, in the middle of Union Square at a reasonable price.

I've stayed at Hyatt hotels all around the world and at several Grand Hyatt's. I'm a member of thier World if Hyatt frequent guest program and do think the chain is a good value, but this hotel was a huge disappointment and not a good value for the money. Granted its in the middle of the city so I understand the high room rate, but to me that is just another reason the hotel should live up to its "Grand" reputation. Issues:1.) Hyatt sent an upgrade offer that linked to nothing and nobody could verify which I would have purchased.2.) Room was microscopic.3.) Wireless was slower than dial-up. Gave up after an hour of trying. 4.) Shower pressure like a water fountain. Too low to activate massage. 5.) Room very worn down. Expected better. Not up to Hyatt standards.

This hotel is beautiful and modern from the time you enter. Everyone is helpful. The gorgeous living room inspired lobby with classy full length wall art caught my eye. The rooms are modern and well spaced. The bar in the hotel is worth going to.Whats best is the location, you're right in the heart of union square. Turn right and its chinatown. So really you can't go wrong here. Loved our stay here.

The Grand Hyatt is located close to Union Square and close to many attractions like Chinatown. Our room was fairly large with 2 queen beds with very comfortable mattresses. Staff was very friendly and helpful. They seemed dedicated to our having a great time in the city. They were a wealth of information. Best to access the hotel from the Montgomery Street station. Complimentary breakfast.

VIP appartment was very spacious and comfortable, with a nice view of the city from the 34th floor. It was a nice stay for our family of 5 for 5 days during our holidays. The only disadvantage is the lack of a private parking at the hotel, but there is a paid valet parking on the other side of the street.

We spent many evenings searching Hotels in the Union Square area of SF. We decided on this one. The location is perfect One block from Union Square and all the super expensive shopping in the area if your into that kind of thing. Its a block away from the Dragons Gate, the entrance to China Town which can be great. Starbucks across the street if needed and tons of local food walking distance. The area was clean and we walked back to the room very late at night and didn't feel at risk. We even walked back from a Giants game and it only took 20 minutes and the streets were full of people so felt even better. The hotel has underground valet parking across the street. We paid for the parking and that made things much easier and cheaper. The lobby was super clean and the staff was superb. Get to the room and had an amazing city view and a very clean room. The room was smaller than what I am used to. There were 2 Queen beds but no couch or love seat. Just one desk chair. In the morning there was a small coffee and snack shop in the lobby that was nice. Overall, great location, easy to walk in and out of, Great staff, and clean rooms. Would go back.

This hotel is perfectly located in the heart of downtown San Francisco, near Union Square. The area is surrounded by great selection of restaurants and shopping. The hotel staff is generally friendly and attentive. The only draw back is the hotels in house restaurant is average at best. One note for ladies - the rooms lighting at night and in the bathrooms is awful for make-up application and the dryer is not suitable for styling. Otherwise great hotel when in San Francisco as access to roads to favorite attractions is easy. And visits to Sonoma County and Napa Valley are within a 90 minute drive from this central location!

My wife and I stayed here for only a couple nights from a business trip. The hotel was beautiful, easy to maneuver around, and the staff was polite and helpful. The room was well designed and had all the updated features you'd find in modern hotels. The only complaint I have, is the size of the room. I've stayed in Motel 6 rooms that were bigger. The view from our room of San Francisco was amazing to say the least. Around the hotel were a nice selection of food, especially Uncle Vito's Pizza up the street. There were two Starbucks right out the front door in both directions. Would definitely stay here again.

Had a chance to stay at their Grand Club room (king bed). Overall favorable but could improve given competitors nearbyPros- great location for leisure visitors (shopping, dining, attractions) I walked everywhere from the hotel - good room: clean, large, great view, comfy bed, especially like the walk in shower- club access for breakfast, snacks, drinks all fairly decent, don't over expect but the staff here were the friendliest and welcoming!Cons- the hotel is huge and lacks personal touch - competing on the same level as the IC, Nikko, amenities like slippers, shoehorns, etc. shouldn't need to be requested they should already be provided in the room- no complimentary bottled water provided

I hate to say it (being a loyal Hyatt customer and having accumulated almost one million Hyatt points), but this stay was not a very good experience . . . It just seemed that the staff just "phoned-it-in." Dr. Greg

Best downtown location. The hotel was steps away from Union Square park. Close to shops and transportation. The room was large. The bathroom was also very up to date. Staff was friendly and polite. Good for solo travelers

The only thing that I can say good after the stay is its location. I am a frequent patron of Hyatt but this is probably one of the worst in Grand Hyatt / Park Hyatt line. Basically the business is so good, no one really cares about you. At one night, fire alarm set off at 3am, our whole family ran down 30 floors. But was told to immediately went back up as nothing happened. There was no explanation nor apology the next day. Again, no one really cares about you. The room was small (understandably) but the sound proof is awful. You will hear the summer wind hurling and whistling all night long and if you have a noisy neighbor. I won't choose this one again.

I stayed in the San Francisco Grand Hyatt during the August 2017. I enjoyed my stay in the hotel. The staff was friendly and everyone always says, "Good Morning." I had all my questions answered including the best way to get to tourist destination such as Fisherman's Wharf.The only improvement the Grand Hyatt needs to work on, is to provide more amenities such as shampoo, hair conditioner, and shower gel, without having me to ask. I asked the hotel maid for such items and they provided for me.The location was excellent and only across the street from Union Square park and Macy's.

Visiting as part of my honeymoon in California, this is the sixth hotel I am in the state so I have developed quite a knowledge in the field :). The location is ok and the room is clean that's it. Super small rooms 0 effort from the staff to accommodate us in a better room as part of our honeymoon, we are put in the 9th floor of 36 facing another building. Paying 360 $ a night no breakfast they say we can pay 30 dollars more for a room as small as the one we are staying but higher. We expressly asked for quiet room and it is sharing door with another room where u can hear your neighbours talk even if they are not loud (although this looks common in California). Breakfast is limited, to say the least, in quality and variety. we have stayed in other grand hyatt and they were much better than this. Not worth it

The hotel has a great location next to all of the best shopping in SF. I walked to my office and felt safe both early in the AM and later in the PM. Great staff, clean rooms and great views of the city!

This has been a very unfortunate trip to the Grand Hyatt on Union Square. No personal touch was exhibited at all this trip, which in the past has been a lovely hallmark of the experience here. Service has been very matter of fact. The crowning touch was that our room was not touched. So after a very long day, we arrived back to our room to towels on the floor and beds untouched. I'm fine with not changing bed linens, but please do make the bed. At $350/night, that's not too much to ask. I would not even mind reusing my towels IF--and that's a biggie-there were towel bars to hang up the dang towels. I actually did read the note in the bathroom, saying linens would not be changed until after the second night in a move toward conservation. Ok, then provide towel bars. And please make the beds, especially after we requested that service! Very, very disappointed in the service/ambiance/general tenor of this stay. Based on this visit, I would not recommend this property.

We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The staff was friendly and very helpful and it was very well located. We were walking distance from almost anything! The rooms were clean and room service was fast. We had a wonderful stay!

Our stay at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco was typical of our experience with Hyatt hotels in other locations. The room met our needs and was efficiently cleaned. Notably, every staff member we encountered throughout the hotel was pleasant and agreeable, particularly in the reception area where the staff was proactively helpful.

Hotel is overpriced and dies not present good value for money at all. Customer service is terrible. Was not mentioned before stay that car park would be at additional cost. Gym is poor and no pool available. Overall in comparison with other Hystts NOT good value.

We actually stayed in November 2009, in the Penthouse Suite.It was the most romantic weekend and the hotel and staff were amazing.My husband and Hotel GM both share the same birthday. As a complementary surprise, we received a bottle of Champagne and a wonderful tray of Chocolate covered Strawberries.Not only was the room gorgeous, very central to all the San Fran sites, but convenient to the Bart as well.Thanks again, and we hope to come back again.

The room was ok, clean and relatively modern. But to pay almost $450 for a room without amenities, no minibar and queen bed is a bit tough.The real disappointment was the restaurant. $36 for a breakfast buffet with hardly anything on it. Worst was that we was ordering an omelette without onion to one in our party due to allergies. Not the hardest request. When we got it I looked ok. After a couple of bites we have an allergic reaction. The chef had according to the waiter missed the information....My recommendation, do not eat here.

It's too bad. We've been coming to this hotel for over 2 decades, we usually come around Christmas season and summertime , sometimes for business or for pleasure. This last stay we had was for pleasure. We stayed for the whole entire week. When we check in we told the front desk that we requested for a higher floor and I called ahead of time for the confirmation of our reservation. The customer service said and that our higher floor request will have no problem when we check in. And so it goes. The middle age man who assisted us in our check in was just ok. He appeared as if helpful but not really. I asked several times to give us the higher floor because we did upgrade our room to higher floor with a city view, we payed extra for it. Once we reach the 20th floor ( obviously not the higher floor) to our big disappointment the room view was lousy. Overlooking from those ugly buildings side by side. I'm to the point that I don't even want to open the blinds just to evade looking at those uncharming buildings. To think that we stayed there for the entire week, the check in person could at least gave us an acceptable view . I will totally avoid this hotel next time. Take your money somewhere else. There is a lot more hotels out there or better yet just stay to the Hyatt Embarcadero. The whole entire people there are nice, talking about great customer service.

The staff and club level at this property made it worth our while. All needs met and exceeded. Great location - ended up spending way too much at Niketown. Food was great at both the club lounge and the inroom dining. Easy to feed our family of 5.

My husband and I stayed here for my first visit to San Francisco and we couldn't be happier with the choice. The room was clean, comfortable and spacious. We also had a fantastic view of the city out of the floor to ceiling windows. I loved to keep the shades open at night just so I could stare at the view of the city lights. The location was perfect! It is centrally located and within walking distance to lots of shopping and restaurants. The bar there was kind of dull, but they had the best buffalo wings I've ever had.The only issue I had with the place was the $400 hold they put on our credit card. I thought that was a bit excessive and no one could explain to me why it was so high. I was told it should have only been $200, but that was definitely not the case.Overall though we were happy with this hotel and would stay here again next time we're in San Francisco.

My family and I just got back from aweekend vacation in SFO. We stayed at the Grans Hyatt Hotel and had a great time. Service was first class from the door man to the restaurant. Easy and fast check in and the facilities were great overall. Highly recommeneded and we will be back!

Huge hotel, but we didn't feel at a very busy place. No long waiting for elevators and no lines at reception.We got a very noisy room (they said it was the wind...) with a bathtub/shower combination. We complained about the noise and we got a new room right away, with great views and walk-in shower - we know that kind of 'upgrade' is not normal, but we were very happy with that.Room had very good size, however bathroom was VERY small and had a very odd rolling door that didn't close. Very bad in case you are not a single traveler. Common toiletries. Small towel size. Closet space was just ok and in room fridge didn't have anything in there. Also the hotel didn't have a place for us to buy water or other stuff to put in the fridge... Thanks for the CVS across the street!We didn't like the restaurant very much - Not too many appealing choices.Nice overall structure and GREAT location, with a direct pleasant garden access to Apple Store at Union Sq! Nice gym with great city views.Didn't use hotel services, but housekeeping was efficient. We definitely think that is a very good option! You know what to expect from a Grand Hyatt.

This is a lovely comfortable hotel in the heart of San Francisco. All staff are helpful and friendly, the service is excellent . Rooms are comfortable with good facilities such as refrigerators. We didn't include breakfast. Highly recommend.

This hotel has gone so far downhill in its quality of service that it is almost laughably bad at this point. After complaining about children in the room next to me screaming "Help, someone is trying to kill me." at the top of their lungs at 12:30 am, my call to the front desk was met with an offer of earplugs. The entire service staff feels inept and inexperienced. I'm even a World of Hyatt member and credit card holder, but was offered absolutely no acknowledgment for being a loyal customer. As a result, I no longer will be.

really great views, design and staff. Super comfortable beds, tasty foods a bar great location. my only complaint was the noise from adjoining room door .. it was like the family next to me was in my room fighting all night. they need to add sound proofing between these doors!

Friendly and warm service starting at the reception. A good buzz and perfectly located at Union square - they have a good coffee and snack cart - and room service and housekeeper is extremely efficient - we loved our stay and recommended ! Near all the cool shops and restaurants - all in walking distance - the staff go out of their way to make your stay comfortable and pleasurable

We chose this hotel because it is central, however the service was terrible, view less than desirable- our room dirty and needs some repairs. Sink cracked, plug stuck and dirty......When we checked in we asked if we could pay to upgrade our room however the receptionist said "ahhh we are fully booked, good luck." Either way, we asked for the pull away bed for our 7 year old however never arrived until we called again. When it did the gentleman was rude left in a hurry not even allowing us to tip him. Bathroom and beside the bed dirty, not enough towels or any towels rack-strange. How do they want us to conserve energy if we cannot hang our towels to dry. No water to purchase in the room. Overall would not suggest this hotel.

Two days after staying at a San Francisco hotel we ranked as the worst weâ€™ve ever visited, we checked into one of the best we've ever experienced.The bad â€“ the dump â€“ was the Klimpton Sir Francis Drake, which Iâ€™ve previously reviewed. The best is the Grand Hyatt.First off, the Hyatt was spotlessly clean, both in its public spaces and in our room. The marble, stone, and tiled surfaces were immaculate; the carpets showed no signs of wear.Our lunch in the mezzanine restaurant offered a good variety of hot and cold dishes at a reasonable price; the service was prompt, friendly, and efficient.We opted to pay a bit extra for access to the club room on the 32nd floor. The snacks in the evening were enough for a light dinner. The breakfast buffet was outstanding: scrambled eggs, bacon, toast and pastries, lox and bagels, hot and cold cereal, milk, juices, coffee, and tea.Our room was large, almost twice the size of the Drakeâ€™s, as was the bathroom. The bed was comfortable. The flat screen TV offered broadcast and cable stations and three or four movie channels. The view â€“ from the 30th floor â€“ was dramatic. (At the Drake weâ€™d looked out onto an alley.)All this for less than $50 more than weâ€™d paid at the Drake.

We chose this hotel for its location right in Union Square. It is a very nice hotel, service was good. Rooms are really small though (225sq ft). We booked on the club floor and having access to the club lounge was fantastic and worthwhile. But we had hoped that the rooms were also a little larger on that floor (which they are not). Family of 4 in 225 sq ft is tight. If you are a single or couple, the room size would be fine. Parking in lot across the street from hotel is 1/2 the cost and safe and convenient.

Nestled in the middle of the city, the Grand Hyatt provided us with an excellent stay from check in to the final valet send off, we enjoyed every moment! Sleek modern styling is present everywhere. The check in desk as smooth and efficient! We had utilized the Hyatt App to check in early, so it literally took a half minute. Then, we had the opportunity to enjoy our room. The 15th floor was high enough to give us great views of the bay and union square. The bathroom was spacious and everything was spotless!The second floor has a restaurant and bar that had very stylish and clean lines. While we did not enjoy any food at the restaurant, my husband and I enjoyed a late night wine. They had an iPad that detailed their different offerings that made it easy to order. The bartender was attentive, but not hovering. It was a great evening! The valet services were excellent! Our car was ready for us each time in very quick fashion! When we were packing up to leave, the valet presented us with four ice cold bottles of water for our trip. While not a huge deal, it exemplifies what we experienced during our stay at the Grand Hyatt!... amazing service!

Stayed for 10 days. Good location right in union square, good service and great hospitality. Room size good for family of four. Provided amenities if one forgets. Breakfast service is good. Would go back again

The location of the hotel is great and everything is within walking distance. The room is renovated and I enjoyed the city view. The staff was friendly and helpful. It is a busy hotel and more on the business type hotel. If I go to San Francisco again, I would choose to stay in this area rather than Fisherman's Wharf.

The included continental breakfast consisted of ONE COFFEE AND ONE PASTRY. Nothing with protein, just a sugar/carb high. Such an expensive hotel should care more about their guests' health and comfort.

The Grand Hyatt is in a really good location --- easy walking distance to many attractions and also to transit to other locales. Our room overlooked Union Square, which would normally be quite nice, except major construction was going on on the streets below, making for some noisy mornings and even a couple of overnights. The room was well-appointed and clean, but a bit cramped for a family of 3. Overall, a good experience, but it would have been even better if the construction noise wasn't a factor.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt and throughly enjoyed our experience. When I made the reservations, I signed up to become a Hyatt reward member (it's free!) and was offered an upgrade upon my arrival for a very reasonable cost. For only a little more, we ended up on the 31st floor with Grand Club access. The staff was helpful and friendly. We enjoyed the view from our room and the location of the hotel made it very easy to navigate to anywhere in San Francisco!

We stayed here for two nights and had a wonderful stay! As soon as we arrived, we were greeted warmly by the doorman and asked if we needed help with our luggage. We were checked in by Wayne who was extremely friendly and personable and gave us a beautiful room on the 25th floor.The rooms are modern, sleek and stylish with nice amenities. The beds were very comfortable and the room was very clean throughout our stay. All of the staff were extremely helpful and accommodating. Vanessa, one of the concierges, was very nice and helpful in giving us information and restaurant recommendations. A week after we checked out, we were getting ready to go to the airport and I noticed on the car rental receipt that we were overcharged for the drop fee at the airport. I called the concierge and spoke with Joanne who was very busy at the time and asked if she could call me back. She contacted the car rental company and returned my call in just 30 minutes to let me know that she had taken care of it and that they had adjusted my bill! I appreciated her great service! If you are renting a car during your stay, I recommend going through the hotel because their rates are half the cost than booking it through the car rental agency on your own. We had a great experience and I highly recommend this hotel!

The location of this hotel is really good. It's in the center of the city and close to to restaurants and shopping. The room is average for the price. If you want things like shower caps, robes and slippers, they all need to be requested. There isn't any bottled water in the room either. My problem is with the service. None of the staff members seemed passionate about their jobs. It felt like it was something they did just to pay the bills. One night I called room service to order a tofu dish. The lady on the phone was rude, she questioned where I had seen tofu on the menu, after I told her it was right under the healthy section, she insisted that they didn't have tofu. Her attitude was so bad that I decided instead of arguing with her, I would call the front desk and see if I can get someone with more sensible. The front desk told me he'd look into it. Then the manager of room service called me, apologized for the mistake and said that they do indeed have tofu and would make it for me for free. I thought my problems were solved at this time. Then 30 minutes later when the food came, the string beans I ordered were now mini carrots, which I am fine with. But my tofu was cold, barely room temperature and there was also a big blue/purple stain on it. I decided it would be safer if I didn't eat it. I also didn't trust the room-service people enough to order anything else. So in the end I just didn't even have dinner that night. I have stayed in at least 20 Hyatt hotels, and the experience ranges from totally amazing to just OK. This was by far the worst experience I have had at a Hyatt.

Contemporary style hotel. Great location to step out of the hotel and roam the city. Professional and friendly service from employees who seemed to care about encounters with guests. We secured a good deal in a mini suite and liked the extra room and access to club level amenities.

As a family of four, we made good use of the concierge lounge and we were glad to have it. The coffee, fruit, eggs and salmon were very good. Some items were below par, but we always found something we could enjoy. The service in the lounge was very gracious and accommodating. Overall, the hotel is excellent. The location is very good for exploring the city without a car, which is really the best way. Driving to the hotel was a nightmare, but that's just a fact of driving in the city. (Stockton doesn't go through, you have to go up Sutter, then left on Stockton). The parking is really expensive, so we parked for about half the cost across the street. Rooms are relatively small, but that's typical in a big city.

I had a nice room on the 17th floor in the corner, and I had a view of the city and a peek of the ocean with boats/ships. I'm from S.F. originally and enjoyed visiting there seeing family, friends, a play, and shopping is an easy walk everywhere. Getting a ride is a cinch and was a happy camper!

This is a centrally located Hyatt and the breakfasts were amazing! Would definitely stay here again when we return to San Fran. We enjoyed the easy walk to local sites. The staff were very kind and welcoming. We liked the email notification that our room was ready!

This hotel is well located adjunct to Union Square and surrounded by a lot of shops and restaurants. The rooms are clean and the bedding is excellent. The interconnecting doors are not sound proof so it is highly likely you will be woken if you are a light sleeper by the customers in adjunct rooms or the street traffic even if on a high floor room. The staff unfortunately, especially at checkin need training or perhaps retraining so that they are reminded that customers matter and in particular Hyatt members. The hotel lobby is small although there are seats to sit on one side of the hotel lobby. Staff seem to stand around and I saw little evidence of staff assisting customers apart from the doorman. Some of the hotel signage needs updating - we couldn't understand why we couldn't take the lift to the top level where we believed there was a restaurant. Apparently this has not been onsite for a long time but the signage remains. Customers couldn't find the restaurant on the mezzanine floor as once again the signage was not clear.

Stayed here four times over the last couple of years and compared to other places I have stayed its the only place I actually look forward to staying in again. Its the small things really - the front desk and customer service generally are very good. The rooms are spacious, modern and well-laid out. Breakfasts are good, the restaurant is decent and the bar is quiet in the day and buzzing at night and serves good drinks. And the best bit is that hotel is just so convenient for everything. I look forward to my next visit.

Elegant sleeping room, strong breakfast buffet, comfortable bar with OK but not exciting food, close to most attractions in San Francisco. The views from the workout room and the top floor are stunning

We recently stayed here to be centrally located in San Francisco. The accommodations were nice for a Grand Hyatt, however what made this stay out of this world was the staffing. The concierge staff of Joanne, David, Mary and company were of this world. They made sure we had the best info to make our family vacation exceptional and then some how were able to get us same night reservations at places that had significant waits. Worth the stay as a Hyatt but worth more because of the staff.

Location and view of union square was awesome! Clean, nice room. Will stay at Hyatt Grand in SF again. We only ate at the hotel once and the food was good. Very convenient pick up for Uber or walking to just about anywhere in SF.

I loved the online check-in option at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco. We received notification via email when our room was ready. This modern style hotel is located perfectly in the heart of San Francisco. We stayed in room 3411. The room was absolutely gorgeous. The high quality modern furniture made this room chic and comfortable, and the city skyline views were breathtaking. Housekeeping did an amazing job in keeping our room clean and comfortable. The staff at the Grand Club Lounge was very nice and breakfast was perfect, with plenty of delicious breakfast items to choose from.

The hotel was nice but rooms are outdated. We had a good view of the town and some of the bay. Staff was friendly. We did not have any meals here. I probably would stay again but I would not be located next to the club bar, very noisy at all hours not worth the money it cost. Overpriced

We're active seniors in our 60's who are also SF Giants fans. Came into town to attend night game. Needed something convenient but not too expensive. To say that Hyatt SF met our expectations is an understatement. Hotel and staff were absolutely wonderful. Every single person across the spectrum of customer service made us feel welcome and special. This was our first experience here and we are trying to plan a return trip to catch a broadway show.

Very nice stay at Grand Hyatt SF. Good location in Union Square. Very nice and helpful staff including concierge. Try to upgrade or pay to use Lounge to save on having to go out for breakfast outside hotel. Also includes snacks light dinner and drinks in the afternoon and evening.

The Grand Hyatt was a dream. We stayed on a Saturday night after seeing a Giants game at AT&T park. The hotel is located close to public transportation, and the valet parking took care of our car allowing for an effortless arrival. The hotel itself is gorgeous with beautifully curated interiors and exceptional service. Every single one of the staff members was helpful and had a smile on their face, we felt very well taken care of. Our room was clean and we loved the modern finishes, and our view from the 24th floor was AMAZING. We were so enamored with the view out of our window that we decided to order room service and ate our dinner in the room looking out at the City below. Food was great and it was very convenient to have everything right there at your fingertips. This hotel is definitely in my top 3 favorite hotels of all time and I hope stay here again the next time I visit SF!

There was no valet parking available on arrival; check-in was very slow - the person at the Globalist check-in line was on the phone; on-line check-in didn't work; neither did keyless room entry; I didn't receive housekeeping service the entire stay; it took over 30 mns to get my car back from valet parking; none of the bartenders knew how to mix classic cocktails; the food was low quality; the wifi was spotty and the drain in the bathtub was plugged. I stayed for 3 nights but only received credit in my World of Hyatt account for 2. This is simply a poor quality hotel on every level.

Stayed here for 3 nights/4 days and was disappointed by the service and amenities. There was mold, dust, variable amenities, and chromcast doesn't work. See below for details.Day 1: Arrived and checked in just fine. Noticed there was no lotion so went out and bought some. Came back that night and noticed MOLD in our vents. We called the front desk expecting a new room but was told they could only clean the vent. So 10pm, maintenance comes in and spends 30mins cleaning and installing a new vent.Day 2: The room was not cleaned. We called downstairs to have supplies replenished. They were given a short list and did not deliver everything on the list. Day 3: Room was cleaned and lotion was left. So they just forgot to leave the lotion when we arrived... But they forgot to replenish the coffee. =/ I noticed a light dusting of dust on the nightstand. Thought it was just due to the turn down service. My friend and I began to cough more than usual when in the room and ONLY in the room. I noticed the dust was on every surface... If we have the newest cleanest vents, imagine how much worse it would be in any other room. Day 4: The windows were fogged up and would fog up minutes after we wiped it. Explains why they have mold in their vents.Really expected more from the Hyatt brand...They did not meet minimum standards for any hotel.

Hyatt staff was attentive and caring. Room was clean, well appointed and in great condition. Great location for family fun as just steps from Union Square, cable cars, and great shopping. What else can I say, Hyatt does it right every time!

I planned an event at the property and stayed during that week in the end of June. It was absolutely wonderful. The rooms are beautiful, spacious and very clean. The event space on the 36th floor is also incredibly special. You can actually go up there and look at the view when an event is not going on so I would highly recommend doing that.The staff are excellent! Nothing is too much trouble for them and they work very hard to make you happy. Several of my colleagues had drinks at the bar and had a great time. One of them also had breakfast in the restaurant and said it was great. I can personally recommend the room service as it was delicious and thankfully Grand Hyatt still serves room service on real plates, rather than to go boxes like some of the other hyatt brands.The hotel is within walking distance of anything you could possible need. You can walk to the ferry building in 30 minutes and union square is bustling with great restaurants and bars. Overall, I would highly recommend this property and we are looking to host this event again next year :).

Fantastic location just off union square, close to all tour buses and multiple restaurants and shopping opportunities. Room was a great size with very comfortable bed. Great view from 20th floor, staff friendly, would definitely Return.

The hotel was very very nice. Convenient to a lot of attractions that we were able to walk to. We parked our car and did not get it out until we left. We made use of the cable car system and taxis, much easier than taking our own vehicle.All personnel at the hotel were very knowledgeable and helpful.

In general, they're great place to stay in terms of condition and location. One bad experience I had was they checked me out without my consent before the standard check-out time because when they tried to service my room, they saw that all of my stuff were no longer in the room and they assumed I had checked out. When I asked if this was even legal, they told me this was "standard" for hotels. For me, this was the 1st time I've heard of it.

Room was ok but service wasnt. No one helped with my luggages upon arrival. No toiletries and water provided in the room, u have to call to request for it. Wifi wasnt working most of the time during my 2 nights stay. In-room dining was very expensive, there is even a delivery charge of USD5!!The only good thing is the location.The only good thing is the location.

Clean, comfortable, spacious, stylish rooms and friendly staff. We liked the extra small hall and desk in the standard King room as it gave a good place to dress. Only negative was the sliding bathroom door that did not feel private.

Stayed for 1 night only, although the hotel was nice and clean but still compared to money I have paid it did not exceed my expectation.stayed here for the brand name but I guess I have seen better for the star rating and price.overall experience was not so great; asked for cutlery in the room and after a couple of fake promises by a couple of different people (staff) the cutlery was finally delivered to my room almost an hour later since my first phone call. Took 2 phone calls and a visit to reception to get it. Apart from that room was nice, good view and a great location.

This is a great hotel just ask to be away from the Stockton St. side to avoid the overnight construction noise. Great front desk and restaurant staff. Gym has great view of SF skyline. Just get there early if you like your morning workouts.

Stayed two nights at the Grand Hyatt on a recent business trip to San Francisco. Very good hotel in a simply awesome location in the city. Nice and comfortable rooms and bathroom. The Gym is on a high floor offering great views of the city. Staff is friendly and helpful. This is a large hotel with over 500 rooms, but has a really small restaurant for breakfast. This hotel does not fall in the Reasonably Priced' category.

The Hyatt was clean and very nice room. We were taken care ofd very well by the staff from checkin to checkout. The food was expensive but so is all of San Francisco. Overall great experience-the location is great in the heart of the city. .

Great location! This hotel is right in the center of Union Square. Staff is super helpful. Rooms were spotless, room service was excellent, and views from room were perfect. Our driver, Ceasar, was amazing!

My wife and I recently stayed in a single king room. This is our second stay at this location. We were at the tail end of our California vacation with our family (SF/Tahoe) and I elected to get a room at Hyatt rather than impose on our son for accommodations at his apartment. Chose Union Square location due to proximity to son and ease of access to SFO the next day. Only looked at Hyatt properties when booking room.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt Union Square for 5 days for vacation while in San Francisco from Florida. This was our first visit to San Francisco and we were welcomed to the hotel like old friends. The doormen were so friendly and very accommodating in helping us get our luggage inside out of the cold and wind. Check in was very smooth- our flight arrived early and we were able to check in 4 hours early with no problem. The room was very spacious and comfortable. We had three people in our party and had 2 adjoining rooms. Ask for a higher floor to hear less of the noise from the street. We were on the 8th floor and didn't find the noise to be bothersome though. We did have two occasions to dine in the One Up Restaurant and it was superior! The food was great and the service was excellent. The staff was very friendly and really set themselves apart. We could also see that the staff worked well together as a team and that was nice to see. We did have some interaction with concierge named Anne and she helped us book a fantastic city tour, tour to Muir Woods, gave us restaurant recommendations, and booked our airport shuttle. She was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel has a wonderful resource in her. I should add that we were also able to use Uber very easily for pick ups and drop offs at the hotel. I would absolutely not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. If you stay here, you will be very pleased!

Great hotel with a great location and view! I got a room Union Square face and I did not regret!5 - Room.4- Management.5 - Cleaning4 - Wifi5 - Location4 - Bathroom5 - ConciergeDo recommend this hotel when going to San Francisco. Great bar and Concierge!

Condition of bathroom is bad and not clean at all. When I took a shower, the water didn't drain well so I need call the service. However the location is great and convenient to walk around the union square and go to shopping.
Lovely, helpful staff, concierge always helpful. Clean rooms, great location.Drinks expensive but you expect that in hotels, little cafe at back door very reasonabley pricedWould definitely recommend

The hotel was nice, room was wonderful. However the gym was tiny and could not accommodate the number of guests at the hotel. At 8am on Saturday and Sunday, every single treadmill or other equipment was occupied, as was all available floor space. Really left no workout option, which was a huge disappointment for a nice business hotel.

Great Location very close to China Town, Union Square, Market St most things are walking distance and Bell Staff were great when needing transport. In comparison to other Hyatts I have stayed in the service and staff friendliness was average. on a positive note we were able to access our room on arrival which was great as we had a 14 hour flight from Australia and were able to shower and change our clothes, this was a big plus. The rooms were clean and coffee machine is provided, we are tea drinkers and on request you can have a kettle and tea provided, the tea wasnt restocked daily and we purchased our own coffee and milk.

This is our second time staying at the Grand Hyatt Union Square. The hotel is perfectly positioned, with a Union Square basically on your door step. A room with Union Square view is a must. The rooms were large, very clean with great amenities. The service was faultless. Close to restaurants, shops, cafes the trolley and tour buses. Highly recommend this hotel.

My wife and I were offered an upgraded room at the reduced rate. We had two rooms at the hotel because my son was also attending. We accepted the offer but was charged the full room rate which I discovered reviewing my travel credit card charges. The hotel refused to honor the discount request and we were moved back to original reservation. My error was not asking to "sign off" on roommate before verbal acceptance. We expected hotel to honor discount offered by staff,

Hotel staff were great and the location is perfect!!!!! Great views, nice fitness center. Surprisingly parking is available across the street in a well maintained garage for a $36 daily rate which is not bad at all.

Good central location, fairly quite street noice. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. This was our second trip to the Grand Hyatt downtown and we will definitely return. Only downside to our stay, hallway noice was a little loud with children running up and down.

Updated hotel with an even better location! Close enough to walk to AT&T park for a Giants game! Literally steps to Union Square and shops! The staff was also super friendly!! I will definitely stay here again!!!

I am kind of new to Hyatt, and I really like this one. Got a good rate for a work trip, even in a run of house room everything was well appointed. I appreciate very much the Hyatt brand touch to leave that card in your room specifying what they have and can send up. It's at the point now where all you really need is to pack clothes and they'll take care of the rest. I loved the bar on the mezzanine level - make sure you're there when Boa is working, he is an absolute doll. Minus one star really only because some of the furnishings in the rooms look well loved, but really other than that it's a top spot. And less than a block from Boba Guys is always alright in my book. The CVS across the street is a little sketch, but you know what folks... it's SF. You have to manage the sketchy parts of the city basically anywhere you go.

This is a great location and within walking distance to a lot of sight seeing sites. It is a huge hotel. The rooms are large. We had two double beds and four of us (2 adults and 2 kids) were very comfortable.You should go to the 43rd floor and enjoy a cocktail and the view.I was disappointment when I found out that they offered me a room with a view and failed to mention that there was an extra charge with it. At the check out they were very understanding and removed the extra charge. Also, the cleaning crew didn't do a good job vacuuming or clean my room. I was there for 5 nights.

Location was great and staff was helpful. perhaps it was the part of the hotel I was in but you can hear everything from guests next door and you can constantly hear the elevators going up and down. the bath tub was noisy as if the part of the floor was broken.

We chose the GRAND HYATT SAN FRANCISCO, 1st because of the brand assurance, 2nd because of its location. just steps away from UNION SQUARE, and the heart of the city, you can't ask for more, everything is literally walking distance.Check-in was quick, the family room was a bit tiny, but well you can't have everything. The hotel staff is super cooperative, & are more than willing to help out with directions etc.,For a tourist in the city, GRAND HYATT is perfect! would definitely recommend it!

I stayed st this hotel for 2 nights with a colleague of mine (I made the reservations for the both of us) and once she entered her room she sent me a message saying ValÃ©rie well done this hotel is amazing and the room are spacious!I loved this hotel very close to Union- Square and very closed distance form ChinaTown Gates.The room are spacious and I even have a vanity corner in mine.OneUP restaurant is very good we just went for breakfast! You won't be disappointed! Top- notched place HÃ´tel trÃ¨s bien placÃ© prÃ¨s de Union Square, Le personnel est sympa, Le restaure OneUP pour le petit dÃ©jeuner est top!Le Quartier Chinois est Ã  moins de 7min Ã  pieds.L'hÃ´tel est trÃ¨s classe @valerie.travelprints

The Grand Hyatt is centrally located in San Francisco, right on Union Square. When visiting, we either walk or take the Muni. Muni stops are less than a block away, for a quick ride to North Beach, shopping on Union Street or Filmore Street, or to the SFMOMA. Take stroll down to Market Street to catch the trolley to the Ferry Building or to Fisherman's Wharf. Or just stay around the hotel for great shopping.

We loved our stay. The checkin was quick, but they said they would text me when my room was ready but they never did. The room itself was gorgeous. Lots of pillows and towels. Lots of places for luggage. The city view was spectacular. The blinds were automatic which was neat. I have nothing too negative to say. The bell hop was the oldest Hyatt employee and he was so funny and charming. Loved him. Don't know why we cant go to the 36th floor, that was disappointing since we thought drinks and a view would be nice. The location itself was perfect. We Ubered everywhere which worked out great. We enjoyed our stay.

Enjoyed 3 nights on the concierge level, floor 32. I was extremely surprised at the extent and quality of food and beverage offering in the club. It was much more than a continental breakfast, there were eggs, sausage, bacon, etc. The evening offerings were just as good, with nice a nice selection and honor bar.. Room was extremely clean, housekeeping did a very nice job. Definitely would stay here again. Oh- and the front desk was won wonderfully helpful and charming!

Loved my stay at the Grand Hyatt Union Square. It was a great location could walk to everything. Very friendly staff and great accommodations. The room was very nice, clean and Loved the bathroom and shower as well as the very comfortable bed. Highly recommend to everyone who likes an excellent hotel in a perfect location. won't disappoint. Satisfied guest, Jo Tuzzolino

This is a somewhat dated property with some nice modern touches and an excellent location. A lot of the 4 star hotels in SF would not be 4 star hotels elsewhere (see my other review), but I would say the Grand Hyatt is appropriately rated at 4 stars. Overall good experience. Here is what I liked and didn't like...Pros:-friendly, helpful, accommodating, wonderful staff (reception, housekeeping, etc.)-very good location, easy to get in and out of hotel-although guest rooms are a bit dated and on the small side, hotel has added modern touches such as motorized window shades, USB ports, frosted glass doors, etc.-comfortable bed and linens (king bed with 6 pillows)-updated, modern, welcoming lobby (which is set up "living room-style" like Andaz hotels instead of traditional big front desk)-ice machines and water coolers on each floor-room service from 6am to midnight (see additional comments below)-check-out time is noon (many hotels are 11am) and they had no problem giving me a late checkout. like I said, very nice, helpful staff and this goes a long way-CVS right across the street is very convenient-Safe location (which is not something that can be said about quite a few SF hotels)Cons:-as mentioned above, guest rooms are a bit dated and selection of artwork is odd-room service menu is limited and somewhat bland menu so i decided to call the restaurant directly to see if there were other choices. There were, and some good ones, and the prices were much less than on the room service menu. You just have to order on the phone and go pick it up on the second floor. I can understand the hotel charging more for room service items OR charging a delivery fee but not both, and why limit the menu to just a few items?-Like so many Hyatts, access to the balconies has been closed off, which means you cannot get any outside air in the room.-Insulation between rooms is not great, mainly because of door to adjoining room. Given how few guests probably request adjoining rooms, the hotel should consider eliminating some of these doorsOverall I think this hotel is a great choice in SF.

We stayed at this property during the long weekend. We had a lovely suite with great views of the city. The hotel is very clean and rooms are spacious. The bathroom was big. The lounge at the hotel had great selection for breakfast and evening hor'dorvors. The quality and variety of food is very good. They also had a good selection of wine and cheese every evening. We loved our stay at the hotel. The location is perfect

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this hotel. The people on the club level are very helpful. Good food and best three dollar glass of wine on the west coast. Sufficient proteins for two meals a day. The rooms are updated and clean. Comfortable beds. Sadly, the sidewalks of San Francisco have become an open sewer, with human feces smeared around and the pungent smell of urine everywhere. The Hyatt maintains the area in front of their building quite well, but the rest of the city needs a good power washing once a week.

Decent location and comfy bed but not worthy of the Hyatt name or price tag. In room bathroom is not at all private. It is a sliding frosted glass door that is directly across from the entry door to the room. It doesn't close all the way, does not lock, and there is no fan to drown out personal noise. The in room fridge is behind a cabinet door which prevents the fridge from closing completely, which we didn't figure out until after our food spoiled. I also had a major issue with gift cards that is still not rectified. While it is not the fault of this location, I felt they could do SOMETHING to recognize the issue and attempt to rectify it. But.... nothing was even acknowledged.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt SF in Union Square for one night. It's a very nice property that is centrally-located and within walking distance to many attractions in SF. I was provided a room on the 31st floor with southern views of SF looking out across Union Square. It was a very nice room with contemporary furnishings (see pics). As it seems with most Grand Hyatt's though, it's a very busy hotel. However, being only 1/2-block from Union Square, this is not unexpected. The Regency Club is located on the 32nd floor and serves a very nice, fully-inclusive breakfast.

The Grand Hyatt at Union Square - located in the heart of shops and restaurants and so much more. Rooms are comfortable and views from all sides of the hotel are good. We overlooked Union Square and enjoyed people watching and checked to see if any activities were taking place. The room shades block most of the sunlight and I do love the fact you can control the shades and lights from your bed. I am always amazed at how the personnel at the Grand Hyatt at Union Square are always polite, attentive and knowledgeable. We enjoyed access to the Club Room - Judy, Warren, Jimmy, Ben, Anh, David, Jessica and Billy always greeted us by name - they cleared and cleaned the tables, replenished the food and still made time to check on us and see how we were doing. Yes this hotel is near the construction of the new transportation system and yes it can get noisy but after a day of walking, exploring the de Young museum, botanical gardens, taking the cable car, visiting Chinatown and shopping - you return exhausted and sleep oblivious to the night sounds of San Francisco.

We always have a wonderful stay at this property. Love the location adjacent to Union Square and Chinatown. Not a long walk to many of the SF sites. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and our breakfasts in the hospitality room were always lovely. The room was "fine" - nothing spectacular - and our only complaint is that our shower head in the bathroom was positioned so close to the water spigot that you had to stand practically against the metal to wash your whole body. But better than many hotels I've stayed in this summer that only have a rain shower option overhead, which isn't good for me when I don't want to wash my hair!

Disappointing stay at the Hyatt. I have stayed at this hotel several times before and this time not so good. I am a Hyatt member which clearly bears no added advantage. Was put on the 3 rd floor where the street noise is quite loud. Bed was squeeky, aircon rattled, no mini bar or water bottles provided. The bath also was weak on the base of the the bath which made you feel like you were going to fall through it. Vanity basin chipped .Requested a paper which never arrived. Not what you expect from a hotel of this kind. The concierge desk offered great service but the check in and check out staff were very underwhelming. Also, always have to wait as they are not efficient. Had a meal at the bar and asked for more bread with my soup. What was delivered was a stale bread roll.I gave feedback at the checkout when I was asked how my stay was. Care factor,very little.Will go to the westin around the corner next time.

Best value on Union Square for the quality level that is expected of a Grand Hyatt hotel. We spent the week-end and did not have to use our car until the last day. Park across the street at the Sutter-Stockton garage if you have to park overnight, it is half the price of what the hotel charges for parking. Club level rooms will give you access to the club lounge which has an excellent brunch and light dinner appetizers and wine/beer in the evening, throughout the day there is fruit and cookies and drinks (non-alcoholic) available. No compromise on quality or level of service here!

Staff is courteous and doormen were always smiling. In fact most people that live here smile a lot! Rooms were good with many towels. Its expensive to park overnight so be aware. Its actually expensive to park in San Francisco! This hotel is near shops and there is a starbucks's right across the street. Taxis were easy to get. We spent a lot of time down on the waterfront.

Terrific location, and friendly professional staff, but the room furnishings need some upgrade! And the noise levels are "high" both from the Elevator and the streets. They even provide 2 Sets of Ear Plugs in each room! !

Wanting to visit this beautiful city before a cruise, we picked the Grand Hyatt because of its location to so many different areas. Very close walk to BART and not that far of a walk to Embarcadero and the piers.

Have stayed at this location several times. Enjoy being able to walk to shopping, restaurants and theater. Great location. This is a great city to visit both historical sites and recreational activities.

Grand Hyatt is in an excellent location, everywhere that you want to be is an easy walk from here, the dÃ©cor is very Hyatt beige with touches of dark timber, as you see all over the world, that is ok as it is understated and not too in your face, rooms are big, bathrooms are comfortable, views from most rooms are great, we had a club room on 22nd floor, the club lounge is on the 32nd floor, quite lounge with spectacular views over the city, the club staff are amazing, nothing is a problem for them, I think that this is a great city hotel with excellent service, no negatives from me.

The staff is generally not very polite and doesn't have not much patience during check-on and when we called front desk for questions. Great location at Union Squrewith walkable distance to China town. Assisted self-parking is in a parking structure across street next to CVS with $35/24 hr with in and out privileges. Breakfast buffet is $32 with omelette and other selections.

We could not have asked for better service. From the attentive door men to the fabulous concierge and front desk, I'm not sure which was better. They were all great and would highly recommend staying here. Our room was comfortable and well stocked. The beds and pillows were comfy. The bathroom was modern and had plenty of light. This was our first trip to the city and would stay here again. Great location. Give the Grand Hyatt a try when in SAN Francisco.

The location is absolutely awesome. The room is ok with good bed, sheets and pillows. But bath has curtains instead of glass doors. In a hotel like this, I really was expecting a better finishing. The hotel service lacked attention to me. I have received a package from Amazon, and the hotel did not call me to say the package has arrived. I almost forgot it there. The restaurant is ok, nothing more.

The Hotel is in a very good location to restaurants bars etc the view from the high rooms are fabulous we had a room on the 18th Floor looking over San Francisco Bay the Hotel is very well organised our room was maintained to a high standard in addition you are fairly close to all attractions that you would want to see in San Francisco either walking bike riding or cable car would definitely stay here if we ever returned just remember bring a good pair of trainers for walking you need them as there are many very very steep hills

This is a great hotel. The decor is fantastic and the rooms are really nice. The bathrooms are well laid out and modern. Nice sheets, pillows and towels. Breakfast was a little bit cramped as only one side operating when we visited but the selection was good. Definitely stay here again.

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco was well located with shopping, parks, and restaurants nearby. Staff was very responsive in correcting a problem with our room early on in our trip and checked back several times.

Hands down the best hotel I have stayed at. From the staff to the food to the quality to the views. Don't waste your time elsewhere and go to the grand hyatt. It is so centeral to every other part of the city that you will find that you can do more simply because they make it easier. I will be going back.

clean/nice rooms but registration and needs a actual line set up. location was in the city but very noisy, view was of a dirty rooftop. did not have time to eat or enjoy any other amenities. I would stay there again if needed.

This hotel was quite nice. I was in a Grand Club room and it was quite comfortable. The Club room allows access to the Grand Club Lounge, where they have breakfast (which was excellent, by the way), appetizers with honor bar, and then is open later for dessert too. Access to the lounge comes with this level of room, and the food is complementary. Honor bar drinks are probably lowest cost in the city - glass of wine $3 and mixed drinks $4. The night that we came for "appetizers" they had fried chicken, mac and cheese, slaw, among other veggies and dips, etc. The food was amazing and we didn't even need dinner that night, it was delicious. The food at the Hotel bar is also excellent. Staff here is great. We spoke with the manager on duty (Steven Reyes) about an issue we had and he was super nice and solved everything for us. He was extremely respectful and the nicest hotel manager I've ever encountered. I would definitely go back to this hotel, and would stay in a Club Room again just for the access to the Club Lounge - best in SF.
