This was my first time staying at this hotel and the location. While this was a business trip, the location of the hotel is great. There are really nice shops, the second largest Apple Store (next door) that I've seen ever and plenty of places to eat. The entire staff was professional and welcoming. The conference that I attended was so well done that I forgot that I was at a hotel. Nice job!

Loved this place! We came for Thanksgiving last year and had a blast; would definitely splurge for the Union Square view next time for the Christmas Tree lighting ceremony. Our room was not available right away, so they gave us a credit for $50. The other hiccup was that the crib we requested at check-in was not delivered until I called but this I've learned is a common problem with the hotels since no one expects a baby to go to sleep at 7pm... so we always have to call and wait.I loved the decor and comfy bed. View was nice too. Very close to everything, which was very convenient with an infant. Enjoyed their restaurant and bar as well.

My wife and I stayed here as part of a large group. The check in process was swift and pleasant. Our room was clean and although we didn't pay extra for a higher floor with a view the room did have view of the bay. The meeting space is nice and accommodating. We appreciated the late check out on our last day. Only complaint was with concierge. We asked her for help finding an inexpensive place for lunch and were open to any suggestions. She was clearly not interested in really helping us and only went through the motions. You expect a concierge to be over helpful and pleasant in a place that charges $300+ a night. Not the case. Still a nice place but can see why this is not top 10 in SF.

My 12 year old son and I stayed in a suite on the 33rd floor for two nights on a trip to celebrate his birthday and see a play. The views of the city are spectacular, and the central downtown location of the hotel is very convenient. The hotel provided a celebratory birthday soft drink and dessert treat for my son, which was really nice. Although we were on a high floor, we could still hear music at night from Union Square and noise from a large construction project in the area during the day. This is normal for a downtown hotel. The bed was comfortable and the bathrooms were clean and modern but the furniture in the living room was dated, worn and stained. There were a few minor service issues: when we arrived in the afternoon, there were dirty dishes and garbage outside our room, which were not removed until I mentioned it to front desk staff the next day. I had asked for an early wake up call on the morning of our departure, but woke up early myself and called the hotel operator and asked her to cancel the wake up call after I found out our flight was delayed, as I wanted my son to be able to sleep a bit later. However, she did not cancel the call and he was woken up early by the phone ringing for the automated wake up call.. Overall, the rooms are spacious, and the location is great. If you are not particular about modern furniture or super-attentive service, it is a very good place to stay.

We had a 3 day stay in April.Room was a double double bed room with Union Square view. Looks right across from Maceys. Room was a decent size.Beds were comfy. Bathroom was small but ok.Room clean and housekeeping good.Lobby was nice but was filled consistently with conference guests who took up a good deal of the seating and filled the lifts. Front desk staff business polite. Door staff v nice as were porters. $75 to SFO using black SUV outside if booked through hotel. Uber available ($48) but no one accepted our enquiry for an XL so went for $60 in cab. Location great for Union Square. Powell cable car stop 5 mins walk .Every eatery in SF is expensive for what you get, but there are a number within 10 mins walk. (Be prepared to pay more than you expect )Lots of hotels in about 5-10 minute walk of the square at lower cost. We expected a little more for the cost.

If you are visiting San Francisco for a couple of days than this hotel will please. It is very close to the best shopping San Fran can provide and resturants are right there. The price for Autralian visitors is a little exy especially with children. We had a room with 2 double beds on the 31st floor looking over Union square. Nice view of the water and shopping district. However, the glass door allows wind in and howls up the side of the building all night. The blind shifts against the glass, knocking it gently which can keep you up if you are a light sleeper. The wind noise and entering the room is a little much.

We had a nice experience staying at the Grand Hyatt during a recent getaway weekend in the city. When I visit a town I look for two things in a hotel: a good location, and a clean, comfortable room. This hotel fit the bill. The central location right off of Union Square is ideal, and makes it easy to get anywhere in town either on foot or on public transit. The rooms look like they were renovated in the last couple of years, and are very nicely appointed. Our room was impeccably clean, which was very much appreciated. In all, it was a very nice stay.

Have stayed here the last couple years for a business meeting. Everything is well done. Check-in is easy. Rooms are nice and comfortably sized. Beds are good and rooms are moderately quiet, but could hear folks having a gathering in room next to mine.Meeting rooms are spacious and nice, but in basement so unfortunately lacking any view of daylight. Food service to meetings is great. Buffet service is well done. Bar service is well done, but at big city pricing.

Large, central hotel, unfortunately near by building work taking place destructed a little but a great stay. Didn't stop for breakfast as wasn't sure where this was or how it worked. Great room- view brilliant, room service also good! Great location for walking around SF, and for shopping. Friendly. Knowledgeable consierge.

Our stay was wonderful. The buffet was amazing every single day. Not only was the buffet good, but so was lunch. It was an amazing stay. The location was awesome. It was near many good restaurants, stores, and near China Town( If you plan to visit it). It was a great stay and the service was outstanding. Next time we go to San Fransisco, I hope we stay at the Grand Hyatt.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for four nights. The location is perfect as you can walk to the many San Francisco's fun tourist spots. The fitness room on the 35th floor has a bank of treadmills that overlook downtown to the bay - an awesome view to keep you occupied as you workout. The rooms are quiet and clean. Parking is a challenge ... you can either opt for extremely pricey hotel parking or garage parking across the street at half the price. The only negatives were the room ran hot - even when we turned the air conditioner down - and the bed was uncomforable.

We had a wonderful stay with Grand Hyatt in the heart of the city. Special thanks to Arnold Setiadi of the Front Office who went out of his way to accommodate our needs. We booked a club level double room and asked for a quiet room on the highest floor. Unfortunately we were assigned a room facing the busier road (Union Square). I talked to Arnold when we were checked in and he was able to work with his manager to secure a room on the top level facing the bay for us. He even showed us the room before we committed! The room has stunning views of the bay and was very quiet! It is updated and beautiful. The club level is 32 floor and has good views of the bay as well. As other reviewers said, there were plenty of food choices. Overall, we had a wonderful stay. We will definitely come back!

Stayed here for a conference. The room was very clean with a great City view. The cleaning staff was prompt and did a good job everyday. The hotel also has a restaurant and bar where you can order food and drinks.

We paid up for the concierge floor and a view of the bay.....absolutely worth it. They offer a large variety for breakfast.....eggs, bacon, fruits, cereals pastries, bagel with all the fixings. They also have a happy hour with do it yourself cocktails for $3 or $4, fill your glass as full as you wish. And they have a desert bar in the later evening. And our view was spectacular! We found everyone to be friendly and helpful.

This was a perfect location for museums, restaurants and shopping The friendly staff made the trip special and remembered us each time we returned from an outing. Highly recommend the Grand Hyatt experience.

If you are a Hyatt diamond, this is place to stay in San Fran. Quick Uber to any downtown hot spots and rooms have great views. All staff are nice and helpful, many restaurants and shopping are within walking distance. My fav part is the Grand Club room, which has great hot and cold items for breakfast and offers views of Alcatraz, Coit tower, Sales force tower, etc

Amazing bay views from our room. Great that the window opened a few inches for fresh air. Bathroom was spacious and water pressure was excellent. The room interior was slightly dated, however, the lobby is gorgeous and comfortable to relax in. The staff were friendly, helpful and kind. We were made to feel very welcome.

We had a great 3 night stay at the Grand Hyatt. The bed and breakfast package is fabulous for families. The breakfast buffet was amazing and left our boys happy and well fueled for all our San Francisco adventures. It is a bit of a walk from most family activities (which are located down closer to the piers) but our kids loved exploring Chinatown and there were several great restaurants near by. Our 11 year old was impressed with how "cool" the hotel decor was! The wait staff at the One Up restaurant were fabulous! So friendly and helpful. All in all a great location for a family to explore San Fran!

Not my first stay here, I really like this hotel. It has a great location right by union square, with easy access to most of San Frans top tourist sites. I was here with a conference and the hotel is very easy to work with and the meeting space is very nice. They have meeting/event/general purpose rooms on the top floor that has the most amazing views. The rooms are clean and comfortable. and over all very decent. Pros:amazing locationfriendly staffmodern hotelgood ballroom spacecons:a little noisy and busyWould I stay here again? absolutely. request a higher floor though. This trip they had me pretty low and it was extremely noisy. This isn't my first time here, and I would happily stay here again. I recommend this hotel for work or personal stays.

This hotel is amazing!!!! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good hotel in San Francisco. The view is amazing and the location is in union square so their are lots of shopping and restaurants options within walking distance. The hotel restaurant, oneup, is very good and the service is great. The hotel has an amazing view on the top floor and in the gym. There is also a cable car stop near the hotel.

Great stay would recommend to all rooms great and food guy at checkout was a bit rude everyone else was very kind especially at the restaurant. The views were excellent and if you go to the top floor there is a better view.

My family and I stayed here over our spring break trip to San Fransisco. The coffee bar downstairs was a delight, and the concierge was very helpful, as their map was excellent. The hotel is in a great location, and if you have a car, you have in and out privileges in the parking garage. The only negative was that because there were four of us (2 adults, 2 teenagers), it was very difficult to move about the room in the morning as they are small. There is also only one sink.

This is a very good hotel in a very good locationNo real problems that I could identify Bar is convenient Bar food reasonable but priceyLocation is good for SF MOMACan be slightly noisy at nights but this a big busy and rich city so traffic and construction is never ending, it did not keep me awake thoughAll round I'd recommend this hotel

We stayed for 6 nights and although the room was comfortable it could of been a little cleaner. The service was average - not what you'd expect for a Grand Hyatt. Found the staff to be pretty inattentive.

Wonderful location, nicely appointed facility with nice views, but very thin walls. Loud conversations and toilets flushing from other rooms were very annoying and not what I expected from a Hotel of this caliber.

Our experience in the Grand Club was outstanding. The wine, beer, and cocktails cost less than $5. The staff, Dave, Billy, and Jimmy were outstanding. Thanks guys! The city view was beautiful. The breakfast had hot and cold items. The evening food had both hot and cold items as well.

Great location for work and play. All hotel staff i encountered were very helpful. My room was a little loud (outside noise) but expected in a big city. Suggest requesting a higher floor. One night I ordered late room service, they shared it would take about 30 minutes, to my delight it arrived in about 19 minutes!

Stayed here on a business trip and didn't eat in, so can only really comment on the facilities - all of which were in new, good condition and well maintained. Overall, the hotel is in good shape and incredibly quiet given how many rooms and guests it has. I particularly liked the full size sliding glass doors that open to the narrow balconies. In a sunny ans warm San Francisco day you can open them up and sit and enjoy your coffee in your room, feeling like you're on top of the world.

This hotel is in a great location across the street from Union Square and a couple of blocks away from Chinatown. The subway is a few blocks away. The hotel is old but rooms are nice and somewhat noisy. They even provide earplugs in the rooms. I have stayed here 3 times and will stay again since the staff are really nice and try their best to make you feel at home.

I really enjoyed staying at the Grand Hyatt. It was an excellent hotel in a great location. Modern decor, good service & very close to Union Square & shops. I don't have anything negative to say, I would recommend staying here.

The Grand Hyatt is a beautiful hotel. All of the staff was extremely friendly, providing first-class service. The rooms were very clean and hotel was in a great location, within walking distance to shopping and dining.

Excellent stay. Excellent room. Excellent services. Excellent doormen....except the concierge. Booked for an airport van shuttle for $17 with the concierge lady a day prior my 7 am departure shuttle pick up in the hotel. The lady assured me that she will be be the concierge desk by 7 am the next day. I was ready and by the hotel door by 6:50 am. No van shuttle arrived. I have to mention to doorman Michael my displeasure. He called the Van Express company and my surprise, when they said that I wasnt even in the manifest for pick up. Hyatt did not call them. So Michael, requested the next shuttle which is 7:30 am. What a clear mess up. I dont travel with many loop holes and everything should be rigid and on time. If a hotel promises great services, it should be fulfilled. That's why I chose Hyatt but not anymore after this. Marriott and Hilton will do better. The concierge lady offered $60 cash for a cab and some free breakfast coffee and items. I refused. A cab in SF is worth $80 to the airport with all the tipping and tax etc. $60 really? I was already so upset. I still commend Michael for doing a great job for making sure I get to the next shuttle. This is the cheapest way to the airport but it's the cheapest quality shuttle service this Hyatt can offer. Do not take chance with their shuttle service. With the traffic, I was able to arrive 45 mins prior boarding. Such a stressfull departure.

Positive: nice view, excellent breakfast, centrally location, friendly staff, big bathroomImprovements: room was not always quite especially the night at arrival when music was played outside across the hotel

Excellent service with warmth, and a heavenly suite that I did not want to leave. Location cannot be beat for access to restaurants, fine shopping and access to transportation. Restaurant and room service also excellent.

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco is centrally located and overall, a great place to stay. I highly recommend it for its wonderful dining room, well-appointed sleeping rooms and staff members that truly go "above and beyond" to exceed customer expectations.

Stay at the Hilton. Beds are more comfortable and staff are more accommodating as far as room preference. Requested a room with a view, got a room with a view of a building on only the 4th floor. The Hilton is a little cheaper with better qualities.

Easy to check in. The new world of Hyatt is a mess. I lost access to the Grand Club (their lounge) though I've had access in the past and with lesser points ironically. The customer agent recommended I upgrade to a higher package to continue getting access to the club. The lights in the room did not work. The cordless phone did not work.

The SF Grand Hyatt looks to have been recently renovated and is well located outside of Union Square in a busy part of town. The rooms are somewhat small and awkward and the finishes, while newer, are clearly retrofitted over an old framework. I think the property does its best to put its best foot forward but these older locations are tough to work around completely.Staff were courteous and pleasant and I'd stay there again for business. I wouldn't bring my family to this property as I don't think its fancy enough and the on site eating/relaxing options are mediocre.

The Hyatt is very conveniently located but this property is in serious need of an update. The common areas are nice and the rooms are average and a tad worn. The elevators take a lot longer than normal and the restaurant is overpriced but most hotel restaurants are. The gym has incredible views of the city and is pretty decent for a hotel gym. The staff is mostly friendly and helpful.

With excellent customer service, superb facilities and a welcoming, friendly and responsive staff, Grand Hyatt has earned repeat customers. Great food at One Up; spacious, fully-functioning fridge in room, bottled water provided on request. Beds were fresh, really comfy, cleaning staff consistently did an excellent job.

We have originally booked Hyatt House Belmont for San Francisco stay but as they didn't provide us with the room we had booked, we decided to move to Grand Hyatt as the lady who dealt our booking confirmed we were going to stay at connecting room. But the rooms weren't connected and the receptionist didn't explain or apologised about it. We were very tired already so stayed but really annoyed as my daughter and her cousin were in the separate room. We were visiting US from Turkey and my sister and nephew were visiting from Japan so staying at two bedroom suite or connecting room means a lot to us. Next day they moved our room to the connecting one but I ended up changing rooms three days in a low. Not happy about that.Aside from that, location is pretty good for shopping, street car, cable car and sightseeing. Also the view from the room and the club lounge was superb.

Stayed in San Fran for 3 nights in February with a friend. Concierge was helpful and friendly offering us suggestions where to get some dinner (arrived in at 7pm). Room was of a decent size with comfortable beds and a decent bathroom. Location to Union Square was fantastic. The price compared to other hotels in the same are was great as well, I'd definitely stay again.

I didn't feel welcome at the hotel when arriving there. The room was a bit shabby and the air conditioning loud and noise, I couldn't use it to sleep. The room was totally overprized - May be my expectations were too high for such a property. The disappointment even more... the bred was old and hard from the room Service. The only good thing about the hotel is the Location, but I would never come back

The hotel staff here does an amazing job, from the check in staff, to the cleaning staff, they all have great customer service and do a great job. Great location(downtown) and easy to get uber to other locations in the city.

We were return guests. Found location to be Very convenient, staff friendly, excellent food and club room amenities. Parking was available across the street at a reasonable rate. Will definitely return the next time we visit San Francisco!

This is a beautiful, central location to stay in San Francisco. Our room had a great view of the bay and of the square. The staff was very helpful, especially the concierge, Joanna, who arranged several tours and made great recommendations for meals and how to get around the city. Our room was beautiful and immaculate. Great coffee bar in th morning. FYI - there is a charge for morning coffee and other snacks. The food in the restaurant is delicious. I would definitely recommend this hotel for vacation or a business meeting. Thank you!

we have stayed there for the second time love the concierge floor the location is very convenient we rented a car for one day to hike in Muir woods Enterprise delivered the car to the hotel and it was super convenient

I was here with work attending a conference at the Moscone West centre which is about a 10 minute walk away. If you ask for a high floor the views from your room are great. Staff were very helpful and efficient.

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Staff very courteous. Very central to where I needed to go. Easy, walking distance from Bart Station. Was not use to hearing sirens during the night. But that's city life. Unable to comment re: the food. Always fresh water and a refreshment in the lobby. Walking distance to the financial district. Everything was clean, well kept. Would stay again!

Great location, great service and lovely room - upgraded to a king room which had a spectacular view of the city and a super comfy bed and pillows! As it was my birthday, the hotel staff treated us to a complimentary bottle of wine and strawberries, which was such a nice touch and really appreciated! Only negative would be that the bathrooms are not great, poor shower in the bath and could do with upgrading in our view and the bar was nice but lacked atmosphere and again was expensive but it's SF and Union Square, so I guess that's just normal. Would stay here again, as we were able to walk everywhere and we did - so if you are looking for a good base and somewhere comfortable to sleep, then this is a really good choice!

Visited the city for a conference at the mascons center and had a pretty packed schedule. Hotel was within walking distance to great restaurants, the conference center, as well as the embarcadero.Best part was escaping up the elevator to a small bit of tranquility. Looking out the window you can see all the hustle and bustle, however it never reached inside the room.

I was looking for somewhere to stay while we were in town for Hamilton musical. Although there were many options available for this particular weekend, I selected the Grand Hyatt because of it's central location and the Romance Package they offered. This particular package included champagne and chocolate covered strawberries, and breakfast either at the hotel restaurant or room service, with a late checkout of 3PM. The package came out to be a tremendous value for an excellent hotel. From check-in to check-out, we felt that we were treated like valued guests. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I will definitely stay here again.

Room was disappointing. No Grand here. They should do a video chat with the Grand Hyatt in Orlando. Not worth the money. I have stayed at other highly rated San Francisco hotels and there is no comparison.

Was told upon check-in that our requested view of east side of hotel was granted and that we would be on the "quiet side" of the hotel. We got a room on the opposite side of what we requested and there was jack-hammering in the street below our room. Bed topper had small holes in it that allowed feathers to escape and I had tiny feathers in my hair when I woke up the next day. I had to use the earplugs provided by the hotel to even attempt sleep due to the jack-hammering and bag pipe playing in union square. And we were on the 33rd floor and could still hear the noise on the so-called "quiet side" of the hotel as we were told by our check-in person. We stay here many times during the year but did not feel appreciated at all this stay.

Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, we reserved a top view room. Great time spent here, room was comfortable and service was good. They did take a while to get our room ready about an hour or so. The hotel is pretty central, lots of shops near by.

Easy to get checked in> Parking lot across street, charged to hotel, before getting checked in so easy! Great view. World Class Shopping, Dining, China Town , Harbor walking distance from hotel. Staff quick, smart, intuitive, Highly recommend. Has a gym that looks out over the bridge- makes for astounding workout-it is on 35th floor. View from top floor incredible!

My boyfriend and I stayed at Grand Hyatt in Union Square during St. Patrick's weekend, which we didn't even know about. From where we were dropped off by the taxi, the hotel seems nowhere to be found due to lack of signage showing "Grand Hyatt". Mind you, the hotel is located in a very busy intersection so you can get easily get distracted. I recommend branding the hotel from the main entrance point of view, too. However, I noticed OneUp in the main entrance. As we walk in, we were helped and welcomed by 2 gentlemen, whom I unfortunately forgot to recognize. We waited for maybe 5 or so minutes until helped by the front desk. Our front desk was Michaela and she was very delightful and professional in her demeanor. No dull moment! The room was pretty fancy, to say the least! The only downside is that, there were cobwebs underneath the bathroom sink, a stain in our bed and another permanent red stain on the automatic curtain. The first night was superb, but the night after that, the noise from the next door neighbor was annoying (considering we marked "quiet room" as our request when we made the online reservation). We called front desk (Michaela picked up) and was offered to be moved, since we have a lot of luggage, she just sent a security which greatly helped to quiet down the neighbors next to us who were loud and obnoxious. Overall, the experience was amazing! It seemed like a short stay, but definitely memorable and positive. I wouldn't mind staying in this hotel and I will definitely recommend this facility to my friends and others!!! :)

This hotel is right next to the Union Square, the new Apple store and in walking distance of the Moscone Convention Center (5-6min walk). Also Market Street is just down 2 blocks. Really great location.Rooms are modern and newly renovated. Staff is very friendly and helpful.The gym is a bit basic and a pool is missing. If you look for a 5-Star experience you need to move to the Hyatt Regency a bit further down town.

We stayed at quite a few Hyatt poperties back in the 90s then went to Sofitel, Intercontinental, Westin & Marriott. We decided to stay at the Park Hyatt Dubai and Hyatt Regency London - the best stays ever - both pretty amazing!We decided to use the accrued points for a stay at the Grand Hyatt SF - no comparision to the other hotels. No soul, no personality, the room was on the 24th floor and very minimalistic and dusty. When we got the bill under the door it also included another bill for the room next door - when I brough ti to reception - no apology - gave the impression this is a common occurence! Thanks goodness it was free!We are going back to Intercontinental San Francisco - much higher class hotel in SF!

Right on Union Square and next to the new apple store you find this huge hotel. If you book "Grand Club" you will enjoy the most marvellous view of San Francisco during your free breakfast at the Club. The hotel is what you have to expect from the Hyatt chain of hotels. You pay for excellence regarding service and that is what you get. We most enjoyed being able to discover the city by foot. We found 65 USD rather steep to have your car parked over night, but that seems to be the price you have to pay for sleeping downtown.

Good location near all transport, shopping etc. Clean rooms with good views, just noisey from inconsiderate neighbours and doors banging throughout the corridor. There are plenty of restaurants and places to eat, the tram is a three minute walk and the hop on hop off buses are behind the hotel at union square.

My family and I stayed her for 4 nights during our spring break. We upgraded to a VIP suite and club which was well worth it! We had a huge room with large sitting area and perfect view! Our room was quiet and clean! Our favorite part of our whole trip was the Club breakfast, snacks, appetizers, and drinks. Wow, the service from the staff (especially Ben and Dave) was top notch. No wait at elevators and centrally located. Highly recommend!

Grand Hyatt is clean, great views, friends staff. Sometimes you can hear other patrons in the hallway or even above you but for the most part it's relatively quiet. I stay here for work and the lounge is a wonderful feature (although their coffee is anything but desirable, especially in SF).

The Grand Hyatt hotel is located in Union Square. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are fabulous, large and comfortable. For a small extra charge when available, it is worth upgrading to one of the top floors as the views are spectacular. Breakfast has an excellent selection of fresh food.

Booked a standard room at hyatt.com and went for an upgrade to exec/suiteCheckin: Easy. Checkin at 3pmCheckout: Standard, OkRoom: Huge room incll. separate living room and second bathroom. 29th floor, view a bit boring. Bed was fine, should be ok for good sleeping. AC fine. Furniture a bit worn. Room was super noisy due to elevator. Not possible to sleep without ear plugs.Location: Easy to walk from/to BART.Overall: Doormen perfect. Checkin/out ok, Hotel seems to be overrated, but you get what you pay for. Seems that the price difference to St. Regis or Ritz Carlton is well founded. Not sure if I will come back.

I stayed there for 4 nights for my business trip. I rushed to the airport after check-out, and then realized I forgot my leather jacket in the closet. After sending inquiry, it turned out my jacket was not found and I found out the similar case had happened here. For reference,https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60713-d80999-r311668329-Grand_Hyatt_San_Francisco-San_Francisco_California.htmlI don't want to claim it's stolen but I can hardly think of other possibilities because I am so sure I hanged it in the closet but forgot to pack it in my suicase. My room was tucked away at the end of a hallway, the same as the case above. Maybe this kind of rooms should be avoided. Guests should be careful while staying here and check all your belongings before check-out because you'll be less likely to get them back, even though this is a high-end hotel.

I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Best of all for me was the location set back one block from Union Square. The staff was friendly and the lobby was clean. I felt the rooms were a little small and I'm not a huge fan of shower curtains but but we enjoyed our stay here and I would definitely stay again based on location and price.

Friendly staff upon check in and check out, very clean and great location. Walking distance to great shopping and restaurants. The cable car stop is across the street, so the transportation is easy. I would stay here again and recommend this hotel.

Hyatt's select testing of their Mobile Entry service allowed me to designate my arrival/check-in time so I could head straight to my room and use my iPhone to unlock the door. Centrally located with clean and comfy rooms; hard to stay elsewhere.

Noisy corridors with slamming doorsLate in the night..... two nights in a row.Rooms are clean and spacious withall the amenities expected of this type of hotel. Close to all the shopping and minutes from Fisherman's Wharf.A good choice with a pleasant staff

We booked the Club level room and it was well worth it, great view and nice to have breakfast included.Perfect home base for visit to SF. Close enough to walk to many locations but you will need cabs too.

I attended an unrelated conference at Hyatt SFO--but I also am in the hospitality business. I found service to be excellent, staff friendly and eager to help. Concierge services made wonderful suggestions. Room was very nice and had a great view. I had a 5 star experience in the city.

I had a great trip, the location is really ideal! Our room was clean and comfortable and we had a great view. The concierge helped set us up with a great tour to Muir Woods, she was very nice and helpful so it was a pleasure working with her. She even gave us advice on restaurants and take away in the area. Overall the stay at the hotel was great, my only complaint would be that the toilet paper was of very poor quality and for 4 star at those prices you would expect all the amenities to be 4 star but that is just a little thing.

I don't often stay at Hyatt properties, and quite rarely at their higher-end ones. But this was the hotel for a conference I was attending, so it was chosen for me by my company. From check-in, to dining, to check-out, the experience here was fantastic. Check-in personnel accommodated my wacky room preferences, and while the breakfast in the restaurant on-property (OneUP) was a little spendy, it was delicious and professionally served. My guest room was simply superb. The layout was nice, the space well designed and open, the bed comfortable, the environment quiet. Even the bathroom was pleasant, with lots of room, and nice amenities. I really liked the modern design of the room, and in fact, of the entire property. Since I was here for a conference, I can even confirm that the meeting spaces were quite nice. My only criticism of them is that they are below-ground, so you need to come upstairs to get some sunlight, but it's not like there are windows in most above-ground convention spaces, so a bit of an unfair comment.In any case, a very pleasant stay in a very pleasant hotel, and one I'd not hesitate to recommend.

Although the hotel is reasonably priced, the food is far more expensive than it should be. On the other hand, San Francisco restaurants are little better. The hotel is situated in a great part of the city, the staff is very welcoming, and the hotel is modern and beautiful.

Very helpful and friendly staff, comfortable beds, clean and quiet. beautiful view of the city from my room that I enjoyed while just having a coffee and enjoying the view in the comfortable chair and foot rest next to the glass Sliders in my room

I have stayed here many times, for both business and vacation, and I love everything about this hotel. Sometimes the price of rooms prohibits a stay, but I always try to figure out a way. The convincing things are the friendly staff, the clean, uncluttered dÃ©cor, good food, and the perfect location for shopping, walking, transportation, and all the energy of downtown.

My wife and I enjoyed a weekend getaway at the Grand Hyatt SF. The hotel is conveniently located on Stockton off Market just north of Union Square. The hotel was updated a few years ago and has a warm modern theme throughout. We chose a 2 Room/ 2 Bathroom Mini-Suite on the 26th Floor. The room was extremely comfortable and the views were spectacular. The Grand Hyatt SF is our San Francisco hotel of choice !!

The Grand Hyatt is well located near Union Square, the shopping district.Our room was clean and spacious and the bed very comfortable.Good water pressure in the shower.Great service from the staff, especially the door staff.

The Grand Hyatt is located in Union Square and is very close to a ton of stores, BART, and Chinatown. My favorite part about this location is Boba Guys is right down the street! Rooms are surprisingly pretty big. I stayed at another hotel just a block away from the Grand Hyatt almost 2 years ago and it was much smaller. I didn't realize that most of the rooms are connected until I talked to one of the front desk agents. While he reassured me there was no way that the guest in the next room would have access to my room, he graciously moved me to a non-connecting room. I have a tendency to forget a lot of things when I pack, so it was nice that I was able to request for some amenities and that a hotel staff could deliver it to my room within 10-20 minutes. A little pricey, but I do recommend staying here, especially if you're a solo traveler who is looking to stay in a safe area.

Generally a nice place to stay. The location is very convenient to everything. My room was just fine. Still, I didn't feel like I received Hyatt typical room set up for frequent guest as in others. Restaurant service and food excellent

We enjoyed the location, pretty easy drive from the airport (at non rush hour times for us). We found many great locations to shop and dine easily within walking distance. Valet is expensive anywhere of course.Staff was great, breakfast was very good, open kitchen, better than average buffet, even for a Hyatt.One tip, pay the little bit extra and get the Executive Suite, its a really nice room, even for just one or two people.I have stayed here twice within the last month, once alone, once with my family of 4, both times it was terrific. It will be our new go-to place for San Fran visits!

Stayed here for the last night hoorah prior to getting married. Staff was very welcoming and helping. The room was perfect they even had a treat wait for us when we checked in to our room. Will stay again.

This hotel did everything right from start to finish! We were given the opportunity to upgrade our view, and it was worth every penny. We were on the 29th floor and had a Bay View that extended all the way out to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. Near Pier 39 was Coit Tower. To our right was a close-up of the Pyramid Building. The cable cars were conveniently close by. We called room service and told them what we wanted since we didn't see a menu, and the meal was so good that we had it three days in a row! Outstanding service, comfortable bed - highly recommended!

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt in mid-February 2017. The hotel was very clean, the staff very helpful and attentive.My room was ready when I arrived at noon and had everything I needed. We drank in the bar and had breakfast and lunch in the restaurant. All experiences were good. The food was good, the wait staff were quick, and the price was reasonable.

The quite Luxurious hotel is centrally located in Union Square. It is very close to all major Downtown Shops, Cable Cars great Pubs and Bars and Great Food.The Room has the Automatic Blinds from bed.stayed for 2 days in June 2016. pretty good Hotel to stay.

We picked the Grand Hyatt for the location...close to Union Square and walking distance to everything (shopping, dining, Ferry Market Building etc) Our stay was short as we were in the Bay area to primarily for a Sonoma wine tour (more about that in another review) The room was modern, bathroom was clean and the we were lucky enough to have a fantastic view of Union Square. The coffee bar in the lobby was very convenient - it's open early and they serve Starbucks. There are some food options - fruit, bagels (there's a toaster) breakfast sandwiches. There is also a Starbucks right across the street. A big thanks to the friendly bellmen...we had a lot of luggage (most of it wine) and they were so helpful and very efficient getting us loaded and unloaded. The only downside was the thin walls in the hotel room. You can hear everything...and I mean everything. It might be due to the fact that we were an end hallway room but at least the loud guests beside us departed the next day after our arrival. It didn't ruin our stay and luckily we had earplugs.

Easy check in. Very polite and accommodating staff. The bed was very comfortable. Breakfast selection is good at the hotel Restaurant.. Close to all Downtown highlight spots.Was able to get to the hotel using Public Transport from the Airport. Close to cable cars and bus once at the Hotel.

The Grand Hyatt SF is a comfortable hotel located a block north of Union Square and surrounded by a ton of shops. The week I stayed here, the rate was unjustifiably expensive due to low availability at all hotels in the area but the hotel is worth a stay if you find a decent rate. The service in the lobby was friendly and mostly efficient. The gym was adequate with a fair number of machines and free weights. My room had a stellar view and was mostly up to date with a comfy bed. My only complaint with the room was the low water pressure. I thoroughly enjoyed the club lounge which was never crowded and at mealtimes had a great variety of options - one of the better club lounges as far as Grand Hyatts go. The breakfast is excellent and featured bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, cereal, bagels, etc. The evening featured one hot dish such as gnocchi along with cheese, cookies, and more. I found this the best amenity of the hotel. A great place to sit and enjoy the view towards the bay.

Had room 3217. Killer view of SF. Automated blinds/lights from bed. Check in folks were super nice. so-so part of town. Good food in bar. Great roll-in shower. I would go back if I had meetings around there

Trying to be a 5 star hotel but is lacking a few things to make it one of the top notch hotels in SF. Location - 5Right in the middle of downtown SF, most everything you need is in walking distance. If not it's a short cab ride to the wharf. Comfort - 3Noise from the hallway seeps into the room too clearly. Bed and sheets are nice but comforter is a little weathered. Misc - 3Bar and restaurant is fair but a little small. Club lounge is nice and selection of free drinks are plentiful. Not really the hotels fault but smell of weed was so prominent in my room most of the time I was there

The hotel was excellent. It is centrally located and convenient for business. I had my family traveling with me and we were able to be accommodated as well. Overall I have stayed at this hotel a few times and always found it easy to find and a great place to stay

Their computers don't work and you will have a terrible hassle checking out. they will tell you your credit card doesn't work and then after a half hour will say it was their computer not working. It is reasonably located near the Moscone Center but stay somewhere else for good service.

I would have given the Grand Hyatt a much better rating but, unfortunately, the night I spent there was quite stormy. In bed I kept hearing a crackling noise coming from the ceiling that made it impossible to go to sleep. I finally called the front desk and they advised me that this was part of the building's earthquake protection and what I was hearing was the building swaying in the wind. Obviously protecting against an earthquake is critical but there has to be a better way. I have stayed San Francisco on windy nights in the past in buildings that did not make noise. I asked other guests if they heard the same thing and everyone replied the same way: "yes and I did not sleep at all".Besides that, the hotel was fine except the fitness center was far too small to accommodate the guest numbers in the morning.

We arrived shortly after 1pm. There was a problem with the computer system so it took a bit longer to check us in. However, Ron at the front desk was really nice, and another lady came to help us with the check-in. They know that it's for my partner's birthday, and Ron gave us drink coupons and free food, and upgraded us to a bay view room! The view is amazing, and the room is very spacious and clean. So far we're really enjoying our stay, and glad that we chose to stay here. Thank you.

Of the various San Francisco hotels in which I have stayed (including one two blocks away), this is my least favorite. It started with our having a difficult time navigating the practically non-existent valet parking area. The hotel is in a heavily congested area at the intersection of two really busy one-way streets, with absolutely no off-street loading and unloading area. Inexplicably, the hotel's main entrance/valet area isn't even marked -- we drove by it the first time not realizing it is the hotel's main entrance, and had to navigate through several blocks of heavily congested traffic all over again to circle all the way back around and try again. After finally getting the car squared away, the reception area was nice enough, but in an effort to be modern looking, it also was a bit disorganized. There was no formal queue as such, and people kept cutting in what should have been the line. The room itself was a disappointment. I have stayed in a number of Grand Hyatts around the country and typically find them to be a significant cut above the standard Hyatt or Hyatt Regency, but did not get that impression upon entering this room. It was small, the ceiling relatively low, and the furnishings felt anything but upscale. The bathroom likewise was on the small side and seemed more like a standard mid-range hotel rather than a Grand Hyatt. The bathroom also did not feel as clean as it should have, with numerous rust stains and other stains in various places. The walls of the guest room were incredibly thin and anything but soundproof. I could hear nearly everything happening in the adjacent room, and assume they could do likewise. I wouldn't even call my wife from the room because I did not feel like I had any privacy. This is downtown San Francisco and rooms can be on the small side, but I have stayed in peer hotels in the immediate vicinity that felt much more luxurious and comfortable. For what I paid, I was disappointed, and likely would not stay here again.

On February 06, we checked into the Grand Hyatt San Francisco, on Stockton St., just above Union Sq. for my wifeâ€™s business meetings in the China Basin area.This was our second stay at the Grand Hyatt, after they had a major refurbishment, and the first was also in February, but a year earlier.The curb area, in front of the hotel was very full and active, but our driver managed to squeeze in, and the bellman was immediately on the spot, to retrieve our luggage. Check-in was very efficient (I still cannot get used to the large table in the lobby, with the reservation agentsâ€™ computers, but the look is very clean, and all seems to be smooth). As we are Hyatt Platinum members, we were upgraded to the 33rd floor. While our room, 3323 had good views, the weather precluded viewing much.The room was fairly spacious, and the dÃ©cor, while modernist, was attractive. This room was very similar to the one that we had on the 25th floor, in 2016. There is a sitting area, then separate bathroom with a glass-door closet in the connecting hallway. While an individual room, the layout makes it seem as though itâ€™s a suite. The King bed was very comfortable, and my wife appreciated the walk-in shower. The bathroom had a frosted glass â€œbarn door,â€ù which some might not like, but being off of the little hallway, did not present a problem. The room featured a desk, with adequate charging outlets for our devices, and a flat-screen TV.Being Platinum members got us into the very nice Lounge.The hotel is very conveniently located, being one half block from Union Square. It is located in a fairly flat area, so no major hills to negotiate. On our previous stay, there was a great deal of construction on both Stockton, and the Apple Store, next door. Even with a west-facing room, on the 25th floor, noise from the construction could be heard. That is all now history, and all was quiet in this room. Unfortunately, the exterior of the building was being cleaned, so there were scaffold units, and plastic sheeting over many surfaces, but these were only visual issues, and not one sound was heard from any work.As always, the entire staff was excellent, and made us feel very welcome. We enjoyed the stay, and will return.

We had a great 4 night stay at the Grand Hyatt. Our room was very nice! I am a clean freak and I search a room VERY thouroughly before I set my bags down. The room was exceptionally clean and met my unrealistic expectations. The linens on the bed were stain free and the towels actually did not scratch my skin. My husband and I went and hand drinks in the restaurant one evening and the bartenders were great!!

Our check was so fast, all of the front desk people were very friendly and made the check in process extremely fast. One of the ladies saw we had children and sent us up some cookies and milk for them - that was so nice. We were on the 19th floor and had a great view of the city. Our room was very nice, clean and comfortable. All the bellmen were very nice during our stay and the concierges were amazing with their recommendations. I wish the 36th floor bar wasn't closed. We did sneak up there and look around at the amazing views, but it would be nice if there were a restaurant or bar up there. This hotel is in walking distance of many fine stores and restaurants. I would definitely come back.

I was attending a conference and my wife decided to join me. I was lucky enough to get a room here as all the other hotels were sold out and/or had extremely high rates that my employer would not reimburse me for. Somehow I lucked up and got this hotel at a decent rate and they did not disappoint. Everything from the staff to the location to the room itself fit our needs.

We weren't quite sure how the hotel was going to be for us since we were traveling with an infant but it turned out to be great. The housekeeping staff made are room more than infant friendly. They provided us with all of our needs just like were we're at home. If traveling with kids just let them know ahead of time and they will make the stay easier. Located across from a Starbucks which never had a wait, next to a McDonalds if you need an easy quick bite to eat and across from a CVS if you need anything else that you may have forgot at home. Overall a great stay.

The walls were paper thin. It sounded like the people next to us and the ice machine accross the hall were in the room with us. We wound up requesting a new room after the people next to us kept us up all night. They were not especially loud, just talking all night long and we could hear every word. The matress was uncomfortable. The shower had weak water pressure that often loss the hot water. I'm also pretty sure i saw two homeless people sleeping on the sofa in the lobby

The Grand Hyatt in San Francisco has been nicely updated, to what is already a prime location next to Union Square shopping district in San Francisco. Walking distance from a variety of shops and restaurants and nearby transportation options across the city.

About five days prior to arrival, I received a kind email from the great experience manager of the Grand Hyatt (Andrew Kim), anticipating our arrival and asking if there was anything we needed in advance. In my response, I mentioned that we would be arriving at 12:30 pm from a long flight from the East Coast and if he could note a request for early check in for our two adjoining rooms if possible, and to provide a list of GF restaurants in the area. Within 24 hours, I received a response from Mr Kim telling me he would do his best to accommodate our early check in and a second email from Anne Sullivan, a concierge at the hotel, with GF restaurant suggestions. Very impressive start -- and we had not yet arrived. From the moment my family arrived, we were greeted warmly by the valet, bellhops and front desk. Steve checked us in and was incredibly nice. Our rooms were in fact ready for us ahead of scheduled check in time. And when Steve learned that we had a birthday celebration, the hotel sent wine and strawberries with chocolate sauce to our room. Our rooms were tastefully appointed, clean and well lit with super comfortable beds. The hotel lobby had a warm beautiful design and modern decor with fireplaces and tvs. It's location was ideal to many tourist attractions and great shopping (to which we did not avail ourselves). The concierges were helpful with restaurant suggestions and driving instructions. I would definitely return to this hotel, largely because of the exceptional service we received during our two night stay. My only one complaint was the steep overnight parking fee.

The hotel wasn't at the standard level of service and value. Even though the hotel was renovated recently but the quality of materials used to renovate was cheap. Very expensive for nothing. No value for money. Not recommended.

This was my first time in San Francisco and when travelling, Hyatt properties are one of the properties I try to stay. This Hyatt property is a great oasis while in San Francisco, first and foremost is the location. The hotel is right downtown and therefore near the shopping areas. This is particularly convenient on days when it rains. In addition, you are close to the cable cars to Fishermans Wharf, Market Street, short cab ride to Castro, and Chinatown is a 10 minute walk. It doesn't matter how great the location is if there isn't an exquisite staff to man the property. Every employee that I encountered at this hotel was wonderful but I need to call out the manager of the guest lounge on the 32nd floor. This gentleman is an asset, he is charming, well knowledge and knows customer service. The lounge was overflowing on weekend I was here but he gave individualized attention to everyone. In addition the lounge is well appointed and comfortable. The evening cocktails and hordeuvres was almost like a meal, the continental breakfast was more of a full breakfast. If you need to get a workout in while here then the Gym will not disappoint you, though small it is jam filled with all the equipment one needs, including a Smith Machine. If running is on your schedule then the hills here will really give you a workout and running along the wharf will visually stimulate you as well. All in all this is a great property for the price.

Stayed here for 1 week in November with Family. I booked the 1 bedroom suite with adjoining room, turning it into a 2 bedroom suite with 3 bathrooms. The suite had lots of space, well appointed and had beautiful view of the city. Really enjoyed our welcome amenity in the suite of Cheese Board and Craft Beers. Used the Grand Club lounge daily. It has good spread of food for breakfast and afternoon snacks. The views from the Grand Club are also amazing, overlooking the harbor. Enjoyed the location, right at union square which made for easy travel around the city.

Everything you want - great service, fantastic views, great location and great food.I was checked in by a charming local gentleman who gave us an fantastic room with a view overlooking union square.The room was faultless.I lost my charger on the way to the hotel, a quick call to concierge and one was delivered to my room to borrow.Great location, you can walk to all the different districts of the Bay Area, or a short taxi ride can get you there in no time.

We stayed on the 27th floor and we Loved the view! We got the Romance Package so it came with the champagne and chocolate strawberries. Breakfast and also late check out was very much needed. Everything was beautiful. Check in was fast, staff were very friendly. Ordered my boyfriends birthday cheesecake a little before the restaurant closed but they were kind enough to bring it fast with a candle and matches. Breakfast was yummy. We ordered the mission st breakfast burrito and the corned beef hash. We're coming back for sure and I'd definitely recommend Grand Hyatt to anyone who asks.

I highly recommend staying at this Hyatt location for several reasons. The staff, rooms, food and cleanliness were all outstanding. Better than the norm and we really enjoyed our stay in San Francisco.

Had a lovely one night stay in a VIP suite overlooking Union Square. The Grand Club lounge had a really nice spread for breakfast and the most/best drink choices I've experienced in a hotel executive lounge. Food quality was high and selection was more than enough. The view from the lounge was pretty impressive as well. The location is very central downtown SF surrounded by shopping. The Nike store diagonally across the street had some nice, exclusive items and there's high end, shopping all around from Paul Smith to Rimowa to Neiman Marcus. Went to a wonderful seafood restaurant nearby called Farallon which was recommended by the concierge. Delicious, locally inspired and sourced food.

The hotel overall needs to be updated. The price to value was poor and one should look at other options within San Francisco before committing to a reservation. When checking in try to not get a corner room; ask for something that has a view towards the water. The location is good and convenient to most attractions.

This hotel was a wonderful surprise with well appointed rooms and outstanding service. When we mentioned that we were there to celebrate our daughter's birthday, they sent cupcakes to our room! Request a high floor room, and you'll get an expansive view of the city and Bay. The location is excellent, right on the Cable Car line. The only thing I'd mention is if you get a bed with two rooms, the beds are only full size, so it's squishy for two folks to share one. If you're tall, ask for a room with a king or queen.

Came up for Chinese New Year parade. This hotel has the best location since the parade goes right by the hotel The staff is terrific. Really enjoyed our stay. The hotel needs some updating I have stayed here before and will return. The other positive about the location are the proximity to Union Square and shopping. The is a Starbucks right across the street.

Ok place to stay if they have a special room rate offer. Clean rooms no complaints & good service as well. Only complaint is that bath room was dated and not really 4 star. Bathrooms are older with tub and shower curtain like you would find in a budget motel. Sink in bathroom was a "post modern" attempt at "design" Water splashed and it was a nuisance. No luxury in the bath . I would stay here again but only if the rates were a good offer. Great location on Union Square is the main attraction. Ok, but a not a "special" experience.

The food is not great, and very overpriced, the prices of things, at least when I was there, were labeled incorrectly leaving me with a $30 bill for salad and water, not okay. My room was dirty. I moved rooms twice and both were extremely noisy. It was not worth the nightly expense.

Fantastic location for a SF getaway. Staff was attentive and made the visit very enjoyable. We had a suite and it was very comfortable for a group of four. Room was very clean, spacious and quiet. We were at hotel during Chinese New Year parade and even with all the craziness surrounding the hotel, it was great. The hotels close proximity to Union Square was perfect. We came for East Bay and took BART in to city. Getting off at Powell street station it was a short walk to Hyatt.

Check in was seamless and very accommodating. Rooms were clean and updated. Perfect for couples and families. We were there for Chinese New Year. Would highly recommend and will definetly stay there again.

The hotel crew, the room, everything was great. I went for a business trip and It was amazing. The only concern I had was because I stayed close to the Staff Room and I had problems with the noise, but I didn't complain about that so I don't know if they would have moved to another room. The location is the best, way better thn Hilton for example. It's right close to Union Square, in the same sidewalk as Apple store and walking distance to other stores and Westfield mall.

For a union square property, this place manages to create an oasis within the city. From the check in through the checkout process they have nearly perfected the hospitality. The club room was well equipped as was the club lounge. The staff was very attentive and the atmosphere was great. The only two things that I feel the hotel could do better was not to charge a meagerly $3 for a glass of wine in the club room. No other hotel that I have ever stayed at anywhere in the world charges for the wine in the club lounge. Seating in the lounge was a problem because of the number of people. Again, something the hotel should look into. But the property has been updated and it is fresh.

We found the staff attentive and efficient. Enjoyed breakfast and dinner in the OneUp dining room. Very convenient location in Union Square. There was always someone available to get a cab, provide umbrellas, get a car for the airport.

I would definitely stay at the Grand Hyatt Union Square again. Very reasonably priced for a 5 star hotel. We used our points to upgrade to the club rooms. The lounge was small but decent. Rooms well sized and pleasant, location good, staff helpful.

This hotel met all requirements and expectations. The room was a good size with a window the whole size of the wall so it was bright with a great view over the city (we were on 25th floor). Everything you'd expect in a 4 star city hotel was there. The location of this hotel was excellent. It is right beside an apple shop and the other side of that is Union Square where you get city tour buses, etc. Macy's is just across the square and there are restaurants within a few minutes walk in any direction. There is a breakfast shop each morning in the lobby where you can get coffee, fruit, croissants etc. The concierge is most helpful. Check-in is easy and efficient. The only downside we experienced were the doormen who are fairly inefficient and careless ( at best!)

Enjoyed long weekend at Grand Hyatt. We used Diamond Upgrade to the Deluxe Suite which was like an apartment with over 900 sq feet. Views were spectacular with Knob Hill and Alcatraz in site. Living room comes with sofa, wine bar, and personal Apple computer. Bedroom was comfortable with automatic shades in both rooms. Bathroom was large with shower, dual sinks and great toiletries.Gym as functional with great views. It was quite popular around 7-8. Treadmills, elliptical, bikes free weights, a few machines are all available. The club level offers wide variety of menu items for both breakfast and happy hour. Alcohol is on honor system but at reduced cost. Wine was 3.00 each but in my opinion beer/wine should be free. Location is great within 1 block of Union Square and 3 blocks to Market Street. Staff are friendly, check in was fast and rooms comfortable. I would consider Hyatt again for my next visit.

A great hotel at a great rate. Perfect Union Square location. Room is fresh and clean and has great views. Bed are firm but very comfortable, quality linens and both soft and firm pillow choices. The green tea and cucumber toiletries were pleasant start each morning. Front desk was amazing. Literally saying yes to very request. As a bonus, the Chinese New Years parade went literally around the hotel. I could watch some from the room, some from the street, some from the bar. And another bonus, the hotel share a great communal area with the Apple Store. And free wifi!

I can't say enough about this hotel, it was fantastic! The staff were incredibly friendly- so approachable and eager to help- the room had an excellent view and the building itself is centrally located so pretty much everything is within walking distance. I would recommend this hotel to all.

The ambiance is lovely. The service and rooms are great. The location is excellent. The food is expensive and with all the extra taxes and charges exploring options outside the hotel makes sense. The business lounge is very nice but the food choices could be better. I have stayed at this chain overseas which are better in terms of the food.

This is a great hotel, which I'm very happy to recommend. The location is superb being right on Union Square so very close to shopping and an easy walk to the financial district. The rooms are modern and clean but still with a sense of warmth and style - really like foyer too with the fire places, couches and leather chairs. I had a view room on the 30th floor with water and Bay Bridge glimpses. The rooms are a decent size with good desk space for working and the gym on the 35th floor has excellent views. I couldn't fault the service from the front desk, doormen and bell staff who were all very polite and helpful. I did experience some of the creaking that others have mentioned from the building swaying in the wind but that and the rain didn't dampen my experience.

Superb location, nice rooms but best of all was the incredibly friendliness and can do attitude of staff. Superb! Also being a Gold member gave access to the Lounge that was well equipped with once again very friendly staff.

This is my 5th stay in San Fran at this time of year but first stay at the Hyatt. The room has creaked constantly all night as the building has been built to sway in the wind. Every joist in the room squeaks. ALL NIGHT Front desk won't move me to quieter room as they say all rooms are noisy. I've got to tolerate another 3 nights of this and front desk have only offered me ear plugs. I'll go back to the Hilton next time. At least you get a good nights sleep.

I had VIP suite on the 34th floor with amazing views of the city! The staff was very welcoming and very accommodating. Definitely worth every penny I paid. Only disclaimer is the parking ($45 a night) is contracted to a parking garage, and not connected to the hotel, made luggage logistics a little tricky. But I would still come back!

Why stay anywhere else? Best combination of value, comfort and superb service. We stayed here as an overnight enroute from Cincinnati to Hawaii.we had special needs due to some medical requirements and the staff were exemplary in assisting us.

The hotel was comfortable and the staff friendly and the location great. If you want tranquility then you're never going to find this downtown so aim for a room above the 20th floor to get the best compromise. The view from the viewing room on the 36 floor is impressive.

I was really impressed with the size of the room for San Francisco given the price. Plenty of bathroom, closet, and work space. Lots of outlets on the desk and near the bed. Soundproofing was good even with a connecting door. Northern view from the 15th floor was pretty good, and I'm sure would be spectacular from the 25th and up. The doormen and bellstaff were courteous and helpful in providing information. I'm not crazy about the union square area, but if you are, this location couldn't be beat. it was still very easy to walk to financial district as well as the 2 very close BART stations. Never had to wait for an elevator. Never had to wait long on the phone to get to an operator. Great experience and I do reccomend!

Good location, but building functionality need to be upgraded. Room sound insulation- a major problem, Bathroom sink allow splashing all over vanity counter, Elevator waiting time slow, Grand club small for the hotel. Lower level meeting room traffic interfere's with hotel room guests.

I have again and again stayed at Grand Hyatt in San Francisco and I never get tired of that perfect located hotel. Always a friendly welcome and even it is a hotel with many rooms, you still feel a cozy atmosphere. The rooms are very, very nice and I think all have a great view. Even if I try, I canÂ´t find things I want to be better. If you want to spend a little bit more, purchase access to the Lounge on the 32nd floor - it is worth it. Lea

To be honest I've been unimpressed with most hotels in S.F. and I've stayed in quite a few. My expectations of the Grand Hyatt were modest, after all the Hyatt Regency failed to impress me a few years ago, so I expected the same or less from the Grand Hyatt. The truth was the property impressed from the first moment - literally - the doormen made you feel welcome upon arrival, a feeling that continued to check in and to the room. The room itself was average size, what I liked though was that the hotel while tall has a very small footprint, so no long hallways. All rooms are 20 steps from the elevator core. Back to the room, as said, average size but obviously decorated recently with some very nice touches. Bathroom was larger than usual and very nicely decorated in marble and tile. Nice, very nice. WiFi was only so so but the wired network was reasonably fast for actual work.Breakfast everyday was at the very small One Up which served a very nice buffet though the price was an eye watering $25 pp. Not sure I'd say it was worth all that. But that's a nit. The hotel is a block off of Union Square, a great location. This will be my go to hotel in San Francisco for the future not only would I go back, but I look forward to doing so.The hotel does not have parking, but there is a large public garage diagonal from the hotel. Valet parking is available, but I'd rather do it myself and save the difference for breakfast.

Nice hotel, but the Hyatt is terrible value. Just short of $500 per night with taxes for a four night stay. Taxes are about 20%. Much better values closer to Moscone Center and less expensive. Room prices really changed with a reservation change so beware.

This is our second time staying here, with the first time being right after their renovation in 2015 I believe. As a Diamond member staying during a weekend when the hotel had lots of available rooms, I was disappointed that I had to request upgrade to a room with Union Square room (instead of just a room on a high floor). Nevertheless, the view is breathtaking, and the room is very comfortable. It is very befitting a Grand Hyatt although far from the best Grand Hyatt I've seen.Front Desk arrangement is a bit difficult to navigate as there is not a separate desk for Diamond/Platinum members so I had to wait in the line a bit to be checked in. The mobile check-in app offered for my stay did not work at all. I think this property has quite a bit of room for improvement if it wants to be a go-to hotel for folks.All in all, the stay was good enough, but not quite excellent.

I was at the Grand Hyatt for a whole business week.The Hotel is of high standard and the rooms at higher levels have a nice view over the bay.Very central and walking distance from the city highlights (SFMOMA, shopping centers, restaurants).

Amazing hotel right next to Union Square. My room was big especially for San Fran standards. The bathroom was nice and modern looking. The staff put plenty of towels which was awesome. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were nice and firm. The service was outstanding. Everyone was so nice and helpful. There is complimentary bottle water at all times!! The best part of this hotel was the amazing gym on the 35th floor. The gym looked out to the bay. Absolutely beautiful views to keep you motivated while working out. Thank you for the amazing stay and I will only look to stay here when I come back.

Front desk staff was arrogant, unhelpful and rude. Room value for the price was deplorable. Overpriced and cheap on amenities. Maid didn't make up the room until late afternoon. We have removed Hyatt Hotels from our corporate list of approved hotels.

This is a well situated hotel, a few blocks from the main tourist/travel/conference (Moscone). However due to construction, it is also not very quiet and not easy to get to. The rooms are excellent, but foyer area is crowded.

We stayed for 4 nights with my family. Room was a disaster and i had to rent the second room since we were 4 and could not fit the room. They forgot to take the laundry once, in the second we reminded reception around 10.00 with the demand of getting the same day. Instead of doing his best, the guy started to teach me that i had to give it at 9.00 to get it back the same day. I reminded him that nobody came to room until 10.00 etc etc. room service never refreshed the sanitary products until being asked (again through reception since they are very difficult to be reached). Reception guy is always trying to teach instead of solving forgetting that i am a diamond member having stayed in many hyatts (and others) worldwide since last 30 years. And so on, and so on. Very snub staff, having no idea about hotel business. They should definitely be sent for orientation to see how other hyatts work, especially in asia.

The location is great, not doubt about that. However there was a few issues which bother me.The bathroom didn't have a door!, only a sliding window and without a lock. I was sharing the room with a co-worker and I didn't get privacy I needed. This turned my stay very uncomfortable.They also charged me for On-Demand movies which I didn't watch.I don't recommend this hotel, you may find something better for a lower price. I have already found better places for less money and in more expensive locations.

Last stop on our whirlwind honeymoon and we had just arrived from Hong Kong tired and grumpy. But Spencer at reception was able to get us in and out and was so very helpful. He also made us feel welcome and special with amenities he provided us. The lounge on the 32nd floor is great too, the breakfast spread is one of the better ones offered at an executive lounge. The only criticism I have of the property is that the rooms are right on top of each other and the wall are paper thin. We were able to hear our neighbors get up at 430 the next morning, blowdry their hair, and listen to their breakfast plans. Earplugs are a must. I would have given it a 3 star review, but the fact that the staff more than make up for it, I can't. That's what you want to see at a dated property, staff that more than makes up for it.

Good on all levels, rooms, amenities, gym, restaurants, location all goodMore in mid town than I would have preferred ( wanted something nearer touristy bit) but then I didn't book it...so fault mine!Would I recommend...? yes for sure - it just depends on what you want location-wise.CL

This hotel met all of our expectations for our family vacation. It was convenient to the BART (three blocks), the cable cars (4 blocks to the turnaround?) and the MUNI (1 block) as well as a few restaurants and lots of shopping. Stay on a high floor if possible. The views are stunning.We also chose to have breakfast and access to the club/lounge on the 32nd floor. This was well worth the price as it also gave us access to a place to cool our heels outside of the room when we weren't running from place to place. They also have snacks, dessert, and an honor bar every night. Worth the $ for sure. Staff was super courteous and check in and out were efficient and easy experiences.

The location is awesome. Great for business or pleasure. Lots of shopping and conveniences, including a Starbucks and 24-hr CVS on the adjacent corners. Hotel rooms are modern and upgraded and the lobby was welcoming. The conference center accommodations were also above average.

I give Grand Hyatt Hotel on 345 Stockton Street 5 stars. Wonderful in house dining and room service dining as well. The room was quite, clean, with all amenities and a great view. If anything was needed the items were delivered. The concierge was very helpful with our requests for museums and special points of interest. Our little group decided on the Walt Disney Family Museum at the Presidio by the Golden Gate Bridge very interesting a wonderful site full of history. I will definitely delve into the many options to explore on the next trip. I recommend as a great place to stay in the middle of Union Square a block behind the main entrance on Powell Street we discovered the best little place of Breakfast and also for fine dining; The Sears family restaurant. The Grand Hyatt is the place to stay we will be back.

We arrived at the hotel after a 14 night cruise to Hawaii we booked this hotel as part of my wifes 70 th birthday treat, but having read the reviews we were looking forward to the stay, we were given a room on the fifth floor with fantastic views of air vents.Went to breakfast the next morning to be greeted by a very surly lady who struggled to speak to us, we had the hot buffet that was cold and not very good .it cost 52 dollars, the waiter bought the bill back because we hadnt put a tip on it.We went to mcdonalds next door for 12 dollars. We found the room cold as the heating didnt work,an engineer came and took the ceiling panels down to fix it.This hotel was on my wifes bucket list as her maiden name was Hyatt and she wanted to sign her name.So we were disappointed after complaining the hotel cancelled our breakfast bill and offered us points off our next stay in a hyatt hotel. But we will wait and see.

Overall all staff in every Dept was very attentive and very nice. Friendly and appear to enjoy to comfort the guest. The grand club was a last minute offer. I just wished I could of controlled myself w the fresh baked good, cakes,etc

Needed a place to stay in SF downtown... Grand Hyatt was reasonably priced through trivago.Service was outstanding which you would or should expect. Gave a free room upgrade when asked upon checkin. They stated they provide this upgrade when they are able. So always ask.Room was spacious well appointed especially the convenient and plentiful outlets etc. room had a great view... EtcWill definitely go back with the right deal!

The room was clean and attractive. It was decorated in a minimalist style, and offered a relaxing place to unwind. The views from the room were beautiful, overlooking Union Square with looks all the way out to the harbor. Within walking distance to many attractions and to public transportation.

Excellent hotel! I was in town for a conference and the Grand Hyatt was one of my first impressions of the city and, it was a GOOD one. My guest room was clean and the staff was super pleasant. The next time I'm in San Francisco I'll definitely being staying at the Grany Hyatt! =)

My husband and I travel a fair amount. We struggled with whether to purchase our nights through one of the many boutique hotels available or a familiar name brand like hyatt. I'm glad we chose hyatt. I was very pleased with the overall customer service (reception, concierge). Our room bathroom was very nice. It had a wonderful little vanity that was great for hair and makeup. The view of the city and shopping from the 27th floor was awesome. Sleep quality was great (linens and pillows were perfect). Ask the concierge for food suggestions. They won't lead you astray. Also, the little breakfast they set up in the lobby was great for grab and go items and opens at 5:30.

Solid hotel with very comfortable guest rooms and outstanding customer service. Good central location. Didn't have time to take advantaage of the hotel's other features, but the bed was super comfortable and slept well!

Using points we opted for the Club level and the benefits. Rooms are on the top three levels with a very nice Club Room and staff. We enjoyed the views, food in late after noon, honor bar, evening desserts and breakfast bar. Room was excellent, rather new, well appointed and maintained. Easy parking across street.

If you are in SFO for a limited time, I definitely recommend staying by Union Square. It is centrally located and walking distance to most tourist sites.
