The Hotel is right by Union Square, which is a very busy area, high end restaurants and shops. Request for a room on the higher level which are recently upgraded and have a good city/bay view too.

I've always loved this hotel! The design and the feeling they give really gets me exited about travel! :D so after years of visiting this hotel and dreaming of staying one day, I Finally did! :D its a very clean hotel, and of course the design is very inspiring and wonderful! I gotta say, if you are a tourist and you traveled long and far to come to this wonderful city of San Francisco, Grand Hyatt SF is one of the best to stay! And a great place just to sit back and relax! (And everything else is taken care for you :) )

Having stayed at the hotel for 8 nights with the family 2 children aged 11 and 8, Iâ€™ll be honest I wasnâ€™t that impressed.Firstly the day we checked in at around 3.30 my wife asked if there was a chance of an upgrade as we were staying for 8 nights and we were told the hotel was fully booked and no rooms available except one other with a rubbish view. Then as we went to our room, the previous guest was in there and had locked it only to use the bathroom. Again, annoying as staff should have blocked his key card from 12pm, the room was made up so clearly he had access all day. Until security checked it we stayed in the room. The room is average for 4 people with not a lot of space for luggage etc. We were however left some fruit and cupcakes when we got back from dinner which Iâ€™m assuming was due to the invasion of our room by the previous guest. The hotel lobby area was decorated beautifully.Considering we checked in on 26th December, I would have thought the hotel would have been in the Christmas spirit and offered guests staying for a long period some sort of gift or something little for the children, but nothing. The hotel was busy for the first few days of our stay due to the local football team staying there, but after a few days Iâ€™m sure many rooms were available and with the amount we paid a real shame we werenâ€™t offered a better room on a higher floor With so many other hotels in SF I would not recommend this one. To be honest having stayed with the Hyatt group in the past, Iâ€™m not sure I will be rushing back to a Hyatt hotel.In terms of cleanliness, the rooms were made up every day, but there was never any dusting done, it was just beds made and clean towels.Biggest plus is location to Union square.

The hotel is situated beautifully in the City and is close to everything. The room was very well appointed and the bed was amazingly plush and comfortable. My only complaint was not enough lighting over the desk

had a great time. We went to SF on a whim to go shopping teenage daughter and mom. Hotel is in perfect location. We had a nice dinner around the corner and night cap for mom at one up. Highly recommend

Stayed two nights in the Grand Hyatt; outstanding service by the doormen and valet. The valet is expensive, as is parking anywhere in SF - but they really worked hard to take care of my needs. The room is a little small, but very nice. The only problem may have been that it was so called those days, that my bathroom against the outside wall was freezing when I took a shower. The bar on the second floor is full of life, and live music - the bartender was great. I would stay here again on my next business trip - looking forward to it.

good hotel in great location. The parking is much too expensive. Hotel is clean an is what I expected I do not want to write any more information This is the reason that I don't review more with trip advisor

Room service very expensive! Hotel parking overnight, very expensive! No coffee pots in the room which forced us to order room service which was outrageous. No pricing on the menu so was very surprised!

Checked into the Grand Hyatt for the first time ever. I have been to SF many times but have never visited this hotel. I had a convention inside the hotel and therefore made the hotel my jumping off point. Great location, amazing staff and the room and the rooms view were amazing! Next time I am back in the city I can see making this hotel my first look.

I flew in to san Francisco and stayed at the Hyatt in Union Square. Epic stay. Classy, upscale, and very professional. The one up restaraunt and lounge was awesome. The grandinner club was very handy for a quick breakfast before sight seeing. View was spectacular. Awesome stay

We recently had a critical corporate meeting planned at Grand Hyatt San Francisco. We had over 175 attendees staying over 5 days. Hyatt team did a perfect job. Their meeting planning team (Particularly Regina Drake) is the best I have ever met.

The room itself was great...well the second one was. The first one the heater was broken and made very loud noises. Clean and comfortable...Lucas at the One Up restaurant they have onsite...fantastic. Simply above and beyond in service. As for the front desk? They authorized my card for over $3000 for a $1000 stay. When asked why that was, they offered no explanation. Just said it was a glitch and "shouldn't have happened." No apology, no compensation. They tied up $3000 of my money, and nothing. I understand that these things can happen, but seriously? No apology or any sort of compensation? After I checked out, another $500 was authorized to my card. What? The charges are still pending. I am assured they will all fall off....but in the mean time, $3500 of my money is on hold. Be VERY careful of this. I have NEVER had this happen to me before and I travel ALL the time. Did I mention my money is still pending? I even spoke to the manager, who eventually apologized....but that's about it.

Stayed 2 nights and this hotel is in a great location, to get out and about in San Francisco. It is within easy reach of Union Square, with great shopping, dining, Chinatown and the Wharf. The rooms are spacious and very comfy and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Wish we had stayed longer as SF is a great place for site seeing and when I return I will have no hesitation to stay at this hotel again.

Rooms are on the smaller size but clean. Everyone nice and helpful. Breakfast buffet was really tasty and good value if you don't want to leave hotel. It rained during our trip and doormen gave us an umbrella before we headed out. CVS right across the street. Easy to get around Union square and Chinatown. Concierge helped with directions to Oakland using BART so we missed traffic and was in time for Warriors game. Definitely will return.

Went for an overnight trip with my mother and daughter. The hotel was clean and in a fantastic location. Across the street from Union Square in San Francisco and all of the stores are within walking distance. Upon arrival the staff was very friendly and gracious.

Most horrible staff attitude ever and severe lack amenities. Despite ordering before check-in, basic amenities like toothbrush and slippers are not provided. When request from staff, they were unwilling to provided and impatient to finish listening to the list of items. In the end, not all were provided. Water has to be requested. There isn't any water provided in rooms. Well, unless you are in the best suites?Information provided by the concierge on tours was also wrong. However, if you just want a nice bed to crash and convenient location, go ahead and stay here.

The Grand Hyatt SF is in a great location just off Union Square. The rooms are modern and spacious. Views are outstanding, especially upper floors facing the Square and the Bay. The Mezzanine Bar was cozy. Service was excellent starting with Anthony at the reception/check in area. The only drawback is the cost for valet. Over $150 for 2 nights, but I guess that is SF. We would definitely stay here again.

If you're going to SFO for a few days of applied tourism, you'll know there's a bewildering number of accommodation options. Rather than go for the low-rise eclectic options down near wharves, we opted for the Grand Hilton near Union Square.This is a nice hotel, as you would expect. The distinguishing features I would mention are a take-away coffee and breakfast bar in the lobby (quicker and cheaper than the breakfast buffet), and housekeeping staff which we found to be very attentive and thoughtful.Location is great. $7 Uber ride (when no traffic) from the wharf district, and one block from Union Square and all the retail activity.There's certainly plenty of homeless around Union Square, but we generally didn't find them aggressive.From the 27th floor we could hear muted traffic noise, but certainly not enough to cause any sleep problems. Great view of the bay disappearing and reappearing through the fog.

Grand Hyatt at Union Square is always a good hotel in San Francisco with its modern spacious rooms. I have stayed here with family also and it's ideally located for both business and family travellers. The OneUp restro - coffee shop is very versatile with its menu. Pro Tip - Request a room with Coit Tower View

Stayed here for business.The hotel is located in the city and very close to big outlets like Macy's and other shopping venues. Malls and restaurants are within walking distance.The hotel is spacious and feels old school with doormen flagging taxis. Loved it,The rooms are well appointed if a little drab. Comfortable enough though with great views.Breakfasts are great with menu and buffet options. They serve the best bacon ever!Room service was good and prompt. I really recommend their pizzas, i was pleasantly surprised.Right next to the Apple store and i think this is a great hotel for both business and vacation!Highly recommended

This property is centrally located in the heart of SF. It is great location to take day trips to see all the SF area has to offer. This is especially true over the holidays. it provides great access to public transportation and cable cars, and it is short walk to Chinatown and many other SF treats.

The Hyatt San Francisco is a typical Hyatt hotel (overpriced for the value). The rooms were standard- nice and kept pretty clean. The location is clutch- right in the middle of union square. However, the check-in process was LONG. First in line, I waited for about 15-20 minutes before anyone even asked if I was being helped. There was one person doing the check-in and the line behind me started building up. After a long flight across the country and a taxi cab from the airport I was finally at the hotel and all I wanted to do was get to my room and relax. On top of that, didnâ€™t seem like any of the staffers really cared about the line either. Other than the poor check-in service, no real complaints (or praises). Overall, it isnâ€™t a bad choice but I think there are equally nice much less expensive hotels in the area that I would suggest going for.

Again the SF Grand Hyatt proves its one of my favorite hotels. Recently had to be in The City for a dinner and did not want to travel back home afterwards. Hotel was decorated for Christmas - looked fantastic. Loyalty works both ways and thats why I have stayed with Hyatt so long. As a life time diamond member - I am always treated nicely but not all the staff knows your status. How you are treated by those that don't know is important - and I can say that the staff is great! From the moment you drive up to departure. I would encourage folks to consider the SF Grand Hyatt if you have not stayed there before. Great location, great rooms and great service.

Hotel is in a good spot for shopping and catching trams (trolleys) right by Union Square (behind Apple store) however it is not cheap and it is very impersonal. Aside from check in and out i did not have a single staff member speak to or acknowledge me in 5 days. The 'doormen' dont even open the doors or help with your bags. The bar is small and usually busy. Rooms are a good size and beds comfy enough. The soundproofing is not good enough if u have a room with interconnecting door, we did with a young family next door. Had to listen to crying and screaming from kids every night and cartoons on their TV the rest of the time.

Stayed here for the first time and it was nice. The roooms are clean and the staff was nice. Vanessa at the concierge desk was very helpful with suggestions on where to dine and what to do. Our first night there she suggested Fino for dinner which is an Italian place next to the saint andrews hotel. It is within walking distance and had amazing Italian food. I would definitely stay here again.

We arrived at this hotel after a long day travelling. The doorman took our bags from the taxi driver and pushed them into the foyer, no offer to take them to our rooms. We were a family of four, ( 2 adult children) requiring a king room and a twin. We booked and paid months in advance. We were told no twin rooms were available, we would get two kings. They offered a rollaway bed! I argued that my 25 year old son would not be sleeping in a rollaway, no success, they didn't care less. We discovered that the hotel was full of college footballers who of course had all the twin rooms, who cares about tourists who promote your city or hotel! It went on, trying to get a drink or some food, a nightmare, 1 and a half hour wait for room service, only option was to go to the bar and eat whatever was available there. Sat down, ignored by staff, bar man too busy talking to another couple to bother with us, finally grabbed a waitress and ordered food. Next day went back to front desk to try to change rooms, after much arguing and a call to our travel agent, managed to get a twin room and an apology in the form of a bottle of wine and cheese platter. But too late to change our mind, every staff member in that hotel was rude, we saw doormen push in front of guests to get in the lifts first, and another bash suitcases against the wall to get into the lift. The only person who showed any friendliness was the doorman as we left, perhaps glad that another tourist was leaving? Only good thing about this hotel......the bottle of lovely Californian wine.

We stayed at the hotel for a romantic weekend in Union Square, SF. The location is perfectly situated for all sorts of activities. Upon arrival, we were met with very professional and courteous front desk staff. The room was very fresh and contemporary with a great view. Can't wait to go back and stay longer!

Modern updated rooms. Convenient to Union Square shopping and restaurants. Friendly staff at the front door and at Check-In. Have stayed at Hyatt Union Square many times, always a pleasant experience.

In the heart of San Francisco within walking distance of shopping and eating. Lobby has three charming living room with fireplaces; especially nice since it was raining all weekend. Suggest staying in the upper rooms to take advantage of the fabulous views.

We loved our New Years stay at the Hyatt. Our room overlooked Union Square which was AMAZING! Christmas trees and ice skating rink. We could hear the buskers from our room which was lovely. We opted to self park at the Sutter/Stockton Garage which is diagonally opposite the hotel. The hotel actually uses this car park for valet. It worked out much cheaper to do it by yourself and not through the hotel. Over the weekend we actually got street parking which was much cheaper on Sat and free on Sunday. There is a McD's at the bottom of the hotel which is good for a cheap breakfast for the kids.

Stayed for 3 nights. The staff was excellent. This hotel is located close to Union Square and walking distance to great shops restaurants and more. Transportation readily accessible for farther distances. Buffett breakfast was good with a wide variety of foods. Room was comfortable but you could hear street noise which is typical for San Francisco.

Nicely located in the downtown SF. Stayed there for four nights. The check-in was quick. The room, bathroom all of that is great and clean. It has a real nice look everywhere. The only thing I didn't like was that there were no quick eating options, especially at odd hours during the day. They have room service but I didn't find much interesting there. There is a Starbucks right across and I ended up going there a lot. That said, there are several restaurants nearby for a take out.There is one odd incidence that I do want to write about. When I checked out, a hotel person at the front door asked me if I wanted a car provided by them and it would cost me the same as a cab. I took that. What they did not tell me was that the car driver had no way to accept credit cards. So I had to run around at SFO to find an ATM. The driver was a nice guy and there was no issue with the cab service but this was an annoying experience.

Room was very nice, staff very accommodating. Restaurant and bar was a little small but food was excellent. Walking distance to Union Square and fine dining. Lots of shopping and sight seeing within walking distance.

I stayed here for a few nights around new year with family and friends.The location is perfect, right in the middle of all the tourist action. The hotel is well maintained and in good order (better than the Westin St Francis, where I previously stayed). The rooms are small but very comfortable.What sets this place apart is the hotel staff. They are extremely helpful and responsive, and will do their best to keep you happy. The free wifi is a bit of a nuisance, dropping out often and having to log in again. But it's quite fast enough for most needs .The food in the restaurant is of high quality. There is also a nice bar on the mezzanine, with bar snacks and sometimes live music. Lovely.I will definitely be going back.

We just came back from staying at the Grand Hyatt for 4 nights over New Year's. It was the end of our family's trip up the coast of CA. We had been to SF before but had not stayed here. It was a great stay. Beautiful views of Union Square from our rooms on the 29th floor. Spacious rooms, comfortable beds, plenty of space for our stuff. Only small complaint would be the loud screeching noise the toilet made when flushed! Oh and one thing the Hyatt should mention to its guests when they are in the city on a Tuesday at Noon: there is a loud emergency signal (sounds like an air raid) they blast in the City as an emergency test. Freaked us out! Sounded like we were being invaded! I called to the front desk and all she said was it was something outside the hotel. This should really be explained in advance to guests. Other than that, a wonderful stay at this hotel, would definitely come back!

We had a enjoyable stay (for 11 nights) in Grand Hyatt Union Square. Our flight touched down at 8pm and we reached the hotel around 10pm. Having flown half a globe (18 hrs flight), we were really tired. Fortunately, the check-in was very efficient. It took us less than 5 mins. The check in staff was courteous and friendly.The hotel is located right smack in Union Square, and it's an easy walk to the Ferry Building, China Town and the Financial district. There are lots of food options around. Pharmacy (CVS) and Walgreen are just steps away. There are plenty of shopping places (incl. Macy's, Bloomingdale, Nordstorm etc.), plenty of luxury brands too.Our room was spacious, clean and bright. I love the king size bed, it is one of the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept on. There are sufficient pillows and power socket in the room, and the complimentary wifi worked well. There was also a coffee machine in the room, which coffee drinkers will definitely appreciate. However, there was no kettle provided.The housekeeping staffs have done a good job. Our room was cleaned everyday by noon.We ordered in-room dining once. The food tasted extremely good. Do note that room service is subjected to a whopping 22% service charge on top of the prevailing government tax and delivery charge. There are some minor issues which I wish could be improved upon:1) The absence of many basic amenities (which are commonly provided by hotels) such as comb, tooth paste and tooth brush, shower cap, kettle etc. You need to call to get them sent to you. 2) The hair dryer was noisy and weak. I think it should be upgraded to better ones. 3) The drawer of our bedside table (both sides) were very hard to pull out. The side tables are also very shaky. 4) Everyday we need to request for bottled water from the reception. Why not get the housekeeping to replenish the bottled water (like many other hotels do)?Overall, Grand Hyatt Union Square is a good hotel. I will stay here again.

Currently staying at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco. A very impressive hotel in a fantastic location. A fantastic room overlooking Macy's in union square. The hotel is very well presented and extremely clean. Great architecture and design that is very pleasing on the eye. All staff are very helpful and the food available for breakfast is top notch. A great gym is available 24/7 on the 35th floor giving fantastic views. Treat yourself to a great hotel.

This is an overdue review. We stayed Club Level and had a room with hardwood floors. If you greatly dislike dingy hotel carpet, you will really appreciate this! The views are awesome and the rooms are very nice and spacious. It is a very solid SF hotel in a good location. There was a small amount of city noise and wind noise from the windows. Again, not a deal breaker but also not as soundproofed as other properties. Did not bother my husband at all, but it may bother an extremely light sleeper.

Good location and very good quality rooms. Not as upscale as you would think. Nothing really negative to say except we had a drain issue in our room and our friends had a A/C issue in theres. Our issue was fixed quickly but our friends issues wasn't. They were comp'd a bit to make up for it. We've stayed at other hotels in the area and will move on to other ones next year. Not a bad experience, its just that we've had better at other locations. Our kids preferred the smaller rooms we've had in the past in exchange for ambiance and extras.

Enjoyed a few nights at this hotel the week before Thanksgiving. I am so glad I upgraded my room to a Bay View as when the fog clears in the morning there is a gorgeous view that you can enjoy on the comfy sofa, by the floor to ceiling window! Not to forget the remote controlled window blind that you can open from your bed!This hotel is very modern and trendy and it's in a great location in SF! You are literally steps away from Union Square and opposite a huge shopping mall. The service at the hotel was very good, and all of the hotel staff were very friendly, from the front desk and concierge to the evening restaurant and I would definitely stay here again because of the location. I have already recommended this hotel to friends and colleagues who are travelling to SF in 2017.

Incredible location, and terrific service all across the board. People were very helpful and friendly. Right next to Union Square, with great shopping, dining and the trolley experience if you want that. Very easy to get down to the Wharf, where you can use as a base for SF tours, etc. Also went to GS Warrriors game and quick trip home, and before that did coastal tour, Stanford and Silicon Valley.

We have a daughter who lives near Napa. So we fly in and out of Oakland frequently throughout the year. The flight form Hawaii lands in Oakland late at night. We stayed at this hotel for two nights prior to visiting our daughter. I noted that you may make arrangements, for a fee, to have the town car pick you us. So, that was what we did. Concierge Liz Baca helped us. She was the bomb!!! Our driver met us at the baggage claim and it was a grand stay from that point on. We are gold passport members and always try to utilize the club floors. This hotel is located right on Union Square, next to the Apple store. Great for SF shopping and dining. Room was recently renovated. And Liz Baca helped us so much. We also had the town car return us to Oakland airport and we picked up our rental car and went on our Napa journey. BTW, the cost for parking at this hotel runs about $75 per day. So that is why we opted for town car pick-up and drop off. We taxied the rest of the stay. We hope the hotel manager will acknowledge Liz Baca. She is very friendly, efficient and has great follow- through. She really made our stay over the top.

I have long been coming to the Grand Hyatt San Francisco in Union Square. There is probably not a better and more central location in the City. While the move towards a more modern hotel in recent years does the property a disservice, the staff more than makes up for this lowering of physical quality. Most of the staff has been there a long time and they are perhaps the most customer centric group you could ever find in a major hotel chain property. Every request is met with a 'can do' attitude and get's done. From an early check in to a last minute request for a king room on a high floor - no problem. Great insulation from outside sounds, good beds and large bathrooms all are positive features of this hotel. The Club Lounge is large and active and services an excellent variety of food and drink. Beer and wine for $3.00, cocktails for $4.00, all come with a wonderful 32nd floor view of the entire City. The restaurant is good and service great. The only downside, from my point of view, is that they have taken away the ambiance of the property, from the larger rooms with beautiful art to the modern lobby that has lost its marble (literally). They have made more rooms with connecting doors which increases internal noise and replaced carpet with wooden floors which also increases internal noise. Helpful security will quiet down loud neighbors, but the noise from floors above can be a problem. Overall, one of the best hotels in San Francisco!

Love the location- by union square (lots of shopping, skating rink ( for the holidays) ) , the atrium was interesting, nicely updated rooms. We were upgraded to a suite and it had such a lovely view! Just perfect for our little getaway !

This is an excellent hotel. I have stayed here at least 10 times in the last few years and I only stay here. No complaints whatsoever. Hotel property is excellent, staff is friendly. If you are in San Francisco and want an excellent place to stay, the Grand Hyatt is that place. The Grand Club is a great choice of room if you want the best of the best.

Excellent service; excellent location for exploring SAn Francisco (Union square, Moma, wharves, etc. within walking). I checked in early and they found me a room as well as fulfilled some "pre-trip" requests of flowers in the room.

My only complaint was the sleep quality. I found the bed horrible uncomfortable. To the point I woke up every morning in pain. The hotel was gorgeous. The staff was wonderful. Every member was friendly and extremely helpful.

The Grand Hyatt was an excellent hotel. Room was clean and service was perfect. The location was perfect for getting around to all the hot spots in the city. I would stay there again for sure and would recommend it to my friends.

Stayed here in November 2016 for business.I arrived at the hotel around mid-day and was checked in quickly by a very friendly associate.The room was on a high floor and had a good view north, towards the Transamerica Pyramid and 555 California. The hotel looks like it has been renovated, as the rooms were much nicer, lighter and well appointed than I remember from an earlier visit. The bed was comfy with nice pillows...I slept well, despite the jet lag. There were also a lot of power plug points, which is always helpful. The bathroom was also new-ish and worked fine. I spoke to the check in person about the hotel looking refurbished but she didn't know...maybe it was a few years back.The main positive of the hotel is obviously the location on Union Square, however towards the quieter side. I was able to walk to all my meetings in SOMA and also the Financial District. For tourists, the Embarcadero and China Town are also nearby. I chatted with the concierge about some dinner reservations and also help with some other chores and she was very helpful. The doormen and the bell staff were also very courteous and helpful.I did not eat at the hotel, so I can't comment on that. Overall, I enjoyed my stay here. I would visit again.

Weve stayed at a few grand hyatts around the world and will never again they have 1 common thread . they only just get over the lineThe rooms are ok but miss alot if things though they do have a list of things you have to ring for that should be there beds are pretty rough , pillows where uncomfortable for usA/C is noiseyShowers are horrible you need to run around in circles to get wet due to some flow restriction device def not good for shampooing hair This hotel is VERY noisey on lower levels Room service is over the top expensive$40 bottle of wine and 2 chicken sandwiches = $122 usd delivered to roomThe location if this hotel in San fran is good but there are lots of other hotels nearby like Westin , Marriott and HiltonI would recommend staying between union square and the ferry building

Stayed here for two nights on holidays. The location really can't be beat, and views from the room were unreal! Everything is walking distance. Free upgrade to a club room as they recognized Diamond status. Would stay here again.

What a beautiful hotel. Loved the lobby area as well as the guest room. The views on the top floors are beautiful. The restaurant is very good. There is nothing negative one can think of about this hotel - the staff is terrific. They make you feel you have come home to family. I would stay there in a heart beat.

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco offered me an exceptional vacation experience. Staying on the 26th floor, I had incredible views of the city. The staff was accommodating, polite and respectful of my wishes. I highly recommend the Grand Club Room/Restaurant. The hotel is located just steps from incredible shopping and restaurants. No need for a cab if you're shopping downtown.

We enjoyed our stay during the Foster Farms bowl game week. Everyone was very helpful and friendly, rooms were comfortable, parking, though expensive, was convenient for coming and going, and there are many choices for eating and shopping close by.

The Grand Hyatt is in an excellent location, really close for shopping, lots to see and do around the area. We had an excellent room, which was large and had good storage. Beds were lovely and really really comfortable. Loved the block-out blinds. Wonderful view over Union Square with the ice skating rink and Christmas tree. Great staff who were very attentive. Great breakfast selection in the restaurant and with good service.

Look it isn't the newest hotel, but it has a lot going for it. First and foremost, the staff is very friendly and accommodating. Next location is easy walking distance to a lot of sights or a cable car. Rooms comfortable and roomy.

Picked this hotel for a birthday weekend for my son. Great location. Great jump off for shopping. Ice skating in Union Square right around the corner. Cable car station down the street. Nice clean rooms . Great helpful staff.

Good hotel and great location. A couple of annoying items. First is the parking is outrageous, $45 for self park and $67 for valet. I realize this is San Francisco, but the public garage across the street is $18. If you have to park recommend the Sutter street garage. Also the bar situation could be improved. They closed the great bar on the top of the hotel, very disappointing. The new bar is ok, live music is a nice touch but they were trying to shut it down at 11:30 on a Thursday night with 20 people in there. They kept making the lights brighter which was silly. Seems like if there are paying customers I'm the bar they should leave it open.

In line with the quality of the Grand Hyatt line in this hotel chain, it is clean, new, and comfortable. Comfortable and warm seating area in the lobby. Rooms are clean and no-nonsense. Hyatt club lounge has spectacular views of the city. Nice place to hang out and rest. It gets crowded quickly during breakfast, so getting a table may be a challenge. Convenient location off of Union Square. Lots of foot traffic in the lobby area.

The hotel was nice. The restaurant and bar employees were inattentive to the point of rudeness. The employees in those areas are working directly against the efforts of the chain to improve customer relations.

Efficient check in after a long 20 hr flight. Location made it easy to access shopping, cable car, buses and Union Square amenities. It is surrounded by a number of different restaurants which cater for a range of tastes. We felt very safe in this area but I wouldn't walk too far in the wrong direction. The room was very clean and updated. It had a very noisy air conditioner and once reported was immediately fixed. As we were out, the maintenance person left a note notifying us and also a cute tin of mints.(nice touch) There is a 'Grab n Go' section on the ground floor that had a great range of options for breakfast which is handy for 6pm tour pick ups. Visited the restaurant for dinner and the service and food was very good.

Went to this hotel with great expectation after staying in the Gran Hyatt in Jakarta. Was terrible. Noise insulation between floors and between rooms was appalling. Wifi didn't work and when it did it was slow. It took 2 days to connect our devices. The lifts took up 15 minutes to arrive at your floor. I travel a lot and this was one of the worst hotels I have stayed at in a long time. On the up side the location is good and most of the staff are great.

Great views of the city and bay from our room! Excellent bed and bedding! We had a comfortable and enjoyable stay!! Next time we'll spring for the club level like our friends did. The breakfast there looked awesome!

I'm generally a big fan of Grand Hyatt hotels--you can usually assume the rooms will be comfortably well-appointed and top tier. We checked in yesterday to the Grand Hyatt San Francisco, and I can already say my husband and I are very disappointed. The room lacks a basic dresser to hold our clothes--we are left to try and fit a week's worth of clothing in our two nightstands with very shallow drawers and a few drawers in the closet that are also about the depth you need for socks, not clothing. So we are left to leave our clothes in our suitcases. Again, not what I would expect at a Grand Hyatt. Secondly, we've only been here two days and the elevators have been severely delayed. There was some kind of mishap last night were the elevators were either not working at all or were extremely delayed so we had to take the fire stairs down to not miss our dinner reservation. The bathroom is tight and tiny--there are two tiny hooks for bath towels and that is it. I'm honestly shocked that this hotel has such great reviews on Trip Advisor--the hotel is fine, but it's not at the level of a typical Grand Hyatt. I would not stay here again.

We have been staying in Grand Hyatt SF for many years and have never been disappointed. This is by far the best place to stay in Union square. Staff is super friendly and caring. I usually don't eat in the hotel restaurants as there are so many other choices in SF. I will highly recommend Grand Hyatt.

Situated right next to Union square .. great service and attention to detail .. we had a room on the 30th floor .. food was great and the happy hour was a great opportunity to meet and greet .. recommended

we went for the Oakland vs. Colts game and we're from Indianapolis. Yet Raiders fans. Being in San Francisco wearing Raiders gear I thought we might get harassed a bit even if just in good humor. Well that didnt happen. Everyone was very cordial.

This is a good Grand Hyatt conveniently located in Union Square in the heart of the city by the bay. The hotel is nice, contemporary and well designed. It's been recently renovated and the rooms are modern and clean. I had a jr suite with incredible views of downtown San Francisco and the Transamerica building. It's not cheap, but you get a lot for the money. The service is good though the check-in process seems a little too casual. Service is efficient and pleasant but not what I would consider five star. The coffee makers need an upgrade. Water pressure in bathrooms is not good though I imagine they are trying to save water. I definitely can recommend this hotel, just don't anticipate a five star experience.

Great value for perfect location. Lovely hotel and attentive staff. Workout room was a bonus. We look forward to making this an annual trip. Thanks to the entire staff for a lovely home away from home.

This was one of the nicest and most luxurious for the money of any hotels I've stayed in during the past tens years. Not only was my room beautifully appointed with elegant, simple modern design, but the bed linens were so soft and comfortable, I was tempted to just stay in bed all day. The mattress was perfect, too, worthy of Goldilocks. The room was light and airy in daylight and extremely well lighted at night, thanks to well placed (and attractive) lamps that illuminated all areas in a way that that is rare for hotel rooms. It's a room where one could actually see to read while sitting in a comfortable chair! Everything was well appointed, including the vanity area and the spacious bathroom. I was impressed when the coffee tray I ordered arrived exactly at the requested time and even the coffee cup was beautifully designed. Based on this experience, I will never stay anywhere else in San Francisco.

Stayed here on the 23rd of Christmas just so we could spend the day in the city on Christmas eve.Pros: 1. The hotel is in a very convenient location. CVS pharmacy across the street. 1 block from union square. Tons of shopping and restaurants.2. The rooms were a good size. Everything was modern and clean. Bed was fairly comfortable.3. OneUp bar and restaurant was hip and trendy. Decent food and drinks.4. Service was friendly and free WiFi is always a good thing.Cons:1. We stayed on the 14th floor and we could hear everything on the street. I requested to not face the major streets (which they accommodated) yet there was still quite a bit of noise at night.2. Parking was horrendous. $60 for valet (in/out). $45 for self park (in/out - 1/2 block away). Wish we knew better and parked at union square (which is around $30 a night (no in/outs). And we also found out that the parking lot for the Grand Hyatt self park would have been $10 cheaper if we didn't tell them we were actually staying at the Grand Hyatt. :/3. The a/c was temperamental which unfortunately caused me some sleep.4. And i know this might not matter to most people but I felt like this hotel lacked some christmas spirit in its decorations. I wanted to go to a place where everything was lit and really christmasy. This has the bare minimum.Overall a decent option if you are carless and don't care much about the noise at night.

The gracious and helpful staff at the Grand Hyatt created a warm atmosphere and a classic, boutique-hotel feel. We were greeted with smiles from check-in thru departure and at every point in between. The hotel was immaculately maintained. It also needs to be high-lighted that the Grand is in a perfect location to take in the shopping, dining, sight-seeing and entertainment that SF has to offer. We will be back!

The staff were friendly and helpful. I was able to check in early before my meeting and the quality of the from was great. Everything was nice and clean. The location was perfect. Able to walk to the waterfront, ice skate in Union square and walk to the state building for my meeting! Loved being able to get out and move after a long flight.

Got dust is everywhere I was coughing all four days. the next-door was very loud and I have complained multiple times and nothing happened. And I complained they told me that they have to follow the procedure and first was to send security and then a manager. but nothing really happened

The moment we arrived at the hotel, we had an altercation with the valet. The check-in was not a traditional check in area. It felt like an airport. The main lobby was confusing. The room was small and I didn't like that the bathroom had a sliding glass door instead of a real door. The location was great.

Stayed for 4 nights in a suite. Great value just before the holidays. Nice suite with good size rooms. Great views over the city from the 29th floor. Efficient reception staff and helpful concierge. Great location near Union Square, good base for exploring SF.

One of the best hotels I have ever visited. The service is excellent, the rooms are spotless, and the location is perfect. I go there once a year, and I have never been disappointed. Try this: Call room service to ask for anything--toothpaste, water, etc.--you'll see that it takes less than five minutes to get it delivered to your room. :-)

This 950 sq. ft. suite was outstanding. This was a special occasion and we enjoyed it very much. GREAT VIEWS FROM THE 30TH FLOOR. The food in the Grand Club Lounge and the service was excellent. Special thanks to Corinna Wenks, Director of Rooms.

Second stay here. This time with family ! Everything was great but the wifi did not work which was a huge let down given that kids wanted to watch a movie in the evening. Upon complaining we were told that tech support would get back but never did.Five stars for everything else - room service, breakfast, housekeeping, room quality and overall service !

This is our family tradition. We have been doing it for the last six years. The Grand Hyatt in San Francisco is the perfect location. Service was very good and the staff was very friendly and courteous. We had a great view of the city from our room.

As locals in the area, we decided to camp at the Grand Hyatt to avoid a drive back to the valley after a Valentine's dinner date. It's a good hotel, clean, professional and has great drinks. It's a typical high end hotel in the USA and while its good, it's nothing compared to the hotels in Asia. I'd recommend staying here if you're on work or just want a night or two to experience the city over a weekend. Location is great and very central to Union Square so access to bars, restaurants and other food related stuff in SF is very easy.

Pros: great central location in Union Square. Excellent staff: courteous, professional from housekeeping to receptionists. Very nice rooms. Cons: Grand Club food quality could be better. Hallway noise too audible through doors. Would go back but not worth paying for Grand Club privileges since better food for breakfast & snacks can be found. However, it was convenient to slip in & out for coffee, tea, water, etc.

A thoroughly disappointing stay. I have stayed at several Grand Hyatt hotels and this one certainly does not befit the "Grand Hyatt" branding at all. Room size is small and finishing is "Ikea" quality. The safe cabinet door was almost falling apart. Bathroom shower knob to switch from overhead shower to handheld did not function. Hot water in the bath was intermittent - sometimes it was way hot and then way cold. Carpet looks worn and wallpaper was peeling. Rooms need better sound proofing - i could hear the lifts wheezing by the whole night.Hotel lobby and reception looks like a budget hotel. The breakfast buffet spread was average only. Service by the staff at the cafe was good and its location is really great - right next to the Union Square with many shopping and restaurant options and centre of activity.The hotel management should seriously look into upgrading the rooms and lobby. I was booked for 5 nights with my family but checked out on the 2nd night.

Excellent hotel with lovely ambiance. Perfect location just off Union Square is easy walking distance to restaurants, shops, theatres. Rooms are clean, spacious, modern with a comfortable bed and large bathroom. All staff I encountered were helpful and friendly. The OneUp Restaurant served an excellent breakfast. This was my first stay at this hotel, but I will definitely stay here again.

Wireless is terrible. Not enough storage space for one week of clothes in the room. Room safe did not work. No robes unless you ask. Fridge did not cool. Other hotels in the area provide a much better experience.

Check-in was easy; room had all the necessary amenities; never a problem with elevators; great location convenient to shops, restaurants, trolley, etc. Was in town for a conference and the walk to Moscone Center and the BART station on Powell is easy.

We enjoy the Grand Hyatt for its location to Union Square and shopping and at Christmas time, the holiday lights and decorations. There is ice skating in the square and easy cable car access. And you must experience Sears Famous Food. Their Swedish pancakes are delicious!

Had a lovely stay with a nice big comfortable bed. The room is clean with good amenities. The concierge is very helpful in giving direction. The gym is basic but using the lift lobby as a mat work area is a little awkward especially when a large group of people got off when I was working out. Love the convenience of the location where most of the attractions are easily reached by walking.

Nice location in the heart of Union Square, walking distance from restaurants and major designer stores. The Grand Hyatt was nice and service was very good. Only negative, we opt to use their mobile key process for check-in, but couldn't get the door open the first time, our Bell person had to open the door for us.

For the annual December weekend getaway, my husband and I decided to stay at the Grand Hyatt to try something new. I had booked a Union Square view room and we had to wait a bit for it to be ready since we checked in at 10 AM and check in is at 3 PM, but I expected that. We shopped and dined in Union Square but decided to check back at the hotel at 3 PM since we still hadn't received a call saying it was ready. Well, the room was ready but when we walked into it, all we saw was a brick wall. Turns out we'd been put on the 7th floor facing Sutter street which is clearly not Union Square.I was pretty annoyed that I had to go back downstairs with all my luggage to correct this mistake. I worked with another employee at check in who seemed pretty shocked at where we had been placed but from the history my parent's have with staying at this place and having trouble getting the correct room, I wasn't surprised. However, he quickly corrected the error and placed us on the 17th floor with a fantastic view of Union Square and two free drink coupons for OneUp, the restaurant in the hotel. This was perfect because we had dinner reservations there later that night.My husband and I really enjoyed eating at OneUp for breakfast and dinner, the hotel's proximity to Union Square, and the views, but I think we'll try out another hotel next time we're in the city. Aside from the room mix up, it was hard to pull up to the hotel since the street it sits on is very busy. My husband and I also had a hard time getting comfortable in the room with the funky thermostat. It was ice cold when we got in the room even though the temp said 70 and we had to blast it up to 81 to get any warmth. However, forget about sleeping with the heater/air conditioner on unless you can sleep through the loud ticking sound. There were positives and negatives to the place but not enough positives to win me back for next time.

Great Experience! Lovely ambiance, Close to what I needed. Staff are great and friendly, and they are also helpful. I think it is one of the best experiences in SFO. The elevators were bit sticky at times but overall experience in the hotel was great. I think the overall rating should be good to very good.

We stayed overnight because of business in the early morning. Holidays were in full force and were treated to ice show from our window overlooking union square. Walk to designer shops, Macy's, etc, not to mention the all-important Starbuck's to start the morning with the appropriate dose of caffeine. A nice lounge with good tapas style fair was a plus.

Although the location is convenient, the overall experience was a letdown. The hotel decor looked cheap and the staff were a ragtag bunch. The room was clean but had no fan in the bathroom and a lumpy comforter; the beds were not particularly comfortable. Amenities were extremely limited for a hotel in this price range, as was the quality of the furniture and fixtures. The sink, however, was a good size. The nicest aspect was the workout room.

This is a nice hotel in a great location, I'm not sure how they got the label of the Grand Hyatt. I was under the impression that Hyatt saved those for some of their top level properties. This was more like a very nice Hyatt Regency with cheap bed sheets from an old Holiday Inn or something. Also if you're planning on going as an elite Hyatt member don't expect much, the club room is filled at all time with anyone and everyone with an email address. The food is pretty good however if you are up for fighting the crowds.

The Grand Hyatt is an excellent place to stay in San Francisco Excellent Hotel, Great Staff and nice rooms. The Grand Hyatt is close to Union Square were you have great shopping. Close to Cable Car stops, which you have to do if visiting San Francisco. Additional it is close to many great restaurants.

This was the worst ever. We shall never again visit Grand Hyatt This wa supposed to be the best ever for my daughter and myself prior to her wedding. I requested a special surprise;it did not happen. I was so upset.

I take my family to two or three giants games, to do xmas shopping and usually one other SF trip each year and we always stay at the Grand Hyatt. The rooms are super clean, spacious and modern. All sides have a great view of either Union Square the Bay or the City. The best part is the location. North Beach Italian or China Town for lunch and then out on the town for dinner in the Union Square area. One tip, parking at the public garage across the

This was our second stay at this hotel. Basically, we liked this hotel a lot. As many people said its location is fantastic and the staff are friendly. However, a few things could be improved: 1) the available WIFI in our room (@Hyatt_wifi) was unacceptably slow; 2) the capacity of OneUp Restaurant is just too small for the hotel of this size; consequently, we had to wait for our breakfast; 3) some room furniture was not well maintained; e.g., the surface of the backless sofa in front of the closet was not clean, and couldn't wipe out some spots; the closet door was too tight to open/close easily, etc.I hope that at least 1) and 3) will be fixed soon so that we can come back again with greater comfort. Thanks!

This hotel is located perfectly just off Union Square. Within walking distance to Golden Gate Theater, Shopping, and the Ferry Building. View was of Coit Tower with Alcatraz obstructed. The best part of the stay was the 32nd floor Lounge. The staff was amazing and the food quite good. Different choices all day.

Great location near Union Square, friendly and efficient staff, fun atmosphere, lively and good restaurant, clean spacious rooms - I couldn't have had a better stay! I travel to SAN Francisco often and never stayed at the Grand Hyatt thinking a big hotel would be impersonal but boy was I wrong. I will definitely be back!! Thanks for a great and restful stay!

The location is very good, near the Union Square retail area and entertainment. Room was clean and staff helpful. The Grand Club with its daily breakfast and evening snacks was a great optional feature. The only downside was the internet connection which was VERY slow. Difficult to get any work done online.

We stayed overnight and had a great stay. Perfect location right next to Union Square and all of the shops. Easy walk to Chinatown. Hotel was clean and staff was very friendly. Bed was very comfortable and I had a great night's sleep. We will return.

Pros- union square location. No carpet in rooms makes for a cleaner room. Housekeeping was very good.Cons- gym is marginally acceptable. Enough aerobic machines but stretching area is in the elevator area and there are not enough weight machines.They also have an amazing view from the 36th floor but the lounge is in the 2nd floor- too bad they don't switch that.

I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt a number of times over the past 20 years (it is one of the two or three convention hotels I tend to stay at when my meetings are in SF). The staff is always incredibly helpful and friendly.The hotel went through a thorough renovation about 3-4 years ago, and although the lobby is not my particular style (one of those styles that tries to merge modern with cozy) it is pretty relaxing and the fireplaces look nice. I am not a big fan of the looks of the open style of registration area (various computer stations placed around open pods, with computer cords everywhere) but if it works for them I have no problem.The rooms also are very nice with electric shades that can be controlled from the main door area or from the bedside. Also, individual gooseneck reading lights by the bed are a nice touch as are very accessible electric plugs both by the bedside and by the desk. The TVs are all nice flat screens with connections via HDMA and video for business people wanting to check out their presentations. And one touch I really appreciate (found less and less in the "upscale" hotels) is the in-room refrigerator rather than a in-room bar fridge. There are so many wonderful places to eat in SF, and it is really nice to have a place to store your own beverages or leftovers from the great restaurants for the next day's lunch (or any of the city's great chocolatesâ€_.).It also has a nice 24 hour health facility with treadmills, elipticals, wights, etc. When I went to it at night there was almost nobody else there, and they had headphones available for anyone who didn't bring their own (although the TV selections on the treadmill were limited, and a strange collection outside the broadcast networks).Although I have never used it, they also seem to now have a very extensive room service menu. I have never been to the restaurants the hotel currently has, or the lovely breakfast snack bar available in the morning. Several years ago I went to the upper bar area which has a great view.The staff is always great, and the bed and pillows wonderfully comfy. Definitely a great and relaxing place to stay!

This hotel is right off Union Square, so if this the the area you want to be in it couldn't be more convenient. And if you've stayed at a Hyatt hotel before you can expect a certain standard of quality and service. This hotel met most of them. We had a king room on the 29th floor, looking west with a city view, just slightly marred by the top of the Drake hotel across the street (I was told at check in this was already an upgrade from the "hotel next door" view on lower floors). Room is modern and stylish in design, with light colored wood furniture, grey carpeting, not large but with adequate space to move around, chair and ottoman by the floor length window, and all the other basics you'd expect: safe, fridge, coffee maker, large LCD TV etc. The bed is the most comfortable we've had on this trip, like a firm futon. Very quiet, the fridge didn't make any noise, didn't hear any neighbors, nor the ice maker across the hall (there's a drinking water dispenser there too which was a nice environmental touch). Bathroom has a large white oval shaped sink, shower has good water pressure. Wifi is fast enough.One thing I was surprised by was the lack of a swimming pool at this hotel, I was under the impression that all Grand Hyatt hotels have one, so that was a disappointment. Although the gym on the top floor is fair sized and has panoramic views. Another was that I made this booking through the Chase LHR program with extra benefits including a continental breakfast. That proved to be a huge source of confusion. It seemed no one at the hotel has any clue as to what that is. We were eventually directed to the "coffee corner" at one end of the lobby where there is a kind of food stand selling coffee, pastries etc, but the staff there still had no idea what we could get for this "continental breakfast", like, just coffee and pastry? Fruit? I mean, it's not a new program and I couldn't possibly be the first person using it, and how difficult could it be to standardize what's included in a continental breakfast? In the end, everything was charged to our room, and had to be straightened out at check out. So service wise, there is definitely room for improvement here.

It's been long overdue but I am writing this review because if as a traveler you are not sure where to stay in San Francisco this hotel should be at the top of your list. The Hyatt is next to Union Square and near great restaurants and shopping if that's something you wish to do. Chinatown is a few blocks away and all the tourist attractions are also nearby. I was pleased with my stay at the hotel since the room were spacious and the bed was very comfortable. Request a room with a view to Union Square, it's worth it.

Great location and fantastic view of Union Square with the Macy's Christmas tree, Christmas lights and skating rink. Last minute booking was managed very promptly and efficiently. We were offered and upgrade which cost only a small amount extra- so worth the view.

Best hotel - quality service from staff and located in a convenient area. The Apple Store is next door, Starbucks across the street and Macy's and Westfield shopping area is a couple blocks away. Friendly staff who gave great eating places advice. Housekeepers are great - room was cleaned in a timely manner.

Loved this hotel! Very modern clean and beautiful. Stayed here for two days with my boyfriend for a weekend in the city and glad we decided to stay here. Our view from our room over looked union square which is such a nice view during the holiday season!

Fabulous location, beautifully appointed/renovated. Great bar and the staff was lovely! Very much enjoyed a really relaxing stay....Loved every aspect of this hotel and our stay there. I can't wait to go back!!

The best thing about this hotel is the location. Really close to Union Square and in the center of the city.The inside just felt a little old and not in a good way. They tried to update a lot of the surfaces with modern finishes. The floor plan is pretty small so I think most rooms were near one of the 6 elevators and I heard the noise of it going up and down all night.I've stayed at other hotels in San Fran that were better, and would only consider coming back here again if the price was significantly lower or I needed some Hyatt points.

The location is the best thing. And then the staff are friendly and helpful. The view from the top floors was awesome. Best for business and family vacation. I wish they include a children playroom and possibly a pool on the top floor for guests.

Our family of four stayed at the Grand Hyatt on Union Square for four nights this December , this is my overall impression and review. The location is the best in The City, Union Square is the heart of The City and is close to stores, parks, shopping and many restaurants. Since its the holiday season they had a skating rink in the center of the square whcih my 9 year old enjoyed immensely. Checkin was easy and quick, we upgraded to a one bedroom suite on the 20th floor, with a city view. The suite was a king bedroom and a separate sitting room, with two full baths. The common areas are elegant, with a sitting area with a fireplace. Street access is convenient .The service is superb, no complaints .The suite itself , and I can only comment on this one , had some oddball furniture, like this too big double circle coffee table in the center of the front room. Since we had two children, one a 2 year old we needed a crib so this table with the crib inside made the room seem smallish.I'm in the tile business, so the criticism is due to my own perspective. The floors were laminate, not my choice for a suite in a top notch hotel. They had a few large throw rugs which I found weird and kitschy. The bathrooms were large, with these giant sinks, you could wash a baby in and we did! The bathtub was large, the floors a 12 x24 porcelain, which was fine. I like marble and in an expensive hotel this is what I expect. The king bed was very comfortable but the pillows weren't down, so didn't like this.The thermostat was a bit tricky, to get heat you had to turn it up to 85 then heat kicked in then you could adjust the temp. The bathroom in the bedroom was also large with these unique maroon red glass counter tops and another huge sink.The shower was large, but had 6x6 porcelain on the shower floor, which in my business is a no no, too slippery.But overall ok.They had these electric blinds that came down to shut out all light at night which I liked.Overall a very good hotel in a terrific location with very good service.Recommend it to anyone.

Planned a last minute trip to SF with the family and booked our room here! It was a lovely hotel with an awesome staff. Our room had a great view of the mountains as well. Not to mention Each Morning was a different complimentary breakfast!

Easy, mobile check-in. Had room on high floor but never had to wait for an elevator and never made more than one or two stops going up or down. Beautiful views. Room was spacious and very modern. Staff were friendly. Only drawback was restaurant which served only OK food. Very convienent to all SF attractions.Would definitely stay here again but eat elsewhere.

I stay at this hotel frequently and it never disappoints. My room had a nice view of the city and was clean with modern amenities. The hotel is literally on Union Square so convenient to shopping and restaurants. The club level is very nice with a stunning view, but frequently crowded. Check in was easy and online check out was available. I decided to stay in one evening and the Concierge was very helpful in recommending a restaurant that delivered.

My family of three spent five nights here just prior to Thanksgiving. We had an executive suite with two bathrooms, and at checkin we opted to add on the Club lounge for an additional $50 per night. Our teen daughter said it was the best hotel we've ever stayed at.Our room was around the corner from the elevator. While I could hear the elevator, at first I thought it was wind outside. It was more white noise than annoying or intrusive. We had an issue with the toilet running all night, and called the front desk first thing in the morning. Maintenance came up within minutes and fixed it, as we never had another issue with it during our stay. The room was really dark due to the automatic shades, and the temperature stayed what you set it at. It was wonderful! We loved having lounge access. I know the week before Thanksgiving isn't a really high occupancy period, but the only time we had problems finding seating was if we went 15-20 minutes before breakfast was over. At 7:30 or 8 am, you had your choice of seats, including by the windows with the gorgeous views. You could see Alcatraz Island, Coit Tower, etc. Each day for breakfast there were scrambled eggs and omelette toppings such as ham, bacon, tomatoes, sauteed mushrooms, green onions. Some days there were bacon and sausage. There were always whole and cut fresh fruit, yogurt, granola, pastries, bagels with cream cheese, smoked salmon, red onion, capers, etc. We loved the machine that would make various espresso drinks. You could take bottled juices and water to go.Employees were wonderful, and the hotel was incredibly convenient if you have shopping on your agenda. Lots of restaurants within walking distance, and very convenient to public transportation as well. There were always multiple Lyft drivers within 1 minute of the hotel if we felt like going somewhere without waiting for a cable car or bus. We would definitely stay there again.

Hotel is in a great location near union square and tons of restaurant. The rooms are smaller than most hotels I guess due to location. Went there with family but staff wasn't as friendly for Grant Hyatt..checked in but wasn't even recognize or thanked as a platinum member. I let it go not worth the hassle since they didn't even care (I've stayed in the past on business and was treated better). Not sure if I would come back to stay here again. Parking at the hotel via Valet is very expensive at $67...park across the street at half price.

Perfectly located among the shopping district and a quick Uber ride to the Piers. Amenities are nice with a very good restaurant and bar area on the second floor. Work out area has terrific views. Everything in SF is expensive but there were some things that I even thought were exorbitant. $40-50 a day to park and $3 for a 6 oz soda were among some of the over the top costs. Rooms were decent sized and beds were comfortable. All in all a very good visit.

It's tough to get a room and at a good price due to the quality level and location. But if you can, it's great. The staff is courteous & friendly. The location in Union Square can't be beat. During the holidays if you can score a union square view, it's so lovely to watch the ice skaters and the lights. The room is ok. Basic. Nice firm bed but overall could use a touch of tlc. My bathroom door didn't close all the way(sliding) and the shelf in the empty mini fridge was off its hinge. Super basic amenities cuz I suppose as a cost cutting move you have to call down for anything extra to be delivered. Kind of takes the quality down a notch but the send the stuff up pretty quickly. Overall a solid hotel, just probably not worth the $400 or $500 it sometimes charges!

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt to celebrate our 10th anniversary. We booked a Bay View room which was only slightly more expensive than a regular room. It was TOTALLY worth the few extra dollars. The view was fantastic. The room was very comfortable and clean. The location is great and within walking distance to TONS of restaurants. Overall, we had a wonderful experience and will definitely be back.

This is a great hotel in a perfect location. We stayed here to kick off the holidays. The Union Square view is awesome. The hotel is updated, clean and within walking distance to restaurants and shops. We will definitely be back next year.

Great service, room quality, cleanliness, and location! Much of the shopping and Union square within walking distance. Room was clean and well-maintained. Staff was friendly and helpful whenever we needed assistance. Normally I don't think I'd be able to afford a room here, but they were having a holiday prepaid discount and it was definitely worth it!

Grand Hyatt at Union Square is the most convenient hotel one could ask for.It's a functional hotel with no frills but every thing is available around the corner. It is a paradise for shopping as it is surrounded by shops including high end ones.The rooms are clean and the staff polite and helpful.It's value for money!

I love this hotel - have stayed here several times. Never really see the staff but know they are all taking care of anything i need. Super clean - great views - simple and elegant accommodations. The location is perfect. Only regret is that they turned the top floor bar/restaurant into a banquet room for meetings....kind of a bummer - but seems to be more lucrative and the way most too-top venues are going in SF. Love the GH!

Excellent location great service close to shopping and fine dining. Staff interaction was wonderful with directions. Parking was pricey need to work with your Diamond Members and others clients regarding this matter. Taxes is everywhere on the bill...whoa!!

Try to get one of the rooms overlooking Union Square and Macy's store front. Like #2520 which is at corner, or higher. Well worth it during the holidays when ice skaters are out in force and the square is decked out.

Union Square was my choice of location in SF and I generally like newer hotels, Grand Hyatt was a great choice for me this time.With apparent renovation, the lobby was very welcoming with fire places and super tall ceiling. I sat at the lobby sofa area many times sipping my coffee bought from the coffee cart right there. It was sure a wonderful way to spend time in cold early mornings reading book/newspapers next to real fire place. Free apples at the lobby too...Front desk service was average, no surprise with any hotel in North America. Room was decent size and ours had a "in your face" Union Square view. Bathroom was clean, new but not enough towel racks as a short coming with many other Hyatt hotels I have stayed. We had to be creative to find places to hang our wet towels. Beds were super comfortable.Had a nice time at the bar lounge with live music and friendly waitresses.Breakfast buffet was not spectacular but then again, there were many good choice eateries and quick bites on Union Square so it was no problem for us. I give this hotel high rating for facility updates, well designed public space and price rather reasonable. Overall, a good Grand Hyatt experience again.

This is one of the best hotels. Love the friendly staff, and the great service all employees have provided for me and my family. Very helpful in finding place to eat and things to do. Great great great.

Had a very pleasurable 4-night stay at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco. Room overlooked Union Square which gave a great view of the Macy's Christmas Tree Lighting Celebration. The Executive Suite Room offered a luxurious stay. The neighborhood is pricey and there are more affordable options for great food in SF but we found the Hotel's restaurant and bar worth the convenience of location after long days of walking around.

Took my wife to San Francisco for her birthday. From the time we got out of the car we were greeted with exceptional care from the bell men to the front desk. Sent up a complementary bottle of wine and cheese with the best view of the bay. Walking distance to many attractions/land marks. Would definitely stay here again.

Our vacation was such an unforgettable experience. Everyone from reservation to all the staff at Grand Hyatt are extremely friendly and helpful. Salute to the Front Desk Mgr. who made our stay extremely unforgettable. The location of the hotel is just a hop away with all the big shops, ice skating rink for the holiday and the lighting of the Christmas tree. These are just a few your family will talk about for many days after their vacation but most of all is our stay at the Hyatt is just something you would dream to come back soon.

i rarely have any complaints with this great union square hotel. last time i stayed though, i did complain about members of the staff ignoring the dont bother door sign and just entering the room. it was a busy thanksgiving weekend and maybe they mistook it for a room that was checked out. but it happened twice so i complaind and wanted to talk to the manager who never responded to my request. i even left a message when we checked out. i just hope that those are not bad apples from their wonderful staff who are randomly "checking out" occupied rooms, its black friday and rooms are full of shopping bags. i wanted them to be aware of it but unfortunately no one is ever available to address this problem. otherwise, its a great hotel, and i would probably stay there in the future but now more observant

I almost did not choose this hotel because there were some mixed reviews, mainly concern about the noise of the traffic. We were on the 23rd floor and we heard no outside noise whatsoever. The rooms are very clean, the staff makes you feel as though you are at a 5 star hotel. The location could not have been better. It is right in the middle of Union Square close to Chinatown, shops, restraunts. I loved our trip and I am so happy we picked this hotel.

The hotel is located in a prime, pleasant area of the Union square, and the bay and union square views are breathtaking. We've stayed at the Hyatt quite a few times, and magic is still there.Small tip: union square king room is considerably more comfortable compare to the double.

We had an excellent weekend getaway, catching a show, dinner and a romantic stay at the Grand. The staff was exceptional and went out of their way to take care of us. Enjoyed room service for breakfast and a late check out. The staff really took great care of us.

The Grand Hyatt is an excellent choice for anyone visiting San Francisco. The location is right in the middle of all the places you would want to visit. Its close to shopping and dozens of restaurants. The hotel itself is very clean and modern. Our room looked up to date and was clean, spacious, and comfortable. A decent sizes flat panel TV and a small refrigerator (not a minibar) were nice touches. The hotel is taller than the buildings around it so you are almost ensured a great view. The only minor criticism I can come up with is the bathroom door. The door is a fancy looking gizmo that rolls sideways on a track. It looks modern and cool but when its closed, it leaves open gaps on both sides and thus prevents complete privacy. Overall, we were very happy with our stay.

Grand hyatt San Francisco it one the best hotel in San Francisco, location staff VERY good friendly good location, Grand hyatt foods need upgrade, ideally best place in town. Rooms are large new. Enough space than grand hyatt than in many hyatt.

The Hyatt Grand is truly one of my favorite hotels, always beautiful & clean, fantastic upper floor suites with sweeping city scape views, and the Union Square area. Macy's is right down the street & ice rink with shopping all around setup for Holiday experience- great place to stay for Union Square festivities! The one Up hotel restaurant has an excellent lunch!

Booked the wrong date but they were so gracious and got us into a room over Thanksgiving week. Got an upgraded room and early check-in. Great experience, amazing service all around. Hyatt loyalist from now on.

Hotel staff were very welcoming and calm. The hotel was very business like and professional. The tour desk staff were helpful. Rooms were of a very high standard. We had a bay view room, which was great but we could not see the bay until around 11am in the morning due to the mist and by 3pm the miss came back.Other guests were considerate and kept noise to the minimum.The breakfast buffet service was efficient and managed well in the small space. The bar and restaurants were also great. Food was good all round and the staff were friendly, helpful and good at their jobs.This hotel is close to Union Square and in the best location for the shopping, Less than a 5 min walk to Market Street for the shopping centre and Powell Street for the cable car rides. and getting the hop on hop off tour buses.We would definitely go back.

All aspects of our stay were very positive. We were well taken care of by the staff and thoroughly enjoyed our week-end. The view from our room was spectacular. We had access to the club room where the food and snacks were great. The location of the hotel is very convenient to to shopping, buses, and taxi service.

Great value , close to everything. Great holiday decoration in the hotel. Gym with great view.They sent handy man to check the AC immediately. He was courteous and professional. Our room had fantastic bay view

Loved staying at the Grand Hyatt; everything is so convenient and within walking distance. Food is excellent, rooms are very comfortable and we had a balcony room so that the door could be opened. Love the fresh air in San Francisco!

Valet was great. They took care of unloading everything and placing on my room. Check in was a breeze. Beautiful view of Union Square. Everything is close by. Concierge went above and beyond. Check out was simple. Great staff, great housekeeping. Had slippers and robes in waiting for us in our room.

This hotel, while nothing to get too excited about is a very comfortable hotel that is conveniently located right off Union Square in San Francisco. It is very large and has large well appointed rooms that have everything that a business traveller would need. It doesn't have anything particularly charming about it as its pretty standard issue for a chain hotel, but it absolutely does the trick and is fairly well priced given how expensive San Francisco is.

I enjoyed my stay. clean room, absolutely no bedbugs and great service! will stay again and recommend to others. the only drawback was some noise at night, but I suppose that is only to be expected at such a central location. i am a light sleeper and was still able to get good sleep even with some noise. service was very attentive and the room was kept very clean and stacked with every-day needs. the food in the oneup was great and so was the chef and staff! great value and quality food. me and my daughter had a great time. the concierge was very knowledgeable and helpful.

We loved our room, the location of the hotel and the friendliness of everyone. It was beautifully appointed and so comfortably contemporary. We felt like true guests rather than having rented a room for a night.

Convenient downtown location across from Union Square...friendly service...rooms on the small side with small bathrooms. Hotel rooms are starting to show signs of wear...club lounge has lively views and service is wonderful....breakfast is quitefilling and Ben is most helpful and hospitable. Parking very expensive. Would stay here again if the need arises

We found the Grand Hyatt to be very modern, clean, and comfortable. We stayed on the Club Level which provides a lounge where breakfast, evening hors d'oevres, desserts, and cocktails are served. However, I would not recommend paying the extra price to stay on the Club Level at the Grand Hyatt. Sadly, the food offered in the lounge was mediocre at best. There are very few options to choose from and the food is either cold, tasteless, or both. We have enjoyed the club level at the Hyatt both in Maui and Hyatt Regency on the Embarcadero in San Francisco and had a very different experience. Both of these offered delicious food with a wider variety to choose from.

We had a perfect stay.Our room was clean, cozy,comfy and very well decorated. View was great.Excellent location.. Just a block away from union square and easy walk to cable car, financial district,etc.. Liked their buffet breakfast.. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful..All in all, Grand Hyatt San Francisco was amazing and is highly recommendable

I was in room 3203 with grand club access. Firstly, the room was great. The view from up there was amazing, and great to see the sunset. There was no noise from the lifts, or from outside as some people in other rooms had complained about but occasionally we could hear trolleys of drinks being taken to the grand club room. It didn't bother us but it might wake light sleepers. The shower was good but no bath, which would have been nice.I'd paid extra for a grand club room and when I read some reviews on here wondered if I'd made a mistake... I don't think I did. The breakfast was good, soft drinks, tea/ coffee and cookies during the day were welcome and while the evening food wasn't a main meal, it was tasty and on one evening after a large late lunch it did provide enough food to keep me going until the morning.
