The staff were very friendly and professional. In particular, Wayne at check-in. I hope we do bump into him at a Depeche Mode concert in the summer!

Excellent hotel. All aspects of our stay were addressed. The concierge was very knowledgeable of the sights and how to get around the city. Staff was efficient and on top of things. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Excellent location. Nice hotel with lots to do all around. Rooms seemed updated and nicely decorated. So easy to walk around Union Square, Financial District, Chinatown, Moscone Center, South of Market, etc. Great food all around and easy to get quick supplies from Walgreens and CVS on every corner -- and Starbucks too!

5 star experience all around. Allowed us to check in at 11 am. Good sized room 429. Really beautiful water view. And a view of an ice skating rink. Nice bathroom with vanity and sink separate from the shower toilet. Hair dryer available. Asked for a toothbrush and razor and got really awesome products complimentary. They will also let you borrow a curling iron if you forget yours. The best!

Our entire experience was a 10! Everyone was amazing! The gal who checked us in new it was a special occasion (my 50th bday and trip with my mom) - so she gave us access to the Grand room which made our day every morning! Our room wasnâ€™t ready when we checked in after 3:00, so they gave us access to the Grand room (32nd floor) until our room was ready. We were going to miss our dinner reservations, so the manager came to us and said they will move our luggage to a temporary room that we can get ready for dinner in so that we could make our reservations, and they would move our luggage to our permanent room once it is ready. They took care of us beyond our expectations. The concierge even put cupcakes on my bed when we arrived in our room on my birthday with a hand created birthday card -- so beyond our expectations and VERY sweet!!! I will always stay at the Hyatt brand -- you blew me away! WELL DONE everyone!

Rooms are modern and clean. Had requested some items via E-Concierge ahead of my stay, which were not delivered when I arrived. Requested them again the next day and they were promptly delivered. Requests made through the regular reservation system did go through. Hotel is centrally located. Starbucks is right across the street - great option for an affordable breakfast. Coffee maker was available in the room and was much appreciated. Check in and check out took no time at all.

On the 27th floor with spectacular views.The 32nd floor Grand Club is a great way eat well for not too much money.The location is close to everything and the staff very helpful.Highly recommended - would stay again.

Stayed for four nights. Great central location near Union Square. The room was clean but dated... gym on the top floor is very small and extremely busy in the mornings. Breakfast options are very limited due to the small restaurant on the ground floor - you have to wait 20 minutes for a table!! Better option is the Starbucks across the street.

The hotel has a very odd configuration putting almost all rooms adjacent to one of their elevators. Earplugs come along with the room because the noise from the elevators can be heard clearly in the rooms. Wouldn't stay here again.

Very nice hotel. More a feeling of a boutique hotel than a big chain hotel. Friendly staff, especially front door staff. Concierge was also very helpful. Her recommendations about a restaurant in Chinatown was wonderful.

Convenient location for walking through the city. And the front door staff was very helpful both in giving directions and in telling us whether we could really walk because of hills that were between the hotel and the site

I had the opporunity of stayng 3 nights at the hotel. The location couldn't be better, one block from the Union Square and near to all major shops and nice restaurants, with easy access to the main attractions. The rooms are very nice. Beds are super comfortable, TV has a huge variety of channels, nice bathroom and decent closet space. Some desapointments for a hotel that is supposed to be a 5 stars hotel: Ammenities are from an unknown brand and are pretty much standard; an empty minibar in a room guaranteed by a credit card (looks pretty cheap for a hotel like this). About the service, I had a feeling of nothing than standard service, from check-in to concierge. No one was really much engaged to offer a great experience or a different approach. Used the concierge once for a restaurant. Was expecting for a concierge that knows what's the talk of the town, and found just a guy that was aware of the restaurants nearby. Had a good choice, but wasn't close to exceed any of our expectations. Just felt like I was in a huge hotel with nice rooms. One exception must be made: Steve, the associate in charge of mail/expedition was FANTASTIC, understood our needs and offered solutions, just like we would expect from the other areas.Bottom line, I could come back to this hotel, managing to have fewer expectations.

Stayed at Grand Hyatt for a conference. Convenient location to many shops and restaurants as well as to public transportation. Rooms are average size and well-appointed. Front Desk staff were not especially friendly. Servers in the banquet were excellent. Banquet meals were exceptional.

This looks like a very nice hotel, but the rooms are ill-equipped for business travelers. Only two inconvenient power outlets in the room for charging devices, and staff unable to figure out how to process sharing a room among two credit cards. In a hotel of this nature, those mistakes just shouldn't happen.

Walked into the hotel after arriving from the Airport, took the BART ($8.95) and was immediately helped by an associate and quickly got up to my room. Very well appointed and loved the electric shades, especially in the Morning! The bathroom was very up to date, the only negative was the size of the Vessel sink. It was really too big for the counter and did not allow much space on either side for toiletries. Shower was good and towels were a comfortable size. Everything was very clean and bed was very comfortable. Many TV stations to choose from.

Great location for my needs. Clean and comfortable. Food was good however not many choices in hotel. Very close to multiple eating and drinking options though. Wish they had a hot tub to soak my aching feet after walking all day.

Our room was clean and comfortable. The view was exceptional. Our room was on the 28th floor over looking the bay. Elizabeth at the concierge was friendly, knowledgeable, and took care of us. Overall stay was great. Perfect location, close to everything.

Not satisfied with customer service...room could use some TLC. Location was great and the doormen was very courtesy. I can't say the registration staff were not frieindly but she did not follow through.

This hotel was perfect. I researched many hotels before selecting this one for our stay. It is in a great location, close to everything. Everyone was very friendly except for the hostess in the Grand Club. She questioned how I got in there and looked at me like I did not belong. Sorry I just finished working out and went to grab something to take to my room. We stayed in the executive suite and it was worth every penny. We had plenty of room to spread out. We had dinner reservations somewhere else but decided to order room service here for dinner since the room and view were amazing.

Grand Hyatt San Francisco is amazing and highly recommendable. Always enjoying my stays there as the hotel is next to Union Square, close to city centre and its easy to arrange transport with Uber and other providers. It is highly recommendable to stay there.

The hotel is fantastically located moments from Union Square. The building is hard to miss towering as it does thirty plus floors high. The rooms are more than comfortable though perhaps a little bland for my taste. The f&b venues are good and the service in these outlets was excellent. What let's the hotel down though is the total lack of service from doormen and the general vibe of the lobby. The awful red queue sign with a you're next notification and an arrow at the front desk is more reminiscent of a social security office rather than a supposedly upscale five star hotel. The doormen are monumentally unfriendly. Not once did they offer to help with luggage, call a taxi or open a car door. I'm actually curious what they are there for? It certainly seems not to help the guests. It was a perfectly acceptable hotel. A good standard but nothing exceptional and certainly not up to the standard I have come to expect from a Grand Hyatt.

Well appointed rooms, very helpful staff, terrific location (just off Union Square); easy and free Wifi connection; comfortable bed; good bathroom amenities. What else does one need??? Check-in process was made very easy by friendly staff.Fully stocked Starbucks immediately across the street (important for those travelers like me who need easy access to the NY Times!).

The service and accommodations at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco live up to one's expectations. From the Door Men (and there seemed to be more than one helping open doors, welcoming you, etc.) to desk clerks, staff was pleasant and very professional. The location cannot be better for shopping, strolling, museum going, etc. I've stayed at least 5 times in the last 20 years, and the quality never wavers.

Great location! Great value compared to many of the other high end hotels in the area made choosing the Grand Hyatt a no-brainer. The hotel restraunt/lounge is very convenient but be ready to pay for this convenience.

Awesome stay and the staff were extremely helpful and courteous in every interaction. Quick check in process with a great welcoming committee. The concierge staff was very helpful in letting you know the highlights of the city and getting you from point A to point B. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Grand Hyatt Union square fell short of the Hyatt name I expected. Hotel has great location but outdated and not very clean.Bathroom sink was cracked lighting around mirror was stained. Cabinet where towels are placed was stained. Shower had very poor pressure. Room had piles of dust hanging on the walls. I not a clean room freak but this stuff just stood out. It was a anniversary trip and didn't feel so special in this room.

Great for tourist and business traveler. Very close to union square and chinatown. This hotel is always very crowd and all the staff seems really busy. But room is big and very clean. will recommend to friends and family.

I got to the hotel late after a long day of working and flying, used the electronic room key (iPhone) so skipped the check-in area, and went straight to my room where I walked in the door and thought "THIS is why I love staying at Hyatt." Spacious, well-appointed rooms with a great view of the city. I didn't have much interactions with the hotel staff, but when I did they were always helpful and friendly. And the location is ideal. Definitely my first choice for San Francisco.

Highlights: Great central location, friendly staff! Room for improvement: rooms need to be updated, the carpet in my room has multiple stains. Standard amenities should be provided in the room not upon request - that's just tacky. The breakfast selection, quality and presentation needs the most attention. My omelette was over cooked and slapped on a plate with potatoes. I've had better at a Dennys. I expect more from Hyatt. Definitely a far cry from the luxurious Hyatt hotels I've had the pleasure of frequenting in Asia.

Excellent location and interiors. The club lounge is also well stocked with great views. Only downside is the gym - it's really too small for such a big hotel and it gets very crowded in the mornings.

We had a reservation at the Grand Hyatt and received an email from them suggesting online check in which we did. When we arrived we still had to go to the registration desk, our room was not ready, no comparable rooms were available and the staff agreed that registering on line was a waste of time. Only after we insisted on seeing a manager did they even pretend to want to be helpful. There are many good hotels in San Francisco. This is not one of them.

We stayed here during Fleet Week. Reserve any room with bay view. Higher floors are better for views of the bay. Staff very friendly. You can walk to most places but ride share with Uber or Lyft is good also. I would not pay extra for breakfast. Too many places to enjoy outside the hotel. Pinecrest Diner is just a few blocks from hotel. Chinatown is just around the corner.

Exceptionally well designed room. Great view, ability to open window for ventilation. Newly renovated and very well done. Service was always excellent in every area of the hotel. Love Hyatt, this is my new favorite in SF.

Everything went extremely well. Great location. Entire staff was top notch. Great accommodations. Courteous and instant resolution to any questions or issues. It was especially nice having a free water fountain on the floor and Starbucks in the lobby. Concierge was especially helpful and very knowledgeable. Great car valet service. Worth the money. I especially want to thank the lost and found dept. I left my car keys and medication in the safe. I called the hotel and they immediately identified the lost items and they were delivered to my home the next day. This hotel is top notch and they really have their act together. Best customer service I have ever seen. I will definitely stay at the Grand Hyatt next time in SF

A friend and I stayed at this hotel as we visited friends and toured Napa. It is located in the heart of the city so that getting around is easy. It's beautiful, contemporary, friendly with meticulously efficient staff, and offers outstanding concierge services. The evening and night views of the skyline are breathtaking. There was not a view of the water as it's downtown. Easy to walk to Bart, shops and activities. I'd stay there again without a doubt.

This hotel is very large and so crowded, check in process was quick and simple (they have a bowl of Ghirardelli chocolates). The room I got was noisy from somewhere so I ask to move and they moved me to a different room on the same floor which was much better. The room is spacey with a great bath, very large bed.The location is exceptional right next to union square, its best if what you desire is shopping, just hope out and in to leave your bags.They billed me by mistake for a breakfast I didn't order but refunded immediately when I called the Hyatt service. There is a parking garage just opposite the hotel, which I used for the weekend.As other people stated there is a small gap between the door to the room and the floor so you can hear when someone is passing by, for me it didn't cause any trouble

Great location hotel with fabulous views. Even though it has been refurbished it felt a little dated compared to other Grand Hyatt's although that's a minor issue. The staff were friendly and very helpful. As we arrived late after a long drive we dined in the restaurant in the hotel that turned out to be excellent. The waitress was very knowledgeable and suggested some good dishes - it was also good value in a very expensive city. The one let-down was an empty mini-bar in the room that gave the impression of a rather "low rent" approach in an otherwise top quahlity hotel.

I would've preferred to stay at a Hilton, where I have status, but a conference I was attending was at this hotel so I stayed here.The hotel is less than a block from Union Square, which has various options for shopping and eating, but there were some questionable people lingering in the square and following people around and that didn't exactly make me feel comfortable. The hotel itself is very nice and has modern decor. I had a room on the 11th floor that was large and comfortable and had two double beds. My preference is a king bed, but the hotel was sold out so I had no alternative. The double bed was too small, but it was comfortable and the pillows and linens were nice. The room had a large flat screen TV, a large work desk, a small safe, a mini fridge, and I especially liked the window shades that could be raised or lowered at the push of a button. The bathroom was modern and clean with fluffy towels and June Jacobs brand toiletries. The sink was pretty cool, but it took up too much of the counter space. Overall, the room was nice, but I have two complaints. First, there weren't enough power outlets around the room. There were 2 outlets on the side of the nightstand, but I couldn't easily find them from the other bed as they weren't visible. It would be more convenient if the plugs were on top of the night stand, as they would be more easily accessible. Second, I could hear the motors from the elevator all night long, and my room wasn't even directly against the elevator shaft. I could also hear loud/drunk guests late at night, which isn't the hotel's fault, but also a testament to how thin the walls/doors are.Surprisingly, the WiFi was complimentary and it was speedy, so that was nice.I had breakfast in the room one morning and it was overpriced and mediocre.Overall this was a nice hotel, but it was just too expensive for me. I realize hotels in San Francisco are on the pricier side, but for what they charge here, I'd rather stay in a Hilton.

My family and I have just spent two nights at this recently refurbished Hyatt property.The location is perfect for a business or pleasure trip to San Francisco, with great shopping and public transport all within easy reach. The rooms are pleasantly furnished and we were lucky to be assigned at room on the 30th floor, which provided fantastic views over Union Square and the San Francisco skyline. Major construction work are ongoing at Union Square, but these did not disrupt our stay in anyway.Hotel staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The concierge was one of the best teams we have experienced and it is worth paying a little extra for the limousine service on your return to the airport.

We stayed as part of a vacation for our 20th wedding anniversary. At check-in, we were pleasantly surprised to be assigned a room on the 20th floor and provided a choice of wine and apps to be delivered. This is the type of over and above service we appreciate in a hotel! The room was quiet and comfortable. Parking rates were outrageous, but likely ot out of the realm of normal for San Francisco. Next time we would skip the car and just Uber.

As a Diamond member my wife and I have stayed at a lot of Hyatt's. This was hands down, by far the worst. I've had a few experiences where the check in staff at other Hyatt hotels fail to recognize my membership level and I have to remind them in order to get the benefits. However, I have never had a Hyatt try and demote me from Diamond to Platinum and that is exactly what they did here. Check in staff was extremely rude and didn't believe that I was Diamond and didn't want to offer the benefits. After I pulled up my account on the app to show them they very rudely said "you booked the stay when you were Platinum status". Nope, wrong again and that could have easily been checked if they were willing to click about 3 keys on the keyboard to see that I have been Diamond for a year now. When I asked about the standard Diamond upgrade they claimed they were completely full and had no other rooms. Wrong again, they had other rooms and I later demanded to move after finding they put us in an ADA room with a very awkward bathroom. Rooms are old, small, and poorly insulated. House keeping took 3 hours to bring us a new fridge after telling them ours wasn't working. Club lounge is about one fourth the size it should be. After our stay the assistant front office manager, Jonathan Hsieh, sent me a pathetic fake apology through email about the Diamond mix up. He claimed that he "tried" to call my room while I was there. Once before I had an issue at a Hyatt and the Manager called me immediately on my cell phone and after our conversation not only was the issue resolved but I planned 2 more trips there because I was so pleased with the managers customer service. This Hyatt on the other hand is a joke and the staff is a joke. Afterwards we stayed at another Hyatt nearby and they joked that the Grand Hyatt San Francisco has the worst employee turnover out of all Hyatt's because the managers are horrible. BEWARE, STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!

Stayed at hotel for four nights on business. My hearing site was around the corner at the Sir Francis Drake, a 5 minute walk. I used the valet service for my car which was excellent. Easy assistance from bell man to move multiple pieces of luggage on arrival and departure. Bathroom and closet were small but adequate for my solo needs.

This hotel has been really updated and upgraded nicely. Clean modern feel, nice reception and sitting area, nice ambience. Well done Hyatt! Situated by Union Square and the new apple store its a great location. Only one minor complain, stayed in a lower floor facing the main street and it was surprisingly noisy outside even well into the night.

My experience at Grand Hyatt San Francisco was the worst of all other places we stayed this two week. The room at Hyatt was extremely dusty and had to have room service come clean it at check-in. Next day room was dusty again, not sure what was the issue but I think air filter needed to changed. At the checking asked if the room was spaces for our 21mon son and was told to use lobby for him to play around. :( Furthermore, the there was no Duvet cover on the blankets, instead it has two sheets between blankets, which was extremely uncomfortable. We were also extremely disappointed to find out Hyatt didn't have NFL Network Channel. Overall, this was our first experience at Hyatt and I have and had better experience at Hilton and Marriott

Only thing to say about this hotel is the beds! Holy moly I've never been so comfortable! We did room service one of the nights just so we could crawl straight into that bed! Amazing place and a cool place to stay but the beds are the best I've ever experienced!

Large room with comfortable beds. Easy and quick check-in. Breakfast buffet VERY expensive. There is a Starbucks that opens directly across street from hotel and it opens very early. Location is great for catching the train - just outside of front door.Don't ask Concierge for dinner options as they will direct you to very pricey tourist spots. Just walk around and you will plenty of reasonable and quite good options.

Stayed at the Grand Hyatt in October. It was a great experience. The hotel is located at union square which makes it very convenient. Union Square is a great shopping area. We were close to Chinatown, only a block away from the cable cars and street cars which helped us get around San Francisco very easily. Only spent a few days in the city but I got to see and do so much in that time. The Concierge was extremely helpful. They assisted us with renting a car twice. The car was delivered to the hotel and was effortless. The concierge was very knowledgeable with the public transportation.saved us time getting to the sites we wanted to see. My room was very nice. The bed was very comfortable, bathroom a nice size and clean. There is a mini fridge and safe- both very small. There was a normal 1875 watt hair dryer which was awesome. Water pressure in shower wasn't the greatest but that's me just being picky. I would definitely use this hotel again. Things I did while in San Francisco- Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz, Pier 39 sea lions, Ghirardelli Square, Chinatown, Alamo Square (under construction) to see the Painted Ladies, mosaic steps (great view of the city), Lombard street, Chrissy field (great view of Golden Gate Bridge), Ferry Market. We also spent a day going to Monterey - went to aquarium, drove the 17 mile ride and went to Carmel beach. Another day we went to Muir Woods, Sausalito and Napa Valley. California is amazingly beautiful. It was a great trip.

We spent a long weekend in San Francisco and this hotel was great. Steps away from Union Square, walking distance to the MoMA, and nice walk to the other high lights.Liked the common spaces, decor is very original and funky.

Great location. Room was modern and updated. Just spent 2 nights prior to a cruise. Easy walk to trolley stops and many restaurants. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet was a little pricey but good.

Great location. Hotel room on high floor with view of Union Square. Amenities in the room have been well thought out. Bed very comfortable.Appreciated very much that we could open the window even though we were on 20th floor as we don't like air-conditioning.I would choose this hotel again as my preferred stay in SanFranciso

If you're looking for an excellent location, modern vibe, and very friendly customer service, this is a great selection. I've stayed at other area hotels, including Union Station, though first time here. I'lol be back.

I recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco. The rooms are comfortable, with impressive views (see pictures). Quiet if on upper floors. Breakfast is a bit expensive for the quality, and service is slow (so plan some extra time). The one thing I would like to see improved is the gym: It is larger than in most hotels, but then the hotel is larger as well, which means you end up waiting to access weight training machines and dumbbells, which is annoying at this price point

First time staying at the Grand Hyatt SF. I was impressed with the overall quality of this hotel, friendliness of the staff and central location. I was well looked after for the duration of my stay and would certainly come back again.

Staff was okay, not overly friendly, but certainly not rude. We've stayed at multiple hyatt hotels/resorts and are accustomed to friendlier service. Would definitely recommend this hotel overall. Great value, nice rooms, and amazing location

We attended a family wedding at the Grand Hyatt and we decided to stay since we lived an hour and a half away. And it was nice knowing we were able to have a few drinks and not drive home :) The location is awesome!

We stayed here for 2 nights recently.....driving there we thought the area may be dodgy but turns out is in a very nice area...only one block from union square. Check in was very fast and professional and plenty of staff on hand to help at door or at concierge. One surprise was they gave us a nice bottle of wine and dessert once they knew we were celebrating an event! Be sure to check out the Cheesecake Factory which is on top floor of macey's and offers great value food and excellent terrace views of union square and the city surrounds...

Very nice hotel! Was there for a day interviewing with a company in the Bay Area. Loved my experience. Room with view was great! City view was great. Hotel room seemed to be very well set up and organized.

Me and my girlfriend spent 2 nights at this central hotel in Union Square DT San Francisco. The staff was super friendly, the hotel itself is beautiful, and it is in a great location for all your tourist adventures!

Great location in Union Square. The mobile check-in and entry is outstanding! We were also notified when our room was ready. No need to stop at the front desk for check-in. The employees still greeted us at the front door and at the reception area. The hotel and rooms were clean, the bathrooms were a nice size. The sink in the bathroom was an elongated oval which seemed odd, but not a stopper. There were no coffee machines nor refrigerators in the room. That didn't bother me because I don't drink room coffee anyways. There is a Starbucks right across the street from the hotel's front door which was extremely convenient. The fitness center had nice equipment. Each time we went, which was 7 am, it was packed and people were waiting to use equipment. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

This hotel became my favorite hotel. While I am a huge fan of the Hyatt Huntington Beach and is hard to beat for location, the Grand Hyatt in SF had the best service I've ever received at a hotel. Hands down. All weekend long they blew my mind - every hotel employee I dealt with was literally perfect. It's in the heart of San Francisco and close to everything. The room was great. The food was great. Beautiful view. It was an amazing weekend all around.

Great location and good service. Club floor very nice for breakfast and snacks. Yes there is noise even on the 34th floor and the construction in the area was overwhelming at times but overall a nice stay.

I hesitated on staying here but bit the bullet regarding price and it was worth every penny. Service was great, room was spacious and very nicely appointed. The restaurant One Up was also good--very attentive, good selection of wine, and very tasty food. Great location as well. You cant go wrong staying here.

Great Hotel in an awesome location, close to shopping, dinning and an easy cable car ride to the wharf. Our room was clean, quiet with an excellent view of the city. A bit expensive but overall on par with other hotels in the area.

Excellent experience and perfect location. We were in town for a conference (at another hotel) and thankfully were able to finish our visit to San Francisco in this hotel. Much better option!! Better location, better service, wonderful in-room food service, and better overall experience.

Grand Hyatt in heart of SF near Union Square. Hosted wedding party. Very professional and friendly staff. Hosted dinner 14 people in hotel restaurant. Great food. Two friendly servers. Very modern nice rooms. Quiet. Great room service. Free newspaper at floor elevator. Wonderful location to walk in SF.

The good:The hotel is beautiful and the room is very nice but i am platinum and used points to upgrade to a club level room. we were given room 3324. Avoid the 24 line at all cost unless you enjoy elevator noice all night ( luckily we travel with earplugs and a noice app) also the shower is the narrowest I am ever been in. The next morning when we called about some other issues we were offered another room but we had already unpacked and we are leaving tomorrow. However I did get some points as an concession to our issues. However you would think platinum and diamond would get the better rooms not the worst line in the hotel. Also there is no way to upgrade to high speed internet as there is no choice. At Check in they warned me that this might be an issue. On the plus side as I said earlier they were willing to move us and the club itself is very nice.

Stayed for business, its a very good location and you can walk downtown anywhere, while the hotel staff was very accommodating. The rooms are a good size, very comfortable - we had absolutely No problem!

We stayed in this hotel on my first trip to San Francisco with my husband. It was extremely conveniently located in Union Square, walking distance to lots of great restaurants, bars, and shopping, and just a block from the gates into Chinatown. Uber in San Francisco is fantastic, for just a few bucks you can get anywhere in town. We stayed on the 17th floor and it was very quiet and had lovely views of the city buildings.

The entire staff from the bellmen, reception, doormen, concierge and housekeeping could not have been better. It was clear they recognized that they were in the hospitality business. Reception checked us in 2 plus hours early with no issue and helpfully explained the main services available.The bellmen were fast, pleasant and provided local info and referred us to the concierge for additional info.The doormen were helpful getting taxi's and even getting us a black car for the same price as a taxi.The staff at the concierge not only were very knowledgeable about events but were able to get us discounts and also provide info about specialty stores we were looking for.Housekeeping provided us with special requested items and provide room cleaning on request off schedule.All services were provided in a most helpful manor. As I stated in my headline. Everything was special.

Nice hotel in downtown. Nice lobby, good food and friendly staff. Clean rooms. Would stay here again and would recommend to friends. Mid range in price but San Fran is expensive. Close to some great restraunts and the business district.

This is an updated top of the line Hyatt hotel with stellar management. Everything functioned well throughout the hotel. I experienced their stellar Regency Club with its well earned reputation for excellence. My room was well fitted out, clean, and modern. I will stay again!

An beautiful hotel in a wonderful location. The front desk staff were all very friendly and knowledgeable of the local area. The rooms are gorgeous, and we were upgraded to a high floor room with a breathtaking view of San Francisco. The only thing keeping me from giving this hotel 5 stars is the restaurant and bar staff. We tried to go for dinner the first night, the bar was empty yet it took nearly 25 minutes before we were served, so we wound up leaving after drinks only. The following day for breakfast, again the servers were very agnostic and clearly wanted you to use the buffet so they wouldn't have to deal with you. And the last night we tried one more time for dinner, and the service was better than previously, but still just ok.Between the great location, gorgeous clean rooms (oh and super friendly housekeepers, I forgot to mention!) and great front desk staff, I would definitely recommend this hotel, but stay away from the restaurant!

This hotel provides all you need for a stay in the centre of San Francisco, the room was spotless and well maintained as you'd expect from a big brand hotel chain. Service was good and whilst I didn't have lunch or dinner at the hotel, I can recommend most things on the breakfast menu. A good home from home when working on business for a week when all you need is things to work as they should without incident.

Nice hotel right in the heart of Union Square. Easy access to dining, shopping, bus lines and trolley lines. Priced reasonably compared to other nearby hotels. Nice health club facility on top floor. Views not as great as advertised.

My stay at SF grand Hyatt has always been awesome the staff is great, and I have enjoyed my stay each time. The check in was easy, when I had to request items as I forgot they were promptThe grand room service and food was great too

Beautiful hotel in a great location! Top notch customer service as well! For a hotel that is in a very busy area our room on the 8th floor was extreme quiet. We were here for a 2 day post cruise stay.

Stayed back in June for 2 weeks. Rooms were pretty good, however AC was noisy which kept me awake a bit. Room service was great and F&B hospitality was brilliant. Housekeeping did let down by not changing the sheets, and I had to remind them. I had billing issues at check-out, which got resolved swiftly when I had to show them the printed document. At the time of booking I had issues registering to the gold passport program, and it has been a disaster trying to get anyone to help me, till now its not been sorted and I have simply given up dealing with their call centre. This has impacted the overall experience of my trip and next time I have decided to stay at Westin, next door.

When we arrived, Alex Benavide checked us in. Alex was very friendly and helpful. He really took care of us. We had access to the lounge where we had beautiful views and plenty to eat and drink! Drinks were very expensive in the bar-$11 for a draft beer! Overall a great stay!

My wife and I arrived at the hotel at 11am after a 14 hour flight from Australia to be told quite curtly that checkin time was 3pm and that the hotel was very busy. As we had lounge access, we said we would wait there if he would be so kind as to let us know when we could access our room. He agreed to do this.After 2 hours, my wife went down to the foyer to check out the state of play and was told my another staff member that our room was ready and had been for some time. Very apologetic and embarrassed.Having survived that hiccup, we went to our lovely room on the 30th floor and with fabulous views. Well appointed with all the usual good quality toiletries etc.We spent a lot of time in the Grand Club ( Lounge ) and found the staff to be friendly, professional and helpful. Top marks to them.It is just unfortunate that what should have been a memorable experience was spoilt before it started.

Such a high standard of rooms and service was awesome. From the concierge to the doorman who spoke to us everyday even if we weren't up for a chat. There was nothing the staff couldn't do assist. Even the room service staff would say hello and smile at us constantly. The gym is also awesome even though it is not us large as GH in Melbourne Australia and no free daily water on bedsides which seems to be the US standard but doesn't have to be as Australia can do it so what can't the US? It puzzles me anyway as for the room just stunning, I was initially to be allocated a room on Level 5 and then I asked how many floors high is the building then was upgraded to level 24 for an additional US$10. The room was super clean without a single piece of dust on the bedsides and counter. We loved the man chair with the foot stool and the gorgeous electric blinds and funky shades. Not only did our room have a full length mirror but it also had a bath and the room it self was large and even furnished with lovely vases! Just wow can't wait to go to San Fran again and stay at the Grand Hyatt. I love that there is such a high standard in customer service that the Grand Hyatt normally attains as the Melbourne Australia GRand Hyatt is to this standard whereas NYC was utterly disappointing!

Business trip, I get to the entry hall. Where is the counter? Only see modern designer tables with Macs and friendly attendants that smile at me and almost informally welcome me to this wonderful hotel. My reservation was a standard one, but the lady just decided to upgrade me to a room in an upper floor - with the view to the bay!! Just wonderful experience from the personel, service and of course, great location next to the Union Square.

We have stayed at Grand Hyatts a number of times in different cities from Tokyo to New York and they're always of a very good standard and we have always been very pleased with our experience. The room in this hotel (room number 2707) was finished to a high standard and had a great view too; however the noise from the hallway and the adjoining room was simply unacceptable and made our stay very unpleasant. This is because the doors finish too high from the floor, (easily more than an inch) and our room was also a lock off so you could hear right through to the next room, even just them talking, or splashing around in the bath! We ended up stuffing the extra blanket under the door to try and muffle the sound. The rest of the hotel I can't fault but I cannot recommend this hotel and I would not return based upon my experience.

We stayed in October for 3 days for business and pleasure. The hotel is very clean, personal ... kind and warm. Cross the street is a starbucks. Next is Apple store. Then some other stores... I mean is a great location. Valet parking is expensive but ... is San Francisco :) .

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for work trip, although I was mostly in a conference room - the location seemed wonderful. Lots of shopping, close to transportation, and close to good restaurants. The hotel itself was super modern, the room was big and clean, the restaurant in the hotel itself had good food (although limited) and great drinks. The staff was friendly and accommodating.

I stayed at this hotel with my partner in September 2016. The hotel is in a fantastic location and the rooms were very modern and comfortable. The hotel was above our usual price range but so were most places in San Francisco. We stayed for 4 nights and were able to walk to many sites or catch the underground located nearby. My only issue with the hotel relates to an accounting error. We paid for the hotel on a debit card and a pre-authorisation fee was taken on our arrival but also on our departure without our knowledge. For the second part of our trip we travelled to Yosemite National Park and my card was suddenly blocked. I was unable to contact my bank given my location. Luckily I had paid for our accommodation and travel and the place we were staying were kind enough to give us a free meal after a day of hiking! I later discovered (after long phone calls to my bank in UK business hours..) that my account had been blocked as there were two large pre-authorisations pending on my account which had left me overdrawn. My direct debits could not be paid and I had to take an emergency overdraft. I called the Hyatt whilst I was still in the US who denied doing any wrong doing. I have now, however, had confirmation from them that they took two pre-authorisations by mistake and that this was due to a training error. I know many people advise using credit cards to pay for hotels in the US but I could not have anticipated what occurred. I would suggest checking this with the hotel before you leave so that the same does not happen to you.

Welcomed with a friendly sincere staff, no wait to check in. The concierge was beyond helpful for our weekend. Our room was very clean and we had an amazing view! We were very happy with this hotel and will come again!

Excellent location. Near BART and world class shopping. AT&T park is walkable for people who walk. Onsite restaurant is excellent. Doormen can give you a p/o of their restaurant recommendations. Union Square location is good choice.

5 day trip to the beautiful city of SAN Francisco. Stayed in the Grand Hyatt suite and loved everything about the hotel. Awesome room, lovely property in the perfect location for shopping, dining and sight seeing.

Situated right off union square the hotel is in the perfect spot for sightseeing and all the activities aground the Moscone Center conferences. The restaurant OneUp is good as is the bar also. The elevators, even though there are 6, can be slow during peak times especially if you are on the top floor. It doesn't hurt to be beside the Apple Store also.

Had a nice experience. Comfortable and clean room. Good room service. High tech hotel in that they pushed several emails to me allowing me to check in online, order room service online, check out online. 2 minute walk to the great shopping at Union Square. An easy 10 minute downhill walk to Moscone center. 15 minute walk to the embarcadero. I would recommend for those wanting to be centrally located.

The hotel was very up-to-date with the coolest amenities and had phenomenal views of San Francisco. The staff was extremely kind and helpful and tried to meet out every need. The hotel is also situated in a great part of the city.
Excellent central hotel, only used for sleeping as too much in San Francisco to do Staff very friendly and level of cleanliness is ver high.Rooms very spacious and beds and pillows very comfortable.

Stayed here for four nights in late September early October. We had a suite, and were blown away by how nice it was. We stayed on the 34th floor with a fantastic view of the city and a partial view of Union Square below. The hotel has a fantastic location to shopping and Chinatown which we took full advantage of. The lobby is also a cool spot to just sit, relax, and people watch during the day. The staff was also great. Very friendly and accommodating. This hotel also has one of the better hotel gyms I've been to. I highly recommend the Grand Hyatt San Francisco.

Horrible vegan food knowledge. Hard time to explain what is vegan food to the supervisor of the restaurant finally served me butter in the name of vegan food, after explaining him over 30 min what is vegan food and a complaint.

Check in was easy. Staff was helpful. Showed me how to print out my airline tickets. I had to go to my business meeting that morning as well as check out. The staff helped me hold my luggage in one of their storage rooms. I was able to enjoy the city after my meeting. Overall, a great experience and I would stay at the SF Grand Hyatt again.

Stayed for 4 nights and overall was disappointed with the quality of the hotel. Wifi is an expected service but the strength of signal and stability of the service was very annoying, with it unavailable very often to the point that reverted to going down to the lobby just to access emails, messaging and Internet.Quality of the room was a little dated as well but cleanliness was fine. Can't complain about the reception staff - very helpful.

First time here. Normally stay at Parc 55 or Hilton since I am a diamond with Hilton as well and those properties are closer to bart for airport access and the price is usually higher at the Hyatt. I was able to use a suite upgrade certficate the dates I was there was made up for the higher price. The executive suite I had was very nice. I like that they have switches to control the blinds electronically and they are great at keeping light out of the room at night time. I like the check in area, there are kiosks in the lobby for check in instead of a long check in desk .Staff was great. This property offers a $15 Amazon gift card as one of the choice diamond check in ammenities and being a huge Amazon shopper I really appreciate that. Staff was great. Good location, only a few blocks from the muni/Bart and next to the Tix booth and a bike rental kiosk. My biggest complaint is with the lounge. The only hot breakfast item they had was scrambled eggs. The lounge is too small, real difficult to find a seat at breakfast, they could easilly use a lounge double the current size. And they always ran out of items during the happy hour. Other small complaint is there is no dedicated diamond line. There was no wait when checking in (I arrived after 11 p.m. however) but was a wait at check out.

Exactly What You Would Expect....well located, efficient, clean, and a reasonable price point. Located just off of Union Square in SF, so it is centrally located for anything touristy one might want to do in SF. Ask for a high floor to take advantage of the spectacular views.

We had a great stay at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco. We especially loved the convenient location and friendly, attentive service. While high-end, the atmosphere is casual and relaxed -- it's a perfect hotel for business as well as a vacation break in the city.

San Francisco is an amazing city I would love to come back to. It is expensive every penny was very well spent. We were in the Union Square area where everything is close by and there was no need for a car. Public transportation is very good and even tourist attraction were right there. The area is surrounded by local restaurants which makes your stay even more pleasant.

The Grand Hyatt was an excellent place to stay during the Oracle OpenWorld show held in San Francisco every year. It's within walking distance to the conference (Moscone Halls) and very near great dining, the waterfront and city attractions. The staff was attentive, the fitness center was well-stocked and maintained, the Grand Club was a convenient and wonderful way to get quick breakfasts before the long conference days started, and the overall experience was a great one. My team and I would highly recommend this hotel.

The Grand Hyatt has a good location on union square. It also has rooms the size of shoe boxes, threadbare towels and sheets,paper thin walls and five start prices. This hotel clearly caters to conventions so if you like that all the above, this is the place for you!

All aspects of my stay was great. The service and comfortable room was key to a restful stay. The location was perfect for my meetings in the financial district and nob hill. Tons of shopping next to hotel as well.

Great place & excellent facilities. The hotel offers peace of mind for any visitor whether on business or leisure. The staff are very pleasant and readily available to offer assistance to the guests always with a smile. The ambience makes the hotel a perfect location for travelers mixing both tranquility and quality of service to make one's stay a very memorable experience. I would definitely recommend it to any friends, colleagues or family travelling in that direction anytime.

One of the best locations, just on Union Square and close to all the shopping action. The hotel has a nice courtyard to enjoy a cuppa as well as an Apple store adjacent in case you want to pick the latest iPhone7. The rooms were spacious and beds are comfortable with automatic controls for the blinds and room lighting makes it convenient to operate. The bathrooms were also clean and the wifi network was okay.

Internet ran at 1990 dialup speeds... actually an old school 56k modem would have been gastwr. Even pandora had problems streaming musoc.a lumpy bed lead to 5 very bad and unproductive nights. At least the Marriott next door gave me free WiFi duento status. Sad part was their signal was better than what I got from the grand hyatt.

Upgraded to a Club room which was way over priced for what the hotel offered. Noisy room, windows are not sealed properly and the wind was blowing through them all night. Club lounge is completely inadequate considering the price paid. There are much better hotels providing better value for money in the Union Square area.

Stayed in the hotel around 4th July,16. Brilliant hotel. Me and my friend stayed in this hotel for one night. Upon check in, we requested f we can get a ROOM WITH A VIEW. And the room that we had was spectacular. Really nice view of the city and just loved it. Customer service was excellent

Diamond member, room good. Lounge for diamond member great views. Parking is way over priced and a rip off, suggest you self park after dropping your bags at curb. Attentive and very cordial staff....

I arrived around 1:00 pm on a Friday afternoon. I was told my room was not ready, which was fine since I was checking in early. I went and did some exploring around the area and waited for the call that my room was ready. I came back at 7:00pm. My room was still not ready. The gentleman checking me in said the hotel was at full capacity so he would have to see what he could do. He did find a room for me after some searching. I do not know who dropped the ball on not cleaning the room, but if every room was booked, there should not be any dirty rooms. The hotel is located in a great area. There are plenty of shopping and restaurants. The employees in the lounge and valet were very nice. The rooms have nice views.
We were very well cared for from the moment we stepped in the door....My wife is ceoliac and the staff in the Grand Room catered to her exceptionally....the grand room is great value look into this

It's was very nice to stay at this hotel with nice person , good help by the "conciergerie" people, also nice person to served on the breakfast , the place of the hotel is very closed to the central of the city , very closed of the public transportation to visiting all the big city

From start to finish, our stay for our 15th anniversary was delightful. Only tricky part is the limited pull up area at arrival. Recommend you get familiar with the one way street layout in the area before you arrive if you are driving.

My mother and I just returned home from San Fran. Stayed at the Grand Hyatt. Convenient location, clean hotel, beautiful views, courteous staff. Will definitely stay there again when we go back for a return vacation.

We had a city-view room, it was spectacular, though it you're staying here spend the extra money for the bay-view. I saw it from the 36th floor and it is absolutely amazing. Room was great, clean, and quiet. Gym is very nice and has great views also.

The staff here is wonderful. The construction noise at night, on union square is obnoxious. There is a long term tunnel project that works 24/7. If you are a very very heavy sleeper you will be fine. If note don't get a room overlooking union Square.

My family and I enjoyed a wonderful stay here while vacationing this summer. We are Hyatt Loyalists and this Grand Hyatt did not disappoint. We had some points to burn so we booked 3 nights in a Club Room and it was worth it. The room was modern and had great ambience (love the automated lighting settings) and of course, the views were amazing. The high floor (32nd) was definitely the way to go and the Club Lounge had a nice selection of breakfast items that appealed to the whole family. Although we only made it for one evening snack, it was great to have that option- especially with a tired toddler who makes a walk down the block a little less attractive.Since we left Brooklyn in a hurry to catch our plane out West, I was sad to realize that I had left a few much-needed items at home. One of the best thing about the new Hyatts is that this is not a problem since they give you an easy menu to fill out where you can access free amenities by simply calling hospitality. It was a life saver! On several occasions, we had friendly employees sent to our room with a bag of complimentary replacement items.The valet crew was great as well, although it's one of the more expensive valet services we've used, they are prompt and professional and made our trip hassle-free. Overall I heartily recommend this hotel. We would not hesitate to stay here again!

I have been to Bay Area 6 times over last few years and this is the pick of the bunch.I used the iPhone service to check in so I got off the plane and turned my phone on to tell me my room was ready - I went directly to the room no reception no waiting - perfect.Rooms are great size, modern and clean - but of street noise from 14th floor but hey better then most places around here.When I had a couple of issues the staff bent over backwards to fix my issues and made my stay a real pleasure.I will be back here next time

From the Grand Hyatt, we walked across Golden Gate to Sausalito, through Golden Gate park to Sutro Pools and Cliff House. Great hotel to stay. We will stay here next trip for sure. Great attention from staff.

We stayed 4 nights in an executive suite. The room was great with floor to ceiling windows, a master bedroom with walk-in shower and a separate living room and second bathroom with a tub. The staff in the the Grand club were great and accommodating when we were late for breakfast one day. The lounge on the second floor was fun, good drinks and "amusing" live music. Location is also great. Don't miss hops and hominy up the street for dinner.

I'm a luxury traveler; therefore, I have high standards and expectations. I have stayed in this hotel once while on business trip in San Fran. This is good hotel for the value. It has a good location.Rooms: very clean.Food: I ate at the restaurant downstairs only once and it was very good.Service: Very good.Overall: I think this hotel is worth its money and continues to improve itself.

The rooms were very nice, beds comfortable with a good sized bathroom. Rooms come with a small refrigerator and a safe. There are nicely decorated, but could use more light (like almost every hotel I've ever stayed in!). Be sure to book or upgrade to a Grand Club level room, it really makes a difference in your stay. The Grand Club (on the 32nd floor) offers a continental breakfast (with eggs, sides, oatmeal and more pastries than you can think about eating) every morning. The room is open all day with light snacks, waters, juice, sodas and coffee. Then in the evening, they bring out the hors devours that are enough to make a meal on and the full self service honor bar. Drinks are only $3 for beer/wine and $4 for mixed or hard drinks (great deal, especially compared to the OneUP bar downstairs - which is a nice bar, by the way, but you do pay full San Francisco prices for the drinks! The bar usually has music nightly).The staff was nice and accommodating, despite it being a very busy holiday weekend. The hotel is downtown, so expect some of the 'local riff raff', but the hotel staff is good about keeping them away from in front of the hotel.

Perfect location. Close to all shops, bus stops, and cable car stops. Had an easy and smooth early check-in process. The rooms are very modern and clean. The staff was very friendly. I would stay here again.

I love San Francisco and have visited there a few times but the downtown area is now a punishment for the less informed city tourists as well as the soulless residents of the streets...Still, if you have a busy schedule then this hotel is centrally located (at least safer than the pier area) for the remaining attractions around town. Room- clean, modern and well kept for it is a Hyatt.Features:Big plus for the electric black-out shade.The bedside telephone/alarm/mini music player featured an iPhone 3 charging socket (a foresight at the time) with 2 USB sockets.Bedside lamps: I would prefer if I didn't have to fumble for the switch hidden in their lampshades, a contrast to other modern features in the room.Shower head is detachable (nice) but like most US hotels (homes), the water pressure is fixed (not very strong either) and only temperature is adjustable(boiling if not careful).Service - check in/out at noon was slow and guests had to line up in the middle of the narrow hallway, blocking all traffic in the lobby while staff was busy talking and running amongst themselves. One can't help to wonder why the retail in San Francisco is suffering, it can't all because of the internet.Did online booking kill good service?

Lobby- slow, understaffed and disorganised for such regular process. Everyone was talking while the queue got longer and longer.Room- modern, well keptArea- San Francisco downtown is rough and smelly. You need good friends to cross the streets.

Very loud elevator noise. Shower sprayer was broken. Maid service never changed pillowcases; there was hair left on the pillows. AC temperature gauge didnâ€™t work properly as temperature would drop in the middle of the night.

This hotel has a great location as it's right on Union Square within walking distance of lots of shops, bars and restaurants. All of the tour bus companies have pick up points at Union Square and the cable cars run right behind it. The hotel itself is very clean and the staff helpful. The room we had was on the 24th floor with a great view due to the floor to ceiling windows. It was quite spacious with a big comfy bed and wide screen TV. The bathroom was fairly small - the bath was too small to lie down in and I am only 5ft 5! There is a small fridge that you can have re-stocked with complimentary bottled water. However, there was no mini bar which was strange. The maid always left the room spotless. However, there were a few things that let it down. There were lots of towels (more than we knew what to do with) but no towel rails or bars on which to hang them to dry off. There were 2 bathrobe hooks that we tried to hang 2 off of, but the lack of towel rails meant the towels never dried properly as you had to re-fold them whilst wet - not great when you wanted a shower later that day/night. The bathroom had a slide door. However, it wouldn't go completely across so left about and inch and a half gap - not great when people are using the toilet! The shower wasn't powerful enough either. The biggest let down for me was the noise. The walls are paper thin so you can hear everything in the room next to you. Also, you could hear the constant noise from the lifts going up and down - which in a busy hotel is constant. A shame really as this would prevent me from going back.

We stayed for four nights. The idea was to relax and acclimatise in a good quality hotel after the long journey from England. In many ways we were not disappointed.The Grand Hyatt is very well located on Union Square and is a perfect base to explore the city. Our room overlooked the square and we had a great view. We were fortunate enough to access the Grand Club Lounge for breakfast and for snacks during the day. The lounge is to be recommended if your budget allows, we enjoyed it apart from one morning when we arrived for breakfast later than normal (around 9 am) and it was a challenge to find a seat and table. I enjoyed, maybe too much, sitting at the cocktail bar and we had a decent dinner in the OneUp restaurant. But all was not well with our stay at the Grand Hyatt. I had originally reserved a Grand Club 2 double bedroom for our family of four. A couple of weeks before our arrival I received an email offering an upgrade to an executive suite for a reasonable price. I thought this would be a treat for the family and bit of extra space and privacy was desirable. So I proceeded to accept the upgrade. On arrival we were surprised to learn that our upgraded room, although very nice and clean, had just one king bed and a rollaway single. This meant that one of my sons had to sleep on the sofa, wrapped up in a robe on the first night because they failed to supply the extra bedding we requested (and we were too tired to argue after a very long day travelling). I mentioned our problem at reception the next day. Apparently, it was all about â€œpersonal choiceâ€ù and some guests prefer to have more space. I suggested that any guest their right mind is unlikely to choose fewer beds than they have people, but there was no satisfactory solution forthcoming from the hotel.Honestly, this didnâ€™t spoil our time in San Francisco, but it is a shame that the hotel would offer an upgrade that was so obviously inappropriate. If you find yourself in a similar position, do check more carefully than I did that an upgraded room is actually suitable for your needs.When we returned to the UK I completed a survey at the request of the hotel and subsequently received a pleasant email apologising for the mix up. Apparently this is a corporate issue and beyond the control of individual hotels. Just to prove what a corporate shambles Hyatt can be, I received a further email, almost a month after we checked out, confirming my upgrade â€“ â€œWe are happy to confirm your request to upgrade to an Executive Suite for your upcoming stay.â€ùI paid too much money to rate this overall hotel experience anything better than â€œAverageâ€ù.

The hotel is situated right beside Union Square. It is a great central location. Rooms are spacious and equipped with all necessities. Breakfast is quite simple, but enough to fill you. No pools, just a gym but with a nice view of San Francisco.

Well located hotel, nice lobby and common areas. My room was a little tired looking -nicked up cabinets and a loud mini-fridge with no mini-bar stocked in the room. I might not have had a fully renovated room. Weekday rate was much higher than weekend rate, so it was overpriced then okay in terms of value. Location is great, though all the one-ways to get to the hotel is a little inefficient - but easy to get places on Uber or by taxi.

The staff was very responsive, rooms were clean, set-up for presentations and panels was good. As a business destination, the Grand Hyatt worked. My only complaint was the constant construction around Union Square. This is not a reflection on the hotel as a business destination but I could see it hampering the enjoyment of a vacation stay to have an afternoon nap be disturbed by jack-hammering.

We just stayed at the Grand Hyatt and it was an exceptional experience. Big/Spacious rooms, excellent views, friendly/courteous staff at the front door, check in, concierge, and housekeeping staff .. Overall, an excellent stay,

From the beginning, the SF Grand Hyatt turned what started off from a glorious wedding ceremony at the SF City Hall to a disasterous Wedding Day. First, the hotel didn't hold a particular type of room I was assured was being held for my daughter and her guests. I was made to feel foolish waiting 30 minutes for the Front Desk to tell me they did not hold the room that was supposed to be a surprise for my daughter. Then my daughter, her wife and wedding party and guests went to the hotel's restaurant to have dinner. They were met by one of their waitstaff who without cause had an attitude with them and seated them apart from the rest of the other diners in the restaurant. My dsughter and her guests then had to wait for over 45 minutes to even have bread brought to their table. By the time their food had arrived, it was cold and unappealing. And to top it all off the waiter broke a glass of soda that spilled all over my daughter in law's new cell phone. The waiter didn't even clean up the mess that was made by him. He just dropped off some towels to have my daughter and her guests clean up the broken glass and spilled soda. Needless to say, my daughter is heartbroken as to the poor and disgraceful service she, her wife and their guests received. The SF Grand Hyatt ruined my daughter's special day. One that cannot be replaced. If you are from the LGBT community and you are thinking about holding your special occassion at this hotel, you should seriously think about going to another Hyatt or another hotel.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco from September 7-10, 2016 for a 3 night stay. I was there for a convention/conference. The group rate was $259 per night, valet parking is $67 per night, not including taxes and assessments. The room was a 1 king bed on the 5th floor. The mattress was comfortable and didnâ€™t show any signs of infestation. There are plenty of electrical outlets on both sides of the bed and desk area for charging any devices. Iâ€™m a Hyatt Gold passport member and I was able to use my iPhone as my room key, pretty cool stuff. The room overall is definitely modern and I enjoyed it. The Grand Hyatt is about a 15 minute walk to the Moscone Center for conventions. Iâ€™m sure the room rate would be much higher if I didnâ€™t have the group rate, and even then my employer paid for the room. Iâ€™ve posted several pictures for review. Iâ€™d definitely recommend this hotel for business or pleasure!

Perfect location - just off Union Square. Great shopping, and walking distance to just about everything. Courteous, helpful staff. Clean, comfortable, modern rooms with nice beds and roomy bathrooms. The spurge for the Grand Club is worth every penny: the breakfast is divine, and it was very nice for a coffee/tea break during the day in the lounge with beautiful views of the bay. Very happy stay.

I have made many trips to SF and this is the only hotel I will stay at. The rooms are always clean and just went under a complete renovation. The views are wonderful. It is perfectly located on Union Square with access to everything. The staff is wonderful and I can never say enough about them. Check in and check out are flawless, painless and doesn't take forever. I highly recommend spending the few extra dollars to get club access. Food is great, coffee superb, drinks are cheap and the staff up there is the best of the best. Plus it provides one of the most amazing views of the city. Only downside is wishing they had more window tables. I mean it when I say that for me this is THE sf hotel. Thank you for yet another perfect stay!!! You continually earn my loyalty.

Being a Hyatt lifetime diamond, I had never stayed here. Must say, not a bad spot. Given a room on 33 with a great view, club on 32 gym on 35.Check in a breeze, staff friendly.Downside. My bed squeaked on the right side, frame or something really annoying.Hotel supplies ear plugs, what does that tell you?I didn't need them, but I understand why, it's a little windy up here, and it has a sliding door that doesn't quite lock shut.Otherwise, I didn't mind it personally. A good stay overall

I seldom write a review... But my stay at Grand Hyatt is worth the time... Had a great time and enjoyed our stay. Great location-- in the heart of Uniion Square. Staff are all very nice and helpful. Self parking is also across the street.

We stayed at this hotel for 4 days while during Thanksgiving 2015. The hotel is centrally located in Union Square and just a few blocks from Chinatown. There are tons of shopping all around and a lot of good food and dining options. I think we had a standard room and it was very clean but the rooms were on the smaller side. Seemed like it would be a perfect stay for a business traveler but for a family of 4 (two small kids) it was fine enough. I thought the staff was very friendly and every time we left and came back to the hotel, we were always greeted with a warm smile especially staff by the front door. Very helpful and patient with questions on the surrounding area and directions. Would recommend and stay again.

Fabulous Hotel in great central location. Large bedroom allocated on 15th floor with excellent views of Union Square for our stay at this Hotel Huge bathroom with shower. Extremely modern facilitiesFree wifi provided in room and public areasCoffee/Tea making facilities provided in bedroomLabour Bank Holiday period during our stay so busyFriendly staff on doors for arrival or departures Helpful Reception Staff who can book tickets for shows, meals etcCoffee Stall serving bagels, croissants etc on Lobby LevelOutdoor seating area located directly next to Apple storeDefinitely recommend as base for visiting this fantastic city

Honestly, it is a very good hotel. It is clean and well maintained. Very good facilities and a nice gym. The breakfast is great but $30 is a bit expensive. I wanted to stay longer had I have booked in advance.

Stayed here for 6 nights and it was just awesome. Check in and check out were the easiest, rooms well maintained and amazing facility. For a view of the city, bay and other views, go to the 36th floor and don't forget your camera :-).

The location of this hotel is great - a few steps from Union square and China Town, loads of shops near by and only a short walk to SFMOMA and about 15/20 minutes to the waterfront. It's also convenient for the BART, trams and busses - even for the cable car, should you want to wait in line!Public areas are attractive too - particularly given how large and busy the hotel is. Check in/out staff are friendly but a little incompetent (they don't seem to understand how the Hyatt passport works).Rooms are pretty decent too - typical Hyatt; quiet colours, sleek furniture and comfortable beds.House keeping in the public areas could have been better (but was good in the rooms) and there is something of a lift problem - you can wait ages to get one! One of the best things was breakfast - the buffet was really good value at about $25 and the food was very tasty. The gym has great views but the room is old and unattractive - this really does need a makeover.All in all - a decent hotel in a great location.

We were so disappointed with this hotel.The location is excellent but it ends there. No help with luggage, room grubby, stood in inches of water in the bath when showering. The air conditioning is pre set, no chance of personal needs.The room had a connecting door and you could hear the conversations of the people in the adjoining room.Street noise was unbelievable, music from a concert each evening in union square, voices in the street, and noise from nearby construction. The lifts were not cleaned for days, fluff, hair and really dirty.

Excellent love the way they setup the room for my baby..! From the restroom to the crib excellent was equipped with the baby stuff.. I love the fact that they had to do the water Didn't need to buy any..

Perfect holiday weekend to be in SF. The Grand Hyatt was amazing and I highly reommend it. Only thing was my request for connecting rooms were not accomplished. They we in high demand. The weekend weather was spectacular so the views from the hotel was gorgeous!

Beautifully renovated hotel right on Union Square, convenient to all. No parking on premises (valet car or park across street). Rates competitive with expensive SF, high government taxes add 20% to your stay.

Choosing to stay at the Grand Hyatt San Fran was not a decision I made easily. My hotel criteria were as follows: Must be in Union Square, Must have a fitness center, Must have easy access to ALL public transportation, Service must be above a 4, Must have a restaurant on site, Room must be above a 4, and the overall rating must be above a 4. The Grand Hyatt turned out to be amongst the top 5 based on my criteria, so decided to give it a go. So glad I did. Amongst the other not so top of my list was 24hour front desk, and luggage storage. My only qualm was with the check in process. Because I booked with a third party (I know better next time) I did not receive my points for my stay which sucks! Also, my charges for my upgrades did not reflect on the third party site, so I totally forgot I even had that portion. All in all, that part wasn't a big deal, I just know better for next time.

I stayed here for a conference overnight and wished I stayed longer. I was not aware of this hotel in downtown San Fransisco and got upgraded to a suite which was phenomenal. I would stay here every time I visit if I could afford it. Great place to stay!

The front desk is very helpful and treated me as if I was the most important guest they saw that day. I stay a lot of hotels but having that feeling that I was important despite many people probably spending more money there than me made it a worthwhile experience.

In for a visit. The staff is extremely nice and accommodating. The room is beautiful and well-stocked with amenities. The bed and the pillows were great. Like virtually all other hotels, they have a "green" policy. I thought it was a little weird when we hung two of our towels up and they added an extra two towels to the room. We look forward to coming back the next time we're in town.

Clean, stylish rooms and lobby. The hotel is in a great location to Union Square. The views were excellent from higher floors. Staff were all pleasant, helpful and quick to assist. The restaurant food and service was good. Bar is quant.

The hotel is worthy of the brand. Location is great -- right on Union Square and close to Dragons Gate and Chinatown. Modern rooms with centralized controls for lighting and blinds, which were nice. Comfortable beds and a minimum of street noise. Nice views. No pool.

This is a good hotel for SF , but certainly not the greatest Grand Hyatt in the world...rooms can be improved upon .Room service is limited and slow . Functional clean , and a new apple store next door.

We stayed here for just one night. Check in was fast and the doormen were friendly. The room had a great view of the bay, but it was very loud. We were on the 24th floor. In the morning before we left we noticed a seal was broken on the window, which may have contributed to the noise. Breakfast in the restaurant was good.

I love this hotel, it is in a brilliant location within two blocks of all the shops around Union Square. It feels safe and secure as I am travelling solo this is always important. Staff were friendly and accommodating with my late check out request. Room service was quick and the food was good. The rooms are spacious, modern, quiet and clean. The bed was extremely comfortable with multiple pillows to choose from.

it's 1:58am and the construction noise going on right outside the hotel is unreal. If you want to be able to sleep then stay somewhere else! The hotel are apologetic but they say there isn't much they can do. There are different projects going on that have 24 hr permits to work.

Have stayed at this hotel before and had a much better experience. They seem to have changed the in room thermostat and now it can't be lowered below 65F (this one is hack proof). You may think that in SF air conditioning is not needed, but you would be wrong. Three times we called to have the thermostat lowered to 60F and every time, twice by the person that went to the room, we were told it could not be done, the exact words were "it's impossible". We had a room facing west so it got very hot in that room. At night we tried opening the windows the sliver that can be open but the only thing that we accomplished was a very very noisy night since all the buildings act as an echo chamber and sirens are going off all thru the night. And the room was still warm. We were also told by the engineer that the hotel turns the cooling water off at night to save energy. It was a very uncomfortable 3 night stay. If you like to sleep in a cool room avoid this hotel. The club room was small and every morning had problems finding a chair to eat breakfast. Very limited selection also. Paid over 1K for 3 night stay, too much, but maybe the price is linked to how warm it gets in the room, the warmer the pricier. Would not stay here again.

Check in was a breeze. Everyone friendly and eager to please! Had corner room on high floor. Nice setup with lots of room and bed was very comfortable. Free WIFI is a plusIn the morning coffee with snacks available for a fee in lobby. Better choice would be free coffee in lobby 'cause coffee maker in room is subpar

The hotel was very clean and the Staff was helpful and friendly. It is next to Union Square which is the center of much activity and shopping. Meeting facilites were good. I did not eat there so cannot comment on the food. I would stay there again.

The entire staff was excellent. The restaurant food was good and service even better. Hotel was clean and modern. The rates are pricey but not out of the range for the location which can't be beat. We'll definitely be returning whenever we make the trip to San Francisco.

Family of 4 (2 kids ages 12 & 14) stayed for 4 nights in mid-August. We booked a double/double since we were in SF to see the sights and didn't plan on spending much time in our room. Don't be fooled, these rooms are small for 4 people. There isn't much room to put clothes if you want to unpack your suitcase. We had a dresser in the closet, which had 3 shallow drawers. What looks like a dresser under the TV, is really the safe and refrigerator (which was a plus.) The bathroom was larger than expected and had a really cool sink, but it took up too much valuable counter space. The bathroom also has a sliding door rather than a regular door that closes. I don't really get this. We had this same experience at a Hyatt in Boston. Do the folks who design these rooms travel with other people?? We picked Union Square because of its central location, but admittedly did a lot of traveling to get to Fisherman's Wharf everyday for the tourist attractions. In the morning we would take the bus ($2.25 per adult & $1 per child) and then usually walked back or once we took the cable car which can drop you off a block way. I have no complaints about the hotel, just wish the rooms were a little more spacious. I would stay here again rather than closer to Fishermans' Wharf, because I didn't think the quality of the hotels are better and I enjoyed walking through the different SF neighborhoods.BTW...the men and women working at the Concierge desk could not be more helpful to folks stopping by needing assistance.

When I walked into our room, the view of San Francisco overlooking Union Square took my breath away. It was spectacular!!! The location of this property is about as central as possible. The room was incredibly spacious with a lovely dressing room and good sized bathroom. Our business is in major projects, so we naturally assess the quality of building construction and finishes.
