As good as this property looks, they haven't used as high quality finishes as we've seen in the other Grand Hyatt properties. But it's still a lovely hotel. We didn't eat at all in the hotel so I can't comment on the food offerings. The lobby has unusual artwork and working fireplaces - both lovely features. One great thing: the A/C was making noise our first night. We rang in the morning and they sent someone to assess it immediately. This person left to get a repairman with the correct parts and we went out. When I got back to the room, I was on my cellphone and the repairman was working. He finished working as I finished my call. He demonstrated how the A/C was now quiet and he apologetically asked me to give him my room key so he could ensure that I was the proper guest of the room. I was thrilled that he was that conscientious about security!!! I told the front desk the next morning to make sure that this repairman was recognised for his commitment to the well-being of the hotel's guests.I would definitely stay at this property again.

Traveling to SF for business, I'm always trying to find a hotel that has a nice gym. The Grand Hyatt in SF had that as the gym itself had a half dozen treadmills, 3 or 4 elliptical machines, free weights, and a number of universal equipment. Located on the 35th floor, you get a pretty view of SF as well.The room itself was also very nice and I seemed to be quiet enough; only once did or twice did I hear some late night arrivals getting to their rooms. The room was a bit pricey, but you are in the heart of SF and luckily I could expense it for work. If the price would come down, I would definitely look to stay again.

Wonderful hotel with modern rooms, great views, beautiful lobby, great breakfast buffet and fantastic service. On top of all that, it's located right in the heart of the city. Lots of great restaurants around, tour buses are next door as well as famous cable car stop. No complaints whatsoever. Highly recommend!

I stayed at this property with a few friends while we were in town to run the San Francisco marathon. The hotel is bright, clean and nicely renovated. From a frequent traveler standpoint, the rooms are small and have tiny double beds if you're staying in a room with two beds. Our room was booked under my friend who is a Lifetime Diamond member with Hyatt - no upgrade. Also the Grand Club was flooded with families so it wasn't a "peaceful business lounge experience" if you're trying to get some work done. When I say flooded, we couldn't even sit down at a table as were forced to eat and stand during breakfast everyday. One nice feature is that the windows open up entirely with great city views on higher floors. From a safety stand point you are able to jump from the window if you choose (might not be the best feature with children).Service at the hotel was friendly and responsive for a large busy hotel. When I used to work in the city for extended periods of time I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton on Stockton - the service at the Hyatt was significantly better.I would definitely recommend this hotel, however if you like to take an after work swim look elsewhere because this hotel is strangely missing a pool.

Pros:Centrally located in union square which makes dining and shopping very convenient.Walking distance to Nob Hill, Chinatown and Financial District.Room is clean, decent size (our assigned room is facing the street on the top level so we had a great view).If you forget any toiletries at home, just give them a call and they'll bring it to you within minutes. They even have a list of products in the room (hair spray, makeup remover, shoe horn, shaving cream, ~just to name a view~).Free wi-fi and the connection is very good.Staffs are friendly and welcoming (from receptionist to room service to bellboy).Btw, if you are a TV addict, feel free to bring your appletv. You can easily connect it to their tv with hdmi cable and all you have to do is to call the front desk for hotel's Internet provider info, call the number and they'll help connect the wifi to your appletv within couple minutes. Just remember to tell them how long you are going to stay there for.Cons:None!!! (SF is a pretty expensive city so union square area's hotel's price is high, just expect there, otherwise, it's a great pleasure staying here)

Great hotel, fantastic views of the San fransico area, and all around amazing friendly staff! We celebrated our anniversary here and had a wonderful time! Can't say enough great things about this hotel !

stayed 2 nights with great view of Union Square, very convenient next to Apple store and near Bart. Many restaurant choices. very comfortable beds and friendly service. Room spotless and modern. Will come back

It's been said before - but one of the best things about this hotel is the location - it is really central and convenient to many places. Easy walk to the BART (train/subway), close to many shops, Union Square (obviously), and not a difficult walk to either the Ferry terminal or Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. The hotel is good - good views and well-appointed room - very comfortable. I would stay again.

Hotel is everything you would expect from a modern Grand Hyatt. Being a central hotel the rooms are comfortable rather than spacious but the design is elegant and all the essential features are present for a business traveller.Staff are welcoming and the public areas are very comfortable. There are some impressive views from the upper floors.The location is great for shopping but the harbour or Golden Gate Bridge are only a short Uber ride away.

We stayed here for 3 nights at the start of our California trip. We had a room with 2 queen beds which was spacious enough for the four of us. We were on the 27th floor with a great view overlooking Union Square. There is still some building work going on, but there was no issue with noise at all.We made use of the hop on hop off buses which stop close by. This let us see the main sights of the city in a short time. The hotel is well located with lots of fabulous shops nearby and plenty of good restaurants to choose from. We didn't eat in the hotel, but had evening drinks in the bar which was lovely.The hotel has a well equipped gym with stunning views over the city from the 35th floor. My sons made use of this each day. We were glad we didn't have a car at this point as the San Francisco traffic is heavy. We picked up our hire car on the morning we were leaving for Yosemite which was perfect.If you are looking for a modern central hotel then the Grand Hyatt fits the bill.

Excellent location - east to get to all attractions. Very comfortable hotel. Great staff. Gym was well equipped. Fantastic view from 30th floor bedroom - worth paying extra for. Would definitely stay here again

The location is perfect in Union Sq - shopping, restaurants, China Town, transportation. The service was impeccable from the moment we arrived. We had special requests which were accommodated seamlessly. The club perks were a wonderful upgrade that I will always look to include when I stay at a Hyatt from now on. They included breakfast as well as wonderful coffee selections and a great happy hour stop-in with excellent city views from the 32nd floor. They also had dessert and beverages. The hotel bar had great ambiance and live music. The room was perfect. I would definitely stay here the next time in SF!!

Service and room were really nice. Rooms have been updated recently and were very clean though modestly dated. The location in Union Square was super convenient and close to everything. The staff was very friendly and courteous as well.

Great downtown location. Lounge upgrade was worth the extra money. Very good staff. Nice room with good amenities. Great view. Wifi weak in rooms. Couldn't watch movies without buying a package. Reasonable walking distance to most things.

Good workout facility and small plates in the restaurant are stellar. A co-worker wanted grilled cheese and tomato soup and those were on the menu! The choose 3-4-5 is a great idea. Service was excellent.

Beautifully maintained hotel. Very luxurious. Best deal in town and in the square. Food was amazing. Check in and out quick and painless. Staff was friendly and courteous. Rooms were very nice. Would stay there again.

Worst place to stay you 400 $ plus and still can't have a sound sleep It's a complete no ..........................................never ever again what a waste It's my first day and I am booked for 3 nights lets c what's in store for me

Planned a quick trip to San Francisco so visit some favorite spots, tour the new SF Museum of Modern Art and visit some friends. Mid-August is the height of the summer tourist season, so I was delighted to find both availability and the points-and-cash option offered by the Hyatt Gold Passport program when I booked our room earlier this year. We knew we'd be in a comfortable property-- it has a AAA Four Diamond Rating. What we didn't realize until after arrival was the convenience of its location. The property is less than two blocks from Union Square. And it's just across the street from the popular 30-Stockton bus route, which takes one north to Chinatown, North Beach, Fisherman's Wharf and the Marina District; or south to Market Street, BART connections and the transit terminal. We visit San Francisco at least once a year and have Clipper Cards to simplify riding and transferring between buses, light rail and the ferry system. Having the bus stops and the retail district of Union Square close by made getting around a breeze. We had a mid-level room with a city view. It was clean and well-maintained. Take the elevator to the fitness club on the 35th floor for some great views you won't enjoy in most workouts. And if there's no conference or event underway, go to the 36th floor for jaw-dropping panoramas of the city and the bay. There's a lot of new construction underway in the district that's slowly changing the face of the area and converting some of the neighborhood's rundown properties into upgraded businesses or high rises. You might hear a bit of construction noise during the daytime and at night but it wasn't very noticeable. We had lunch Saturday morning at OneUP, the second floor restaurant, and it while it was tremendously busy the staff gave us seats in the small private dining room off to the side where we had a tasty pair of straightforward entrees. I earn my Hyatt points at conferences and other stays around the country and this was an excellent place to combine them with some cash for an affordable room and a great couple's weekend. One other offbeat note: If you play PokÃ©mon Go, there are a couple of PokÃ© Stops close by and dozens of regular stops and "lures" within easy walking distance. That gives fans a chance to stroll and play or simply relax in the room after hours and reload their stock of PokÃ© Balls. Just sayin'.

Outdated. To expensive for very little return. Ends don't justify means. Very loud , Food sucked, Tv was not great programming even worse. Staff was friendly, online concierge offered executive suite, then welched on what he offered, made me look foolish in front of friends. Kinda was refund if possible

I won't stay anywhere else. Felt very special with the staff attention and the overall attentiveness of the staff. I loved the help we received as to any request we had.. A lovely g bunch of people. Location is very good. Rooms clean and quiet. But most of all it was the people who went our to their way to meet our needs.

Overall my stay at the Hyatt in San Francisco wasn't bad. Very friendly accommodating front desk. The room was clean, bed was comfortable, unfortunately can't say the same about the city it's self. If i flew into San Francisco late. I would definitely stay there again. Price was right. Most importantly I didn't feel skeeved out staying in the room or sleeping in the bed as I did in some (over rated) hotels. Could there be a few minor upgrades? Of course! But definitely nothing that would alter my stay dramatically.

This Hyatt is a relaxing respite from the bustle of Union Square. Within walking distance of shops and attractions, the hotel is quiet and comfortable. On the higher floors you have marvelous views and can't hear any traffic noises. The fitness center is spacious and well appointed. The Grand Club lounge on the 32nd floor is available to Hyatt Diamond Passport members - the buffet breakfast is fabulous! The bed is comfortable and the room is airy with large windows.

If this was a budget hotel, Holiday Inn Express or similar, on half the price, I would rate it quite highly. But it is supposed to be a premier brand and has prices to demonstrate this. For this I only give it 3/5. On the plus side, the hotel is in a very central location. We upgraded to a 28th floor room which had great views over the city. It was comfortable enough and we had no major issues. On the minus side, we had a double double for two adults and a child and found it a bit snug (but it is a city hotel). The bathroom is also quite small. It had a design flaw in that the door to the bathroom had a large pane of glass in it and there was only one bright light in the bathroom. So if someone went to the bathroom in the night, they invariably lit up the whole bedroom. The biggest minus was the general lack of attentive service you might expect from a Hyatt. The doormen/porters were next to useless. Our taxi dropped us off from the airport with 3 suitcases. We were completely ignored by the doormen. We wheeled our suitcases to reception for check-in, expecting the receptionist to ask if we wanted a hand with our bags. Nothing doing, we took them to our room ourselves. Checking out, I went to get a hire car and my wife and daughter wheeled the 3 cases out to the sidewalk on their own. Again no offer to help. In fact the doormen frequently didn't even both to open the doors for us as we came and went. The concierge wasn't able to get us a table in a restaurant other than what was already listed on Open Table. I had always assumed they would have the contacts but not here. An app could completely replace them. We left a note for the maid asking for another shower cap (and left a tip). We came back to find our toiletries replaced but not shower cap. First World problems I know, but when you are paying hundreds of dollars a night, is it too much to expect the staff in a hotel to help you with your bags, find a restaurant table or replace an item in the bathroom? So if you want to stay near Union Square, I think there are a lot of other options which I'm guessing are going to be a bit better than the Hyatt.

I really don't like this hotel after the refurbishment, however the beds are very comfortable and the location is exceptional right next to union square. Now they have a huge Apple Store next door as well. The concierge was very good as we emailed before our arrival that we wanted phone cards which was promptly arranged for us. The service overall was good and the view from the lounge is spectacular. Also the price is very reasonable compared to similar hotels in Sfo.

We spent the weekend for our anniversary. The staff was so amazing, they offered strawberries and chocolate to celebrate! They also granted my request for a late checkout because I am pregnant and wanted to take a quick nap before leaving. Great location and staff, and clean room. Would stay again.

Great location close to Union Square, shopping, BART station, and many great restaurants. We got a room on a higher floor (25th Floor) with a great view of Union Square and the entire city. Check in was smooth and they even comped us 2 cocktails at the bar on the second floor. Conceirage was also helpful in recommending place to visit, easy ways to get around town-bus, bart, or uber/lyft.bartender Phil makes some tasty drinks

Here for a weekend stay.The hotel doesn't look like much on the outside but the inside is totally updated and modern. It's right at the corner of Sutter and Stockton, which is 1.5 block NE of Union Square.Location: just out of the craziness on me Westside of the square. A lovely outdoor courtyard and fountain that overlooks the brand new Apple Store. A nice little oasis. Hotel valet is $60/day (crazy), park across the street at the Sutter garage for $25/day instead. Easy access to shopping on the square and to SFMOMA and other sights in SoMa. The hotel has a nice cutout on the curb to allow easy loading and unloading. Plenty of taxi and uber nearby.Room: we had a city view room. Floor to ceiling Windows and has sliver of bay view in between the buildings. Room is standard sized with king bed, club chair and ottoman, desk. Bathroom barely fits two people, shower only. The sink is the largest I've ever seen and looks outsized for the bathroom. But all updated and new. Nice bath amenities.Bed is a bit on the hard side but linens were nice and soft. Room has blackout curtains, which was nice. We were on the 30th floor, so no street noise. But have stayed at lower floors and can hear street noise and construction on Union Square.Had a very enjoyable stay and would recommend.

Located in the center of the city of San Fransisco, near the most popular shops, restaurants and bars, the Grand Hayat Hotell provides excellent services, spacious rooms and very good breakfast and cuisine in general ! It is a very good combination of value, money and location. We will definatelly chose this hotel when we visit SF again!

Stayed here for 6 nights. A little under whelmed by the hotel. Nothing really bad, but I expected a little more from a grand Hyatt. Neighborhood is very mixed with upscale shops and restaurants and homeless people. Rooms are a little small but adequate. Big useless bathroom sink. Little drawer space for 4 people. Warning!! Nearby Contruction goes 24 hours / day. Not the hotel's fault, but be aware a lot of street noise and construction noise around the clock. 14 floors up and still loud. The hotel was apologetic, offered a free breakfast and felt bad. It was beyond their control. Overall decent experience though. Good location plenty of places within walking distance. Cable cars and #30 bus can take you just about anywhere!

Beautifully decorated suite with lovely furnishings, lovely living room area and the bedroom spacious and bathroom is big. The view from the suite floor of downtown San Francisco is breath taking. Bliss!

I took a long time to book a hotel in San Francisco for the start of our holiday and the hotel didn't disappoint.Located in union square which is full of bars, shops and restaurants a nice place to get too and stay. Room was of a high standard and great views of the cityStaff were friendly

I was able to get my room from under $200 a night and stayed for three nights. The people there were very nice and the room was clean and well kept. Safety is an issue for the hotel and there was always someone watching the lobby and the elevator area. The hotel is centralized where shopping and restaurants are close by as well as China Town right around the corner. The hotel pricing is seasonal and there are times in the year that you can a great deal. Parking though was $40 for a twenty four hour period.

I had stayed on 2 previous occasions due to business. This visit was personal and location was very convenient. I was very surprised by the remodeling of the hotel and there was definitely a different feel to the hotel. I was always comfortable staying there. However this time it felt like an indulgence because it was a personal trip and the remodeling and new check-in/check-out process made it feel like a whole new experience. I miss the top floor restaurant (had a nice breakfast). However the check-in and check-out process was far more efficient and much more progressive for the more quick paced, mobile generation.

I have stayed in numerous hotels in San Francisco, and this is my favorite. It is small, easily traversable, has great service and rooms are never a surprise....except this visit! Hyatt has renovated the property, and I am amazed with the improvements. The rooms are peppier, modern, and they feel more expensive. We upgraded to a two room suite, and loved the City views, which were hidden from us with the touch of a button. (Shades going up or down) Bathroom lighting is a vast improvement over the standard fluorescent lighting which made anyone over 25 look horrendous. Lovely sinks, comfy furnishings, and intimate feel with a modern flair. Room service from a distance, via my cell phone. I did not want to leave! Remember, higher floors have less street noise!

Spent 4 nights here. Was a great location and everyone was friendly. Room was small for 4 people for sure but the view was great--we faced the square. Every morning we ran out of towels. They only provided 3 large ones! We left a note about that and also about coffee. They only left one regular everyday. When I called they brought more. I was underwhelmed by all that and also the restaurant. The food was ok. I paid $16 for a grey goose Cosmo. I thought that was a bit over the top.

Excellent hotel and staff. All staff were very friendly. Rooms were spacious and laid out well; plenty of storage. Love the mattress; it was a great night's sleep. The refrigerator is always nice to keep food and beverages. They also had fruit water next to the ice machine.

The hotel staff was consistently friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean with a modern design and stunning city and bay views. I love the rainbow LOVE artwork in the courtyard outside and the stunning art installation in the lobby area. I enjoyed cozy lobby design with plush couches and cool library walls overlaid on glass to the alley - very cool :)

Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights for a conference. Having lived in San Francisco for many years, totally agreed that this hotel has a perfect location, close to all kinds of public transportation, within walking distance to shopping, dining, tourist attractions, Chinatown, and even a pleasant 20-min walk to Fishermanâ€™s Wharf. Knew that the hotel had a major renovation recently, so really have expectation to it. When first arrived at the hotel, everything looked fresh and new. Checked in was easy and the staff were OK (not specially friendly). But when you got inside the room, you would find that they were using budgeted materials for the renovations. The closet door couldnâ€™t be closed properly, the night stand was moving, the water pressure at the shower was weak, the mattresses were soft, and the frig was empty. The air-con was noisy so I decided to turn it off and opened the window (can be opened up to 5 inches) to let some fresh air in, I was on 20th floor but could still hear the traffic noise from the street all night. So you can choose which noise you wanna hear while you sleep. I booked this hotel with the conference package and it said â€œcity viewâ€ù, but donâ€™t expected to see the view from their website, it was the office building next door that you could see. Unless you pay extra for a higher floor with nice view of the Bay Bridge or Alcatraz, donâ€™t expect a nice view. Overall it is just an average hotel and I'll give it a 3.5 star only.

We visited San Francisco for both a conference as well as some tourist-time. Grand Hyatt was perfectly located for easy walking to Union Square, Chinatown, Financial district, SFMuseum of Modern Art, shopping and dining. We enjoyed walking as well as the sightseeing bus that we caught from Union Square.

Wowed away by the property and excellent service. The BF and I booked a 36 hour jam-packed trip to SF for a random getaway weekend from the heat in Denver. Right from the moment we arrived on property (car sharing service transportation), we were warmly greeted by every staff member. The guest services agent(s) promptly/efficiently assisted us with getting pre-checked in (as we arrived at 8 AM to stow our bags) and shot us a text once our room was ready. Very chic dÃ©cor and modern accommodations, very helpful information in the rooms of all services available, great amenities for any traveler, and the best sleep!!!!! We had breakfast at OneUp Restaurant and enjoyed our experience/food with Johnny (server) - highly recommend the Dungeness Crab Omelet over the buffet Location is prime: located off of Union Square, you are in the center of it all. Walking distance from pocket neighborhoods. Plan on staying during our trip in November.Thanks, Grand Hyatt, for the lovely service!

The Grand Hyatt has a fun interior with very sleek & artsy designs. The staff is very knowledgable about the area and is really very helpful. One Up serves a great, simple breakfast. The size and design of the hotel rooms makes it very easy to feel at home.

The team at this Hyatt was outstanding. They were very helpful, kind and knowledgeable!! The hotel is right next to Union Square and in the middle of a great shopping area. Also lots of restaurants to choose from.

Though IÂ´ve been there for just a few days for vacations I must mention how wonderful Elaine from the concierge desk was. Always went out of her way to help me and answer all the questions I had and help me with the packages I had to received. Trully one of the bests!The hotel is really beatiful, well located and with trully care staff.

work trip with a small time to walk the city a bit...and loved every minute of it...the city was quite cold for august, but i'm from texas and in texas it's HOT. beautiful town. the grand hyatt is located close to china town and union square and in walking distance to so many cool spots.

The location of this hotel was perfect for our needs.It is 2 blocks away from the Powell Street bus station and literally sitting on Union Square, were most tour companies pick up from.There is a coffee cart open in the hotel in the morning, if not a Starbucks across the road. There are plenty of shopping opportunities (with Macy's on one block away) and plenty of places to eat.China Town is also close (technically one block diagonally away from the hotel).All staff were approachable, including check in staff, luggage store staff and the concierge desk.Will definitely stay at this hotel again when returning to SF.

We came here to see a concert at AT&T Park and to take in some of the tourist sites. The Hotel was a wonderful place to stay located in Union Square and lots of shopping. All staff across the board were amazing and very attentive. Once there i was offered an upgrade to a more roomy Suite and I'm glad we took them up on it !! what a room. Huge Living room with dining table and separate kitchen area. The views in this room were amazing !!! City and Bay views !! The room also came with access to the "Grand Club" on the 32nd floor which offered a hospitality suite with drinks and appetizers and continental breakfast in a room with spectacular views. The bedroom was great and the bed was very comfortable. Great Stay, Great Location and walking distance to lots of restaurants, shopping and AT&T Park.

The hotel is excellent overall, staff are friendly (except some at grand Club in the morning shifts). The reception and bill men were excellent and so much helpful. I would recommend this hotel for everyone who wants to be in the center of SF downtown. We did not need a car. we walked to all places

Enjoyed the staff, and club level services. Double bed room was small for my family of four, but location near Union Square was great for shopping and restaurants, as well as very near China town. I would stay there again with my family next time I visit San Francisco.

We loved this hotel. It was in a great location, right at Union Square with shopping and restaurants very close by. The hotel is beautiful and immaculately maintained. We had an amazing city view of the city and bay on the 28th floor. The beds were comfortable and we had nice bathroom amenities. When we arrived at our room it was a nice personal touch to see our names on the tv screen welcoming us. Juan who checked us in sent a cupcake and milk to our room to celebrate our 10 year old granddaughter's birthday. The concierge staff was warm and very helpful in recommending tours and restaurants. We had a rental car and we used the parking garage right across from the hotel with a 45.00 per day self assisted hotel rate with in and out privileges.It was billed directly to our room which made it very convenient. The bellmen outside the hotel were very nice and helpful as well. We loved this hotel and if we ever get back to San Francisco we will definitely stay at the Grand Hyatt.

The beds were very uncomfortable. If you like being in a noisy, hustle, bustle area with LOTS of shopping and LOTS of crowds/people, then this is a good location. If you are trying to get rest (R&R) - forget about it. Average service, marginal food and service at restaurant. Very small work-out area. For a Grand Hyatt. this hotel did not measure-up.

I travel every week to San Francisco for work. I've been looking for my go-to hotel, and this one isn't it. I also travel frequently to other places, and the Grand Hyatt San Francisco is more like a hotel in rural India or rural China than what I'd expect in a world-class city. Everything looks nice, but doesn't really function or work the way it should.My main complaint is that rooms are very noisy. You can hear everything going on in nearby rooms. A conversation 20 feet away in the elevator lobby. Someone urinating in their bathroom in the room next door or upstairs. The construction quality of the building itself seems to have skimped on some of the basic architectural techniques inside the walls and plumbing that would improve sound-proofing. I experience this most frequently in rural India and rural China where construction is fast and low-quality but looks nice on the surface.The service from the employees during my week-long stay was consistently good. I order room service breakfast every morning. The options are pretty limited for a large hotel, but sufficient. Sometimes the wait was long (40 min +). But the employees who took the order and brought the food were always very nice and very professional. Check in was also very easy, friendly with a smile.Overall, I'd say to avoid this hotel, mainly because the building itself was not constructed very well. You can tell by how easily sound travels. But the staff are great.

I was in San Francisco for a business trip for 3 days and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights (although my booking was for 3 nights).The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is right next to union square. It is a touristy location, so it is busy throughout the day, there are many restaurants & shops around.The staff is not very friendly. I had some issues related to charging the bill & they made very little effort to solve the problem. I found the staff at the reception impatient. I was trying to get some local help and the concierge desk was always either busy or unattended. When I took a taxi, the bell boy "helped" me to hire a flat rate cab which turned out to be much more expensive - so beware!The room was okay. I was alone but they gave me a room with 2 small (twin) beds although I requested a double bed and didn't change it at checkin time. There are the usual amenities in the room: TV, fridge, coffee maker (this was inside a cupboard so I didn't see it the first day). There are very few electrical outlets, only 1 chair and very little space to move around. On the whole, I would say the room is manageable if one needs to stay for a few days.They had free wifi which worked well for me.Overall my stay was comfortable, but I would try & find a more business friendly hotel next time (free or even paid breakfast in the hotel would be nice, 24 hour coffee, printer, etc.).

As is the case with other Grand Hyatts I've stayed in around the world, I have only good things to say about the Grand Hyatt San Francisco. Plenty of outlets located around the room. Modern, yet tasteful and comfortable decor. Large (and very cool looking) bathroom sink; plenty of counter space. Plenty of desk space for work. Very cool power shade cover for the window. Fantastic location in the heart of the city. I particularly liked the combination luggage stand/drawers in the closet -- it's very convenient. Upon check-in, I was given a voucher for complementary drinks and appetizers at the hotel lounge. (Thank you!)

This was our first time staying at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco. We came up for a staycation while our daughter went to Outside Lands. The location of the hotel is very convenient as it is 1 block from Union Square. We were surprised by the cost of overnight valet parking and $76!!! Found a couple good restaurants - one across the street at the Taj ( Indian cuisine) and the other is up one block, Bouce ( French Cuisine) reservations required at both but we got lucky!

I stayed here for a week in July when travelling on business. The hotel is very centrally located, just next to Union Square and only a 5-10 minute walk down to Market Street, the Financial District and a bit further to the Ferry Terminal (South East) or Westfield (South West).I walked to most places (my offices were just down on Market) and an UBER will get you quickly anywhere further - e.g. Pier 39, AT&T Stadium area etc.Rooms were spacious and comfortable, with a soft bed, good work desk and a decent view of the city. To stretch those legs, there were good fitness facilities (with a great view on a high floor), though no pool. It's relatively more expensive for the price and is slightly more "tired" than other hotels under the same Grand Hyatt brand. I would rate it 4/5 rather than the usual 5/5. Service was as you'd expect for a hotel like the Grand Hyatt. My wife bought a bike one day and staff were extremely accommodating to put it in storage til the day we checked out.

I was expecting so so very much more than what we received. The customer service was horrible, they did not care about us or show us that they valued our business. We arrived early and requested early check in, they forgot about us, they did not seem to care. We had arrived early after a 7 hour drive, cold, and a tired 1 year old. The king club felt like any standard room... The food presentations were a joke; bananas and cookies lol... I could go on and on.

The rooms are very quiet despite being in such a central location. The last time I was in SF, my wife and I had to but ear plugs to sleep. The hotel is close to all the action (Union Square, Chinatown, etc.) in San Francisco. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I really have nothing bad to say about my stay. Highly recommended.

A bit of a pickle at check in was resolved to our satisfaction and our room had a great view.Very helpful staff - from the doormen to the cleaning staff in particular who always had a cheery greeting for us.We will return.

Being in the Finacial district puts you smack dab in a location where the ferry is walking distance, cable and street cars are just outside the hotel and you can walk to so many wonderful attractions and neighborhoods. While there is no pool this place makes up for it by having a great restaurant and spectacular libby/atrium with well appointed fitness facilities. The hotel serves conference wonderfully. The rooms are well furnished and clean. Beds are comfortable. And the staff are very polite, professional, and friendly. There are other good hotels in the area but this one's location edges the other out. It's not the most cost effective place but you tend to pay for what you get. This is the main place I stay when traveling to the Bay Area.

We are staying here for 4 nights am disappointed in the hotel. First no security when it comes to getting to your room. Anyone can go to any floor. In this location you should only be able to get to your floor and the common areas of the hotel. Am surprised this hasn't been implemented. The rooms are ok nothing special for decor. Am surprised no night turn down. Coffee making facilities in the room but has coffee mate no real cream. WTH. No bar with a great view even tho there is a room they rent out for private party's on a high floor. I guess I have stayed in Grand Hyatt in The Middle East and SE Asia and they were on a different magnitude then this one. Not worth the money if you are going to pay this kind of money you should be getting the extras!!

I travel to San Fran regularly work and this IS the hotel i would love to stay at all the time. I love the great views , the great rooms and most importantly the service !The club lounge on the 32nd floor has awesome views and great options for breakfast and evening snacks !I havent tried the gym yet as I get plenty of walking around the city, union square etc.. Great Location !The beds are quite cozy !I will always come back here.

This is a great hotel that's, of course, in a great location. We went for the $50 "Club" upgrade and after a 4-night study we're glad we did so. It did help to have our room on the Club floor, 32. It's more than breakfast. There's a cool espresso machine, drinks and fruit that are available at all times we were there. Then, at 5, they set out a full "honor bar," with a couple of red and white wines for $3 and "make it yourself" cocktails for $4. Until 7pm, they put out quite a spread. Vegetables, pickled vegetables, delicious cheeses and, one night, "sliders," and another night a pasta dish. Breakfast is the usual pastries and fruits plus a delicious lox and bagels spread. There's oatmeal (good) and delicious scrambled eggs bPlus, there's that great espresso machine (and regular coffee too). We 'dinged' a star due to a weird housekeeping experience. Coming back to the room late one afternoon, we were surprised to find that the room hadn't been made up even though the towels had been replaced -- and out $5.00 tip picked up. It was too late and too much hassle to do anything about it. Especially odd because the day before (with an immaculately cleaned room) we were pleased with the nice thank-you note for our tip from housekeeping. Another sour note was the lack of capacity in the Clubroom. As other reviewers have accurately noted, at busy hours (either AM or PM) the place is overwhelmed with people milling around unable to find a place to sit. However, Clubroom staff are helpful and gracious, especially David. Based on our experience the $50 daily upgrade cost for the Club is well worth it.

would try another hotel on a future visit. Noting particularly special about (or wrong with) the hotel. The restaurant, One Up. was ok. My biggest pet peeve was that there was no place to hang a towel in the bathroom so you couldn't reuse a towel to save water even if you wanted to. The sink in the bathroom was trendy, but was too big for the counter space and resulted in not much space for toiletries.

Fantastic place to stay. I would go back to stay at this particular hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone for business or pleasure. Hopefully this review will help others choose your hotel for their stay. The bed was awesome and I slept very well. Everything was clean and well appointed.

The Grand Hyatt in San Francisco meets the expectations one has for that brand: it is well run, clean and with high end service and attention to details. For example, for our party of three, my wife and I booked two room separately under our respective names. The hotel had the initiative to make the connection between the two reservation and give us adjoining rooms without being asked. The rooms (one with a king and one with two doubles) were clean and functional. Staff here was uniformly friendly and helpful. I also attended a conference here, and the facilities were more good (the conference rooms on the 36th floor have spectacular views). The location is also very good. The hotel is near Union Square and a short walk to Chinatown. The only negative is that the elevators are very slow.

There was a lot of noise at times there shouldn't be any (I woke up at 6 in the morning with the sound of construction, but could only call asleep at around midnight because of said construction). Good rooms, although not very spacey. The breakfast was very diversified and very good overall.

the spectacular renovation of the San Francisco Grand Hyatt--situated between Union Square and the business district--manages to combine the needs of a large business hotel with the feel of a boutique property. i hadn't visited since the makeover and was impressed with the cool, clean organized lobby and the professional, friendly staff. Six elevators guarantee a few seconds wait at most. We arrived early and our double double room wasn't ready. we walked around the corner for breakfast, strolled back and picked up keys to our good size room. Not much of a view but terrific, comfortable beds and well stocked bathroom. this may not be in the Ritz or Four Seasons category but within the chain properties a step below, this Hyatt stands out.

We stayed here with our family as our home base for touring San Francisco with our 15 and 10 year old daughters. Located half a block from Union Square, near Yerba Gardens, the entrance to Chinatown and near the hub of transportation. We took advantage of the streetcars, cable cars, busses and train all convenient to our hotel. Close to LOTS of shopping and plenty of dining. Starbucks just across the street for morning coffee. Plenty of nearby breakfast spots and great food. The hotel itself was comfortable and modern; the automatic window shades were a nice touch. Would stay here again.

One of the best experiences I have had at a hotel. The staff was incredibly helpful and courteous and the facilities were top notch. They offered us a discount on upgrading to a suite and our room was incredible.

Location of this hotel is great. Check in / out speedy. Nice bar and hotel interior. Rooms are spacious and clean, the gym was ok. There are some great eateries nearby and easy walking distance to all the places in San Francisco. Good for a short stay!

Rooms, staff, location and amenities were great. A 5 minute walk to union square. I stayed here a few years ago before the remodel so was sad that the lounge at the top is no longer there but the new bar/lounge is great, the room was incredibly comfortable, the hotel was quiet, some street noise from time to time but it's a big city so that is expected. I would like to recognize the fantastic Ron at the front desk, great guy and started our trip off on the right note. Great customer service. Also Vanessa at the concierge was a wealth of knowledge and gave great suggestions, I think we did almost everything she recommended. Hope to stay here again on my next visit

The hotel is situated right in the buzzing Union Square. The staff is very courteous. The breakfast is quite wholesome. The gym has a lot of machines and free weights to chose from, apart from the regular treadmills. If you end up staying here, don't miss the view from the 36th Floor. Overall a very good experience.

I've stayed in SF before at the Hilton and this was a definite improvement even though it's a similar price. Rooms were spacious and comfortable, with modern decor (also throughout the hotel). I really liked as well the list of bits and pieces (toiletries etc.) that you could ask for if you'd forgotten things - a really nice touch. Staff were personal, friendly and helpful. Location is great - right on Union Square. Bar is a bit of an unfriendly space to spend much time in, but otherwise fine. OneUp was ok. Few issues with service the night we went and the food was ok rather than really good, but for price and convenience it's a good option. The menu had a nice selection as well, and the dishes generally were tasty (special call out for the burger). All in all, I'd recommend it, if it's in your budget. If I come back to SF on work again, this will definitely be my preference,

The dÃ©cor of the lobby was great. The room conditions are clean and furnishing very tastefully done. The staff are nice and the location is excellent. It is located right in the middle of the shopping district

Paid big bucks for a Club room for two nights. We were put in a tiny standard room. When I questioned the room right after check in, I was told it is absolutely a club room. When I checked out and complained I was told I was not in a club room and that hotel management does this all the time.

The hotel's staff were courteous and friendly. My room was asthetically pleasing, clean and the bed was surprisingly comfortable. The electronically controlled room darkening shades were a great touch. The premium Wi-fi was very reasonably priced. I'd definitely stay here again.

If you are traveling for work, this is a great hotel to book, as it is in the center of downtown San Franciso and is accessible to all the dining and shopping you can handle. It is also close enough to the airport and to other areas you may be interested in touring. Overall, this was a good choice. The hotel is pricey, but you pay for the location.

The hotel is located just at few steps away from Union Square with all the famous shops in walking distances. A Starbucks is right across the street, a Nike Store at the corner of the block.Powell St. Station/Cable Car is 5-10 min. walk around the corner.The rooms are modern but a bit tiny for 3 pax and five suitcases. The bathroom is new remodeled and luckily with a handshower - not like a usual "american" showerhead. Everything was cleanThe hotel has not a own garage/parking facility - there is one around the corner who is working with the hotel. It's about 45-67$ per day - really expensive but unfortunately quite "normal" for a big city like SF. Personally i missed a coffee maker or similliar to prepare a morning tea/coffee - on my opion it should be available in a hotel that pricy/category.We booked a double room for three nights. As a Gold Card Member i got the option to get an upgrade via mail. I did everything online but as we arrived we were told that they couldn't find anything about that upgrade. There wasn't any bayview rooms available for the first night but the employee said that we could move into the new room the next day - they will pick up our luggage in the morning and we could get our new keys in the afternoon.BUT surprise, surprise: as we returned back from sightseeing any bayview room was reserved for us and the same emplyee like the day before couldn't explain the circumstances... The guy who took care of us could be a bit more courteous. He offered us a little cash refund but due to the planed moving, no room maid came and clear/clean up the room. I didn't call for one because due to my health conditions i had to lay down after spending the whole day 'on the road'.It's not the first time that i have problems with that hotel chain and hopefully my bookings the next days in SoCal will be without any complains/problems.Beside these personal issues it's a good central hotel to stay with - a bit noisy because of traffic but you be close to a lot of sightseeing places.

Beautiful hotel in great location. A gorgeous fire in the reception area was well appreciated at the end of a busy day. Close to shopping & Chinatown. A fair walk to the marina (25 minutes) with one steep hill to climb. The customer service is outstanding, from the doorman through to concierge. The rooms are very comfortable & spacious. The restaurant is small so there is a short wait for breakfast but the food is of a very high standard. We had lunch in the restaurant which I recommend doing, particularly the Crab Bisque. There is also a bar/lounge with a lovely atmosphere although the wine list was a little disappointing. Overall, a great stay.

Reserved 2 beds - got a King. Was there for a marathon so really needed to rest and the rollaway isn't what I had in mind for $319/night. TV was OK but movies selection was awful and then didn't have any sound! Go back to basics - you have a great hotel, keep it simple. Restaurant is GREAT for breakfast.

Good hotel , helpful staff in very good location for shopping and sightseeing.A walking distance from Chinatown and even marina is not so far away.A lot of shops and good restaurants around - ask the concierge service they are very helpful with all you need.

My fiance and I just can't seem to stay away from SF. We got a great travel deal for flights to SF so decided to head up to the Bay for the weekend. The Grand Hyatt is centrally located for San Francisco. The hotel is modern, sleek and the rooms are really nice. We had a great time in SF and a great stay the the Grand Hyatt. Highlights:- Again, amazing staff. Very helpful and friendly. - Location is really great if you want to explore the city. Walking distance to a ton of things and just an Uber away from other parts of the city. - Bar is nice. We always like to hang out at the bar before we go up to our room. - Rooms are modern, sleek and clean. Same goes for the hotel groundsOverall, another amazing stay in SF. Next trip, we'll definitely consider staying here again. Be sure to book ahead so that you can get a good deal.

Not good value for money. Rooms are in poor condition with equipment like showerheads in disrepair. When I awoke early one morning I could not get a cup of coffee as room service, the club lounge and the coffee bar downstairs were closed. Coffee and such should be available 24/7; and the club lounge should be open 24 hours to allow access to coffee, water and tea at all times.

Reception was very accommodating is arranging expedited checkin so could sleep before a midnight start to my race. Windows needed to be washed on outside so view would have been more magnificent! Bed was very comfortable both before and after a double marathon. Kindness of reception staff person, Maria, to send up a note of encouragement and food amenities was awesome.

This Hyatt is the best location for everything! The rooms are nice, some with great views, worth upgrading for! The staff are really great, happy to help with everything, all of them! Comfortable beds, great sleep.

This review is so overdue. My family and I stayed here for 2 nights in January. Prior to our arrival Jason the executive housekeeper contacted me to see for there was anything he could put in the room for us since we were traveling with children. He is the most amazing, detail oriented, thoughtful man. He went above and beyond thinking of any and everything we could have needed. Down to a bottle brush which I had forgotten. He even bought my daughter a gift and had it as a surprise for her with a card when we arrived. I can't even explain how this made our trip. The rooms are beautiful. Beds were comfortable and the restaurant was great as well. We used the club lounge daily and enjoyed it very much. The location is great and I am truly grateful for Jason Hillman and the special way we were treated. We will definitely return.

Refurbished, fresh and well located. A good option for work or exploring the city. The club room lounge has fabulous views of the city, so its worth upgrading. Staff are very friendly and its a magnet for Pokemon hunters.

I was here for 9 nights and have stayed here several times before. This is a very comfortable sleek hotel and amazingly convenient for all of downtown SF and for any expo at the Moscone. (why I was there). We also hold a small client meeting in the hotel each year and the conference staff are excellent and simply cannot be more helpful. Pretty reasonable rates too if you are a guest.Rooms are good size (for a European) the higher you are the quieter it is. All clean and mine was recently refurbished and in really good nick.Gym - amazing morning views of the sunrise over the bay from the 35th floor, good selection of kit and free weights equipment too. Suggest going up to the conference rooms at the very top to get views over to The Rock etc. Breakfast is very good when you consider eating out can add up to almost the same $$ even if there are some great local diners etc. It was convenient and quick and the buffet was good quality.

Best hotel we have been so far in the US, from LA also Las Vegas staying at the suites in Palazzo last week, but this Grand a hyatt takes it a level up. Great check in desk, immediately proposing multiple upgrade choices including suites which we took and what an experience so far. 34th floor, amazing view of San Francisco, great club lounge, top room, the Grand Hyatt immediately accommodated extra beds for our daughters. We just had dinner 1st floor, we recommend Franck there, knows exactly which wine to best taste, we took a great Pinot Californian wine and what an experience. Looking forward to tomorrow

I would rate this hotel as excellent. The room was clean, staff was very willing to help with everything, mini fridge, and there was A/C and good temperature control. My only gripe is a lack of vending machines. There was only one in this big hotel with snacks, and it was poorly stocked. We went shopping to stock our fridge with late night snacks. I would definitely stay here again. Great location.

Hotel is located very centrally for San Francisco. As many know, the traffic and congestion continues to get worse in the city. Despite that, itâ€™s located centrally so within the Union Square area â€“ anything can be walked to. There is a great gym â€“ awesome view. The gym is the whole 35th floor. Always found equipment and well maintained. The hotels rooms have been upgraded and is very comfortable. One advice: The parking is $65 /day. If you donâ€™t need a car â€“ donâ€™t valet.

Good experience. A solid four stars. Check in was a breeze using the new Hyatt app that lets you skip the desk and go straight to the room. We had used points to upgrade to a club floor. We had room 3311 which afforded a nice view of the city. The room itself was in good condition and looked like the pictures. The bed was very comfortable and included feather pillows and nice sheets. We loved the automated black out shade with controls placed on either side of the bed. The bathroom was spacious and the shower was a bit tight, but nice. Toiletries on the club floors were by June Jacobs (had never heard of her before). One of the benefits of the club floor is access to lounge which includes breakfast and snacks throughout the day. While we only used for breakfast, there is good news / bad news here. The bad news was that at breakfast, the lounge is a total mob scene - clearly, demand exceeds capacity and one morning we gave up our seats to an elderly couple trying to find a place to sit. Th good news was that the breakfast spread was decent: OJ, coffee, bagels, lox, eggs, muffins, fruit, etc. Service is good and food was quickly replenished. We finally just ended up asking for a tray and taking things back to our room. All in all, we had a perfectly good stay. But I would think again about upgrading to the club floor - not sure that was worth it. Needless to say, the location on Union Square is unbeatable.

We recently stayed here for 5 nights and were allocated a room on the 3rd floor. Check in was fine but at check out, the gentleman was a little aloof and impersonal. Housekeeping were very friendly, polite and very efficient. Our room overlooked the Apple Store and we could see Union Square from our window. We were initially concerned there may have been street noise, but it was actually lovely and peaceful from any city noise. However, the same cannot be said of internal noise. Fellow guests speaking at high volume outside our room at 6am was a regular occurrence. They had little concern for anyone who didn't want to be awake so early, some even shouting from the lift area to family members still in their rooms. This also seemed to be made worse by the gaps at the bottom of the doors, allowing noise through and also banging of doors with automatic shutting action. We also had a room with an adjoining door which was no way near sound proofed enough, so neighbouring voices could be very clearly heard in our room, along with banging on the door. Better fitting of more solid doors would possibly help the situation.The location of this hotel is great and I would definitely considered staying again but I would request a room without an adjoining door, and overlooking the Apple Store.

So the hotel is sharp and the amenities plentiful. Beware tonight that Between the flushing toilets, slamming doors and barking dogs, it was loud to say the least. The staff is great, the bar is terrific and you can't beat the location. Stay here but bring your ear plugs.

My teen daughter and I just returned from a mother/daughter getaway to San Francisco. We spent four nights at the Grand Hyatt. Upon arriving at SFO, we took a taxi to the hotel. Ron at check-in was fabulous. The hotel is right next door to an Apple flagship store, so I was not surprised by the iMac check in stations. We had a room on the 24th floor, beautiful view. We were easily able to walk everywhere during our stay. Cable cars are nearby. We enjoyed ample shopping, great dinners and gelato while people watching in Union Square, just steps from the hotel. SFMoMA, Yerba Buena Gardens, Chinatown, the Financial District and SOMA were just blocks from the hotel. Walking Grant to Columbus was an easy 20 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf, no major hills. We liked that our hotel was in an area that was always vibrant, so we felt very safe. If noise is an issue for you, bring your earplugs. We did occasionally have street noise, especially early in the morning due to nearby construction. Our room was clean, well-lit, good storage, beds were comfy, in room safe and refrigerator. Housekeeping was prompt, we always returned to a clean room. Hotel concierge arranged a car service for our return to the airport. Super easy, we were very happy. Would return to this hotel.

We loved our four nights here. The Union Square location was great but everything closed down by 9pm. However, during the day, it's easy to walk to the main attractions such as the Ferry Bldg, Fisherman's Warf and even the AT&T Park.

The hotel was centrally located and convenient to all the locations that we wished to visit. We were just a few steps from the shopping in Union Square and only about two blocks from China town. The rooms were comfortable and we slept well after all the walking from that days activities. We did take advantage of the concierge level and found the staff to be extremely helpful.

Stayed 2 nights at Grand Hyatt. Location wise, this hotel is good. Plenty of stuff to do around the area in terms of pubs, restaurants and shopping. Easy walk to union square and to catch the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf. The room was a decent size and clean however our room faced in the opposite direction of Union Square (not the best view). We recommend, on check in, to request a room facing Union Square. The room was right next to their service door and we constantly heard attendants open and shut the door. We were woken up a couple of times by loud folk in the hallway and in the room next door (early morning and late night). We didn't mind the hotel but it reach our expectations.

If you'd like to feel special, this is a great place. My wife and I stay here 3 times a year for 4 day weekends, we always get the 2 room suite and it is the best. The Grand Hyatt Club has the best staff, great food, and awesome views. So friendly, courteous, and professional, best service in the whole city.

I stayed here for 2 nights with my husband and 3 year old son as part of our trip to the San Francisco Bay Area. When we checked in we noticed the previous guest left some clothes in the closet. We alerted housekeeping who then took the clothes away but no apology. The response at check out was "Oh I heard about that." I would have expected more from this establishment!

our traveler was so impressed with this hotel and their excellent personalized service. keep up the good work! the room was comfortable and spacious. I asked for pics but I guess he was so comfy he forgot!

If you love shopping, this hotel is a great choice for your stay in San Francisco! A short walk to Banana Republic, Macy's, Nike store and right next door to the new Apple store.We love Hyatt properties and this hotel is newly remodeled in a cool, urban modern design with an updated reception â€“ no desk, just Mac stations. Super comfortable beds too!You can't beat the view either, get an upper floor if you can and you'll be treated to the million dollar Golden Gate to the Bay bridge panorama on one side and the sprawling southern city on the other.We will definitely be back!

The location is good for travelers in the city for business or tourists who want to stay away from the tourist trap area. It's a nice, comfortable hotel but nothing special that will distinguish from other hotels in the area. I'm traveling for work and didn't have much selection. Last week I was at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf, so it's definitely a step up and more enjoyable. The downside for me was the cleaning, or lack of. I found several strands of someone's hair (definitely not mine) and it was in a place that should have been cleaned and is clearly visible.

My family of five enjoyed our four-night stay in two adjoining rooms at the Grand Hyatt. We appreciated the courteous hotel staff, comfortable beds and pillows, cleanliness of the hotel and excellent location in the city. We will stay at the Grand Hyatt the next time we visit San Francisco.

Stayed here while in town for Cavalia show. Beautiful views of the city and within easy walking distance to many attractions. The facilities were immaculate and the attention at the front desk was spot on.

This hotel is on the northern edge of Union Square. Near the trolley, market street, and walking distance to China Town, the Ferry Building and Fisherman's Wharf. Bit of a hike with luggage from the Bart but doable if you have a small rolling bag. The room was comfortable. Views are super. But the pillows are like lumpy rocks--ugh. Need replacing.

... just saying that at these prices- in San Francisco- you want to feel special and "privileged". The Grand Hyatt pulled that off for me nicely. Hotel, I understand, was recently remodeled and it showed... everything was modern and clean, but still cozy.

The rooms are clean but small. The Asian cleaning people are very professional and work hard. The cleaning products make the rooms smell bad (too many chemicals, too much chlorine). The windows do not open and the air conditioning will not eliminate the chemical smell... The receptionists are very nice. The concierge ladies are unprofessional, and rude - let aside slow and inefficient. The hotel is a mix of people from hundreds of nations. Most customers are highly educated and polite. Very few rare exceptions. Prices are high. We paid almost $400 for one king bed, small room. LOCATION is the best thing about this hotel. Oh... the restaurant is great. Excellent waiters, kind, professional and with a great sense of humor, especially the Asian ones. Waiters and cleaning people saved the review. Without them, a one star would have been in place, not a 4 star.

Very nice stay at the Grand Hyatt. Staff, attendants, and all grand Hyatt "folk" were courteous, attentive, and accommodating. Location is very good in Union Square; easy access to many modes of transportation - especially historic trolley cars. Good dining options within a close walk. The hotel is modern but the size of the rooms are smallish and the overall condition of the furniture, fixtures, and furnishings are not always upper tier quality. Club Room access was convenient and food and general were very good. Valet parking is good but uber-expensive.

Family vacation - we had 2 rooms on the 17th floor. Our rooms were large and we enjoyed the views on the 17th floor. The beds were comfortable and the amenities in the room were stellar. The service from the front desk to room service were top notch. You will not find friendlier people. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again when I return to San Francisco.

Beautiful hotel just steps away from Union Square. Shopping, dining, bars are all nearby. The room was comfortable and the view from the 24th floor was amazing. Try to get a room on a higher floor if you want a good view.

Great property to be in the middle of the city. Once the construction is completed, it will be even better. The hotel is walkable to my business meetings. The room was clean and housekeeping staff was wonderful. They were polite in the morning greeting guests and kept the room clean and neat.

We arrived here at the last day of stay for our trip around California. This hotel is located right next to Union Square, and we were able to some last minute Disney Store shopping and grab dinner just few blocks away. The lobby of this hotel is artistic and inviting, and has many spots to relax, if desired. The check-in and check-out processes were quick and easy, and the receptionists were helpful and kind.Jason, Assistant Executive Housekeeper, personally emailed us prior to arrival in order to best prepare our room for our arrival with our child. This was fantastic, and our room was even more prepared for our child than we expected. There was even a diaper genie which was super helpful for dirty diapers. It really helped us out to help us have the room be so well prepared, and we're thankful for his effort.Overall, the experience was better than even we had anticipated. We plan on coming back here in the future, and would not hesitate to recommend it to others.

As a native Californian, I was surprisingly startled at the ease with which one could stay in the very heart of downtown San Francisco! Too often, one makes decisions based on the traffic, crowd congestion, etc. Much to my surprise, the Grand Hyatt provided clean, tranquil rooms with a very accommodating staff from the bellman to the staff in their coffee bar. A true oasis in the very heart of the city!

Our room was very small. It seemed so much smaller than pictured. The floor was not very clean. The towels seemed damp or not properly dried before folding. Check in was difficult due to construction in the area. The lobby was not very friendly. The price we paid was within $70 of a 5-star luxury hotel. I wish I had selected differently. I do not think that the value was here for the price.

The Hyatt Grand in San Francisco was a very nicely appointed and clean hotel in the heart of Union Square. The rooms are very small but once we settled in we didn't have any issues with space for our family of 4. A few issues included the mattress which made a squeaking noise at any movement. It seemed as if they had a plastic bed pad. Fortunately we were tired from the days activities to sleep thru it. They need to address the sliding door on the bathroom and see if it can be altered to provide a little more privacy. The double beds were very small but there aren't many other hotels with queen bed options anyway. It seems to be in line with most other hotels in the area but the hotel was updated, clean and nice to return to after exploring.

In all of the years visiting the city, I have never stayed here. Driving up to the hotel, I could not have had a nicer group of valets. Check in was a breeze, the room was huge and had a fantastic view. The location was great and the beds vere very comfortable! Definitely going back!

Great location and staff was very accommodating. We were very impressed with service from bar and food was excellent. Location was right near shopping and excellent restaurants of types were close by. Only complaint was that someone was smoking in a room close to us. Non-smoking hotel.

Bad service. Room not cleaned fast nor thoroughly. There were no cups for water or coffee, even though there is a coffeepot. No complimentary bottled water. Room very tiny. Dated furniture and style. All this for over 300 bucks a night, was not good value. Better look elsewhere.

This hotel was clean and comfortable. Service was fine. Good location. However, nothing about it - i.e. room, lobby, bar, restaurant, etc. stood out. Room seemed a bit worn (carpet). Fine for transient business travel but not a "hot spot" if you are looking to enjoy your stay as part of a leisure trip to SF.

Wow! Really enjoyed the wheelchair accessible room here. Great bed/pillows. Nice view. I actually got a decent shower on a vacation! A great roll in shower, with a hand held shower head that had spray options that worked! With water pressure! I know, right!! A clean gimpy, is a happy gimpy, and makes for a better world ;) Here comes the bummer part of the room, it was noisy. The concierge desk was awesome (Liz & Anne). The complimentary breakfast in the dining room was a happy surprise. Creamy scrambled eggs one morning, many options with veggies and cheese, various pastries, cappuccino machine, oatmeal, etc. What a delight Judy was, she worked every day we were there. I looked forward to her company every morning, so sweet and helpful!

This was my second time staying at this hotel, the first being this time last year for Intersolar North America trade show at Moscone. This hotel is right next to Union Square and there is usually always something to do.There is construction around the property so it gets loud during the day and it seems like there is the occasional horn honking through out the night- typical of big cities.The staff is pro and is always on the lookout to attend to your needs- bell hops, check in, bar, room service, etc. The bar on the second floor serves an awesome Moscow Mule, by the way :DI was upgraded to a higher level floor room because of my Gold status- definitely worth having a rewards membership with Hyatt. Hotel offers amenities/toilettries in case you forgot yours. Workout room is pretty good and overlooks the city on one of the highest floors in the hotel.There is a Starbucks across the street as you walk outside. Lots of restaurants in the area within walking distance.Recommend parking at the Sutter-Stockton garage which is caddy corner from the hotel. I stayed for 3.5 days and it was $111- about $31-35 a day. Hotel offers valet for $65/day and partial drop off at their garage for $45/day. There is also a parking garage underneath Union Square. A 2 minute walk or less from the garage gets you to the hotel.

Stayed here two nights. Very hip hotel. Loved the check in via their app. My room overlooking Fisherman's Warf was superb. The staff was very helpful in arranging reservations. I wish they had full spa on site. My previous stays have been at Ritz which is more luxury oriented, Hyatt is more business.

I booked 3 rooms for 4 nights that costs almost a thousand bucks per night through rocketmiles (priceline company) for a double bed room. I emailed asking to be placed all in the same floor and required 2 extra bed. They said its all been requested.Then while checked in by ira, 2 of the room were downgraded to king size room due to they cant place rollaway in a double bed and which is much much more cheaper and what a small room. Beside me was a caucasian family who book 2 king size bed and upgraded to a suite. Ha! And you downgrade customer who paid higher? I dont care if someone get upgraded, but you downgrade my room then its a problem for me. Or perhaps your hotel was just a pure racists. One of the room need to be extended by one night since they only can give late check out until 1pm. So Ira told me to pay direct to them with their own rate. I asked how much would that be, she said the same price that Priceline give me which is almost a grand. I checked through an app in front of her with my hotels.com app, the price at hotels.com was only three hundred fifteen including tax. I told her, i will book through hotels.com. She then told me, she will ask for her manager to give the price match as what hotels.com has.Then she gave us higher price which is three seventy for a night extra, which I told her no. and asked I thought they can do price match? She said no, thats the lowest they can do.Then I told her I will book via hotels.com then, since I feel like taken advantage by this hotel. She said, "no if you book via other 3rd party you will need to check out before noon and check in to another room after 3pm, you cant stay in the same room you are staying now, its not possible." She knew that The room extended was with an infant and a small kid and it will be troublesome for us to move and wait in the lobby, so they pressured me with that. One hour after checked in my card was charged 400usd. They said its for security.One of my sister in law booking (she checked in earlier than us) she was asked to moved too because they said they give her a promo rate. If they wanted to stay, they will need to add more. Look, I thought staying at hyatt will makes me secure, like any other hyatt. But sadly this establishment is a green eyed monster who tried to rob you even to your cents. This is the greatest joke they made in a bad economy, isnt it?Last day I called the bell, he took my luggages and drop it to the main door, he didn't want to upload it to the suv and said the doorman will do that for us. He took the tip and leave and none help us with our luggages after that.The positive thing here is the housekeeping. All of them are nice and helpful. The breakfast is poor, dont bother coming, scrambled egg, one with ham one is plan and another one is mushroom, potatoes and sausages. Just go across the road starbucks they have better option too. They open a starbucks stall too infront of the conciarge and bill twice more expensive.You ruin the image of grand hyatt, and no I wont stay in any other hyatt anymore, because your management is a rubbish rip off place. Loosing a customer who cares right? Good luck with the pennies.

Stayed here for 5 nights last week. Location is pretty good with lots of shopping around. Very busy however and there is major road construction along stockton but we were not bothered by the noise. You can walk to china town and the Little Italy area within 10-15 min and to Coit tower in about 25 min (great walk..wear running shoes). The room is big..not luxurious..we stayed in 2117 standard king facing Union Square. There are no robes or slippers in the room but if you ask, they will bring them. The size of the washroom is large (although we had an accessible room so maybe that's why) but there isn't too much counter space or hooks in the washroom. There are not that many drawers either. The bed is comfortable. Staff is friendly and the doorman was very helpful with directions.

I sometimes stay at the Grand Hyatt when I have to because the other hotels in the vicinity are full or too expensive. I don't like it, because there basically are no facilities and it is very difficult to get attention from staff. There is no minibar and when I (usually late) arrive at the hotel there is nothing in the room, not even a bottle of water. And water is also the only thing you can get brought up to the room, if someone pick up the phone that is...I find it very strange that this place is a "Grand Hyatt", it is definitely the worst GH I have ever stayed in.

Excellent 3td stay at this hotel, a great location, close to shopping, restaurants, transit. A very busy and safe area. Great hotel for couples as well as families.All staff was great. Concierge was so helpful, even the ladies at the coffee bar gave us great directions. Room was always cleaned by the time we arrived back in out room in the afternoon.Can't wait to return here again!

The location of this hotel is very nice especially if you do not have a rental car. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The few problems we encountered with housekeeping flaws were eventually corrected after the second day.

We spent a long week end in family. Good location, concierge ladies very efficient for rÃ©servations and assistance. breakfast is correct. Lobby Very sad and common for such level of Hotels. The rooms are correct but bathrooms are more three stars for me. Last i don't know the standards in SF but parking at 70 usd is huge comparing to Europe.

Amazing hotel and people. These guys actually care about customers. I was celebrating my wife's b'day and these guys made sure it was well taken care of and made her feel special. One of the best hotels in all categories i have stayed anywhere in the world.

Spent 4th of July Weekend at the Hyatt in Union Square. Highly recommend hotel. The hotel's staff was friendly and helpful, the hotel was beautiful, and clean rooms. Also, the hotel location was great. Centrally located to walk to many restaurants and stores. I was glad the hotel had a small kiosk Starback's on the lobby floor and a restaurant and bar in the hotel.

A block from Union Square. Nice clean modern hotel. Parking is expensive - but they give you option to self park at lot across the street for $45 per day. Buy their continental breakfast option - it's continental breakfast and evening hors d'oeuvre on their 32nd floor club room for everyone in the room for $50 a day. Their free wi-fi is very slow.

Had a great time at the Hyatt very friendly staff and always courteous ,will definitely stay again , within walking distance to all of the restaurant,coffee shop on every corner all major shopping area union square is wonderful to hang out

The Grand Hyatt is a beautiful hotel very centrally located and about a 5 minute walk from Union square. The hotel is beautiful and seems to be fairly recently renovated and the service was impeccable from the time we checked in until the time we checked out. It was a little on the expensive side but there aren't too many deals around union square. The rooms were very nice and modern and the fitness area was well equipped. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Excellent mattresses, fresh air and a really nice view through the balcony sliding door, and clean beds (no bedspreads,thank you! just fresh sheets on top of a thin down comforter). Lots of desk space and bathroom counter space. Everything laid out for efficiency, comfort and quiet. Very good value for the money and a super location.

LOVED this hotel. The staff was great too. Very helpful. Every person we talked to was very nice. Love the location. Room was great too. Nice view of Union Square. Will tell everyone to try this place. Can't wait to stay again.

Excellent location and amenities. Staff is terrific. Pricing fluctuates greatly depending on census, holidays, etc., but probably floats with the rest of The City's hotels. Only caveat is to make sure no valuables left in car or securely locked up as we had a problem on a prior visit (3rd party to Hyatt; not Hyatt's fault per se)

The hotel is "Grand" only in it's name. Cleaning staff has no idea what attention to detail is, they'll short you on towels, so make sure to call for more oh and if you plan to valet make sure you're driving an expensive car, otherwise they'll just think you're waiting for someone to come down. Truth be told I'd stay away spend you money on another hotel that will provide the right experience for what you're paying.

Excellent location, near Union Sq, short walk to Chinatown etc ... and shopping. Good clean rooms, pricey but then everything is in SF ... good guidance from concierge. Recommend because of location and service.

One block from union Square makes this a great place to stay. Not that there's much in the square, it's the location. All the shops and walking is great to just about anywhere.
