Great staff and easy to Check in and out. But it's a big hotel and that brings the traffic in and out. Quiet and room layout is very comfortable, no coffee maker in room or refrigerator. So you have to head to the lobby with the masses for a cup or muffin but the Starbucks is across the street. No robes in the room but you could probably call for them. Great views from the workout room and its adequate. Almost a four star.

We had a little trouble with parking but in the end we were able to park for free but that's not where I saw the excellence by Saleem... During the baggage storage my little boys sword that he got in china town was broken... When I showed Saleem what had happened he called the engineer to have the sword fixed I was ok with that... Disappointed but satisfied he sensed that and took off ones nights stay and provided water and snacks while we waited for the sword to be repaired... That level of customer service is so far beyond what you usually experience I was floored... Thanks Saleem and we will be staying at the Grand Hyatt the next time we are in SF

Did I get your attention? We stayed the night of Independance Day Celebrations and there were fireworks galor all around us and the noice was a small hum in the room. It was nice to be able to sleep sound because of the seamingly quiet room. I woke up at midnight and the fireworks were still going and I could tell because of the glow on the fog. The noise was still a light hum. That was important since I had meetings early the next morning.

Stayed here for a business trip. Location was perfect, lot of great restaurants (cafes to great dinner options) all around. Shopping all around for my wife that accompanied me. Cable car line picks up 1 block over on Powell. Concierge and Bell staff were all friendly and engaging. We were greeted by Steve at the Front Desk- he started the stay off on the most positive note! He was friendly, engaging, and took an interest in our story. We had recently been married so Steve had a little something sent up to our room! Bed was comfortable, a little on the stiff side but that was ok.

A modern hotel, in an excellent location. Union Square is close to many stores and restaurants, and also to cable car stops. The check in was efficient. The rooms are comfortable, but watch out for rooms faced to noisy spots, as the windows do not have an adequate noise reduction system (there are some ear plugs available in those rooms). Many channel options on TV. Different choices of pillows. The gym is complete and there is a half basketball court. The restaurant serves excellent meals. I definitely recommend this hotel.

windows in room in poor condition. you can feel the wind through window & because the windows are in poor repair it is very loudin the rooms. even 25 floors up. parking garage damaged my vehicle & refused to take responsability.

Was not great that on arrival - which was late because of a flight issue - the room I had signed up for and paid for was no longer available (despite calling before I took off to fly to CA). Instead I was "upgraded" to a room with a view of the city. Apparently that means the building across the street. Also, there was construction going on that I didn't expect. On the positive, the hotel was very clean and the staff was great. But overall I expected more from a Grand Hyatt, and I likely wouldn't stay here again.

4 star hotel with 5 star service. In general people in sf were not that friendly, however not at the hyatt. Every single employee we came across was friendly and helpful. One up restaurant has the best salamon! We willDefinitely be back very soon

I stayed at Grand Hyatt San Francisco for a few nights on a business trip and had a great stay. The location is right next to Union Square in downtown San Francisco so it's close to everything whether you're in the city for business or pleasure. The staff was friendly and check-in/check-out was a breeze. The hotel offers top-notch amenities that you'd expect from a Grand Hyatt. Although the bar/restaurant area looked modern, given the location I did not eat at the hotel. I used the fitness center and the executive lounge though and they are both on the highest floors with amazing views of the city and the bay. My room was modern and comfortable as well, and if you're on a high floor you could enjoy a breathtaking view.

Super over priced and extremely dated...maybe 20 years ago it might have been 'nice'The 'Business Center" if one could call it that, tiny room with two Macs and keyboards fixed to the bench, need to work on your lap top? Good luck!US$2 a page to print and US$20 for the privilege of using the box...oh, their WiFi does not reach this spot!The super expensive conference rooms have little to no sound insulation so noise from the atrium and adjoin rooms is always there - not acceptable.We do however, compliment the photographer who shot the promotional photos for this property.Had they been realistic, we wouldn't be here, nor writing this review

We stayed in March and found the construction around the area to be noisy and city noise to be invasive in our room. We were on one of the highest floors so insulation and soundproofing must be part of the problem. When we asked about the poor insulated windows one of the managers said it was something that would be updated soon. But too late for us. We also could had some sort of elevator noise or washing equipment whoosing in our bathroom every evening. Never did determine what it was definitely some machinery in the building. When we left the hotel to come home we were exhausted and disappointed in our overpriced room. Most of the people who worked there were aloof and disinterested. Concierge was capable but on auto-pilot and bored. Never anyone rude just going through the motions. To be honest the room was big and spacious and nice bathroom but with low water pressure. The modern decor was faded alittle and bed was hard as a rock. I am surprised that the last couple of Hyatt's we have stayed at that the mattresses have been so hard. Definitely not a 5 star bed. We did enjoy the concierge suite the food was very good and a nice view every evening to enjoy with a glass of wine - it made our stay alittle better. We will come back to San Francisco for sure but will be staying somewhere else.

Wife and toddler and I stayed here recently. We live in the Bay Area but decided to have a San Francisco "staycation" over July 4 weekend. We picked the Grand Hyatt primarily because of its central location near Union Square. There are lots of hotels in that area, but this one had larger rooms than most of the older nearby hotels, which was important to us given our need for a portable crib. We were not disappointed. The room was pretty spacious (by downtown SF standards) and had a great view. We faced west so we had a City View and a bit of Union Square as well. We were on the 24th floor, so it was also fairly quiet, although we could definitely hear street noise, especially with the window open. Not a complaint. Just an observation. The room was modern, the bed was comfortable, and the shower was surprisingly nice for a big hotel, where the water pressure is often severely lacking. We didn't use any of the hotel amenities, but the staff we encountered was very friendly and courteous. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel location is ok.. first Hotel that doesn't have a parking.. they can park your car for $67.00 fee excuse me. And this hotel doesn't have a Pool also.. for the price you don't get what you deserve.

This was our first stay at this hotel, and we were pleasantly impressed. All people connected with check-in (car, luggage, room,, etc) were very pleasant and helpful, but not in-your-face. The room was clean, fresh and comfortable. Bathroom was newly renovated and great. We enjoyed every aspect, except for the air conditioning, which was always COLD not matter the setting. We reported it on checkout.Restaurant exellent- reviewed separately.

Stayed for 6 nights while visiting San Francisco and was very happy with the stay. First the Location is great as its in Union Square and minutes walk from many good restaurant and shopping options. China Town is about a 5 minute walk. For Fisherman's wharf its a bit of a walk but there is public transportation minutes away to take you there which the concierge directed us how to get to. The hotel is very modern and has Free Wi-Fi which worked great, Black Out Curtains in the Room which were operated by remote and worked great as well. Additionally the Rooms were very clean and modern so a plus there as well. We paid a bit extra and had a higher floor room with a view of the bay which was excellent. If its your first trip to SF in quite a while, I would recommend getting the view! We ate breakfast at the cafe one morning and it was very good but as mentioned there are many restaurants in the area. While I can't complain about anything, the thing I think that sets the property apart though and what stood out to me is the friendliness of the staff at the hotel. Everyone from the front desk at check in and check out to the doormen and valet couldn't have been nicer and more attentive. As we had a car we interacted many times with the valets to get our car. Each time, they hustled to get the car for us and always welcomed us back to the hotel pleasantly. Never a problem. Overall excellent stay!

The Grand Hyatt SF has great location at union square. The rooms are nice and modern. However, there are small issues that keeps me from giving this hotel 5 stars. The most frustrating thing was the shower head. The design of the shower head coupled with the low water pressure meant that in order to get your hair wet, you had to bang your head against the wall as the water flow could only get as far as 3 inches off the shower wall. This was the most ridiculous thing I have ever experienced in a hotel. The other "small issue" is that the buttons in the elevators were filthy.

Good Hotel, good location neat and friendly staff. No water bottles in room. Break fast no variety and very limited to compared to other Hyatt in other parts of world. Stayed 7 days - absolutely no change in breakfast menu. out of few items 3 are scrambled egg items. Center of city and very near to Union sq. Lots of options to nearby restaurants ans shopping (macy's). Careful about billing. In spite of room booked with breakfast, final bill comes with breakfast price added. Requested and removed the same without any questions. Chin town nearby. 30 mnts walk to piers and creek/marina side. Hotel Telephone calls kill you. Any call even 1 sec charge you nearly USD10. No need to get the line, but voice mail same charging. 3 rings US telephones goes to voice call, 10 such calls USD100+ a lot to pay to homeless people in street.

The Grand Hyatt is a great hotel for a business trip to SF. Recent room remodels and location make it a top option. That said the high level of service sets it apart. Just want to applaud Steve at Reception and John, the Concierge for their attention to detail that made my recent visit memorable.

We stayed in this quite modern and tech savvy high-rise in Union square.The breakfast staff, including George, Douglas, Wendy,Ed and Guadalupe are really attentive. I mean is San Fran really child freindly? Not everywhere! But here, with a group of kids, we did it all.Breakfast buffet here is reasonable for a meeting as well as quite good.

Grand Hyatt is a wonderful hotel chain and this one is no exception. Great location in the heart of San Francisco. I was here for business in he Financial District and was able to easily walk everywhere I needed from the hotel. The taxi ride from the airport was a bit high though.Lobby is nice with plenty of seating. Cozy fireplace and convenient elevators.Rooms are a good size. Beds are super comfy with tons of pillows. TV is an oversized flat screen. Plenty of desk space. Coffee maker, iron and hair dryer all in the room. They have a large list of toiletries that they have available complimentary in case you forgot some necessities. I noticed this because I forgot my toothpaste! They quickly brought it up to the room by discreetly knocking and hanging it on the door handle. Great views from the high floors! They have a nice onsite restaurant, bar as well as a coffee store that serves pastries, fruit, granola and such. The workout room is really small with about 8 cardio machines, a few weight machines and small sample of free weights. I would definitely stay here again!

Really enjoyed our time in this location--were able to walk to almost everywhere we wanted to go. Our room was modern and very clean. It was quiet within the hotel but because we don't use the air conditioning at night, the street noise (even 15 floors below us) could be quite loud. The gym could equipment could use an overhaul. We had to try several machines before finding one that actually worked as it should--in particular the TV and sound system. We really appreciated having a water dispenser by the pop/ice machine on our floor. It was handy for filling our water bottles.

My family and I thoroughly enjoyed staying at The Grand Hyayy. The hotel is beautiful. The room was clean and beautiful. Staff was incedible and attended to every need. Beds were comforable which is a huge plus after walking San Francisco streets. I can't wait to visit again. Will definitely return to this hotel.

Great staff and property. area is close to attractions and shops, the staff is very concerned about you and your stay and concierge was amazing in planing my day being as though i was there for just a weekend.

This hotel is in a great location. Very convenient to transit and shopping. Stayed in a room with a view of Union Square, so had great views of the city. All of the staff is very helpful and courteous.

I know the hotel is in the city but some have rooftop pools. This one does not have a pool. Say what? Then, there is a rooftop room or observation room that we tried to go up to but the elevator would not stop there or even allow us to press the button. We finally asked a staff member and he said oh, that is only reserved for events. What again? For someone to pay 650 average a night, I would say a rooftop view is in order! I had points/rewards with my Hyatt card to use on this room but if not I would not have stayed here. I can't phantom a person paying this much and getting a tiny room. I picked this one because it is in an ideal location, smack in Union Square, but I came to find out I miss the Wharf easy slow lifestyle. In US, people are everywhere, like ants .. all for themselves. I did not enjoy Grand Hyatt at all. What really irks me is that they don't have a drive in area so you would pull up if there are spaces, if not, you would have to drive around again? That's insane. There is about 3 or 4 spaces max? I don't remember but that is just so stressful just trying to check in. Overall, I would not stay here again even if it was 150 dollars. I guess I don't like high rises. I'm more of a warmer place like the Hyatt wharf.

Stayed for 4 days, had a corner suite, they said the upgraded me because of my points and credit card but it's a sad upgrade if that was so since the view was of other buildings air shafts or whatever and very small room, it was noisy in the day. The room was modern and clean and nighttime was quiet. Great downtown area, easy to walk to restaurants but at night recommend Uber, I was told by Uber drivers not to walk on your own which I did one night and it was pretty sketchy a couple blocks away after 9pm. Staff was excellent. Coffee place was ok but breakfast sandwiches were very McDonalds type.

I stayed at this hotel before years ago and liked it. This time it is even better. The room is modern and clean. The bed is extra comfortable. I had one of their ADA room with extra large bathroom on high floor with a view of Union Square. The bed night stands have a remote control of curtain on both sides of the bed, and a small bendable reading lamps at the headboard. Free WiFi, with large flat screen TV, safe, coffee maker, ironing board, and spacious. The price is very reasonable at $219/night.restaurant on second floor was nice at reasonable prices. There is a new Apple computer store next door, and art show across street with different sculptures and paint for sale with a CafÃ©. 5 minutes walking to shops and 15 minutes walk to China Town. I walked every day to eat at different restaurant in the area.

My husband and our Zoe have been coming to this hotel for several years now. It's location is the best. Rooms are clean, spacious, quiet and what a view on the 30th floor. The gym is more than adequate with a view of the Bay Bridge. Room service is great! I would give this hotel a 5-star but because we are not crazy about their breakfast or dinner I give it a 4 rating. Thank goodness there loads of restaurants around the area. Concierge, personnel at the front doors are always present to open the door for you with a pleasant greeting.What a warm feeling!!! Highly recommended!

We enjoyed our stay at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco. The beds are very comfortable. This hotel is centrally located for all amusements in the city. Just blocks from China Town, shopping, Union Square, and the best restaurants around!

Grand Hyatt is perfectly located in downtown SF. The rooms are exceptionally clean and good size. The staff is very attentive. Stayed here numerous times and have always found it to be my first choice for SF lodging!

Excellent location. Rooms were clean and staff extremley helpful. Gentlemen who worked the front doors greeted each guest as if they were their best friends. Front desk outstanding. You just do not see that type of service. Good value for an upper end hotel. The taxes for the city are nuts but that has nothing to do with the hotel.

Was there for a business meeting. Overall it was a good experience, friendly staff and nice rooms. I especially liked how you could use an app for your room key as it was one less thing to keep track of (and I always have my phone handy).

Good hotel if you want to stay in the center on union squarePros- perfect location in center of union square with many eateries and shop and fashion mall around- clean rooms- modern room- good house keeping- nice layout on lobby- nice staff- easy to find taxiCons- a bit expensive but within the price range of union square area, worth it for its location

The location of this hotel is great. A 10 min walk will bring you to china town, financial district, shopping malls. Located next to Union Square, you can find everything you want here. The hotel is a little dated, the staff are friendly. Nonetheless, acceptable

This is a high quality hotel with a great location right off Union Square - a prime shopping and dining lhub San Francisco. We cashed in some Hyatt Gold Pass points to get upgraded to a Regency Club floor. Our room had the best view towards the San Francisco Bay. Our bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was top-notch. Unfortunately, the Regency Club lounge was usually very crowded with other guests, so we didn't have the feeling of being pampered or relatively peaceful luxury we have enjoyed in other Regency Club lounges. Being located right by Union Square, it was very easy for us to head out on foot to great stores, restaurants and other attractions, and to have access to cable cars and trains.

Stayed here for 3 nights for the NBA finals. We got there early in the day and were able to check in which was great. Customer service very friendly and helpful. Great location to walk to just about anywhere. About 5 minutes to China Town, 25 minutes to the Wharf. The Trolley line is just 1 block over. shopping all around. The hotel was nice enough but nothing fancy. We were up on the 12th floor and had a screaming baby in the next room and could hear every bit of it so the walls are on the thin side. We didn't try the restaurant there as chose to go out and try other places. There's only one mirror in the room and it's in the bathroom so made it difficult to try and get ready when someone was in the bathroom. (only a female would notice this!) Mini fridge in the room was great to keep drinks in for our trips back into the room. Comfortable beds.

I am a frequent Hyatt traveler for the simple fact that they never disappoint, and this stay was no different. My fiancÃ© and I arrived at about 10:30 AM, way before check in time, but the front desk staff still promptly checked us in. I felt terrible because we had to switch our rooms mid day (there was a terrible creaking noise coming from the headboard that literally would not stop) but they had no issue immediately moving our room. I was a little underwhelmed by the size of the room, but given the location that was to be expected. The property itself is beautiful and the location is extremely convenient for those doing all of the tourist type things in the city. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to the area.

The location is one of the best for downtown San Francisco. Close to everything, yet a few minutes away from busy Market St. The view from my room was fantastic. The room was very clean, the staff friendly.

Excellent location, nice big room with a view of Union Square, comfortable bed. I love the clean modern feel of Hyatt hotels, the art in the lobby and little touches like putting paperback books in your room.A few little niggles - nice to have a bathtub, not just a shower, but the tub is very small (not like the first Grand Hyatt I ever stayed in, the one in Berlin, with a huge soaking bathtub and walk in rain shower. The Berlin Grand Hyatt really raised my expectations for the brand, the US ones have not been on that level.) The friendly young man at reception checked me in and asked, as I am a platinum member, if I would like a newspaper sent on the mornings of my stay so I said sure, why not, but no paper ever came. I don't really care about a paper but it is slightly annoying to have something like that offered and then it doesn't happen. There are no bottles of water for you in the room, you have to call and request them, same with a robe and slippers. I do like that there is no mini-bar, an empty fridge you can store your own drinks and snacks in is much better in my opinion.Very minor point - I didn't like the music in the elevators, sort of rap music or something, I thought it was tacky but someone must like it I guess.But all in all a very nice hotel and I will probably be back.

The hotel was nice and clean. Most of the staff were very nice. The food that they provided us with, however was not appetizing. Eggs were watery and fake, the salad had a strange orange dressing that tasted like soup. Other than that, my stay went very well. It is a beautiful hotel, and the pillows in the rooms are the most comfortable pillows I have ever slept on!

Excellent in most every way except for those wishing a softer more comfortable bed. TV does not include HBO and movie selection and remote control is unusual. The check-in process is different but quick and the location could not be better.

Great place to stay. Room was of a high standard, large Windows affording views overlooking part of Union Square and beyond to the sea. Very comfy bed and pillows, luxury toiletries and gourmet coffee for coffee machine. When booking the room we had seen review tips suggesting high floor which we requested, this was granted and we were given a room on the 26th floor, 09. The staff were friendly and helpful. The restaurant, One Up is a good place to eat especially especially if your day has been long one. Recommend from us.

Great hotel , we are a family of 5 , my mom , dad , aunt at their 60s and my 5 years old daughter. Staff are very friendly and helpful, great location, we could walk everywhere or uber was convenient. Rooms are spacious and good layout, we booked seaview and it was amazing ! Breakfast was great, good quality good with fresh strawberries, raspberries and blueberries every morning , they also offer great tea . Staff at breakfast place was very efficient and friendly. We will definitely return to this hotel. We had a fantastic and enjoyable stay !

Stayed here in June 2015 with family. Good location, had booked club floor rooms so freedom to eat for breakfast and unlimited drinks too. Location is great. Staff needs to be more hospitable and more warm. Recommend for staying again

I visited for a conference and brough along my 11 month old son. The Hyatt went above and beyond in making his stay comfortable. Most places only provide a pack and play, but here we were given a pack and play, blanket, infant bath tub and shampoo/wash etc, a bottle brush and dish soap (!!), and a bath toy. These made such a huge difference in the comfort of our stay! They also provided a high chair once we asked. I also had a family member coming to help provide child care, and requested an adjoining room. They were able to guarantee this which many hotels don't do. The restaurant (one up) was delicious, though a bit pricey but lunch was the most reasonable. From the doorman, to the front desk to the housekeepers, everyone was extremely nice and helpful. I would definitely stay here again, and if you are travelling with a baby or kids you won't regret it.

This hotel has been around for several decades now but, as is usual with the Hyatt, the rooms have been updated constantly. Nevertheless, the regular rooms are on the small side and the bathtubs are very uncomfortable. The rooms could also do with some bathrobes. Overall though, the view from my room was gorgeous, check in was seamless, service and food was very good and the hotel's location is top notch. If only for that, I would highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed here for two nights (would have definitely stayed longer!). The location means you can walk right out to the shops and restaurants, which we found particularly convenient in the evenings when we went out for dinner. A personal highlight were the views from our room and the guest lounge. Only negative was that we found the dinner menu in the hotel restaurant was limited. There are numerous nearby places to eat outside the hotel anyway that this wasn't a huge problem.

...excellent location near everything. Well maintained, classy hotel. Staff very professional. Been coming here for many, many years. Recommend very highly. Nice views, rooms in excellent condition. Attentive staff.

From the minute you get off the shuttle you are greeted with a warm smile and willingness to satisfy. I will admit that the front desks are a bit weird but it isn't the employee's fault. Someone at the top thought that weird shaped pods were better for checking in guests than the standard long desk. The location of the hotel makes it easy to catch a cable car to Fisherman's Wharf. The only thing it lacked was a swimming pool.

I was in town for business and booked a regular queen room, luckily everyone from the conference had checked out and I was able to get an upgrade. also, was able to use the club floor which was nice to go and work as well as grab a snack. The room had robe and slippers as well as plenty of room in the bedroom and bathroom. Wifi was fast and easy to use which is great for business travelers.Room service was fast and the food was about average, the mashed potatoes were a bit weird not sure what was used in them. Close to everything but that also means you are close to BARt and the homeless who hang out by BART.

The hotel and the room are beautiful, decorated in a classy modern style. The front desk staff and concierge people were extremely courteous and helpful. We didn't patronize the restaurant or room service so have no basis for comment on those features.Our only complaint is that the furnishings of the room were such that there was no obvious way to plug in a mobile phone by the bedside for overnight charging. In this day and age that is most likely something that most guests would wish to use. The phones had to be placed across the room on the desk in order to reach an accessible outlet which means that if they are needed during the night one must jump out of bed and cross the room to get to them. Not a huge deal but also something that could have been easily accommodated by the room designer.Bottom line, I would recommend the hotel and would stay there again myself.

The hotel has been remodeled and room are awesome. The hardwood floor and meticulously clean bathroom enhanced the typical hotel stay as did the bedside controls for lighting and the window covers. The desk / work area was more than adequate with a very comfortable chair. There is an in-room refrigerator, but no snack bar. The room rate is very pricey, but that is to be expected for a hotel on the edge of Union Square - the heart of the shopping district. The downside for this hotel was the food menu. Breakfast was good, but the lunch and dinner menus were extremely limited, uninspiring and not particularly healthy. However, the numerous restaurants in the immediate vicinity allow a person who has time to get just about any type of cuisine day or night. Unfortunately, I was there on business, and needed to order room service in order to get my work accomplished and the variety of food options and the times that in-room food service was available were very disappointing. I would recommend the hotel for business / conventions if the person did not need to rely on room-service.

I stayed here on a business trip last February. Booked a club room since it would include breakfast and snacks through the day. First of all, the hotel is old and run down. The check in process was kind of whatever. My only request, checking in so late (around 9pm), was that they would recommend somewhere I could grab an easy dinner. Their response was that I wouldn't find anything because it was Sunday, that I should order room service! This is downtown San Francisco!!! So I decided to venture on my, in spite of their ill advice, and ended up finding (around the block) this fab sushi place. Wish I remembered the name...The breakfast spread was laughable for a hotel that praises itself so highly. Grand Hyatt, not so grand... The snacks during the day were also quite disappointing, I would have rather not booked club room.The rooms are old and not very clean. As to be expected with a Grand Hyatt, the amenities in the bathroom were of very poor quality. At 300+ dollars a night, I would expect better even if that is the brand standard. The windows of the room are very old and let in the cold, they didn't close well. The AC was very loud and stopped me from sleeping well during the night. Overall, I would have been better off staying at another hotel, maybe even the Ritz without the meals would have been better. But I chose the 'comfort' of having the 'lounge'..........

Hotel in the Heart of the city,but the price too much for 4 stars ,rooms are clean, Staff very candly, but i dont like this entourage like this hotel,for the smokers is site out the hotel , From this place is near super shops and butics

This hotel is excelent . Service , food and friendly sales staff.I am planning to bring large incentive group in November 2017. This is my second time in this hotel and I enjoyed .I do not understand why is requested to write more . I said what I won't in few words.

Fantastic location as it was within short walking distance to the all the shops and a Starbucks across it. Just really hard to beat! There are notable restaurants nearby the hotel as well. Staff was really friendly. We enjoyed the selections of their breakfast buffet. The beds and pillows...ahhh. We slept like babies for 5 nights. We'll be back most definitely!

The location of the hotel was an advantage. We were in easy walking distance to the cable cars, as well as several nice restaurants. The concierge was very helpful with reservations and recommendations.

Average food which was expensive, rooms that were old, doors don't seal properly so very noisy. No comforts that you expect when paying over $300 a night (like no robes, no mini bar). I stayed in 2 other hotels in San fran and did not have this same experience. Very disappointing.

The Grand Hyatt was very clean and comfortable and was in a great location. The staff was helpful, knowledgeable, and friendly. I would recommend this hotel for any future visits to downtown San Francisco.

Great location. In the heart of all the shopping district (Macy's, Nordstrom, Nike, Louis Vuitton, etc. Walking distance to almost everything we wanted to do and if we didn't want to walk, we were near other transportation options!! Quick check-in/out. Concierge team was great and very helpful. Room 2320 was perfect with a great view. Rooms are quite insulated (minimal to no noise interruption). Bottle of wine & a selection of meat, bread & spread provide for our anniversary.

Friendly staff and great location. No complaints. Bathroom layout was a little odd. Only a sliding door between dressing area and shower/toilet area. Free internet. We had nice view from the 18th floor.

Very modern hotel, with wonderful rooms. Loved the beds, we slept like babies. The restaurant for breakfast is quite good. We stayed on a high floor and had amazing views. The gym was a bit cramped, but had the requisite minimal equipment. The service was very friendly, and helpful.

My title sums it up. Love this hotel's location, which is just mins walking distance from the square and major shopping spots and Starbucks and Chinatown at your doorstep. Love the rooms, which are spacious with good fittings. Gym is excellent too My experience at the restaurant, especially for breakfast is usually mixed. Both the service at the restaurant and registration can be better. Its been fairly consistent.... with a 3 star service experience since i first stayed at this hotel in 2013. With some serious focus on upgrading their services, this property can easily be the No 1 in downtown SFO.

San Francisco is one of my favorite cities to work and play. I have stayed in many hotels in SF and the Grand Hyatt is my first choice-always clean, modern, accommodating and the location could not be better. Exit out of the hotel into union square shopping and dining. The Restaurant in the hotel is average at best but the bar is delightful with live music on the weekends and great small bites and drinks. There are so many hotels in San Francisco ranging from downright scary to extraordinary-booking at the Grand Hyatt is your safest bet (if available).

Just spent a couple nights at this fine establishment. Rolled in a little late and had some dinner in the lounge. I was greeted by Boa, an amazing bartender and all-around good dude. He told me he has worked at the hotel for 35 years! We chatted and he went out of his way to show me a few things about the city. He left for the night and his replacement Jaime continued the great service.Food was great, drinks were delicious.....all this before I even got to my room. The room was excellent - very modern and truly showcases technology. As it should, since Silicon Valley is very close by.Great location, views were incredible. The staff was very friendly. Price was not cheap, but you get what you pay for. If you're looking for a low-budget hotel, this is not the place. But, if you're willing to pay a little more and have an amazing experience, this is the spot!

Although I have been to San Francisco many times and thought there was nothing I hadn't seen or done but I was wrong. The concierge at the Grand Hyatt found amazing shopping experiences that I didn't even know existed (and one of the best meals I have had). It is a rare treat to stay at a "chain" hotel that is so exceptional on all levels

After an initially shakey start with some costumer care "issues" I can honestly say I loved my stay at this hotel. My room was on the 32nd floor overlooking the city sky line and the view didn't disappoint, the hotel itself was very well kept, check in / out was quick and easy and staff were very friendly throughout the hotel. Breakfast was OK - nothing to shout about but it had something for everyone and the buffet allowed you to fill up before a busy day of sightseeing. The hotel is in a great location only a few blocks away from China Town and approximately 25 minutes walk from the Pier 39 / Lombard Street/ Little Italy etc I caught the train from the airport to Union Square (this cost me $9 and the journey lasted 35 minutes and the stop was less then a 10 minute walk from the hotel) I loved my stay here I would definitely recommend this hotel.

great location, wonderful staff . comfortable and clean rooms. Grand club food and beverages were excellent . Walking distance from all scenery places. will stay again. very nice staff at the Front desk.

Upon check in, I mentioned that it was my husband's birthday. Receptionist greeted and sent a bottle of red wine, strawberries and biscotti to our room. Room was very modern. View was just okay. Amenities and free wifi were appreciated. Concierge in lounge was helping in recommending a tour. Great location to all sites.

I was in San Francisco for a conference at the Mascone Center. The Grand Hyatt was only about a 5 block walk. It is also only a couple blocks from the Powell cable car which goes down to Fisherman's Wharf. The price is pretty spendy, but, so is everything else in San Francisco.

I would highly recommend this hotel. It was very clean, and everyone there was really nice, and helpful. The concierge was very helpful, and the doorman was always polite. The hotel was at a perfect location for China Town, Little Italy, and Hero's park.

The room was small, but clean and comfortable. We asked for a city view and we're accomodated. Location was great, across the street from Union Square walking distance from several eateries. We recommend Cesarios Itallian. Room service was very pricey. We would consider going back.

Whenever I go to a major city I always look for a Grand Hyatt. There are so few of them the hotels tend to be well done. This is no exception. Great looking hotel and a friendly staff to start. Nice rooms, good flushing toilets, and hot water to follow. Also lets not forget good free wifi everywhere, HDTV with all the jacks, and a great fitness room. Lets add in a great central location. These are all the essentials of a great hotel and the Grand Hyatt San Francisco has them. The one criticism that I have which is a minor one is the club lounge. On my reservation it says that my room will be on a private concierge floor. This was never true and as I rode the elevator to the club lounge level the elevator was full of people like me. Needless to say it was standing room only in the club lounge everytime I was there. It seems the only criteria for the club lounge is to request it. This is a bit dishonest and needs to be reviewed. However this is minor in the scheme of things and I highly recommend this hotel.

The hotel is located in the very convenient place where you can reach to shopping area, china town, business district on foot. The hotel staff is so friendly and helpful. I didnt eat there but there is a restaurant on the second floor. Only negative comment I would is that the hotel guest room

Nicely located, central, near Chinatown. Close enough to the pier that a good walker could walk to it easily. Excellent staff, smiling, knowledgeable, efficient. Only downside : walls are thin, so it is a bit noisy.

I stayed in this property for 3 nights during a business visit in May 2016.the property is very conveniently located next to the union Square and behind the new opened iconic Apple show room. The hotel is conveniently located to most of the major attractions of San Francisco and has excellent connectivity options to various forms of public transport like trams , buses etc. Rooms are good size with modern amenities. Concierge desk is very helpful. Front office staff are also very cooperative and eager to assist. Housekeeping was very good. However the buffet breakfast located on mezzanine level was average and has lot of scope for improvement. Not only do they have a limited choice of items but the breakfast is not worth the charge they levy. Waiters have mastered the art of thrusting the bill on the table even before you are through with half your breakfast as if they want you to leave ASAP. WIFI is complimentary. Doorman is very friendly friendly and helpful. Overall this is a good property and stay is enjoyable.

Grand Hyatt SF is a very nice place to stay when in San Francisco. The hotel has a great location at Union Square and with-in walking distance through the Stockton Street tunnel to North Beach / Little Italy. The staff at all positions was very nice and forthcoming and made the stay even more enjoyable.

Air Condition Vent is very dirty and full with Mold. Room need renovation soon as furniture getting old and need more maintenance in the room. try to avoid Suite soon that next to elevator as you always heard the sound of wind from elevator passing up and down 24 hours . Club Lounge is very small, limited variety of food , Alcohol drink need to pay extra , should not call club lounge at all.

Being next to Union square brought the opportunity to see local artist's work when we checked in on Sunday. The Hyatt is an excellent place to stay and explore the delights of San Francisco. The rooms have great views when above the twentieth floor.

Amazing experience overall. Beautiful hotel and superb view of Union Square, city and bay. Hotel staff very friendly, helpful and welcoming. The bed was exceptionally comfortable! Will definitely return to this hotel on my next visit.

Very noisy - Saturday night. room was not kept up on the second night stay. You may want to call and insure that the room will be cleaned. The room charge was expensive for what we received. There were other hotels near that would have been better choices

Centrally located. Very comfortable rooms - modern but user friendly. Staff exceptionally helpful and friendly. Don't recommend eating in hotel restaurant as is $$$$. Otherwise would definitely stay there again.

When you enter the Grand Hyatt you will meet hotel staff who are trained and very friendly. We were greeted with warm smiles and "hello"s everywhere in the hotel. The fitness center is well equipped. Centrally located to shopping at Union Square...right next door to the new Apple Store, which was filled with customers. The only disappointing thing is that the street around Union Square is all torn up right now...impacting the ambiance. This Hyatt is definitely a good place to stay.

Very happy with my stay. hotel is located in prime location in Union square. close to restaurants and nightlife. Great service and very clean. staff was great also. Parking was pricey but to be expected in the city.

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco provided the back drop for a perfect weekend in the city. The staff at the hotel is very professional and fully anticipated any need we had. The room was beautiful and perfectly appointed.

Positives:After arriving from a 20 hour flight at 11:00am, I was very impressed with the Hyatt having a room ready for us! I am so very much appreciative of this and putting overnight travellers first. Room was clean and fantastic city view. We got really cold so had to ask for a second duvet due to the drafts coming into the room.Friendly staff. Internet was good.  Negatives:No water in roomsLimited tea and coffee No milk providedThe port on the radio does not workBalcony and front door there is gaps which creates drafts and makes the room cold. No slippers provided until asked forNo toothbrushes provided (luckily we brought our own)Tip - bring toothbrushes and also if you are a light sleeper, you might want to go elsewhere as there is currently construction which you can hear. Luckily we are heavy sleepers and were on a high level so didn't hear too much.

Location of this hotel was perfect, right in the middle of everything. Only stayed at this hotel for one night, was more than pleased with the service we received. Payed for valet parking which was easier than finding our own parking and then carrying all our luggage to the hotel. This wasn't much more in price than the regular self parking and made life a lot easier. Free WiFi in rooms and areas of the hotel.Had the buffet breakfast in the restaurant which was expensive but was plenty of things to have.Defiantly recommended and well worth the price.

Truthfully, I had a horrible time at this hotel. I couldnâ€™t wait to get out of there and wouldnâ€™t recommend anyone to stay there for FREE. Parking was cluster. Gentlemen by the name Nichola (in the garage) was extremely rude and had no customer service skills whatsoever. The room was overpriced if you ask me. Dust was everywhere and specially in the hallway between a wall and the lamp (didnâ€™t look like it was ever dusted there). I had to clean it up because my wife is allergic to dust. There were 4 people in the room but we only had 2 sets of towels. I asked 2 different people at the front desk about location of my seminar (Roper Export Compliance) and they couldnâ€™t find it in the computer. Then they sent me to look at the monitor by the elevators for the events so I told them that I already looked there and my seminar wasnâ€™t there. Both individuals gave me an attitude and wanted to see for themselves. When they realized thereâ€™s no Roper seminar they had a nerve to ask me if Iâ€™m in the right hotel. I was told there will be signs everywhere to guide me to the right room downstairs. Next day I went down and there were several signs but for different events and none for my seminar. Iâ€™ve met 4 more people, who was looking for the same seminar and they actually had to call our corporate office just to confirm that the seminar is in this hotel (we spent about 20 min looking for the room). Then during first 2 hours of the seminar we had to listen the construction going on upstairs. Our coordinator had to call twice because we couldnâ€™t hear the speaker. We stayed in Westin last year and what a service and hotel compare to this one. Iâ€™ve been going to these seminars every year for the past 15 years or so and never experienced hell hole like this hotel. I did have a good time after I moved to another hotel and enjoyed my time in San Francisco.

We checked in on Saturday morning while the flagship Apple Store next door was being opened, it was a very happy atmosphere & did not detract from the efficiency & friendliness of the front desk staff. The location is great. Our room on the 27th floor offered great views of Union Square and beyond. The concierge offered us many useful suggestions for dinner and on getting tickets for the Giants game.

We had a large group here for one night. We didn't use many of the accommodations besides the rooms, but the rooms were great. Clean, quiet, clean bathrooms. The location for us (went to see baseball game) was excellent. One oddity which seems to be a trend is the "sliding door" to the bathroom, similar to a barn door that's big in home renovations - it slides, but doesn't latch. It's not quite private. It's an odd feature that you can't even latch the bathroom door. Other than that we enjoyed the room, with a decent view. We were on the 12th floor. They did mess up the billing for us, but it was just billed to the wrong card, not an actual discrepancy in the amount. Overall a good stay I'd consider coming back.

The hotel is superb, location at Union Square excellent, except for the massive construction, quiet and comfortable rooms and the service is extraordinary. Special thank you shout out to Steve at the front desk, Shari Wellington in reservations, and David Chew in the club lounge.

I generally like the location, the property, the staff and the amenities as this location. I also am very easy to please and usually on business so less likely to use the amenities other than the bar and gym, yet both are very good. I would describe this property as a safe bet other than the one instance it was very windy and my hotel room creaked.

Convenient and central location in Union Square. We had a king room on the 25th floor, nice size room, comfortable bed, newly renovated, bathroom on the larger side with plenty of counter space. No mini bar or even bottled water in the room. My only complaints about the room were the low-flow shower head (weak water pressure, but I get it, eco-friendly San Fran), and the sliding bathroom door that all hotels seem to be implementing. Who is leading hotel developers to think that privacy is not a desired quality in a bathroom? There was still construction on the street but we had the quiet side of the building and you could almost hear a pin drop. Unexpectedly quiet. We tried the bar which was unremarkable but shame it was only on the 2nd floor with the great view up top they could be using. Overall a good stay.

The Grand Hyatt SF is a great hotel in the center of union square. It's the perfect location for walking to shopping and restaurants and it's pretty close to everywhere in the city. I love this part of SF because I love the shopping by it and it's cole proximity to almost everywhere in the city. The rooms are nice and spacious and the service is great. We know stay at this hotel every time we are in SF because we have had such great experiences there every time. It's also very festive around the holidays :))

Well located in downtown San Francisco with good restaurants in very close location. The hotel is very well maintained, clean and all of the staff were very prompt to take care of whatever needs I had.

the service provided by the personnel was perfect and charming. Although it is a large hotel you felt at home. The room was also great with (in our room) a awesome view. Incredible! Only minor issues were less perfect. In my view a hotel with such a standard should serve a much better breakfast with salads, real fresh orange juice and really perfect strong, tasteful coffee. Now it was too much of an american style although such a hotel is a melting pot of the world and is located in San Francisco. Again, these were only minor remarks

Grabbed a quick drink and a slider after a long flight, not bad at all, but not a place to spend the evening.Beef sliders good and tasty.Deco was dated, a good drop if you just want to be in and out.Hyatt should try to keep sharp in there concepts.

I was asked upon check-in to change from 2 doubles to a king room. Little did I realize this put me directly above the 24 hour a day heavy construction. 3 nights with no more than 3 hours of sleep per night and a complete unwillingness of the front desk to find quieter accommodations.Add to that, a big ball of someone else's hair in the closet upon arrival.Modern and pretty cool., streamlined rooms, but dirty and unwilling to find me a place where I could get sleep. I'm not very happy.On a plus side, the concierge was wonderful!

Construction work (banging and beeping) outside the hotel into the night meant I did not get a good nights sleep whilst staying here. Otherwise, the staff were friendly, bed and room comfortable and food in One Up good.

This is a fine hotel in what would ordinarily be a great location in Union Square. Unfortunately, there was construction going on 24 hours per day immediately next to the hotel (Apple Store) and Stockton Street is under construction as well. It's incredible that the city would allow construction to occur through the wee hours of the morning (weekends included), and hotel makes no mention of what's going on in the neighborhood. We heard hammering, banging, trucks unloading/dumping materials, etc. throughout the night. Unless you are a very sound sleeper who is completely unperturbed by LOUD construction noise, STAY AWAY until the construction is over.

This is an outstanding hotel in the midst of a lively San Francisco with the nearby shopping, bars and clubs. The room was quite nice with two beds, a flat-screen TV and gorgeous bathroom containing a big shower with hot water and good water pressure at all times. The decor was new and pleasing. We had a good view and particularly appreciated the automated black-out blinds. With the click of a button, we had a peaceful dark room in which to sleep at any hour. It was also quiet, as we never heard any noise from neighboring rooms.The check-in was quick and professional and every time we had a question (and we had several), they were perfectly polite, friendly and efficient. The concierge gave us a map highlighted with all the areas we wanted to see with the most efficient ways to get there. (Twice... we lost the first one). Room service was awesome - the food delicious and beautifully presented.The breakfast buffet at the One Up restaurant was very good with a selection of different flavors of scrambled eggs every day, bacon, pan-fried potatoes and a wide variety of fresh fruit, yogurt and cheeses.At the time, the building next door was under construction but we were never inconvenienced in any way. The 24-hour police presence near the front door was even welcome, as the guests could feel safe coming in at any hour of the night.

Ideal location. Great hotel. Great room. Good gym at the 35th floor (great view of the bay). Breakfast counter with Starbuck coffee. Standard internet is really reliable and streaming is easily possible. There is construction on the Union Square unfortunately... Only disagreement.

I called ahead of time to let the Front Office team know I was proposing to my GF that day. After speaking to Ashley at the Front Desk, she set us up in a very nice room, high floor and wonderful view. Thank you to Shannon at the Front Desk as well for a very nice check-in experience. There was a lovely amenity waiting for us with well wishes and congrats on the big day. Thank you to the Front Desk team for making my special day even more special. I'll be back!

I normally stay at the Hyatt Embarcadero (since it's close to work) but thought I'd try a change of scenery this time. The Grand Hyatt is not only in the perfect location for some great bars, restaurants and of course smack in the middle of the shopping district but also one of the more modernly finished Hyatts in the city. My room was bright, spacious with simple modern furniture. The staff both at check in and check were incredibly welcoming and very helpful.I rated the hotel down for 2 reasons. Firstly after flying for 16 hrs to San Fransisco I was feeling jet lagged so stayed in the hotel and ate at the One Up restaurant. I ordered the short ribs and the meat tasted so bad I couldn't eat it. The second reason was due to the handling charges for some deliveries I had. I purchased a range of products from Amazon which got delivered separately for speed of delivery. The hotel charged me $5 each time a package arrived, so I ended up paying $25 in total..not a huge amount but I find it ludicrous they charge this for their customers and for each package (vs just once per stay) and especially for a Platinum member of their loyalty program! Both of these left a bad taste in my mouth in what otherwise would have been a great stay

The hotel was ok. This is the first time I stayed at this Hyatt in Union Square. The location was convenient. There was nothing wonderful about this hotel. I rather stay at the Hyatt at Embacadero, which is a much better hotel.

The rooms were standard Hyatt rooms which are always nice, clean and roomy. This is a great location as it's close to Union Square, shopping and tons or restaurants. The bar area is quite large and a nice place to meet up of drinks.

From front drive to back of the house is excellent . Front desk staff are very friendly and helpful . Got in our room early and we feel lucky . Great amenities including for an 8 months old granddaughter Aria . The Executive housekeeper made sure everything is ready upon arrival . This is really an exceptional service that we can't thank enough . Regency Club is very clean and organize , staff very friendly as always . Good and fresh fruits , hot coffee and tea serves all day . Once again , Thank you Hyatt and staff .

Stayed here for the third time. Definitely has been renovated since my last stay. Rooms are very nice and modern. Good gym and nice lobby. Great location next to Union square and shopping. Now that the Mandarin is gone, this will by go to SF hotel.

Last minute trip required overnight stay and I am really happy that it resulted in a stay at this place. Great atmosphere, quiet rooms and wonderful staff. I didn't arrive until after midnight after a full day of airports but the desk staff was cheerful and happy to help me get someone to help me with my bags to my room (usually I have to ask but they anticipated the need). They also waived the valet parking fee and helped me with directions the next day. The view left a lot to be desired but I was there on business not pleasure so to me it has no bearing on this review.I will be back to this place not only for the awesome staff but also for the wonderful quiet atmosphere.

Very central, clean, modern and excellent customer service. The television in our room was on as we entered with a greeting personalized to us. Bed was comfortable and room was very well maintained. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend.

from the first contact with the men outside to the check in, to the bellman, everything was outstanding. one of the best hotels we have ever stayed overnighted in san Francisco. you cannot go wrong with this property, they do things right

We arrived on April 27 and checked into a 4th floor room facing an active construction zone right outside the window. Thankfully construction did not start in earnest until early the next morning. We worked with the check-in agents who got creative and were able to move us to an east-facing room on the 26th floor.The room was spacious and well maintained, relatively quiet, with a nice view toward the Bay. Service through our entire stay was excellent. We also appreciated quick access to the BART and bus lines for day trips around town. Nice amenities too, including a 24-hour gym with filtered water and a sweeping view.We'll certainly consider staying here again on future trips to the Bay Area.

Stayed 3 nights in beautiful SF with our family and although we love union square, right now it is too hectic. There is so much construction going on in the area it is just too noisy to sleep. I could hear the elevator gong up and down all night long as well as the back up beeping from the construction site vehiclesright outside the hotel. It is a shame because the hotel is lovely but not relaxing. A good night sleep is needed when you travel across the country but that was just not happening. I would consider going back to the Hyatt but only once the construction next door is done.

The hotel was great as usual. We always stay at the Grand Hyatt when in San Francisco. The weather was good and the service at the hotel was excellent. The food in the hotel was of good quality and we had dinner and breakfast at the hotel The location is good if a person wants to shop or be in the city. Best to park your car at the hotel and take a taxi. .

We stayed for two nights but could not bear the construction noises around the clock. We could not sleep for the entire stay. Worse yet, nothing about the noise had been mentioned to us before, during and after the stay. We raised issues to the management but no one reached out to us despite the fact that they promised several times that someone would call us to address the issues.

Has the best meeting at Grand Hyatt. My coordinator provided exceptional service. Everyone who attended our meeting had nothing but great things to say about the view from our meeting room and the food.

I recently stayed here for four nights for a trip to meet friends. It is definitely feels like a large convention style hotel and very posh. Location is excellent if you need to be near Union Square - away from the main bustle, but close walk to the square, Chinatown, cable cars.The lobby is pristine, with plenty of spots for sitting. There is a cute cafe, but also conveniently a Starbucks across the way for coffee. The bell staff were always welcoming me back, and the concierge was very helpful with maps/directions.The best part was being able to have an early checkin (I arrived in the morning)! Very much appreciated.The biggest downside was the room itself. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable, but there was a weird smell to the room (vinegary, like someone left a salad with dressing out). The smell cleared when I opened the window, but would come quickly back when the window was closed. I'm not sure if I was near the kitchen? It's my fault for not calling and changing rooms to one without an odor - after my stay, I was emailed a survey and the manager answered my concerns - I think they would have been very accommodating. (I didn't change rooms because I felt too lucky to have received an early check-in and didn't want to seem ungrateful. stupid, I know!)Minor things - no newspapers were delivered to the door. Instead there was usually a pile near the elevator, though one morning, they were gone by 9am. A dirty washrag was hanging in the shower. Room was also next to a staff closet/room, there was a period of time when I was working from the room in the afternoon and heard that door opening/closing (loudly) constantly. Great bathroom amenities, including ear plugs. Note there is construction going on outside, blocking a portion of the sidewalk/road outside the hotel. Nothing that can't be worked around, just awkward to break the barrier every time you wanted to go through the main entrance and made it a little tricky for drivers!

Staff was very nice and helpful. Good location to Union Plaza, which isn't much but an open area in the middle of a very busy city. One street over from Powell which is a very cool street with restaurants, shops and the main cable car street. Good views of the city from our room.I understand that everything is over priced in San Francisco but to pay over $300 which is discounted due to a corporate event is ridiculous. Had a burger one evening at the One Up bar. Not great, save your burger night for Burger Bar at Macy's.If you must stay here wait until the construction of a huge flagship Apple Store is complete next door. They have a 24 hour construction permit. We stayed 4 nights on the 16th floor and were up all night on one of the louder and busier nights.

My mom Luz had been wanting to spend the night in San Francisco for years now. Her birthday was coming up in a couple of days. I though this stay would be a great way to surprise her and combine her birthday with mothers day present. This became her mothers day, wish come true.

My son and I stayed here over Mother's Day weekend. The location is fantastic--right in Union Square and walking distance from both amazing shopping and wonderful restaurants. The rooms are beautiful, spotless, well-appointed, and boast some incredible views from the top floors. The beds are some of the most comfortable I've experienced in any top hotel. Best of all is the service--everyone you meet from the first minute of your arrival is there to help in any way possible. The concierges are beyond accomodating and will help you plan a perfect touring day in the city, or just recommend a great place to eat. Will definitely stay here the next time we visit!!

The Grand Hyatt interior is an updated contemporary design, including the reception and lobby area. The staff is very friendly and attentive. The rooms are nicely appointed and comfortable; however get a room as far away from the central elevator shafts as possible for less elevator noise. Valet Parking is the expected $67 per day-but arriving late Friday afternoon can be chaotic. Do not bring a pet. While the GH is listed as pet friendly, but digging down into the website you find there is a $100 per stay charge for up to 6 days. Being advised at checkin is too late. The Westin St Francis has no pet charge.

Nice hotel, right on Union Square, accessible to the heart of San Francisco and all of her attractions. The Grand Hyatt is exactly what you would expect from a Hyatt. It is clean and comfortable, and the staff is friendly and helpful. Its just so very formulaic. So if that's your thing, don't think twice and stay here!

Our first impression as we drove in: "Valet is $59/day & Self-Park at a garage a block away is $34/day." We turned our rental car in the next day as we didn't need it! The atrium is vast & beautiful! Rooms are neat/nice. Our sliding door view was of the bay but we couldn't see it from our bed. The decor on each floor is plain. Overall experience was positive.

We usually stay at the W San Francisco but decided to check out the Grand Hyatt. We were deeply disappointed. Our room was old, the door was all scratched up and the trash cans were all rusty (very visible). It felt like staying in an Embassy Suites than a high end luxury hotel. We also had a bad experience with very loud neighbors at 2:30am and it took 3 calls over a 15-20 minute period before security was dispatched. Wasted my Gold Passport points for the room and was totally disappointed.

San Fran is a beautiful city, during my one week business trip in this great city, I never regret to choose Grand Hyatt for my stay. Very friendly staffs, served great food especially breakfast. Location is superb and I truly enjoyed all the facilities in the hotel.

Stayed here for 2 nights with my husband on vacation. There is construction next door on an Apple store. We requested a room far from the noise and our room was quiet. Service here is good. The bar is nice. Location is good if you want to walk to nearby tourist places, shopping mall, Muni to see other parts of the city. Room was very comfortable and clean.

Chose the hotel for its location at Union Square, in the heart of the shopping district of the touristy city. Stayed for two nights.The hotel is situated between Union Square and the Chinatown Dragon Gate along Grant Street.Check-in by a friendly staff was a breeze upon arrival.The room and bathroom were clean and well-maintained. Pillows were good.The lady at the concierge was also very helpful when we enquired about transport to the airport.There's some construction work going on beside the hotel on north edge of Union Square. So there could be some noise starting early morning. But I found that not to be a big nuisance.One peeve was a Chinese-looking house-keeping staff knocking rudely on the two mornings I stayed. She retorted rudely I did not hang the DND sign when I complained about the way she knocked at 8:30am. Don't think she should even belong at this fine hotel.We thoroughly enjoyed the shopping around the area, and taking in sights of the lovely city. The Powell street cable car terminal is within walking distance nearby.

It's what you would expect, clean and was a fine for us. The breakfast buffet was a little repetitive, but was okay. It's really near Union Square and close to high end shopping and a short walk to the local mall. There was a Bubble tea place out the front to the left of the main entrance, just before the tunnel, which was nice as girlfriend loves her Bubble tea.

We were met after a long day of travel by a friendly and most helpful employee who gave us an upgraded corner room. The Grand Hyatt is clean, updated, modern with super friendly staff, free wifi and in a fabulous location. I would have rated it 5 stars if they had bathrobes in the closet. If you choose to stay here be sure to pack one!

When we arrived we were told that no King rooms were available at present and they had a room with two queen beds that was slightly disappointing as we had booked a King room. We could have waited a few hours but it was past check in time and just wanted to get settled.They offered to change our room the next day but in the end we couldn't be bothered to moved. We had a lovely view with a clean and comfy room. The location is fantastic and we walked everywhere.

I've stayed at numerous hotels in SF, but this was my first stay at the Grand Hyatt. I was expecting a well-worn tourist hotel, but was surprised at how updated it is. It's very clean, and our room looked like something out of Architectural Digest Magazine. The carpet was clean, the furniture was new, and the bathroom looked brand new. The black out drapes operate via a button near the bed...it was like something out of Cribs. In terms of location, you are half a block from Union Square and one block to the Cable Car line. You could not be in a better location. As of May 2016, construction is going on next door for the new Apple Store, and the street in front of the hotel is half blocked. This makes for some interesting arrivals, as there is hardly anywhere to stop and drop off luggage. However, they have numerous staff outside to assist and even an on duty policeman. I've stayed in the other Hyatts in SF, two Marriotts, the St. Francis and the Hilton and this is hands down the best.

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco is everything you expect from a Hyatt hotel. It has all the amenities, great location near Union Square and high end shopping and not too far from convention center. Unfortunately, the construction on Stockton for the subway was load and I wasn't able to sleep in to 6 am. It'll be the perfect everything once construction is complete.

We had an amazing experience at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco. We booked a room on the 30th floor (Grand Club Floor) and got an incredible view of the city. We also had access to the Grand Club lounge where the food selection was good. Front desk receptionists and valet services were great as well. Everyone was welcoming and courteous. We're definitely going back!

If you don't mind spending a little more , then this is a perfect location to be . Near Union Square. It's close to high end shopping . Lots of restaurants and inexpensive diners close by too. It's easy to flag a taxi. And the hotel ...it's customer service to the cozy lounge and room, no complaints.

The Hyatt in Union Square was a perfect location for shopping, dining and people watching. AND they are building a brand new Apple store next door. convenient . The staff is friendly, the hotel is top notch and cable cars are right around the corner. Excellent getaway hotel.

All positive other than crowded fitness room footprint (would be forgivable given dramatic view if windows had thermal protection/tint to keep out afternoon sun) and NO IN-ROOM COFFEE. High-end hotel shouldn't try to force the coffee bar upsell.

Had a recent 4 night stay here in a standard bay view room. The hotel is in the perfect location, right on Union Square and easy walking to many restaurants and shops. We did have a car when we arrived but after finding out how expensive parking was, we returned it and walked / caught transport everywhere.Our room was large and modern. Loved the remote blinds which I could put up and down from the comfort of my bed! The bed itself was very comfortable. The bathroom is small, and has a (tiny) shower over bath. In a hotel of this standard, a stand alone shower would be much better. Had a few issues with slow or non-existent service with housekeeping but they were cleared up quickly. There are roadworks going outside the hotel which cause a bit of chaos at the front of the hotel but they couldn't be heard from inside the hotel.Had breakfast in the restaurant and the food was delicious. But given the location of the hotel, we chose to eat out locally instead most of the time.

Nice room, friendly and helpful staff, convenient for down town business. Some nice features like electric shades and built in reading lights on the bed head board; however not great for extended stay as the mini fridges don't have freezers, there are no microwaves in the rooms, no complimentary WFI and no swimming pool. For the price I would expect more than just a nice room with a good view of the city. Also the walls are thin and you hear doors slamming at all hours and there is a lot of light leakage under the bottoms of the doors as there are no door thresholds to help seal the room. I used a towel to block the light.

My family of four (two adults and a 11 and nine year old) stayed here for four nights in a family room. We found the hotel well located; right across the road from Union Square and close to public transport (including the world famous cable cars) and restaurants. I really appreciated the hotel's fitness centre which had a very good range of cardio equipment and weights. Hotel staff were friendly and happy to provide assistance in how to get to tourist locations. The hotel was clean and nicely maintained. The only slight downside was the beds which seemed a little smaller than normal, which was noticed as we had to share the two beds between our family.

I stayed here for 3 nights with my Mom and her friend at the start of our week long ladies getaway. We enjoyed the location of the hotel and found plenty of shops and restaurants in the area to keep us entertained when we were not sightseeing. The hotel itself is very large and modern, and we were assigned a room on a high floor with a great view of the San Francisco skyline. The room looked liked it had recently been updated, and it had all the modern bells and whistles like remote controlled blinds. The bathroom was also very modern with a large bowl style sink and beautiful tile backsplash in the shower. The room and bathroom were spotless, and the maid always left extra June Jacobs bath amenities, which we all loved. Since I was staying as a guest of honor under a Diamond GP member, the hotel sent up a beautiful fruit platter and bottle of champagne upon arrival. We also had access to the Grand Club and thoroughly enjoyed having breakfast with a beautiful view of the city. very morning The hospitality of the lounge staff was also top notch, and they really went over and above to make our time in the lounge pleasant. My Mom and I also used the gym, which though often crowded, provided a wonderful view of the city. It had plenty of cardio and strength training equipment, and staff were coming by frequently to clean and replenish the towels.I have stayed at quite a few Hyatt properties, and this is probably the best Hyatt I have stayed in the lower 48 with regards to the friendliness of the staff, hotel location, and amenities. I would not hesitate to return.

Grand Hyatt is very well located near the financial district. It is also close to tourist spots. Rooms have modern amenities and common areas are well maintained. Checking in and out is very smooth process. Had a good dining facility. Employees are very efficient.

I had a lovely time at this hotel. Very clean and nice room. I requested a crib before arrival and they had one waiting in the room. Lots of stuff to do around the area, great for walking around. You get that "New York City" feeling in SF. One word of caution: the valet staff stole $20 bucks I had in my ashtray. Kinda my fault for leaving it there but don't leave anything in the car before giving it to the valet. Overall a very nice stay.

I travel quite a bit for work and have stayed at this particular property nearly 20 times spanning over a 10-12 year period. This hotel is honestly one of my favorite places to stay when I am in the Bay area primarily because of the staff. From the maid service to the front desk to the concierge everyone always goes above and beyond. As someone who is on the road quite a bit, I also was impressed post renovation that the rooms were very well thought out (my colleagues and I all agreed it must have been a woman :)) The placement of plugs, reading lights, closets beside the bathroom, etc. makes for a comfortable and convenient stay. Well done! I used to alternate between the Hyatt and the Fairmont (for their incredible bay views), but I think my most recent stay at the Hyatt may have converted me to stay only at this property. I would be amiss not to mention the Grand Club level offerings and particularly the staff. They are some of the best I've experienced!

From the doormen to the housekeepers everyone is friendly and helpful. Great bedding, clean comfortable rooms, bar is nice and friendly. Checkin easy and concierge was amazing. Close to everything, and easy to get to.

I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt many times. It is superbly located and has excellent facilities. I made a last minute reservation, and everything was in order. The staff was excellent. The room was quiet and is excellent for a business guest.

Hotel room and service has been good. Location is good with easy access to shops, cable car, China Town etc. Free Wifi or should I say Wifi included was critical to help plan things to do. We have especially been impressed with the concierge service from Joanna who has been exceptional-good job.

Check in was a little confusing because there are independent kiosks for each front desk person rather than one long counter, so we walked around a bit before returning to the reception area (to the right upon entrance). The gentleman who helped us let us check in early and gave us helpful hints for our stay. The room was great with modern finishes, an awesome view of the city and one of the most comfortable king sized beds we've ever experienced. One thing I would change is the bathroom door. Though trendy, I am not a fan of the sliding door because it doesn't block the sound of restroom use from the living space. Not too romantic if you ask me. Otherwise, the restroom came equipped with all the amenities and great water pressure.Free wi-fi throughout the hotel. The lobby and restaurant looked like museums. They gym has state-of-the-art equipment, both cardio and weight training machines. Tip: the gym is on the 35th floor and because it is east facing, gets pretty warm in the mornings; Friday afternoon workout was much less crowded and hot than Saturday morning. Either way the view is incredible. There is no pool, but it was freezing out so we didn't miss it. There is a Starbucks right across the street, but they also serve Starbucks coffee in the lobby each morning. Fewer people and the girls who helped us were super nice. Though we'd made other plans, the restaurant lounge has live music Friday and Saturday night. As far as location goes, it was walking distance from anything we needed and we enjoyed our coffee at Union Square. The only bummer was that between the hotel and the square there was some pretty heavy duty construction happening, which could be heard throughout our stay (beeping trucks and jackhammers), and some of the sidewalks were blocked. All in all, a wonderful experience. Beautiful room, great location and friendly staff. We'd definitely stay there again.

The neighborhood is safe & Nice.. The valet parking is a little over priced but the service is top notch, you can text them and they have your car downstairs ready and waiting! I highly recommend the club level package! The view is amazing and the food is better than most. I wouldn't recommend dinner at the club level but breakfast and their snacks + free drinks are plenty and generous. I found the staff extremely professional and courteous and they won me over with their charm. I will be staying at this hotel when I am in for business from now on! Check out a couple pictures I took of the suite. The bathroom was bigger than most SF hotel rooms!
