Had a very nice stay at the Grand Hyatt. Check-in staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was quite nice with an amazing view and the bed was super comfortable. I wish that I had asked what the brand/style the bed was . . . I'm in the new for a new mattress!

Very clean and very beautiful hotel. Staff was some of the best I have encountered and I travel a lot. But if you book this hotel remember you are in the middle of a major city- and it is noisy at all hours (and we were on the 23rd floor). Nothing Hyatt can do about the cars honking and ambulance sirens, but I just thought I could help manage expectations for those ready to book. If you do want to stay in the city, it is a great choice. Steps from China Town and the end of the cable car line. If I stay in the city I will stay here again.

This was our third or forth stay in this hotel and by far the worst. Our room was really small comparatively with a horrible view in a terrible location in the hotel. We asked 5 times for a different room nicely. We checked in early so it should not have been a problem. We stayed here for an anniversary celebration and this made our stay pretty bad. One of the people who we spoke with about changing the room was straight up rude. We were willing to pay up to $100 for an upgrade, we just wanted a decent room. After our last effort to switch rooms we went back to our crappy room and the maids were in the supply closet that was next to our room (both were at the end of the hall) with the door open and the cart blocking our door. This really made us feel like the Hyatt couldn't care less about us as guests in the hotel. At this time I called down and really complained as this was ruining our romantic get away. The man I spoke with was really helpful and tried to get us a better room but by this time most guests had checked in for the night, so rooms were slim pickings. He gave us a similar room with a slightly better view but it still wasn't really that great. He also gave us a comp in the bar for our inconvenience but I feel all of it was a lot of trouble for a slightly better room. There are a lot of hotels in Union Square and I don't think I would stay here again.

This hotel was awesome. The location was great, the staff was great and our room was great. The concierge's were very knowledgeable and extremely helpful. They never steered us in the wrong direction and were very friendly. I will stay here again when I make it back.

Great view and friendly staff. From check-in to check-out it was a great experience. They go above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable. Hotel is nicely located since you are right next to union square shopping and you can also walk to fisherman's wharf or china town.

This is a very nice hotel. The rooms are large with updated decor. The hotel is near a lot of high end shops and close to restaurants. The bar is lively with a fine wine list and beer selection. There was a lot of street construction during my stay but that should not worry anyone who plans to walk the city. The only complaint would be their TV system, it's very strange. I could not get NBC one night and this morning I could not get ABC.

The Grand Hyatt is in a great spot. Just outside of Chinatown, we were able to walk to everything in the city. And for those days when everyone was tired, the cable car and street car are close by. The suites are huge! We had a one bedroom suite with a large living room/office and 2 full baths. Would definitely stay again.

Have stayed here couple of times. ItÂ´s a nice hotel with great rooms, amazing view over the city and very helpful staff. Ask for room with overview over the city center if possible.Unfortunately the 36 floor was closed at my rescent stay.

All Staff I encountered whether on the reception desk, conceirge, doormen or in the breakfast restaurant were helpful. The room was spacious with a big bed and very effective black out blinds. The lounge chair was comfortable and it was good to have an iron and ironing board available in the room. The sink in the bathroom looked large enough to wash a baby in it, but the shower didn't have the best water pressure. I borrowed a dressing gown from housekeeping which was delivered immediately along with slippers and the mouthwash I had requested. The restrooms on the lower level had neon sinks and a TV on the mirror which was funky but weird.The location just around the corner from Union Square was great - there are currently roadworks outside however this didn't impact my stay & I couldn't hear any construction noise from my room. The breakfast was ok with attentive service (even for the buffet). The food choice was ok too but there are cheaper options nearby.

I've stayed here about 10 nights over the past three years. The hotel is a half block from Union Square but it's slightly affected by construction. It's a well run Grand Hyatt with updated and comfortable rooms. There are a mix of conference rooms downstairs and the event room at the top of the hotel is quite nice. Overall, it's a good choice for the area, especially when their rates are lower. When it's busy, the rates can get absurd.

My mother and I truly enjoyed our stay at the Grand Hyatt. It is centrally located and the property is modern and clean. The staff readily accommodated our requests and gave us plenty of information about the surrounding area.

We could not have asked for a more perfect weekend for our Girls Weekend Out! San Francisco weather was a wonderful surprise in that it was WARM and CLEAR the whole time we were there! The hotel amenities was perfect for us - the staff so warm and helpful - we were even joking with them! We had the 33rd floor and had an incredible view! The Hyatt Club was just wonderful - the breakfast was the best - scrambled eggs and all the toppings to add that you can think of, plus oatmeal, muffins, Danish, bagels and lox, toasts, fresh fruits and juices and coffees and teas! And cold beverages to choose as well. I would strongly recommend this hotel - it's also a great location for restaurants and shopping. It was a perfect weekend for us galpals!

This hotel is situated in a wonderful location, friendly staff, and close to all the top department stores and small boutique shops. However, rooms are dated and in need of refurbishment. Great for any one looking for a centrally located hotel in city centre.

Nice hotel, good location etc etc per the other reviews. But you either get a good view or as in our case a view of the car park....and pay the same price. I asked for a room change and wasn't met with a positive response. Disappointing honeymoon experience where you expect to be wowed at this price. Reception staff were nice but yet to crack a smile from staff at the front door. Have stayed at many Hyatt's around the world and this is the only one I will leave feeling underwhelmed.

one of the best Grand Hyatt in the US with outstanding concierge who seems to be able to get you into the coolest restaurants. (eg: Chez Panisse). The hotel is mature and currently being disrupted by the construction of the new subway, it is a great location, very welcoming and the rooms are very good

We've stayed at this property before, but it has been updated (very nicely, I might add) so we were confident in our choice prior to arrival. But then - we received an email from the hotel staff the day before our arrival regarding our child (age, etc.) and upon arrival the room was equipped with not only the crib we requested but an infant bath, bottle brush, dish soap (for bottles), diaper genie (!!!!) baby bath kit and baby blanket. Plus, everything was spotlessly cleaned when we arrived - early, I might add. The staff could not have been more friendly and accommodating with our excessive luggage and gear and special requests (note: we booked 2 adjoining rooms to spread out and we tried very hard to be unobtrusive to the non-family travelers in the hotel). We were in Northern California for 10 days, and stayed at 4 Hyatts - I have to say they were all accommodating but this Hyatt is absolutely the best if you are traveling with an infant or young child.

This was my first time at the Grand Hyatt in SF and itâ€™s a very modern and comfortable property at Union Square. My room was on a high floor and at the end of the hall which is generally a good location. It isnâ€™t here. The doors to the rooms on either side of me were inches away from mine. Needless to say any time my neighbors arrived/left/chatted briefly in the hall it felt like they were in my room. When I opened the door I was a little shocked by the hardwood floors. I thought it was interesting but then also made the room feel more cold and certainly more loud as I walked around.The room was a unique shape and I enjoyed that it was different than the usual set up. There was a small hallway next to the bed that contained the closet and the entryway to the bathroom. The closet was large inside but the doors were so small. In order to get the ironing board in the closet I had to almost climb in to get it. Most of the space in there was inconvenient and unusable.The wood accent around the TV and the desk, and nightstand look good from a distance but up close show a lot of nicks in the wood. Iâ€™m not sure that was the best choice. Also, the decorative window screens held in place with Velcro didnâ€™t stay in place and consistently were askew. However, the bed was comfortable, the shower worked well and the view from the room was nice since I was up so high. I also had access to the club a few levels up. That was a nice feature to grab something to drink whenever I needed anything. I donâ€™t know if I would stay here again but with so many great hotels in SF I certainly donâ€™t need to. I just donâ€™t think this hotel was for me. The lobby space and seating were a lot more inviting and comfortable than my room unfortunately.

Just stayed and had a room on a high floor with an amazing view of the city & bay. Great location, close to union square, Chinatown, restaurants, and cable cars. Beds very comfortable, nice furnishings, staff nice. Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is room is on the smaller side, window wouldn't open at all for fresh air, and the coffee in the room wasn't any good. Other than that, no complaints.

Great location for first time visitors to San Francisco. Located on a corner of Union Square for easy walking access to primary stores, restaurants and trolley lines. Sleek, modern, easy check-in. Rooms have been recently updated with sliding doors to outside that actually open slightly allowing for fresh air. Views from upper floor rooms are outstanding, especially those overlooking bay.Recommend you book lounge access. Very accommodating staff. Breakfast spread is nice - great to drop in anytime of day for a soda and light snack. Was surprised that the charge for a glass of wine is $3-that's correct-which is unheard of in most hotel lounges. Great place to take a break during the day with the family and enjoy what has to be the best view of the bay in town.Avoid use of your own transportation. Construction nearby severely limits even the shortest of parking options.

We stayed here recently on a weekend getaway and were not disappointed with our 2 night stay. The hotel is walking distance to most attractions except Fisherman's Wharf and the Golden Gate Bridge. The rooms were spacious enough for us and kept clean by housekeeping. The only thing is that valet is expensive and it was way cheaper to park directly across the street in the structure facing the Starbucks on the corner of Stockton and Sutter.

Located in the centre of the city right next to Union Square, buses, street cars and shops, this hotel is perfectly located. The hotel itself looks very modern and clean, with polite and helpful staff. From our room on a mid-level floor, we looked out towards the city with water visible between other buildings with a lovely view (especially at night). The room was comfortable with all the usual comforts you would expect in a hotel of this quality. I was personally particularily impressed with the bathroom, which was very modern and vibrant, unlike most hotels where bathrooms seem like an after-thought. The food in the hotel bar/restaurant area as well as room service were a little pricey, but there are plenty of close diners, cafes and restaurants within a block or two, as well as a Starbucks literally across the road from the front doors of the hotel, as well as a McDonalds around the corner.During our stay there was a lot of construction work going on next door and on nearby streets (I believe from the building of a new rail line), so it was a little noisy from time to time depending on what work was happening, but nothing that kept us awake. The footpath outside the hotel was blocked off which meant a little extra walk around, but that is hardly the hotel's fault.The hotel fitness centre was pretty well equipped too with an impressive view, being on the second highest floor.A great, comfortable stay and a hotel I would highly recommend to anyone staying in downtown San Francisco.

Very nice place to be!!! Many shops and restaurants on the surroundings. Good food. Spacious and clean accommodations. The view is just astounding from the higher floor rooms. Would surely book it again!!

Grand location! Grand view! Grand service! An all around grand experience from check in to check out. The beds were super comfy.Housekeeping was quick and efficient and the front desk was snapping with a few special requests. We were four women so we had a suite and adjoining double. Perfect!!!You can't go wrong

Used points to upgrade to club floor and called like 5 times to make sure we would get a bay view. It's was totally worth it. This was a business trip for both my wife and myself AND we brought the baby so I was a little nervous and wanted things to be perfect. It worked out great. Hyatt staff provided a Pack'n'Play crib and Fisher Price tub (the whale) plus all kinds of baby products including a Mr Brown bottle brush. It doesn't get more thoughtful than that! They had emailed me prior to arrival to get the details on the child's age (8 months). The Grand Club on the 32nd floor was very welcoming and accommodating to our needs and unusual requests. We came up every morning for breakfast and the hors d'oeuvres in the evening mostly replaced a real dinner. Did I mention the views already? :)) Love the casualness of club lounges. They have an honor bar. You pour your own drinks and get to keep track of your own tab. How cool is that? We are coming back in the summer and I am looking forward to staying at the Grand Hyatt again.

As others have mentioned the location of the Grand Hyatt is great. You are basically across the street from Union Square. But do know that this area is currently under construction and is one of the busiest intersections in the area. A lot of tourists, tour buses, tunnels being built. The hotel is nice. Your sort of standard 30+ floor Hyatt that is well maintained and comfortable. The service was alright. Not bad but not great either, but thats to be expected of a hotel that size.

While a good location, the furnishings in the room are cheap and uncomfortable with exception of the bed, it is very comfortable. They charge 67 dalliers a day for valet parking which is about double what most SF hotels charge. Overall there are many better choices in their same price range, I'll stay elsewhere next time.

This hotel located at the center of San Francisco, next to the Union Square. It takes only 5 mins. walk to the Westfield San Francisco Centre where you can find supermarket and food court (shopping mall closed on Sundays). It's also very convenience to take the cable car at Powell Street, or subway at the Powell BRAT station.We spent two nights at the one-bedroom suite with very beautiful city view. The choices of food and drinks provided by the Premium Lounge were not much, but the food was delicious. The Lounge is small but the city view there is even better than at our room. Since it is small, you may need to wait for a table during peak hours.The staff were very nice and friendly. Will definitely stay at this hotel again when we visit San Francisco next time.

Travel date: April 2016Length of stay: 3 nights Number of guests: 5 adults Room type: 1 suite and 2 double bedrooms Purpose: business & pleasure Summary: great location, bad service, dated hotel. Overall rating is 3 out of 10. Will not stay at this hotel again. Not recommended. The Good:1. Received upgrade to a large suite 2. Express check-in 3. We got the rooms we requested (one connecting to the suite and one adjacent)4. Great location 5. Fast Internet 6. Received access the club lounge The Bad:1. Hotel parking is $67.5 per day2. No one answers the guest services telephone line. You have to call multiple time to get attention!3. Breakfast area is too small and very crowded. Food choices are limited and horrible (omelet is not included in the Buffett). We had to wait for 15 minutes to get a table!!!!!4. Gym is extremely small and very crowded. Long wait on all machines!!!5. There is nothing grand about this hotels "don't know why it is called the Grand Hyatt". Lobby is small with limited seating. 6. Rooms are dated and in need of serious renovations. 7. No special check-in area for IHG members 8. AC was not working in one of the rooms and we made multiple calls for repairs and the problem continues! 9. I was on the 34th floor and getting an elevator is a challange10. The noise level was unbearable due to poor insulation and cheap Windows. We were on the 34th floor and still could hear the street noise all day and throughout the night. Recommendations:1. Consider complementary hotel transportation to SFO2. Consider offering IPads in all gust rooms 3. Consider free hotel parking for IHG Spire members

We stayed in the Hyatt for a couple of days. The rooms were clean and spacious. I had a booked a city view room. We stayed in the 27th floor and the view was really good. The hotel is located very close to Union Square and is very close to restaurants and malls. The hotel staff were very friendly. The breakfast was good but repetitive. The spread is not too big.There is construction going on near the hotel and i was worried if that would affect my sleep but it didn't. Overall a very good stay

This hotel is outstanding in all respects: responsiveness to concerns; speed of resolution; great food; excellent manners of all employees. Good location, close to shopping and Chinatown. Outstanding restaurant across the street..

The Grand Hyatt is in a good location close to restaurants and shopping. It's across the road from Union Square although there was some street construction going on while we are there which meant going the long way around to get there (obviously not the hotels fault). The guy who checked us in seemed to be quite confused and was a bit rude. The doormen and bar staff were helpful and friendly. The gym was bigger than expected and has great views. I would stay here again.

I typically like to stay at Hyatt, but this hotel disappointed me. Found a dirty bath towel hanging above shower curtain when I took a shower. GROSS! Also scared the hell out of me because it's totally unexpected. Will try to stay away next time.

I really enjoy staying at the Hyatt when I work in San Francisco. It's a great location, the rooms are comfortable and have great views and I can have meetings in the restaurants with clients. The service is excellent and the food is delicious.

Nice hotel centrally located to all major San Francisco attractions. Very professional check-in and valet staff. Not once did our family have to open the hotel lobby door. Staff was very attentive. Great location to be able to walk to just about any city attraction, including Chinatown, Little Italy, Fisherman's Wharf and the Westfield Shopping Mall. Would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to San Francisco on business or pleasure.

This hotel is in a great position for shopping, sightseeing and plenty of good restaurants. We had a really lovely four night stay here. We did find the bedroom needed a little updating especially the bathroom but having said that you couldn't really complain about anything.The staff here are wonderful, very friendly and nothing us too much trouble. Breakfast was very good and so was the food in the bar that we sampled on the night of our arrival.Would definitely stay here again.

The room was good. For the price, I found it to be pretty basic but it's all about the location for this hotel. A block away from Union Square and Chinatown and just a few minutes walk from Financial district. Close to BART stations and really good restaurants and retail stores. I was put up on the 15th floor - no view from there. The staff is friendly and helpful. Free WiFi, coffee/tea. Overall, had a great stay.

You can't have it all. This hotel is right next to Union Square, easy to get to from the airport by train, and is a nice stylish hotel with generous rooms. What you expect from a grand Hyatt. But like all of San Francisco, the rooms are not cheap. So it's hard to rate down for cost when most alternative 4+ star hotels are just as pricey. Would go back for the location and because of the reliability. But would look online for a good rate first.

My wife and I had a wonderful stay at the Grand Hyatt but once outside the doors we were appalled by the dirt on the streets and sidewalks around the hotel. SF may be the city of song and legend but overall it is a rather dirty city with few or no green trees or plants visible outside of Golden Gate park. Also, the homeless were everywhere for which I don't fault them in any way but it is sad that such a wealthy city with such high earners can't do a better job helping those less fortunate.

Only had a couple of nights in transit on the way east so needed a place central to the city highlights. Close to Union Square, major retail, Chinatown, North Beach and my favourite stores.A good tasteful spacious room and enjoyed the club facilities.Great views of the Bay and city from the Club lounge and Bay Room

There are many hotels in this area, but the Hyatt is the best. It is modern and has very spacious rooms (not something easy to find in downtown SF) and if you go high enough - it has great views of the entire bay. Food is delicious, check-in process is amazingly fast. the concierge is very helpful and the location cannot be unbeaten. Note there are 3 Hyatt hotels in SF, this is the one next to Union Square called the "Grant Hyatt" not to be confused (as I did in the past) with others.

Great location with excellent service. Room a bit small, but quiet and comfortable. Be aware of construction in the area. Valet area very congested, but staff does a great job of getting clients in/out of their vehicles.

Staff are friendly (except the elderly gentleman at the concierge desk), room is clean, great location - walking distance to shops, restaurants and the citybus tour. My husband and i opted for a trip to SF this time to celebrate our 27th wedding anniversary -- and we had a great time! Only thing is, we tried to check in earlier, the receptionist was nice enough to accommodate us, but is going yo give us the 17th floor. I informed her that we paid extra to have the city view on floor 20 and up. She said nothing is available and will call us when one will be available. We went to grab lunch nearby and we were called within an hour. So it's not bad. But don't they check your reservation before giving you a room which costs less? We wanted to go back and stay at Grand Hyatt again. This time, I would like to try the lunch pairings at One Up restaurant, which we did not have time for this time. Maybe next time.

The streets around the hotel are currently under construction, so there is some noise from the workers, but it is fairly muted at the higher floor levels.The location is great and you can get around well by walking on taking the street cars. If you forgot something, shopping is very close by.The room is a good size and the shower/bath tub combo is nice. The bed was comfortable and lots of pillows to choose from. I would stay here again.

Stayed at the hotel during DocuSign's Momentum 2016 conference. The quality of service was top-notch and the hotel and room was very clean and well maintained. Staff assisted with some urgent dry-cleaning requirements which was very helpful given that I needed to be in the conference rather than running around trying to locate a dry cleaner.

I spent 5 nights at the Grand Hyatt on a pleasure/business trip. The hotel staff was extremely accommodating and friendly. My flight from Philadelphia was 4 1/2 hours delayed causing me to arrive at the hotel at 1:30am PDT. My husband called ahead to ensure I would get my room preference and he ordered a bottle of wine with a small cheese plate to be waiting for me. He told me the person on the phone went out of his way to make it happen. The rooms are clean and well appointed with great beds for a restful sleep. I would definitely stay again.

Due to a conference, I did book the Grand Hyatt and I was happy about the choice. Got all I needed at the hotel with fast check-in and check-out. Restaurant could have a better menu but that's all about personal taste.

Contemporary hotel with fabulous rooms; outstanding artwork in the lobby/rooms; Starbucks served in hotel; wonderful fitness center; great top floor viewing room; comfortable beds with extra pillows; superb/helpful staff; great restaurant and breakfast bar; centrally located in heart of shopping/dining/gallery district

The Grand Hyatt on Stockton is in a great spot in Union sq...easy to get everywhere. Gym and Club have spectacular view of bay/ coit tower! Highly suggest staying here. The staff are well trained and the rooms are well equipped. Love having a gym open 24 hrs a day when I come form Europe.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for one night when in San Francisco. The guest check in person was very polite. Thought the rooms were wonderful. Didn't like that they had no pop-machine in the whole hotel.Rooms were pricey but it is San Francisco.We would stay there again, no problem.Bed and pillows were comfortable.Our cruise got in at 10am and they were kind enough to give us a room right away. WOW!!!!

The event team, lead by Meghan Nicholson are wonderful to work with. They are accommodating, friendly, responsive and quick to take action. If you select the Grand Hyatt as your next event location you will not be disappointed with the view of the city, ambiance of the hotel or professionalism of the staff.

The rooms are wonderful - comfortable and pleasant modern design. Loved the oversized - long - bathroom sink. Central to nearly everything (I love to walk). I recommend the Grand Hyatt to anyone wishing a hassle-free, pleasant experience in the center of San Francisco

This is my 3rd stay in this hotel mainly because of the location - in the heart of Union Square.The rooms are fine but not really can match the label of 'Grand Hyatt'. To my experience, the worst thing is 'staff'. You can hardly see any staff in the lobby who takes the initiative to greet you or even to give you a smile. I once called the housekeeping asking for amenities and the lady answered my call was very rude too!

NEGATIVES1. Lots of construction noise that seemed to last late in the night and restart early in the morning-- sound proofing windows necessary (I was on the 10th floor, 1017). Construction dbl shifts starting at 6:30am and quieting down at 10pm. I should be warned of construction noise when booking-checking in-- see photo2. Lots of street noise--sound proofing windows necessary (10th floor room, 1017) Bed was way lumpy on the left side-- (it's good to flip a mattress)3. 2 plus inches of space between the floor and the door---Annoying with the bright hallway light streaming thru at night along with the standard hallway noise of people and doors--see photo4. Really ugly wall with fixtures-- see photo5. Scratched and beat door to my room--see photo6. Wouldn't offer a late check-out (3:00pm) without a half-day charge. I checked online-- plenty of rooms available at half the rate I paid--they weren't sold outMy daughter stayed on 22nd floor (2217) and had the exact same negatives I note aboveThis is a way below-average hyatt property and experience. Hyatt GM only seems to respond primarily to positive notes on TA. Hoping they stay consistent and don't reply to this negative review.Nah, I won't stay here again. There are too many other choices in Union Square area.

I have stayed many times at the Grand Hyatt SF and I'll continue to come back. If you need to be in that part of the city for a conference, then stay there because it feels cleaner and safer than the area adjacent to the convention center. The hotel has been tastefully updated and is clean and comfortable. I think that it could use a few more elevators and more manpower at the check-in reception kiosks. When the weather is bad, the hotel creaks in the wind but that's not uncommon for high rises in the Bay Area. Overall I think that the Grand Hyatt is an excellent value for that part of the city.

Snow in Denver delayed my arrival from late evening Wednesday to Thursday early morning, reducing my stay from 3 nights to 2, yet I was able to get in to my room right away at 9 am upon arrival - definitely much appreciated. I requested a room with a King bed, and was very happy with the room I received. Plenty of space, large and convenient desk/work area, comfortable chair near the floor to ceiling windows to enjoy the view of the neighborhood, and a delightful vanity/dressing area between the bedroom and bath. Others who traveled with our group shared a double room, and the king room was definitely more spacious.One evening, a friend and I had dinner at the OneUp restaurant. The waitstaff was attentive and pleasant, and the food was amazing. After a long day of meetings and walking, the chicken pot pie was perfect! Plenty of shopping within walking distance, and convenient to the city bus for further exploring. Wifi was not reliable, but I had a good cell signal, so no worries.Would definitely stay again for business or with family.

There is a massive amount of work being undertaken directly outside this hotel - covering more than a block (something related to the subway, I believe). Work kicks-off at 7am on the dot - and is VERY noisy. The hotel did not pre-warn us of this - despite booking 5 months in advance. We had requested a "quiet room, high floor" - this was definitely not a quiet room (floor 25).The room itself is comfortable - altho' the internet is hit and miss.Regardless, at the end of the day, a hotel is for a good nights sleep and it was not possible to do so here.Avoid while the work is taking place.

We loved being close to Chinatown and Union Square. We were able to do most of the things we wanted to do, find great places to eat. We added the Grand Club level to our stay which made it less stressful and was convenient for us

Great location. Windows are massive so light is great in the room as well. Plenty of elevators, so didn't have to wait long even when there were lots of people there for a conference. Housekeeping staff was wonderful -- friendly and kind!

Nice hotel, great people. However I was not lucky and found stubborn smell in the bathroom. Staff did not offer to change to another room, even though I suggest it. May be the hotel was full. The TV is useless, considering I watch only PBS, NBC, CBS. It has a computer keyboard, who knows for what. Ah! I almost forgot, I had to pay (not much) for WiFi upgrade to continue working in the evenings. The standard WiFi does not even connect. The IT staff was very helpful in this field.

This is a beautiful hotel centrally located with amazing staff. As a professor, I travel all the time for work. This was hands down one of the nicest and most convenient "work" hotels I have stayed in. I highly recommend the Grand Hyatt Union Station

The view from our room on the 27th floor was great of the city. If you are sharing a room, like I was, don't expect a big room. I had a colleague with their own room with a king bed and it was much more spacious than my room with two queen beds.

A perfect hotel for a Easter weekend getaway. Prior San Francisco stays included the Wharf area as well as Nob Hill; the Grand Hyatt just off of Union Square is a more desirable location, due to its close proximity to many fine restaurants of all levels, as well as shopping and cultural venues. The Hyatt has been one of my hotels of choice in many cities, and the Grand Hyatt confirmed that again. Comfortable, upscale accommodations; will stay here again.

We stayed at this hotel for five nights with my family while we toured San Francisco and shopped around Union Square. This hotel is located one block away from Union Square and the location is great. The hotel is a high rise and has spectacular views of the bay area, specially at the penthouse. The bar is very nice and there is a convenient Starbucks kiosk in the lobby. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I was hesitant to stay in such a large hotel, but we had a great stay and I would definitely return.

This is a GRAND Hyatt. However, there is much that is not grand at all. For example, the lounge chair in the room had Fritos between the side of the chair and the seat cushion. Easy to see; easy to smell. But not "GRAND." Another example . . . it is incredibly easy to hear the noises from the neighboring units. One person in the room next to ours was not feeling well. We knew this because we could hear the person cough, sniff, clear their throat, etc., etc.. Maybe I'm wrong, but it just seems to me that if I'm staying at a GRAND Hyatt, the noise I hear from neighboring rooms should be minimal to none. In fact, I recently stayed at a Hyatt Place and the noise from neighboring units was far less problematic. As others have noted, the hotel does have a great location. And the personnel in the Grand Club lounge (Anh, Jaydee, Ben, Billy, Judy) are fabulous. But if you're looking for a CLEAN and QUIET room, be advised that you might be out of luck at this property.

Definitely much better than the airport Hyatt (that's currently under renovation; reviewed previously), this hotel is located strategically right in the heart of San Francisco, nearby iconic places like the Union Square, Chinatown, and the highly connected Powell Street Station (BART, Cable Car, trams and major bus lines incl. tour buses). Very happening and lively place. Shopping, food, nightlife entertainment, everything within walking distance. (Not to be confused with the other SF Hyatt i.e. Hyatt Regency by the Bay in the slightly less entertaining financial district.)The interior design of the rooms and public areas had a very contemporary 21st century theme that I absolutely love (none of that gaudy tacky flowery chandeliery nonsense you see in other hotels where they can't decide which continent, era or century they're trying to emulate). The personalized welcome message on the TV screen and the interactive consoles were a nice touch. Want to order food? Just scan the QR code given in the interactive channel anytime.Lobby and restaurant make you feel like you're in Mass Effect or Deus Ex. Silicon Valley scifi technopia feel resonating. Yes, I'm totally geeking out here.You can request rooms higher up for the best views, but you'll need to book way ahead for those. The hotel is pretty full all the time.Enjoyed the stay very much. Giving it 5* rating hands down. Highly recommended for techies.

I have completed the Hyatt Trifecta in San Francisco. On prior visits, I have stayed at the Hyatt Regency and Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf, but on this visit, stayed at the Grand Hyatt. Upon arrival, it was a little crazy dealing with parking; there's very little space and construction near front entrance. Despite the High Price of Valet Parking ($67/night), we valeted with all the street chaos. (There's another lot nearby, but its still $45/night.)The lobby is not as grand as the Hyatt Regency in town. They have little kiosks to check-in. We waited less than a minute. Lobby was busier than expected, but we realized some schools are on Spring Break, already.We were automatically upgraded to a Grand Hyatt Club Room. Cool. When we reached our room, we had gorgeous views. Plus, we had access to Club Room w/breakfast, snacks & wine. Free Wi-Fi and a refrigerator in the room (but no mini bar or water).Comfortable bed, Huge shower and separate vanity area (nice!). Grand Hyatt Club Room has gorgeous views, as well. Plus, good selection of breakfast items. (smoked salmon & bagels, cereals, pastries, coffee, lattes, etc.) Selection of wines & liquor that run on the honor system (you tell them how many you had). Overall, good service. Front Desk Clerk, Doormen, & Club Servers were all very friendly. A pleasant stay and I would return.

we stayed here for 3 nights as first stop of California road trip to celebrate my 50th birthday. From the outset the service was excellent. We were given a club room with an amazing view of the city from the 33rd floor. A gift was in room on arrival. We used the club room for breakfast and drinks later in the day which was very nice. Rooms spacious and modern furnishings. Hotel very close to Union Square so a bit of noise during night but nothing too bad. Recommended as a good standard of hotel in central location.

Great hotel. Very clean and the service was outstanding. The Grand Club Lounge is excellent and I loved the honor bar in evenings. $3 beers/wines and $4 cocktails that you pour yourself! If you are looking for an upscale property in a centrally located San Francisco location, this is the place. I

Ok, so if you are looking to do a little shopping while in San Francisco, you only have to walk out the door of this hotel. Overall the hotel is fairly well appointed for the price point in the heart of San Francisco. Short walks to almost everything. The Club Room is convenient but to small for the needs that this busy hotel has. The gym is adequate to get moving before heading out - nothing fancy. The bed is very comfortable and the room is ready for all the high tech conveniences. Only issue is very limited draw space if you like to un pack. Absolutely would stay here again on next visit to get my San Francisco fix.

The hotel is tired and is need of a serious renovation and redecoration. The rooms are drab and depressing, as are the common areas, especially the elevators and the hallways leading to the rooms. Everything about the place is old, nothing is forward thinking or welcoming. We won't be back unless and until this property is comprehensively upgraded.

The hotel is nice newly renovated hotel and the entire staff is extremely nice and helpful. I was fortunate enough to stay in one of the suites with an attached room and was very impressed with the size of the suite (3214). There was a Beautiful kitchen with a large wine fridge, coffee machine, there were 2 very large sofas and a dining room table that could fit 8 perfectly surrounded by floor to ceiling sliding Windows with dramatic views of the city. The rooms were clean and the bed was very comfortable. The bedroom was tiny but overall a great value.If you have access to the lounge it's not a bad place to stop for breakfast, snacks or the panoramic views.The restaurants were very good incase you just want to stay in and enjoy a meal.They have a nice gym located on the 35th floor and they are pet friendly incase you want to bring your four-legged friend with you ;)

Despite a modern renovation and clean guest rooms, only the basics are provided. Prices seem to reflect design and newness of common areas, where, if you're traveling for business, you spend little time. Rooms are well-designed but amenities are sparse. No mini-bar, no safe, water coolers in the hallway by the ice-machines.

We attended a Saturday night dinner at a downtown restaurant and booked the Grand Hyatt as it was two blocks away. Everything in downtown SF is blocks away from this hotel - the location is ideal. There was a long line at the desk on arrival, but four very pleasant clerks moved it quickly. We had booked a club room, which had a fantastic view. The room was a bit on the small side, but was clean, with a comfortable bed. The club rooms include access to a hospitality room with a comp breakfast and evening hospitality. It was a nice room with decent fare, but the room fills quickly (no one was asking for proof that anyone was entitled to be there, which was odd.) All in all, this hotel is perfect if you're visiting downtown SF

My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt twice during our visit to San Francisco, both times for 2 nights. Check in was easy, very friendly and professional staff who easily dealt with a situation on our first check in (Expedia had stuffed up the booking details - not Grand Hyatt's fault). The quality of the hotel is superb, very comfortable king sized bed, great shower etc etc, good gym (no pool) and the view from our room was spectacular. The location is fantastic, close to shopping, restaurants, cable cars, the financial district (great coffee and lunch options) etc. Super easy to get to from SFO. Complimentary wifi also a big plus! However, all this comes at a price - and for the price per night, we found a couple of things lacking. Firstly, the hotel operates a system where very few "extras" are provided initially in the room, and you have to request these be sent up (e.g. A bathrobe). The list of things to request is extensive..., but I asked for three separate items and not once were these actually delivered without us having to contact the desk a second time (and I had waited more than 4 hours on both occasions, not unreasonable I would have thought.)Also, service in the OneUp bar is pretty surly, especially when it's busy. Great drinks selection and yummy food, but given the exceptional service we experienced elsewhere in SF, this could be done better.

My husband and I travelled to San Francisco for our 1 year anniversary. We got a room on the Grand Club Level thinking it would be better than a regular room. The room was extremely small, with inadequate seating and the club breakfast needed some additional items. We were disappointed in these two things, but aside from that, we really enjoyed our stay. We loved the hotel, the location, the view, and several of the staff members. Liz in concierge was extremely helpful, and even called one of the tour company's to book our tour for us. The doormen were friendly and helpful, even after helping us for four days straight. The view from our room was great!! We had a view of downtown and the bay, unfortunately we couldn't sit there and admire it :) Overall, it was a great stay. The hotel is right in the middle of union square, the staff is attentive, and the views are amazing. I would definitely recommend staying here, but probably in a regular room.

We just booked the hotel for a one night stay while we toured San Francisco. Comfortable beds, great city view at night. Beautiful TV, however only with very basic channels. Other channels were extra. Comfortable large beds. We got a City View Double. We didn't get a chance to experience everything we could from the hotel, but the staff was great. They even went out of their way to provide us with a drink that the vending machine took, due to it being out of stock. This hotel is very luxurious and highly recommend to those who can put in the extra $$$ to stay at a great place.

The hotel is centrally located & we had a great view. Quiet, clean, good staff, everything was great! The room was very modern/oriental in feel & comfortable. I didn't try the restaurant so I can't comment on that.

We came here for only one night after a long flight and it was like finding a lovely Oasis in the desert. The service was excellent, the hotel itself is beautiful and modern, the facilities are top notch - and the view from the fitness center is stunning. Great place to stay and centrally located. I would highly recommend this hotel for travel for both personal and business.

was in this hotel for 6 nights and just loved it. location was beautiful and close to very good shopping areas and excellent restaurants. the view from our room was phenomenal. the travel assistants were very nice and gave us excellent advise and service for our daily trips. Our room (2 queen size beds) was a bit small, but very clean. would definitely come back!

I booked a room at this hotel about a month ago as I will be planning A trip from Los Angeles for me and my wife's anniversary. I have been going back-and-forth about upgrading our room for room with a view as I know it would be important to my wife. Called couple times and spoke with reservations and explained that I was on a budget to see what the best arrangement would be. And if I should wait till checking in to see if there was any last minute offers or a complementary upgrade for our anniversary. I was assured that rooms may book up quickly and to spring for the upgrade. $400 later Today I'm receiving an email for a last-minute upgrade at less than half the price. I feel cheated and maybe I just should've waited.

Check in was not pleasant, I was not welcome the host stand person did not go over the amenities. I got bitten in the room I stayed reported it to the manager he was careless he transferred me to file the complaint with the housekeeper supervisor. I left a message and the housekeeper never return my call.

This hotel provided me the weekend get-away I was so in need of. Staff was extremely professional and courteous. The entire facility were first class, with an incredible view of the San Francisco skyline.

When I checked in, I was given a room that was in the middle of being cleaned. Not a good start but Maria, on the Check In desk quickly sorted me an alternative room. The location of the hotel was very conveinient.

Staying at the Grand Hyatt was a great experience. The rooms are on the small side, but definitely enough room for two. The service was perfect--not one complaint, the rooms were clean and nicely decorated, and the location was great. It was the perfect home base for exploring the city.

Great service. I was not feeling well and the hotel did everything to accomodate my needs. The staff was really friendly and responsive. Next time I go to San Francisco I will stay there for sure! 100% recommended!

My partner and I stayed for two nights. The staff at reception were extremely professional and attentive. They allowed us to check-in early and gave us a very nice corner room with a King size bed.The room was a good size with everything that you would need to make an enjoyable stay - comfy bed with premium bedding, desk, sitting area, quiet A/C, plenty of reading lights, HDTV, fresh coffee machine and free Wi-Fi. N.B. Our room was not affected (thankfully) by noise with the ongoing building work with the new Apple Store currently being constructed next door to the Grand Hyatt. Completion date it would appear, is not too far away so I don't think it will be a problem in a months time or so.For a hotel of this size we were surprised that the bar and restaurant areas were quite small. In fact, the only real criticism we had on our stay here was the limited offerings for breakfast when it came to the buffet. In comparison to other similar rated hotels in the area, we were very disappointed with the choice on offer and the quality of food here. Staying many times in Union Square, we've come to expect better value for money.Seeing as there is an abundance of restaurants and food outlets in the area, we will opt to eat out next time we stay.Overall, a very pleasant stay at the Grand Hyatt made even better by the very kind gesture offered by Maria T. at the front desk to help celebrate my partner's birthday.- Thank you again Maria!Much appreciated.

Beautiful modern rooms. Bathroom is stunning with wood trim and raised sink. Lots of closet space and drawers. In room safe and frig. Well furnished and well lit. Beds are super comfy. The hotel has a gym, business center, restaurant and room service. Also sits across the street from giant Starbucks. Lobby is gorgeous and welcoming!

The hotel was nice. This is my second time staying. The room was small for 4 people but we made it work. The bathroom has a sliding door with no lock and a big gap so forget privacy when going to the bathroom. If you are bringing your kids like we did plan on one sleeping on the floor, the 2 beds are double NOT queen. The rooms are too small for queens. at over 400 a night getting 2 rooms was not an option. The food is okay at the one restaurant. It very expensive.(but so are all the places to eat) San Fran is a fun city but not Cheap!! We had a great time shopping, The Grand Hyatt is in the perfect location to the shopping, food. . We walked to the mall. There is a movie theatre at the mall for rainy days. The Imax is a taxi ride away so is Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 to catch the boat to Alcatraz. The concierge service is AMAZING!! ask for John or Elaine!. They are building the big daddy of big daddy Apple store right beside the hotel. the one further down is moving to this location. There is construction right in front of the hotel. They are extending the subway line right in front of the hotel so there is a noise issue in the morning. I would stay again.

Stayed here for GDC with a friend. The Hotel is on Union Square, half a mile from the Moscone Center, which is a straight shot and a painless walk. It's in a very safe and comfortable area of San Francisco. My room had a beautiful view of the city. Every staff member I spoke to was very friendly and anticipated my needs. Highly recommend upgrading to a club room if possible; the Grand Club is excellent. A bit expensive, but you're paying for quality. Would stay here again!

There is no way this hotel should be categorized as a Grand Hyatt. It has all the charm of a plastic, disposable razor. Let's start with the he outrageous noise from the 24 hour construction going on in Union Square. Now, you pay a premium for that room ($499 per night!) precisely because it faces Union Square; yet forget about getting a good night's sleep. I ended up feeling ripped off. The room and bathroom are decent sizes but hardly the comfort level you expect at a Grand Hyatt. The mini bar is not stocked and the room have virtually no amenities. You have to fill in a form or call guest services to request things like toothbrush, slippers, robe. No bottled water provided either. Ugh...why bother? While the location is good, you are paying a series premium for a very sub par experience. Look elsewhere.

Amenities left a lot to be desired. Liked it more when bar was on top floor. Food was okay but overpriced. Room and bathroom very small. Close to shopping and dining.There is no gift shop and no in room paper delivery. Cost of parking was outrageous.

Very clean with super friendly staff. I felt right at home and I got an amazing (although short) night of rest. I will stay here again! I got in late and even tough it was late, everyone was friendly and helpful. I was very grateful.

Very standard hotel but Starbucks is across the street and you can walk to the business/financial district, to Union Square and to Chinatown. It's a 3-4 star hotel, busy, functional although with no particular charm

Extended a business trip with a weekend stay and could not have been happier with location, service, room, and view. Construction and a St. Patrick's Day parade complicated already intense traffic so take advantage of easy Muni access and do not bring a car if you can avoid it.

The room is clean and nice, with good view of the SF city. Chinatown is within 5 min walk up north, with the downtown right south. The buffet breakfast is good but sometime it may get crowded. For some reason, the air-conditioning is making some noise if the temperature was set other than 22 degree ...

The standard room was clean and functional, but rather on the small side. Although the hotel appears quite new, my room showed some wear and tear, like a cracked sink in the bathroom or some veneer coming off. Didn't bother me much, though. Staff was friendly and efficient. There is a nice bar in the hotel; I was just a bit irritated the bartender needed to look up a standard drink's recipe...While my stay was totally OK and I wouldn't mind to return for business, I probably will check out one of the many other hotels close by a next time.

the hotel is very well located (union square)very nice inside and great decorationthe view at 36th floor is amazing, food is averagelobby a little bit windy and miss some area to chat if still street work ask for high floorpier is at 2 km, lombart street at 3 km

I stay at this Grand Hyatt whenever I have business or pleasure downtown San Francisco, CA. As a Hyatt Diamond member I stay at Hyatt's all over the State of California and the other parts of the world whenever I can this hotel is as good as any of them. I love good service & great restaurant & bar and this has it all.

Not sure how long the construction will be taking place right next to the hotel but I absolutely did not sleep. When I complained, they did move me to a higher floor but absolutely didn't go above and beyond to make it easier on me. They weren't on top of their game. The rooms were very beautiful though and trendy looking hotel

As suggested in the title, I was here for business in San Francisco. My review and high marks are predicated largely upon this fact and the relative affordability of the hotel versus other suitable options. Here's what I liked and thought they could improve upon:Pluses1) common areas are very impressive. Stylish and new. Nice wow factor.2) room was also new and spacious. Bed was comfortable - not plush like the ritz, but perfectly adequate. Views from upper floors (i was on the 25th) are very good. Like the knock out shade operated from bedside. I read that some of the rooms are tired and some renovated. I obviously got the later.3) staff were all very friendly, well trained and helpful. Particularly liked the bartender who knows how to pour.4 ) loaction is terrific for access to downtown financial district. If you're strictly a tourist, I'm guessing you may want to consider other options.Minuses - not a lot here, somewhat have to nitpick1) gym is too small for a hotel this size. It was tight in the morning.2) would have been nice to have a bottle of water available in the room3) strong light from the hallway slightly illuminated the room at nightThat's it. I was very pleased with the hotel and would return on future business trips.

We were on the 32nd floor in a spacious, comfortable and clean room with a city view.There is a room on the 32nd floor that serves a very good breakfast, afternoon and evening eats. We had to purchase any alcoholic beverage but everything else was included, Reception provided great service and there is a very convenient garage across the street that will save you money if you have a car. We went for a one night birthday celebration and it was everything a first class hotel should be. It doesn't offer romantic dÃ©cor, but that isn't the intention.

This is a wonderful property, and my first time stay at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco. Have to admire the Grand Hyatts which I've visited since 1992 in Shanghai, Hong Kong, Taipei, Zurich and now here.The Hyatt guys are prepared to invest and re-invest to provide premium services and facilities. The standouts for this hotel are: - Central location in Union Square, the hotel hub in San Francisco - close to the department stores, boutiques, financial district and China Town. You are also sitting atop an underground network (Powell Station) which provides connectivity to the greater Bay Area.- Common Areas - there is a "wow" factor in the main lobby area decor. The Check-in area is comprised of 3 "pods" where you can speak with each front office officer confidentially, without another guest ogling behind you. This all provides for a very personal and private experience. - Well designed rooms with luxury touches including hardwood floors, mirror wall bathrooms and co-ordinated interiors- all very welcoming. I was upgraded to a Club Room Suite which was large and had separate lounge, bedroom, dressing and bathroom.- Club Room - it's worth considering a Club Room which offers a higher floor - 32nd to 35th floors and expansive, unobstructed views of San Francisco. The Club facilities include access to the Club which provides for a more than adequate breakfast and other food and drink options during the day and evening. All-in-all an enjoyable stay. I was considering to sample another hotel for a change (see other reviews for this city), but ultimately reverted to the Grand Hyatt.If you have no experience with the Grand Hyatt brand, or San Francisco's hotels then I would highly recommend. It has an excellent price point booking on sites via TripAdvisor. I am a business and leisure traveller who is out on the road 3 months of every year.

This hotel cuts through the busy jumble of usual hotel chaos to the simple business of easy registration, nearby elevators, comfortable rooms and beds and wonderful views! The absolute most user friendly hotel I have ever stayed at. I loved my experience at the Grand Hyatt!

Stayed here for 6 nights on a business trip. The location is great, right next to Union Square, Cable Car and the shopping area. There are also many restaurants and bars in the area. The service was great and the breakfast was very good as well. The rooms are a bit old, but I heard that there are some newly refurbished rooms available as well. All in all a pleasant stay.

Great location just around the corner of Union Square. The hotel has everything you expect from a Grand Hyatt hotel. Rooms are clean but without inspiration, very much focused on the business traveller. Services are good - concierge is very efficient in arranging dining and transportation options and I was there during SB50 weekend. Only the breakfast lets this hotel down. Buffet has very poor options and a la carte is so so. Go elsewhere for breakfast.

There's a construction next to the hotel, so if you're looking to sleep, I wouldn't recommend this place. The food/room service is overpriced, there are better restaurant with less price nearby, or pretty much everywhere.

Great hotel....Hyatt's typical are great and consistent. The location is perfect for both business and leisure travel. The rooms are spacious which can be hard to come by in the city and the customer service is fantastic!

Valet parking costs us $65 for 1 night. Bed is not comfortable. Ice machine is broke. Bed sheets feels like paper. They could use a more mirrors. Loud noise from upstairs- you can hear people walking. No military discount if you booked through hotels.com Overall, I didn't get the comfort for what I paid for...

From the front desk to housekeeping we felt recognized. Our room had an expansive view of the city. Location of the hotel within walking distance of the best shopping and eating in the city. Who could ask for more?

Hotel is located adjacent to Union Square and offers convenient access to several local attractions. As reported by others, ongoing construction of Apple store adjacent to the hotel created constant traffic snafus that affected on and off boarding of guests and visitors. However, concierge and doormen worked hard to minimize the impact and efficiently moved patrons to nicely refurbished common areas and rooms. Check-in was equally efficient and welcoming; we were kindly offered a room on a high level that faced away from the construction. As such, we did not experience any noise issues related to the construction. Newly furbished room was provided with modern accents and elements of the Hyatt brand. The room was of standard size and had floor-to-ceiling windows that extended the width of the room - that made it very bright. Working desk had facile access to several power outlets; the free wifi provided robust and reliable signal. The bed was comfortable and the climate control, as were all the other fixtures (lighting, fridge, bathroom), were functional. Breakfast at the new and nicely decorated "One Up" restaurant offered a limited buffet selection that in my opinion was not commensurate with the rate charged. The restaurant was also small relative to the size of the hotel; consequently, the staff was evidently working hard to move their clients through their meals, which negatively affected the experience. Overall, this is a nice and well-managed establishment; I would consider revisiting.

Reservation desk service is terrible! They lied to me on that rooms are not available and I would need to pay to get a kind bed and city view room. Asked to speak with manager and I was told there manager is not there and transferred me to general reservation desk of Hyatt. That is where I found out that I was lied to and the hotel was not full or over booked!

The room was good but very expensive. No water or mini bar in the room. Bottled water available from room service a$29 for two large bottles. Club lounge very disappointing limited food and all drinks were charge to room. Very odd accounting system - made charges to my credit card twice a day. They charge as they think and give you balance at the end of the stay.

The Grand Hyatt is a somewhat basic large, chain hotel. It has some elements which are great (modern rooms and gym with views from 35 floor), a central location in Union Square, and reasonably priced. First impression was also quite positive, the front desk staff was friendly and provided early check in; they also have an open concept front desk that is unique and welcoming.My biggest issue is the extremely thin walls and doors which don't prevent any noise from entering room. There was so much noise on both Saturday and Sunday morning due to construction, cleaning and unruly neighbors that impacted our sleep.Also, WiFi worked well in room.

This is a typical big hotel and totally suitable for a business trip. Good beds, good gym and central to everywhere.Its a safe option for business people and families.Excellent breakfast and an excellent concierge.

While we weren't staying at this Hyatt, we needed to activate our Hyatt points so decided on a lunch at this downtown venue off Union Square. We were really pleasantly surprised by the delicious selection of tapas style dishes for our lunch at their 2nd floor restaurant. Tasty and memorable with outstanding service. And not overly expensive in a quiet and tasteful city centre venue. Lunch for two for less than $25.

The Grand Hyatt is located by Union Square. There are lots of great stores within walking distance for those who like to shop. It's within 4 blocks of the BART -- most convenient is Montgomery station rather than Powell. The rooms are clean and sleep was not a problem. The food for conference was tasty. Service was great. Nothing to complain about.

I've been to SF three times now and every time, I strive to stay at the Hyatt. The location is fantastic. Right in Union square but still far enough to feel immersed in more residential neighbourhoods. The hotel is beautiful, the staff are always attentive, the concierge is always friendly. The rooms themselves are small - but this is standard for SF. The one complaint I would make is that, I wish the washroom doors were able to shut completely (sliding door, leaves a crack open) and that the washroom had an exhaust fan. WIFI was included when we were there and it is high speed. The gym is fantastic for a hotel gym. Many free weights and different machines to work out on. Overall, had a fantastic time and always felt good coming "home" to the Hyatt.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt Hotel in SanFrancisco to attend the "2016 Epilepsy Pipeline Conference" which brings together decision-makers with a stake in the field of epilepsy treatment, therapeutic innovation, and product development. This was my first stay at the Grand Hyatt Hotel and I found the Hotel excellent in all areas, from: check-in to layout of the room - for a disabled individual like myself, to cleanliness, to service provided, to my rooms value for the dollar ($). In addition the Hotel and room lay-out for a disabled individual like myself was excellent. The conference I attended was in this Hotel and the over three (3) days the Hotel conference room added to the important subjects and classes and was important to the success of this conference. I definitely recommend the Grand Hyatt Hotel to everyone visiting San Francisco and on my next visit here I look forward to returning to this very special Hotel.

The hotel was nice overall. The construction was a nuisance when trying to unwind, but the earplugs left in the room was a good alternative. The overall room was nice, just a bit dated in the furniture.

I've stayed at the Marriott down the street from this place and I couldn't sleep one bit due to the noise coming through the windows at 3am with garbage pick-up and people walking around. However, here at the Grand Hyatt, I couldn't even hear the construction going on, right outside my window! I was on floor 21 and I could see the crane swiveling back and forth, but not a peep. I actually got some sleep this time!

With a sincere attempt to combine business travel with an opportunity to celebrate a 22nd wedding anniversary, this hotel delivered in terms of location and accommodations, but failed on the attention to details.

It is a 35 story Best Western. The bed was uncomfortable. Among other things, the mattress shifted around. The bath/shower had no hand bars. The window shade system is ridiculous -- either it was completely open or shut out light like a wall. The lights had no central control and each light was a game of trying to find the switch. Room service is very expensive. I can't speak to the quality because II didn't try it. The location is good -- except for the subway construction next door.

First of all, the excellent downtown location cannot be beat if you are a tourist or on business..Even though the hotel was busy on the mid-February weekend we visited, we found the service staff to be very friendly and helpful, from the front desk to the bellboy, which is no easy task! The rooms are decent sized and tastefully decorated with a contemporary feel. The beds were also comfortable. We had a fantastic view from our room, overlooking Union Square and could also see Alcatraz in the distance.While I don't have many complaints, as others have mentioned, the walls are on the thin side. We could definitely hear guests in the next room at certain hours. Also, there was major construction going on in front of hotel, Every time we came back from somewhere, our taxi driver was harassed by the police that was directing traffic, so we had scurry out of the taxi in a hurry,If you are traveling with multiple family members, club level is a cost effective option in terms of breakfast and snacks. It's also a wonderful way to let teens have their own safe space away from parents, or parents to have a working space away from children.

Despite the ongoing construction next to the hotel, my room on the 20th floor was an oasis of quiet with a view of the city and the Bay. Good lighting, comfortable chairs, plentiful hot water/towels, all contributed to an enjoyable 3 night stay at the Hyatt.

I agree with the majority of the other reviews that this hotel is an excellent choice for a central downtown location. We have stayed here multiple times, and have found the Club level to be an excellent option with a great breakfast and nice choices for afternoon hors dâ€™oeuvres, with desserts in the evening.The rooms are a fair size, with a small desk area. The beds are comfortable. There are blackout shades for the floor to ceiling windows. There is wi-fi for a fee, but it is free on Club level. The rooms are quiet - although currently rooms facing Union Square and Stockton Street have some street noise from the subway construction. Bathroom showers are good size. One concern: the toilets use a pressurized flush, and can be loud.Staff is friendly and helpful. Workout facilities are adequate and do have a view.A great choice for downtown accommodations.

In contrast to our stay at the Hyatt Regency, I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. I used a Diamond Suite Upgrade here and was incredibly impressed with the room which was very well appointed, generous in size and had two bathrooms which was a delight. Staff here were truly wonderful - with the exception of a female staffer manning the lounge who was very rude, but the rest of the staff more than made up for that. The views from this hotel are quite something - especially from the club lounge - just breathtaking! The location is awesome, a great place to base yourself for work or pleasure. There are some terrific dining options nearby and the shopping can't be beaten!

Love the hotel. Great location. Rooms were so comfortable and inviting. I was on the street where construction was taking place and it did effect my stay in any way. All the staff I encountered was kind, high attention to details. Room Service was fast and the most incredible Quesada that I have ever had. Great location and the Apple store, developing adjance to the hotel, is going to be fantastic. Ambience of the lobby is very welcoming. I don't usually like standup check-ins but this was good because I was standing too. Definitely will return.

the hotel was ok, but not excellent, too expensive, location was perfect, no breakfast included unfortunately, no additional things like water, cosmetics, newspapers, cafe, tea etc. it could be more clear

I am here right now at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco on my last night of a 4-day business trip. I absolutely loved this hotel. The front desk staff is awesome. My room is amazing! I have a corner room on the 16th floor, the rooms are so spacious with a huge bathroom. I just came from a trip in DC, at a nice hotel, but the room was half the size of this one, so this was a very welcome surprise. There is a lot of construction on this street (Stockton), not sure what's going on but it's pretty extensive. Overall this is an outstanding hotel. Everything is very "high tech" here. You can control most things from your TV. I would definitely stay here again in a heartbeat!

Nice hotel however a Little bit of construction going on in union square. Not great views but rooms are very nice and staff is efficient and lovely to deal with. The hotel is central located only about 5 minute uber to fisherman's wharf. Rooms are spacious and have a sit down vanity as well.

I am a frequent traveler to SF, and they hyatt is one of my favorite places. Not because it is the most luxurious, it isnt, but for the price it is my top choice. The hotel has recently undergone a complete renovation, so everything is brand new. The hotel rooms are not large, but well designed with style. I especially like the modern bathrooms and finishes.The location by union square is a great. It is not a long walk from the Powell Street Bart stop so easy and cheap to get to from the airports.I think the grand hyatt is my first choice and a bargain for the price

I loved my recent stay at the Grand Hyatt. All of the staff were friendly and ensured that the stay was of excellent quality. The room, bathroom and closet was the perfect size. The remote shade opener from the door and bed were nice to have when we wanted to open the shades from the door and close them while in bed or while changing. I will definitely be staying here again (I've already told friends that we're going to plan a trip).

If you want to go shopping, which we did, the venue is outstanding. Within walking distance of all the major department stores. Food at the restaurant was exceptional and the service everywhere was superior.

You want to be in the heart of the city then this hotel should be your choice. Five star standards in all respects, excellent rooms and well trained staff. Top quality meals in restaurants too. Union square has all the shops you would want.

Conveniently located close to Union Square this hotel was a perfect choice for a one night layover in San Francisco. Very modern rooms and great service make this hotel easy to get in and out. We had plenty of time to take in a cable car ride to Buena Vista cafe for our morning Irish Coffee and a leisurely walk back.

Stayed for the entire week (Feb 16 to Feb 20), and the service was great. Was able to secure a room a 645am on the Monday arrival, thanks to Steven at reception. I have stayed at the Hyatt on the last 3 of 4 trips that I have done to SF, and will stay again.

We stayed on 25th floor with fantastic views overlooking Union Square and downtown San Francisco. The hotel is quietly efficient, quiet well appointed and spacious rooms. we had a twin double. Fabulous gym, coffee cart open from 0530 hrs (great for the international traveller) and in a fabulous location. The Union square area is smart, fashionable and have something for everyone. it is also quiet on an evening so great to get away from the hustle and bustle of the Wharf. It is located on Stockton and Sutter so 2 minutes walk from the Powell-Sutter cable car stop which takes you directly down to the Wharf. The concierge is fabulous and overall I cannot fault this hotel. Will stay again.

Convenient when visiting the area for a convention. Just two of my events were held in the hotel, but it was set in a central location. Valet & front desk employees were attentive and very polite. The room itself was immaculate - well-appointed, comfortable beds, great TV, clean bathroom, quality toiletries, beautiful view. The only downside I found was the $10 per night Wi-Fi charge. A little excessive for such a huge hotel, in my opinion. Since the convention organizers paid for my trip, staying here was fine, but if we return to San Francisco, we'll probably choose a cheaper place to bunk down at night.

Hotel location is superb, staff very efficient, although check in can be crowded, rooms very comfortable, bathroom may not be at the expected level, but overall a sensational stay and relatively good value.

Where to stay in San Francisco? Well the Grand Hyatt was not bad. Our room was comfortable with a nice view. The location was great, right in the center of everything. We jumped on a cable car a block over, walked to Sears for breakfast, walked to Chinatown, etc. And the concierges very helpful.I'd stay again.

This is the second stay at the Grand Hyatt, equally satisfying as the first. The construction of the newest Apple Store next door caused minimal inconvenience. Staff made me feel as though I was the only guest. Concierge staff was excellent

I have been traveling to San Francisco and Union Square for years, and have experienced many hotels. However, the Hyatt is the only choice for me. Location, great service, and the new remodel place it far ahead of the competition.

Not a bad experience, but this Hyatt property cannot compete with other true high-end hotel properties. I thought that is what the "Grand" Hyatt brand was supposed to do? Room service was nice, though (quality of food and service) and the hotel staff was nicely attentive and helpful.

Have been staying here on and off for years. Recent renos have updated the rooms. This hotel is centrally located at Union Square. Walking distance to shopping, Chinatown, Nob Hill and North Beach. The Trocadero and Fishermans wharf 20-30 minute walk or approx $10 cab. Lots of cafes and restaurants in the neighbourhood and a Starbucks across the street.

Stayed for a few nights on business and over-all a good stay. Rooms are nice and comfortable and hotel is in a good location. The only issue was I went to go have a breakfast meeting one morning and the restaurant is quite small and I had to wait for a table. I ended up down the street so we didn't have to wait. Gym is also pretty tight - equipment and weights were OK, but very tight space.

Bedroom furnishings badly needed renewing . Television so modern everything such as room service had to be done online. This unfortunately was beyond us. Despite calling reception who passed us to someone else who could not take us through it , it took almost one hour to have a room service menu delivered. Part of the problem was language We should have asked for in room dining then restaurant staff would have understood us. We were very tired after long flight so all we wanted was something quick!!!!!

Room was very nice, clean and contemporary but then you flush toilet and its so loud i think people walking by could hear it...very strange. Otherwise like everyone else says location is perfect to shopping and restaurants and near enough to business district that you can walk to your meetings after grabbing a starbuck"s coffee across the street.

It was a perfect hotel on a perfect location. I really recommend. it. Don`t miss the terrace restaurant, great food with a great view! Lo.cated at the Union Square it`s easy to go wherever you want in San Francisco. You can see a lot by foot.

This is our second rating of this hotel, the last being in 2014. Like all hotels around Union Square rates are based on supply and demand. We do find though, that we often get a very good rate for this hotel which is in such a great location within the city. Beside in the heart of Union Square, a short walk through the tunnel (or over the tunnel) puts you right in Chinatown. Just a bit longer walk (or short cab/bus ride) you are in North Beach or the Embarcadero. Great restaurants around and night life can be found atop a few of the nearby hotels like the Starlite room, just a block away. The layout and design of the hotel is very modern and the rooms non-traditional, most all of them with some sort of a great view. Service is excellent and the bar (OneUp) is very nice, but with the usual high hotel prices. Parking is available at some nearby parking garages, one just kitty-corner from the hotel is your best option. Excellent hotel, great value!

I traditionally stay at either the Grand Hyatt or the Hyatt Embarcadero. WIth the renovation, the Grand Hyatt's rooms are very comfortable, easy to set up for work and the room service menu (although somewhat limited) is enhanced by a thoughtful staff.

Had to call twice for something (i.e. towels, car..) and late checkout (2pm) offered by the front desk seems to never properly communicate with House-keeping (HS). HS will either come by n check prior to check out time at 12 or be irritated that u r still in your room.

Hotel room on small side but probable normal for SF. Newly refurbished and decor modern and tasteful. Powershades with remote controls by door and bed but you have to find that out yourself. Bed very comfortable and room and bathroom well equipped. Wake up service is tenacious: called me 3 times then knocked on the door when I didn't answer. Computer services and TV/video good.

We go to the city for cultural events and always stay at The Hyatt. Easy drive in park your car and enjoy San Francisco. Good location. The people are friendly and helpful. The restaurant is convenient and the food well prepared.

I was pleasantly surprised by this Hyatt. It is on Union center. The staff was very helpful. The view from the room was incredible. The workout room was on 35th floor and all glass walls.
