Be sure to go to 36th floor observatory deck with 360 degree views of SF. If you have choice to face the Bay or Union Square, I enjoyed union Square side but you can't go wrong.

Perfectly located, half block from Union Square. Very friendly and helpful staff. Buffet breakfast is good. The view of the city from 36 floor is awesome. Rooms and bathroom are very spacious and clean. Only beware of sending packages by ups because they charge $5 per package.

Nicely located hotel with very central location right on Union Sq. Check in was very quick and very informal they even had hyatt no which I had forgotten to enter. Room was nice and clean, but slightly small. Bathroom was small very outdated as compare to room. Room service menu is very limited and very pricey.

We stayed here in May. The facilities were great. The location was great. We opted for the club with penthouse facilities, including food and drinks. It was a great perk. The views up there were second to none. Would go back.

True Rating: 4.3 circles for a centrally located, modern hotel with uber-friendly staff, especially "Maria T." at the front-desk (more on her later), clean, comfortable room with a stunning North-bay view. We wish there was a pool or better fitness center, but for many travelers, these may be non-issues.The Good: Easily, the staff ... "Maria T." at the front desk charmingly greeted us with a smile, engaging in genuine conversation about many things, and diligently worked to find THE room for us. She also resolved our Gold-Passport membership discrepancy (computer mismatch) quickly, provided us with the room we preferred, and assured us of our access to the Grand Club. She was terrific! To top it all, she delivered a card to our room, apologizing again for the discrepancy, following up & assuring us of the correction, and offered her card for assistance with anything beyond. Now, many of you cynics may say...it was just a standard-obligatory card for their error ... be assured, it was a very caring hand-written long note from her ... thought-out with expression of genuine hospitality that caught us for a smile. Thank you Maria !! Now, beyond her ... the rest of the staff was also very polite, friendly, and smiled during their greetings when encountering us in the elevators/halls, from doormen, to cleaning or maintenance staff, to servers, to Club hosts, even though we were meeting for the first time nor requesting any service ... this becoming less common in the hospitality industry. Moving on to the second 'good' = location: Smack in the center of downtown SF... below is Union Square, surrounded by mid-to-high-end shopping within easy walk, and easy access to the rest of SF - plenty of public transportation options to get to all sightseeing, or convention center...super-convenient and efficient for night life. Moving on to the room: stunning, picturesque, sweeping, birds-eye Northern view of the bay, laid out by your large windows - dotted with the Coit Tower, Transmerica building, Alcatraz Island, Nob Hill area, Chinatown gate below, etc.... though the room is not large, it is clean & comfortable with a King bed - very sleep-inducing worthy, incorporating full credenza that houses a desk/work area, an in-room safe, a small fridge, along with a nice large, wide lounge chair + ottoman for comfortable TV watching or reading. Strong, consistent - free WiFi included. The bathroom was clean, bright and spotless, with a glass-shower stall, large boat-like sink, (2) robes and basic toiletries. The room is modernly 'dressed' in muted tones of brown, orange & white, with push-button shades and lights at your bedside (nice!!). The Grand Club was terrific, with very friendly, attentive & gracious hosts who kept the food and drinks well stocked, and tables spotless.The Not-So-Good: Some minor minuses we noted that took our rating from perfection: We wish there was a pool. We also wished for a better chair for the desk/work area. The low-back rolling chair was not very comfortable to work with, especially for longer durations. We also wished the fitness center was larger ... basically, just adequate. Do note: on the South side - facing Union Square, the area is going through some subway construction 2 blocks away, and there is construction of a building (new Apple store?) literally, next door, but we were not effected, as we were on the other side. Not the hotel's fault, but for your awareness.Overall: Terrific stay at this hotel, and as you will note above, no real complaints. This location, for your events, whether shopping, sightseeing, convention, or just to visit friends in the area, is most convenient and efficient. We were very happy with the staff's friendliness and warmth, even though we did not request anything or required any services. A great sign that their staff were genuine (Maria-front desk) or well-trained, or both. It may be a little pricier than some, but deals are to be had ... we got a good deal. We recommend a stay here when you travel to SF.Happy Hotel-ing!

Great stay from the time I pulled up until I left. Only issue was with construction I was not sure where to pull up for valet service, no signs. I would highly recommend this hotel to any visitor to the city of San Francisco... I've stayed in many hotels in SF and this was by far the best.

The hotel staying was OK, room is clean with pretty completed facilities. However, we get shock for a hidden rule when I do my checkout. We were planing to stay 5 days but last minute decide to check out one day earlier, but the hotel insisted to charge me 5 days. I got the room from expedia and they never state in the rules say that checking out earlier will get penalty, I have been traveling and staying different hotels for 7 years in different regions, this is the first time I heard that I cannot check out earlier. This is really ridiculous especially their font office manager told us this is their (Grand Hyatt San Francisco) rule and they don't care other hotels' practice when we were trying to talk to her. I hope whoever would like to stay this hotel be warned for it if you think you may need to change your schedule because there is no place to remind you for this rule.

A quick business trip was extra special with a view of union square and a walk around the long square block. We stay at Grand Hyatt again and again. Breakfast at Sears Fine Foods rounded out our overnight stay.

Great place to stay depending on your budget. Little expensive, but you're paying for location!! Staff is fantastic!!! Rooms are nice, except the bathrooms. Since they have a sliding barn door design with no locks, it makes it hard for a little privacy. Also, no vents in the bathrooms... Other then those little quirks. Would stay again. Also, here's a tip for parking if you have a car. DO NOT valid your car! They charge over $60 for an over nite. They is a public parking lot diagonal from the hotel. It's safe and clean and much cheaper. Park it there! This is were the Hyatt parks it anyway..lol

perfect in cleaness, quietfulness, services in general, location. Very friendliy,warm attention. I didnÂ´t like to pay USD 5 for receiving each package of purchasing things. I have been in the Marriot Hotel in the same location and the packages service is for free.

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco was truly Five Star in all respects, from Check-in, to Suite, to Gold Passport Club, to Check-out, a Perfect San Francisco Experience. I would recommend this Property to anyone wanting an Excellent Property in a fantastic, convenient location.

The staff are uniquely nice and the location is very central. So when also considering the nice views, cozy bar, versatile restaurant and high standard rooms this hotel offers, you can only be a fan. Great for short stays no matter if it is business or pleasure.

The staff are friendly, the location is good, the gym is a real disappointement, its tiny and cramped and utilises the lift lobby to try and compensate. Not what you would expect from a Hyatt or for the price.

I have stayed here 3 times when visiting SFO. Love it. I cannot fault it. The rooms are amazing, clean, with lots of extras; bar, wifi, nice widescreen TV and big clean comfy beds. The rooms are spotlessly clean. The hotel has recently had the lobby renovated, it's very trendy. Amazing views from the high bay facing rooms. The staff are excellent. Good location. I cannot fault this hotel and would love to stay here every time I visit SFO, budget allowing!!

This will be my 5th time to stay at this beautiful, convenient, clean hotel with an amazing staff. Oh, yes, the views are spectacular! !! From the moment you arrive at the entrance to the departure, it is a memorable experience. Last year my 89-year old sister was with my daughter and me. Staff had to handle a wheelchair in addition to luggage of 3 prissy ladies. Not one complaint, rather laughter and graciousness. ..I am so excited to be staying again for my 74th birthday

I was here with my husband and 1 year old in June and then again by myself for work in November. The staff is fantastic! They were so friendly and accommodating! They made sure we had everything we needed for our little one including changing out pack n play sheets. We always had what we needed and if we didn't, it was brought up quickly. The concierge is great and always has good food and fun ideas.The location is great! Right in Union Square with tons of restaurants and shopping. There was construction in the neighborhood both times, but never heard any inside of the hotel and it was not in the way. Thanks so much Grand Hyatt!

We were in SF celebrating the release of my wife's book, "If Something Should Happen: a Travel Insurance Disaster". Upgraded to the Grand Club level and it was well worth it. Great room, the Grand Club is beautiful with a fantastic view out over the Bay and The City.

We arrived at the Grand Hyatt after a 4 hr flight delay, late in the evening, with a sick daughter. The front desk staff were warm and welcoming, getting my daughter a bottle of water and immediately upgrading our room to a higher floor with a city view. Rooms are well equipped and have been refurbished by the look. Other reviews mention noise, however we found the rooms to be very quiet compared to other hotels we stayed in. Rooms are very clean and look like new. Location is spot on for tourists with plenty of shopping and the trolley cars less than a block away. The mezzanine level bar and restaurant are relaxed and have good atmosphere. Food is OK but you will pay for it, especially if you order room service. All in all we had a great experience here and would definitely go back.

For pampering and feeling like you are a hundred miles away from home I suggest experiencing a weekend at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco. Service and staff are customer service orientated in all departments, they go over and above.

Great stay. Wonderful staff and steps away from the heart of San Francisco, Newly remodeled, the room was up to date and had tons of plugs. May seem trivial, but a real pus for a business hotel. Staff was top notch without any stuffy attitude. Another plus.

The only good thing I can say about this hotel is that it is well located. The cleanliness of the rooms leaves much to be desired. They don't have all day room service which is a must in any 4 star hotel and will not accomodate so much as a cup of tea should you request it outside their service hours. The Club room is not worth the extra cost as it too is not too clean and the selection of food offered is very poor. It could be a Hyatt, but definitely not a Grand Hyatt

This was our first time at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco and I planned a special trip to celebrate my mom's birthday. I travel to the Bay Area often for work and always stay at the Mark Hopkins Intercontinental but after this stay, I truly believe I am a convert now. We had a fabulous experience; from the warm, friendly & professional greeting by Maria at the front desk to the nice Doormen and Bell Desk to talking to the manager at OneUp Restaurant. We dined at OneUp for my mom's birthday and the food and service were excellent and I look forward to dining there again! All the special touches were extremely appreciated and I definitely plan on returning. Thank you for an incredible and truly memorable experience!

Although I live in San Francisco, I've stayed at the Grand Hyatt several times, the most recent being this past weekend for the two-day Edwardian Ball. My weekend at the hotel consisted of almost non-stop getting ready (hours of makeup, costumes, etc.) or taking everything off, getting cleaned up, and sleeping (from 4:30AM to 10AM). Everything had to happen like clockwork and the staff at the Grand Hyatt did their part to make that happen - from check-in to in-room meals, bell service (arrival and departure), car valet, and the maids. They made me feel like a true guest, which let me focus on the things I needed to get done and having some fun in the process. On the downside, traffic can be an issue due to subway construction in the area, but other than that, I can't imagine my stay at the Grand Hyatt being any better than it was. Highly Recommended!

We stayed here over MLK weekend for several nights and had a wonderful stay in part to Ashley in the front and Jason through the VIB program. They made sure that the room was clean and ready for our daughter. From the start, we were waiting to check in and a front desk attendant immediately brought her a coloring book and some crayons. We were put in a room with the view of Union Square and a huge star which our daughter loved to stare at. We did have an issue with the creakiness of our bed and they ended up bringing in a brand new mattress and box springs. The housekeeper at the time helped to facilitate this whole process and make sure the bed was cleaned out underneath as well. It is when you have staff noticing these details that you know they want their guests to be comfortable and happy. We loved the location which is a close walk to many attractions. We especially liked the close proximity to Boba Guys and After Osha. There is slight congestion in the front since there is not drive so can be a bit difficult to get off a taxi/uber during busy times. Overall the hotel is beautiful and the staff is friendly and helpful. My daughter loved going to the lounge and saying hello to the staff who remembered her each day.

We stayed here for three nights in January. The staff configured the room differently to what was agreed, they couldn't find a parcel delivered to the hotel for us and when they finally did find it they charged us a handling fee. The lounge was just the bare essentials and the check in and check out took way too long.

My husband and I stayed for 4 nights at the Grand Hyatt for a conference. The location, right on Union Square, was great and the lobby, bar,lounge area are very nice. We had a room on the 12th floor and it was large with a nice view. The king bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom and bath products were very nice. The major rub was the construction noise all day long right outside our window. The construction had jack hammers, air horns, etc... and it was started around 7am every day including sunday. The hotel does supply ear plugs so clearly they are aware of this situation.The work out room on the 35th floor was great and both my husband and I enjoyed the amenities and equipment there. We had drinks at the bar and while the drinks were delicious, the bartender could not have been more unfriendly. I would recommend this hotel to friends and we may stay here when we come again next year. I just hope the construction is gone.

We stayed here overnight last weekend and we were woken up early in the morning due to the construction going on next door. Please note that this was a Saturday morning, when I would expect everyone to be off work but it just wasn't the case. Overally, I love staying at Hyatts and the interior is very nice and contemporary but the current construction conditions make this place not recommendable.

Rooms have been refurbished and offer enough space. They were clean. Soundproofing is terrible as Hyatt kept the old, single glazed windows. You will thus be exposed to street noise even on the highest floors.Gym is average and floor was dirty - a real shame given its location on a top floor.Breakfast and housekeeping staff lack even rudimentary manners of politeness and courtesy. Greetings are reduced to "how many are you?" instead of "Good morning.." at breakfast whilst the breakfast service is terrible and the restaurant far too small for the hotel. Staff training needs improvement except for the concierge and receptionists.

A building construction project located directly next door goes on through about 3:00 to 4:00-am. Sleeping is impossible and all rooms located in close proximity should not be rented or rented only after a warning and at a heavy rental discount.

Hotel room was good, towels, bedding, toiletries were good. Not a very inviting lobby. They should move the restaurant to the top floor, gym is ok, not exceptional. Compared to other hotels in SF, it is a good value.

This is by far the best hotel in San Francisco. The rooms are bright, comfortable, and modern. Stayed in room 2802 which overlooked Union Square and the Drake. Floor to ceiling windows for exceptional light. Door windows crack open a few inches to allow air flow. There is a tendency to feel movement in the building but it is a high building building which catches the wind. Beds are awsome.

We have stayed in a few different rooms at this hotel. Each has had its personality and quirks. One had a problem with the tub. When you stood in it, the bottom felt like it had a hole underneath it and made a loud pop when you would move your foot. Very annoying when you are trying to take a shower. In another room the tv remote did not work. In still another room there was a layer of thick dust on the carpet around the bed. The walls are paper thin and your can hear everything going on in rooms and in hallways, coughing, sneezing, clearing of the throat etc. Now for the good.Great location and views. You are near shopping and restaurants and convenience stores. The views of the bay and city are great and their floor to ceiling windows add to the view to be enjoyed. The staff is very friendly and helpful although I think they are skilled in making you feel like you are getting something extra when you really are getting what you paid for. Overall I would stay here again but don't expect too much pampering and wow factor here.

I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt a few times and always find the staff very helpful and courteous.The location is excellent with a short walk to Union square and the rooms are spotlessly clean, modern and very comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel.

My wife and I spent a single night at this hotel to avoid two round trips from the San Jose area to attend San Francisco-based events.Room with view of Union Square was quite nice and clean and unlike many other hotels switching to LED lighting, well-lit. The location is fantastic, right off of Union Square and walking distance to most shopping, theatres, the Moscone Center, etc.Excellent night's sleep although potential guest should be aware of major construction adjacent to this hotel (both new building and new transit lines). The loud noise starts at 7:00am and goes through about 5:00pm. This is not the hotel's fault (you can't soundproof against this magnitude of noise), but nonetheless, this is the wrong place to stay if you need to sleep late.As part of the San Francisco political correctness thing, guests are notified that unless you otherwise call housekeeping and request otherwise, towels are changed only every other day. OK, no problem with that EXCEPT that the bathroom (at least the bathroom for our room) had absolutely no towel rack. There was no place to hang a towel to dry and save for reuse! Duh!?!?The hotel provides internet access. However, our experience was that it was exceptionally unreliable. When it was up, speed was good. But gradually access slowed to the point where it was totally unusable (disconnects from e-mail servers), unable to reach any websites, etc. Then it suddenly comes alive again and the process of gradual degradation begins anew. This is totally unacceptable for business travelers who much count on continual high speed internet access. And it certainly is not the standard one would expect for rooms going for well over $400 per night! Whether it is a router problem or simply not enough bandwidth, this problem needs to be fixed.Note that this hotel has no driveway. The front door is right on Stockton Street with limited curb space to stop and either discharge or pickup guests and their luggage. There are several local parking garages, but given the traffic issues, I would recommend their valet parking, albeit at over $60/day.

my guest was bitten through out her whole body.. ecolab was sent out, they did nothing besides that. the manager was extremely rude.. we had to stay out of our room for hours for testing, they didn't even offer to move us to another room, absolutely terrible

I stayed at the Hyatt and had a very pleasant stay. The bellmen and front desk people were very helpful and nice. The room was very comfortable. The hotel is in a great location. The lady at the concierge was very helpful in picking a restaurant to eat at for dinner. I would stay here again!

Stayed in room 1018 in mid Jan 2016. The hotel and location are very nice, clean, and convenient. Unfortunately several factors contributed to a below average experience. If you are a light sleeper, be aware. The actual construction is not the hotel's fault, but I feel that some warning, during booking, should have been given. There is a large construction project underway, right across the street. The project is so noisy, that our room came with complimentary ear plugs! Trucks were backing in and out during the night, so the reverse gear beeping was pretty constant. Then at around 8am, the pile driving started. We were barely able to sleep, and were being awakened constantly, by the construction noise. Booked a king, but was given a room with 2 double beds. Not queens, doubles. I protested, but was informed that those were the only rooms available. Good luck having a comfortable/romantic weekend with someone, while sleeping in separate beds. I suggest calling ahead, and verifying that you will receive the actual room you booked. Other than calling ahead, I not sure what other options you have, if they don't have your booked room available. Room was average. Wi-Fi included. Very low pressure shower, with a tub.Single sink, with minimal counter space. Hotel bar was nice. Upper scale, but table seating was uncomfortable. Sitting at the bar would be your best bet.

I was in the city the weekend of 1/15/2016 - 1/17/2016 For a holiday party for my work. My Company "blocked" out room reservations at The Grand Hyatt and I will never stay at another hotel in SF. Amazing experiance

Stayed here for a week after Christmas through New Year's Day. Checked in and was given the 36th floor. Our room overlooked union square and was fantastic to see the lights, tree, and ice skating rink. Since we are a Diamond member, I was able to obtain a DSU only a few weeks before our stay. We could of asked for a better room and suite. The stay was friendly and accommodating. The hotel was very busy for r weekend. I think the only problem is it too just about 5 hour to get a rollaway bed. Executive floor had a lounge however it was always super crowded. Can't imagine there is that many diamond members or the hotel just gave it away to everyone. I would make it more exclusive for elites. The staff worked hard to keep food and drinks replenished and to keep the tables clear. Elite breakfast was in the same lounge. I'd recommend breakfast be an option in the restaurant on oversold and crowded days. Again hotel front desk, operators, valet, bellman, everyone was super friendly. Will stay at is hotel again for either business or so the family again soon.

Currently construction out front making it nearly impossible to unload as you arrive. Rooms are renovated but you can hear every single word of the person in the room next to you talking at a normal volume. Great views, good club food and honor bar, but far too loud to sleep.

The location of this hotel is hard to beat; it's right on Union Square. Also, as the building is taller than any adjacent building, rooms in upper floors have pretty awesome views to the city (and beyond).The rooms are just what one would expect from a Grand Hyatt; modern, clean, well equipped and spacious.

Exactly what I hoped for. A modern, clean place right in the centre. Lots of shopping and restaurants within walking distance. Great staff, quick check in. Very nice room with comfy beds, electric shades, safe, fridge, nice flat screen TV. Room service was good too although a bit expensive (all the extra charges really add up). Only disappointment was the breakfast: tried the bagel with cream cheese (a la carte): the bagel was dry and hard and the cream cheese terrible.

A return trip to San Francisco after many years and I decided to stay at what had been my favorite hotel over a long period of frequent visits to this magnificent city. A bit of disappointment greeted me as the top floor restaurant and the mezzanine breakfast terrace are no longer there, hence my 4 rating. Yet the impeccable and exceptional service by the personnel, the magnificent views from my room and the location still makes this hotel the one to stay when visiting San Francisco.

Right on Union Square, walking distance to Chinatown, Market St, shops, restaurants, and many other attractions. An updated hotel, very nice lobby. Helpful and friendly front desk staff. Self park is just across the intersection. Rooms are contemporary, electric shade over the window. Comfortable bed, quiet room. Modern and updated bathroom.

This was my first stay at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco - having traveled there in the past - I was always looking for a hotel I would look forward to staying with again. I now found my preferred location. The Grand Hyatt is centrally located and a serves as great hub to see all of San Fran. The staff was helpful in recommending both local spots as well as a ton of terrific destinations just outside of the city.

Affordable and very nice. Had a little construction going on, kept me up in the afternoon when I went to take a nap. Staff more than took care of it for me!  All staff very good! Rooms nice and clean. Everyone went the extra mile. Excellent location. Clean and moderately upscale. Very good value.Ill be back!

You have to get to the top floor. I think it is 36. A beautiful view of the harbor and Alcatraz. The hotel is a block from Union square which now has an out door ice rink. Very nice hotel with very friendly staff.

Have been a frequent guest at this property. Of the three Hyatt's in SFO this is by far the best and most central location. It is perfectly located for easy access to all major SFO attractions and an easy cab ride or Uber to those a little further away.

Located in the heart of Union Square, the Grand Hyatt offers everything that the other luxury hotels offer but for over $100 less. Mid-week prices are higher for business travelers as they are everywhere in the city, but weekends are especially attractively priced. You are right next to the cable car turnaround and the best shopping of the Union Square experience. It's central to Market Street and the local theaters and museums. For my money I think it is the best locale in the city. Ask for a high floor with a bay view and you will have great city views out your floor-to-ceiling windows, and be away from street noise. Parking is high-priced but there's a lot just around the corner off Stockton for half the price. I live in the Bay Area so we frequently travel to the city. For the city views, service, and the location, I don't think the Gr. Hyatt can be beat. Plus, the hotel offers promotions often, so be sure to book directly with the hotel itself rather than the booking websites because it won't be cheaper and it's a whole lot easier to solve any issues when you book direct with the hotel.

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco was wonderful in every way. From the doorman who helped with our luggage and parking to the reception at check in who gave us s beautiful room facing the ice skating rink in Union Square. The location couldn't be better for shopping, food and sightseeing. We walked and took the Cable Cars all over the city. Our family was so sad to leave.

This hotel feels more like a Marriott than a Grand Hyatt. It is a good hotel to stay in, has all you need but just didn't feel "grand". Location is convenient too. It's a good business hotel and for short leisure stays is good. It's an efficient hotel and breakfast was good.

I like the location (close to main streets/shopping/offices), food (restaurant is great), pleasant amenities (extras/things I forget are available), style/decor (modern but classy), staff (from front desk to room service).

Great customer service! Room was very clean with great view of the city. I will definitely look into staying at this Hyatt the next time I'm in San Francisco, and I would definitely recommend it to family and friends.

I like the hotel a lot. I travel around the world. It is usually not easy to find a good quality hotel in the states. Even luxury brands are mediocre. I believe the hotel is refurbished in recent years and the room standard is comparable to Asian hotels. Service is top-notch. There are always doorman to open the door for the guests. The hotel is right next to the Union Square, means it is a great location for shopping. The views from higher floor rooms are just fantastic.One thing could be improved is the breakfast offerings in the grand club. I stayed for four days and every morning the offerings are the same.

The location is the best in Union Square. Every major shopping mall is across the street with Barneys, Neimans, Saks, basically shopping heaven. The views are amazing from the room. The gym is kinda small but its ok. The hotel is super clean and modern. Its way better than the Westin Hotel across the street. The prices are quite decent here. There is a restaurant here and the food is pretty good. The staff is really nice. There is a construction in front of the hotel with the biggest Apple Store coming in and also the subway construction will be done in 2017 or something so Union Square is kinda loud. But other than that, the hotel is great!

My overall experience of staying at Grand Hyatt at San Francisco is very satisfied. The staff members are very friendly and take care all you concerns. The hotel is located in the central of the city. Highly recommended.

Friendly staff, complimentary wi-fi, and overall good experience. It really needs a complimentary breakfast (as do nearly all other high end hotels in the US). At the minimum, please have a table with bananas, oranges, apples, etc. so that people can just take and go.

Beautiful hotel, excellent customer service from check-in to check-out, excellent breakfast. It is pricey but typical rates for downtown San Fran. Hotel gives you ear plugs in your room in the event you need them but I found my room to be very quiet. Room temperature was set to 70 degrees, which it maintained a comfortable temperature without constant adjustment and air constantly blowing on your face. Views from room were great too. Electric blinds controllable from bedside was a nice added feature. Great stay!

The staff at this hotel is very friendly and it seemed like it was renovated recently. The guest bathrooms are nice and modern with fancy fixtures and the bed was comfortable, but the rest of the furniture in the guest rooms is cheap and has not worn well at all. The guest rooms seemed to be cleaned ok but the public spaces--especially the guest room floors need a lot more attention from the cleaning crew. I was there 4 days and three nights (and in the hotel most of the time) and I never once saw anyone vacuuming or mopping the floors in the common areas.

The hotel is in an excellent location, overall it is an attractive hotel and has a pleasant atmosphere, we enjoyed having drinks at the lounge. The hotel staff was kind and professional. The only negative review was about the rooms, they were small and beds were uncomfortable.

We stayed here for one night because our hotel was overbooked so we decided we'd stay here because of the great location.The airline had sent our bags in a different flight so we had to wait till the next day to get them because they said they'd ship them to the hotel (meaning the one we were supposed to stay in). When we told this to a man working at this hotel he told us not to worry and when we got to our room, there was a know on the door and they brought us toothbrushes, deodorants, creams, toothpaste, band aids, shaving creams, gillette's, and more things (all for free) and we thought that was an incredibly nice gesture and it saved our night!The hotel is really nice, the staff is helpful (I can't remember that one guy's name but he was incredibly nice), the rooms are spacious and good for allergic people (like me) because of an air cleanser they have which I found to be really cool and thoughtful.After we'd checked out we decided to go shopping for about 4 hours and asked if we could leave our belongings in the reception area for them to hold them for us and they did which made life easier for us, so I would recommend this hotel (even if it is a bit expensive). We had an amazing stay, even if it was just for a night.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt while attending a conference in January, 2015. I was very impressed with the staff when I checked in and out. My room was immaculate and I loved the look and feel. The bed and pillows were most comfortable. My only regret is that I didn't get a room on a higher floor so I could have enjoyed a great view, too.

This was a really nice hotel - clean, quiet. They gave away warm cookies and hot chocolate in the lobby on New Years Day - it was a nice touch. Everyone was very friendly. The room had updated bathrooms and nice storage. The shades were automatic from a touch of a button which was nice too

We attended the Top Shelf New Year's Party at the Grand Ballroom of the Grand Hyatt. We wanted to stay at the same venue, especially since it was New Year's. The staff was very welcoming and friendly.

Hotel check in started off bad as I was initially under impression I had used a DSU and was booked into a suite. I was excited to use this as I was traveling with my wife. At check in they let me know that it was not available but I could get access to the grand club ( A general perk of being diamond )Hotel room was stuffy and not cleaned thoroughly. The next day we were asked to change rooms because of a plumbing issue. My wife wasnt thrilled but thankfully the hotel comped us the 2nd night. Next the heater didnt work in the new room and had to call down to get fixed. My wife let them know that we prefer for them to come when we leave ( which we told her was in 30 minutes. Within a couple of minutes the engineer comes knocking on our door...Lastly, at checkout they had the wrong total on my bill but thankfully it was a quick fix. Having previously stayed at the Grand Hyatt DFW and the Fairmont Kea Lani, this hotel has a large amount of work to do.

My family and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt hotel in SF for the first time and had an absolutely Grand New Year's Eve celebration that lasted through the following weekend. The hotel was centrally located to almost everything we had hoped to visit in San Francisco. It was only a block away from the famous Union Square, where there was an outdoor ice skating; the marvelously Grand, Huge, Christmas tree; all the fine shopping and dining you can ask for. There was literally something for everyone in my family to do! The service at the hotel was exceptional, from the doormen who never ceased to greet us with a genuine smile , while cheerfully opening the front entrance doors for everyone, to the very helpful concierge, housekeeping, and front desk teams. Our room was very clean and had a beautiful view of the Transamerica pyramid and a partial view of the Northeast section of the bay. The beds were comfortable which made for a very restful night. Staying at the Grand Hyatt was an absolute Grand experience.

Very helpful staff, we stayed from Christmas Day until New Year's Day. Despite being understaffed, all of the employees were helpful and pleasant. Rooms are really nice and location is fantastic. We booked somewhat late but enjoyed a very good rate.

I cannot thank the front desk staff enough. There are excellent. There was a bit of a problem with the room booking and the staff worked very hard to resolve the problem and ensure that our stay was wonderful. All the staff were very nice, but the front desk staff were miracle workers.

We rented 2 rooms for a 5 day vacation at the Hyatt in the week between Christmas and New Years and were overall quite pleased. I've been staying at this Hyatt for over 10 years for business and knew a bit of what to expect. The first (and, to an extent, persistent) impression is one of crowded chaos. There is almost no space on Stockton for taxis or private vehicles to unload and the adjacent construction aggravates that. I suspect that after the holidays things become a bit more orderly. The lobby is quite small relative to the number of rooms and the front desk was wisely replaced with several staffed & automated kiosks to help mitigate the very long lines that can extend into the elevator landing. All that said, everything from valet parking, bag check and check-in moves surprisingly quickly. Don't be alarmed if you walk in to a huge line - it moves quickly. Our rooms on the 32nd (club King) and 26th (double) floors were clean, reasonably large and outfitted with very nice, modern furnishings. This includes some fun modern tech touches like a smart-TV with keyboard, wall-buttons to lower the blinds and Bluetooth enabled door locks. The bed was wonderfully soft with crisp linens. The bathroom was a little small but the all-glass shower and full length mirror made it feel a bit larger. Also, kudos to the management for installing free, albeit small, refrigerators for guest use rather than the rip-off minibars that some properties insist on imposing on guests. The only issue I would have with the rooms is the lack of drawer storage space. My only complaint about the Hyatt is the massively-oversold Club lounge on the 32nd floor. I was under the impression that there were a small handful of floors with upgraded rooms that included Club access for light snacks and drinks. In fact, every time we visited it was shoulder-to-shoulder with no place to sit and families with lots of kids eating full meals at the tables. During our stay we regularly rode the elevator down with other guests carrying toâ€“go containers overflowing with the club snacks. The management really needs to rethink the mission of this space as it doesn't make anyone happy as it is. Business travelers are hugely frustrated by the constant daycare atmosphere and family's are attempting to feed their children bar snacks instead of a pricey San Francisco restaurant meal. The highlight of the Hyatt is doubtlessly the staff. Every person we had contact with was 1) friendly, 2) helpful, and, 3) made certain our needs were met. I'd particularly note that the Club lounge staff worked extremely hard to clear plates, replenish serving containers and act as concierges while being uniformly friendly and upbeat (even when, quite literally, working up a sweat).

This hotel just has. The best location when visiting SF. But the hotel is very busy and the staff isn't as responsive as you would have expected. We had booked a room for three people, but there was only sleeping places for two - at e reception they didn't say that even it was quite evident at check-in. Over the next 5 hours we contacted guest services 4-5 times (incl mgt) to get an extra bed, with limited effect. Very disappointing way to start a vacation. In addition, the rooms are quite poorly insulated, so expect some noise from street/hallway

We chose the Grand Hyatt because of its location. Our view was sensational - overlooking union square with the ice rink and Macy's in the background. It was a great place to stay right before Christmas. Rooms were "luxurious", clean and comfortable. Beds were great and the club room was very nice. I highly recommend. View from the top floor was sensational.

Close to all of the shopping and a couple of blocks from trolley lines, it is our first choice here. Staff at curb and bellmen were all excellent under stressful conditions as many cars arrived close in time. In-room service was prompt and food was hot and of excellent quality. Our room on the 25th floor had a perfect view of Union Square!

The construction started pretty early and it woke me up around 5:30am both mornings. Stayed on the Union Sq view side. I wish there was a note on the construction so I would choose city view instead for the same price.

the room was clean and comfortable and the price (approx. $200 per night) was good for the hotel's excellent location...every year we stay at this hotel (or the nearby marriot) to do our christmas shopping and enjoy our favorite restaurants in SFthe staff is friendly and helpful,,,in-room wifi was acceptable and freethe parking is way too expensive...catch a taxi somewhere else to avoid the costs of getting out of the Union Square mess...3 blocks will cost you $10+

very nice. great location.staff very accommodating. Right by great but expensive shopping. Far enough away but no too far from the crazy crowded pier area. Free breakfast was very nice but room too small-not enough tables for all. Would s\tay here again

We came during holiday (Dec 28), and the hotel was very busy. We did not get help with our luggage as what we expected for the usual 5-star hotel. We were waiting for the valet guys who were overwhelemed helping other people. I have parked my car and what they need to do was just giving me the valet ticket. But it did not happen. It might not be their fault but I expect them to be trained and prepared for holiday season. The valet guy finally apologized for the delay.The waiting did not stop there. I was waiting for my rolling bed for more than 3 hours. The receptionist changed my reservation from double bed room to king size and promised to provide a rolling bed. He politely argued that the double bed rooms available are on the very low levels. So it looks like he gave me better room in higher floors. It is true. The room is on the 14th and we can see union square from our window. Very nice. But the rolling bed did not come until 10:43pm when I have almost fallen asleep. The guy who sent the bed apologized for the delay.Maybe the fault is mine. I expected a 5-star hotel quality without knowing the truth that Grand Hyatt is not one. Maybe my expectation was too much because of the word "Grand."

This was our first hotel in a 9 day trip down the PCH with our 2 college sons. It was by far our favorite hotel of our trip! This was our families first trip to San Francisco and the central location was perfect and the holiday spirit was magical. The rooms were superb and quiet and the bay view was spectacular. Make sure to go to top floor sky deck for awesome views.

Very nice staff, location and amenities! Awesome view! Smoothest elevator! Loved taking pictures from top-floor with large windows! Upgrading to Club membership for just $50 paid off for my family of 4!

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco is centrally located right by Union Square in SF downtown, so that is a plus for tourists. The downside of that of course is the horrible traffic if you have a car or want to catch a cab to get out of that area. The grand club lounge had decent food and decent service for a U.S. hotel...of course they don't compare to the service at hotels in Asia which we're used to... Being a traveling family, I wish they had an indoor pool but it seems all or most of the SF downtown hotels don't have one.

Nice location aside Union Square. Hyatt QualityYou can go walking to all big stores and malls, plenty of restuarants, but also to chinatown, littlel italy, AT&T Park, etc., or just take ubers to any touristic areas for some few bucksWe used a lot of zipcars since many walking distance parking lots on area, to go to close sites like sausalito, monterey or napa valleyGood choice to stay

Great hotel right in the center of San Francisco on Union Square. Make it easy to reach restaurants, all kind of entertainment. The Regency Club is not the best, so plan that part. The views around San Francisco is great almost no matter what room you get.

The Grand Hyatt is located right next to Union Square (2 minute walk). So yes, you cannot ask for a better spot in downtown SF. We traveled with our toddler and stayed there on Christmas eve and Christmas day. He was offered a choice of little gifts on a small wheelbarrow when we checked in and I found that to be especially thoughtful. Nothing like a well behaved toddler during check-in. We were upgraded on arrival with a 2pm late checkout option (perks of being a platinum member...so yes, do get on their GoldPassport program) and the view from the room was awesome (facing the ocean side of downtown). The rooms and bathrooms are pretty good in size, considering that you are in downtown SF. The king size bed was super comfy. I happened to have one of the best Moscow Mules ever at the "One Up" lounge on the mezzanine level, which by the way is a cozy little place to sit back and relax. They also serve some tasty bites. Overnight parking charges are a bit steep, but thats expected anywhere in SF. In summary, I would recommend the property for both business and family travel.

Very good hotel in a convenient location near Union Square. Location is very good access to many stores for shopping and places to eat or drink at night. Rooms are all new and modern with comfortable beds and very clean. I would definitely recommend staying here if visiting San Francisco.

okay, first thing about this place that may sound negative, but you'll understand so Im getting out of the way right now. This is not a 'quiet' hotel, not only in the heart of union square, and all the car traffic you hear from below, but also the noise of elevators, plumbing (especially toilet flushes), this place is impossible to sleep in without earplugs....which the hotel provides! But understand that before you book here if getting a great night sleep is on your priority list, cause other than that this hotel is great! I highly recommend splurging and getting the club level rooms, the view is amazing (we got to look west and over union square, and for Christmas is was amazing!). Plus the added benefit of getting into the club room on floor 32 was an added (and unexpected) treat, we had breakfast, snacks, and evening cocktail, getting to look north over downtown and the bay, it was worth the price of admission just for that!!! We live in the bay area (just stayed night to go see nutcracker) and we were amazed at the beauty of it all, and the comfort of just sitting there with a nice glass of wine.As for the rooms, they are a bit on the small side, but the beds were super comfy, the bathroom very clean and spacious enough for a family of 3. One downside is their 'queen' bed is actually a full size bed, we laughed a little, but it was fine. We did have lunch at the Oneup restaurant, and the food was delicious, but don't expect 'large' portions, they are smaller portions (I think they call them bar bites) but was perfect enough for us, not to be over stuffed, and ready to go to the ballet!Ive stayed at a dozen or so hotels, from the biggies to boutique hotels, and I think this was my favorite (other than the noise, but the earplugs did help). I thought the location perfect, the staff from valets, to checkin/out were very professional, and the folks in the club room were very courteous!if want to spend a couple of days in the city, this is the place to stay!

I always look to stay at the Grand Hyatt whether I'm visiting for business or pleasure as the location and convenience of parking and shopping are unsurpassable. If the price is right, this is always my first choice.

I've stayed here so many times it's my home away from home. I participate in trade shows at the Moscone Center and the Grand Hyatt is just a few blocks away. It's in a great location next to Union Sq. Great restaurants and shopping are right there. This hotel has all of the amenities you'd expect from a great hotel!

Very nice bay view room, very clean and modern, very helpful staff, great location for holiday shopping, close to some very good restaurants, all at a very fair price considering it is in San Francisco at Union Square.

My friend and I had a most enjoyable stay at the Grand Hyatt. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever experienced in a hotel. The view was spectacular. The staff was very efficient and kind. I will stay at a Hyatt again.

Even with the pretty heavy construction around the hotel you can score a pretty quiet room (if you ask for it). I was lucky again and got it. There is a few things that could be a bit better but in all I highly recommend it. You CANNOT chose better location in the downtown SF.

We arrived at 3:30 and our room wasn't ready yet. No others were available, so we were upgraded from Club to an executive suite. The view was pretty good and I loved the separate rooms so that my husband and I had one room and the kids had another (we got a roll away). Also nice was that there were two bathrooms- one with a tub and one with a shower. Also, we went out and when we came back in the evening, we had been brought free wine and cheese plate. What a nice touch! We loved it!!The club room on the 32nd floor was awesome (and worth the extra $) because we could have food/drinks whenever we wanted. With two kids who love to snack throughout the day, this came in handy. There was a lot to eat during the continental breakfast, as well as cookies and other snacks. Dinner time had appetizers.All in all, check in and check out was quick and the property was quiet and clean (and just a block from Union Square!)TIP: Don't pay the high valet rate- right around the corner is a public parking. We stayed sat-sunday 3:30pm-11am for $18!! Cheaper than anywhere else in the area!

I was recently in San Francisco for business and my group arranged for me to stay at the Grand Hyatt! Lucky me! This place has wonderful service (from check in, to restaurants, to room service, to check out, to housekeeping, to door men. I could not have felt more attended to and special. The room was perfect (and I got a fantastic view of northern San Francisco and the bay). Very comfortable. Very sleek and clean. Very very nice. And, oh yes, the location is right at Union Square. Perfect.

The Grand Hyatt is right on Union Square, centrally located for most San Francisco activities. The staff was absolutely excellent and the hotel was modern, comfortable and the restaurants were great! We visit San Francisco once or twice a year and this rates as one of the best hotels we've tried. Definitely worth repeating.

I stayed here for one night for business. The room is beautiful, and the bathroom fixtures are really nice. I really appreciated the shades, which kept the room really dark. You can't beat the location, which is adjacent to Union Square. Please note that there is a major construction project happening right next to the hotel. I requested a quiet room and couldn't hear a thing.

It is right across Union Square and very near shopping stores and convention center. However, there is still on going road construction when I was there. I find the lobby not so well lighted and the elevator seems old. You need to call housekeeping if you need amenities like slippers, shavers etc as they are not readily available in the room but they are free of charge. The breakfast area is great but there is not much variety in terms of the food (if you stay there for more than three days). The concierge was very helpful but their station is located at the other end of the lobby.

We were lucky enough for the hotel to provide us with access to the Grand Club. The view is wonderful of some of the city's sights and the service is outstanding. The staff works tirelessly to ensure your table is clean and helpful with providing fresh eatery items. Also, they are very courteous and some of them would provide suggestions about sightseeing destinations.The front desk was very helpful with our reservations and the service overall was excellent.

Wonderful City and Outstanding Hotel-- Grand Hyatt--highly recommend and we will return!! The location, accommodations and staff are excellent. We had a group of 12 couples staying and all complimented the hotel and staff.

An outstanding hotel with a very attentive and can do attitude staff. Everyone from the bell staff, reservations, sales and maid were extremely friendly, helpful and made you feel important and comfortable. Rooms were very clean and high quality food. Great hospitality room with a beautiful view of San Francisco.

This hotel is in a great location with plenty of things to do and see within a couple blocks of the hotel. The lobby is nice and spacious. The gym has a great view but is a little cramped. The rooms are fairly nice. The furniture and bathroom are a little dated but the real issue is that the door is not soundproofed. You can hear everything that is going on in the hallway. Anytime someone opens a door, talks in a moderate voice it sounds like it is happening right next to you.

I was treated like a queen from the moment I walked in the Grand Hyatt. The room was perfectly appointed, service was great, I will be back again. I decided to upgrade myself to the top floor and it was worth it. The grand level with the delicious food and drinks were well worth it.

This hotel is in a very good location, located right near shopping, restaurants and the trolleys just a few blocks away! The service in all areas of the hotel were great! The concierge and front desk were extremely helpful and friendly, as were the bar servers. The only drawbacks of this hotel are three things: they are building the new subway/transit system literally right next to the hotel, so the noise level is very loud, especially in the early mornings! (Alas, the Hyatt does provide you with earplugs). And since they are building the new transit, the sidewalks and streets are all blocked and boarded up, not that big of a deal, but when your lugging luggage around, it can get annoying. Lastly, the elevators in the hotel are sooooooo slow, and annoyingly confusing. At one point we were boarding the staff elevator, which is unmarked and right next to the guest elevator, and on the bar level, you push the call button, which the elevator could open up on the other side, which you can't even see! (Suggestion, don't board the elevator from the restaurant/bar level)! Also, personally, I feel if you are younger, this may not be the hotel for you, as I was wanting a more youthful presence, this hotel seemed to cater to an older and/or more reserved clientele. The bar was very subdued and quiet, and was not even open for an early Sunday morning mimosa, which they also didn't serve in the restaurant (weird, right?!) however, one of the servers did make me one, which is why I said the service was great! I wouldn't stay here again, but the hotel is not bad by any means, it just was not the right hotel for me.

Stayed here from end Nov for 6 nights as a family (2 adults 2 tweens/teens). We got a club room on the 30th floor, with access to breakfast and snacks at the Club lounge. Overall it was great value and great location, but with a few areas that were below my expectations of a Grand Hyatt experience.The good:- great location, right next to Union Square- service staff were excellent, from valet to front desk to housekeeping- nice breakfast at Club lounge with great view of the Bay- free Wifi in the room- humidifier was provided in the room. Nice touch as the air was very dry.- nice gym with many treadmills.The not so good:- room seemed dated, no shower stall and only a bath tub with shower head.- we had 2 double beds, the mattresses was soft and sort of sank in the middle so with 2 pax per bed we felt like we were sinking in sideways. But maybe if it's just one person on a bed it would not have been so obvious? The mattress was definitely the least comfortable of all the beds we slept in on this trip.- room was at the end of a corridor next to the staff room and a lot smaller than expected. I called and was told that all double rooms were the same size so I did not pursue it further. - our view was the top of other buildings, rather blah. Overall we had a good stay, despite the cramped conditions (which I suppose I cannot complain about as we had 4 pax in a room, but the room was certainly much smaller than other double rooms we stayed in). It was good value for money and great location, all things considered. Service staff were very good all around. I don't know if we had simply gotten a small room that had yet to be refurbished and had a lousy view, but I would certainly consider staying here again if we could get a bigger room or a more updated one next time round.

Right bang in the center of the city and must be the very top hotel there. Nothing to fault - staff service, restaurants and good rooms. Cannot hear any noise so we are happy here. Good views all over the city from all high up rooms.

Great place to stay and get into the holiday spirit. Stayed here with wife and two best friends. Very cheerful atmosphere. Pleasant staff, friendly guests. Clean upscale room with great City views.. Great location at Union square.

I went for a conference. My room faced the city and was incredibly loud -- could hear the buses and trolleys squeaking down below all night long.Food provided at conference was fine. Actual room was quite comfortable with good amenities (including a white noise machine -- so they must know about the problem.) If I went back, I'd spend more for room on other side of the building.

Great entry lobby and attention to customers as they enter. The room was very clean and new. View out the windows was noting special. The location was good centralized, could use more information to first timers in the city.

Very happy with the new and improved Grand Hyatt Union Square. Lovely rooms with floor to ceiling windows looking out over the city to the Bay. Great service and perfect downtown location. Will go back next time we are in San Francisco.

I checked in for the second night for a 2-day convention at Moscone. Everything is as expected for a Grand Hyatt at the heart of San Francisco. Welcoming staff, modern interior, exterior was a bit outdated though. My room was on the 18th floor and I had a great view. There are also plenty of restaurants nearby. Moscone Center is a 10-minute walk away. I do have one gripe that took off one star. The room door was not soundproofed properly. I could hear people outside talking as if they are standing right outside of my door. When I heard them opening and closing their doors, it sounded like they were opening and closing my door. A little weird especially considering the bath tub is right there by the door. Not a huge problem, though, I only heard them 2 or 3 times. Just wish it would be a bit quieter.

We stay at the Grand Hyatt every year at Christmas time. And always stay in a Union Square view room. This year it was on the 24th floor with a beautiful city view and the ice skaters in Union Square. Really puts you in the Christmas spirit. Room is nicely decorated with floor to ceiling windows. We always upgrade to the club lounge on the 32nd floor. Appetizers and alcoholic beverages (for a minimal charge) at 5:00. And a very nice breakfast with hot and cold selections

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco for business. The hotel is busy yet friendly. The staff is excellent and friendly. The bell hops are courteous, friendly, yet never made me feel like I had to give them a tip. The view of the sunrise from the gym on the 35th floor is spectacular. Location is excellent within walking distance to the BART, shopping, and Union Square. I felt safe walking around by myself.

We had a wonderful stay at the Grand Hyatt Hotel. The hotel is perfected located for shopping and dining and entertainment. Staff is pleasant and extremely helpful when recommending dining and offering directions. The streets and buildings all around the hotel are undergoing massive renovation so vehicle and pedestrian traffic is not so easy to navigate. However, these are al good signs the economy is rebounding. Would recommend this hotel for sure!!

Stayed at the San Francisco Grand Hyatt for 7 nights on business and co hosted an event in the meeting spaces. I got to interact with almost all of the departments. The most noticeable thread throughout the property was the staff. From the housekeeping, to front desk, the terrific concierge, and meeting/ food services staff; I was able to make the property my home and workplace with ease for a week. All of my guests were well attended to. The building and rooms are kept very well. The club was very nice and had a decent selection. Location is also good, walking distance to many attractions, shopping and restaurants incl Chinatown. The only critique I'd have are that some of the rooms could have been engineered a little better, as the space was a little squeezed. Understand this is a city hotel. Also, the walls next to me were thin and I had a group in the suite next door and I could hear their normal talking, which got pretty loud. Other than that, the hotel is a shining example why I pick Hyatt whenever possible!

Right in the heart of Union Square, this hotel has all the night touches for a comfortable visit. The location is fantastic, in the heart of great shopping and dining. The rooms are very nice and if you're able to get a high floor, go for it. Many have views of the skyline and the water. Rooms are modern and comfortable. On-site dining is typical so I'd get out as much as possible. Just so many great options nearby.

We just returned from a stay at the San Francisco Grant Hyatt San Francisco. Steve assisted us at check-in ... he was fantastic. I prefer Hyatt Hotels for our stays, but unfortunately I cannot give the Grand Hyatt a 5 rating as I have for previous hotels. Don't get my wrong ... this is an excellent hotel. We had an Union Square view room, and quite frankly I think I would have preferred a view of the Bay. I find the ocean to be more peaceful. The view of the square is really nice, though. My reason for four stars is because I think the hotel needs some upgrading. Our room was nice, but seemed a bit cramped. The carpet looked like it was in need of replacement, and the light in the outside hallway shined into our room at night because the door did not seem to fit properly into the door jam leaving an approx. 1/2 gap at the bottom of the door, and a 1/4 inch gap around the door itself.Would I stay here again? Certainly ... this is a great hotel located in the center of Union Square. Parking in SF is expensive, so I would recommend the Sutter-Stockton Garage about 1/2 block from the hotel ... but remember, most garages do not offer in and out priv. so you will pay extra if you move your car.

We liked this hotel so much we extended our stay there instead of moving on. The Grand Hyatt is conveniently located 2 blocks from Union Square and we were able to walk to many places like China Town, North Beach, Fisherman's Wharf and the Ferry Building.We thought that everything about this hotel was top notch from the helpful staff, exercise room and the room itself. We were located on the 17th floor and I thought that we had a pretty good view of the city.The room was a modern decor and had the usual microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker. The bathroom had a sink big enough to bath a kid in it. The room also had a number of nice unexpected touches such as power and USB outlets, directional reading lights and power shade controls on both sides of the bed. There were a few minor negatives. The windows were not soundproofed enough and we could hear sirens and construction from the street below. There were some complimentary earplugs available but we didn't use them. The bathroom has a sliding door which offers no sound privacy. Also, their tv-entertainment-info system was painful to use.We opted to park in the Sutter-Stockton garage located caddy-corner from the hotel. This was way cheaper than the Hotel's options. Even though we were there during the Blackf Fiday weekend, we had no problem finding a space for our overly large SUV.

From check in to check out, the Grand Hyatt San Francisco is world class in comfort and guest related technology -- check in, check out , room service, Internet connection, etc. The location of the hotel in the center of one of the most beautiful cities of the world is great!

Probably our favorite hotel during a two week trip in the US! The hotel is perfectly located 2 min from Union Sq (where all the shops are!) and the rooms are absolutely gorgeous! We had an amazing view from the 29th floor overlooking the city, we could watch the sunrise in the morning from the bed. We were lucky enough to have access to the Club Lounge, Ben was great and gave us some great tips on what to do in the city. Elaine at the Concierge was also great and remembered us every day we came to see her. As well a special thanks to Jane in Sales who took amazing care of us!

Spent the Thanksgiving holiday visiting San Francisco with family. This location is absolutely perfect. We were near all of the public transit, and many of the "tourist" attractions we wanted to see. Walking distance to Chinatown, and a short cable car ride to Lombard Street, Ferry Building, and Fisherman's Wharf. I would definitely stay here again if I visit in the future. Being in the middle of downtown was also perfect for light shopping, excellent restaurants, and we were able to walk over to the lighting ceremony of the Macy's Christmas Tree. Couldn't be happier!

Although this facility was a bit of a stretch for my budget, my party wanted to be near Union Square to take advantage of public transportation for our weekend. Everything about our stay was excellent and I can recommend this hotel highly.

We just had three days at this Grand Hyatt. From the moment we stepped out of the car to be greeted by smiling,friendly Door men to when we left we cannot fault anything about this hotel Great location steps from Union Square , views from the room and a relaxing Bar for a well earned drink after the sights and shopping of this magnificent city. Will definitely choose the Grand Hyatt,Union Sq when next in San Fran

After 3 requests to fix the ac...finally gave up getting anyone who had any idea of what they were doing...or in the last two cases would even respond. Loud people in the halls, and a staff hat couldn't care less. There are numerous better choices

Great Location - Great Staff - Great Place - Great Room - Great Price - Very Clean and well kept. Could not have been better. Walking distance to Union Square (45 seconds). Walking distance to Cable Cars (2-mins).

Love love love the Grand Hyatt on Union Square. Thank you for your hospitality. The fantastic food in The Grand Club Lounge especially the wait staff and food prepared -- very tasty. The housekeeping staff is very nice too. The gym is great. The gin gin candy from the concierge desk is good.

Everything in the Grand Hyatt San Diego is just better than the one in San Diego. My toddlers and family loved our larger suite in San Diego but less the smaller cold and noisier suite in San Francisco. Everything here is designed for singles/adults but certainly not for families with kids. Suite a great until you have one or two kids with you. Hardwood floor sounds great until you kids keep sliding on it. Space is counted if you need to cram a roll-away and crib even within a suite. Noise level even on the 26th floor is not acceptable because the elevator makes you fell like there is a subway running under the hotel and your room is on the second floor. Service is slow to clean up the room and if heater is broken when cold weather hit SF, they you have seen it all. Please consider this review as an apple to apple comparison between SD and SF Grand Hyatt. Grand Hyatt is still a better proposition than most other hotel chains out there. But just like all others Grand Hyatt SF with nicer touches to families like us (baby bathtub, diapers trash and other baby gears installed in the room) is failing parents with toddlers and kids in a big way. Room layout is not for families nor are the amenities or services. I have yet to find an hotel who has thought about parents and how everybody in the family can enjoy hotel stay. Now I live in SJC so SF is just 45 min away for a nicer family weekend break. Not SD but I get smaller room. You win some, you lose some.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt during the Thanksgiving weekend. The hotel is in the center of great shopping, restaurants so we never had to get in a car. Staff were welcoming and attentive. The breakfast on the concierge floor offered something for everyone. Definitely will stay here again. Recommend higher floors for the views.

Noisy rooms, I could here people next door. Cold showers, hot water would run out. Cold room because heater did not work. Did not received view that I requested. Elevators are very slow. Staff was friendly but service was slow. The location is excellent and rooms were clean. But I still don't recommend.

It's near all the shopping in Union Square, close to Chinatown, easy to walk to SOMA or Market St and access public transportation, and the rooms are spacious and modern. Wifi worked fine and you could order room service through some kind of web-style UI on the TV monitor. And I didn't have to foot the bill - I was there for a business trip - so it was highly affordable too. :-) Very convenient and I would stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone.

We enjoyed our stay at Grand Hyatt at Union Square. The hotel had beautiful rooms. We were on the 23rd floor with a beautiful view of the city/water view. The staff were so helpful and great about making our stay comfortable. The restaurant OneUp had delicious food. We ate a breakfast meal and dinner meal there. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Value for the per night rate. Located well within the city centre. Would definitely recommend an update to the bathrooms; the Hyatt branded hotels in Asia are much more elegant and well furnished. This should be standardise across the globe. What I have viewed in SF is a little disappointing but definitely much better that other chains that I have stayed at. However, I would suggest increasing the competence of the staff. At my checkout, most hotels in Asia will be able to process very quickly all the charges and be presented with the bill almost instantaneously. At Grand Hyatt SF, I had to wait at the counter with the service staff for nearly 15 minutes for him to clarify the charges. I'm confused. Am I the customer or should the hotel have such information at their finger tips? Where is the system/process to ensure that all charges are documented appropriately? So much explanation but not decisive, not clear and not customer friendly. I do not need to be troubled with the challenges you are experiencing; we want solutions and be out as soon as possible. Similarly, the night before my checkout, I had asked if a package was delivered and the bellboy was unable to locate the package when a message was left in my room phone to collect from the first level. Again, the team explained that they did not relay that message and that there was no package. I had to wait 30 minutes to clarify this.

This hotel is so lovely and incredibly well situated. The staff is great. We had a great time, and will return to the hotel again. I would recommend this place to everyone as it is so close to everything. The rooms had wonderful views.

If you plan to shop in San Francisco, this is the place to stay. It is within walking distance to every shop imaginable. There is some construction nearby, but you will not be too inconvenienced. The rooms are a good size. We had our son with us and a rollaway fit nicely in the room. The rooms were clean. The hallways could have been cleaner. There was a coffee spill near the elevators that stayed for two days without cleanup. There also seemed to be dishes, cutlery, glasses set outside the rooms that took forever to be cleaned up. The bathroom was a good size with one sink and a standup shower. There is a makeup table with chair outside of the bathroom. The room was pretty quiet, but the hallways were noisy. Sometimes I could hear through the door people talking. We were far away from the elevator, but the voices would carry. The staff was friendly. I will stay here again. It is better than most of the other hotels around Union Square.

Surprisingly didn't offer 24 hour room service for a 4-5 star hotel. Was jet lagged and wanted a bite to eat after midnight, but told no room service after midnight. There wasn't any bottled water in the room. Service was lousy.

My family and I stayed in this hotel for the first time. It looks newly renovated and the room looks new too. The hotel services is very good, especially the concierge services. They recommended some good restaurants near the hotel and they serve with a smile. The beds and pillows are very comfortable too. I will definitely stay in this hotel again if I have a chance to go to SF again.

We had a great time celebrating my granddaughter's 11th birthday. We were very impressed with how the hotel staff picked up on the fact it was her birthday without us making a point of telling them (must have been the helium balloon on our luggage cart. HA). The room was squeaky clean and we really liked the blackout shade. We will definitely be back

Located on the corner of Sutter and Stockton the GH is one of the big Union Square hotels, as such it doesn't come cheap, but you are paying for Location and a modern very clean hotel.Perfectly placed for Union Square and downtown generally, with very helpful front desk and concierge staff you are well looked after straight from arrival. (sadly I didn't get her name but the women - from the Philippines- who checked me in was fabulous really friendly and helpful).Rooms are excellent, fresh roomy and a very comfortable bed, plenty of closet space and a good quality bathroom. shower could be more powerful but thats a small complaint.Breakfast high quality if a little pricey.Right now there is huge construction work going on in Union Sq, new Subway. I had a room over looking the square which had great views but even on the 21st floor you could hear construction work - it starts at 0630 even on weekends!! so whilst the view is great I suggest you ask for a room away from the square whilst the construction continues.

We were lucky enough to stay at this modern hotel right in the middle of the city. We had a wonderful view and the hotel was great for taking public transit or walking to most of the major sights. As told by other reviewers ,and by the hotel itself, parking down the street is less expensive than the valet. If it's in your budget, I definitely recommend this city hotel!

Its not easy reviewing big hotels particularly when you don't have high expectations. I just want to sleep and I want to be able to watch TV when I wake up (at least when I'm in the US). Tick. Is that 200 characters yet?Rooms are a decent size and are quiet - I couldn't hear my neighbours nor anything from the street and I was on a fairly low floor (Moresby Inc not well recognised in the US yet I suspect). Bed was comfortable. The downstairs space is modern and restaurant looks cool (although we didn't try it). Checking in and out was easy. Must be more than 200 characters now.

At this particular hotel you will be told you don't have a reservation. You will be questioned about whether you know at which Hyatt you have actually made a reservation. When you ask to speak to a manager your request will be ignored. I strongly recommend you don't arrive to this hotel without a printed copy of your hotel reservation confirmation email.

Excellent location just off union square and walking distance to most tourist sites. Typical City centre hotel with a mixture of tourists and business people. The rooms were quiet and comfortable rather than luxurious but absolutely fine . Breakfast was good but you did sometimes need to wait for a table as the restaurant was small for hotel of this size. We stayed there with teenage children and they could provide interconnecting rooms which was big plus.

Slightly more expensive than the Westin but definitely worth it given efficient hotel configuration, nicer rooms and strong service. Decor was modern but tasteful. Hotel generally quiet considering it's off of Union Square (versus its other competitors).

Terrific location with a Hip Youthful Vibe at Union Square in S.F., modern rooms and super service. Seek out the "Foodies" in Concierge services for dining recommendations. This hotel is a great spot for solo female travelers on business, food lovers, true shoppers or for a fun weekend away.

I booked this hotel because I was attending a conference there. What a mistake! This facility feels outdated and creaks when the wind blows. There is no front desk, only kiosks run by inexperienced staff. The restaurant food was terrible, even for a hotel. The room price I was quoted over the phone was not what I was charged. My room was $500 with taxes! I was told they charge higher rates on Sunday. What? Ridiculous. There are so many great hotels (and restaurants) in San Francisco. You can do better!

I've stayed at the Hyatt a number of times on business due to its convenient location. The rooms have come to their years, the lobby is very flash and nice. Quite dark though. Like most places in US, there is an extra price tag for everything - literally. Its very pricey but the location is good. The staff however i don't remember as either warm nor overly friendly. I will stay there again, simply because its convenient for business, but wouldnt recommend for a private trip.

I had a King Room with Concierge Access and a SPECTACULAR view of San Francisco! All staff were helpful and Professional and I was happy to meet all hotel Concierge during my stay for CRELC Event. This hotel is close to everything and a short cab to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirardelli Chocolate Factory, etc.

Stayed for 2 nights. Great location. Rooms just ok. Very weird bathroom sink (more like a trough) that took up too much of the countertop. Beds were fine. Room clean. SErvice great.Had apps and cocktails at the bar, great value, and nice way to relax after a 7h flight from the east coast.View from 36th floor unbeatable!!!Shopping nearby (bring your credit cards, every high end store on earth right around the block).
