My mother decided to surprise my father for his 70th birthday with a trip to San Francisco and we decided to stay at the Grand Hyatt. My mother, father and sister were coming from Alaska; I was coming from Pennsylvania. When making the reservations, I indicated that I would need a crib in the room (my sister was staying in the room with her three month old son). A few days before my arrival I received an email from the hotel asking about the child that would be staying in the room with me. I emailed back and indicated that my sister's three month old son would be in the room. Upon my arrival, I was blown away with the care that was taken preparing the room for the baby's arrival. The staff had already set up a pack and play, small baby blanket (blue with trucks, I believe), a small rubber ducky, a diaper pail, a travel size pack of baby soap/shampoo, a bottle brush/dish soap, and even a baby tub! I was so blown away that I had tears in my eyes. I have NEVER been anywhere that takes so much time making even their tiniest guests feel welcome. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left I felt like family. We were made to feel as if we were the only guests in the hotel; everyone was so kind and helpful! The staff makes sure to make everyone feel like they are the number one priority. I have stayed in many hotels, but I have never had an experience like this. I will absolutely stay here again if/when I'm in San Francisco. My father is a hard person to please, and he was even impressed with the hotel, staff and service!

The very best hotel in the Union Square area. The location cannot be any better. The staff is amazing. The views are spectacular. What makes this hotel so special is the staff. For business or pleasure the hotel is a haven to come back to after a busy day in the city.

I was in 28th floor with a nice view of the Bay and Union Square - there was a construction right next to the hotel, and no noise was reaching my room. Service was great, every employee was very polite and helpful. Everything worked in my room and they had a complimentary set of elements that you could request: from make up remover to slippers. My only critisicm is that they don't have room service for lunch time (only morning and evening) and that they charge you $5 for every package you receive, no matter if you retrieve it the same day it arrived

Stayed for 4 nights in October while visiting family who were also visiting San Francisco and staying here.Were given a corner room adjoining/connecting with their room, but whereas ours had a double queen bed they had a king bed. Found the room having double bed more spacious with a small alcove containing a table where you could do your make up etc. Very convenient.The amenities were ok, especially the body lotion (which they appeared to have run out of, as it was not replenished on daily basis). Other than that, very thoughtfully, they had placed a card mentioning that you just had to phone the housekeeping department in case you wanted the slippers or bath robes or the comb/shaving stuff etc. Our only regret that we found this note on the last day that we were there.Location is excellent with the facility of a shuttle to the airport very convenient. In the neighborhood, you can find some Starbucks coffee shops and of course the Indian flagship hotel Taj is right opposite.Breakfast buffet was fairly extensive but with hardly any variety on day to day basis. The provision of fresh fruit was welcome, which we indulged in to our heart's content. Eggs could be ordered made to order and were catered to as per requirement. Other than that there was the usual sausages, potatoes, cereals and the like.Quite liked the lobby, where a nice warm fire raged behind the glass enclosure making it a nice warm place to sit and browse from the selection of books, so thoughtfully provided. One negative point was that the front office staff could have been more efficient. At times there was just one person standing with a longish queue forming up. Second negative point was that despite our request we were not given a higher floor and had to be content with rooms on 7th. floor. So, I cannot say that there was a great view.

Either the property is very tired or they gave me a very tired room since I was using points. Room 3010: smells of sewer gas, toilet made strange loud sound when flushing, the nightstand drawers and the other cabinets were in poor shape. On the plus side the club was okay except kept extremely cold so people would not hang out too long. Staff in club was excellent. Elevators were dirty. Valet parking is $67 and change per night.My original keys were not able to get into club even though I brought the fact they needed to be up when checking in.I have been a Hyatt member since mid 80s.I think I am done now.

We arrived for a week after a 17 hour journey, a friendly staff unloaded our bags whilst we registered, our request for a high floor and Bay view, booked 18 months prior was ignored. Instead we were mid floor City view. Our bags taken to our room and the porter gave us several tips about what to and not do. The room was very clean with 2 Queen Beds and the bathroom included all the usual toiletries. The use of Bathrobes and slippers was welcome. The view overlooking Union Square and facing Macy's was pretty good. From a central location it was simple to get to the cable cars and car hire, with lots of shops, restaurants and tourist attractions within walking distance. We requested a mini fridge, it was delivered within 5 minutes. So our overall impression of the hotel was good.

Grand Hyatt is well-located. Good customer service. Rooms are clean. Loved the electronic blinds! Check-in was quick as was check-out. Staff was friendly and when I needed some additional amenities, they were brought to my room within 5 minutes.

Excellent location, comfortable and clean, friendly staff, ideal for shopping, sightseeing and business meeting. In close proximity to Chinatown and the historic tram. Wonderful views of the San Francisco Bay from the 36th floor.

Arrived exhausted mid-week in the middle of a multi-location business trip. Check in was super easy and fast and I was directed to my room on the 27th floor. Gorgeous room and amazing view over the city and the bay. I was too tired to do much than drop off my belongings and head downstairs to the onsite restaurant, OneUp. The service was great as way my Cioppino followed by Caramelized apple pie (dessert for me is a rare indulgence). I didn't do much more than fall into bed, leaving the unpacking until the following morning. That is when I observed the unique elements that make this room/hotel so perfect for me. I have been doing a lot of travel lately and never, I mean not once, have I been blessed with a 'do-your-hair/makeup counter' as this room has. I don't like standing in the bathroom to dry my hair or peer into the over the sink mirror to get my makeup on. At home I use a lighted magnified mirror which helps me get things right! I usually remember to pack my portable magnified mirror which I will often balance precariously on a surface close enough to natural light and also an outlet for the hair dryer/hot iron. I practically screamed with delight when I came across the large, magnified, illuminated mirror sitting quietly and with stability on this little alcove equipped with outlets, a counter for my junk and a stool to sit on!! Happiness times a million! Thank you Grand Hyatt. If all your hotels are equipped similarly you will be my go-to chain in future.Oh, and did I mention the comfy bed, amazing view and general comfort (no noise) and general excellence of this hotel for a weary female traveler? Love, love, love.

I stayed in a one bedroom suite on the 34th floor and could not have been happier. The suite was very large with a private bedroom and bathroom, a living room with 2 sofas, a desk with a Mac and printer, dinning room table with seating for 6, a wine refrigerator, another small refrigerator, small prep area, a well stocked Keurig and another half bath. Every room had sweeping views of the city and bay.The hotel itself was very nice with a good restaurant and great spaces to with sofas and fireplaces for people to gather. In walking distance to shops and restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Overall our four night stay was delightful. We requested a quiet room -- there is a lot of construction work happening nearby (new Apple Store being built and a large portion of Stockton St is being dug up) -- so the lower floors can be noisy. On the 21st floor it was relatively quiet, and we had a great view over Union Square. The staff were friendly and helpful with requests. The hotel is a 10-15 minute walk to the convention Center, and close to trolley cars (fun and cheap transport). Only negative, is that the restaurant lacked atmosphere and was overpriced for casual dining.

My stay was for a convention I worked. So I came very tired and I found my room to be relaxing and clean. I was able to get a great night sleep every night. The check was easy and the staff was very nice and professional. The hotel is very quiet.

Hyatt Grand San Francisco offers allmost everything you expect from high end hotel. The rooms are spacious, clean and welcoming. The bathroom too is spatious too but I havenâ€™t spotted the largely expected bathrobe and branded slippers. One good thing is that the rooms are well noise insulated adding bonuses on sleep quality. Best view is in the rooms overseeing the Union Sq. but the view it comes at a price as construction works currently taking place there may be bothersome during early hours.Having said that, a bit of urgency at the reception may do no harm

I have stayed at Hyatt's all over the world including this one, many times.Usually I have a great experience and the staff are well trained, the systems work.Maybe I caught them on a bad couple of days.The problem started when I tried to order room service and the auto-answering service told me room service was closed at just after 9 pm. which I knew wasn't possible.So I called the front desk. They seemed unconcerned but they did connect me to room service which was prompt and good quality.Next morning, I went through the regular drill of lining up at the main restaurant which as usual at 8 a.m. was full. But after waiting 10 minutes without any communication, I went straight to the back restaurant which I knew from previous visits is where they would send me.There they told me to go back to the line and wait. I said if I leave the restaurantwill go to the Taj hotel across the street rather than be ignored again.They then immediately seated me and we had a perfectly pleasant breakfast and Jason, our server was delightful. This morning I went back to the regular place as my colleague already had a table. It was fine but not particularly welcoming other than the server who was very friendly.I think the real problem is one of service and communication. Everyone can wait if asked politely, but to be ignored is not what I have come to expect from the Grand Hyatts anywhere.For the rest of my stay, 3 nights, everything was fine except for the restaurant ambience.

We stayed in the Grand Hyatt just off Union Square. The hotel was lovely, and our room was luxurious. The room service was excessively pricey (my $19 Cobb salad and glass of water cost about $35 once all the fees, taxes, etc were added), but the location was perfect. And there were 3 Starbucks on the same block. There were many other nice restaurants and great shopping within a short walk too. The trolley ride to the Wharf was fun and scenic. If you walk a few blocks from the hotel you will encounter homeless people (and once right in front of the hotel a very unstable woman needed to be taken away by police and ambulance). This is a reality of bigger cities and was not a problem for us, but I suppose some people would like to be aware of this. It would be the same for any hotel in the area. I wasn't impressed with the restaurant we went to in the hotel, but really enjoyed several close by.

All of the staff at this hotel are great but front desk staff really go above and beyond to make your experience great. Nice hotel, perfect location and nice views. Would stay here again. The breakfast buffet was average so we ordered off menu.

Rooms are nicely decorated but need more thorough maintenance, in particular the ventilation trap door that was blackened by dirt. Very limited in room dining menu. Food quality isaverage. Very noisy ventilation system. Good staff. No spa facilities , no swimming pool

Perfect location, central, close to union square, the market place, financial district, and china town; we walked and never needed to drive. Hotel rooms could use more outlets for charging cell phones, lap tops, etc. in the bedrooms, but overall, the rooms were clean , modern and nice.

I stayed in the City for three days on business the Grand Hyatt has everything. Location attentive staff reasonable rates and great amenities. I always stay there for my CME courses. Love San Francisco

This is always one of my favorite hotels to stay at, with a starbucks right across the street, Nike on the corner and China town for walking makes the area fun place to visit. The hotel is simple in check in and out, and always a comfortable stay.

Excellent choice for stay in SF!!! Rooms quiet clean and comfortable, Staff all friendly and helpful, BEAUTIFUL views from our room and workout room. Perfect location. Would gladly choose this hotel again next time I travel to SF

It is hard to find good accommodation in good areas of San Francisco at a reasonable price. This was an expensive three-night stay in one room with two adults and two teenagers, but worth it, if for nothing else than the location of this hotel in Union Square.Check In â€“ small queue at check in and whole process was very thorough staff spending as much time as needed with each customer. Very happy and informed staff who gave great information of attractions, events and restaurants around the area.Room â€“ was small but had everything we needed. We were on and upper floor so views of the bay were magical out the floor to ceiling windows. Modern room with all mod cons. Very comfortable beds and good shower. Free in room Wi-Fi.Location â€“ Union Square location was great for us, it was easy walking distance to Westfield Centre, Apple Store, Macyâ€™s, China Town and heaps of restaurants. If staying in San Francisco again would be staying at Union SquareCheck Out â€“ simple and efficient didnâ€™t need to return the key, bill was delivered the night before, all paid and then just left the room cards in the room and left. Car was in parking and arrived by the time we arrived in the lobby with our bags.

I've been to a few Hyatt in Australia and Asia and this one is well below that standard. The location is great, just off union square and the staff are good but when you pay almost $400 a night, I expect better quality. The shower was in a bathtub and the buffet breakfast was small and weak.The bed was very comfortable and there was a selection of different types of pillows to suit all tastes - which is a huge plus for me.This is a good hotel - just not good value.

Location is good for shopping but beware of the massive amount of homeless and otherwise avoidable. Ask for a north facing room, worth the effort. Central location and easy to get uber/lyft/etc. Avoid the square, disgusting.

This was mine and my husband's third time staying at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco. We love the location, the atmosphere, the style, and the staff. Although the one thing we've noticed that is a reoccurring issue for us is the noise level. In our recent stay we purposely requested our room to be up on a higher level due to the noise level. The helpful receptionist helped me on my request and put our room on the 32nd floor, which didn't really help at all with the noise level. Everything was wonderful with our room until we went to bed and was woken up to sirens, people yelling, car noises etc..There was really nothing anyone could do so we just tried to sleep through the night. When we checked out the front desk had asked us how our room was and we explained how everything was wonderful with the room except the noise level. Their response to us was that we shouldn't have been bothered with the noise and they just seem to not care about how we felt. We just brushed off their response because other than the noise we had a great time, grand hyatt just needs to replace their thin windows.

We left a really nice hotel over at fisherman's wharf to come over to the Grand Hyatt for a work event. I had been told by the first hotel that the Grand Hyatt was a nice, classy hotel. Perhaps in the 70s that was true, unfortunately the room decor appears to have not changed since then. Wood paneling, wood panelling everywhere! Even the phones and lamps look really dated, which is not something I would normally notice at all. I half expected to find an old top-loading VCR hooked up to the TV. The lobby area was nice, but then who spends much time in the lobby other than the staff?There was no offer to take our bags up to our room (not that we necessarily needed it, but EVERY other hotel I've stayed at in the USA has at least offered). For some reason the bathroom door doesn't shut flush against the wall, which means you have no real privacy. Fortunately I was with my wife but if 2 colleagues were sharing a twin room it would be embarrassing.The only plus point I can really give the hotel is that it's in a good location, but there are other hotels nearby which I'll try out instead next time.

We stayed at this hotel for my husband's business conference, so it was chosen for us. And I must say, it was a wonderful choice! I loved our stay, didn't want to leave. The hotel is updated and modern, clean and beautiful. Very friendly staff! I loved being able to walk everywhere, especially close to shopping.There was a lot of construction going on in Union Square, but the hotel was very quiet, so we were not bothered at all by it at all.Thanks for a great stay, we will be back!

This is a beautifully hotel in a great location. Our room was gorgeous with a great city view and it had all the latest amenities. I especially liked all the extra outlets for charging devices. The thing that especially stood out to me was how well trained and helpful all the staff are. We were greeted warmly and throughout the entire stay everyone was so pleasant and helpful. I was especially impressed with a gentleman who appeared to be cleaning rooms who noticed that the water cooler on my floor was empty and I was looking for water. He offered to get bottles of water for me right away. I haven't seen such service in other hotels in a long time.

The Grand Hyatt is centrally located in Union Square. The rooms and the service were excellent and everything was in working order. Loved the idea of refilling water bottles from 20 gal bottles. It worked very well. Close to food and locatwed in a great walking area.

As a diamond member of the Hyatt Gold passport program, I found this Grand Hyatt in San Francisco to be one of the best.The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. The staff was extremely professional and courteous. The Grand Hyatt San Francisco will be my first choice when ever I visit the city.

Girls night for a birthday! Had the city view with king bed. Lovely view, not to bad for noise considering it was over Stockton St. Staff was extremily friendly. Location is perfect, right on Union Square for a great shopping experience. 2 blocks south of China town, 2 block north of bart.

For the price they charge, the bathroom smelled sour like it had been cleaned by a dirty rag, the water pressure dribbled out of the shower, the TV was so small you could barely see it, and our AC was broken in the room. As a Gold Passport member, we were also placed in a room facing other buildings with no view. Avoid this Hyatt, as there is nothing "Grand" about it.

Once again the Grand Hyatt has provided us with the best place to stay in the Union Square area. The staff was spectacular and the Club Level made our stay just perfect. Won't stay anyplace else when in San Francisco.

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco afforded all one could want when visiting the city: a fantastic location, superb service, and the benefits of Hyatt's Gold Passport program. As a "road warrior" I have the opportunity to experience dozens of hotels in the course of a year, the Grand Hyatt San Francisco met all of my expectations--and I'm not easy to please!

Hotel is accessible to Union Square for shopping. Hotel is within walking distance to all local Restaurants. Renovation is on going next to the Hotel, but does not affect a persons stay at the Grand Hyatt Hotel off of Stockton Ave. Bedding is good and the view of the city is spectacular.

Noisy Employee talking loudly on the phone for 20 minutes after midnight woke us up. We couldn't go back to sleep afterwards. The pillows were too flat, our neck hurt in the morning and bothered us for 2 days.

We had a beautiful room. Fantastic fitness center. Our booking gave us access to the Club facility. We ate breakfast there every day. There were a couple hot items, and anything else you could possibly need for breakfast. Evening hors d'oeuvres had a feature dish that was always delicious. And there were mini desserts later. The only thing we had to pay for were bar drinks. There were various luxuries in the room as well. The staff were also very courteous and attentive. I can't think of any negatives.

I had a very pleasant stay at the Hyatt. I was in town overnight on business and the location was perfect. The staff was great. Check in was smooth and quick. the facility was modern and fresh. The room was clean and the TV had a welcome message when I walked into the room. I would recommend this property.

Standard and what you would expect from a Grand Hyatt. Superb location in Union Square, excellent service, bar and restaurant, breakfast options, fitness center with a great view, a tasteful bathroom.But the room was covered in dust, which is just unacceptable at this level of hotel.There was also an issue getting some sports channels on the television.

I have stayed at this hotel numerous times for both business and pleasure, and every time it has been amazing. The rooms are modern, the service is impeccable, and you can't beat the location. We were upgraded to Grand Club and it's definitely worth it for the daily breakfast and happy hour. The hotel is just a few blocks from BART, close to cable cars, shopping and of course all of the fabulous restaurants in San Francisco.

We really appreciated the excellent customer service and the cleanliness. Road construction made walking around the square a little challenging, but it was still do-able and we felt safe. Easy access to Muni was helpful.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt in the beginning of October to celebrate my 30th birthday and can honestly say that I have never been treated sooooo poorly as a guest. Having experience working at the Montage Laguna Beach and Palomar Hotel San Diego, and having stayed at multiple different properties including Hyatts, Marriotts, and a number of boutique hotels throughout my years of traveling, I could promise you that your money would best be spent elsewhere. The hotel seems nice but could use more detail in cleanliness and function (elevators are slow and we had issues with the blackout curtain in our room). My biggest issue was with the staff. The last day of my stay I had a Tiffany's necklace, which was a birthday gift, stolen from my room. I spent hours going back and forth, contacting the front desk, housekeeping, and security. They sent security up to my room to file an incident report and I was told that someone would get back to me but never did. I feel as though the hotel staff was hoping that I would simply forget about the incident, considering I was the one continually following up with them. I spent the next 3 weeks going back and forth, calling and emailing the hotel and nothing was ever resolved. I was promised multiple times, verbally and through email correspondence, that the hotel would send a check to refund the cost of the necklace and then was just recently informed that the hotel had reconsidered the reimbursement. There are multiple hotels surrounding Union Square and I would strongly suggest staying at any other hotel. The Sir Francis Drake, for instance, was a wonderful property I've stayed at with friendly staff, beautiful decor, and stuff doesn't get stolen from your room there. If you do, however, choose to stay at the Grand Hyatt, I would recommend locking up any valuables and pray that you do not have to deal with the unfriendly and incompetent staff.

Great customer service, convenient location to transportation, shopping, and all the rest! Beautifully renovated, modern, yet classy. I look forward to staying here again on my next visit. Great value for the money!

We stayed here for 2 nights before getting on a cruise ship. The location is very good, walking distance to lots of restaurants, bars and shops, and the cable car stop is also quite close. The room is comfortable with everything you need, a comfy bed and good amenities in the bathroom. Most of the staff were very friendly and helpful.I think I would recommend this hotel for a short stay.

Stayed there in 2012, most of the staff gave me a very cool impression. Stayed recently for 3 nights, staff were very warm and proactively to offer to help. View overlooking the bay area is fantastic. Internet speed is good.

Arrived atthehotel about 2130 first impression was reception was very sparse ,but the service and check in we're faultless they gave a quick run down whilst checking in regarding facilities available, Then told had a lovely room on the 30th floor they weren't joking on entering the room straight away you could tell it was spotlessly clean bright and airy with modern funiature after a good nights sleep in a very comfortable bed I decided to open the blinds on doing so was greet with a fabulous view overlooking the city towards the bay and Alcatraz prison. The hotel staff who I dealing were very helpful and attentive to detail, the bar had good selection drink with an happy the head barman was very informative and friendly who made feel extremely welcome a credit to the hotel .If I ever return to San Francisco then this hotel would be top of my list to stay at .

SFO Grand Hyatt situated in a convenient location and is easy to reach out to different tourism spots. Staffs are nice and overall I would rate it above standard. I drove around SFO and there is a public car park nearby which could provide convenient and affordable pricing for overnight parking.

We had a great stay here. The central location made it easy to walk to most places, or to jump on public transport.We stayed in one of the club level rooms, which was well worth it in our opinion. whilst the room was not the biggest (to be expected in city centre hotels) the views were great, and the room stylish and well appointed.Travelling with a 10 month old baby is never easy, but the staff bent over backwards to help up, providing not only a cot for the little one to sleep in, but also a pack of essential baby supplies - lotions, bottle cleaning brushes etc that was unasked for, but very much appreciated.The club level is great, as the lounge offers the that bit more space to relax in, plus lots of drinks and snacks on demand. The breakfast was great every morning, and the evening snacks were also good. It was a little frustrating that the club lounge closed every evening at 9pm (just about the time we'd got the baby to sleep and were ready to enjoy a drink!).A lovely hotel, with fabulous, friendly and efficient staff. I wouldn't hesitate for a moment to recommend it to friends or to stay here again if I'm lucky enough to go back to San Francisco in the future.

The Grand Hyatt at Union Square is truly a fantastic hotel. The beds were so comfortable that within minutes I was asleep! My friends and I chose this hotel (despite the steep price tag that night) because of its reputation, and because it was super close to the starting line for the Nike Women's Half Marathon, which was the primary purpose for the weekend. Service was en pointe from the moment I made the reservation: email reminders were sent out to me and pre-accommodations were offered. Upon check-in, we were greeted by Steven, who was genuinely concerned with our comfort for the night before the race. He placed us on the quieter side of the hotel, where we heard little to no sounds from the streets of Union Square overnight. It was truly amazing and almost worth the price paid. A couple of friends forgot some toiletries, and we had asked for additional pillows and towels, all of which came up to the room within minutes of the request despite the fact that the hotel was practically fully booked. Most other hotels leave you waiting around for hours, wondering if you need to call the front desk again as a reminder. Not the Grand Hyatt. Everything about the weekend was lovely - much gratitude and many many kudos to your staff!

What a great staff only, matched by the elegance and functionality of the rooms. Easy to drive to the front door and then a truly enjoyable experience began. I recognized right away that the staff was something special; they were never engaged in personal conversations between each other, and they always greeted you with a genuine smile.

I stayed here on business for 4 nights. The room was very good. Great coffee machine. There was some building work going close by, which combined with jet lag made for some sleepless nights but that didn't detract from a very pleasant all round stay. I would recommend the hotel as it is perfectly located. Credit has to go to the concierges. They were brilliant.

Right on Union Square. When the street construction on the entrance of the Hotel is finished, the hotel will be much more lovely. The breakfast offered in this hotel has no match for those offered at Hyatt in the Asia. Don't worry, there are plenty of restuarants with various types of foods (including Thai noodle restuarant) surrounding the hotel. It is within blocks from all fine shops as well.Have no complain with services. We enjoy our three nights there very much.

The Grand Hyatt was a perfect hotel for me and my family that was visiting from France. The location was fantastic- we were in close proximity to shopping & restaurants, and it was also a manageable walk to the Ferry Building and Fisherman's Wharf. The staff was very attentive and willing to help with whatever was needed. Most importantly, the rooms were very clean!

What a great city! What a great hotel! My husband & I just spent three nights at the Grand Hyatt and loved it... great location at Union Square and convenient to everything. Hyatt staff was great, especially Ahn in the Club Room -- she went above and beyond by offering to make my husband tea w/honey and lemon as he had a sore throat! So nice, as was everyone else there. Definitely recommend!

We loved our 4 day mother daughter visit in this hotel located in a fantastic location in downtown sanfrancisco! Excellent and courteous service at check in and during our stay our room was very well maintained during our stay. We were on the 25 th floor overlooking union square which was amazing. We were able to walk everywhere and it seemed every day we had questions for the concierge and all staff at the concierge desk were so friendly and helpful. Most hyatts have a great rooftop bar so disappointing that this one did not but the bar at one up was good. I would highly recommend this hotel and it is pricey but worth it.

Great location in the heart of san francisco, and steps away from the union square and all the shopping you can find. The parking is an absolute rip off @ $55/day however the rooms are comfortable and the overall service is good.

My wife and I spent the first 2 days of a 6 day stay in San Francisco at the Grand Hyatt. I honestly don't have anything bad to report. The location of the hotel speaks for itself. It's right next to Union Square in the heart of everything. Shopping, dining, sightseeing and much more are just a short walk away. Check in was very pleasant. A young lady named Kathleen was just genuinely kind and made the process a breeze. Our room was on the 17th floor overlooking Union Square. The room and property itself was what I'd expect from a Grand Hyatt: modern, chic, clean cut and spacious. A nice touch was automated blinds that were adjustable via a switch right by the room door and switches on either side of the bed. The only other Hyatt I'd encountered this little feature to date was the Park Hyatt Paris Vendome. The room and bathroom were very well lit, which is a big plus! Water pressure was also on point. Other than the young lady at the front desk, the only other direct contact we had with hotel employees were the doormen who greeted us each time we came back to to the hotel and a gentleman who delivered room service to us one evening. ALL employees we encountered were incredibly pleasant. You can tell that they take their guest service very seriously as they should.Speaking of room service, it was prompt, expensive and convenient. Always nice when you don't feel like heading out. Have no reservations about this hotel. As a longtime Hyatt Gold Passport Member, this hotel fits the bill of a very nice property. Location and service combine for a great experience!

We all enjoyed our 5 nights at the Grand Hyatt San Fran. Neighborhood is perfect for sightseeing. Love taking the trolly up and down the hills. The hotel was welcome retreat after full days of sightseeing. Comfortable beds. Modern rooms. Great service. Fabulous room service. Delicious food. Wifi worked great. Free too! Air conditioning worked very well and was quiet too. Love the automatic shades. Awesome views from our 32nd floor room. Shower and bathroom spacious. Not a huge fan of the frosted glass bathroom door but that's a minor detail. Plenty of plugs for computer equipment by bed and on desk. All in all fantastic hotel.

Very central, great view from the lounge and some rooms to the bay area. Extremely nice and friendly staff and a good selection of fruits and food. Lounge is great but American style. So do not expect the drinks and cocktails all day...

Stayed for 7 nights the first week of October. My room was spacious, clean and modern. Was the perfect location. The food was really good - especially the hamburger with bacon jam! I will stay there next visit for sure.

The hotel staff were extremely helpful and knowledgeable of the area,shops and tours. Located in a convenient part of the city making it e add y to wak to most destinations. The housekeeping staff does an excellent job. Would definitely stay again.

We checked into the Grand Hyatt and as we expected with most Hyatt, were treated like royalty. Upon check in we were upgraded to a club level floor and given access to the club lounge. The latter was fantastic and offered a nice continental breakfast, great snacks, and evening dessert. The workout room was small but packed full of all the equipment one would need to get a good workout, plus they had a location for yoga. The room was well appointed with modern decor and the views of San Francisco were picturesque! In addition, the hotel personnel were extremely nice and hospitable. We will definitely stay here again!

The Grand Hyatt is perfectly located at Union Square. Most attractions can easily be reached either on foot or by muni and cable car.On-line reservation works well, a week before arrival a reminder is being sent by email.Staff is very welcoming and specially congierge Joanna (hope her name is correctly written) was extremely helpful.Our bayviewroom had a spectacular view over the city up to Alcatraz. The room is spacious and relatively well maintained.Free wifi worked fine.Minor details : a bit annoying that one has to phone to the congierge to get f.i. a second pair of slippers or enough towels for 2 persons (although the demanded items were quickly delivered in the room). Our room had the disadvantage of being next to the icemachine, as this brings a lot of noise, specially if guests seem to be in need of ice at 4h00 am.An illogic aspect of the laundrypolicy of the hotel is, that towels are only being replaced every second day, but there is no rack in the bathroom to dry wet towels. Although not cheap, we would certainly stay again this hotel.

The hotel has been remodeled and they did a good job. Very busy and a little less personal. Room services very nice. Easy to walk from location and fast taxi service. For a large hotel, one of the best in S.F.

Excellent guest rooms, huge breakfasts, upper rooms have a great view, but ours was too low for that advantage of the high-rise hotel. Location is very convenient to good shopping. Room service was friendly and prompt. Elevators were sometimes slow and crowded.

Great hotel in the best San Francisco location. Service is attentive. Rooms are stylishly contemporary. Food at hotel restaurant is superior. Amenities what you would expect from Hyatt. We recommend it.

The hotel was clean and beds were comfortable. The rooms are small but when you're on holidays you really only need a clean, comfortable place to rest your weary bones. The restaurant and lounge had average food and average service. Hotel staff were pleasant enough. The location was terrific. Close to great shops, restaurants, the cable cars and if you wanted to catch a taxi it was only a US$15 trip to Pier 39.

Great hotel, clean room. Bad lounge and restaurant. It's called OneUP, should be called OneDOWN. Could use some more security at the elevators to keep the homeless out. They are everywhere! Overall the hotel is nice, and the room was fine. Slept great and the WiFi was good. Id it wasn't for business I would have stayed at an Airbnb.

The rooms are terribly small... The restaurant has terrible food...The bathroom door offers no privacy...the beds are so creeky and uncomfortable...But the club lounge is phenominal- I would never stay here again.

I am from the Bay Area but now live in Seattle. I go to San Francisco often on business but I never stayed at the Grand Hyatt until recently and now it is one of my top picks. The hotel is located in the heart of Union Square near great restaurants, shopping and in a safe area. The hotel is very clean and has several great amenities such as an awesome gym, good restaurants and the staff is very courteous and attention to its guests. They make you feel valued and appreciated - always greeting guests, opening doors, etc..top notch service. The room service was prompt but they serve only breakfast and dinner - no lunch service available. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The management is doing a good job with their hiring and training strategies. Oh - the room dÃ©cor is incredible along with the views of the city from both the rooms and the gym.

It took me awhile to search for a convenient hotel with a reasonable price, I usually choose hotels where I have loyalty programs to earn points, I made an exception for this hotel since the price and the reviews are good.The hotel is very well located Next to Union Square, shopping malls are also near by, many designer shops as well (if your traveling with your wife or girlfriend then you will end up broke by the end of your trip), the rooms are very clean and the size is good, the soundproof should have been better, the staff are amazingly friendly, be aware of the gorgeous ladies in the front desk they might capture your heart, the check in was quick since I did the online check in, and the check out was even quicker since I did it through online as well, I didn't even have to go to the front desk for the checkout and the billing was sent to my email.I rate this hotel:Location: 10/10Room: 10/10Bed comfort: 10/10Room service: 9/10Cleanness: 10/10Value of price paid for the room: 9/10Breakfast: breakfast not includedStaff: 10/10Internet/wifi: 9/10

The Grand Hyatt S.F. is a typical large Hyatt with a gazillion rooms. The rooms are smallish but the views are outstanding . The views from the Regency Club are sick.The views from the nicely equipped fitness center are great as well. The one up bar is nice and the staff is very friendly. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is on Union Square where all of the high end shops are located.

I really liked the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco, nice clean and quiet is the short version but I am also happy to give a good shout out to the training room on floor 33 that had an amazing view over the town. Location is good with a Starbucks just across the street. When I visited the noise level was high early mornings due to construction in the vincinity but hopefully that should go away as soon as that is finalized.

The hotel and staff were excellent from start to finish, truly a pleasure to have that kind of attention while off for a week of California Culture. The staff from front desk to housekeeping were genuinely concearned of our every needs.

Best staff we have ever experienced, wonderful central location in the city, very comfortable room, great bed , view from the top floor of San Fransisco bay and skyline was breathtaking Hotel lounge delivers great service , food, and drinks

Came here as a platinum member. Paid big bucks for a Club room. It happened that I left a remote from my Internet TV receiver in my room while checking out. Called the hotel same night about it, wanted to get back and pick up the remote. Unfortunately, once you out of the door, the hotel treats you as a dirt. Obviously, the remote was thrown away same day by the cleaning crew. But the hotel answering service kept transferring my inquiries to the Security Department, instead of asking the cleaning crew. Very disappointed, will never come back again.

Recently stayed 5 nights at this property on business. The hotel is located in the heart of Union Square, so can be very busy with lots of tourists and vacationers. The hotel is very nice with great dÃ©cor. The rooms are modern with nice dÃ©cor and are spacious as well. The beds are not the best for comfort, but ok.Be aware that there is a building being constructed directly next to hotel on the Union Square facing side. The construction starts early, so there can be a good bit of noise. The hotel does provide ear plugs in the room, but you may want to ask for a room facing another directions, if this could bother you.Overall, I would recommend this hotel for business travel.

The hotel is located in the heart of the union square. Many great restaurants and stores close to the hotel. However, there was some noise due to constructions. At all events, I loved staying at the grand hyatt San Francisco!!

My husband and I were on a business trip to San Fran. We had a great time at the Hyatt. Clean room, great bathroom, fantastic view of the city and close to everything. Very friendly staff. Would definitely stay there again.

From the minute we walked in, the staff were excellent, very friendly and helpful for the whole of our 5 night stay. Great location for Union Square so didn't have to walk far for restaurants or cable cars. The drinks in hotel bar were expensive (what hotel isn't) but the barman was happy to recommend a very nice Californian wine, and on one night there was a guitar player singing, which was a really nice. Our room was clean a spacious with a large very comfortable bed and loads of super comfy pillows, which from my personal experience is unusual. Would definitely stay here again.

Conveniently located off Union Square. Lovely hotel with upgraded amenities. Nice and new dÃ©cor. The Club Lounge had great hot items for breakfast as well as cold items. The evening had a full array of food and open until late night. It was also open on the weekends, which some Lounges at hotels are closed over the weekends.

Large hotel and large hotel chain - central location - close to shopping districts and city center. Ask for room on higher floors looking out towards Bay. May be a US thing but mini bar not stocked and no free water provided in room.

I have stayed here many, many times for business over the years. The hotel experience is consistently good, and the location is great for access to business district, as well as dining options around Untion Square.

This hotel is very well located by Union Square and just 2 blocks from Chinatown's dragon gate. Rooms are pricey, but very comfortable, bed, pillows and furniture are great. It is very clean and functional. Internet is slow (free) and you can upgrade for a daily fee (on top of the daily rate). Restaurants are very good as pricey as well, although the breakfast not so great and didn't have espresso (if you care for it) so you have a Starbucks across the street and some local coffee shops a block away in every direction.

Whole stay was very pleasant. Great hotel with good service. Wonderful location to explore San Francisco. Staff was very helpful. Great views. Would stay there again and would advise others to do the same.

Had a 4 night stay in Grand Hyatt on Stockton Street in September with the family. Has a double+double room for 3 of us which was sufficient space although not much room for clothes for 3 adults. Room on the 17th floor so needed the ear plugs (supplied) due to nearby major construction works, road cleaning etc early in the morning. One gripe was the shower; hardly a modern one with low pressure and awkward controls. Staff were very helpful and polite, hotel is well placed to walk the centre of SF and easy to get to Market St for the shaopping mall etc. There is considerable road works going on which meant walking is far easier than driving! Overall, it is a big hotel that does have a lot of corporate/business clientele but is large enough for this not to be an issue. Did not try the in-house restaurant as plenty of (cheaper) options close by. It will be better when the building works next door are finished and Apple move into their new 'Cube' store.

Excellent staff, clean comfortable modern rooms. A great pick for your stay in San Francisco! Close to China Town and shopping. I would definitely stay here again. Great stay for a business meeting, but would also work well for a family trip.

Could not have had a better location,clean rooms,excellent amenities throughout,walking distance to many places,concierge and all staff very helpful and friendly ,great gymnasium,if booking San Francisco and you want to be central this place will be perfect,look forward to coming back one day

The hotel was clean, had a helpful staff, and was located in a great location. We had a gorgeous bay view and it was worth the extra money! Enjoyed the free wifi and the treats in the lobby each night. The hotel is located a block from the cable cars and is right on union square. Would definitely stay here again.

The hotel is under construction and the room we stay in is right next to where they do external work. They started working very early in the morning and our heads are like being hammered since they started. But even before they start, we cannot sleep because there is a huge gap underneath the entrance door and the hallway light is so bright it light up the room even when we shut all lights. We complained when we check out but the staff only take down my email. I haven't heard from the hotel except the automatic survey.

In Grand Hyatt SF you can except excellent service, a spacious room, and if you are staying in the club floor, and excellent club lounge. We must admit we optimised the services of the concierge team not only for directions but to book our restaurants, show tickets, trip bookings, and the team delivered it with efficiency and a smile. If you are staying in this hotel which is so centrally located to all the shops, premium outlet, restuarants you need to ask the concierge team to assist you and don't burden yourself with the details. Then your stay in SF will be so much more comfortable and enjoyable.

I've stayed at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco for a work conference the last three years. They have the best beds and pillows in the industry. Their housekeeping staff is very kind and the valets out front are courteous and look very professional. I really appreciate that they have a good restaurant and coffee bar in the hotel.

We were warmly greeted by the front desk and bell staff which contributed greatly to the hotel achieving a boutique fell in spite of being a large property. We will certainly stay at this property again.

My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco in the beginning of June. We could tell immediately we were going to enjoy our stay. They upgraded our room to a higher floor, overlooking Union Square. Not five minutes in the room and we get a phone call making sure the room was good. Then were asked if we enjoy baseball and if we'd be interested in attending the Giants game that night. Awesome!! Love it. We were able to walk to the ballpark and walk home.My wife and I enjoy walking. The hotel is in a great location and streetcar stops nice and close. I would not hesitate to stay there again. Thank you Grang Hyatt SF for an amazing stay!! And the Giants tickets!!

Let me preface this review by stating that I travel a lot for work and personal trips. I can honestly say that the Grand Hyatt San Francisco is one of the nicest and best hotels I have had the pleasure of staying at.The rooms are spacious with luxurious beds and decor. I am never very impressed with hotel beds but their selection of beds and sheets gave me one of the best night's sleep I have ever had on the road. I was lucky enough to have a higher floor room with an amazing view. Everything in the room is updated and modern.The service staff was warm and friendly and made sure I was well taken care of. Their hotel bar and lounge is very nice and I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of drinks and their selection.I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city who wishes to be met with welcoming staff, amazing service, a great location, and a wonderful stay.

We recently stayed at the hotel in September. It was my first time visiting SF, actually first time in California! The hotel is a high rise, and situated in the center of the Union Square area of SF. Perfect location, albeit fairly busy and touristy. Our room was a good size. They put us in a handicap accessible room. We were on the 22nd floor and the view was of the Union Square (across from Macy's)...really pretty at night time!All in all, a good hotel. It's location is definitely a plus. It's within a 2 block walk of Chinatown, and there is a trolley stop within 2 blocks as well. It's also fairly close (about 1 mile) from Fisherman's Wharf. We also took a cab to the Mission area. Finally, a one BIG plus was the customer service we received at the end of our stay, actually, we had already checked out. We had left an Ipad and Bose headphones in the room safe, and we were already in Santa Clara. We called the hotel, and they had opened the safe and had our items! Apparently, if a room safe is closed, they open it prior to the next guest. We made arrangements to pick our items up a couple days later. So kudos to Security for helping us!

Located in the heart of Union Square, this hotel is in the center of everything (Shopping, Food, China Town, & more) The building is also one of the tallest I've seen in the area so there are some killer views if you have the right room. The hotel itself is very nice and checks the box for just about anything you could want. We particularly enjoyed the small surprises like complementary pop corn and candy in the lobby one afternoon. They even had breakfast treats from starbucks some mornings. These little things stood out to us and made our visit more enjoyable.It's hard not to recommend this hotel for anyone. It's good for just about everything.

Great central location! Exceptional service! Good Food! Very knowledgeable concierge! Nice quiet room! Clean bathroom! Easy check in/check out. Staff was kind, courteous and helpful! Will stay there again.

This is my 2nd time staying here, location is the reason why I chose this hotel again. In the heart of Union Square, shops, restaurants are just nearby! Hotels rooms are clean and the size is just right (for not more than 2 persons)!

Was very pleased with the location, service and comfort of the Grand Hyatt Union Square. A great hotel and staff that listens to your requests. The rooms were spacious and the restaurant and bar were warm and inviting.

We stayed three nights in this wonderful hotel in Union Square. The location was superb. The staff could not have been nicer. We had a room on 31st floor with a splendid view of downtown San Francisco and the breakfast was brilliant. Would stay there again any time.

Great location in San Francisco, close to Union Square. Lovely staff who took great care of our needs, especially Maria at the Front Desk and Randy at the front door. Would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting San Francisco.

Stayed at the Grand Hyatt for two days during a business meeting. Hotel appears to have recently been renovated. Rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Bed was nice as well. Internet service was a little slow (could have been because I was a corner room) but overall I enjoyed my stay.

We had a room with bay views so we had a magnificent panoramic view of the city and the bay beyond from very large windows. Everything was great, but the only disappointing thing was that the top floor which is supposed to wonderful views all around the city is off limits except for special functions. Immaculate room, very friendly, accommodating staff ready to help. Highly recommend. Enjoy!

Grand Hyatt reflects San Francisco perfectly. The staff was so nice and accommodating I felt like I've known them for years. Would love to come back and visit again with my wife. The location is perfect!

Loved this place. Almost perfect.few things here and there which need attention.Have stayed in other hyatts in metro cities and this is by far the best one,Location is close to everything. Lots of good restaurants, shopping,china town, fishermans wharf.  Starbucks kiosk is available in the lobby and a store is across the street.Ron, at checkin was very friendly and welcomed us with big smile but g

A beautiful hotel, super friendly and helpful staff. The room was spotless, modern and did not have that 'worn out' look so many big city hotel rooms do. I had an amazing view of the financial district, Chinatown and the bay from my room. Surprisingly little street noise which made for a restful sleep. If you want the best view of the city, go up to the 36th floor and look around. I'm sure they don't encourage this, but it is the best view of the city and the bay by far.

Were staying as a family during July 4th at The Grand Hyatt. Great view on Union Square (large Windows), top quality beds and bathroom, great breakfirst selection and also very good restaurant (high prices though). I can recommend this Hotel for business and pleasure and will return again.

Excellent hotel at Union Square near a variety of very good restaurants. Staff is very professional and friendly. They remember you if you have been a guest before. The lounge has good snack food and cocktails. The servers are very pleasant.

Everything was wonderful - we will definitely be back. The hotel was nice and comfortable and the staff made our stay excellent. We checked in early without and question, received good recommendations from the staff, and were always greeted with a smile.

Great hotel. Modern, comfortable room - great bed. The staff makes sure that you feel at home. Everything is first rate. Love their mobile entry app. And the missing items service is a nice perk. Would not hesitate to stay at this location the next time I'm visiting San Francisco.

Great hotel and stay. This is the level of service I expect from a Hyatt. I hope to visit again. The rooms were clean and updated. Had a great view of the city from a high floor. Obviously parking is very expensive, I would cab next time and just uber/lfyt around the city.

We stayed the hotel with our kids and we all surtisfied. The hotel is very convenient and close to the cable car, drug store, and shopping center. The staff at concierge desk was very kind and did the confrimeation for the tour for me. The door men was very friendly and great, too.

Was able to have 3 rooms on same floor high enough to avoid noise. Valet/bellman/front desk/room service attendant all excellent & friendly. Checking in/out fast. Rooms clean & sufficient towels. Plenty of room for 2 ladies to share a room w/large vanity in bathroom and space to keep items off floor. Convenience of frig & safe. Great views even from 16th floor. Room service prompt w/temperature of food just right. Comfy beds & good pillows. Helpful concierge w/great suggestions. Great, safe location to walk to tons of stores/restaurants. Would return to this Hyatt. Valet expensive ($60+) but in center of downtown (very quick retrieval)

Took our two 13 year olds to San Fran for a girls weekend and stayed here for two nights. Newer hotel with a modern look and feel. Plenty of front desk and front door staff to help. Rooms are on the smaller side with beds that are full not queen. It was hard to share. Beds are also very soft with that top layer of fluff that some people love. I prefer more firm so this was kinda an issue for me but not a deal breaker and again if you like that thick pillow top feel you'll be happy. Location is great and is an easy walk to union square or china town, etc. a lot of construction going on but no noise in the room. Did not have the chance to sample the in house food options but it looked good. Would stay again.....if I got my own bed!

Were in room on 26th floor with amazing bay view, hotel is located in the heart of SF, everything is pretty close. Left a car with only $41/day, only few blocks away there's all shopping area, Starbucks cafe on every corner, opens early, closes late.

I stayed here on two different occasions in June/July. One was with a friend- which happened to be during pride. She had a great room with doors that opened onto the parade- I believe she booked a basic room and didn't have Hyatt status. Without a doubt, look to this place for a late June stay for the location. I was at both the Hilton Union Square (don't bother) and the Westin St. Francis (fine enough but I used points) for comparison.I booked again for one night two weeks later off the California Zephyr. I was disappointed my original room didn't have a window that opened, but after a call they upgrade me to a room with a balcony. I'd definitely give this place a go for visitors.

If a hotel provides you with ear plugs this is already a bad sign. At the Grand Hyatt in S. F. you definitely need them!! There was already a lot of noise coming up to my room (22nd floor) from Union Square but really bad is the major construction work in the Neighborhood going on 24/7. This will stay there for a long time... The location is great, but the staff is rather unfriendly. The breakfast area is small and I had to wait long. Service here is very slow, too. If I pay close to $500 I expect MUCH more. I will definitely not come back...

This is a great place to stay and is a great value at the weekend rate. Accesible to public transportation and a short walk into the financial district, embarcadero and China town. The happy hour is worth a try and the service was amazing.

The hotel occupies a central location, with a few restaurants housed within. We stayed in an Executive Suite using Hyatt Gold Passport points. The room was spacious. Our only complaint was that part of the room had a rotten egg odor. The hotel was good as a departure point for exploring the city. The hotel is often used as a site for conventions, so it can feel a bit crowded/lively in the lobby areas. Note that the hotel lacks an indoor swimming pool.

Stayed here for 3 nights for my birthday, location wise very close to union square (2mins) and Chinatown (5mins). As with most Hyatts the hotel is of a very high standard with great facilities especially the gym which had great views over the city. Rooms were of high standard again with good views and comfort. Nice bars and restaurants maybe not so cheap but worth a visit if you wish not to venture too far one evening. As San Fran is a expensive city to stay with hotel costs I would highly recommend it should your budget stretch. I expect to return on my next visit soon

A great hotel in a great location --- the regency club is a great feature and is highly recommended. This was a pretty good deal despite the salesforce convention pushing availability down all across the city.

It's very perfect hotel for business trip in union square area, this is my second stay in Grand Hyatt - it's really awesome. I think one concern area is road work happening more than 2 years nearby that causes some commutation problem

I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 5 days while attending the Dreamforce Conference and loved everything about this decision. The hotel was close enough to the Moscone Center but not that close, so it wasn't affected by the crazy traffic around the area. Rooms are very spacious and luxurious, and the Staff handled all my requests promptly. The complimentary popcorn and lemonade in the afternoon were a nice surprise while I was waiting for my airport ride. Would definitely recommend!

Rooms were new & renovated - NICE! It was close to everything that I needed for work. Concierge was beyond fabulous & check in was easy. Best part every morning they were happy smiling people that greeted me with enthusiasm even at 4 am

This is what every 5-star Hotel should strive to be. Every staff member was a pro: friendly, respectful, genuine, well-informed, eager to make my visit enjoyable and uncomplicated. From the curb-side Bell-Hops to the Laundry and everyone in-between, this staff knows how to make you feel like an MVP. And the experience didn't end at the Hotel: the ride back to the Airport flew by as the Limousine driver was able to engage with us in a wide-ranging and lively discussion of business such that I wished the drive had required a bit more time. I was in the city for 5 days, and normally I would be in a hurry to get home, but I found myself entertaining the thought of staying a little longer.

We stayed in a club room and they provided food and drink for us each morning and night. The staff was nice. Our room was normal, but the view was amazing. The location is great for shopping, eating, and public transport. A nice safe part of town.

I have stayed in SF many time and this is my first choice for hotel. I usually have to go to the Moscone Convention Center and the walk is not too bad. I choose to be closer to shopping and food options than closer to the Convention Center which is generally boring.The rooms here are always clean as you would expect from Hyatt.Sometimes when I check in I am a little too early, Hyatt seems to have always found room for me when I get there which is great because I have usually been flying quite a few hours by the time I arrive. I know this isn't guaranteed, so I consider myself lucky.There is some construction going on next-door as they are building the new Apple Store. My stay was July 2015 and they should be finished with the new store summer of 2016. Even though construction is usually seen as a bad thing, I did not hear a peep from them any of the 6 nights I stayed. My co-worker also said the same thing.Even though I usually go for business, I have actually stayed here for vacation. It makes a good home base in the center of town.Also, finding a Taxi is no sweat in front of this hotel as there are always a swarm of them waiting. Have also done lyft and Uber, as there is ample room for them to pick-up/drop off,Lobby has a cool feel to it with modern furniture.WiFi is also quite good at this hotel with my experience.

On our way to Maui, we decided to spend a couple of days in San Francisco. We had booked a double room in advance and were excited about our stay. We had also let the hotel know that we were on our honeymoon. When we arrived, we were told that they had no more double beds and were given a room with twin beds instead. We were offered some free amenities as a compensation and were asked to mark something on a list. Not the most elegant way, but it's the thought that counts, so we picked up some Californian wine and strawberries. Unfortunately the free amenities never got to our room and nobody apologized or bothered to ask if everything was OK during our stay. I find it really sad to pay and tip generously and get mediocre service. The hotel pays no attention whatsoever to detail. Maybe you have to be a diamond or platinum member in order to not be treated like a second class guest. If you want quality, book somewhere else!

We love staying at the Hyatt SF Union Square. Great service, food and view of the city , bay & Alcatraz. We enjoyed the Grand club with happy hour and breakfast. The staff was friendly, courteous and accomodating.

The lobby entrance is dark and not too impressive. The room doors and the hallway walls are scuffed. I had to ask two days in a row for housekeeping to vacuum because the floors were not clean, with someone else's hair on my floors. The first time I'd asked for the floors to be vacuumed, my request was ignored. The gym was extremely awkward, with a broken scale, some equipment a bit squeaky, and the stretching area basically in the elevator bank. Not impressive at all. Positives included a gorgeous bar on the mezzanine floor with attentive service, a super bell desk staff who were always friendly and helpful, and a nice bathroom sink area with a modern look.

We stayed here for 5 nights last week, and we were pretty happy with the hotel overall. Upon check in, we were helped very quickly, and upgraded to a higher floor with a better view for being a Platinum member. The view was beautiful from the 36th floor, and the layout of the room was very nice, it even had a vanity area with a makeup mirror. We had the "Romance" package during the first 2 nights which included champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, and free breakfast buffet at One Up located in the hotel. The buffet was small, but was satisfying enough for us. There wasn't many choices, a couple different eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, and pastries. At $25 a head, I wouldn't have paid for it if it wasn't included in our package. We stayed in Napa for a couple nights and returned for another 3 night stay here. The second room wasn't as nice as the first, but still on a high floor. Overall, both rooms were very clean, and the bathrooms had beautiful finishes. The pillows were not comfortable at all, way too soft and flat. I requested the foam pillows, and they weren't much better. In the room they have a card that lists amenities that you can call for and it stated that they would deliver it in a bag and hang it on your door knob and knock when its been delivered. Both times that I called for things to be sent to my room, the people that delivered the items were waiting for me to come to the door, presumably for a tip. I don't mind tipping them, but I don't feel that it is right to advertise that the items will be left for you with a simple knock to let you know it's there, and then have the staff wait around for tips. On our last morning there, we were packing everything up and getting ready for our flight back to Hawaii. I searched high and low for my Gucci carry on bag that I had folded flat in my suitcase for the duration of our trip. It was nowhere to be found. We had been so busy doing things on our last few days there, I hadn't even noticed it was missing until I needed it. Our room was tucked away at the end of a hallway, no one was ever around when we would enter or leave our room, and it was definitely there and now it was gone. It's quite easy to come to the conclusion that the maid(s) took it. I filed a complaint with security and I still have not received a phone call, that they said I would get a couple days after I left on Sunday. So overall, the hotel is in a great location and really nice compared to the other hotels that I looked at in San Fran, and at a reasonable rate. Noise wasn't a problem either.I would definitely stay here again, depending on how this situation is handled. I definitely will not allow maids in my room again. I spent well over $1000 here and it would have been completely worth it....if my $600+ bag wasn't stolen.

The Grand Hyatt at Union Square is excellent. The location, the service and room quality is excellent as well. Although the rooms are typically Hyatt, they have been renovated in recent years and are clean. I can recommend this hotel without question.

My husband and I spent two nights at the Grand Hyatt and had a wonderful stay. The hotel staff is very pleasant and the concierge was very helpful. We got lots of great tips for our visit to SF. The rooms, of course, are well appointed and very comfortable. Only thing is there is major construction going on for a few blocks on Stockton Street so it is a bit hectic trying to navigate the streets around Union Square. We found that it is a short, easy walk to Chinatown. As per one of the listed directions we took the BART from the airport and got off at Powell Street. We then discovered that it is a 5 block, uphill walk to Sutter Street and then 2 blocks over to Stockton where the hotel is located. If you don't mind walk, otherwise grab a cab. Overall, we had a great stay and will definitely book this hotel on a future visit to San Francisco.

This hotel has a wonderful location...if you can splurge for a club room...the breakfasts and hapoy hour is awesome, and David there is great..we stayed there 3 days on our way to Napa, the shopping is everywhere around the hotel...saks and macys and nordstrom, but also a lot of the high end boutiques and the normal stores..China town is a skip and a jump away.... I definitely recommend this hotel

Our stay was on July 9th for 3 nights. The staff at this hotel is courteous and friendly. The room spacious; linen fresh; room very clean. Our view was spectacular. The location at Union Square can't get any better. Walking distance to shopping, restaurants. Hotel has off parking type of valet at a reasonable price. Breakfast was included in my rate; it was worth it. Great service. We would go back to this hotel. Our experience was totally positive. Just a great stay.

Our experience started with super friendly and helpful staff at check-in. We were able to check in a little after noon which was nice since this was technically early. The room had a great view but the view from the fitness center was even better. Both my husband and I commented that the bed and pillows were very comfortable. The location is close to everything in SF

Had a very enjoyable stay at the Grand Hyatt. The hotel is located right on Union Square within a few minutes of all the shops and restaurants. Room was very comfortable and had a tasty late dinner one night in the hotel restaurant. Highly recommended.

Thanks to Yelp for getting us such a great discount staying at Grand Hyatt Hotel. Excellent location. Walking distance to many tourist attraction in downtown. Hotel concierge even offers walking distance self-guide tour list. Very useful!!!The service has been amazing since the moment we checked in the hotel. We received welcome gift few minutes after we got to our room. Great room on 26th Floor!Room is clean and modern. Housekeeping is so friendly and attentive. All the service are absolutely "A+"!!!Fitness Center on 35th floor is breathtaking. The floor to ceiling windows totally showcase downtown San Francisco. The bonus of our stay.... complimentary cookies with YELP logo!! We are here for Yelp 10 Year Anniversary Celebration and the hotel really makes all the Elite Yelpers feeling very special.

I am very impressed with the staff. Everyone is super courteous and one comes away feeling that they genuinely care. The amenities are standard but they will loan you almost anything, including curling irons. Well kept, modern rooms as well.

We stayed for two nights and really enjoyed the experience. A great base from which to explore SF, an old trolley ride away from the piers, a bus ride from the Golden Gate bridge park and a walk to catch ferries to view sights from the sea. Tastefully modernised rooms and lobby/restaurants and courteous staff who helped with anything. Only grouse was the creak of the building in the wind.....I've never had that experience before and when we called reception to ask about it they said yes it was because of the way the building was designed to withstand earthquakes?! Reassured by that the creaking didn't keep us awake.....but surely there is a way to design against earthquakes without the creaking!!

The hotel lobby and entrance seems dated.Rooms were your typical Hyatt rooms,more of business than pleasure.Bathroom was also ordinary.The staff were courteous esp. the room service were quick.Location is fantastic as in the heart of union square.The high cost can only be justified by the location.

Okay this is our 3rd visit to this hotel. Stayed in the Clubroom on the 31st floor. Hotel very well located and most areas are walkable to. Hotel was busy over the 4 nights we stayed but staff were always pleasant .I have always requested a bay view prior to my stays but have never recivied one. I did put this request on my booking but was disappointed on check in this was not noticed until I remarked on it, I was told no bay views available but I will give you a room with a nice view, turned out to be a view from the rear of the hotel onto the flat roof of another hotel, just a minor issue but it would be nice for requests to be looked at and I do appreciate these cannot always be honoured.Anyway room itself was fine and the Grand Club facility was excellent, staff always cheerfull and helpful and willing to make effort to have a conversation.good selection of hot and cold drinks and beer and wine at $3. Plenty to eat for breakfast and nice snacks of an evening.Great Hotel to stay in. Thank you Hyatt

I was at Grand Hyatt San Francisco during last WWDC, Apple Event. It was very near the place, so for me was very good, but it looks I little bit far from San Francisco turistic attractions. The included breakfast was very good, but I not sure it is included in every reservation, I was using a business agreement. If you are going by your one, check it before. The room was very good, big and clean.

Overall we had a great stay at the Grand Hyatt. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and seemed eager to assist. In fact, we were most impressed by the service offered at this facility. Although we arrived early, we were offered early check in and were given a complimentary bottle of wine after the hotel recognized that it was our anniversary.The room was clean and modern, and although the hotel acknowledged that construction was going on in the area, we did not experience any problems with noise. We had a partial view of the bay, which was great!! We had lunch at the hotelâ€™s restaurant on the first day and fell in love with the food! Finally, the location of this hotel was perfect for us!

Nice hotel, very modern. Close to MUNI so very easy to get around. Lobby was nice and room had some nice features, the blinds were amazing. Was there for a conference. Nice facilities for that. Cleanliness is my biggest concern with hotels. First room we were given had dirt on the bed and garbage in the room. Got switched to a room on a lower floor, directly across from very loud ice machine. Definite downgrade. New room,first three towels I picked up had hair on them (not from me), there was also hair in the tub. Gross. I actually looked at the sheets before getting into bed. Rest of stay was nice and staff were friendly but that really turned me off.

Great hotel and location. Only issue was not their fault: construction noise next door. Great views, and tranquil room. Lots of hotel choices in San Francisco, this hotel stands out for ambiance. Next trip I plan to visit the OneUp hotel bar, looks interesing.

The location is excellent but all else did not live up to expectation. The room was adequate and clean but small with no view. Breakfast NOT included feels like a penalty, come off it Grand Hyatt what's grand about that! Didn't eat in for dinner either although we were not invited to either.The reception is more like a hot desk zone or drop in centre with no privacy and an immigration like policy of "stand behind the line" which does not make one feel welcome!

enjoyed the location and nice to see the real sf not just tourist locations. Walkable to port ferry building and chinatown . The room was on the 8 th floor and quiet. Take a trip to the 35th floor to the fitness center and enjoy the view of the bay. The vending machine stoled my money but i will get over it. There is filtered water machine up there also. Its easy to get transportation to airport by bart(8.95 short walk from powell st station) or airport shuttle (16 dollars) .

Haven't stayed here for the last several years, but glad I did so this time. The hotel has been completely remodeled and the rooms are great. We were on the 30th floor with huge windows overlooking the cityscape. Rooms are very conveniently equipped... Power outlets easily accessible for charging tech items and phones, sophisticated lighting system, adjustable reading lights at both sides of bed, separate small vanity area outside bathroom. The beds are all white, with great linens and very comfortable. Baths have beautiful tiled showers and modern vessel sinks. I didn't want to leave! Be sure to take advantage of the club room if you can. The setting is magnificent, views all the way to the bay. The room is large and very comfortable, breakfast is extensive and gourmet.Negatives: 1. lobby is an awkward configuration and feels very cramped and corporate. Some seating areas terribly uncomfortable, with very low chairs that are hard to get in and out of. Definitely all about business, not leisure. 2. Smokers linger outside in front of the hotel and are too close to the property, so smoke wafting in leaves a lingering cigarette odor that is unpleasant.On the positive side, there is a coffee bar in the lobby, and lemonade and popcorn some afternoons.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt at the End of August for 5 nights. This is the second time that we have stayed at this wonderful hotel. Our room was on the 17th floor, overlooking Union square. Our room was cleaned to a very high standard every day. My Husband told Maria at check in that it was going to be our 34th wedding Anniversary during our stay she arranged for champagne and chocolates to be sent to our room, courtesy of the hotel. This was very thoughtful:) all the staff were very helpful and friendly at the hotel.

I stayed here for my friends wedding and the hotel served its purpose perfectly. The small lobby bar worked for the small wedding party for pre drinks and although the rooms aren't large (as expected in a city hotel) they were still roomy and nicely acquainted.
