Hyatt remodeled this hotel a few years ago (thankfully) and it is now a favorite of ours when we are visiting. We used to live in San Francisco and enjoy the central location this hotel provides.

Very clean rooms. Excellent service. Friendly staff who wen tout of their way to satisfy.Only downside is the construction for the MUNI subway line extension going on right outside the hotel on Stockton St. Not their fault, Just letting others know.

As always a great place to stay. Our room on the 25th floor had an amazing view of Alcatraz, Coit Tower and Angel Island. The staff is responsive and very polite. The room was also very comfortable and exceptionally clean. We loved the "feel" of the lobby and mezzanine bar. We have stayed here twice and will definitely be back.

Location is right in the heart of SF city center, surrounded by great Restaurants, shops, department store, and hub of transportation. Famous tram on Powell street is at the Conner. Great courtesy of hotel staffs.

massive construction all around the hotel. rooms been to be up-dated, TV did not work properly, black out drapes would not lower, cheap quality to room. The room was very clean and the staff is very friendly, but unable to fit the problems in my room.

My fiancee and I stayed here over the Labor Day weekend in one of their larger corner rooms. The hotel itself is very pretty, is modern, and has many nice thoughtful touches such as books in the rooms, motorized shades, and they even provided free treats in the lobby on Sunday. While I am used to primarily staying in huge suites, as I travel to Las Vegas often, I can say that the room was a good sized with a good sized bathroom as well. For San Francisco this is a rarity as the majority of hotels here, even at the 4/5 star level have rooms that are the size of a walk in closet in Vegas. I feel that Grand Hyatt is significantly better than the Fairmont or the Intercontinental Mark as both are overpriced, and are frankly decaying. Also their service was far below the high standard set by Grand Hyatt. I also enjoyed OneUp's restaurant and their lounge. The food and drinks were quite good, as was the service and the ambiance. The only negatives with my stay here were that the hotel doesn't have a pool and parking is ridiculous. The hotel doesn't have its own garage so you have to park in one across the street or valet. Valet was, I think $62 a day. Look, I am far from cheap and I know that this charge is the norm in San Francisco, but that still doesn't make it right. Even in LA it is cheaper and I think LA prices are ridiculous. I also noticed that there was a large gap between the floor and our door and the rooms weren't soundproofed too well, though this is also the norm for San Fran. This all being said the hotel deserves it 4 star rating. Actually I would give it 4.25 stars if that were a thing. I would also highly recommend it for anyone who wants to be in the middle of the action in San Fran. It is next to Union Square, Macy's, Neiman Marcus, Saks Fifth Avenue, and is a few minutes walk to the Bart Station and Chinatown.

My husband and I were here for four nights over this Labor Day weekend. The service was excellent, the room was clean, the restaurant and drinks were yummy. I missed having a coffee maker in the room as it's the first thing I do when waking up. Apparently there is a coffee "cart" in the lobby but I have no desire to get dressed and go down to get a cup of coffee. They have complementary juice and snack in the afternoon. We had an issue with the adjoining room having a party and making a huge amount of noise. At 10:30 I called the front desk and the lady asked me by name "how can I help you"?I told her what was going on and in no time security was there to intervene.

How do you love a hotel chain and hate it as well? When we stayed at the Berlin Germany Grand Hyatt in July of 2014, I wrote a Tripadvisor review about how we loved everything about that hotel except that the air conditioning was substandard. No matter how low we adjusted the temperature it was too hot in our room. Guess what happened in San Francisco? We absolutely loved everything about this hotel especially the Staff, the Club Room, the amazing service we received and the cleanliness of our room, but the Air Conditioning was terrible! Yes, it was not hot outside to some peoples standards, but walking up and down the hills of San Francisco several hours in 73 to 75 degrees can be warming to say the least. I would loved to have come back to my hotel suite to cool down at my requested 68 degrees. The temperature in the room was 72 degrees despite the setting on the thermostat. (Yes, I had the blind shades pulled down all day). I should not have had to take a cool shower to cool off, but that is exactly what I had to do. Twice, I had hotel maintenance attend my suite to improve the performance of the A/C, to no avail. An employee confided in me that the hotel policy (all Grand Hyatt Hotels) was to restrict the A/C to rooms in order to save energy and therefore money. That would explain the exact same problem we had in Berlin.I am all for saving the environment, but when I am spending some pretty big bucks to stay at a luxury hotel, I don't want to lay awake sweating into my sheets trying to fall asleep.If I stay at a Grand Hyatt again, it will be at a winter resort. I hope the windows will open.

Awesome view from 33rd floor, service was outstanding, room comfortable, gym quite good, club lounge excellent. We stayed there for a getaway weekend in SF and everything went smoothly, exceeding expectations.

The location of this hotel is perfect. All the big store are super close and really good restaurant as well. The hotel have an awesome bar. Order the Moscow is just amazing! Staff is very friendly and the room is very clean with good decor. Definitely worth the money.

This was our first stay at Grand Hyatt San Francisco and we loved it! Staff were very friendly and helpful, room was spacious, modern and came with an amazing cityscape view. Location at Union Square was very central to all cafes, restaurants, awesome shopping and close to all major tourist spots. We will definitely be back.

This Grand Hyatt is right on Union Square and in the middle of everything! Currently they are doing a lot of construction on the Union Square side of the hotel so I requested to be on the other side. The rooms were clean and nice and the staff here really is fantastic. They were all very friendly and helpful any time I talked to them the hotel is close to the Cable car and Streetcar lines and lots of great restaurants. I would definitely stay here again!

If you are visiting San Francisco, I am pretty impressed and definitely recommend this hotel. Great staff members and good service. Most of all great location for sightseeing, restaurants and shopping.

Attended a conference in SF and always stay here. Great location away from the Moscone conference center crowds. Having the park across the street is a nice retreat to people watch. Staff, check in and great lobby are all pluses.

This is not the Hyatt we have experienced in other locations. Staff was polite and helpful, however it does not make up for the lack of everything else. Belhop was snooty and pretentious acting. Not at all interested in helping us with our luggage.Our room was clean but nothing special. I do think that extra effort could be made to remove water spots, smudges, and streaks throughout. Although we did have a good nights sleep, the entire building seemed tired. For the price, we will try elsewhere on our next trip to S.F.

I had a great weekend stay that was very restful at the Grand Hyatt. The room, service, and fitness center were all really good. I have stayed at several hotels by Union Square, and I would definitely consider staying at the Grand Hyatt again.

My wife and i made our first visit to San Francisco to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary and our stay at the Grand Hyatt made the trip all the more special. The views from our room on the 17th floor were spectacular, the hotel was conveniently located, and the staff were very attentive and helpful. Their crab omelet is a must have for breakfast!

My wifey and I stayed here and really enjoyed it. First off, itâ€™s perfectly located to just about anything in San Francisco. Right in the middle of all the shopping, great places to eat, a mile away from ATT Stadium, a couple blocks from Chinatown, right next to the trolley line, etc. We easily strolled to and from the ballpark, grabbing a couple of drinks along the way. Additionally, the staff was very friendly, extremely helpful with directions, and helping us tape up a box of wine before departing for the airport. The rooms were nicely sized, clean, and very comfortable. I usually hit the gym and use Wi-Fi, but didnâ€™t have the chance during this shorter stay. The only complaints may have been the noise from the busy street and the $80 valet parking, but any major city center youâ€™re going to get noise. End result, if I were going back to San Francisco I would definitely check availability at the Grand Hyatt.

This hotel is facing away from Union Square but is in a great area. Check-in was a breeze with friendly staff from bell boys to reception. Hotel is up to date and quite quaintly small and cozy. There is a fire going for the chilly days which is warming and welcoming in the lobby area!Rooms are a bit small for 2 check-in bags but is clean and modern. Window opens a few inches for fresh air. There is an automatic black-out shade Air conditioning was good. Sheets and bed was heavenly. Housekeeping is wonderful and cleans that room perfectly leaving us with more than adequate amenities and wonderfully made beds. Breakfast was a small area which is always close to being full. Staff were super attentive and wonderful with service. However, the breakfast buffet was really small compared to the ones we have in Asia. All dishes were western such as scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages, oatmeal and a selection of fruits. Quite surprised by the small buffet available. Coffee machine was in the room. I had requested for a tea kettle one day when I was on the way back to my room and was surprised when the front desk asked me to use the coffee machine instead to heat the water. Well, no surprises when I didn't manage to get my cup of tea for the entire trip. Apart from that hiccup, this is a great hotel and wonderful place to stay in.

This hotel is conveniently located in Union Square close to all the shops and entertainment. It has a great onsite bar with live music at night. Beautiful, elegant rooms and extremely friendly and helpful staff. I would stay here again.

Great hotel stayed for two nights. Had interconnecting rooms for family. Fantastic breakfast with berries fruits, yogurt and normal scrambled eggs bacon , pancakes etc fresh juice really good. Highly recommend the hotel and its great skyline views fo Sna Francisco. 39th floor has views of Alcatraz!

In town for leisure. Perfect location. Walk to china town. Shopping. Dining. The train. Room had a great view. The room was nicely furnished. Clean most importantly. Upon arriving front office staff very welcoming. Will definitely stay here again.

Love this hotel, the staff is always so nice and arranges our room before we show up if we have an occasion. The suite is amazing and is so worth the extra money! We stay here for occasions or just if we want to go catch a giants game, its close enough to enough activities and the price is good :)

It was great pleasure staying at the Grant Hyatt in SFO, cant wait to be back. Great property, friendly staff and excellent location. A short distance from Union Square and Moscone makes it very attractive.

Wonderful stay with Great views, fantastic breakfast. Reall loved our stay .would come back again. Easy walk to all the shops and trams. had interconnecting rooms which was a great thing with family of four. Highly recommend. This hotel.

Grand Hyatt stay was just what I needed. Only had one night to stay in San Fran and the Grand Hyatt did a great job getting me into my room early and out the next day without any issues. Would recommend this as a friendly and well maintained hotel. Staff was great and accomidating.

I stayed 5 nights in the Grand Hyatt SF. Since walking in i felt that the Hotel's lobby to be small compared to the size of the hotelâ€_ Lobby always gave me a feeling of being full all the time. Going up to the room, We stayed in a Grand CLub room. Room is large, with a nice bathroom. huge bed, automatic drapes, nice small closet for 1, and a huge glass walking shower, no curtains.Grand Club lounge isn't one of the largest we've been. BUt it was nice. The STaff in the Lounge was just perfect! Always attentive and willing to help. It was the highlight of the stay for sure. we used the lounge a lot, they made us feel welcome all the time.The Hotels location was the best! we walked all around the neighborhood. It has high end shops and plazas and great places to eat. couldn't be better. fantastic.I used the online checkout, worked fine for me. really nice touch of being a hyatt gold passport and getting point for my stay.

This is a wonderful place to stay in SF. The staff is fabulous-knowledgeable and accommodating. Location is great-near to transportation, restaurants & sights. Parking is expensive, but that is true all through SF

This is place that has a great location convenient to downtown financial and the shops around Union Square. If you get a high floor room you would have a very good view of San Francisco. If you do not pay enough or do not get lucky with a higher floor room you can always go up to the top floor for a drink or a meal and have one of the best view the city has to offer. Even if you are not staying here it is worthwhile taking the trip to get the magnificent view, specially in a clear day. It is indeed a treat to stay here.

This is a solid hotel, befitting of the Hyatt brand. Beware there is a bunch of construction around Union square, but still it's a great location for eating, drinking, shopping and anything else you'd want to do in SF.Pros:Nice, modern hotel. Typical of HyattGreat service from front desk and bell deskGood location, minus the constructionCons:Restaurant is too small for the size of the hotelSan Francisco was dirtier, smellier, full of homeless people than ever. I love going here for 24-72 hours, but this city is going down hill

Beautiful renovated hotel in the heart of the city in Union Square. Very friendly check in and check out, eager to help doormen, and prompt response when we buzzed for a couple housekeeping and toiletry items. The lady at the concierge was helpful and informative, gave us great advice for on places we needed to know and how to get therr, and a map of the main points of attraction. The restaurant has a wonderful breakfast buffet that is bang for your buck if you book a Breakfast Rate room. Would stay at again for sure. Beds super comfy, shower and bathroom clean and updated, comp wifi.

The Grand Hyatt in San Francisco is always a first class experience. The staff is exceptional, well trained, and very friendly and efficient. Excellent location and perfect for both leisure and business travelers.

Attending a conference here and the majority of our group stayed at the Grand Hyatt. Room was clean, well appointed and nice view. Good location, easy walk to conv center and other areas downtown. On site restaurant left little to be desired -- too small/crowded.

Visited USA in July. This hotel is best for people who love to shop. It is right next to union square and everything from restaurants to big branded shops are a minute away. I feel it is better to live near union square than fisherman's wharf as this place is more lively. Ben the receptionist was very sweet and friendly at the time of check in. Location- best location to stayRooms- they are decent rooms, spacious. As construction going on near the hotel. Try taking the rooms on higher floors to reduce noise. Service- good service. We were disturbed around 12 am by a knock on the door and there were two people on the door sent by the hotel. They presumed there was no one in the room. We felt really annoyed and weird about it. At the time of check out they gave us a lunch coupon of $150 which we could use at there restaurant. It was really sweet of them to realise there mistake and compensate for same.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Very Clean. Fast Check-in and Check-out Process. Great Amenities. They were able to get transportation around the city and to and from the city very promptly. Fast free wifi. Keurig available in the rooms.

The views from the floor-to-ceiling windows on the 20th floor were really amazing. Room was otherwise nice, clean, pretty standard. Some very loud Euro-visitors one night at 3 AM -- I guess they were jet-lagged, but they were pretty darned loud even for daytime. The lot and street adjacent to the hotel has construction going on, which a cabbie told us has been going on for years -- I'm glad we turned in the rental car when we got there are didn't try to drive, it's a mess.

The hotel was very clean and great location. Room was a bit small for 5 star hotel. Staff extremely helpful knowledgeable, specialty concierge staff who assisted with directions, transport and booking rent a car. the hotel also arranged to take the rent a car back for us. Awesome . Hotel had free pop corn and drink in lobby each day. Room was also great

The hotel is adjacent to Union Square and the whole of the city centre is within walking distance. Chinatown is 5 mins away and Fisherman's Wharf is 25 mins walk.The underground and the famous cable cars are only 5 mins walk. The underground (Bart) provides easy access to the airport and is recommended.The hotel is very clean and modern and meets any high level of expectations.The views across the city are excellent, particularly in the evening.

We stayed there for a day earlier this year coming from some other city and before catching the flight. It was a very nice stay. The staff are very professional of course and friendly. The breakfast was good. Out room wasn't closer to the top of the hotel but still the views were nice. Some essentials are not automatically in the room and you have to ask for them. But they were delivered promptly when we asked. The location is very nice. Lots to do around and convenient for doing all the touristic stuff.

Location, staff, room, bed were ALL great. Only thing that could had been better was more comfortable chairs in the room, both were hard and stiff, couldn't relax in them. Beds were great, staff was awesome and friendly, rooms were clean. Location was great and centrally located. This part of the MINIMUM 200 Character Survey I don't agree with.

The Grand Hyatt SF is quite nice and the rooms comfortable, if small. Check in was easy and although check out was very crowded, one of the staff was actually paying attention and dealt with our requirements to store our luggage. Amazing attention in this day and age of non-customer service!

Always enjoy the hotel and pleasant staff here. Great location near Union Square. Perfect for a quick get away. Rooms are always clean and beds are really comfortable. I highly recommend the Grand Hyatt.

Full disclosure -- this was my first time to SF, so I can't compare the Grand Hyatt to any other hotels in the city. That being said, my room (king bed) was fine. Clean and comfortable. Some of the features are odd for the sake of being odd. WiFi was pretty good. Many commenters have noted the great location and they're right -- Union Square is a fantastic spot if you're a tourist (walk to Chinatown, AT&T Park, Ferry Building, etc.). If you're into shopping I imagine Union Square is the place to be. A few specific notes:- Parking. Valet parking is around $60. There is a public parking lot (the Sutter-Stockton garage) just across the intersection to the northeast from the GH for <$40/day. I used the lot for four days and it was clean and convenient. Traffic and parking in SF -- and Union Square, especially -- are such a mess that I didn't really want to drive anywhere. Almost anyplace I couldn't walk (with the exception of Muir Woods), I took a cab/Uber because I didn't want to deal with finding parking. The Sutter-Stockton lot worked well for me (with no additional inconvenience) and saved us some money. - Construction. Other commenters have noted the construction (someone is apparently tunnelling to the center of the earth). If you're in a room on a low floor you WILL hear construction noise late at night and early in the morning. I have no status at Hyatt and requested a standard king room (didn't pay for an upper floor). They gave me a 10th floor room (relatively low) and earplugs were a help (earplugs are provided in your room). Certainly not a criticism of the hotel, but it is something to consider.- The TV/cable package and interface is a mess. I would kill for a hotel to offer a regular cable package with a regular remote that works like a regular television. Watch a movie on your laptop instead. Overall, the GH is fine and I would probably stay there again (assuming it was cost competitive). It's hard to say there's "value" given the price, but it's SF and the price of most hotels are seemingly out of whack. I certainly wouldn't discourage anyone from staying at the Grand Hyatt.

Lots to like about the hotel. Everything is clean and in working order. The elevators are fast without a long wait usually. The beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are clean. In addition, Wifi worked well, there were lots of outlets, and staff was quick to respond to requests. On the downside, rooms are small and the floor to ceiling - wall to wall window takes a little getting used to. There was a motorized shade, with 3 different panels so you could block the direct sunlight which helped. The hotel is amazingly quiet for such a large hotel. Self parking is $41 a night and across the street with unlimited in/out. Plenty of really good restaurants in the area within walking distance. Public transportation is easily available and the concierge will advise you on the best way to accomplish your travel goals.

Horrible waste of a stay, I should have stay elsewhere. Staff was rude and lacking of service for a Grand Hyatt. I have had and did have better service a Hyatt Regency or regular Hyatt. This is a poor representation of the Hyatt family. I wouldn't stay here again.

My experience at the Grand Hyatt, was filled with errors and all we got was lip service. Still waiting for a gift and its been a week. Be firm and when quoted a price ensure they honor the rate and the room agreed upon.

Location is the best feature about this hotel - I found it old and in need of some serious renovations - I stayed it here a couple of times (which is hard because it's highly demanded) and the rooms I got needed some serious renovations, felt run down and unattractive. Below par for a Grand Hyatt.

Outstanding all around. Great friendly staff, excellent food, spacious rooms, great views, awesome location. Hardly ever have a problem with Hyatt stays. Doormen unusually friendly as is the maid service

I had a great time at this hotel in which we got there with our children at midnight and the night manager truly took great care of us and he facilitated our connected rooms and they send a bottle of red wine to the room for my Wife and I , Breakfast was lovely at the club room and the internet service was very adequate , I can only say thank you for a great 5 days stay at the Hayatt , Will use the same hotel again for sure

I expected more from a Grand Hyatt. This perhaps is low on their scale of hotels. Very basic and nothing special about it. Clunky elevators and tired rooms. I had to ask the housekeeping personnel to come and clean the bathroom when I checked in. Apparently, only clean towels and amenities were put there. At least I hope they were clean. Personnel was responsive, so that was good. I hate the smell of urine.

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco is always my first choice downtown. Centrally located, GREAT staff, OneUP all make it an easy choice. I come the San Francisco a couple times a month and when available I love this property. perfect business hotel. Walking distance to most everything, good restaurant and lounge in the hotel and the staff understands the business traveler. Easy in and out, always a cab and great meeting rooms.

The hotel is very conveniently located next to Union Square and Chinatown. It delivers exactly what one would expect form a big modern hotel. The room was good and the service good. Being so central to the city, it is expensive so if I was in San Francisco on a budget I'd most likely stay elsewhere.

Good location @ the heart of union square. Fast Wi-Fi. Very comfortable bed & pillows. Coffee facilities & equipments in the room. Quite noisy because of the construction behind the building. Don't prefer the rooms overlooking union square.

I stayed in the GH on a recent visit to San Francisco. I was there on business and it was my first time in the City. First impressions of the hotel: it's very busy/ very touristy/ great location/ nice rooms. Detailed impressions: The hotel is located at Union Square which is very convenient as there are department stores all around the square plus quite a few restaurants and cafes. I've never stayed in a hotel like the GH before. It's very busy and almost feels like an airport terminal at times. My room was nice but I wouldn't say that it was 'warm and inviting'. Most amenities aren't in your room when you get there but they provide you with a list of the things you can ask for from room service (free of charge). One night when I came back to my room after meetings all evening my room had not been cleaned. By this time it was 10pm and I had brought take out to eat. When I called down to the reception they were very apologetic and said they could send me fresh towels. After hearing how annoyed I was they agreed to send someone up to clean my room but needed me to vacate my room for 45 mins. Annoyed and hungry I told them I would go down to the restaurant and they agreed not to charge me for the dinner. Dinner at the hotel restaurant was surprisingly great. I had a fish stew and it cheered me up. Overall my experience at the GH was ok. I wouldn't say it was bad (they rectified the room cleaning issue straight away) but the hotel lacks the inviting feeling you want when you come back to your hotel after a day of meetings. It does the job and I might stay there again.

Centrally located by Union Square. Short walk to Chinatown and close to cable car going to Fisherman's Wharf.Nice hotel, friendly staff and decent bar. Good lunch at reasonable prices. Clean good size rooms.Recommended.

We stayed here for my birthday. When we told them it was my birthday they upgraded our room! The room itself was very nice and the bed was very comfortable.The location was great. We were right in Union Square and were within walking distance of so much. Highly recommend!

Outstanding service, beautiful rooms, extremely comfortable beds, attentive staff. Perfect in every way. We stayed at the Marriott Suites as well during the same trip and had beds that were hard as a rock and HVAC that blows directly on you all night. The Hyatt is an excellent value if you can afford a well priced luxury hotel.

Big room nice bathroom, great view clean and a double size bed with a very good quality mattress. Good price for a king room with bay view. The staff very polite and always available to help. Very close to downtown. Waking distance to Union Square and Chinatown. What else you need to have a great stay? Very good choice .

We enjoyed a top floor suite with fabulous views over the city. the suite was amazing with great space, luxurious bathroom and very comfortable bed.The club floor does get busy but the breakfast and evening service is very welcoming, so it's not surprising that it attracts a lot of guests. Location couldn't be better for us as tourists on this visit to SF. The open top buses go from the opposite corner of Union Square and you are perfectly placed for jumping onto both the cable car lines. (catch the cars one or two stops up from the turn arounds - as they never fill the cars there for this reason). You can walk to all the major shops, Chinatown and Little Italy.Service was outstanding - every one we encountered was friendly and couldn't do enough for us. We were made to feel valued and appreciated. The only slight negative is that the windows do let in a fair bit of city noise, even when closed. Though on the plus side, the windows can be opened which is rare these days.

This is a great base beside Union Sq for San Fran. We were welcomed by a very nice receptionist who could not have been more helpful and throughout the service was excellent. The Concierge were very knowledgeable and efficient in booking restaurants(try 54 Mint - an excellent new Italian 10 minutes walk away). Rooms were well appointed, nice decor with very good bathrooms and comfortable beds. Breakfast menu was good. Only issue was it was very busy during the summer season and the lifts were slow. Also be aware there is a lot of construction around Union Sq which is noisy so go for a high room.

This Hyatt is exceptional. Front desk was extremely accommodating. The staff in the Club lounge were exceptional and the food/beverage choices were fantastic. Everything fresh and abundant. Even at peak times everything was stocked and tables and eating areas were clean and welcoming. Kat at the front desk was so very accommodating too. She was happy to help me with my floor requests and treated me as if she had known me all my life.

My fiancÃ© and I came to the beautiful city of San Francisco with two of our friends for a couples vacation. We stayed at the Lavish,Trendy Grand Hyatt Union Square. When we arrive we were surprise to see different conception of the front desk,We loved it.We received help from a agent by the name of Samaj. Samaj was very helpful and friendly. He offered us bottled water and Give us room upgrade. He also offered for us to call down ask for him personally if we had any discrepancies or problems with our room. Can you say Five star service? The room he put us in was beautiful,very clean and had a great view of the City. But what really made Samaj a Super Star was, when the Conicerge desk was closed. He give us great recommendations of thing to do in the city and see. He Also Made restaurant reservations for us. Which really made our trip easy and rememberable. He sent us to the Press Club and a restaurant called Blue Sterm. We're they Treat us like VIPS. My fiancÃ© jokingly said he must have called in a big favor for us. We had a great time and was able to meet other young couples. Also he recommend we go to 1300 Fillmore for Sunday Brunch and It was delicious. For a great surprise they had live Jazz. I recommend any young couple or anybody who want to be in the know about San Francisco or its nightlife to talk to this Guy. The only negative thing about the hotel was the construction near the hotel. But We will definely becoming back to the Grand Hyatt, next time we come to San Francisco.

the bellman were rude, never smiled, and seemed like they did not want to be bothered. they lost our luggage and did not seem concerned, they counted number of pieces of luggage, even though one had someone else's name on it. instead of being embarrased, they made it seem like it was our problem.

I stayed at Grand Hyatt for five nights while visiting a conference at the Moscone Center. It is clearly within walking distance to Moscone and to the city center. At the time there was however a lot of construction work at the streets nearby that made it a little bit cumbersome. The staff was helpful, the room clean and the size of the room was clearly enough for me. The safety locker in the room was not big enough for my laptop but this is a common problem at most hotels. Although there was earplugs available in the room it was very silent and I could not hear anything from the streets.At Grand Hyatt you can go up to the top flor to watch the view over San Fransisco Bay. I took the elevator every morning and night. The first morning there was bad weather and there was not much to see. The other mornings I was met with a sign stating that the viewing area was closed for a private cermeny but when I glimpsed round the corner there was nothing happening or being prepared. So for some reason the viewing area was closed most of the time I spent at Grand Hyatt.

Nice hotel. Rooms were great. Employees very helpful. We stayed here two nights and went to two Giants games. We walked to and from the night game on Friday. It is about a 25 minute walk. We felt safe walking because this is a good area of San Francisco. Saturday we took a cab because one was waiting at the curb when we left the motel. I believe the fare was $8 before tip. We didn't eat or use room service at the hotel.There is construction going on next door which made the street very congested trying to get to the valet parking area in front of hotel but it was a Friday afternoon and San Francisco was very busy to try to get around.It is a new building going in next door so construction is going to last for quite a while.

We had a great stay! The hotel itself was very clean and updated. The staff was amazing. Especially Ann and David that work on the club level. We will stay here every time we go back to SFO because of them. The location is also close to Union Square, Mall and all public trans stations.

Hotel was perfectly located, staff was exceptional in every way and room was extremely quiet and well appointed. As a lifetime Marriott Rewards member this hotel got an A+, Will defintely stay here again! Only tiny negative was valet/Bellman. We pulled up to check in and they just stared at us which made us believe we were in the wrong area to park, so we had to ask them.

We stayed here for 4 nights on our way home from Hawaii. Hotel is located just off Union square a block or two away from Market street, trolley buses and cable cars. Room was modern and well appointed, great view of Downtown and part of the Bay from the 22nd floor. Concierge were very helpful and staff provided great service

From beginning to end, this hotel did not disappoint. I was very impressed by the customer service, from check-in to departure, including serving staff, bellmen, etc. The hotel is in a central location to a number of restaurants and shopping.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt recently when attending a large convention at the convention center. The hotel is well taken care of, the rooms and all public spaces were very clean, the staff was great, the meeting space and food and beverage at the hotel were top notch. The large amount of construction going on outside the hotel makes for a surpricing early morning wake up! Take advantage of the ear plugs that are provided! But, an overall great experience.

The hotel, staff, and area were all exceptional. I highly recommend staying here. It is located right on Union Square, where you can find lots of shopping and dining options. The overall feel of the hotel was luxurious. The fitness center was nice and had a great view of San Francisco.

I decided to try the Hyatt because of its location in San Francisco, really near Union Square. It turned out to be a disappointment. The location is good, but the hotel feels like a train station. Lots of people in and out. The check in desk is not a real desk, the lobby is weird too. The rooms are okay, but the mini bar comes empty. I ordered two small bottles of water and it took almost 20 minutes to get them and the hotel charge was $21dollars. For almost $300 a night, I would say there was very little value for money. Definitely one to avoid.

An excellent business hotel that was easy to use and very friendly. Located within walking distance of the business district and good access to the bay front area with its restaurants and stores. Service within the hotel was excellent, with very friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are tastefully designed and provide all you need for your stay. Online check out was qui and simple and saved time on the morning of departure.

Great hotel, great location, rooms were clean, diamond club staff were friendly, concierge was very knowledgeable and helpful with suggestions and directions (maps), bellmen were fantastic and always there day or night to welcome me and open the doors!

Although the hotel has been remodeled you still get the smoke smell in the rooms from years of use. Rooms are comfortable and clean. People are friendly but expect about 30 to 40 minutes for luggage delivery. Didn't appear to be a real busy day as we walked right up to front desk.$56 for valet parking which was much more the others. Location is great but there are others that are better value for equivalent or slightly more money.

The hotel is superbly located on Union Square. Everything in SF is close or can be easily reached, either by walking or using public transportation. Staff at the GH was friendly and forthcoming, really making life easier. Modern room, a bit on the smallish side as to be expected in a major city. We, a family of three, coped quite well though. The gym on the 35th floor offered stunning views and got really busy during the morning rush. Equipment could be a bit better maintained -- showing some wear and tear, nothing what attention to detail could not cure.

Located just across from Niketown, on Union Square, this hotel has a nice bar and restaurant, and pleasant rooms. We had two double beds with comfortable beds/bedding, and a view to other rooftops. The higher level bayside rooms have spectacular views, but can be more costly. The union square side views are nice too, but currently have large construction noise and may impede future views. We'd definitely stay again, really enjoyable stay.

Our room was on the 26th floor overlooking the financial district. The room was spectacular and has modern finishing with remote control blinds that you could control from your bed. The lobby is beautiful and they serve free popcorn and limonade in the afternoon and the staff from the front desks to the doorman were always smiling and very helpful. I highly recommend this place the only thing is their is no pool.

This hotel is in a great location on Union Square. The rooms are small and quite compact as most are in SF but nice. Bathroom is good size and recently redone. View is great (we were on 25th floor). The fitness room has an amazing view on 35th floor.

The GH is conveniently located to all major shopping centers. Easy to get around. Staff is very knowledgeable and offered great advise. The room service is excellent and worthwhile. My room was left spotless when cleaning occured. I definetly reccomend staying at the Hyatt

Bathroom shower head is poorly designed and just annoying to use. The air conditioning in the room just doesn't cool the room. The wifi is spotty. Room service tray was in the hall all day long even after I called to advise them to pick it up. I did like ordering room service on the television.

We had 2 rooms in this hotel for a week. The service was good, the housekeeping was very good, and the location was fantastic. Walked to wharf, AT&T park, restaurants all over town. This hotel was very reasonable for all that it offered!

We stayed 2 nights in room 2019. It had a great view of Union Square with bay in distance. The room was very clean and the staff were all very nice and helpful. The concierge was very patient helping us with directions to different attractions and how to take public transportation in great details. Our departure flight was in the late night. They stored our luggages after we check-out so that we could go out to do our sightseeing until it was time to go to airport.The Stockton Street next the hotel was under major construction. Traffic was very chaotic. Although our room was on the 20th floor we still could hear traffic outside. One night some people were protesting in front of Macy's across Union Square. We could hear the noise very clearly.

Traveled with a great friend to celebrate being cancer free. I was excited to be in the heart of the city and enjoy all the at SF has to offer. I poured over reviews and even though I tend towards Hilton (bc of my rewards card), the Grand Hyatt stood out. We were so impressed that this busy huge hotel made us feel so welcome. The concierge was extremely helpful with all of our questions and setting up a rental car for us to tour Napa for a day. (They work with Enterprise and the car will be dropped to the valet for you and that is where you can return it, VERY EASY!) Housekeeping was excellent as well. The ultimate experience for us was that front desk agent Steve N. took note of what I was celebrating and upon returning to our room the first night, he had some items to help us celebrate waiting for us. SO thoughtful! Everyone we came in contact with was extremely helpful and personable. Location is excellent, right in the heart of it all...steps from everything. Uber helped us cover more ground when needed. While I love being in the busy city, the noise might bother some. Jackhammering began at 5:30am the first morning. Ear plugs provided though and black out windows helped us sleep in. Room service was awesome, fast too. The only thing the room was missing were robes. We loved having the coffee maker and fridge...loved the views. The beds and pillows were really really nice. I love down pillows and I slept so well. The lounge was were we started out each evening. Drinks were great, decent pricing on all and the live music was very fun. Bartenders know there stuff but the servers didn't really engage much. Overall, I would select this hotel again and because of their employees being so welcoming and helpful (Steve is awesome in my book) I'll be selecting more Hyatts for future trips.

I have stayed here for business many times, but this time it was all family. It's so close to everything whether walking, taking a cable car or grabbing a ride with a cab/rideshare. Hotel rooms are recently remodeled. Very nice and comfortable. the beds are so wonderful that you find yourself wanting to stay in the room instead of going out into the city. The only downside is traffic if you are driving in. This is Union Square and the center point of shopping. So many places to dine, see and/or buy from.

Only valet at this hotel for what I believe is $80/night. Across the street there is a parking lot for $60/night, outrageous. The hotel room, had so much dust, that I ended up with bronchitis. The hotel uses a "menu" for necessities, which you might have forgotten. But be ready to wait about 1 hour to receive it. Ok hotel, but pricey.The location is great, restaurants and stores all around, and close to China Town.

20 people in line to check in when we arrived, with two people handling the traffic. Hotel is OK, but with poor room design and VERY loud due to tons of construction outside. We noticed two sets of ear plugs when we got to the room, which should have told us something. Service was lousy, but maybe that is just San Francisco. Wouldn't stay there again.

Excellent quality and Service! Great staff! extremely helpfull, great service in OneUp restaurant! Speedy check in with four or more computer check in stationd, Great Concierge service, very helpful front desk

Exactly what one would expect from GH; perfectly located on Union Square, well equipped with very good rooms excellent views. Club lounge worth upgrading too as excellent with great food and drinks and a superb view of SF harbour. Best thing about this Hyatt ? The staff, from an excellent seemeless check in to brilliant club lounge, superb Concierge services, great doormen who high five my 8yr old every time she went through. you may pay more to stay in in SF, but I doubt you will get as much value as here. Stay.

Very nice hotel. Well located. Though could use elevators directed to specific blocks of floors to cut down on long waits in lobbies.Cannot say enough nice things about the staff; esp. the concierges Elizabeth, Joanna and Elaine. Always helpful, patient and polite. And with excellent up-to-date information about San Fran. Housekeeping was very good too. An area where problems can occur in even the best lodgings. We've worked in hotels ourselves and know where to look for issues. The Grand Hyatt Union Square had almost none and we recommend it.Now about the cable cars... if you enjoy standing in line for an hour watching while gov't employee operators take their leisurely union breaks... go for it.

I wouldn't stay here again. It wasn't the worst ever, and honestly most of my complaints have to do with the room design. The service has been fine. The walls are so thin that I actually heard my neighbor peeing. Like, not just the toilet flushing, but the actual urine going into the toilet. Gross. Also, the bathroom was really big, yet there was only 1 sink, and no towel rods! The clean bath towels were hung on the handicap rail next to the toilet, which I found completely disgusting.

Grand Hyatt's have that name for a reason. Besides having a great location, every staff member is courteous and friendly and couldn't be any more helpful except for one of the concierge staff.We had a great room with a view of the GG Bridge.

I often come and stay at Grand Hyatt in San Francisco for my business trips cause Its one of my fav place in town. The staff is super professional and kind, rooms are large, clean and the position is strategic. The breakfast is amazing with fresh fruits, pastries and the food in general is really really good. The bar is cool as well and there is also a fitness center with a stunning view on San Francisco. The wifi connection is powerful and its free. The concierge service is one of the best in town. I cant wait to be back at the Grand Hyatt. AD

View of Union Square and street level current construction. Ear plugs added as toiletries are needed as single pane windows don't muffle noise regardless of floor level. Convenient to Macy's, Victoria Secret, Johnston Murphy, tiffanys, and more. Rooms have been updated but corners cut.

This was a perfect location for a very comfortable named brand hotel with all the right amenities; fridge in room, coffee maker, great bathroom amenities and wonderful service 24 hrs a day. The bellman, concierge and check in front desk agents were very knowledgable and helpful.

This is a wonderful San Francisco hotel. The location is ideal and is in easy walking distance to major attractions. We stay on the 32nd floor with access to the special private lounge there. It's wonderful. Many breakfast choices in the morning, snacks throughout the day, and an elaborate happy hour selection are available to guests. There's a great view of the city toward the Bay as you enjoy the wonderful pampering of David as he makes sure that everyone's needs are met. The room itself is large, well appointed, and meticulously maintained. This has been our hotel of choice for many years when we head to San Francisco. It's well worth the price and travel.

This is a great location for wandering around San Francisco. If you've stayed in Grand Hyatt's before you know what you're going to getâ€_a comfortable room, a seemingly safe environment, concierge, etc. There seems to be lots of parking to go around and we were happy to find a garage kitty corner from the hotel that offered special spaces for motorcycles. This is in the heart of the city, lots of shopping, restaurants, taverns, a short distance from Chinatown, the Embarcadero, North Beach, etc. and great walking access to MOMA and other entertainment.

It was a nice stay and the location was fanstastic. The room had nothing in it but there was a list you were able to ask for a lot of opptions free even hair brush. The restaurant was really god for dinner but the breakfast wasnt really something spacial and if you go out you will find perfect places nearby for breakfast. The staff were lovely and helpful and made my stay pleasent. you dont need to wait for taxi because there is always a taxi waiting outside and the people at the door will help you any time with anything. Public transport is near and there are a lot of shops around. But as there are a lot of contractingwork around the hotel you cannot sleep well and it is always noisy.

My husband and I stayed here during my husband's business trip on July 28, 2015. While the hotel accommodated an early check in, the quality and cleanliness of the room left a lot to be desired. The desk was dirty and the bathroom was not thoroughly cleaned (hair on floor and pink mold on tiles around bathtub). Although this was bad enough, a previous guest had urinated under the vanity! I discovered this when I came back to the room after using the gym and pulled out the vanity chair! Although housekeeping immedietly came to the room to address the problem, I requested our room be changed. Ben from the front desk was helpful and courteous. He moved our room to a higher floor and gave us access to the Club Room. I am stunned that a hotel that charges over $350 a night does not have quality assurance methods in place to guarentee guests have clean rooms!

Just traveled to San Francisco with two friends. We had a fabulous time staying at the Grand Hyatt. The staff took very good care of us. There was a tray of cheese, and bottle of wine sent to our room upon check-in. Anything we asked for from housecleaning was brought, or left in our room. The beds were super soft, and we were never disturbed by outside noises. We stayed on the 32 floor and had an amazing view of San Francisco. We were part of the Grand Club, and ate breakfast, etc., overlooking Alcatraz. The Grand Club experience makes me want to find other Hyatt's to stay at in the future. Wonderful food and service, 3 times a day. It saved us a lot of money. Would highly recommend staying here!!

The Grand Hyatt is centrally located near Union Square. We got a high floor with a view towards the East Bay. The room was spacious and had great amenities. There was an arm chair with an ottoman, a long desk for working, a makeup dresser and makeup mirror, a modern bathroom and great decor. The staff were very friendly and helpful, though the person at the reception desk did get confused about a couple of things. The only reason I'm not giving this hotel 5 stars is because the floor of the bathtub was springy. It was some type of plastic which gave way a little when one stands on it. In all my travels I have never encountered a bathtub floor like that; it was completely out of character with all the modern fixtures. In fact, the sink was so modern that it was hard for me to get my large hands under the water. In any event, the only real drawback was the strange bathtub floor. The hotel has a lot of amenities. Since this was a business trip, however, I did not have time to avail myself of those amenities. I definitely would recommend this hotel for business people, tourists and for couples looking for a romantic getaway.

The room was fantastic money's worth people are warmth Cardinal and courteous the location was more suitable for us since we were going for Alaskan cruise and the pier for departure was very close. We were extremely satisfied and it's really good for people going on cruise like us

While this is a great middle of the road hotel we were there for a work conference and had little to no internet. We tried to use the wi-fi and it didn't reach into the conference rooms, we tried the purchased wi-fi and had the same issue. Also, our rooms were very warm, we had maintenance look at them and they told us the air conditioning was working properly. Otherwise, again, this was a nice central location to shopping and while it was a long walk it was a very interesting walk to the Pier. Concierge here is FABULOUS and extremely helpful!!!

No complaints,Good locationCleaning crew excellentLobby is pleasant and welcomingValet was forthcoming about cheaper parking across the street, maybe they were full.Concierge Joanna is phenomenal, an incredible asset: Recommended the perfect walking tour, the perfect restaurants both in San Francisco and Napa including where to park near said restaurants, how to get to the Giants game an back. She provbably raised my rating from four stars to five.

No water or beverages of any kind in rooms. Nothing in mini bar. Small beverage cart downstairs opened after I left in the morning and before I got back in the afternoon. No coffee available when I woke up. No turn down service. No food menus in the room (forced to use poorly designed on screen prompts to order room service). Food in the restaurant was mediocre at best. Basically if you are used to staying in a top hotel that provides ammenities and service that makes your trip easier this is not the hotel for you. I will not be staying here on my next San Francisco trip.

I've stayed many times in this hotel and have alway found it to be acceptable - nothing special, not too grand - with a good location. But on this stay I noticed just how paper thin the walls seems to be. It was as if the jet-lagged family next door was in my room with me. I don't blame the family - but it seems the hotel has had issues with noise because the only amenity provided in the room (apart from soap and shampoo) was earplugs. Of course the hotel provides many amenities upon request. But it was telling that they go ahead and provide earplugs in the rooms without request. The location is of course great, but there are many many hotels I n the area. I will be choosing a different one on my next sf visit.

Great clean well located hotel. The rooms are practical and upscale. I really enjoyed my first experience with the Grand Hyatt brand. Will absolutely consider staying again on my next visit to beautiful San Francisco. Had a great view all the way to the water, so ask for a high floor room.

We recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt SF for a few days. We were very impressed with the service of the staff and the rooms as well. The rooms are very spacious and have great bathrooms. I especially liked the motorized window shades!

I love to stay here each time I stay in San Francisco. The rooms are very nice and the staff is great. It's right across From the park. There is great shopping near by and even better restaurants. You will enjoy it as much as i do.

Modern rooms, delicious breakfast, centrally located in Union Square, friendly and helpful staff. Overall, wonderful place to stay for families. Front desk was great at providing detailed directions on how to use the cable car and Muni to get to all destinations.

While the room and stay were average the fact that we were there for a business meeting and could not connect to internet ANYWHERE in the hotel was quite a problem! Otherwise it was a comfortable room and a nice view.

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco is a fantastic hotel. It is located just a few blocks from Union Square. The hotel is clean and the rooms are tastefully decorated. The breakfast buffet was excellent and service was outstanding.

I spent three nights here last week and it's a great mid-city location from which to explore the rest. The room was good (but not great.) I was lucky to have a full wall window from which to enjoy the view out over the city and Bay in the distance, which was great for watching the world go by.The bathroom was lovely and the vanity table was a lovely touch.Big comfy bed and choice of pillows.A couple of less good points:The Union Square location is noisy. Plus there was construction work almost all night - past midnight and it started again around 5am. Ear plugs were provided...There was a fridge but no mini bar stocked. Not even a bottle of water was provided. Room service is only until 11pm. Apparently there are water stations on each floor, however there is no hotel information provided to tell you this.TV channel choice is awful. I didn't even turn it on after the first evening.It's not particularly good value in relation to many other cities, however it seems that hotels just ate pricey in San Francisco so this is a neutral point rather than negative against the hotel.Would I return? Yes, definitely, depending on the rate available. Good for business travellers and solo travellers like myself.

Very modern hotel, very business oriented, good gym. Very much like any other Hyatt. The service at check-in is great, but I felt that the concierge was rather annoyed of me (most likely because he gets the same questions all day long). My room was full of long, black hair in the bathroom, but also in my bed linen, so Ihad to get everything changed twice! The location is very central, but not much to do after work hours. Wifi is included in the price!

The hotel is spectacular! It is adjacent to Union Square which puts you within walking distance to many other places to explore. And if you don't like walking then all kinds of taxis and other public transportation is immediately available. You will love the hotels rooms and restaurant / bar. Typically I avoid buffets like the plague but their breakfast buffet in OneUp Restaurant was an exception. The food is excellent. The only drawback is that the 35th floor workout facility is tight and cramped. But once on a treadmill you are looking out into the cityscape and there is never a bad view. And speaking of views you have to go to the 36th floor!On this level you can see the city and bay from a 360 degree vantage point. There are comfortable sofas on the side that allows you the perfect view of the sun setting. This floor was a highlight of our visit.

Visited here for business recently. This hotel is in a prime location if you have multiple meetings around the city as it is quite central. Checkin was fast, although the lobby checkin area is a bit odd and confusing (as in there is really no front desk, just a bunch of workstations). As a Diamond member in the Hyatt program, I was upgraded to a nice suite on floor 23. The room was very nice, but I would say the furniture was designed for style not comfort (unless you want to sit ramrod straight on a sofa). The room was noisy because of the way the wind hit the building (perhaps this is why they provided ear plugs in the bathroom). The bed could use an upgrade (overly soft and worn). All in all, this is a good business hotel, and I would stay again.

I've stayed in this hotel for 2 straight years now..both times for business trips. The best part of the hotel is perhaps the location. Right now marred by construction but nothing beats the proximity to Union Square. The check-in process was quick and easy although I was disappointed that some of the things I had requested for before booking weren't taken care of. For ex: I'm not a coffee or english breakfast tea drinker and had requested for those to be swapped with green tea.. didn't happen. Please be aware that some rooms have higher construction noise than others. Tip: A hot water kettle is available on request.

The Grand Hyatt in SF was in a great location and close to many shops as well as China Town. The room we had looked out toward the Financial District and we loved the floor to ceiling windows. The movie prices on the TV were ridiculously high.

Great central location. Incredibly convenient for shopping. Get a higher floor for spectacular views...if you are an East Coaster, coffee service starts early...take a walk to Chinatown to see the sights at dawn and no crowds!

I enjoyed my stay at the Grand Hyatt during my short business trip. My room was very clean, and the furniture was nice (modern). I stayed on a higher floor, so I had a great view of the city. Also, the location was great as it was pretty close to the financial district and Union Square, which was great for shopping. Lastly, the service was great.Cons: The front desk area seemed a little unorganized. It always took a minute for one of the front desk employees to help me, which I think was due to the physical organization of the desks (scattered and not all in a row). Also, my room was near a storage closet, so I could hear people accessing it at night.

It is truly right next to the Union Square. But the down side is that there is a construction site right next to the hotel. Construction work lasted the whole night the first night of our 4 day stay there. That was bad.The hotel got some renovation recently. Not super nicely done, but does not look old any more. The suite we booked is quite nice and reasonably spacious. Service is good. We requested a roller bed of our daughter and the delivery was timely.As it is also close to the China town, it is a plus for us Chinese tourists to grab a bite there. Would recommend this hotel.

Got the "bonus" room upgrade for a very reasonable $39, but our room faced construction. Also, couldn't seem to get HVAC fan onto low setting. Thank goodness for earplugs. Bed was super comfortable, and we slept well. Very nice business touches such as reading lights next to the bed, lots of outlets to charge our electronics, and a/v plus VGA plug-ins on the multi-swivel HD LCD tv. FREE WI-FI!!! Yeah! "Interesting" decor...kinda retro late 50's/60's but very tasteful and clean. Wife LOVED private vanity area. Parking Tip: avoid $60+ valet unless you need in/out & park across street in public lot for half the price of valet.

The Grand Hyatt in San Francisco has great accomodations, great views, great staff and great location. Our stay was terrific in every aspect of the trip. we will definitely pick this hotel our next time in SF.

The Grand Hyatt is a beautiful hotel... but there are a few things that really bugged me.... the arrival was a disaster as there is no driveway so there were 6-8 cars stacked alongside the road, not enough hotel valets and not a great way to start our stay at this hotel. The hotel does not have a gift shop or store that you can purchase snacks etc... The check in was also much to be desired. We arrived after 2pm and only 2 of our 4 rooms were ready....but what made it worse is that they supposedly put a rush on our rooms...well check in time came and went and we were never notified of our rooms being ready. Normally this would be ok, but we had a ton of stuff traveling with a big group.. I just didnt feel that we received the Hyatt standard in any way shape or form when it came to service. The only bright light in this whole thing was the bellman ray who graciously shuttled all of our luggage and instruments from room to room as our rooms became available... he was working overtime to get all of us settled. Everything else was great... clean, nice rooms etc. Great location. The wifi isn't very good ...slow at best. Not sure if I would choose to stay here again.

One of my best stays in San Fran despite the construction. If your looking for a nice comfortable place this is it. I was there for 5 days and the club floor is one of the best I have been to in a while.

The hotel is located just at Union Square - a cool area for shopping and dining - and just about a 15 minute walk to the Embarcadero/Ferry Building. Every convenience is located within a block or two of the hotel. The staff is professional and friendly. The hotel is very modern and clean - their checkin and checkout processes were entirely done on my iPhone - super easy! And the price was great, considering it is SF.

This is a fantastic property - first class customer service from the moment I entered until the moment I left. The hotel is lovely and relaxing with a unbeatable location (I've been to SF many times but this was my first stay in Union Square). I stayed in a bay view king room and it was well worth the extra. I was on a high floor with a dazzling view of the Coit Tower and the Bay. Room was spacious and extremely comfortable (great mattress), plenty of storage, nice bath, refrigerator, and bedside controls for the shades on the floor-to-ceiling windows. Housekeeping was immaculate. Yes, there is construction on the south side of the hotel - my room faced the north and I didn't hear a thing. I didn't hear my neighbors or the people upstairs either - very good sound proofing made for restful nights. I had drinks and snacks in the OneUp Lounge several nights - Linda was my server and took great care of me. Room service was prompt and delicious. The entire experience was on of pampered relaxation. I can't imagine staying anywhere else and I can't wait to return.

Very good location and staff! We had a beautiful room on the 35th floor with an amazing view!. We were happy to discover a very affordable weekend rate. The hotel is close to Chinatown, but a bit a walk to the wharf. I would recommend this hotel to friends traveling to the area.

The hotel is located in Union Square. Perfect location for exploring San Francisco. There is lots of construction going on around the hotel (they are building a subway extension), but we did not have any noise or dust issues in our room, or at the bar inside the hotel.We ordered late night room service. The order was not correct, however the kitchen and room service staff not only corrected the order, but removed that portion from the bill.The front desk staff are some of the friendliest and nicest people I've encountered on my many trips around the globe. Lyle was amazing. He went above and beyond to make sure my family and I had a wonderful experience. I can not say enough kind words about him. Thank you!My only issue is the lack of curtains or blinds. They have odd window coverings that do not block out the morning sun, waking us all up much earlier than we'd have liked.

Great stay at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco despite the construction that is currently going-on to add to the hotel. Exceptionally clean room, from the floors to the linens. A special thank you to Ms. Ava He, who kept my room tidy and clean, to Guadalupe in the restaurant who waited on me each morning with a friendly smile and a glass of juice, and to Mark Herihy the Concierge who provided us with recommendations, reservations, and the best way in which to get there - thank all of you very much!

The Grand Hyatt is a fantastic business hotel. A lot of the hotels near Union Square - Moscone Center are old buildings that have been rehabbed. Although they have "character", the problem with these places is that many of them are really noisy, and have poor internet, and no desk to work. The Grand Hyatt is a the opposite end of the scale - the rooms have comfortable beds, have a great work space and the internet connection was 5 bars. Right now (July, 2015), there's subway construction during the day in Union Square so there was some noise during the day, but the hotel was still reasonably quiet. The staff is really helpful, and the location is convenient since you can walk to Moscone in about 10 minutes. Excellent gym, on high floor, with fantastic views. Highly Recommended.

Stayed here for 4 nights last week. Great location at the heart of union square, very convenient for shopping and many restaurants nearby. Close to cable car and local muni bus station. Room is nicely refurbished with new bathroom and rather modern interior. Automatic blinds control and good cable channels. Most importantly it's clean and house keeping is up to the Hyatt standard. We had the high floor grand club king which has great view and access to the well run grand club. Definitely recommended for first time SF visitors.

The services are up to standard and I enjoyed staying upper floors to see the beautiful bay view. The night view of Coit Tower is spectacular. The breakfast in the restaurant is delicious. I felt warm in the lobby with the open fire.

I visited last month on business and stayed here. The rooms were spacious, with a work station and just another chair and table for relaxing. It also has a dressing room area, with a mirror and plug points, table and then a bathroom (shower within the tub). The rooms has blinds on it but there is no obvious way to operate it so you have to call reception to ask. They told me they always get calls about it. If you are reading this, the button to adjust the blinds are located on headboard of the bed, near the phones. The sleep was very comfortable! Bed is huge.I can't comment on breakfast as the host company had their own thing for us on the top floor, not linked to hotel. It's located at Union Square and there is a lot of construction taking place. But location wise, just up the road from the Apple store and other major retailers.But overall a good hotel. Recommended.

This indeed is a beautiful hotel as are a lot of San Francisco hotels. I think the next time I am there I would be tempted to try another hotel to see what is available. The location is excellent and the beds are very comfortable. The room was fairly quiet. The bathroom is lovely. It was expensive but that is to be expected in San Francisco.

For someone who has travelled extensively for business and pleasure, i am likely to change my travel preferences to another hotel. the room was terrible and there was no lobby bathroom and as someone who spends a lot of money, i would expect to be able to check out on time and use the club both before and after i check out. this was not the case.

This hotel is in a perfect location near the BART/Muni system, and near the trolleys to access Fisherman's Wharf easily. Short walk to Chinatown. The rooms are nice and so are the staff. We really enjoyed our stay!! We would definitely stay here again!

We spent 4 nights at this hotel. Excellent service, great breakfast at the Club Lounge. Nicely renovated rooms and great shower. Location is great and donÂ´t miss the city view from the top floor.Highly recommend this hotel.

Stayed here 3-12 July. Fast no nonsense check in check out service. The rooms are decently decorated. 5 mins walk to Chinatown entrance, also a five minutes walk to the Union Square, which is the starting point for Hop on Hop off tour bus of SF. A lot of dining places within 5-10 mins walk. I tried Loris Diner and Scala's Bistro which is good. The only setback right now is that there is a construction that works all the way into the night right in between the hotel and Union Square. Deafening until mid nite.

It was our 1st time in San Francisco. The location & great hospitality of the hotel made our stay very comfortable. The breakfast staff at the One Up Restaurant was very friendly & attentive. Mark in Concierge gave great suggestions re: nearby restaurants.

I had a very delightful stay at the Grand Hyatt - SF. I would recommend for business meetings or personal time. While construction was going on nearby, it was hardly noticeable in the evening. Loved the popcorn and lemonade on Friday.

Great place in the middle of everything. The weekend was pretty quiet but during the week, there was noise from the construction workers at the time we stayed at the hotel. I would still stay there again.

The property merits five stars. Rooms are large and comfortable, and well appointed. Work desk is roomy, with plenty of outlets and connections for any computer. Rooms contain a safe. Bathrooms are large, and with plenty of surface on the sink for toiletries. Bed is comfortable, easy chair and desk chair also comfortable. So why is it not a five? Elevator-to-room ratio is not good, resulting in long waits for elevator. More than once a phone call to concierge or front desk resulted in 12-15 rings with no answer. Approximately $5 for every 15 minutes of internet usage seems high. No pool (but there is a gym). The staff is helpful and personable. Overall, a very nice experience (rooms bigger and more comfortable than the nearby St. Francis), but one that could have been even better.

Stayed for 3 nights on business recently. Check in line was long and understaffed, but use of the kiosk was easy even for the first time and check in and key was quick. This is a large hotel with an excellent location for all san fran activities.There seemed to be a 50/50 mix of biz travelers and tourists.The rooms were nicely sized with all necessary amenities. Surprisingly quite room, though once construction started around 8 it was impossible not to notice.Did not try the restaurants or bars but within walking distance is great food and drink.

Loved the hotel!!!! the rooms are great and the location is magnificent, wich is good in san francisco, close to good restaurants and the staff was great. The restaurant is good and the consierge was so helpful and knew his job

We had a wonderful time here. The location is great, right next to Union Square. It is easy to access public transportation from nearby Powell Street and saw the entire city. The hotel is beautiful and comfortable. The concierge staff is wonderful, so get a map and dining suggestions upon arrival. The entrance to China town is only a couple of blocks away.

This hotel would have been a 4 if not for the construction noise. Room was spacious for the city and they seemed to have a good stock of rooms with two beds. It wasn't spotless but not dingy either, so I can give the benefit of the doubt on a few crusty surfaces. The bed was way too soft and saggy, like sleeping in a basket. Decor was updated but had a lot of golden wood so it didn't feel as sleek and modern as Hyatt Regency and Andaz locations I've stayed in.But the construction noise was a huge intrusion. Immediately to the south of the hotel is a new Apple office building with a 24-hour work permit, but during our stay that site only worked days. However, the city has a 24-hour work permit on the street itself, and they did their loudest work starting promptly at 12:30 a.m. each weeknight. It wasn't standard jackhammering, more like a piledriver, incredibly loud. The hotel provides the yellow 3M earplugs that are thick and stiff, not at all comfortable to wear all night. Definitely bring your own better quality earplugs (the orange and purple ones from Lowes are good) if you plan to stay here in the next several months. Unfortunately the loudest part of the noise is intermittent, a few times an hour, so it's not a steady din that you can get used to. During the second hour of noise I called down and was told the only thing they could do was move us to the other side of the hotel, which I did not want to do at 1:30 a.m. The desk employee also said that my side of the hotel was usually the quiet side, which seems impossible given that I could see two work sites and there didn't appear to be any on the other sides. Quite disappointing not to be warned about the noise when booking. Marriott is always good about warning about hotel renovations even when they have only a minor effect on the stay, and this was much worse than any renovation.

the rooms are small, but the views of the city from the higher floors were cool. The continental breakfast was excellent. The reception people were friendly, but the concierge staff was surprisingly unhelpful. Our keys weren't properly activated at first and there was a long line at the reception desk so we approached the concierge who told us we needed to go to reception, saying 'I can't do anything about the keys'. Maybe so, but it would have been nicer if he had walked us over or just been a little more friendly. nothing really bad to say about the hotel, but for the price I expected something more luxurious and accommodating,

I have returned to stay at this fabulous hotel for the third time. This is one of my favorite Hyatt hotels in the U.S. I like this hotel because of its location and the flexibility of their staff. I have asked for a 3pm check out and the front desk agreed without the slightest hesitation. They did this even though their hotel seems to be very busy. The doorman at this hotel is also very friendly and will go out of their way to assist you. I will continue to stay at this hotel whenever I visit SF and will not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others.

When we made the reservation, we requested a quiet room. When we checked, I reiterated the request and the individual who checked us in checked his book and said that we were assigned a quiet room on a top floor that was very quiet. Within seconds of going to bed, it sounded like a helicopter was landing in the bathroom. When we called downstairs a sheepish voice told us that we were facing Union Square where there is a massive construction project for a subway--and that the construction company has a permit to work 24 hours a day. We were then given a room on the opposite side of the hotel. Ashley helped us move and what an impressive employee she is. If it were not for her assistance and the friendliness of the doorman (Paul) I would have had one star in my rating rather than two. The front desk manager (Maria) phoned at one stage to offer her apology with an insincere, scripted hope that we would have a nice stay. All in all, for the money we will monitor the construction project and avoid Union Square on future trips until things are back to normal.

We stayed for 4 nights. Loved it and sure would come back. Location at Union Square is great, near to shopping, major attractions, restaurants. Hotel is in a very good condition. Looks very well kept. Service was excellent at check in and overall. Concierge service very helpful. Room has good size and is comfortable. Beds are too soft. Gym on floor 35 has a great view of the city.

my husband and I took a trip to SF over 4th of July wkend. booked it thru hotel.com for $279/nt w/ city view. they upgraded our room to higher floor when we arrived without us even asking. city view is great view and our room had remote control shade in very large wall to wall window which was cool. they also had complimentary beverages (strawberry lemonade and blueberry lemonade) with popcorn in lobby for 4th. rooms are modern and clean and bathrooms are not too small, very comfortable size compared to other boutique hotels in SF (this is my 4th trip). wifi was free. when we asked for toothpaste, they supplied. but best part of this hotel is its location. we decided against fairmont hotel because it was farther away from center/union sq, fairmont is closer to china town and up on a hill. the hills are very annoying to walk up day after day. some of the other boutique hotels (such as klimpton ones) are actually located a bit farther down near touristy area near shopping malls on market street, its close, couple of blocks from GH. Market Street is crowded, noisy and there are a lot of street peddlers and homeless people. its not even a trendy part of town.
