GH was by far not the most reasonably priced hotel but for the money, service, size of room and bathrm and location, it was perfect. there was construction right by the hotel but it didn't bother us. there is convenience store half a block away for your water bottles and snacks and starbucks across the street as well as mini starbucks in lobby every morn. we walked to fisherman's wharf (2mi) but hilly. we walked to financial district, soma area, china town, pier 39 where there were no sea lions (they leave for the summer), and pier 14 where some restaurants are. riding the street cable car is not practical in holiday wend, sometimes there is 3hr wait. walking is what most people end up doing. but one thing we missed out on was the alcatraz tour. they have dinner tour which is extra spooky but we got shut out to every tour. it gets booked over 8wks in advance. some of popular restaurants get booked 8wks in advance too, so plan ahead if this is part of your trip. for the fireworks, GH has top floor, 36th where you have view of the fireworks by the pier/fishermans' wharf towards GG Bridge part of town. rooms are not what I would describe as "Luxurious" but in terms of what you get and where, it was 5 stars for us.

I Stayed at Grand Hyatt for four nights from 15th June onwards. I was expecting a bit more from the hotel. Its a good hotel dont get me wrong with good location as its very close to Union Square and i paid around 480 $ per night including breakfast which was just too much. The rooms were small (i expected a bit bigger), bathroom is small too. The service was good and not Great . I was disappointed by the breakfast at level one the cafe as i was expecting a Luxirious Buffet breakfast but there was hardly anything to choose from not even a egg station .To make it short. Its at a very good location. The hotel is good if not great. Rooms are small , breakfast is ok. A bit too pricey i would say. I got fooled by trip advisor reviews, its Over Hyped .

As a Hyatt rewards client and an avid business traveler, I have come to expect high standards for any Hyatt, but especially a Grand Hyatt.Pros:- service was excellent- bellman were quick and welcoming- front desk assisted in changing your room quickly and without hesitation.Cons:- I was checked into I believe a "stale" room. It smelled musty and had a fishy odor.- there was dust everywhere.- the sink filled up and wasn't draining.- there was no robe or slippers.- the headboard was all wood and beat up and scratched.- the bed actually squeaked.- the whole room was filthy.I called the front desk and moved me right away and the next room was much better, had just been cleaned, and had a robe and slippers indicating it was recently refreshed.- it was still dusty and the headboards need to be changed out as they look banged up. Something ,ore sure is required for a headboard.- the bar and room service had God quality beverages and food.- I love the location as its next to Union Square and all the shops surrounding the hotel. I'm hoping management reviews and escalates up to remodel the rooms as they need to be done.

The hotel is very centrally located at Union Square. We stayed for 4 nights. There are lots of nice bars and restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel and China Town is only a 5 min walk away. Fisherman's Wharf can easily be reached by food or public transport (bus stop is just across the street). Best to try to get a room with bay view as there is a construction site facing Union Square. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was great.

Admittedly it was a last minute booking at about 6pm but on arrival the receptionist was quite offhand and definitely needs some training. The room she gave us was on the first floor and when we asked for something higher, as my husband has a Hyatt card we hoped this would help, but she said it was the last room and when we asked again she said " it's only for one night"! So we went to the room and were horrified. It was obviously originally a big corner room that they had simply divided in half. You could see that the front window went into next door, as did the wardrobe. The entryway was so narrow and it was a tiny room. We have stayed at many Hyatt hotels around the world and could not believe this room was part of the Hyatt chain, let alone the Grand Hyatt. I am sure a lot of the rooms were great but this one was pitiful. We rang down to speak to the Duty Manager, he wasn't very apologetic but we were moved to a room on the 4th floor( so the first room was not their last!!) which was somewhat better but still not worthy of the Grand Hyatt brand name. A month later we were talking to some friends about San Francisco, they complained about staying in a terrible room- yes, the same hotel - so it wasn't just our opinion.So be careful, as I said I'm sure there are some great rooms.

It was the first time my parents visited the beautiful city of San Francisco. The location of the hotel was very close to Union Square, Market St, and Chinatown. The Pier was a good 15 minute walk from the hotel which is not bad at all (5 min using the trolleys). People were friendly and the room was nice as well as comfortable.

Great hotel experience. Perfect location to walk to everything in the downtown core. The room on the 17th floor was great. Very comfortable beds and pillows. I can't say enough positive about the Concierge folks. They couldn't do enough for us and did everything with a smile. Highly recommend this place.

Stayed there for two nights over July 4th weekend. I'm a diamond, so my review might be skewed in that regard. Used a suite upgrade for the two night stay and loved the room. The only complaint we had was the bed was too soft. It was a pillowtop that had seen it's better days. Don't like a soft bed at all. Otherwise the room was fantastic. Regency Club was staffed with excellent help; very friendly, too. Would most definitely recommend on our experience. Will return.

As a frequent traveler - domestic and international - I realize that things happen - such is life. Additionally, it's almost instinctive to write and complain when something goes wrong. I try to write and compliment the establishment when something goes well and exceeds my expectations. The 4th of July visit was one such occasion when the staff at your SF location outdid themselves. From Julia at the Check-in to Adnan and Jason during the fogged out fireworks. Pedro at the bar and Stephanie (Operator) not to forget Nate and Philip and Maria. Well done folks! Well done!!

The hotel is very new looking, rooms recently renovated. Had some issues with the house keeping accidentally taking 2 champagne flutes we brought back from Napa, but the management went above and beyond to alleviate the issue. Really great customer service. Our room had some slight creaking coming from the ceiling, I assume this must have just been a random occurrence for our room as I've never experienced this with a concrete build hotel before.. otherwise very quiet and really great views.

Room was comfortable, but they have only two elevators that go to the restaurant and lounge and they seldom were in service during my stay. I ended up walking around the neighborhood to look for breakfast since I have a knee problem and stair access only was not comfortable for me.

Strongly recommended to stay at this hotel when visit San Francisco. Great experience! We all enjoyed our 3 nights stay there. Great city view from our room. Central location, within walking distance to the shops and restaurants.

Stayed at Grand Hyatt San Francisco for a work trip in April, 2015. My colleagues switched to the Gran Hyatt a few weeks before the trip because of the Hyatt Gold Passport point promotion that was going on. So glad we did! The property is about 30-40 minutes from the airport, and about $50 one way cab ride. I was upgraded to a room that overlooked Union Square/Macy's...loved it. The privacy blinds could be controlled by remote control and I loved the morning sun rises. I did not eat at the hotel, but from what I hear from my colleagues, the food was fantastic. I loved the location because it was in walking distance to pretty much everything we needed and to get to our office. Definitely a great work trip choice hotel. I would definitely consider staying for a personal trip as well.

The ho0tel is located close to all major sightseeing attractions. The conference center and amenities were more than suitable for all 200+ attendees. Perfect for business and pleasure! Staff was helpful and friendly, the Gold Passport is a must.

Our favorite hotel to stay in San Francisco for the excellent service and proximity to many key attractions. You often do not get the overwhelming crowded hotel experience in here, and the staff tend to be extra helpful and hospitable. The hotel has nice amenities and offers several dining options that are good. The views on high floors are terrific. There are many very good restaurant choices within few blocks.

The best part of this Hyatt is the staff. Everyone is exceptionally helpful. If you can stay on the club floor - it is well worth it. The club room has a great selection for breakfast and the afternoon hors d'oeuvres were delicious. You can make yourself your own cocktail and sit and relax with great views of the city. Our room was okay which is how I would rate the hotel itself. It is not up to the standards of other Grand Hyatts. The bar on the 2nd floor was okay but again missing the higher standard of a Grand Hyatt. We did not eat in the restaurant.

Great hotel with very helpful staff, although a liitle on the expensive side. The Gym is on one of the top floors overlooking San Fran, a wondefrul way to work out. The location in Union Square is ideal within easy reach of the main shoping area and Market Street. I would certainly stay here again.

I appreciated the gracious and helpful service, stylish decor, and a very quite and comfortable room (I now hate my own mattress and pillows after being spoiled here)! I look forward to staying here again in the future, since it was by far one of the most restful and customer-service oriented hotels I have stayed at so far.It is within close walking distance with Union Square, making it easy to access the cultural goings-on in the square as well as Asian Box, a 100% gluten free restaurant that made life easier for me as a traveler with celiac. :)

The conference I speak at had changed venues and i was so glad they did. Although I was used to the other hotel and had been ogling there for several years, the Hyatt was a definite step up. The room was excellent and the food in the restaurant, as well as the catering for the conference, was very good. I'll be back.

Lots of mistakes on check in but i must say they seemed absolutely flat out with a big conference at the hotel. After a couple of complaints the front desk manager gave us Regency Club access and cut the room rate by half so cant really complain too much. Rooms are a bit dated but that is made up for by the location and great staff

Very satisfied with the hotel in general and with the service. The room was pleasant and clean, and the staff responded immediately in replacing an iron and hair dryer that were not working properly. Concierge was very helpful in getting a dinner reservation at a great restaurant.

My wife and I had a great experience staying at the Grand Hyatt for a conference and vacation. The room was nice and big. Just as important, the customer service was excellent. The people who checked us in and out were very helpful and handled a tricky checkout with ease.

Good service, very comfortable beds, clean room, nice view, but the noise from the BART station construction outside our room was a real drag and woke us at 6:30 every morning (including Saturday and Sunday). Convenient location for the convention center, Chinatown, walks to the Ferry Building and lots of great restaurants.

Rooms needs to be updated. We had a room in the third floor (stayed for a week), and it was not part apparently of the mayor update the hotel went through. Great service at the concierge. I asked to be moved to a better room...was not possible. Good -not great- breakfast.

I'm a diamond with Hyatt AND Hilton and I stayed at this property for 1 night in June. I was impressed with the quality of customer service; from the front desk to the doorman - everyone was helpful and kind. The room's view was GREAT - which I asked for - and the lounge was fantastic. I'm impressed - and that doesn't happen easily for me. I'm staying again this Friday (July 3) and hoping to see the same standard of service and room quality. Well done.

Stayed at the Grand Hyatt San Fran for 4 nights. Fantastic location right across from the Port of San Francisco. Close to Fiance District and public transport right outside your door. Beautiful hotel with great food and bars, reception area is outstanding. Staff are very friendly and helpful if you need to find your way anywhere. Great choice for accomodation in central San Francisco CBD.

I just spent four nights at this centrally located hotel, and I highly recommend it. The room was immaculate, furnishings were in great condition, and staff was very friendly. My room had a terrific view of the city. While I was curious to see a package of ear plugs in the bathroom along with the hotel toiletries, I quickly understood when I heard the street level noise way up on the 25th floor. I appreciated the hotel staff offering the plugs. I would definitely recommend the Grand Hyatt to others.

I recently returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel, where there is construction going on directly next door (I was told an Apple Store was forthcoming) and the street directly in front of the hotel was also all tore up! So, needless to say, utter chaos reigned around the vicinity. The hotel itself was lovely. As soon as you walk in the doors, the hotel is an oasis of cool quiet. We did not eat at the hotel, but there was a restaurant on site. Our room was comfortable, clean, and well-attended. I was in town for a conference, and the conference center was a nice 10 or 15 minute walk away which was a definite plus. I would definitely stay here again, hopefully after the construction projects are finished!

I stayed there for 4 nights. It's a 5 star hotel and I'm glad I got what I expected.Room was big and confy.It was centrally located few minutes away from convention site and shopping center,I left my iPhone in the hotel after checkout and I got it back.Breakfast buffet was awesome. Staff are nice.

Terrific staff which made me feel welcome and offered a free room upgrade. Also gave an excellent recommendation for breakfast. The hotel is in an excellent location with lots of shopping and restaurants close by. The hotel offers amazing panoramic views from the top floors. The interior design is modern contemporary.

I stayed at the San Francisco Grand Hyatt while attending a conference at the Moscone Center. On the positive side, the location was convenient, and the staff were friendly and professional. However, the room was average, not luxurious. I was charged a conference rate, much lower than the advertised price, but I was still a bit disappointed. I know bed preferences are very subjective, but I found the bed and pillows uncomfortable, so I did not get much sleep during my trip. The mattress was lumpy and the pillows were squishy, not at all supportive. I would not choose this hotel in the future.

perfectly located almost equidistant from the piers, Chinatown, arts district, and major downtown shopping areas. Million dollar views (assuming you are facing the bay), and uncluttered contemporary rooms.

I spent 5 nights at the Grand Hyatt on Stockton St. Rooms were very nice . . . simple and modern. Very clean and comfortable. I was on the 18th floor with a view across Union Square. There's a lot of construction going on in San Francisco so you do hear quite a bit of noise. No fault of the hotel. The location is great for walking around, shopping, dining, and going to the convention center. It's 5 blocks to the Powell St. BART station which I took to and from the Oakland airport. Chinatown is a few blocks away. I had a room with two double beds. The only complaint I had is that there's no water in the room. A few bottles of water would have made it perfect. I like the Hyatt brand and I'm rarely ever disappointed. This was no exception. I didn't try the restaurant or bar. The lobby area is quite nice and self check-in was quick. Staff is friendly and the doorman are pleasant. I would definitely stay there again.

A friend and I came for a few days of shopping and hanging out. The hotel is located right off Union Square. It is a fairly central location, excellent if you are looking for big name stores. Not very close to boutique style shops and eatery. Hotel was clean and room was updated. Small complaint would be that they did not change the windows when they renovated so there is a lot of noise coming from the street. We were

Excellent hotel. Great view from 20+ floors. Love the l9unge on the 25th floor. At $30 per person breakfast is a wonderful value and selection. Rooms are very comfortable and quiet. Try and check in as early as possible to get the besf available rooms. I highly recommend bay view above 20th floor. Overall A+

This hotel has it all given that it is a very nice hotel and it is located on Union Square so a lot of shopping and site seeing is literally outside the door. It has been renovated during the past few years so the hotel is very contemporary in design and every feature of the room fits the theme. In addition to being in the right place with very nice accommodations, our interactions with the staff were all very good and they seemed to make sure we were happy. Given we were there on a busy weekend, this is not an easy thing to accomplish so I can highly recommend the hotel. Larry

I've actually stayed at this Hyatt a number of times over the years and it's provided consistent high quality service every time. The rooms are comfortable, they're not havens of modernity but everything is there that you would hope is there. All the staff are great from the front desk, concierge & valets all the way to the cleaners.The lobby has been updated in the last few years and is inviting but it's not massive, in fact the hotel has quite a small footprint so the elevators take up a lot of space in the middle. There's a restaurant and bar on the mezzanine level and I must say that I preferred the restaurant on the top floor where you'd get a great view in the morning, but it's still ok.Location is awesome though, I think you could be in Union square in 100 steps (I didn't count) but you're on the quieter side of the square away from the noise and general hubbub of Powell St.

Poorly trained staff! Very bad layout of reception! Has to clue about the Hyatt Members or recognizing them. Rooms are way too small - no matter what room you get its nowhere near the Grand Hyatt in the middle east for example! Grand club was very disappointing at this facility Room was next to a pantry and the noise just messed my entire weekend - could not sleep properly as the banging woke me up each day around 6 am!

The location was the reason why I stayed. You would expect all the good things about a Hyatt and the hotel delivers them. Ask for a room at a higher floor to enjoy the view, I had a room at 16th floor and didn't see a thing. Breakfast room is small and crowded, I had to wait 10 minutes to get a table.Cool stuff for kids, they had in the lobby free popcorn and lemonades.

When we first drove up to the hotel, we were not sure if it was the front or back entrance because no one came to greet us until a minute later. The check-in process was fairly easy and the man who guided us to our room was very very courteous and brought us extra towels and tips on shopping and where to get the best views all without asking. The room is very updated and modern and the hotel wifi is fast too. The check-out process was a little more unnerving as the man who checked us out did not bother with any formalities and seemed like he was just trying to get us out of there. All in all, a great experience up until the very end.

I changed my reservation from an inferior hotel to the Gran Hyatt SF during my business trip and was very pleased. Excellent location and amenities. Hotel is modern, clean, and has outstanding service. Very happy that I moved hotels.

This hotel is in the middle of everything San Francisco. It's clean, modern and the staff is friendly & helpfull. No negative complaints. I recomend this hotel & would stay there again. I was traveling with my family (2 kids) they loved the hotel as well. Hyatt Rocks!!

I stayed here to four nights. I am very satisfied with the location of the hotel, the super clean room, and very impressive view from room. The dinning at OneUp restaurant is a pleasant. The fitness center is in the 35 floor, it was pleasant experience exercising while facing beautiful city view.

Great location, a walk away from all the shops and department stores around union square. A little bit more of a walk but did it most days, to Fisherman's wharf through China town, took about 30 minutes. Lovely clean, modern rooms and comfy beds! Also has a good size gym. Friendly staff. Would stay here again.

Beautiful hotel! So close to shopping and great food! Had a great time with coworkers in the bar and great food in the restaurant on 2nd floor. Amazing views from the top floor. I was able to see Alcatraz and all the way around the city. The room I stayed in was a really nice size with a huge bathroom and was really trendy.

A bit shy on elevators at busy times, the Grand Hyatt is nicely refurbished and the staff is responsive. Close to SF Union Square it is centrally located for mid-town shopping and sightseeing. Getting to the wharf and piers is a bit of a schlep. A good choice for a SF first-timer.

I found this to be the best deal in SF on hotels.com based on price, level and location, and was glad of the choice. 2 others in my party who usually stay at higher end were also pleasantly surprised. Package included 2 breakfasts (not just a continental, but a la carte or full buffet). internet and rooms. Bargain! The rooms are not huge, but nicely re-done, lobby, bar, front, hallways, rooms and bathrooms have all been renovated and look modern and sleek. The automatic shades are a nice touch, big TV's (no HBO sadly), nicely re-done bathrooms and closets. Service on the phone, requests, etc were taken care of quickly and efficiently - water, a robe, toothpaste, late checkout, etc. Breakfast is excellent for a hotel - dungeness crab omelette!! No extra charges. My two complaints would be 1. design of hallways which cannot be changed of course leaves several room doors meeting and you can hear if your neighbours are the boorish kind that talk outside their doors or bang around coming and going. 2. bath needs a spray to get rid of mildew, a bit of red mold growing between tilework in areas. If housecleaning were a little more careful about the baths, I would have very little to pick on in most hotels. great bar area on mezzanine - caffe on the ground and salt water taffee at the front desk!! You are right on Union square. every bit of shopping a block away and a Starbucks across the street (though in SF I think it is mandatory to have one every 2 blocks).

The location of this Hyatt is right in the middle of one of San Francisco's jewel, Union Square. It's very clean, modern and the staff is very helpful Grab the highest floor possible as this location is very busy with cars and people. If you get a room high enough on the bay side, you'll see Alcatraz, the sail boats and Coit Tower. Dining is satisfying and the bar staff is wonderful. Got my own private whiskey/bourbon/scotch tasting. Top notch, world class hotel and staff.

I came to san fran to join my girlfriend for the weekend. she was in town for business and i came out to join her on thursday night. The staff here are amazing . the front desk staff were friendly and helped with all of our questions. this was my first trip to the bay area. The dorr men were all very friendly and helpful. I would recommend staying here the veiw from the 36th floor is very nice and you can see alcatraz form the viewing deck. The breakfast was always fresh and plentiful

Excellent hotel located in Union Square. Rooms were nicely appointed and staff was friendly. Valet parking was very expensive but convenient. Construction during stay provided early am wake-up calls. Nice lounge areas with hotel.

We've stayed overnight here many times when we come in for dinner and don't want to drive home after enjoying an evening in town. This hotel has been kept up nicely. Rooms are clean and bathroom has all the amenities you need. Although this time around no bathrobes a favorite of my wife's. We get a king with a view which is nice. The main attraction is location. Right across from Union Square. Nearby to all the shopping you need. Be aware that there is major construction going on adjacent the hotel and nearby Stockton Street. The noise is not a factor in the hotel but getting around the streets requires some maneuvering. Don't valet park it'll cost an arm and a leg. Use the nearby public lots on Geary or O'Farrell streets.

Our family of 4 stayed at hotel for 2 nights during a sightseeing trip to San Francisco. The hotel service was outstanding, the rooms were well kept, and the upgraded "Club Room" service was very good. Would stay again.

Most things went well, but I was shocked to wake up one morning -- struggling with jetlag -- to the sounds of drilling and pounding. Unbeknownst to me, staff at the check in counter had happily placed me right next to a construction site, without even giving me a heads up. The internet in the room also conked out on my third day, and I had the pleasure of staying on the phone with their technical support for a good 15 mins to troubleshoot the problem.

If you have allergies, make sure you ask for their pure rooms. The rooms are fresh and clean and even the bath products are fragrance free, etc. Air freshener runs 24/7, you can turn it off if you like. I'm not a big fan of the sliding door on the bathroom, but otherwise it was quiet and clean.

Stayed with our points to have dinner & attend a theater performance at the Orpheum--The Book of Mormon--very funny but crass. Very nice hotel with friendly staff & easy access to any where in San Francisco. We ate in the Lounge & OneUp dining room & found the food very good in each area. We did feel the parking fee was a little excessive, but we were able to take the car in & out without an additional charge. We will return.

ok - before I start - there is construction going on right next door - not that the hotel can control that but wanted any soon to be travelers to know this in advance as you do have to maneuver around this if you are walking around the area and it does get noisy beyond what I would consider normal San Fran noise. I had a room on the 30th floor - which was not my original room but as I arrived early due to a early AM flight - they were great to get me into a room early. I had a great view of Coit Tower and the TransAmerica building and being on a high floor the street noise was still there but a bit less(this is a city - like NY there is noise - they had ear plugs in the room if needed). The room was typical Hyatt furnishing - no complaints - here though is where they stray from General Hyatt - they people in both the restaurant and the lounge in OneUp were some of the nicest most genuine people I have meet working in a hotel - the gentleman in the Grand Club was also a dear man - this alone would have me coming back as well as the location.

The Grand Hyatt was a wonderful hotel. We stayed there 4 nights and had a view of the city and bay with a king-sized bed. The room was kept very clean. Bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. The bathroom was large and water pressure was ok, but not outstanding. The shower curtain was a tad short and that created a lot of water on the floor after showering. The only problem we had was there was a lamp on the desk that wouldn't turn off and maintenance promptly took it but never returned with a new one. Since I needed the light, I had to call to receive a new one, which I did without a shade. The doormen were outstanding. We always had a cab within minutes. We were traveling with a large group for a wedding and everyone was pleased with their rooms and the general atmosphere. The location is within walking distance of all the shopping and one of the trolly stops, plus the bus tours are only a few minutes' walk to where they pick up and start the tour. Chinatown is a short walk away through a tunnel. I would stay there again. There is quite a bit of construction going on about a block away, but we didn't hear any of it in the hotel and it wasn't a problem walking on the sidewalks, either.

Visited San Fran for a business trip and this was the perfect hotel. Close to the Moscone center as well as the shopping and attractions. Helpful staff, large rooms, clean and modern. The restaurant is good for breakfast, albeit a bit pricey, and has a nice bar area. Would recommend to a friend.

What I love about the Hyatt SF is the location: its close to everything in downtown. And walking downtown is really a pleasurable experience. The other asset is the staff are very friendly and helpful, you truly feel at home.The reason for my low score is that the hotel isn't very user-friendly. Instead of providing the basic necessities that any decent hotel should provide; they ask you to call for shower caps, cotton buds, tooth paste, and the list goes on. The coffee machine is tucked in a cupboard that is not easily discoverable and no map to help you get around the room. The night blinds are not easily discoverable either. You need to call for everything. By the way, you also have to request for the electric kettle as its not a given.However what is most annoying is if you have parcels delivered to your room, the hotel charges $5.00 for every package. Considering how much you pay for the room, this should be service that the hotel can provide at no extra cost. And it doesn't matter whether you pick the parcel at the reception, you will still be charged. On the positive side, the hotel has a great gym on the 35th floor and it has a great view of SF. The hotel has lots of interesting events in the evening and this makes it a really cool, happening place!

The construction noise from union square ruined our sleep. The rooms are not constructed to handle any bit of extra sound. where its from the construction or the neighboring rooms. Rooms are very small aswell .

My daughter and I stayed here for our quick trip to the city. We wanted to shop near Union Square, we were attending a show at the Orpheum, and we had an appt. near Sutter and VanNess so the location was perfect for us. We drove into the city and parked at the Sutter-Stockton garage which is basically across the street. We were parked there for about 19 or 20 hours and paid $27. Not too bad relative to other options.Check in was quick and easy. The lobby is very different from other hotel lobbies - there are a few people standing with laptops at small podiums ready to check you in (rather than one big long counter). Our room was on the 14th floor and faced west so we basically had a view of Sutter Street. We noticed a bit of street noise but it was not too bad - and we are used to complete silence at home.The room was very high-tech (at least in our minds). There was a shade that you could raise or lower via switches at the beds or at the door. The tv had internet access and the remote had a mouse / trackball like control.The bathroom was fairly spacious, although the design of the sink (one large trough-like basin on top of the counter) took up a lot of space so that there wasn't much counter space left and you still only have one sink - it would be nice to have EITHER a bit more counter space OR 2 sinks (or both). The shower was ok - I like a stronger water flow but it was adequate. The towels were a good size but a little thin in my opinion for this level of hotel.Both my daughter and I thought the beds (we had 2 doubles) were THE MOST COMFORTABLE we have ever slept in! We both wished we could have slept in and enjoyed the comfort! My one comment re: beds would be that I prefer to see queen beds rather than doubles.There was free internet access that was sufficient for our needs (basically checking email and using some basic apps). There were 2 other levels available for purchase ($5 or $10) but we did not need more than the basic level available.I did order room service after we returned from the show and it took about 30 minutes for it to arrive. I have really no experience with room service but the wait seemed reasonable and the food was good and quite warm.We didn't use any of the other hotel amenities although we did go and look at the fitness room. It was fairly big with lots of machines and had a great view of the city from its location on the 35th floor.

You cannot ask for a nicer, friendlier hotel in Union Square. We had a wonderful view of the city, the buffet breakfast can't be beat, and everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. If you like to work out, what better way than overlooking the city!

Service forms a big part of my impressions of hotels, so the Grand Hyatt was a terrible experience. It took housekeeping an hour to deliver a charger for my laptop, and when I called at the 30 minute mark the operator's response was "I don't know what to tell you." My $10 room service bill (for 5oz of ice cream, already a clear markup that I accept is part of hotel food everywhere) that I ordered through the Roomlinx system came with an additional $5 "delivery charge". When I called to find out what it was for, the room service staff said it would be on every room service order I made. This is my first time encountering such a system in years of travel. There are no basic toiletries in the bathroom, like a toothbrush or toothpaste (this too only came after waiting for 30 minutes). The rooms are big and the location convenient, but there are hotels around the area with similar facilities and much, much better service. This is really not the best you can do.

I was very happy to utilize the mobile check in and mobile key. It was great to enter and walk past the registration desk!! I had previously requested any free upgrades and was happy to be assigned the 32nd floor! We loved our room and would be happy to return. The room was small but had a great view and bed. The bathroom had a cute / funny sink that looked like a bathtub!!

I stayed here three nights on business. The check-in experience could have been a little better - rather slow and a bit of a line. The room itself was great - large, comfortable bed with a big clean bathroom and a good view.Two complaints - the coffee machine made atrocious coffee; basically tasted like hot water. And I found it odd that the minibar fridge was empty - such a lost opportunity for the hotel to make some money!Shower Score: Average - Simplicity 5/5: Single knob to control everything; it was responsive and well- varies - Flow 3/5: This is perhaps the most important element of a good shower, but unfortunately this one was a little weak - Space: 4/5; Simple, in the tub

The hotel was overall lovely. The staff extremely accommodating. And the location couldn't have been better.... Walking distance to the Trolley. Walking distance to great shopping. Walking distance to Chnatown.

I really enjoyed the stay in the Grand Hyatt while going to the Apple WWDC 2015, just as the years prior to that. Great service, location, hotel and views. Just what you want in SFO if you are there on business or leisure, with family or without.

Stayed here for three nights. The hotel is very centrally located right in the heart of The City, near Union Square. Steps away from great shops, restaurants and attractions.The Bell staff and Front Desk were very friendly and helpful. Our room was on the 31st floor with a beautiful view of Coit Tower and Bay Area. The room was rather spacious with two double beds, however, the beds are rather small for two adults to sleep on one bed. I think it would have been more comfortable to have stayed in a room with a King bed and a rollaway for my husband and I and our teenage son. The hotel provides you with earplugs, as the noise from the occasional honking horns and sirens can get a bit loud, especially late at night.The one area that needs improvement in is at the Concierge Desk. We were very disappointed with the staff there. We asked the Front Desk for help regarding visiting an attraction and they referred us to the Concierge, we went over to the desk and the person manning the desk was helping someone else regarding a lost wallet, which we understood and had no issue with but what bothered us is that the concierge, did not acknowledge us at all. She made no eye contact, and pretended not to see us. After the other guest left, the concierge immediately got on the phone and was trying to find the wallet, and not once did she look at us or say that she would be with us shortly. While still on the phone the other guest came back and said he found the wallet and the two of them proceeded to have a long conversation and we were completely ignored. We were disconcerted to say the least. We left and found out on our own what we needed to know. It was very disappointing for a hotel like Grand Hyatt to have their staff ignore their guests. To make matters worse, that wasn't the only negative encounter with the Concierge desk, later that evening, we wanted to get a recommendation for an eatery and asked one of the Bell Staff, well he referred us to the Concierge desk and we decided to give the desk another chance. Well, the woman earlier must have left for the day, as there were two gentlemen on the the phones sitting at the desk. One of them acknowledged us and said he would be with us shortly, but shortly was not the proper term as they both were on the phone for at least 10 mins. It was very frustrating, because I know that the one who acknowledged me was helping a customer over the phone in making dinner reservations, but I highly doubt that the other staff member who was also on the phone, was helping a guest, because he was on his cell phone and the desk phone simultaneously and it sounded like he was dealing with a personal issue. With the exception of the Concierge Desk, the rest of the staff at the hotel were professional, friendly and very accommodating, and we would not hesitate to stay here again.

I am satisfied with all aspects of my stay. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Free wifi internet offered in the rooms was very fast. Room service was great. Whatever you need, you call them and they bring it to your room in few minutes. After staying in four different 5 star hotels in US, this hotel was the only one who offered a tea kettle in the room. I don't have anything to fault the hotel.

This one is bordering on dropping out of classification, I think. It is reasonably clean and tidy. The fit out is a little dated and in some rooms tired. I tried a couple, for reasons I will come to in a minute. Bed is comfortable. It is a tourist hotel, some distance from the financial district, but convenient to the main shopping area, and appeared to be frequented by tour bus parties. There is not a good selection of restaurants and coffee close by.The rooms are incredibly sparse. No water, nothing in the fridge or cupboards, no paper (they have gone paperless and services are requested online through the TV/intranet). The only thing in the room were toiletries, towels, and an American style brew coffee machine. Free wifi speed is just above the threshold of pain.But the reason I won't be back follows. Readers who are easily offended should now stop reading.At about 11pm I was just contemplating turning in when I heard a noise. Other reviews have commented that it doesn't see well soundproofed. I heard a regular, high pitched "owwrrr" from the room next door. Usually these things don't go on for long, so I wasn't too troubled, but it persisted. Only to be replaced by a sort of "mewwww" that was also regular and high pitched. I admired the variation in style, but it was so persistent I stuck my head out my door, partly puzzled, and party intrigued. Only to have it stop and be replaced by a distinct "yap". At which point I realised there was actually a real dog in there. Extraordinary. Which promptly started to go off its nut with a full time barking episode. I rang switch and, in disbelief, asked if it was hotel policy to accept dogs. And was advised it was. Which means there is a statistical probability that a dog had lived in my room at some time. Sorry not on. I love dogs, but I am not staying a hotel which allows dogs to stay. It never even occured to me that a Hyatt might. New question now added to my travel list!!Anyway, back to the evening's entertainment. I explained to switch I had a problem. They sent security. A large, very pleasant man who sympathised, established there was no-one but the dog home and rang the manger. Who came, tried to contact the owners and then opened the door. Only to have the security guy attacked by a wizened rat like creature, which the owners had obviously (and fraudulently) been told was a "dog" because one of the sounds it could make was a "yap". The visual contrast as the rat attacked the physically imposing security guy was hilarious and a clear indicator of the rat's IQ.At which point the guys managed to herd the animal back indoor and shut it. Advising me that they would have to get the "animal control officer" up. You are joking...an "animal control officer"????? I offered to control it permanently for free. But the offer was declined.After some little time they managed to find me a downgrade room to move to. While the rat yapped on....Bizarre.

My room was amazing. Great views of San Fransisco and a comfortable bed. If you like working out, you will be very pleased with the gym here. It is on the 35th floor with an amazing view and excellent equipment.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt, Union Square, San Francisco for 5 nights in June 2015. I have food intolerances and the hotel catered for this in most cases and they made it reasonably easy for me to have food for breakfast and evening meals. I have stayed here in 2013 for a similar amount of time and in a very similar room. This time however I was on the Union Square side and I found the rooms very noisy (not from the construction work outside - which I was told during checkin, but from the rooms surrounding). I even, ashamedly, called down to reception to ask them to deal with the noise at 1am (as this noise level was constant in the preceding nights and I couldn't deal with it for a third night in a row). The security dealt with it, which was good, however it started again the next night. I donâ€™t believe it was the fault of the other guests, more so, the lacking of soundproofing in the walls, something that is quite disappointing in such a high calibre hotel and for what the guests are paying!The hotel is very well situated with a Muni Bus (the easiest way of transportation around the city) right out the front (on the corner of Stockton and Sutter Streets). As well as being walking distance (without hills) to shops and Union Square and Bart (the train system)There is a wonderfully equipped gym (pictures attached) as well as a lovely set up of the breakfast and evening canapÃ©s in the Club Lounge (images attached). On the top level is a private area that you can view (if there are no functions being held) the landscape of the city. It would also be a fantastic location for any function you are wanting to hold (images attached)The staff from all departments were very friendly and helpful and it also helps that I have an extreme soft spot for San Francisco. If any readers would like to hear things that you really need to do during your time in San Fran please donâ€™t hesitate to get into contact with me â€“ Iâ€™ve done tourist things as well as "off the beaten track" walks and venture - I have photos of all I have done.

Our stay has been really enjoyable. Customer service is top notch from housekeeping to the doorman. Rooms are nice and the bed is comfy. Our view of SF is awesome! Convenient to Union Square, steps away. Chinatown is also just a block away. The fitness center is nice and has everything you need to get a good workout in. We'd stay here again.

Its been the best place i have stayed at !! The well decorated and equipped rooms Great hopitality !! The ambience around the hotel is great ! Of the best corner was the fire place at the lobby to beat the cold outside. Union square being just a few steps away and ofcourse the shopping was easy to access ! Loved every bit of the stay!

Since there are a lot of Filipinos who work there, it felt like home. Starbucks in the lobby is good but there is one right across the street as well. We dined there one evening but food wasn't that great. I would rather eat in Loris Deli, which is just a 2-3 minute walk. I would consider Marriott on my next visit just to do a comparison.

Looking like a great cold building the inside is surprisingly cozy, I sat with friends in the lobby for hours just talking. The rooms were bright and sunny and dark when it was needed. Bathroom was modern and had all the necessities in it. Close to the Bart and surrounded by great shops.

Only stayed here 1 night prior to moving on to Fisherman's Wharf. Check-in was quick efficient and friendly (after having a bad journey through immigration at SFO)Our room was high and overlooked Union Square.Hotel furnishings were very nice and the only small complaint I had was the inter connecting door seemed thin and we had noisy neighbours.....but saying that we were only there 1 night so no major problem.A nice hotel in a good location.

We stayed 3 night at the Grand Hyatt and really liked the location next to the union square. We had a room on the 26 floor with a splendid view on the bay. The room it self is nice for a city travel or business stay. The doors do not close from the outside noise so you can hear pretty much everything eg when your neighbors are coming home late at night. And stay away from any room next to the ice machine if you do not want a all night noise. Besides this we liked the stay and slept really well in this hotel.

Before heading to the Hyatt I had seen great reviews and some negative feedback on the construction around the hotel and noise. It honestly didn't bug me a bit! The location of the hotel was fantastic, close to shopping and great restaurants. We had booked 3 rooms and stayed for 3 nights. Upon arrival, one of our rooms wasn't ready until after 6:30 pm due to a late check-out. We weren't too put out, as we had two other rooms to put our belongings in, but it did seem pretty late. The front desk staff sent up some wine and beers to our rooms for the inconvenience, which was nice. We had club level rooms, which was worth it. Access to continental breakfast (a good one, not just muffins and yogourt) made it worth it and also kept us up in the higher floors, so the view was spectacular. We had kept one extra room for an extra night so that we'd have somewhere to put all of our things until we left at 5:30 pm. With not getting our room until so late the first day, it would have been nice to have that credited - but whatever. I'd stay again simply due to how nice the hotel is and the location.

We stayed there April 2015, the hotel is in great location but I wouldn't say it compares to other Grand Hyatt hotels, its not luxurious as other Hyatt I have been to, maybe it is for NA standards. Good location close to SF shopping area and all attractions accessible.

We stayed for 4 nights in June, and as diamond members, used one of our suite upgrades during our stay. Overall a nice, clean hotel in a good location with friendly and helpful staff - you certainly would not go wrong staying here. However...It's just not what we had come to expect from a Grand Hyatt and there were a few annoyances that added a little frustration to our stay. The Grand Club is nice enough but the breakfast and dinner snack options are pretty limited compared to other Grands we've stayed in. Our Wifi connection was problematic throughout our stay which as I had to work a bit was frustrating. After I phoned tech support and was told it was my laptop, the front desk were very helpful and offered to send someone to look at it which was good but frustrating nonetheless. Since my laptop has travelled everywhere with us and we'd not had problems anywhere else, seemed odd it would suddenly be the laptop . Indeed on the Tuesday before we left it suddenly started working without any problems at all - Ho hum! Also, there are no express elevators to the higher floors which meant during busy periods it was taking 10 minutes or longer to get from our floor (29) to the lobby, or we would be waiting for an elevator for what felt like ages to go up to our room each time. Minor things but they add up and left us feeling a little underwhelmed rather than really satisfied which is how I normally walk away from a Hyatt stay feeling.

Very nice hotel, location, and rooms. Just a little noisy right now with lots of construction next door and down the street. hfjksk hsdflkjhsdlk hklsjdfhsdlkjh hslkdjfslkj hsflksklj kljsdhfjklsdhfsjkdh lkjashdflkjds lkjsdhflkjsdhfjk kljshdfjkshdfh lkjhsdfkljhsadflkhj

The room was large and comfortable. As I was on the 32nd floor, the view, too, was incredible. I have one small complaint - when I checked in, I had to wait for an hour for my room. During that time, I received no feedback from the staff as to my room's status. However, they compensated for the inconvenience (without me asking) by giving me access to the Grand Club during my entire stay. The restaurant, although recently moved to the second floor from the top of the hotel, was fantastic - great service and delicious food. The concierge service was exceptionally helpful.

We selected this hotel due to the location on Union Square and it did not disappoint. But our stay was much more pleasant than expected because of our experience with the excellent and friendly staff at the hotel. Steve on the Reception desk was very friendly and made we two weary travelers feel right at home. Our room was lovely and well appointed. Everyone we dealt with at the hotel, from the people holding the doors in the lobby to the concierge who was so helpful and the staff at both the OneUp bar and OneUp restaurant were very pleasant to deal with. We had a very good experience in San Francisco and would cettainly stay here again on our next visit to San Francisco.

Decent stay, good location, friendly staff. Hotel restaurant was a bit disappointing, maybe caught them on a bad night. Other eateries close by. Good location for shopping, and getting to know downtown San Francisco. Cabs right outside hotel.

The hotel is clean, modern and comfortable. Quick check in/out and very good service. Very nice bar/restaurant to hang out. The rooms are spacious and the beds are fairly comfortable. I was hoping for a pool, but it did not have one.

Excellent facilities, super friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are clean, quiet and modern. If you are able to have access to the Club lounge, it is a great relaxer. Staff there are the best in any club I have attended. Location is great to get to all the parts of SF you want to visit.

Love this hotel. Right off Union Square. Great for business also if you happen to like Christmas shopping in The City. Easy across the bridge to Emeryville / Oakland in case you are headed that way. Staff is excellent and super friendly.

We stayed here 5/27. First off, the staff, EVERYONE, is absolutely AMAZING and helpful. They provided suggestions for site seeing, transportation and food. Unlike other hotels that charge $8 per bottled water, we had 6 brought to us for free. The hotel is literally in the heart of the city. We were a 5 min or less walk from Chinatown and a 2min walk to amazing shopping. Any direction you walk from the entrance, you'll end up somewhere amazing. Great shopping, farmers markets, places to eat...it's all accessible from the Hyatt ! We took a trolley ($6 all day pass ) down to the wharf. I highly recommend this! Great views, picture opportunities, and HELLO, you're in San Francisco! RIDE A TROLLEY!! The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because construction woke us up at 6am. Omg....lol. Our room faced Macy's, and although the view of Union Square and the bay are stunning, that construction was loud. Let me reiterate, the staff was Just lovely, from the valet to the bellhop to the front desk. Omg....almost forgot. You can even 'text' the hotel, and asked questions! We asked about bars and breakfast recommendations. They responded within 2min. How fun is that! We didn't eat there, but we did go to the bar for a drink. Great vibe to just relax and socialize. I included pics of our room view (2419) and a fun trolley pic!!

Well located in downtown San Francisco with only walking stroll to Macy, Disney store, Union Square and other shopping strip. It's also couple blocks away from Powell Street turntable and Westfield. The good thing is you don't see homeless around your hotels as homeless is part of SF community that you normally see around the town. Room is kinda small but expected for downtown hotels. If you ever forgot any amenities they have list of items that you can request to housekeeping, very long list! Sure that would meet all your needs!

We chose The Grand Hyatt for our weekend getaway as it was perfectly located in between the theater, Book of Mormon, and the restaurant, Slanted Door. It's a well-maintained property with stunning views of the Bay and city. The proximity to Union Square was also a real bonus. I will stay here again when I return to the city.

My opinion of the Grand Hyatt San Francisco... meh...I stayed for a night in a standard double and found it to be small and the bed to not be very comfortable. The amenities are average, the bathroom is average, the check-in experience was average.... you get the point.By far my biggest complaint with this hotel is the service. First off, don't put on your website as the first option for arriving from the airport a route by way of the BART. It's six blocks... uphill... from the nearest station. My father and I hoofed it with 6 pieces of luggage, arriving drenched in sweat. Just unacceptable to not provide proper information to paying customers. We would have gladly hired a car or paid for a taxi from the airport had we known it is in no way a walking distance with luggage. Just in case you think I'm over-reacting, the reaction from two front desk employees was "You walked that with luggage!!!!".Second, when I filed a complaint I asked that they please e-mail me once they've had time to discuss internally possibly putting a disclaimer on that "transportation" option. Of course I never received an e-mail, nor an apology.Just a disappointing experience. I originally had a reservation at the Hyatt Regency SFO, but changed it to the Grand Hyatt. I certainly regret that now.Low-end of the scale 4-star property in a 5-star location, with 3-star service. My recommendation would be to shop wisely.

This hotel is situated nicely so you can access Chinatown, Union Square, the Moscone convention center, and other areas within minutes by foot. The modern feel and the great amenities were a welcome treat that I enjoyed while staying here on business. The higher floors (I stayed on the 23rd) offer scenic views of the bay (including coit tower, Alcatraz) and the sunset/sunrise was gorgeous. I would definitely stay here again.

Hadn't stayed at this property in several years, but they've really upgraded the place. Rooms are spacious and have everything you'd need. Staff were friendly, welcoming and available. The coffee bar had fresh muffins and breakfast sandwiches which is always great.

The Grand Hyatt has great staff that care about your stay. The rooms are updated with Hyatt class.The location is fantastic, just around the corner from union square.We walked to the theater and plenty of dining and shopping options. This location is safe and views of the bay are awesome.

Excellent hotel with a new attitude to do business. There is not lobby by as soon as you get to the hotel you are greed with a person that makes your life easy. This hotel is used to test the new method and I can tell it worked for me. The hotel's instalations , the personnel and the rooms were fanastic. Great location, in downtown closed to all major transportation means, close to Chinatown and to all the major stores.

If it wasn't the neighbors too loud at midnight to interrupt our sleep, it'd be a perfect trip. But everything else was great. The staff are excellent. Would stay there again. The location is where you want to be. You can walk to Chinatown. You can walk to a BART station. We even walked to Fisherman's Wharf. There are plenty of shops and restaurants around the area. It's everything you want on a vacation in the Bay Area.

This hotel is 1 Block from Union Square, and 1 mile from AT&T ballpark, very busy location, lots of construction going on right now, lots of services and shopping nearby close to Embarcadero. Friendly hotel staff.Nice rooms,Will stay again.

Location : Central, Macy's next door, 10 minute walk to Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf is 10 minute by taxi. Lobby : The interiors are not that great, there is definitely room for improvement. People : Very nice and accomodating staff ! from the bellman to the receptionist to the concierge, every one was warm and friendly and willing to help ! Food : We had room service, buffalo wings, it was excellent ! Beds : Very comfortable !Room : Cozy and Clean ! Bathroom : Typical hotel bathroom,nothing fancy but it was clean. The toiletries are not name-brands, but still good enough to use.Price : Reasonable considering you are smack right in the middle of everything

My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt in SF for two nights while on business. We were very happy with our stay, the room was very clean, and we will definitely make plans to return to this hotel in the near future. I was fascinated with the layout of the lobby, and I thought the artwork looked cool (see pictures). Also, the room was very nice and the bed was extremely comfortable, although I thought that the room could have used a bit more lighting. We ate at the restaurant OneUp a couple of times, and we met up with friends at the lounge in the evening. I admit that we were surprised to find that the food was excellent, especially since the restaurant was never crowded when we visited. The staff was friendly, and we enjoyed our food every time we visited. All in all, the hotel is in a great location downtown (Union Square), is close to lots of shopping and eateries, and the rooms are well-appointed. Thank you!

Stayed here for the weekend. Great location just off Union Square. Central to almost everything. Staff is excellent, very attentive and responsive. Rooms are updated and very nice. Street construction on the Union Square side of the hotel was quite noisy. Would recommend asking for a room on another side of the hotel.

From the moment we got there, Valet parking was on it although it's quite a feat to get curbside in the first place since the city is hustling and bustling. Check in was a breeze, the bell hop got our belongings quickly up to our room. The room was fantastic, we had a room on the 26th floor with Bay views which I probably enjoyed the most. Room service was prompt, food and drink were great! Felt a good sense of privacy too. The only thing that was a little disappointing was the water pressure in the shower. One Up Bar and Restaurant was excellent!! The location was also a big factor as it's right in the middle of the city.

Our arrival was Filled with "Hawaiian Hospitality" Hugs of Welcome from Steven at the front desk just made our Day (traveled by by Van that morning from Eureka). Check-in was smooth; our luggage was promptly brought to our rooms by Ceaser (he was so helpful too.) Our Executive Suite was spectactular and jaw dropping. Mahalo Michael Jokovich the Best ever General Manager EVER!!!!( we miss you on Maui : ( The Grand Club Services were exceptional and gracious as ever. Manuel/Engineering took care of our requests and left us well taken cared of. Gina in the Executive Office is a priceles Gem! Mahalo for securing "Giants" Tickets on such short notice. My first Game ever....I will Never forget it!. And Hugs from Jennifer Loh made our trip complete!. So many Wonderful memories for Me and my Ohana (family) Mahalo Nui Loa (Thank you Grand Hyatt San Francisco from the bottom of our hearts)

I generally like Hyatt hotels and this one was pretty good as well.The staff was efficient and accommodating.I did find two draw backs.The beds could use renewing, they are very soft and I prefer a firm mattress.The exercise room was on the small side and if you wanted to work out before work without waiting in line you better be there before 6:00 AM.

So far the business hotels of other big chains were rather disappointing. So the Grand Hyatt was a very positive surprise. Everything new and clean, no worn out carpets, etc. My room was on the 8th floor on the backside. Not the perfect view but it was very quiet. Rooms are big, beds are good and here I could even handle the aleays present shower curtain. You have a little coffee maker for a first wake up coffee or to make hot water for a tea. There is a Starbucks in the bldg and one directly opposite. One block up Sutter St is a nice diner if you are looking for a good breakfast and there are also some nice pubs around. Little down was the pricing in the hotel bar. But all together - thumps up.

Good hotel, comfortable spacious accommodation in a brilliant location. Friendly staff: Welcoming reception staff and knowledgeable concierge offered good advice for our first visit to San Francisco. Would recommend staying in Union Square.

First time visit to San Fran.Stayed here for convention at Moscone Center, which was a short 10 minute walk away. Our initial room was on the 12th floor with a Union Square view. As a fan of high floors, and awesome views, it did not cut it, so we asked to move, and for a slight rate increase our request was granted. New room was on the 24th floor with awesome view of the Bay and had a better layout than the previous. Bountiful choices for shopping and dining nearby. We did have a rental car, which was $41 a day to "self park" which is not really self parking since you hand over the keys to someone to park your car. We did have to go back to the car to get our luggage the 1st day, and lets just say they park the cars very tight! Could barely get the suitcases out of the trunk. Also note it is across the street and requires 3 left turns to get back to it if you pull in front of the hotelThis area is very busy with pedestrian traffic and for the most part felt very safe. Walked to the Masonic Theater one evening for a Sammy Hagar/James Hetfield Acoustic Benefit concert for pediatric cancer. No issues walking back at 11pm after the show.If this is your 1st time to San Fran be prepared for some serious hills and elevation changes while walking! We walked to Tony's Napoletana and then to the Piers, Ghiradelli Square and Lombard Street. Amazing views, but we were exhausted! Would do it again in a heartbeat.Hotel is maybe 15 minute drive to Golden Gate Bridge. Drive over to the other side and drive the road up to "Hawks Point" which is at an elevation of 805 feet. Best vantage point of the city from up there. Muir Woods is a must as well, but try to go off peak.

Our stay at the Grand Hyatt Hotel exceeded our every expectation. Terrific location, upgraded room was beyond belief, and service by all staff was "Grand"! Of the thousands of hotels we have stayed in over the years this experience was "the best"!

Location is great, walking distance to majority of important places. Clean rooms with great view from higher floors ( we were on 24th ). Breakfast was one of the best during this our stay in US. We have tried the dinner once as well and we were satisfied too. Willing personnel. Everywhere clean.

I just arrived 15 minutes ago and was badly welcomed by a bad behavior receptionist. This kind of attitude does not fit at all to this high class fancy hotel. Then, my room should be available by 3pm and the receptionist just said coldly that it was not available and not even an apology. Unbelievable! I hope the manager can read this and give her more training.

Impressive view of the room, cleening and stlyle. I just love it! Plus, there are no additional charges when you deliver a package from Amazon or other online sites to the hotel (as other hotels do, such as Sheraton).

The Union Square area is under a lot of construction right now but the hotel itself was a pleasure to stay at. It's convenient to the BART and local city transportation options as well. I'm a Diamond Hyatt member and the club access is great with stunning views and very attentive staff. Really nice stay.

Be wary of staying in rooms close to Union square as the roadworks and adjacent construction occur day and night. The noise was audible from the 18th floor. Nice room and good location. Friendly staff.

Got upgraded to a bay view room with grand club access. The food at the club was great. Rooms are updated, spacious, and clean. Bay view was spectacular. Nothing I can complain about. I have stayed at the Westin St. Francis a few times as well and I would give the Grand Hyatt a slight edge over it.

I have stayed at the Park Hyatt Hotels in other countries and have had wonderful experiences. However, the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco left me unsatisfied. The hotel staff were very professional. However, we had requested assistance in getting dinner reservations from the checkin rep. She stated that she would take care of it and would contact us. We never heard from anyone at the hotel regarding the dinner reservations. The hotel had no store to purchase water and other items needed throughout our stay. There were no water bottles in our room until the night before our departure (which was I assume, the maids attempt to make a good impression for tipping purposes only). Lastly, although our room was clean everyday, the mattresses left my husband and I with back pain every morning. On a good note, the doormen were always there to open the door for us, they got taxis for us immediately and the location was perfect--right in Union Square.

This hotel is very centrally located and walking distance to many attractions. The staff was polite and helpful throughout our visit. Our room was adequate in size, updated, and clean. Our only two complaints are 1) the low water pressure/rain shower head make showering slightly difficult and 2) housekeeping came in to our room even though we had the privacy sign on our door. I don't think I would use these as reasons to not stay here again, but if these things matter to you, then it's important you know.

Great place to stay in SF, close to Macy's and Union Square, so good if you want to go shopping. Lobby had popcorn and lemonade while we waited to check in and champagne when we checked out. Room was spacious, no noise from neighbours or the street, pressure in the shower was nice and strong and the bed was big and comfy. So it ticked all my boxes. I would definitely stay there again and have recommended it to my parents on their visit.

The hotel had a GREAT location - close to shopping and restaurants and Union Square. Room was nice with a good view of the water, but the bathroom sliding door did not close all the way, and the shower had no water pressure. Free wifi, didn't eat at any of the restaurants. We did get locked out of our room and they sent maintenance up right away to let us in. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Stayed for a couple of nights to see the Giants. Nice hotel. Interesting lobby and is smallRoom was clean average size.People were great and very helpfulRoom not ready so went to bar for a couple of beersCoors Lite 12 oz draft $9.00 each seems a bit high.Close to Union Square and lots of great places

Insanely expensive. But didn't mind since someone else was paying for me.Reception is great. As u would expect.Rooms are pretty standard affair. But since mine was at the 19th floor so view was great. 1 complain I have is they didn't have a glass for water in the room.

great staff courteous helpfull and friendly. absolutely loved the room .Best view of san francisco i`ve ever had I have already recommended others to this hotel and will continue to send others in the future

Stayed for a few days while attending a convention. I liked the peace and quiet in the stylish and modern room, the comfortable bed and the above-average quality of the in-room coffee and tea selection (always a nice touch). But apart from this, the hotel offers little else for a relaxing stay: the large lobby is extremely busy and noisy, with throngs of people being shunted through at all times, the mezzanine bar likewise. Perhaps the only thing to go some way towards making up for these shortcomings is the (not so busy) fitness room on the 35th floor, with views across the skyscraper jungle towards the bay. Overall an ok stay, but not quite so convincing value-for-money.

Hotel was wonderful, I would have given this 5 stars except for the noise that came from the construction that ran over into our meeting. No fault of the hotels but annoying none the less.Hotel staff partnered with us to make this a positive experience for our attendees.Location was great; lots of shopping, restaurants and public transportation within walking distance.Hotel lobby was unique and well decorated. Sleeping rooms were clean and comfortable. Showers were great with good pressure.Food was the best conference food I've ever experienced.

Overall, this hotel was great. Only complaint was that the bed wasn't comfortable. Mattress was likely on the older side and I sank right into it, resulting in back pain each morning. Everything else was top notch.

great location, great 35th floor workout room with killer views of the city..breakfast at hotel was outstanding, fresh, very good quality food...lots to do in the area...shopping in area something for everyone...

We had booked this hotel as part of our honeymoon through a booking site for 4 nights. Upon check in we were made welcome and checked in very swiftly and on check out we were advised that we had no charges and everything was prepaid. 2 weeks after returning home the hotel charged the entire stay to my credit card which we had provided for incidentials. When I rang and emailed the hotel I was advised that we had cancelled our reservation with the booking site and this is why they billed us directly. This has put a real stink on our once in a lifetime honeymoon/holiday and we found the customer service to be very poor. Also SF is beautiful however it dosnt feel very safe especially at night.

The hotel was clean, well decorated, and centrally located to all the desirable "tourist" destinations. The view from our window was incredible at night; so much so, that we elected to sleep with the shade open to view the nighttime skyline. The staff was helpful and courteous. We will be back.

I stayed at the Hyatt for a business trip and would love to return for leisure. The hotel is beautiful and well-kept. The staff was very friendly. The breakfast that was included with my room was also amazing! But the best part was the view! Amazing views! Would definitely recommend to anyone staying in the area!

Rooms were tastefully decorated and very comfortable. The hotel location is very convenient. Rate was great for the quality of the property. Fitness center was small but great views! Large hotel but 'small' hotel feel. Great lobby - cozy and comfortable.

I was there for Business and leasure. Location is just perfect as it could be. Staff was Not caring except of the valet Parking Team and concierge at Club which Are great. No water in minibar or in the room. You have to take care to get it at the icemachine if you like to drink something in the night.

Excellent hotel room and staff. Great location right in the middle of Union Square with lots of dining and shopping options. I had left an item in the room safe and the security staff was very responsive and helpful in retrieving the item and mailing it to me. The room is very nice and cozy.

I have visited this property several times and it is still improving. It is close to BART, shopping, the ballpark, the cable car to fisherman's wharf, etc. But the property is also nice enough for a staycation with the fitness center, business center and the views.

The location is ideal for visiting the theatre district or shopping in Union Square. The overall atmosphere of the hotel is excellent. Views from the higher floors can't be beat. Used the new mobile check in which worked flawlessly.

Excellent location for this Hyatt - staff extremely attentive - would definitely stay here on my next San Francisco visit. The OneUp restaurant/bar was open late which helped with a place to retreat to for good food, drinks and conversation after a long day of San Francisco sight seeing.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a night in May on our way back into San Francisco. Our room was located on the 25th floor and it was great. Very modern, all amenities and really well looked after. We we there with some of my work mates and had drinks in the bar on the 1ST floor. Service and the drinks were great also. No complaints with this hotel and our preferred over the Westin as we had stayed there earlier in the same week. The Grand Hyatt is much more modern and contemporary.

Excellent location off Union Square. I really liked the room layout and furniture. Also has block out blinds. Great mezzanine bar and restaurant really added to the experience as I don't spend much time in the room!House keeping wake up at 8.45 on Saturday morning was ridiculous, but all other staff really friendly and helpful while professional.Ask for a late check out!

Grand Hyatt staff was very helpful, friendly and courteous. Willing to answer questions about locations and travel without issue. Loved the hotel decor. Very modern. Location was close to lots of shopping and restaurants within walking distance. Enjoyed the view of the city from the room.

I had conference San francisco Moscone center. It was walking distance to the center and union square for great shoppingGreat views from the restaurant, very helpful concierge service.I will come back with my family next time.

Located right in the heart of Union Square and San Francisco, this Grand Hyatt is a fabulous choice for lodging and dining in the city. The staff was exceptional...at check in, in the restaurant, and on the club level. We would go back again and again!

The Hyatt is about 20 mins walk to Fishermans wharf. It is very close to Chinatown though but I found that to be alittle dirty.The bed was a king and was very comfortable with great pillows. The bathroom and shower was well presented and clean. Free wifi, self parking is $40 per day close by with in and out access and valet is about $61 for a park (I don't think you can go in and out). When you pull up out the front they will let you know these options.

Stayed for 4 night for a business conference. The room was clean and overall comfortable. The chair at the desk sat too low to work comfortably there. The overall work out facility is adequate and has a nice view. The hotel's location is convenient to shopping and convention center.

I stayed here only for one night. The room looked like it was very recently remodeled and it was lovely and quite large. I like the motorized window shade on the very large picture window. Nice view of the city and the bay. Unfortunately, the hotel room was very noisy. Conversation in the hallway was fully audible and the ac unit was also loud. On the plus side, ear plugs were provided! Location right off Union Square was convenient.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a week. great weather and the city is worthy of a visit. Grand Hyatt disappointed. While many Union Square hotels are pricy, we picked the Grand Hyatt because we stayed at this brand in other cities. For the price, it did not seem a bargain. Lobby, restaurant were nice but our room seemed very dated. uncomfortable seating. Shower (tower) had low pressure and seemed less than normal. Overall I would not stay here at this location again.

Stayed here four nights during a twelve day stay. Very nice and secure. Close to everything- restaurants, China Town, museums, trains, Trolleys. I parked my car elsewhere because to hotel's fee. There are plenty of garages around. Would visit again!

First the good:1) Location in the heart of downtown San Francisco overlooking the bay and restaurants, attractions etc.2) Service was good for most part - Belldesk, Checkin etc3) We had an infant travelling with us and the Hotel took extra care to make our stay pleasant. 4) BAd:1)Price is definitely on the high side.2)Parking is very close but pretty expensive with Valet running at $60+ a day and self at $41 so if you can avoid dont bring a rental car 3) Housekeeping wasn't responsive. We forgot toothpaste and it took them almost a day to get it to us.

I stayed 4 nights. With the combination of adjoining room and poor windows it was the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed in. When I asked to move from the room I was told 90% of the rooms where adjoining. Terrible for what they describe as an executive suite.

Highly recommended hotel with friendly helpful staff. Starbucks conveniently located in the lobby for morning coffee and pastries. Conveniently located and easy to get around with and without a car. Keeping car at hotel is expensive but convenient. Clean and modern and good gym facilities.

Room- A little dated, very dusty, creaky walls..Staff- Helpful, Polite, Location- Fantastic location on union square made it easy to go anywhere.. This is what your paying for.. Facilities- Didnt get a chance for restaurant experience but hear it's very nice, no pool, starbucks across road..

Great business hotel, very well located. Staff is great, bar/lounge is very good, location is very central right next to Union Square, and rooms are very clean and comfortable. Grand Club is beautiful, although food choice could be larger.

I stayed three nights. Decent distance to subway (BART) and plenty of bus stops nearby. Was in town for business conference at Moscone and found it convenient and very agreeable walk back and forth. Lots of shopping and dining options in walking distance as well. Fast elevators, friendly staff. Would definitely consider staying here again for business trip. Not really a kid-friendly hotel but not unfriendly either. But definitely more of the corporate, tourist option as opposed to staying in a quaint, neighborhood hotel or VRBO - so if I brought wife or family I'd look at getting out of the core SF downtown and finding something with more local and cultural flavor and appeal.
