I got a surprisingly good rate on this (still expensive!) and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Overlooking Union Square, the hotel is very modern, stylish and the room was spacious and well furnished. Staff were friendly and room service excellent and prompt. Minor quibble was that the bathroom did not live up to the expectations set by the room - but it was fine.

The hotel is perfectly located at the central area of San Francisco, very close to the cable car, and close to several stores and restaurants! The union square area also is very safe to walk at night and we didn't have any kind of trouble or dangerous situation.The rooms are very spacious, beds are very confortable, and service was very attentive and fast!The only two downsides were the rooms a little noisy, specially in the morning (you could hear other rooms doors opening and closing), and the Internet work a little irregularly.Besides that I think that a hotel at this should have the breakfast included.In general the hotel is very good and I would come back!!

property has been updated and staff are top notch. Would like better restaurant on premises. If you are out of town guest, the location could not be better...anytime of year...especially December holidays.

The Grand Hyatt is one of these 'can't really go wrong but won't be too memorable either' hotels, of which there are so many these days. It's all it promises to be: at a great location almost directly on Union Square, friendly receptionists and concierge, efficient, spacious rooms, good breakfast with a great spread. The views from floor 18 or so upwards are wonderful, going over SF's roofs and onto the Bay. I was a bit disappointed with the gym, which was small, cramped full of machines and quite characterless. But beds were good and - important for those intercontinental travellers among us - the blinds made the room completely dark. Oh, and the free wifi signal was very strong, even in the upper floors! A quick word of warning: there's a building site in front of the hotel at the moment so the lower floors should perhaps be avoided (some of our party had difficulties with noise). Overall a very good and comfortable stay - just not a spectacular one.

Fabulous location if you're a shopper. Lots of construction in the area make it more difficult to get around, however. The staff (especially the front desk staff) were very helpful. Rooms were nicely appointed and comfortable. Wish I were there longer (only stayed one night) to use the other amenities in the hotel.

The hotel was remodeled a few years ago, and is now a very modern, sleek hotel in downtown San Francisco. It is situated on Union Square, and is just a short walk/cab ride from most of San Francisco's main attractions. It is definitely a fantastic location - and if you're visiting San Francisco for tourism, you'll want to stay in a hotel that's this convenient.I arrived early, not expecting to be able to check-in, but the hotel staff kindly took my number, and within 15 minutes they had my room ready. I was booked in a suite on the second night, and a standard room on the first night, but the staff realized that asking me to change rooms would be inconvenient and thus allowed me to stay in the suite for both nights for only slightly more money. The room was fantastic, with two bathrooms, two televisions, and a nice living area. The views were great, and if you are one of those travelers that likes to exercise, then you'll enjoy the fantastic views from the hotel's 35th floor gym. My only critiques of the hotel are the following: --This hotel has (just like many others) done away with minibars (there is a small refrigerator) in the room, this is fine but there were no water bottles in the room (not even for purchase). I found this to be really inconvenient. I did ask for waters, and the hotel did bring me several (at no charge), but the second night we actually ordered water from room service, and a large bottle of mineral water was $20 (after taxes, delivery fees, and tip). --Room service isn't 24 hours, again, not that important, but full service hotels traditionally have 24hr room service. If I remember correctly, room service was only available in the evening, and for breakfast (most travelers staying at the property probably don't stay in to eat lunch). --I am a Hyatt Platinum member, and I stay at Hyatt hotels around the world frequently. I found the toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, body wash) to below the standard of what I would normally expect from a "Grand Hyatt."Overall this is a great hotel, with great service, and a great location. Try booking through Hyatt's website to get a good deal (you may be surprised). I found the rates to be very competitive even though I made the reservation about a week before my stay during a busy spring weekend.

I loved the dinning experience in Grand Hyatt, the service is what I particularly valued. The staff and manager in the restaurant provided personal service and answered every question. Plus, the location of the hotel is so close to the center area of the city!

Stayed at the Grand Hyatt SF for 6 nights last months and had a great stay. The check-in was very quick, friendly and professional. Got a corner room on one of the lower floors, but it was really nice and clean. The location of this hotel is fantastic, only a few steps from Union Square. The service was overall very good and I will surely return to this hotel next time in San Francisco.

This is my second time staying at the Grand Hyatt, San San Francisco. Rooms with king size beds is slightly smaller and the bathroom is slightly older compare to double bed rooms.Cons: - Great location- Grand lobby- Friendly staffPros: - Some rooms needs to be updated- Lobby is nicer than rooms - Rooms with king size bed is cramped- TV is position oddly on the wall (king size room)

Great stay in SF in perfect location at Union square. Web check in was a breeze and the kiosk check in at arrival was smooth. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful from the valet to the restaurant staff. We had a great view of union square in our room 1719. The hotel was the most reasonably priced hotel around and I will book again on our frequent trips to the city.

I stayed here with my wife for a few days and it was great. Rooms were a bit smaller than some hotels but not much to complain since it was in the middle of San Francisco. I would recommend this place for anyone that needs to visit SF.

We spent spring break in SF and were extremely pleased with the hotel. Beautiful adjoining rooms with a great view of the city, the bay, Alcatraz, and Coit Tower. Excellent service and amenities and a perfect location.

Checked into the hotel very easy. The staff are really friendly. We had an amazing view from the 20 floor and there's still another 15-16 above. The hotel is central to everything, there's plenty of shops and not far from the cable cars to take you to fishermans wharf. Will stay again

Situated in city centre near Union SquareRooms clean and comfortable but nothing special. Floor to ceiling windows provide nice views on higher floors. Disappointing that the Grandviews top floor bar is now closed, so residents can't access, used to be one advantage of staying at this hotel. Had fantastic views across the city and bay.

So the location is excellent, the rooms nice and functional, it overlooks Union Square, is a short walk (albeit through construction) to get to the main shopping areas and Macys is on the far side of Union Square from it. However the service just doesn't match. It was slow...so so slow. They also neglected to advise or mention the 24 hour construction work that is going on right outside the hotel. The only hint when I arrived in my room was the industrial strength ear plugs that were provided. 12th floor and earplugs and still I was woken at 4am by the drilling and clanging. While I appreciate that the construction is not the fault of the hotel, when I asked for a room with a view, I thought perhaps it might have been mentioned that the view would come at a cost - lack of sleep. They leave an impressive list of items that are available to you should you require them at no extra cost - the usual, toiletries etc. - however you will be waiting up to an hour to have any of these delivered so if you want something in a hurry, it would be quicker to run to the Walgreens around the corner or to Starbucks across the road if it's refreshments you are looking for. I also find that providing only creamer powder for the lovely filter coffee defeats the purpose. On requesting actual milk or cream for my tea and coffee it was suggested I buy it from the above mentioned Walgreens and use the fridge in the room. Which I did!Would I return? Not by choice. There are too many other places to stay!

Friendly staff, nicely appointed rooms, good location. Beware if you are a light sleeper like I am (there's a reason the rooms have ear plugs in them) as even on the 21st floor, I can hear the construction coming to life at 4 am. Certainly not the hotel's fault (my room does face Union Square and I couldn't move as the hotel is full due to a conference) but you may have a hard time sleeping.

The staff here is uniformly among the best I've had the pleasure to meet. You expect great location and views in hotels of this caliber; it's the staff that sets the Grand apart from many of its competitors. One of the delightful surprises of the trip was looking out our window to find that we overlooked the alley in which Sam Spade's partner was shot in The Maltese Falcon. If you've any interest in San Francisco literary history, the GH is a great place to start the tour. I am looking forward to my next visit!

I really like this hotel. It is right near Union Square and an easy walk to Moscone. However, there is construction noise during the day that is unmanageable. This is going to go on for quite some time too as the City is building a subway down Stockton Street. If you have to stay, go for a high floor to get away from some of the sound and try to get a room facing Sutter. The rooms are really nice and have floor to ceiling windows with power shades that can be operated from either nightstand. The beds are comfortable and the bathroom is well appointed. The water pressure is weak but that is probably drought related.

Just had a really warm and friendly experience at the Grand Hyatt SF. I travel over 200 nights a year around the world and these guys are up there with the best. The One Up lounge has a good selection of wines by the glass. The Grand Club staff are so friendly and will go way beyond their job to help you. Small club lounge but great views and excellent canapÃ© selection in the evening.

This hotel is excellent. We got a room facing downtown SF and the bay.. It is definitely one excellent view of the beautiful city.Rooms are decently sized for a hotel in downtown SF, and impeccably clean.Location is great! Within walking distance to the many department stores and restaurants.Concierge is also always very helpful and friendly.Now on to the slight minor issues..You basically have to request everything.. from slippers to shower caps!We requested for some shower caps and were told that they run out!Oh and they have construction next door; however, we didn't find any disturbance from that.Overall, I would recommend this hotel for travellers looking for central location.

This is my second stay at the Grand Hyatt since the renovation (the first was actually during the renovation). The hotel is in a great location, nice and very modern. The rooms are good size and most, at least on upper floors, have great views. The lobby makes it feel more like a boutique hotel. The staff are very helpful. I'd recommend for both business and vacation.

I stayed here with my family (2 adults, 2 teens) arriving on 7th April for 6 days. When you arrive, super greeting from doormen and lobby reception team, very informal and friendly yet efficient. Obviously coming from the UK we were all very tired on arrival, were given a room on the 12th floor so off we went, I will cut a quite long story short or I'd go on for days, the room smelt very strongly on stale cigarette's and as none of us are smokers we really didn't want to stay in it for almost a week. The chap who showed us to the room came back up and said 'I'll get housekeeping to spray around and open the window for a while' which I did have a little laugh to myself about. Went to room number 2 also on 12th floor, my husband went to open the French window a bit and the frame broke completely then wouldn't shut, not ideal either, engineer came up and hammered it back into place but meant no fresh air for our stay as the door now couldn't be opened. Room number 3 on 17th floor was much better, roomier and cleaner but the noise from the works next to hotel was a shocker and they have a 24hr licence to work so the noise was going to stay! Anyway properly 3rd time lucky and were given a room on the 25th floor, super clean, roomier like the 17th floor and had fab views over the bay, so phew we could finally unpack and start our trip!! Location of hotel was perfect to get everywhere, close to restaurants, great designer shops on Union Square, Bus tour stops, trams, cable cars, all on your doorstep! The staff on reception were friendly and helpful, I definitely wasn't a cross complainer but when you go on a trip like this with your family you want it to be right. The One Up bar is a great place to nip in after a big day sightseeing for a drink and a quick use of the wifi as here has the best reception. I think it was a Friday evening, a singer was in the bar who was great, good atmosphere, good spot to relax.The room we ended up in was super, good sized bathroom, robes on request, shower I found no problem with as I had read before about the water pressure being weak but it was fine. Great housekeeping service, turndown service of an evening if you wanted it, fresh towels daily and a good little coffee machine in your room. Lovely comfortable beds and bedding too. The gallery on the 36th floor has amazing views of the bay and over the city so well worth a visit for photo's. My husband used the gym a couple of times and was 100% happy with it. Even after our rocky start I would stay here again without a doubt. Our stay in San Francisco was really great, it just was over too quickly!!

The hotel was a perfect location to explore San Francisco during my first visit to the city. However, be warned - the rooms are not very soundproof - I could hear every word the two families next to me said, and they were not particularly noisy.

We stayed 8 nights on Bay View Room, on the 26th floor.The outstanding view from the room on sunrise or sunset worth every nickel.Except for some police sirens from the city during day (after all this is center of town), no noise came into room. we had quite nights.The service is beyond our expectation. for example: there is no kettle in room (there is coffee machine), and when we asked hot water from room service, we got them in 2 minutes.Excellent bath room, Excellent bed, Excellent interactive interface on TV, a lot of TV channels.Close to bus stations and also to the shopping on Market street and Macy's.

I stayed here for the first time and was completely pleased with the hotel and its location. The room was clean, modern and quite accomodating. It's centrally located- walking distance from most places, shopping, restaurants etc. The hotel staff was also helpful. I checked in late and was helped to find a local restaurant.Would definitely stay here again.

The Grand Hyatt staff greeted me with a big smile, and that's always the best first impression. The lobby is quite small and informal so I immediately started wondering what the rooms would be like. When checking in, I mentioned that I wanted to go to the gym and I was offered a room on the 32nd floor so that I could be closer to the gym that was located two floors above me. That was a very nice touch. When I entered my room I was excited to see my view was overlooking Union Square. Such a beautiful view! The room had a tasteful clean and modern decor with wood floors. I hate carpets so this was a plus! Everything was high tech, with automatic sunshades on the windows. My bed was big fluffy and very comfortable. The spacious bathroom had an entire line of skincare products, soaps and shampoo etc. The gym was decent with free weights and cardio equipment and offers a great view onto the city while you workout. The view over San Francisco is spectacular from the top floor where you can see the entire city of San Francisco. As for location, you can't get better. You're right in the middle of everything. Walking distance to shopping, food and galleries. I would most definitely come back to this hotel and the hotel staff is wonderful. Thank you.

The Grand Hyatt is very well located and a well run property. I visit two or three times a year, and this is always my hotel of choice in SF. Rooms are spacious and amenities are above average. Valet parking is pricey as it is in any urban hotel. The Club Level for Hyatt members is especially nice. A full breakfast is served as well as a happy hour light buffet. The view is terrific. I'll be back and highly recommend the Grand Hyatt.

If you want to be centrally located on your next leisure trip to San Fran, then I recommend the Grand Hyatt. The staff are super friendly and helpful. The concierge service is also very informative on what to do in the area. As a Hyatt diamond member access to the Grand Club on the 32nd floor is included. Great views, and a really great spread for breakfast and happy hour. The OneUp bar is really a must visit too, but the experience definitely depends on the bartender you get. We had some outstanding ones, and some wet noodles. While I was mostly here on vacation with my wife, I had some business at the beginning of the week also, so WiFi and business center were critical. The WiFi in my room was especially spotty (very unreliable DNS), the staff do everything they can to address the issue, but it's all outsourced so its a tiring pass the buck, please reboot your device kinda dance. The business center is just sad. A small cubby without even one outlet to plug my laptop into! really!?! Also, spring/summer of 2015 they are building an Apple store right next door so be prepared for construction noise! And all day long! All in all though, a really good hotel.

Stayed here with my wife and daughter for a few days. It was perfect. We did not want the best, but wanted a reasonable value for a hotel with good location. This fit our needs perfectly. Rooms were clean and nice. Loved the Union Square location. Did not eat anything at the hotel, so can't comment on that. I would definitely stay again.

We have just returned from a trip to San Francisco where we stayed at the Grand Hyatt. I was expecting a generic city centre hotel, but this was far from it. The views were incredible, and I absolutely loved the electronic blinds on the wall-sized windows. The beds were very comfortable (there were two small doubles in the room). The air conditioning unit was quite loud and made some weird clunky noises.The bar area was very good, and aside from a relatively grumpy bar man, was a great experience with lovely cocktails. We also ate in the bar where they serve good snacky food (burgers, flat bread etc). Breakfast was served in the restaurant and was either buffet style or you ordered from a menu. The buffet was great, with so many options (there were 3 different kinds of scrambled egg!) and they make eggs for you if you ask your waiter. Coffee and orange juice was consistently topped up, and one of my favourite things was the size of the orange juice glasses, they were huge! I hate having my morning juice out of thimbles. Special mentions to Linda who served us on a number of occasions and was lovely, and also to a man in the restaurant at breakfast whose name escapes me, but he was fantastic, remembering our name, and nothing was too much trouble for him. The location is perfect, you are right next to Union Square. There are some serious works going on around there at the moment so it looks a little bit messy, but you can still easily navigate around.I would definite recommend staying here if visiting San Francisco.

Will definitely stay here again! The views were spectacular and each room has floor to ceiling windows. The hotel was spiffy, clean and well maintained. The Grand Hyatt's location is 1/2 block off Union Square so if is super convenient to all kinds of shopping. The San Francisco transportation system is so discombobulated that I found it difficult to get to some of the tourist sights such as the Golden Gate bridge -- you have to make three transfers. It is only 4 blocks from the BART which whisks you to SFO in thirty minutes. Was a little surprised that the Grand Hyatt only had high end breakfast and dinner -- and grab and go breakfast. Food in the area was touristy.

This is an attractive hotel, in a great location, with fantastic, professional staff. Despite its large size, the layout, decor, and courteousness and attentiveness of the staff make the hotel feel more intimate and homey. Outstanding views from rooms and especially from the fitness center. There was a mysterious wet spot on the carpet when we arrived that was quickly addressed, and it would be nice to have in-room coffee or complimentary coffee in the lobby in the mornings, in addition to the paid coffee bar, but these are minor gripes for what is overall a very good, borderline excellent hotel.

I visited the hotel for my birthday. When I originally arrived I explained that a previous mishap resulted in me being upgraded. I was put in the smaller room anyway. While I was out and about I called and talked to the front desk and explained to them that I was previously promised a larger room and I would like to have that because it was my birthday and I was in town celebrating. I gave them permission to move my items to the new room. When I returned I had rose pedals on my bed, wine, and a cheese and fruit plate. Also, there was a birthday card signed by every person working at the front desk that evening. I have never experienced such great customer service anywhere. I was so please with my room, the surprise items and especially the card. I plan on contacting the hotel manager to tell him how great this experience was. All of the staff I came in contact with were gracious, helpful and friendly.

Our recent stay at the Grand Hyatt was fabulous! The staff - especially John, the concierge - was absolutely exceptional! The location was great and convenient to everything. I do recommend a high floor since there is currently construction in Union Square.

We had a wonderful stay. From doormen to waiters to housekeeping, everyone greeted us warmly. The room was immaculate, the bed comfortable, the bathroom roomy and clean. It was a relaxing place to end the day.

My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary last week. Check-in was quick and easy. We were given a room on the "quiet side" of the hotel. I had read about the construction noise and was concerned about it, but we never heard a sound in our room (and we were only on the 5th floor). We were also given access to the club lounge on the 32nd floor which has amazing views along with food and drinks. The location was perfect for what we were looking for. Centrally located and public transportation was easily accessible. The room was spacious and clean. All in all it was a great trip and I would definitely stay here again.

So when I think of a Hyatt Hotel, I think 5 star luxury! Unfort not this hotelPros- great location, fairly priced, good health clubCons- Tired rooms especially the bathrooms, weak water pressure and decor of corridors was very poor, slow wifi,

Didn't stay in the hotel much. Mostly spent all of my time out in the city walking around. Hotel is in a good location. It's close to all the shopping and about a 30 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Everything in the room was clean and the staff were friendly. There is always someone at the hotel door ready to open it for you. Overall I was pleased and happy to stay here again.

This hotel was perfect for our visit to SF. A few weeks before my arrival I spoke with the concierge. Liz was so helpful and pleasant. She helped plan a number of tours for me. Joanna also was so helpful. They both did a great job and made my visit enjoyable. The staff were all attentive and check in was quick. The hotel is clean and the rooms were very nice. The location in Union Square was perfect and we were able to walk to different restaurants.

Staff was very friendly, facilities were all very clean, and you're only a short walk from lots of stuff to do.Downside:I think the rooms are a bit overpriced, they're on par with Ritz/Four Seasons, but for a hotel that isn't nearly as "fancy". I checked into another hotel after I got off the company dime!If you've got the money or if the company is footing the bill, I doubt you'd be disappointed with Grand Hyatt.

The hotel's location is excellent. Rooms are not big but are nicely decorated, as it is the bathroom.I would not recommend the breakfast. The space is very small compared to the size of the hotel and queues are frequent. In addition it is split in two parts and if you are seated in the area far from the food you spend your time walking along the long corridor.The buffet breakfast is not exceptional.

Grand Hyatt San Francisco is placed smack in the middle of union Square , Shops and conveniently close to Chinatown and transport to Pier 39, Fishermans Wharf. The Hotel is in good shape - seems recently renovated. We booked a high floor room with 2 double beds. Was surprised how noisy it still is from 28 th floor and the walls /doors are just thin to a level you can hear activity in hallways and rooms next to you. Hotel has ear plugs in the bath room - meaning they are aware the noise level may disturb. We slept well, but beds are on the small , if you have kids above 12 - would recommend extra connecting room instead. The lounge is fine - food is fresh and well displayed. Coffee is however below expectations - such a pity that GH has decided to go for mediocre coffee in the lounge. If you want good proximity to the action in San Francisco - can accept the natural noise from a big city - GH San Francisco is a good choice. The door man arranged a great SUV to the airport , at fixed price matching the taxi rate - much better.

Just spent a week at the Grand Hyatt SF. Fantastic location in Union Square - close to everything and extremely convenient to restaurants, shopping, transportation, cable cars, Chinatown, Financial District, North Beach. Hotel has views from practically every floor and room. Service is excellent with many long time staff that I seen over the years, having stayed here for business and leisure for almost 20 years! Rooms are all renovated but still on the smaller side. Overall, highly recommend and my first choice whenever I'm in SF.

My family of 5 stayed at this hotel for 3 days. Was a wonderful experience but definitely made better by having adjoining rooms. If we hadn't had this, the rooms would have been tight. The hotel itself was clean and well kept. The staff was terrific. They did their best to make us feel welcomed and helped us with directions, dinner reservations, and even made our kids' beds up special with their stuffed animals.

Stayed here over the Easter holiday for a work. I always enjoy my time in San Francisco. Being at the heart of Union square in a newly renovated hotel made the fact that I was working during the holiday worth it. The staff were all friendly. Everyone said good morning. They were responsive to my needs (albeit they were very minimal). The gym up on the 34th floor w/ a sweet view of the city was awesome, too! Will definitely stay here again.

I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt SF at least three dozen times in the past five years and it is always a top choice for me when traveling to SF. The Concierge desk has a keen awareness for new local restaurants to explore and the staff truly take an interest in ensuring that you experience is satisfying.

Nice room. Comfy bed and pillows. Large desk for working. Nice chair/footrest for reading. I had a fabulous view of Coit tower and Transamerica bldg from 15th floor. Plenty of Elevators. Nice gas fireplace in lobby

This was the second horrible experience we had with this hotel. The staff was lazy an not accommodating. We were lied to with regard to our room when making reservations. The air was out in our room and they said they would fix it and never did, but moved our room. Housekeeping was disgusting. The lobby was always packed and it took 15 minutes each time to get an elevator. The remote for the television was never brought to the room. The room service was horrible. The manager, Maria, was nasty. Rest assured, we will never return to this hotel.

The staff is friendly and very helpful. Super clean and comfortable! Centrally located in SF so you can easily see all the famous historical sights. Right next to Union Square and there are so many great restaurants close by.

I was there for a week. 4 days on business and 3 vacation. Hotel: Hotel was in a great location. 2 blocks from Chinatown, and 1 block from Union square and cable cars. Basic Wifi was free with two upgrade options for 5.00 and 10.00 a day respectively.Rooms: Very clean, a tad small. Recently renovated and had a modern look. The bathroom sink was very modern looking but not very practical. The shower could have been a little better too, but no real complaints. 32 inch flat screen TV with Internet TV was a cool feature. Bed was very comfy with lots of pillows. Blinds are on an automatic switch which was handy. It can be a tad noisy depending on the side you are facing. There is Major construction going on, but you are given free ear plugs if needed.Staff: Very friendly and always willing to help.

Should have been lovely, and bits of it were. But systematically not providing guests with water... leaving a coffeemaker broken in two pieces in the room, closing off the bar/dining room and cramming everyone into waiting for a tiny area for breakfast so management can rent out the top floor for weddings, these are not the hallmarks of any sort 'Grand' hotel.And yes, we worked around these inconveniences, but I felt rather sorry for the staff, whose aspirations for providing customer service so obviously exceed those of their employers.

This hotel is near perfect, if for no other reason than its location. Right on Union Square, just about everything you need is within walking distance-shopping, restaurants, Chinatown, cable car-you name it! Plus, the views are spectacular, service is good and the rooms are clean and decent sized. The only drawback is parking-it's expensive and it takes a while to get your car, but that's normal for San Francisco. Other than that, it just doesn't get any better!

This hotel location is excellent as are the rooms, spacious and well equipped with an air conditioner that Works beautiful, quiet and easy to set at your preference. Bathrooms smallish but still work ok. Lounge at mezzanine worth a visit for a pre or post dinner drink. I highly recommend this hotel and of course will be back.

Check in process was quick and efficient. The staff were very friendly and helpful - all super nice. Lobby and elevators were fine. Hotel room was tired - needing to be refreshed (pulls in the carpet, arms of desk chair were worn\dirty).

They care about you! I did not feel well late at night. I called and inquired about antacid. The bell boy was sent to retrieve antacid at the corner drug store, even after I declined the offer from the desk (I am stubborn). The rooms and bed were very comfortable and it is a wonderful location.

the hotel was in a great location, the room was clean, the bed was very comfortable and the staff was very helpful and friendly, the only issue was the construction site next store. The noise was very loud during the course of the night often found it hard to sleep.

I enjoyed my time here at the Grand Hyatt. The location was superb (right in Union Square) and the staff was kind, prompt, and seemed genuine. However, I did not like the noise level. I could hear the entire conversation of my neighbors (and they weren't necessarily yelling) and the children in the room next to me were very noisy and the walls seemed to be paper thin. However, my room was clean, the sheets were clean, and there was complimentary water served to guests! I would recommend the hotel even with the noise levels.

I consider this the near perfect location, next to Union Square, cable cars, Chinatown, Convention Center, right in between At&T park and Fishersman Wharf. The tour buses lined up right across the hotel by Macy's and numerous food option around within 5 blocks. The doorpeople were exceptionally pleasant and nice. The rooms were average, but the room service was nice. Go to the 36th floor for a 360 view of the city. A little pricy, but this is the big city.

The service was terrific. The rooms were very good. The hallways and main public areas need some touch-ups. There is construction happening around the hotel, but the noise did not bother me - perhaps because I was away during the day.

Great stay at the Grand Hyatt Union Square. Stayed for 4 nights for a conference. They put me in a corner king suite on the 11th floor that afforded me a decent view of the bay. Heard a little creaking noise in my room when unpacking. It was windy and the building sways some due to earthquake performance. Front desk had an air cleaner brought up which created a perfect amount of white noise to cover the creaking. Fitness center on 35th floor is great. Brand new equipment with an unbeatable view. Location is perfect for Union Square, Nob Hill, Moscone Center, etc. Great staff. Would definitely stay here again.

Recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt, for a conference at Moscone West. The hotel was very accommodating, allowing an early check in, and the higher floors offer amazing views. With floor to ceiling windows, it was beautiful looking at the city lights at night. Only ate in the bar once, but good was good & priced similar to restaurants in the area.Positive: Quick elevators, clean room with a view, all necessary amenities, pleasant staff, short walk to Moscone Center if there for a conference (less than ten minutes), and a Starbucks right across the street.Negative: Rate was slightly higher then other hotels in the area, but no other complaints.Overall, a great place to stay.

Was a comfortable hotel, we stayed in one of the Bay View King Rooms on the 27th Floor...+VSBrilliant view of the waters, the alcatraz, etcgreat for shopping, dining, walking around, everything within a stone throw's distancelively hotel-VSlacked personalized service

Paid about $182 including tax. No free breakfast offered unless you have a membership. Parking was $26 a night. Given our options in the area, this was our best choice. A little too pricey for me considering breakfast wasn't included and I had to pay for parking.

One of the best place I have spent both a weekend and business meetings. Just in the heart of San Francisco. Hotel has great service and facilities. Served food quality during business meetings was very good, like in high class restaurantes. Would recommend to all planning to have business meetings in San Francisco.

If you're looking for a good base to see all that San Francisco has to offer the Grand Hyatt Union Square can definitely facilitate. With spacious rooms, comfortable beds and everything imaginable on offer the hotel has definitely covered all of its bases. We stayed in a suite on the 32nd floor which is the same floor as the lounge where you can enjoy refreshments, breakfast and afternoon tea whilst overlooking an spectacular view. I must say I was hugely impressed as this is one of the best views of San Francisco and the food on offer was excellent with plenty of healthy options available. If considering this hotel I would definitely consider higher rated rooms as they are definitely worth the extra money. The minibar however is empty and room service is expensive however there are both 7-11s and Walgreens nearby that has everything you may need. Overall I had high expectations of the Grand Hyatt Hotel and these expectations were definitely met and I was glad that I decided to stay there and will most likely be back when next in San Francisco.

We almost always stay at the Grand Hyatt - love the location, the rooms are wonderful and very nice staff. The Grand Club for Gold Passport members has stunning views and I like that it's open all day from 5:30am. Nice workout room, fast room service, and amazing views! They treat Gold Passport members very well here.

We stayed 5 nights at the Grand Hyatt for a SF vacation. The hotel is centrally located in Union Square. We stayed on the 21st floor. Yes there is some noise but you are in the city and one block from the cable car line so expect some noise. The room was nicely decorated and the bed was very comfortable. We slept great!We ate at the OneUp restaurant once and thought the food was very good.We used web check out and took their limousine service to the airport ($50).We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again!

Clean, busy, shopping, starbucks, Launge, great great great LOCATION.Kids&family friendly.Nice view.Good bathroom.Comfortable bed.Again . This is an investment when it comes to the location.Though I don't think there is a swimming pool But overall I love it.

Excellent experience at this hotel, would stay again! It was a little expensive even with the company discount i recieved. However the service more then made up for that. Great great great views from Grand Hyatt club

I stay at Grand Hyatt properties all over the world, this property may not be the most extravagant but it met all my expectations for service and comfort. I was able to conduct business meetings in the second floor during the day very easily as there was no traffic or noise in the bar area. Even had coffee served from the breakfast staff during my meetings. After business, it is quite easy to enjoy oneself immediately as Union square is just one block away. Shopping, Restaurants are all blocks away and this is a great area to stay. E&O kitchen is one block away, great Asian fusion food with great cocktails.

The Grand Hyatt was the base for my family's visit of San Francisco last August. The location was perfect for walking tours of the city. Our room had a fabulous view of the city, and we were very pleased with the cleanliness of the property and the size of the room. We booked a grand club room and the lounge access was worth the difference in price. We found the staff to be helpful and courteous. We had absolutely no complaints!

Was thinking of going for dinner to a nice roof top hotel but we didn't find anything really cool with nice food. The view it was wonderful. 40th floor it was impressive, but the Menu it was really tiny. A place like that should also have some nice back ground music or even better some live jazz music.Personal was dressed so funny, weird but at least it was super gentle.

Grand Hyatt San Francisco is a nicely renovated Hotel in central San Francisco, a few meters from Union Square. The Hotel is brand new and well decorated. Service is extremely effective with no queuing at reception. Hotel bar and restaurant are comfortable with excellent quality service. Rooms are large and those who are highest have great view over the city (I had a room on floor 28, marvelous view). The gym on floor 35 is equipped with modern and well maintained training machines. Wifi freeThis Hotel is to be recommended

This is a very nice hotel, right next to union square and a lot of nice restaurants / bars / cafes / etc. Rooms are a little small, but the furniture is optimized to make the rooms look bigger. Service is excellent. Only weird thing is the checkout area, its not a regular looking area, its kind of like a weird triangle pod set up, I guess to make it seem more personal and interactive. Fitness room is a bit small but definitely workable. Wifi was fast - what you would expect for a hotel in the middle of SF.

I was attending a medical meeting at the Moscone Convention Ctr . I decided to stay at the Grand Hyatt (GH) since it is among the hotel choices with shuttle service. I will need three more hotel stays at the Hyatt to get the platinum status so it was an easy decision. We had an upgraded room near the lounge on the 31 floor; the room is comfortable, modern with a breath taking view of all the landmarks and some view of bay. By the bed, there is the multi-switch remote to automatically close/open the bay window blinds. The mesh curtain is an unique touch. The window treatment gets A+ for its function, smart look and classy beauty; it provides the uninhibited panoramic city view. I wanted to thank the courteous and professional staff associated with GH; from the minute we walk in, the doors are held open for us always, the open style reception islands mean no waiting line, quick service. I ordered a lunch box at the restaurant "Step Up" which offers a quite environment. I saw a lot of guest enjoy their salad/soup and a glass wine-it offers a perfect spot if one dines alone. Steps away from Chinatown which is one of the oldest in the country, it's a short walk over for a bowl of noodles or a crab feast. Visit the R & B Lounge at Kearney for the delicious crab ($51) cooked in many ways.On the first morning after I arrived, I left for breakfast before 7:30. I was so pleased that when I came back to the room to pick up some meeting stuff, the room was fully made. I must say, the high efficiency in housekeeping was the "first" among so many hotel stays. If the room is not made early in the morning, one would definitely understand. The problem is, at times, the guests do not know when the room will be cleaned so they wonder around outside not able to return to the room. I must give the house keeping staff a high mark for their superb efficiency. The lounge provides a "room with a view"; it opens for fruit and drinks just about any hours. It has arrays of hot hors d'oeuvres, cookies and small tartlets in the late afternoon and evening. The continental breakfast of egg/cheese/lox/bagels which would make most people, young and old very happy and content. One memorable experience was to see a rainbow after a slight rain fall ...Billy who works at the lounge witnessed my enthusiasm, he showed me the way to the adjacent patio so I can take some pictures.If one is lucky enough to visit San Francisco, I would suggest to stay at GH for its friendly and superb services, for its modern and impressive room. If you want to spurge, you might upgrade yourself to the club level so you can taste the food, wine and watch the sunset. GH is a marvelous place and is a top rated hotel.

Service: Excellent! From the bellhop to the frontdesk, Hyatt knows how to run a hotel. I think they are one of the greatest hospitality organizations in the world. Rooms: Small! I felt like I was in a small closet, and given the fact that I'm a pretty big guy, I felt a bit claustrophobic (not truly in the sense of the word, but more cramped). The decor is pretty nice, but I do recall paying an arm and a leg. But considering that you're in Union Square (read below further)...you shouldn't stay in your room.Location: Right by Union Square, so that's where the action is at. Don't wander to the Tenderloin area, folks (I learned my lesson there).

We were so looking forward to staying at the Grand Hyatt during our most recent trip to San Francisco (March 10-12). Our room was clean and sophisticated, but for our first night we were placed on the 5th floor facing a construction site, and that construction went on through the entire night without stopping. Do whatever you can to avoid this situation. My husband and I put in ear plugs, wore headphones to bed, and turned on multiple white noise apps, but nothing could drown out the sound of jack hammers and heavy machinery all night long. It was honestly the worst night we have ever spent in a hotel-- we could not sleep at all. My husband had a presentation for work the next morning (which was the whole reason we were in town) and he had counted on a good night of sleep. Frankly, they should not be putting anyone in those particular rooms at this moment because the noise is unbearable. The second night we were thankfully switched to a quiet room on the 17th floor with a beautiful view without any problems, however, this did not overshadow our horrible first night.

I stayed for 5 nights for a conference at the Moscone Center. From the moment I checked in, I could tell the service would be top notch. The staff at the front desk were welcoming and pleasantly efficient. The hotel is in a good location. Would definitely stay again.

Iâ€™ve always enjoyed staying at Hyatts and I was very much looking forward to this one. Sadly it was the first to not live up to my expectations of the Hyatt brand.Booked a 5 night stay in July last year - $439 plus all the tax so approx. $500 per night. This was for a â€œGrand Club Kingâ€ù with access to the club lounge on the 32 floor. We arrived late after a long flight from London. I had asked (at time of booking - 8 months previous) for a quiet room on a high floor. At check I was told I was in a â€œgorgeousâ€ù quiet room on the 30th floor. It was clear that no one looks ahead to see the bookings for the next day and pre-allocates requested rooms. It is more a case of â€œturn up and hope for the bestâ€ù. NOTE: we couldnâ€™t use online check in â€“ it simply wouldnâ€™t work.The first disappointment was that, on entering the room, it was a connecting room (which means more noise). Second was the size of it â€“ it was very small with a tiny bathroom. Thirdly, we had a very dull view â€“ even from the 30th floor. Given we were there for 5 nights I would have hoped that we could at least had a view of the bay or out towards the Oakland Bridge. All we could see was buildings. We briefly contemplated returning to reception but we were both exhausted so we decided weâ€™d to ask to move rooms in the morning. We hit the shower and went to bed. Next morning, the queues at reception were huge so we didnâ€™t bother with an immediate request. Went for breakfast with the idea of trying again later only to be met with a â€œweâ€™re fullâ€ù when we did speak to the man on the Hyatt desk (I didnâ€™t believe him). So we ended up staying where we were. It was disappointing.There was no tub in the bathroom (too small) and when opening the shower door it was clear just how small the room was â€“ the shower door missed the WC by approx. 2mm max - space was that tight. The shower worked fine â€“ June Jacobs toiletries: green tea and cucumber (not known in the UK) There were ample towels but no mouthwash (Note: there is a list of things you can get from reception if you need them). The huge sink took up a lot of room on the bathroom vanity area and ours already had a hairline crack in it which didnâ€™t look good.The bed was comfy and the linens quite nice (but not Sofitel standard) From the bed you could switch on/off the lights and raise or lower the blackout blind. Other than that, there was a TV (didnâ€™t use it), fridge (empty â€“ what a waste of energy if they are in every room) and a safe. There was also a small coffee maker/water heater. There was one sofa seat and a foot stall plus a floor lamp. Wardrobe was decent size but not enough hangars for 5 days clothes. Housekeeping was excellent â€“ really lovely people who did a great job.Free wi-fi available everywhere including room. Only used it briefly so no idea if it would have allowed efficient work.There is construction around the hotel but the noise wasnâ€™t bad. Room neighbours could be heard through the connecting door (and they bizarrely decided to repair their push bikes in the corridor outside of the room which meant more disturbance)The â€œGrand Loungeâ€ù was just OK. Breakfast was carb heavy with just scrambled eggs as a hot savoury item (everything else was sweet). Breakfast time was exceptionally crowded. We only went to the evening presentation twice and again it was not great â€“ very limited choice of food items with an honour bar â€“ red/white wine and a few spirits. There were nice views of the bay and the bridge on 2 sides of the lounge (to show us what we were missing in our roomâ€_) Two MACs and printer allow you to print boarding passes etc.Overall I can honestly say I was very disappointed â€“ poor customer focus and poor value for money (total $2.5K). I certainly wouldnâ€™t choose it again nor recommend it to others. They get the very basics right (you get a bed and a bathroom) but other than that, you are just a commodity at this hotel â€“ we never felt like true â€œwelcomed guestsâ€ù.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt on Valentine's weekend 2015 with our two kids (ages 6 & 8). The front desk service was excellent. We had reserved a bay view room, but the hotel was overbooked, so they had us in a room overlooking Union Square for one night at no charge, then moved us the next day to a bay view. The rooms themselves were identical - clean and sleek with modern bathrooms. The views - what a difference! There is construction on the Union Square side, and the noise goes on all night (there are complimentary ear plugs along with the toiletries). The Bay side is quiet and the view is the quintessential San Francisco experience, with Telegraph Hill in the distance.The hotel is within walking distance to Chinatown (a couple of streets over from the Dragon's Gate on Grant & Bush), Yerba Buena Gardens, and the Embarcadero (we walked all the way to the Exploratorium). It was too hilly for the kids to walk north to the Fisherman's Wharf and Lombard Street, so we took a cable car there and cab back. (I don't recommend the cable car, it's not as exciting as it seems; they pack you in there. It's cheaper to take a cab, even cheaper to take the bus.) If you want to go to the Golden Gate Park area, you would also need to take a cab. I highly recommend the Grand Hyatt, would love to come back in the winter when there is ice skating in Union Square. Hopefully the construction will be done by then, otherwise, there is always the Bay side.

First of all, I have to say that I didn't stay at this hotel to sleep. But I visited a conference, which was organised in a conference hall. And I have to admit that the place was chosen perfectly. The hall is big, it easily accepted all guests, there are several rooms for chilling out and drinking coffee. The hotel itself is luxury and imposing. However, I had constant problems with wifi.Downtown location gives easy access to all kinds of urban benefits.I had a minor trouble with my personal effects, and security service did their best to help me.

Great trip to SF with my 18 year old son. Wonderful central location with super team at the concierge. Very contemporary design throughout hotel. Loved the clean comfortable rooms that were connected. Lots of electrical outlets, nice dressing area.

We were impressed with the hotel. Upon arrival music was playing both outside and inside the hotel. The check in process was fast and the room was clean and modern. When opening the electric blind the view was incredible. We were on the 18th floor (out of 36) and the view was just amazing. We could see the sea in the distance and were surrounded by tall buildings. The staff were very friendly and the on site restaurant "one up" was very good. We visited the restaurant twice, and the second time our waiter "Frank" was absolutely brilliant. We left him a large tip! Highly recommended for a luxury feel good hotel. Only problem is that they moved the restaurant from the 36th floor to the 2nd floor!!! Silly mistake. 36th floor is now shut off to the public and is used as a business centre. Those views were unbeatable.

I've stayed in every Hyatt in the bay area and this is the most modern and probably the best on average, however the Hyatt Regency is in a better location (view wise) and is a little more relaxed. Although it is rated as 4 star it exceeds many of the 5 star hotels I've stayed in. The rooms are very modern with powered curtains and a variety of preset light settings. The lighting in the bedroom is rather dim and in the morning I would turn the TV on to try and get some extra light to see. The bathrooms are also well finished with slate floors and custom tiling. There's also a really large selection of bathroom products, if that is important to you. You can order room service from the television and there are a variety of connections for your devices. The club room on the 32nd floor offers a wide variety of snacks and has a nice selection for breakfast. It also has several workspaces. I think that access to the club lounge is essential because there is almost no lobby space or other area to relax in (aside from sitting on your bed). I don't have any criticisms other than to comment on the valet parking exceeding $60 a day. I know the hotel will likely say that it's standard for the area - as though that makes it any less egregious. Also, it's about 15% more than the average hotel valet charge. Overall I was please with the hotel and will no doubt return.

Overall a friendly hotel in downtown location. China town and major stores are in walking distance; easy access to commercial zone.Wifi is terrible (or in fact, you may consider no wifi unless you pay to upgrade the speed.)

We moved here from the Scarlet Huntingdon, and I prefer this place. Our initial check-in was warm and welcoming, with the staff taking extra time to ensure we were orientated. Of course, it's a bigger hotel, less 'style' and primarily orientated for business users, but the location is excellent and somehow felt more homely.We had cause to move rooms because of a technical problem, and this was handled quickly and efficiently. It's not the problems that put you off a hotel, it's how they are dealt with!The bar seemed small for a hotel of this size, but there are plenty of alternatives within staggering distance of the hotel. No pool here either,which is a shame, other hotels within the area offer this.I would stay here again if on business, but with so much other choice, I'd be tempted to find somewhere with a pool.

My wife and I booked what we thought would be a high room with a view of the bay. We didn't have the view we wanted. When I called to the front desk they apologized and upgraded us to an amazing suite. They comped us with a bottle of wine and we got to enjoy a special lounge with drinks and appetizers. The view from the suite was amazing. The room was huge, with a 2 person tub that we enjoyed. It was an amazing experience. And when we got home I wrote to find out what kind of wine they had given us, and the manager had another bottle delivered to our house! I've never had service this good.

I've stayed at this hotel a number of times, the location is perfect! The staff are so friendly and helpful, rooms are lovely and the gym has amazing views! I called reception to ask for more coffee and 4 packets arrived within a few minutes. There has been some construction work taking place in union square recently and the hotel has provided ear plugs - how thoughtful. I didn't hear any noise anyway!

The Grand Hyatt was a highlight of my holiday to San Francisco. Ideally located on union square, the hotel is a short walk to all major attractions and shopping districts. There is a starbucks across the road and Macys one block away. The concierge team was a standout helping me plan an action packed two day visit. The newly renovated rooms are industry leading with free basic speed wifi, automated blackout curtains, large comfy beds and well appointed bathrooms. The OneUp Lounge bar located in the hotel was an excellent place to grab a drink with live music on Thursday and Friday night I was there. It was worth every dollar.

The check-in was unique with no desk. Very personal, professional and quick. Room was extraordinarily clean every single day. Cleaning staff very respectful of time and space and took care of the small stuff. The Grand Club lounge was a great treat. The views from the dining area are spectacular, food was grand, especially the fresh lox for breakfast and desserts in the evening. Nice to grab a juice or water before trekking out to the city. Enough can't be said about this place. Parking was a small inconvenience (off site) but not a good enough reason to not go here again.

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco is an updated version of this hotel format located on the North Corner of Union Square. Convenient to cable cars and what passes for shopping in San Francisco, this is a really nice hotel that has recently been updated. San Francisco is a nice city but it has a problem with panhandlers and freaks.Hotels on the wrong side of Union Square swarm with tourists and pan handlers and sometimes it's hard to tell the difference.The Grand Hyatt San Francisco is an oasis.With a nice open plan lobby greeting you, check in is at kiosk, Andaz-style with laptops/ipads. There is a cool lounge-y feel to the lobby with a coffee bar in the back. Up a set of floating stairs there is a decent restaurant.Rooms are nice, get a view if you can. There is construction going on underneath, a tunnel or something, but I did not hear it while I was there (Late Feb 2015). They supply earplugs.The rooms themselves have been recently updated. While the bathrooms were not quite up to the Andaz standard, at least in my King Bay View, everything is nice and clean. I ate Breakfast in the restaurant, nice buffet. I got coffeee from the coffee place, good coffee. I used the gym - small but good equipment.If you are a fan of Hyatt, this is a better property for most business and tourist activities compared to the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf or Regency. Hyatt Regency is nice, but takes too long to walk to your room. Recommended.

I was there for a full week on a business trip and it was very handy to be next to the conference centre and right in the centre in f the city. The staff was very helpful and very diligent. The rooms are a good size and the view from window was breathtaking.

The minute you step in the lobby you know that this place is something special, the huge chandler is breathtaking and when you look up it is mesmerizing!! Every one who works there was very accommodating and pleasant , the room was clean and cosey with a window as big as the wall it was spectacular ! It is a short walk to the Ferry Bulding , restaurants,and shopping! We cannot wait to go back!

What an amazing stay! We were treated amazingly from the moment we arrived! Betsey did a great job of a speedy check in as we had a delay in our flight. The view from this hotel is amazing! Go to the 35 or 36th floor...the floor is a full view of the city...there's chair to see the view...OMG! go in the morning and see the sunrise! We went every day we were there...the Coit tower is nothing compared to this view! We were there for two days and we were so sad to leave! I won't ever stay at another hotel that isn't the Grand Hyatt!!!

My family and I recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt and I must say the location is perfect! There was construction going on on the street but we didn't have any problems getting where we needed to go. The rooms are really nice, we all had city view rooms w/ breakfast included. The breakfast was really good as well. Overall, I recommend the Grand Hyatt. Lovely stay!

Five star in every way - the location, the eating places, the rooms, ambiance etc etc. No complain at all. The hotel staff is excellent and friendly - one day I lost my wallet with all money and cards etc. By mistake, the wallet went with a trouser in a laundry bag. I informed this to the hotel and they went out of the way to get the laundry pickup person back from the way to get my wallet back. In the meantime, they accompanied me with a free coffee and some snack and told me not to worry. Lovely attitude and I was surely touched.

I've stayed here a number of times and always found the hotel comfortable. The hotel has always been pretty consistent in experience. The wifi is free and decent. The rooms are pretty quiet. There is parking nearby and the price isn't super outrageous for SF.

My family of 4 decided to spend the weekend in SF to celebrate my father's birthday. Being a Diamond member, I have been to numerous Hyatt locations for special occasions, and they have always been very accommodating. This property is no different, I actually felt very special when Kristen from the hotel called me and arranged everything for me 2 days before my arrival. Kristen was able to arrange me to a VIP suite and had a birthday letter and wine ready in the room that made my father's birthday celebration a memorable one.Too bad Kristen wasn't around over the weekend for my arrival to make things perfect. One major set-back I noticed is even though I have booked for a party of 4. By the time of my arrival the room was not set up to accommodate 4 people(cups, towels, bath kits) were setup for 2, but all is quickly resolved when I called the front desk.I would give a perfect 5 if they just put in the thought and have the room perfectly ready for 4 and also leave the birthday letter on the table instead of slide under the door on the floor. Lastly, the grand club was kind of a disappointment, it has written time indicating they serve food before 7:30 and after 7:30 is desserts but by the time I arrive at 7:10pm all food is already taken away. When I asked for some food, they just simply said nope, all is taken away at 7:00pm sharp. I wish they just serve food till 7:30pm as indicated on the operation hours, or simply be more accommodating when I requested for some food, also the selection of cocktail food needs to be improved, most of other Hyatt properties I've been to have simply more selections of food and desserts comparing to just 3 plates consisting of cookies, fruits and desserts. The breakfast at oneup buffet was very good and the staffs were very attentive and friendly so that kind of made up for my grand club experience.

I have stayed at the GHSF too many times to count. I've documented my impressions in a prior review. I have a few additional positive comments:1. Consistency. The GHSF will not knock your socks off but I know exactly what I am going to get. This is especially good if you are staying for work. I attribute a lot of this to the staff. It is a veteran staff that wants to do its best.2. Noise suppression. I commented about street, construction and interior noise in my last review. The GHSF has upgraded its earplugs to the 3M brand. They are more substantial and seem to let less noise through.3. Food at OneUp. The chorizo flatbread was extremely flavorful. Good selection of beer.I recommend the GHSF and will most definitely be back.

Stayed at the Hyatt for 3 days on business. Short shuttle journey (15mins) from airport.For me it's location was perfect for San Bruno, however to mountain view and Cupertino its a steep uber fare. Not hotels fault.Room was clean tidy and main communal areas were well kept.The bar restaurant menu was limited and I ended up eating at the American diner just outside front doors for next 2 nights.Good free wiFi reception in room and communal areas.Staff all pleasant and helpful.Would stay again.

I stayed here back in 2012. I was here for a work conference. Stayed here for a few nights. At the time they were going through renovation. The rooms were clean and the staff was courteous. I remembered I needed to warm something up. So I called the front desk to inquire if they had a microwave that I could use. They said they will look for one. So I was expecting to get out of my room to use it. Instead a moment later there was a knock on the door. It was a microwave! They brought one to my room and plugged it in for me. That's going beyond! The hotel location is great. Within steps I'm at shopping central with all the big name store. I loved it! Look forward coming back here to see the new reno!

Right off Union Square, (so you are on the flat) The Grand Hyatt Hotel is right downtown, close to all major shops... right behind the Hotel you can take the famous San Francisco cable car right down to the fisherman's wharf (6$ per ticket) super fan and a great experience.The wifi is strong all through out the hotel, the rooms are adequate, decent size.If you stay in the club floor you have access to the club lounge on the 32 floor, where you can enjoy complementary breakfast, snacks and happy hour.the gym is small but well equipped.The concierge "Elaine" was wonderful and super helpful, she arranged all of our tours, dinner reservation, car rental with driver and gave us great tips to where to go for wine tasting, so Thank you.Enjoy drinks and live music at the bar, a level above reception.

Our business conference was held at the Grand Hyatt. What a wonderful hotel and staff! The conference rooms were very comfortable with excellent food and service. It is in a good location for restaurants and shopping.

I liked the service and responsiveness of all the staff I interacted with here. From being greeted at the door, to a rapid check-in, to having the blinds adjusted within 10 minutes of our request and the convenience of leaving our bags securely with them after check out due to a late night flight. There is some seriously noisy construction going on next door at the moment so I'd recommend requesting a room on the opposite side.Fortunately we were not at all disturbed by it given Sunday's off and the high floor... which offered a really nice view and the blinds were remote controlled by a button by the bedside... fun! We had a great night's sleep with bedding and linens that were fabulous as was the mattress. Bathroom updated but older tub/shower... decent water pressure, abundant hot water, adequate basic toiletries and luxuriously thick towels. Overall a very comfortable stay surrounded by friendly top-notch service :) and conveniently accessible via BART if you're travelling light.

Stayed from 21st-24th Feb, 2015 in a club room. Unfortunately our stay was nothing short of terrible. It started at check in when we were told that we had 2 x doubles (not the king requested) and as they were completely booked had no other options except perhaps to downgrade to a lower floor the next day IF a King room became available. I accepted this as there was no room for movement. We had a club room on the 34th floor and I will say the view was nice. The room.......though obviously recently refurbished didn't have a luxurious feel at all, instead felt like a cheap renovation to bring it into the 21st century. Ok maybe a little harsh but I had spent the last 4 weeks staying in 5 star Hotels and this wasn't even close to standard. Perhaps the hoards of people for an Indian wedding down in the lobby didn't help the cause! The club lounge itself was tiny and over crowded and never have I had to pay for an alcoholic beverage in any other club lounge. Given the rate I had paid per night for this Hotel I was expecting a whole lot more! I had stayed previously at the Pan Pacific (now the Marriott) a block away and wished that I hadn't strayed from a well familiar path. Our first night's sleep was abruptly cut short at 2.45am by the guests staying in the suite next door to us. We had an adjoining room which transported the noise from what seemed to be at least 10-15 people straight in to our room! Hearing every word being spoken these guests are from the wedding that I had seen earlier. I ring down to front desk and request security to take care of the noise immediately. Within 20 mins or so all is quiet. The hotel advised that the guests would be checking out that day but unfortunately that was not the case. The 2nd night we are once again jolted awake by the unruly guests and their entourage of friends. I ring down to front desk at 1am and request security to break up the party. The woman whom I spoke to offered a free breakfast or dinner and I explained that I was unable to negotiate as was tired and very upset of the disruption for a 2nd time. Security were quick to act and we were able get back to sleep. I visit the front desk in the morning and am assured that the wedding party would definitely be checking out that day and we would have an uninterrupted sleep. On our last night once again we are awoken but this time it is approx 11.15pm and it now Housekeeping who are the cause. We put up with the noise for close to 30mins but the noise becomes unbearable with vacuuming, clanking, people talking loudly, banging on the walls. My partner rings down to reception at 11:45pm and requests the cleaners to stop of which occurs some 10 mins or so later. This Hotel was a huge disappointment and our stay was not pleasant. What a shame to end a 5 week holiday like this! I have submitted a complaint to the front desk on check out and I eagerly await a response to our extremely woeful experience. My advice is to stay elsewhere as you certainly do not get what you pay for.

A very good hotel right behind Union Square. Nice location, good views from the hotel, clean rooms. Hotel staff very courteous, typical of Hyatt properties across.. Few minutes walk to China Town, Market St and all the famous landmarks in SF City.

Contemporary hotel in the heart of Union Square. Speedy check in. Great spacious rooms. We had interconnecting rooms. Very clean and modern with a degree of sophistication. Overlooking Union Square. There was a little construction noise and the sound of wind from the expansive windows but acceptable from a major city. Beautiful modern bathrooms. Breakfast was a little sparse and a bit mess but was ok to kick start the morning. Concierge were very helpful. Car parking is available nearby for an extra charge. Hired a car for the last day so that we could travel to Muir Woods and then to the airport. Enjoyed our comfortable stay in this busy city.

This was a great hotel. Everything looked new and refurbished and the staff all seemed wonderful. We had a great room with an excellent view of both the city and the bay. We had a rental car so we parked across the street at the Stockton Garage which was a cheaper bet than the hotel. It was about $28 for 24 hours. The location seemed good but we were looking for a few bars or pubs to get a late afternoon drink and struggled. I am unsure if there's just not a lot of bars by the hotel or if we just missed them. Overall though it was safe and I'd definitely stay there again!

After reading many reviews about hotels in San Francisco, and taking into consideration that we wanted to make sure that we stayed in a safe and centric area because we were traveling with our 9 yr old son, we finally decided to stay in the Club Level section of this hotel and boy am I glad we did. This modern and elegant hotel is conveniently located in Union Square near many different designer stores and walking distance to the Pier, Fisherman's Wharf, Financial District, Westfield Mall, Restaurants, etc. Guest services on the main level of the hotel assisted us with the reservation of a couple of tours which made the process quick and simple. We would have breakfast every morning at the Club Level Lounge, in the afternoon a freshly baked cookie and in the evenings a snack or dessert...special thanks to Jerry and Jerry, as well as the rest of the staff who make the lounge a great place to kick back and relax throughout the day. The hotel restaurant One Up is also a very good option for getting something to eat at any time of the day. The rooms are very nicely decorated with modern amenities. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco because our stay was excellent.

Staying at this hotel from 26-28th Feb, and all I can say it was perfect! We got a super affordable price (include breakfast). Arrived in the lunch time and there was someone waiting for us to take our luggages, ugh first class service. We checked in, someone welcomed us so friendly and cheerful, she made my day back then for her cheerfulness. We got room on the 7th floor, it was quite quiet although there was a renovation going on in union square! Bed was comfortable and big, the room was quite spacey, ambient lighting, sleek interior.Breakfast was great, although they kinda lack of variety, but the taste covered it up. definitely going to choose this hotel again! Ps, it's only 1 minute walking from union square.

Really nice hotel in a fantastic location. It's a short walk to market street or a 10 minute tram ride down to the piers.The view from the upper floor rooms is fantastic and it's nice to be away from the street noise. Rooms have pretty standard free wifi that can get frustrating but it's a million times better than the exorbitant rates that some hotels charge.The breakfast is good quality and the service is fantastic. I would definitely recommend this place for your stay in San Fran

Gets the job done! Attentive, knowledgeable, highly competent staff. I managed a major, complex event work event here in November 2014 -- the Hyatt team made it seamless, (relatively) stress-free, and very very successful. Perfect venue for a business meeting and great, central location for out of town guests. We would definitely go back.

I have stayed in other Grand Hyatt Hotels and have been so very pleased, but not this time.I can only review the room and nothing else within this hotel because as soon as I walked into the room, I started looking for other properties to move to for 2 nights.This room was so ridiculously small and utilitarian looking. I was shocked, saddened and depressed to think I would be staying there for 2 nights.The linen thread count of the duvet seemed to be about 150; so threadbare and scratchy. And the bedding, with duvet, blankets and sheets was about 1/2 inch thick. It was not luxurious in any stretch of the imagination. There was one picture on the walls. The room seriously looked like some sort of quarters for confinement, not at all what I've seen in Grand Hyatts. Even the Grand Hyatt in NY had a larger, more decorated and luxurious room.I left this property within 20 minutes of arriving...I stayed in a much more luxurious place for $199 per night instead of the $314 I was paying at the Grand Hyatt

You either like Hyatts, or you don't. I like them. The staff is always knowledgeable and attentive, without being intrusive. The concierge emailed me the day before my stay to inquire about any special requests. This particular Hyatt is right off Union Square, so for us, it was about location on this particular trip. The thing I don't like about this Hyatt is what I don't like about every hotel in San Francisco...parking is ridiculously expensive. It's not really Hyatt's fault, it's just the market in SF. Here's where Hyatt shines. Right on their website they suggest the public garage across the street that was $25 a night cheaper than the hotel parking. Nice touch.

This hotel has one of the best locations in San Francisco. If you don't mind walking, it gives you a chance to see so much more than just the Fisherman's Wharf tourist traps. Chinatown is right next door, the Ferry Building and Saturday Market not much further, even a walk down Haight is doable on foot. A huge assortment of great bars and restaurants are very close. And if you must see Fisherman's Wharf, you can walk there as well. The view we had from our room was great, overlooking the city and surrounding hills. And the rooms themselves are fantastic. Very modern, luxurious and romantic. Lots of automation (lights/blinds), reliable Wifi, and large LCD TV. The club lounge was nice, with some decent food options, typical of other Hyatts I've been at. This hotel will certainly be at the top of my list when I want to explore downtown San Francisco.

Although the location is perfect and the hotel is well presented but we were offered rooms facing a 24 hour construction site. There was no prior warning and no explanation and when we asked to change rooms, they said the entire hotel was full... not only that but the staff had a very nonchalant attitude and just said they can't be cognizant of what goes on next door, which is less than 10 ft away. This was unhelpful and uncaring.

My wife and I recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt over valentines day. This is our second visit to this hotel. It is very well located and convenient to great restaurants, China Town and other activities at the Union Square area downtown. Public transportation is close and convenient. The hotel facilities are very nice and rooms clean. Concierge services are very courteous and helpful.Most notable, we encountered a problem with noise that was out of the hotels control with a room adjoining ours. To the credit of management, this issue was completely resolved in a very satisfactory manner and dealt with in a courteous and professional manner. Well done Jessica and your response is a credit to you and the hotel. We will be back!! Thanks again!

Nice hotel, well located in the financial district downtown. My room was on the 18th floor and had a pretty cool view of the city (facing Union Square). The room itself was very clean, spacious, new, and overall well appointed (with some nice gadgets and connectivity). Wifi was free and fast, and overall was good. On my particular stay they warned me that construction at street level (building a subway?) would be potentially annoying and offered to put me on the other side, which I said would not be an issue. In the end, during the day you could hear the construction but if they did anything at night I did not hear it. I was unlucky enough to be there during a day of extremely high wind, which was disconcerting in the afternoon when I tried to take a 15 minute nap and it was aggressively pounding on the window - apparently this is not the first time and the windows and hotel overall are designed to withstand a lot of this type of thing (or earthquakes I am told).Staff were friendly, with my only complaint being about the check-in: I had come off a 6 hour flight and unfortunately had a pretty bad headache, and the lady ahead of me at check-in was extraordinarily slow and seemingly had never stayed in a hotel before. The other check-in desk was also occupied so ended up having to wait about 15 minutes in a line to physically check in and get set up. I don't fault the staff for this, but would suggest considering having more computers + people available to reduce wait times like this for the future.
