Great location on Union Square but the hotel is dated and very noisy from road and construction noise. yes, i know its in the middle of a big city but the noise from the windows was more than you would expect and the windows are clearly very old and not able keep the noise out. we asked concierge for the best / cheapest way to get to Fishermans Wharf and was told to take a cab which (allowing for traffic) took almost an hour and cost us $35.we later found the cable car tram which took a fraction of the time and cost. would have expected concierge to have given us a few options.Starbucks over the road from reception is open from 05.00 for those of us that suffer from Jet lag.Cant help but feel they have missed a trick with the viewing area on the top floor. would make a fantastic bar / restaurant with amazing views but currently is meeting rooms and an open space that is pretty useless.

The Hyatt reservations line mistakenly booked me into the wrong Hyatt. When I showed up in the Grand Hyatt without realizing the error, they informed me that I was booked down the street at the Embarcadero Hyatt. That would have been fine except the general manager who informed me was unacceptably rude. What was even more surprising is he learned I was a Diamond member and couldn't have cared less. Normally I am very understanding but the terrible attitude of the manager prompted me to leave this note for others to read. I strongly recommend readers avoid this property.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt, located next to Union Square. The location is excellent because there are Muni's (busses), trolleys, and cable cars which all run close by. The views from the Regency Club are amazing- you can see from the Golden Gate Bridge to the Bay Bridge on a sunny day. The sunsets were so romantic too. We were upgraded to a suite (although we're Hyatt members), so we had two bathrooms, a king bed, and a separate living area. It was really wonderful to have the extra room, especially bunking with a two year old. All of the amenities were wonderful, from the soap to the automatic shades. The views from all sides of the building are great, especially from the higher levels. There is a lot of construction going on next door, but not only were earplugs provided, but we couldn't hear anything from where we were on the 26th floor. The sunsets were fantastic, especially with the way the light reflected off of the surrounding buildings. Recency Club - If you are a club member, or decided to purchase a spot at the regency club - we thought it was over sold, or possibly too small for the size of the hotel. While it was a holiday weekend, it seemed you had to wait a long time for a table or even enough chairs to be able to sit down and eat. The food provided was what you would expect for a regency club. Service - Friendly, but you could tell that throughout the hotel, it was overwhelmed and possibly too busy for the amount of staff personnel (particularly at the front desk during check in, even if it was hours in advance of standard check in at 3:00pm.Parking/Sight Seeing - I would not recommend bringing your car to SF. Parking is flat out outrageous throughout the city (at this Hyatt it cost $62/night to valet or a quoted $41 to self park at an adjacent nearby parking garage). There is also a plethora of public transit throughout the city and a lot of things are within walking distance. The bellmen are very knowledgeable and can direct you anyway you'd like. The concierge also has a great recommendation of traditional tourist sights, as well as the more behind the scene feel that SF offers. We very much enjoyed staying here this weekend, and would highly recommend this location for it's views, service, and state of the art amenities.

Amazing renovation, friendly staff, speedy service, very clean, near union square what more do you want. First we thought this gonna be a so so hotel but they surprised us by their charm when we arrived. So friendly and straight to the point solution. They had a little mistake and made me wait for a little time that i didn't mind instead they give me a voucher for a free breakfast. Very rare service. To all the staff of grand hyatt sanfrancisco " keep it up you guys are wonderful".

hyatt's recent renovation has helped elevate the hotel and it finally doesn't look run down. the rooms are modern, clean, and the view from the rooms are unspoiled.the hotel is located in the shopping district/union square so easily accessible too.the breakfast spread is great.downside- service is slow at the restaurant and the concierge unhelpful unless you call for their help.

Room was spacious enough for my purposes. Washroom was very nice. Staff was helpful beyond belief.The location of this hotel is fantastic! It is a 1 minute walk from Union Square. Downtown shopping is all around the hotel, and is a 5 minute walk from Chinatown.

I come to SF quiet a bit for work and always stay at this property. I am Platinum with Hyatt and have stayed at a lot of different Hyatt's and this is by far my favorite. Location, staff, design and feel of this property is a nice balance between business and pleasure. The bar also has a very nice wine selection which I enjoyed after long days. For eating there is a great selection of local restaurants with in walking distance. Highly recommend.

Stayed at the Grand Hyatt on Valentines Day, a very busy time. This may have contributed to some of the dissatisfaction from my time here.Starting with room not available.No bottled water in room ( may be a city thing, not sure), when you do get your roomThe checkin processor is similar to going to an Apple Store; Desktop computers spread out in lobby. In summary, a big bottleneck and a massive backlog of people waiting.No sauna, spa or pool.The positive,My room was nice with a very nice "bay view ".And with a nice bathroom.It is a hectic scene in lobby and hotel entrance:I would stay here again for a business type event.I would not stay here with a family, couple type event.

Stayed at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco for three nights in early January. Absolutely loved it! We stayed at five different hotels across the US during our trip and this was our favourite - the Hyatt Times Square was a very close second!The staff were lovely. Upon check-in, they noted we were there on our honeymoon and sent up some complimentary fruit and champagne to our room. It was such a lovely touch and an awesome start to our time in San Francisco. Thank you Grand Hyatt.Our room was on the 29th floor overlooking Union Square Christmas tree and ice skating rink. Such a lovely view. The room had a really comfy funky chair in front of the floor to ceiling windows. It was so relaxing to sit there looking out at the view and people watching from above. The window opened about a hands length to let some fresh air in.The bathroom was great - the shower was excellent and the toiletries were of good quality. I loved that the hotel had a list of extra items that were available upon request - ie. mouthwash, toothbrush, comb, etc. The bed was super comfy and the blackout electronic roller blind was terrific. The gym was decent - on the small side - but basic equipment for a short stay. A couple of treadmills, a small selection of free weights, smith machine and cable machine. The view was amazing though! This hotel is in an excellent location right in the heart of the city. Macy's in right across the road and there's a Walgreens a few steps away. It's also close to the streets of China Town. It's a lovely walk down to Fisherman's Wharf (about half an hour - but stop and enjoy everything along the way because it's a lovely walk!).Loved this hotel and would stay here again in a heartbeat. In fact, I wish I was there right now!

I stayed here at the start of January and found the hotel facilities to be a typical five star standard. We had two adults and two children in a standard room with two double beds. For four people and all their luggage space was a bit tight but for a short stay it was OK.The location is excellent being just around the corner from Union Square. My family and I would definitely stay there again.

I booked this due to its location as i was on a quick stopover. Amazing views of Union Square and down town from my VERY large room. Prices were a lot cheaper than basic hotels in Fisherman's Wharf. Staff very helpful and there is great diner just around the corner :)

I'm currently staying at this hotel right now for a week for a conference and it has been top notch. I am Hyatt Platinum member so some of my experience won't apply to other travelers but I was so impressed with the hotel that I had to write a review while it is still fresh. Service/Lobby-Every staff person I encountered was great. Friendly, helpful and enthusiastic. Check in was a breeze and they gave me all the info I asked for regarding public transportation and restaurant recommendations. They do not have the traditional check in desk but rather a bunch of small tables with representatives at them, I suppose to create a less formal vibe.I did not use the valet service so I cannot comment on that (very pricey at about $60/night!). The lobby is very modern with cool fireplaces and artwork.Location-This hotel is centrally located in Union Square and is walkable to many destinations in SF. There is plenty to do within a few block radius, but if you don't mind walking further you can walk to the Pier, Embarcadero and even Telegraph Hill. But be in good shape because the hills are killer. There's a BART station and cable car stop only about a block away. I didn't find a ton of great restaurants in the immediate area for my taste. Most of the options were either chain restaurants near the mall/shopping area or older establishments that didn't appeal to me. But I'm sure most people would find the selection just fine. Room-I used a suite upgrade award and stayed in an executive suite on the 26th floor with amazing views of the city. There is construction going on next door which my colleagues complained about but this room faces east and I have not heard any of it. The suite is awesome, like you would expect - automatic shades, smart technology, two full baths, living room and bedroom. Super clean and modern with floor to ceiling windows. Cleaning service came daily and did a nice job. Conference-I do not like that the conference facilities are in the basement and require 2 escalators to get there, but that being said, the food and service this week has been great. Restaurant/Room ServiceI ate in the OneUp restaurant on the 2nd floor for dinner one night. Service was very good, food was pretty good. This is San Francisco so you should venture out of the hotel to eat if you can. There is nothing special at this restaurant but you could certainly do worse. Room service was fine too.Gym - Nicest gym I have seen at a hotel of this level. All the equipment you could want, TVs, fabulous city views, water stations, towels, and a lot of extras you don't normally find in dinky hotel gyms.Grand Club -The Club was very nice with excellent service. A good variety of hot and cold snacks at happy hour time, along with complimentary non-alcoholic beverages and an honor bar. You could probably fill up there and not have to eat dinner but again, you are in SF and should venture out to eat... It was a nice place to relax away from my room. There is a TV but it is on mute.All in all, a great place to stay that is central to everything. If you can afford it or have status, I highly recommend upgrading to a suite. If you can't do that, at least ask for a high floor so you can have a view.

A luxury hotel very well located in the heart of San Francisco. The room are comfortable and well furnished also the bathrooms. The sad thing is that they have moved the bar from the 32nd floor to the mezzanine which is souless and uncomfortable seating, also the breakfast room is the same although the food served is good and cooked in an open kitchen.All in all I will not return

I loved this hotel because it was so central and when I say central you walk out the door and you are in the middle of everything Union square,shops, cheese cake factory, Saks etc. The rooms are great and the breakfast is so good everything is fresh and hot. There is so much to pick from you can have fruit, cereal, fry, eggs or what I had every morning the hot pancakes and maple I stayed on the 23rd floor and the view is just amazing I love SF and can't wait to go back x

I have stayed in this hotel several times now and just this last weekend it confirmed our high recommendations. It is nicely located near Union Square. It has had a recent update that was clearly apparent in our room on the 18th floor. Ask for one like it since the lower floors' windows have no panoramic view. The top floor used to house a nice restaurant, but it is now gone and replaced by a small cafÃ© on the second floor. We had a buffet breakfast which was nice, but pricy if not included in your rate. When leaving, we called for our car, but when we arrive at the lobby, it was not delivered for about a half hour. However, the head porter volunteered to cancel our parking charge ($62 for one night valet). We appreciated that; an indicator of a quality hotel and staff. Regarding the next door construction noise, we were not bothered but try the east facing rooms for now. Also, a new change: free wifi!

Only stayed one night, had a 1 bedroom suite on the 24th floor. The accomodations were modern and in great shape. The staff was perfect. A smile and hello from every staff member I encountered. The hotel sits right across the street from Union square, and only a block to the Trolley stop. Lots of restaurants, bars, and shops within easy walking distance.

I travel to San Francisco once a month for work and try to stay at the Grand Hyatt as much as possible. Here are the pros - great location! Right next to Union Square and a 5 minute walk from Market Street. Plus, there are so many great restaurants and stores within walking distance.-the rooms- good size and comes with all the expected amenities. The beds and pillows are also super comfortable.- workout room - recently upgraded its treadmills and bikes. Has all the basic equipment you need. -staff- everyone is very nice and does their best to meet your needsThe cons- they recently opened a new restaurant and bar on the mezzanine level. I've tried it a couple times with my coworkers and we were all underwhelmed. Plus, it's pretty expensive. I highly recommend you go outside the hotel for food.

The best thing about this hotel is its location and the bar above the lobby. The room was a little small if I compare it with other hotels on the same level like the intercontinental hotel on Howard st.The best indication for me is what you get for the price you pay and in this case I believe that the price this hotel asks is too high to what you get especially with the constructions noise on the street next to hotel which began last year.

This was overall a pleasant stay. The staff was super-friendly and personal and deserves kudos. The room was OK - the hotel had apparently been renovated a couple of years ago, so I had expected more.However, they did one thing right: the AC was very quiet, which is a big problem in many hotels.I do not hesitate to recommend the Grand Hyatt, but, on the other hand, there are many super (and more interesting) hotels in the neighborhood.

Stayed for 4 nights for NADA Convention. very comfortable hotel, staff very friendly and great location. The view from 36th floor outstanding.Only down side was not hotel but construction work just down street apparently part of new metro? Very noisy also shame about number of people begging in town.But hotel is great and should be pleased with overall effect.

First, the location can't be beat - it's a short walk to Union Square. The common areas are pleasant, the rooms clean, and the beds comfortable. But the rooms are undistinguished in terms of decor, as well as being fairly dark (no good overhead lights). Most problematically, my room was noisy - even on the 21st floor I still needed earplugs to block out street and construction noise. I'd think that with a little poking around you could probably find an equivalently-priced hotel that was a little quieter and possessed of more personality.

Grand Hyatt has renovated itself into a more contemporary setting with individual check in sites instead of the usual counter check in which seems to be more friendly but, less efficient as there always seems to be a line waiting for check in, however, check in staff was very friendly. Rooms have been updated although small in size. Was difficult to fit in a roll away in one of our family rooms. One up cocktail lounge entertainment and service was great and nice reprieve from the Union Square hustle bustle, but, be prepared to pay premium price for drinks.Only complaint that kept me from giving the 5 star rating is that we pay extra $100 per room to get the executive concierge club privileges because we had two kids with us and thought this would help with breakfast and snacks as well as give the adults a nice happy hour to enjoy with the kids. Big mistake because the executive lounge was short on quality food refreshments and was always so crowded that I saw many people who paid for the service leave the lounge in disgust. This happened during their breakfast time (scrambled eggs and cereal and stale pastries were served..not worth the money) and during happy hour where they served cheese, cracker, veggies and two very mediocre hot snacks like pizza rolls. Service in the executive lounge was good but, I could tell the lounge was overcrowded. So if you got to the Hyatt, enjoy the hotel but, forget the Executive Lounge.

It was our early celebration for our 4th year anniversary! :) We received complimentary wine and cheese platter! I would suggest you bring your own wine --- as we did!  We stayed on the 33rd or 34th floor, I can't remember. The main perk was the use of the Grand Lounge. The breakfast there was delicious. Salmon lox, nice scrambled eggs (not too watery like many hotels make them), pom juice. DELICIOUS and exclusive! When they are not serving breakfast they have little bites to eat and access to the espresso machine! VERY USEFUL!The room itself was spacious and bright! I love the automated curtains! ;) We were able to see a view of the cityscape, ocean, Union Square! The service from the staff was quick. I called for slippers and other necessities and they were in the room in 10 minutes or less. Parking of course costs an arm and a leg. But that is just how SF is. I highly recommend the hotel!

Really excellent hotel, staff really friendly and helpful, rooms great, with beds soooo comfortable you never want to get up.Really central to everything in San francisco, brilliant hotel would highly recommend

I visit this hotel again after last year's visit and I have to say it didn't move in the right way. The rooms are small and the bed is not comfortable. It looks like the matress needs to be changed. The service at the checkin is good and quick but the service at the restaurant bar is very unfriendly and the prices are crazy, one tap beer for 9$! There is a small not very comfortable lobby and the hotel needs anyway a make up. The location is great and the view high up too, just outdated rooms and equipment.

I was very disappointed with what I would have expected of a Grand Hyatt hotel. I stayed at the Argonaut hotel for a few nights prior to my stay at the Grand Hyatt. Believe or not, the Argonaut was cleaner, and way better than that of the Grand Hyatt. The rooms are old, not overly clean though not dirty, and in need of refurbishing. The room service was good, but the doorman of the hotel was awful. I was checking out on the morning of friday (Jan 16th), and the doorman watched me struggled with luggage getting it into the Uber. While he runs to help a customer that came after me into a taxi. I suspect he gets something from the Taxi and not from the Uber! What a contrast to the doorman at Argonaut, who was friendly, attentive, and offering to help.I do NOT recommend the Grand Hyatt San Francisco - there are cheaper and better options.

Lovely hotel! spotless cozy and welcoming! Only gripe I have is the Chinese restaurant we was recommended as the restaurant was extremely rude (trying to remember name to leave a full review of that horrid place)In whole can not fault booking a stay here! slap bang in the middle of the shopping area and quiet enough not to notice!

Hyatt consistently gives great service, and this hotel is no exception. The location is great, central to lots of SF attractions. The restaurant, One Up, is also very excellent. We went there on a whim when we were too tired to go out and we were very glad we did. In fact, I plan to return to the restaurant the next time I visit.

The first sign should have been the ear plugs left for me in the bathroom, but it worked out OK. There is construction going on just outside of the property and its just impossible to control much of that noise. The staff here was fantastic and really seemed to care about the guest experience. I would recommend that you ask for an interior room and make sure you bring workout clothes - good gym with inspiring views. Check this place out!

This is the second time I've stayed at this property and I must say I really enjoy everything about the hotel. Both times I've been welcomed with an incredibly warm check in. What I appreciate is the fact that the front desk has notes to acknowledge status, which is great when you're a loyal member to the Hyatt chain. It does make it seem like they appreciate the business when they acknowledge it.I've also gotten great perks as a result as well. Little touches like a bottle of wine and cheese plate to say thanks for your business goes a long way. The rooms as well are well sized and appointed in a simple, understated and luxurious way. The rooms on the higher floors have fabulous views of either the San Francisco Bay or the city itself. Moreover, the club level is also great at every point of the day. Breakfast to late night drinks, the selection of food and drink is superb and the service is even better.

Great location! Just infront of union square and surrounded by great shops (macys, barneys, saks fifth, u name it)Great staffs! Great valet service! it was really hard for me to leave the bed. As the bed and the pillow are soo comfy!!!! Its very good hotel!

The hotels location is fantastic. Right in the heart of things yet we felt that it was quite quiet. We arrived late December with high winds. Upon checking in we were originally placed on the 10th floor but asking if there was anything higher we were given a room on the 23rd floor. Even being that high up the room was fairly quiet (winds did rattle the windows a bit). Rooms are small but comfortable and I especially loved the big windows. Took advantage of the little Starbucks coffee shop in the lobby for breakfast. Made things easy to just grab and go. Although we were there over the NYE period, the hotel never gave me the impression of being over crowded which was comforting. Doormen were always very polite.

My daughter and I traveled to San Francisco for her 16th birthday. We arrived late evening and were greeted warmly by a young gentleman. He acknowledged my daughter, wished her a happy birthday and handed her a menu to choose a special treat to be delivered to our room. She was super excited and it made her feel special. Thank you!The location was perfect for shopping (important for a teenaged girl) and it was close to public transportation. We purchased our 3 day muni passes at the Walgreens on Powell which is a couple of blocks from the hotel. The stop for the double decker sightseeing bus is on the opposite side of Union Square. We received a room on a high floor on the Stockton St. side of hotel. The room was clean, beds comfortable and the view was nice....not a Union Square view but still good.

Very elegant hotel in modern architeture. You would have incredible views of Union Square from the rooms. Location is excellent, as it's near from best stores, including department stores, restaurants and it's a strategic spot from other touristic sites of San Francisco. The service is very kind, excellent rooms and great breakfest.

It's a modern place, great location, and very comfortable beds. There are a few finishing touches missing that I'd expect from this level of hotel like no bottled water or kettle in the room, and the bare minimum bathroom toiletries. The breakfast buffet is pretty small in terms of choice, but the quality of the food was good.

We have stayed at the Grand Hyatt Hotel several times and have always enjoyed our stay. The rooms are clean, comfortable, spacious and the views are breath-taking! The location couldn't be more perfect--overlooking Union Square. We especially enjoy going during the Christmas season when the ice skating rink opens on Union Square and the wonderful decorations are up.

We stayed there in Sept 2014 as part of a 2 night stay in S.F and it did the job. It is essentially a conference hotel, we found it easy to reach the main tourist destinations (it is fairly close to Fisherman's Wharf) and the staff were friendly and attentive. The room we stayed in was at the front of the hotel 13 floors up - the room was clean and spacious but we couldn't have the windows open due to the traffic noise below. The gym facilities were better than expected and I would certainly recommend this hotel as a good 'base camp' if you are in SF for a few nights. If you are looking for a luxury experience though I would stay elsewhere.

My experience at the Hyatt was great. I stayed there for 4 days & 3 nights & I enjoyed my stay there very much. They had comfortable beds & pillows, my view was great, the room service was awesome (thanks Marnie), the doormen were very polite & helpful, the OneUp bar had a great solo guitarist/singer who was also awesome & there are so many stores to shop at in walking distance. I would definitely come back to this hotel again.

While WiFi is free in the lobby they actually charge for it where you really need it in the conference center. If your building blocks cell signal it is a basic level of service to provide WiFi. This is 2015 and San Francisco. Get with it.

I was asked for my room preference - asked for a room with a view and got a corner room looking at a rooftop and no viewWhat was worse, it was facing the construction site. Don't know if there are bylaws in SF regarding when construction can start but 2h of jack hammering (or whatever was making the noise) starting at 4AM is not acceptable

My wife and I traveled to San Francisco for 3 nights. This Hyatt exceeded our expectations. The rooms were clean and the common area seemed well maintained. This property is in a great location and provides easy access to embarcadero and Fisherman's Wharf. We would definetely consider staying again at this property on our next visit to San Francisco.

San Francisco is a city of neighbourhoods and it can be difficult to choose which neighbourhood to stay in. This hotel has the advantage of convenience to all neighbourhoods and especially Union Square, which is at your doorstep. When we went, the hotel was very busy, but management handled check-in with ease. The rooms are very quiet and the food is excellent. This is a very well managed hotel and will keep your heart in San Francisco.

We stayed for three nights and could have stayed longer! The hotel is superbly located for walking and has lovely views down to San Fransisco bay (ask for a room at a higher level!).The room was well appointed, the decor modern, the bed comfortable - all you could ask for and the service superb. Recommended.

This Hyatt is perfectly located on Stockton Street right near Union Square and close to cable and street car lines. The Union Square area is great for shopping and a little less touristy than Fishermans Wharf. The views from our room were magnificent looking down on the ice rink in the square.The hotel itself has been renovated recently and the design of the common areas and rooms is quite nice. The hotel gets very busy so keep that in mind if you prefer quiter properties.Staff were always friendly and helpful whenever required. A little cafe operates out of the lobby and is handy for a quick bite and coffee in the morning.The only negative was there were only three towels for our four person booking. I left a note for housekeeping and this was rectified.

Booked a room (direct from their website) with a view to the Union Square during my 1st trip ever to SF with my family, only to be dissapointed upon check in that they had an overbook of the same room type and at the end downgraded me to a room with no view. Yes they offered me a rate adjustment, but money is not my priority. It's the experience that counts. Everywhere I stay, i always book a room with a view. I feel that has to be part of my requirement to enjoy the hotel and the city. Hoping to have the Union Square as my view that was what I looked forward coming to this hotel.Situation like this, a hotel should upgrade the guests into a higher room category. Offering to downgrade, that's a first time for me to hear, and should have been a big no no for a 5 star hotel like this.Moreover, i feel the standard is not up to Hyatt's usual standard. No amenities whatsoever in the room, no slippers, no robes, had to call couple of times to request for few basic amenities, took forever to deliver.Hairdryer in the room was not working, the housekeeping told me they ran out of any spare hairdryer and couldnt get one from any room as they claimed they were running full occupancy. The way the lady on the phone talked to me was like 'tough luck, you just have to bear at least 24 hours without a hairdryer'. For some people like my wife, she cant go out without drying her hair properly so it was a must have item for us.Been a frequent travellers staying in 5 star hotels, and owning few luxury hotels myself in Asia, that excuse is simply not acceptable. Grand Hyatt should have noticed my dissapointment during check in, and should have done everything to help me enjoy the rest of the stay.At the end I felt like i was staying in a Mercure/2-3 stars standard. Really dont feel any pampering nor luxury. The Hyatt's tagline: feel the Hyatt touch...dont feel it at all. There was no special touch at all!!Checking out from Andaz Tokyo (also part of Hyatt group) before checking into this hotel, the standard drops too much. Checking into Wynn Encore after this experience, even with 5400 rooms operations, service was much much better and quicker.I guess it shows that Grand Hyatt SF is not prepared for full occupancy.The only thing good I need to mention is the kind service of the greeter/front door man. I forgot to ask his name, but he is Hawaiian/Japanese looking, and he was very nice and attentive to me, my wife and my two young kids. I valet my car and he was always there to help us with anything. Nice guy.I never write on tripadvisor, being a hotelier myself, and being so dissapointed with the experience in this hotel, i feel i have to share my experience for the hotel to improve this future operations. Hope this helps!!

We stayed New Years Eve with our school age children. Top notch hotel!Loved the service, location, atmosphere. The amenities such as a hot chocolate station, the modern loungy areas all had warm fires going. Their small cafe was serving free smoothies on New Years Day. Nice little touches that made our New Years in San Francisco a great experience.It was a bit tight having four of us in two double beds but we actually slept well. The automatic blackout drapes were definetly used.The off site parking was a fair price for $41 with in and out privlidges. Made it easy for us to get to a show and back on New Years Eve.They are building the new Apple store next door, which when finished will only create more energy around the hotel. Great hotel.

This is definitely a great place to stay in the heart of San Francisco. Definitely not low price, then again there is not much in San Francisco that is low price. We were put in this hotel because of my wife coming to a training convention. Very clean rooms and great customer service.

We had a lovely stay. The room was standard but everything we needed. Very clean and comfy bed. Only downside, shower pressure is very weak. As it was cold, a strong hot shower would have made it perfect. Would stay again.

A high-end experience right on Union Square. We enjoyed a fantastic view over the square, the city and the bay. The higher floor the better view and less city noise. Ear plugs come in handy. The hotel is very clean and well kept. Wonderful beds and spacious, modern rooms. Don't forget to consult the absolutely great consierges in the lobby. Sooo professional, helpful and attentive! We had a wonderful stay much thanks to their advice and guidance!We'll stay here next time in SF!

Grand Hyatt is always Grand! Perfect location in SF for shopping, restaurants and nightlife. (Tio; Stockton//Sutter garage across the street from the hotel is reasonably priced for city parking. approx. $34 for 24 hours)

We celebrated our wedding anniversary & loved everything. The service, hospitality & rose petals sprinkled throughout our room along with chocolate covered strawberries waiting on our arrival was fantastic!San Francisco is a beautiful romantic city and Grand Hyatt was the icing on the cake! Thank you & we'll be back...

Visited this hotel for NYE. We were really impressed with the quality of the room and also how comfortable the beds were. The hotel is in an excellent location and is surrounded by shops and restaurants. Union Square, Macy's etc are right outside.The only downside was that the lifts took forever to come and were always busy, but this may be due it being busy over New Year

We booked this hotel after a not so great stay at an neighboring hotel. The Hyatt was great! Beautiful hotel, well appointed rooms, great view of the bay. Check in was smooth, we were greeted every time we walked through the door. Bell man was helpful and professional. The only downfall was the bar. The staff was not of the came caliber as the rest of the hotel. But even with that it did not diminish our stay. We would definitely stay here again (just not go to the bar)Thank you Hyatt for making the last day of our vacation WONDERFUL!

We stayed here over the weekend and the location is great. It is practically inside Union Square and is perfect to get to shopping (the huge Macy's and a Westfield mall are right down the street), the Trolley cars, and Powell Street with tons of restaurants. The hotel itself is pretty modern but very nice. All of the employees we met were great and everyone was very helpful and accommodating. They upgraded us to a club room which had hardwood floors and a great view. It was really comfortable, although it was a little small. There was a refrigerator and coffee maker in the room which was nice. We never had to wait too long for the elevators, although sometimes we had to stop at many floors. We were also given a free coupon for the coffee cart downstairs which was really nice. They also had free WiFi, and as a Platinum member we got an upgrade in speed. Overall, it is a really great hotel that I highly recommend. If you want a good, downtown San Francisco experience, I would definitely try the Hyatt.

Similar story to last year. Great location. Wonderful hotel. Some big misses on service though.At checkin I asked for the food & bev amenity (had a very nice charcuterie plate and a bottle of wine last Christmas on a previous award stay as a Hyatt Diamond) and was told that isn't available on Award Stays. Oh well, no biggie, got the late checkout and went up to the room. I did check the terms & conditions online though and pretty sure I'm right about the amenity.Long wait at the elevators again to get to our room. Seems to be typical here.As usual, very nice room. Nice views. Big windows, nice bed, bedding etc. Great shower. Acceptable internet. Hit the lounge. Great place. Always crowded, but hey, they offer boxes to take back to your room and the offerings are great.Awesome location next to Union Square. We went out several times to nearby holiday stuff (ice skating, the tree in front of Macy's, the giant cake at the Westin, drinks at the Drake, shopping). Took a cab once and got a cab immediately. Good service at the Bell Desk too.We ate once at the OneUp restaurant on mezzanine. NOT recommended. The food was fine, but the service was UNACCEPTABLE. Seriously, we were there for an hour before we got our drinks and there were only four tables with people at them and lots of staff. Also lots of mistakes on our orders, an undrinkable Moscow Mule (w-a-y too gingery) and other stuff. Don't go.Also some misses on requests for items we forgot to pack. Similar to last year's requests for extra pillows (we have a 4-year old sleeping with us).

Thank you Hyatt for providing outstanding customer service from start to end (making the reservation, check in, and check out). The staff's service made the stay that much more relaxed and comfortable in this lovely hotel.

I frequently visit San Francisco as I used to live here and I still have family. My wife and I prefers to stay in hotels around Union Square as it is accessible to many things...shopping, dining, and transportation. I finally had the chance to stay at the Grand Hyatt and I was looking forward to a grand experience. I enjoyed the new modern lobby and the comfortable living room area. A mix of modern and old. I asked for an upgrade and as a Hyatt Gold Passport they were able to give us the Union Square view of Macy's, the skating rink and the beautiful Christmas tree. Our room was small and had a modern feel including the small bathroom. (I prefer the balcony of the Hilton's top floors as the balcony extended the room.) The bed was softer than most and made my wife's sleep difficult. I enjoyed sitting on the single armchair and ottoman as I watched the cityscape of San Francisco. The door lacked privacy as I can hear the people in the hallway and I can only wonder if they can hear us that I had to place a towel to block the noice. And the door latch when the door opens would hit the light switch and this was irritating. What stopped me from giving a higher score is what I found on the side tables and desk....dust bunnies...and lots of them. And as we open the window screens, dust flew around the room. We have stayed at lesser class hotels in other parts of the world and never seen this much dust. I can only hope that this problem is inherent to our room but chances are....

We have stayed here before. They have updated to a more modern look. Which we liked. However, we stayed here at Christmas time, we felt the holiday decor was not the same as on our other visits. The hotel is located a block from Union Square. There are plenty of high end stores and eateries all within walking distance. The staff was as friendly as always. Parking at the hotel is very expensive. We opted to park at the Sutter/Stockton garage across the street. It was one quarter the price. So if you don't mind walking a block you can save up to $40. We will stay again.

Pros(1) Was upgraded to a suite(2) Check-in and check-out was smooth(3) Great walking location next to Union SquareCons(1) Hotel lobby always crowded and busy(2) No separate drive in so dropping off car can be chaotic(3) Rooms a bit noisy(4) Not pleasant to drive to as area can be jammed(4) Room fridge not stocked

Hotel is right next to union square. All good shops are within 5 mins walk. Lots of restaurants and bars very close. Fishermans wharf is about a 30 min walk and worth it. Loads of tours and restaurants there. Great views if above 15th floor. Gym is on the top floor and has amazing views. Rooms are good size and have everything you need. Concierge is really helpful and can book anything and everything. It is right in the centre so driving around here is hard due to traffic if on foot its a great place.

The room was clean and comfortable, but it took a very long time for the shower water to get warm. The staff was very pleasant. The big but to our experience not being excellent has to do with check-in, which was not handled well due to inadequate staffing. Parking was overly expensive.

The Grand Hyatt is right on Union Square in downtown San Francisco and perfectly located for shopping and sight-seeing. It's been newly refurbished with a very modern style. My room was a "bay view" room on 23rd floor with an awesome view of bay and Coit Tower! No issues with noise and the air/heat was easily adjustable. The King Bed was so comfortable I am thinking seriously of buying one of the beds from the Hyatt-at-home website. With all the issues I've had with connectivity in some of the boutique hotels in the city, it was so nice not to worry about WIFI availability since I had a virtual business conference one day while I was there. Excellent and friendly service throughout the hotel! Will definitely return for business or personal trips.

Here's the thing I really battled with myself on which Hyatt hotel to stay at on my first visit to San Francisco! After spending an hour or more going back and forth between the reviews and comparing I finally made the decision to stay at the Grand Hyatt! I must say that I really went into this hotel a bit apprehensive because of the previous reviews! Upon arriving I was wondering if I was in the middle of a WAR ZONE!! It was beyond chaos with all of these people in line, luggage EVERYWHERE! No real designated lines and I had to ask one of the employees in the lobby where was the lines for the Diamond Members! I sure as hell wasn't going to stand in that regular line! Anyways after about 10-15 minutes I was greeted by Adam who kindly checked me in! Poor thing was so overwhelmed and dazzled by all the commotion himself! Still was able to provide me fantastic customer service! As a diamond member he not only recognized that but also that it just so happen to be my birthday! I was able to still receive my keys and wait in the lobby until my hotel room was ready! Only problem I had with this was it was past the amount of time that is stated that you can check in! Along with me and other guest just patiently waiting. After about 20 more minutes I was able to finally check in and Adam definitely compensated for the inconvenience of me having to wait especially with my friend being sick! I'll tell you why the 4 stars were still able to be given on this hotel because it's not about how bad it started off its about how it ended and how the staff made the correct actions to make up for the madness! My room it self was amazing because I scored a Grand King Club Corner room on the 32nd floor with a fantastic view of union square! The bed was amazingly comfortable and I loved the bathroom! The fact that my room was very close to the elevators AND the regency club was even better! Talk about amazing food and even better service the staff inside the Regency Club were so attentive and friendly! I will most definitely stay here again!

Stayed here for a weekend to just stroll Union Square area of San Francisco. Perfect location! Couldn't be better. We had just come from Los Gatos with a very uncomfortable bed and were so looking forward to a couple good nights of sleep. The room was very good sized and clean with a plush king bed that was so comfortable we could have stayed in it the entire weekend. The view from our room was of the ice skating rink and Christmas tree. Beautiful view. We absolutely loved it. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We didn't eat at the hotel because of all the great restaurants around Union Square. It was just a beautiful room and bathroom. Very good sized and extremely comfortable. Completely surpassed my expectations. We will stay here again the next time we are in San Francisco.

I had to stay at this hotel for a conference and I must say I enjoyed myself very much. The hotel was incredibly clean, the rooms amazing, completely surpassed my expectations. I would stay here again if I were ever in the area. The breakfast buffet is a bit expensive but there is def. a lot to choose from!

nice location- philip at the bar was very difficult and rude- ruined my stay- i often come to sf but will not stay there again because of him- i hope this rudeness isn't throughout the entire staff as it will make me never go there again

I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt in Union Square several times. The rooms are nice - the staff helpful and the location and view terrific. It does not have any of the boutique intimacy - but when I travel for work that is not ever what I want. The wifi worked well and the staff is always willing to upgrade your free wifi package if there is a problem. I have been upgraded to club rooms when there was availability - at no cost to me. I would suggest to always request a high floor as the area is noisy (it is on Union Square) and there is usually some construction nearby.I have tried several other hotels in the area - but none compare for business travel.

We were unfortunate enough to be staying in San Francisco during the powerful storm that hit California in early December of 2014. Fortunately we were staying at the Hyatt where when the electricity went out. The staff did everything they could to make this difficult situation tolerable. Kudos to the management for creating a calm atmosphere during what most certainly was a stressful time for them.

I was in SF on business and for an entire day, the power was out due to a blown transformer, no fault of the hotel. Yet even in that craziness of managing an entire hotel with no power, the staff at the hotel did everything in their power to make the guests feel safe and secure. Additionally, food (deli type) was served free of charge. In a crisis situation, the hotel did an excellent job at holding down the fort. There were many people irate with the situation, but in this case - there was nothing the hotel could do except pressure the power company to fix the problem.

We had the pleasure of staying at this hotel recently while in the San Francisco. It's located in the heart of Union Square surrendered by the fashionable up scale stores and still a little taxi ride to the Embarcadero. Walking distance to China Town and there a wide variety of stores for any needs you may want. There is a restaurant inside the facility along with work out area. The rooms are nothing short of classy. Attention was paid to make your stay a real pleasure.

This is my second time staying at the Grand Hyatt. It's an absolute winner in terms of location, close proximity to everything. For starters you're right in Union Square and virtually across from Macy's. It's about a 15 minute walk to the Ferry building (no hills) where you can hire bikes or take the ferry to Sausalito. The hotel itself is nice now the renovation has been done. We arrived at 1pm and our room was ready - very nice after the long flight from Australia. The room was nice, large and well decked out. The bed was comfy and the airconditioning worked well. We had drinks in the bar for happy hour, all in all I am glad we chose to stay here again.

It was raining as I came in the door along with 50 plus other conference attendees (of which I was not a part) and they quickly triaged me and had my check-in lickety split. The lady who checked me in saw I was a tad wet and offered me a complimentary umbrella which I thought was super nice. The room is very nice and spacious with a terrific view and you're only a minute walk away from Union Square. Bed was missing a sheet and the bed overall wasn't super comfy. Shower pressure left a little to be desired here, too. Overall this is a classic four star hotel staffed by five star talent. Would love to stay again.

Top marks to this hotel. Completely refurbished recently with great style and taste, modern and stylish. Super friendly staff. Excellent happy hour and breakfast, high quality and excellent value. Superb location for Union Square and surrounding areas shopping and activities. Comfortable rooms and outstanding views. Highly recommend!

Not all Hyatt hotel are the same in quality but Grand Hyatt @ Union Square well meets my expectations. The high ratings are indeed justified with 2000 reviews already.What stands this Hyatt out is its great location close to major departmental chains and short walk to Chinatown (for Chinese food). Taxi fare from airport to hotel will set you back by near $60+/-I also like the homely feel in the lobby area with a nice fireplace and sufficient places to sitThe only tip to I can offer to newcomers to this chain is to book well ahead for discounts but which subject you to a 'no refund' cancellation policy.

Let me start by saying all of the staff I interacted with were very helpful and professional. However, my stay was overshadowed by a couple of negative issues.First, housekeeping removed or disposed of some of my toiletries. I travel 6-10 times a year on businesss (plus personal travel) and have never had this happen before. There was little possibility of mistaking my items for hotel provided as they were brightly colored TSA-approved reusable travel bottles. I received a pleasant letter of apology from the night housekeeping manager, but my items were not located and returned.Second, downtown San Francisco experienced a major power outage (not the hotel's fault). However, this hotel had NO emergency lighting, not even lighted exit signs! Navigating the stairs in total darkness to exit the building would have been difficult and dangerous if I had not brought my own flashlight. How are they allowed to operate?! This has to be a violation of safety code/law.

Spend more than 60 nights in SF. Tried the new Intercont, Ritz, Hyatt Embarc, St. Regis.... The Grand Hyatt is the best. The gym is ecxcellent, food is good and the room are very comfortable.But the best thing about this hotel is the staff, bell guys, housekeeping, valet guys, front desk and most importantly the GP specislist, Ms. Shiroma, she is just amazing. Tone of voice, follow up skills, a polite and professional person. At the times, this location is less than the Hyatt Regency and can't figure out why.... One thing that drivers need to be aware of... lots of construction near the hotel. But don't point the finger at the hotel, it's the city of SF. I had a very bad experinice at the Grand Hyatt in Tokyo.... GM (country of origin, Spain), warrant for the ex GM... Maybe the Grand Hyatt Tokyo / $600 USD / night can learn a few lessons from SF, which is 50% less than..... Job well done SF.

Stayed here two nights on business. Efficient at check in and room clean and reasonable size. Free and fast wifi obvious plus. Didn't use too many amenities but gym looked well equipped. Would have liked to use top floor bar but closed apparently now for two years. Didn't appreciate having to wait for table at breakfast but sorted itself out in ten mins which was ok. Ate in bar and restaurant both nights - wasn't bad. Very good central location. Would be ok staying here again.

Smart rooms, great bar and restaurant - feels classy! Ideal location just minutes from Union Square. Hyatt quality. I totally recommend this hotel whether it's your first time in San Francisco or you have stayed before.

Great 5 star hotel, for a short visit to San Francisco located in the heart of the shopping center.With a very good service, clean rooms, very comfortable beds, this hotel is great for traveling and enjoying SF. In my opinion a great hotel, highly recommended

I love new renovated rooms. Up grade to regency clubSuite. Amazing view, spacious, cleanest, I said better than St. Regis. Both Hotels are the best in San Francisco. Regency club offers best champaign, quality snacks. Great ocean view. I really suggest you to pay extra to getting regency club. Concierge, bellman, doorman are working same Hotel for more than 20 years. 4 am departure, doorman suggested us to ride Hotel limo. Only $5 different from local taxi. So relax. We had wonderful 12 hours stay.

I've been to the Grand Hyatt Hotel during a business trip in San Francisco and stayed there for 6 nights. The Hotel is located right in the center of San Francisco near Union Square, what makes it quite comfortable to use it as a starting point for discovering the city. All important buses and two cable car lines start nearby and even the Muni is in walking distance.The Room was very nice and clean, the bathroom was quite spacious. Only the shower was not as much high-adjustable as it would be necessary for a tall person. Water pressure was an issue as well. But overall, those were smaller problems. The TV senders offer only american TV stations.The food was of good quality and I've used the restaurant for breakfast and one time the in-room dining. From a European perspective: the buffet could offer a much broader varietyOverall: I like the Hotel and I can definitely recommend it to you from my perspective.

I stayed here for a large event that was held at Moscone center. The Grand Hyatt is centrally located, comfortable and clean. I ordered a light dinner in my room on the first night and it was very good. The staff was helpful and friendly. The Starbucks coffee in the lobby was very handy -- only open in the morning though.I would certainly stay here again on business.

I have stayed in many hotels in the San Francisco area and been really impressed with the customer service at this hotel. EVERYONE in the hotel is nice, friendly, and accommodating. Paul at the front desk was outstanding and everyone else I encountered from the door greeter to food hospitality have been more than helpful. The rooms are nice and clean and the location is perfect for shopping around Union Square. I would highly recommend this hotel while visiting San Fran.

When I stayed this hotel before, I loved it. I came back again. This is a nice hotel with Hyatt standard. I enjoyed my stay. This time, it seems there was a big event at the hotel. I had to wait for a line to check in for 15 minutes. Later I saw a line of check in guests goes outside of the hotel. This is ridicurous. Because of that, a kind of small lobby as Grand Hyatt, I had to wait for a line to get an elevator for 5 minutes, packed with people all over, over crowded club lounge, etc. I hope it was because of the busy situation, I hope they have not changed their service standard.

We arrived with a confirmed reservation at 4:20 yesterday afternoon, Saturday. Check in time is 3:00. The first thing the receptionist told us was that he could offer us a room at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf or Hyatt Embarcadero. We said no thanks. We had chosen this Hyatt because of its proximity to our dinner engagement. After registering us, he said the room wasn't ready. We were due at dinner in a little over an hour and wanted to clean up and dress. He went somewhere to check further. After about ten minutes, he returned and told us that there might be a room ready at 6:30. I said that was not acceptable - that we had a confirmed reservation and that check out time is noon. That there was no reasonable excuse for our room not being ready. His response was something like Hyatt Gold members checking out at 2:00 Platinum members checking out at 3:00, etc. Not being so privileged ourselves, we were simply stuck. While this was happening to us, two other couples trying to register were also being told that there was no room ready for them either. One couple was told their room might be ready at 10:00 p.m. We canceled our reservation and walked out. As luck would have it, we got a great room up the street at another hotel for less than half the Hyatt price. We'll never stay in a Hyatt anywhere again after this kind of shoddy treatment, andI hope whoever is reading this doesn't either.

Firstly the location of this hotel is unbeatable! It's right on Union Square! That automatically puts all the hottest shopping and nightlife in San Fran in close proximity. It's a stone's throw from - well - everywhere! China Town is a 5 minute walk. The hotel itself is a grand affair with a 35 storey tower. From my room on the 20th Floor, I could see almost the whole of the city right up to the 101 off-ramps and the residential neighborhoods beyond! At night, the twinkling lights and in the morning, the mist rolling down from across the Golden Gate are sights to behold!The hotel has all the standard comforts including multiple restaurant options, gyms and fitness options et al. The room too was quite comfortable with a King bed, large LED TV etc.

Great views from the rooms and lounge/bar. Rooms are decently sized and the staff is friendly. Pet friendly is a major plus and with its close proximity to Union Square its location is pretty good. The only slight minus I can think of is that the rooms have a sliding glass door to the bathroom. I was traveling solo, however it wouldn't provide the most privacy if you were traveling with someone else, again not really a big deal for some.

The Grand Hyatt is a superb hotel, with everything one would expect. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. HOWEVER, when will top-rated hotels finally understand that full speed internet connections should be free? I can get free wifi almost anywhere; heck, even McDonald's has it for free. But fancy hotels will charge you every day. They MIGHT give you free , slow connections, but if you want speed, you must pay.In fairness, this is not a dig at the Grand Hyatt, but at a pervasive policy I've found at many "better" hotels, and I don't know why they don't "get it".But the Grand Hyatt was terrific, really. Staff was most pleasant! Food was good, room was clean, view was terrific. Stay there, really.

I stayed here for 4 nights in September. It's in a great location for Union Square and all the great shops. It's really central for shopping and for boarding any trams and buses. The hotel was very clean and we even had champagne upon arrival. The rooms are very spacious and quite quiet considering it's central location. We were located on the 4th floor. The bar area is a fabulous place to get a drink after a busy day exploring the city and its sights. Would I stay here again? Yes, it would be one of my first choices.

I have stayed at downtown hotels about 20 times this year so far â€“ mostly at Starwood and Hilton properties. Recently decided to try Hyatt and the Grand Hyatt is BY FAR the most stylish & elegant property I've enjoyed.The rooms have a clean modern design, everything in this property is new, it doesn't feel mobbed even though it is a large hotel, the amenities in the rooms are pretty nice, staff is very pleasant, I am completely satisfied. Someone always posted at the front door, holding it open for you. Just a very nice, upscale experience. If you come to SF a lot and expect some decent ambience out of a business hotel at this price point -- try this one out.Amenities for diamonds - the lounge - are top notch. Great breakfast spread, wonderful service, a guy working the lounge remembered my name from one day to the next...really impressive, and an cheap, make-your-own-drink honor bar (I think $4/drink?) Amazing.Love this place, hope to become a regular.

We stayed for 3 nights. Our room was very comfortable and quite. The hotel has some wonderful staff and we would like to thank David the concierge for his help and Maria at reception such a lovely and polite young lady. The cafe in the lobby for early starter's is a great help to anyone leaving before the restaurant opens, we were looked after by the young lady, who, when she knew my husband was a diabetic, arranged some pastries to get him through. I wished that I could remember her name.We look forward to our return some day. We loved the hotel's extra service of providing any little extra's that one may forget,even toothbrushes , the range of toiletries are quite lovely and once again the hotel provides a wide array of products all free!

We lucked out with the construction. They didn't work when were there. However, get a room higher up so the street noise doesn't keep you up. For some reason our room was right next to the housekeeping room. Good thing we are early risers otherwise I would not have been civil from lack of sleep. Staff was great and the location was fabulous! We were able to walk all around Union Square and down to Market St. Fun times.We spent the evening at the Opera. Took a cab. Ask the doorman how much the cab ride should cost because some cabbies take the long route. One ride was 10 bucks the other ride was $12 and we went a different way.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for one night as a family tradition. While the room was great, the service was lacking. We arrived at 10:30 am - too early to check in, but were able to check our bags. We returned in the afternoon and were told our room was not ready, but that they could check us in about one hour, and they would give us a call. Fine. We went out again, and received a call that they had switched our room to a lower floor because the person in our room decided to stay so there would be another delay checking in. This is now 7pm. They said it would be available at about 7:45pm. We decided to have dinner, and returned 9:15pm to find that their systems were down and they could not check us in or give us a room key. We waited for about 20 minutes, and finally were given room keys. We were grateful that we were offered two bottles of wine as an apology - we ordered one white, one red. I thought was GREAT customer service - if the wine had actually been delivered before 11pm. The wine did not arrive for 30 minutes or so, so we called to check. The front desk said they had no idea when it would be up, and that it was really busy. I called again 30 minutes later. Finally it came around 11pm - 2 bottles of red, only 2 glasses (4 of us in the room) and no wine opener. We had to wait another 30 minutes for additional glasses and an opener. Seriously - this is not a big deal, but I expected more. Plus we had ordered a 2 queen room, and were given 2 double beds. A little cramped for four adults. Overall not worth the $300 we spent to sleep for 8 hours. I understand it was Black Friday and they were busy - I didn't mind the wait so much as they way it was handled.

The hotel has been remodeled and is now very contemporary and 'stylish'. The location can't be beat and the service was extremely good. I would not hesitate for a moment to stay here again. The workout room was especially nice. Instead of being down in the basement somewhere, it was on one of the upper floors and you get a great view of the city as you exercise.

Great location for sure, but as others have said it can be noisy in certain rooms. On this stay I was woken to multiple folks closing their door at night. Its not really their fault, since the doors are heavy and basically slam shut for some reason. You would think with the very nice room remodel they would install some dampeners on the door. I get it has to close tight, but whoa it makes a slam. They are working on the Central Subway tunnel near the hotel - my only suggestion would be to stay on the North side of the hotel on very high floors to reduce the overall city noise. There are not that many rooms per floor - so you might not really have a choice. I asked for a quiet room when booking oh the hotels own website and checking in but still got a room near the elevators and facing west. My room 2023 came with earplugs.

This hotel is consistently great and perfect for the business traveler. It's convenient to the convention center and is right next to China town. The CafÃ© Press around the corner is a must for breakfast. The lounge staff is friendly and there's a great breakfast buffet and lounge menu. Of course, the rooms are also very nice and the beds are so comfortable. you can even get a quick town car to the airport for a great price, even when the largest convention is in town.

We stayed for a long weekend in San Francisco and had the Grand Hyatt as our base. The hotel was very nice - great rooms, dining, wine and some live music. The staff was very nice, starting with the doorman, front desk and the bellman. They gave us a beautiful room and the bellman showed us a view across the city that was absolutely without equal. We asked for recommendations from the concierge on dining, best ways/times to visit some of the sites and their guidance was spot on. I haven't been a Hyatt frequent guest for years but this facility put me on the path to prefer Hyatt again.

I chose the Grand Hyatt because of past experience and the ease of getting around. The Bart station is only a few blocks away and the proximity to Union Square was great. Over Thanksgiving weekend there was a Christmas tree, ice skating, and all of the stores around the hotel were decorated. I could not ask for a better location.I received a welcome email a week before my stay. After chatting with them I was able to stay in a room on a high floor and looking out at the bay. The Bay View rooms are spectacular, stay in one if you can. Housekeeping was very good, better than other Hyatt's I have used. Toothpaste and ear plugs replaced, nightly refresh, and I was greeted by the housekeeper in the hall.I used the club on the 32nd floor. A good selection for breakfast and adequate snacks for dinner. But, David in the club was inviting, attentive, and made me feel like a frequent guest. I must say that ALL of my staff interactions were excellent, not something I can usually stay.Bottom line, stay here, weekend rates are very good, and can't beat the location or staff!

My wife and I stayed here the weekend before Thanksgiving. Upon entering the front doors, I felt the decor was very modern. There is a nice lounge area with a fireplace in the lobby. The check-in area was not behind a counter, but felt integrated with the guests and therefore very personal. The hotel was busy and the staff seemed to handle it well. I do not remember who I spoke with at check-in, but she was very accommodating. There is a restaurant and bar on either the mezzanine or 1st floor. We did not visit, but based on other reviews the food is good although pricey. One confirmation email I received stated a 3-6 pm happy hour where drinks start at $3 and increase $1/hour. That would have been nice, but we were too busy visiting the rest of the city at those times.We felt the price was excellent considering the location. We ended up in a corner room with a northeastern bay view, and a nice view of the city. The buildings were tall enough to obscure 60% of the bay view, but it was still a great look at the city and the bay. The room was a decent size, but I imagine the regular room (not corner) would be on the small side. The room was very clean and modern looking. Hidden under the TV are the fridge and the safe. We felt as if there was not a lot of drawer space, however we managed to store three days worth of clothes.The location was the best part of the hotel. We fortunately did not have to use BART, but our original plan seemed as if BART would have dropped us off within a couple of blocks of the hotel. If you frequent high end retail shops, this will be heaven for you. If you can't get to your destination through 10 minutes of walking, there are convenient bus, street car and cable car stops within a couple of blocks. You should be able to get anywhere in the city within 20 minutes.Definitely make it a point to visit floor 36 at some point during your stay. GORGEOUS views of the city!

We stayed 4 nights at the Hyatt 3 years ago and loved it so much, there was no hesitation in choosing it again for 6 nights this time. Firstly, the location is just excellent. Right on Union Square, it is near Chinatown, North Beach, Market Street, the cable cars, I even find it is near the Fisherman's Wharf (10 minutes by cable car)! It is near many MUNI lines to get to most parts of the city. Accessibility is unbeatable.I experienced great customer service from prior to check in, until check out. Before I arrived, I emailed the e-concierge multiple times on questions like the MUNI pass and making changes to my reservations. Replies were always prompt and friendly. Check in at noon was fast, I was given a room on a high floor (29th) as requested. The room was clean and beds were most comfortable. Housekeeping was very observant that I was running out of toothpaste and provided a new tube when they cleaned the room the first day. Maria from Front desk was helpful in providing scissors and tape which I requested. The Concierge desk provided me with big paperbags for bringing my returns to the UPS store, and also a huge box for packing myshopping. Check out was even better! I received an email on the final night and had to tick a box and submit to receive my final bill. The bill was accurate and there was no need to queue up and check out the following morning.A few things which may be helpful to you:1) The hotel wifi is free and fast enough for FaceTime, surfing the net2) There is a computer at the reception where you need to provide your credit card and are allowed 15 minutes and 5 B&W pages every 24 hours for free.3) Receiving packages at the hotel costs US$5 per package. If you are shopping from Amazon, I highly recommend sending to the Baileys Locker at 7-11 just 1 block away. It is free. Amazon tends to split up shipments into many boxes and you will be charged US$5 for every package received at the Hyatt. I had 9 boxes at Baileys the first day I arrived. I'm happy to share more about ordering from Amazon using Prime shipping, drop me a line. There is a UPS store 2 blocks away on Sutter for shipping returns to Amazon for free, Shopping is my passion.4) Get a MUNI pass. It saves you time and money. Each cable car ride costs US$6 and a 7 day pass costs US$30. The passes are sold at the 24-hour Walgreens a block away.5) I always do my rentals from National at 750 Bush Street 2 blocks away. They are friendly and efficient. If driving on weekdays, watch out for the tolls.We will never stay anywhere else in San Francisco city!

Let me start by saying the staff at the grand hyatt are awesome. The hotel is in a wonderful location a block off of union square. When you walk into the hotel the check in area is located immediately to your right, the hotel was extremely busy and the process seemed chaotic. The lobby area was very cold, due to the location of the counter and entrance exit doors.Our room is clean and nice the bed comfortable and the pillows acceptable. I found the bath towels to be on the thin side, I like a lush thick towels. Our room came with two sets of ear plugs, which both my husband and I needed to use the first night. Unfortunalty we threw them away and they were not replaced. I have been up since 2:00 am listening to street noise and people talking in the room next door.We come to the city a lot and this was our first time staying here, there are so many wonderful places to stay in San Francisco. We have our favorites which we will be returning too, unfortuantly The Grand Hyatt is not on that list.

I joined my husband, who was in SF for a conference. This is to say I had no idea concerning the room. I/We are discerning, but never demanding. The Grand Hyatt is a hyatt and I believe these hotels know when guests are part of a conference. As a result, the staff doesn't know whether the attendees will be appreciative of any service provided. So, the staff sees another conference and well, the service should be the same for everyone, but who knows.Our room was great and the service was excellent. i was certain to make the housekeeping staff know us and knew what to do to make our stay enjoyable. It works. Our room was cleaned to perfection and housekeeping was especially nice. I have no reason to expect anything less from Hyatt and this hotel did not disappoint. Not one complaint. Our room had a great view.The primary plus to this hotel is its location. The proximity to restaurants and shopping is worth the stay. The hotel is not close to Fisherman's Wharf or the Golden Gate Bridge, but the location next to Union Square is so easy and convenient and centrally located to so many activities. Highly recommend for business or personal travel.

Right on Union Square, the Grand Hyatt is perfectly situated and a great base for any visit to San Francisco. Chinatown, theaters, Macy's, Nordstrom, dozens of other shops and restaurants, Yerba Buena gardens, and many other attractions are a short walk away. Everything else is accessibly by street car, cable car, bus, taxi, etc.The service was outstanding, and it began before we arrived when Kristen assisted us with room selection. Check in was smooth and quick. Despite our arriving quite early, they were able to out a rush on our room and get us into it in short order. Rooms are clean, comfortable, and well-appointed. The amenities are above average even for similar level hotels, though I would not classify the rooms as luxurious, though definitely upscale. The lounge has good bar food, but limited seating. The lobby is relatively small and not particularly comfortable, and the check in uses open stations rather than a traditional reception desk, which would have been more comfortable.All in all, this is an excellent choice.

I absolutely loved my time staying at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco. The staff are incredibly knowledgeable, polite and friendly.We were in a great location, with a Starbucks right across the road for breakfast on the go! You are literally seconds away from the shops (and my personal favourite, the Cheesecake Factory) and buzz of San Francisco. Other attractions such as Fishermans Wharf, Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge are close by and easily accessible by cab, bus or walking if you like to explore like me. I would thoroughly recommend walking to the golden gate bridge from pier 39 - it takes a little while (it's about an 8 mile round trip), but totally breathtaking views and a fantastic way to exercise off some of the tasty food you'll be eating! (Boudin for Clam Chowder is a must!!)The rooms at the Grand Hyatt are modern, roomy and incredibly comfortable. The bed was just brilliant and the room was equipped with great features like automatic blinds, a flatscreen wall tv and a roomy bathroom.I can't really say much more about the hotel aside from it was a brilliant experience to stay and was exactly what I wanted in one of the most gorgeous cities I have been to.

Though not as fancy as a W or a Marriot, this hotel has all that you need for a stay more than an overnight. It is right next to the Union Square plaza, that's more than enough to decide to stay. Close to all the shopping. Great places to eat nearby.

A newly remodeled hotel with excellent location. The rooms are decorated with a mix of contemporary and modern style. The registration/ check in area is unique. Highly recommend it. Value with parking is very expensive but across the street you can find a little less $60.00 vs $40.00

My wife and I traveled to San Francisco so I could attendthe North American Spine Society meeting. The Grand Hyatt was one ofthe conference hotels.Our flight was delayed due to weather. I called the hotel to informthem that we would either arrive late that evening or early thefollowing morning. We were told this would not be a problem. When wearrived around 1:30 am, there was no doorman available to help us withour luggage which we didn't mind too much because of the hour. Theassociate at the front desk told us our reservation had beencancelled. I was very confused about this as I never cancelled thereservation and even called ahead to let them know we would be late.He said it would not be a problem and reinstated our reservation. Hethen gave us our room keys. We went upstairs and the keys he gave uswouldn't open the door. Furthermore, I believe the room was occupiedbecause there was a do not disturb sign on the door. We went backdownstairs, he apologized for the mistake, and gave us the correctroom key. Mind you we were trudging back and forth carrying ourluggage as there was no doorman at this hour.Probably the most disappointing thing about our stay was the room. Itwas very small and cramped. With our three pieces of luggage (twocarry-ons and one suitcase) there was not much space left in the room.The shower was tiny. I'm not that tall (at 6 feet) but the shower headwas too low for me. It was detachable and could be used as a handpiece but that was less than ideal. The bed was not that comfortable.The TV was connected to the internet which was probably the nicestfeature of the room. The next morning neither my wife and I wereexciting about the thought of staying at the hotel for three morenights. So ultimately we moved over the the Westin St. Francis.

San Francisco is such an expensive city and I was hoping that the $300+/night room rate was going to be worth it. It definitely was. this hotel is right in the middle of the downtown shopping district and we really didn't need to drive anywhere. We were in town for a visit with our son to University of San Francisco, which was a short 10-minute drive away. The restaurant (One Up) in the hotel was great - excellent breakfast choices and very attentive and helpful staff. The rooms were very nice and the beds are some of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The one negative was the service in the bar on Saturday evening. Our waiter was extremely slow and seemed to spend most of his time at the register. I finally had to go to the bar to get a drink order in after waiting 15 minutes at the table for service. Other than that, it was a great stay.

Quick checkin, very friendly staff. "free wifi" had intermittent problems forcing you to upgrade to premium. The mattress was definitely in need of replacing. It was like you fell into a hole. As a result - a miserable backache that would wake me at night. So I never had a complete night's sleep. Breakfast buffet, better than most, good variety. Bell captains very helpful. Only 7 blocks from Moscone Center and one block from Union Square. Streets and sidewalks torn up due to major construction.

Really nice work on a remodel, rooms are small but very well done, beds/technology/views - really nice.Can't beat the location/proximity to restaurants and shopping, also the bar on the second level - very well done, great spot to knock down a drink after a long day, before dinner, or after dinner - a lot of people there - pretty good scene.

I am not sure if this hotel is new but as a businesss traveller struggled with the lack of room service at lunch or after midnight. There is nothing like arriving after a long flight to be told there is nothing to eat and no water to be located. Or when you are trying to work through lunch be forced to rush out to find something. I also found the hotel operator to lack knowledge of the actual hours/services.Otherwise hotel was great - I just would not choose to stay here, I need convienences.

Pretty good experience here, having stayed in San Francisco multiple times it was my first time at the Grand Hyatt. Check in swift, room ready at 11am - always a bonus after a 13 hour flight. Room was modern and clean. Floor 5 overlooking Stockton Street, noise of the street drowned out by white noise of the aircon. Main disappointment was poor shower pressure - pretty poor form at this standard of hotel.
