Also they have a yoke style ball thing on the tv remote - frustrating to use at best, even more frustrating when it only works intermittently. Gym was adequate. No roof top bar unfortunately. Staff pleasant throughout, rooms made up by noon each day and cleaning staff very pleasant. Location is 30 second walk to union square.

This hotel is in a great location. Close to lots of shops and restaurants and walk able distance to Fisherman's Wharf. One plus is we arrived at 10:00 am and we were given our room without delay. While the room was spacious with a great vies of the bay it could have been a bit cleaner. The dust in the bathroom made it clear that it had not been dusted for some time. The towels were very thin and left lint on us. For the price we paid I would expect a bit more. The shower head was such that you had to be up against the wall to reach the water. While this sounds negative I would stay here again but would first look elsewhere to get more value for my money. Just a few things they need to work on to be the "Grand" hotel they claim to be.

Clean, updated, friendly staff, right on Market Street and a short pleasant walk to the Pier. Also close to all amenities. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will return. I am a tough critic with extensive travel and this is one of the hotels I would definitely return to.

I spend half my life in hotels around the world. As such I have certain expectations regarding room service, pillows and general access to food on a 24 hour basis.This hotel doesn't have room service between 10:30 am and 5:00 pm, which is useless if you're jet lagged or traveling at odd hours.The beds are terribly soft and uncomfortable, which is compounded by pillows which are the equivalent of the types of pillows given to you on an airplane. Well used and worn out.The lobby restaurant closed in the afternoon, with the only food available in their understaffed bar.Wish I had a better experience here. There's nothing 'grand' about this Hyatt.

Great place to stay if you want to be in the center of SF. Close to Moscone Center, restaurants and shopping. Modern hotel with all kinds of service incl FREE internet also in the room.The rooms are very comfortable and spacy. Service good very helpful personnel who gave us good tips. Breakfast very good a little queue in the morning but no real problem.

I'm not sure I'm "hip" enough for this hotel, but I can tell you that I was really impressed. I stayed in a club room that was beautifully appointed, very clean and really comfortable. The bath was bright and they had a lot of fancy spa samples to bring home for my wife (bonus). The club lounge was very well stocked, nice service and nice quality breakfast and snacks. The lobby was gracious, busy but a fun energy. The constant drone of dance music combined with the low-seating conversation spaces reminded me a bit of a W HOTEL but done better - warm woods and bookshelves with a running fireplace. The workout room is really well appointed and spacious, although no spa services. I'll be back.

Had a great stay here this week, everything was smooth and enjoyable from check in to check out. Lobby area is small-ish and can get congested, same with the elevators, but it should not diminish a desire to stay here. Room was modern and well laid out etc but on the smaller side. Had a great view of a beautiful city where view actually matters. Perhaps the only negative to the room was the shower where water pressure was so-so at best via a detachable shower head. All in all I enjoyed it and would recommend it. Great Union Square location, easy walk to almost everything.

I stayed at this hotel with my younger daughter for couple of days and was pleasantly surprised by the great service, friendly staff, nice room with a beautiful city view, great location ; conveniently located close to many attractions, shops, and restaurants. I would definitely go back again !

We stayed here for 5 nights and were fortunate enough to purchase Grand Club access. The additional cost of the access was so worth it with a great breakfast each day, afternoon snacks and dessert each night. We were going on an all day tour one day and asked if we could take some bottled water with us due to the early pick up, the gentlemen working was so accommodating and even organised a bag for us to take some fruit and muffins for morning tea.A few of the notable staff in the Grand Club were Jimmy & Ahn who were very welcoming and personable. Hotel room was very clean, the hotel is located in a great location walking distance to Union Square, China town etc.Would stay here again for sure. Thanks

I stayed at this place during a conference and I got to say it lives up to the expectation of being grand. Walking and taxi distance to most of downtown SF attractions, I'd thoroughly recommend checking out the awesome breathtaking view of the city from the top on 36th floor.Oh, the rooms are also splendid.

Stayed here for a family emergency. I was on the club floor and expected a heightened experience. Nope. The rooms are tiny. The bathrooms tinier. The walls are paper thin. The club wasn't bad, great views of the water while you snack. But the overall atmosphere and ambiance of this place can best be described as non-existent. It's a corporate chain that exists solely as a place to sleep. Mediocre food, service, rooms. Again, not terrible, but given the choice I'd pick somewhere different any time. This hotel definitely makes me rethink Hyatt as a luxury brand. This is NOT a true 4 star hotel, so be advised, even if its prices are.

I stayed at grand hyatt SF for 6 nights. Hotel is ranked as a 4 star but it is more like a good 3 star hotel. The best thing about the hotel is its location. It is in walking distance to shopping centers, apple store!, restaurants and any public transport.The reception is small and not comfortable. The concierge is realy helpful but sometimes it has only one staff and you should wait a while.I did not use hotel restaurants because many good food were outside.The room is small ,clean and a little bit noisy .Mini bar is empty. There is no water in the room! No teas either! but the Air conditioner works well.For city tours you better not follow concierge's opinion because pacific tour that they suggest does not worth it at all!

I am staying here for 2 nights on business. In previous years, I typically stayed at the W Hotel, or the Westin near Market Street. I have been a loyal Starwood and Marriott customer and have had great experiences leveraging their status/points for upgrades and free nights, but have decided to have Hyatt (I also have the Hyatt Visa which I recommend because of the 40,000 points bonus and free night stay) as a first or 2nd option in the next twelve Pof business travel. This property is near Union Square, within walking distance to the Embarcadero/Ferry Terminal (About a 15 minute walk), the Financial District, and there is good bus/trolley transportation options near by. The hotel itself was renovated 2 years ago, and is very contemporary and modern with a mix of earth tones and blonde woods throughout the lobby and rooms. I am a Platinum Hyatt member, and received a 23rd floor room with great downtown views of the city. I would recommend you request a high floor as the city sounds and construction near the hotel would make sleeping difficult. The room is a standard size city room, beds are comfortable (I would still give an edge to SPG beds, but this subjective). Bathroom was small but again, very modern. My only knock on the room is the water pressure is weak, and the hot water took a while to begin, otherwise I really like the design scheme throughout the hotel. The gym is on the 35th floor but is small with the typical free weights/cardio machines, but only one weight bench. I would stay at this property again, and would recommend if your tastes run towards larger, modern business class hotel. If your tastes run to more historic, or boutique properties, there are many other options nearby.

Make sure you ask if the streets surrounding Union Square are still under construction. They work throughout the night and it is extremely loud. They are not willing to provide other accommodations, so if you book here while Union Square streets are under construction, make sure you get a room on the opposite side of the hotel.

During our stay of 4 days, the choices in the buffet breakfast was the same. Our room offered a fantastic view of Union Square, Powell Street, the San Francisco skyline and the mountains in South San Francisco.

I usually select hotels based on location and look/feel, and was not expecting anything special from the Grand Hyatt as overall it seems like a rather common type hotel, what you would usually expect when you go on business trip. The thing that really blew my mind and that makes it totally special is the fantastic staff and service !! I have been staying here for a week when I relocated for my job from Switzerland to SF - from the reception staff to the luggage people, the breakfast waiter to the fantastic concierges , everyone does their best to make you feel comfortable valued and special. Amazing! The fabulous concierges Elaine (and her male colleague, not sure of the name sorry!) went as far as to help me for my car search as I was going househunting and car hunting. They helped me prepare for the car bargaining, printed my documents, provided great tips and advice, etc. Unparalleled service and friendliness !This is the first time I write a review on tripadvisor, I just could not leave this place without showing my appreciation. What I thought was "any other SF hotel" had just completely changed in my mind to become my preferred venue by far.

There are many great locations in San Francisco but our favorite is Union Square - great shopping, easy access to the cable cars and Chinatown, and close to some good food. The Grand Hyatt is right in the heart of what I consider the heart of the city. The location could hardly be better. The hotel itself is very nice. The lobby is a little disjoint wrapping around the central elevators - no grand lobby here but still nice enough. When we first walked into our room, I was a little nervous. It seemed very modern which, many times, means not too comfortable - we were pleasantly surprised that was NOT the case with our room here. The modern looking desk chair was actually very usable for work. The side chair was very comfortable for relaxing in the evening. The bed was very comfortable meaning a good night's sleep every night. The floor to ceiling windows let in a very nice view (our room was above half-way up but not near the top but still some nice cityscape / bay views). There was some solid technology in the room - good wifi connections, multiple controls for the window shades, lots of power plugs in strategic locations for charging all of the gadgets. You could order room service directly through the TV which was very convenient and we also received an email that you could order through your smartphone (didn't try that feature). The in-room fridge which was completely available to guest (not filled with the overprices mini-bar items you usually have) was very nice. I had recently had surgery and couldn't eat full meals so this allowed me to actually take some leftovers and eat them later. The bell and front desk staff was efficient but not overly friendly but the concierge staff was very nice and helpful.A tip - because of the location and the expensive parking ($62 for valet or $45 (I think) for "assisted" self-park) if you can avoid bringing your car, you should still be able to get around the city easily. The cable cars are nearby and it isn't too long a walk all the way to Fisherman's Wharf (which you could do through North Beach which is also fun).Great location + comfortable accommodations + everything you need and a little more = we have already booked our next visit!

Spent one day at the hotel. The check in was easy and we were well treated. Our room had a wonderful view of the bay. The room was contemporary, clean and comfortable. Loved walking Union Square and enjoying the shops and the people. Well worth having on your list of hotels to stay in when in San Francisco.

Weekend visit to see our son (and get swept along in post-Giants' parade hoopla!) went from good to great when the desk clerk (Wayne) fixed a small problem (needed 2 beds, first room had just one) with a nice upgrade to a terrific view. He even met us at the elevator door with new keys so we didn't have to haul our luggage around or wait. Nice touch! The property was great last time we visited, and has been spiffed up even more. Lively bustling vibe in the lobby; immaculate and efficient. We'll be back.

The best part of our experience here was the friendly staff, especially the doormen. We stayed here for the weekend. The room was fine with a great view. The bed was not comfortable at all. We stayed on a clubhouse floor, the breakfast was great, but the other "meals" were more like snacks, and there is no food out at all at certain times. This hotel is located in the heart of downtown right near China town and an upscale shopping district. We had to walk considerably to get to the bay. The hotel is trying to be very modern, there is even annoying top ten music playing on elevators, which is not relaxing at all. All and all it's a nice hotel, I think next time we will stay somewhere quieter--my husband and I are too old for this contemporary hotel! Great for 20 somethings and families!

Stayed Oct 27th, 28th, 29th. Always stayed at the Regis while visiting with the fam but decided to try out this hotel. Reception staff needs to be attentive, was left waiting for 10 minutes without anyone greeting me. I think the only person who greeted me was the door man and the bell guy. The Grand Club on the 32nd floor was awesome, great view and awesome selection on the food. I really have to compliment the people working at the Grand Club, they were very professional and attentive. The housekeeper were very friendly and always had a smile on their face. We would defenitely stay here again, but please the people working at the reception really need to be more attentive and please tell them to put smile on their faces like the Grand Club workers, the housekeepers, the bell guy and the door man.

Stayed here for 5 days to attend an event at the Moscone. The hotel is located right off union square. There is a parking garage across the street (stutter/stockton) to park your rental. Also there is a Starbucks right across the street to grab some coffee on your way out. Upon entering the hotel there is no clear check-in desk, it's more like a modern minimal office setup lace where you have to check in. The lobby is nice and offers a nice hangout place with a couple of fireplaces. Another good spot is the bar at the window side where you can just do some people watching. The rooms are Spacious, Modern and clean. A nice touch are the automatic blinds (rather then curtains) and i particularly liked the overall design of the room. and it come fully equipped with a little fridge, safe and iron board. I've found the hotel staff to be courteous but nothing extra. per example: I asked about the skybar/lounge on the top floor (it was advertised on their website) but got a short answer that it was closed and nothing more nothing less.....(i just wanted to take a nice picture from the topfloor). The most friendly staff are the doorman that welcome you in a friendly way every time. also a small complement to the housekeeping staff, I used the laundry service and I misunderstood one of the items on the list and the personnel corrected me saving me some money. Overall I liked this place and i may return. But i do feel that the main-desk staff can up-level their hospitality skills.

My friend and I stayed here overnight for the Nike Women's Half Marathon. This hotel is half a block away from Union Square where the expotique was held and where the starting line was located. All my friend and I had to do was get up at 5:30 in the morning and take the elevator downstairs, walk out of the hotel and corrals were down there. I'm glad we stayed here because we did not hear much of the race set up from our room. We were on the 12th floor. I had stayed before at the Westin St. Francis for the race and I could hear all the noise from the traffic and the race set up. I got a better night's sleep for this race. The hotel's decor is modern. We had a double room and it was roomier than some hotel rooms in SF. The bathroom was nice. My only complain about the room is there's only one place where you can plug in anything and it was by the desk. You can't plug anything anywhere else, not by the bed or anything. Other than that, the room was fine. The wifi was great. No issues downloading anything and no need for a password. We had dessert at the lounge on the eve of the race and the dessert was fine. We had lunch at their main restaurant, One Up, and that was good. My friend liked the clam chowder and I had the Dungeness Crab Melt. If you have the Yelp app and live locally, check in on Yelp and get a 20% discount on your bill. Not sure how long this promotion will last though. We would stay here again for the NWHM race or for just a quick getaway.

My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend with our then 13-Month-Old daughter. The staff was really wonderful and made sure we had everything we needed (even suggesting a close place to get Mac and Cheese at 7pm). The location is solid, but there a tons of Hotels in the area, for me, it was the service that would bring me back.

Whether traveling to San Francisco for business or leisure, the Grand Hyatt San Francisco is the best choice for accommodations. The hotel is centrally located and reasonably priced. The rooms are updated and provide beautiful sweeping views of San Francisco Bay. Location is perfect. The hotel is on Union Square. There are plenty of shopping and restaurant options within walking distance. Chinatown is two blocks away and the business district is a quick 10 minute walk. For those looking to ride the cable cars, the Powell line is only a block away.The rooms are spacious and updated, with the luxurious touches you'd expect from a Hyatt hotel. The staff is courteous and efficient.I travel to San Francisco on business monthly. This is by far my favorite hotel.

This is by far the best place to stay in San Fran. The staff - from doormen, hostesses, the concierge, food servers/cashiers - have all been well trained to deliver excellent customer service. Our room was very spacious and clean. Bonuses included free wifi and bottled water. Oftentimes, those are only available at a cost (especially when part of a conference). Location is convenient as it's right off Union Square. This is a quiet, well maintained GH property that will now become our "go to" place to stay in San Fran.

I used to travel to SF a lot and almost exclusively stayed here because of the location. I haven't been back in years but went there recently. It was exciting to see that it had undergone significant renovation. Frankly it was needed. It is a reasonably large hotel and lots of tour groups come here. The service is good but if you need a concierge, you may have to wait.

I'm in town for a meeting and chose to stay here. It is in a perfect location being close to union square and easily can walk to Moscone center. Nice modern rooms with free wifi which is nice. Only advice is not to stay in room 701, it is right next to housekeeping closet and fairly noisy with the closet, street and thin walls for room next door. Room comes with fridge and coffee maker. Water bottle would be nice. Hotel lobby is very nice and all staff have been friendly

Stayed here for an overnight (Friday) when a friend from out of town was visiting. Location is very central to shopping and BART (for example, can take BART in from SF airport and walk just a few blocks to the hotel). VERY nicely remodeled. Had a nice view of Union Square. We were in room 1919. It had 2 full beds, and the room was SUPER clean with GREAT furnishing. Free internet â€“ very nice for a hotel chain. The check in service was good, and the bellmen were quick to open the doors etc. Did not use any of the facilities. The room had ear plugs in them and that worried me a bit when I checked in - but other than the garbage truck in the morning I did not hear any noise. Did not use the ear plugs. They did not have coffee maker in the room which was disappointing. They did deliver the local SF Chronicle paper to our door (so much nicer than USA Today â€“ perhaps we got the local paper because it was the weekend).

I chose this hotel for its great location and the price. Being first timers to San Francisco this hotel proved to be in a verygood location. There were plenty of places to eat nearby, public transport to anywhere we needed to go and coffee served all day in the lobby. Staff were friendly and anything we needed was bought to the room immediately. My only gripe would be the breakfast area. We had breakfast included in out 4night stay and the hours it was available was just great. Unfortunately the breakfast room was on the small side and we found we had to wait quite a while as it was always busy. However on one of the mornings we were given a private room to eat in which sounds good but was dark and very cold so breakfast was eaten in quite a hurry. On the plus side the service was very friendly, food was very nice and we all thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

We decided to stay at this Hyatt due to the location of being so close to all the shopping places and Chinatown. It was a bit pricey but I guess that was to be expected due to the location. You would think the price we paid we'd get a better customer experience but the concierge was horrible. We waited for ten minutes being the next one in line but the concierge thought it was more important to go over another restaurants menu with someone. What a joke!!!

The check-in app is great and the front desk is uber friendly. Room 1605 doesn't have much of a view (unless looking into Mystic hotel rooms is your idea of a view) but is elegantly furnished and very large and comfortable. Check in and check out was a breeze and great to have free wifi and its location--a block up from Union Square makes it a good location for SF city meetings. A very comfortable back lobby seating area as well.

We were surprised by paper cups provided for an up market hotel. Only 2 tiny long life milk sachets. For the price of their rooms?? We are tea drinkers and a lot of other overseas visitors would be also. We shouldn't have to bring our own milk and mugs.Concierge very helpful.

I would give the hotel 3.5 out of 5 due to my tv not working correctly, super slow service in the restaurant for lunch, and bad room service one morning. Other than that the front desk service was amazing, room service on another morning was great, and everyone in the staff whether they were opening a door, getting a taxi, or I was passing them in the hall were great. Location worked really well for me and I had an amazing view. I would recommend as I feel the couple instances that weren't up to par were most likely exceptions.

Many hotels boast a Union Square address, but many are a few blocks away from the actual square, The Grand Hyatt is one block up from Union Square. As it was a special occasion we were lucky, and managed to get a room upgrade to a club room. Right from the outset, the check in was smooth and quick with Paul. We overlooked the bay up on the 31st floor, the view was fantastic. The room itself is nicely appointed with new furnishings, the decor was pleasant and modern. The bathroom is a good size with a huge sink and really good sized shower, which worked well. The bed was a nice size, however the pillows could've been firmer. I didn't hear any construction traffic during our stay, but as the floors are all made of wood which makes the room look nice and modern, it did feel like there was a herd of elephants in the room above (3211) especially at 2 am. The bonus of it being a special occasion is that we received a free gift of our choosing from a list, normally in other hotels when I've seen this happen you're not given a choice and I think this is a good idea, well done hyatt. The club room benefit is that you get access to the club lounge on the 32nd for where you can access lunch, breakfast, snacks and soft drinks for free. The cookies are lovely and the views fantastic. The only downside is that the 36th floor wasn't open during our stay to take advantage of the views as advertised on the TV screens by the elevators. Thank you Hyatt for making this a special stay.

Great location next to Union Square and China Town. Close to some great high end shopping. Check in and out process was easy. Welcome message on the TV. Rooms were clean. Bathroom was clean. Ask for a room overlooking union square. Close to a ton of great food choices. Walgreens is around the corner. Parking is expensive ($62), but you can expect that in San Francisco. Staff was friendly and always willing to help. received a couple of great food recommendations from the concierge.

Hyatt experience ...great location ...service ....liked especially the GYM ...top floor and inviting ....cozy rooms ...very friendly staff ....city centre excellent location and close to many attractions ..

Stayed here when I ran the Nike Women's Half Marathon. Location could not have been better. Right on the corner of Union Square and steps away from all the festivies of the event. The hotel is very nice. The rooms are upgraded with modern bathrooms and large tv's. Everything was very clean. We stayed on the 26th floor so noise was not an issue. The beds, however, were horrible and in need of an upgrade. Our mattress sagged in the middle and no matter how far to the side you tried sleeping, your body would roll to the center. This made for a horrible night's sleep before the big race. The elevators were very slow. Overall, I guess you pay for location and not comfort.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco for almost a week and I must say that next time I'll book there again.The rooms were comfortable, with big beds, air purifier, a nice desk to work, and with also fantastic toiletries.Over all, the great location (you can walk everywhere) is definately one of the most remarkable aspects.Additionally, I must also say that the breakfast room was nice and that except for the cold cuts (ham, cheeses, turkey...) , that we Europeans usually have in our hotels at breakfast... the whole food variety was very wide and of a good quality.My favourite spot though, was the gym. I think its the most beautiful fitness room that I've ever seen in my entire life.So this hotel is definately a very good choice!

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt in September. Reception area was fine, shown to our room and we were both amazes at how small it was for the money we paid. The area was fine, close to main shopping and eateries. Our remote control for our television didn't work, told front desk and they had a maintenance person at our room within 5 minutes, we also received a little box of candy. Our biggest complaint was the price of breakfast, continental was $25 per person, then a tip. The other major issue was the construction work in Stockton Street, not the Hyatts fault, the noise was unbelievable, pole drivers working day and night. Trucks coming and going all hours of the day. To the Hyatts credit they did offer a sound machine that defuses the noise. I still feel that the hotel is over priced.

The Pros: It has a great location on Union Square, and our room was immaculately clean. It was comfortable, and the electronics (TV etc.) were excellent.The Not As Good Part: We paid a bit over $500 per night (including all of the taxes and fees) for room on the Club Floor. The first disappointment was the room size. It's not tiny (like some of the older hotels near it), but for the money, it just seemed a bit small. Another disappointment: while everyone has different taste on decor, this was very modern and, I thought, somewhat stark and cold. Further while, the bath surfaces and fixtures were nice, the designers fell pray to the temptation to go for a cool look, and forgot about practicality. Specifically, most of counter top in the bath/sink area is taken up by a very large sink that sits on the surface of the counter and looks like miniature bathtub. The result is that there is virtually no room for any toiletries, etc. It's not awful; just, I thought, an odd choice that I haven't encountered in any other hotel.The Club Room was decent but not great. It has a great view, was well furnished and was comfortable. The breakfast was good, and quite satisfactory. We missed the other services because we were doing something else, but you do have to pay for drinks on the honor bar system. On the other hand, the price for a glass of white wine was nominal for a big city hotel: $3. If you are thinking that this will be like the Club Floor at the Ritz-Carlton, you would be mistaken. However, you aren't paying RC prices either.So, while we had a pleasant stay, I think I'd try someplace next time. I've stayed in number of Hyatt hotels, and liked them much more than this particular one.

I stayed 7 nights, 5 for business (Dreamforce) and 2 for pleasure. Needless to say Dreamforce 2014 with 145k registrants was a mob scene but the Hyatt was an oasis. Check in and check out was easy and the housekeeping service was excellent. The TV has Internet on it which was handy because I did not bring a laptop. This meant I could watch some of the sessions from my hotel room when I had a cold. There is construction in the area so I appreciated the suggestion I stay on the Sutter side of the hotel. I requested a low floor near the fire stairs and that is what I got (room 404). They pointed out that it was near an ice machine but I really did not hear it. It is one street away from the cable car and solidly up on the bedrock part of the city - a bit up the hill but not too steep. I would definitely stay again.

I stay at Grand Hyatt a lot. This one wasn't my favorite. Although the location was considered convenient by everyone in my party, I didn't like it...it seemed like a so so neighborhood The on site restaurant...I forget the name...was stellar...I mean really wonderful...that wasunfortunately the highpointof the hotel for me.

I stayed at the hotel for three nights for business and two nights for personal reasons. The average price per night was $500. I understand it was a busy week in San Fran but I expected a pretty luxurious hotel for this price. This hotel is fine if you are paying $180 a night, no more. The lobby is cold and unwelcoming with a very strange check-in area which is often understaffed. The decor in the hallways is reminiscent of a hospital and although the rooms are new, the wooden desk and TV surround were beginning to look worn. The room cleaner was completely inconsistent. We had to ask for two days in a row for face cloths and they didn't replace the shampoo/conditioner etc. There was also no floor mat! This is a safety hazard! I never saw one the whole trip I was there (so just used a towel). I also didn't like the location but this is a matter of personal taste. The hotel is smack bang in the middle of the shopping district with no good restaurants nearby. Oh by the way, if noise bothers you, don't stay here either. I was on the 24th floor and I could hear the construction and traffic all night long. I will not stay here again.

On a recent tour of America we stayed at the Grand Hyatt, it is superbly located for touring the city. We stayed on the 25th floor at the back and had a great room with a great view. Some of our friends were staying on lower floors on the opposite side of the building and had poor quality of sleep because of subway works going on outside the hotel even at night. This we understand is ongoing for some time. The breakfast is buffet style and you are seated overlooking the square, the staff were a bit brusque and not as helpful as we found elsewhere in America, this seemed quite common in San Francisco for some reason. It is really central for touring the city with the cable cars, trams and shops close by. The rooms are clean and well equipped to a superb standard. Big comfortable beds with thick fluffy pillows, you cannot fail to sleep well here. A definite good choice if staying in San Francisco but check if the building works are ongoing and what is the location of your room.

There are actually two Grand Hyatts in San Francisco, so make sure you know which one you need. This one is right by Union Square - perfect location! The hotel is great, the staff is friendly, they got everything right. The only thing missing is it doesn't have much personality or any stories behind like some other top hotels in San Francisco, but as a business hotel it's as good as it gets. BTW, it has great Wi-Fi - I went from the basement to the top floor and never lost connection. And it has really amazing views!

This was my third visit in a year. Unfortunately, each one has seemed a little worse than the last. This time I was unable to leave my air conditioning on at night due to some clanging noise it was making. The bathroom floor was filthy upon arrival (but thankfully cleaned the next day) and the shower head leaked half of the water out the back. Additionally service at the front desk and at the restaurant did not make up for these issues. I found the staff to be at least a little rude, with one exception, each time I dealt with them. Not sure that I'll willingly stay here again.

This hotel was an excellent one to stay at in San Francisco right next to Union Square. Wonderful service, extremely clean, and near many attractions. We upgraded to the Regency club paying approximately 300 per night, which is very reasonable for San Francisco. The Regency club located on the 32nd floor had excellent service and food was phenomenal for complimentary service. Also had nice wine/beer choices for small fee. Regency Upgrade definitely worth it.

Just completed a great stay at the Grand Hyatt at Union Square. Staff were all very wonderful and accommodating for our business needs. The Grand Club has a very good breakfast and evening appetizers as well.

I came to this hotel with my family on vacation and it is a brilliant place to stay if you wanted to do a lot of sightseeing. It is placed in union square with the best views out of your window there are places to eat a short walk away and a Macys store opposite the location there is also a westfield very near it if you are the shopping type. The hotel itself is very upper class and stylish but also family friendly. The lounge area is a cosy place to sit and drink warm beverages as there is a small cafe which brews Starbucks coffee there is also fires to warm up and if you are there working there is laptops that anyone can use. The rooms are an average size with two double beds and large sized bathroom. The maids are friendly and will make sure you get what you need. The clubroom has very nice workers who make conversation and get to know you so when you enter they know you're name and are very welcoming. The food there is up to my expectations with lovely breakfast and afternoon snacks. The snacks are mainly for adults not because of any alcohol but mainly because they are cheeses. They do have a range of muffins and cookies though. The club room is located on one of the top floors but you don't get a view of the union square but a view of all of sanfrancisco you can sit at window seats and be able to have the pleasure of seeing Alcatraz and Sausalito (a small island that follows the Golden Gate Bridge. The location of the hotel is not only in union square but not long from fisherman's wharf which is a walk away with many hills altogether this hotel was one of the best hotels I have stopped in which any generation if people would enjoy

Easy check in, helpful concierge staff, room very clean, well equiped, hotel centrally located- to recommand, price is ok, nice view from the top of the hotel. I would recommend this hotel for people, who want to be located in the center - use taxi transfert of the hotel.

This is a very well run hotel. From check in, which was very slick, to the beautiful, well appointed rooms, to the knowledgeable and helpful group of Concierge staff, excellent food and service in the restaurant, the whole experience was outstanding.Must give a special mention to Cham the lovely girl who served us every morning in Starbucks, a ray of sunshine in the morning, no matter how busy she is.Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a well located City hotel, just off Union Square and for all the best shops too.

apart form the fact that the room was dark, dreary and not very cleanthe check in line was always very longonce self checked when asking if i could change rooms was twice told nothere was a noise in my room that could not be fixed and i could hear every movement of the next door room

You wont go wrong with this hotel !! I loved it , from the spacious rooms, the city views and the superb location , this hotel really has it all and its very reasonable rates . The staff were so helpful, courteous and friendly with a smile every time you passed the doors !! I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone . Union Square is on your doorstep and The Ferry Building about 10 mins away . I will certainly stay here again !!

We had a Bay View room and it was a VIEW. Nice, modern room, bigger than expected. Unfortunately we had a bathroom with a shower above the bath with a shower curtain, bit awkward. On the other hand, it had the biggest hand basin we have ever seen and the best magnifying mirror ever. Wish I could get one.Would return without hesitation.

Nice hotel and location. Friendly staff. Yet they want to charge Diamond members $5 or $10 for faster and fastest internet. They don't tell you that when you check in. Only Hyatt I've stayed in that charges like this. Not a big deal but in poor taste I think.

I am a regular guest at Hyatt Hotels in Europe, Asia and NYC and I have to say that the luxury and sometimes intimate service of other Hyatt hotels could not quite be matched by the SFO property. Let me start with the not-so-good: the place is HUGE, it is a hotel factory and that is sometimes matched by staff attitude, eg in the breakfast restaurant. We found a 'could not care less' attitude which is totally unusual for a Hyatt.The goodies: The views in the high floors are absolutely amazing and you will hardly find better in SFO, location right next to Union Square is extremely convenient for both biz travellers and tourists, the ladies in the Grand Club are very nice.Bottom-line: Not my favourite Hyatt in the world but a solid choice.

Just back from a trip here for 2 days.A great hotel with fab rooms. very clean and really good bathrooms. We had cocktails and snacks at the Mezzanine bar which is a good place to start the evening. the location is in the heart of the city and only a 10min stroll down to China Town and harbour.

This was a very nice hotel. The rooms were recently remodeled and I especially liked the new shower heads they were amazing it felt like being under a waterfall. the staff was exceptional and also kind during the entire stay! the location is in the heart of Union Square so it is fairly centrally located to most things in SF and Uber is right there when you need it. It is very centrally located to shopping. The only reason for 4 stars is the rooms are a bit small. We got an upgraded room with a nice view of the bay and Transamerica tower. Try to get as high up as possible and facing the bay so you won't hear the whistles from the taxi person downstairs. So even with the upgrade the room is like 325 sq ft. Everything in SF is tiny but still it is a small room. But nice. I missed having a sitting chair or something beside the beds. Overall I definitely recommend if you are in the area. Much better then the other Hyatt in SF.

We have stayed here many times over many years. This was our first visit after the major renovation. I can't imagine staying anywhere else. The rooms are up to date and trendy. The location is the very best. You can walk almost anywhere--and get a cab when necessary. We were able to upgrade to the "Club" floor upon check in. That gave us a fabulous free breakfast buffet, and lovely cocktail hour with ample appetizers. We recommend this hotel to everyone.

Almost perfect business hotel in the heart of downtown/Union Square area. Rooms are modern and well appointed. But it almost feels like they chose style over function... Eg: Sleek and trendy furniture, but none have drawers, so good luck if you want to really unpack.....! Other than that, the room was perfect. I had a nice view of the city (from a 26th floor room). Although the hotel was booked full, never had to wait too long for an elevator (they have 5 or 6 in total). The lobby and hallways were modern and clean.The one thing that bugged me was how long it took to check-in/check out. They have several small stations/tables with employees handling everything from laptops. Even at peak times there were only 3 people handling check outs at this "front desk", and they did a lousy job at that. With only 2 people in front of me, I had to wait ~20 minutes to check out... Paid $250 per night which is typical for this type of a hotel in downtown SF...

10 minutes walking from the Moscone Center and Yerba Buena Theater.Great location, close to Market Street (shopping) and cable car stations.36th floor provides an amazing bayview. Unfortunately, no bar at this level.

Nice hotel, centrally located at Union Square. Modern rooms, with electric roller blinds. A little pricey but overall I was very impressed by this hotel. The Hotel is very large. Lots of transport option located nearby for easy access to tourist attractions. Definitely recommend.

Try to be cool but what I expect from Hyatt is classic and formal service and attitude.Check-in desk layout is still awkward, it looks like Apple Store but makes me uncomfortable. Service quality is random, I was satisfied with a staff when I checked in but disappointed with a blunt staff when checked out and at the bar (OneUp?). Breakfast place is small and short of food choices compared to the price. Staffs at the place was nice. Workout place is located at the top of hotel but don't expect to much its view. And the gym is really small. Overall, the hotel appears to try deliver comfortable atmosphere as it is located in SF but its staffs , interiors and facilities are mixture of coolness and classic. Need to choice.

Crazy entrance to hotel very well handled by lovely doormen/concierge. Staff all friendly and helpful. Room a decent size and very clean. Good food in on site restaurant. On a low floor but no noise at all from neighbours or street. Best thing is fantastic location. We walked from here to everywhere in San Fran and also so close to Market street for busses and cable car. Would definitely stay again!

Stayed here for 3 nights - its located right next to Union Square, so shopping, trams, restaurants - all walking distance. We had a car but we were advised not to have it in SF for our duration as parking is so expensive - great tip - you don't really need a car until you are leaving.Rooms are great - we had 2 queen beds and they are spacious and comfortable. We had a problem of a leaky air con at 5AM - it was fixed (after a few calls) but it wasn't until we checked out and then mentioned to the lobby that they compensated us with a free breakfast - it did take them a long time to let us know and the duty manager in charge didn't really do much. Credit where credit is due though - the lobby staff were excellent and they made quick decisions there and then. Everything is walk-able and this hotel is highly recommended despite our air con issue !

We stayed here for 5 nights last week. Overall a fantastic location for the City. The hotel is located next door to Union Square - which has shopping, food choices and there is a tram stop. There is also a laundromat two blocks walk away which is handy. Several years ago we stayed at a motel across the road from pier 39, however we are glad we stayed in the city instead as the pier is only 10 minutes by cab or tram away anyway. I did not rate a 5 as you could hear what was going on in rooms beside and across the hall. Unfortunately on one night, a room across the hall had a bit of a party going on until 2am and we heard everything. Just a tip budget for car parking as you need approx $60 US a day on top of the room rates. We would stay here again though.

This is the perfect spot in San Francisco and it's where I will definitely make my home if every visiting again.Check-in was the only thing that took quite a while so this perhaps they can improve upon. I didn't know how to use the check-in bar code on my reservation. Maybe it was set up for it, but signage was lacking so I queued, along with everyone else. Minor issue though, unless you're late for a meeting! :)Regardless, the welcome was extremely warm and hearty. Staff were all consistently friendly and upbeat.Rooms were very clean and spacious and everything was within working order.The entire hotel grounds were very well maintained, and their restaurant options for dining are great as well. The gym is quite okay too, but there is no swimming pool or sauna or steam room to unwind in. So for that, you'll just have to go down to the OneUp bar and treat yourself to a glass of wine (good selection!).The best thing...I think was the location. Perfect spot from which to explore the city. And you're just on the footsteps of Union Square.

The Grand Hyatt is the best hotel stay EVER!!! I would definitely stay here again and again and again! The staff, to include the bellmen, front desk, wait staff, housekeeping, and concierge is SUPER friendly and helpful. Everyone I interacted with was AWESOME!!!!Most notable: Champagne waiting for you while in the lobby area, my interactions with staff and I truly love the web check in and check out. Very convenient and EASY!!! The hotel room was very spacious and has a lot of great amenities to include: great pillows, a restful bed with a great view, an iPhone charger connected to the telephone (no need to bring yours), several electrical outlets located near the bed (no need for an extension cord), the electrical window shades, green tea toiletries (soap, body wash, shampoo and conditioner), great lighting (especially the bed lights), the IRON, OMG! (I forgot to write down the brand of ironâ€_ super duper, especially when I used it to iron my linen skirt â€“ wrinkle free in less than 5 minutes), and free WiFi. But my all time favorite thing... a welcome note, with my name, displayed on the flat screen TV. After seeing my name in â€œlightsâ€ù well on the TV, I felt like I was definitely in the right place!! GREAT touches. The staff knew me by name and yes, the staff sincerely CARED about me. My last night, I felt dehydrated. I called the front desk at 2:30 am to find out where the ice machine was located. The front desk receptionist immediately said, no problem Mrs. Williams, we will bring you a bottle of water (as to say, don't worry about leaving your room, it's too late, we will take care of you!) Just a great feeling!!! I want to give a special thank you to Rolando, he knew exactly what I wanted before I could ask (a good ole midday Heineken)!! Love you Rolando, Grand Hyatt and San Francisco!! GREAT Location, People, and Environment!!!!

i stayed a week on business purposes in this hotel and enjoyed every moment. Especially the breakfast and the location contributed to this feeling. Despite some little problems with the room service, which was handled great by the hotel director, everything was on Fife star plus level!

Really nice hotel, great location right next to Union Square, easy for shopping. The rooms are large and clean. Breakfast is high quality but somewhat limited in choice. We were given a Union Square view room, but I had paid for a City View room which costs a bit more. Regret! The Union Square view is much nicer :)

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for our recent vacation stay in San Francisco. We have to give the Grand Hyatt an A++. The location is perfect, at Union Square. It is within walking distance to the Powell Street Cable Car line. There are some very good breakfast locations within walking distance and the best shopping in San Francisco. The hotel staff was very professional and the room was very clean. We had a view from the 28th floor that was overlooking Alcatraz and the Bay. We would have no issues about staying at the Grand Hyatt when we go back to San Francisco and would suggest this hotel to anyone looking for a great experience.

As we only had one night in San Francisco we thought a whistle stop open bus would be the best option. After checking in at the hotel I called on the Concierge who was extremely helpful and booked tickets for that evening. We had a beautiful room and our evening meal was excellent with wonderful service.

I have stayed at this property many times in the 1990's and it is still the best hotel in the city. Right on Union Square with awesome views of San Francisco, the bat and the bridge, Grand Hyatt SFO is the place to be.Yes, there are many great hotels all around it but this is one of the iconic hotels that has kept its charm, service and ambience to the best.Check in was a breeze as with check out. Rooms were very comfortable as with the amenities. Any view is great for this property.The executive Club is small but nonetheless comfortable. Unlike properties in Asia, drinks are charged here at a standard rate and go on an honour system versus being part of the package of staying in the executive club room.Car park is not on location but nearby. Doormen could be a bit more attentive.The facilities in the room are modern and certainly a change with time.Location - everything one needs is literally at the doorstep.

Stayed for 3 nights, problem on check in as our reservation had not been confirmed through tour operator, reception were excellent sorted a room out for us and then sorted directly with tour operator. Excellent standard of accommodation and great location. One small issue but not the hotels fault was that at the moment roadworks are taking place down the street and if can be noisy early mornings. Definitely recommend hotel

We normally stay at the Hyatt, and this was another great experience with this hotel. They've done some upgrading since our last visit, and the rooms are a bit trendier. I really liked the new electronic sunshade on the main window, it was very much appreciated. The rooms are comfortable and the hotel is fairly central.It was quite a bit more in cost than on our last stay, not sure if that's a SF trend or just this hotel. Seemed quite the jump from a couple of years ago, so we may be looking at other venues for future visits.

Our room was great and we had fantastic views from our room. The staff were really friendly and extremely helpful, booking us taxis, restaurants etc.. There were even doormen who opened the doors for you as you approached! We ate in the dining room for breakfast and lunch and both were amazing and very good value - not overpriced at all. The location was fantastic too - right down from Union Square and not too far from China Town.A lovely place to stay for mere mortals!!

The hotel is beautiful and excellently situated. Joanne the concierge was so lovely. She was extremely helpful and patient. It will be the first time that when I think about a great hotel a person's face also comes to mind. .. perfect!

The Grand Hyatt is situated at Union Square in the heart of San Francisco - we chose to base ourselves here rather than the more touristy Fisherman's Wharf area and glad we did.The hotel is big and comfortable with a typical San Fran welcome on arrival. We had an excellent room on the 19th floor with a city view - looked fab at night. Amazing views from the gym on the 35th floor - encouraged the morning work- out....... Pretty essential if you are indulging in the buffet breakfast - really good, if a bit pricey. Union Square is great for restaurants and bars, and feels safer than Fisherman's Wharf especially after dark (not that we had any fears in San Fran - it's a wonderful city) sadly lots of homeless people hanging around the square but although they can be a bit intimidating they don't generally take much notice of tourists .Would definitely stay at the Grand Hyatt again - check your bill before checking out though - there were mistakes on mine - sorted quickly by the front desk but don't just sign off without checking.

Our room was very nice with comfortable bed. The chair in the room was great too and the room appointed with a large flat screen tv. Floor the ceiling windows with a city view. I especially enjoyed the hot water pot as I bring my own tea and the boiling water was convenient for tea. I thought the room comfortable and relaxing and I heard little street noise on the 26 th floor. The bathroom has been remodeled but they used an old bathtub which was newly glazed instead of one that was sleek and modern. That's a disappointment but the fixtures are new as is the sink area with granite top. The staff is very kind and attentive. The housekeeping always said good morning as does the concierge and bell staff. Our car was brought around quickly and they offer directions. Great stay and great convenient Union Square location. Also had a mini fridge in the room, a big plus.

Don't misinterpret the heading, its a nice hotel but grand is misleading. Its a good quality business hotel, the rooms are comfortable and reasonably well equipped.my room was street side and noisy at times with tram bells and whistles( I know its San Fran atmosphere) and the flag was banging against my window on a couple of windy nights.But for $350 a night excluding breakfast I would expect a little grander . I guess its the location that you pay for and you cant argue about its position, right on Union Square, easy access to tram/ cable and all major shopping.It also has spectacular views from the top floor.The staff were very good, check in is slick and door and concierge very helpful.I though that compared to other hotels nearby that bar area was a bit unexciting and didn't offer a great selection. I one ate breakfast in the restaurant one day, preferring to grab and go from the very convenient lobby trolley stocked with egg/bacon rolls, fruit, yoghurts cereals juice and coffee, much cheaper.Overall a pleasant stay, but 6 nights over $2k ?

Paper thin walls..baby crying all night. No longer have bar on top of hotel open to guests. Staying in downtown SF but very limited tv channels..could not get Giants game. Average hotel for high price

Arrived 21.00 on fri 19th and was through a very smooth and professional checkin by 21.15 and pleasantly surprised by standard of room and amenities, enjoyed on outstanding bloodymary expertly mixed by boa my kind el Salvador mixologist, after doing sight seeing trip returned to onelevelup and delighted to be rememeber from previous night, on entering my room, absolutely spotless, would never have guessed was my room apart from my belongings being left as I had left them, nice touch, oh and room service prompt and polite, if the next few days continue on same vain, should prove a memorable visit, ps take elevator to floor 36, wow, still this hotel has a nice ambiance about, so far outstanding.

Good location, good service.Unfortunately, early arrival truck which brings food and supplies to stores around made a lot of noise. The window and curtain can not block them all. It can be better if this problem is solved.

Breakfasts were lovely, but it was the service which really stands out here. Very attentive doormen greet you and open the doors whenever you enter or leave the hotel and are very helpful with luggage or shopping. I'd stay here next time I come back.

The hotel is located downtown and San Francisco is building a subway system. Traffic is very bad and it can take awhile to go anywhere. If you have a car it costs you $41.00 a day to park and $62.00 a day if you valet. The other problem is noise from the construction which is going on 24 hours a day, The hotel actually has ear plugs in your room for you to use. The hotel has also removed all soda machines and they said it is to encourage good eating habits. Well it is San Francisco. LAUGHING OUT LOUD The hotel is clean, the employees are very friendly and helpful, the service is excellent, the food was good, the furnishings were new. The room was an adequate size with a modern look. The sink in the bathroom was weird. However, I can't rate the hotel higher because of the traffic, noise, and parking problems.

This is a beautiful, clean hotel with great views of the city. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is there was no fridge in the room. The staff was the real star at the hotel though - every single one was excellent and friendly. Loved staying there!!

i recently stayed at the hyatt for four nights, whilst the hotel is lovely beware if you have room overlooking the square you might struggle to sleep due to the road works!! i couldn't believe they went on all night - the drilling, the noise of reversing JCB's all through the night ...

This hotel is in a good location â€“ right at the corner of Union Square within the downtown shopping area and a good variety of restaurants. The famous tram stop is nearby and the Financial District / Chinatown is within a 10-15 minute walk. Fishermanâ€™s Wharf is a 10 minute drive away. Service provided by the Front Desk and concierge was within expectations. Like any downtown hotels, the room was slightly small but it had recently been refurbished. We booked twin beds as we were a family of 3 â€“ but the bed itself was smaller than a queen size bed and it was a bit of a squeeze. Wifi is complimentary in the room.The bathroom was also a bit small â€“ thereâ€™s no separate bathtub and shower room. You need to climb into the bathtub, draw the â€œplasticâ€ù curtains and shower. The bathroom door was also frosted, which could be annoying when the bathroom lights are switched on while you are sleeping. And the flushing system for the WC was the noisiest weâ€™ve ever heard and experienced in any hotels. The shower was also under-strength. Housekeeping was very average â€“ several items were missed out (eg. shower gel was not replenished for 2 consecutive days, used mugs was taken away and not replaced, bathroom floor stain not cleaned etc). Requests for certain items were not met until we had to remind housekeeping about it. Thereâ€™s a water and ice dispenser on each floor â€“ but on 2 occasions, the water container was empty and not replaced. Staying in a downtown hotel meant that on higher floors, you could get spectacular views. Sound insulation from the windows wasnâ€™t too good and you could get some traffic noise, which was more obvious at night. Parking rates here, as expected, are expensive. To self-part at the nearest garage, which is opposite the hotel (along Sutter Street), the rates are $41 for 24 hours with multiple entry/exit. For valet parking, that is at a mind boggling fee of $62!!! Apart from its location, our stay here fell a bit short of our expectations, especially having to pay $400 per night. Somehow, other Grand Hyatt properties, especially in the Far East, exude not only more luxury and comfort but comes with more attentive and superior levels of service.

Easy check-in with friendly associates who were kind to a weary and somewhat grumpy traveler. The room was very modern and clean, quite lovely. Stayed on the 7th floor, no noise. Location...one of the best.

I give it 4 and a half stars overall. Nice room, recently remodeled. Small, but as expected for SF. Comfortable bedding. Check in and out was very fast for me, although others reviewers apparently had some difficulty. Standard room, 2 doubles, which came with in room fridge which was nice. All staff were friendly except for one of the female concierges. She answered the phone twice while I was talking to her, acted like she couldn't be bothered to help me with directions. I guess I should have pulled out my cell phone to talk to her. The other concierges were very helpful, however, and I think she is an outlier. There was some street noise, but not much different from other SF hotels I have stayed at. I would stay here again.

I arrived with my family for 5 days for a meeting. Prompt check in and great location. All staff well trained and courteous. Recently remodeled and clean. The hotel has a good gym with great view.Good concierge. Really it was a no hassle stay!

Ok so maybe I expect to much of the check in clerk, a little welcome and a smile rather than an abrupt 'name' and not even a please or thank you in site then to be thrust a piece of paper and told $75 to upgrade so you can use the bar at the top of the hotel, excuse me you want me to pay to use the bar in a hotel! After that I then tried to use the one small bar in the hotel and again very rude and abrupt bar tender then to be charged $22 for a wine and a small beer..I really thought we would get better service from a $400\ night hotel. I must admit I would never stay there again and would highly recommend Hyatt to train their staff in customer service skills.I have a booking at another Hyatt hotel for Christmas and the new year but based on this experience I my think twice about that booking

We love Hyatt and are never disappointed with them. While visiting San Francisco we got a suite on the 20th floor with great views. The room was great and spacious. King size bed was very comfortable. Bathrooms were nice and shower had good water pressure. Bell hops and valet attendants were all wonderful. We bought access to the club level which was so nice with beautiful views and great staff. It's nice to have a place to just unwind and relax or start the day with coffee overlooking San Francisco. Wi-FI is reliable. They have a fridge in the room but no mini bar or bottled waters in the room. It's a nice location but not really in walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf but is in the heart of the shopping district. There are plenty of great restaurants nearby as well.

I stayed at that hotel while visiting the vmworld convention and it was a really great choice. It is only a short walk to wherever one might want to go. I had a great room nearby the Grand Hyatt Club lounge. The staff did a marvelous job. I really felt welcomed there. My choice for my future visits to San Francisco!

We have stayed here in the past and given it a great review, but not this time. First of all the check in was very strange and unprofessional. There were two agents sitting at a table out in the middle of the room with guests lined up into the entry trying to check in. It reminded me of the return lines after Christmas. They didn't greet us as Hyatt Gold Passport members and did not go out of their way to help with our questions. The worst part of the stay was the noise from the construction outside the hotel (not the hotels fault). Jackhammers and pile drivers worked ALL night. The noise would wake us up every 10 minutes with a huge BOOM and the sound of rock being loaded in trucks. This may be the same at all hotels near Union Square. I have never given another Hyatt a poor review.

Stayed 4 nights at this hotel. Booked and paid In advance directly with the hotel, for a Bay View King Suite on a high floor. Upon check in the agent had us in the 19th floor which is the lowest for this room type and when we recomfirmed a bay view king on a high floor he said oh ya and put us up one floor to the 20th what is that? When we reached our room NO bay view it was a city view. So glad we booked so far in advance to not get what we paid for on any level. On a positive note the location is great !

This hotel is lovely. The moment you walk in you think wow. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The staff are helpful and the bar is decent although a touch overpriced. The location is wonderful - and the area felt very safe and we were able to walk around at night without worrying. The hop on hop off bus stop was just a block or 2 away. Would defiantly recommend staying here.

We spent 4 nights at the Hyatt SF. We had purchased our package through priceline and it included breakfast. Unfortunately, we didn't read the small print on the breakfast receipt that said tip had already been included with the breakfast package and we had ended up overtipping the breakfast room staff with an extra 20% tip plus the 15% tip included in the check. The location of the hotel is convenient and the staff were helpful and friendly. Our main issue was at checkout when the front desk noticed several questionable charges from their restaurant on our bill. The front desk deducted those charges and left with what I thought was my final bill, until I got my credit card statement and noticed they had charged me for a breakfast and a tax that was not included in my final bill. I called Hyatt to straighten the bill out and they deducted the breakfast charge, but I've never encountered this much problem with a hotel bill that had to be corrected two times because of of incorrect charges.Would I stay here again? Probably not.

We spent two nights here & found the service & hotel in general to be ideal for us. We wished we had allowed ourselves a few more nights. Great spot, good range of meals, quick breakfast & coffee option in the foyer which we used both mornings for speed & convenience. The concierge guided us to the right attractions & tours for our requirements. A memorable stay & we would recommend this hotel to anyone heading to San Francisco.

This Grand Hyatt hotel was clearly just refurbished! It looks brand new!!!!! We had a great sleep. We were pleasantly surprised that we were able to check in very early, which was great for a day of sight seeing! The concierge desk is very helpful. We had a great stay!

The hotel was very accommodation to my family. They gave us a room close to our grandparents, provided complimentary baby care items, set up the room well, and coordinated will with babysitters. Very nice hotel.

This is a top-notch modern-style hotel in the heart of San Francisco. The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable and the location is ideal. We stayed in a "city view" room which was a nice bonus. Not much more you can ask for in a hotel.

This is a great hotel to stay at. It has been recently refurbished so the rooms are fresh and trendy. The staff are helpful and the location is very good; right on the corner of Union Square for easy access to the cable cars and shopping area. It was just a shame that there is no rooftop bar/restaurant.

I was overwhelmed with the thoughtful service and wonderful amenities at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco. Steve checked me in and made a point to find a great room with a nice view, even though I am not in a higher Hyatt rewards category (and I was also on government business & staying at government rate). On two different days, Ron kindly made change for me when I needed it. Other staff were also helpful, although I did not get everyone's name. I am very picky about where I stay and hate rude and disinterested staff but I can report that staff here are incredibly kind and helpful. It was obvious to me that this was a well-managed hotel. Rooms had all the amenities one could want and I appreciated the free WiFi. I was afraid that we would be charged for the fitness center so I did not bother to bring my workout attire, but I was told that the fitness center was complimentary and also had amazing views. My only suggestion would be the inclusion of a "night light" in the room as I don't like to sleep in a completely dark room so my only option was to leave the bathroom light on all night. There was still too much light as the bathroom door was opaque. All in all, though, I would definitely stay again. Well done Grand Hyatt SF.

As soon as you walk into this hotel, it is clear that it is extremely chic and perfect for business travellers and families alike. We stopped in the 'Grand club room double' on the 32nd floor - with huge windows that overlooked parts of the city below us. The view of union square is brilliant, and it is in the perfect location for everybody, within a 10 minute cab ride to Fishermans Wharf, and only a few minutes walk to the Westfield mall. The room was modern and spacious, the beds were comfortable and everybody woke up well rested. The lobby is also very good to relax in, with comfortable sofas in front of fireplaces, televisions and a coffee shop! I strongly recommend upgrading to the Club room as well, as we found ourselves in it at least twice a day. There is a huge selection of delicious food and drink to choose from, and with the fast free wifi located all over the hotel it was hard to be drawn away! Again, it is also on the 32nd floor, with a superb view of Alcatraz, Angel Island, China Town and the city beneath. The only disappointment was we had to pay for the wine/alcohol in there. However overall we could not have asked for more polite and caring staff, in the club room especially. The staff were so warm and welcoming it added to the experience. Had a wonderful stay!

The staff at both the front desk and the concierge desk were very helpful, there was a very nice lady at the concierge desk that helped get us dinner reservations the night that we arrived. It was very much appreciated since we had flown from the east coast and it was already 7 PM Pacific time. Also our room the first night was on the side of the hotel where all night construction was going on outside, they moved us to a quieter room for the balance of our stay.

Grand Hyatt was one of the best hotels we stayed in San Francisco. Even though it was far from the city but it was great when after a long day you come back to a great , spacious, clean room with a great view. We also had breakfast included with our room which was fantastic. The satff very polite and accommodating. We had absolutely great time.

Pros:The hotel was in a very good location: 1 block from Union Square, 3 blocks from Chinatown, and a couple of miles from Fisherman's Wharf. Wal-Greens, CVS, Starbacks are within 1 or 2 blocks of the hotel. The customer service provided by the concierge and front desk was excellent. Please check with the concierge for information about tours, cable/trolley cars, shows, etc. The rooms were average sized and had been recently renovated.The room comes with a mini refrigerator but you can request a larger size if necessary.Free wi-fiYou can request a microwave.Cons:Please note that there is a lot of noise from the street throughout the night. We were on the 9th floor and you could hear noise as if you were on the first floor with the window open.There are no towel bars in the bathroom, only 2 towel hooks.The bathroom door is frosted so your sleep is disturbed if someone uses the bathroom at night.The shower and tub are all in one.The toilet is very loud when you flush it.

Our room had a spectacular view overlooking Union Square and our upper floor room also gave us a superb vantage point over the rest of the city, looking all the way out to the bay. The Hyatt brand is one you can always trust to be consistently excellent. The luxury amenities, electronic perks, and storied beds add a level of comfort guest can always count on. Service is excellent and the food options are delectable. We had a fantastic Sunday brunch, and the bar offered a lovely array of offerings for tea (which I skipped this time in favor of Starbucks across the street which remains open til the wee hours!). The concierge and the bell staff are immediately and thoroughly helpful, and the options for dining, sightseeing and more in the vicinity are legendary. Guests experience the difference immediately at check in where, instead of the standard counters which separate us from the staff, we are greeted at individual counter top tables with a laptop and a warm handshake. The intimacy gives guests an immediate sense of having arrived at a welcome destination. The lobby boasts gorgeous fireplaces and comfortable couches where we found respite from the cold breezes swirling outside and stunning art installations on opposing walls. My only complaint, not really a complaint but a wish, I suppose, would be for queen, rather than double, beds in the double room. We brought along our two teenaged sons, so the accommodations were a bit tight, but were we offered a larger room at a lesser hotel we'd never have opted for it. Hyatt is a no-fail brand in my book!

Grand Hyatt was one of the highlights of our stay in San Fran. We stayed here for 3 nights, it was our anniversary. When we checked in the lady at the counter sent us a bottle of wine and strawberries which was really lovely. We had an amazing view from our room! The room was clean, spacious and well equipped. We used the gym one time and the view is to die for! We ordered room service coz the day we landed we were tired, and let me tell you, this was by far the best room service ever! We loved it!! everything is so convenient from the Hyatt. Would definitely stay here if weâ€™re in San Fran.

My only complaint is that we didn't get the room I reserved and paid for. We were supposed to have a view of the bay, which I re-confirmed before going up to our room, but they said they were booked and didn't have it available. I have a sneaking suspicion it's because I reserved via hotels.com so they didn't want to honor my reservation, even though that's what I had paid for and we were celebrating my birthday,Everything else was very good. Smooth and quick check-in/out. Our room was very nice and clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The hotel restaurant was excellent, which was a relief because we had done so much running around, researching and eating at area restaurants that we just wanted to stay in on this night. I highly recommend eating there. Our room-service breakfast the next morning was also very, very good and the service was awesome. If they have the tomato soup on the menu, you've got to order it. It was excellent.

We stayed at this hotel 8/28-9/2 and were glad that we did. The property has undergone remodeling which has created a modern, classy hotel. The 25th floor room overlooking Union Square was great. We had two issues that were resolved immediately. Wonderful service. We ate dinner at the hotel one evening and it was extremely good. The door men in their top hats were very professional and always were on hand to secure us a cab. We needed to rent a car one day and the concierge desk took care of everything. The car was delivered to the front door of the hotel. We had a minor snafu with the gas, as it was delivered with less than half a tank yet the contract showed that it was full. The concierge waived all gas charges. Amazing, really. Finally, it was a one year anniversary for us and at check in they gave us complimentary choices of drinks and snacks. I will definitely come back to this hotel, and can't recommend it enough.

My wife and I along with two other couples stayed at this hotel Thursday August 28 thru September 2. With the exception of the noise from construction work being done outside, this is a great hotel. The staff is very professional and goes the extra mile to ensure your needs are taken care of. The hotel is located in the heart of downtown San Francisco, plus it offers discounts on tour buses. Definitely a cut above most hotel I've stayed at.

Amazing experience at the Grand Hyatt. Staff were all extremely friendly and helpful, bellman, concierge, front desk, and Club staff. If you are able, I would highly recommend upgrading your room to a Club Level room if available. This Hyatt has an amazing Club room with a panoramic view of the city and bay!! Not to mention the breakfast and evening appetizers. Also, a great gym on the 35th floor! Also with an amazing view and great equipment.

We stayed at this hotel last Saturday 8/30/14We arrived around 11 am, obviously our room was not ready yet,But the good thing was, they gave us our room around 3:30 thinking our checking is at 4:00 pm and was the perfect room, magnificent view, I was able to see in front of my window Macy's, Louis Vuitton boutique, oh was pretty nice.The service was excellent, no complaint.Totally recommend like a first choice if you go to San Francisco to shopping at union square.

You will not be disappointed staying in this hotel. Fantastic location. Clean, classy and friendly - what more could you want. Five star in experience in everyway. All staff from front desk to tour desk and housekeeping were very welcoming which can be unusual in hotels today.

The Grand Hyatt is my accommodation of choice when attending conferences in San Francisco. I go yearly and the rooms are nice and clean. I tend to eat in the hotel and the restaurant has great happy hour prices. A midnight cheesecake snack is nice too! They have great music in the bar and nice meeting rooms. I highly recommend the Grand Hyatt.

The Concierge is especially helpful and knowledgable. Though I lived in the City for 3 years, there's no better recommendation than those closest and making continuous evaluations. That's this hotel's Concierge.

Of all the Hyatt's we have stayed at this rates as the best. From the time you drop your car to the time you depart (four night stay), every employee offers a smile and a "can I help you"? Front desk, restaurant, housekeeping, and particularly the Concierge staff were very efficient and you felt like you were getting personal attention. If you have Club Room status you will be especially pleased with the food and service. Have stayed at the water front on previous trips but this Union Square location is the best for tourists.

Really enjoyed this hotel and it's location. The layout of the lobby is a bit confusing for check-in, but that's a pretty minor thing considering there is no shortage of people available to ask questions. I had a room with a city view and access to the Grand Club Lounge and it was very nice... the service was great and food was wonderful with lots of options and a great breakfast selection! I ordered room service one night through the tv internet connection and it arrived incorrect so that was disappointing. The view out the window certainly could not be beat!The room contained no information on how to conserve resources for towels, etc. not being exchanged, and the typical "hang if you want to keep it" policy did not work as my towels were replaced after doing that.The hotel is in walking distance to the Union Square area where I was attending a conference and that made it extremely convenient!

My wife and I spent one night here after our trip to Pebble Beach. We got a great rate for a Sunday night. Valet parking was highway robbery ; about $20 more than others in the area. Very nice modern lobby, and the room was very zen. Our bathroom sink was very awkwardly shaped ; looked like a miniature bath tub. The lighting in the bathroom was great. Breakfast was very good, and the service was top notch. Would definitely consider staying here again, but only if I come in by cab. I refuse to pay $62 for valet parking.
