I know this is San Fran, but it's ridiculous.

we stayed at this Hyatt for 2 nights. We found that the service was very good, everyone is friendly from front desk to valet parking attendant. Location is second to none, close to all the shop and restaurant.our room was very spacious, very cleanOnly downside, there was a rattling sound ni our room, we could not locate its provenance. We also were a bit concerned about security, the lobby is crowded at all times and everyone can use the lift, no card access or anything.

We looked at the previous reviews and two weeks prior to arriving asked for a room a little farther from the construction. The staff were very accommodating and immediately arranged this for us.We were assigned a room on the 31st floor with a view of the bay and it was spectacular. We enjoyed our room and had 11 beautiful days !When we first arrived we were greeted by Nikita, who checked us in a very professional manner. She was very enthusiastic and helpful. In fact, contrary to a couple of odd reviews we saw, everyone was professional and polite. The Grand Club Lounge was great. It was also had a professional staff and was very scenic. We had room service a couple of times during our stay (yes the restaurants do start to close down at 10:00). The price was comparable to a restaurant price (I guess that is because it comes from the one-up). The location was great and very central to our needs.We have stayed in other hotels in San Francisco in the past and quite frankly the Grand Hyatt is far superior. We will definitely be returning.

This Grand Hyatt is a bit dated but is in a great location right next to Union Square. Top Floor lounge offers breathtaking views of the city! Close to the cable cars & dozens of great restaurants nearby. Concierge was very professional and helpful.

The incredible, hard-working team at the Grand Hyatt SF truly makes this one of the most fantastic hotels in the area! Everyone went above and beyond to make our stay unforgettable, especially Elaine the Concierge, who helped us book our tours and navigate the city like pros! Great location. Great rooms. Great team!

Stayed here with two nights with my family. Our rooms faced the Union Square, Macy's and Saks Fifth Avenue. The hotel is within walking distance to the Westfield Mall on Market Street. The staff at this hotel is very engaging and extremely helpful. We had around 16 luggages and the doorman and a bellman handled them without any fuss and with full efficiency. The Concierge assist us to book a large van to transfer us to SFO. We highly recommend this hotel.

If you're a centralised location surrounded by lots of shopping, people, food & easy access to public transport, then this hotel is for you! Just be be warned of the ongoing road upgrade at Stockton St - goes 24 hours everyday except Sunday! We stayed for 5 nights, & if you're a light sleeper, the noise from the street travelling upwards may keep you up & wishing you stayed somewhere else! Front line & concierge staff were courteous. Unfortunately, housekeeping service levels fell a bit short for such highly rated hotel. I dialled for a few room items (bedroom slippers, cotton balls) & they were not delivered until I had to ask for them a day later! On another occasion when we requested to borrow the weighing scale, the person who delivered it to our room had a look that he wished he was doing something else instead! I read previously that hotel had recently been upgraded with improvements to the rooms. Whilst the room is sleek, there is no separate shower cubicle in the bathroom, You need to climb into bath & pulled the curtain & shower the "old fashion" way. No complimentary bottled mineral water. I wanted to give this hotel an above average rating but finds it hard to justify esp for such a well known hotel brand to be exhibiting much inferior customer service compared to their other peers within the HYATT group of hotels.

We only stayed here two nights but this is a really luxurious place to stay. We had a bay view room and the views were spectacular. Alcatraz and Fishermans Wharf were right out the window ( really a mile or so but it felt closer). The windows are floor to ceiling and the power shades were very cool. The hotel has a nice restaurant and bar with live music almost ever night. We were two blocks from China Town, a mile from Fisherman's wharf. Everything was great.

We stayed here for 5 days and would definitely stay here again, when we revisit San Francisco. This was our first time in San Francisco and the concierge, John, was fantastic!!!! He gave us maps of the city and how to get around, and we pretty much navigated with ease. We stayed on the 17th floor and everything was great. Nice nice hotel. Great staff. Oh, and the location is superb. It's in the heart of Union Square, close to anything you may need. Cabs, public transportation, shopping, sight seeing, anything.

Great location, decent enough room, but don't stay here if you need hotel WiFi. Was staying here for business and absolutely needed internet access in the room. The free WiFi offered by the hotel didn't work so I upgraded to the $10/day access - still didn't work at all. Ended up making multiple trips to Starbucks across the street just to fire off some work emails. Unacceptable in this day and age.

I really liked this hotel for many reasons, - The location is ideal, close to all the shops and restaurants and bars and right on union square, you cant get better- The staff are all very helpful and friendly, excellent service- The amenities offered are outstanding from the standard toiletries and sewing kits, to hair styling tools! you literally don't need to pack anything to stay there except your clothes!- The concierge desk gave us an incredible service, taking the time to find great restaurants , bars night-life spots based on our specific preferences and offering advice on everything from timings to local areas, safety etc..they also booked us on a great wine tasting tour.- The breakfasts and food in general was delicious! the coffee not so good though...!- the rooms are very nice and spacious and well decoratedthe only thing I don't understand from a hotel that offers so much is why they are being funny about their WIFI, they offer this free but its a terrible service you cannot connect for very long and the reception is on and off. However they also offer a chargeable one which they say is better. I believe a hotel of this calibre should be offering a strong and reliable FREE WIFI connection so refused to pay more for the better one. They need to fix this issue and make sure its offered as standard.

We spent four nights at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco and were generally very happy with the hotel. The location is fantastic, the rooms are excellent and the staff are great!Located on Union Square, getting to all of the major shopping centres was an easy 5 minute walk and there were also lots of dining options in the area. You can hop on a cable car which stops on Union Square and get to Fisherman's Wharf in 20 minutes after a thrilling ride up and down Frisco's hills. Parking at the hotel was quite expensive (approx $60 overnight) but there were several cheaper options very close by. We booked a Grand Club room facing Union Square which was virtually identical to a standard room (we were in a standard room for one night until a Grand Club became available), but on one of the top six floors. That did make a small difference with regards to the street noise levels. Normally you wouldn't expect to get much street noise 30 floors up, but the construction on Stockton Street is incredibly loud and goes on all night long! The hotel walls are also unusually thin and the adjoining room doors aren't soundproofed so it was possible to hear (loudish) conversations next door and all of the noise from the corridor. This was the only downside to our stay. The room itself was excellent - spacious, modern, well appointed. You can do everything over the TV so there was none of the usual booklet/pamphlet/menu clutter that you get on the desk. There is a small "powder area" next to the bathroom with a lighted make-up mirror, which was very useful. The Grand Club rooms don't have a bathtub, only a shower in the bathroom and the space around the vanity was somewhat limited.The staff at the hotel were helpful and we received excellent service. We had an issue at check-in because the Grand Club rooms had already been allocated, but this was dealt with efficiently. The housekeeping staff were very good and our room was cleaned and made up to high standards each morning. We also found the staff at the Grand Club Lounge to be fantastic. Not only did they provide great service, they also interacted with the guests. The Lounge is definitely worth it, with a nice selection of hor d'oeuvres and drinks in the evenings and a very good breakfast in the morning with a hot buffet and pastries. The views from the Lounge were amazing and you could easily spend 2-3 hours there over drinks and nibbles.Apart from the noise, our experience at the Grand Hyatt SF was great and we would definitely recommend it... after they finish the construction work in Stockton Street!

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 6 nights in June 2013 as part of my honeymoon and was very impressed! The hotel itself was in a perfect location, close to Union Square, Powell Street shopping precinct and many food outlets.We stayed in an exclusive city view king bed room with breakfast included and the room was amazing!! Probably one of the nicest rooms I've ever stayed in (for a city location, as opposed to beach location). The decor was modern, spacious, the bed and pillows very, very comfortable and I liked that there was even a dressing room/vanity dresser incorporated into the wardrobe area. Amazing floor to ceiling windows provided a great view to wake up to every morning! Another feature the room had was the room service - via the TV! You could browse and view all the food items available and order as well - very cool. Wi-Fi also worked really, really well in the room!!Breakfast; while the food was great at the buffet, the area was quite small considering so many people are staying at the hotel at one time. We had to line up and wait quite a few mornings. One morning I wasn't really impressed, when we had been waiting for over half an hour and finally got to the front of the line, only to be bumped by waiter 'Douglas' for a family of four who turned up and 'claimed' they had been lining up earlier and had just gone downstairs to get some fresh air - well, we could all turn up and say that now couldn't we?? Nonetheless, the AMAZING pastries made up for my frustration! (I'm pretty sure they were cronuts). Special mention goes to a wonderful waitress named 'Wendy' - if only all waitstaff were like Wendy! She was friendly, on the ball and very prompt with her service.I would definitely stay at the Grand Hyatt if I ever visited again, and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to SF!

Well. I really liked this hotel room . It has a really comfy bed and I had great views with the electric blind control right next to the bed so I didn't have to move . The plug socket was also just next to the bed ( which is a well thought out addition to any hotel ) so you don't have to fall out of bed to find your phone . I was delighted do to find a kettle in the room . As a tea drinker it's a luxury you don't find in many American hotels . They even put a little jug of milk in the fridge for you which is the attention to detail I crave when staying in a big hotel . The location is fabulous ( no hills to climb) the staff I encountered were polite but not welcoming or friendly . The view from the gym is great . The only thing it lacks is a pool. Over all I was very impressed with tis hotel

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt on a family trip in June of 2014. Check in was expeditious, hotel is well appointed and rooms are newly remodeled, modern and clean. For the area, the rooms are a nice size and vistas are great. You can't beat the central location to Union Square, great restaurants and shops. Bell Service was fantastic, very personable Doorman who offers information when needed. The hotel caters to mostly business travelers but families were also welcome. Rooms are a little tight for 4 persons (family) but well appointed and very clean. Overall we enjoyed our stay and will definitely return.

My wife and I stayed here for a 10th anniversary trip, and boy, did the hotel make it special! We had booked a Club room and they upgraded us to a suite. They also provided some snacks and wine. The front desk was very welcoming, more than usual for such a big hotel. The remodel is fantastic - comfortable beds, high technology, nice design. The concierge was very helpful with tour ideas and dinner ideas. The Club was a nice treat - decent breakfast each morning and amazing views of SF. Overall, even though it's a huge hotel, it didn't feel that way to us - the service stood out. Tip - if there are no major events in the hotel, the meetings room on the top floor provide amazing views of downtown SFO. We just went up there and looked out the windows. Would be a very cool place to host a meeting.

This grand hyatt is a wonderful hotel to base a SF vacation, located next to union square. The check in process was effortless on my part, and the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. My room was large and comfortable, with a great view of downtown. Be aware that like new york, the buildings in the area echo and project sound, so take earplugs if you want to sleep peacefully. There are plenty of muni street car stops in the area, and the Powell st cable cars stop at union square. If you are planning to take the cable cars more than once, each time will cost 6 dollars. You can buy a muni passport for unlimited trips for $15. There are a ton of shops in the area, so if shopping is something you are interested in, this is a perfect location.

I stayed in Grand Hyatt for six nights on 23rd floor. The room was clean, tidy and modern but one wall of the room was a big sliding glass/window and it was not solid! When pushed, the entire glass door moved out substantially. It allowed plenty of police, faire truck and ambulance noise right in the room. On windy days (almost every day) the steel balcony structure made cracking noises. When I reported this, staff treated me like a five year old and explained that it was normal for a building to move with wind, failing to understand that it was the noise that was the problem, not movement. Bar area is small and can get full very quickly & live music stops early which was a shame. Not a hotel that I would go back to unless I have to. Nothing special; average.

The grand Hyatt is a modern, well equipped hotel with courteous and friendly staff who seem determined to make sure you have a trouble free stay.I was staying on business booked through my employer and on arrival there was a problem with the credit card they had used for my booking. However the staff ensued this caused me minimum disruption by checking me in anyway had liaising directly with my employer to fix the issue meaning I didn't have to. Superb service!When I got to my room on the 27th floor I was greeted by the stunning view offered by the floor to ceiling windows. From my room I could see across the bay to the city. It was wonderful to take breakfast sitting in the lounger admiring that view.The hotel is well situated for exploring the city, a great base for any trip.

The hotel is perfectly located in union square, in my opinion one of the best starting point to visit the town. We had an executive room at the 32nd floor which was big enough. The room is modern and quiet (just some noise from the street). Personally I found very pleasant the executive lounge and the view you can enjoy from there. Of course the rate are not low, but in line with the category and the city. We always had breakfast at the executive club, which for us offered enough. The parking with valet is quite expensive (63usd) as well as the self parking (41 Usd).Probably not the best solution but a good one.

My husband, daughter and I just stayed at the Grand Hyatt SF and I would like to comment on the service we received for staying there with our child. We had requested a crib in our room when booking, and without even asking we showed up to a room fully set up for a baby! We had a diaper genie, dish soap, bottle brush, snacks, change pad, baby soap and a rubber duckie to help us with our stay. This was much appreciated as some of these items I hadn't even though to bring. I found out afterwards that this was part of their V.I.B (very important baby) program and I must say it was great! One small complaint is that the fridge was very small, so storing food for our daughter was a little tight. We enjoyed the view from our room (fabulous view of the bay - beautiful at sunset), and the breakfast bar in the morning was a quick and easy way to get started. Hotel was conveniently located and the wifi was very fast.

We stayed for 5 nights on the club level. The room (3005) was spacious with a great view of Coit Tower and the bay. Overall, the staff were helpful, the room was clean, and the accommodations were modern and comfortable. We used the club room on the 32nd floor extensively as there was no mini bar (empty fridge) and no water provided in the room. The club room was well staffed with free non alcoholic beverages (honor bar) and snacks throughout the day. If you stay on this level you should definitely utilize.The real plus of this hotel is the location. Very convenient to Chinatown, downtown, and next door to Union Square.

This hotel was having building work going on during our stay. The room that we were put in at first was very small and had an awful view. Our first night we were kept awake by building/construction work going on just outside the hotel. I complained the next day and luckily we were upgraded to a room with a view of Union Square which was much bigger. The gym is amazing with great views of the city. The location is ideal. Right outside Union Square and Macys!

Just finished a quick family trip to San Francisco. As usual, had a wonderful stay at the Grand Hyatt. Immaculate rooms, attentive staff. Special recognition to David and Jimmy on the evening shift in the Grand Club, who continually go above and beyond to ensure an excellent experience for guests. We will be back again and can't wait!

Lovely rooms excellent reception staff made welcome . Excellent location though at moment huge construction work nearby,though we were there at weekend and didn't effect us .We arrived at 8.am and staff did all they could to get us a room asap as we d had a overnight flight .

I was in and out very quickly - one night stay. Everything was perfect. Highly recommend this to anyone that wants a downtown location in the city.I did the regency club - very nice. Got to watch a football game with snacks in the afternoon and had breakfast available but I did not partake.

Great location, right next to Union Square, the rooms are big and clean, very quiet for its central location, but i feel it was a little bit pricey. Basically at walking distance of restaurants and shops, Try to get a room with a view to the square, it's amazing.

This is our 2nd time staying at the Grand Hyatt San Fran since last summer. Our room #2923 has a city view but not directly facing Union Square so the noise level from all the construction below and the winds hitting the glass doors have reduced dramatically. Of course, one can still hear the sirens but don't forget we are right in the heart of Union Square and the location of this property cannot get any better. Within a block, you have Macy's and Saks Fifth Avenue, within 2 or 3 blocks, there is the Westfield Mall with Bloomingdales and Nordstroms. Walk 10 mins and you are at Chinatown and what is even more convenient is that it is only a 3 min walk away from a laundromat. There are so so many great restaurants all within walking distance of the hotel along with many Walgreens and little grocery type stores that also sell liquor.Our room is great with automated black out drapes and sheers; coffee maker; bar sized fridge; ample lighting;flatscreen TV; free wi fi in room which is very quick this year; and a room safe.The two double beds (not queen sized unfortunately) were very comfortable (a bit on the softer side) but made a lot of creaking noises as you get up from it though. We especially enjoyed the duvet and there is also an extra pillow and woolen blanket in the closet.The air conditioning in 2923 was fantastic as it worked like a charm and quiet. We always kept it on at 74 to 75 at the lowest level (one bar) for comfort in the evenings because we found anything lower than 74 was quite cold but in the afternoons with the sun beaming on the glass door, we would keep the AC at 71 (one bar) to cool down the room a bit. We love how quiet the AC is in our room.There was a lot of counter space and a small closet which you could leave one or two valises. The Grand Hyatt thinks about everything as there is an order sheet in the room for you to have any amenities delivered complimentary. Ex: corkscrew; hair brush; razor; toothbrush; woolite; and the list goes on. How great is that!As for the dining on site, we always enjoy the hotel's happy hour from 5 to 7pm at One Up lounge where excellent Mondavi wine, Canvas, especially bottled for Hyatt is only $4/glass. Our favorite is their merlot which is an excellent choice. Beers are also $4 during happy hour and only their flatbreads are $7 while all other appies are regular priced. Again, our favorite server at One Up Lounge is Linda, who even remembered us from our last year's visit! We are really impressed with her efficiency, friendliness, and welcoming smile. Thank you Linda!We also enjoyed the hotel's buffet breakfast a lot and that is because the quality is top notch. It isn't your store bought muffins and pastries like what one would get at some of the other hotels like Embassy Suites, Springhill Suites, and Residence Inns. We especially enjoyed the Hyatt's french pastries, the little brioches, which were flaky, buttery, and they tasted better than some of the ones I had in Paris, France!The buffet consists of 3 types of scrambled eggs--plain, cheese with ham, and egg whites with spinach and tomato; bacon, sausages, cheeses, oatmeal, cereals, bagels and breads, french pastries, yogurt, fresh fruit salad, blueberries, blackberries, raspberries, and strawberries, and our other favorite is their flapjacks/pancakes. We have never tasted better flapjacks than here at this hotel because they are ever so light and fluffy. It is like eating "clouds"--absolutely delicious!Those little pancakes at Sears Fine Foods do not even compare or measure up to these at the hotel! The bottomless coffee is very good and fresh with OJ juices but it is not freshly squeezed. Our stay is amazing at the Grand Hyatt and no wonder the hotel is s

This was a really comfortable hotel, the location was very central if you like the bustle of the city. The staff were very friendly. Housekeeping was fantastic. And the best of all - this hotel has a wonderful lounge/bar/restaurant - the bartenders were wonderful and made some really great drinks and the food was amazing too. We were on the 28th floor so the view was wonderful. Nice workout facility also. Jaime is the best bartender ever!!! Thank you Jaime!!

We stayed on 30/F with club access. The decor of the room is quite new. On our first night we found the dust on the ventilation window of the bathroom was a inch thick as it was just above the hook where we hanged our bath tower, I really could not bear with it and asked housekeeping the next morning to clean it together with all the dusty spots (eg the phone) . The dust was finally cleared out. My cosmetic bag was black in colour, and we did not open the window at all but didn't know why my bag after placing on the room table for 2 days has become dusty. Where was the dust from?The Club closed too early (at 9 pm), you can never have a drink there after dinner. Breakfast closed at 9:30 am in the morning. Compared with an hotel in Asia, it closed too early (in case you are on vacation) and there was not much choices on food. Only scramble eggs, ham, toast, bagel, toast, salmon. Very simple food and they just took away the food right at 9:30 am sharp without heads up. As it is a club lounge, it would be good if they could take order of the freshly made eggs and have more items. For evening cocktails, they were providing the least canapÃ©s I have ever come across on a club floor. As a conclusion, the club facilities need some upgrade hence it is not worthwhile to spend the extra there .

There is a reason fellow Trip Advisors have not rated the Grand Hyatt in the top 20 of SF hotels. It is the victim of some odd omissions.First, the rooms are good. Granted, one could pull a back muscle reaching around to the toilet paper. Strange, as there is a blank wall where it could be better located. And the sink is an odd dish elevated above a base. This seems to work well, however. So, too, do the high standard bath and shower fixtures.The tv has a terrific screen and the controls are simple. There is a lot of closet space and enough of a work desk. Our room had a separate area with a makeup mirror. We also had a wonderful view of the bay.The one restaurant is good and pleasantly staffed, divided into a dining room and bar area.However, there is no shop for newspapers and snacks. No brochures for local attractions. No parking and no area to pull into and unload baggage. To be fair, there is a private parking garage very close by. The reception area is an odd area in its simplicity of design. It works well when no one is lined up to use it.I would not stay here again. There are better choices, but the rooms and staff are pleasant.

For business or pleasure - the Grand Hyatt is my favorite in SF. The staff is exceptionally friendly caring for all needs of their guest. They're really commited to quality and guest comfort. The location at the Union Square is ideal. We will be back. Thank you to the Hyatt team!

Continuing our Roadtrip from LA to Portland we spent a night at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco. Up in checkin we were given an upgrade to a one bedroom suite on the 30th floor which was amazing.Very clean, very modern.The concierge was amazing in recommending restaurants and transport options.Thankyou everyone who made our stay so special in SFO!

Stayed five days for business this August. Found the staff to be exceedingly gracious and helpful. The room ( Club level) had a fantastic view of the Bay and was very comfortable. Enormous walking shower beautifully tiled and great water pressure. Great food at the restaurant.

Stayed at this Hyatt as part of a business trip. The hotel has an odd design and layout. Getting to the registration desk takes a bit. Staffing at the desk is a bit light. At 7 pm there were two folks at the desk and 12 people in line. Not a great way to start. Rooms are large with several having a patio which is great. I arrived at my room to find no toilet paper. On my way to dinner I mentioned something to the front desk with a response of "are you sure?". I should mention I have status with Hyatt. Outside of the Intercontinental and the Four Seasons in downtown SF I am not sure there are any quality hotels. Unfortunately part of being in downtown SF. Would look for another location in the future.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a business trip recently and had a great time. I traveled with a friend and we were originally told that there were no double rooms available on the club level so we booked two king rooms separately. When we checked in they were going to put each of us in a double room because there were no kings available! They offered to cancel our second reservation with no penalty so we could split one double room, which we did. The staff was very helpful, including the front desk, bellhops and concierge in the lobby. The staff in the club lounge was very friendly and even remembered our names from day to day. The food in lounge was great, it cost a little more for the club level room but the cost is made up for by taking advantage of the breakfast in the morning and snacks in the evening. It was very handy to be able to run up for breakfast instead of having to find somewhere else to eat. They had bagels, (including smoked salmon!), scrambled eggs with toppings, oatmeal and toppings, cereal, pastries, fruit, a selection of juices and bottled drinks, regular coffee and a cappuccino/latte machine. Our room on the 31st floor had a terrific view over Union Square and to the bay. I was surprised how much noise we could hear so far up, it was not enough to prevent us from getting to sleep but I can imagine it would be problematic in a room on a lower floor. The room was not especially spacious but it appeared to be recently renovated and was nicely appointed. The beds were comfortable and soft. There was definitely a lack of drawer space, there are only 3 tiny drawers for clothes in closet. We ended up using the bedside table for clothes. The room included a small refrigerator and a safe, both of which we used everyday. The door to the bathroom was a slider and when fully closed there was still a gap in the door so if you are a private person and are sharing a room, be forewarned! The bathroom did not have any storage drawers but had two cubby areas in the bottom of the vanity. The vanity top was mostly taken up with a huge sink that left little area for personal items, if they had installed a normal-size sink there would have been plenty of room for items. The shampoo, soap and lotion that were provided were nice, but my roommate ended up having an allergic reaction to them. The hotel brought up hypoallergenic alternatives as well as a selection of other toiletries (razors & shave gel, extra toothpaste, comb, etc). The shower had a "rainfall" style shower head, which did not provide much water pressure, but it was adjustable to a more powerful stream. The shower arm was not very long, I had to stand practically next to the wall to be under the shower stream. Overall we had an enjoyable stay and we would stay there again.

Check- in was smooth and fast. Room with 2 beds was clean but small. Perfect for 2 adults. Could be very tight for 3 adults or if you have a child. Safe wasn't working so we had to call guest services. They sent someone from "engineering" and he couldn't fix it. He told us to give him 10 minutes to locate another safe to replace ours. 30 minutes after, still no show. I complained to Steve in the front desk who promised "to light a fire under them" but nobody came after 15 minutes so we left. (What an inconvenience to have to lug passports and jewelry around town because hotel safe isn't working!)We came back to the hotel after 6 hours and found the safe still NOT working and a note from Marco apologizing - plus a peppermint candy tin. Valet guys were fantastic. Hal the concierge was very gracious, helpful, polite and informative. Thank you Hal. We paid $320 for the small room on the 21st floor with a busted safe and $62 for valet parking. Will we return? No. We'd rather stay in a boutique hotel in the same block (there are plenty)

This hotel is very clean & in an excellent location next to Union Square. The front foyer looks very ordinary, but the overall rooms & service are great. The gym is excellent with the most amazing view we have ever seen from our running machines! The concierge is great & booked all our tours. Alcatraz is the best tourist destination! Pier 39 has great food & atmosphere. We enjoyed happy hour in the hotel bar every night - good beer & wine. The staff are very friendly. We also appreciated that there are 2 laundrettes located within 1 street walk of this hotel. Try Lori's diner for a great 1960's breakfast. The fridge is big enough to stock with fresh food & beer! We would stay here again.

I stayed at the hotel in December last year. The hotel was rather packed as it was Christmas season. However, service was still good and check in was quick and efficient. On Christmas morning, we found a stocking with chocolates and candies on our door. It was a very sweet gesture. The location is really good. Room was huge, clean and comfortable.

Do not expect Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton or Mandarin standards here. Also do not mistake the much better Hyatt International hotels with itÂ´s inferior American counterparts. This is a huge hotel primarily catering towards tourist and conventioneers. Rooms are pretty basic and and on the small side but clean, contemporary and recently refurbished with windows that can be opened. Hyatt beds are usually to soft for me, so if f you prefer hard beding you will be disappointed. Housekeeping did a good job to clean the room. Otherwise service is between OK and non-existing. Location is great for sightseeing and much better than Fishermanâ€™s Wharf IMO. Noise level was tolerable on the 27th floor but I needed earplugs to sleep trough. If you get a good deal on the room rate or a room on one of the higher floors facing towards the north or east you will be fine. But if you pay 400 $ per night for a 4th floor room facing the Sir Francis Drake Hotel you might feel ripped-off.

Stayed at the Grand Hyatt recently. Excellent location, centrally located. The One Up restaurant serves a great breakfast with excellent servers. Upon request for chicken sausage, which was not part of the breakfast buffet, the server and chef quickly heated up the sausage and brought it to our table. The room in general is nice with padded bedding with good housekeeping staff. But the bathroom can use some improvements: 1. not enough hooks - with only 2 hooks and no towel bars, you need to get creative where to put your change of clothes and hand towel, your bath towel etc. 2. the bathtub has no handle or treading to help steady yourself as you step in and out - an accident waiting to happen ! Electrical outlets are scarce. We only found 2 electrical outlets in the room. The electrical outlets for a floor lamp and a desk lamp were both (mysteriously) behind some paneling !?? In this era of devices, 2 outlets may not be enough to recharge your phone, your computer, your iPad, your camera, etc. Better bring your own power strip !

Not excellent, not bad â€“ just what you expect from a Grand Hyatt Hotel. Big rooms and very corporate. We got a room with a nice view towards Alcatraz, which was nice. The hotel has a very good location. As a tourist, I will recommend staying around Union Square and not Fishermanâ€™s Wharf â€“ which is better for a stroll daytime

Stayed here two nights in conjunction with a conference at the Moscone Center. There was a line at check-in, but it went quickly. Instead of the normal registration counter, there are several individual stations to register. My 20th floor room was nice with a view of the city and bay in the distance. It was quiet and clean with free wifi. I am glad I read on a previous review that the room had black-out shades and where to find the controls (on either side of the headboard), because otherwise I would not have known. There is no standard guidebook in your room to the hotel and area - instead everything is provided through the TV which has a mouse on the remote. I did not eat at the hotel, but did have a nice dinner a block away at the Cheesecake Factory located on an upper floor in Macys. While you are waiting for your table you can walk outside and view the area and Union Square. There was a Korean festival going on in the Square and it was quite colorful. If you are into shopping, all the major players are clustered around and close to Union Square. We also had breakfast right around the corner from the hotel at Lori's Diner - a 1950's style diner. What's not to love about a diner with a full-size Edsel in the middle of the restaurant. Cheap and good. The hotel is also a very short walk to Chinatown and the tons of shops and eateries there. I am glad our convention had shuttle service to the Moscone CC, because otherwise it would have been a little hike. All in all, a nice stay.

We stayed five nights recently and really enjoyed our time there. Not overly in love with the lobby. It is a little sterile and not very welcoming. But the rooms are good and the Club and its staff are great.

Checked in a bit early, our room was not ready. Offered a City View room or could store our luggage until our Bay View room was ready. Wanted the view so went out for the afternoon, came back to the hotel, waited for our bags to be brought up. Nice room, quite basic, lovely view. Bathroom looked brand new - sink nearly as big as the bath! No fan in the bathroom so after showers the whole room and all windows steamed up. Went to bed and could hear the guests in the the rooms over the corridor talking and laughing. The windows in the rooms weren't sealed correctly and the road noise and the consturction noise in the morning was very loud and woke us up. I know its a city environment but up on the 23rd floor we didn't expect it to be so loud.Conceirge was very helpful.Overall was ok but would think twice about staying here again

We had booked a room for 4 nights on club floor but when arrived at 10 pm we were told that all club rooms are full and they can give us a club room only next day but allowed us to use club lounge. Next day when we went to reception in the morning we were told that they would give our club room only after 3 pm with no gurantee of city view which we had requested and which was there in our present room. The most shocking thing they told us was that we had to empty out our present room by 12 noon,keep our luggage in their storage and then shift to our new room. This absurd process would have wasted our entire day so we decided to stay back in our present room only. This was least expected from a Grand Hyatt property. The safe locker in the room was almost on ground level. Every time I had to sit on floor to open/close it. The breakfast in club lounge was upto 10 AM. At 9.55 the staff would tell the the guests that in next 5 min they would remove everything and at sharp 10 they would actually do it. The result was that guests would fill up their plates 5/10 min before 10 beyond their needs and then waste the food. This was horrible experience. Now some good things. Location was excellent right next to everything in San Francisco.The room was clean,looking newly renovated. The concierge staff was very helpful. The Union Station area is better place to stay than Fisherman Warf.

Spent 4 days here during a business conference. Great location for all activities within and nearby the city center. Room was modern and very clean. Service was attentive where ever I ran into staff. Easy walk to many tourist attractions.

So much nice things to say about the Hotel and staff . Our 2 nights stay was enjoyable . Everyone is friendly , great food and clean property . We will be back . Thank you Grand Hyatt and staff . We would like to send a special thank to Jessica - Front desk Manager and In room Dining crew.Great Job !Try the One Up restaurant new menu too .

We spent two nights at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco at Union Station. Great location, beautiful accommodations and excellent staff. The concierge was outstanding and suggested terrific tours and restaurants.

The Grand Hyatt is pretty well located for all the things you may want to do while in the big city. It is easily accessed from SFO via the BART, however take the elevator up to Powell street rather than the stairs when lugging a 53lb suitcase. The Grand Hyatt has gone through an make over recently and are adopting the "Personal" check in. No more long reception bar. Frankly, when we arrived they were swamped and unfortunately did not have enough "Personal Check In Folks" to assist us. However, they did get it going and we were checked in and up to our room. We requested the highest floor possible, but only ended up on the 23rd floor. Even so, our Bay View was awesome.We decided to bounce downstairs to the OneUp Lounge and partake of a beverage and a quick munchie.. drinks were fine, but the food was average at best. On the food front, we did get a pizza via room service which was actually pretty decent, albeit $36 bucks. When we ordered a pizza delivered from Uncle Vitos down the street, it was less expensive, but no where near as tasty as our room service pie. We stopped in the lobby a couple of times for breakfast sammys and Starbucks which were quite good as well.Our rooms were always fresh and clean when we returned to them after a long day of sight seeing and partying. We got some robes and a razor since I had forgotten mine delivered to our room at no charge. The lobby was a nice area to sit back and share a bottle of wine with our friends, with very interesting art pieces through out. What was interesting in our room was the sink in the bathroom. Very retro modern and was not as functional as a normal sink. We seemed to always sloosh water around the sink areaThe staff all were friendly enough and the door man who looked like a walking fridge was always very helpful and quick with a hello every time we left and came back. He was one big guy!

Ok, it's not the most interesting looking hotel - fairly corporate as expected, but it's in a great location and our rooms had brilliant views. There was a mix up to begin with as I'd requested two connecting rooms or at least near to each other for our children aged 16 and 11. When we arrived after a long flight we were told the rooms were two floors apart! Eventually we were allocated rooms on the same floor, although not as close as we would like. Fortunately the rooms were good - clean, spacious and with great views. It's worth paying a bit extra for a good view - ours was a bay view, the other was a city view but both were excellent. The rest of our three night stay was excellent. We ate in the hotel on our last night and it was good and not overpriced. Location is great for shops and easy to get cab or cable car. We also did a lot of walking plus big bus tour to Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz - both excellent. Must book Alcatraz in advance in the summer. Also recommend Slanted Door and Boudins restaurants.

Recently stayed here on a business trip and very pleasantly surprised by how modern the hotel rooms are, they look recently updated. Nice location near Union Square. Check in was smooth and staff was very pleasant and helpful. Room service food quickly delivered and was good quality. Bar area was nice but a bit tame and quiet so not great for nightlife; other down side is they seemed to seat overflow from the restaurant in the bar, including with young children, even later at night.

My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon. Had an amazing time and the rooms were absolutely gorgeous. Will absolutely stay here again if we return to San Fran. Room Tip request a room on a higher floor.

Union Square is one of the better locations for visiting San Francisco, and the Grand Hyatt is situated right in the middle near shopping, transit and the famed cable cars. However, the room was not overly "grand" but rather a bit on the small side - which goes double for the bathroom. Would consider staying here again if I knew the room would be larger

We had some credit at the Hyatt so we were able to use it for a July 2014 weekend. Fortunately for us, we were upgraded to the most beautiful suite. It was huge with a massive dining table, living room and kitchenette. There were two baths and separate king size bed. We definitely loved it since we were traveling with a young child. We also had access to the concierge floor where there was a good breakfast, cold drinks, heavy appetizers and the female staff was very friendly and kind to our daughter. I thought the workout room was kinda small but my husband used it. We also loved the free taffy and popcorn in the lobby. My two minor complaints was the bed was not as comfortable as I am use to, and housekeeping wasn't all that stellar. I don't like to criticize them because they have the worst job, but I expected a bit better since we were in the suite. I think they must have been rushing because they didn't finishing making the bed properly and didn't clean until very late in the afternoon.

We recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco. Prior to arriving, Iâ€™d made several telephone calls to be clear about the kind of room we wanted; we were promised a specific room. However, upon arriving, it turned out that there had been a glitch and the room was no longer available. Gasp! The individual checking us in was the assistant manager and he said heâ€™d offer us a room that should make up for the booking issue and as it was a celebratory stay.Weâ€™d originally booked for the 15th floor and were given a room on the 33rd floor, Club floors, Executive Suite. The suite had a fantastic view with floor to ceiling views of the Coit tower, bay, etc. from both the living room and the bedroom. We were more than thrilled and actually glad that there had been a booking mistake as this room was so much better than the one weâ€™d bookedOur room was close to 600 square feet with a large bedroom, living room, kitchen area and bathroom. The bathroom had two sinks, a large shower and seating area for make-up (huge). The kitchen was more of meeting convenience area with a two sided below counter refrigerator, coffee maker and small sink. We bring our own coffee, coffee maker anyway. There were three large flat-screen TVâ€™s: one in the living room, one in the bedroom and one in the bathroom mirror. As well, there was a lot of closet space as well as drawers for clothes/other items. As this wasnâ€™t the hypoallergenic (PURE) room, an air purifier was brought up that evening. Also, the large windows were actually sliding doors that would open an inch or two, just enough to get some fresh air; I really like it when you can get some fresh air in a hotel room. The king size bed was very comfortable.The next day, a bottle of wine and cupcakes were delivered for the birthday; very nice and unexpected. The assistant manager, Zach, also called to make sure we had everything we needed. All of the staff were friendly and accommodating. We liked the modern design of the suite. There are one button touch blinds for complete black-out which we never used as we wanted to see the view. Some of the lights we couldnâ€™t figure out right away, as well as the TV but were able to figure it out quite quickly. The room was very quiet; as expected could hear the occasional siren but it's the city so that's expected.We just loved our stay as well as the location of the hotel. Spoiled now, I canâ€™t imagine staying anywhere but the Executive Suite next time thereâ€™s a special occasion. Our stay was memorable and the view just incredible. Weâ€™d definitely stay here again and would request the same room, if available.

Great location and hotel experience. Came back here after 6 months and enjoyed it again. Recommend for families as the staff was passionate and considerate for our little noisy "monster".One of the best restaurants "One Up" in SF is right there at Mezzanine with delicious cuisine and friendly service. And I loved the view to the city, even not too high up, very good street view.

Choose the Grand Hyatt because of the great incomparable location, I was with my wife and we were coming from Mexico doing stopover in our way to Bangkok we stay 3 days twice.Room 3409 with access to club floor in an amazing choice, the room gives opportunity to appreciate great view over Union Square, we tried the restaurant for a light lunch and was very confortable and good service, the bar in the evening with live music were we tried a Californian Merlot " Canvas " which was a good choice. noticed in the afternoon there is sometimes wine tasting at the lobby, concierge service was great and recommended us a tour to the Art Museum by Golden Gate ParkBeautiful scenery and nice place to walk.

I was there the past week end, the hotel is very conveniently located on union square, chinatown gate is 2 steps away, cable car stops on the square. the rooms are ok but smallish (double room bay view) if compared to other hyatt structures, the bathroom is definitely too small.the staff, specially those at concierge desk, is very helpful and goes beyond the tasks requested by duty

This was one of my considerations - choice between somewhere near the touristy stretch of fisherman's wharf, or downtown in Union Square. I am glad we stayed downtown amidst the action in SF, and in particular at the Grand Hyatt. Check in was a breeze and we were given a wonderful room on a high floor with a priceless view over San Francisco. I looked out at Alcatraz in the distance and Telegraph Hill / Coit Tower on the right. Room was spacious and the bathroom was very elegant. Breakfast was a small but adequate selection of fresh fruits, pastry and hot items. Loved the coffee. All the breakfast staff were warm and cheerful.Downside - we had a very bad noise problem on the first night when we were awoken by a party returning late at night to the suite next door. The door connection between the rooms was very thin and I was actually jolted out of slumber with what I though was someone in the room. We had to call concierge to feedback. Thank goodness the other party was obliging. No proper coffee cups in the from, only paper cupsMy son had a very bad abrasion after he hit the rigid LED bedside lamp which was protruding out of the headboards

I was very pleased with my recent stay at Grand Hyatt San Francisco. We took the BART from SFO into Union Square - $8.65 per adult. Once we exited "Powell Station", we saw the many tourists who were lining up for the cable cars and it felt like San F. The walk to our hotel was short. We reserved an excellent room, that highlighted the city's view and we were not disappointed by the room. The size of the room is standard. I heard the hotel went through renovations. The bathroom door in our room was hard to open/close. Housekeeping was standard. A highlight of this hotel was the access to the Club Lounge on the 32nd floor. Employee commendation: David, a Hyatt employee was engaged with his job. This lounge has good views of the city, and it was relaxing. The hotel is right in Union Square and below Nob Hill. When I return to San Francisco, I would stay at the Grand Hyatt again - I enjoyed my stay.

My sister and I stayed here for 2 weekend nights while I was showing her around San Francisco. For sightseeing this is the perfect downtown location. It is next to Union Square and all major stores are nearby very convenient for shopping. Chinatown is within walking distance. Also you can catch the famed streetcar right outside the hote to Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel seemed well maintained. Rooms are not particularly big but with good view through the floor to ceiling window. Grand Club was open on weekends, so we pretty much ate there all the time without visiting the restaurant. So I can't comment on the restaurant. Food in the club was pretty good, but it was quite crowded late morning (it's quieter in the evening). One big drawback is that there is no swimming pool. Another drawback is that parking is very expensive and it's valet only.

This hotel is in a great location if you want to be in the middle of things at Union Square. It is busy around the hotel. Driving a car to it can be a challenge especially for check in, but the best part of the hotel is the valet drivers. They do an amazing job of getting cars situated when you come in, getting cars from the parking, etc. They also do a great job of greeting you when you come in each day. That adds a great touch.The room is very modern and if you have stayed in many other San Francisco hotels, you know that this can be rare as many of them are in older historic buildings. The bed is comfortable and the room is a good size for San Francisco. We did have 2 problems with the room. First, our TV wasn't working. They were able to replace it in less than 10 minutes. Second, our A/C barely worked. We would try to set it to 65 degrees at night to sleep but it would reset to 70 degrees. We are both warm bodied and need a cold room to sleep. We called the front desk in the middle of the night, and they sent someone who "fixed it" but didn't really fix the problem. We continued to sleep warm and not the best sleep as a result. Additionally, housekeeping didn't clean our room one day.Don't expect much of any amenities in this hotel like snack shop, pool, etc. Our room didn't have a guide with nearby attractions or hotel services.For San Francisco, this is a good hotel but it would fall short in other cities.

We stayed here for a total of 9 nights over the 2 weeks period, once for 4 nights on the 14th floor and 2nd time for 5 nights on the 9th floor. Nothing cute or cool about this hotel, typical corporate hotel. Main reason I stayed here is because I got a 50% discount and it cost me $169 per night. In my opinion, I overpaid. Other than location and amazing views from the 36th floor gym, this hotel offers less than most of the $99 hotels. First 4 nights were ok, bed was comfortable, views were amazing, our room faced Stockton but it was very noisy. It appears that hotel is trying to save money on little things that mean a lot to many travelers: cheap coffee in the room, awful toiletries, basic TV channels, no HBO, no coffee in the lobby. I was amazed by the amount of dust that accumulated in the room overnight. Everything was literally covered in dust, it was incredible. Cleaning ladies were super friendly and nice, others were smiling robots. Hotel sells Starbucks coffee for 50 cents more than in Starbucks across the street, but people don't seem to mind that. My last 5 nights were spent on 9th floor overlooking Sutter street, view was less enjoyable, but I was out most of the day so it didn't matter. Bed in this room was very uncomfortable, my back was numb every morning. Overall, not thrilled with this hotel, I can't believe people are paying big bucks to stay here, such a waste of money. Two blocks down on Bush street, Escape from New York pizza has Happy hour every day from 4-6 and you can get slice of pizza or beer for $2.50(cup of coffee in Hyatt's lobby).

My husband and I recently spent one night at this fabulous hotel. The location is perfect if you want easy access to Pier 33 (Alcatraz Tour) and Pier 39. The staff here is highly professional and courteous. Everyone provided a smile and efficient response when being asked a question or looking for assistance. The room was immaculate and the beds were very comfortable. We had an excellent breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Other reviewers complained about the noise level -- we did not experience that at all. Hotel was extremely quiet and we had an excellent night's sleep. Amazing view of the city from our room. We stayed in five hotels while traveling through CA and this was one of the top two.The only downside I can think of was the Parking Garage. Parking is expensive and it did take quite a while for us to get our car. Allow plenty of time to get your car if you have reservations somewhere -- allot a good 10-20 minutes for retrieval of your vehicle.

Arrived at hotel on a Sunday morning and able to check into room immediately.Very nice! Bellhop was very helpful and got us setup quickly. Our stay included Grand Club which gave us food and drinks evenings and mornings. This is a huge plus for traveling with 8 yr old and a teen. The staff at the Grand Club went out of their way to welcome us and remember our names.We stayed in a double room on the 31st floor with a view great of north/northwest San Francisco. Blinds worked great to keep out the sun and even though there was construction going below us in the Union Square area it wasn't an issue for our family. We ate at OneUp, the hotels nicely appointed restaurant, the food was well cooked and the staff was friendly.The hotel is close to every kind of shopping imaginable and the main transportation hubs are within walking distance. (5-10 blocks) We used cabs, subway and street cars which can be interesting until you figure out where to go but we found help when necessary. While in town we visited a Giants game, Alcatraz, biked from Golden Gate Park to the bridge as well as shopping and the hotel gave us a central location to do these activities.I would stay at the hotel again if on business or I needed a centralized location for shopping etc. but I probably would stay farther away from the city if we visit again with the family. This isn't a negative reflection on the hotel but only because we don't need the nightlife scene, etc that SF's downtown provides. Room was small but nice and provided a nice clean bathroom and comfortable beds to rest at night. The staff at the Grand Hyatt are very kind and professional.

I recently spent five nights in the Grand Hyatt while attending a trade show at Moscone Center. It was my first experience with this hotel after staying in other nearby hotels for all of my conventions in the past. My first impression on walking in was it was a very nice place. The lobby has an upscale, trendy look and feel to it and the front desk staff was very friendly and efficient in checking me in. I had a room on the 9th floor and also found my room to be modern and upscale/trendy looking. Everything was not only exceptionally clean but also looked relatively new. This is in comparison to a lot of other hotels in the Union Square area and elsewhere around SF that are often quite dated looking. I was pleasantly surprised that the rooms had refrigerators - a nice amenity when you are spending multiple days in a hotel. The bed was quite comfortable and as I have come to expect in the nicer hotels, you are provided with a selection of pillows with a variety of firmnesses. I also noticed that when I called guest services for anything, the phone was answered on the first or second ring and I was greeted by name.I would love to give this hotel a 5-star rating, but there are a couple of things preventing me from doing that. First of all, the on-premises bar/restaurant is outrageously expensive. I had breakfast there one morning, and any one of the menu entrees will easily set one person back $25 by the time you include coffee, tax, and tip. That in itself wouldn't be a negative for me. This is afterall an upscale business hotel and you generally expect the on-premises dining options to be on the expensive side. The bigger problem for me on this particular stay was that there was road construction going on immediately outside the hotel, and it was literally 24/7. Because of that I just didn't sleep well at all. I was unfortunately kept awake all night by the unpleasant sounds of jackhammers and trucks backing up. Now I know that's not the hotel's fault and not even within their realm of control - shame on you City of San Francisco or whoever made the brilliant decision to run a major construction project 24/7 just steps away from a major hotel. I would however have to caution anyone considering a stay here that you can't count on a good night's sleep until the project is finished, unless you're capable of sleeping in a war zone.Other than that, I will consider staying here again when I join the same trade show next year as long as the road construction is complete.

I would not stay at this hotel again. The room is nicely decorated but the mattress is worn out and sags and is very uncomfortable. There is extremely loud construction noise at night from work on the subway station on Stockton and the front desk seemed to be unaware of this potential issue and not particularly sympathetic. The hotel lacks basic amenities such as a gift shop where one could purchase a drink or basic sundries.

This hotel was a gem. My family of four had a fantastic stay here. The location is ideal just off Union Square and close to all transport. The staff was very friendly and helpful and offered some good tips on getting around. It is close to China Town, Market Street and other great shopping as well as food.The only draw back would be the room size, but you are in San Francisco where real-estate is prime. We fit a bit tight but well with four large suitcases.All in all I will stay here again and recommend it to everyone.

I just returned yesterday from a 2 night stay with my 17 year old niece that I booked in early April. I checked TripAdvisor several days before the trip and found out about the construction near by. We took BART from airport and being summer, Powell Street was extremely crowded but we were able to navigate our way to the hotel. We arrrived about noon and our room was ready but faced Union Square. I could hear the construction noise and we decided to take a "quiet room" away from the noise. We got a room facing the back of the hotel (towards Powell St.) on the 7th floor. Let me tell you, the room was fabulous. It was recently renovated and I thought my niece was never going to leave. The beds are so luxurious and I slept very well. This is unusual since I have a Temperpedic at home and usually cannot sleep on a "traditional" mattress any more. The down side is that I spent many hours walking around the city by myself since I could not get that kid out of bed!! I question my "quiet room" since there was plenty of heavy duty construction noise at 11:00 PM. I guess I wasn't specific enough about what I wanted so if noise is an issue for you please take note of other room suggestions on other posts. Luckily, I was so tired I fell asleep easily.My niece loved the exercise room and used it every night. The location is simply divine - you are surrounded by all the stores you could want. Chinatown entrance is less than 2 blocks away and I even got her to walk down to the wharf . I would have given 5 stars but due to no fault of the hotel I gave it a 4 for the noise. The construction literally is a full 3 blocks down Stockton starting at the corner on Post and continuing down to Market. According to the news this is subway construction and will not be completed until 2017. We actually went back down to BART using Stockton and it was so much easier than Powell. There is a narrow sidewalk adjoining the construction site that you can walk down and there is not much foot traffic,.As a side note, if you like hamburgers try Super Duper Burgers on Market Street. The long line is a testament to its quality (and my other niece works at In N Out so I shouldn't be complimenting the competition!)Thank you Hyatt for a wonderful property!!!

We booked a basic room plus breakfast package some months before on the basis of location and from TA searching what looked a more modern and spacious room compared with other hotel pics.Check in was very efficient with a very nice and friendly guy who managed to give us a corner room( slightly bigger) on floor 16 with a view of the Transamerica Pyramid and other downtown towers and a partial bay glimpses. Note that even from the top 35th floor/gym windows the towers block out a full bay view.Overall we were very pleased with the room etc, it is modern and relatively new, its not inventively designed or contemporary though, however it was always welcoming to come back to after tiring days out.We got a very good deal on the internet and by only paying a bit more got the breakfast buffet option for 2 included. As a walkin customer it costs $25 per person, which actually is still good value compared to paying for each item off the alacarte menu and there aren't many more options here anyway.However the buffet is good for maybe a couple of days but it is fairly limited and repetitive over our 6nt stay. Also there is only limited seating and staff so do prepare for a little wait. They can open up a further room down the corridor which can be quieter but you are away from the buffet table!overall we did like our stay, good hotel and we liked the location so you cant get much better.However we found our stay in SF hard going, a big crowded city with poor public transport, lots of road works, and many of its attractions closed for redevelopment- hardly the best mix for romantic stays.Unfortunately on our return to the Uk we found an unexpected charge on our CC. It took several emails and phone calls before the first professional person in the Hyatt group took responsibility to address the issue and sort it out. Not good service and disappointing.

Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in the end of June. Placed just 2 blocks from Union Square it doesn't get any more central in SF without the tourists. Further it is very close to the highclass shopping of SF. The lobby is a bit small for a hotel of this class, but with a high class and fast, serviceminded and smiling checkin. Valet service was great to, and the doormen are relaxed and smiling. The rooms are not that big, and not completely up to the modern design that you often experience at Grand Hyatt hotels, but definetely a nice, high standard.The rooms and the hotel itself would usually only qualify for a 4 star rating in my book, but the service and location just sneaks the Grand Hyatt into the 5 star category.

Stayed here with my wife and 3 teenage boys in July on the 30th club floor! A little disappointed to miss out on a view of the bay but otherwise perfect. A great friendly greeting from the doormenwho were superb and great variety and service in the club lounge as well. (great breakfast options)The rooms were very well appointed although a tad small for my 3 boys and 10 cases. The bedswere sensational and bathrooms very good. We were first time vistors to San Francisco and absolutely loved the city (so much to see do and eat!!) This hotel and its great location near union square complimented our stay beautifully. The club lounge was also a perfect place to relax and take in the excellent views. The tariff while not inexpensive was excellent value for a property of this qualityWe would return to San Fran and this hotel in a heartbeat!! Well done Grand Hyatt

Stayed here for 7 nights & had a good night's rest from the first night. Room was on the 3rd floor & very quiet & dark. Didn't get to eat in the restaurant but enjoyed the "One Up" bar for happy hour - 5:00-7:00 for $5 glasses of wine. Very pleasant staff on check-in & housekeeping does an amazing job. Within walking distance of Ferry Bldg. & we even walked back from Fisherman's Wharf. Lots of good shopping close by.

Loved being next to Union Square. Greeted immediately curb side as we pulled up to the hotel and the bell staff quickly retrieved our bags. The checkin was very high tech and smooth. Bellman showed us around our room on the 14th floor and brought ice to the room. Free internet and it worked well. Comfortable and quiet room. Loved the button by the bed to lower the black out curtains. Really like the couches and gathering areas in the lobby. A very comfortable feel. Got a breakfast sandwich and latte at the coffee bar next morning which was a big mistake, should have gone across the street to Starbucks. Had to toss the latte, horrible. Only two complaints, the shower head was pathetic and the water pressure very poor. Really surprised as everything else was so chic and modern. Also the bed mattress and pillows were the worst of our ten day trip. This was our last night and did not get a good nights rest. I would stay again if the rate beat the Westin around the corner which is why we chose it. However, it is hard to beat a Westin bed.

Loved the area right around the corner of Union Square, very clean, nice staff, stayed here twice and it's the only place I will stay now. Only bad thing is a little noisy from outside streets. Rooms are small but that's everywhere in the city.

We stayed 1 night at the Grand Hyatt SF as part of a Bay Area vacation. Though we did not stay long and did not use all the hotel services, we felt it was above average for a Grand Hyatt.Pros:- The hotel is in a wonderful location, just off Union Square. - Rooms were newly renovated and relatively stylish for a business hotel. There were all the modern conveniences, including plenty of conveniently-placed electrical outlets.- Though a huge hotel, the front desk was never busy and we were helped immediately at both check-in and check-out.- Service was friendly, from the valet to the bellman to the front desk. Cons:- Perhaps not the hotel's fault, but Stockton St is extremely busy and it was difficult to unload and load our car at check-in and check-out. There were many cars and pedestrians all around.

I really enjoyed my stay. Starting the moment I arrived, my check in was flawless and the staff was very helpfull. I prefer a high floor and was given a room with a great view. This was for the Semicon/ Intersolar 14 convention. I really enjoyed the Bar and the food was fine. In the evening I even went for a walk and it was really enjoyable. Now for my issue..There is not a coffee maker in the room , I could have gotten room service but I prefer to make my coffee early and be able to start work without interruptions. Other than that I am looking forward to staying here on my upcoming trips.

Wonderful hotel in the middle of everything. The concierge staff was incredibly professional and helped with all sorts of questions, Hotel beds are extremely comfortable and shades are controlled from bedside. Will definitely highly recommend hotel.

I've stayed in this hotel twice, so this tells you everything. It is in a good location next to union square. The room was nice and modern and comfortable. Lots of restaurants and bars next to. China town is close by, you can just walk.

This hotel is virtually on Union Square, which is convenient (and also noisy, especially in a room that faces the square, and especially at this time, with construction going on around the clock on Stockton Street). Nevertheless, theres are enough nice touches to elevate this hotel far above the average for the business traveler. My room, ending in 20, had an unusual and attractive layout, with the bathroom next to the window rather than to the right or left of the entrance. The room itself, on a "quiet" floor, was spacious and well appointed. The mysterious switches next to the bed and the door were eventually revealed to trigger the lowering and raising of the window screen. Nice touches extended to the large bowl of salt water taffy at reception, the helpful (and very busy) concierge service, and a casual coffee-and-breakfast wraps service on the lobby level. Convention facilities were what one would expect, with a couple of odd room layouts, but also with plenty of washrooms in convenient locations. Meeting rooms on the top floor were spectacular.

I come to San Francisco frequently, and never have I stayed in a hotel quite so good as this. Without shadow of doubt, the best hotel in San Francisco. When the doors are opened for you, you are greeted with a grand, open-plan lobby, with faultless ornamentation. The rooms are beautiful, the decor and amenities are luxury, the bed is high standard and the staff are incredibly helpful, on point and courteous. And to top it all off, the hotel situated in a prime location on Union Square, with the most breathtaking views of San Fran and the bay. A very well presented hotel. I'm proud to call this my accommodation of choice for every trip to San Francisco. Don't make choices. Stay here.

We visited the Grand Hyatt for 5 nights in July to celebrate our Silver wedding anniversary. After spending our first 5 nights in Vegas and the very lush Vdara our expectations for the Grand Hyatt were high and we were not disappointed. We arrived and was greeted at the reception by a very nice friendly gentleman who wished us a happy anniversary. On arriving at our room it was a nice touch when room service arrived with a complimentary bottle of chilled wine for us. Our room was lovely, very comfortable and spacious with a very modern feel to it. We loved the fact that the TV was fully interactive giving information on the local attractions, restaurants and bars. Housekeeping did a great job keeping our room clean and tidy with fresh towels every day and clean linen every other day. On our first night we ate at the Grand Hyatt and had a lovely meal. We were really impressed with our server who was knowledgeable about the food and wine giving us recommendations and also spending the time to chat with us, he told us he had worked there for 26 years which says a lot in itself. The hotel is very centrally located within an easy walking distance on Union Square with an huge selection of restaurants, bars and shops. China Town is a short walk away and well worth a visit. We loved this hotel and San Francisco and would not hesitate to recommend either. We hope to visit again one day and would definitely stay here again.

Stayed on the 27th floor overlooking Union Square. There was some street construction outside during my stay but the noise wasn't too bad during the day, and wasn't problematic at night. Free wifi was much appreciated. The hotel is in a great location for seeing everything San Francisco has to offer.

Been coming to SFO for many years now both for work and pleasure and I've stayed in many different hotels here.The Hyatt has to be my favourite downtown hotel to date.Perfect location in the heart of the shopping district with good transport links to other areas of the city. Not located on top a hill or on a steep slope makes it easy to get to!Rooms are very comfy, clean and modern with great views across the city. Staff are friendly and helpful.Would definitely recommend.

Had four nights here along with other family members who were in San Fran for a wedding. From the minute we arrived to the time we left we couldn't really fault this establishment. The staff are very attentive, friendly and professional. The room we had on the 29th floor was very good, nice and clean, well laid out and comfortable. The hotel was very busy (full house one night) but we found our room was quiet and very peaceful. Others who were staying there in our group commented with similar thoughts. Nothing seemed too much trouble and a request for an extended check out was not a problem. The location is so handy to everything. The concierge desk was very helpful and knowledgable. We will definitely stay here again next time in San Fran.

The position in Union square is great and having stayed pre refurb I must state it is a great improvement.Noise from other Rooms was no problem but I did ask for a higher room and reception were very good in sorting room--just ask !,Beds very good and bathroom fine.

Expensive and blandThe Good:Great bed, good sleepLarge room, but no character (despite a fake bookshelf with books)OK (free) wifiFast and friendly checkin/outThe not so Good:5 star hotel 2 star shower water pressureNo long mirror, this would drive my wife nutsExternal noises ~ somebody sorting bottles at 3am in the morning, followed by garbage trucks and I was on the 20F

In the heart of the city and a beautiful hotel. Top notch service all around. Rod at the front desk was great. Fay from room service personally called me back and addressed me by name and took care of wonderful request we had for another guest checking in on there wedding night. Also the young woman working the coffee lounge in the morning with the unique name was very helpful and pleasent throughout our stay. Thanks for making our trip so memorable and I can't wait to visit your wonderful property again. Well done Hyatt.

Im a DIAMOND GP member. I used to stay here but not anymore. Why? Because its noisy. Nearly all are connecting rooms and when hotel is full you can hear that person do EVERYTHING. Noise comes through door since there is huge gap. Also walls are thin. Gap under front door is thin. No turndown service. Housekeeping sloppy. They want to get through rooms as fast as possible, Room service is bad and pricey. Have to call for ameneties. Noise from union square. Noise fro wind. Clientele level is riff raff. Stay at Four Seasons instead.

Just spent two nights at this gorgeous property and hated to leave. The room (a suite) was lovely and comfortable, great shower (with one of the things in the corner for shaving legs) and the bed was super comfy. For those with access, the Grand Club Lounge, was wonderful for drinks in the evening (it's nice to be trusted with an honor bar) and "continental" breakfast (but SO much more than typical continental). Another home run with Hyatt.

We spent 2 nights here and the location was perfect as I like to walk a lot when I'm traveling. It was really easy to get around union square from here. We were minutes away from the cable car and other public transportation too if you want explore other neighborhoods like North Beach, etc.The rooms were clean and the staff was pretty nice, but that shouldn't matter too much right? You won't be spending much time in your room anyway!

Hotel is recently renovated. Lobby, bar and common areas are all terrific. Room was nice and plenty large enough for 2. Seems like some rooms have great views, although ours on the 5th floor was non existent.Part we liked best was across the street from Union Square. Cable cars were around the corner, BART station 3 blocks away or so as was the F line street car (both walking distance)It really is a perfect spot to stay at to explore the city.

I can't say enough good things about this hotel or its staff. This was a very special romantic weekend, and everything needed to be perfect. As it turned out, it was even better than that. The room was spacious and very beautiful and the service throughout the hotel was impeccable. Had we left the room, the location would have been convenient for everything. Do yourself a favor and stay here.

I stayed there for 3 weeks in June &July. Hyatt's location is perfect for touristic vacation. It is in the middle of everything. You can easily reach to touristic places, shops and restaurants. When you are tired, you can go back to Hotel quickly to relax. Rooms are large with nice view, elevators are fast, breakfast is delicious, bed is comfy..But staff is best. Manager, frontdesk, bellmen, doormen, cleaning ladies, all staff of OneUp restaurant.. I hope I did not forget anyone. Everyone tries their best to make your stay special and enjoyable. 3 weeks stay is very long and for problems arise, they were always available for solution. Thanks a lot for everything.

We spent two nights in San Francisco to kick off an eight day California vacation. I looked at a lot of hotels before choosing the Grand Hyatt. The best things about this property are its location just up the hill from Union Square, the modern, clean feel to the property and the professional staff, doormen, etc. The room itself (10th floor, cityview, 2 beds) was a little small, though nicely furnished. I found the beds to be too plush, not firm enough. The bathroom door was a sliding door that didn't have a lock - not ideal when there are kids in the room!For those who don't know San Francisco, if you take the BART from the airport (SFO) its about $9 and you get off at the Powell Street station and then walk uphill to Union Square, not an easy climb with luggage, cross Union Square and then go up another 50 yards to the hotel entrance. The walk was maybe 10 minutes, but Powell is pretty crowded most of the day.
