The cable car lines all run near the property, but the lines at Powell are ridiculous.Anyhow, I was expecting a little something more from the Grand Hyatt. It had some nice aspects, including a nice sitting area in the lobby and a good happy hour in a nice restaurant/bar area ($4 wine glasses, beer pints), but all in all I think I may have been a little happier in a boutique property.

This hotel is everything you'd expect in terms of service and quality from a Hyatt property. The location right on Union Square puts you in the middle of shoppiing and many great restaurants along with short walks to most of the city's highlights. Rooms were large, clean and well appointed with great views of the city.

Stayed here recently for 5 nights. It's in a perfect location in Union Square, near all the shops and restaurants you could want. Short walk to the famous cable cars and only a 40 minute walk down to Fisherman's Wharf. The drinks in the bar at 'One Up' we're expensive but what you'd expect for a hotel of this calibre. Only downside was the noise from outside as the windows were not sound proofed. Would definitely return.

This is a terrific home base to see many of San Francisco's sights, overlooking Union Square. I stayed for a week in June with my two teenage daughters. The room was clean, modern and spacious. We enjoyed the club room for breakfast each day and snacks in the evening. Check-in and check-out were extremely efficient and I enjoyed the fact that check-out and room service could be handled online. Wouldn't hesitate to come back. The only con: a little noisy due to construction near Union Square (not the hotel's fault) and thin walls. I hope I never have to endure my neighbor's loud lovemaking session alongside my kids EVER again!!

Stayed at this hotel in the beginning of june for a week. The hotel is located near Union Square with a lot of shops and restaurants. Nice. Stayed in a clubroom at 32nd floor facing Union Square. The room was spacious and clean. Nice bathroom with good amenities. Very comfy beds. BUT - outside - every day and night - loud construction noise. We found that the windows had no isolation. Had to change room with a lot of difficulties. Not impressed of the reception staff. Best service in the club thanks to David. The food was average, the wine was good.

Have just got back from our honeymoon, having stayed the last 5 nights at the gran hyatt in San Francisco.The hotel is ideally located for visiting all of San Francisco. It's situate on union square and is about a half hour walk from fishermans wharf. The staff are very attentive and went out of their way to help when they could. A mention has to go out in particular to the older Chinese waiter in the restaurant at breakfast, who gave the best service and had us rolling around with laughter.The only downfall to staying at the hyatt, is the ongoing road works on Union square. We were on the 24th floor and it sounded like they were working In the room next door. Fortunately they weren't working on te 4th of July and most of the weekend but when they were working they carried on until the early hours of the morning.Would definitely stay here again, although may call first to check the works have finished.

Pros:- Great location in Union Square- Quiet room on 30th facing bay- Used the club room for breakfast each morning and great appies/dessert in evening- Hardwood floor rooms were great.Cons:- software logic for elevators seems to be stop at every floor and fill them up which makes for slow travel given there are 5 elevators - - tip: take the two staff elevators if in a hurry- the welcome/check in staff need a bit of training - - the check-in area is open so you can stand around/with the staff. First staff told me right a away to stand away from the screen since has personal information. Huh? Why are you telling me this and why do I care when paying $250 a night? Figure out your problem and solve it.- July 4th event on 36th viewing room was overbooked so did not bother attending even though was hyped.Overall a good Hyatt.

We stayed here for 3 nights and chose it primarily due to the location. It is close to the BART system, the cable cars, downtown shopping, food, and served as a good base for us during our stay. The hotel is modern and the staff is friendly. They allow web check-ins which allowed us to check in and avoid the massive line they had with the front desk. Unfortunately, we weren't able to switch our rooms as a result and ended up in room 320 which gave us a good view of the adjacent building facing south.Can't complain for the price though especially during the summer!

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt by Stockton during the 4th of July weekend for 4 nights. Overall it was Fantastic all around. Check in - Maria was so fast and efficient and friendly! What a great way to start our trip!Room - we were on the 26th floor facing the union squate. Great decent sized clean and neat king size bedroom. The only thing was that we had a noisy neighbors with two rudy kids (thin walls could hear their conversation). It was great after they checked out though.Service - fantastic staff fantastic service with beautiful smile on a their faces. SO genuinely friendly. Stands out from all other hyatt we have stayed including Korea, Chile and Australia.Food - delicious!!!!!!! Need I say more?I am not easily pleased but I give this place my two thumbs up!I certainly will be back.

The bellman are READY to assist! Very helpful, and informative.. The elevators ran pretty quick, our room was lovely, lol I guess I haven't stayed in a hotel for awhile because the first thing I said was "wow", so futuristic, but only because the blinds were automatic:))) lol really enjoyed this for the sunny afternoon naps, shut those suckers and lights out! Everything was very clean, felt new. I will definitely be staying there again and recommending it too. The lobbyist even made reservations for us while we were in the room, that's pretty awesome...Didn't have a chance to check out the pool area, I mean I'm sure it was nice but we were busy enjoying the city. Thank you Grand Hyatt .

The hotel has a nice location but there is an on-going construction nearby. We had the hypo-allergenic room. But even with that feature, I did not see any difference. In fact, I sneezed more than usual and still had my morning allergies. When we lifted the blankets, we saw particles/dust fly up in the air. The bed was springy and uncomfortable. My body sunk into the bed, which makes the pillow too high. I did not sleep well in my stay.The room was also cramped/small. There were just 2 beds and a narrow table that served as a dresser and office table. The room wasnâ€™t even big enough to fit a couch. Service was ok, though. Whenever we asked for something it was delivered quickly in our room.If Iâ€™m visiting SF again, I will definitely look for another hotel to stay in.

Fantastic place to relax and unwind. If you are going to spend the money then I recommend staying here. Great hotel with great staff. Rooms have been renovated and decors are different throughout. Located in the center of Union square allowing walking distance to shops and tram, buses. Highly recommended.

the hotel has a great location, steps away from union square, the shopping and great restaurants.the attention at the hotel excellent everyone is willing to help youWe stayed in a room on the 19th floor overlooking union square, At night it was noisy because of the subway construction

I stayed 3 nights at the Grand Hyatt on a recent business trip. The hotel is in a great location in the heart of San Francisco on Union Square. Check in was fast, friendly, and efficient. The rooms are really nice, clean, and updated with a very modern European dÃ©cor. The beds are comfortable and the bathroom is a nice size. The TV can also be used to access the internet as well as the hotel info and room service can even be ordered via the TV. One item to note â€“ the control for the window shade is next to the bed and next to the door, not next to the window. It took me a while to find it! Housekeeping was great too. The only complaint I have, as I do with many hotels in cities like this, is the cost for room service. The food was fine but the price is really outrageous. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

The Grand Hyatt was terrific! Very modern, great location, and friendly staff! The rooms could stand to be a little bigger, but overall excellent experience and would go back in a heartbeat! Also, the concierge service is excellent and will help you with everything you need! They ONLY reason I gave this place 4 stars instead of 5 is the room size.

Apparently this hotel has had a makeover on the recent past..It worked. The club level room was not cheap but still a value considering the level of service, the view and the location. Hardwood floors, great beds and showers, and floor to ceiling windows. The bellman and valets were 100% on point for whatever you needed. Never a long wait whether you wanted your car, a cab or your bags. The hotel bar was one of the best I have ever visited, 20 plus foot floor to ceiling windows overlooking the street with a great selection of all spirits and the professional level bartenders to run things. The fitness center is on the 34th floor and you run on a treadmill with a view of the city in front of you.

Aside from the convenience of the location our stay ended up being average and not very comfortable. We could not wait to leave - we were exhausted after our stay.The reception staff were friendly and helpful - we were given a room with a nice view of Union Square but we soon found out that it was horrible. We went to sleep each night with construction loud noises outside, it continued throughout the night and we always awoke to loud drilling noises - we stayed for 5 nights and it was the same every single night, never ending. I can't believe the hotel didn't inform us of this construction and incredibly disruptive noise - As a general courtesy. We had to use ear plugs each night and that didn't even help. The windows must be incredibly thin as it felt like we were sleeping out on the street.The room was clean but didn't even have a kettle or tea - Not 5 star at all without basicsThe Concierge team was the most unfriendly Concierge team we had experienced in all of our hotel stays - Very lacklustre attitudes, almost seemed we were wasting their time with questions and felt we were rushed. Just didn't feel welcomed - a smile would go along way. The first time we thought they were having a bad day but it was the case everyday. Some training at The Venetian in Vegas would show them how its done. To us it seemed this hotel catered to business travellers not holiday makers.In general the staff in the hotel were not friendly compared to other hotels - except for the odd few like the bar attendant in bar who was super helpful and gave us some tips for restaurants and things to do.Great location, clean but didn't have the hospitality standards a five or even four star hotel needs to make guests feel welcome. Service needs work.Check if there is construction going on outside the hotel before staying there.

This was our hotel of choice in San Francisco for many years until we decided to go a little "up the scale", but then returned on this trip. Our experience was the best yet, and we are back. The rooms have been nicely modernized, and the service is much improved. Our old friend the doorman was still there and as gracious as ever.

Iâ€™ve stayed at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco (GHSF) at least five times in the past year for both business and pleasure (in these cases I was traveling with my wife and two daughters, ages 10 and 8). Iâ€™ve also stayed here with my in-laws in an adjoining room. The GHSF is a large, conveniently located option that provides a reliable option for travelers. I have also held a meeting at the GHSF (three days, more than 120 attendees) and strongly recommend the GHSF for meetings as well.WHY YOU MIGHT LIKE THE GRAND HYATT SAN FRANCISCO1. Central location. Located at the corner of Stockton and Sutter, guests at the GHSF are well-situated for both business and tourist activities. You are a block from Union Square, a few blocks from Chinatown and within walking distance for many businesses. You can get to Fishermanâ€™s Wharf if you want (one easy option is the #30 Stockton bus). The BART and the MUNI trolleys are within a five to ten minute walk.2. Newly renovated. The guest rooms have been renovated within the last few years, and the lobby has been renovated in the last year. The lobby has a nice seating area with sofas and coffee tables and barstools facing Stockton where you can plug in your laptop and do work.3. Meeting space. The ballrooms and meetings rooms are located below ground level, accessed via escalators. The rooms are large and flexible in terms of format. My meetings required a ballroom, a large meeting room for 40, and six rooms for simultaneous smaller meetings. The GHSF can handle all of this. Because the meeting rooms are on different floors, breaks and snacks can be handled easily without bothering (or being interfered by) other guests. Like the rest of the hotel, these facilities are very up to date.4. Highly functional guest rooms. The guest rooms are efficiently laid out. There are remote controlled blackout screens which keep things dark in the morning hours. The bathroom is aesthetically pleasing. There are lots of plugs throughout. King rooms (the ones I have stayed in) have a comfy chair and ottoman. Nearly all rooms are connected to another room, making it easy to accommodate a larger party. If you are not connecting, the connecting door area is a great place to put a suitcase. The beds have adjustable reading lights. Each room has a mini fridge and a safe. Be careful because it is easy to forget stuff!!!5. Staff. The GHSF has a very professional staff. Many of the staff (especially the bell and curbside staff) have worked there for years. Lyle in particular is very good about helping guests out with their bags, looking out for kids and other stray family members.6. Elevators. For a hotel with so many floors and rooms, the elevators work great. There is an occasional wait, but I never have had to let an elevator pass because of overcrowding. I like the stack of SF Chronicles in the vestibule. The elevators do not cause any noticeable noise (they are located in the middle of an H-shaped floor layout and are some distance from even the nearest room).WHY YOU MIGHT NOT LIKE THE GRAND HYATT SAN FRANCISCOA. Double rooms are very tight. Perhaps this is the reason why there are so many connecting rooms. Sleeping four to a double room is not easy and there is little room to spare.B. Beds are soft and squishy. The combination of double beds and squishy mattresses Is far from ideal. The GHSF could use better mattresses.C. External and internal noise. I stayed on high floors in every stay but still could hear the street, a cab hailing whistle from across the street, traffic, trucks and cable car bells. The interior noise comes from doors opening and closing as well as the toilets, which flush at high velocity. I recommend earplugs.D. Breakfast could be better. The sit down restaurant is very small for a hotel of this size. The buffet does not have extensive choices, but I do give them credit for its healthy options (e.g., egg white frittata). There is also a grab an go setup on the ground floor, which is pretty convenient.E. Front desk could be better. The lobby is small and there are many rooms. The front desk can get really backed up. Theyâ€™ve installed a red arrow to guide the check-in queue, but I donâ€™t expect this to work. There are kiosks available to check in, but I wouldnâ€™t expect anyone to use these. Itâ€™s rare these days to not have my status recognized (I am not looking for a royal treatment but itâ€™s nice to be thanked). On my last stay with my in-laws I was very surprised at how inflexible the staff member was when I said I did not want to have a connecting room. My room was not ready and I never received a call to notify me the room was ready.The above issues are not deal breakers. With a corporate rate, the GHSF can be pretty reasonable, and there are no surprises when it comes to the rooms.

Added this hotel to a weekend in SF at the last minute and what a lucky choice it was! Very very clean and comfortable in every way. I'm not a luxury traveler, so I'm sure there are fancier digs, but I would definitely stay here again!

This Grand Hyatt had a great location, i.e. about 2 min walking from Union Square.However our room was not that spacious as expected. Also the breakfast buffet comprised of much less variety than what was expected from a such a hotel. The concierge and reception service seemed to be really inefficient and in general the atmosphere in the hotel was more hectic than welcoming. This hotel was really impersonal and considering the price of the rooms and relevant service, the value for money was rather poor. I would most probably not go back to this hotel when next in San Francisco.

The Grand Hyatt on Union Sq is right in the center of town and is a well finished hotel. However, you should avoid it right now because there are major civil works on-going around Union Sq...at night time. At 2:15 AM I was awakened by jack hammers! The double glazing is simple not up to the task.

Stayed here for a 30th anniversary trip and it was perfect. Rooms were awesome and totally high tech. The beds were incredibly comfortable. Buffet breakfast a good value for the quality of the food. Location was perfect to get to any place in the city. But the coolest part was the gym on the top floor overlooking the lights of the city - with high tech treadmills and equipment. A definite great place to stay in San Francisco!

I stayed at this hotel for four nights on business. The staff was friendly, courteous and attentive. The black out shades were wonderful - and worked. The bathroom was clean and the rooms offered ample plug-ins for charging your equipment. It is an easy place to stay connected with the office, or tune all that out and enjoy the city. There is lots of storage options - you can really unpack and move-in the room! The location is nice - but at the time of my stay (June 2014) there was a great deal of construction in the immediate area. Not in the hotel and no reflection on the hotel at all, just worth noting in a review if you are looking at staying in Union Square are it will be loud and streets crowded. This location was far enough away from Moscone for me to be able to get some fresh air and experience a bit of the city - but very close to everything and anything the city has to offer. All in all I enjoyed my stay and the amenities of my room. I would say this is a pretty sexy hotel - an excellent place for couples wanting a getaway!

Following a warm greeting by one of the front desk staff and following the efficient check in I got to my room on the 24th floor  The room was modern well equipped with a fantastic view with some nice touches like the jug of milk ,lemon wedge , books on the shelf , electronic window blind .Bed was comfortable I had an adjoining door ,there was some brief noise from the people next door , the bathroom was clean and stylish I liked the bar with the elegant staircase leading to it ,good service and nice reasonably priced food and drink The hotel is in a very good location being just off Union square ,everything you need is in walking distance From the doorman ,front desk staff,bar staff ,and house keeping everyone I came into contact with was friendly and helpful ,this is a really excellent and well run high class hotel I look forward to my next visit

Very good location, near union square. A little bit noisy at night as you are in the town center, but if you are in a higher floors then this should be fine. Breakfast was average with croissants & Danishes being dry, but scrambled eggs tasting nice. Would definitely stay there again.

The rooms in this property were spacious and had lots of preprogrammed buttons for lighting, shades and such.My room was on the 32nd floor. Each room has a sliding glass door that opens slightly to allow fresh air in. My door didn't seal properly so he sound of Union Square far below came in to my room rather loudly. Other than that than it was a wonderful stay.If you are there for meetings, the elevators don't go to the meeting room levels. Also, the elevators can get overwhelmed with people if there is a meeting at has just let out. But, I would definitely stay here again.I took the BART in from SFO and the hotel is an easy walk from the Powell stop.

Here on a trip with my partner, thought this hotel would be nice. It is nice, no doubt, but it severely lacks soul and the staff also seem very indifferent about everything. Do not get me wrong. They are in no way rude. Just lacking some happiness.

Flew down for a long weekend in SF. Grand Hyatt Union Sq was perfect! We upgraded to the club level and that was an awesome plus. Location to BART, great Union Sq shopping, and easy access to Waterfront and Pier 39 was all awesome. Hotel was very nice and inviting and rooms very spacious and luxurious. Never had to wait for a cab out front and hotel staff was excellent. We won't stay anywhere else on our next trip and highly recommend to all who visit SF.

Check in / out: coldly efficient. No smiles. At all. Mezzanine lounge: good business lunch menu, restaurant staff were friendly and efficient. Bar staff were hopeless. Mostly hanging about polishing glasses avoiding customer eye contact. On one evening we asked them for a 2nd round of drinks and they said wait. 45 mins later we gave up and left the table. Rooms: smallish "upgraded" room facing union sq with construction so a bit noisy. Barely any amenities - had to call for bathrobe, slippers, shower cap, you name it. And they never brought the slippers. Major cost cutting ?Conference staff on the top floor and the ballroom seemed stressed and verging on rude. On one occasion they mixed up lunch orders for two groups - the waiter actually took my half eaten plate out of my hand and said: you can't have that. FAb views from the top and the Club. Not sure id pay us$100 for access to the club but we were given 50% discount which was ok - and better value than the ridiculously priced room service menu for breakfast - even by 5* hotel standards. Gym was ok - pretty basic but just about acceptable. Good location, newly renovated, but just over priced and disappointing staff in my view compared to other Grand Hyatts. Westin Market St round the corner was a much better experience overall.

I accompanied my husband on a business trip and we stayed at the Grand Hyatt. The bed was very comfortable and the room was nicely appointed but nothing special. The hotel has limited food and beverage service and the concierge was only somewhat helpful. The best part of the hotel is the location - right next to union square and just about anything else you would like to do. Catching a cab is easy despite the road construction in front of the entrance. If you are looking for a place with a spa or extensive menu - this is not the place for you. Fortunately, all of those amenities are within walking distance. As an aside, I found the people in San Francisco to be very friendly and quite accommodating.

Hotel is fantastic. The rooms are very modern, clean and well appointed. The smart TV is also fabulous. Beds very comfortable and we had a great view from our high floor room- a pre arrival request which the hotel kindly fulfilled. We had room service one night which was very good and well priced. The location is perfect we went shopping a couple of days which was really close by and also walked to Fisherman's Wharf which really wasn't that far. The only small complaint was the bar, we went one night for a few drinks and our waiter was not particularly friendly and very slow! Such a shame as everything else was so good. We found another bar in a different hotel (Parc 55) which was much better. Despite the issue with the bar I would not hesitate to stay here again and would highly recommend.

Had a very nice stay at the Grand Hyatt! The staff was polite and helpful, with the check-in that went nice and quick! Very modern room with great views San Fran. The hotel is in a great location, with plenty of choices between bars, restaurants & shops within immediate walking distance. The concierge desk was extremely knowledgeable and helpful, and recommended for us to take a day trip to Sausalito, which was very enjoyable. All in all ... Great hotel... Fantastic location

The Grand Hyatt welcomed us with open arms, even though we may not have booked like we belong, that's what made it special. This was our final stop over before we hitting the road. The staff at the door were more than welcoming, the reception desk is different to most of the hotels we stayed in this trip, funky and welcoming.The concierge assisted us with a number of special requests and mailing post cards around the world was not a problem.The OneUp Lounge is worth a visit - live music - a good wine selection. The only thing that put a damper on it was the service on the final evening of our stay. But we will not hold that against them. It happens.Our King room, like most rooms in the USA had more than ample room for all the luggage we had with us. Clean crisp and modern.

We stayed in this hotel, as a friend of Mrs C works for the Hyatt chain and recommended this hotel. The building itself is very nice. We had a lovely clean room that overlooked the city, which was amazing at night. It is centrally located and close to just about everything you need. We did not take breakfast, so I am unable to comment about this. The only issue we had, was that the sliding door to the bathroom got stuck in the closed position and it took over an hour to get me out of the bathroom. The maintenance guy took forever to come and no apology was ever made. For me this was just as bad as getting stuck in a lift, it was not a pleasant experience, yet brushed over by the manager I complained to. Not impressed with the service.

Stayed here for 4 nights. On arrival we were greeted extremely cordially, and everything explained. Indeed, throughout our stay, nothing was too much trouble. The beds are extremely comfortable, and the towels changed at least once a day. We didn't eat in the hotel, but we did take advantage of happy hour. The coffee stop by the Concierge gave us enough choice for the morning. The Concierge staff have been very helpful AND informative. The location is ideal for getting about. Would definitely recommend.

I stayed here for three nights for a business conference traveling with my husband. A nicely appointed, comfortable and well laid out business hotel. Great location with easy access to Muni, Bart and cable cars. The bathroom door in our room was odd in that it duplicated a pull curtain and didnâ€™t provide much privacy. I.e. I wouldnâ€™t room with anyone other than a family member or very close friend. Breakfast was less than stellar and expensive.

We were only in town for 2 1/2 days and this was our first visit. So glad we selected this property. The location was superb, near the financial district and very close to Chinatown and major retailers. So happy to see my favorite Italian ladies blouse store, Nara Camiche down the block. Also a short bus or cab ride to North Beach or their Little Italy. Hotel had super comfy beds, ultra modern TV/web system in room(but no coffee maker, to our surprise). They had a lot of elevators (maybe 12) so even though there was a huge conference taking place while we were there, you never had to wait for an elevator and when you got one it wasn't crowded.The concierge staff was the best I've ever experienced. They were our lifeline in a sense, fielding questions graciously and patiently even from the road if we were looking for a restaurant or didn't know what bus to take. The reception staff were also great. They made me want to return to SFO because they made the experience so effortless for a newbie!

Solid choice for a conference hotel. Some of the best conference food. Rooms have been redone and modernized. Staff are outstanding. Public areas are open. Elevator service and be slow and congested. All room amenities you expect. TV channels are slim, and not a lot of choices unless you pay. Location in Union Square is good for food, walking and lots of taxis and town-car services. Some street noise (night and early am) from the ongoing work on Stockton Street at Union Square. Room chair was comfortable. Lots of electric sockets at the desk area and bed. Free wifi. Good bar service.

What a brilliant hotel! Rooms are lovely and ours had a fantastic view of union square through floor to ceiling windows! Service was really good, staff fantastic and really helpful. There was a good choice of TV channels and large safety deposit box. The hotel is decorated to a very high quality and is in a fantastic location. We could not say anything negative about the Grand Hyatt and would definitely stay there again.

Loved the location right on Union Square could walk everywhere whether picking up a day tour or your evening meal or just a quick cup of coffee. The hotel decor was on trend and the staff were friendly and helpful. The bed was comfortable, and the room was quite spacious. The view we had was not good, backed onto some apartment block. I had booked a room overlooking Union Square which they could not give me. This was very disappointing if they cannot provide the requested room they should at least advise you at the time of booking,

We loved the location of this hotel, we were there the week before Christmas and looking over the ice skating and the tree was really wonderful.I would stay here again. Breakfast was a bit of a let down, there was always a huge line (the place was packed) but the actual food was the same every single day. After our 8 nights we were all a bit over it.The beds, rooms and actual hotel was great. The staff were really friendly and helpful, housekeeping was good.

When we arrived we were upgraded to a room that gave us access to the top floor lounge. In here we had beautiful breakfasts, drinks and night time snacks. Our room was large, clean and modern. Only bad thin was the bath was very shallow and short but considering the stunning view over the city we didn't care. The staff where just wonderful and helpful and always smiling. Just perfectly located next to union square, actually jsut perfect

Good position, in Union Square. Room and bathrom with new furniture, Starbucs right next to the hotel. Free and fast Wifi Connection. Nice view, and a fantastic gym where you can see the whole San Francisco skyline.

Fabulous location, bang in the centre of Union Square but this hotel should be like an Ibis or Best Western. They were extremely unhelpful while checking in, made us feel like they were doing a favour while giving us connecting rooms, gave us a low floor ( which also they said were the last connecting rooms left) even though we booked through our Centurion card. A few room lights weren't working when we came in and after telling the housekeeping about 5 times, did they finally sort it out.The first night an obviously drunk and stoned person knocked on my childrens room door repetitively, after we opened the door, he tried to enter and we pushed him out. We called the management and they didnt even bother responding. The next day we left our hotel at 9 am and on returning at 6 pm, we saw the rooms were still dirty and had not been cleaned. We are frequent travelers and I have NEVER ever experienced a Grand Hyatt like this one.There are about 10-15 hotels around the same place. Im sure they offer better service.

This is a large centrally located hotel in Union Square. The thing that sets it apart is the Club Level. Friendliest service I have experienced. Breakfast and appetizers were both good. Best is from 5pm on they have beer, wine, and cocktails with an honor bar (pour your own) service. A really good value if you like a cocktail or two or three! I would definitely stay here again. If you are a walker you can pretty much cover the city from here and work off the great food in SF.

Oh My Gosh, where do I start -- Beautiful hotel at Union Square -- Everyone working at this hotel were so kind and helpful -- We were on 30th floor room with double beds with a fantastic view of Union Square - Just a short walk to catch public transportation -- great eating places nearby -- I can't comment on hotel food or drink as we did not eat or have a drink there -- Check-In and Check-Out very pleasant - I cannot think of one thing to fault with this hotel -- lobby beautiful -- rooms very nice --

Myself and my Husband stayed here for four days middle of May 2014 and really enjoyed our stayThe location is fabulous just minutes from Union square, and China Town on the other side.5/8 mins walk from tram terminal.The rooms are spacious ,clean and quite.The staff are amazing, so helpful, friendly and our every need was met.Great small bar with really good bar food and reasonably prices and music most nights.Happy hour from 5 pm to 7pm on some drinks.

Excellent location and staff, car park on corner opposite was good value for an overnight stay. Shame about the noise from the road works outside.Room was good although servicing was erratic.Enjoyed the food in the restaurant and the service was excellent as far as it went. It would have been better had we had the offer of a bread roll whilst we waited for our mains, also a server could have asked if we needed anything such as mustard (had my own) and how was our food!

Very polite and helpful staff ....Check-in was hassle free and quick! Got put on the 21st floor with great views of San Fran. The hotel room was done to a very high standard (the hotel has just recently been refurbished - bonus!). In my opinion i would say this is the best location to stay while in San Fran. With plenty of choices between bars, restaurants & shops within immediate walking distance from the hotel. The cable cars (which take you to FisherMans Wharf) are about a block away - stunning views on the cable cars leading towards FisherMans Wharf.The hotel offers guests a shuttle to the airport for $16.00. Highly recommend this option as taxis range between $45 - $55 (also baring in mind the shuttle will get you there around the same time as the Grand Hyatt is one of the later stops on the shuttle)All in all ... Great hotel... Fantastic location.

Visited with the husband and twin 15 yr olds. We loved the spot and great open view from the room. Room was a tad small for all of us but as others have said, there's too much to do and see in SF and surroundings to be in room that long. Easy to walk to cable cars. Check in and out was a bit strange with the individual kiosks but staff was very attentive.

Stayed for 4 nights in two adjoining rooms (King attached to 2 doubles) on the 30th floor. There was a special family-stay rate for the adjoining rooms but only if you call reservations directly!! The rooms were very nicely updated and clean but very short on storage space. Might not be an issue for business travelers but one tiny cabinet with 3 drawers (crammed into the closet) wasn't enough for us, who were traveling with 10 days worth of gear. The small fridge was convenient though. Bed was OK; I thought it too mushy but kids and hubby liked them. The bathroom had huge sink and decent counter space but the rolling door was not very quiet and the track created gaps that might bother those very particular about privacy. We had Club rooms with a nice city/partial bay view. For some reason, the check-in staff failed to mention the really nice Club lounge on the 32nd floor. We found out by asking another guest! The Club lounge was well stocked with bottled drinks and had a full breakfast in addition to cocktail hour. Lounge manager David was very friendly. The Concierge was helpful with maps, dining ideas, and discount tour tickets. Lobby lounge had comfy couches near fireplace that was welcome after windy day of touring. Overall this was a well-located, nicely decorated hotel for our San Fran stay.

Unfortunately there was all night work going on outside which we were compensated on when complained so higher rooms are probably better but the rooms were fantastic, clean and very comfy plus the staff were all really great.Would come back as location is incredible!

Stayed from Sunday-Friday for CiscoLive conference. Check-in took a little longer than I hoped, not because of line-ups, but because of the casual and pleasant demeanor of the staff, who were happy to chat. I had just gotten off a 5+hr flight, so I wouldn't have minded that going a tad faster. 17th floor room was very spacious and clean, no defects with carpet or walls that I saw. Wifi worked well throughout the hotel. All staff that I encountered were smiley and helpful, including the staff at the on-site restaurant, where I ate dinner 3 times. Not a vast menu, but food is tasty and service is fast.Conveniently located next to Union Square Park, and close to other amenities like Walgreens (for those late-night snack needs) and several restaurants (2 great breakfast places 1 block over on Powell?).Would definitely stay again.

The Grand Hyatt is located in a great location in Union Square in San Francisco. It was easy to get to all of the cities main attractions and had a great view of the city. The staff was amazing and prompt with any extra needs that I had. The rooms were modern and nicely furnished. The beds were comfortable but not the best hotel sleep I have ever had. I enjoyed an evening meal at the restaurant in the hotel as well and the food was very good. I would definitely stay here again if I were in the area.

We really enjoyed staying in this hotel, the location was perfect I went to sleep at night watching the shoppers on Macy's 9 floors. The staff were especially helpful with everything and the rooms were very modern with great views. Minor annoyance was they were a bit on the small side we had a bit of trouble finding space to put empty suitcases, however, perhaps they expect a family of 4 to rent 2 rooms??? We stayed for 5 nights and had the best time ever in San Francisco. Would absolutely stay at this hotel again.

My wife and I stayed for several nights at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco as a part of a corporate event for my wife's company. For the most part, I was extremely impressed by the hotel, its amenities, and the service we received throughout our stay, but a few relatively minor annoyances keep me from being able to give the hotel a 5-star review. Let me start with the good: I really loved our room. It was fairly small, but the layout was functional, and the modern decor made it feel bigger than it really was. I also loved the floor-to-ceiling windows that gave us a beautiful view overlooking downtown San Francisco! The bed was also very comfortable and offered a good selection of pillows from which to choose. In addition to the room, I was also very impressed by the service I received from the Concierge desk. Having never been to San Francisco before, the Concierge helped provide some great recommendations for places to go and routes to take to get there, and this service really helped make my trip the amazing experience that it was. Finally, I was very impressed by the event staff and amenities that the hotel offered. The ballrooms were very nice, the food was fantastic, the service very good, and all-combined it created a great atmosphere for a company celebration.Unfortunately, there were several aspects of our stay that left a little bit to be desired. My first gripe is the shower in the hotel room. I absolutely love rain showers, but the shower head needs to be further away from the wall in order to be effective. Every time I showered, I felt like I had to stand against the shower wall in order to be immersed by the water. Not the worst thing in the world, but inconvenient nonetheless. And while I'm on the topic of the bathroom, I would also recommend that they invest in higher-quality towels. I've had better towels in far worse hotels. Another let-down occurred one night when my wife contacted the front desk requesting a pair of scissors to be brought to our room. However, no one ever came, even after several follow-up calls. I would expect better service from a hotel of this quality. And finally, I personally just didn't care for the Union Square area of San Francisco. The next time I return, I will most likely choose to stay in a different area of town.

Positive: 1) The hotel was just recently remodeled, so the rooms and surrounds look quite nice. New and/or well-maininted furniture and fixtures. 2) The views from the Regency Club are panoramic and the staff there excellent. 3) Excellent and professional front desk team. They got the stay off to an energetic and positive start.Neutral: The place can get busy, so just be aware that there will be a lot of activity in the lobby and club.Negative: None.Elite benefits: Diamond members are welcomed quite nicely and treated very well. All benefits delivered like clockwork.Comparison with other Hyatts: There is often discussion about whether to stay here or at the Embarcadero Hyatt. This Grand Hyatt has newer and nicer rooms. The Hyatt Regency Embarcadero has a much nicer Regency Club with better views. The Regency also has rooms with balconies. If the room itself is most important to you, stay the Grand Hyatt. If little extras make your trip nicer, stay at the Regency. In the end, both are great hotels.

I should have written this a while ago. This hotel has the best location in town. I traveled solo and nothing made me feel intimated nor unsafe while staying in this wonderful hotel. Personal safety is my prime concern while traveling alone.Situated right in the heart of Union Square, you can practically walk out of the hotel and begin shop shop shop until you drop. I stayed on the Grand Club level for 4 nights with free access to Grand Club lounge, which was a wonderful experience. I was also given a very well appointed room with sweeping view of the Union Square overlooking Macys. Staffs were generally helpful and welcoming when I dropped by and asked for direction. I must say, this is a perfect stay for anyone who travels alone and wants to be close to all actions.I managed to manoeuvre comfortably downtown, but found the street a bit rough at night. Just avoid wandering around at night on your own. I had stayed at the Ritz before. But if you ask me Ritz or Hyatt? I would go for Hyatt in terms of seamless service, value and location. I will definitely come back as this hotel serves my purpose perfectly!

Terrific place to stay in San Francisco. It's about 5 blocks from the BART stop and an otherwise great location downtown. The staff are incredible. From start to finish they did everything in their power to make our stay perfect. We arrived at 3:30 and a room wasn't ready for us (check in is at 3:00). Nikita at the front desk comped drinks in the bar for us while we waited. There was also an issue with what package we booked but that was swiftly resolved. The rooms are pretty spacious for San Francisco and the beds are comfortable. There is a reception each Saturday with wine and some sort of "taste" from their restaurant. During our visit, it was meatballs and they were delicious. The OneUp Bar is pretty cool- Boa is the best bartender. There is HH everyday at 4:00 (I think it goes until 6:00) and it's a nice place to have a beverage after walking around all day. The gym is OK. The lay out is a little odd because there is a stretching area immediately upon exiting the elevators so that can be awkward. But there are several treadmills and weight machines and complimentary headphones if you've forgotten yours. My minor complaint is that we did not care for the breakfast here at all. Hubs had the buffet and I had the maple bacon benedict and they were both just meh. We opted to eat elsewhere the other days. I love the Hyatt though and this trip truly made me realize how great it can be to be loyal to a specific hotel chain. Thanks to all of the staff that made our trip so great!

The location of this hotel is ideal. It's right beside union square,which is the main shopping area in San Francisco. The staff is very friendly and helpful and they have a very cool reception area. The rooms are nicely appointed and the beds are comfortable. We had a room with a great view of union square. My only issue was the bathroom in the bedroom we were given. We got a handicap accessible room so there was no floor divider for the shower. This meant that the water would seep out of the shower and on to the rest of the bathroom floors. The staff were nice enough though to provide extra floor towels to keep the water contained. Otherwise we had no complaints.

We chose The Grand Hyatt to be close to Union Square. It was a wonderful location, just down from Macy's and so close to Union Square and Powell Street. It was so easy to walk to great shopping experiences and restaurants. We preferred to stay closer to Union Square than Fisherman's Wharf as it was less touristy. Our room was extremely modern, clean and well appointed. As other reviewers have commented upon, the rooms are not sound proof. We could easily hear the families in the next rooms. It did not distract from our overall hotel experience though. Very approachable, knowledgeable and friendly concierge and valet staff. Great to have a hotel car to choose from to take us to the airport. Would definitely stay at The Grand Hyatt if we are ever fortunate enough to visit San Francisco again.

The hotel has been redone since I last stayed there, and cosmetically, it is great. The restaurant had some good choices for breakfast ($25-45) and courteous staff and waiters. The room was clean, had a decent space to work, fairly standard bed, TV, and armchair. The shower had a nice big shower-head, implying a satisfying shower but at full pressure, the water barely fell one foot away from the front wall. Rinsing shampoo out of my hair was an exercise in banged knees and elbows. The views from the conference rooms on the 36th floor were fantastic.

Great location almost on top of Union Square. Self-park just across the street for $42/night with full in/out access is a BIG plus in any city but especially SF. There are SO many terrific places to eat AND DRINK within a very short walk that the fact you do not need a cab to/from dining or to shop or to grab a cable car easily justifies the price.Very easy check in...one of the 5 most comfortable mattresses....our room did NOT have a view worthy of the word 'view'...but having been to SF dozens of ties I don't feel it necessary to pay up for a view when I want the room to sleep...great shower...clean as a whistle....quiet.. (we were on the 3rd floor but not over the street)....comfortable and friendly.((I recently gave a so-so review to a Hyatt in San Jose and if the fellow who berated me for that review stayed at the Grand Hyatt he would understand what I meant when I said the San Jose property was NOT what one expects of a Hyatt.)

This hotel was recently renovated and was a great stay for my mom and I. The location is in Union Square and it is right across from Starbucks and close to a few diners to grab breakfast. The room was very comfortable and modern. I really enjoyed staying here are would definitely stay here again.

We stayed here for the last leg of our honeymoon. It's a nice hotel with modern & comfortable rooms. Reception staff are great & concierge are also excellent. Breakfast is good with a range of choices. Location is excellent, I would recommend this hotel for a comfortable stay in San Fran!

We didn't know what to expect from this hotel but since we arrived everyone was ready to help us out. We were amazed by the customer service we got from every single employee. Once we got to our very home-like rooms we were surprised by how everything was prepared for us to stay there. When we finally laid down we all just said "wow!"; the beds are SO good and oh so comfortable.The location, the beds, the service, the lobby, everything is just perfect. I would absolutely recommend it and will definitely go back in the future.Thank you for an amazing vacation!

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco is like having a luxury vehicle which you cant drive because there is no fuel in it.When you pay the kind of money they charge, you would expect the basic stuff to work.1. My booking was for a king bedroom and what I got was a double queen room.2. Squeaky elevators make you feel like you are in some 1960s building where there is some bloke pulling your elevations with a pulley. The elevators take unbelievable time to arrive and when they do, you hardly get space to stand.3. The Air conditioning in the room would not work.4. There is no water pressure in the bathrooms.The rooms are equipped with the most chic and trendy stuff, but if you dont have the air conditioning in order and you dont have enough pressure in the water whats the point?I would never like to see a service man come into my room when I am on a vacation to repair the water pressure or air conditioning. I pay the hotel good money to ensure that this is taken care of. Unfortunately this happened at the "Grand" Hyatt and to my surprise, the guy could only fix the air conditioning and could do nothing about the water pressure.Location of the hotel is very good and the restaurant in the hotel, "One Up" serves some good food.Overall I do not think this hotel is value for money. I would not stay here again and I will not recommend this to anyone.

The hotel is very well situated. The rooms are small but functional. Despite my platinum status, we could get no higher than the 5th floor because the hotel was booked over Memorial Day weekend; there was some minor street noise but it wasn't terrible. The hotel is modern and seems to have been recently renovated. It was very clean and the staff were universally responsive and friendly. We enjoyed the on-site restaurant for breakfast and snacks; while pricey, it was convenient and very good.

Just spent 4 nights at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco with my wife and 11 year old daughter and had a really enjoyable stay. Before travelling we requested a room on a high floor, and we're given floor 32 with a fantastic view. Our room had a single King bed which would have been just about ok for the three of us, but we asked for a roll away bed for our daughter which the hotel provided at no extra charge. From check in to check out, all the hotel staff we came across were friendly and helpful-a special mention for Dave in the Club Lounge, who went out of his way to make us feel welcome. The lounge is on the 32nd floor and we had access, which I wasn't expecting. The views from the lounge are spectacular. The room we had was modern-the bed was very comfy, and the bathroom well appointed with a walk in shower.The hotel is conveniently located a block away from Union Square, near all the shops, the cable car lines and many restaurants. It is a pleasant area to stroll around, particularly round by Grace Cathedral which is only a few blocks away up the hill.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Grand Hyatt and will definitely book there again if we come back to San Francisco (which I'm sure we will as we loved it).

This hotel had a perfect location for my first visit to San Francisco. Many key landmarks were within relatively easy walking distance. We had to wait on a long line to check in over the Memorial Day holiday but the wait was made pleasant with free appetizers and drinks. Free internet and comfortable rooms were also great!

We were delighted with the look of the hotel ... it looks incredibly stylish, and is impressive from the moment you walk into the reception area. I like the open feel of the reception area, with no long counter separating you from the reception staff, and the staff are very attentive to your needs whenever you walk past.The mezzanine level is great as well, and the cocktail bar is a lovely venue in the evenings.The room impressed us when we checked in, with the automatic and motorised blackout blinds, the impressive smart televisions. We were pleased with the free wifi (more hotels really need to realise this is a must nowadays - unless they have something to hide and don't want guests on social media!)The room looked great, the appliances worked great, and the beds were plush and luxurious.Where the hotel is let down, is some of the little things you wouldn't normally notice in a hotel, but that make a huge difference to your quality of stay ...- the first was the fact that we had a large gap underneath our room door (in places it was just under an inch!). This meant that you could hear every single noise in the corridor (including whispered conversations), and conversely, the people in the corridor could hear everything from inside the room. It's incredible how much a night's sleep can be disturbed by footsteps, doors, conversations & luggage and the movements of hotel staff. In the end, we used the spare blanket in the wardrobe as a slight noise buffer in front of the door, but this was not very successful;- the second thing was that the aircon just did not seem to work. We lowered the temperature on the control panel to it's coldest setting (which is only 18Â°C / 64.4Â°F), but this made absolutely no difference. The room was not cooling down. We rang reception, and asked if someone could look into it while we were out for the day, which they said they would. There was no change that night. In speaking to other guests, they noticed the aircon in their rooms wasn't working properly, either, and the aircon in the gym was also ineffective, making for a hot gym area. To look at the systems, the panels seem to say that they're set at a comfortable temperature, but the reality is that the air temperature doesn't seem to reflect the same thing, with the air temperature being far too warm.So, while we loved the location, the design, the staff, the wifi and the televisions, we didn't get a good night's sleep, which is - after all - what you want most from a hotel.This hotel is lovely, but if you can find some way of getting a room with a door that fills the frame and an air conditioning system that works, then do.

The hotel rooms are typical San Francisco...not very big, but that's what you get there unless you're willing to pay and arm and a leg. The Hyatt staff is very nice, very helpful. I was there 4 years ago and I have to say overall the people in service positions in SF are much nicer and friendlier than they were 4 years ago. Not sure why but it was obvious.

Great location perfect for my business needs ...central and easy to get to and from the location...would urge you to pay up for the Bay view ...requires a higher floor north of 20th for best views...the rooms are plesantly appointed and roomy enough for business or pleasure...staff very helpful... Room got abit stuffy during the night... not sure why...was told that they shut down the AC...not a very good idea...Food in the Hotel was decent and easy to get in and out if time was an issue...Solid experience for my business purposes....

We stayed for 4 days in mid May. The hotel staff were all extremely pleasant and helpful.The hotel room was large enough to accommodate 3 adults in the room with no problem. The rooms were extremely neat and clean. The location was great to access Chinatown, numerous upscale shops and resturants. We did alot of walking and felt very safe in this area. We did a 2 day hop on/hop off bus tour(BigBus) that worked out great for first time visitors to the area and there was a stop two blocks from this hotel. Would certainly recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Read several prior reviews. Food in Club solid and staff extremely pleasant. Steve at front desk most helpful. Only two negatives. Later in night they shut AC down and this is annoying! Secondly don't take room on Union Sq side. Too much construction noise. As others have stated location is peerless. Joann secured hard to get brunch reservations. Again biggest plus is can do attitude of staff.

I stayed here for 5 nights on a business trip. The hotel is nicely located in Union Square so it is easy to get around from there. The room was fine, clean and quiet. The restaurant is great - I ate there for a few breakfast and dinner meals and the food was good. The staff was very nice.

Airline lost our luggage and the hotel supplied an extensive "emergency package". Thank you!Every staff member we encountered was super friendly. The Grand Club Lounge served a nice little breakfast and the hors d'oeuvres in the evening were good as well.Upgraded to a "Bay" view and our room was on the 21st floor. It was not high enough to really see the bay over the buildings so next time I would not except unless it was the 25th floor or high.Room was very nice as was the bathroom. I liked the decor of the entire hotel actually! I would return to this hotel for sure.

I recently travelled to the Hyatt for a business event. They have upgraded the place recently, and its quite nice. The lobby is the newer Hyatt intimate casual theme, where you wander aimlessly and end up bumping into a staff standing at a bar table with a PC :). Checkin is pretty easy. Poor attempt at humor. Rooms are nice, clean and modern. One can tell they were reno'd. Nicer newer furniture, but old HVAC system (Read here noisy). The desks are a built in wall unit that oddly enough are totally functional. For example. Sitting at the desk working, on a call etc, one cannot see the TV. Because its all built into the wall, its restricting. The TV has a swing arm, but its llimited. Cool feature though, there is a PC interface on the wall at the desk so one could put their PC onto the TV for say work, Netflix etc. Speaking of internet. Its slow. The upgrade is faster, but its expensive. On the upper end of what I pay for hotel web.I didn't get to the gym or restaurant, wasn't there long enough . Room service was good, but spendy. there is a starbucks across the street for the morning java, but its heaving, literally lined up out the door all AM.Taxis. Be careful I honestly don't know how San Fran taxi drivers get their license, cause I had 2 that didn't know my destination downtown (other large hotels, really?) and didn't know MY hotel - get in the taxi say 10 blocks away, say Grand Hyatt, and they pull out their GPS and start asking questions in poor English. I actually got out of 1 at the Hyatt front door and told the concierge that guy should not be allowed to get Hyatt guests, he is totally lost. From there on I made sure they knew where they were going before I got in. I walked away from several when they had no clue.

Stayed here during the Cisco Live conference In May. It is right next to Union Square. While our 7th floor room didn't have a view, we were still impressed at the cleanliness and how comfortable it was. The bed especially was so comfortable which made it hard to get up in the morning. We did have the hotel buffet breakfast. We was spectacular-all types of fruit, cold and warm oatmeal, egg, bacon, sausage, yogurt, pancakes, and so much more. It was $25 for each adult which was expensive, but super delicious. The staff was nice. The valet parking was $62 and self parking was $41. We had a rental car so we done self parking. Overall great stay.

I recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt SF while attending a conference. The room was spacious, modern, and clean. I had a view of Union Square which was fantastic! The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. I used the concierge services a couple of times and they were very helpful. The hotel is centrally located close to shopping, dining and tourist attractions. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to SF.

Stayed here for 3 nights during this past Memorial Day weekend with my 18 & 20 yr old sons. I booked Bay View room and got exactly that. On the 25th floor and has a Superb view of the Bay and Alcatraz and without a doubt the extra $25 or whatever the per night difference was! The location of this hotel is absolutely perfect. Super easy and close walk to Chinatown. Easy to get to cable car stop at Powell & Market. Very easy to get to anyplace and anything you needed and the surrounding area was well populated and felt very safe even at night. We went to a Giants game on Sat. night and walked there. Probably close to a mile and a half but it's a non-hilly route and hundreds of others walking to (and back from) the game so again, very safe.The hotel itself was very nice. Clean, comfortable room. All of the staff was helpful and friendly but the Concierge staff was exceptional. They really made a difference and had quick answers to all of our questions. Provided many good suggestions re: restaurants and very helpful with transportation options when needed. The only small disappointment was that the top floor bar which I'd seen in the hotel information no longer exists. I was told that during the remodel of a year or so ago it was turned into banquet space. I will without a doubt stay here on my next visit to the city and recommend it to friends and family!

We stayed for 3 days in mid May. In all respects, we found the hotel to be an ideal base for our visit to San Francisco. The location was perfect and the staff was very helpful. Our room on the 19th floor was very comfortable with a great view of Union Square.We had breakfast at the hotel each morning .Although breakfast is expensive, it was very good and convenient.I would strongly recommend the hotel

Great location! Easy walk to anywhere. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We especially enjoyed Dante and Jaime in the bar upstairs. Excellent service, and if you go, you must try the Moscow Mule! Best drink ever! Although they kept mentioning this special copper cup that they used to serve them in, but apparently they would disappear as fast as they got them in. Anyway....the hotel is awesome! We hired a town car through the hotel and it was a pleasant ride to and from the airport. Cab to the ballpark was about $10. Our room was on the twentieth floor with tiny bay views. Paid extra for bay view, but ask for higher so you can see more. Bed was comfy. Room was quiet even though we were by an ice machine. Slept like a rock! Bathroom amenities were restocked plentiful everyday. Short on hot water one day, but apparently the issue was fixed quickly. We did not try the restaurant but had room service one morning of coffee, champagne, and OJ and it arrived quickly. The coffee pot in the room is your standard hotel one cup pot, but the room service coffee was so much better! Valet was a little spendy, but it's San Francisco. We didn't pull the car out once. We would stay here again in a heart beat!

Very once hotel.Pros:.Very central.Goo value for money.Staff are very helpful.clean hotels room.Spacious hotel room.Nice bathroom with shower and bath.v comfortable beds.The gym is excellent, big, all new equipment and looking over the city.Cons:.More of a business hotel.No bar in the lobby.we didn't like the standing check in- bit weird.The rooms are connected so you can hear everything in the next room. We had 4 teenaged next to us who decided at 4am in the morning to party in their room. When we called reception they said they couldn't do anything about it..

Booked 3 nights, had a room on the 33rd floor, great views. Rooms clean and comfortable. Close to all transport and shopping. We had buffet breakfast each morning only because it was included in the room deal. Had the car parked by valet parking and didn't see it until we booked out, that was expensive but was a hire car (had to do something with it).

Recently renovated with a upscale modern feel. Great views of the city and bay from our 29th floor room. The upgrade charge of about $25 was worth it. Ron at the front desk very helpful as were the concierge staff. George in the dining room was great. if only they had not moved the bar/dining from the top (36th floor i think) to the 2nd level this would be 5 stars. Missed that view with Makers Mark.

My first stay in both San Francisco and at Hyatt. I stayed for a week during a conference and would definitely stay again. The staff was super friendly. The room had a great view of the city looking towards ATT Park and just a short walk to the Moscone Center where the conference was. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom had nice hot water and good pressure. My only criticism would be the slow internet (which was free and is fairly typical at most hotels I stay at) and the slow response time on the TV while changing channels (again, fairly typical). I would definitely stay at this hotel again

This hotel has nice rooms but they are not very quiet. There was a lot of outside noise. After our second night there was no hot water in the morning. During our last night a large party was going on in a nearby room until 3 am. Security finally shut it down at 3.

I stayed 4 nights on a business trip and it is a good hotel well located very close to Union Square and a very short walk to Market Street. The room was large and comfortable, well equipped and included free wifi. The bar was a little non descript and the food we ordered was pretty bland. It was just a snack but there are a lot of good eateries outside the hotel that are better and a lot cheaper.

I would gladly stay at this Grand Hyatt again. My reaction upon entering my room was "this feels tight"...small like a European room. Next thoughts were "it is quite sexy." The room featured a huge window with a great city / water view and an automatic shade with controls between the beds. The style of the room was very contemporary and also a bit European in feel with rich wood and leather accents...including the trash can. There were convenient snaking reading lights mounted by the beds. Slow closing toilet lid. Then for good measure there were buttons by the door for "welcome" and "leave" options that automatically turned on/off lights and lowered/raised the window shade. Unusual features that just made the room feel sexy in spite of its size. It had a mounted safe and small fridge.Only gripes with the room were disappointing shower pressure and the window, which you could slide open just a crack, would sometimes move with the outside winds.When I arrived for some reason my reservation was not in the system but after a few minutes the very pleasant staff figured a way to accommodate my 2 night stay even though no availability was expected on the second night. The reception area was very different than the typical desk. The staff kind of wanders around a three point pedestal that doesn't separate them from guests...unusual but made the interaction more intimate.The gym was nice as they come. The elevator to the floor it's on opens to an area for stretching, stepping, or ball exercises that was large enough for probably a dozen people to work. I wondered if that was it before turning the corner to a well equipped area with sophisticated cardio machines, weights, and machines. There was even a healthy diet vending machine.As others have said the hotel is located in the heart of San Francisco action within walking distance or short cab ride to lots of things to do.

I attended the Cisco conference in San Francisco last week and stayed at the Grand Hyatt. I am normally a Hilton guy but they were fully booked. From the moment I arrived at the Grand Hyatt I was treated like royalty. From the experience at the front desk all the way to my room I felt like the king in a palace. The rooms are nothing short of amazing, they are decorated in a very elegant and contemporary theme. The rooms are a great size and have push button controls for the entire room right at the bed. If you are going to visit San Francisco I highly recommend staying at the Grand Hyatt.

At the lobby you will be greeted by their cheerful concierge before entering a poshy lobby that coaxed you comfortably into homely mood. Their room was considered spacious, not huge. Beds comfortable and soft, though i thought it could be better for a 5 star Hyatt!Location is definite a win. It is near to a lot of shopping and restaurants.On the overall I would think the lobby is prettier than their room! So if you are paying more than USD 300, I would go for another hotel. There are so many hotels in San Francisco, NO FRET!http://missconneckions.blogspot.sg/2014/05/i-found-success-in-my-old-neighborhood.htmlHappy searching for a hotel! Point to note: San fran is considered a walking city... so it isn't too far from anywhere if you stick to the city-centre. Avoid the blacks dodgy areas though... they do look quite shaddy. Try looking for a spot near the harbour,,, better seafood for dinner!

Stayed at the Hyatt for 3 nights in early May. I chose this hotel for its location and have stayed in other Hyatts so was expecting a comfartable stay. It was what I was expecting and better. The service was fantastic, very polite and and helpful. The room was clean and moderate in size and the views from my room on the 23rd floor was great. Location is perfect for anyone wanting to explore the city as you are near the cable car, tour buses and the BART. Also the shopping disctrict is right on your doorstop. Breakfast is tasty and staff chatty. My only negative would be the noise from adjacent room as you are able to hear people chatting. Well worth a stay.

We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Grand Hyatt. First impressions were excellent. The lobby area was clean and sweet. Not too big, but had verything it needed. Staff everywhere to help with luggage from the car and then to the room. Check in was smooth and faultless. We were cheked into floor 5 and room 520. Had a lovely view of Union Square and and Macy's! Though be warned that there is a fair boit of buildwork going on around union Square and in the evenings especially at the weekend it was rather noisy. We felt that the floor we were on was just too noisy. Would have been a better on a high floor with less noise. The room itself was lovely. Had safe, Fridge, Iron, Hairdryer. The bed was lovely and comfortable. Location was unbeatable for us. 2 min walk to union Square and right next to All shops. China Town as only 2 blocks away, though was rather dissapointed that it all closed down by 10pm! Would definatley stay again, though making sure we had a higher floor.

Great location, good hotel and good service.Electric Curtains, great view if you can get a room on the square. Service was good.The only 2 drawbacks: -breakfast is very expensive (around $28) if you don't have it included in the package.-TV programming is very bad and lacking. no HBO, no showtime, very basic channels, could not even watch champions league game.Overall I enjoyed my stay and it is a very good hotel.

Excellent stay half a block from Union square. Super comfortable beds, updated rooms. Staff very friendly and helpful. Great location for exploring downtown with Chinatown nearby as well. Numerous restaurants/shops all within easy walking distance. Lobby is small, but who wants to hang out in the lobby? Great location for exploring downtown SF and highly recommended. Will definitely return in future.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Grand Hyatt! The hotel staff was wonderful. The location is at Union Square providing easy access to many fun things in San Francisco. The room was immaculate! The only negative is there is a bit of street noise if you are on a lower floor. We loved our stay!

The Grand Hyatt has been my "go to" hotel for years in San Francisco. Recently updated, each of the rooms are modern and the beds are super comfy. Most importantly, the service is top notch! I highly recommend this hotel. If you are a regular, they never fail to remember your name. The staff at this hotel takes pride in their work and they actually care. Simply amazing. PS - Sneak to the 36th floor for the views, incredible!

I think that this hotel is a no mistake choice due to location (which is perfect near Square Union); if you choose it, one will understand why (hop on hop off busses the perfect way to get initially oriented, renowned cable car next corner, big shopping area etc etc). Overall good hotel, rooms and service. It is advisable to take from the hotel some day trips like Yosemite, Napa Valley etc. I did not regret one minute...

From the moment we stepped through the door the Grand Hyatt offered us a great experience. We utilized the web check-in option and when we noted our arrival time of 12 noon didn't expect to receive an email advising us our room was ready 2 hours before check in, tick number one. Tick number two came when I inquired regarding a late checkout and reception staff were more than accommodating.Location is top notch, for me Union Square is the epicentre of San Fran and it was so easy to branch out in all directions either on foot, bus or trolley car. I must admit though USD6 for the trolley ride can be a little steep if you are only going one or 2 stops.Rooms are decorated with an earthy modern design and offered more than enough room for us. I'm not a fan of showers over baths but at least this one wasn't too difficult to get in an out of. I am a fan of tea and coffee making facilities in room and unfortunately the only thing on offer was a drip filter in the room, a quirky idea but it was missing a part and there wasn't any milk in the fridge to have with it only that revolting powdered chemical "creamer" mix. Another great option on offer is a morning breakfast bar in the foyer offering Starbucks coffee, fruit, cereals and pastries etc. A great option to grab something light and take back to your room rather than a full breakfast in the restaurant. We visited the bar on a couple of occasions and the staff were very engaging and helpful. As we weren't overly hungry one night we ordered a snack off the bar menu and it was lovely. A few tips for San Fran... don't bother with shuttles from the airport, at approx. $50 the taxi and speedy trip was worth the $20 extra. Carry USD1 notes at all times for public transport as they don't give change. Don't bother with duty free alcohol, it is so much cheaper at Walgreens or any grocery store.And lastly for a hotel in such a busy location we had absolutely no traffic noise on the 20th floor.

I stayed here for x5 nights on my honeymoon and we were very happy with the level of service and room size. Excellent location too. Our only criticism was the pillows...way too soft we stayed on level 3 and asked twice to be placed on a higher floor. The cleaners started vacuuming outside our door and asking for cleaning at 8.30am!!! Way too early.

We were very happy with our recent stay at the Grand Hyatt. We spent the extra money to get the "city view on a higher floor" and were happy with Room 2803 - very neat city view. The hotel lobby was ALWAYS very busy, no matter what time of day. I would highly recommend doing the web check-in and web check-out (which we did, and it was very easy and efficient).The bed was relatively soft, so it wasn't the best night of sleep, but the pillows were amazing, and the overall level of the room was great...very modern and updated. Extremely clean. Transportation in the area was pretty easy...we took a bus a few blocks from the hotel to get down to the Alcatraz tour pier, took a trolley car on our way back, and were close to the BART to go to/from the airport. We even took a Metro to AT&T Park for a Giants game, and then just walked back, which wasn't bad. Although we didn't use it, we checked out the hotel's gym, which was GREAT!!! We wish we had a gym like this to use...amazing view from the gym too, as it was on the 2nd floor from the top. You can also go up to the top floor for a wonderful view of the city.Great stay, and we felt it was a good value for the level of hotel, especially as compared to other area hotels.

When looking for a place to stay there are usually a few brands that you can count on to provide a nice upscale room in a great location. Hyatt is one of those brands. We booked a king room with a city and bay view. The room was very clean and was furnished in a modern tone. The rooms are not large but they are adequately sized. We had some amazing evening views of the city and the bay.The hotel also has a nice bar area that is very relaxing. We did not dine at the hotel because we met some friends for dinner near the wharf. We also left the next day very early to make a drive to Lake Tahoe so we did not have breakfast at the hotel. I felt this hotel is in a great location no matter what you want to do in SF. The only complaint I have is one regarding a hotel staff member. My wife left her cell phone in our room and we realized this about 50 feet from our room when we were leaving. One of the cleaning staff saw us leave the room and then when we asked to be let into the room to get her phone, the staff person refused and told us we needed to go to the front desk. I was kind of irritated because she saw us leave the room with our luggage. If we were not the room tenants, what were we doing in that room? She could have called the front desk to verify that we were the guests in that room and that would have saved me the trip down many floors and then back up again. But by midday I changed my mind and realized she was just doing her job. It was clearly our fault for not making sure we had everything with us when we left the room. I will definitely stay here again when in SF.

This. Hyatt is direct on Union Sq and has a good overall quality. The standard rooms are small but clean and kind of modern. The side with the bay view is great, wake up in the morning with sunshine, the bed quality is excellent . The lobby is a negative point, very small and not that many seats too. Not convenient for some talk meetings. The service is good but not over friendly. Overall a good business and (premium) tourist hotel. It can be pricy in the hot season and when the city is booked well. The gym is good and has a great view of the bay.

First time in San Francisco and this hotel exceeded our expectations. Great location and the room was beautiful. It had a nice view and the restaurant was good. The customer service from the staff was excellent, very friendly.

Room was great with breathtaking city view. Room service was excellent - most of all we enjoyed the delicious breakfast - the location is so central with Union Square a few steps away -- would definitely choose Hyatt when back in San Francisco

The check-in was fast and friendly, the lobby was modern and tasteful, and the rooms were classic and comfortable. The views from the top floor (all conference rooms) was worth the elevator ride - don't miss the chance! The location was close to shopping, a park and a cable-car stop. The room had electric shades that could be dropped to make the room totally dark or you could leave them open for a view of the city lights. The only thing that was less than excellent was the work-out facility. Stationary machines in the actual work-out room, but to lift weights, stretch or do yoga you were in the hallway where the elevators opened up.

Enjoyed our stay in the hotel which was renovated recently. The room is large, bathroom is nicely renewed with contemporary design.
