Our room has the view of the Union Square and it's walking distance to lots of shopping, restaurants and parks. It maybe a bit noisy when there are shows at the Union Square but it usually doesn't start until 9:00 am. Their gym is well equipped and is located on the 35th floor of the hotel with a spectacular view of the City and the ocean. Do not miss the chance to see a better view from there. In general, great hotel in the best location. Loved it.

I stayed a week at this hotel on business. Check-in and check-out was very efficient and making use of the online facilities made it even better.I was a little disappointed by the room (not as good as some Hyatt hotels). There was an ice machine right outside the door that made a noise 24hrs a day so not a great start. The bathroom was good but the shower was poor. The rest of the room was very good - comfy bed, good facilities and tech.I ate breakfast a couple of times and the first time I had to wait 10mins to be seated and a further 10mins to be served - not great.I ate dinner twice in the lounge restaurant - the quality and quantity were excellent but the price was very high for hotel food.In summary, very good hotel, great location, good service and would stay again, but look out for ice machines, don't be in a rush for breakfast and be prepared to pay a lot for the food / drink.

From the moment I walked in, I was appreciated. I'd received Diamond status via a challenge, and had 2 free nights from signing up for the credit card. I was given a room on the 32nd floor, with a floor to ceiling glass door covering the western wall. The views were incredible. I had access to the Grand Club lounge and used it often. The views from the Club equaled or exceeded those from my room. The food at the Club was average, but adequate, and the coffee machine I enjoyed. My room was small, but large enough to contain a sitting area in front of the window. I would have liked to step outside for pictures, but the patio door opened only a few inches. The bathroom is comfortable, and decorated with a modern touch. The staff were welcoming. I would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Check in was flawless, and you can't beat the location of the hotel in the center of the downtown. The valet parking was stiff, $60 per day!The room facing the Union Square and partial ocean view was fantastic. The size of the room was adequate, and the bathroom was nice enough.Didn't use any of restaurant in the hotel, but my wife and I have used the grand executive lounge extensively. Nice view and atmosphere, but strange that we had to pay for the alcoholic beverages!! The breakfast was OK, not great but adequate.Overall, I would recommend it to anyone who visit SF and want to stay near the center of the downtown since all the department stores are nearby!

Decent hotel with great facilities and proximity to the famous SF Union Square, which is the heart of access to the financial district and shopping haven. Only setback is noise and chatters from second floor bar during the weekends.

The hotel is of a good standard but the location is fantastic, right next to Union square at the heart of San Francisco. The food and drink within the hotel is very pricy so I'd recommend going elsewhere to wine and dine. Other than that a pleasant stay.

First stay here and thoroughly recommend, the location on Stockton St is just one block from Union Square so shoppers paradise, all the staff I had contact with were polite and helpful. The hotel has been refurbished recently and my 14th floor room was spacious and very comfortable, bathroom has a modern feel with one of those odd shaped but shallow wash basins, fabulous over bath shower, plenty of decent sized, soft, fluffy towels. There is a sort of dressing room joining the bedroom and bathroom, with a welcome vanity unit, plenty of space for ladies to do hair and make up and a magnifying mirror, just a shame there wasn't a better quality of light in that area.I would suggest familiarising yourself with the room before heading out for jetlagged dinner and drinks ... the blackout blind is in fact electronically operated, but there is NO switch anywhere near the window, they are located just inside the door and in the panel at each side of the bed!The large flat screen tv is brilliantly improved with the built in TV Programme/Channel guide on screen, first time in years I've actually managed to watch a whole tv programme in a US hotel! Room service is also ordered through the interactive TV, mine arrived in about 15-20 mins, very good. During my stay there were some strong winds blowing and some strange noises seemed to be coming from the wall near the door, thought I was imagining things for a while, but when I woke in the morning, there was a letter under my door, explaining that in such conditions it is normal for high rise buildings shifting with the pressure of the wind to make such sounds.On this occasion I didn't use the hotel bars or restaurants, but I have eaten in the top floor restaurant before on Christmas Day and thoroughly enjoyed my meal and the amazing views. Colleagues also commented that the breakfast was very good at the hotel and the 35th floor Gym made working out a pleasure due again to the amazing views.I look forward to my next visit.

The location is great, at Union Square. Initially I chose this hotel because of the location and despite that I read that the service weren't as good as other "Grand Hyatt" elsewhere. To my surprise, I had a very warm welcome and check-in staff were great and friendly. We are staying in 2 rooms for 5 adults, so the connecting rooms were definitely to our advantage. One of the room was a corner room which is slightly bigger than the normal room, having a little space between the bed and bathroom where they put in the cupboard and a mini powder/make-up table. The additional space also means that with the additional bed, it wasn't as cramped as I would imagine. Rooms were clean and we enjoyed our stay here!

Treated myself and 2 grown daughters to a couple of nights in the City recently. I always love the Union Square location for its centrality, and because there were 3 of us I wanted a modern location with more room square footage instead of one of the more historic hotels in the area.Hotel has several inviting common areas; we did not eat at the hotel so I cannot comment. The room was nice with comfy beds, frig, coffee maker - and roomy, not spacious. There were not enough "supplies" for 3 and someone came promptly after I called.I liked the automated check-in (I checked in thru my iPhone - we were early but our room was ready) and check-out.So - nice room but paid so much for it!

Due to the connecting door to the adjacent room we could hear just about everything going on next door. Impossible to sleep as long as our neighbor was awake and watching TV, talking to someone on the phone or taking a shower. When we complained to reception they told us that all their rooms with the exception of one per floor have connecting doors. So they were unable to provide us any solution - all they did was to give us access to the executive lounge, which was totally useless to us.Having previously stayed at other Grand Hyatt hotels in Hong Kong, Berlin or Jakarta, I can not understand why the one in San Francisco deserves to be a "Grand" Hyatt - there is definitively nothing grand about this hotel. Any airport Hyatt is just as fine.The location is great and the view from our bay view room was spectacular. However if it is important to you to have some privacy in your room and to be able to sleep in a quiet environment, I would recommend to avoid this hotel.

It took 2 days to get the shower head fixed, the elevators did not work one morning and only had de-cafÃ© coffee in the room as they ran out of regular. Finally, the air conditioning unit could not get the room cool. It was a great location but I wish I had stayed at one of the other name brand hotels within the same block or two.

Right next to Union Square in the heart of the shopping and entertainment district of San Francisco, this hotel did not disappoint. Rooms were decent size, and all amenities were already there. Only issue was that the room service ended at 11pm or so, so you may be out of luck after a long day at the office. Otherwise, can't complain!

Totally overcrowded hotel. Have to wait for hours for any of the many lifts that wobble squeak and get stuck from time to time. The hall is so noisy that when the alarm button is being hit by who ever is stuck in it, it takes guests to point this out to security standing there. Staff and bell boys catch rides and when not dispersing chemical smells, talking loud on either cell phones or to each other, or squishing you in an corner w suitcase trollies. The panels are visibly dirty w the same spots for all the time were there. On the whole this hotel's surfaces are not kept clean. Even the carpets on the floors we were staying were not even once seen being vacuumed, with the same small rubbish in the same places in the carpets. Dishes outside rooms on floor often w smelly food took some time to be removed if not days.

check in can be a little confusing,but it is clean,quiet,and reasonably pricedbook as far ahead as you can to get lower rate and check AAA and others asthere are different packagesrestaurant staff and room cleaning are exceptionalvery convenient locationcheck on-line for restaurant couponshighly recommend

This hotel is located near Union Square with lots of great shopping within walking distance. Chinatown is a few blocks away and the waterfront is a 10 minute cab ride. The staff here are very friendly and helpful. Our room package included breakfast for two. I would highly recommend it since the buffet runs about $29 dollars. The quality of the food and the items available are great. There is a coffee bar on the lobby level in the morning or a Starbucks across the street if you just want to grab and go. The rooms are comfortable and clean. Housekeeping was in and out before we returned from breakfast each day. The only downside is the parking. Valet is $61/day or you can self park around the corner for $41/day. There were lines for taxis around dinnertime but we generally didn't wait more than 5-10 minutes. Overall, a great experience and I would definitely come back.

Again at Grand Hyatt, a really nice place to stay in the city, amazing quality-price ratio, totally renewed, now with the new OneUp restaurant and a really good bar on the mezzanine floor. I had a room w a stunning view on SF and I will be back here really soon. Clean, gentle staff, perfect. Thank u so much.

We have chosen this hotel for our stay in SF because is extermely well located on Union Square. It has a public parking across street with (ballet parking). There is anything you may need within 2 blocks distance. Breakfast is fine, sometime you have too wait 15-20 minutes. Room are normal.Worth going to upper floors to have a nice view of the city. There is a gym in floor 36, nice for exercicing with such a view.Reliable concierge advice and recommendations.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt last autumn and enjoyed my stay very much. Clean rooms and fine bathroom and toilet is what I expect from a good hotel and here I was not disappointed. I usually spend quite some time on carefully choosing the places I stay at and my recent search in SF lead me to a couple of hotels one of which was Grand Hyatt.Beautiful views of city center from most rooms. Would go back again!

The hotel is in an extremely convenient location. We were able to walk to the Ferry Building in around 15 minutes. Access to public transport was very easy.We stayed in a room facing Union Square on the 11th floor for five nights. It has a lovely view of the square. The room was comfortable with electric blinds. However, the noise from the street was unbearable. Roadworks on Stockton St took place throughout the night. We could hear machinery chugging away at 3am. Because the floor to ceiling window was not one piece of glass (it was a sliding door though it could not be opened), the wind could be heard howling through the gap. A note was slipped under the door on our last night informing us of the noise due to high wind. A few train tickets were also passed in along with the note. We weren't quite sure what to make of it.There were four of us staying in the room but we were only given 3 sets of towels. We requested for an extra towel when we first arrived but housekeeping did not take note until our very last day. Check in and check out were efficient. Both Mark and Elaine from concierge were very helpful.

This is a comfortable hotel in an ideal location for shopping and downtown-area sightseeing. Although the property doesn't come across as "grand" to me, the service is excellent and the remodel gives it a fresh look. The rooms look and feel quite up-to-date. The onsite restaurant has very nice offerings beyond what one expects from a "hotel restaurant."

Top hotel. Great service, nice atmosphere and lovely rooms. Had a great 4 night stay here. Only gripe is that the happy hour isn't advertised too well. Ordered many wines assuming it was all half price when it's only certain wines that were. Better advertising would be great. Location is perfect for tourists too.

Stayed recently in this hotel for five nights with my friends. After a courteous welcome we were allocated a room on the 11th floor. Room was spotless and looks like the rooms have all been recently renovated.This is a perfect location for Union Square, the surrounding bars, restaurants as well as a block away from the famous cable cars to Fisherman's Wharf. Tour buses also pick up on Union Square. If you visit this hotel and can't get access to the roof top bar just visit the gym on the 35th floor and you can get some amazing views and photographs !Would definitely consider staying here again if I return to San Francisco

Stayed here for three nights on arrival to SF from London and were very happy with our stay were allowed to check in a little early which was good.There is not to much going in downstairs in the communal areas but the rooms are new and the hotel is in a great location. I would defintiely consider staying here again on return to SF.I thought the front desk staff were excellent every time we dealt with them and helped my girlfriend out after she fell over and needed so antiseptic and plasters, they were great there and the help was most appreciated.

This is perhaps my favourite hotel that I have stayed in thus far.The location is great in Union Square, with lovely restaurants and shopping close by, the staff were fantastic and so helpful, and our room was incredible.We stayed in a Club Room, and it was great to be able to go up to the club lounge, with a great view, to eat breakfast or canapes in the evening.The flatbread in the restaurant was delicious.

I stayed at this property with my 8 yr old daughter. We both had a very nice time. The staff was very courteous and helpful. We had a view of Union Square which was beautiful at night when the city was lit up. The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. I found the lobby to be congested and confusing at times of high volumes as the reception, bellhop, and concierge are not set up conventionally. There is a Starbucks in the lobby which is great because the Starbucks across the street is always packed. Internet access in the rooms was free which was a big bonus. This hotel is located at the center of everything with easy access to everything by public transportation or walking. I would avoid renting a car and parking if possible as the parking fees range between $41-$65 per night. I would definitely recommend this hotel and plan to stay here again on my next visit.

Excellent place to stay for a city getaway. Located right in the heart of Union Square, there is ample shopping and dining opportunities within walking distance. The hotel staff is friendly and very professional. Valet & Bellmen service was excellent. Our room was well appointed and extremely comfortable. The view of the city from our room was amazing! I loved looking out at the surrounding architecture.

We stayed here for 6 nights of our honeymoon and enjoyed our visit. The location was great and it was easy to navigate the city from the hotel. It's a shame that the roof top bar was closed and being refurbished as a conference centre as many people said to us that the best views of the city had previously been from the bar. We ate in the hotel on one evening, just having pizza as most of the dishes were beyond our budget. The pizza was good but there are so many great restaurants nearby that it was more appealing to eat out. Despite leaving a decent tip for the maid every day we didn't have our tea/coffee tray replenished unless we specifically asked which was a little disappointing. I've never had this in a hotel before, usually it is replenished as standard. The toiletries were nice and the room was a generous size with a great view. The closet was huge and the fridge was a good size also. The phone charges were extortionate - three times as much to phone the uk as any of the other hotels we stayed in on this holiday!! And the info for costs wasn't easy to find which was frustrating. So, overall the hotel itself was great - very attractive, great location and very clean. However I felt the service was a little lacking and additional costs were too high. I would recommend the hotel due to the positives but would recommend eating out, leaving notes for the maid if you want your coffee replenishing, and avoid using the phone.

The hotel was what you would expect of a 5 star hotel. Location perfect just off Union Square. Greeted by staff as soon as we pulled up to help with luggage and direct to check in was courteous and efficient. The relaxed style of check in and foyer was different but a little messy. The room was clean and size was good. All toiletries and linen were of high quality. We had a room on the 34th floor over Easter and access to the club room on the 32nd floor. Of course it was a busy time so the club room was overflowing with people therefore my rating in lower. The size of the room was not adequate for the amount of people wanting to use it. Sharing tables, waiting for a table and the whole hustle and bustle defeats the whole purpose of a club room. The food selection wasn't great. Minimal. If the club room is not included in your package I wouldn't up grade.

First person I met was a wonderfully kind and humble gentleman named Lalit (la-leet). He had a gentle soft smile that let me know immediately I was in good hands.He helped me out of my taxi, collected my bags and off we went into the hotel. When I went to tip him, all I had in cash was a twenty and a single one. He saw my embarrassment and said, "a dollar is fine maâ€™am please donâ€™t worry about it" and quickly left to go attend to more arriving guests. Lalit and the staff at Grand Hyatt are attentive, professional and extremely eager to create an enjoyable experience for the guests. Check-in is three art deco kiosks, so theyâ€™re not standing behind a stuffy desk away from you. It's an up close and personal experience, as if to imply weâ€™ll be here. The kiosks were decked out in all the technological fanfare necessary to process your reservation quickly and efficiently. They even had a person push the button for the elevator for me and again stayed right there until it came, held the door as I entered, chatting me up the whole time (awesome service). My accommodations were on the 33rd floor, fantastic view of town and the bay. I couldn't help notice the TV display said, welcome Renda so and so. I grinned and thought to myself; AHA, trying to enter my psyche, with the whole name in lights trick (clever); they already had me at hello.The room is very tastefully decorated in understated elegance. The Grand is huge on technology. YES, I had a learning curve on the TV. The focal point of the room of course is the room length, floor to ceiling window which had a motorized shade (me likey)! At first I could not figure out how to raise the shade on the window so I looked around the room and discovered next to each bed are buttons for the lights and shade. This may not seem like much in making someone happy but it's the little thoughtful things that make your stay more pleasant. I started taking pics of the room like I had never been anywhere before, Iâ€™m goofy!This is a business trip, Iâ€™m only here for one evening, but I would definitely pay to stay here again.

I would recommend this hotel to anyone for its great service and value. This was our first trip to San Francisco and opted to stay at Union Square for the great upscale shopping and proximity to better restaurants in the Union Square area which are quite literally right out the front door. We do not enjoy really crowded touristy areas such as the Fisherman's Wharf. We did not regret this decision. We did spend much time at Fisherman's Wharf which is a slow trolley ride away. The trolley's are hard to catch if they are full so be patient. The hotel was clean and updated. We consulted with the concierge daily and they were friendly and efficient in grabbing restaurant reservations, car service and Giants ballgame tickets. I would absolutely recommend this hotel. We routinely stay in five star hotel such as Ritz-Carlton and Mandarin and I would say although not quite as luxurious, this hotel provides a better location and value.

Our final hotel of 6 on our USA trip.Had booked a club room for our final stay and was not disappointed. Level 32 with magnificent views across the city.Room was a good size and has all amenities needed,comfortable bed and beautiful bathroom.Made use of the Club lounge and was surprised to find an "honor bar"? This may be usual in the USA but most other countries we have visited include drinks as part of the Club privileges? Seen some guests filling glasses so high they were flowing over,but guess when your paying,you get your monies worth!! Breakfast was very good and choice excellent. Position of the hotel is excellent and would recommend it on that alone,we walked to Chinatown,shopping and the HoHo buses.All in all met our requirements and was an enjoyable stay,thank you Grand Hyatt.

We stayed at the hotel for 5 days when touring the area. The concierge team was outstanding with the ladies efficient, unflappable and very knowledgeable of the local scene. The hotel lived up to its billing and was efficiency personified. The experience was spoilt a touch by a grumpy senior citizen (bespectacled) who was controlling valet and bell boy services. We met him on the last day and were taken aback by his attitude. The rest of the team including the younger lads at the bell desk were proactive and eager to help.Would unhesitatingly stay there again. Inspite of the sole "grumpy" Indian valet.

Their renovation is a retro 1980 look. Even the stereo could not be used with our iPhones and reminded us of our old stereo system in the 90's; at least the CD player worked! The room space is a bit cramped for 3, thought the bathroom is generously appointed. The hotel has a great location to quickly access Chinatown, the piers or the Union Square shopping areas. The staff was generally helpful. The breakfast is delicious but very pricey.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 5 nights while attending a conference and couldn't have been more pleased. The location is excellent. Right in the middle of the Union Square shopping district, walking distance to Chinatown, Market st, and the Bay. Rooms are well appointed and very clean. Housekeeping staff was friendly and excellent. The only complaint I have about the room is that there is a large gap at the bottom of the door which lets in light at night and noise from the hallway. The rest of the hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Nice bar and good restaurant. Very professional banquet staff and nice convention rooms. Not enough elevators however, at peak times the wait was considerable. Even so, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Location can't be beat. To the south you have union square, to the west is Chinatown. It's so near both places but far enough not to be noisy. Due to jet lag, my 9yr old son sleeps until 12nn. And the hotel is quiet and has black out drapes. Room is spacious and very clean. King bed is big enough to fit 3 persons comfortably. Service is excellent. From the reception to bell service to the operator to engineering. Very fast service. Didn't have to wait long when I ask for something. It may be a little bit ore expensive than other hotels, but it's definitely value for money. You get more than you pay for.

Excellent location being barely a block away from the center of Union Square. The hotel is otherwise quite average and the premium you pay is for its location rather than the rooms. Rooms are decent but could be a bit more spacious, bathroom quite standard, generally not much surprises.

Ok. Check in can be a little annoying. They seem to move a bit slow, but after that everything was great. DO NOT try to check in before 3:00 pm, the room will not be available. This place is busy, especially on the weekends. We checked in on a Monday afternoon, not a problem. We were on the 14th floor, no complaints. Had a very nice double bed room. But the location of the hotel is superior. One block to Union Square and one block to Chinatown gate. Ask the concierge for their list of restaurants within walking distance, it's a great list. Also, we didn't need a car. If you are flying in to just stay in San Francisco, you really don't need to rent a car. I found that the CHEAPEST BEST transportation to get around the city was ÃœBER. If you do not know about Uber, download the app for your smartphone and pre-register your credit card. The service is AWESOME. It's a flat rate ( no meters running) and tip is included. They just bill your credit card directly and there is no hassles. Only $40 from SF airport to the hotel (UberX) or if you need a bigger car it is $65 for the Black Car option. Then we used UberX to get down to the Wharf for $7 which includes the tip! The cable cars are fun too, and you should definitely ride them but it is $6 per person one way. All in all, the hotel was excellent and we enjoyed our stay. P.S. Check out Dylan's Tours for an excellent tour. It picks you up only one block from the hotel and is incredible and fun!

Check-in: We arrived on Sunday, after an early flight from the East Coast, delayed at a stop over, then getting off at the wrong Bart Station, walked the wrong direction for 3 blocks, passing through some not so safe looking area, before we found our way to the hotel. Needless to say, we were exhausted by the time we arrived at the hotel. As soon as we arrived, we were greeted warmly by Paul, who took care of our check-in process. I loved their reception desks. They were arranged in a way that allowed more privacy and individual attention. I had requested a room away from common area on a higher floor. Paul spent the time looking for the perfect room and asked which criteria (quiet or higher floor) has a higher priority. And wanted to know if we wanted higher floor for view or to be away from the street noise. He ended up finding the perfect room on the 11th floor facing Union Square for us. He provided wonderful customer service and really made us glad that we chose this hotel. It was the best check-in experience I ever had. The room was modern, clean and nicely done. It had a mini-fridge, which was convenient to store the cream puffs I got from Beard Papa. Even though the room was on the 11th floor, we could still hear some street noises, but it was not too bad. The room had a nice view of the Union Square and Macys. There is complimentary wi-fi in the room (not every hotel in the area provide the wi-fi in the rooms for free). The hotel location was convenient for us. We went to Chinatown to pick up breakfast everyday when we were in town. Starbucks, Walgreen, the bus stop, and the trolley stop were all very close. We were able to go to the tourist attractions (Lombard Street, Fisherman's Wharf, Crissy Field...etc) taking the trolley and the buses. Concierge: We went to the concierge desk to ask about the Muni passes. The person we spoke to seemed preoccupied. When we asked, she simply told us the passes can be purchased at the Walgreen. And nothing else. We asked about the price for the passes. And she told us the wrong price. It was not a big deal. We could totally look up the information online. But I would expect the concierge to have the correct information for something basic like the price of the Muni passes and to be more helpful. Other than the minor misinformation from the concierge, we had a wonderful stay. We will definitely choose this hotel again when we are in town.

This is an update to a previous positive review for the property.On my recent stay, I checked in on a Saturday. I asked for a quiet room and the front desk person seemed unfamiliar with the property because they put me on the 10th floor, facing Union Square and with my front door less than 2 feet from 3 other rooms (very odd configuration). Not only did I get to hear everyone coming in and out of their rooms, but the Union Square noise and overnight construction (woke me up at 3am on 4/16) were intolerable. Additionally, on day 1-3 of my 4 day stay my non-smoking room was filled with marijuana smell off and on. My guess is that hotel staff were smoking in a service hallway that somehow connected to my air duct, or there was someone constantly smoking on the street near an intake. The smoke didn't appear to be coming from neighboring rooms.After two nights of this madness, I asked the front desk staff to move me to the other side of the building. They had rooms on the other side, just nothing on a higher floor, which I said was fine. He said he would take my name and room number and see what could be done to get me up higher, as well. I said great, and confirmed with him that I would check-in with the front desk when I returned in late afternoon. When I returned, there were no notes on my account. No one knew anything about what was going on with my move. After explaining this twice now, I was very frustrated and just decided to deal with staying in this terrible room and never returning to the property again. To add insult to injury, the staff I spoke to in the morning had de-activated my room key (I know this because he mentioned that he needed to change that for me because he had realized that I would have to get back in my room when I returned for the day). My number one pet peeve in customer service is people communicating to you that they are taking ownership and will see it through, but then they just let it drop without closing the loop. I'm not complaining about lack of availability to switch rooms (if that was the case even), I'm complaining about the continued missed follow-through by staff at the hotel from check-in to my request to move. As far as facilities go, the surfaces were dusty (need to change the air filters) and the water pressure was terrible. If a neighboring room flushed the toilet or turned on a shower, my shower pressure dropped so low that the toggle between shower and bath faucet was switched. Fun. That happened multiple times during a shower. When I checked into the room, they had doused the place with Febreeze. The only pros I can say about this hotel are that they provide a mini-fridge, and the location is good.

Really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt in SF. Excellent location, very close to Union Square and plenty of shopping choices. Speedy check in and check out and housekeeping responded quickly to a couple of requests. Rooms were spacious and very modern and well appointed. We had a room on 5th floor and had a bit of street noise occasionally but not a major issue for us. I would stay here again.

I recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt on Stockton and was very pleased with the new renovation and upgrade in general. I particularly like this location because I an find everything I need and walk everywhere. But I am most impressed with the concierge desk. Elaine is my favorite go to person whenever I am in town but John, Annie or Lisa all provide wonderful services. Elaine recommended a top notch massage place: Pure Organic. I promise you will not be sorry!

I stayed in this Hotel with my Family and thoroughly enjoyed the Stay. The staff are nice and the Best part about the Hotel is its proximity to Union Square. Its just Beside the Hotel. There is enough transportation nearby and Also lots of Shopping Option. Overall the Hotel experience was pretty good.

We had a quick 2 night stay at the Grand Hyatt for a conference and it was in a wonderful location. The hotel is centrally located in Union Square and within walking distance to everything from shopping, dining, entertainment to Chinatown and the BART. We actually took the BART to the hotel and it was quite convenient. The only negative thing I would comment is that the air was a little stuffy and stale when we entered the room. Of course you don't feel it as much after you get adjusted. The size of the room was decent with all the standard amenities expected at a Hyatt. They have additional items you can request for which is always nice. I've attached a picture of the list for anyone who wants to see.During our down time, we also explored the area a bit. If you contract concierge, they have a full map of the SF area from SoMa (South Market) to Fisherman's Wharf. For those who don't mind walking, we actually walked to Fisherman's Wharf from the hotel. Took us about 25-30 minutes, but it beat having to wait in line for the same amount of time for the trolley.

Stayed that the Grand Hyatt San Francisco in April 2014. Modern Hotel, lots of electronic amenities including automatic window shades controlled from your bedside, and a Smart TV that allows you to surf the web, watch movies and order room service among other things.Very comfortable room, of a decent size. Staff were very friendly and accommodating.At one mean at the hotel restaurant called One-Up, well actually the lounge / bar attached to the restaurant, had the One-Up burger it was extremely good.Location is steps from the heart of Union Square - for shopping junkies this is the place to be. Also just a couple of the blocks in the other direction is Chinatown.The only complaint, is that as a Gold Passport - Platinum member, I was not offered a complimentary room upgrade, which was surprising as I understand it the hotel wasn't close to sold out.Highly recommended.

The prices were steep like every other place in downtown SF. Location is fantastic. Can walk to most places not involving the harbors/piers in the downtown area.The rooms are clean, apparently updated. No hot tub, but very nice work - out area.Highly recommended.

At modern Grand Hyatt; ease of checkin/out very much appreciated....comfortable bed...quiet corner room- my new choice for San Francisco stays--great breakfast with excellent service/cozy bar to end the evening

Love the location. Clean rooms with modern flare. Perfect for San Francisco. The rooms were a little on the small size for our family of 4. Is nice to have the Starbucks in the lobby. The parking fee is outrageous with an added 5$ per night for larger cars that take up the same space.

The Grand Hyatt is a very stylish large hotel, in ultra competitive hotel cultured San Francisco. It's well located next to Union Square, and easy to access. Staff were graceful and accommodating - door were always held open for us.The rooms were recently renovated and lovely - nice warm wood materials, comfy beds, and lovely bathroom fixtures. A nice touch - a sliding door on the bathroom that has an opaque glass window in it. If someone is in the bathroom, the area immediately outside is still lit up.The only thing this hotel could really use is a hot tub. Hard to justify why a hotel of this size and quality wouldn't have one.Overall however, a place I'd gladly stay again, if their rates are reasonable :-)

Very modern hotel, very nice. Be aware that room sound isolation leaves much to be desired.Ask for a room in a high floor. Mine in 8th floor was not well insulated against street noises. I wouldn't hesitate to come back but only on a high floor.

In a nutshell this is a great location. A fairly good price for a very nice hotel. Efficient. Modern rooms. Located overlooking Union Square, this is the perfect hub and allows you to walk everywhere and easily find your way around town. Taxi's are easy to find from here. The hotel is newly refurbished and very modern. I was pleasantly surprised when I walked in. It has a very cool modern vibe and younger audience. The rooms are small but very nice with electronic shades (very cool). The bar is a great place to connect with friends and have a few drinks. I did not eat in the restaurant so I cannot speak to this part of the hotel. But overall I really liked it. I did not give it a 5 because it's not the best place I've stayed in SF, but overall you won't be disappointed.

I'm not suggestion that this is a 5 star hotel in terms of hotel ratings, but everything about this place was excellent and deserves an excellent Trip Advisor rating. It is an excellent value! The design is very modern decor, very non-traditional. Service was excellent, rooms very nice with most offering great views. It is an excellent hotel, great value, in a great part of the city.

I stayed here as a single traveller last week. It is a great hotel in a superb location. Union Square in a good central place to stay and is close to the shops, bus tours etc. The hotel had great decor and the rooms are spacious and modern. The reception and concierge staff were all really helpful and the customer service was great. It was a bonus having a Starbucks in the lobby!

We travelled with three teen girls and knew I would have trouble finding accommodation in SF. I am so glad we booked at the Grand Hyatt! With 5 people, we needed to book 2 adjoining rooms and they were able to offer a great family rate when I called reservations directly. The hotel is cool, modern, urban and easy to navigate. We added a breakfast package and enjoyed the buffet before a long day of sightseeing. All of the staff was very friendly and unpretentious which I appreciated. Definitely visit the top floor of the hotel for an amazing view. My only complaint is that the beds are too soft.

The hotel's renovation really changed its character into a high energy urban hotel, if that's what they were seeking. The decor was nice, the service prompt but not overly fussy and the location is simply unbeatable. The hotel was very open about Stockton Street being closed at Geary and gave alternate directions which where easier than trying to mess with a GPS unit. Overall, a great stay.

Myself and a buddy stayed in San Francisco for 4 days as part of a California/Nevada roadtrip and booked this hotel for our stay. We had cut costs throughout the holiday so this was a bit of a treat to kick start the holiday being a fair bit more expensive than our other hotels. It was well worth the cost.The hotel is a relatively easy 30 minute drive from the main international airport and has parking right next door (this is however pretty pricey, though this is to be expected in Downtown San Fran).The hotel itself is smart, modern and very clean and this trend continues in the rooms. Our room came with a fantastic view over Union Square and the city's skyline. The room was beautifully furnished - everything looked brand new and the beds were among the comfiest I have slept in. I know that sounds exaggerated but they genuinely were awesome beds!The hotel is located literally ON Union Square so right by the streetcar (a must do!) and right by a load of high end shops (Tiffany's etc) and a fantastic Cheescake Factory with a roof top seating area. It is a 5 minute walk from the main mall and is in great proximity to AT+T Park (well worth going to a Giants game!) and Fisherman's Wharf etc.I couldn't write this review without giving a mention to the fantastic concierge. The whole team were incredibly helpful and were brilliantly knowledgeable. We were visiting during the Stanislaus Forest fires and thought it would scupper our trip to do some hiking in Yosemite but the concierge advised us on alternative routes to the park and other general tips. Also before heading to the states I looked to buy tickets for Alcatraz (about 2 weeks before our arrival). I had no idea it sold out so quickly so when I went to purchase the tour tickets it emerged that they were gone weeks in advance and that we couldn't go. In a 'Hail Mary' attempt I emailed the hotel to see if they could help. To my (pleasant) shock they managed to arrange tickets to the prison and a city sightseeing bus tour for a great price and even phoned me in England to confirm it all. FANTASTIC service.If you are looking for a great, clean, safe, helpful hotel in the centre of town then look no further!

The front desk agent, Paul, was phenomenal! He was very informative and answered all my questions and concerns. I really enjoyed their gym as well. It has an amazing view. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city.

I enjoy staying at the Grand Hyatt, we have been there many times. It's close to Union Square and a lot of shopping. This morning I called the valet to get my car and I was looking at the claim card and it showed three little scratches in the back which I knew about. Nothing else. Car comes give card to valet and my wife says there is a scrape and a little scratch on right side front. Valet with pen in hand says oh it's on the card. How could my wife and I both miss that? He said he was going to check the other card at valet station and comes back showing mark on card. What can you do? I wish I has taken a pic of the ticket with my phone before I handed it to the valet. I told him I don't believe him and left. I should have gone him with to valet station. So if you use valet parking be sure to check your car and go to valet station with him. I like the place and will go back but we learned a lesson this time.

Recently updated hotel and rooms make this property a pleasure to stay at. The smaller footprint of the hotel and styling make it almost feel like you're in a boutique hotel. There aren't many steps between the front door, to the check in area, to the elevators, and then to your room.The updated room styling is reminescent to some other recently renovated Hyatt properties. Staff service here is very business professional and friendly. The doorman were always eager to welcome and open door for guests. Lyle, one of their bellhops is probably the best bellhop I've come across and is the face of this Grand Hyatt and represents their service level. Steve at check in was also one of the most efficient and smooth check in staff members I've come across.My only frustrating moment of this stay was upon arrival and trying to figure out where "valet parking" is. There isn't any type of driveway area and the real estate space is fairly small and you just pull up to the front of the hotel. There wasn't any type of signage to designate valet parking and as i made the 1st pass in front of the hotel the front was full of cars and or taxi's. I must have drove around the blocks 3 times before the cars cleared out and I pulled up and asked if I'm in the right spot for valet parking while checking in. Staff were quick to help and also advised of a self park garage nearby if that was my preference but I wanted to valet.Location is smack in Union Square and it's walkable to all the nearby retail shops. Later in the evening if walking around late at night (after midnight), do practice caution as in most major downtown cities. There are wandering homeless or suspectible people walking around a few blocks away that would make some uneasy.I had a higher floor room facing Union Square and it was nice to gaze at the city lights at night. Everything worked fine in the room and I really liked the big oval wash basin. I would have preferred the room and bathroom to have been a little larger in size as i like roomy rooms, but the room was probably about on par for a downtown size room. The gym facility was nice as it was on a higher floor of it's own. There's a panoramic view facing east looking at the financial district from the treadmills and elipticals. This is a great hotel to stay at and you really can't go wrong with choosing this Grand Hyatt. It's stylish, modern, and the service is superb!

I stay in San Francisco quite frequently and I tried the Grand Hyatt to experience something new for a much better price than my typical first choice of the Mandarin. I have also frequented the Embarcadero Hyatt multiple times and the Grand is superior in every single conceivable way. The best thing about my visit was the superb service. It was very surprising and I couldn't have asked for the people to be nicer or more accommodating whether it was the bellman or the front desk. The location is also very good. It is a nice part of town and the financial district is very close. The only possible downside about the location is that the nearest BART station is a couple of blocks away, but that is true for most hotels in SF. The room was also very nice with a fantastic view. It is truly as nice a view as the pictures indicate. The only critique I had is that I heard a little too much outside noise and the bathtub/shower is simply ordinary and I would have liked something a little bigger. Are the rooms slightly nicer at the mandarin, yes, but really thats the only thing superior about the mandarin and at least for me the Hyatt was less than half the price. Overall it was a great stay, and probably the best value in SF in terms of what you get for the money. The rooms are well decorated and spacious, the service is exemplary and the view is simply killer.

If you're in town, this is an ideal place to be staying, away from the tourist traps at Fisherman's wharf. Stayed for the night in transit before leaving for home. Was upgraded to a spacious suite, although the view was somewhat pathetic - overlooking roof-tops of other buildings, etc.You are always within stones throw of Union Square and public transport. The lounge on 32nd is surprisingly good and pleasant experience, with good choice of food and wine available

Arrived via car hire after a day of flying, was met immediately by doorman with a cart, I had several bags. The new check-in area is in fitting with the new trend away from the sterile front desk, I liked it. Smooth check-in, upgraded to a nice suite, presented with Diamond amenity card showing various options as well as Club hours and service chart.The room remodel done here recently is great to look at, but the furniture is designer picked for looking at, not sitting on. The electric shutters are a nice touch, they could be darker and 1/2 inch wider to block light in my opinion. Rain shower is OK, I am not a fan of them, though. Bathroom sink is too large and too shallow, but looks cool.The Grand Club still occupies an amazing space on the 32nd floor, the views to die for, the food not so much. In San Francisco with all of the great restaurant choices, all I wanted at the club was a snack and a cocktail. The alcohol selection is basic, but adequate, and very fair honor bar priced. The food selection could be improved with very little effort or thought, Wednesday night was chicken wings for the hot dish, Thursday night tested the low end with mini turkey corn dogs, Really?I dislike that the restaurant has been moved from the top floor to the mezzanine. While the new bar is fine, with a nice drink selection and competitive prices, I really miss that view.So, overall, I think that the staff here were great at all levels! Parking is expensive, it is San Francisco, there are better places to eat than in the hotel, duh! It is in the best part of the city, easy to get to anywhere, great shopping, Chinatown, etc. San Francisco is a great city for uber cars!

From our arrival until departure all the staff we met were welcoming, friendly and efficient.A recent refurb means all the rooms and public areas were clean, modern and efficient. The bar/restaurant offers excellent cocktailsThe location is excellent, right on Union Square and ideally placed for downtown shops and restaurants

A 2 /12 would be more appropriate. We stayed here due to a conference. Three nights and fair to say nothing impressive or memorable. Nothing dramatically poor but loads of examples of contrast from hotels you stay at that excel. Night we checked in (family 4, 2 young children) when we asked for help with luggage placed on cart for us and left at front desk - did not offer to take up. (Cart we used actually sat over 24 hrs in hallway after we used - until we took down ourselves. Obviously small deal but indicative). Breakfast in room dining amongst flattest/plainest we've had at similar priced hotels ever. Directions to parking garage as well as once to leave hotel were seemingly incorrect. One occasion calling to front desk during daytime resulted in no answer at all. Almost on cue as finale my wife called down to ask for help with luggage and check out as I left to bring car around (with incorrect directions) and roughly 15 min later no bell hop yet. I parked and found head bell hop who realized no one had responded to our request and he went up himself. Kind of him but took 15-20 minutes for something generally in quality hotel is prompt (especially when not busy - as the Hyatt seemed to be at the time). Most interactions with staff were vanilla - no sense of anything extra or that folks were happy to be working there. As for for family or those hoping for a bit of pampering also not much to extol - no pool, no onsite spa/place for pedicure, etc.. Should note, however, the work out room was very good. The views are great, location desirable but the emperor has no clothes - only choose if no other option close by.

Had a great 4 nights at the grand Hyatt in San Francisco, it kicked off our west coast road-trip perfectly! We arrived in San Francisco late-evening on our first night and found the hotel fine, from the BART that comes from the airport- come out of station and a 10min direct walk up and you will see union square! First night we were tired from travelling from the UK so had some food and wine in the One Up restaurant which I would highly recommend- my partner is a chef and we both agreed they made the best crab cakes we have ever tasted!!! Little pieces of heaven!The hotel is perfectly located on Union square for shopping and catching the tram, it's around a half hour walk down to fishermans warf and the pier. We walked down through china town and then ended up just staying out all day/night as there is so much to do! Then we got the bus or a taxi back up to union square. Staff were extremely helpful and let me borrow a iPhone 5 charger as mine stopped working. Rooms are comfortable, clean and contemporary. Unfortunately we did not try the cocktail bar as we just stayed around the pier area after day trips out but would have loved to if we had more time. Would recommend and visit again- I loved San Francisco and the vibe of the place! We did the bike ride over the bridge and Alcatraz which were both amazing, we also went to Haight Ashbury which took us ages to get to, so in hindsight would have preferred to visit Golden Gate park or do the open top bus and have the easy option of hop- off hop- on there.

We stayed here at Christmas time while on vacation. In a nutshell, clean, good service, a bit noisey as we were on the street side, and convenient. Nice cafÃ©, better bar and close to everything. We would book here again!

I have visited the Grand Hyatt 2 times in the past year . Once with just my wife and once with my wife and 3 kids and both vacations the Grand Hyatt was on the money ! Courteous, Clean, Informative, are just a few words to get started. The location is outstanding and views from the rooms were just awesome. Not far from all transportation (cable car , street cars , buses).Great food places all over and walking distance from Chinatown . We are very picky where we stay but this place is an all around HOME RUN !!!

Stayed here for business/leisure (3 nights). We were above the 30th floor, with outstanding views of the bay, lovely suite. (Street noise was unfortunate). Room was in good shape & clean. Near Union Square shopping, which was a plus. Doormen very helpful and pleasant. OneUP cafe was nice. Had to come back for breakfast when recommended hotspot per Concierge had a line that took over 40 mins to barely move (let alone get in the door), so we ended up back to hotel just to eat something before we had to leave for airport. Waitstaff were very kind as we were now pressed for time. (No fault of the Concierge, really. Just very slow moving line ....)However, Conciege Desk in general was disappointing, and most recommendations fell flat. Asked for a trendy, fun place for Friday dinner and they suggested Michael Mina at St. Francis (Westin) Hotel. Just 2 blocks away, but DULL, DULL, DULL. Food good, but boring ambiance. There were only a few tables occupied, so not sure why I couldn't get the res time I requested. Would not be on my recommended list of dining spots.

My husband & I traveled here for a long weekend on a business trip. We picked the Grand Hyatt for two reasons - the meeting was there & we are Hyatt GP members. We arrived late in the night and were warmly greeted. The location is simply amazing - we were within walking distance of so much! Our room was on the 15th floor, which had a nice view. The room (and whole hotel) was clean, spacious & modern. Our rooms fridge wasn't working and our shower head didn't work well but they immediately had someone come up to fix them promptly. Every morning, a NY Times was delivered to our room. The gym was nice, but will agree was not well ventilated. Parking was expensive, but we had done our homework a head of time & took a cab from the airport and booked an excursion to Napa instead of renting a car. Didn't try the restaurant since there was so much nearby. Would stay at again, especially with such a great location!

I had a great experience during my stay and the customer service was exceptional. The bar has a wide selection of drinks and is very relaxing. The room was not as clean as I would've liked (there was hairs in the sink and toilet). I would stay here again because the customer service was awesome, but I hope the next time I stay my room is clean and hairless.

I am a regular to San Francisco and am so happy to have discovered the Grand Hyatt. Not only are the staff from waiters to engineers superbly polite and helpful, but the facilities are really excellent. The restaurant food is tops. Try their tomato soup! Wow. The have a great swanky bar, a roomy conference facility and a wonderful 35th floor hotel gym with amazing city views. The rooms are to a high spec and very tech synced. Perfect for the urban or business traveller. And the location is simply perfect for Central San Fran. I will be back!

As it is very close to Union Square, there isn't a better option in SF. Beds, cleaningness, rooms... everything up to it's cost and reputation.However, some small details to bear in mind:1. The concierges were rude when trying to approach them for indications and help.2. The Gym isn't well ventilated...3. Parking isn't easy in that sector.

The locations is great with tons of shopping and restaurants near by. Also close to various transportation and they had taxis lines up every time I needed one. Gorgeous lobby and meeting rooms on the 36th floor are impressive with majestic views. Service was very good. Rooms were nothing special but good and the automatic shades were kind of cool (once I figured them out). I would stay again.

Have stayed hear many times, mostly in the '99-'05 timeframe, stopped because the rooms and decor were both dated & worn. The remodel (not sure exactly when done) has brought this hotel, which is in a fantastic location, up to snuff. The bed was super comfortable with quality linens, god lighting and desk space, remote controlled blinds, nice big flat screen tv; even though I was only there one night, was very comforable. As everyone else has said, this is a great location for SF shopping, getting to BART or Cable cars to go everywhere. One note, the regency club hours are a bit minimal... wish it was open all day, like most international Grand Hyatt properties; also, I understand and appreciate the need to conserve water, but the flow from the showerhead was really weak and since it came out of a handheld, had to press nose to pipe to get under it to scrub all the shampoo out.

As others have mentioned, this is an excellent location. I've stayed in the nearby Westin (great history, but dated) and Hyatt. A work colleague booked our meeting at this hotel, and I was really impressed.At just $185/night, the rooms were a bargain. The decor was modern and clean, with some amazing artwork in the lobby and bar. My room was spacious with a large, comfortable bed. My only minor complaint was that the water pressure could have been a little stronger, but it was fine.The bar was above average for a hotel, and the live music was a nice bonus. The drinks were a little pricey, but not unreasonable for SF.The highlight was the views from the meeting rooms on the 36th floor. Amazing 360 views.While my loyalties are normally with Starwood hotels, I'll definitely stay here next time I'm in the area.

Nothing to have as a downside. Was not a bargain, but San Francisco hotels are pricey any way. A short walk from the BART stations Powell St and another one. Wondered whether it would be easier to get into town by taxi with big suitcases, but didn't need to worry about that. Pulling along big suitcases was no problem for the short walk from the station, and there's a lift from the station floor to the street on ground level, so you won't have to carry it, and the BART wasn't too crowded either. Room was nice an spacious enough, had a great view overlooking the Square, just as the reception staff promised with a great warm smile. Plenty of nice places to pick up breakfast at beside, and a lot of shops and restaurants open till late at night in a very safe looking neibourhood. One small regret is that I didn't get more of Ghirardelli's chocolate squares at a great bargain at Walgreens! Did the Big Bus hop-on-hop-off as well, that we started from the Square as well. China-town was just a few blocks away and just a short stroll.All in all, I think it was the 'niceness' of the staff that made this hotel a really nice place to stay. They really made me feel welcome without overdoing it or being too posh about it. They even have yoga mat rentals (for free I think, but don't quite remember), if you want to join the San Francisco locals with keeping fit.

The best location in SF - Pros.- The property is located in Union Square- Remodel of the property just finished and it is stunning- The rooms are huge for SF standards- Every room will have a view- They have one of the best Grand Hyatt Lounges in Americas- Staff is outstanding at the front desk- Usually pretty solid in pricing and well worth its value- City parking garage across the street (Parked overnight on a Sat. for only $18!)- Gym is on the 28th floor (or something like that) and is huge!- Some of the best views from a hotel in SF (Maybe minus Fairmont SF and Westin)- Way better than any Marriott property in SFCons.- The bathroom sinks are useless and get water everywhere- Room shades are fun, but not practical - Elevators can be slow at times, but they have improved- It is an uphill walk slightly for a half a block to get back (but hey its SF)- Rooms can get a bit loud from outside- Front door staff is a bit lazyOverall, what a great property! The remodel is amazing, I was trying to get a suite but no dice as they were all sold out - but I saw the inside of one and just amazing. Upgrade to a Grand Hyatt Lounge access room - man that lounge is fantastic and has jaw dropping views.

I booked two rooms here for myself and a friend and my 23-year old daughter and her friend. They stayed two nights and we stayed three. I'm a big Hyatt fan so I always try to stay at a Hyatt because the service is always top notch and the locations are typically great. We checked in early Friday morning about 10 AM--much earlier than the 3 PM p.m. check in time. The staff placed us in rooms on the 26th and 27th floors. The view was fantastic! The only issue we had with the rooms with that the air conditioning was not sufficient. I had engineering come up twice and it was never really resolved although they did offer to move us to another room. This property has a great location right in the middle of Union Square--with tons of shopping and restaurants nearby and Starbucks right across the street. This is a perfect city for walking and we sure did a lot of it while we were there for four days. This Hyatt has a very nice wine bar and the package we booked included a buffet breakfast which was delicious. The staff is very accommodating and everyone's pretty friendly. This may be our new favorite hotel in San Francisco!

I'm a local - living just North of 'the city' as locals like to call it and stayed in town one night because my business meetings would run long. Had been awhile since I had stayed here and they have redecorated. Uber modern - vessel sinks - pretty to look at, not so convenient if you need counter space to lay out your grooming supplies - ladies you know what I mean. But not a big deal. As all the previous travelers state - get a high room for two reasons: street noise (SF is a busy city and this is a very busy area) and views. Don't bring a car if you can help it. Why? For one thing this area is very pedestrian friendly with tons of restaurants/shopping w/i walking distance, secondly the traffic is a bear downtown and third it will cost you $62/night for valet and $41/night to self-park. The rooms are fine - nice touch is that all controls are right at your headboard - electrically controlled sun shade, lights, etc. Plenty of plug ins for electronics. Big picture windows. Union Square is just down the street, with a huge Macy's as well as many, many other shopping opportunities. Starbucks located in the hotel for your morning fix. Nice choice for staying in San Francisco.

This hotel is right in the heart of Union Square. So if you go to San Francisco to go shopping, this is the perfect place. This hotel and the area is a high traffic tourist area. The lobby is new and modern. I stayed on either the female friendly or female only floor. It is a nice option if you are traveling alone. I was told that there were extra amenities for females. The extras were a nail polish remover pad and a facial cleansing cloth. The room was nice and clean, but a bit small for two people.

I stayed here for 5 nights while in San Francisco on business. This hotel is in a great location for walking to the Financial District or around the immediate area for shopping or picking up one of the sightseeing tours that launch from Union Square.I checked in a bit early and asked if I could be placed in a high room since I read that street noise can be an issue. I felt the reservation desk representative went out of his way to get me in a great room even though a rather large convention seemed to be going on during my stay. I had to wait about an hour for my room but it was worth it. Room 2918 has a great view of the city facing Union Square. Street noise was still heard that high up but it wasnâ€™t bad and sort of added to the ambiance.Pros-The automatic shade was a really fancy feature that made me feel like I was a high roller. It did a great job of keeping out the unwanted sun in the early morning as well as helped keep the room cool when the sun was a little too intense.-The rooms have been remodeled in a modern style, very nice.-Flat screen TV-Built in TV guide, although it has a way to go. -Clean linens -Plenty of outlets at desk area and beside bed. -iPhone charger is available on the phone, although it is not a lightning connector.-The cleverly disguised refrigerator had nothing in it which was perfect for my needs. I just grabbed a few breakfast items and snacks at a local bodega to keep in there.-Concierge always very helpful and courteous Cons-I kept the temperature pretty low but I donâ€™t think it ever got as cool as the display read-While I didn't hear people in adjoining room, I did hear room service who was rather loud and housekeeping made lots of noise for hours even though there were only three rooms in the immediate area.-Not enough drawer space for clothing.-There isnâ€™t a lot of privacy in bathroom provided with a thin sliding door. -The shower head is a nice idea, the rain shower type, but it didn't telescope out far enough. I had to stand almost on the wall to wash shampoo out of my hair All in all, my visit was great. A few co-workers staying at a competing hotel chain said I definitely made the right choice by staying at the Grant Hyatt.

We enjoyed everything about this hotel. It's a very close walk to China Town, it's a very nice walk down to Washington Square and Fisherman Wharf area. Union Square is just outside the doors which is very awesome. Great energy, great restaurants and amazing shopping all with-in a few minutes of anything you could want. The rooms were great, staff was very helpful. The gym was close to as good as you'll get at a hotel, great variety of equipment.

We stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel is in a good location for shopping and is a short walk from the metro. Without traffic, it took us just over 20 minutes to get to/from the SFO Airport.The first night, we were in a corner room close to 2 other rooms. We heard music late at night from one of the rooms and then doors slamming early in the morning. We asked the front desk to switch our room for the 2nd night and they did so without any hassle. The 2nd night was very quiet. The room was comfortable and clean the bathroom was a good size.The hotel gym is well equipped and has nice views of the city through the clear glass walls.We ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant, which offers a breakfast buffet. The food was okay; I would recommend exploring restaurants outside the hotel if you have time to do so.We were pleased with the service and location and would stay here again.

We just returned from a 4 night stay here with 2 young kids. The room was very well appointed but the two double beds were VERY small especially for adults. You'd really need to get interconnecting rooms with older kids. The hotel staff were accommodating and moved us 3 times until we settled for a room with one king bed and a roll away. We weren't allowed to have 2 roll aways which meant our youngest child had to share the king bed with us! Not ideal but still more spacious than 2 cramped double beds. Beds were comfortable though. The room was very clean but a little dusty. This could be due to the dark wood furniture attracting dust but even so it detracted from the otherwise clean feeling. We could hear guests in the other rooms as I'm sure they could hear us! Great bay view on the 27th floor but even this high up the street noise was significant. We enjoyed the cocktails in the bar and very tasty bar snacks. Very friendly and attentive staff here. Would definitely stay here again were it not for the small double beds.

Totally love this hotel.It is clean, comfortable, in a convenient location and has lovely staff! I arrived early and they had allowed me an early check in. Room was big, well appointed and well maintained - Grand Hyatt standards. It may not be the best Hyatt property I've stayed in but good enough. Service standards were good, staff were efficient, pleasant and always ready to lend a hand.There is a water dispenser then comes in handy when you run out of drinking water at every level. Quite thoughtful of the hotel in my opinion.I would stay here again when I visit San Fran!

My wife and 8 year old daughter spent Valentine weekend at the Grand Hyatt and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location near Union Square is very central to great shopping. Service was friendly and efficient. The room was roomy, comfortable with a nice bay view. Having a fridge and a microwave was convenient. We were able to check in early and they even provided a welcome gift of cupcakes and juice. The only improvement I'd suggest is to darken the glass bathroom door, as its very bright at night when others are still asleep. We would stay here again and recommend this hotel without any hesitation.

I loved the Grand Hyatt. I stayed there for 4 nights and wished I could have stayed longer. I called to ask for an early check in and spoke to Zack. He took my number and let me know when the room was ready. I was able to check in at 11:30. When I got to the hotel, Nakita checked me in. She was so friendly and offered to give me a late checkout which I really appreciated. A very nice bellman took me to my room which was on a high floor but did not have an exceptional view. I was told that was the only king available at the time and they would change the room the next day. However, when I returned from a bit of sightseeing, Steve was at the front desk and he found a room for me on the 27th floor overlooking Union Square. I loved the view. I sat in front of the window lots of times and just enjoyed the city. The hotel has these cool motorized shades that you can raise and lower from a switch at bedside. That was so great because as soon as I wake up I like to see what the weather is like outside.Steve and Jessica who are both front desk managers were also so helpful. I really felt that I was being so well taken care of by everyone at the hotel. Thanks so much to all of you.The only cons: I wish they had grab bars in the bathtub. I was told that all rooms have adjoining doors. I guess there isn't anything that can be done about it. For the first 3 nights of my stay, I never heard anyone in the adjoining room. However, the last night and morning I could hear a woman talking in the room next door. It wasn't a problem. It just felt somewhat odd.

The hotel has recently been completely renovated and is very modern. Our room had automatic blackout shade that you could control from the bed which was super nice in the morning. The room was pretty spacious and had a separate vanity area that my wife used to put on makeup. The hotel is across the street from Union Square, tons of high end shopping and two cable car stops. We also ordered room service twice during our stay and the food was quick and good, however pretty expensive. Really couldn't have been happier.

Really nice hotel. Stayed for business, thought it had a high end business feel. But would like it for leisure as well. Large and active but attentive service. Grand Hyatt knows how to make you feel special, like you are the only guest staying at the hotel. Didn't have full meal but they have a mini counter to grab a coffee and snacks. Cappuccino was watered down but girls serving were lovely. Would definitely stay again.

Great location, great staff, great room. Consider reserving a room on floor 20 or higher with a view of the bay. Health Club on 35th floor has fantastic views. If I discuss the imperfections of my visit I would be embarrassed for nitpicking. I look forward to visiting again.

Nice hotel, right on Union Square by the Stockton St. Tunnel. Their Bay view rooms are very nice. This is a place you can just sit in front of the floor-to-ceiling windows and watch the city and bay. One block from a cable car stop and a short pleasant walk to convention center, china town and little Italy. I would stay there again, especially if I can manage to get one of those bay view rooms again. Of all the very helpful concierge desk personnel, John really deserves a special mention for taking care of me, when the person at the front desk was not at all helpful. He restored my faith in Hyatt hospitality. My flights to Atlanta were cancelled, so I needed to stay an extra night. Even though they had my room still available the person at the front desk wanted double my room rate and when I declined the price increase, sent me to the concierge to find me a cheaper alternative, who then was able to extend my stay at the Hyatt for one more night for the same rate.

This Hyatt has undergone some great renovations, and I enjoy staying here. I am always greeted and treated with respect when I check in. The public areas have a hip, city vibe. Beds are comfortable and linen is crisp. Lighting is well designed in the bathrooms. Interactions I had with staff members were always positive and polite.On the slightly critical side, It appeared to me, having stayed here a few times, that there are longterm tenants on each floor (I am not sure if this is correct, but the food smell coming from one of these rooms was a little off-putting). Water pressure is a little low but the shower is still good, and while the sinks are beautiful to look at, the water takes a while to drain, which I always hate when I am brushing my teeth (I don't need to go into any more detail!)  As a Hyatt Platinum member I love the upgrade perk, especially when it entails a high room looking over Union Square! The location is obviously superb, and there is great parking just across the road for $35.00 a night.

This is a modern hotel located a block from Union Square. The staff were helpful and friendly! Our room was very comfortable and had the view of the Bay, which was nice. The front desk let us see the top floor and try the buffet for free. Our 2 night stay just happened to coincide with the Bat Kid event and we got to meet the Batman teenager - very cool! I would definitely stay here again!

We chose this hotel because we wanted to stay at a Grand Hyatt and it had of view of the city in San Francisco. I guess you can say we were disappointed. Me and my husband don't think there is really anything grand about it. Check In was interesting. It seemed to us that this hotel is trying too hard to reinvent the wheel. The check in area felt like you were waiting to speak to a banker. There were tables scattered around the check in area with laptops and a few people to check you in. It seemed disorganized and there really wasn't a way to tell who was next in line. In fact we were waiting there before another couple and they were helped first. The check in person was very friendly. We really don't like when they try to be your friend and in this case the person was. He asked us a billion questions that we didn't feel like answering. All we wanted to do was to be checked in and go to our room. My husbands patients were wearing thin after an 8 hour drive.The Valet people were awesome. They were very helpful with your car, luggage, upon arrival and when we left. Parking is expensive whether you park it yourself or do valet. Our room had a nice view. The room was small and it was an adjoining room. I am learning that I need to specify no adjoining room in future reservations at any hotel. Our neighbors were noisy and we really didn't appreciate feeling like we were in their conversations. Again the room was small, it was very clean. Again it seemed like they were trying too hard to be modern. It didn't feel like a Grand hotel. The furnishing were cheap, for example the end table drawers were hard to open and felt like they were going to fall apart. The room as well as the bathroom was very modern. The bed was comfortable, nothing special.We added a meal plan to our reservation for breakfast and it wasn't good. The meal plan only includes the buffet. The eggs tasted fake and they were even able to mess up bread for toast. My husband said Wonder Bread would have been better to make toast with. He didn't even finish a quarter of his toast because of the taste. The juice was brought out in little tiny cups like they were giving you a sample but in fact it was the actual size. The staff was very helpful and nice.We probably won't be staying here anytime soon.

Location at Union Square is unbeatable. Just two to three blocks from main shopping centres; 5 mins walk to Chinatown; 15 mins walk to Japan Center. Nice lobby with (gas) fireplaces and squashy sofas. Restaurant on Mezzanine floor excellent (service and food unpeccable). The room, however, was not above standard; the bathroom cold and cheap-looking. Shower had very weak pressure; the (old, burned an battered) ironing plank was leaning against a wall in the bathroom because too big for the tiny closet.Staff at front desk was very freindly and helpful. Housekeeping staff (I met one male member of that team who delivered shower gel they had forgotten to stock up again) was grumpy and rude.Overall this hotel could make a much better impression, if they would invest just a few bucks for a face lift of the bathroom. Otherwise it's OK.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco for four nights of our Honeymoon in late November 2013. From the moment we arrived after a long, long flight from Europe we were made feel at home and welcome by the friendliness, courteousness and professionalism of the staff at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco.Our room was spacious, had a fantastic view of the city and was beautifully furnished. The bed was exceptionally comfortable and the coffee maker with take away cups in our room was a nice touch, especially when you have an early start. We booked some tours and day trips through Joanna the hotel concierge and she was fantastic. She went out of her way to get us a last minute spot on a city day trip which included Muir Woods and Suasalito. She also booked us on a trip to Yosemite. She was very professional and discrete whilst making bookings with our credit card details over the phone. At OneUp restaurant we had the breakfast buffet which was very good with lots of choice. With very early starts to go sightseeing we were set up for the morning with the great breakfast they provided.I have already recommended the Grand Hyatt San Francisco to family and friends and will continue to do so. The hotel is in a fantastic location, right on Union Square with many many great shops. Also we were able to walk to city sights including Fishermans Wharf and to Coit Tower. We would like to Thank the staff of the Grand Hyatt San Francisco for making the first leg of our honeymoon memorable and special. I feel quite proud of myself for choosing to stay here. We loved San Francisco and cannot wait to return. When we do we will definitely stay at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco on Union Square.

The Grand Hyatt SF is a fantastic hotel! The Staff are great, the location is awesome and the rooms are amazing.When I arrived at my room, I was greeted with my name displayed on a screen and great music playing, I felt like a celebrity! The big was super comfortable and the view was great (I was on the 17th floor), I could see all the way to the water.The location is perfect. You're right beside shopping and restaurants at Union Square, which is a great area and everything is within walking distance. China Town is a 10 minutes walk and Fisherman's Wharf maybe 25.I loved this hotel and would book again. I found the rates very reasonable for the quality of service and location.
