The place has been recently remodeled and is at a great location. Well greeted at the door, friendly staff, clean room, comfortable beds. The place is nice and quite, other then hearing an occasional trumpet playing outside in the streets. Other then hearing a door close every once in a while you can hear foot steps or people in the other rooms. The bathroom area is nice, the showers are fine, don't need to use the hand held like other reviewers mentioned. It adjust just fine with good water pressure and heats up fast. Overall great experience, the only thing was that the TV wasn't working bur I wasn't there to watch TV. But is did figure out the cable in the back was just loose. I really liked the electronically adjustable shade for the large door/window...

This hotel has a great location right above Union Square - we had a room with a view over the Square. The rooms have been redone in a contemporary style and are comfortable and very light. Bathroom was a bit small with a both/shower combination but the wardrobe had an ironing board and iron in it as well as a blanket and extra pillow.One minor issue is the fact that information about the hotel is only available on the TV screen - there is no information folder or room menu. I think that most people still like to be able to look at a hard copy for information/services rather that a TV screen.Other issue was the amenities in bathroom - if you want as shower cap or mouthwash or cotton buds you have to ring and ask for them. This is a bit minimalist, in my view, for a Park Hyatt.Staff are efficient and our room was cleaned promptly each day. Good gym on the 35th floor but can be a bit crowded at peak times. We were here for six nights and had problems with noisy guests in an adjoining room on one night - and no sleep between 2am and 3am. We had to call and complain twice. Security attended both times but the guests ignored the first warning. While this is not the fault of the hotel, it was a problem and possibly could have dealt with more effectively when we first complained.However, all in all, this is a good base in the Union Square area and we would recommend the hotel.

This hotel was remodeled last year. The rooms and lobby are well appointed. It's in a great location. Easy walking to the best shopping and the wonderful ferry market. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. That being said, I'm not sure i'd stay here again. I don't like handheld shower heads and the hotel has the most limited tv stations I've ever encountered, except for maybe Russia. You also have to navigate the tv using a mouse. I didn't like it enough that I may not stay here on a return visit.

After reading some reviews I was concern about some issues like check in, people not being friendly or helpful. However, this has been one of the best hotels I have been lately. Perfect location, great views from all rooms and the staff, all of them very extremely friendly, courteous, kind. Betsy did the check in for us in one minute, with a smile and gave us the rooms we requested. Then I wanted to do some changes in my bill and Olivia helped me in seconds! And the best, friendly person ever was Susan at the concierge desk. She booked some restaurants for us, transport to the airport, the big Bus hop on hop off tour, and was always eager to help! Doormen always opened the door with a smile, a nice word, very friendly!Loved the room, the view, the fact that there was a coffee making machine in the room, but best of all was the staff. This was our first time in San Francisco and this hotel made our stay a wonderful one. Will definetly return to this hotel

It's been a little over a year since I stayed here. It was under renovation the last time, and I expected a nicely redone hotel this time. It is, to an extent, but they made one fatal error that is bound to cost them guests. They closed the restaurant/bar with one of the best views in SF and moved it to the mezzanine where it is now dark and claustrophobic. Apparently, they thought they'd make more money using the space for meetings. What a shame. They have denied their loyal guests (many who stay here just for that view) one of the main reasons for picking this hotel. I am a Hyatt Platinum member, but the next time I'm in SF, I may have to look for a hotel with a real view.

This is the second time I have stayed at this property and the first time I have splurged on an Executive Suite. This accommodation is well worth the extra money foremost because of the extra space with a separate bedroom and the bonus of a powder room off the living room area for your guests to use. I find the normal guest rooms on the smallish side and with an odd layout. The club level lounge has stunning views and has a more than ample amount of amenities.The staff at the hotel was very helpful and on top of things. This is especially true of the door staff and the valets. The front desk and room service staff were also prompt and helpful.The only minor complaint I have regarding this hotel is that they do not stock Diet Sierra Mist which every other US Hyatt that I have stayed in carries. This may seem like a small point, however as a diabetic I really appreciate that Hyatt carries a non cola beverage that can also be used as a mixer.I plan on staying at this property again in the future.

Pros:- Great location, close to Market Street, Financial District, Chinatown, etc.- Renovated rooms (we stayed in an executive suite, and the setup was pretty good)- Responsive GM team (we had requested an upgrade before checking in, and they generously accommodated us)Cons:- Disconnect between their Twitter team and the rest of the staff (we had asked if we could get an early check-in, which was confirmed, but ended up not happening, causing me to miss an important client call) -- the front desk person didn't even know they had a Twitter team- Doormen were inconsistent in holding the door for guests- Shower door opens outward, which is inane, and makes it pretty much impossible to get your towel without getting the bathroom floor wetI would've given this hotel a better rating if not for the check-in issue, but I would certainly recommend this to others who are looking for a well-located and well-furnished hotel.

Our hotel stay here was amazing. The rooms are spacious and quiet, and the bed was extremely comfortable - I slept great. The staff were very nice and friendly and were eager to help us in selecting a place to eat nearby.The hotel's location is perfect if you're doing business in the city, and you're within walking distance of several great places to shop and amazing restaurants. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was delicious. Coupled with the Starbucks across the street, it made it easy to get going in the morning.My room was on the 29th floor and the view from up there was amazing, and the upper floors have restricted quiet hours, which made for a great night's sleep.Overall our experience here was great and if I'm ever back in San Francisco, I will definitely stay here again.

Fantastic location-- perfect for a short walk to the Moscone Center and right across the street from a Starbucks (bonus). The doormen and valets were extremely helpful and polite. Love them.I really liked staying here on business, but noticed there were some quirks that made things a bit inconvenient for doing work. There were no outlets on the walls... only on the side of the TV and in the bathroom. Very tough if you use your phone as your alarm clock or need to charge multiple items (laptop, phone, iPad, etc). Also, the lighting was strangely laid out, so I couldn't quite get enough light wherever I was in the room. Seems petty, I know, but was annoying for the business traveler in me.I LOVED the travel amenities (shampoo, lotion, etc) -- better quality than most places I stay. Room service was great and on-time, but like so many hotels, extremely overpriced for the quality.

Location is great! Check in was super easy and wonderful customer service. Very clean rooms and on the big side for San Francisco. We enjoyed our stay and would stay here again. The only negative is the $60 parking which is outrageous! Find a parking garage if you can.

This Grand Hyatt has been totally redone.From the front office with the most courteous staff to the room service staff that is doing everything to please (with a smile)A great New bar, with a quality restaurant, ( very unusual for a hotel)On my next to SFO , this willBe the hotel of my choice.

Location I think is the best in San Francisco, directly at Union Square. After the recommandation the rooms are very modern and clean. Negative: small restaurant for the breakfast and in peak hours you have to wait

Wanted a nice place for a quick get out of town stay. Spent lots of time on Yelp looking and finally decided on the Grand Hyatt. Check in was smooth and easy. We asked for a room with a water view higher up and got a great one on the 25th floor with floor to ceiling windows and a partial view of Alcatraz!The bed, pillows, dÃ©cor, tv, and most everything in the room was 5 star.What makes my review only a 4 star is only for the fact that you can hear your neighbors if there wasn't any source of noise in our room. But luckly they checked out after the first morning.But the concierge desk made the getaway really amazing! Everyone one of the staff was very professional and eager to help. They gave maps with detailed instructions/directions and recommendations to whatever we asked for.So a big 5 star for the Concierge Desk! They made things easy for a slightly OCD person like me ;-) Location was really great, couldn't get much closer to Union Square and there was a starbucks across the street.All in all a great value for the what you get. I'd be very happy to come back again.Sincerely, David D.

I stayed here for two nights when travelling to Honolulu. This hotel is great cause of its location and service. I recieved top service. Everyone at the checkin was friendly and 100% there to make my stay great. I had the suite at the 29th floor wich had spectacular view over the city of SF. The Grand Club was also top notch with food and beverage. I sat there alot cause of the nice view of the city. I have no complaints about this hotel at all! I think they treat their platinum/diamond members very good here and therefor i will stay here next time again. I really enjoyed it!

Grand Hyatt is located in Union Square. There are plenty of shopping nearby. Chinatown is a few blocks away. Friendly and smooth check-in. Modern type reception, which was very welcoming. The lobby is on the smaller side but I liked the design. The rooms are nice. The color scheme are very earthy and furniture is Jetson like. Comfortable bed with plenty of pillows. The bathroom is adequate, however the pressure in the shower was poor. Breakfast was great and service during breakfast was stellar.

I'm a frequent traveler in luxury hotels. Hotel get 4 stars, restaurant 2 stars - hence 3 stars in total. Stayed here over the weekend. Location is absolutely great - walking distance to everything. Friendly staff and good clean room with a very comfortable bed. Lived in 1001 - some noise from the elevator and ice machine. Water in the shower running slow - annoying. Only one small restaurant at the hotel. Ordered room service twice - very boring food with no taste. Breakfast the same. But again: Staff is very friendly. OK bar if you want to get a beer, but rather small for a hotel this size.

We stayed at this hotel by Union Square for eight nights over Christmas. The hotel is located perfectly in the midst of all the shops, so the location is perfect for shoppers who need to drop off their shopping bags several times during the day.The hotel itself is very clean, the bed is quite comfortable, love the numerous pillows, airconditioning is great. We also had an air purifier in the room. Wifi was not bad and it was free. I especially liked the anti-slip mat in the bathtub. This mat, plus the soap dish by the sink, were much appreciated. I don't see these often in hotels, but they are so useful and makes a big difference for safety (the anti-slip mat) and neatness (the soap dish).Service staff were also very polite and helpful, from the front desk, the concierge, valets, cleaners... no complaints! The lobby is a bit small, however, and there are not many seats for sitting/waiting. It can be a long wait at the elevators. It was a very busy hotel when we were there but once you are in the privacy of your room, it is very relaxing.Overall, an excellent pick. I would recommend the hotel and I would stay there again.

Stayed overnight, had first-rate the following morning, quiet rooms, good sleep. First night picked up relative coming in from over-seas, so 2 rooms worked best for us. Breakfast in a.m. first-rate in beautiful setting on Mezzanine floor.All service was tops, the location? The absolute BEST.

We were planning a last minute family trip to SF and I had to find a hotel that was not only in a convenient location but that also had the the amenities we needed for our toddler. After doing some research online and seeing that there weren't very many choices for hotels with kitchenettes, I found that the Grand Hyatt SF offered refrigerators (not many hotels do these days), connecting rooms and a microwave upon request. Plus, the bathroom sink was large enough for me to wash my baby's bottles!! All requests (microwave, extra towels, bellman, etc) were fulfilled at lightning speed. The hotel was so clean and modern. I loved having the outlet right on the dresser so that I could charge my phone. The remote controlled shade was awesome as was the reading lights attached to the headboard!! My only complaint would be that the drawers were very small but since our trip was short (2 nights), we didn't really bother to unpack. The location was ideal - right smack in the middle of Union Square and so convenient to everything. There is a Starbucks right across the street (and another one around the corner) so our morning coffee runs were quick and convenient. It was nice to be able to grab a cup of coffee and some breakfast while taking the baby for a quick stroll. Everyone from the valet guys, the check-in staff, the bellmen, etc. was very nice and polite. My husband kept mentioning that the hotel rate was so good for such an amazing hotel. Even though we were on the 14th floor, we could still hear the hustle and bustle of the streets below...that's what we get for staying in the city! If we wanted quiet, we would have stayed at a B&B in the country. But that did not deter us from getting a good night's rest. The beds were very comfortable. I normally do not sleep well in hotels on the first night but had absolutely no problem. That says a lot! Oh and our friends (who traveled with us but stayed on a different floor) brought their dog because the hotel is pet-friendly! What a bonus! We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

We stayed for four nights in November and was very pleased with the location. Our room was not ready when we arrived so we went to do some shopping nearby at Walgreens. After returning approximately one hour later, it still wasn't ready. I suggested they comp us dinner since it was way past check in time while we waited for our room. How quickly they found another room on a higher floor...which turned out to be a blessing because we ended up on the 29th floor with an awesome bay view!! The beds are very comfy. We felt very safe inside this hotel. I called security the first night due to loud people in the room next to us. Security arrived almost immediately and took care of the problem. The concierge was so helpful to us during our stay. I can't tell you how thankful I am that Angela helped me with something that needed safely secured for my flight home. She went out of her way to help me and smiled the entire time. Many fast food places nearby for quick meals. Powell St. one block over where you can catch the trolley to other tourist attractions. If you decide to buy any tours then I would suggest The Great Pacific Tour Co. They pick you up at the hotel in the smaller vans and start the tour almost immediately. We had to take the wine tour on a big bus with another co. and was not happy that we were taken to another location and transferred to another bus. We knew this was going to happen but the GOOD tour co. was already booked. I suggest booking ahead to get them as we did on one of the tours and had no problems. The area around the hotel itself is very busy and noisy. Be aware that you can hear this in the hotel rooms so don't expect it to be without noise. I would stay again in this hotel despite the street noise!!

We were in San Francisco to get married in early December 2013, and I think this was a great choice for our hotel. It was close to everything (not just Union Square, but also Chinatown and great restaurants). We're walkers, so honestly it was close to everything for us. Cabs were ALWAYS outside, so even on those occasions we didn't walk, transportation was effortless. The front-desk staff was average to good, but the restaurant staff was excellent. They were chatty in a friendly way, were curious about the brand of teabag I brought with me (yes, I'm one of THOSE people), and remembered us each day. And the breakfast and bar menu were fantastic. You won't be disappointed. Even the yogurt was fabulous.My only negatives were the televisions placed all over the hotel lobby and restaurant blasting Fox News. It seemed a very odd choice in such a liberal city, and I did not need to see it every time I walked out of the elevator. And the front desk staff could've been slightly more friendly. They were a little too business-like for my preference.

Stayed here 20 years ago, returned this past week, and it's still a terrific hotel. I got a great rate over New Years, including the breakfast package (a very nice buffet, the fruit was delicious, though the wait staff a bit obsequious). Was in a room that had some slight residual elevator noise the first night, and they were very accommodating to me, moving me to a 22nd floor room overlooking Union Square.Rooms were clean and very quiet, though if you face Union Square, sometimes you can get some late evening noise (music for the skaters; the obnoxious beeping from a lift moving up/down as they were removing decorations off Macy's windows across the street), but it was only one night, and done by midnight. A southern and eastern facing room yields the best views, and if you choose to utilize their fitness center (which has a good variety of equipment and is very well-maintained), you won't be disappointed with that view, either!

Great location in Union Square - close to lots of shopping and the trolley. We stayed on floor 29 and overlooked the ice skating rink. The elevators were fast so I would recommend a high floor. The lobby was always packed but using the back doors made it easily accessible. The rooms were very clean and modern. The lobby could use an updated in furniture. Lovely view. Downtown hotels are expensive but this was almost worth the extra money for the ease of location - don't bring your own car - nightly parking is too expensive in the city. Use the trolley; limo; or taxi. PS - No pool.

Have not got shares in Hyatt group, but my experience with them is their excellent customer service and this hotel did not disappoint. This was a 50th birthday treat and I had a brilliant room with great city views. The room was a great size, excellent staff and always being helpful with a smile. The beds were really comfortable, an issue for me as I hate hard beds, a good sized flat screen television. Will definitely stay again if I am in San Francisco again

My wife, 2 children and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 4 nights over the New Year period in a Suite and attaching king bedroom.The hotel did not come across as the typical Grand Hyatt. We have potentially spent up to $ 500,000.00 staying at Grand Hyatt`s, Park Hyatt`s and Andaz hotels around the world and felt a little let down at this hotel. We never contemplate staying at any other Hotel brand however after this stay will consider other brands similar to The Four Seasons.After breakfast on the second morning we were locked out of our suite / and attached room. We went down to the front reception and obtained new keys as this we thought was the problem. After trying the new keys we still could not access the rooms. We went back down to reception to be told that the keys are fine it was our credit card that had insufficient funds to pay for the rooms. We then made several frantic phone calls to try and get to the bottom of the issue knowing that there were sufficient funds on the credit card. We were then advised by our credit card provider that the issue is not with our card it was in fact the Grand Hyatt who was entering the incorrect expiry date. We took this up with the assistant manager Zac and he finally advised that it was their fault and simply said I hope you enjoy the remainder of your day. Due to this hiccup we managed to miss our tour on this day. Normally in a situation like this the Grand Hyatt brand would have apologised unconditionally and sent a bottle of wine to our room as a peace offering. It was clearly their mistake that ruined our day and made us miss the tour. Not good enough Hyatt ! It would appear the Asian Hyatt`s have far superior customer service. The TV in the main bedroom of the Suite did not work so we then had to phone twice to have it serviced. It still did not work so therefore I demanded another TV on the following day therefore meaning we had no working TV in the suite bedroom for almost 48 hours. There was no apology from management or any refund mentioned. Again not good enough Hyatt. In general we found the majority of the staff to be impersonal and overly stand - offish.The location is good however not ON Union Square.The hotel was obviously another hotel in its past life and the Grand Hyatt have tried to make it there own however with small pokey doorway entrances, noisy lifts in the middle of the night, impersonal staff, it falls short. Sad to say but on our return trip we will definitely consider the Four Seasons and if up to scratch will then forward our business to them - worldwide.madijack

My wife and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for our honeymoon for 6 nights. Check in was great. A warm welcome from one of the staff who informed us we had a complimentary upgrade to a room with a fantastic view of the city and Alcatraz!The room was lovely with a large flat screen tv, safe, electronic blinds. Complimentary coffee was also a bonus.We ordered room service once and the food was okay. We ate at the restaurant One Up and the food was great. Excellent service from the waiter too and barman!I used the 24 hour gym a few times. The equipment was all modern with fantastic views of the city.We really loved this hotel. It is modern. In a great location in Union Square.Here are the negatives and reason for marking down our review-Upon checking out we had a look at our bill onscreen which showed $200+ for room upgrade and room service. We just thought there was an error for the upgrade charge so thought nothing of it.When we went to the desk to check out it was a totally different experience than checking in. No greeting from the guy at the desk. No 'how was your stay' or anything like that. We questioned the bill to which he replied saying there wasn't anything showing on the system to say that we've received a complimentary upgrade. He did mention there was a note on the system saying they would send up a gift to celebrate our honeymoon though (we didn't receive this 'gift') After a brief debate about the bill he had a word with his manager who then agreed to take the charge off the bill and then they would be in touch if there need to question the bill. After that no goodbye or hope you enjoyed your stay. Nothing. Maybe this guy didn't want to be in work on New Years Day I don't know, but we can say that sadly our impressions of the hotel were mixed and the negative was down to one staff member.

The location was fantastic, close to everything. Our room featured a floor to ceiling window, which would have been great if we were higher floor and were able to see more than only the hotel closest to us! The door men were friendly, the front desk staff didn't seen too happy or very welcoming. My biggest issue was the carpet in our room, it was dirty and had visible stains.

The hotel is right in union square in san francisco. We stayed in mid December and it was very festive at the hotel and the surrounding area. We had a room with a nice view of the city. The staff was very friendly and efficient. My kids ordered room service; the room service menu is very limited but the delivery time was decent.The room was smaller, but given we are in the heart of San Francisco, it is to be expected. The room was modern and the bathroom was larger and well stocked. The Hyatt bed is always comfortable.We had the breakfast buffet. The selection at the buffet was very limited. The staff was really terrific.I liked this hotel better than the Westin in Union Square where we had previously stayed around Christmas time. Will return to this Grand Hyatt next time we are in SF for Christmas festivities.

Checking in was very easy with nice employee. Chain hotel feeling though. Rooms ok for the deal we got for family with three children. Nice plus to get an included breakfast buffet - lovely and healthy choices! Rooms have been renovated but on beige/brown sad side. Very slim doors at bathroom and hallway doors. No in room bar. Tiny fridge though and coffee maker. Hard to find out how lights work! Good tv, wifi reception so so.. Lots of noise in the AM from cleaning ladies in adjacent rooms as early as 7am. Good view on city and bay from bay side though (higher floors). Down side: a bit chain like and room cleaning down to minimum (maybe because we were a family?) not even refill of soaps/ shampoos etc.!!! No cleaning of coffee maker holder, some days not even vacuum of room... People in this country have a strange tendency to think that families don't care about cleanness and organized rooms!!! How strange.. they usually care more than others. Still, good compromise for 2 connecting rooms and very central too.

This past fall with stayed at the Grand Hyatt Kauai and it definitely sets the standard of grand. I do not believe that I am making an unfair comparison in stating that the SF Hyatt falls well below this benchmark. My wife, daughter and I typically make it a point to stay at a hotel on Union Square during the holidays to bask in the beauty of all that is great about SF this time of year. Last year we stayed at the Westin St. Francis which was nice. This year we decided to give the Hyatt a chance.When we arrived we had to double park, this is downtown SF and is to be expected. After securing someone to assist with the bags, I mentioned that there were several coats in the rear driver's side where I had left the vehicle's door open. After acknowledging my request, he briefly engaged another guest and then began wheeling the baggage cart to the door. I pointed out he had forgotten the coats (and my car door was still open to traffic). He realized his err and went to pick up the remainder of our luggage. This would not be that big a deal but for our subsequent experience. Check-in was easy and to the GHSF's credit they have a modernized set-up where the staff mingles with guests checking in at a number of tables and utilizes iPads for check in. We had a nice room on the 23rd floor overlooking a corner of Union Square and facing the Sir Francis Drake. One criticism about the room, however, they do not stock it at all period. Now many hotels have gone away with honor bars but it would be nice to at least have a little bottled water, even if we were charged for it. Instead, everything had to be ordered via room service or an on floor vending machine.Room service was another unfortunate let down. As we had tickets to take my 5 year old to see the Nutcracker Ballet, we decided to order room service to make it in time for the show which started at 7 pm. The GHSF has an online ordering system for room service which allows you to make your selections via your television. It will even allow you to set a time for delivery of your order. We placed an order at 3:30 and elected 5 pm for delivery. My daughter had been asleep for about 20 minutes when we received a knock in the door "room service". As it was only about 4 pm, I opened the door and informed the server that the time of delivery was 5 pm. Fortunately my daughter slept through the interruption. The server returned at 5 pm and the quesadillas we had ordered were terrible. Flavorless, flour tortillas folded in half. I don't expect a whole lot from room service, but again this is a Grand Hyatt.Waiting for a taxi to take us to the Nutcracker was another adventure. And thought it is really hard to get taxis this time of year in downtown SF, it was if there was no system in place to secure them. It was if it was the first time the bell hops had dealt with the problem. And it almost appeared as though cabs were avoiding the GHSF for some reason.Finally, after checking out of our rooms around 11 am, we requested the bell desk to hold our bags so we could grab breakfast and do a little shopping. I was handed 5 claim checks for each of our bags. When we returned to the hotel, valet brought around my car and I requested our bags. After 15-20 minutes of waiting a bell hop came out with 2 of out bags. He reentered the hotel and after 10 minutes came out and asked what the remaining bags looked like. I can only imagine what the storage area must have looked like.All in all we did have an enjoyable stay, we only wish the GHSF could have done a much better job to make it better.

On arrival we had to look for someone to help us with our bags, which was a disappointing start. The check-in was smooth and our request for adjoining rooms was accommodated, but at the cost of a room with a view, so sadly we had a view of other buildings and we looked down onto the roof of UGG. The rooms were clean modern and comfortable and the beds were very comfortable. The bathrooms were also clean and had good amenities, but were quite small. We found the service throughout the hotel quite cold and impersonal, and room service took ages. One Up bar/lounge is a great place to unwind and relax with a drink and a snack after a long day. The hotel's major advantage is it's proximity to all the shopping, dining and attractions of Union square and we happened to be there during the weekend of Santa Con...the Santa convention. We were treated to thousands of Santas of all shapes sizes, styles and parental guidance ratings ;-)

The view was very nice, is a very big property in the very heart of San Francisco so easy to walk to the best places , the room very comfortable and big , the bar area super we expended new year was super busy but we really enjoy.The concierge very nice and helpful .

Positive: -modern-awesome bathroom-great view-location (starbucks across road)-fancy and sophisticatedNegatIve: -the only negative I have is that if you have a room up high, you can feel and hear earth tremors, not pleasant for those who are nervous

We stayed 3 nights at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco. We paid for a city view with an AAA discount. At check in we were able to get a corner room - a tad larger than a regular room because we had a roll away to accommodate. We had room 2308. Our view was amazing!! Floor to ceiling windows with a shade controller on both sides of the King sized bed. The hotel is located a short short block from Union Square. Great location right by China Town, terrific shopping and restaurants. You'll need to drive or take transportation to Pier 39 but we actually walked back through Ghiradelli Square, Lombard St., North Beach and Chinatown. A lot of walking to be sure but we enjoy being active and it's a good way to see all the neighborhoods. The valet is very pricey $60/night but the "self park" is actually assisted parking around the corner where you have to wait for them to get your car. The $20 extra is worth the valet service. They'll have your car at the front at a certain time if you request it and they are very very friendly and helpful with directions. The lobby area is a bit chaotic but we didn't use it much nor did we go to any on site dining. The concierge desk is also helpful and easy to locate. The beds are very comfortable and our room was very quite - no street noise or noise from the hallways. I also felt very safe walking near our hotel at night. I would definitely stay here again.

spend 4 nights there with family on club floor-informal check in, great service, terrific locationGym needs to be expanded and on a Sunday morning there literally wasn't a machine or a weight available-fabulous room on 30th floor with wall length windows and great viewsIt was service with a smile

Rooms are all very clean and while chic and simple, also cozy and most with great views. The location is terrific. Did not eat in house so can't comment on that. Very pleasant stay and great staff from valets to front desk and cleaners

LOVE this hotel! It's a great location, right next to union square. My room overlooked it. Fantastic service. I had left my room for a couple if hours in the evening and when I returned, there was wine and cheese waiting for me in the room! A perfect before dinner appetizer. Amenities in the room were well appointed. I was welcomed with the tv on and a "welcome" was up on the tv with my name. They had just gone through a remodel of the rooms and it looked fantastic. Check in was easy and quick, an early check in at that. The staff was friendly and welcoming. I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed here for three nights over Christmas and everything was perfect. The location can't be beat and the service was spot on. All the employees were helpful and friendly. The concierge really knew the city well. We liked that they had a small breakfast area (not in a restaurant) that served bagels, coffee, cereal etc. We had two connecting rooms for a family of 5 and they were both immaculate. Although the hotel was extremely busy, we still felt we got personalized attention! The only semi complaint is that the valet parking cost so much!

I enjoyed our visit to San Francisco and our stay at the Grand Hyatt.Upon check in we were upgraded to a higher floor with a better view. With the upgrade they up charged me on my bill $50.00 per day and that was for the use of a club room. I didn't know that we had to pay for the upcharge as I would not have paid for the use of the room. They charge you for beer, wine and alcohol on top of the $50.00 not worth it. The food was marginal and the staff in the room spoke very broken English. Over all the staff was vary friendly and enjoyable to converse with. I would stay here again.

The Grand Hyatt in San Francisco is one of the best hotels I have stayed at in America. The staff are very friendly and professional. The room was so spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable. Room service and the restaurant were excellent and the clam chowder was so yummy. Concierge were very helpful. The location couldn't have been better, Union Square is so lovely with great shops located nearby. I would strongly recommend staying here.

Chose Grand Hyatt as one of our Hyatt program reward nights on our recent visit to San Francisco. This hotel stands right in the middle of all the shopping and dining action. We got the Union Square view room on the 29th floor. Nice view of the ice skating rink below and the Macy's building well decorated for the holidays. The christmas tree on Union Square was quite a sight at night. The furnishings and gadgets in the room and bathroom were top notch. Comfortable bed, beautiful view, location, free Wifi, professional and courteous staff, everything perfect. Only issue was with the valet parking which at $55 is way too expensive. There are a couple of parking garages in the immediate vicinity that are way cheaper if you don't intend to take your car out often. If you are here just for shopping, you do not need a car to move around the local area as everything is close-by.

We stayed here for the Fight Hunger Bowl and got a room on the 34th floor. We had a great view of the city from our room. The rooms were beautiful and very spacious. They were very clean and looked like they have been recently updated. The room is equipped with the latest in tech gadgets as well. The staff was very helpful including suggestions as to how we could get around the city and recommendations for dining.

We stayed in San Fransico for the last 49er home game and this place was amazing. We had never been to San Fransico before and really had know idea where to stay. I am so glad I choose the Grand Hyatt. We stayed for 4 nights and although it was very busy with Christmas shopping it was close to everything and worth every cent. Everyone on staff was friendly and helpful. Even made our dinner reservations. I love this place. Work out center was amazing with views from the 35 floor, who wouldn't want to workout. Only down side was the noise, but what else would you expect with it being Christmas and everyone shopping last minute. Thank you Grand Hyatt for making my first time in San Fransico remarkable and unforgetable for my family and I.

We had excellent service at check-in. They have a lot of elevators. The rooms are beautifully appointed in leather and wood. Nice bed. We had a view to the east, I think there are some to the north with a view of the Golden Gate. But our view was still pretty great. We ate in the lounge which had good options though the staff seemed overwhelmed. The place was slammed though but hey, it was the last weekend before Christmas in a hotel off Union Square. We drank in the bar (One Up I think) which was great fun. Only negative note was the concierge was pretty much useless. Gave us bad information, took forever, didn't know much. Pretty bad. But the rest of the experience was wonderful. But if you want a great lobby, stay at the Hyatt Regency which is simply spectacular. Would stay here again for a Union Square trip though.

The room was quite expensive objectively, even if it was in line with other downtown hotels. Still, it was a reasonably good value in that everything at the hotel was spot on. The wifi was fast, the room was well appointed and clean. The Sutter Stockton Garage across the street was a cheaper, convenient alternative to the valet.

It's my second time to stay in GHSF. The last time was before its renovation. This time with everything redesigned it's a whole new experience. The once dated lobby has become so modern. They allowed us to check in early at 9 am and the process was so smooth. We got a standard city view room with quite nice view (China Town, the Transamerica Pyramid and Coit Tower). The room was so clean and modern. My first time to see electric curtains in a hotel. At first we couldn't locate the room service menu. Later we found out that we needed to use the TV and the remote with a trackball to order. Choices are great and price is reasonable for a luxury hotel. The bed is the usual Hyatt grand bed and was thus good. Toiletries were now June Jacobs (the same as Grand Hyatt Hong Kong) and we're

We just returned from a happy but exhausting weekend shopping trip to San Francisco.Our stay at the Grand Hyatt Union Square could not have been nicer.We arrived at 4 PM on December 20 and our connecting rooms on the 23rd floor were waiting for us upon our arrival.Our son was with us so he had his own room. He loves his privacy.I had read reviews here about the potential noise facing Stockton Street so I had requested and was given a "city facing room" which turned out to be excellent.The only noise we heard was an occasional faintly distant siren.My wife and I thought the bed was just one of the most comfy we have slept in forever.I had trouble getting her out of it to do some shopping and explore the Union Square area.As mentioned here by others, the bathroom lighting was great. My wife said it made putting her make-up on a cinch. I should also say the hotel's hallways are set up so that there is very little walking to one's roomand yet the elevators are positioned so that there is not a noise factor from them or the people using them. This can be a problem at some hotels but not this one.Our primary goal this trip was for shopping and we spent a great deal of time out and aboutdoing just that. The streets all around Union Square were overflowing with shoppers and it was a fun time to mingle with all of them.We met up with my youngest sister and family at the Macy's Men's Store down the street from the hotel. After a full day of shopping and visiting a million stores we all had dinner at Tony's in Little Italy over in the North Beach area of the city. Great food and fun time all around!We have been to San Francisco many times over the years and always enjoy our visits.I must say the Grand Hyatt Union Square will be our choice from this day forward.The personnel there could not have been more friendly and accommodating.I just want to give a very special thanks to Ron, William and Jessica who were as nice as one can be.My only complaint about our stay is and was that we had to leave and fly home.

I travel to San Francisco for business a lot and I've stayed at quite a few hotels in the city and whenever the Grand Hyatt comes up on my company's travel booking system I look no further! The rooms are fantastic - brand new, super bright bathroom, excellent shower, very comfortable beds and accommodations. The views are amazing. The staff are great and check in is very fast ( they have multiple staff with laptops checking you in). The location is perfect. Starbucks is right outside the front door and a perfect location next to union square.

My wife and I spent one night at the Hyatt during our coastal getaway. We upgraded to a room which had a view of Union Square. I highly recommend it. The hotel is modern but still has a warm feel to it. The rooms are very clean and nicely decorate. Only problem was water pressure. We will be back.

My wife and I stayed in a standard room with a king bed on the 18th floor. The room itself was really nice, clean, and comfortable with a modern look and a lot of modern conveniences. Overall, I feel like staying here was a pretty good value. I only had two minor complaints. (1) Despite being 18 floors up, it seemed like a lot of city traffic noise still came through the windows. I live in a quiet suburb, so maybe I'm more sensitive to it than most people. (2) The only light in the bathroom is extremely bright. A nightlight would have been nice. Why? Because the door to the bathroom is translucent. So, if somebody goes to the bathroom during the night, you have to turn on a light that illuminates not just the bathroom, but the entire hotel room.

Conveniently placed near the bustle of Fisherman's Wharf, but sufficiently set back to be quiet, this hotel offers almost everything- at a price. It would have been nice to have coffee-making facilities in the room, and the split-level reception area was a bit odd, and not too convenient when handling luggage. But efficient staff, and a pleasant stay- thank you.

Nothing to complain about, but two things. The fan in my room was noisy and you had to pay for a fast Internet connection. Although, on the positive side, the free Internet Connection was not so bad after all. I would stay there again. Oh, and by the way, the restaurant was too small for breakfast, but the breakfast was excellent

I used to live in the Bay Area, so it pains to have to stay in a hotel when I visit. Or rather, it pains my pocketbook to have to stay in a hotel when I visit.We chose the Grand Hyatt because of its location and because rates were discounted because of nearby construction. The hotel is modern and sleek, but not cold and unfeeling. Despite the apparent enormity of the building itself, the lobby and front desks feel contained in a small space.Breakfast is not complimentary here, nor would I recommend it. SF is a city brimming with cafes and patisseries. Coffeehouses are a charming part of the local experience, and are more memorable than the lobby cafe, which is unremarkable in any way.Our room was spotlessly clean and crisply decorated with cool greys, bright whites and right angles. The floor-to-celing windows overlooked Union Square. However the room itself was a shoebox. Space is at a premium in SF. The room had two double beds, not queen-sized. There was no room for much of anything else.Parking was $36 per day in a garage around the corner. Such is life in the City. Fortunately the car was unnecessary for getting around SF. The hotel is a short walk to cable car, MUNI and BART stops, and there are many sights to see in the immediate vicinity of the hotel such as Union Square shopping, and Chinatown.

This hotel has been recently remodeled and unfortunately the ground floor is not very welcoming any more. I saw several people walk in and not understand how to use the self check in kiosks. There were workers at some of them and others were unmanned and people were wandering around the back sides of them not knowing where to go to get checked in. I think it's trying to be uber-modern euro style but it's just weird. I recommend that the hotel replace this stuff with a regular check in counter.My room was on the 12th floor and was clean and very comfortable and had a great view of the city. One concern with the room was that the heater did not work very efficiently. I had it cranked up all the way (outside was around 40 F) and it was just extremely slow and weak to warm up. I wonder if they have the heaters throttled so as to not waste electricity or something? Well regardless it was too cold. So I recommend that you talk to the front desk and make sure you can get them to get your room warm. Maybe they could have helped...The location was great and the immediate vicinity is clean and walkable and fairly low on homeless people. I very much appreciated the free wifi.I will stay here again for sure, but still recommend that the hotel consider going back to a more traditional reception desk and be aware of potential problems with the heaters.

The hotel itself is very nice, which it should be for the price.What isn't so nice is the noise. The large windows in the rooms facing Stockton Street mean you will hear the doormen blowing a screeching whistle to hail cabs, and every conversation of people on the street.The other noise factor was that the walls are PAPER thin.

Great location - right on Union square for all of the shopping you could need. Only a few blocks from the trams that will take you along market street to either the wharf or to the Castro. Really comfortable room, clean and nice size (bay view room). AND, importantly, free wifi! Really great gym facility as well.

Overall, I love this hotel--I stay here every year. This year, however, there was something different about the hotel. Usually the bellmen are very welcoming--opening the doors as you go in and out of the hotel, greeting you upon your return, etc. This year, they would literally stand there, not greet you, and let you go up and open the door yourself (even when your arms were full). It was the strangest thing. They just didn't seem as happy as they were in the past. It was very cold so it could have been due to this...but it just seemed like their morale was low. I hope this will be remedied by next year because it really helps send a positive message to visitors when they take the time to greet you and welcome you back to the hotel. The rest of the stay was fine and I loved my room.

found this ideal if you want a downtown hotel for buisness, not so much if your doing the sightseeing stuff. the hotel was under going a renovation when we were there so it all felt a bit un organized. but the rooms were nice with a city view.

I rarely stay at Hyatt properties but this was the only hotel available (under $600) on one of my weeks in San Francisco. I was pleasantly surprised by the amenities, room decor/size, service, and an upgrade to VIP suite was given on my first stay. Delighted by the experience, I signed up for the Hyatt royalty program and have stayed at this hotel the last four business trips. Perhaps the bar was set too high after my first trip as my stays since have been "fine" to "average." The rooms are modern and spacious (for San Francisco), beds are comfortable, and the views are terrific - corner suites above the 30th floor. I appreciate that they don't charge for wireless and breakfast and bottled waters are included (with Business Plan or Club Lounge package). Watching the sunrise from the fitness room while on treadmill is uplifting and the facility is better than most hotels.OneUp bar drinks are fine - nothing special. Service is slow and often curt. There are better after-work bars and lounges nearby with Happy Hour. I would not recommend the food - not even the cheese tray.I've only had the breakfast buffet at the restaurant and wish they would switch up the menu for the regulars and for those who stay 2+ nights. The morning service at the restaurant has been consistently good, fast, and reliable. I am not a morning person, and they've been more than accommodating. Can't say the same for others...Service from front desk and door man have been mixed. Some are super friendly, courteous and helpful. Others barely make eye contact, speak with impatience, and don't bother to open the door for you. And the doors are heavy! I think a nice greeting as one enters the hotel would set the right tone for a guest's stay/return. I've never had to wait in line for check-in/out but have not always been able to check in early as requested.I've used the Club Lounge once and preferred the service here to the OneUp bar. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel for business travelers as long as you can tolerate the inconsistencies in service from different departments. Frequent business travel can be tiring, and sometimes, friendly and consistent service matters as much as (if not more than) nice spacious rooms.

My wife and I stayed at Grand Hyatt for the weekend while attending my best friend's wedding. The interior decor is superb. Super modern. Just the way I like it. The service was great. The staff was very professional and courteous through out. The only downside of staying at a hotel in downtown is the parking fee. It is not cheap.

Enjoyed a 2 night stay on vacation. Very centrally located, room recently renovated and clean. Front desk and concierge desk staff friendly and helpful. Made our short stay in San Fran very enjoyable.

This hotel is amazing. It totally blew me away from start to finish. It's super high-tech, so you check yourself in (some glitches, though, the keys the machine made me didn't work and I had to call for help but they came quickly and replaced them) and everything you need is on your TV remote. That didn't have batteries that worked, so maintenance came right up and replaced them and everything was A-1 from there. I really loved the room -- spacious, elegant, clean and relaxing, with Asian/modern decor and soft lighting. The bathroom was huge, the view beautiful, the bed sumptuous and the best part was the FOOD. I had the BEST French Dip sandwich I have ever had in my life. It was stacked thick with prime rib meat, carmelized grilled onions and real au jus. Just delicious! I will definitely stay at this hotel every time I am in San Francisco. Loved it!

My husband and I were celebrating our news of pregnancy with dinner. As a spur of the moment thing, he told me to choose any hotel I wanted in the city. We had a wonderful experience before at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf, so I wanted to try this one. My mistake... The service was terrible! Let me break it down...1) Check in: My husband and I were waiting in line to check in, when out of no where, a woman with blonde hair came up to my husband asking "Are you here to deliver food?" My husband said no and she asked again, "Oh so you're not delivering food?" To which my husband responded, "No... I'm checking in..." Really?!? Okay... so my husband WAS holding a large brown bag, which was from our leftovers from dinner, but he was ALSO holding my hand... Incredibly rude! She didn't even apologize. She might want to ask, "How may I help you this evening?" next time so she doesn't make the mistake again. I wish I got her name...2) My husband and I reserved a room with a city view, but when we got to the room, we were hesitant to stay in it because it was adjoining, so I called down to the front desk to see if we can switch. The front desk associate told me that they had a room that was in a lower floor, but it was next to the ice machine. My husband and I decided to take our chances. When I got to the room, we I had a view of a parking structure, which was noisy all night... I had to do research on my own to figure out that we were downgraded... It would have been nice if they had told us straight out.3) I called down, letting the front desk know that we had not been notified that we were going to be downgraded and I wanted to make sure that our rate would reflect the downgraded rate... front desk said "Okay, we will give you a refund..." The bill gets slipped under our door in the middle of the night and of course... the rate was not adjusted....4) We did the breakfast package. My husband asked the host at the restaurant if we could take the food up to our room after we saw a few guests leave to the elevators with full plates, which she also saw. She said we could not, but then apologized. I wondered why the other guests we saw were an exception... As my husband and I were eating, the server placed the bill on our table, telling us if it was complimentary, to let the front know and pointed toward the hosts. My husband left to go back to the room because he wasn't feeling well. About 10 minutes later, I was about to leave to bring the bill to the host as the server had instructed when the very same server yelled "EXCUSE ME, MA'AM!!!" I was just a couple steps away from my table and him... There was no need to yell and embarrass me... I turned around and he said "You have to fill that out!" I told him that I knew I had to, but I thought he said to go bring it to the front to which is replied "No. You leave it at the table." Really... the only people that were friendly were the gentlemen doing the valet parking and the bartenders (especially Ben). It's ironic how the only name I cared to look at at that time was the only person who displayed genuine hospitality.

We are avid Hyatt stayers and part of their platinum rewards program. We were in-town for Thanksgiving and received impeccable service at check-in and a gorgeous upgraded room with a view of the bay and Coit Tower. It made our Thanksgiving break and our city experience extra special. The beds are ultra soft, rooms impeccable and modern, and a great happy hour goes until 7 pm to top it off. We have frequented Park Hyatts in Paris and Sydney this year as well as the new Hyatt in New York. As close Central Coast dwellers, we will be back to this Hyatt as our go-to hotel for city excursions. Thank you, Hyatt!

I surprised my daughter on her 16th birthday and whisked her away from Canada to SF and stayed at the Grand Hyatt this past weekend. From the moment we checked in, to the very moment we departed, our stay was absolutely fantastic! Since this was my first time in the city, I was looking for a central location and was I ever amazed at how close we were to everything! Shopping, restaurants, trams, cable cars, etc - you name it!The Hyatt is an upscale zen-style hotel with great modern rooms, a lovely clientele and plenty of smiles from the staff. We walked into a few other hotels and all this did was justify our decision to stay at this property. The executive floors are exquisite and access to the lounge was top-notch. Your private concierge is there to help you with anything you need. Breakfast was delicious and the views were breathtaking. Free Wi-Fi is also a big plus. The head concierge went out of her way to spoil us for our double celebration (birthdays) and I was so impressed - it was unbelievable. We felt so welcome there! I travel the world for business and have to say that the customer service at this hotel was outstanding. Whether you are there for work or for pleasure this hotel has it all. It was one of the best concierge services I have encountered. A huge thanks to TT for taking such special care of us and making my daughter's very special birthday such a terrific and exciting experience. We are already making plans to return with the family and will not stay anywhere else but at the Grand Hyatt. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit this spectacular city - and please note that I am a very picky traveller!Take the early-bird and audio tour of Alcatraz (what a production!), day trip to Sausalito and ride the cable cars and trams - great way to get around the city and see the sights! Great outdoor markets worth exploring and take your time to discover small little gems of stalls and local products.Thank you to all the TA specialists for SF in the forums - you guys were great helpers!TIP IF YOU WANT TO TREAT YOURSELVES : We took a beautiful new town car from the airport to the hotel with a great company called Pleasant Limo - excellent service and a nice way to start out our trip. On the way back, the hotel had a limo service available outside the front doors which was also fantastic.

Booked via hyatt.comCheck in: Very, very, very friendly. Fastest check in everCheck out: Better than ever express checkout. Very fast, very friendly.Location: Very good, close to action, but not to close to touristsAccommodation: Nice room, clean, well equipped. Good beds, quiet. very good views.Overall; Good place to stay in SF. Fair value. I will come back.

Having just joined the Hyatt program and having an incredible experience at the Park Hyatt Tokyo I was not expecting the same level of service or amenities here in San Francisco but little did I expect a marginally better than Motel 6 experience. Here are a few things to keep in mind if you book this hotel. 1) Location is great. Could not be better2) Rooms are small but adequate with abysmal housekeeping. Sheets not changed in 3 nights, lights not working, a shower handle falling off and general filth in the common areas. One is even wary of touching the buttons to the elevators they are so grubby. 3)DO NOT PAY EXTRA FOR THE CLUB FLOOR...It is a children's playground. Breakfast tables and chairs are cluttered with food and screaming children. Evening drinks is even worse with last night 11.. yes 11 children playing games, scattering toys around and screaming while their parents slopped food all over the tables. We finally refused to eat breakfast in the club room and have avoided drinks in the evening. This despite the nicest manager, David who has no backup from management to do anything about the chaos in the too small room. Food is poor and wine selection is at best, cheap and cheerful.4) In general staff are very pleasant and helpful with some long time employees knowing how to anticipate guest's needs. That nothwithstanding no top management was in the hotel over the Thanksgiving period when I stayed. Utter chaos with no leadership5) If this is the standard of Hyatt hotels in the US then one better look for another program to join. I MOST CERTAINLY WILL. 6) Living in Asia and enjoying top level hotels the standard of this property at this price is shocking. Thank you to David in the Club room who tried and cared for his much disgruntled guests who experienced the horror of the Club room. Ripped off? Absolutely... will never return despite an annual visit to SF.

As a Diamond member I was contacted 24hrs before my stay by Erica, a concierge team member, asking if I had any requests before I checked in. I usually thank someone for such a gesture and then politely respond "I do not." However we were not arriving until after 11pm (traveling from the east coast) so half kidding I wrote back saying "It would be great to have In&Out waiting for us in the room."I did not think anything of it until we arrived and there were Burgers, Fries and Milk Shakes (fresh) waiting for us in our room. I had made a strange, even outrageous, request and the concierge staff took care of it with ease. That is GREAT service!In addition - the room and views were beautiful. I will definitely be returning on my next trip to San Fran.

As a native from San Francisco that currently lives elsewhere, what a welcome surprise to be treated in my hometown as a valued guest. From the moment we arrived the front desk representative was welcoming and helpful. Steve had a terrific personality, a friendly vibe, and a helpful attitude. He gave us an overview of the hotel and added in a bit of the history of the hotel. Our 14th floor room was quiet, beautifully decorated and was immaculate. I've stayed everywhere in the city and this is my new favorite hotel. The food is delicious and our breakfast that was included with our room was perfect. We couldn't have asked for more, and we will definitely be back very soon.

I stayed here for my birthday weekend and when I first arrived it was about 3pm and the traffic to get into union square was ridiculously hectic. There is no official parking structure for the hotel but there were other available nearby structures for $37 a night except Sunday for $18. Then upon checking in they found out it was my birthday and said they would send up a bottle if wine, how nice. The room was nice, clean, nicely decorated, free wifi and comfortable beds. The only reason I didn't give them the extra star is because they didn't bring me the cups I requested and prior to that placed me on hold for a long time. If you're looking to have a nice dinner get in a cab and head to Foreign Cinema, excellent.Pros: - Amazing location near union square- Clean and comfortable- Free wifiCons:- No official parking- Traffic around the area can get crowded during prime time so plan accordingly

I stayed at this hotel for 7 days for a work conference. For conferences held as Moscone, this hotel is the perfect distance away-- close enough to walk, but far enough away that the madness has dissipated by the time you return "home".First, the only small complaints I have are minor:The front door guys aren't staffed enough to effectively open the doors at all times. For those times there aren't enough, they need to have auto door openers. The doors are large and glass and heavy. They had some nice self check in options, but seemed to guide everyone to humans. I'm someone who would have preferred to check myself in, but was guided to a human line. I didn't prefer that.I had an annoyance that my room often wasn't cleaned by 3 p.m., when I'd often return from the conference and get ready for dinner. I made a single tweet about this displeasure and they replied to me right away and fixed it. Very pleased with this service.We had the breakfast buffet each day. It was nice. The lounge area has very high ceilings and 3 mini living room setups with TV's and a fireplace. A great "great room" common area to meet, relax, people watch or wait for your team. The elevators were fast & efficient without losing your stomach. I stayed on the 28th floor and faced Alcatraz. I was very pleased with the view and with the room. The room was appointed nicely in a good mix of modern luxury. The bed was good and the pillows were simply fantastic and luxurious. I wanted to go home with my luggage full of them! (I did photo the brand) My particular room was 2805, and happened to be right next to the ice machine. This generally was not a problem. The bathroom was nice, and the lighting around the mirror was also absolutely fantastic. Bright enough but mellow enough to make everyone look fantastic. Nice trick on that one ;) The TV worked fine and had some internet options that I did not take advantage of. I used the free internet and it worked well for my every purpose including video streaming. They offer a premium service and I suppose at some times it might be necessary for more bandwidth hungry applications, but during this visit it worked great for me. The room was on the high end of acceptable cost for a business trip, but we had few options. In the end, we were quite pleased with the service, hotel and location and I could imagine we will come back as a team if we attend this conference again in the future.

We recently went to San Francisco just for the night. We packed in two days of activities and loved coming back to this hotel as home base. The location couldn't be better! The room was very nice and included a night shade remote by the bed so you can make it dark whenever you want. Also in the City I worry about noise coming through the room from the street. This wasn't an issue. It's such a solid, nice hotel with nice rooms and thick windows :) I didn't need my earplugs.The valet parking guy was a little snooty that we opted to park in their self park lot across the street but whatever! It saved us about $20.00 or more I think. The hotel check in staff were very friendly. The view from our room was wonderful, we opted for the city view room.I don't think you can go wrong staying here!

I completely recommend this hotel. I recently stayed here 2 nights on a business trip where the conference was held in the hotel on the 36th (top) floor. The views from the top were EXCELLENT! My room on the 18th overlooked Union Square. The room was well appointed and clean. Bed was very comfortable. Loved the bathroom, the closet and the work/desk area. Staff was excellent and friendly. I did not eat in the restaurant or drink in the bar, and why would I when I'm in the heart of San Francisco. I will stay here the next time I come to San Francisco.

We stayed at this Hotel a few years ago and it was a very nice experience. After the $100 Million Modern renovation, it is really only caters to Business travel. Not really a place to bring your kids. I booked an "Executive Suite" in Advance with the Hotel. When we arrived we went to our Suite and I noticed there were no roll-away beds for my two children to sleep on. Even after it was confirmed before we arrived. The manager on duty was rude and indifferent. She informed me that it is a fire hazard to have 2 roll-away beds in the Suite.Even AFTER this Suite was confirmed weeks before we arrived. Now mind you, I have stayed at many other Hyatt Hotels and "Executive Suites" are large with ample room for a family. BUT, NOT AT THIS HOTEL. I finally got through to the director of rooms and after a long redundant conversation they worked with me...FINALLY. So again, I am NOT staying here with my family anymore.

We spent a weekend at the Grand Hyatt on Union Square and were absolutely impressed by our room and the service we received. We were familiar with the so-so hotel prior to the major renovation they made and all we can say is that it is a night and day difference. The decor is now modern and tasteful and the staff were wonderfully accommodating for a wonderfully enjoyable birthday weekend. The lounge in the lobby area featured great appetizers, decent drinks, and the live music featured there was some of the best I've ever experienced at a hotel chain. Hyatt made a big investment in upgrading this property top to bottom and it clearly shows. Now when I want to get a room in San Francisco at Union Square, this is my new go-to place.

The location was good, near Union Square and good for shopping and dining, everything in walking distance. Only about 15 minutes from the airport (in good traffic). The room was clean and modern, the staff were friendly. It was a very busy hotel. We ate in the restaurant which is where the experience declined, not a great selection my meal was average and my son was not impressed - we had to go and find a snack afterwards!! Parking was expensive, but that is normal for San Francisco as parking is very limited in the center. Overall a good time.

Stayed here in October for 5 nights on the 1st leg of a trip.Pretty nice hotel with a good bar that serves good food, rooms are spacious and beds are comfortable and the concierge were helpful. A great base to explore San Francisco from.

Fantastic location - middle of Union Square facing Macy's, Bloomingdales, etc. Fantastic staff - everyone was so courteousFantastic food choices Just a lovely hotel option, had a great King size room facing Macy's/Union Square. I would definitely stay again if I could in San Fran.

The hotel was nice, newly re-innovated with excellent location. It is only walking distance from union square and the market street, where most of the brands are available. The service was nice with good price value. We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights. The room was wide, modern and the bed comfortable and clean. The room service was good with variety of choices.I highly recommend this hotel for families vacation and business trips.

We had 6 nights here in Nov. All staff were very helpful. Room was fabulous and totally renovated, we looked out straight into union Square. The King Bed and pillows were so comfortable. The location is perfect as it is right in the heart of Union Square with all the restaurants and shops and only 2min walk to get on the tram to Fisherman's Wharf or 2 blocks to the underground if you want to go further which we did to Oakland Stadium to watch the Oakland Raiders. Also really handy for the hop on hop off bus. So glad we choose this hotel and would love to stay there again. I highly recommend the Grand Hyatt.

The hotel has a perfect location for public transportation, (BART, MUNI and cable car) walking distance to Fisherman's Wraf and AT&T ball park. The entrance has a beautiful atrium with interior restaurants and bar. Accommodations are very nice and each rooms have excellent views of the city.

I was (am) here on a very short business trip and could not have been happier with my stay at the Grand Hyatt. First, the location is absolutely perfect - about a block to Union Square, close to shopping, China town, etc. Second, the atmosphere is spot on for modern, chic, and relaxing. Love the music, the design of the space (lobby and restaurant/bar) as well as the colors. Very much enjoy the fireplace/literary theme. Room - spacious and the bed is very comfy. Love the view from my room on the 16th floor and the automatic shade. Bathroom amenities are modern.OneUp restaurant/bar - again, love the design and the atmosphere. The bartenders were friendly and helpful. Live music on a Friday night was great and perfect for a glass of wine after my business event. Could have some healthier food nibbles in the bar section, but still good. The breakfast spread was nice, though a bit pricey. Overall - great stay, friendly and helpful staff. Loved the atmosphere. Spot on for what I was looking for. Will definitely come back in the future. Hopefully, not just for business!

Had a 3 night stay at this beautiful hotel. Entrance very open and classy. Bellman always got the door for you and a taxi. About a 10 minute brisk walk to convention center or 8.00 cab ride. Great food. A little pricey. 40.00 salad was amazing from room service. More homeless than I have seen in awhile. Didn't feel threatened but uncomfortable.

We stayed for 3 nights last week in Room 1009The bed/pillows are the worst that we have ever slept on. Not fitting of Grand Hyatt.It is so "spongy" and none of the pillows accorded any support whatsoever.....my wife and I both ended up with stiff necks.There is a gap of about an inch between the main door and the carpet - so every single word and footsteps filters right into the room.The breakfast room is cramped. Very poor value.Concierge - especially Mark - is very courteous.We chose the Courtyard by Marriott (even though it is not so centrally located) on our return from Tahoe a week later and slept like logs.

The best thing about this hotel would be that it is located right in union square. You are steps away from some great restaurants and all of the department stores. Cheese cake factory is right across the street on the 7th floor of Macys.The rooms have all just been renovated so the rooms and washrooms are very nice and modern looking. Rooms and washrooms were very clean. Beds were very comfortable as well.My fiance and I had tickets for the city sightseeing tour buses, which was perfect because you can hop on and hop off right infront of macys which is almost right outside of the hotel.Would recommend buying tickets for the hop off/on tours because you can save a lot of money by using these buses to get to all of the popular attractions. The next time we visit San Fransisco we are staying at the Grand Hyatt again!

I stayed at Grand Hyatt for a conference. From the time I arrived at the valet to the time I checked out, I had an enjoyable stay. The Grand Hyatt just recently completed renovations of the hotel and they had awesome amenities in the lobby and guest rooms. It was a very comfortable stay. The staff was also extremely professional and friendly. And you can't ask for a better location when staying in San Francisco.

The hotel was recently remodeled so very clean, and modern. Only problem was the cable and internet went out on the second day, the staff promptly addressed it. Numerous calls we made to accommodate us. Including complimentary buffet breakfast for the remainder of our trip. I would definitely return. The location is excellent for great shopping and dining.

I was in town for a conference at the Moscone Center. The Hyatt is a short walk (4-5 blocks), but the Hyatt is in a great location. But I was more impressed with the staff. Each member from the doormen, to the operator, to the front desk, to the restaurant waiters were just friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. An example was wanting to go for a walk to help offset jet lag. When asking in the lobby they asked me: how long, what would you like to see while you are out, etc. From there they set a nice course. Having lunch one day before a meeting, I wanted something just a little different than an item on the menu and they quickly said no problems. At check-in I felt more like a long standing repeat guest at a small resort. This type of attention just makes a stay feel better. Finally the room was quite nice and update. Also was equipped for working with all your electronics. I would stay here again.

My wife and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco in early October, 2013. This was our first time at this particular hotel. To say we enjoyed our stay would be an understatement. Our room was very clean and well appointed. My birthday happened to be on one of the days we were there. The hotel sent to our room a complimentary bottle of wine and a fruit and cheese tray. How nice was that! I need coffee in the morning. The hotel provides a coffee bar, which opens at 5 a.m. (yeah for early risers). Coffee is not free, but it's a small price to pay for your caffeine fix. The only concern we had is that housekeeping missed cleaning our room on one of the 4 nights we were there. The exercise room is fully equipped for cardio and weight training exercises. Beautiful view of the city while on the treadmill. We will definitely go back to the Grand Hyatt on our next visit to the City by the Bay! GO NINERS!

I stayed for 4 nights in grand hyatt San Francisco and I loved it!Nice and friendly staff especially the Conceirge team, all staff are so friendly and courteous!!Just a bit few choices during the cocktail hours at Grand Club.. Hyatt in Asia have wide range of food and drinks to choose from.. This is the only thing I think it can be improved.. Other than that everything is excellent and I will visit again for sure!

i had a chance to stay at the grand hyatt in SF. loved it!the view was breathtaking... i was on the 25th floor... had the view of union square and Macy's:)watching the sun rise and set is pretty amazing:)the staff were all very professional and courteous:) everything i asked for, they delivered:)highly recommend

Super fast check in. AMAZING Bay View room with sweeping views of the city. Updated and modern furnishings and super clean room. Comfy bed and pillows. Fantastic location in the heart of the action. I simply cannot wait to stay here again. Highly recommend to anyone visiting San Francisco!

Extremely comfortable beds, nice rooms, Excellent service...you really can't go wrong. We had an issue with noise and it was rectified immediately. They could offer bottled water in the rooms...that would be the only complaint. I would love to return soon!

I stayed at this hotel for a business conference. From the greeting at the front desk to the bar, everyone was extremely helpful. The location is a shopaholic's paradise-Hermes, Barney's, Saks, and way too many other stores to name. This hotel underwent a remodel; so the rooms and the entire place feels very clean. Take time out to visit the top floor where you get a great view of the city. My only critisim was around the weekend. There were thousands in town for a marathon and hearing cannons, loud music and a bunch of screaming folk at 4:30 in the morning wasn't great...however, the hotel did give us a heads up. All in all, I'd stay here again.

Fair Disclosure: I was doing business with Hyatt Corp. Reality Check: I do business with a lot of hotels and strive for a balanced review providing details on things that travelers want to know bout.My two-night stay at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco hit high marks on everything this business traveler was looking for: convenient location, service, food, business comfort, bed, bath, and cleanliness. My WiFi was free, as I was on a club floor - with a delightful view towards Nob Hill (Mark Hopkins). But in an era where work-friendly desks are given over to more floor space or other furniture, I had plenty of outlets to plug in, spread out, and while away in a decent "task" chair.Other basics, such as cleanliness, bed & linens, adequate towels and shower items were just what you'd expect in a Grand Hyatt. But the thing this woman, given to spending time in front of the mirror for hair and make-up, absolutely loved was the bathroom lighting, especially around the mirror. Make-up artists and theater folks will immediately clue in on the natural-spectrum lighting and full-surround of the mirror. It is hard enough to find this in most residences, and even rarer in hotels. And dirt or grunginess in the bathroom has no place to hide in a bathroom with lighting like that! And counter space - yep, I had counter space!Good water pressure in a glass enclosed shower was just what I needed to freshen and prepare for the day.A few other business-related things worthy of mention - the club-floor room on 32 was perfect for breakfast and business planning with colleagues. If you have need for a private meeting, try out the private dining room at their restaurant OneUP for a unique space excellent for a small grouplooking for a bit of seclusion while breaking bread.
