An interesting combination of rustic and modern, the wood paneled room is lit with sculptural fixtures and a wood dining surface closer to eco-art.than just a table.Lots of tourists are right around Union Square, but you can't beat it for accessibility - from the airport, to Moscone, to BART stations - its in the middle of everything. For a high-level business stay, I suggest the modern and renovated Grand Hyatt.Just for fun: take a peek at the restrooms outside the lower level meeting rooms - high design and technology meet up in a public washroom.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt from 10/25 - 10/27. Several of my friends and I were in town for a wedding. The hotel's service from Friday afternoon when I arrived through Sunday when I checked out was impeccable across the board. The room was very clean, the hotel staff went above and beyond to meet my requests (bringing me a tooth brush / tooth paste an hour before the wedding while I was getting ready Saturday morning), the hotel bar / restaurant staff was excellent. A restaurant patron accidentally knocked over a plate, which smashed into the ground, and actually made a small cut on my hand. The staff and management of the restaurant comped drinks for us and went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of and I was okay. The front desk / concierge service is friendly and provides helpful details. The Grand Hyatt made me feel comfortable, relaxed, and like I was truly on vacation. I would love to stay here again.

I've stayed here already twice and loved it both times. The location is perfect and the service is outstanding. Also, I really enjoyed the lounge - the view from there is definitely breathtaking. The bartender at the lounge was incredibly nice and took several pictures of me and my then-girlfriend - thanks again for that :)

This ultramodern hotel is in a great location, and the view from the rooms are amazing, the bathroom was clean and large and the beds were very comfortable, the TV had lots of information about San fran and you could order room service on it! Free wifi is appreciated but the only thing was the food in the restaurant wasn't great and the room service is crazily priced even for normal room service, I would definitely stay again.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt from October 23 through October 27. It is a great hotel located in a great area. Room on the 19th floor was well put together. Great view. Beds were extremely comfortable. Staff could not be more helpful. They gave us a list of local restaurants and we put it to good use.

Stayed here on the recommendation of a friend - would not trust their choice again! Rooms are small and dingy and the A/C noisy. Charging for WiFi typified this hotel; any chance to exploit the guest was taken.Probably my fault for staying at a hotel that was clearly for business people on expense accounts, but other Hyatt around the world have been very reliable.

Had the pleasure of staying at this hotel recently for a meeting. Check-in was efficient and the people and staff were very friendly--even upgraded me without me asking. The room was clean and bed very comfortable. Used the workout room with an amazing view. Free wi-fi with good access. Close to transportation and meeting venue

My partner and I just returned from a trip to San Francisco and a stay at the wonderful Grand Hyatt. We had previously stayed at this hotel prior to it's remodel and thought the room was dated. What a wonderful difference this stay. The room was modern, the bed very comfortable and the bathroom well appointed. We arrived very late on a Wednesday night and although we had reserved a room that would have been on a lower floor, only two doubles were available not the king we reserved. Paul at the front desk worked some magic and gave us a king on the 25th floor with a wonderful city view ( we could see bay on each side). When he heard we were in town to get married, he made sure we received a special treat delivered to us the next day ( cupcakes and sparkling water).The room was very clean and the maid was very attentive to our needs. The large windows had wonderful views, especially in the evening. The room features a safe, an iron and ironing board, plenty of hangers and a coffee maker. The hotel is in an excellent location, within walking distance of shopping, market street, Chinatown and Nob Hill. The staff was wonderful, very friendly and extremely helpful.We truly enjoyed our stay at the Grand Hyatt and look forward to staying there again in the future.

Very close to Union Square, one of the best place in San Francisco.Some drawbacks were: breakfast, which is very simple and conversely too expensive; the charge for every package shipped on my name, besides the late for delivering the packages.

We stayed here for the 4th of July celebrations this year. The service and staff were impecable. I loved the location right on Union square with more shopping than anyone could ever want! The rooms overlooking the square were great, and all the Hop-on/Hop-off tours start here, so it really is centrally located. The rooms are quite compact, but have been refreshed. The restaurant and bar were excellent, and concierge service was extremely helpful.Overall a great stay.

We stayed in this hotel for two nights on the way to Hawaii and were very impressed. The hotel is very stylish, the communal areas as well as the rooms, which were an excellent size for a city hotel. The room was spotlessly clean and the beds extremely comfortable. The location is brilliant, a 10 second walk to Union Square. We would definitely stay here again although even though we were on the 14th floor we still heard a fair amount of street noise, which we fully expected in a city centre hotel, however we would probably chose a room not overlooking the street (and the fabulous views) as a compromise. There was some work going on on the top floor which makes for a stunning viewing platform, whatever the hotel plans to do with it.

I stayed here for five nights and enjoyed the experience. This hotel has special PURE rooms specially designed for guests who have allergies. The room was immaculately clean, there were no feather pillows or down comforters in the room, a HEPA air filter was running to remove any airborne irritants and the toiletries were unscented and hypo-allergenic. It was wonderful!Additionally, this hotel is excellently located in San Francisco, within walking distance to so much of what the city has to offer. The service was excellent and the room was quiet and comfortable.There's one thing to be aware of, however. If you have a room on the east side of the hotel, the sun bakes the room by 10:00 am. The rooms have metallic mesh blinds to filter light, but the only way to avoid the hot sun is to use the motorized black-out shade and then you're literally in the dark. Plan to be out enjoying the city before 10 if you have an east-facing room.

This is by far the best location SF. Overlooking the union square, it is much walkable to every tourist location be it Pier 39, cable car station, ferry building etc. Union Square has all the best brands in the world. It comes alive early in the morning till late in the night, never disappoints to buzz.I recommend this Hotel to all those who are going to SF for the first time.Dont forget to try the cheese cake of the hotel.

The Grand Hyatt in Union Square is quite the hotel. This is the first stay in this property and would definitely stay here again. The location is within walking distance to lots of great shopping, Chinatown and North Beach. If you bring your walking shoes, Fisherman's Wharf and the Financial District are not that far away either. The hotel room was nicely updated with a modernistic electric shade, modern work station and bathroom. Being on the 23rd floor facing San Francisco Bay did not hurt my impressions either, looking out at Coit Tower, the Transamerica Building and Alcatraz every morning. I could hardly take enough pictures. Online check-in and out made the whole experience painless.

We came here as a group to run the Nike Women's Marathon. We were greeted by friendly staff and they were helpful throughout our stay; from the wait staff at the restaurant, the bell men, the maintenance man and cleaners. We had one problem at the restaurant due to a new menu, but the manager was very professional with his apology. The rooms were lovely. The bed and pillows were comfortable.The location was fabulous. It was a block from union square and close enough for a longer walk to the piers. The bell men were very helpful in giving directions. It was a block away from the 30 bus, which we took to Girardelli, but could be used to get to Chinatown, as well. I would stay here again!

Nice property and well priced for the location. Check in desks were a little confusing but efficient once you got there. Housekeeping seems well trained. I, too, disliked the lock- less, sliding, frosted bathroom doors, but the rest of room was thoughtfully designed.

The rooms are tight, but nicely updated have all the amenities you need.The econcierge lets you get razors and shaving lotion, corkscrews, and shoe horns before you arrive. The location is very convient to the convention center, china town and north beach.window treatments are metallic and work great.Will be here again in the spiring.

Since the hotel has been remodeled, now the place equals the benefit of location and ambiance -- great views - the restaurant is "interesting" in a positive way. Recommended for shopping, theatre location and being in the center of San Francisco

Very handy to be right in the centre, and only 2 minutes walk from Union Square.Handy to be located so close to Super Duper burger too.The rooms are a good size, tho the large window did get stuck on my room so I could hear the noise from outside.Good facilities too.

We recently returned from an 8 day break in Las Vegas and San Francisco.We stayed at two separate hotels in San Francisco & this hotel was without a doubt the best we stayed at. Centrally located on Union Square and near to big attractions. The staff were very welcoming and friendly & went out their way to make this a special trip for us. Helpful Concierge and got a late check-out with reception also. Thanks!

Nice hotel located in the heart of it all. Remodeled rooms which was the main reason I booked this hotel. Always a great welcome walking in the hotel. We had requested a higher floor and they accommodated us which was great. The reason I'm not giving an "excellent" score is because of one detail which for most will not be a big issue. The bathroom is new but the "bath/shower" area bothered us. We had a typical bath with a shower curtain. I guess we didn't expect to have a plain shower curtain in a Grand Hyatt. Usually you'll get a glass shower or something a bit more modern and hygienic than a shower curtain. Not a major issue but again we were a bit surprised to have this in a Grand Hyatt; considering that everything in the room had a modern feel. We stayed 5 nights and our stay was nice. Again, location is amazing!

Disclaimer: My son works for the Hyatt organization.My wife and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco, from October 5 to October 10. This is by far one of the finest run hotels I have ever stayed at. Everything went smoothly, every employee at the hotel were helpful and pleasant, especially the fantastic concierge service. The guestrooms have all been recently redone are extremely roomy and comfortable.The in room dining service, always served hot and on time.If you're staying in San Francisco, whether it for business or pleasure, I highly recommend staying at the Grand Hyatt.

We stayed here during a recent trip to SF for a conference and found the hotel to be very nice, although we probably wouldn't have stayed there if we didn't get a huge discount. The room was really nice and the power shade was cool, as was the view of Union Square and the rest of the city, especially at night. I didn't give it a rating of five because it is a bit louder than expected, but it may not be as bad in rooms that do not face the square.

The Grand Hyatt was a great place to stay in SF. We paid extra to get the bay view, and it did not disappoint - wow! We did not eat in the hotel restaurants at all - there were so many things nearby (even a Starbucks across the street!). The room was large and bed comfortable. I would have given them a 5 star, except there was a meal charge on our bill that was not ours, which I went down and told them about. They told me they took it off, but when we got home, we found it on our credit card statement. At checkout, we wanted to be sure it was not there, but they told us they were paperless so did not print us out a copy of our bill! At home we had to dispute it with the credit card company before Hyatt finally credited us. Watch your bills and charges!! Other than that, the hotel itself was very nice.

I have never done a review here before, however, for the Grand Hyatt San Francisco I just had to!This is such a great hotel. We stayed for a week whilst visiting family and it was the first overseas trip for our 7 month old.As any parent knows, any trip with a baby is a trial in itself but the staff at the Grand Hyatt were more than accommodating and couldn't of done more to make our stay comfortable!The room was fantastic and had such an amazing view overlooking Union Square.Anything we requested ( such as a crib and a kettle for babies milk) was provided to us within minutes of us asking. We were also allowed to check out late so that we didn't have to hang around or walk the streets with the baby!The staff are friendly, courteous and seriously cannot do enough for the guests.The coffee shop has amazing coffee too!!Many thanks to all at the Grand Hyatt for making our stay so great!!

Usually, a hotel will spend top dollar to have an amazing lobby & less on their rooms. This hotel did just the opposite, which is great for we travelers who like a comfy, well laid out room!China Town is steps away & Union Square 1 street in front of the hotel. That said, on a Friday & Saturday night it gets really loud, even 34 floors up. The rooms are really nice with a great "new" feel & well laid out (with a huge shower, perfect for 2, with only 1 shower head) & we had great sunset views. There is a Starbucks across the street (yay!!) & the breakfast buffet downstairs was good, with a very attentive staff. The lobby is what I would describe as casual (with modern check-in stations) but there is a nice sitting area where people we're enjoying chilling out, much like an over sized den, in a giant (high rise) home.The negatives: valet parking was a whopping $55.00 a day. Self parking is 35? Crazy! I suggest bringing some good walking shoes. Even taking one of their charming trolly's is expensive & mostly just for tourists, I notated. If your from NY none of this will even phase you.

The hotel, rooms and gym are beautiful, The location is in the heart of the city and shopping!! The staff very friendly.The view from our room looking at the bay. The hotel is updated and remodeled looks like new. Checking in was easy. We would recommend staying at this Hyatt and our family will be back to stay in the near future.

Excellent hotel that is recently renovated and decidedly upscale with great views along with great staff. Newly configured decor with a very unique way of checking in that I personally do not appreciate because it is so confusing with little privacy, but good effort.The best executive lounge that I have seen in years and I applaud the hotel management for making it great. Open throughout the day and offering great breakfast and evening snacks and drinks, i am sure Diamond and Platinum members will appreciate the convenience. Others who have paid to be on the lounge floor will also be pleased.Next to Union Square and close to Moscone Center, this hotel is great for those attending conventions nearby. Very expensive if you don't get the right rate since the management refuses to budge from highest rack rates if you missed getting the negotiated rate - even when rooms are avaial

Stayed at the Grand Hyatt with my husband.Waited half hour for room to be ready in the upscale comfy lobby and promptly called when room was ready. Given a gorgeous 29th floor with city view. Hotel is very upscale in terms of decor....fancy touches like remote controlled window coverings made it feel luxurious. The Hyatt has a long list of free toiletries that can be called for. Highly recommend the bath robe and lint mitts.In all, very pleased with this hotel. Also breakfast buffet is pricey but delicious!

This hotel is ideally situated for visiting San Francisco or attending a convention. Warm and genuine welcome, efficient staff . My room, although not very large had absolutely everything I needed and extremely comfortable - it was perfect for my needs. I had access to the club floor - the view from there is unbelievable! Wonderful breakfast included with the club floor and also appetizers in the evening. Overall an extremely pleasant experience.I found the ability to check-in/out online at the lack of an old fashioned check-in desk pleasant and convenient.

we stayed at Hyatt for just 2 nights during our trip to San Francisco, very good location for those who want to be close to Union Square and China Town. I understand that locals prefer this area, but if you are there as a tourist you might also consider the Pier, this is where most tourists like it. The rooms are nice and spacious, staff is friendly, considering the prices in San Francisco, rate is also acceptable. we didn't try the restaurants, but there seemed a lot going on, they were putting a lot of effort to get the guests to restaurants. Lobby at the entrance was very cosy also, good area to get some rest after a busy day and watch around.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a work conference and the location was awesome. Everything is within walking distance - Starbucks directly across the street, Walgreens around the corner, Macy's a couple blocks away, restaurants, Cable cars, etc. The reception staff were welcoming and provided us with suggestions of where to eat, since we arrived late on a Friday night. Room service was great and prompt and the food was delicious. We tried the lounge on site one night and the drinks were excellent, they even had live music which was great.The cons? The room for us was adequate but nothing special. We were placed on a quiet floor, which we had requested in advance, which was great. However, the room was pretty "plain Jane" for paying $320 per night. It must simply be that price for the location. The bathroom was small and was lacking in towel racks or hooks; there was no where to hang the hand towels, etc, which we thought was odd. The shelf in the bathtub was broken and the water pressure from the shower was less to be desired. The king bed was comfortable, but I questioned the cleanliness when I saw a few stains on the sheets and woke up one morning with bites all over one leg. There were no light switches in the room, you had to turn on each lamp individually, which seemed a bit dated.We used the concierge service several times and found them to be less than hospitable. We felt like we were a nuisance when asking questions and one lady, couldn't get us out of the way fast enough so she could answer the phone.The location is excellent, but because of the issues with the room and the price we paid for it, I might not stay there again.

We have just returned from this hotel and found it a nice hotel to stay at . The hotel is well located near Union Square and China Town . The rooms are good with good views over the city from higher floors . We ate in the restaurant one night and found it a nice experience with good service and food options .As a family this hotel did the job without wowing us . We would probably stay closer to Fishermans Wharf next time as it would offer more for us to browse at a walkable distance from the hotel.A good hotel although not really aimed at families.

customer service at this hotel is perfect! -great bar in the middle of things -great food. -cute little gift shop with nice San Fran things to purchase.....only thing needed is an upgrade on the room decor....otherwise awesome hotel

i stayed both in the old and new rooms and location remains top.The new rooms are well appointed, and to me the colors & decorations are nice.The club has fantastic views too, nice staff. However i am still amazed about all hyatt Clubs in the USA charging for wine and alcohol whereas this is not the case in Europe and Asia where I spend most of my time.One evening we had dinner in the restaurant of the hotel and I was surprised about the extremely attentive and great staff as well as the quality of food. They spend a lot of effort in the food being authentic and health conscious. No need to go outside if your r too lazy or on a rainy day, its does the job well.The single drawback I find is that they kept the old doors, some rooms they have a lot of space at the floor leaving true a lot of light as well as sound. Also the doors are not well isolated against noise and somehow people always seems to be loud in the hallway in the USA. Dont have a clue why.And the hotel management should do something about clearing the hallways with all the roomservice trays standing around for hours, ours for 2 days.....All in all, I recommend this hotel.

I have stayed here a couple times and have had good experiences. It's a safe bet and the rooms are nice. Close to a couple parking garages and about 5 blocks from Bart. Prices are decent but naturally go up during large events. Close to Union Square.

Had a really good stay here. All public areas are very modern and tidy, but I'm not sure if I like the 'informal' reception area (other reviewers have said the same).Room was very nice and faced Union Square. Bed was comfy and the bathroom was clean and modern. Room service food was very good (breakfast).Perhaps it may be an idea to say about the electronic blinds in a piece of the in-room literature! Location is great being right off of Union Square, with an easy walk to shops and restaurants. I would definitely stay here again if back in San Francisco. :)

Our room was recently updated, with pleasant, modern decor. Updated bath with modern amenities, but only a single sink and no separate toilet or shower.Tub shower with shower curtain. Nice soft goods and very nice bed and linens.Free Wi-Fi. Small exercise room on top floor.This very large and busy hotel can be noisy. We heard noise from the streets outside, even though we were on a high floor. Also, the door let in a lot of corridor noise.The hotel has one of the best locations for tourists. Steps from Union Square and the cable car line, and a block from the entrance to China town.Parking is impossible on the street, so you'll need to park in one of the nearby parking garages.You can walk to Fisherman's Wharf, which is 45-60 minutes up and down hills. We did it and got to see a lot of the city.

Ok I had been sleeping in a RV for ten days but nevertheless I still think this was one of the most comfy hotels in I've stayed in! Excellent service, excellent bar with cracking happy hour 5 til 7 and electric blind which didn't break despite our constantly playing with it. We were in a king suite on 8th floor. You get what you pay for - it was not cheap!

Pretty nice location by Union Sq. Super nice lobby and the room are sweet but a bit on the small side. There are some convention centers downstairs as well. There was a motorized curtain in the room and the bathrooms have a sink that resembles a bathtub. There is also a gym on the top floor.

easy access to everything. Great for when you're lugging your shopping hauls and you don't have to walk so far back! Hotel offered a very friendly, helpful staff, it was clean, & the amenities were second to none. Great happy hour & gym was worth getting up for just for the sunrise & view. Bartenders were knowledgeable of area & offered sound advice that proved true about sights & restaurants. Location is unbeatable if you're sightseeing - close to wharf, ferry building, North Beach, and of course Union Square. Cable car & busses are close too. It was a very enjoyable stay.

On our arrival the man at the door who collected our bags informed me that I was the hotelâ€™s â€˜Guest of the Dayâ€™! At first I thought he was just joking but sure enough when I got to the check in desk this was confirmed by the person checking me in. This meant that I was able to choose from a list of free gifts, one of which was free limo ride back to the airport at the end of my stay, so having just paid over $50 to get to the hotel from the airport I decided to go for this. My room was also upgraded to one on a higher floor with a great view looking east towards some of San Francisco taller buildings and the bay area behind them. The room was very spacious, modern and clean. The bed was also very comfortable and I had no trouble sleeping.Even without my â€˜Guest of the Dayâ€™ experience I would still recommend this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were excellent. It is in a wonderful location just off Union Square (great area for shopping, restaurants, the stops for the hop on, hop off tour buses and also the San Francisco cable cars).Hopefully I will be back to San Francisco one day and if so would definitely look to stay at this hotel again.

We stayed here for 3 nights on the 2nd stop of a tour of USA. Great location, right on Union Square. First impression of the room-WOW! More like a suite! It was really spacious, particularly so after staying in a small, but lovely hotel room in NYC. Huge room, ENORMOUS bed, floor to ceiling- wall to wall window, retro dÃ©cor, walk through dressing room leading to large, luxury bathroom. The bed was the comfiest bed ever! Massive deep mattress & so comfy topper, loads of huge soft pillows, crisp sheets, best nights sleep Ive ever had. Didn't want to get up in the mornings!! Almost a shame there was so much sight-seeing to be done! Top floor restaurant & bar was impressive, amazing panoramic views, when the fog lifts! So one night amazing views sat in the bar just having a drink, booked a table for the following night-FOG! But all adds to the experience. Loved this hotel

Hotel offered a very friendly, helpful staff, it was clean, & the amenities were second to none. Great happy hour & gym was worth getting up for just for the sunrise & view. Bartenders were knowledgeable of area & offered sound advice that proved true about sights & restaurants. Location is unbeatable if you're sightseeing - close to wharf, ferry building, North Beach, and of course Union Square. Cable car & busses are close too. It was a very enjoyable stay.

I stayed with the Grand Hyatt in June and it was a really comfortable experience. The hotel's location is fantastic and right where all the shopping places are in Union Square. Great for when you're lugging your shopping hauls and you don't have to walk so far back! There are several dining options near the hotel as well which was great. Like what other reviewers had pointed out, Starbucks is just right across if you're looking for a quick fix. I had a nice Sunday brunch at the nearby Cheesecake Factory (in the Macy's building) and it was superb. The room was very comfortable for three adults and it was very modern and sleek as well. I did not feel that it was cramped at all though there were three of us in the room. The bed was heavenly and I fell asleep instantly every night. It was a little hard waking up the next day! We visited the bar & lounge one night and there was live music which was wonderful. The lounge area wasn't very large but it was really nice and I enjoyed it. I would definitely return to stay at the Grand Hyatt once again should i return to SFO.

I stayed at this hotel in Sepember 2013 on a business trip. Excellent location, right off Union Square which is the shopping district. The hotel is very good. Rooms are modern and good size.My room was on the 26th floor and had a city view. Some of my other colleagues had excellent views of the bay from the same floor. They have friendly staff. Basic necessities like water and ice are available on each floor. The gym is on the 35th floor with breath taking views of the San Francisco Bay. They have a nice lounge + restraunt on the first floor. The hotel is located walking distance from several restraunts and bars. There is a Starbucks across the road and a Walgreens about 200m away. I would stay there again!

My husband and I spent this past week at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco, and it was a modern, renovated hotel with a very friendly staff. Everyone was nice, and they treated my service dog particularly well which is something I appreciate. We had breakfast with our room, and the food was consistently good and very fresh. I loved the berries and the museli and would also suggest the banana pancakes. We had room service one day as well, and that was good, too. The location is great, near lots of shopping and right across the street from a Starbucks. It is a block from Union Square and we were able to take our dog for daily walks in the park. The only negative about the hotel is the small rooms. I'm not a fan of small hotel rooms, and this one is barely comfortable for two people. Overall, the hotel was nice and I'd stay there again. It is a typical city hotel that has modern but small rooms. Our room didn't have a great view, but it was comfortable and the food and bar made it very nice. I also liked the shower fixture and the minimalist feel to the decor.

The title says it all, from check in to check out, we had a fantastic time. When we pulled up in the car Peter was very helpful, took our luggage and gave us directions to the car rental return. On returning to the hotel we were met by Erica and the check in was smooth and efficient and we were shown straight to our room. The bell hop that showed us to our room was very efficient showing us fire escapes how everything worked in the room and offered to get ice for us. The staff in the club room were very friendly and welcoming, in particular Jimmy and Dave who likes to wave. The views from the club room are amazing. When I return to San Francisco I will certainly stay here again

I stayed here 1 night (Sept 30) for work. The hotel was in a great location - walking distance to all of the high end shopping. There is a Starbucks right across the street. The rooms are all newly upgraded with an Asian simplistic feel to them. Loved the Grohe shower fixture. The room was super clean and the beds and pillows were very comfortable. The room was also very quiet. My only issue is that my TV would not turn on, and I could not connect to the WiFi in the room - but I checked in so late and checked out so early I didn't have time to raise the issue with the front desk.

The hotel is situated in Union Square so a great location if you like to shop and it is within easy access of the cable cars. The staff were friendly and helpful and our room was clean. There was free Wi-Fi which is always a plus so overall we had a fairly good stay.Our stay was marred slightly by the fact that the room was a little noisy as there was a gap between our windows/doors so we heard the external traffic (though to be fair we didn't bother trying to address this). Also we were located fairly close to the ice machine so heard that on a fairly regular basis which can be a little annoying. I personally don't like a bath/shower set up so didn't particularly like that and the water pressure definitely could be better.If location is important then this is a good option and worth consideration.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in September and really liked it. The hotel has a great location. It is right in the middle of Union Square, which is a main shopping area. Macys is one block down and the Westfield shopping centre (Old Navy, Levis, Abercrombie and Fitch etc) is only two blocks down, so really quick to walk to. The hotel reception is nice â€“ it has got a large lounge area with fireplaces and comfy chairs. When you walk in, there are quite a few staff members around with laptops that can check you in, rather than the usual check in desk. We arrived at about 4pm and were checked in straight away with no queue. We asked if we could have a room with a city view which they gave us. The room was on the 31st floor, and the views over the city were great! We were also high enough up that we couldnâ€™t hear too much street noise. There is some construction work going on down the street near Macys, but we couldnâ€™t hear this from the room. The room was quite large, with twin beds which were both really comfy with nice squashy pillows. We also had a flat screen HD tv with lots of channels. There is a safe in the room and tea and coffee making facilities. The bathroom is quite big, but as other reviewers have said, the bathroom door is just a sliding door with no lock. The shower was over the bath, but the water was hot and the pressure was good for every shower, so no complaints there! The sink is a quite long and shallow, so the water from the tap does tend to splash back if you turn the tap on too hard, but we soon got the hang of it! The best bit about the room is the floor to ceiling windows that look out over the city. The view is amazing, and the windows had curtains and automatic black out window blinds, that could be closed and opened at the touch of a button. The blinds were great at keeping out light so both me and my husband slept well. There is a little coffee bar downstairs in the lobby that sells tea, coffee, bagels and other breakfast things. We had two bagels with cream cheese and two teas and it came to just over $10 so it wasnâ€™t expensive by hotel standards. It opens at 5.30am so handy if you wake up with jet lag! The only thing we didnâ€™t like about the hotel were the lifts. They were a bit clanky, and one day it sounded like something broke off and smashed into the top of the lift! We jumped out on the 23rd floor and walked up the stairs for the rest of that journey! Another guest reported it to reception, and the lift was closed off for the rest of our trip so we didnâ€™t have to risk it again! The views from the 36th floor are amazing â€“ you can see over the bay so it is definitely worth a trip up there if you get time. We didnâ€™t walk up to Fishermans Wharf, but we did take the cable car which you can pick up from just past Old Navy, near the Westfield shopping centre. We used the Powell â€“ Mason line, which was $6 per person per ride. It took about half an hour to get from Union Square to Fishermans Wharf on the cable car, and the views are amazing as you come down the hill towards the bay. We had a great omelette for breakfast at Mamas on Washington Square, but we got there at 8 when it opened, and had to queue for half an hour to get in! The best place for breakfast was a place called Sears Fine Food, which is just round the corner from the Grand Hyatt on Powell Street. We had their signature pancakes, which were delicious, but the service was just amazing! Our waitress was so friendly and professional, and they even give you a good luck token when you leave. I would definitely stay in this hotel again. All the staff we met were really friendly and helpful, the location is great, the beds are comfy and the views are amazing. I would recommend it to anyone. Thank you Grand Hyatt for getting our honeymoon off to a great start!

This is some hotel!! It's beautiful and has amazing views from some of its rooms of San Francisco. It really is amazing!! The room was a little small but had everything. They even have a list in the rooms of toiletries that you can have if you've forgotten anything (the usual in a good hotel) and things that you can borrow! We borrowed a kettle, there's nothing nicer than a mug of tea in the morning and that's rare in the US!!? The location is fantastic, it's right in Union Square. The only down side was the parking!! Valet is $55 + tax per night and self parking is $39 + tax, a bit steep even by SF car parks!! But apart from that, this hotel is excellent, we'd stay here again!! I highly recommend it!!

The location of this Hotel is great on top of Union Square. If you get a high floor( there are 32 floors), the views are great. In fact, we slept with our blinds open to enjoy the view. The room is a fair size, but the bathroom is poor. The sink is very shallow and makes brushing your teeth and shaving difficult. I do not understand how this basic design fault was approved as this Hotel was refurbished in the last few months. Also, the shower pressure was rubbish and the bath was tiny and uncomfortable.There was no kettle for tea. I had to insist to get one. I stayed for 5 days and on one day, the room service wanted to charge $4 for a small jug of hot milk & argued with me, when I said , since it was small, I was given free on other days. There is a small fridge but no mini bar and this fridge remains empty. Bizarre.This Hotel is quite pricey and the level of service does not match.

This hotel was fabulous right in the centre of Union square. Our room looked right out onto Macys and Union Square. The staff couldn't do enough for you I would recommend this hotel as you won't be disappointed.

Hotel is less than 5 minutes walking distance from Bart/Muni subway stations (both Powell and Union Square) that will take you to/from SFO International Airport. Hotel rooms are spacious and clean. Free WIFI available for guests and Fitness room at top floor of the hotel with beautiful city views is open 24 hours. Lots of retail shops, restaurants & convenient stores outside the hotel. Very safe location and accessible by foot to most major tourist attractions. We stay at Hyatt Properties locally and abroad wherever Hyatt Hotel is available and hotel staff's customer service is consistently excellent. Highly recommended for all travelers.

Stayed here on a business trip, and thanks to my employer's relationship with the hotel, was comped breakfast (like a $25 value). The breakfast buffet was very nice.Room was clean and modern and had a nice view of the city. Room service was great, though they forgot my dessert but promptly brought it up. Very comfortable stay, nice bed, great bathroom.The lobby was undergoing extensive construction which made coming/going a little confusing, but it was bearable.Would definitely stay here again.

My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights and we are wondering if this is truly part of the Hyatt chain. Whatever they are doing to train the staff, they need to spread the word to the other Hyatt properties, where we never get this kind of experience. The staff at this Hyatt property is really quite excellent and they all consistently have a habit of going the extra mile. This place is obviously very well managed and this hotel's manager should go out there and train all the other properties to be this good. The hotel was recently renovated top-to-bottom, so it just adds to the very positive experience.

Modern hotel with friendly staff. In the past, I usually stayed at the Hilton when going to a conference in San Francisco. I was very glad I stayed at this hotel in the recent trip. The room is more modern and the price is much better. The Hilton is just too big and checking in could take a long time during a conference. I don't eat big breakfast so the Starbucks coffee across the street is convenient.

I stayed 2 nights at this fabulous property a few months ago. The revamp the property doesn't go unnoticed. The finishes are all rounded off beautifully. The room was extremely comfortable & I loved all the modern amenities. What you truly can't beat is the location! Literally a stones grow away from Union Square. The prices are extremely reasonable for what you get. Absolutely excellent! Can't wait to be back!

The hotel is about a minute away from Union Square and the surrounding streets are pretty flat for San Francisco. Great views of the city from our room, especially watching the fog rolling in. Checking in was very quick and staff were friendly. We had an issue on our first night with noisy neighbours at 3am (not great after a 10hr flight), however one call to reception and this was sorted out within 5 minutes. Would definitely stay here again.

Visited in September 2013 for three days. Checking in was ok but only 2 of the four reception desks were open and we had to wait 20 mins as 'guests' asked for local information .... What's wrong with the concierge desk? The room was excellent, very comfortable and included a fridge for our own use. We were on the 6 th floor so didn't have a view but did venture to the top floor as advised by others. However, the top floor is no longer a bar but a venue for private functions as per the notices. Again however, we ignored the notices and ventured in and I think as long as you stay out of people's way it's fine and very much worth it - the view is stunning. We did not eat or drink in the hotel as we wanted to sight see as much as possible.Alcatraz is a must but you must book at least two weeks before (10 bucks from the hotel to pier 39 by taxi) and we can highly recommend the open top Big Bus city tour. Reduced rate tickets available from the concierge desk and the nearest stop is 300m from the hotel by Macy's.Overall, a very good hotel and would definitely recommend it.

The hotel is in a great location. Within walking distance to Chinatown. The concierge was very helpful. He gave us a sheet for restaurant options when we wasnt sure where we wanted to go. He even had stamps for our postcards to send out! The restaurant there was ok (we had breakfast). A little pricey, but the food was good. The room was clean and decent. Would defintiely stay here again.

Well the hotel is perfect, excaxtly what you expect from the grand Hyatt. But it think they should offer free parking with a 250$ room!!! We had to pay 35$ for a nearby parking over night. Other than that the location is perfect and the stuff really helpful.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Grand Hyatt. The staff is friendly and helpful with whatever you need. The city, is obviously amazing and a definite must for anyone looking to explore. Our room was very clean, the bed was comfortable, the pillows on the bed were too flat for us. We will probably try a different place when we return, but by no fault of the Hyatt.

Stayed here for a short visit sadly only 4 nights, we will definitely return.The Hyatt is a good location central to all sights etc.The staff are all very helpful and professional, nothing's too much trouble.Rooms are a good size and very clean. The beds are very comfortable with a choice of feather or foam pillows and bed linen is a nice quality.The restaurant is very nice, good quality food and service.Most importantly all rooms had complimentary wifi.I would recommend this hotel and will definitely use in future.San Francisco's a great place to visit very diverse and colourful.

The roof bar, restaurant really is what this hotel is all about. The rooms are a bit long in the tooth but the view from up top are absolutely outstanding. I love San Francisco and this is a hotel which has many rooms with a view,

We were at the Hyatt a couple of days ago. It is a great location, the rooms are not big but ok. The only problem we had was the room was boiling during the day if its sunny. The sunshine was fighting the air con. No matter how high you turned the air con on it was very hot. Other than that, I needed a jacket cleaned with in the day and they collected it 9pm on the night we arrived and it was back in the cupboard when we came home late the next afternoon, and for $11 so not a rip off either. Breakfast in the restaurant is actually very good but the restaraunt is very small, so unless you are up early there was a queue, it's a very big hotel but very small restaurant for breakfast. The gym is very good, but gets very busy, by 8.30 all of the machines were being used, so get up really early or leave the gym until later in the day.

Large hotels in cities always have certain touch of being slightly impersonal. We were pleasantly surprised at the Grand Hyatt as all the staff we encountered were friendly, pleasant and very helpful. Maybe because we were Brits visiting! We had a large comfortable room with all amenities, although spent very little time in it. San Francisco is a really great city.

We have stayed in different Hyatt hotels numerous times, all over USA. In the past, we usually had a positive experience, thatâ€™s why before going to new place, we always checked Hyatt first. This time it was frustrating and disappointing experience. We checked in on September 6th, 11 am. My husband called twice and asked for early check in. When we arrived at the hotel, my husband asked for bayview room and was told there werenâ€™t any available. Later, he was told that there was one room which will be ready shortly. So apparently, there was a bayview room. We agreed to wait. We left the property for sightseeing when the receptionist called us at 11:40 stating that the room was ready. We hustled back to the hotel, at the reception we were told they called us by mistake. Well, we went back to sightseeing plans. My husband called the hotel at 3:30, and was told that room will be available late after 4 since the previous customer had 4 pm check out. That was never mentioned to us before. Well, we went more sightseeing and came back to the hotel to check into the room at 9pm. I guess, it was enough time to check that everything is working in the room. When we got to the room, apparently none of the electrical switches worked. Shade wouldnâ€™t open or close, lights would turn on/off only manually. We called front desk. 2 engineers came numerous times with ladders and tools and were not able to fix the problems. So after a long day of sightseeing we still were not able to rest. After our 9 years old son fell asleep, they called us from the front desk stating that if we want the working room we will have to move. It was after 10pm. Exhausted, with a sleeping boy, we moved to another bayview room. Apparently there were few of bayview room available, even though we were told there was none. The story just began, since none of the electrical switches worked in the new room either! In the morning, shade wouldnâ€™t open, so we called front desk again. One more engineer came who couldnâ€™t fix it. I called front desk again and was transferred to 3 different people, each of them called himself manager and asked me what my problem was. So I had to tell everything over again for 3 times! Did they make a fun of me? Eventually I got disconnected. I called again and told the 4th person that we are not going to pay for this night. Only after that, this girl Jessica called (God bless her), and said she will take care of everything. We left the hotel after 12 pm, the shade in our room was still shut, so we couldnâ€™t see the bay view anyway. We are loyal customers and understand that technical problems can happen, however, this is not the way this situation shouldâ€™ve been handled by hotel class like Hyatt. Hotel staff left a bottle of wine and 2 cookies in our room, which I donâ€™t feel could compensate us for all the inconveniences. I strongly feel that we shouldâ€™ve been offered full or at least partial credit for the first night, since we didnâ€™t enjoy a single bit of it, and were not able to see the light in the morning, which was quiet depressing. During check out, my husband mentioned our traumatic experience and after telling the whole story (again!!) was offered Hyatt points. This is generous but doesnâ€™t satisfy us. This requires us to stay in Hyatt hotel again, however, after such experience we will most likely stay away from Hyatt for a while. By the way, breakfast in the club is till 10:00, however, there is nothing left by 9:50, so hurry! Also, they wouldn't clean up your table if you don't tip them in advance.If you are lucky, and everything works in your room, you could still enjoy.

As a Hyatt diamond member I tend to stay at quite a few of their properties and this is one I'd recommend you take a pass on... The list of their shortcomings during my stay (and I'm only halfway through it) would be tedious to review but the short of it is: however well intentioned, ill trained staff and poor management don't make for quality hospitality. Add to that a poorly conceived property and you have the right mix for an awful experience.

This hotel was so good. Perfect location. right next to Union Square, rooms were clean comfortable, faultless. We had a meal in the restaurant on our first night which was very good, maybe a bit on the expensive side, but service and food was very good. If there was anything I could say needs a bit more improvement with,it would be the concierge. We were trying to ask the lady some questions, but she was answering us, having a conversation with someone else behind the desk, and then answering the phone. we were a bit frustrated and felt like we were more a nuisance than anything else. Before writing this review, I read someones elses, and it appears we weren't the only ones that had the experience. Bit disappointing as other than this department, this hotel for us couldn't have been a better choice and would definitely recommend. We will hopefully be back to visit SF which we loved, and we will definitely stay here again. We stayed at the Hyatt in Vancouver a couple of weeks after the SF Hyatt........SF is WAY way far superior in service in comparison.

I don't really know how I feel about this hotel so I will pin point the good things and some of the things I found disappointing..Check in was fast and friendly, we arrived, after a long haul flight, at 11.30am, and were given a room straight away on the 32nd floor (we paid extra for a room on the 32nd+ floor with access to the Executive Lounge). We were very grateful and it was a good start. The first thing that hit me walking into the room was the noise - it was deafening. On closer inspection the door to a tiny balcony, which I suppose at one point used to open, would not close properly and the wind whipped into the room constantly. The hotel doesn't appear to have double-glazing and the noise from Union Square was unbelievable. Still, the room was a decent size and very modern. The bathroom was amazing - the shower was huge (and a waste of space? How many people do you want to fit into a shower? I'd say a family of 6 would have fitted quite comfortably!).It's in a good location. The One Up Bar was a nice place for an afternoon drink. We didn't try the restaurant.The Exec Lounge offered us a buffet breakfast (good) and access all day. In the evenings from 5pm to 9pm we were offered snacks and drinks ($3 for a beer, $4 for a wine and free soft drinks) and that was good value. I am glad we upgraded so we had access to this. David and Jimmy were delightful! Their customer service was amazing and they were very friendly and knowledgeable. There was a computer and printer for guests to use, very handy, as we needed it to print out tickets to the baseball. The hotel also has free wi-fi in your room and all over the hotel - a plus.I found the concierge okay, not very knowledgeable at all - seemed a bit like our questions were an inconvenience. One day we were leaving for the day through the front doors and one of the staff closed the heavy glass door on my husband, hitting him in the head and nearly knocking him out. No one was concerned and the employee just smiled. My husband had to sit down for a while to get his bearings.House keeping were lovely, very pleasant - we left them a tip every day and one day returned to a lovely note thanking us for the tip/s and wishing us a lovely day. I thought that was a lovely touch!I have to say the bed was incredibly comfortable and the pillows were fabulous!In all I guess I'd say it was average. There were some great things about the hotel - location being one of them. Some of the staff were great, others seemed to be just "doing a job". The noise from the wind and the street was terrible. I probably wouldn't stay here again. Double- glaze the rooms and I might consider it.

Stayed 4 x nights over "labour-day" weekend on first visit to San Francisco. Hotel is in great location and we were given high floor city view king room as per request. Good city views - room large and comfortable, all conveniences as you'd expect. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, giving advice on local transport etc. Overlooking Union Square you are right in the heart of downtown SF, good shops, cafes and eating out close by, as well as minutes walk into Chinatown and Cable Car and city-tour bus stops just on the square etc. Good base from which to explore the city - can walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Would highly recommend for location, attentive staff and accommodation standard. Roof-top gym (if so inclined) gives great city views. Had breakfast in the hotel restaurant one morning - very good, and also had breakfast on-the-go from the lobby. Bar is nice area to have a drink although there are lots of places to go in the surrounding area. Would definitely consider staying here again if/when return to San Francisco.

Location is great. Rooms were wonderful and the floor to ceiling windows gave a great view of the city. Grand club lounge on the 32 floor was a great place too start on a wonderful evening. Doorman was great at arranging car service to airport and got us a super driver.

I stayed here four nights on my first trip to San Fran. The room was clean and comfortable. I paid extra for the City View room so I was higher up and the street noise was less. Loved the floor to ceiling windows. Location was perfect. I took one of the tours offered through the concierge. For a first time visitor, it was a great tour as I got a feel of the town. The hotel is next to the Muni so you can visit other parts of the city easily. Lots of great restaurants nearby. Breakfast at OneUp was a perfect start to the day and worth the extra money. Met some nice people at the happy hour there too. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip.

Excellent hotel friendly and helpful staff .I was in a tenth floor room overlooking Union Sq. Beautiful room spacious clean with all facilities required . Large floor to ceiling window gave a fabulous view over this wonderful city . Not cheap but worth it every penny. One small issue is lack of a retail outlet for essentials . However staff will try there best to assist .

It certainly has location going for it! Very convenient to doing the touristy things inSF. But unfortunately, many of the staff know this and believe they can throw customer service out the window into union square. Our encounters were mainly with the front desk and bell desk the two times we stayed

We stayed here for 3 nights as our first stop in California. We don't travel light unfortunately and because we had no car during our stay in SF, all our luggage had to fit into this tiny room. Small issue if you are using this as mostly a city break to see the sights of SF. But with all our shopping and baggage, we could barely see the carpets on the floor by the end of our stay! The lighting in the bathroom is super amazing for applying makeup. Big plus for me:)Location is definitely unbeatable. You are steps away from Union Square and there is a cable car stop just round the block. There are tons of shopping nearby at Market Street and Geary and Post. Starbucks is just across the street so no problems with breakfast & coffees. All round reliable option as a base in the city.

I love the location of this Hyatt. Very nice room, quiet, clean & spacious. The lobby was being renovated, so Front Desk was in a temporary location. The Front Desk staff handled the flow of guests very well. Very courteous and accommodating.The Stay Fit gym was bigger than most Hyatt's I visit, which was awesome. I didn't visit any of the Food & Beverage outlets, so no comment here.Again, if you love to shop, this is the place. I will recommend to family & friends.

Our trip started with 3 nights in San Francisco and we choose this hotel because of the location just close to Union Square. The Grand Hyatt was renovated and the entrance was nice. The staff at the front desk (especially Olivia) was super friendly and helpfull. We got a room on the 30th floor. Room was clean, good and the most important quiet during the night. The hotel has free wifi and it works good in the room too. We had inroom dining and the food was good including the service.We would definitely stay here again!!

Excellent experience at the Grand Hyatt! It is located in the heart of Union Square, next to multiple shops and restaurants. I was able to walk to Chinatown, North Beach, Fisherman's Wharf, Coit Tower, the Ferry building and took a taxi to Hayes Valley in the evening to watch the symphony. The hotel does have it's own coffee shop, but right outside the door is also a Starbucks. The lobby has a very modern and open feel with a friendly staff readily available to help with any questions. The food onsite is good. My conference experience was good. The room was very nice and comfortable. I stayed on a higher floor with a great view. Internet was provided and there is 24 hour fitness. When I go back, I will be staying at the Grand Hyatt!

We spent 4 nights at the Hyatt for Labor Day weekend. Our family had 3 rooms. The front desk was very accommodating in making sure that 2 rooms were connecting and the 3rd room was nearby on the same floor. The concierge (Mark) was awesome! All of his dinner recommendations were a huge hit - including the trip to the food truck park at Fort Mason. Great creative ideas! Mark also gave us advice on when to walk, cab vs. drive ourselves. His maps were perfect. The rooms were clean and we especially appreciated the water refill stations next to the ice machine. We will be back!

My one and only night ever in San Francisco and yikes! This hotel took over 2 hours to check me in. Stood on line for at least 30 minutes. The room was average, the breakfast was a cattle feed line of yuc... After a night here I was grateful to get on a jet outa here...

During our visit last weekend we were given a room on the 20th floor overlooking Union Square. Great room, bed and linens were very nice and everything is very modern. Free WiFi with a good connection in the room. One of the best features was being able to raise and lower the window shade remotely while in bed. They moved the bar and restaurant from the 36th floor to the 2nd. The new location is very nice although we wanted to see the view from the top floor which is now being used as an event venue. We asked the front desk if we could be allowed up to the 36th floor and were escorted up by a security person who allowed us to take some photos. All staff was very accommodating from the moment we checked in. Lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. We wouldnâ€™t hesitate to stay there again.

In the center of SFO and near Union Square. The clercks were very friendly, the Room is clean, modern and confortable. The location is perfect if you don't want to drive because is near of Market Street with a main store for your shop.

checking in to the hyatt, the front desk felt a little weird to me. maybe it was a more modern way of checking in? the lobby was nice and warm and we got in just in time for a free wine tasting at the lobby! we had a weird experience while have breakfast at the restaurant, one up. The glasses for juice they gave us were very small. it was like a 3 ounce glass (they we're using the same glasses for shots at the lounge.) and then when we asked for water, the server only filled our glasses halfway for some reason, all 4 of us. we werent upset or anything, just found it all unusual. overall though, the rooms were nice, the location was good and right in the middle of everything. the food, decent and standard for a hyatt hotel.

The Grand Hyatt is truly a Grand Hotel on its own. They won't call it GRAND for nothing. From the reception area to the elevator and then to your room, you're greeted by the employees with their great smiles. The view on my room was superb. Facing the Union Square and it is really wonderful view especially at night time when you see all the lights on the buildings nearby. Overall, I give 10 Stars to Grand Hyatt for their location, service and great customer service. I had to mention about their valet parking... It is a compliment since one of the valet driver was so kind that he helped us to rotate the steering wheel since we couldn't get it to move. Thank you so much Mr. Valet Driver for helping us out!!! It was late at night when we checked in, but thank you for making us feel comfortable in the area and for your kindness in helping us out. You guys are the best! Also, the lady who gave the directions on where to go, local attractions, etc was also nice and very helpful. She takes time in telling you where you need to go and what street to take. Good job everyone. Please keep up the good work!!!

I periodically have to stay in San Francisco and always choose the Grand Hyatt Union Square. The renovations turned out great, the club is well run and service is great? I would love to have windows that open as I prefer fresh air to air conditioning

It is nice to see the improvements continue at that Grand Hyatt Union Square, but I really really miss the breakfast and cocktails on the top floor. It is no longer open to the public and only used for convention space.The restaurant and bar on the mezzanine level is ok, but just not the same as it was on the top floor. Not likely I'll stay here as I just loved taking in the views from up there.

I stayed at this hotel in July of this year. This hotel is in the middle of union square near all the shops and restaurants and is near all the major transit lines. If you like a nice stroll, you can walk to the Embarcadero. The bus stop to Chinatown is right across the street. Our room was a little small but very comfortable and clean. Because our room was on the 21st floor, we had panoramic views of the city and bay. Their breakfast is a little expensive but very delicious; I recommend it for anyone staying at this hotel.

Stayed for a conference in the hotel 5 nights. Asked for a high floor room upon reservation and at check-in. Was put on 10th floor with a view of...nothing. I thought it might have been because of the conference rate, but others at the conference had great rooms. A little disappointed. Room was also next to elevator shaft.Rooms were clean and well appointed. Small as expected in a big city.Location was excellent, near restaurants, shopping and transportation.Not sure what the doormen are supposed to do, because they didn't do much. They seemed more interested in chatting with eachother than opening the door for my wife.

It is placed at Union Square, near lots of magazines and the Moscone Convention Center. The restaurant is undersized for the number of rooms, and frequently we had to wait to be seated for breakfast. The employees are very attentive.

After a week of college tours mixed with hiking in the great outdoors we were ready for some luxury, hotel service and good food. The location for the Grand Hyatt is perfect for seeing Chinatown, The Cable Car Museum, Golden Gate Fortune Cookie Factory, great shopping, and restaurants of all types. I would describe our rooms and the overall vibe in the hotel as urban elegance - cool, hip but not overstated. The gym is huge with gorgeous views of the City. The highlights of our stay were the concierge desk - everyone was helpful, knowledgeable and one concierge offers a free coffee walk around the block to share what she knows about the area. I did the coffee walk and found the info and anecdotes interesting and her enthusiasm entertaining. The other highlight is the lounge access. The view alone is worth the extra fee but the breakfast and appetizers (tuna roll, tamales) were great too. My teens loved it and felt save venturing out on their own in the area. My husband and I loved the close proximity to everything we wanted to do and see.DISCLOSURE: I publish TravelingMom.com and the cost of the room and lounge access were provided to me as part of a press package, however, the opinions are my own.

Had everything that we needed. Rooms were clean and well maintained. Location near the shops, but a long way from Fisherman's Wharf area (further than we thought from the maps) and cabs were relatively expensive. We had no problems with this hotel at all.

I was walked from the Hyatt Regency San Francisco to the Grand Hyatt San Francisco, and I wish I would have staied longer, because the service was 5 stars. They ensured I had a quiet room, with a king sized bed (which was unnecessary), and I had probably the best view of my life of San Francisco. The concierge was very helpful, he tried to ensure I could stay there the remainder of my stay, even though it was not possible, and he managed to get me tickets to Alcatraz, which is a very difficult thing for a tourist.I would defitinely come back to this property. The Hyatt Grand San Francisco lives up to the Hyatt mission of providing authentic hospitality!

Stayed four nights on a business trip. Staff reasonably helpful at checkin and checkout, breakfast and bar staff very pleasant and happy to help. Not the quietest of spots and traffic noise fairly noticeable on the 11th floor. Rooms clean and well maintained. Not cheap but also a nice place to stay.

Nice hotel, excellent view! We had a balcony room with a view of the bay. Really nice. The location was great, we walked up and down the piers all day stopping in for a bite here or a drink there. Lots to see including the America's cup, way cool! The service was very good, exceptional even. I'd definatly stay there again.

This was my second stay at this Hyatt and it was first rate. The rooms have been newly renovated and have a slick, modern almost Scandinavian feel with light woods and earth tones. The hotel staff tries very hard to make each guest feel special. I had a King room on a high floor with a great view of downtown as well as water views of the Bay between buildings. Lovely, especially at night. As a frequent guest, I had access to the Club room and it was a very nice perk, offering breakfast and evening appetizers/drinks. Most rooms now feature a walk-in shower. If you need a tub, be sure to ask specifically for a room so equipped. The location just one block from Union Square is perfect for work or pleasure. The cable car on Powell is just 2 blocks and the BART & MUNI are just 3 blocks away on Market. Ask for a high floor for the best views.

We are a family of four, with two boys, ages 10 and 12. We stayed at the hotel on 8/21- 8/24The hotel is in a great location. Although, while not the quietest of areas (Union Square and after all, SF is a big city) our room (2102) was quiet and well appointed.The staff was very attentive and made you feel welcome.The hotel has gone through a complete renovation so our room seemed brand new. Cool looking room, with electric shades, cool lighting and furniture. My kids liked the fact that you didn't need to slide your key into the lock to open it..just needed to put your key card next to the "plate" on the door. The bathroom is stylish with a great sink. One strange item though - the door to the bathroom is a sliding, frosted glass door - but does not have a lock!!??. This was OK for us since our kids are older but if you are traveling with younger kids, believe me, a lock is desired (or maybe we aren't that hip or we couldn't figure out how to lock the door - probably both!)The lobby is sleek and the registration desk is unlike most hotels - it's more like a "registration area" where the staff have cool tables with their laptops and use those to check you in. Also, in the AM, the lobby has a section where they serve coffee, pastries and fruit and is a nice added feature (they charge for this but there is a coffee maker in the room, if desired) Also, there is a Starbucks directly across the street - one of 483 in the surrounding blocks!! Being by Union Square, many choices for food and shopping. Our bellman told us of a Walgreens in the Marriott a block away which had a decent grocery section so we got some snacks etc there to store in small in-room fridge. One other nice feature - directly next to the ice machine was a filtered water dispenser (like a Poland Spring water cooler). Nice!Room was a bit small but the beds (two full size not queens) were very comfortable.All in all, great place to stay in the city for a few days.

Arrived late to hotel, service at the desk was great! Rooms were clean. Hotel service was prompt amd delicious! Hotel restaurant food was excellent.. Location prime for sight seeing!! Would def go again!

This hotel was excellent. The renovated hotel is completely different than before. They did an excellent job upgrading all the facilities. The new guest rooms are elegant and functional. This truly is a 5 star hotel.

It's 4:30 a.m. and I am wide awake. The AC fan in my room is so loud it woke me up. I was so exhausted last night, I guess I didn't hear it. Although I'm on the 14th floor, the street noises are also very loud. And the large gap under the door lets in a lot of light and noise. If you're not a light sleeper, this hotel will be a great choice for you. It's modern, clean and well located.

Stayed at Grand Hyatt San Francisco for two nights in July as part of a family vacation. Itâ€™s great hotel and fantastic location. Albeit a bit expensive, it is still worth it. Diamond-status recognized almost to my full satisfaction. Had asked for a suite upgrade but due to check-in tried their best to secure a good room (high floor, etc). I travel around 140 nights per year, and really likes when a hotel treats you well when you come with the family which is THE most critical time. Three things that made our stay really pleasant were: 1) I received excellent service and information from the Concierge (I recall the name of Joanna Husk or something like that). Advised on excellent steak-places, golden gate view points, etc 2) the Club Lounge is really nice â€“ in particular the breakfast is with lotâ€™s of healthy choices (dairy, fruits, etc), the food is presented well/â€ùappetizingâ€ù, and overall the lounge is kept clean, itâ€™s reasonably quiet and with a good view 3) the restaurant and bar on the first floor provides excellent food and service. Overall a great stay. Our kids (aged 10 and 15) loved it. Suggest that the self-parking information is a bit more detailed, (e.g. with a photo showing where to enter the self-parking which is around the corner, just across the street) since I had to circle the block twice to be sure I got in at the right place.

a brilliant place to base yourself to access the shops, the sights, the cable car, market st - everything really. We ate in resturant one night and was impressed, Breakfast was also great, especially the fried potatoes. Would recommed staying here

We are a family of five with three teenagers.We arrived late and were brilliantly looked after by Betsy on reception. She even gave a recommendation of Lori's Diner around the corner for a great late night meal.The rooms are freshly and stylishly renovated with great views of the city. Easy to make your way from here around town.The concierge service was brilliant with Elaine and Liz helping us arrange trips to Muirs Wood and to watch the Oakland A's baseball. Our apologies to A's fan Liz for jinxing her team to a loss against the lowly Houston Astros.The restaurant is small for the hotel which can cause some delays at breakfast time. Not a problem for those of us on holidays but it could be for anyone with a busy schedule. Food is good though and the bar is a pleasant place with live acoustic music in the evening.The hotel even provided a limo to get us to the airport for the same price as a minivan.Thanks for great stay. We are happy to recommend the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco.

This was a very modern hotel where everything worked like clockwork. The Staff were very good. The concierge desk staff were brilliant. The location is great for tours and the cable cars. The restaurant was lovely, good food, good service but not expensive.The room was good, clean and modern. We would stay there again.

OMG what a beautiful hotel , the view its amazing i was on the 31 floor , you can see the city and the fog in the moring, service is very good the, location , location , location , worth the price! the hotel is next to union square from there you walk to Chinatown, market place is just 4 blocks away

We stayed here for 3 nights on the first part of our honeymoon. The location is great - right in the heart of Union Square. The hotel was clean and modern and the staff were great. The only thing I never liked was the breakfast buffet - it was a bit of a rip off. Otherwise, all in all this is a good choice for San Fran.

This is my first vacation in San Francisco and decided to stay at Grand Hyatt because of its high reputation. There are both pros and cons during my stay, which I will pin point in detail. First off, I really like the location. The accessibility to Union Square and ChinaTown are within reach. Secondly, the concierge here are absolutely amazing ! One of the concierge named Joanna is half Thai, so she gave me insurmountable information about San Francisco's main attractions as well as recommended us delicious restaurants.Moving on to the room, we're in 27th Floor and the room we have had a great view of the Bay. Also with high technology TV programs, it makes Grand Hyatt more attractive to the people in this generation. Now moving on to the cons. Firstly, there are no mini-bar inside the refrigerator. I found this strange because how can a great hotel as Hyatt do not have mini-bar in it ? I just don't understand.Secondly and this is the only thing that I REALLY REALLY HATE on this stay. The breakfast and its service. I have been traveling around the world and never ever been disappointed with breakfast as this hotel before. Before complaining, I have to say that it's my fault to book Bed and Breakfast package at this hotel. We thought that the breakfast is gonna be good but things turned opposite.  Now, we actually had buffet as breakfast, not a la carte one. There are not as many breakfast selections and the dining area is small compare to Hyatt Regency Orange County in Los Angeles that I've been before staying at this place. Furthermore, the food here taste horrible that I can only eat just Yogurt and berries ( that's the only thing that was great ). The scrambled eggs were too dry and have no taste and the pancakes were horribly made. Also, the sausage and bacon were too salty and the appearance of it looks as if it was made yesterday. Moving on to the drinks, there are limited choice of juices, which we only get orange juice but not apple juice or grape juice. The coffee and tea are okay but not that great. Next is the service, my younger brother was really piss at one of the waiter named Jackie. I was also frustrated with the way he talked. He didn't even say " Good morning sir, would you like some tea or coffee ? ". Instead, he said '' You want some tea ? you want orange juice ? ''. I did order an English Breakfast tea and when he served, he spilled some out and it was on my new suede sneaker that I bought a day ago. He did not even clean and apologize. All he did was saying '' Here's your tea enjoy''. Moreover, his facial appearance didn't seem nice and also he was not that enthusiastic either. A good service-mind waiter should be alert all the time as well as remembering each customer's menu ( e.g. my younger brother is allergic to orange juice, but the waiter still serve it ( which is wasteful ). ). For other waiters are okay but not that great.The manager here seriously needs to improve the breakfast quality as well as their waiters because when I was about to checkout, I heard from others saying that they hate the breakfast here so much. Lastly, I had a great time vacationing in San Francisco but not at Grand Hyatt. Are there chance for me to stay here again ? Maybe no.

Union Square and its surroundings have all the shopping your soul might want and then some more. And this Hotel is right there, everything is in walking distance, be it shops from Marshalls to Luis Vuitton, food for foodies and everybody else, Chinatown 2 blocks away and the Cable Car 1 block away to connect to Fisherman's Wharf and Giardhelli Square. If you arive with a "smile" and ask "nicely" you will be accomodated in one of the upper floors for a beautiful view of the city. The rooms have been remodelled nicely, and although for me in particular the beds are too soft, nobody else in my party complained about that! Consierge service is excellent and very helpful in suggesting restaurants, arranging for rental cars etc.

So i stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and it was great the service was great the valet did a nice quick job getting our car and the check in was flawless. What i liked most about it was that it had a great location walking distance to a lot of major places like union square. The only reason i gave this 4 stars is because the rooms were a little tight and cramped with 4 people even though it had 2 double beds, but that was not that much of a problem. But otherwise everything else is fantastic.

I very much enjoyed my stay at this hotel! The location is perfect in the heart of San Francisco's Union Square. It makes it very convenient to take advantage of public transportation including the famous trolley, and the many tours and hop on hop off buses. Additionally, there are many stores nearby. The rooms are beautifully appointed, and I particularly enjoyed the suite that Chris Friedemann upgraded me to as a Hyatt Diamond. He is a consummate professional with impeccable follow up!The concierge team go above and beyond, and in particular Susan advised me on many VERY helpful tips by email before my arrival, such as booking advance tickets to Alcatraz as they sell out far in advance. She also advised me about local tours and hop on hop off buses, as well as not to have a rental car based on what I wanted to see due to the high parking fees and convenience of public transportation. The club lounge was phenomenal with great views and a wonderful selection, and the staff was superb checking on the hotel guests there, and making sure everyone was comfortable and had what they needed. The check in staff and bell staff was super friendly, and I truly had a remarkable experience (which I've gotten used to and come to expect from the Hyatt brand). I highly recommend this hotel, and I will certainly be back!

Adjacent to Union Square, this hotel could not be in a better place for shopping, dining, and seeing sites. The view from the room overlooking Union Square was nice although it could be noisy during events. However, the space allocation in the (recently renovated) room was awkward and walls seemed paper thin -- we could hear conversations clearly from adjacent two rooms. Room doors could stand to be adjusted to prevent slamming when guests choose to let them self-close which became especially bothersome in early morning or late at night.
