Front of house staff seemed unconcerned when these items were mentioned, even remarking that the noise issue has been raised before; no compensation offered. As such, I elected to stay at the Hyatt Embarcadero upon my return the following week; there are plenty of other Union Square hotels to choose from.

We stayed here over the 4th of July weekend and even though it was very busy the service was very good. The room was a good size, with a great view and a very comfortable bed. The only hitch was that we had requested a cot and there was a bit of a mix up where it was delivered to the room and not set up. When we requested that the cot be set up, they actually removed it instead. After explaining what had happened, the night manager personally brought the cot back up, set it up himself and offered us a complimentary breakfast for our trouble. He really went above and beyond and made our stay a good one. Thanks.

Grand Hyatt is pricely but a good value because of its great location - two blocks from Chinatown - one block from the cable car stop that takes you to Fisherman's Wharf and less than a block for the multiple hop-off-and hop-on tour buses that travel the city. Starbucks across the street, drugstore and laundromat within easy walking distance. Concierge most helpful in arranging tours. All price range of restaurants nearby. Hotel is beautiful and rooms were excellent, though we spent little time there.

While we loved the location of the hotel and appreciated its close proximity to shopping and Sears Fine Foods for breakfast (one of our favorites!), the hotel itself was disappointing. Small rooms and odd bathroom layouts made the experience average at best. It was clean and we didn't have any issues. But for the money, you can likely do better.

I like this hotel. Our room was extremely clean if small for the 3 of us; not the hotel's fault, more the fault of making arrangements through Virgin Holidays instead of directly with the hotel. Not a lot of storage space, which leads me to think this is a hotel catering more for business travellers than holiday makers, but maybe there are more spacious apartments elsewhere. No pool to the best of my knowledge, but there is a gym located on the top (35th) floor with fantastic views over the city. Our room was on the 12th floor, so we had background traffic noise, and also there is a lot of construction work going on (and they were definitely working at night); that wasn't great, so choose a room higher up and facing away from Stockton.Staff are extremely friendly, helpful and efficient. The location is central to lots of shopping, mainly high end, but more reasonable shops within walking distance. Transport of all varieties is right on the doorstep - cable cars, buses, trams and metro. A CityPASS is a handy thing to have and we've used it a lot; will get you all over the city. Chinatown is walking distance, in fact, so is Pier 39 though you have to be a more keen walker there and learn the less hilly routes. The only down side is that it's very close to the Tenderloin where many of the city's homeless have shelters, so it's a common sight to see people begging for money on street corners. I guess that's reality, but a shame.So lots to recommend this hotel. One more thing there is free WiFi available, but it can be temperamental and slow at times. But it's there, and that's also helpful. For completeness, there is also a faster WiFi but you pay for that.

My husband I can spent the long 4th of July weekend at the Grand Hyatt San San Francisco. We flew in from San Diego, took a shuttle (the BART system was not working because of a strike), and headed straight to the hotel. We were able to check in quickly (under 5 minutes) and super early 11am. Check and check!We loved our king standard room on the 20th floor. Our room overlooked Union Square. The weather that weekend was impeccable with all sunny skies. The room was large compared to other comparable hotels in San Francisco (Anyone who's been to SF before knows that rooms in the city are usually crazy small). The automatic shade dark-out shade was AWESOME! The bed was low, but comfy. We didn't eat at the restaurant onsite as there are just so many options within walking distance in the area. The room was super clean and tastefully appointed. The best thing about this hotel is it's location. You can walk and shop around Union Square, which is just steps away. The walk to Chinatown was 5 minutes. While you could walk to Fisherman's Wharf (taking about an hour), we took a short cab, then caught a trolley on the way back. This hotel is pricey, but in a city like SF, you really get what you pay for. We'll be coming back.

Ive stayed at this hotel about 4 or 5 times. I LOVE this hotel. The staff is fantastic, the location cant be beat, and the rooms are very 'cool' and modern. The views from the higher floors is fantastic. So awesome to see the fog roll in and out of the city. The gym is on the 35th floor. Its a great gym, and you have incredible views from the cardio machines. If you are lucky enough to have club access, the lounge on the 32nd floor is great. Honor bar and free appetizers every night. My only complaint: Dont get a room near an ice machine. It is very loud. Overall great hotel. Cant beat the location!

I love everything about this hotel! The service was great, all the staff were so friendly and helpful, the rooms were spacious and clean. The location is perfect! Lots of great shooping near by. If I ever go to San Francisco again, I would definately chose Grand Hyatt again.

Loved this location! The room was nicely decorated, spacious and comfortable. As hotel beds go, this one was pretty good. The fitness center had plenty of options. The hotel restaurant (One Level Up) was delicious and they offered generous pours in a glass of wine. One drawback in the room was the shower, which did not have much pressure and couldn't adjust to reach even half way across the tub. Also, while service overall was very good, the concierge staff was lacking in knowledge when I needed it and personality.

I walked in without a reservation after a disappointing experience at a nearby hotel, and was instantly impressed with this property. The entire hotel has been remodeled, with a fresh, hip vibe in the lobby, and clean rooms with a similarly swanky feel. Little touches like leather-wrapped handles on the closet and electric window shades give the room a feeling of luxury that some of the city's top hotels would have a hard time matching. Desk staff was very friendly, offered lots of details about the hotel's remodel, and was quick to send up bottled water to the room. Excellent stay, will be back the next time I'm in the city.

Warm reception (though unusual front desk set up - free standing oddly shaped tables), clean, modern rooms. Very accommodating to our request for connecting rooms as we were traveling with children. Great restaurant - friendly, efficient and professional service, good food. Great location - easy walk to shopping, bars/restaurants, easy 20 min walk to piers.

My wife and i wanted a room on Union Square. This was our first time at the SF Grand Hyatt, and everything from the telephone booking to checkout was seamless. We had a great view towards the Bay from our room on the 22nd floor..it was immaculate if a little small. The coffee corner in the lobby is a great idea for a quick breakfast - we used it at least twice! The check-in, checkout system could be made faster. Munir Salem (executive housekeeping) was a gem in helping me look for my lost BlackBerry on 6 April, after I had checked out of the room. I still don't know how and where the phone was found, but Munir managed to find it, and Hyatt couriered it back to me in Singapore a week later. Many many thanks!

The rooms have been refurbished and they are all new. The beds are very comfortable.The view from the lounge situated on the top floor was amazing. There was a vista at every window.The lounge was well stocked and cozy and the staff was very helpful. Overall a great place to stay in San Francisco!

We had a nice one day stay for my wife's birthday.We had booked a Bay view, hoping to see the Bay bridge at night.When we checked in the clerk stated that none of their rooms face the Bridge,but we still would have a Bay view and not a City view.Our room was on the 20th floor. I would estimate that about 80% of the view was city buildings, 15% was sky and 5 % was of the Bay.I stated my case when we checked out. I even showed the clerk the picture of the view that I had taken on my phone. She quickly apologized and reduced the room rate to the city view.... a $50 savings.The next time we will ask for a floor higher than the 20th.

Ok. Hyatt Goldpasspott reservation have messed up the reservation (AGAIN) but the hotel was great friendly clean. Super nice club staff, cleaning staff etc. the only thing what my kids really missed was a pool. Also front desk (room manager) Tiffany was friendly and very pragmatic. E

Stayed in June. This was our second visit and it was as nice as last time, 2 years ago. Room still feels new and modern. Great bathroom. Lobby has been renovated and looks better than before. Great location. Food at the hotel restaurant was unexpectedly good. Also this restaurant is very spacious,nicely designed. Definitely recommended.

We stayed here for a bachelorette party. We had booked a Grand Club room, but didnt specify if it was for a King or Double. About 2 days before our arrival I called to confirm that they were putting us in a double and I was told yes on the 30th floor. Upon check in we didnt end up getting a double, but rather a king and there were no appologies given. Simply told "you just made a request we cant guarantee" You know that would've been fine if the guy wasnt talking to me in a rude manner as if I was not quite understanding what he was saying. It was just really annoying that we were told one thing and then later told something else. As far as the hotel, it was very nice and clean. I think I would've gave it a better rating had I been happy with the customer service.

Easy middle of San Francisco location, close to where we were meeting for work and great to walk around San Francisco. Helpful staff and nice lobby. Would have like to stay longer and check out the bar.Rooms were clean and nicely decorated.Only issue was the howling noise from the wind, which I understand is normal for these high-rise hotels. I had a hard time sleeping because it felt like someone was coming into my room every time the wind blew.

I spent a night in a Club Room at this hotel and was impressed with the customer service in the Club. The room was clean, the bed linen high quality. A good night. The front desk staff were very accomodating, allowing me to check-in early, having arrived after an international flight. I was also able to check-out a little later the next day. This flexibility was very much appreciated.

We stated for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon. It was a great experience, the staff were all superb, from a quick check in and out,bar tenders, cleaners, to the most helpful concierge Joanna! The location is perfect, and gave a great starting point to explore San Fran. It is a little noisy, but you are in the city centre of San Francisco, it's not the countryside!! We managed by accident to access the staff lifts, we got such a laugh looking at the requested staff affirmations to guests on the wall of the lift (always smile, greet guests etc)... But you know, they all were super and doing excellent customer service and extra! We got lost after coming down from the bar... Great cocktails!! It was a really busy hotel with the conference that was on, but it added to the ambiance I think. We never had breakfast there, but the coffee bar was good value and great coffee.The gym on the 35th floor is such a gem, working out over the city was cool! To finish, it was a great hotel and we will be passing the recommendation to others

Rooms were clean, small but adequate . However the bartenders were the best in The city. Phil, Boa, and Danielo! Wow , I have been around the world, but never have I had better bar service ever. What a team, Congrats to Hyatt for having such exemplary employees.

I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco multiple times. The location, at Union Square is excellent. My family (My wife and I and 2 kids) stayed here, this time, for vacation. We had 2 adjacent rooms. The rooms were nice, and clean. The beds were very comfortable. The service was excellent. The concierge was very helpful and his and her recommendations for places to visit, how to get there and restaurants were accurate.I highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again

We were in San Fran for the last night of a great week and chose Hyatt for their reputation. We were given a 6th floor bay view room. The room was nice enough but the outdoor bar music and noise was extreme. Tried to rest for a few minutes in the afternoon and it was impossible. Would not recommend staying in any bay view room when the dj is there. Disappointing to say the least

My wife and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a week of vacation in San Francisco and had a great stay. The hotel is located in the heart of Union Square and is close to everything you can think of. There is great shopping, dining and bars all within walking distance from the Hyatt. We never ate at the hotel, but did get drinks one night at the bar, which were a little pricey, but we expected it. The room we stayed in overlooked Union Square and had great views of the city. The room was always clean and tidy. Our room had a king size bed that was very firm. I prefer a more soft mattress, but was able to manage with the bed for the week. The black out drapes were a nice perk and did an amazing job keeping the light in the morning. The in-room WiFi was fantastic and never gave us any problems. The front desk staff and bellmen were great. We had an issue one night with the people next door to us coming home drunk and making too much noise. I called down to the front desk at 2:30 AM to see if they could do something about it. They sent not one, but two security members up to the room in no less than 5 minutes of my call, I was more than impressed. Susan (I think that was her name) helped us out at the concierge's desk to plan a day trip to Monterey/Pebble Beach and rent a car for the trip. She was also a big help with making reservations for dinner on a few occasions. Overall, my wife and I had a great trip to San Francisco and the Grand Hyatt played a major role in it! We would definitely consider staying here again if we came back to San Fran!

Location is excellent, next to Union Square. Parking is a rip off at 45USD per night. Staff are helpfull and friendly. Soundproofing is dreadful. Constant noise coming into the room from adjacent rooms and from the outside. Very high tec power shower heads but low water pressure render them useless. Would I stay there again? No chance !

This is a nice hotel in San Fracisco. The rooms were on the smaller side, but they were clean and furnishing was up to date. The lobby was very nice, but a little small for the size of the hotel, so I found myself going to the meeting area where the conference rooms were located. The front desk service was great and the entire hotel staff was able to deliver extraordinary service. The location of this property is great, short drive to North Beach and the Piers. If you park a car, leave at least 1/2 hour for them to pull it around.

This is a very nice hotel located right next to Union Square. Handy for all the shops and the cable car terminus for that run down to the piers. We had a room on the 32nd floor with great views over San Francisco. We had room only but the hotel did have a coffee bar on the ground floor which was sufficient for a quick breakfast in the room. We did not try the restaurant as there is plenty of choice on your doorstep. Overall a very nice hotel in a great location.

Enjoyed every moment of our stay. The staff are just wonderful- from housekeeping to bell desk to reception, the service is flawless. Reception and concierge are fantastic. The concierge, Joanne booked our Alcatraz tours and we found her so efficient and friendly. The refurbished hotel rooms are well designed and thought out. They are not mean with their amenities which is important as many 5 star hotels are skimping on basic stuff like shower gel these days which is frankly ridiculous!The negatives:  the accommodation definitely has poor soundproofing of adjacent doors. We were on a quiet floor on level 28 but we could hear a crying man and noisy family on either side of us. They clearly didn't understand the concept of quiet floor!! The only other negative was the bath plumbing which made continual strange noises when the bath tub was full.

The hotel is huge and extremely well located... Like one block away of everything!Room, although is a little too small is great and has a little bit of technology everywhere - till today I'm wondering where to switch on main room light.Minibar unfortunately is empty... ;(Breakfast restaurant is too small for the size of hotel and service so so... Buffet ok but not enough variety ...

As they say, you pay for.. LOCATION, LOCATION! and this hotel has it! No taxis are needed on a daily basis. It is walking distance to the best shopping and some of the best restaurants in the city. Bus transportation is right around the corner, as well as the trolley car. Starbucks is accross the street. The Concierge service here is the best I have ever experienced! They take time with everyone, and with a smile on their face. We were travling with our family of 7 having problems with getting resevations in restaurants, as well as some booked attractions. Joanna was creative, and helped figure out a way for our family to get tickets. Liz follwed through with getting our family every reservation needed. It was worth staying at this hotel just for the great service they provided. Our family vacation was saved thanks to the concierge service!

This is my go to hotel whilst traveling to San Francisco, The rooms are wonderful as is the staff and the amenities. The best part is that hotel is so centrally located and walking distance to most of San Fran's tourist/business locations of interest. The best aspect of the hotel is the staff who make you feel welcomed from the moment you walk through door. The only complaint I have and this is a more of a preference is that the mattresses are too soft.Can't wait to stay here again when I am in SFO in November.FYI The renovations make the hotel more appealing then ever.

We arrived at the hotel and found a group of 10-15 people at the check-in so we joined the long queue. We were really amazed to discover that in just a couple of minutes we where at the desk and minutes later in our room. The staff is exactly what you want after a long flight: friendly, professional and straight to the point.We had a city view room on the higher floors and the view from there is great, especially at dawn or at night. The room seemed to be recently refurbished and the quality is very high: no noise and the bed is very comfortable.The location is also perfect to visit San Francisco: you can catch the cable cars just one block away, the shopping district is on the other side of the road and with the public transport you can easily get to Fisherman Wharf or the Pier 1.

Stayed three (3) nights in two rooms with family in mid-July on a Grand Club floor (31st). Rooms are very nice after the remodel and the Grand Club on the 30th floor is spectacular. The service is top notch and the location cannot be beat. One of the better hotels in San Francisco.

You cannot beat this location right across the street from chinatown, union square a few blocks from north beach, theatre district, and more. The lobby is a little cramped and they have revamped it so that you stand a sort of desk with the agent checking you in: I find it a little offputting and prefer the old method. But the agents are friendly and efficient. I'm platinum level and had reserved a room on the exec club level. exec club is a bargain if you can upgrade to it as it includes snacks, breakfast, hors d'oeuvres, inexpensive mix your cocktails and a dedicated business center. The view rooms have outstanding views. The rooms were refurbished a couple of years ago and are pretty nice if a little cramped.

I normally stay at the Hilton which is a nice hotel, but could not get in so my company booked me here. WOW, recently remodeled this property is very nice, The room design is great. It is one of the VERY few hotels that designed for the business traveler, outlets in the RIGHT place, Lights in the RIGHT place, even the design of the shower - shelving int he RIGHT place.Highly recomennded

Stayed at old version 6 years ago and refurb makes this an excellent place to stay.rooms and bathrooms are very modern and loved the remote contrlol for lighting and curtains--not complicated just very good.hotel is central for most must do sight seeing etc.A big must is cycle the Golden Gate bridge .visit Sausilito-- go back on ferry--sheer heaven.Giants ballpark great day out with wow views.MUST MUST UPGRADE TO HIGHER FLOOR CLUBROOM.

Travel full time in business so lots of experience.Great location, great remodel, great bar, great work out room but...They have some real clunkers1. Internet is over complicated with the levels of service and none of them worked and despite several calls for tech support never could get them working2. Self park garage is third party anda total mess3. Bell service is slow and whineyHeading to the WESTIN on market

The Grand Hyatt is a lovely hotel. We really enjoyed our stay here and found the staff to be friendly and the rooms to be lovely and clean. It was extremely close to Restaurants, Macy's (a great place to shop), Cable Cars, Buses etc. If you like walking, especially up a few hills, the walk into Fishermans Wharf is also worth doing. We walked to Lombard St and it was one of the nicest walks and gave you a chance to have a close look and different things. All in all we had a great time. Thank you to all involved.

Stayed here on business and was pleasantly surprised - I normally stay at the Hyatt just off Embarcadero but was put up here instead and Iâ€™m glad I was. The property has been recently updated and upgraded. The experience started on the greeting by the front door staff and was followed through by the swift and efficient check in process. I received a room on the 9th floor facing north with just s small peek at the bay, which was fine. Met some coworkers at the One Up Lounge and the happy hour prices are very reasonable as others have mentioned in their reviews. Service was good but a little slow for the small amount of folks in the lounge. The room redone and very nice and the bed very comfortable - I liked the remote control blind that lower and cut out a most of the light that you control from the bed. My only complaint was that the windows do not block out the construction noise and you cannot open the slider to get some fresh air.A good stop in the morning is the coffee bar on the opposite side from the check in area, which has very hot coffee and various quick grab breakfast items (muffins, hot sandwiches and dry cereal) I also appreciated having a choice of which newspapers at each elevator lobby.I noticed a nice mix of business and vacation travelers staying at the hotel. I was talking to a British couple and they thought the hotel was a perfect jumping off point on their touring around San Francisco. Next trip I will be back and stay here and I look forward to having some time to explore the area and the many stores close by.

My husband & I spent 5 nights in June. We're very happy that we choose this hotel. The location is perfect right by Union Square, shops, public transportation, Wallgreen, Bakery, Starbuck, China Town - everything you need just in walking distance.Check-in was smooth. Thanks to Meagan, she's so friendly, funny & helpful. She gave us a room in the 10th floor. We didn't care about the view (it's a city view), what we wanted is a safe, clean, quiet, comfortable room. The room was big enough for us, the bed was very comfy, amenities were good, the room , towels , etc, were always clean. The House Keeper did a very good job. She always left a thank you notice for the gratuity. Well, actually all the staff were very friendly & helpful. All in all we're very satisfied. We had great stay, and will definitely stay here again.

My stay at this Grand Hyatt property was a result of a booking error on my part. I thought that I had reserved a room at the Hyatt Regency in the Financial District near the Embarcadero. It wasn't until I landed that I realized my mistake. The good news is that my stay at the Grand Hyatt turned out to be a pleasant surprise and upgrade in quality. This property was recently renovated from top to bottom. The finishes are tasteful and everything is new. I was assigned a room on the 30th floor that provided panoramic views of Union Square, The Financial District and the Bay. Some of the best shopping in the country are at the doorstep of the hotel. As an aside, I sometimes like to sleep in past sunrise and often find that hotel blinds do not do a very good job keeping the sunlight out of the room. The blinds at this property are a positive exception and provided near blackout conditions when drawn. The Grand Club lounge (32 floor) was staffed by attentive folks that took great pride in providing a comfortable environment for guests to relax. The food offerings were more expansive and seemed to be of higher quality than other Grand Clubs that I have visited recently. The views from the lounge are some of the best in all of San Francisco. The Grand Hyatt is now my Hyatt property of choice when staying in San Francisco.

We stayed here for 5 days over 4th of July 2013. Great central location. Concierge was wonderful and got us a late booking to Alcatraz even though all tour companies fully booked. Has breakfast at the restaurant and best eggs Benedict ever. F&B director came to our table and gave us suggestions on local points if interest. Wonderful guy and great rep for Hyatt. A couple says later saw us in the lobby and stopped to chat to see how our trip wa going. Staff treated us with personal customer focus. Will recommend and stay here again.

This particular Grand Hyatt has been in Union Square for umpteen years as I remember it when I first came to San Francisco 30 years ago. It has recently been renovated so the lobby, restaurants, and rooms are all very modern and new looking. Let me start off with the highlights of the Grand Hyatt:1. The staff at One Up Lounge (Linda, Raphael in particular) offer fantastic service and personable connections with their guests. The Lounge offers Happy Hour from 4 to 7pm and some of their beers and house wines are only $4 along with flatbreads at about $7 (50% off from $14)2. Check in customer representative, Brian, was very helpful. We arrived at about 12:45pm but our room wasn't ready so we went out for lunch and returned by 4pm. The room still wasn't ready so he kindly gave us another room on a higher floor (32nd floor) corner unit overlooking Union Square. Thank you Brian!3. A big thank you goes out to Tiffany, one of the hotel Managers, who made sure our stay was an enjoyable one. I enjoyed the buffet breakfast and thank you Tiffany!4. There is free Wi Fi in every guest room and it is very speedy so no need to pay for it at the Grand Hyatt. 5. The rooms are modern, new with electronic blinds, free coffee in room, and the best is the little fridge that has no mini bar in it. It is so convenient to have a little fridge for drinks, milk, or medication without needing to empty out the mini bar.6. There is free drinking water beside the ice machine so you can fill up your water bottle anytime without needing to carry liters of water back to the hotel from Walgreens.7. Daily complimentary newspapers which was great to keep up with the news8. There is a Starbucks coffee directly across from the hotel or there is a coffee bar set up in the hotel, across from Concierge, every morning which also serves coffee and pastries. 9. The hotel's location is wonderfully close to Chinatown and all the fantastic shops like Macys, Nordstroms, Saks Fifth, and other high end fashion boutiques.10. If you happen to forget any toiletries from home, the hotel offers an extensive list of amenities that you can request. ex: corkscrew, razor, slippers, deodorant,and the list goes on. We found this so useful especially if we forget this and that. 11. The Housekeeping staff is superb! They do a great job in respecting the Do Not Disturb sign and keeps our room extremely tidy and clean.Now a few hiccups that we felt--This is by no fault of the hotel but because of the age of this building:1. Even being on the 32nd floor, you can still hear the loud sirens, the construction (mostly weekedays only) which is directly across from the hotel on Stockton street because they are building a new metro stop there, and the music from the Square.2. On windy days, the glass door (permanently shut) will shiver a bit and you can hear the winds quite a bit against the glass. 3. I did not see any ventilation fan in the bathroom so if someone goes you know what, there is no fan to draw out the smell.4. The rooms are small with either 1 king or 2 double beds with no queen beds. This is a great property for business travelers (single) or a couple but if you have more than 2 people in the room, then it is very tight in space. The washroom is very small but very well lit.5. Our bathtub is probably still the original tub before pre reno days because it is not a soaker tub and when you stand on it to shower, there is a spot where it will make a hollow crackling noise. I believe it is one of those acrylic tubs thus making this sound. 6. Some concierge members can be more friendly and less arrogant. When certain concierge was asked about the Bart and bus system to get to a destination, the knowledge was somewhat lacking. Liz, the Cle d"Or concierge was fantastically knowledgeable and helpful always with a smile on her face. Thank you Liz!7. The valet guys and the doormen were wonderfully friendly and helpful. In all, the hotel is very nice but because of the age of the building, the noise issue and the ventilation problem can not be helped. If they can only replace their glass doors with much thicker glass, install bathroom ventilation, and replace the double beds with queen beds, then I would say this Grand Hyatt would be nearly perfect. Thank you for a great stay and see you soon!

We stayed here for 5 nights at the start of our honeymoon, since we had work in San Francisco before we could jet off on holiday. While not the most romantic of hotels, we very much enjoyed our stay. It's a modern, clean, nicely designed building. Our room had a great view over the city. We liked the high-tech features, e.g. button-controlled blinds. It was very clean, spacious and functional. The staff were very helpful. The location, by Union Square, was great. The perfect place to stay if you are on business or a short leisure trip. I'd normally rate it at 4 stars, but we benefitted from a very good work deal, meaning we paid a lot less than we should have, so I'm going to bump it all the way up to 5 stars!!

Stayed at the Grand for 6 nights in early July and admit it was a very nice 'home away from home'. Requested a higher floor with a bay view based on reviews I had read prior to our trip. We were given a room on the 27th floor and were not disappointed. We were fortunate to be in SF during a period of extremely good weather and the views we were afforded were spectacular. Great sightlines across Chinatown and North Beech and out over the bay.The rooms at the Grand had recently been updated and the place was spotless. The bed was extremely comfortable and the furnishings modern. Only a couple minor annoyances as the television volume was a bit on the low side (even my wife commented) and there could have been a little more pressure in the shower, Otherwise A+ all the way.Staff at the Grand were very friendly and helpful....special kudos to the doormen. Did have breakfast there one morning at the OneUp. Food was very good with lots of selection, though it was on the expensive side. Being close to Union Square there is a wide selection of diners nearby. I would recommend walking one block to Sears for a great breakfast at a good price. The location of the Grand is good, it is just steps from Union Square and close to public transportation. Depending on the nature of your visit to SF this area could be a plus or minus. Shopping, restaurants, hop on / hop off....great location, sightseeing tours, hanging out at fishermans wharf, etc......you might want to stay in that area. Having said that, getting around SF is really not that difficult. We walked from pier 39 to our hotel after the 4th fireworks and did the same from AT&T after a ball game. Long walks to be sure but do-able if you have decent footwear.After a long day in SF we ordered room service and were pleasantly surprised. Our meal was presented to us on a portable table (with linens of course) in front of the floor to ceiling window overlooking beautiful SF at night. What a nice way to cap off our stay. We definitely recommend this hotel.

We spent 4 nights at Grand Hyatt at Union Sq. and we liked it a lot. After 3 hours delay from Las Vegas due to the plane crash just a couple of days ago and with only one runway operating, and then a taxidriver overspeeding and was pulled aside by the police in traffic controll, we finally got to the hotel at 01.30 am. Tired but happy that we finally was at our last destination, we spoke to a very nice frontdesk employee who gave us a upgraded hotelroom with a stunning view over SF skyline and the bay. The room was very fresh, modern and well equipped. We had a room with 2 double beds, but they were very small to be double beds (or queen beds, about 120 cm) and we barely manged to fit in. The hotel is very modern and nice. The service level is high and the employees are very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The Grand Hyatt has a perfect location just one block from China Town, 20 min. walk to North Beach, next to Union Square and 5 min. walk to Market street. The only negative is the stiff price for a buffet breakfast. We tryed it once at a price of $25 each and we were not impressed. The breakfast was good and the waiters very nice and attentive, but they had no fresh bread or rolls just stale bagels and toast and very little coldcuts to choose from, but they had bacon, scrambled eggs, sausages and potatoes. To be fair they also had other options that was cheaper. Overall we had a great stay and would highly recommend Grand Hyatt.

Grand Hyatt San Fran is conveniently located one block from union square which has all the premium shopping (Saks, L.V., Rolex, etc.) stores boarding. Within walking distance from China Town, Mall, pickup spot for "BigBus Tour" and fine dining options all over (OneUp located in hotel is a great option). The customer service is very professional and always courteous. The rooms were clean and considerate of late sleepers (I slept in and they still freshened up the room once I left). Although they did not have a pool or hot tub, I would still stay at this hotel over others because of the location and great customer service.

My husband and I were extremely disappointed with our stay at the Grand Hyatt. We are Hyatt Platinum members and are supposed to be given rooms on higher floors, etc. This was not the case. We were put on the 18th floor out of 36. As soon as we got to our room, we knew that something was wrong. We could hear everything outside. And I mean everything, I could hear the cars driving by 18 floors below. We called the front desk and after being on hold for 10 minutes finally spoke to them and they sent up an engineer. His method for dealing with the draft and noise was to slam the fake door/window closed as hard as he could. That was all he could do for us and he left. Later that night when we tried to go to bed, we were awaken because it sounded like there was a rave taking place in our room. I again called the main desk to complain, and once again after being on hold for about 5 minutes, we were told there was nothing that they could do, and that there was a street party 2 blocks away for French Independence Day. The next day we left early in the morning and arrived back in the early afternoon. Once again I could hear everything going on down on the ground level. I called the front desk again, and they finally offered to move our room, really it took 3 calls of complaints to get my room changed. Unfortunately, they moved us to a handicap room. On top of the outside noise issue, the walls in the hotel are paper thin. We could hear talking and vacuuming in rooms around us, which makes me uneasy, because that means people can hear us in our room, as well. Also the maid service comes around to clean rooms at 8:30am. I'm realize we were staying in the business area of San Francisco, but I've never been to any hotel who cleans rooms that early, and I did not appreciate being woken up at 8:30am on my vacation. After the first morning, we always left the do not disturb sign on our door before heading to bed. Honestly, there are just way to many issues with this hotel. I'm sure there are way nicer places to stay in San Francisco, and now I'm wondering if we should consider moving away from the Hyatt brand and bringing our business elsewhere.

Great location. Great hotel. This is a business hotel, not a resort. The rooms are super clean and updated. The staff is service oriented. The location is perfect, especially if you want to go to China Town for an amazing dinner.

Am pleased that we chose to stay in this hotel, having earlier tried the Mandarin Oriental. The Hyatt is better placed, right by Union Square, meaning it is very convenient for shops and for connections to the subway and trams.Our perception of the hotel got off to a great start, thanks to an exceptionally helpful member of staff (thank Yena Choi) who was so personable - even remembering our name/ room number) during our visit. This made us feel very at home, which is unusual in a large, busy hotel like this.The rooms were comfortable, with all we could ask for. The Fitness Centre was more than adequate and appeared rarely used, despite the amazing views from the 32nd floor across the city skyline.Conclusion: Definitely would recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

My wife and I spent 3 nights in San Francisco at Grand Hyatt and thoroughly enjoyed our holiday. Check-in was smooth and we stayed in a suite, with a stunning view of Alcatraz island (view attached). The bar area of the hotel is very nice and modern. The location of the hotel is fantastic, it is easily accessible and no real complaints about the hotel. A very pleasant stay.

We traveled throughout California during the 4th of July week/weekend. We traveled with 2 adults, 2 kids, and a small dog. We stayed 3 days and 2 nights at this location and it was great! Its a great location for Families since Union Square is right across the street. The Powell Street Cable Car is a few blocks down and the shopping is great in this area. The hotel is pet friendly and the staff is very knowledgeable and very friendly. The rooms are adequate, and the beds are small, but comfortable. We stayed on the 28th floor with a view of Union Square. Very nice city view! We traveled with 2 adults, 2 kids, and a small dog. The only downfall to this location is parking. You have the option to pay $33+ if you self park it across the street, or $56 for Valet. Not good options if you are staying at this location with a vehicle.

we arrived without a reservation, got off right at Embarcadero and had no idea where to go, we started walking and just got there, very nice area, close to everything including the cable cars, restaurant and shopping.We first were met by a very rude front desk lady, but then Amy treated us really nice and she gave us an upgrade to a very nice Suite, with a balcony, 2 bathrooms and beautiful living area, it was so nice we actually decided to stay one night in and rent a movie.The guys at the bar ( Carlos and the guys from Mazatlan) were amazing, they were very nice to us, also the concierge ladies.Rates are high, i wish i did my homework before arriving.

Can'r beat the location right in Union Square. Recently renovated with new bar/restaurant on floor 2 and fitness center (that rocked) up on the top floor. Super friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms, big flat screen TV's. This is my new favorite hotel in SF.

The hotel are close to union square shops,restaurants and mall, the rooms are nice and the location suberb,the only but is the cleaness, the rooms should be well prepared,the dust at the lamps and under the furniture should be watched for the manager or the housekeeping,will return

The hotel rooms are great the location is awsome close to union square shops,restaurants and mall,the only but was that the rooms that should be more cleaness,overwall was ok,but the lamps and down the furniture needs some one to watch,will stay again

We stayed at the grand Hyatt over July 4 and it was fabulous! We had an upgrade to a suite on a high floor that had spectacular views and was very quiet( there was a sign that it was a quiet floor. We would definitely stay there again

I recently went on a business trip to San Francisco and brought along my family (4&7 year olds and husband). I was a little concerned ahead of time because SF rooms can be small. Not the case at all here. We had 2 double beds on the 25th floor, and the kids loved looking down at the city and counting the taxis. The room was *very* clean and appeared to be newly remodeled. The beds were super comfortable. The location was great, too - I was able to walk about 10 minutes to the Moscone Center for Semicon. My family was able to walk to Chinatown, a Children's Creativity Museum and Carousel, and had easy access to trolleys/busses/fairies. I sometimes wonder about high costs of hotels in big cities (especially near convention centers) but this was a case where I think the value was worth it. They even had a "free" wi-fi option, which wasn't super fast, but very tolerable. There were also a million places to eat, and the area felt safe day and night (I was out up to ~11PM). Highly recommended hotel!

The best hotel I've stayed at in sfo in many years of visiting moscone center in July. One small gripe about the modern laptop check in islands which just seemed to confuse everyone and slow things down. Otherwise perfect stay.

The Grand Hyatt has a terrific location one block from Union Square. It is walking distance to all Union Square restaurants, the trolley stops, and is very close to China Town. The staff was very courteous and helpful - from teh doorman to the front desk to the concierge. The rooms were very nice and seemingly recently renovated. The beds were comfortable; the rooms had all kinds of techological gadgets (including curtains that opened with the touch of a button); and were equipped with a refrigerator, coffee maker, hair dryer, etc. The concierge gave good recommendations for restaurants.Some negatives included: street noise, even 15 floors up; the bathroom doors hang on a track outside the bathroom wall and slide shut - but leave a 1/2 - 1 inch gap eliminating privacy; and there was mildew in one of the showers.One other significant feature was the discounted rate for a second room to accommodate our children. The adjoining room was $99/night - very nice touch when traveling with several children, and was likely the deciding factor in staying here.Overall, the hotel was a modern, well-located, service oriented hotel that we enjoyed.

I used to work as a consultant before my current job so I have seen many many hotels in my life, most of them good with no big complaints but the experience I had with this hotel was simply amazing. I was very impressed with the service; they were always on top of everything... I traveled with my 2 years old daughter to spend 4th of July in San Francisco and everything was just perfect. They gave her the option to choose a new toy when we were checking in and she really liked that and she got one more toy when were having dinner in the second floor... The location was perfect. I didnâ€™t even need to rent a car, everything was really close and the taxis are not that expensive in the city. The room was very nice and elegant, we got the 24th floor so it had a great view... recommended 100%

We stayed 18 floors up and still heard every siren, car, backing trucks, etc... Nice hotel with great service but very hard to sleep. Getting your car out of Valet took forever also. IF they would sound proof their rooms if might be worth it. Otherwise pick another hotel-for sleep

Refurbished since my last review the hotel is great. Rooms are a decent size with amenities including fridge, coffee making and wifi. The new decoration of the room is a big improvement. Helpful staff and good value plus a great location by Union Square.

We stayed here to break our journey up back to the UK. This hotel was nice and clean and the staff were very helpful. The only thing I would say about this hotel is that being on the front of the hotel was very noisy.

My husband and I were on a SCAL Road trip from San Diego visiting Santa Barbara, Carmel and San Fran. The Grand Hyatt was our final stay for two nights and it was wonderful from check in to check out. We upgraded to the 33rd floor and the view was amazing. The room was very clean, spacious with a comfortable bed and we loved the auto shade and "welcome" lighting. The food was good, friendly service with lots of smiles. Our bartender Phil was attentive and extremely helpful with hints on what to do and how to get around town. Now our 2nd favorite Hyatt (fav is Maui). We had thought about staying at several other nearby hotels and were so glad we stayed at Hyatt. We'll be back.

Spent 6 days with family at a conference in downtown. Everything about the hotel was excellent, in particular the attentiveness of the staff. Rooms above 20th floor have great views. Great fitness center. Next to Union Square and central to everything in town. If I had to find a flaw the breakfast prices are high but there is a Starbucks on either side of the entrance plus a coffee bar in the lobby. Overall I highly recommend this hotel and if you search and plan to visit at the right time you can find a very good rate.

Such a wonderful location for San Fransisco. Hotel room on 11th floor overlooked Union Square. Great sized rooms and bathroom. Good amenities and friendly staff. Would definitely recommend for families couples or singles traveling.

This is an above average hotel in one of the most sought after parts of town. With a little homework, you can get a great rate. And the location can't be beat. Some might like being closer to the water or in a quieter neighborhood and those all have their own appeals. But if you want to be close to good dining, shopping and ease of access to other places, either on foot, by car or public transportation, Union Square can't beat.We were upgraded to a quiet floor and had a view of the Bay from Alcatraz to the TransAmerica Tower. Our room was clean and spacious. We were also at the end of the hall so it was extra quiet. We asked the conceirge for recommendations on several occasions and each time got good advice. I highly recommend this hotel.

I stayed at this hotel june 25 to 28 for an annual conference. I enjoyed my stay tremendously. My room was prepaid by my company so checkin was very smooth. My room was spacious and quite dainty. The entire staff was friendly and cordial at all times. My room was cleaned to my satisfaction on a daily basis. The hotel was centrally located downtown within walking distance of my fav shops- Macys, DSW, to name a few. If you are ever in San Fran stay here!

This property is centrally located, within walking distance to major attractions. All the rooms were recently updated and it appears the entire hotel went through a face lift. The overall decor is more modern, like most other hotels of the same class. Customer service was attentive, very friendly and helpful. My only complaint, if I had to point out one, would be that there are not enough elevators to service the 50+ floors. Sometimes you will have to wait a while for an elevator to arrive.

My room was on the 20th floor overlooking Union Square. A fabulous view of the mountains and the city at night. The walls are a little thin so if you have a rowdy neighbour it may be problematic. I was there for a conference and the hotel was booked; even though I could hear my next door peers, it wasn't disturbing. Get a higher up room to cancel outside noise because I could hear the concerts in Union Square but it was fain from the 20th floor. The room was extremely comfortable and because it was a corner room had a recessed toilet/bath and closet/vanity area which gave the main room even more space. I took a business plan with a king bed which included free breakfast and internet. There is a 'fridge and percolator but no microwave in the room which doesn't matter because there are many great restaurants within walking distance. I walked everywhere including to Chinatown (the one for tourists, not the real one) and down to the harbour (about 45mins). Do take a ride on the ferry. A friend walked all the way to the Golden Gate bridge which would be about 2 hours. The financial district and fabulous high (Gucci, Tiffany's etc.) and medium/low cost shopping (Macy's, Old Navy's, Ross) are all a walk a way. You don't need to hire a taxi for anything but do take the tram just for fun. The room was exceptionally comfortable and the toiletries paraben free which was icing on the cake! A good stay too for couples or family. The buffet breakfast was wonderful and catered for a wide range of tastes including me and my yogurt with pumpkin and sunflower seeds every morning. And freshly brewed green tea! The dinner wasn't so accommodating to us vegetarians but as I said there are many restaurants within walking distance. If you take a bus tour do take the open aired bus and really see the place. I got trapped in a normal bus and missed a lot of the sites having to peer around my seating neighbour or if an attraction was on the other side of the bus. San Francisco is beautiful and the people are warm. It is definitely one of my favourite cities. Hilton to me is huge so that you can get lost (which my friend and I did looking for her room in tower something or the other) and the numerous additions have left it looking like a hodge podge. Grand Hyatt is crisper, cleaner and with friendlier staff.

The hotel is really good, modern, clean, nice location just by union square and by nice boutiques. Our room had also a very nice view as we where on the 18th floor.The only thing we disliked was the thinness of the room door. We didn't get the choice to hear or ignore the other room's door slap late at night (2am) and early in the morning (6am) but maybe it was just our bad educated rooms neighbors.

Went there for 10 days to attend a conference and celebrate my engagement. We asked for a king bed room upon reservation and confirmation. As we got to the hotel we were frustrated to be handeld a 2 beds room. When we first talked to the girl at the check in we were told there was nothing they could do. After a small gilt trip on her conscience we got a king bed room on a higher floor. The view was great. The room a bit small, but very nice, just renovated.Parking is quite expensive (40/night).Doormen do not open the door for you and seem to be payed to chat.Conciergerie did not help, and made a reservation to a regular restaurant when we asked for help to make a reservation in a fancy one.There is free wifi.And you can not forget the LOCATION. It is great!!!

We were on the 43rd floor and had such an amazing view of the harbour I couldn't believe it. I specifically asked for a high room with a nice view as we were celebrating my husbands 50th birthday but never expected anything so fabulous. The view of the fog moving in was amazing. The complimentary bottle of wine was also such a lovely surprise and enjoyable. Great location with loads of restaurants and shops on the door step. Consierge was extremely helpful in advance of my stay recommending restaurants and things to do. The bar area was average.

Nice clean hotel and the staff were fine but we didnt have any issues. The area is great if you fancy shopping in macys or if your into your brands. The hotel currently does not have a gift shop to buy drinks etc and the meals in the hotel are very expensive. I wouldnt reccomend this area and would advise to stay in the fisherman wharf area for going out etc.

We lucked out picking the Grand Hyatt. We'd never been to San Francisco before, but this hotel turned out to be a perfect site-seeing "base camp." We didn't rent a car and were able to easily walk the few short blocks from the BART. Then we were able to walk all over. Chinatown was right around the corner, catching a Hop On/Hop Off tour bus was only a block or two down, as was catching the buses and trolley cars. The concierge was helpful getting us last-minute tickets to Alcatraz (and advising us to book while we had a chance, as the tours sell out fast. If we'd waited until the next morning we wouldn't have gotten tickets. And we were lucky period we were at the end of busy season because Alcatraz sells out weeks in advance, which we didn't know.) It was a long walk, but doable, to Fisherman's Wharf. We had a blast walking all over in fact, and the hotel proved the perfect starting point for all of our adventures each day. Plus, the rooms were spacious and the bathrooms pristine. Oh, and our room came with the buffet upstairs every morning, which was pretty decent from a choice/selection standpoint and offered excellent views of the city.

We just returned from a trip to San Francisco and we could not have been happier with our stay at the Grand Hyatt. Clean, modern decor, great location, concierge was very helpful, staff was attentive all the way around. We were celebrating our anniversary and arrived to find complimentary wine in our room. Just can not say enough good things about this hotel.

We stayed as a family of 5 (baby and 2 small kids) in a double queen room for a week whilst my husband was at a conference. There are a lot of challenges involved in that especially without a kitchen or laundry but the hotel staff were so helpful and accommodating and the location so good that it made thestay enjoyable. Particular mention to the awesome girls on the breakfast coffee cart in the lobby who my girls "adopted" and who are just lovely. Great coffee and food as well. There is a laundromat just up the road as well if you find yourself in the same boat as me!

My wife and I recenly returned from a two night stay at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Having never been to the city we were looking for something centrally located. The Hyatt just off Union Square was perfect. We had a 10-15 walk to most everything we wanted to do.The service at the hotel was excellent! From check-in to check-out the staff went over and above to meet and exceed our needs. The hotel was recently renovated and it shows. From the high tech front desk to the electronic window shades in the rooms, there were nice touches everywhere. The rooms were very modern, clean and we had a great view of the city from the 20th floor.I would not hesitate to recommend this property to any of my friends or colleagues.

We just returned from a 4 night stay at this wonderful hotel. The check-in and check-out process was very efficient and the staff was very professional. We loved the modern, clean room with very comfortable beds. A big plus for me was having a digital room thermostat that worked great and an electronic privacy curtain that made the room very dark for sleeping. The hotel location was perfect to see many sites and near the cheap public transportation stops. There are many terrific stores and restaurants within walking distance and the concierge desk was so very helpful in making suggestions and also reservations for you. We were very happy with the Grand Hyatt!!

The service was great. The moment our cab from the airport pulled up, employees were opening doors and assisting with luggage. Check in was a breeze, and even though our room wasn't quite ready yet, it only took about 20 minutes to get it ready. Everyone that we came in contact with was friendly and professional. We were on the 9th floor, so we could hear a little bit of traffic noise, but not enough to keep us up at night or disturb us in any way. The rooms were super clean, very comfy. The staff will help you out with anything you may have forgotten. The fitness center was very nice, as compared to other hotel fitness centers, and the view from the equipment can't be beat. Cable cars were right around the corner, as well as stores and restaurants. I was impressed. When we return to San Francisco, we will definitely stay here again.

My daughter and I just returned from a 3 night stay at this lovely hotel. From the moment we walked in, we were treated with professionalism and warmth. Really appreciate the upgrade to a higher floor with nice view. We were on a "quiet" floor which was perfect for us. The room was modern, extremely clean and had very comfy beds!! We made use of club for breakfast 1 morning and appetizers and wine a couple of evenings. Nice selections and could actually make a light meal from it. And view and atmosphere were great!The location was perfect for seeing the city. We had muni passes and public transit easy to obtain. Walking distance to many places.Had breakfast twice in One Up. Fantastic buffet and great service...thanks Danny!I wish I could remember the name of the lady who checked us in...maybe Yena? ... A special thanks to her also.I researched many, many hotels (with reservations at several) before deciding on this one...I was very happy with this choice!!

I've stayed here several times for business and it provides very consistent quality with free wifi and a wonderful location right off Union Square and on the edge of Chinatown. It is my first choice. The lobby is small, and they recently converted the top floor restaurant/bar to conference space. Too bad -- the views of the city were amazing.

The remodel was a success. Location was great for site seeing and shopping. You will enjoy your stay. The staff was helpful and polite. Love this place. A short walk to Union square and the cable cars. Downtown rental cars are just blocks away. Some great restaurants are a short walk away.

The Grand Hyatt is in a great location just off Union Square. The renovation is good and although the rooms are small by Asian Grand Hyatt standards, the fit out was very nice. The room just seemed to work, bed very comfortable and Club good. The only downside is that all rooms have sliding opening doors to outside (open 3 inches and no balcony) that's fine except the seal between the doors is long gone and so the outside noise is very noticeable. After all, you are in the middle of a city. We asked for it to be repaired but that didnt occur. The bar and bistro on Upper floor was very nice too as was the service from the concierge.

This hotel is in a great location, however the staff have a lot to learn about service. We have travelled a lot, and this w the worst service we had received in America. This hotel could be a really great hotel, should the service be improved. I would ow ever stay here again.

It was our first trip to San Francisco and before arriving to this hotel we stayed one night at Hyatt in Fisherman's Wharf because Grand Hyatt was fully booked. Both of the hotels were great but the staff at Grand Hyatt was not so friendly and accommodating. I can't say that they were rude or unhelpful, but they just didn't try to go an extra mile to make our stay more pleasant. Since the hotel is so big and there are so many guests, it's perfectly understandable. But I personally prefer more boutique-style hotels where you feel more like at home. This hotel is great but you will always feel like a part of a big depersonalized touristic conveyor.Apart from that I can't complain much. The location is amazing. Rooms have been recently renovated and look great. Try to get a room at the top floors since the views on the city are amazing

Me and my sister stayed here in May. First off let me start by saying that San Francisco is my favorite city. We have visited 4 times and stayed at different hotels each time. We have stayed in different locations each time also. While non of the hotels were bad (they all were good in their own way) none of them were perfect... meaning while one might have a great location, the view wasn't that great ... or maybe the hotel was wonderful but the location wasn't great... you get my meaning. Well let me just say the Grand Hyatt met all of out expectations and then some. From the moment we stepped into the newly renovated lobby (it is a little different than most lobbies (the computers are just on small desks not behind one massive long counter).. but that is just a little strange ..not bad or good just different, until we checked out everything was great. Our room was beautiful with the best view of the bay, Alcatraz and Coit Tower, . Union Square is just about 1/2 block away, so there are many restaurants (Sears Fine Foods was a good one) and shopping galore right outside the door. The tours that the concierge recommended left right at union square , we bought our tickets at the hotel. We took the double decker bus hop on hop off for 2 days and that was our mode of transportation. The concierge was wonderful in arranging a rental car for us (they even dropped it at the hotel) and we sat at the bar one night after a day of sight seeing which was great.... good drinks and great flat bread pizza. Fisherman's wharf and Pier 39 are not close but again the tours takes you right there, but I wouldn't want to stay near there anyway it is very touristy .......so I loved going there and having a bread bowl but not staying there. This hotel isn't cheap (but what hotel worth anything in San Fran is....) but it was worth the money. Trust me when I tell you that you will love everything about it.

I stayed here in September of 2012 for a business conference. The city was packed but the hotel was well prepared and I had no problem checking in. Rooms were nicely appointed and the service was great. I had issues with my light one night and someone was there within 10 minutes to fix it. Perfect for a business trip and I would stay here for pleasure as well.

Really enjoyed my stay last week here. City View rooms are well worth it. The location is within an easy walk to China town, Union Square and public transport. Web checkin and checkout made life a lot easier. Bed would be one of the most comfortable I have stayed at over all my years in nice hotels for business and pleasure. Free wifi was a bonus.

The newly renovated rooms here are very pleasant! An updated version of 70's Danish modern that really works. The lobby lounge is delightful. Only downside is the dim check-in area. Grateful for the free Wi-Fi, and the water dispenser (although the one on our floor was continually empty).

This recently upgraded hotel is really lovely. Excellent staff, easy check-in/check-out. Rooms are comfortable. One-cup coffee maker offers paper cups but I could use my own coffee (wrap in my own filter) in the plastic tray, works great. Huge sink is odd, seems like an invitation to do hand laundry. A sign promises that towels and sheets will be changed only on demand to protect the environment, but, like most hotels, there are no towel racks and even if you hang up towels they are changed. Excellent reading light on each side of the bed.

beautifully renovated rooms and hotel in general. Free internet in the rooms and throughout the property appreciated. Paid the $50/d rate extra to access the club lounge and found it worth it. lovely view from the 32nd floor, helpful staff, terrific breakfast (one hot choice, pastries, yogurt, fruit, oatmeal, etc.), heavy hors d'oeuvres, and light desserts. There's always fruit, cookies, sodas, coffee, tea available. Nice quiet area to get work done. Gym is small (4 running machines and 4 stairmasters get busy) but view is great (35th floor). would readily recommend the hotel.

This hotel is fantastic. Great location, gorgeous rooms, excellent staff. We are currently staying in an Executive Suite and it is so comfortable. The two room layout makes you feel like you are in your own apartment in the city. The bed is very comfortable and the linens are of excellent quality. Views are to die for. Really, though, the crown jewel of this hotel is the customer service. The staff here really gets it. They remember your name. They are extremely kind. They smile and you really feel that they mean it. This is the mark of an excellent hotel, and not something that you can buy. It's hard to find good customer service these days. If you are craving VIP treatment by a well trained staff this is the place to stay!

The room is very clean and well maintained. Hotel is very conveniently located and close to union square. Loved the hotel had the facility of having a water dispenser on every floor of the hotel. It makes getting water easy. Had enjoyed my stay.

The hotel and rooms are nicely upgraded and clean. The bed was amazing! The staff was very friendly and helpful. We took the bus at the corner many times to different locations. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

More like 4.5 stars (or circles).This is a great location right at Union Square. Perfect for shopping and walking over to Chinatown. Here's my full breakdown:LOBBY: beautiful lobby with a fireplace towards the back. The front desk is more like multiple desks, which is nice and gives a personal and private feel. I like their soft mint candy available for the taking too. ROOMS: nice clean rooms, beautifully decorated, with a modern feel. Thin walls though as you can hear folks out in the hallway. Bed is fine, nothing special. Views depend on what side you're on (ask for the bay view). And the lower levels are noisier, so we asked for higher floor. The weekend we stayed was windy, and they were kind to notify us of potential noise and that it is normal. Rooms are spacious enough and a good closet too. Plenty of outlets to plug your electronics too.BATHROOM: Good counter space and the sink is a giant bowl/tub which I thought looked great (now I want one at home). Shower was fine with good pressure, amenities were fine, and as usual with the Hyatt you get toothpaste too. Towels were standard white towels, nothing exciting. The door (a slider door), although very pretty with the frosted glass (at least I think it was glass, maybe not, didn't notice), didn't keep the light in. So basically if someone goes to the bathroom in the middle of the night, goes in and slides the door shut, you will still definitely take notice because the light shines through the frosted door. There is no fan in the bathroom either.PARKING: Ugh. The problem with this location is that parking is horrible!! It is not the hotel's fault, it's just the way of the location. However, I will say that we were given conflicting information about valet/self-park/self-valet. Whatever it is, you're paying a lot for parking at any hotel in this area (actually this one was reasonable compared to others). With tax, we paid about $53?? a day for valet, plus tips each time. Our car rental was cheaper than that.SERVICE: Everyone was friendly from the bellmen, front desk, maintenance and housekeeping. FITNESS CENTER: I must say this fitness center was very nice for a hotel, probably one of the better ones that I've seen! Excellent views from the 35th floor and quite a few machines available too. FOOD: I actually never ate in here. So many food options in this city! OVERALL: Very pleased with the hotel and would definitely stay here again!!

My husband and I were here for a conference he had so were automatically booked into this hotel. I can assure you I would not have found a better one had I searched on my own! The location is just perfect -- right at Union Square. Union Square is a destination in itself with a large plaza often filled with artists and performers. On a sunny day you can while away the afternoon at the Square whilst enjoying Italian coffee and light fare from the bistro right on the plaza. If you enjoy shopping, every major store you've ever heard of is within 2 blocks of this location. Bring an extra suitcase for all your great finds! There are 96 Starbucks in this city so you'll never be more than a block or two from one. However, for even better coffee, find the Blue Bottle coffee bar. Transportation to anywhere in the city is easy from this location -- the doubledecker buses, street cars, and cable cars all stop within a block or two. One tip is if you want to take the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf, do not go down to the starting point at Market where the que is an hour or so long. Instead, wait just by the plaza in front of the Westin St. Francis, and you'll get on much quicker from that stop!So back to the Grand Hyatt -- it has undergone a MAJOR renovation is you would think you are in a brand new hotel. The room are very clean with plenty of space. The beds are out of this world...likely the most comfy hotel bed we've ever slept in!! The linens are also very nice. The housekeeping staff was delightful and worked hard to keep our room spotless.The downsides to the hotel were this. Nothing major, but...we were on the 10th floor and the outside noise was bothersome. If you aren't used to noise, request a higher floor. The views are obviously much nicer on higher floors as well. My biggest complaint (again, minor) was that in modernizing the hotel they made the lobby very futuristic in that it is very sterile and lacking in character. So the initial impression of the hotel is not a warm one. Contrast this with the glorious lobbies of other hotels in the area that are destinatons in themselves. HOWEVER, don't judge a hotel by the lobby...I can assure you the guestrooms are incredibly nicer here at the Grand Hyatt than at any of the hotels with opulent lobbies. I would easily choose this hotel on future visits to San Francisco...it was just wonderful. If I could make a recommendation to the hotel staff, it is this...the check-in process, while very modernized, did not feel at all welcoming. We were unsure if we were to go to the computers and do a self check-in, or exactly what to do. There is just something very nice about a warm welcome to a hotel, and we didn't get this. Many of your guests probably have arrived after a long day of travel and a warm smile and "Welcome to San Francisco" would have gone a long way in giving us a better initial impression of the Grand Hyatt.So look no further in choosing your hotel in San Francisco. I can't wait to come back here!

We stayed for 3 nights at the start and 2 nights at the end of our visit to California. Had a room on 31st floor at the beginning with a great view of the city, could see the Chinatown gateway. Room was very quiet and even on our return when we were on the 12th floor it wasn't noisy. The rooms were modern and clean with comfy bed. Location was excellent, we could walk to most places, or were close to transport. We were surrounded by many shops and restaurants. Best thing about the hotel was the staff, especially the concierge. We got so many great tips on places to go and eat. It was great to know we were coming back here for our final 2 nights. Highly recommend

We had a Suite with an absolutely amazing view of the SanFran skyscrapers! The room was newly refurbished and everything was clean and very nice. We had a strange sound coming out of the aircon one day and the staff were at our room within minutes to fix the problem, so the sound was gone once we raturned to our room later this day. Only strange thing was that we had to pay for the alcoholic beverages in the grand club. Never had this anywhere else before. Staff told us that they must charge a small amount by law, because it's forbidden in CA to give away alcohol for free. The location is also very good! Just a few minutes walk to Chinatown and the BigBur Tour stops just next to the hotel. All important shopping is in this area and even the cable car stops right behind the hotel. All in all a very good experience!

We stayed at this beautiful hotel in April this year. We were so impressed with the level of luxury in their standard room. So modern and a fabulous view. Staff were so friendly and accommodating of our needs. In a fantastic location surrounded by great shops.

A modern, sophisticated property with possibly and best location for visitors in downtown San Francisco. Smartly renovated, the rooms have extremely comforable beds, great electronic connections, bath appointments and auto shades which really darken the room. Staff is top notch with possibly the finest concierge staff in the business. Lower rooms do encounter street noise but there are 35 floors to choose from so ask for a higher floor if noise bothers you. Only item lacking, a comfortable chair in the room (or in the ultra sleek lobby for that matter). Many restaurants of all grades and prices nearby if you want to avoid typically expensive hotel fare. The food is good at the hotel, however.

The location and service at Grand Hyatt are awesome. I have absolutely nothing to complain about our room either: it was spacious, modern, nice and clean (I believe it has been recently updated). There are tons of restaurants, stores and places to go around the hotel and when we needed transportation to explore the city it was a breeze to find an option (i.e. bus lines and cable cars).

We stayed four nights at the Grand Hyatt for our first trip to San Fran. The rooms were what you would expect...updated, clean and spacious. Bed was very comfortable and bathroom was super clean and you had plenty of room for one person. There was only one sink so you couldn't have more person in there at one time. TV was awesome with all high def channels and you could plug in other devices. By far and away the best part of the hotel is the location. You are less than a 5 minute walk to all of the train and bus stations (as well as cable car starting points). This is key because it is not necessarily a walking city because of the hills. Taxi's were reasonable but it adds up quick. There was the best shopping in the city surrounding the hotel and a number of restaurants (some were very reasonable). We were a little disappointed with our view because we were only 1/3 of the way up after requesting in advance a higher room but it was a busy weekend. The lobby is a little odd in that you don't have much of one. Breakfast was included one night of our stay and it was really good but would have been very expensive. But with the choices around the hotel, not a big deal. Would definitely stay at the hotel again.

Located just one block from Union Square, very central to walk everywhere or catch public transport. We were there with my elderly mother and I was concerned that the location of the hotel was too high up on the hill but that was not the case. My room was a corner room and I found both the room and bathroom to be on the small side.

We had booked the accommodations by using points, and the Hyatt offered us an upgrade for a small amount of money each night. It was worth it! The room had a great city view, a large living room, bedroom and 2 BATHS! The room was recently updated and it was pretty cool. It had automatic shades in both rooms and the bathrooms were very upscale. One thing to know, the hotel makes a great deal of noise when it is windy. It sounds like an old house and can be a bit daunting being on the 18th floor. (It's because it is built to weather earthquakes)We had access to the concierge level, which is on the 32nd floor. What a view! We had drinks there on a few nights (reasonable prices - you serve yourself) and snacks. We also went up there for continental breakfast (included) and the layout was excellent. One tip though - get there early on the weekend or you might not even get a table! One day we had to bring our small plates back to our room which was annoying, but it happens. The service from the staff was superb, and we truly enjoyed our visit to this hotel.

I had a great time at the Grand Hyatt. The rooms were recently renewed, nice and clean. They have a well appointed bar with live music, which is pretty cool. Prices are not bad during the happy hour.The location couldn't be better, steps from shopping, restaurants, bars and Chinatown. Bus lines and cable cars to everywhere in the city run from close by, metro station a couple of blocks away and a Starbucks for your morning coffee just across the street. So you can't do better than that :).

No complaints! Excellent location, cleanness, great room service, wonderful view of the city. I've stayed at Grand Hayatt twice and it really was worth it. One Up Restaurant services a good breakfast. Teh menu colud be a bit more varied, but it was OK.

We arrived for a 3 night stay in early May. This hotel is a short, 10 min walk from the Powell Street BART station if you decide to catch a train from the airport. We were greeted by friendly staff on arrival and the check in process was fast and efficient. Our room was spacious, modern and pristine and we were able to sleep in peace on the comfortable king size bed with no street noise noticeable from the 14th floor. The hotel is located in Union square so there are plenty of options for eating out, shopping and close to the SF tram cars if you plan on sightseeing. The cost was quite cheap and would be hard to beat from other hotels in the area. Also, If you plan on seeing the major sights in the city I would recommended the "Hop on / Hop Off tour" bus company as there is a stop just around the corner from the hotel in Union Square. We can't wait to stay at this hotel again. Thanks for a fantastic experience.

The hotel is just one block from Union Square. All the staff is helpful, the breakfast is really delicious. Room 1108 is large, clean, and very comfortable and the office facilities are available inside the room. I strongly recommend!!

Arrived here on a Saturday and stayed until Wed. AM. It was a short walk from the Powell Street Bart! Check in was smooth. I had requested an upgrade to a bay view which was well worth the 25.00 extra per night! I had a view of the COIT tower and Telegraph Hill and the Bay! I was on the quiet floor on the 28 th floor. It was indeed quiet and I did sleep well. Room service as expected was pricey but nice and welcome after a long flight. The bonus was that I could enjoy it with my view of the Bay. The hidden gem was the coffee bar across from the concierge desk. It was quicker and less expensive than the Starbucks across the street.
