This is a tastefully designed property with gas fireplace in the lobby and shelves with books and potted plants. It gave one the feeling they were in a family room or a den. I would definitely stay again.

I stayed 5 nights at Grand Hyatt and I felt really good. Big hotel, totally renewed and perfect for business but also for leisure. A lot of times is fully booked so its better if u reserve a room in advance. The hotel staff is really kind and helpful. Its my fav choice for my company trip in SF. Keep going!

Stayed in 2 adjoining rm w family, but as most connecting rooms, the other room has a 2 double beds and the other a king size bed, but since we needed 2 beds in each, they gladly provided us a roll away bed, which was free, so we get to be together during our stay.The service was impeccable, we needed to heat our food to go and they sent us a microwave,, we needed some tools to fix our luggage which got damaged, they sent us a handyman to help us, we requested for a late check out, they gave us till 3 pm for both rooms instead of 1, what a great service ! Will definitely be back next time.

This hotel has a modern decoration in the lobby and rooms. Spacious room, the beds were very comfortable, and the bathroom was very nice. Staff was variable... check-in very confusing due to lots of people, but check-out was easy and got a 2pm late check-out. Breakfast was good, but the room was small. The location of this hotel is great. Very close to Union Square, with all the shoppings and restaurants nearby. I could go walking to Convention Center and to the other shopping centers. Cable car stop is 2 blocks away and Chinatown 2-3 blocks away. There was a Starbucks in front of the hotel, which was very helpful, since the frigobar in the room was empty and there is no bar on the lobby (the bar is located on mezzanine). Wireless internet was complimentary. I would certainly stay in this hotel again.

I've stayed at this hotel a lot. . . even while it was being rennovated and some rooms /floors were completely closed, I stayed here. Funny thing is they never seem to know I've been there before unlike other hotels I frequent so I always get the intro to the property speech. The new check in area I hate because it's a three pointed star shaped desk which offers little privacy and there is not Platinum or Diamond check-in counter which is a bit annoying given my loyalty to Hyatt. I've noticed a similar trend at Marriott's recently. The other day I waited ten minutes to get checked-in . . .annoying for a frequent Hyatt guest.Anyway, the rooms are nice but the furnishings all look like they were sourced from China during the recent re-do . . . sort of a shame when Hyatt is an American company. I guess I shouldn't care but although the furnishings look modern they look somewhat cheap. The internet service is particularly slow here so I don't recommend paying for that and the water pressure out of the showers is the worst. You're probably wondering why I return again and again. The staff is generally very nice even though they seem to have no way of knowing I've been there countless times. The hotel is centrally located and convenient to many things. My bed is always clean and my sleep is quiet. On a few occasions, I've had to ask them to bleach the red mold on the grout in the floor but they readily and happily accommodate.

Stayed 3 nights in the hotel, overall experience was fantastic, everything is a stone throw from the hotel. Staff were fabulous and very helpful, from the jenator to the reception tests to their management. Will diffenetly stay there in my next trip to SF.

We loved this hotel for our long weekend get away!! The location was the best and so convenient to everything we wanted to see-chinatown, ferry bldg., shopping, cable car and great restaurants. The hotel had cookie decorating for the kids and our lil one loved it. All of the employees were very friendly and helpful. The concierge could use a little improvement. We will be coming back to the Grand Hyatt the next time we visit SF-can't wait for the comfy beds and the comfortable yet modern decor in the room and in the lobby.

Here's my honest review...Pros:-Updated/Trendy hotel in the middle of pretty much every shopping facility you could imagine-Tons of restaurants within close distance-Excellent Housekeeping-Great city views (depending on your room)-Great Showers-Tasty breakfast (only breakfast)-Decent priceCon's:-Inconsiderate staff-The Valet representative didn't want to be bothered when us when we advised we would self-valet. Self valet is $32/day, hotel valet is $50/day, the self valet parking lot is literally right across the street, but GH has to give you a ticket for the $32/day rate...When I advised the valet that I would self-valet, he skipped past and ignored my vehicle without giving us a ticket-so I had to leave my car in an illegal parking space to search for someone to give me a voucher-Rooms are updated, but very small (inadequate cabinet/drawer space)-We booked a King room, upon arriving they advised us that we were booked for a double queen-luckily we had our reservation confirmation handy-so they quickly changed our room. It may seem petty, but this mistake frustrated me the most, because it was apparent they wanted to bump us to a less desirable room, although our reservations noted our stay as a "5th Anniversary celebration".-Checkout was 12noon, we requested late checkout due to our flight departing from SFO at 11pm, they were only willing to extend our checkout to 1pm...BUT HERE'S THE KICKER***A gentlemen behind us on line requested 3pm checkout, and his wish was granted...WTH???-As previously stated, the "One-Up" bar/lounge/restaurant serves a great breakfast-but that's it. My wife and I went for cocktails during the evening, only to find that our drinks were watered down. I opted for a Downtown Manhattan which bore a taste resembling a two-day old soda float with a hint of syrup...But who knows, maybe we caught them on an off night. Overall, this hotel gets two stars from me...check some of my other reviews and you'll see that I'm not a picky person. I've stayed at tons of GH's before, and this is the second one to disappoint me. Grand Hyatt's new business model appears to reflect Toyota's Lean Efficiency Process Method...But G.H forgot one major factor-They're dealing with people, not cars...

Stayed for 9 nights April 2013 for conference in hotel. Had upper floor room with view. The room renovations are great - sophisticated but not intimidating. I slept better than at home. I found all staff very friendly helpful if a bit old fashioned. The concierge was very knowledgeable. Hotel conference facilities proved OK but are a bit claustrophobic for long conferences. Top floor entertaining area is spectacular. THE LOCATION IS AMAZING. The best city shopping location I have been to in North America. Close to public transport. Great for walking to waterfront, china town, museums, stadium.

I was really delighted to have chosen this hotel to stay in on my way back to Auckland. Being a solo traveller for the first time it was important to have a safe, modern and clean hotel close to shops and restaurants and transport. This hotel ticked all the boxes and more. Recently refurbished, the room was super comfortable and the bathroom was beautiful. Free internet was available at the time I was there and it was very much appreciated. The hotel doesn't have a check in desk system, rather computer kiosk/desks manned by the reception staff. This was surprisingly easy to use and the staff were extremely polite and accommodating. As I was on my own I was given a lovely room on a great floor that was a designated quiet zone. They also have a hotel car to take you to the airport for not much more than a taxi. Wonderful. Perhaps the only things that let it down, and they are not not a big things, were the restaurant and that there was only a coffee maker in the room. There are travellers who like to make drinks other than coffee and a jug would have been appreciated. While the meals were in the restaurant ok they lacked a certain flair in flavour and choice. I didn't get a chance to try the bar but it looked great. Would I stay here again? Most Certainly! For the price I paid it was infinitely superior to a similar hotel literally around the corner. Well done Grand Hyatt.

My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt SF for seven nights and had a King Bay View room on the 25th floor. The view from the wall of windows was spectacular (tip of Alcatraz, Coit tower)!I had used the web check in, so our check in was very efficient, and the bellman brought our luggage up to the room with us. He showed us the features of the room and got our luggage set up on stands - things that used to be common, but we find are lacking in many hotels today. The location of the hotel is very good, one half block up from Union Square, in easy walking distance from high end shopping, restaurants, tours, and cable cars and buses. We had not visited San Francisco before, so we had many questions, and the concierge team was outstanding! From maps, to helping us get reservations, to helping us plan our days, the men and women were uniformly gracious and friendly. There is a small coffee shop set up in the lobby in the mornings, with an array of coffees, baked goods, fruit, and breakfast sandwiches. The room itself was furnished well, including a bookshelf with 3 books on it. The room and bathroom were very clean and well designed. The housekeeping staff was also great - on our last day I forgot my ipod that was charging in the dressing area. As soon as we realized it, my husband and I returned ( about 1 hour later), and the ipod and charger had already been bagged and taken to security. Our stay here was a delight from start to finish, and we will certainly stay here when we return.

I stayed at this hotel to attend a conference and got the conference rate, which was hight but not by San Francisco standards. The rooms were large clean and modern, with sleep modern furnishings. I loved the electronically controlled room-darkening shade. My room was very quiet (even though it was an only the 4th floor) but my travel-mate's room was noisy. The bed was comfortable. Although they did not advertise free in-room wifi they did have it, and when I had trouble connecting in the middle of my week there they connected me with an IT person who fixed the problem quickly. The thing I most appreciated was a REAL refrigerator with nothing in it, great for storing one's own beverages, fruit, yogurt, what-have-you. The location was very central, near public transportation and within walking distance of the Moscone Convention Center. Yes there were beggars around, but this is true all over SF, especially in the tourist areas. The bed was very comfortable and the staff friendly and accommodating. The shower had good water pressure at all times.

I've been on many hotels for business this has got to be the better ones I've stayed in. I've stayed in many Hyatts and this one is better than most. It's been recently renovated and it shows. I had an upgraded room with a city view. The room boasted an awesome view with electronic shades and sliding panels. Everything looked and seemed relatively new. Room was very nice. Wifi internet was stable, reliable and fast. TV channels were actually in HD and not stretched.My only gripe with the room was the shower fixture and the water pressure. I don't know if the shower fixture was chosen based on being eco-friendly (this is San Francisco after all...) but the water flow pressure was ridiculously low. Granted I was on a high floor, but still it's just not powerful at all. It was a shower head wand that you could pull down, but when you turn it upside down and spray it upwards it goes maybe 2 inches tops (to give you an idea of how low the water pressure is). That coupled when you attach it to the wall, the weak stream of water forces you to stand close to the front of the shower. They definitely need to switch out those shower fixtures with something different. if you're going to have a low flow showerhead at least have it protrude further from the wall or make it a large rain shower head from the middle of the shower, not from the wall.I don't know if it was just my room that had the problem with the shower. Overall, the hotel boasts nice rooms and great ammenities. The gripe with the shower is not enough to not make me stay here again. It's close to everything, shopping, food, public transportation. Starbucks right outside. Self-assisted parking (you drive the car to the garage they park it for you / bring it back to you) costs $36 a night with in / out priviliges. For the price you pay for the rooms you'd expect high quality which you do get, I'm rating it overall a very good because the bathroom shower sucks. If the shower was better I'd give it an excellent rating.

Having stayed in Grand Hyatts in Hong Kong, Bali, etc I was expecting something rather grander! This one is very ordinary. Rooms OK but not spectacular, breakfast OK but not fantastic. Best thing was the location.

After about 13 hours of trans-Pacific flight, my hubby and I were welcomed with a free room upgrade that had the Union Square for our view. Nice touch for these weary but excited travelers. I would have given it 5-stars if the internet had a fast connection and was for free - a small thing to ask but a necessity for business travelers like my husband.

The best loction and nice rooms size. Just one block of union square! The staff are very helpful. The concierge help me to book all restaurants and activities. Very easy to checked in and checked out.

The Grand Hyatt is in an excellent position next to Union Sq and next to public transport connections. The food is fantastic and it has a good bar to have a drink in either before going out in the evening or to finish the day off. The staff at the Grand Hyatt and rweally helped us out when we needed anything which is more than I can say for Virgin Holidays.

Lovely Hotel and great stay. We went to celebrate my daughters high school graduation. Everything was absolutely perfect. The room was beautiful, clean and very quiet considering the hotel was fully booked. The beds were amazing, like sleeping on a cloud! Steve got us checked in and he was great. Lyle helped us on several occasions and he was so kind and helpful too.We will definitely be returning!

This is a nice very modern hotel. You do need to watch where you stay at in San Francisco and this hotel is in a good location. If you are in the city for pleasure this hotel is right around the corner from the where Union Square. This is where the Double Decker bus tours pick up from. It is very convenient. It is also walking distance to the big indoor mall, I forget the name. The rooms were very clean and had enough room compared to some of the other hotels I have stayed in big cities. Some friends that were in town were staying at the Hilton and Wyndham and this hotel was way nicer than both of them. The staff was also very nice. We had one small problem in the room and they arrived almost immediately after we called to resolve the problem. I would suggest this hotel if you are visiting the city for the first time.

Me and my then-girlfriend stayed at the Grand Hyatt in the beginning of May. I called the hotel a few days before our arrival and informed them that I plan on proposing to my girlfriend in the room as soon as we got our room and requested to have a bottle of champagne and some chocolate dipped strawberries in the room upon arrival. The hotel was glad to assist and even set us up in a room with an amazing view of the bay. Rooms were very clean and spacious, staff was very friendly and location was great. And to top it all off the champagne and strawberries were complimentary. Many thanks to the staff at Grand Hyatt for making this special trip even more special

I stayed at Grand Hyatt for a last night before departing back home. In a nut shell: You get what you can expect, and even a little more. Very friendly reception, modern & recently renovated rooms and a good view if you ask for a higher floor. I really would like to highlight the recently renovated rooms, the are quite nice in comparison to some of the more dusty places in SF. On a side note: The rooms seem to be a bit smaller then other hotels in the US, I didn't mind.

Booked this as part of a package for a weeklong vacation. Had a bay view and it was great! Could see Alcatraz and the Bay....very nice. Room was a good size (king bed) and plenty of room. Entire staff was friendly and did a great job as well! Only real critique (and this is being picky) is the room could have had a better cleaning. The cleaning it had was more of a quick wipe down instead of a good detailed cleaning between occupants (dust under lamps, hair on bathroom floor, etc). Not a deal breaker, but kept it from being a 5 star rating for us.

I couldn't have been happier with my stay at the Hyatt. It underwent a complete face lift in the last year and they did a great job. Cool and hip but totally comfortable. Rates are in line with most hotels in the area. Room was great with multilayer window treatments that you can control bedside. Fabulous bathroom mirror and lighting. Breathtaking view from the fitness center on the 35 th floor and the bar was a totally comfortable place to hang out even though I was traveling alone. They had an adorable singer in the bar and the food was delicious and not ridiculously priced. The hotel is conveniently located to shopping nd transit. I will stay again.

The location is excellent, close to main shopping, Chinatown etc.Great views from the rooms.Not easy access by car - parking in front almost impossible, assisted parking around the block for 36 USD per 24 hours.Front desk staff very friendly and efficient.Design of property very poor - who would use rough granite in the hallways which creates a hell of a noise if someone is pulling any pice of luggage to the elevators. - room door had a gap of 1.5 inches!! towards the hallway - one could hear every word from  hallways.- our room had a connecting door to the room next door - they could have left the door - this is  an insult to any guest staying - we had a family with a child next door - impossible to sleep,  it felt like they were staying in our room.- bathroom faucet - which champion did design this? Impossible to rinse your hands.Overall a disappointing experience.

This hotel is located right next to Union Square Park. A great spot for locals and tourists alike. You can enjoy a coffee or wine/beer with equal enjoyment. You are in the center of SF shopping. As for the hotel, I do not believe you could find a nicer room for the money in this city. Unbelievable for the price. The bar and restaurant are nice. The concierge very helpful. Other than two of the bellmen who seemed oblivious, the staff was top notch (two of the other bellmen/doorman were the best). You will not be disapointed.

If you are looking for a well situated business hotel in the center of San Franciso, the Grand Hyatt is a very good option.Located around the corner of Union Square, you will find the most important attractions of San Francisco on short distance. Shopping facilities, China Town, even the financial district is not that far away. The harbor and Fishermanâ€™s Wharf is a little further away but is even in walking distance for an average trained person.The rooms are very nice, spacious and very clean. Of course the higher the floor on which your is situated, the nicer the view you will have over San Francisco. Nice about the rooms in Grand Hyatt is you can leave your toothpaste at home as this is taken care of by the hotel.But in general, good value for money.

The property itself is nice and in a great location, but getting a good sleep is also very nice on vacation. All we heard were the people next to us (even using the bathroom), people in the halls at all hours, and doors slamming. Room was very average (small). Bathroom was a little awkward. Basically had to reach over the toilet to turn on the shower. The sink looked like a mini bathtub and took up the whole counter top. This wasn't very convenient for two women trying to get ready in the morning. The mini fridge only keep items lukewarm. Beds were not very comfortable. Did not get much sleep due to all the noise.

This hotel is in a great location, within a short walk of Union Square. The rooms, which boast great views, are generous in size, well fitted out, and very clean. Service is consistently excellent throughout the hotel.The menu in the hotel restaurant is somewhat limited, but there are plenty of other choices nearby.We wouldn't hesitate to come back.

I am more used to Grand Hyatt in Asia Pacific than in the US, therefore my comments could be biased.Here are the positive points:- Great location for visiting San Francisco, recently refurbished hotel- easy check-in and check out (the web check out feature is great)- very helpful conciergeArea of improvements:- More hooks and towel holder needed in the bathroom. There were only 2 tiny hooks - Food selection for the breakfast at the restaurant can be increased. Choice was very limited, although quality was good- The Grand Club lounge : The variety of the lounge breakfast should be improved. It was exactly the same every single day during our 6 night stays, same fruits, same smoked salmon, same eggs... And compared to Asian Grand Hyatt, the food selection in general (breakfast but also during cocktail hours) is very poor.

I love sf and it was unfortunate that I had to stay across the street from the Grand Hyatt due to a company meeting. But I did spend what time I could at the Grand Hyatt's OneUP Bar and Lounge. The new look of their renovation is something every hotel should model. The service I received at lunch by the F&B Manager was over the top, making you feel that we were all old friends. I couldn't believe their buffet. Priced right with healthily choices to choose from. I couldn't wait to go back over at the end of my day to relax at their bar, unto known to me that they have wine Tasting every Wednesday in their beautiful lobby at no charge. Dogwood Cellars was very gracious with their pours and all stood around with other guest who were talking about their days events with one another. My best conversation was with an employee by the name Lisa. She was helping out in the lobby during the wine event. What stuck with me was how she interacted with the guest, making us feel that we were part of her extended family, she is one that you can tell loves what she does and does it well. My next time back to sf will be to stay at the Grand Hyatt and experience this special place and people.

Excellent location, very attentive staff, breakfast was great! The rooms were very nice and clean. I guess my only complaint is there is not enough drawer space for clothes. Our tour group only stayed 2 nights so I just left everything in my suitcase. Also 2 suitcase stands would be nice; only one provided.

It was such a pleasure to stay at this hotel! The room was extremely modern, yet very comfortable. The staff, from the maintenance engineer to the concierge, were very knowledgeable and friendly. They went out of their way to make sure that we enjoyed our stay. This hotel is centrally located near Union Square and the downtown area. If you do not have a car, the local transport system can take you anywhere in town that you want to go. The Fisherman's Warf and Pier 39 are less than 15 minutes from the hotel on the #30 busline. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and look forward to returning as soon as possible.

Great location. Rooms average size and clean. Came with family on a business trip. Hotel going through renovations in the lobby so noise level, dust and crowded lobby area very disturbing. Concierge desk constantly busy, unable to receive service in a timely manner.

Location:Great location, half a block away from Union Square. Close to many shops, many restaurants, and 2 Starbucks on the same block.Lobby:Pretty cool lobby, check-in staff is not behind a counter, which makes it more personal. Great ambiance music and lighting. Cozy fireplace lounge where you can use free wifi while you wait for your friends. We arrived early, and were given a room immediately.Rooms:Rooms seem recently refurbished. They are modern and extremely clean. Bathrooms are spacious, well lit, and completely new. The curtains are controlled by a button next to the bed. They even have a list of items they can give you for free (things you forgot home like razors, etc)I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in the Union Square area. I have no complaints about this property. Good Job!

Great location, Union Square is a great staging point for tourist activities and shopping is seconds away. Hotel staff was very helpful, we had to rush a dress out for pressing and the concierge made it happen on check-in notice late in the day and they also setup a hair appointment for the lady at a local salon, VERY HELPFUL! TIP: Go up to the top floor, there are north and south facing viewing rooms that give you a spectacular vantage point of the bay & bridge and on the other side the Square

I truly enjoyed the Grand Hyatt San Francisco. I love to be in area where I can get around and comfortably see the city. It is a perfect location. Staff was friendly. We checked in quickly. Restaurant and food was great. Great lobby area for sitting and getting together with others.

This is a very nice and upscale hotel. Best hotel location in SF , right in Union Square with Macy directly across the street.Very nice , recently renovated hotel . The location is so convenient being in Union Square so it is a shopper 's dream . China Town is only 5 minutes away. Lots of great restaurant nearby makes this hotel even more desirable.The only negative is the Valet parking fee which is steep ($40 per day). I would definitely stay here again .

Would like to mentioned that the staff is very friendly and helpful.Location of the hotel near union square is a very good starting point for different actions like shopping or sightseeing.Was staying at the Hyatt a few years ago on a business trip and this time came back with my family. Only weak point is that the restaurant on the top of the hotel is no longer there and the new restaurant is not very useful so be prepared that you need to go outside.

This is, hands down, a wonderful place to stay. It's an enormous hotel but the service is wonderful, the location is perfect, the beds were amazing and the bathrooms were very clean. The hotel must be brand new, or newly renovated. Either way, it was a perfect place to stay in San Francisco, even though we were only there for one night. The fitness facilities were top of the line and my husband was able to have a great workout, like one he would have at the gym back at home. The room even has electronic shades you can lower at night by a switch next to your bed!I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco and looking for a comfortable and luxurious experience.

This hotel is first rate! The rooms were very clean and the staff was very helpful. I was arriving very late and when we arrived at 2:00 am the doorman was the first person to come to our car and greet us. When we got to the desk they knew who we were and check us in fast so we could get to our room. I had requested a high floor facing Union Square. We were placed on the 10th floor but had a great view of Union Square. Joanna at the concierge was so helpful in making reservations with us, and just taking her time with us to expalin everything.

Beautiful right from the checkin area. You don't realize its lobby. Bunch of stand up booths with all gadgets welcoming guests! Welcome message with your name on the TV in your room looks good and and buttons to control curtains felt easy in the night rise it and gaze the city and sky and scroll it down while going sleep. Right next to Union square is both good and bad in its own way. You have Starbucks opp to hotel, Cheesecake factory to right side. Love it. You checkout of your room using your TV or web and you are all set to move. Would choose again.

The Grand Hyatt at Union Sq in SF has done a nice update and travelers, especially those on business, will find this comfortable, well situated and reasonably priced. Ask for a room that overlooks the Bay and Alcatraz, really nice. Their updated exercise room is great!

While I didn't stay at this hotel, I attended a conference event cocktail hour. The conference room was nice and spacious and there was a wide variety of tasty and unique snacks, including warm Brie, roasted red pepper tapenade, taro chips and an assortment of yummy desserts.

If you are traveling on business, as I was, and you can swing the business package, I recommend it. The breakfast buffet, included in the package, is delicious and convenient, including lots of fresh fruits and savory items. (Otherwise, you are looking at a $30+ expense!) The other perks -- newspaper selection, shirt pressing -- can also be valuable. Plus the location is great: just a block off Union Square and only about 5-6 blocks from the Moscone Convention Center. Given all the restaurant and shopping entities nearby, this location is ideally situated. The rooms are all newly renovated and fresh. The bar is pleasant and featured live music the few nights I was there. The service was excellent. The fitness center on the 35th floor has a spectacular view. I recommend asking for a room higher up as an added bonus. I was on the 31st floor looking north with an incredible view of Coit Tower. I always kept the electronically controlled blinds up to enjoy the view!

Excellent hotel - in fact one of the best I've ever been in. Everything was new and absolutely spotless, and did not feel at all like a typical "chain" hotel - apparently the hotel has been refurbished recently. Rooms are large and the furniture (which I could describe as an American-modern meets Scandinavian) made the rooms look and feel even larger. The beds were great as well - just firm enough to provide firm support and just soft enough to feel like sitting on a cloud. The staff was great - especially the lady at check-in that actually made me smile after 15 hours of flying half way across the globe.Strangely enough, even though Internet was supposed to cost quite a bit (9 or 14 $ a night, I can't remember what was advertised), it was available free of charge. I have no idea if this was temporary, given that there was a hotel strike during my stay or a permanent feature.On the minus side, there is no pool available, and, apparently, you pay extra if you want a room on the top 5 floors.P.S. There's a big "air purification machine", separate from the A/C, in the rooms. What that does (except noise) remains a mystery to me to this day.

Newly renovated areas of the hotel. Rooms very comfortable, clean and quiet. My room was on the 18th floor overlooking Union Square. Location was very convenient to financial district and just about anything you are looking for. Staff at check in were so efficient, before I knew what happened I had my room key and was on my way. I was traveling on business so didn't have the opportunity to dine at the property as we ate offsite. I will be back to this property for vacation time and use the facilities at the hotel.

First the great bits - the service in this hotel exceeded my expectation... By a mile. The bellmen were so helpful and welcoming - I have not experienced this kind of help even at the Four Seasons. Personable and friendly, the team went beyond what was expected to put a smile on the faces of guests. They even came out with a wagon of toys in the lobby to welcome some young kids to the hotel.Our car was broken into during our time in San Francisco and we had stuff -including a passport - stolen. But the boys were so good helping us out. Equally helpful was the front desk team and they even waived late check out charges in order to facilitate our vehicle exchange. We appreciated the great help the team rendered.And the number of staff they put in the lobby also made getting help (or the elevator) a breeze!The location is top notch. Overlooking the centre of union square and flanked by a bevy of department stores and boutiques, this hotel makes it a breeze to nip in and out.The thing that disappointed was the room itself. The appointment of the room was of a different quality from the Grand Hyatt rooms in Asia. Bathrooms did not come with separate shower stalls and the walls are paper thin. That means you can't count on a good night's sleep. We had guests waking us up just by closing their room doors and vacuum cleaners in the next room keeping us up when we were trying to nap. Basic amenities were also available only on request which was a bit of an inconvenience. The decor was also a bit schizo - gorgeous contemporary lobby with cool LED backlit sinks in the rest rooms but head up to the rooms and you will be disappointed with the refinements.I am however more likely to remember the outstanding service than the lackluster rooms. Well done Hyatt team!Ps: beware the parking charges in the garage. Parked using their offsite provider and it was still a small fortune!

The interior appearance is now very stylish, attractive and up-to-date. The check-in staff were standing at pedestals with laptops rather than the usual counter. They were very efficient and friendly and the experience was positive. My room was on the 7th floor without a view, but the room was ideal in styling and function. The TV was on when I came in displaying my name and how to access the different functions through the TV. It was connected to a wireless keyboard and there was access to basic internet there or through WIFI for free. I found that a real and welcome bonus. The window shade is motorized, there is an LED reading light and the workspace was big enough with full plug in capability. So often you have to hunt for an outlet to plug in electronics, but there were plenty here. Along the hi-tech lines, the key is an RFID so there is no swiping; it works on proximity. The sink was a raised, elongated bowl; quite stylish. The restaurant, OneUp, was more like a chef-owned restaurant than what one normally sees in a hotel. The food and service were excellent for both dinner and breakfast. The location was close to many options for shopping and dinning. I was attending a convention at the Moscone Center. They had a shuttle bus, but it was a very pleasant walk there and back, and probably just as fast as the bus. I would definitely stay here again when in San Francisco.

I love the location of this hotel (near Union Square, but away from the madness). I've stayed here many times in the last 12 years, for this reason. The renovations in the lobby, restaurant and bar are a huge win. Well done! Boa in the new 2nd floor bar gives excellent service, too. He recommended wines (and not only the expensive ones) and treated me so kindly.I stayed for 4 nights. Rooms are comfortable, and modern and cozy. They have bathtubs and refrigerators, which is a huge convenience. I requested a room that was "quiet" (*24, next to the housekeeping closet) and that was helpful. There is a fair amount of building noise from the elevators shafts and wind (?), but I was okay with it.

What a great Hotel. Positioned perfectly in amongst the action of San Francisco. Great service. Room was beautiful and roomy for 2 adults and 2 children. Concierge was so helpful in choosing the right tours to enjoy with limited tome. Looking forward to returning.

Hyatt usually does a great job and this one is no exception.They have nice rooms -- although pretty small.Unfortunately their rates and add-on charges are sky-high! Watch your hat and wallet!Parking and internet charges are exorbitant -- ugh!These hotels are going to eventually kill their golden geese like they didwith high rates for telephone service.Nevertheless this a great location with good service.Since my last visit, the remodeled the hotel and moved the top floor view loungedown to the 2nd floor. The beautiful views are now only available to conference rooms!Definitely not a smart idea! Businesses don't want their business meetings with distractions.Too bad... so sad -- we used to like this hotel.

Spent 2 nights holiday w/c 15/4 on a recommendation from a family friend, who stayed @ G.H. Union Square Oct.'12. Check In quick/efficient; originally requested high floor Bay view but got 7th. floor street facing; however room was well appointed & quiet @ the end of a corridor.Good choice @ breakfast, including plenty of fruit in buffet. Staff were very helpful, especially one of the breakfast management team who printed me a map where to catch bus & number.Hotel location is good for shops, restuarants & transport. We got from Market St. to Golden Gate Park, Ashbury/Haight, Lombard St., Ghardelli Sq. & back to Powell Street at a leisurely pace, on a $14 Bus/Tram day pass! Not the cheapest in town, but "you get what you pay for". Used "Super-Shuttle" from SFO @ 2 x $17 plus tip. However, the hotel limo service to SFO, via Tom a friendly driver, was well worth the $40 fare + tip!

Stayed for 3 nights with the family in a Union Square facing room. Since the renovation both the lobby (fire places) and the rooms are fantastic = new, nice and cosy. The location is great with about 20 meter to the Union Square. I would highly recommend it. We havent used any of the restaurants. Used the gym and its a nice high end 24 hours gym.Service was mixed. Friendly welcome, luggage to room took 5 hours and a call, despite no disturb sign house keeping was busy cleaning right in front of the door - every morning. 2-3 more slips. While there are two garages next to the hotel, these come at a price. Again, we liked it and would recommend the place.

Stayed in the Grand Hotel for 5 nights without any issues, had a good view of the bay from my 24th floor room. Hotel has live music a couple of nights a week in the bar and can get quite busy, food in restaurant and bar good was disappointed with breakfast but grab n go breakfast service is good value and fast. Used SuperShuttle for transfer 2 and from the hotel, just under $20 each way and about 40mins. When I next go back to San Fran will probably stay in the Gran Hyatt again

Had occasion to stay at the San Fran Grand Hyatt on business and while the hotel is located next to union square in the centre of the downtown area and positioned in the heart of some of the best shopping you could imagine I found the area too noisy at night to get a good nights sleep. I'm not a light sleeper normally and was on the 22nd floor so the noise level had to be quite high to keep me awake. I also had an issue with the registration desk in getting charges levied that were not appropriate removed from my credit card. It took multiple tries to correct this issue and it wasn't until I returned home and contacted them via telephone that we finally succeeded in getting this money issue resolved.

The service was impeccable. The staff was ready ready to accommodate our every need. Our corner room had a great view of Alcatraz and the Bay.It was Christmas in San Francisco and our location just 1 block from Union Square provided us with the opportunity to see the wonderful decorations in the area and explore the numerous shopping opportunities.Typical large city parking fees are exorbitant, so in order to avoid the $50/night, we did not get a rental car. We used BART to ride from the airport to the hotel as there is a station within 4 short blocks of the Hyatt. There are many good restaurants were within a short walk from the hotel and public transportation is readily available to most tourist locations.We have stayed at this hotel 3 times in the past 8 years and looking forward to another stay in the future.

We stayed in the Grand Hyatt SF from March 13 for 2 nights. Our stay should have been longer but we cancelled to look for a nicer hotel (which we found at the Inn at the Presidio). Our room was on the 11th floor, with, as the bellman admitted, â€_not much of a viewâ€œ, but quiet. In fact the view was quite ugly, but we did not really mind this as we spent only the nights. What we did mind, however, was that the room was very dusty. Dust was everywhere, the carpet had lots of lint on it and the most dirty thing was the rail of the sash window (see pictures). The air conditioning unit was also very dusty and covered with cobwebs. As our little daughter had a nap and I did not want anyone to come up, I cleaned it myself.I let the frontdesk know about the dust on our second day and the room then received a thorough dusting. The furniture of the recently renovated (!) room was chapped, the bedlinens had fissures and the minibar was empty. Not what I expect of a four star hotel.We called room service for some mineral water and were asked if we wanted â€_lime or lemonâ€œ and if we desired ice. We said lemon and no ice...the glasses were delivered with lime cuts and filled with ice cubes.Air conditioning gives you a good taste of everything going on in the house, with breakfast and other smells coming through from elsewhere. As the windows in the hotel could not be opened at all we were a bit worried where the fresh air might come from. Even more so as we had been explained that the air conditioner only recycles and conditions the air from inside and no air is drawn from the outside. We thought this was impossible and asked the hotel to clarify...they never even bothered to call us again, even though they had promised.At breakfast I could receive some gluten free bread, but it was bland, as well as the overpriced omelette. The only good thing about breakfast was that the staff was very friendly and helpful. Of the two elevators accessing the restaurant, one was constantly broken. The drinks and food were overpriced for what they were.Really, there is nothing "grand" about this hotel, and the price is not justified.If you are looking for a nice place in SF worth of the money it costs, head to the Vitale or, even better, the Inn at the Presidio.

My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt last summer for a quick trip to San Fransisco. The location of the hotel was great - very central and close to many restaurants and shopping. However, the hotel itself was slightly lacking. The hotel was quite busy and it usually resulted in 15 minutes of waiting every time we wanted to speak with front desk or concierge staff.The rooms were also quite noisy, resulting in pretty poor sleep quality. Noise from the hallways really reverberated through the room, and the sliding door in the bathroom also resulted in noise and light in the bedroom at night if someone used it.Overall, not a bad stay, just a few little things that could have been better, especially considering the price.

Overall not a bad stay. They have updated the rooms which are nice but have not updated the windows. They are old single pane aluminum with next to no sound proofing. I was on the 12 floor and could hear all the traffic etc. including the whistle they door man used to call for a cab. I am from the city so was not to bothersome for me. If you are a light sleeper go for a much higher room. That being said I received a note from hotel management about high winds and the noise I may hearâ€_now that was a first even for meâ€_.bring back to the outdated windows. I did have some trouble checking in. they made an error on my reservation and the gentleman (Term used loosely) was rude, boarding on obnoxious. They lose a few points for that. There is now reason for front of the house ever to be rude to a guest. No pic this time, camera battery was dead and had no charger.

We stayed here for 2 nights, the walls were very thin and we could hear every noise from the corridor. The valet parking was over 50 dollars a night, which we thought was very high! The rooms are minimal, functional, but don't consider paying for an upgrade to a view - it is not worth it. The breakfast was nice and kids under 5 ate free which made it good value for families.

The location is fantastic and the rooms are well-appointed and lovely. We had breakfast on the top floor overlooking the city. Excellent service throughout the hotel. The fitness center was larger than most.

Newly remodeled lobby, great location, accommodating staff, nice rooms. Only issue is with the bathroom. The sliding opaque door was a pain to one and close and let in a ton of light, which was very annoying when others were trying to sleep

Definitely lived up to the standards I would expect for a Grand Hyatt and especially true at the price paid. Not too high a price, given the location, but definitely not a discount hotel. The room was well-furnished and well-kept. I didn't use the restaurant hotel, but there were very good choices from low-cost to high-cost food choices nearby. I did use the health club and found it to be very well-equipped with a variety of cardio equipment; not as true for weights but I didn't use them anyway.The interior of the lobby is very impressive. Open architectual design with very interesting lighting

Stayed here for a week whilst on holiday in San Francisco. Really great location and very comfortable rooms. Staff friendly and helpful.My only gripe was the noise from the interconnecting room on our last night. We were woken just before midnight by our neighbours returning and could hear their whole conversation which went on until gone 1am. This is such a shame as up until then we couldn't fault the hotel.Chose Hyatt because we stayed in a Hyatt when we visited Los Angeles a few years ago and that was a lovely hotel, so decided to stay at another Hyatt hoping that it would also be a positive experience. We were not disappointed. Thanks Hyatt!

We picked this hotel for its central location, so we could walk to most of the places around Union Square. Check in was quite efficient. All the staff were very professional and friendly.The room was fine, bathroom was spacious with a big shower area, nice amenities. However, the lighting in the room was a bit dim to my liking, and the bed was too soft as it sank to the middle.There were complimentary ice and filtered water in a room along the corridor, that was handy to fill up our drink bottles.

We had a lovely stay at this hotel. Initially we were quite scared as so many issues had arisen in a simple reservation. We had to deal with them for 2 full days. It was very frustrating. However they made up for it by upgrading our rooms. Overall, the hotel is very nice. Some may complain that there is no mini bar. We didn't mind as we never use the mini bar as it is outrageously priced. The rooms are clean and modern and nicely decorated. The location is perfect and staff is very nice. We stayed as a family and would stay again.

Location couldn't be more central and the service was excellent. Rooms are small but well designed and very clean. I didn't try the restaurant but the room service was good and moderately priced for a hotel in this category.

Lovely 3 night weekend stay at the newly remodeled Grand Hyatt. Rooms are lovely, bathrooms are well designed and the employees couldn't be more accommodating. As a Diamond member, I really enjoyed the newly designed grand club lounge. Breakfast was well done as were the evening hors d'oeuvres and snack throughout the day. Location right off Union Square is awesome and you are right in the middle of a plethora of upscale stores. Definitely will stay here again when we return to San Francisco.

Wonderful location, lots to see and do around the hotel. Hotel itself is average. Lobby decor is nice, but room decor looks very dated, even after their renovations. Bed was comfy, shower was very nice.

The Hyatt had a major renovation a few years ago and the rooms are now SO much nicer: very comfy beds, great views from the higher floors, and electronics to delight everyone. There's a large, built-in flat screen TV, lots of desk space, and bedside buttons to raise and lower the window shade. What I really appreciated was the LED reading lights on each side of the bed. The bathroom, too, received a facelift: ample lighting around the large mirror and a new, 21st century sink with nice amenities (even toothpaste!) Of course, the location is the best: right on Union Square. Even the lobby is more user-friendly. This hotel does tend to be crowded due to conferences, etc. but we weren't bothered by any noise. Didn't try the restaurant. Would definitely stay here again.

I stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms with a gorgeous view and loved it. The room was really well appointed and very well designed. The restaurants and room service were all excellent, as was housekeeping. (One thing: One evening I had to cross a picket line to get into the hotel. Apparently Hyatt does not have a great record on paying and supporting its housekeeping staff, which is very disappointing, as I am a fan of the Hyatt brand.) If you have a car, the parking is very expensive in downtown San Francisco, but the valet parking is exorbitant. So, park at the Sutter Street structure catty corner from the hotel. It's easy and will save you a little money. The location could not be better. It is one block up from Union Square and three from the entrance to Chinatown. Shopping, restaurants, and the cable car are all nearby. On top of all this, I got a great price at the last minute! Would definitely stay here again.

I spent three nights recently at this hotel on a weekend trip and I think the best thing going for this hotel is the location. I was able to quickly get wherever I wanted in the city either walking or taking public transit. While it is not in the central business district it is probably an ideal spot for business travel. I'm not sure I would call it ideal for families since the fisherman's warf and the other core touristy areas are a bit further then some of the more business locations. Also while the area is full of people at night and relatively safe there are a good amount of homless people around. Still, everywhere in the city was realtively easy to get to and I would not have had such easy access to all the areas had I staid in the northern end of the city. There are also a lot more stores and coffee shops then in the main business distrct. Chinatown is also walking distance.The hotel is very nice as others have stated on here. The hotel rooms are very modern feeling and clean. The front desk was a tad confusing- its more of a computer kiosk now then an actual traditional front door. The staff was very helpful and polite. The only person who gave me some issue was the curt individual when I went to get my luggage out of storage to leave. Overall this hotel is very well updated, has enough around it to give you something to do at night, and provides quick access to other parts of the city. It isn't the best for families with small children since there is a small sketchy element and the touristy spots require a trolley ride to get to.

Nice city hotel. A bit of a rushed feel to it. The lobby is lovely and though there was an attempt to make it cozy it is still a bit sterile. The rooms were adequate, as was the service. With one exception. There was one consierge who just was so UNHELPFUL. She wasn't unfriendly, just businesslike. But more importantly she just would not listen at all. Everything I tried to ask for directions, suggestions, anything at all she would try and finish my sentence and assumed she knew what I wanted. And the thing is - she didn't!! I finally left the desk and came back when she wasn't there.

The Grand Hyatt at Union Square has one of the great locations for people visiting for work or play. It's a short walk to the Moscone Center complex South of Market and in the heart of the Union Square shopping district. The only problem during the past few years was that the hotel felt trapped in a time warp of the early 80's. The rooms were dark - the lobby (unfriendly) and the lack of a casual place to eat or drink would make one wonder if this truly was a Hyatt.All of this has been changed with the recent modernization program. The rooms are now decorated in a fresh, contemporary style. It's electronics friendly - one can even plug a computer into the large wall-mounted flat screen. The bathrooms are better lit, too! The lobby is much improved - not a place to spend great amounts of time, but finally one can meet and have a conversation comfortably. The new "open" desk registration area seemed much more efficient and the staff was friendly and incredibly fast at processing our requests.On the mezzanine, the new restaurant and bar were above expectations - not a bargain - but, the food was certainly equal to the price!From a style/charm perspective, its unfair to call this a sterile hotel as a criticism. It's a Hyatt - it's amenities and services are consistent with the level of other major chains: no more, no less. Because it's large, it is very likely one can find a great rate through the major travel sites - and relative to the other hotels on Union Square, a cut above.

Stayed 4 nights in this hotel . There was an ongoing conference in the hotel during that time so the place tends to be crowded in the lobby most of the time . I liked the location, which is very central , with the Union Square ( with many shops and restaurants) just literally a 1-2 minute walk from the hotel doorstep .I also liked the spacious rooms , well designed and presenting state of the art amenities, such as an interactive huge LED TV , which has a separate control pad , and the nice button control for the curtains. Beds are comfortable, lighting is good, although the bathroom is not that elegant (except for the basin ). Reception and the check in proceedings go smooth, the female front desk staff Jaze is friendly and so was Yena , who helped me secure my loss Hyatt Passport #. There are 3 great services that they offer 1) the complimentary drinking water (they have a dispenser ) provided beside the ice machine at every floor and 2) and the offer to provide needed amenities such as toothbrush , shaving cream, razor etc if needed. 3) the free wireless internet (but not that very fast at times ). Regarding the room by the way, I noticed the sound of the gushing wind although i can't say if the room was soundproof or not considering i was not disturbed by the voices of fellow guests during my stay there . i am not impressed by the breakfast buffet selection , the only thing i liked was the strawberries included , and the service by the coffeeshop staff headed by Danny. This hotel is indeed beautiful , and pictures may not be enough for the proper description . i would also like to commend the bell staff Jurgen and Angelito . Even the westin st francis and marriott present something more central in location , based on the services and facilities offered , i would still choose this hotel , and that is inspite i don't like the treatment (sarcastic ) I got from the male front desk staff when i checked out. For travellers out there , if you want points credited to your membership card ( Accor, Gold Passport , Marriott Rewards etc ) , don't book through Agoda, Expedia or travel agent , they won't credit it , even you paid it with your own buck . And last thing , have breakfast at the famous diner outlets in union square instead of the coffeeshop or starbucks (just in front of hotel ), you won't regret it.

Recently modernized 70's era high rise near Union Square. Easy, hill free, walking to shops, Fishermans Wharf , Chin Town and Financial District. Rooms modern and functional. Good aircon. Showers, beds comfortable.Pros- No hills to climb . Rooms bright and modern. Conveniently located at foot of Nob Hill next to Union Square shops and restaurants. Mark and Joanna friendly concierges who can advise on restaurants, sightseeing.Cons - A convention hotel. Short on character and warmth. Wait for elevators can get tiresome if there's a large group staying. Restaurant small - gets crowded at breakfast. No store in the hotel so you have to go a couple of blocks to Walgreens for water. Surprisingly no turndown service.Sum up : $500 a night reasonable by SF standards. Everything clean and efficient. Has the sterile feeling of a hotel run by accountants. Certainly a Hyatt but not a Grand Hyatt. Probably wouldn't stay here again although we're great fans of the Hyatt brand.

We are currently staying at this hotel. Although a great fan of the Hyatt brand, this hotel truely disappoints. The views are good from our 32nd floor room but it is virtually impossible to sleep due to the noise from the room next door.Unfortunately, we have a room with a connecting door to the next room and we can hear everything our neighbour does -what TV she watches, when she showers etc... We asked to change rooms to avoid having a connecting door but were told that the hotel is busy and the only other room was next to the elevator and ice machine - which could be equally bad. Apparently, a significant number of rooms have connecting doors in this property. The lounge is very nice although a little crowded. Club-level staff are very friendly.Overall though, a disastrous stay. We won't be back.

Centrally located so you can get to just about every part of the city by walking. The service was friendly and attentive. We had a great room, comfortable and clean. It even had a refrigerator so we could store the cheese we bought at the Farmers Market. The only reason I wouldn't give it 5 stars is because the beds (2 doubles) were a little soft and worn out. All else was good.

I traveled here for business. Very disappointed in this hotel. Great location and nice modern rooms. But there was no mini bar in the room and no store in the hotel or nearby to buy amenities such as bottled water and soft drinks.There is ONE restaurant in the hotel that serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Two mornings in a row, the small restaurant was full and I would have had to wait at least 15 minutes. The first morning, we walked to the W Hotel and had a wonderful breakfast there (I'll be staying there next time, that's for sure).The second morning I had to catch a plane, and after trying the hotel's restaurant for breakfast and being told it would be a 15-30 minute wait, I was forced to walk across the street to Starbucks for coffee and a stale scone.

Check in was efficient and fast. Rooms were decent sized, and very clean and updated. Great location in the midst of Union Square. We got a great package that includes breakfast (crowded but not a big problem). When we were there part of the lobby was undergoing renovation, so it was a bit messy. And there was no proper drop off place for cars, just a makeshift door way at the back.

So you are considering the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco? I say go for it. However, you probably want to know why. Firstly check in. I checked in from my office in Toronto on my day of travel. They have webcheck in and it is very convenient. We arrived in SFO at 1130pm so didn't reach the hotel until after midnight. The girl at the checkin was very cheery and welcoming - although given we had already completed it online, all that was really required was our room pass. We were given an awesome room on the 25th floor - expansive and modern. The bed was really comfortable and the room had all we needed. Some have complained about the sink in the bathroom - really not an issue. The room had remote control blinds that could be operated from the bed. Quite a treat enjoying the view outside. You can even order complimentary items for the room - e.g toothpaste, toothbrushes,hairspray etc. Other items such as shower gel and shampoo and conditioner were already in the room.The location of the hotel is excellent. It is about a 2 minute walk from union square - very safe and lots of people around (even at the late hour that we arrived). There are many shops and restaurants nearby, as well as the bus pick up locations for the sightseeing tours. We had not been to San Francisco before, so my husband spent a lot of time praising me for my excellent choice of hotel location!The hotel lobby etc is lovely. There are comfy couches where one can linger with a coffee. The concierge staff were also very helpful and knew a lot about what the city had to offer. Housekeeping was also excellent. Everyday we returned to a perfectly clean room - with no un-wanted rearranging of our personal items. If you want to work out while you are there (if walking the city all day is not enough) the gym is excellent - lots of equipment etc. Also fresh towels and water - not to mention the amazing view (the gym is on a really high floor).You do hear the occasional ding of the cable car bell from your room - however it is not really loud - it adds to the character. I had such restful sleep at the Grand Hyatt and woke up refreshed each day. Check out was also simple - you have a range of options - the internet, the interactive tv in your room or the traditional way with a person. You can also print out your boarding passes from the hotel lobby - I did that and it made things that bit easier. Overall a great stay, came back relaxed and refreshed and would most certainly stay at the Grand Hyatt next time I am in San Francisco.

Great location and wonderfully updated, this hotel is a very good value in Union Square. Staff was friendly, room was well appointed and room service was punctual with good quality food. We had a standard room with downtown views and a view of Coit tower. Parking was available across the street and worked out well.

Wonderful staff, great bar and restaurant. Reasonably sized rooms, excellent location. Recently renovated lobby. Asked for a top floor, got a decent 16th. No bad views: city or SF Bay. Priced accordingly, but got a discount over the convention web site. Will definitely stay again.

My husband and I spent seven nights at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco. After reading all the TripAdvisor reviews on this hotel, and most reviews for most other hotels in the same price bracket, I chose the Grand Hyatt with slight reservation. I'm a really fussy traveller. I used the hotel's website to pre-request specifics for our room (one bed, bath tub, high floor, view). This is the only hotel in our month-long trip that paid any attention to my requests. We asked for a Gold Passport upgrade to a bay view room, which the hotel kindly gave us.Firstly, the check-in. People who complain about the funky layout must be seriously jet-lagged not to figure out how it works. The layout means no lines and attentive service. The lobby is mod but relaxing. The bar equally pleasant. The room. Yes, the windows fog with the shower and you can hear police sirens on the 25th floor and the loo could be more sound-proof, but it was so comfortable and nicely laid out that we extended our four night stay to seven nights. Our view over the bay was gorgeous. The bed and pillows were heavenly. Housekeeping responsive. Room service really yummy. The concierge couldn't be more helpful.The location. It is impossible to find better. The area is safe and near Chinatown (wonderfully vibey), not far from North Beach and in the designer shopping area. We love walking (but aren't particularly fit) but could walk to almost any attraction within half an hour. All modes of public transport are very close. We love bars and music. Not into pretentious, but enjoy smart as well as grungy. Try the Tunnel Top (very close to the hotel), Vesuvio (Jack Kerouac's haunt) and The Saloon (has to be seen to be believed). The last two are a 15 minute walk (which helps one sober up if one has had too many margaritas!). This hotel is superb value for money. Not the cheapest, but worth the price. I spent days searching the internet for the best deal and couldn't beat the hotel's own website.

spent 2 days over the weekend, in the heart of san francisco. parking garage is across the corner, no need to do valet. wonderful for shopping.upgraded to club floor which is very worth doing..great views and good breakfast with eggs, salmon, toasts, cereals, etc...will go back again for sure.

after struggling with poor reviews of many luxury hotels in San Fran i finally settled on the grand hyatt union square. i have nothing but positive things to say, rooms were comfy, clean not noisey. room key always worked, breakfast with room deal was great and they will make you what you want if its not on the buffet!. staff was all nice and we were just happy in general with our choice

First time at this Hyatt property. Fairly fancy and recent renovation was almost finished. Hotel was clean, as was my room. Hotel is a short walk to many nicer stores, and actually quite close to many different attractions in the area. Hotel has an excellent exercise area, if that is something you like. Rooms were a bit small, but workable. Internet was terrible. I was told I should have paid the 9.95 fee to get the "upgraded" internet connection, and the cost would have been removed when I checked out due to my member status. The rooms do creak when there is high winds, which is part of the building construction. Caught me by surprise the first time it happened. Staff at the front desk ran Hot and Cold. Might give it another try when I get back to see if things have improved.

We stay in San Francisco about once a month and always stay here because its right on Union Square near the shopping and dining. The recent remodel of rooms and lobby have really turned out nice. The hotel can be a little noisy on weekends but that is expected. Good value for money at this prime location.

Short three night trip and it was excellent. Just off Union Square and in the heart of the City. Walking distance to much of the City and convenient to transportation and lots more.I was on one of the Club Level floors and access to t he Grand Club. Well done, good, attentive staff and very friendly.I have stayed at this property before and it was good but now that they have finished the renovations, the rooms are really very nice and most have good are very decent views. I was on the 32nd floor looking West, interesting. Not quite as spectacular as looking East towards the Bay but still good.Modern, clean, great bathroom. I was happy with my stay.

The Grand Hyatt is everything you expect and more. The location is ideal for downtown San Fran. A good walking distance to the Pier, but great location for amazing restaurants and shopping all nearby. The rooms are perfect size and the beds are very comfortable. The rooms are decorated to modern times and the hotel lobby and bar are modeled extremely nice. The staff were all very helpful, friendly and most importantly, knew what they were talking about when asked many questions. The Concierge staff were especially helpful with tips and locations of restaurants, shopping, etc. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Stayed here in March 2013. The hotel is in a safe and excellent location, ideal for single ladies travelling alone. The beds are wonderful! I slept like a baby for 8 straight hours. The room is bright, intuitive and the amenities are what you expect from a Hyatt.

We spent 2 nights at the Grand Hyatt. The check in and out was very fast and efficient. We arrived before 9am and was pleasantly surprised to be offered our room then. The room has been remodelled and was large and modern with great views. It is the best location for downtown San Francisco with everything at walking distance or a trolly ride away. It is a excellent hotel and we will be back.

Everything you could possible want to do in San Fransicso is right outside your door and either a short walk or a trolley ride away. The check-in was easy and a breeze. Modern lobby and check-in process. My room appeared to have been remodeled and was very comfortable and clean. High vanity in the bathroom, which i like and a nice large showerhead with great water pressure. The cleaning crew did a great job everyday. I was so impressed with the Hyatt that i came close to changing my membership from Hilton to Hyatt. I will have to stay at a few more Hyatts before i make that committment. The only downside and it is not the fault of the hotel but select a room away from the ice machine. for some reason guests seem to need ice at 3 in the morning. Decent places to eat surround the hotel and the front staff is very friendly and willing to help you decide where to eat. I live in DC so sounds from the street are never a problem for me. But light sleepers may want a higher room.

We spent 4 nights at this great hotel. A fabulous central location just around the corner from Union Square, shopping precinct and all important trams.Our room was a great size complete with requested views across town towards the bay. Service was good, even though the hotel lobby was under renovation. The bar on the top floor was a pleasant place to watch the sun go down or the fog roll in, after many hours of walking the hills.There were many good places to eat, all within walking distance from the hotelHighly recommended for location and good value for money.

Steps from Chinatown, the Financial District and Union Square, the location of the Grand Hyatt SF simply cannot be beaten,The rooms were somewhat updated although overall, I found the carpets in the room and common areas of my floor to be worn. I was on a high floor and noise wasn't an issue.I did get to use the gym. It was totally sufficient for a "travelers workout," with lots of fresh water, towels, personal TV screens against a beautiful skyline view from the 35th floor.  I'd say this hotel was a notch above my previous stay at comparable hotel in SF and as an added bonus, the price was fantastic. Going to request this hotel next time.

When I went shopping by phone for a place to stay in SF, I called the hotel reservations service through Delta. I needed to stay near SFMoMA and was undecided between the Marriott and the Hyatt. The prices were about the same but the Delta operator told me that the Hyatt was offering a "complimentary breakfast." That cinched the deal for me. When I arrived at the Hyatt, though, I was told no such deal with Delta or any other service existed. I explained that I had chosen the hotel primarily because of the breakfast. The people in reservations were kind enough to honor what I thought was the original arrangement. Classy behavior. I'd stay there again, as my room was clean and efficient, too. I wish I could say the same about Delta's hotel service. I tried to complain and never was able to reach a human being.

Newly renovated. Great location with excellent staff. Loved it. Union square over look was great. Was December so looked at Christmas tree and ice scaking rink. Checg-in was different - Computerized stations out incenter of area. Great Door and Bellmen - very attentive. Large room andquiye - good sleep. Going to be our Hotel in San Francisco.

We stayed for a vacation and the location was spectacular to say the least. Room was clean and spacious. Service was prompt. Quiet space. The breakfast was a great price for what you get, I avoid eating in the surrounding area for breakfast for a family. The only issue is I wish had free WIFI in the room. Its hassle to have to go down to Starbucks or the lobby.

I lived in San Francisco for many years, and when I come back for visits I always want to be around Union Square. I had avoided the Grand Hyatt because it was a bit worn out. But recently I stayed there and was pleasantly surprised at the remodeled hotel. It is beautiful! They have a friendly staff and you cannot beat that location. The views are gorgeous. I used Hyatt points to upgrade to the club level room, and access the lounge. This is a great perk if you are traveling with a family so they can get snacks when they want. The food in the lounge is really good.The one drawback about this hotel is that you can hear the room next door. We had a noisy neighbor who had drank too much. I called the front desk and the next thing I knew the bellman was at our door and they moved us to an even better room. Problem solved.If you are going to SF to shop, this is the place to stay. Take a walk through China town, then through North Beach up to Coit Tower. Its all easy to do from this location.

He staff were very friendly and helpful. Nice location at the top of Union Square. Starbucks, 7/11, restaurants, shopping center with upscale grocery store, etc, nearby. Rooms have been nicely renovated Grand Hyatt style. Used to be a Hyatt Regency, I believe. The only negative may be the plumbing and bathroom. Low water pressure, shallow bath owing to the age of the building. Parking across the street for cheaper price than the hotel.

My husband and I recently visited San Francisco for a long, romantic weekend. When I booked the Grand Hyatt, I was looking for something with a nice view and romantic amenities. They offered a romance package that included a high floor (aka view) room along with guaranteed late check out (3pm!), breakfast for 2 and champagne and chocolate covered strawberries upon arrival. The rate for all this was the same as the basic rate for a standard room at other hotels in the area so it was a great deal (I did have a AAA discount so that made it even better!).The room we stayed in was well appointed and very nicely decorated. The view - amazing! This is exactly what I wanted so complaints here! I will say the room was a bit smaller than I am accustomed to but it was so nice it really didn't matter.As for service, the staff went above and beyond. Our bellman has been around forever and had so much information to share about the area. He was so helpful.We asked if we could switch out the champagne for wine since my husband doesn't care for champagne. They said no problem. About 5 minutes after the wine was delivered, the room service manager called and asked if we'd opened the wine yet. I told them no. They said "Good, I sent you the wrong bottle and want to upgrade you to a better one". Honestly, didn't know what they were going to send and were happy they were willing to switch it out so a better wine was a plus.When we checked out, there was a minor mistake on our bill. They didn't ask questions, didn't argue, just took it off. I know this should be expected but in this day and age it is shocking to me how unclient-friendly some places are. NOT the Hyatt! Full client centered service the entire time!Overall, we had a great stay in a top notch hotel. I have to admit I was a bit sad they did away with their top floor restaurant but there are plenty of places in the area to get that romantic view with a nightcap.

We got an early check-in to a wonderful room with a view of the city, Coit tower and the bay. Floor to ceiling windows and everything newly remodeled. Modern yet warm. The bed was comfy too. At night the city lit up like a jewel box.The location is perfect for exploring the city. the staff was so helpful and answered all our questions about getting around the city.

Grand Hyatt is right in the center of all the happenings. A few steps away from Union Square makes it totally fab. All the awesome specialty stores are right in front of your very eyes. Great restaurants all within walking distance. Be sure to wear your walking shoes and get ready for a great experience. Fabulous city views from this hotel and friendly staff. The breakfast is to die for.

This is my go-to hotel whenever I have a business trip to San Francisco. The hotel is nicely located adjacent to Union Square and it's a short, pleasant walk to the conference center. The rooms are nicely appointed, and as long as you have a higher level floor, you'll get a nice view of the San Francisco skyline. Even if you don't, the gym is on the top floor and offers a great view. I'll also add that the gym is functional, if not small, but you can't expect too much being in downtown SF. Unfortunately, they no longer have a bar/lounge at the top floor which was one of my favorite parts of the hotel on my last trip. I also ordered room service which was good (I had the thai beef salad) reasonably priced as far as room service goes. I've stayed at the nearby W Hotel before and the Grand Hyatt is close to the same quality but a much better value.Other tips: - The paid WiFi is significantly faster than the free one so it may be worth the extra money - If you want to save some money and travel time, especially during rush hour, take the BART to/from Union Square. It's a very short walk from the station to the hotel

A good location next to Union Square so it's close to shops, restaurant. china town, tram lines etc. This hotel doesn't have a reception, just men in suits standing over their lap tops. The room we stayed in was classed as handicap accessible and for some reason there's a large gap at the base of the entry door so at night it's like sleeping in the hallway. We had to put a cushion across the door at night to stop the light from shining in and everytime someone shut their door I would wake up. We also had a connecting door with no soundproofing, especially when the kids next door kept opening their door in fascination, and then, of course they'd slam it shut. As I've seen in other reviews the bathroom doors just slide shut. Actually our door had a 2 inch gap, it wouldn't shut, let alone lock. We changed rooms, had a quieter neighbor and a bathroom door that shut but still the same gap under the entry door. The bathroom was nice but the towels were placed on the handicap bar next to the toilet which had no lid. That's really unsanitary, they need to find another place to store the towels. Don't think I'll stay here again.

The renovations complete, this hotel is excellently appointed and cared for. The staff is super helpful, the rooms are modern and top notch, and the views are great.The check-in experience is a bit different with several podiums in the lobby, allowing you to interact more personally with the desk clerks. You can also do a web check-in. My room some 25 stories up had a great view to the west that I could enjoy with a push of the button on the electrically powered shades. No broken curtain tracks and tacky sheers in this hotel. The TV had a good selection of channels and easily accessible input ports to connect to other devices. There were plenty of power outlets and an iPod dock on the clock/radio. The bathroom was excellent with stylish fixtures and everything in perfect working order.The fitness center is most of the 35th floor. It isn't the best in the city, but it has a great view and several cardio machines. The weight machines can get a little crowded early in the morning.The bar is nicely set up with fast service, however, it didn't have any light or simple appetizers available; only expensive and exotic choices. That will appeal to certain people and not others. I didn't try the restaurant. There's a Starbucks across the street.The hotel is located a half block off Union Square which makes it very convenient for shopping, access to the cable car, and several restaurants close by. It is a 10 minute walk to the Moscone. I hope to be able to stay here on my next trip to San Francisco.

My wife and I stayed at the hotel for an anniversary getaway. The hotel itself is very nice and well located, and our room, overlooking the City from the 33rd floor, was fabulous.
