But what really sold me on the experience was two instances of customer service.First, we arrived at about 8:45 pm on a Friday and I mentioned to the bellman that my wife was anxious to have some dessert. We were staying on the club level, which has dessert provided only through 9 pm, and he offered to go up to the club lounge and make sure they didn't put away the desserts before we arrived. Suffice it to say, due to his initiative, disaster was averted, we had a great dessert, and the stay was off to a good start.Next, the following afternoon, as we were about to head out to a show after a day of museum going and shopping, we received a call that the hotel had been trying to deliver a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries for our anniversary all day but we had our Do Not Disturb sign on the door. We quickly took the sign off the door and, when we returned later in the night, we enjoyed the unexpected and delightful gift, which made an already special occasion even more memorable.Bottom line: two thumbs way up for the Grand Hyatt.

Rooms are clean, location is decent, and service levels are on par with most major chain hotels. They brought me ear plugs in the middle of the night - nice touch. But rooms were very hot/stuffy. Overall there are no surprises at this hotel. The bar is worth a mention; nice view, nice room - check it out if you are killing time.

I recently had the pleasure of spending two nights at the Grand Hyatt located in Union Square in San Francisco. The room I stayed in was small, but nicely decorated. The atmosphere was cozy and comfortable. Rooms offer a Flat Screen TV, and a refrigerator that you can use. (not one of those overpriced minibars.) The bathroom had a good shower. Lighting was a little dim for my needs, but may be acceptable for others. Towels were not as fluffy as I like them to be, but were adequate. The beds were very comfortable. I would suggest requesting a Queen or King bed if you are traveling with your husband or significent other. The double beds in the double double rooms are small. The Grand Hyatt Union Sq offers hypo allergic rooms which I found to be terrific since I have many allergies. These rooms have a state of the art purification system to cut down on pollents. In the rooms there is a card that offers several diffferent (forgot at home) items that are offered complimentary. There is also an additional list of items that you can use while staying at the hotel. If you take them home you will be charged for them. The reception area as you enter was extremely appealing. The public lobby areas are beautifully decorated and have a fireplace. The Concierge was very knowledgeable. Service in general was very good. Located in Union Square you will find the best shopping in San Francisco. There are quite a few very good restaurants nearby. I stayed on the Stockton Side of the hotel and I could hear sirens at night but did not hear cars going by or street noise. Perhaps there is a quieter side of the hotel that you can request. High floor is also better. There is a health club on one of the top floors of the hotel which offer a great view and nice equipment. It was a very enjoyable stay.

I stayed at the hotel for a conference that my husband and I attended in San Francisco recently mainly because of its location and rate. After trying to select a hotel, I looked through amenities and prices and compared sites. Basically when you hear GRAND HYATT, you are expecting something really grand. However, the hotel is generally a nice downtown 4 star property. There is a fitness club on the top floor, free wifi throughout the hotel and complimentary water available. The hotel is very clean and has recently gone through a major renovation. The hotel's restaurants are quite pricey and may not accompany every palate. However, the location is right in front of union square and was very accessible to the convention center- although a small walk, the weather is great.

I couldn't have been made happier at this hotel, the staff were attentive helpful and friendly. We rang from LA a day early and requested an extra night which they kindly accommodated and also upgraded us to a king bed. The newly refurbished rooms are beautiful. (I also stayed here in nov 2011, so I know what the hotel was like before).The rooms were clean and the king bed was one of the best I have ever slept in.The new "one up" bar is beautiful, staff were friendly. Couldn't have found a nicer place to stay. The location is perfect, especially if you want to shop. One thing I found amazing is that when I spoke to the concierge regarding restaurants she gave me a list of all the great nearby ones, all grouped by cuisines and prices, which I think is fantastic for a holiday.

Excellent choice for business travelers, it's 1 block off Union Square, close to shopping and restaurants. The lobby is nice and comfortable, staff friendly. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and well appointed, if a tad bit dated.Concierge was very helpful and made some great recommendations on dining, shopping, and even a haircut I needed.Can't comment on food. I didn't dine in the hotel as there are simply too many great options in SF to be eating hotel food.Probably a half step below an elite level, but I would definitely return.

Friendly staff, breathtaking view (from the 31st floor), opulent (though expensive) breakfast, nice walk to the Moscone Center. I was recovering from foot surgery and the staff went out of their way to help with check in, bags, hailing cabs. Beautiful contemporary, spotless hotel in good location for shopping and site seeing. Room included cartridge-style coffee maker, awesome hair dryer, cable TV with all expected stations (local and national).

We stayed at this hotel during renovations but it really didn't cause any inconveniences. Although the main lobby was in full construction mode, the Concierge and Front Desk still operated at 110%. The Concierge was extremely helpful for dining suggestions and overall day to day itinerary. The location of the hotel is right in the middle of Union Square, great for shopping and starting point from overall attractions. If you need to rent a car, there is a parking lot right across the street along with Starbucks if you need your daily fix!Our room was extremely clean, great view and didn't have any issues with noise. There was a weird odor the first day almost smelling like cleaning products but we didn't notice it for the rest of our stay.

This is THE best HOTEL I have ever stayed at. The service was outstanding, visually the hotel is beautiful. The bar was excellent and had a wide variety of drinks, there was live entertainment both times we went into it. The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable. This is the only hotel I will be staying at in SF. If you are thinking of staying at this hotel, book it right now!!

Winning location. Room was fine. Nice view. Beautiful lobby atmosphere with fireplace and live music. Business hotel style, it almost likes other Grand Hyatt hotels all over the world. I had chosen this hotel, because of their brand and I am a long member of the Hyatt Gold Card. When we arrived at the hotel about 10pm, the front desk was so unfriendly until she saw that I have a Hyatt Gold Card. On the other hand, the concierge was pretty helpful, but for a couple of times we had to wait for about 20 minutes to be served, as nobody in charge in the concierge desk. I was thinking, is this really what you call a 5 stars hotel with service? We will be happy to come back but there are so many other good hotels choices in San Francisco, I definitely prefer to go to the other!

At the outset, I should reveal that we (my family) are Hyatt loyalists and stay at Hyatts every chance we get. We find the chain to be a fair priced moderate luxury chain on which we can depend. That said, we have often stayed at the San Francisco Grand Hyatt at Union Square. For the last dozen years we've found the hotel to be a great property, with a wonderful top floor restaurant and reasonably sized rooms. The staff, especially the restaurant staff, has treated us like family. Well, at least so in the past. This hotel just finished a huge remodeling and renewal of sorts. The top floor restaurant and bar (with amazing views) has been moved to the second floor mezzanine level. The rooms have been "modernized." On this trip (late Feb, early Mar 2013) we had four rooms for our group. Every person in our group complained about the new rooms. The bathroom does not have a real door, but instead a sliding partition like door that is smoked glass. If you are sharing the room with another person, and you get up in the night to use the bathroom, the light from the bath floods the entire room, and because the door is just a sliding partition, there is no privacy -- especially with noise. People in our group ending up going to the basement level public bathrooms for privacy rather than use the room toilets. The rooms, at least the ones that two of us stayed in, are smaller than in the past. The new age modern look actually looks cheap to us, and we don't think they are going to stand the test of time. We can hear through the walls, and noise from the hallways is pretty loud. We don't remember this from our previous eight or ten visits (pre-renovation). And while the restaurant staff is mostly helpful (especially George, a 22-year Hyatt employee), we had hot and cold experiences there. One night our food was great, the next service and food were very sub-par. And twice we had to get new keys because the present key wouldn't work (that seems to be a Hyatt problem, despite what the very curt and condescending front desk employee tried to lecture me about). It wasn't hard to get new keys, but the employees seemed very troubled or put-off by evening being asked to make new keys. Although we've stayed here so many times, we probably going to start exploring other S.F. properties for a new favorite. We'll still stay in Hyatts in other cities, but likely not in S.F.

My husband and I stayed here at the end of July 2012 for 4 nights. We had a town car bring us to the hotel from the airport and the hotel staff are excellent if you need a car or other transportation. There was renovations happening in the lobbey however despite this check in was a breeze and the staff was very friendly. We didnt notice much noise coming from the construction. I thought the price per night was very reasonable compaired to other modern hotels in the area. Our room was located on the 22 second floor and we had a view of the city and of Alcatraz, I thought the room was a very good size, the closet was big enough for me, and automatic blackout shades are a must in hotels now a days. The bed was comfortable too and there was a bonus area between the bathroom and bedroom which I thought was great. The restuarant on the 36 floor was good, the breakfast is better up there then ordering room service for almost the same price. The hotel is located right on Union Square so you can walk around at night and have something to see. We walked to AT&T park so anything is walking distance for us!! Overall I would stay here again.

Have stayed here three times in the past six months, as the renovations have progressed, have been blown away each and every time by what a first class job this property had done in recreating itself as a contemporary but service oriented property. Feels on a par with a Four Seasons, service is exceptional, physical renovation is fantastic, common areas are beautiful and upscale, the rooms are first rate and hi tech without being over the top. Food all around is great, and the gym has one of the best views you'll ever see. Staff all first rate, especially Tiffany, who helped me with last minute changes and was top notch in how she handled everything.

Very friendly staff and gorgeous rooms. Comfortable beds and good reviews. In the middle of good shopping.Only negatives are that the toilets are uncomfortabke and there's only power on one side of the room. Bring an extension cord.I would stay here again.

The new lobby looks great! What made my stay special was the service I received from your staff. When I arrived, I realized I forgot my collar stays. This is not a huge deal, but still it bothered me. I asked at the desk for a set and expected to receive some plastic stays which would have been great. What i received was a complete set of metal stays from Nordstrom. What this does is make me feel wanted, like you want my business again, which as a result you will have!

Stayed here for couple days, for business. Requested for room facing Union Square (it's right beside it) because I wanted to see the goings on. Perfect location if you want to be close to the shopping and couple blocks from Chinatown. I'm not bothered by noise so room was great! If you are a light sleeper, you will need ear plugs. I was able to hear street noise 12 floors up. You can block out light with the shade. If you're taking Bart from the airport, exit at Powell but its a few blocks walking along Stockton St. And you'll have to lift carry on bags up flight of stairs from subway. There was a lot of stores along the way so if you travel light, the walk is not a problem. Bed was comfortable, room was clean and had modern furnishings. I like the leather touches. I like the bed lights and selection of tv channels. Bathroom was clean, had spa scented toiletries. Love it! I don't understand why the negative reviews on the sliding door for the bathroom, I thought it was genius. Space saver.Felt safe walking around, even through Chinatown. Great cheap food around there, and great pastries. Moon cake and steamed pork bun, yum! I did eat at king of Thai at recommendation of front desk. If there's 2 of you, then the portions are good enough to share and get 3 dishes in total. Food was alright, had pad Thai, and papaya salad.Concierge was great. Recommended restaurants for Embarcadero, which was about 45 minute leisurely walk from hotel. There is cable car that you can take there, about $6 one way. Concierge also arranged for an airport shuttle pick up.I would stay here again if money was not a problem. It was about $179/night when I stayed in Feb.Fitness room was awesome if you go early. Great views!

We love Hyatt hotels, but usually stay at the Fisherman's Wharf hotel when in San Francisco. Although we still prefer the location on the Wharf, this hotel was really amazing inside. We went during the Christmas season and they actually had it snowing in the lobby! The layout of the hotel and it's lobby is quite breathtaking, and the service was excellent. They checked us in hours before check-in and offered us numerous upgrades. It "is" Downtown, however, and some of the area is a little sketchy (vagrants, etc.).

My wife and I spent a couple of nights here on a quick trip to SF and we were impressed with the recent renovations to the lobby and the rooms. The fireplace-library themed decor in the lobby was very warm and cozy. We also liked the closer interaction with the reception as they did away with the traditional bulky registration counter. The rooms are also very well appointed and modern. Downside is the acoustics. Granted the hotel can't do much about inconsiderate and loud guests but banging doors and hallway voices were way too audible. I'm hoping they can do something to improve acoustics. We also remember this hotel having a rooftop restaurant before but either that's gone or is still under construction. But this is San Francisco so finding a good restaurant is never a problem.

Great rooms, good technology, warm and hospitable decor on entrance. The room amenities are well chosen and very unique. I like the throwback colours after the recent renovation. By far the fastest internet I've experienced.

We stayed here two different nights this past President's Day weekend (on the front and tail end of a Sonoma vacay) - so my review is about two different rooms.First, I want to commend the front desk for being super helpful and so friendly. Both times, the check-in process was a breeze! For the first part of our stay, we arrived early (very very early!) and didn't expect to have our room ready. We were right -- our room wasn't available yet -- but they gave us a room to stay in while our real room was getting ready. Amazing. The front desk called us when our club room was ready a few hours later and all we had to do was switch the keys. Fantastic. Our first (real) room was a club level room (I used a platinum reward to upgrade). So lovely! Buttons when you enter the room to turn the lights on and have the shade rise; and to turn off all the lights and tv, etc. when you leave. And buttons right next to the bed to turn off all the lights; turn on the night lights; draw the shade down, etc. The room is super clean and modern, with nice wooden floors. Bathroom had a nice shower with glass doors. I LOVED this room and if I had only stayed in this room I would have given this place 5 stars all the way. The second room we got after we returned from Sonoma was a regular room on the 20-something-th floor. It was noticeably less-nice than the club floor (totally expected) -- without the little buttons, and with regular carpet and a bath with a shower curtain. This was all fine because I wasn't expecting the same little luxuries we got on the other floor. The only thing is that this room was LOUD! Like really really loud. We could hear our neighbors (singing!), the ice machine (across the hall!), the air conditioner, and street noise. Gym was nice and clean, with towels and water. :) Location is sooo nice if you love shopping. To give you an idea, it's right behind the flagship Levi's and Tiffany on Union Square. There are 2 Starbucks within 1 block that sell pastries from La Boulange. Yum!

We usually stay at the InterContinental on Howard, but we were looking for a bit more central location this trip, so we booked here. Wasn't sure what to expect, but we were pleasantly surprised. Our room on the 17th floor was newly refurbished and pretty spacious for a city hotel room. Bathroom was also recently redone and very nice. And the supplied coffee for the coffee maker is actually decent! (But there's also a Starbucks right across the street.) The gym on the 35th floor is greatâ€”floor-to-ceiling windows, brand new machines, decent weight selection. It's a bit small, but I'd take new machines over space. The main lobby/bar areas are nice, though as others have noted, the menus are limited. Location near Union Sq. is good, although busy, and there are a number of car rental places right nearby. We will definitely be booking here again.

Stayed here for 3 nights on a recent trip to SF since the Hyatt Regency Embarcadero was waaayyy too much money for my dates. I had never been to the GH, so it was a chance to compare. The location is good, as it is right in Union Square, and is walking distance to several areas, like Chinatown, the Embarcadero, Little Italy, etc. They recently renovated the hotel, and apparently the lobby has been redone. Check in is a very open area with a few desks placed in an open room, without specific "lines" or counters. Honestly, I found it a little disjointed and inefficient, especially if there are a lot of people waiting. The staff were friendly and helpful. The club lounge was decent, offering standard cold breakfast items, and a hot egg dish every morning. Nothing terrible but nothing to write home about. We had a great view from the 32nd floor, and the room itself was adequate. A little cramped, but nicely decorated, with wood panels and soft, comfortable beds. The bathroom was a good size and the shower was adequate in size and pressue. Overall, the hotel is nice and I had no complaints. I must say that overall I prefer the HR Embarcadero, just because I like the location better, and the slightly easier access to transit, plus I like the look of the hotel and view from the lounge more there as well. If the GH were markedly cheaper again, like it was this time, I would definitely stay there again.

After staying at a subpar Hyatt the prior week, I was a bit pessimistic about frequenting another Hyatt. Not only did this location meet expectations, it exceeded them. Rooms are beautifully done and very modern. I was pleasantly surprised with the overall quietness of the room given prior reviews. Plus the location right near Union Square can't be beat. I would gladly stay here again.

We had a suite on the 33rd floor with a remarkable view of the city. The room was nicely appointed and very tastefully-decorated. My only complaint was the heating and cooling in the sitting area. The thermostat would not stay on our chosen temperature. We had to continually reset it. Other than that, the coffee maker was nice, and the bed was comfortable. I especially liked the vanity area in the bathroom.The location is perfect, just off Union Square and a couple blocks from Chinatown. We walked everywhere we wanted to go.An odd thing for San Francisco, but the room service clam chowder was not good, and they didn't have the bread bowl offered on the menu.

Arrived via taxi and the conceirge abused our cab driver quite aggresively as he parked - not super professional. Got a tiny room on level 9 with no view (924 - for sake of avoidance). It was the only room on offer when we checked in. Air conditioning was very loud but couldn't turn it off due to warmth of room. Got an adjoining room (not requested) and the guests next to us had a baby who cried most of the night. No mini-bar so no bottled water on offer. No amenities apart for cheap shampoo and shower gel - everything else was on request. Bed was very comfortable. Maybe we just had a crap room and experience but next time I would choose a smaller more luxurious hotel. This place is very average overall if you get a average room.

The hotel has been renovated in recent years. Room was fresh and modern, big uplift from the last time I stayed here about 6 years ago or so. Comfortable bed. New furniture. Bathroom modern and new. Couldnt hear the neighboors, no rattling air conditioning, none of the usual US hotel nuisances. Free wifi throughout, which is great (and which was working reliably). The location is excellent: right next to Union Square. Excellent shopping and rest of the city easily accessible from here. The big negative: $45 for valet parking per day...what a rip off. The restaurant on mezzanine floor is ok, but the menu was quite limited. All in all, much improved from previous stays and pretty unbeatable location.

I got the 'refurbished' package deal - a lovely room on the 25th floor. Not quite a view over Union Square (and the hotel is actually one block away from the square itself) - but a good one, nonetheless.Bed - good/comfy/great pillowsWifi - free low speed, pay for higher speeds - so you can get your email without paying, but if you want to stream Netflix or play games you have to pay for it, Seems reasonableBathroom - high quality (although had to ask for a bathrobe). Even got complimentary toothpaste!Gym - not huge, but good quality machines/weightsrestaurant - didn't quite live up to the rest of the hotel. Looked good, but menu was a little limited, especially for breakfast.staff - everyone was very helpful

First time visitors to San Francisco and although a high level room was requested at time of booking so we could have a view of this wonderful city we were disappointed to learn we had been given the 5th floor. However upon asking at check in if a higher floor was available our request was granted if we could allow for a later check in time and within half an hour the room was ready on the 19th floor. (Thanks Ryan for going to the trouble). We were delighted with the room. Spacious, clean and every amenity you could ask for was available. Concierge was more than helpful (thank you Mark for all your recommendations) so that we could make the best use of our 3 nights here.Hotel is situated perfectly to all kinds of attractions and easy walking distance to many. A great stay and would highly recommend.

Stayed here for two nights over Valentines Day/Presidents Day weekend 2013. We stayed in a Grand Club room on the 31st floor, with a view of the city and it's beauty. Well appointed room, huge bathroom and comfy bed. Loved the electronically controlled window shade and the large shower. (The toilet is super loud! haha, it was like a plane taking off the first time we flushed it)The Grand Club lounge was on the 32nd floor, with a gorgeous view of the city and the bay. Cold drinks, ice, coffee, little snacks are available all day (and a welcome respite!) with a continental breakfast and appetizers/dessert in the evenings. Concierge helped us with a walking map and amazing place for breakfast our last day. Use them for any of your trip needs.The bar on the mezzanine level is really good, with decent drink selection. I liked the Moroccan cosmo, it had a really good spice taste to it. The special Valentine's Day drinks weren't my thing, but it's cool they tried to cater a view drinks to the day. We took BART from SFO to Powell St., then walked several blocks to the Grand Hyatt. It wasn't long, but there is a lot of construction going on and that last block is up hill, so be aware with your lugging your luggage. From SFO to Powell St. on BART, it was $8.10 and took about 30 minutes. We did take a taxi back to SFO, it took about 20 minutes (with no traffic) and was $45.Plentiful taxis in front of the hotel, a Starbucks across the street and Walgreens around the corner. Really good location!Definitely consider staying here!

We booked a 3 night stay at this hotel, specially due to its great location.It is half a block to all shops and restaurants you could ask for.At check in, we were offered an upgrade to their Club, by paying a fee. It was totally worth it since included internet, breakfast and snacks.Our room was recently renovated and with breathtaking views from the Bay...the only shame is that they didn't have a king size bed room, so we took double beds for the view.This is an excellent option in San Francisco, for sure!

I had stayed here years ago and hated it. I stayed here this time because of corporate requirements. A great location (even better than in the past due to build up). Great view, though I would have preferred a quieter room. Food at restaurants better than usual for a hotel. Housekeeping just okay. Fridge in room is TINY-- may not matter to all, but I could barely fit two containers of fruit. Love that you can open the window/door for fresh air.

Last minute trip with a friend, couldn't have asked for a better location for a first time visit to San Francisco. Centrally located whether you choose to explore on foot as we did (we went as far as the Golden Gate), or if cable cars and transit are your preference. Nicely renovated, friendly staff. The reception area is rather odd, not sure what they were going for but if it's a busy time it's a rather confusing set up. On weekends very LOUD music from the lounge/bar fills the entire lobby area. Felt like we were entering a nightclub as opposed to a hotel lobby! Rooms are very comfortable however windows are very thin so if you are a light sleeper bring earplugs! We were on the 31st floor and the noise from the street and Union Square could be heard loud and clear and our room wasn't even facing the square. That was the only drawback but with earplugs all was good! Would definitely stay again on a future trip.

This is a wonderfully located and newly refurbished hotel. Situated at union square, it is in walking distance to all of the great shopping places. The hotel has been recently done up, the rooms are spacious and modern and the bathrooms are lovely. Downstairs lobby is groovy and inviting. The staff are wonderful and friendly. Would definitely return here and was a very pleasant stay.

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco sits on a northern corner of Union Square in the city centre, so the location is excellent for all that the city has to offer. During my stay, I think the lobby was being renovated as it was quite small for the size of the hotel and was also not particularly in keeping with the style of the rest of the hotel, as it looked a little dated. The hotel has been renovated with light, bright walls and modern, wood effect surfaces. Itâ€™s pleasant and inoffensive. The room was of moderate size, very clean and had the most fantastic view of the San Francisco skyline. The bed was firm and comfortable. Lighting and curtains were controlled electronically. The bathroom was of moderate size, had a lovely modern white suite. Toiletries provided were the Hyattâ€™s own brand, Portico Spa, which I REALLY donâ€™t like! I wish Hyatt would change these, perhaps provide a nice branded set? The rooms provide high quality, comfort and good value for money. I had received a voucher as my partner is a member of Hyattâ€™s points scheme that enabled me to upgrade my room from a standard to a Grand Club king. This allowed access to the Grand Club lounge that offered drinks throughout the day including coffee (lattes too!), tea and bottled water. Food was also provided at breakfast, mainly continental offerings but one hot option was available each day and pre-dinner time hors dâ€™oeuvres and desserts. Everything in the lounge was of a very high quality and having access really enhanced our stay! It was lovely and the lounge had the same fabulous views as the room. The extra cost for the Grand Club room may be worth your while, or alternatively join Hyattâ€™s scheme and start racking up points when you stay, you might get the voucher too!! The hotel unfortunately doesnâ€™t have a swimming pool, which is a shame. The Grand Hyatt San Francisco provides exactly what should be expected from high quality hotel chain. This hotel is far superior when compared with the Hyatt Fishermanâ€™s Wharf, which I found was very underwhelming at a previous stay. I would certainly recommend the Grand Hyatt San Francisco and will consider staying again, when in the area.

Awesome view room of Union Square was perfect for my three night stay. My room was newly renovated and modern in design. Aside from some odd design features, I appreciated the remote controlled blackout window shade. I liked the morning coffee and pastry bar in the lobby. This bar's staff was helpful, cheery and professional. It was quick and easy. Requested synthetic bedding after checkin which was delivered pronto! Thank you.

The Union Square location was perfect for us, lots of shopping and of course the green area where we could walk our dog. The hotel has recently been remodeled so the rooms are very nice. My only complaint would be that hotels now seem to be putting in non-doors to the bathroom. By that I mean these sliding things that just don't close properly which translates into not as much privacy as one would like. So I vote for real doors hotel architects - not too much to ask for I hope. But back to the review - these folks could not do enough for us. We had our dog as I mentioned which can present some dining challenges but they did not have a problem serving us in the lobby seating area which was great. Nice couches and a couple fireplaces and bookcases - so somewhat homey and comfortable. The next night we had some friends join us for dinner and because of the number - there were 6 of us - they gave us a private dining room so Bernie (our dog) could join us. I had no problem with the bed and I usually have issues. Also room service in Union Square? Yeah you better be prepared to drop a bundle on that as in any nice hotel there, but there is a nice coffee bar with some cereals and muffins in the lobby that is a lot cheaper.

So, my point of view is from that of a mom with 4 month old twins. Here is what I loved:*the location was great! There is lots of shopping, things to do and public transportation within walking distance - and, for those of you who need it like I do, there is now a TARGET on Mission and 4th!! A ten minute walk away!*the staff was, with few exceptions, incredibly kind and helpful - front door staff, particularly, but everyone I interacted with was pleasant*loved the view from my 21st floor room*our king size bed was one of the BEST beds I have ever slept in, bar none. Super comfortable*towels were nice and big*concierge service was very good - we talked with them almost every day and they were very accommodating with our special needs :)*I liked the electric shade over the window to block out the sun during the day - it really helped because the room could get really hot in the mid afternoon in the sunshine*Loved the tv you could watch hulu and netflix on! Once we figured out how to work it and tech support did an update, we could watch our shows on the big screen*room was very cleanparts that were not as awesome:*the sliding bathroom door was fine for us with babies, but would've been really annoying had my older children been there - we couldn't figure out if there was any way to lock it?*we paid for the premium internet and it was pretty lame - like, almost completely unusable much of the time. My husband spent a lot of time on the phone with tech support but it was really frustrating. They did refund a good part of our money but I would've rather had working internet*the little fridge in our room did NOT get very cold, just cold enough to keep things from spoiling but not the kind of cold I like the milk in my cereal :). And it is quite little, we kept a few containers of yogurt, a 1/2 gallon of milk, a big of carrots and a baby bottle and that was about it. *one of the portacribs we'd requested was a nice Graco playyard - but the second was an old metal portable crib. I decided to use it since one of my babies doesn't move at all at night but had he been a mover, I would've requested another playyard. If you do request a playyard, I'd bring your own sheet from home because they didn't have one that size *you can't set the thermostat lower than 65, at least we couldn't in our room, and that midday sun really did heat up the room and the a/c couldn't even keep it at 65another tip: use the parking garage across the street on Sutter - you can pay the daily rate through your hotel bill (significantly cheaper than the hotel valet) and I always got my car right quick, friendly staff too

Are you kidding me! The room had these expensive sinks and lots of money spent on hard surfaces but the most uncomfortable bed ever!!! Old, lumpy mattress with scratchy sheets and no warm comforter. We sleep in the room- up dating your uncomfortable- worse EVER MATTRESSES WOULD GO A LONG WAY. If you want to get rest in your hotel room- stay somewhere else. Absolutely unacceptable!!!!

The Grand Hyatt is generally a very solid hotel. While we were largely satisfied with most things during our stay, there were, unfortunately, a whole series of little issues and inconveniences throughout that tended to take away from our experience. We want to emphasize up front that on balance this is still a very nice hotel â€“ centrally located, clean, and modern - but it could certainly benefit from a little more focus on its process and policy details. Things actually started off very well. Upon check-in we were voluntarily upgraded by the very friendly reception staff to a nicer room with a bay-side view â€“ which we really appreciated. However, while the room was nice and clean and had a very nice view, we quickly encountered a number of minor issues. For one, the in-room safe battery was dead (quickly fixed when reported). Secondly, the light switch did nothing (not sure if by defect or design), to the point that any light source had to be turned on manually during our stay (i.e. turn on each lamp separately). This is generally fine, but somewhat problematic when you come back after dark and have to look for a switch underneath a lampshade in the corner of the room. Thirdly, the sliding door to the bathroom was rather poorly designed, without ever fully closing, and didnâ€™t offer much in the way of privacy. Lastly, and more generally, a lot of features one would expect in a hotel of this class were only offered on a limited or on-request basis â€“ and this appeared to be mainly justified on the basis of the hotelâ€™s eco-friendly policy (slippers, daily bedding change, certain toiletries, etc â€“ all only upon request). Overall, this did irritate us just a little bit, as while we find it appropriate that one would have to ask for things that most guests may not need (like specific pillows or baby items, etc), it seemed excessive to have to ask for things that most guests would certainly find useful and could just as easily leave untouched if they did not need them (like slippers).To further add to our list of issues, we were mildly disappointed to discover that the a-la-carte breakfast menu that is so prominently displayed on the hotel website is not what is offered when you have â€œbreakfast includedâ€ù in your room rate. In truth, the room rate breakfast offers you access to a fairly good, albeit rather limited, breakfast buffet. Now, not to say that the food was in any way poor, as it was fresh and inspired, but the selection was relatively limited and we felt a little misled in having paid for breakfast in the room rate but not having access to any of the items on the menu. The room rate breakfast also causes some confusion with both serving and billing. First, the servers will always give you the a-la carte menu when they seat you, but it wasnâ€™t until we asked (and we really should not have had to ask) that we found out that we had already paid for something else and the menus were effectively meaningless (unless we wanted to pay for a different second breakfast). Second, even with the buffet, youâ€™re still required to sign your name to a bill as if you were buying the buffet option as a walk-in guest (when in fact this cost has already been paid and will not appear a second time upon checkout). It just seems like this process could really be simplified and improved upon, and some very unnecessary confusion can be avoided through better communication. In addition to this, the breakfast on our first day was truly a comedy of errors (and we say this in good humor, as we just took it in stride and largely laughed it off): we were given water when we asked for orange juice, the potatoes were undercooked, the tea failed to brew properly, and our table was cleared and given to another couple in the brief moment we got up to go grab dessert! (we literally came back to find someone else sitting in our seats) To be fair, things went notably more smoothly throughout the remainder of the trip.As noted earlier, although this list of issues may seem lengthy, they are not major in any sense, and our experience was still generally positive. By any measure, despite everything, we still feel that this is a very good hotel â€“ very centrally located near Union Square, complimented by polite and helpful staff, and nicely decorated in a clean modern style. A few small policy tweaks by management aimed at eliminating the issues and inconveniences we noted above and this hotel would really leave you with very little to complain about.

The room is clean and comfortable, the location is great, near the Union Square, the Hotell is very beautifull and that's all! The breakfast for 2 adults and 2 children costs U$ 100.00, but the main reason that made me rate as 2 stars was the Internet. They offer a free wifi Internet access that is terrible! They must know it, as when you proceed the login it's offered an upgrade for a faster access paying U$ 14.00 per day. The fact is that doing this the quality of the access changed from terrible to poor, whith the acceptable connection being archived only near the room's door (!!!!), whith all of the different devices (notebook, iPad and iPhone).They also charged U$ 5.00 to bring to the room a box that arrived on my behalf. The problem is not the amount as its only 5 dolars, but the fact of having brought and then charged without previous information.The Bathroom: There was only 3 towels and we was a party of 4 and the shower had a very weak flow.Me and my family was in SF as tourists in the ending of a 16 days trip trough California and this hotel was the only one that probably will not see me and my family again.

The Grand Hyatt is just off Union Square giving it a perfect central location for exploring San Francisco. The rooms are updated and the beds are very comfortable. The amenties in the bathrooms are upscale. The service was great. We had very noisy people in the next room and called the front desk. They immediately sent security up to handle the situation and it was resolved within 10 minutes! Then we got a follow up call from the hotel manager. Very impressed!

We expended our summer vacation in the beautiful city of San Francisco, and based on the reviews we decided to book Grand Hyatt. This hotel is excellent, great location in the heart of San Francisco, right in Union Square, new furniture and decoration, very clean, friendly and helpful staff; although there was a construction in the lobby, we did not noticed it. Overall, we had a wonderful experience and fully recommend this hotel.

I stayed here for 5 nights in December while attending a conference. The hotel itself is in a great location, right next to Union Square, in the heart of the shopping district and a 10 min or so walk to the Convention Centre. I read that the hotel had recently been renovated so I was exciting about arriving but unfortunately it was not as â€˜grandâ€™ as I had imagined with a relatively dim lit reception area with 4 or so laptops. I had to wait 10 mins to check in as there was a queue of people, not really queuing (as there is little space), more milling around. My room on the 6th floor was comfortable but had a horrible view. I was ok with that as I wasnâ€™t there for most of the time. One of the most annoying things was the heavy rain and wind on the first night which made a really loud creaking noise in the room every time the wind blew. I was up most of the night, despite the 11 hr flight from London, and ended up going down to reception at 5am to speak to someone about it. I explained I was 5 months pregnant, travelling alone, and how I needed some sleep with work the next day, but all she did was say that lots of other people had complained, offered me ear plugs and said she was expecting too. I knew there was not much she could do but she didnâ€™t have to be rude about it. I didnâ€™t find the staff half as friendly as other hotels I've stayed in. When I was checking out, the guy at reception even said â€œare you still here?â€ù I felt the same way. I couldnâ€™t wait to get out of there. Iâ€™ve stayed at many Hyatts in the past as Iâ€™m a Gold Ppt holder. Despite our conference being in SF every year, Iâ€™m sad to say I wonâ€™t be staying here again.

The Grand Hyatt has been renovated recently and our room was very nice - and,of course, the location is the best! But what was even more impressive was how excellent the staff was - professional yet friendly - totally "at your service" and always with a smile. We were so pleased to be given a room on the 29th floor with a stunning city view - it made for a great stay. An extra touch was a welcoming email from one of the managers with the assurance that everything would be done to make our stay "exceptionally satisfactory" - which it truly was!

We have been to this hotel before and it has certainly gone down hill. On the face of it the hotel has been remodelled, but it has been a negative not a positive. The beds and pillows are really not good and the reception service not great. We had a drink in the bar, which is nice, but I have never so many people behind a bar doing nothing. When I went to the bar it was too much for one to just serve I was told its table service so you then wait 10mins for that while you watch 6 guys behind the bar do sod all! Good way to get tips up, but USA is driven that way. Overall wont stay here again and more a business (on expenses) experience. Overall not good, but a great location. The stay was finally finished off when the town car we took got pulled over by the cops on the way to the airport.... Possibly the worst driving I have every seen!

Spent a weekend here on vacation. It's at a great location near Union Square, Market Street, Chinatown and Nob HIll. Positives - 1. Lovely large room 2. Recently remodelled, so everything is pretty much brand new. 3. Bathroom supplies are nice and unconventional - ginger body lotion and cucumber soap. 4. Room had a large closet and a dressing table and chair. 5. Breakfast buffet and ala carte menu is pretty good. Had the eggs benedict - nice. Restaurant staff are attentive, perhaps a tad too attentive. 6. Hotel can arrange a shared shuttle to the airport for US$16.Negatives - 1. No master control switch for lights next to bed. 2. Switches for bedside lamps are hard to find. 3. Free Wifi is slow and hard to connect to. 4. Think only 1-2 lifts out of 6 lead to the Mezzanine level where breakfast is served. A little confusing. 5. Would have been nice if reception had asked if I needed information about the city. Got that a day later from the Concierge.

I stayed in an executive suite for 2 nights. It had 2 full bathrooms, one with a tub for our girls and another with a shower only. It was nice to get ready for my meeting without disturbing my family. The location can not be beat. The renovation was excellent. The Grand Lounge had an amazing views. The staff in the lounge was wonderful, he saw that I needed and extra chair and brought it over before I had a chance to ask. Would definitely stay here again.

Stayed at this hotel three nights. this was my first stay after the renovation and I see there is a significant improvement. room is efficient. strange looking sink. everything except bathtub in the room seemed renovated. friendly staff. great location. as we all know we should not expect much from big American chain hotels (Hyatt, Hilton, Sheraton, Marriott, etc.) in the us unlike the ones in Asia, this hotel was one of the better one in the US.

After our 14+ hour flight from Australia and a shower, it was fabulous to crawl in to the exceptionally comfortable bed...!! Very impersonal registration process, you look for reception desk to find there are some benches with laptops and when you step up to one a receptionist walks over, books you in and hands you your keys - at AU$227 a night I was expecting a little more. The room was great and you could not have asked for more in regards to position though. Disappointed with the buffet at their OneUP Restaurant - see my review. FORGOT TO MENTION: Could not believe to see people stepping out of elevators with dogs on leashes as we were waiting. DOGS staying in hotel rooms??? YES!!

This hotel is in the best of locations in Union Square. The recent facelift is beautiful however the loud pounding music( noise) competing with the enthusiastic chatter throughout the reception/ mezzanine area in the early to late evenings is very negative. One can't hear to converse in the lobby sitting area whether it be with a companion or staff member. What a shame. It seems that this hotel is trying to compete with W hotels in a non favorable manner. Oh by the way the loud pounding music is piped in when you get off the elevator, yet another reminder. One saving grace is that once you get to your room you've arrived to a quiet haven and the rooms are nicely remodeled.

I really did not see anything wrong with this Hotel for a four star rating. The rooms were just remodeled. the bar and restaurant had just opened (brand new). THE ONLY CRITICISM i had was its a weird front desk. I personally like a grand entrance with a big impressive front desk, art work and attentive hotel staff behind it. This hotel just a table with a a staff person at it with a computer.There were about 6 or 8 tables in the lobby and that was it, maybe its the new thing.I would look on all the discount site for your stay here because you can get it for under $200 a night.Also if your driving opt for the Self Park option only $36. per night with in and out privileges and its about 1/4 block away. The regular hotel parking is $56.You are in the heart of San Fran so don.t eat in the hotel. There are plenty and I mean plenty of restaurants with in walking distance.

Came on a business trip for a convention in the hotel. Location was excellent and the guestrooms well appointed clean and updated with many plugs and outlet beautiful bathrooms.My room as quiet on the 22nd floor and had a great view.The service at the hotel was less than ordinary. Being in the hospitality business, I travel extensively and had high expectations for the Grand Hyatt. Check in and check out was less than satisfactory and waiter service at the restaurant was lacking in service. Had eggs for breakfast and no toast was even offered, It was not a great experience and I do not suggest eating in the hotel, it was less than perfect and expensive.

After a week on business it was nice to have a night in this great hotel right in the heart of they city. Love the location! Close to all the great shopping. The hotel was lovely. The valet greeted us and informed us of an assisted self service parking option across the street which also allows in and out access - much cheaper than most downtown options.Check in was easy with their open check in space. Room was clean, beautiful, and comfortable. Was a wonderful stay. And Internet was free to boot!

I'm a business traveler who unfortunately spends far too much time in hotels. My review foucses on the Grand Hyatt San Francisco reservations staff. While attempting to make my booking, the staffer seemed very annoyed with the questions I had, regarding the rates for the Regency club room and specific room locations. I also inquired about Rack /Amex / AAA rates. It was strange, since I've never had a bad experience with their folks before. I have stayed at other Grand Hyatt properties with little issue, surprised and a little dissapointed. -Ed

My wife and I stayed at this Grand Hyatt for New Year's Eve and found the reciently completed remodel excellent. The hotel was packed beccause of the holiday but the new "tripod" check in desks made for quick, easy, and fast service. The room remodels also are very guest friendly as well as beautiful with thoughtful additions such as electrical connectors in the side of the night table and communications panel in the side of the television cabinet in living room. I am not sure of the cause, but the new elevator system had a glitch while we were there leaving only two of the cars running. This caused a back up and delay getting up and down from your room. The staff were very gracious in handleing the unhappy patrons and repairs were immediately started. Good customer service is easy under normal circumstances. It's when a problem arises that true colors are shown and I have to say the staff rose to the occation. Good job!

This hotel is perfect in it's design, which is contemporary, sleek & modern. It's location is also perfect, within walking distance to many of the sights, i.e. Chinatown, shopping. The service is excellent, from check-in to doorman to conceriege to waiters. We had a bay view room, & it was perfect & a beautiful sight to wake up to each morning. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

I was searching for something reasonable to attend a wedding around Union Square and found a $159 deal on an executive suite at the Grand Hyatt.Considering the room was in fact a 1 bedroom 2 bath suite it was fantastic. I understand the property was recently remodeled and now the rooms have every high tech feature and toy you can dream of from power window shades on. In fact it was almost confusing to control the room at times.So if you are considering JW or any of the other 5 stars in downtown, then check here too. And for that matter if you can get a deal like I did, then consider it the best deal in town, look no farther.Happy Traveling,Uncle Eric

It's just next to the Union Square. Walking distance to Chinatown, restaurants and shopping malls. Great customer service. They offered gifts to the kids at their front desk. Self parking is just across the street for about $32 plus tax per night. Definitely recommended.

Where does one start, great Hotel, great service, great bar, shopping.... Hello! This is in shopping central allowing for furtive sessions in Macy's and time to drop back in the room before visiting the Levi store (30 seconds away), Porsche Design shop etc etc.... Forgot to mention I was on business and one of the best Steak Houses.... Mortons. Food to die for, they serve just steak and you choose the sides!

I love staying here. I enjoy seeing so many regulars on the staff. Place has minimal turnover. The move to downsize the check in area - make it more personal, built around lap tops also works for me. And always, the bowl of peppermint taffy. Was great to be back.

I am a gold passport member with HYATT and it comes with lots of goodies and surprises.so my reason for staying in Hyatt properties is obvious.Although it is always good to advice on your priorities beforehand so that you don't get dissapointed last minute.Hotel is very well located in the heart of downtown union square , restaurants, theater, nightclub, lounges and cable car to wharf on adjacent corner.It is also a treat to the shopoholics because the hotel is surrounded with all the fancy brands.Good breakfast and comfortable rooms.I understand that they are recently renovated lobby.I particularly like the bay view room .OneUP restaurant has amazing wine collection and yummy californian menu.It is also a great venue for conference.

we stayed at hyatt fishermans wharf(see review on that) then we transferred to this hyatt for our shopping day, since all the stores are practically right outside the door. Everything from the entry to the lobby was just amazing and beautiful we were told it just went through a huge renovation. After your done with the touristy things and you just want to shop and walk through the shopping mall this would be the ideal hotel to stay at. we were on the 31st floor and we had a nice view. The staff was incredible we had a very nice front desk csr name Jazelle who took care of checking us in and going through all the fine details very nice young lady. Everyone from the porter to front desk houskeeping regency club attendants everyone associated with that hotel seem to be really enjoying their jobs. The hotel was clean rooms comfortable and location unbeatable. Would highly recommend this property.

Staff was great, renovated rooms smaller but very nice. The main we have returned on many occasions was the amazing top floor restaurant and lounge, which had breathtaking views in a comfortable and relaxing setting. Since renovation, the restaurant is now on the mezzanine and the views are reserved for conference rooms. There are many great hotels in this area, and loss of the top floor to guests have hurt.

I loved this hotel, it is pratically new, the service is good, we had good concierge who gave us some really good advice on where to go in the city, rooms are very nice, but the highlight is the amazing breakfast view from the rooftop!Great option for business, couples, families or solo!

3rd time for me at the Grand Hyatt, now totally renovated, the lobby is beautiful, fireplaces, cozy sofas and all the staff is really professional. I had a room on the 21st floor with a stunning view on Union Sq. Rooms are nice and simple, super-clean and very quiet; this is a really good hotel in a strategic position. I will come back for sure at Grand Hyatt in San Francisco, my best choice in town... and I am a very picky traveler!

I've stayed here many times over the past 20 yrs. It's a great location for shopping and dining right near union square and the cablecar line. It's been redone recently - modern, functional, but not the best quality. The beds, bathroom, and size of rooms are very good. Great food for breakfast. The conceirge staff is great - do ask them for help and reccomendations. Get a room on a high floor overlooking the square and the hills of San Fran.

This is a really nice choice if you are interested in being downtown by the Ferry Building. Many of the rooms have views of bay and most of them have balconies, which I think is a really great given the room ventilation issues with most hotels of this size. We stayed on one of the club levels --- I'd recommend doing this since there a great view from the lounge on the top floor and the food there is quite good. Service is great and the rooms are well designed. This is a hotel that won't blow your socks away but will likely do a terrific job at serving as a comfortable, convenient base as you explore San Francisco.

We stayed here for 7 nights whilst attending a conference. The room was modern, spacious and well-equipped and the hotel is in the perfect location for visiting Union Square and the conference centre. The new bar and restaurant which opened on the last night of our stay was very nice but expensive. Unfortunately, we had not been informed when booking via the conference website of the building work that would be undertaken during our stay which meant that the new reception area and bar/restaurant were not available for 6 out of the 7 nights. There was a shabby-looking cash only bar on the top floor which was only open from the early evening and not open at all on some evenings and a wildly-overpriced buffet service restaurant with limited opening hours available for food which resulted in us having to go out elsewhere for all of our meals and drinks. When pointing out that we were disappointed about the lack of facilities available during our stay the gentleman on reception merely replied 'yes, the bar is closed' without looking up from his computer and did not apologise or suggest an alternative facility in the area. Not the service we would expect from this standard of accomodation.

I've stayed at many Hyatts, and this is one of the best. It's a classic beauty and the service level is top notch. Their Regency Club is the best I've been in. I strongly urge you to book a Club package if you are not a Diamond Member. (In which case it is complimentary.) David made the Regency Club experience unforgettable. He is simply a kind and gracious addition to the experience. Bedding is super comfortable, and I ended up spending more time in bed than I had planned. The location cannot be beat, as we were able to walk to Chinatown, Nob Hill and even Fisherman's Wharf from here. I consider this Hyatt a destination, and I will be making another trip here in the near future.

I had never stayed at this hotel and I was pleased with the location and service. The have been renovated to a very high standard from both business and casual traveler. The views are tremendous. My only complaint is the restaurant is more then a little over the top for breakfast. Other then that this a great location in SF.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 5 nights whilst in San Francisco for a conference.Despite having 'man flu' the whole time I was in San Francisco I still very much enjoyed my stay and found the hotel very comfortable, quite and relaxing.The view from my room was superb and the view from the restaurant is even better. The location right in the centre is also excellent.The service and care from the staff was great too. In short I would love to return for a personal holiday with my wife some day.

First of all I feel guilty for not writing this review many months ago! I hosted a grand luncheon for a special birthday for 30 ladies in feb. 2012. From the planning stage till it was finished everything went smoothly. I work with a lady named Kaleen Bartlet and she was most gracious, accommodating and very professional.It was at their event room on the top floor! Breathtaking views! Everything was done according to my specification. Had 4 course sit down meal which was executed perfectly. The waiting staff, the bar tender and the supervisor were all very courteous and professional.Only thing I Had a problem with was their "corkage" fee and policy. I guess I should have paid more attention. Make sure you choose your minimum for the event and whether it is cheaper to get their wines instead of bringing your own.

We stayed at this hotel over Christmas. The weather was gloomy, but the location could not have been better.From check in to check out the experience was wonderful. It is a whole unique experience. The check in desks look more like casual computer stations. It is a new concept and confusing when you are looking for the standard check in desk. Hyatt thought of that aspect too. There are several Hyatt employees in the lobby to immediately assist you.Our room was ready even though we checked in early and we were quickly escorted up to the room. We stayed on the 19th floor, and upon entering the room we had this amazing view of the city surrounding Coit Tower. It was such an impressive entrance to a room. The room was done in a sleek modern style that was also extremely inviting. We could have comfortably relaxed in this room with the amazing view, but Union Square with all of the holiday finery was just around the corner. We could easily walk to Chinatown also.As far as the bar and restaurant facilities, I think the hotel was lacking in this area. The service in the bar was impeccable, but it was a very strange design with odd furniture. At peak bar times, seating was at a premium. The restaurant left one cold. We ate there Christmas eve. There were 5 selections and left us hungry when we left. To compound this on Christmas we had lunch there since we were departing that afternoon, and it was the same menu. I am sure the cooks put together this special menu, but a simple hamburger would have been a nice choice also.There are several unique items that they have decorated the hotel with. We enjoyed our stay but as far as things to do in the hotel on cold wet rainy San Francisco days, or to get away from the crowds, this hotel is very limited. It was such a perfect location.While we were there the ASU football team was there to play Notre Dame, so our visit has lots of screaming kids in the lobby, not to mention leaving big messes (open food containers, apple cores, potatoe chip bags etc.)that the staff quickly cleaned. The staff was beyond exellent and so was the location. Go confidently that it is a marvelous hotel.

Very good location very pleasant staff, before I arrive I got an email that protest at the front gate, but the staff they did there best to help my to reach the front disc, really every thing was great. The hotel was a bit noisy even my room at the 12th floor.

The Grand Hyatt is our favorite San Francisco hotel, and we've enjoyed it for several years. We love the spirit of the Union Square, and appreciate it even more when the Ice Skating is on. Hotel service, comfort, friendliness, etc. is always perfect.It was beyond disappointing to learn that the 'Grand Views' bar on the upper floor is no longer serving hotel guests.... The 'Grand Views' truly belongs to the San Francisco 'must see' list. Hate to find this enormous downgrade to otherwise joyful stay.I consider the recent renovation a success: modern hotel style is very appropriate for San Francisco. I expect some modern, but nonsense bar furniture is replaced by now, or will be replaced soon. We were so sorry for the waiters missing extra-narrow bar tables!

With construction complete the Grand Hyatt San Francisco is my new place to lay my head when my wife and I go to SFO. There was a sophistication that came with the hotel. The halls were not filled with yelling children, nor were the elevators lined with drunken adults. Over the Thanksgiving holiday we assumed there would be families and tourists galore. We made the getaway from our family tables looking for a good time, so naturally we assumed others would do the same. They did come out in droves, but all were well behaved. The hotel is right next to Union Square. If you have ever been to San Fran, you are well aware of how crowded Union Square can get. Being that it was Black Friday and the Christmas Tree Lighting Ceremony the street surrounding the hotel were closed. After the initial day after Thanksgiving shock, the street opened and getting in and out of the hotel was much more tolerable. Market St, the main street is just a few blocks away. From there we were able to get to every part of the city with the clipper card. Chinatown was a short quick walk about 2 blocks away. The Warf is a nice 20 minute walk through North Beach and Chinatown. The remodel was fantastic. We had a large room on the corner, which allowed for the bathroom to be in a different position. It was at the back of the room, down a short hallway. With bathrooms normally off the entrance to the room it was nice to have it isolated. It kept the light out of my eyes while my wife got ready in the morning. The beds were comfortable, the TV was large, and the aesthetics were pleasing. My favorite was the automatic curtains. I was like a child playing with a new toy every time I opened and closed the curtains from the warmth of my bed. We happened to get a special for $150 a night including breakfast and WIFI. The WIFI signal was sufficient. I wasnâ€™t streaming movies so it didnâ€™t matter the speed anyhow. The breakfast was ok. It was trying a little too hard. I am a basics type of guy. The sour cream and shallot scrambled eggs were a little much. This is San Fran! If you are going to put stuff out for the guests to eat you better keep on par with the other 150 restaurants serving amazing breakfast. We tried it one day and didnâ€™t go beck the next 2. We were happier going and paying for something we truly enjoyed. Besides the food, the hotel was great. A convenient location, great design and formidable service make the higher price worth it.

A great hotel to access downtown San Francisco. Right next to Union Square and great shops and restaurants. A short walk to Chinatown , so you can enjoy the city. It is a short cab ride to San Francisco wharf 29. Great views of downtown San Francisco start at about floor 24. The only drawback is that when the hotel is filled it takes forever (10-15 minutes) to ride the elevator .

It's been approximately 10 years since I have stayed at this hotel. I chose it for its location. I remember it as sort of outdated. Wow, I was so pleasantly surprised by its recent renovation. I loved the warm wood tone colors throughout. I was especially pleased by the new open check in process. The staff was overly friendly.The rooms were beautiful. We stayed in room 2815 and had a beautiful view of the bay on both sides and of the city. Other family members stayed in room 810 and had a great view of Union Square, the Christmas tree, ice rink and Macy's beautifully decorated windows. The beds were so comfortable. I also loved the lounge where there were comfortable couches and even live entertainment to enjoy. The atmosphere was both relaxing and fun. I will definitely stay here again.

Great view, comfortable bed, fridge, quiet room, in a well run, well located hotel.$280 per night was good value for SF.Try the bar after dinner for good live music in an attractive setting. One block from Union Square.

Grand Hyatt SF is in a great location, has a great front desk team - and a open front desk plan, so it itself is an experience. The hotel just finished a renovation and it is well done! Very modern hotel, but warm and inviting. Hyatt always uses great products, the amenities in the room were outstanding. We had a room on the 30th floor and the room featured hardwood flooring! This is only on their top floors and suites as far as I know - great addition! No shortcuts were taken in the renovation which was nice - everything seemed brand new. These are city rooms so keep in mind they run smaller in size, but this room was of good size. Great views and easy to get to. Valet parking can be a little tricky if there is a lot of traffic but they stayed on top of keeping everything moving.The Grand Club was amazing! They did a stellar job in design and it flows well - the staff in the lounge is outstanding and kind. The drinks in the club lounge were exceptionally well priced - I was amazed - If I remember beers are $3 and mixed are $4! Anyone that uses club lounges knows that is a pretty fair price! Esp. for a downtown property!The only gripe was that it seemed they had one elevator working - we had to wait a while for the elevator every time - the hotel was busy with NYE, but it was a hassle.Stay here if you enjoy the Hyatt brand or want a prime location in SF. It is right next to Union Square without being in a shady area.

Settled just with union square, it's just a few steps away from shops like Levi's and others. Moreover it's no more than a 10 minute walk to Chinatown, hence making it's strategic location a plus point. The lobby was "slickly" furnished and the people at the front desk were very accomodating and friendly. The room was beautifully furnished , spacious , clean and had all the items you could ask for. The flat-screen tv showed a wide variety of programmes in HD and the bed was soft and very comfortable. We stayed on the 26th floor and the view of union square that we had was magnificent at night. The only problem we encountered was that the concierge made several mistakes. Firstly when we asked for a morning call on one of the days, it wasn't registered and hence we didn't get it. Secondly, when we signed up for the airport shuttle stating that we wanted the bus to reach at 8.30am, the shuttle didn't come and stated that the hotel put our names down for the 9am slot instead of the 8.30 one. However the frontdesk was kind enough to take a certain amount off our entire bill as compensation.Overall, my family and i did enjoy our experience there and would definitely visit there again !

My husband and I had a great time in this hotel. We celebrated our second honeymoon in San Francisco. We stayed at a room with a breathtaking view of San Francisco. The breakfast was good enough for us, nothing to complain. The hotel is very well located, many interesting places within a walking distance.

The hotel is very modern and "Slick". The rooms are nice and the staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. However, did not like the restaurant or bar. They used to have a restaurant and bar on top of the hotel that had a wonderful view. But they changed it all and put it on the mezzanine level. Why? Second of all they stole my IPAD!!!! Don't trust the housekeeping staff.

Newly renovated hotel provides very comfortable rooms. Views from the 19th floor and above are spectacular. Location on Union Square means you can walk to shopping and dining. BART, Muni, Cable cars and buses are all a short walk. This can all be had at other properties. What sets this hotel apart are the people. We're checking in at 5:30 pm on a Wednesday. The young man at the desk tells me the suite is not ready, he'll take care of the bags and sends us to the lounge for a glass of whatever. I'm in business. I know things go wrong. The lounge service is very good and the tomato soup is outstanding. The young man comes up to collect us and show us to the room. The bags arrive all is in harmony. The young man calls a little later to inquire about our room, everything is fine. He then tells me he's going to send up a bottle of wine and an appetizer. I tell him it's not necessary, he insist. Next day I call the concierge to inquire about some mail that should have been there. He tells me it's not in the system but he'll go down to the mail room later. We come back from shopping there's the mail on the table. I went down to get his card and show my gratitude. I have nothing but positive feedback about house keeping, room service, the bellmen,and the staff at the Grand Club. I'm a diamond member and the PEOPLE at Hyatt consistently remind me why I like their brand. And why I wouldn't stay anywhere else in San Francisco. I noticed a member of Hyatt reads these reviews. Why did you close Grandviews?

We have stayed at Grabd Hyatt every Christmas Holiday for the last 6 years. It has always been consistent and a pleasant experience. The hotel has just finished a major interior renovation - it's nice, Eco friendly, and a bit minimalistic in style. However my two complaints are the front desk check in area as well as the front desk service. The check in area is now a few table like desks instead of the traditional reception counter. It was very confusing to figure out who was waiting in line and when the next reception agent was available. Having stayed here several times over the years this was the first occasion that the reception and check in was far less than acceptable. Our reception agent was not friendly nor was he interested in assisting us in getting a decent room location. We are situated in a corner next to the housekeeping closet. Each time we have exited our room and returned the closet is open and there are housekeeping carts blocking our way in to our rooms. Even after going back downstairs and inquiring again about being relocated even at a higher price we were told there was nothing he could do. Not being able to relocate us is a bit unbelievable but what was worse was the reception agent's complete lack of concern for our satisfaction. Very disappointing and we may check out tomorrow and go elsewhere. The Marriott up the street was very nice when we cruised by and sadly after many years of memories here we will most likely make this our last stay.

We have stayed at Grabd Hyatt every Christmas Holiday for the last 6 years. It has always been consistent and a pleasant experience. The hotel has just finished a major interior renovation - it's nice, Eco friendly, and a bit minimalistic in style. However my two complaints are the front desk check in area as well as the front desk service. The check in area is now a few table like desks instead of the traditional reception counter. It was very confusing to figure out who was waiting in line and when the next reception agent was available. Having stayed here several times over the years this was the first occasion that the reception and check in was far less than acceptable. Our reception agent was not friendly nor was he interested in assisting us in getting a decent room location. We are situated in a corner next to the housekeeping closet. Each time we have exited our room and returned the closet is open and there are housekeeping carts blocking our way in to our rooms. Even after going back downstairs and inquiring again about being relocated even at a higher price we were told there was nothing he could do. Not being able to relocate us is a bit unbelievable but what was worse was the reception agent's complete lack of concern for our satisfaction. Very disappointing and we may check out tomorrow and go elsewhere. The Marriott up the street was very nice when we cruised by and sadly after many years of memories here we will most likely make this our last stay.

Stayed two nights before x'mas. Right next to the Union Square and in the core of the downtown area. Very convenient, don't need a car. Hotel was new renovated, looks good. But had a weird smell in our floor and the room. Elevator is very slow. Have 6 elevators but still have to wait more than 5min on average. Once we were going up and some guests got in the elevator and said they've been waiting for 10mins. They were actually going down but couldn't wait any longer.The first night we received 3 phone calls around 1:30AM. My husband picked up the third one the staff said he was confused and asked us to confirmed how many people were staying. We went to the front desk the second day and was told that another guest with the same name check-in the hotel at 1AM. The staff just wanted to make sure that they were not with us. But still, there was no other way but calling the guest during the midnight???We went to their lounge located at the MZ level for drinks twice. We had the same server for both nights. No greetings, no smiles, no nothing from her. The second night we wondered if they have sweet potato fries, she simply said "No" and left. When we asked for the bill she literally slipped the bill on our table without one word and walked away.

Lobby is nearly finished and looks great fire pits outside,fireplaces inside very nice when you come in from the cold weather breakfast buffet was great. Room was great ,nice beds fast elevators excellant hotel!!

The hotel is located right on Union Square so is right next to the main shopping area. The rooms looked recently renovated. While not the largest rooms I have stayed in they are nonetheless clean and modern. The beds were comfortable and the A/C was easy to use and quiet and the room included all the basic amenities. Having stayed at previous Hyatts everything was as expected from a leading hotel chain. The staff were always very helpful and very accommodating to our requests during out entire stay and the bellhop was especially helpful whenever we needed help with directions.

I stayed here for business in late Nov. Because they were full, I was upgraded to a suite on a higher floor, so my experience was definitely more positive! However, one of my business associates had a regular room and said it was fine as well. The views from the upper floors of the hotel if are great - over look Uniion Square and then SF bay in the background. Staff is extremely helpful and nice. And location is great if you are going to market street or Union Sq shopping. Not as convenient to the wharf area but close to a BART stop.Overall, a very good experience!

This hotel is located on Union Square in San Francisco and is convinient for shopping trips or attending the theater. We live in the Bay Area and have stayed here before for those evenings where you want to stay in the city for dinner or a show and not need to worry about driving home.In the past this hotel had a "corporate" feel to it and the rooms were a little plain. A major renovation occured since we last stayed and it has a completely different personality. It starts with the pods (small tables) which the staff use to check you in via laptop and the living room feel of the lobby. The bar/restaurant has a much more hip feel to it. Our room was also nicely furnished and comfortable. Congrat's to Hyatt for a nice update to a well situated hotel.

Stayed only 1 night. 5 minute walk from the Bart, in the middle of union square shopping. Beautiful, modern hotel. Check in very fast and efficient and friendly. Recognized our platinum status and told me I would get free upgraded wifi and offered me a late check out. Most Hyatt's I have to ask for those perks and I find it annoying. Nice to have been offered them right away. Room was small but very modern. Gym is on 35th floor with an amazing view. Would stay here again in a heart beat. Staff was all very friendly.

We enjoyed this Hyatt. We were in town for a wedding, the room was nice, bar on top floor was great. Staff very responsive. Great value. They did have construction during our visit, but we were aware of it, as it was on the Hyatt website. Enjoyed the stay in the city by the bay, would return.

My husband and I visited San Francisco for the first time for a vacation. This hotel had just been renovated, and our room was absolutely beautiful.
