It was so clean and modern, and they thought of everything in its design. Next to the bed was a wall reading lamp on each side and controls for the huge window shade. There were outlets everywhere. We stay in Manhattan a couple of times a year and they never have enough outlets in the hotels for gadget chargers; we have to bring an extension cord with us! Our room, which was an upgraded King, had a dressing area (vanity and closet), and then a sleek modern bathroom. We had a huge window taking up the whole wall overlooking the city. I don't know if it was because I signed up for the Hyatt Gold Passport (which was free), but we were given complementary wine in our room. It may have been because we were frazzled from a long ride from Yosemite and still had to bring the rental car back to the airport at 7 or 8 p.m.! In any event, the staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. We had gotten a package deal which included breakfast each morning, and it was fantastic. The views from our room and the restaurant were breathtaking. The room was extremely quiet even though we were in the heart of the city.Without the package deal, I probably would not have been able to afford this hotel and the upgraded room. I can't understand why parking and/or wireless is not included in the room price for all the money they ask. I decided to do without the wifi, since my smart phone gets 4G.My husband and I are planning a trip to San Diego in September 2013 and would really like to stay in a Hyatt again if I can get another package deal like this one.

After having done a lot of research of hotels to stay in San Francisco, we chose the Grand Hyatt.... Not disappointed with this Hotel. The refurb certainly has worked. We had our room on the 29th floor and the views were breathtaking..... The service was fantastic. Quite surprising that this place has just one restaurant. The coffee area opposite the concierge was fantastic and a special thanks to Suzzane who took care of my daughter with nice warm chocolate! Will be back...

The Grand Hyatt lobby and mezzanine-level restaurant appear to have been nicely and recently renovated. The rooms are well-furnished, as you would expect for a Grand Hyatt with adequate wi-fi and the latest electronic equipment. Beds are comfortable. You may want to ask for a non-adjoining room, as you can hear everything from the hallway and the next-door room. Another alternative is to ask for a hypo-allergenic room, which comes with an air purifier. It fortunately puts out white noise to help with the other noise you will probably hear....

I would have given this hotel 5 stars except that I had to wait for breakfast on both days because the restaurant is pretty tiny. I stayed on a thurs and fri night, and I had a bit of jet lag coming over from Asia so breakfasts are always my hungriest meals - unfortunately I had to wait about 10 mins before i could be seated and I didn't think the buffet selection was that great. THere were only about 4-5 hot food selections which was disappointing ,and it was the same on both days, no variety. Rooms were excellent, I was on the 7th floor, not very tall, but good size. I was paying sub US$200 a night, very good value in my view. If you come out of the hotel, turn right and right and go a block, you are in union square. I love shopping in SF and shopping around union sq, absolutely fantastic location.I use to stay at the Four Seasons SF and Ive stayed at the Westin St Francis and I've stayed at the Huntington hotel (small luxury) and i have to say id def choose the Grand Hyatt over the other hotels. i think location, plus comfort of room are the two biggest positives.One complaint I have is if you order from places like amazon and ship to the hotel, they charge $5 bucks per item and you know how Amazon can be, sometimes packaging one item per box - the charges add up.

This hotel has it all. The beds are just gorgeous! Sooo comfortable! The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms have amazing views and the hotel has everything you could possibly need. I would definitely stay here again. Thanks to the Grand Hyatt for making our first time in San Fran amazing!!!

i stayed in this hotel for 4 nights mid dec 2012. the location is perfect right in the middle of shopping district and close to all kinds of public transportation. walking distace to china town and market street. check in and check out was so easy and fron dest staff are really nice and professional. The rooms were nice but beware that no matter how high your room is, you still can hear all the traffic ( i was on 27th floor and i still could hear it ) . The breakfast was not impressive however there are many nice restaurants in the area that you won't get bored. The people at consiege are really helpful and nice. you can count on them for good advice. There were some issues which can not be called problem but might need some attention : There was no bottled water in the room, which now adays is offered im mostly all good hotels. There 2 times that i called house keeping for items like robe and slippers and it took me three phone calls to have them brought to me. As i mentioned the noise from street can be a set back. No pools or spa. However i was told there were several nice spas in the area. I couldn't go because they were booked for times i wished to go. But in general a nice stay :-)

I just returned from a week in San Francisco on business where I stayed at the Grand Hyatt. I have nothing but compliments and great things to say about this amazing hotel and truly caring staff. When I arrived, check-in was prompt and even though I arrived well before check in time, my room was ready and the process didn't take more than 5 minutes. Upon arrival, I was informed that I had been selected as "guest of the day" which brought with it an upgraded room and several other wonderful surprises. I want to let people know about my experience in several areas:Location - There is not a finer location in San Francisco than that of the Grand Hyatt overlooking Union Square. Hotel Appearance - The renovations to the lobby and public areas of the hotel are wonderful. The Hyatt was always a classy property but now they have stepped up even more. Great design, great appearance.Staff - This is where the Grand Hyatt truly distinguishes itself. This is a large hotel with hundreds of rooms but it NEVER felt like a large impersonal "conference type" hotel. I was always referred to by name and people just bent over backwards to help and be friendly.Rooms - Again, great job on the renovation. The room was quiet, comfortable, clean, and classy. Loved it. I want to thank everyone at the Hyatt for going the extra mile to make my stay a great and memorable one!

I was debating if I should stay at Hyatt at Fishermans Wharf or the Grand Hyatt. I wont regret this place is completely refurbished and rooms was real nice and jazzy. The club is really great. The best is the coffee machine and could get my Cappuccion any time. Right next to the shopping district and it is not more than $15 cab ride to the Fishermans wharf. You could also take $6 ride on the cable car right from the next block.I would certainly come back again to this property.

Even though I made reservations a month in advance and when my wife and i arrived at the grand hyatt we were told that the only room they had was ada compliant. the hotel was totally booked and no other rooms were available. after much discussion the hotel finally reduced the room cost. as for the hotel breakfast in one up lounge was over priced and the buffet food was cold.

Stayed here over thanksgiving long weekend for a law conference. Stayed in a recently renovated huge corner room with super comfy king size bed with a mountain of super comfortable pillows and top shelf linens and duvet. 46 inch flat screen tv with large selection of channels and virtually everything accessed via the TV computer system. Bathroom was huge and immaculate, tons of storage space in closet and one or two bureaus/chest o drawers. Mini fridge was great as was the large desk and extra chair and side table. Can't say enough about the location across the street from Union Square and walking distance to many great restaurants, bars, pubs, shopping, Chinatown and even AT&T Park. Outstanding! Only minor complaints are that the in hotel food offerings are a little slim with only one restaurant and one lounge/bar with very limited menu. Had the burger a couple of times and it was fantastic as was the pizza and seafood salad. Room service was very prompt and arrived well presented and very tasty. Room service, while admittedly expensive offered significantly better value than room service I have had at a number of Fairmonts. Other complaints are that you could sometimes hear a fair amount of noise emanating from the hallway as the doors have quite a bit of space between the bottom and the floor. Also, forgot my iPhone on the end of the bed when I was in a hurry to get to the AT&T Park Tour and when I got back a couple hours later it was gone, stolen by housekeeping. Checked back numerous times with front desk same day and over the next few days when I got back home to no avail. Hotel was pretty blasÃ© about it and offered to compensation whatsoever and suggested I make a claim with my home insurance -- not really a satisfactory approach in my view. Also, was a little disappointed that there was no in room mini bar or snacks, which I found to be very odd for a hotel of this caliber. Also a little disappointed that there was no swimming pool. Value was decent however at $179 per night. Were it not for the aforementioned complaints, I would probably have given this hotel a 5 star rating. Generally found the staff and service to be very professional and excellent with the exception of when dealing with the in-room theft of my iPhone, which I thought to be rather cavalier and less than helpful. If you go, make sure you lock your valuables in the room safe or they will likely be gone when you return to your room.

I spend 3 nights in the Grand Hyatt for a convention in November and the hotel is great and modern. the room design is clean and modern. The bathroom is functional and shower head is good. The service is great and the restaurant and lobby are good. The entertainment system is good as well as the internet. I was able to take the BART from SFO to Powell for $9 and back to SFO. The hotel is 4 blocks away, 10 minutes walk right on Union Square.

Pros1. location - just above Union Square; across the street from Starbucks and the Taj Campton Place; kitty-corner from the Sutter-Stockton garage (much cheaper than hotel valet parking which uses this facility). Great shopping withing blocks.2. room decor - recently remodeled, variety of bed pillows (hard, soft, flat). Flattering lighted mirrors in the bathroom and closet area. 44" HD television with handy hyperlinked guide to go directly to the program using the remote which has a built-in trackball mouse.3. lobby - like a cozy living room(s) with fire place(s); public bathrooms are very modern.4. service - very friendly and helpful staff; minimalist front "desk" right by the front door.5. upgrades - available with online reservations; inexpensive; but once you request it you must take it if available on check-in.Cons1. noise - from adjacent rooms and hallway: bathroom and sneezing noises can be heard; large gap under the lower edge of the front door lets in the hallway noise like room service and closing doors.2. radio - couldn't find it.

I stayed with my wife for five days on business. This is one of the best Hyatt hotels we have stayed in. The hotel is on Union Square in the center of the shopping area of the city, it appears to have been completely renovated, everything seemed new and clean. Our room was large with a chair, desk with chair, very comfortable bed with pillow-top mattress, lots of outlets for our electronics, a large well-lighted bath with tub and shower plus a separate make-up desk with mirror and lights. The lobby is large with many chairs to sit and talk with colleagues but a little drafty with wind from the front doors. Our room was relatively quiet. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Check in and out was very fast. My wife used the exercise room and rates it good. I never saw lines at the reception. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel. When in San Francisco I always go to Lorris Diners for breakfast.My only concern was street noise. We were on the 29th floor overlooking Union Square, and we could clearly hear the musicians (for some reason drummers were out in force this year) and people singing. All rooms have sliding doors that can open a few inches, and they do not seal out noise very well. I hope the hotel seals the doors, or replaces them with non-opening, sealed windows. Still, the noise did not bother us, and it is quiet by 11PM or so.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt in November 2012 and had a memorable trip. San Francisco is such a charming city and the Hotel stay made it a memorable trip.The union square location is THE biggest plus- it cannot be beat. Just walk one block down and you are in union square, three or four blocks to the Powel st. Cable car, five or six blocks to Market street- you get the idea!!We booked directly from the Hyatt site and got a very good AAA rate. Our stay turned out to be quite eventful because our 9 month old baby was down with a virus. Elaine (sp?) at concierge was so helpfl, though, that we cannot thank her enough. She helped us find a local doctor who is available for questions for guests and the doctor's group helped us reach a pediatrician. The pedeatric practise was sooooo helpful too. They reassued us that it's just a common cold/virus and even recommended we don't prepone our return plans. We are so glad we listned to them because we were able to catch all the SF attractions in the rest of the stay. Elaine was very helpful with other requests as well. For example, we requested that we be transferred to a hypo-allergenic room which she arranged right away. She even helped with restaurant recommendations, hop on hop off bus etc.The original room we stayed in did seem to have something going because we all suffered from cold or cough but I really don't want to blame it on the room or hotel because quite frankly it could be just us -may be something we caught on the plane.I guess I digressed a bit but coming back to hotel amenities, the rooms are very decent size for a major city, the upgreaded lobby is excellent, and of course, so many attractions nearby. We orderd food from room service but the quality of the food was just OK- nothing great. The in-room TV service was upgraded during our stay and the TVs now have many more channels in digital quality. Big plus if the day is rained out. As far as drawbacks, I do agree that the check in is a little confusing but personally we didn't find it to be an issue because the staff was prompt. The only bad experience we had was with valet/doorman. When we were departing, the door man called a small cab for us and when we explained we needed a bigger one because we had bags and babay stroller he just kept refusing to call another cab and even remarked that we wasted his time!! Definitely a blot on an otherwise pleasant service.

Grand Hyatt is in the middle of the upscale shopping district. I stayed here the week after Thanksgiving and was in a shoppers paradise! The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Decor is modern, stylish, yet still comfortable. I used to stay at the Westin St Francis when in town, but I am officially abandoning it in favor of the Grand Hyatt!

Perfect location at Union Square. Parking garage a block away. Best service from employees you will get. I love the Peninsula in Chicago but the service here is even better. Literally they open the door with a smile as soon as you walk in. The rooms are fantastic and we had an awesome room with perfect water views. Interior looked brand new and super clean.Bathroom immaculate. Rooms super quiet. This hotel is a must stay if you are going to San Fran. I honestly cant imagine staying at another hotel in San Fran after having stayed here

Great hotel- well priced and friendly staff. No complaints but for the pesky kids who had pressed the call button for all 30 odd floors before exiting :)Nice location by union square.Did not try the food here though.

Really nice hotel in the heat of Union square. Shopping on your door step and an easy stroll to little Italy, China Town and Fishermans Wharf.The top level bar is a must to visit (even if you don't drink) to see the view.Service was fantasic; we stayed here as part of our honeymoon and were provided with a nice bottle of red and a cheese platter upon arrival which was a nice touch.

Perfect location, wonderful service..rooms renovated and very clean. All of the little amenities, refrig in room, auto blinds that raise and lower with view of city...I just loved my room...very quiet floor. The staff were all very nice, welcomed you back each time....opened doors..nice location right next to Union Square...absolutely the best. I will be back...

Owners of this property really have done their homework when deciding for the location of the hotel. Despite the fact I am a first-time traveller to San Francisco, I dare to say the location is second to none. And I do not mean Downtown SF or Union Sq., I mean the exact hotel address at 345 Stockton St at Sutter St. And the reason I state this so enthusiasticaly is that while being at walking distance from Union Sq (30 secs to be exact), the hotel is opposite to Macy's and other stores where crowds and beggars tend to populate.About the King Room at 23rd floor I was assigned to: size-wise it is just right, well-furnitured, convenient coffee machine, excellent internet-enabled TV, excellent bed, complimentary wi-fi or paid higher-speed ones, excellent bathroom facilities and good closet space, very silent, nice view from Financial District and rooftops along Sutter St and partial view of the SF bay with beautiful sunrise.Cons: windows seemed like never been washed, what ruined what would be a perfect twilight photo, I could use some more hanger space on the bathroom, you have to remember to put your privacy doorknob lable out otherwise staff may barge in, found significant amount of dirt in less accessible areas behind bed and you have to be careful while opening the shower at night as cleaning staff may have directed it outwards and a splash incidend may occur if not careful.About the hotel, I can always say it is pricy, but I feel like I got enough value for what I paid, but I would recommend not hiring internet unless really necessary and prefer having breakfast outside because 50+ USD for a couple seemed a litlle bit overpriced for me, especially considering you are 1 min walking distance from Sears Fine Foods and Loris Diner and 10 secs away from Starbucks across Stockton St. Would I look any further for my next stay in SF? I very much doubt so.

Stayed this past weekend, the remodeled lobby, restaurant and bar had all opened up only 2 weeks prior. The remodel is very nice, with 2 gas fireplaces in the cozy lobby seating area. The restaurant has been re-located to the mezzanine level, along with the bar, and these are open to the lobby below. They spent some serious money on the furnishings and fixtures, but beware there are no views like from the Grandviews bar and restaurant they replaced. They say that Grandviews will no longer be a public area, and be converted into meeting room space. Sad, as this was a very nice feature of this property with impressive views from the 36th floor.  Check in was prompt, but slightly confusing, as staff each are situated at small desks with laptops. It seems they are going for a boutique hotel look, but when you have over 500 rooms and no intuitive way to queue up, it gets crowded. The doormen were always very efficient at hailing cabs and providing directions. There's also a lot of staff standing around by the elevators and I could never figure out exactly what their jobs were. The breakfast buffet is very good, and is $25 a person, though service seemed a bit unsteady. Perhaps the staff is still very new. Rooms were nice and very clean. No curtains. There are some light plastic movable shades, and then a roll down room darkening shade powered by switches next to the bed. Room was very quiet while I was there, except on Saturday night during a massive rain and wind storm the building's steel structure squeaked and groaned for hours, keeping us awake. I was surprised that no robes were provided in the room, and after 2 phone requests for 2 bathrobes, only 1 ever showed up. Also, newspapers for elite members are not delivered to the door as at other Hyatts, but are left in the elevator lobby. The bathroon did have a great shower, and hot water was abundant each morning. A very welcome touch was that the room had a mini-fridge that was empty so that you could stock your own drinks in it for your stay. No mini bar. There are a couple convenience stores within a block or two of the hotel along Sutter Street. You are also almost right on Union Square, and the heart of San Francisco's shopping district. Literally every major department store and boutique has an outlet within a few block radius of the Grand Hyatt.Overall, a nice renovation job, and I would stay here again, if just for the location. They do have a few kinks to work out training personnel, but hopefully this will be accomplished very soon. I do hope they will re-open the 36th floor bar space again someday.

First the good: the location is great and the housekeeping staff are prompt and courteous.Now the bad: check is very confusing. There seems be a lot of people standing around in the lobby area, more as security than to be helpful. They could use more people in concierge as there was constantly a line up there. The walls between the walls are pretty thin. Tried the restaurant and it was overpriced for the quality. Had only recently re-opened so hopefully it will get better. Had a club room....breakfast was great but the appies and desserts in the evening always ran out within about 1/2 hour. It was quite used but could use a bit more food. Pretty average in my opinion.

We arrived in San Francisco during what many said was the worst rain storm in years. We didn't know what to expect from the hotel, other than we knew it was upscale and appeared to be in a good area of the city. It was very easy to locate from the BART, which we took into the city from SFO Airport. We checked in easily and our room was beautiful with an excellent view of the city. The concieage was very helpful with directions and things to do in the city in the rain. The hotel provided us with large umbrellas which proved to be very necessary during our trip. The hotel is very close to Chinatown, the BART, the cable cars and there are excellent value-priced restaurants in the area. We did have breakfast at the hotel one day as it was included in the price of the hotel, however we would not recommend it if it's not. It was very expensive for the buffet ($25 per person) and while the food was good, it was not worth the price. The windows in our room rattled all night due to the storm and the hotel was very nice in addressing this concern. If staying in San Francisco again we would consider staying here.

Hyatt has done an excellent job with the re-model, giving the hotel a contemporary, elegant look. Every single staff member was friendly and transmitted a warm feeling that made us feel at home throughout our stay. Small touches like excellent bathroom lighting for makeup and fast wireless internet in guest rooms show the detail that went into this hotel. The concierge took care of several reservations and airport transportation via email before we arrived. The only negative is that we had to wait for elevators at times - we hope this is a temporary glitch that will be corrected. Will definitely stay here again.

This newly and nicely refurbished hotel is in a really good location for a trip to San Francisco. It's a short walk from the main shopping areas, cable car lines and BART Station which I used to get to and from SFO airport. There's a Starbucks right across the street and a large drugstore just around the corner. The view from my 24th floor Bay View room was superb. The bed was comfortable, there's an in-room safe and a fridge which is free to use. Minor negatives are the TVs are not HD and the bathroom sink is designed for style over function. The Business Center has 2 computers but you have to pay for internet access - there is free Wi-Fi in the very pleasant seating area in the Lobby however. There was no Grand Views restaurant on the top floor during my stay in November 2012 so I didn't use the hotel restaurant for any meals (the view would have been the major draw) - it's now on the Mezzanine Level above the lobby. The staff were friendly and helpful during my very pleasant 7 night stay and I would definitely return here again.

Arrived after 3 year's absence. Lobby and fireplace sitting area was new. Stayed on the 32nd floor in a Club room. Now room is modern and comfortable. TV comes with Internet capabilities, cool. Some amenities missing like slippers, bed was too soft and wouldn't work for someone with a bad back. Concierge is tried and true for many years. They give good info

This is one of the best hotels in the Union Square area of San Francisco. Although it does not share the same classic and stunning lobbies like other more historical hotels nearby, the interior is newly renovated. There is something to be said about walking into a place that smells new and fresh (in our case the lobby is still off-gassing when we walked into the lobby!) My husband and I were in town for a convention. The location is great for attending events, do some shopping, etc. In contrast to San Francisco's other quaint neighborhoods, downtown San Francisco has a more corporate and 'big city' feel. So if you are looking for charm and personality, this neighborhood is not it. The hotel looks like every other Hyatt property in the world. The room looks beautiful at first glance, but once you start to use the space in more detail, things begin to fall apart. In some cases it literally does. The headboard started to wobble when we pulled the attached nightstand drawers. There are plenty of wood furniture, cabinets, and drawers in the room, but none provided very much storage. There are a lot of knick-knacks all over the place, but the overall effect is not cohesive. A little too much fussy fluff for my taste. The 'modern' interior decoration is mediocre at best. It is a case of one corporate hotel looking just like another corporate hotel, while trying to out do each other.The lighting in the room is overall very dark. The only highlight, no pun intended, is the bathroom. The overly bright spot of the whole room, the bathroom is actually the best looking part of the room. Other awkward lighting controls includes a funky silver semi-translucent full-height window screen in the room that don't look like it can last more than five years.The service throughout the hotel is consistently friendly and good natured. Everyone we came across is top notch endearing. The porter is very responsive and helpful. The cleaning lady for our room is very responsive as well. When we left her a thank you note one day, she wrote a response back to us with a smiley face.Back to the bathroom. The water pressure at the shower on the 16th floor is pathetically poor. You would think a semi-modern high-rise would have resolved that technical problem. You are literally being washed by something a little bit better than the drips of water torture. At least the water is warm.Now to the Internet. They charge you a certain amount per day for high-speed premium Internet access. This service sucked. The Internet speed is excessively slow for us. It was okay when I just have to surf and dilly dally. But it was not okay when I have to do work. I called their Internet support immediately. The man was very helpful. Unfortunately that was halfway during our stay and we already suffered the poor service for a while.The parking is $55 per night. There is a cheaper lot directly diagonally across from the hotel. But they also charge some exorbitant amount per night. My advice is, if you can help it, do not drive in downtown San Francisco.Did I mention although the bed was very comfortable, it was sagging? There was a noticeable higher ridge along the middle of the bed. I guess most people don't sleep in the middle of a king bed.

Love this hotel, service is generally excellent, staff is great and the hotel has done a very good job with their remodel. Stayed here twice in the last few months and was very impressed with the rooms and what you get for the price. Service was excellent and the staff is always attentive and helpful. For a large SFO hotel that is unusual.

Loved the modern decor & the hotel overall! The only reasons I didn't rate "excellent" across the board. 1) not enough drawer space in the room 2) even though we were on a "quiet floor" you can hear the people in the next room (literally when they flush their toilet). The room rate was pretty high but that's the going rate for a nice hotel in Union Square. I found the most reasonable rate through the hotel's website (pre-pay, non-refundable). With that said, everything else was wonderful! They let us check-in early & beds/pillows were amazingly comfortable.

The location near Union Square is nearly unmatched (only a few others right on the square.). The rooms feel luxurious including remote blinds and elegant bath fixtures. The lobby and check in are modern -- very upscale. Valet (as one can expect in SFO) is fantastic. Unfortunately the rest of the staff, especially dining, seemed untrained and lacking sophistication for this level. I agree with other reviewers that moving the restaurant and bar from the 36th floor to "one Up" was a massive misstep. Moreover the restaurant seems to be suffering from serious freshman jitters. Food is sufferably slow in coming. Hours of operation seem to be erratic and subject to chef irrational preparation. That said when and if the food arrives it is spectacular. I can only hope they figure out the service irregularities as I do hope to return again with better dining experiences.

It's been 7 years since I wrote my last review. We have been staying here several times a year for about 20 years. With the recent remodel, it's now one of the very best hotels in the city. The rooms, especially on the Regency Club floors, are nothing short of spectacular, both with their views, impeccible service in the Club, and the beautiful materials which have been used in the guest rooms. The huge lighted mirrors in the bathrooms seem to make everyone look 20 years younger ! The views from rooms on the north facing side of the hotel give the very best views, which include Coit Tower, the Pyramid, and Alcatraz. The new lobby is beautiful and has individual desks rather than a single front desk. There is a new sitting area with a gas fireplace. However, the new bar is directly above and open to the lobby and on this Saturday night pulsating music from above was annoying. This beautiful hotel still is about the most centrally located in the city -across the street from Union Square - and in the heart of the shopping area. I can recommend it without hesitation.

Like most frequent business travelers, I keep a mental list of which hotels really do it right (and which do not...) The Grand Hyatt San Francisco is absolutely at the top of my list! From the personalized attention upon check in, the doormen, the concierge, room service delivery - all are top notch. The eleventh floor room I stayed in was lovely and very comfortable. I am both picky and brutally honest - so I would tell you if I found anything to complain about, but I did not.As a fine example of the care they take of their guests here, I called downstairs to see if I could get some band aids - I said I needed several. The young lady response was to ask - with great concern in her voice - if I was ok. I just don't think most places care like that. (I just had blisters - take your most comfortable shoes! San Francisco is a *walking* town.) And further - they were at my door with those band aids faster than I would have thought possible.When I have occasion to travel to San Francisco in the future, you can be sure that this is where I'll stay. I recommend it unreservedly.

The hotel is centrally located just off union square, rooms are a good size and have great views over the city. Staff service was excellent.I usually stay over the road at the Taj, but I think this will be my new regular SF hotel.

We have been staying at this hotel every time we have come to San Francisco (two times minimum per year) for the past ten years. Our last visit was for a week in April, when they had remodeled the rooms to a somewhat more Oriental flavor. One of the reasons we have always stayed there was the Grandview Lounge on the 36th floor.It had the best view in all of San Francisco and we spent many hours watching the ships and boats in ther harbor. Imagine our shock the find that, in the final part of the remodel, they have moved the bar and restaurant to the 4th floor, a box with no view!!! They took the best feature of their hotel and turned it into a conference area/private room. There are many very good hotels near the Square, but the biggest factor we always chose the Grand Hyatt was the view from the lounge! Very sad.

We managed to pick our days about a week after the hotel completed remodeling. Our room had a great view over Union Square (as often noted this hotel has a great location) and was done in a contemporary style. The TV setup wasn't complete (should be very soon) but remained usable - just the channels available didn't match the guide. Nicely done bath, albeit a small counter, probably because it was handicap accessible and needed more room in some areas.Very pleased with the new restaurant for breakfast (a separate review). The bar was excellent (a good selection of wine by the glass at (for SF) reasonable prices. Quick check in and out. Everything we could have expected and it's tops on our list for next time.

We stayed four nights in November 2012 at the SF Grand Hyatt located in Union Square. The Union Square area is convenient and feels relatively safe for tourists. Lots to do and see there as well. The recent room rennovations were excellent! Everything was new and fresh. The desk staff and concierge were helpful to me and my guests. When we were there they were in the process of completing rennovations on the lobby and restaurant. We were told this via email in advance so that this was not a surprise. My only disappointment was that the restaurant on site where I took the group for lunch was buffet only. This would have been fine but they ran out of food right away and the food they had was disappointing. Small complaint for a lovely property!

we stayed at the grand hyatt while my husband was attending a show. The location was absolutely perfect, right in the heart of union square. The breakfast was outstanding and Scott the mixologist at the bar was fabulous. The concierge was so helpful (all of them) with restaurants, tours, and shoppping, and anything else we might want. Check in via the laptops in the lobby was a breeze as was check out. I would have preferred to be on a much higher floor, but we had a fabulous rate because of the show, so no complaints. The bed was extremely comfortable. i will stay there again when i return to this magnificent city by the bay!!

Stayed in 2008 and really enjoyed it so returned again in November 2012. Hotel had nearly completed its renovations. Had a great room on 31st floor with bay views. Everything went smoothly from checking in with Wayne, meeting David and Jimmy again in the Club Lounge, and everything else was perfect. Friendly polite staff made the hotel stand out from other hotels. Will definitely return to this hotel when next in San Francisco.Fantastic powerful shower and really modern bathroom. Liked the welcome button that turned the lights on and raised the electric blind!

From check-in through check-out, the staff of the Hyatt was terrific. This hotel has a lot going for it beyond service. Beautiful new bar and restaurant on the Mezzanine; very cool setup for check-in; comfortable beds; nice HVAC system in room; sliding door allows fresh air for the room; well-appointed bath.I did not provide an excellent review because internet service was very slow and there was a fee for it; high speed internet was more expensive ($15/day) but worked well. There was no lounge chair in my room and the chair for the desk was not height adjustable. Taxi service in SF is lousy in SF and even worse at this location, likely due to construction a block away. But it is a convenient walk to great shopping, restaurants and the Moscone Center. I recommend it!

Was informed at check-in the the renovations had "just finished" and it looked it. Lobby, lounge and room were all gorgeous. The room was nicely equipped - hooray for lots of electrical outlets for device charging. Very comfy bed, nice bathroom, plenty of room to unpack if you're staying a few nights.Location is great. Right in the middle of major shopping, a quick walk to the BART/Muni and if you're touring around town in a car, this is fairly easy to get to.If you do bring a car, you're going to experience SF parking rates... and this hotel is no different. Not cheap to use valet overnight here.Pretty quiet room for being in such an urban setting. Would definitely stay here again.

Stayed here a few weeks ago for an overnight stay. The lobby was under construction but check-in was great due to an awesome unexpected early check-in and free upgrade to a corner room on the 21st floor. The rooms have been completely renovated and look FAB as do the hallways. My only complaint was that the doorman talked us into parking across the street - saving us $15 with in and out privileges. The only problem was that the service at the garage was EXTREMELY slow. You had to get aggressive with the guys in order for them to help you. The lines to get our car were long and one time it took nearly 20 minutes to get the car. To me it wasn't worth saving $15. We had a few drinks at the rooftop bar one of favorites hotel bars in the city. We were sad to find out that the bar was closing for good in a few days to make room for ballroom space. We had lots of good memories at that place - its the end of an era. But the completely revamped Grand Hyatt is a new beginning.

It was a great stay.Stayed there for 4 nigths.The location is so good,the stuff were really freindly and the check in was quickly done,we took 2 rooms with a connecting door as we were a family of 5,2 adults and 3 children,the rooms were all new,the bath was big and spacy,the decoration was very nice and pleasent to see,great sink!!!the beds were very very comfortable,and allthuogh the hotel was in renovation we didnt feel it at all.The rooms were very clean..The consierge was very helpfull and gave as directions and explenations.Across and down the road is the-cheese cake factory resturant,which was excellent and we enjoyed it alot,dont forget to reserve !!Dont think twice!!!this hotel is a must!!if you want your stay to be pleasent and worth it!!

I had the opportunity to visit this hotel yesterday and WOW! The remodel of public areas appears complete and it was jaw dropping!I've stayed in one of the remodeled rooms (which was very nice), but hadn't been to the hotel since its public areas were remodeled. The new restaurant and lounge are now on the 2nd floor mezzanine and it creates great buzz. So smart - very hip, but not in a creepy "we are trying to be a club" feel. I didn't try the restaurant out yet (I peeked in), but the lobby lounge was great. The restaurant and lounge are separated by a long walkway that is a wine cellar of sorts. They are open to exterior windows so you see the city and it creates great energy. I can't wait to go back! I don't know what they are going to do with the old restaurant and lounge on top floor, but they were rather sad and needed to be retired anyway.The concierge desk is smartly placed, new seating in the lobby for guests is great with a cool fireplace. There are video screens everywhere - showing tranquil scenes. Even the etching on the glass of San Francisco map is totally cool. The stone flooring, warmth of wood ... it all works beautifully.I loved the front desk ... it is just a collection of counters with laptops. Super inviting.The staff were all very welcoming - they must be excited to have this total revamp. And the doorman looks like a doorman (maybe he had same uniform before, but I don't think so.) It really felt like everything had been revamped. It feels like a brand new hotel! The outdoor planters are wonderful and welcome you as approach the hotel. It used to be drab (and that is being generous). Now the hotel inside and out is alive and inviting. I really was blown away - and you will be too. It truly is a "grand" hotel now! Bravo! I highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed here for 3 nights in November at the end of our USA trip and were very impressed. We booked the free Hyatt time deal through Hyatt and paid 2 nights and got our third night for free and got free breakfast each day. The hotel was recently renovated and we were given a free upgrade upon arrival to the 29th floor so it only added to our experience. Staff were all helpful and friendly and I found the staff at the 1-up restaurant to be excellent. We loved the Buffett breakfast. It was ll fresh and organic ingredients and was beautiful. The beds were so comfortable. Only one flaw was there was not Dsney or Nickoleon Chanel's for kids. Would highly recommend.

Stayed for a couple of nights this past week after the lobby renovation was complete. Very nice looking lobby with a casual check-in, beautiful fireplaces and sitdown areas. Check-in was efficient, but not very accommodating with regards to asking for a different room view.Room was very nice and everything appeared brand new as they completely gutted their rooms and updated them with wood floors, nice walk-in shower, and very comfy beds.Ordered room service and it was fine, nothing outstanding, but came very quickly and the server was very friendly.Location is excellent- right across Union Square from Macy's and within walking distance to a ton of shops and restaurants.My main issue was the fact that they've spend millions on renovating their rooms, a big, new lobby and restaurant, nice new tv's, but no HDTV signal in their guestroom!? C'mon, this is 2012- almost every decent hotel has HDTV signals broadcast. Might not be a big issue to some, but I enjoy watching sports and non-HDTV is almost enough to turn me away in the future.

The Grand Hyatt just completed a much needed renovation of its public spaces and the new version is much improved. The lobby has a modern, yet warm feel to it and the staff could not be any friendlier. The new restaurant, OneUp, has a limited menu but the food quality is outstanding. I got the lamb burger for lunch and it was one of the better burgers I have ever eaten. The Regency Club lounge at this property is one of the best in the US as the views alone are worth the additional cost. From the Regency Club you get a panorama of one of the most beautiful cities in the country. The food in the Regency Club is excellent and the staff (Dave and others) are incredibly helpful and friendly. The workout facility is on the smaller side for such a nice hotel but the equipment is new and well maintained. The concierge, JoAnna, is friendly and very knowledgeable about local restaurants and activities.My room was a double on the 32nd floor. The rooms are moderate in size but have new amenities including a very comfortable bed and a large flat screen TV.This hotel is centrally located, very close to Union Square, close to the BART Station (Powell Street) and close to the Terminus of the famous SF Cable Car (Powell Line). I took that BART in from the airport and then walked 4 blocks to the hotel. The BART ticket cost me almost $9 but was far less expensive than a taxi ride into the city which will run about $50 with tip. The ride in on BART was 30 minutes and I am sure that rush hour traffic would have resulted in a 45 minute taxi ride, at least. The hotel is also very close to the Financial District, for those in SF on business.

My new home in San Francisco. Construction was complete by my arrival and the combination of warm, retro, chic cozy is a perfect pairing for the city. The checking is open and friendly with individual check in at large tables. Fireplace huge living rooms grace the lobby with spa music playing in the backgroundThe rooms a retro colors of golden, sand and brown put together in a very sleek configuration. Love the vibe, location and service

Check-in was quick and efficient, lobby was under contruction but the staff did its utmost to limit the impact to its guest. Good rooms clean and spacious.Disappointing was the bar and restaurant. In particular the breakfast buffet was up to standard - if I was staying at a Holiday Inn. The buffet was rarely open on time, drinks arriving late, etc. The construction in the lobby was to create a new bar and restuarant but it seemed that they had already closed down. Too bad because the view from the bar and restaurant is awesome.Great hotel - and I expect the new bar and restaurant to be better organised...

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a week in early October and it was an absolute pleasure to stay here. I was in San Francisco during an extremely busy week for the city, with all the events on (the Oracle Convention, Americaâ€™s Cup, Fleet Week, the Blue Angels Air Shows, Castro Street Fair, and the Hardly Strictly Bluegrass Festival).Yes, the hotel Lobby was being renovated (due to be completed in November) and the main temporary entrance was located on Sutter Street, but that was nothing to be worried about. As soon as I stepped out of the taxi in front of the hotel, the service I received from staff was exceptional. All the staff members I spoke to were very helpful and professional (the bellmen, front desk, concierge, club lounge and housekeeping staff). They all provided top notch service and were very willing to help when needed.The room was beautiful. It was designed in a way that just felt welcoming and very comfortable, with lots of space and storage. I had a room on one of the higher floors, so it was quiet & the view was spectacular. I loved coming back to my room after a long day of exploring the city to unwind & go to sleep in a very comfortable bed. I would also lower the darkening shade on the window before I went to sleep, so I wasnâ€™t woken up by a bright room in the morning. The bathroom was also larger than I had expected.The hotel is right in the middle of Union Square and is very centrally located.You can walk all over the city from there, or easily find connections to public transport within a few blocks (buses, trains, streetcars and cable cars).Otherwise the bellmen can call a taxi for you, right outside the front door.I really enjoyed my stay at the Grand Hyatt, thoroughly recommend it and would stay here again if I get another chance to travel back to San Francisco!

We stayed here for 8 days in late October to early November 2012. The entrances were a little screwed up because of construction and remodeling, but it didn't interfere with any of our plans. We stayed in 1620 and overlooked the Union Square plaza. Room was comfortable and quiet. Daily housekeeping was consistently good. I'd recommend to others without reservation - not in the literal sense of course ... probably should have a reservation before arriving. :)

This hotel is in an awesome location in union square, right smack in the middle of the shopping district. If you're in town for the stores, then this is the perfect hotel for you. Barney's, Macy's, Nike's, Levi's etc are just some of the examples which are within walking distance of no further than 10 mins. Besides shopping, the location is also easily accessible for walking to Fisherman's Wharf, North Beach and Chinatown. For example, on our second day, we walked to the Ferry Terminal Building for the farmer's market and this was also easily achievable; about 20 mins of leisurely walking. The hotel is currently undergoing renovation, and therefore it might be slightly troublesome dagging your luggage from the taxi stand round the hotel to the makeshift lobby. Other than that, we experienced no inconvenience. The room was clearly newly renovated and I don't know if it was the fatgue of having travelled for close to 1.5 weeks by the time we reached San Fran, but the bed was extremely comfortable. We were out like a light every night. We will definitely be returning to this hotel when we are next in San Fran.

While the finishing touches are still being applied, the new bar on 2nd floor looks amazing - and the renovations to the lobby, guest rooms, etc put it on my short list of business hotels I'd stay at when traveling for fun.

The Grand Hyatt is situated in a really central spot next to Union Square. There are lots of shops, restaurants, bars within walking distance and the area feels relatively safe at night (I'm a single gal so that's really important to me). I chose a room that was hypoallergenic. At first I wasn't sure how much I'd appreciate that feature but once I entered the room, it was pristine and I felt like I would get a good night's rest. The bathroom was lovely and the bed was exceedingly comfortable. There's a nice desk area which I appreciated for my work. My room had a view of an ice skating rink down below that was put up for the holidays. Fun if you're visiting sometime in the next couple of months.My only real complaint would be my walls were pretty thin. My next door neighbor was on his phone all night and early in the morning and I heard every cough and every sneeze. I typically just drink coffee in my room in the morning and I thought the in-room coffee was pretty bad but there's a Starbucks across the street so no real harm done there. Yes, as many people have written before me - the hotel is currently under construction but staff were very good about directing me where to go. The big downfall to the construction from my perspective was really just the lack of a real lobby (who spends that much time in the lobby anyway?) :)All in all, I found the staff to be very friendly and the hotel to be an excellent choice (particularly for business travel).

I have stayed here several times over the past year, and with the exception of my first stay, the service has been extraordinary. The first time I stayed here a few months ago, the service of the front desk wasn't very welcoming, and I wasn't expecting construction at the hotel either which was a little inconvenient at first. I wasn't thanked for being a platinum member either, as I normally am at other Hyatts. However, that experience was short lived, because every stay after that has been a 180 degree turnaround from the first. The staff has since been super friendly after that first experience, always welcoming me back (I love when hotels recognize return guests) and even remembering my name, as well as my dog's name! Construction is still fairly inconvenient, but the quality of service, as well as the rooms make up for the inconvenience. The rooms are very nice, contemporary and very clean. I have always requested a high floor, and with availability, they have never had a problem honoring my request. The higher floors have AMAZING views. Each room has floor to ceiling windows with automatic blinds that you can operate while lying in bed. I'm also very particular about bathrooms at hotels, and I have nothing to complain about with these ones -- They are always spotless (I always look at corners, and dirt between tiles, etc.), and showers have a detachable head and plenty of counter space. The location is another plus with this hotel. It's located almost in the heart of Union Square, only a few blocks from Chinatown, in a crowded part of town, so to be able to walk out of the hotel and down the street to shop, eat, or sightsee without having to deal with taxis, parking or public transportation is awesome. I have to say that the only drawback would be the noise from the downtown streets late at night. Although the windows seem to block out most noise, I could still faintly hear echos of crowds of people, concerts, trucks, etc. even from the higher floors. But the noise from outside has only been a minor thing.This hotel is one of my favorites to stay at in San Francisco, and I have stayed in many. A colleague noticed me say a few times: "I'm going home" instead of "I'm going back to my hotel" which shows the kind of sentiment I feel being there.

I recently stayed at this hotel for work. I added on a few extra days to be a tourist while I was in town. The hotel was chosen by work but was a good starting off point for the vacation portion of the trip. The hotel is a block off Union Square and easily accessible to public transportation. The cable car is only a block away on Powell. The hotel is still undergoing construction in the lobby, but the room was renovated and very nice. The controls for the window shades are on the wall by the bed. Took me a while to find them. The hotel restaurant was a disappointment, but they were only serving a limited buffet during the renovations. There is a 7-Eleven and a Walgreens at Powell and Sutter to grab bottled water and snacks. There is also a good restaurant, Lori's on the same corner that is open 24 hrs and has a good breakfast for a reasonable price. There is lots of shopping close to this hotel location. I mostly used the Muni and the cable car, but there is a National/Alamo location up the hill on Bush Street where I rented a car one day to drive up to Muir Woods.

I stayed 6 nights in this hotel and loved the location... as well as the renovations. The lobby was still being worked on, my room on the 6th floor was great! It was spacious, modern and clean. The bed was soft but still comfortable, and the sheets were silky soft on my skin. Loved it. The location was great for both work (going to the convention center) and fun (shopping, Ferry building, restaurants). The thing I liked the least about the hotel was how thin the walls seemed to be. My neighbor was playing music one night late, which woke me up. The good part: I called down to the front desk and security came up IMMEDIATELY. I'm sure the person had no idea I could hear his/her music quite so clearly. :)

Hotel has been under re-construction for three months which should be ending in 3 weeks. Rooms have been updated, furniture is great and the bed very comfortable. Window treatments make the room dark and the ac is cold. Staff is handling the construction well and are very helpful during this time. I will be abck at this hotel.

Great location (5 min walk to Fishermans Wharf) and very professional staff.A bit expensive, but most Hyatts are. Room was very nice and service was great..would stay again. We had some travel laundry to do after a week in the states and the service was prompt and resonably affordable.Hagen & Dawn - Australia

My husband and I were a little worried when checking into the Grand Hyatt as we'd been backpacking around the South of the US and had a load of rucksacks and gear with us, not to mention the very casual attire we were wearing! The moment we walked in we were treated like absolute gold. We had staff members rushing over to help us, and happily chatting and asking questions about where we had been travelling, even offering us water and candy!! We were upgraded to a high floor with a fantastic view over Union Square, and the room and the view were stunning!!! The staff recommended some nearby pubs and places to eat, and the easiest way to use the public transport to get to all of San Francisco's 'hot spots'. Unfortunately the gym area was closed for renovations during our stay, but that was probably a good thing as we got to spend more time out and about San Francisco, which is such a wonderful city. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel. The staff at the Grand Hyatt were by far the friendlist, most genuine hotel staff I have come across - we will definitely be back!

Nice hotel, but building work was going on which was a bit rubbish as reception was half closed. Make sure you get what you pay for, they tried up downgrade us into a cheaper room as the place was busy - thought we wouldn't notice. Make sure to complain about anything that wasn't up to scratch as we got $100 of the bill when I said I wasn't happy. Great customer service!

My husband and I stayed at this newly renovated hotel and we were so glad that this was the hotel we chose for our stay in San Francisco. We arrived by taxi and were greeted by the valets with a smile and a warm welcome. Check in was a breeze and we were quickly given our room and told that the bell man would escort us upstairs with our luggage. The bell man was very polite and gave us a tour of the room and asked if we needed anything or had any questions. We were on the 16th floor in a room that had great city views with a glimpse of the bay on the left and the right. Our room was spacious enough and nicely decorated. I loved the big bathroom and the dressing room adjacent to it.. Nice touch. Loved the automatic blinds that you could control from your bed. The coffee maker and fridge in the room is a nice touch as well. The room and hotel is very clean and all the staff we met or who served us were extremely friendly and helpful. The concierge staff were so helpful and lovely... Even got a lovely comment by one about how nice my hair looked today. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant was very nice... the view is magnificent. The hotel is located in a superb location close to all your shopping needs and all forms of public transport. Yes the lobby was still under some construction, but that did not impinge on our stay one bit. People who whine about this are plain and outright silly. Overall a great hotel, a very comfortable room/bed and a superb location. What else do you need!

My room was very nice with a fantastic view of Coit Tower and the bay. Room size was generous and the bed was very comfortable. Closet and dressing area were a nice bonus. The bathroom was great...spacious, lovely shower. Nice to have a refrigerator and small coffee maker in the room. The only downside is that the lobby was undergoing a renovation which was inconvenient. It will be completed, soon, however and will undoubtedly be nice. Location is very central to downtown, chinatown and the Embarcadero. Would definitely stay again.

We really enjoyed our two stays at this hotel, pre and post cruise from San Francisco. The rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Beds were terrific. Housekeeping did a great job.The front desk staff, concierge staff and bell boys were excellent.It is in a terrific location for shopping and sightseeing. Terrific views from the higher floors.My only complaint was that the foyer was undergoing renovations. Fine, I can cope with that. But the problem was that there was only one seat for visitors in the foyer. We had to stand waiting for our transfer for 45 minutes, as the only seat was taken. The staff kept looking at us and smiling, which is fine, but what I really wanted was a seat to sit on. Even a few temporary dining chairs would have been preferable to having to stand for that long a period of time. There was room for some temporary seating.Other than that, all was fine.

The hotel is very good located. You are close to everything. The room was big enough and very clean. The staff was extremly friendly. The breakfast was also very good with an amazing view to San Francisco. The valet parking was also good. We almost never had to wait for our car. There was just one big problem. I had a special request to get a romatic atmosphere. We arranged everything, but they just forgot to do it. At least they didn't charge us for that. I was very dissapointed for that.

stayed 5 nights because a conference was held there. The only good staff I could name is Lyle (Bellman), who was the only staff provided 5-star services.On the first night, I called the Front Desk to arrange a morning call, the guy asked me to call the operator myself (couldn't he arrange the morning call?)The message light was on, I called the operator who told me there was a voice mail and asked me to call 4747 to retrieve myself (doubt couldn't she connected me to the voice mail system?)The most unbelievable and unacceptable was I asked the banquet waiter: do you have toothpick? the answer was : Sorry, I don't have. Then he walked away and I didn't get the toothpick even after 15 minutes.View and location is excellent, but service is not up to a 'GRAND' standard.

Stayed four days in connection with a conference. Nice room and super service. The restaurant on 36 floor has great views but is apparantly closing in the near future. Ask for a room on a high floor! I was on third floor and there is a lot of noise from the street (people and construction). The location is perfect for business and shopping.

I felt like i was at a mediocre hotel. Having arrived close to 11pm, we couldnt find the side entrance that we were instructed to use from the website since they had construction going on at their front entrance. No signs, no one to help us outside. Even thru the front entrance, nobody cared to assist us with our 4 bags on arrival and departure. This is "Grand" ???Usually, as with other hotels, when one requests a corner room, one gets a true corner room with double views. We paid extra for a room that was at the "end' of a floor but just with 1 view facing front. Seriously???Also, our door had a 1" crack underneath that allowed a lot of hall light to keep us awake at night. Why?Then, early next morning, we couldn't even sleep in as people started vacuuming the hallway in front of our door keeping us wide awake. This is "Grand" ???Being on the 27th floor, the water pressure from the shower was weak. You actually had to stand almost with your nose against the wall so you could catch the weak shower flow; The room ac was a bit too warm even when set at 65 degrees.

I had stayed at this hotel with my family about 10 years ago and knew it was in a prime location. My husband and I booked the hotel and were able to walk everywhere. In addition, the hotel was recently renovated and it surpassed my expectations. Very modern style, luxe feel and great views of the city. The staff were great and very helpful. I would book this hotel in a heartbeat if I were to return. I definitely recommend it if you are visiting San Francisco. You won't be disappointed.

My husband and I recently spent 4 days in San Francisco and are very happy to have chosen the Grand Hyatt for our stay. While the lobby was under construction, it wasn't an inconvenience at all. Our room was great with nice upgrades. Comfortable bed, big bathroom, and a fabulous view of Union Square. Very friendly staff. Excellent rooftop bar with beautiful views of the city. Highly recommend this hotel. Great location, too!

Hotel is being renovated but we knew that when we booked so wasn't really a problem. Staff were polite and helpful in arrival and we were able to access our rooms straight away (about 10 am) and also get a late check out for one of our rooms, on our last day(we had 2 rooms as SF hotel Rooms are really to small to comfortably accommodate 2 adults and 2 teens). We didn't use in house dining as so many options close by.Our rooms were newly refurbished and very pleasant. The views were stunning. Beds comfortable and showers good. I was really disappointed in the Internet access, firstly you had to pay (which is unusual these days and seems petty) and then I couldn't get it to work (on my iPhone - surely nothing complicated) the hotel staff really not interested in helping. Ended up going to Starbucks every time needed to use it which worked fine but I expected more from the Hyatt. Location is perfect if you want to shop, lots of options any direction you walk in.

Stayed at the hotel while on business in SF.A few hassles with arrival as the lobby is currently under construction but once past that had a good stay. Rooms are decent size and well appointed. Feels like they have been upgraded in the not too distant past. The restarraunt on the top floor has just okay food but amazing views. If you go for an early breakfast, watching the sunrise over the city is NICE!

There is a bit of construction in the lobby area but the rooms were very clean and modernized. The service was great. The room service breakfast was very good. And the central location of the hotel was wonderful. Very nice views and a very good restaurant on the 37th floor. The restaurant will be replaced by a banquet room. So sad to see the restaurant on the top floor go because we saw a beautiful sunset from our dinner table. All in all, a great stay.

My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt in San Fran on a particularly busy weekend for the city (Fleet Week, Air Shows, Blues Festivals, 49ers and America's Cup). A Hyatt should be able to stand up to these events. We knew that the lobby was being renovated but there was a total lack of signage to direct guests where they needed to go and there was no doorman at the makeshift entrance to the hotel to mark the entrance and provide direction. The check in process was totally underwhelming. The woman provided no information on the hotel, or the city and was incredibly aloof. Initially I thought the room we were in was one of the unrenovated rooms.... turns out it wasn't. Granted the colour scheme was not to my taste but even if it was, it was cheaply finished and already had chips taken out of the veneer of the bedside tables. The bathrooms are not bright enough and the bath so small it was pointless to have one in there at all.We had arranged for tickets to be sent to hotel prior to our arrival. Obviously we confirmed this was ok prior to the booking to tickets, we then confirmed that they had been received. We then spent two anxious days while concierge attempted to locate them. Until this point my husband was pretty positive about the hotel, he then tried to organise a restaurant via the concierge, after that experience he was well over the concierge and the hotel. I understand that the city was busy and there were a lot of guests but perhaps additional staff during the turmoil of the renovation might make the guests feel welcomed and satisfied with their stay. Even without the renovation our experience was disappointing and I will certainly never stay there again. If you are paying for a fancy hotel you expect a certain level of service, The Hyatt did not deliver on basic elements let alone the inconvenience of the renovation.

Lobby is under construction, doesn't feel like a 4 star hotel. Breakfast is only served from 6.30am which is a shame as business people starts their day at 7.00am. Fortunatelly there is a Starbucks around the corner. Room was very noisy, you can hear all noises from the street (actually I thought the window was open...but that was not the case). Very unpleasant. Otherwise rooms are fine and large. Bathroom is great.

Our three day stay was enjoyable but for three things.1.Incinvenience with renovations.2.At this rate thought wi fi would have been include3.Transfer booked and paid for previous night to early morning flight was never booked by staff hence last minute panic to make flight.

We stayed here just for a quick 1 day trip on 9/22. We choose this hotel because its location, just across from Union square. We got there at noon, almost able to checked in right away but another front desk checked in another guest while we were thinking about whether to take the room or not. So, we checked in our luggage and went out for shopping. In 1 hour the hotel called and informed me that the room is ready. The room was clean, new and also have contemporary design to it. This hotel is also undergoing renovation to all rooms and also the lobby. So, the lobby is a bit messy and seemed smaller. The bathroom has a big mirror with back lighting, very big and long sink. Tub and shower combination with Hyatt portico amenities. The bed was comfortable and new. The view from the room was ok. The fitness center was small and probably they will refurbish it later. I love that they provide cold towel and Ice water dispenser by the entrance to fitness center. No swimming pool is the only draw back. All the staff were great and very professional. I recommend this hotel and would love to go back again.

They are doing a nice job on the hotel but the lobby is a bit messy with all the areas under construction. Entry is now on Sutter St. Can be confusing. But the rooms which have been remodeled look great and the updated bathrooms are nice. We had a suite and it was very large and comfortable. No complaints about the room and the furniture comfortable as well. The Club room on the 32nd floor for the diamond gold passport members is terrific. Great foods and service. Stunning views of the water and bay.

Great hotel, Great Location. We flew in from Australia and after travelling the better part of 20 hours we were looking for a bit of comfort, and we found it here. Central to most things and easy to commute from with public transport all around. We had breakfast included in the room price and it did not disappoint. My goodness the buffet was endless and the views are second to none. Just amazing watching the fog roll in down the bay from the 36th floor. Staff were helpful and polite and made check in and out absolutely seamless. If I ever return I'd definitely come back to stay. Nice one grand Hyatt !!

We stayed at this hotel for a week. We asked for a quiet room high up and away from street noise. We were given an end unit on the 12th floor next to the housekeeping door. Street and construction noise were still heard so we had to run the air conditioning to get "white noise" to cover the unwanted sounds. The rooms were renovated but the windows which opened slightly were not replaced. The housekeeping door opened and closed very early in the morning. The lobby was under construction but they had sufficient staff for check-in and getting our luggage to the room. The newly renovated rooms were very nicely appointed and the electronic blackout current worked well. The coffee makers and supplies in the room were sanitary and easy to use. We got additional towels but had to keep asking for additional towels each time they made up the room. We thought that what they removed would automatically be replaced. The concierge service over the week was inconsistent. Some of the concierge provided very good and accurate information and recommendations while others were not as good or complete. The location was very convenient for shopping, dining and sightseeing. We felt safe around the hotel and there were many attractions to which you could walk.

Stayed here for a few night on my last trip to San Francisco and had a nice stay. The hotel was just finishing the refurbishing of the lobby so everything was a bit rough, and there was a convention in town so everything was fully booked.They still managed to get me a nice room with a view of the Coit tower and the water, very nice. I also appreciated the nice bathroom. The Club lounge is big but only average in quality in my opinion, but nice to spend some time with an even better view.The gym is also good and also has a view (another part) of the city and the Bay. Will stay there again when in town.

We stayed 2 nights. The hotel exceeded expectations. We weren't aware of the renos taking place in the lobby. It was a bit of an inconvenience, but the hotel more than compensated by offering us free wifi and breakfast each day. The location is great. We especially enjoyed the lounge on the 36th floor. Wonderful views. Would definitely stay here again.

San Francisco was the last stop on a 12 day trip along the coast from Seattle. We were so happy to reach the "big city" and it didn't disappoint.The hotel lobby is under construction but the staff never missed a beat. Don't know if they are always this accomodating but they were wonderful. Newly decorated room was fabulous. Electric room darkening shades were very cool. Bed was yummy. Our package price included breakfast which was served in the 37th floor restaurant. It was packed on Saturday and Sunday mornings but the staff was incredible. To placate folks for the wait they took our orders for a beverage while we stood in line and we even got our herb tea before sitting down. When we did get our table and began to enjoy a scrumptious buffet, it seemed the staff knew what we wanted/needed before we even looked around to request something. I have traveled alot and was very surprised - pleasantly of course - at the quality of the service. Just amazing.Concierge helped several different ways. We were able to print our boarding passes in the lobby. GREAT experience.

I was attending a conference at the Moscone Center and though this was a 15 min walk (ok 20+min walk in heels), it was through Union Square and lovely shops and stores. My room faced Union Square (Macy's) which was a nice view. I ate breakfast in the restaurant and it was ok but fairly noisy, and I ordered room service which was prompt and pricey. I overheard one of the staff explaining that a custom wood staircase will be a main feature of the new lobby- sounds wonderful, I'll have to see it when I return!

Stayed for 5 nights in September. As already mentioned Lobby is still having work done to it. However staff have worked hard to minamise any inconvienience. Stayed in a club room on 33rd floor. Expensive (as San Francisco is) but very pleased with the room and view fantastic. Breakfast in Club lounge was more than adequate for my husband and I as we are not bothered about having a full cooked breakfast every morning. This is normal in our experience of club rooms for breakfast so was not suprised. What did suprise me was that you had to pay for the alcoholic drinks .Yes they were discounted but I have never had to pay for alcohol before in any club room we have been in. Usually 2-3hours of free drinks and then stop. Location of Hotel is very good. Found all the staff very professional and helpful. Would recommend the hotel but shop around for the best deals on all similar hotels

Lobby is still very minimal while being remodeled, but no visible construction or detraction that I could notice as a guest. Stayed on the 12th floor and was not disturbed by noise. The room is wonderful, I loved the room darkening shade that could be lowered or raised from the bed. Bathroom fixtures and amenities are grand. Wi-Fi was free and strong. The location is wonderful. I did not eat at the hotel, I was at a conference where most meals were covered.

Hotel has a fantastic location, just off Union Square. There is a Starbucks across the street and a 7-11 about 3 minutes away. Got a club room on a high floor with a spectacular view of Alcatraz! Food at the Club floor was quite spartan for the price we paid (about US$700 /night). I opted for the pricier Club floor room due to a recent stupendous experience at their Hong Kong hotel. Two options of hot food, cereals, hot cocoa/coffee/tea, pastries, fruits. You couldn't even order pancakes or bacon.. a major disappointment for the kids. We ended up buying our own nutella and peanut butter and bringing that every morning for breakfast. Cocktails was another surprise as you have to pay per glass of wine ordered! The level of service and food / wine option are leagues apart from the Grand Hyatt Hong Kong. HK offers unlimited champagne (Moet!) and wines at no extra cost and a massive spread of food! Loads of people at the check-in / check-out counters as hotel is a popular choice for conventions. Definitely check-in / check-out online. It will save you time and the headache of waiting. Concierge was polite and helped us book a couple of tours: Alcatraz (book in advance, especially during peak seasons) & Redwood, amongst others. We stayed almost 10 nights in this property. Next time, we will try a different hotel.

My family and I stayed for 8 nights and it is without doubt one of the best hotels my family and I have stayed at. The staff on the front desk were fantastic, often going out of their way to meet our request, housekeeper was faultless (couldnt fault a thing), the views from our room were sensational and the Grand Club is a must. Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Sensation value for money when you include the views and grand club facilitys which came in very handy with our kids using the free internet there as well as haling ourselves to the juices, bottles of water, yoghurts etc.

Though disappointed that construction was not completed as indicated on their website, the location more than made up for it. We had a nice room, facing Union Square, on a high floor. Looks like the rooms were recently redone, but seemed small and had NO drawers to put clothing away. The in room frig was appreciated. Be sure to up to the 36th floor for drinks or a meal. The view is spectacular.

stayed here for a night as I had a summit the Hyatt regency and they wre booked out the 1st night so I was directed here.good size room and the food was.the best is the breakfast at club level that has ana amazing view of the city.I only stayed a night so I didnt get to experience all the amenities but overall I would recomend this hotel especially if it was a choice between this and the hyatt regency.

We just checked out today after three nights in a newly renovated room on the 20th floor. The room was quite comfortable and well thought out. It was equipped with a mini refrigerator and had a view overlooking Union Square. Floor to ceiling blackout shades are very helpful during the afternoon to block out the direct sun. Because the hotel is in the process of renovation (the last phase will be the relocation of the signature restaurant on the 36th floor and its conversion into function rooms) the staff and management are especially helpful and apologetic and concerned about keeping guest informed as to what is happening.The location is very convenient to the Muni and other public transportation as well as shopping and other tourist oriented activities.

Rooms were on the smaller side, standard, nothing spectacular...Not one with a view either! It was very loud, between construction and the wind, we weren't able to sleep very much..Best part about this hotel was the location, near lots of shops, restaurants and bars. Short walk To China town, northbeach and Embarcadero. Cable car stops also nearby.. we had breakfast up on the restaurant, view was great but food was average and super over priced..overall a little disappointed with the stay, not a four star experience for sure..

Stayed here for 10 days in September. Although lobby under construction this did not effect our stay. Rooms lovely all refurbished, very quiet we were in the 18th floor great view. Hotel bar great with good views of the city. Fantastic location right in union sq could not ask for more. Would def stay here again.
