Stayed at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco for six days during the Intel IDF conference in September 2012. The location of the hotel is a block away from Union Square, and it's a short walk to the nearest subway/BART station. I had a standard room in the 32st floor with a king bed. The room was newly renovated, and during my stay they were also working on renovating the lobby of the hotel, I did however not notice that too much. As mentioned the newly renovated rooms were quite good in size, and so was the bathroom, everything also seemed very clean.For breakfast, I used the Grand Club in the 32nd floor, which is open for people in club rooms, and GP Diamond members, the Club at Grand Hyatt SF is open 24 hours, so you can also pick up water/soft drinks at night. The view from the club is excellent!Overall my stay was very good, the staff at the hotel was very friendly, and I would definitely come back next time I visit San Francisco, either on business or with my family.

This was mine and my husbands' first trip to San Francisco. What an amazing place. We stayed on the 31st floor and had an amazing view of the city. This hotel is right in the middle of all the shops. It is about a 2 minute walk down to the start of the cable cars - which cost $6 per person per ride (you can get day passes). The hotel is right at Union square - where there is an information center with all the things to do.We ate at a fantastic restaurant right around the corner from the hotel called Scala's - dinner.Eat at the Cheese Factory - again near the hotel for lunch.Things we did and you must do:Walk from Pier 15 all the way to Pier 29 where you can watch the seals on the docks. Go to Fishermans Wharf - lots of restaurants.Rent a car or bike and go across Golden Gate Bridge to Sausalito. Very pretty.Visit the Painted Ladies - famous houses in a row.Walk down the crookest street - Lombard Street.We would stay in this hotel again - very central, great staff, great views.

My husband, kids, parents and I spent 2 nights at the Grand Hyatt in SF last August. The location of this hotel is great if you would like to stay downtown. It is right at Union Square, close to shops and tour stops. We had two adjoining rooms on the 15th floor. The view from both rooms was amazing. The rooms were recently remodeled. One of the rooms had a vanity right outside the bathroom which I thought was very useful. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom, although a bit small, was functional and nice looking. The lobby was still under construction, so it got crowded at times but since we were not spending time in the lobby, this did not bother us that much. On the last night at the hotel, we had dinner at the rooftop restaurant which supposedly has one of the best view in SF. I say "supposedly" because we did not get to see anything since the fog had settled in. Overall, a great stay at the Grand Hyatt and I would definitely stay there again.

First vist to SF, the hotel is in a great location for all transport around the city, Muni F takes you between pier 39 and fishermans wharf to south of market, renovation of the hotel not quiet finished, but will be great when it's done, the rooms are a good size and very modern, with everything that you need, hotel staff are friendly and has free airline check in which was useful, thanks for a great holiday!

I recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco for 7 nights. The hotel is great and I have mostly all positive things to say about my stay. The room I had, in particular, was fabulous. It was a huge room on the 31st floor that overlooked the financial district. The room was modern with hardwood floors, large windows with automatic blinds, great furniture, a nice bathroom with a HUGE walk-in shower and, of course the Hyatt bed which is large and comfortable. Outside the room, the gym was very nice, as was the Club Lounge and the hotel is very close to Union Square and all of the San Francisco sites. The staff for the most part was all very nice and helpful...it didn't seem like they would go out of their way to be friendly and helpful, but if engaged it was fine.Now, there was a couple things that that kept me from rating the hotel a "5". First, is the reception area. I understand the lobby is under construction and that's fine. However, the check-in procedure (which appears to be fully renovated) is very confusing for a hotel this size. There are several small desks for check-in and the lines get quite long and people get angry quickly. My second criticism would be the restaurant, or more specifically, the lounge on the 36th floor. I am assuming it is next on the renovations list because it is quite outdated and rather old appearing. The menu in the lounge as well is quite small and very basic food. I ate there 2 nights - not wanting to go to the restaurant - it was fine, just had a diminished expectation from the feeling from the rest of the hotel.Overall, I would quickly recommend the Grand Hyatt to anyone. I was sad to check-out and move into my new apartment in San Francisco.

Stayed at the hotel for a week from the 19th September. Was in a great location, the room was big and the beds were lovely and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpfull. The fridge in the room was good for keeping water and milk in. There was a water machine and a ice machine on all the floors. The lobby is still being done up, will be finished in November, but didnt make any difference to our stay. The bar on the 36th floor was great, but its going to be changed into a conference room and the bar will be relocated. Rooms were cleaned and beds made everyday with clean towels. Would definately go back

I stayed here recently with some girlfriends. The location is perfect, right on Union Square, the rooms are very comfortable and clean and the fridge is very useful. The only thing missing is an ipod dock which is standard in most good hotels. The hotel charges for wifi which is unnecessary and annoying !  The staff are all friendly and helpful.

My friend and i have just returned after staying a week at the Hyatt and this hotel was in a great location.We had a room on the 12th floor and found only the same levels of noise coming from outside that you would find in any city so really wasnt that bad.We had a room with 2 double beds which were sooooo comfortable after a long day out sight seeing.Yes the lobby is not completed yet but that did not bother us and all the staff were very polite and very helpfull especially the consierge team.The 36th floor bar was great with amazing views and was very busy at times it is such a shame that they are moving the bar to the 2nd floor im sure the powers at be know what they are doing never the less agreat shame.Union square is a great location for getting out and about we took the cable car one block away on powell street this is also where the station is for the bart train from the airport $8.75 one way or $16 for shuttle express arranged by the hotel which was very efficient.All in all this hotel is great value and im sure if the lobby means alot to some folk it will be great when completed in nov.Would i stay again most deffinately.

Excellent and safe location - 1 minute walking distance from Union Square. Very clean and new renovated room.Wireless internet should be free- no slippers in the room and no shower cap! For a 4 star hotel these are must.

We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Grand Hyatt. It was a girls weekend away and it was awesome. The beds and pillows were comfy and the bathroom super clean ! The staff was very helpful and we had no real problems. Would definitely stay again.

Even though the Hotel was under renovation the hotel staff made up for any inconvenience. We booked a King room and when we arrived they had us for a Twin room. We showed the front desk person our copy of our on-line purchase and with out making any excuses they gave us our King bed room and free breakfast at the club room for all three days we were there. By the way the club room rocks, a great view on the 32 floor which we were staying on made it even more convenient. The Club room besides having better the your average continental breakfast serves up appetizers, wine and beer from 5:30 - 7:30PM every night. Oh by the way it's honor bar at night, which of course we did pay for. The location is great, situated next to Union Square and all the great shops.

Some hotels don't quite have it right with the new minimalistic renovations they have undertaken. The Grand Hyatt San Francisco got it right. I stayed in a small suite, so this review may be slightly different from some other others but I could not have been more pleased.When you enter the room there is a light panel where you can indicate lights on, off, low or shades open or closed. A panel further into the room says "Welcome and Goodbye" to adjust the lights to predetermined levels. There is a lots of unique lighting throughout the space.The room has hardwood floors, and gray walls, with subtle bursts of color in the area rugs and a picture on the wall. Lots of wood detailing also. In the parlor area there is a desk with a large screen MAC computer, on which I am writing this review, and a 50-52" Bose plasma connected to a blu-ray player. The room comes stocked with about a dozen various dvds for your entertainment. The Bose plasma is also has an iPod dock, so you can control your iPod through the remote for the plasma and watch your movies or videos on a big screen.Helpful to the business traveler, there are outlets literally everywhere. Near the bed, on top of the work desk in the bathroom and pretty much everywhere you need one. Nice sized walk in closet. Three very large floor to ceiling windows with automatic shades controlled from several places throughout the room.Bathroom is large and includes a separate tub and seated area along with the shower inside of the same walled area. Includes a rain type shower head in the ceiling, along with optional handheld shower heads on the wall and another for use in the bathtub.The bed was comfortable; I feel like Hyatt opted for something more comfortable in their renovation than they've had in the past. This is room I definitely wanted to come "home" to at the end of my busy days.Fitness center is not large but has modern LifeFitness equipment. About 6 treadmills, 5 or so ellipticals, a few bikes, and weight machines.The front door area is under construction, but this didn't cause any problems with my stay. The concierge and front desk staffs are top notch when it comes to customer service. I was on a top floor and did still hear street noise at time, but am not a light sleeper and it didn't cause any problem for me.

This the second time I stayed here & it's been a very pleasent experience again, so I thought to write a Good review on them! Location is Fantastic, just around the corner of Union Sq!Very Comfortable Newly rennovated rooms & great services! At the moment they're rennovating the Lounge area, as they're very organize so nothing really gets in the way. I'll be back. Oh WIFI is excellent!

Pros:* Elegant room and bathroom design. * Attractive offers because of renovation.* The WiFi was free to my surprise (perhaps also because of the renovation).* Location right around the corner from Union Square.Cons:* Noisy rooms - windows are old and don't close properly. What's even worse is that the aircon/heater cannot be switched off and is always blowing.* My "City view" room on the 21st floor had a vastly different view from the 36th floor, so insist on a high floor.* Breakfast buffet ($23) is rather limited for a hotel of this size and class (a Hilton Garden Inn has more variety).* No place to hang towels in bathroom.* Towels so fluffy one is covered in a layer of white fluff after showering...

The Hotel is lovely, rooms comfortable, there is free wifi if you only want to email and catch up on social media. Starbucks across the road, Self Service laundry 3min walk on Bush St. One block to trolley (Powell St) to Fisherman's Wharf. My only disappointment and maybe it is due to current renovations, was it was not clear how to check in, people standing all over the place, nowhere to queue, I ended up using self service kiosk beause I couldn't get assistance from anyone. I had to find someone to ask where lifts were, not helful at all! I was disappointed we were given 2 Dbl beds instead of the King I requested 4 months earlier as it was our 25th wedding anniversary...how romantic! I didn't bother to complain as we were able to check in early at midday which was a bonus. The restaurant / bar on 36th floor is great with wonderful views of the city and bay, great place to pass time when waiting for airport shuttle! Overall a great stay.

My daughter and I shared a mini vacay in August and stayed at this hotel. We loved the hotel and our room was very shi shi . Other than the construction in the lobby we found all the staff we spoke to to be very friendly and helpful. The location was central to everything. Just a short walk to famous, Chinatown. Very easy to get around the city at this location and the concierge was extremely helpful in recommending restaurants and patient with directions. The restaurant at the top had some breathtaking views once the fog blew over. Comfortable beds and a quiet floor made this stay most enjoyable.

My wife and I stayed here in September. It is a very nice hotel right on union square. The rooms are modern and very clean. There is a nice top floor restaurant and bar overlooking the city. The staff were lovely and helpful. The cable car is a short stroll away which u can ride down to Fisherman warf. My only complaint was the wait for breakfast on Sunday morning, otherwise a great stay.

We knew that the lobby of the hotel was undergoing a reno and it was not a problem. Our room was as requested with 2 double beds; rooms were also recently renovated and were well laid out and appointed. My only real complaint was with the sliding door to the bathroom - feels like the door is not quite closed and lacked some privacy. The bed was wonderful and gave a great sleep. We also enjoyed the Grandviews Lounge - we shared a Caesar salad and the pizza - plenty for 2 people. The staff at the concierge desk were very helpful and knowlegeable. the location was great; close to all the great shops and Union Square. Only other complaint was that it was pricey and yet local calls were $1 each (!!) and the internet was $15/day.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt on two occasions in September and both were great experiences. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to rooms on the 31st and 32nd floors for our stays. The location worked great for us, fairly centrally located and easy to get where we wanted. We did however, hear street noise all the way up as the full outside wall is window. Gave a great view of the city though! And it was fun listening to the USC pep rally in Union Square. Rooms were completely renovated and very nice with room darkening shade a the touch of a button. Enjoyed the Grandviews Lounge and Restaurant while we were there also. Bar staff were very friendly.

Up-to-date hotel with great rooms. I was on the 30th floor and had a spectacular view of the Macy's and the city. The bar on the 36th level was also affordable and gave us a great view of the Bay. It even had live music on Thursday night. I stayed there for 4 nights and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for something central in San Francisco. You can't really beat the location of this Union Square hotel. The light and curtain switchs next to the beds was for sure appreciated and the bathroom offers a big sink. Everything was great.

Our two night stay at the Grand Hyatt was at the tail end of a two week family vacation in Nevada and California. We have stayed in Hyatt hotels in the past (in fact, this was our third Hyatt property on this vacation) and it was truly amazing. Very well located, very modern, well staffed (and friendly). Our room faced the bay, and we were about 2/3 of the way up the tower, so THAT was a pleasant surprise. The room was big enough for all four of us (two adults and two pre-teens).Only complaint (and it's a minor one) - based on the price that we paid for this hotel, would it kill them to offer complimentary wireless internet access? (One of the other two Hyatt's that we stayed at on this trip also wanted payment for wireless). That aside, we'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

We visited San Francisco for 1 week in September. The hotel is just newly renovated and in the lobby there is still some wok going on but didn't effect us at all. We got a room upgrade to the 20th floor with a view over Union Square which was great. Rooms always clean, concierge was extremely helpful and stunning view from the bar on the 36th floor. The weather was nice, around 20-24 degrees but can get cold at night due to breeze.

Grand hotel, with central location, good service, renovated rooms, clean but why oh why did they not renovate the windows...noise is awful and for the price and brand, this is not acceptable.Pros: great location right near union Sq but not on the cable car roads. Stunning views from the restaurant. Good service overall (top marks for their conceirge).Rooms are nicely appointed and good sized bathroooms. Clean overall (lobby was being renovated so cannot comment on what it will end up as, but they dealt OK with that)Con's: check in does not match the ticket. Book a room get another lottery seems to be the order of the day. Checkin staff smile away but don't seem to care, no doubt heard it all before...Worst part is the noise. Now we were up on or near 25th floor, so I hate to think what it was like down below. The windows are single glazed so you could hear pretty much everything happening below. Why do you renovate a place and forget to put in some serious sound proofing ont he windows??reason is perhaps what lets this hotel down the most. They've got a great brand, a great location and want to milk this for kingdom come.Get that sorted out, and this would be a good but expensive 4 star.PS Complaining gets you extra points and smiles but they clearly messed up on the noise

We were in San Francisco for the start of a 17 day trip around the southwest to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary and our travel agent selected this as our first hotel. Right on Union Square near the shopping district and a short walk to the historic cable cars makes this a great location. The view from the restaurant is second to none, being on the 36th floor with panoramic views over most of San Francisco's landmarks, when not covered in mist. The Hyatt is still undergoing some refurbishment, which gave a somewhat cluttered appearance on entry to the lobby. But the staff were very friendly and welcoming.The rooms however were of excellent decor and modern, complete with a separate bathroom and dressing area and included a large screen LCD TV and an i-pod dock!The only reason this gets a four is because that in this day and age you should not have to pay extra for wi-fi when you are paying this amount of money to stay. We stayed at 9 different hotels on this trip and this was the only one which actually charged for wi-fi, poor, considering some of the others were more budget end of the hotel market.Wi-fi charges aside, if you want a hotel with good location and stunning views this is the place come.

This hotel is well located in union square with all local amenities on its doorstep. Our room over looked union sq and Macy's. The room was big with a very comfy bed and decent bathroom. The staff have been fantastic, very welcoming. Breakfast is great, a good selection which gets you started for the day. The highlight of the hotel has to be the bar and restaurant on the 36th floor. Incredibly views of San Fran including coit tower, Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge. Highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed in a bay view room on level 28, and while the room was nice enough, the view was what made it memorable. We thoroughly enjoyed the fantastic view of the bay, Alcatraz, Coit Tower and the TransAmerica building. As the hotel is currently undergoing renovation of its lobby, we got a stay 2 nights, get the third free including breakfast so it was excellent value (with exception of the wifi at $10/ day). The union square location was very central, with a short walk to china town and north beach.

We stayed here for the last part of our honeymoon and with the exception of the construction and concierge I would give it 4 stars.Pros: Upgraded to a suite and wine and cheese sent to our room. Phenomenal touch and the front desk staff was amazing. The room was spacious, modern and absolutely gorgeous.Cons: The concierge experience. Rude Rude Rude. Not friendly, professionally or educated about the city. The concierge had us waiting for 30 minutes to ask a question and when we got to the front desk he actually complained about a prior customer staying at the hotel. I've travelled to many first class hotels and I have never heard a hotel staff speak to another hotel guest about another guest that way. It was appalling.

We selected this hotel as the options in San Fran are quite limited.. and we were able to book at great rate! We really enjoyed our stay even though the lobby and reception is under serious construction. Rooms have all been renovated and are very comfy - nicely decorated and if you have view - it is a killer view! Bar on the top floor had amazing views but felt like a tourist trap - hope this is one the renovation list as well! What you can see of the lobby so far - looks really promising - stylish - hip and perfect for the city. Location for shopping can not get any better - it is ALL right there - All of it! So this was great for us (bad for our wallets). We did not have any meals here - but why would you in a city like San Fran with all its amazing options. The concierge (Gentleman and lady) were both really helpful and friendly. We will be very happy to stay here again.. and no it was not our most amazing hotel experience ever - but perhaps one of the most convenient city hotel experiences. - I really do not have any critique here (except maybe the construction - but then again they are just getting it ready for our next stay).

We started our recent travels in the Grand Hyatt. The hotel is under going renovations of its reception area however all of the room have been restyled. Our room was on the 17th floor and we had a good view of the city and could see the water between the buildings.The room was a good size and clean and there was everything that you required within the room. However ladies if you go to use the hairdryer you may have a problem as the lead to the hairdryer is so short I was unable to blow dry my hair, this was not a problem as I had brougth my own. We had a meal in the restaurant located on the top floor of the hotel which gave us a spectactular view over the city to the bay. The food was good and service was also good.The hotel is located by Union Square which is a good location for transport and to get to all area's of the city.

Stayed for a conference;spacious rooms recently updated and are very well done. Nicely furnished; comfortable bed, widescreen TV, great bathroom - except for sink - very shallow and prone to prone to spilling water if glass is emptyed quickly. Hotel dining and lounge are on the top floor, very good quality food and service; excellent views. Fitness facility is also top notch. The hotel lobby is still under construction so services are somewhat cramped for now - due to be completed by year end; enter from the side next to Levi's store. Overlooking the square and in the heart of everything, this is a great location from which to enjoy all that San Francisco offers.

My wife and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt S.F. last week. We were lucky or because we are regular guests we were given a Bay View room on the 31st floor. It was beautiful. The Hyatt lobby is in the process of being totally remodeled and should be finished in October or November. This is the last step in the hotel being remodeled from top to bottom. The staff went overboard to make everyone feel comfortable thru the check in. Only complaint is you can hear guests outside your door talking especially when they slam their door at 2am. Still a very nice hotel in a great location

This hotel was good, but not what I was expecting. The location is a big plus. You can't beat it. Around the corner from Union Square. The room was nice, but the bed and pillows were terrible. Very uncomfortable. The bathroom and shower were good though. However, the biggest disappointment for me had to be the Grand Club facilities. The breakfast choices on offer were poor and the fact that alcohol during the evening "happy hour" service had to be paid for was amateurish. I've previously paid for the same type of benefits when I stayed at the Sofitel in Melbourne Australia and their offering was a lot better. The breakfast was better quality and all drinks and food was free to club guests between 5pm and 7pm each night. Charging people for drinks when they've already paid extra to use the club facilities is a disgrace.

The location for this property is excellent for exploring the best areas of San Francisco. This is a far better area to stay compared to touristy Fisherman's Wharf. The rooms here are clean, comfortable, and modern. The couple of times that I've stayed here, we had a great view of the city. Higher floors are better obviously.

We stayed here for 3nights, the room was great-had everything we needed And housekeeping did a great job. The best thing about this hotel is the location-right by union square and the top floor bar and restaurant has the most amazing views but isn't ridiculously over priced. I would recommend this hotel to anyone

New refurbished rooms are simply ok. Nice and clean at the minute but poor quality and will not last, some bits falling apart already. Refurbishment also only partial. Still noisy air-con and old doors that should have been replaced. Noise from corridors can be easily heard in rooms. Sprinklers not cleaned and dusty. Refurbishments of the lobby were continuing despite booking confirmation stating they would be finished.Staff all very friendly.Location pretty good although be aware of where you are walking at night.Parking $56 a night. Suggest using the Union Square underground car park where the Hyatt actually park the valet cars. Will save $20 a night and is just next door. Do not use the multi story car park diagonally opposite, cars often get stolen.Pretty average.

Hotel is in a prefect location for visiting SF and the rooms are attractive, clean and with stunning views. Customer service is terrible though, we had quite a large problem during our stay which was not resolved at all by the staff, in fact they only made it worse! Complained to Hyatt head office on my return home and received compensation and an apology. Despite this I would stay again as the hotel was nice and the location great, unjust wouldn't expect anything from a customer service point of view! Ask for a high floor room on the bay side for an amazing view.

I stayed there in late July early august and had a wonderful experience. The location was great, and we had a beautiful view of the city. Do yourself a favor, and have a drink at the bar. The prices are comparable to any city bar and you get a great view of the city. We were originally supposed to stay in a hotel in Berkeley and I am so happy we splurged on this. It was worth every penny. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt for 2 nights at the end of a little west coast road trip we were doing. The location is great, right near union square downtown. Easily within walking distance to great shops, restaurants, cable car stops, and other attractions. They were finishing some renovations in the lobby but it really wasn't anything that was an in inconvenience. The room we got had just been renovated and everything was really modern. It was big, had floor to ceiling window, updated bathroom, big comfy king sized bed, and was 'pure' so had hypoallergenic linens and an air purifier in the room-pretty cool. Only complaint was that we were in an adjoining room and when someone checked into the room next to us they were pretty noisy and we could hear them through the wall. Overall loved our stay and wound definitely go back.

Thought for the most part the room was good. Comfy bed and housekeeping was good too. Wish we had a room higher then level 15 so we didn't hear the door man call for taxis. The place in under construction but I would say the people were nicer as we were checking out than when we checked in...Unless I get a great deal would I go back but I'm sure I could find just as nice of a place for cheaper.

Large, stylish and recently refurbished rooms including walk through wardrobe, attentive service and an unbeatable location in union square make this a great place to stay. Some minor criticisms - the walls are very thin, so you can hear everything going on in the rooms around you and every time someone opens their door, it sounds like they are coming into your room; the water pressure in the shower is pathetic; the amenities were pretty basic - no shower cap, sewing kit etc and the bath towels were too small. The lobby is undergoing renovation so it is cramped and the layout confusing. Apart from that, highly recommended.

We were a little disappointed with this hotel, given the price and reputation. It was a good stay, but we expected better.The lobby was dark, drab and outdated, and the staff weren't particularly friendly.That said, the rooms and hallways are very nice, very stylishly decorated too. The room was spacious and bright, the bed was fairly comfortable, and the bathroom was nice and clean.The hotel is in a FANTASTIC location. Right beside Union Square, a minute away from the cable car, a load of bus routes, and a few minutes from the bart/muni station.My biggest complaint was noise. This is not a quiet hotel by any means. There is a huge amount of noise from the street outside, partly from the roadworks, but mostly from people and traffic. There's also a lot of noise from within the hotel. We heard people talking in the neighbouring rooms and the hallways. We also heard the housekeeping staff hoovering right outside our door every second morning at 8:30am. Lovely wake up call...All in all, this wasn't a bad stay, but I was expecting a bit more. Would I recommend this hotel to others? Probably, but only with the caveats of "If you can get a discount" and "bring earplugs"

Reccomended by our travel agent.A great location just off Union Square.Lobby was dark and a bit uninviting but the staff very friendly and helpful.The room was very clean and modern with very very comfortable beds!!!I would definately come back.

Lots of nice things about the hotel - great location, beautiful views from top floors and just a few blocks from BART. Unfortunately, the lobby is currently under construction. It's quite a mess right now. I would stay here again for the right price, though there are so many great hotels in San Francisco that I tend to move around.

The Grand Hyatt is situated a few steps from San Francisco' Union Square where you will find absolutely everything you need;shops, restaurants (pricey though), tram and bus tour stops, etc. Me and my husband stayed on a high floor room and just coudn't get enough of the view.The 36th floor, where the restaurant and bar are located also has an amazing skyline views (best at night time)! The beds are extraordinary and so are the pillows, you only realise this when you go to another hotel straight after this one and think how comfortable the Hyaat was. The bathroom is quite big with a great shower. All amenities in the room are up to a 5* standard!The service is ok, shame about some of the staff who could not understand English that well, but we managed to order some room service at the end. Overall, a very nice hotel and I highly recommend it.

Very rarely will you stay at a hotel where you can have a once in a lifetime view. From the 36th floor bar looking north you can see across the bay, the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, the city, the Pacific Ocean and into the horizon. If you can, stay on a high floor with a room facing north. Aside from the sublime views from the high floors, the rest of the hotel is perfectly fine. My room was small, modern, recently renovated, and attractive. The staff was helpful and friendly. The hotel lobby is under renovation, thus there is no place to hang there. The internet is not free, but upon check in the staff provided me with complimentary access. The health club was modern and had great east facing views from the 3th floor. Stay here if you want to be near Union Square and the central business and shopping districts.

I recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco for 3 nights over a very busy weekend- the city was sold out! My expectations are generally not high when it comes to chain hotels but the Grand Hyatt was overall a very pleasant expereince. In fairnesss, the hotel is completeing rennovations so the lobby area is small right now, and a little chaotic. The rooms however have been renovated and are wonderful- great contemporary design, light & bright (higher rooms have good views) and very pleasant bathrooms. The service in the hotel won't win any awards but equally was pleasant and the staff were always helpful even when it was clear they were very busy! The location of the hotel on Union Square doesn't come any better. What does come a lot better is the food- just not at the Grand Hyatt. Rooftop retaurant/ bar was horrible and the service was well...... non-existant. We left after 30 minutes of no action! However there are great places to feed and water yourself within a 10 minute walk of the hotel so go explore!

We stayed in June of this year, first time in San Francisco. Debated over the Fishermans Wharf area or downtown. Opted for downtown and the Grand Hyatt as I'm a Hyatt Platinum card holder. Room was ok, not particularly large, but it was just a standard room. Maybe this is the norm for San Fran, but I just though small and the whole hotel just lacked any atmosphere and life.

Nice new room with north bay view from 27th floor. Bed etc so comfy! Lobby under construction. Service very nice. All good! Parking available on Stockton St behind hotel. Breakfast included on a bed& breakfast package deal-good! Dinner not recommended. Bar view from 36th floor- wow!

Trying to choose the right hotel adds so much stress to a trip, especially a spur-of-the-moment one. I found myself a bit overwhelmed with the variety of hotels available in the San Francisco area and after several hours of reading reviews and looking through guest photos I opted on the Hyatt Grand. The rooms at the Hyatt were recently renovated and the lobby is still under renovation. The check-in was easy, the room was very clean, the view was great and later that night we discovered the matteress was perfect. To be honest it was almost like we were the only ones in the hotel, no noise, no maids running up and down the hallways and no elevators doors opening and closing. I soon found my room a welcome spot to shower and rejuventate after our miles of walking.

The room i stayed in had a great view of union square. There are lots of shops and restaurants within walking distance to the hotel. Room was clean and staff was helpful. The lobby was still being renovated right now but the room was comfortable and clean.

...We didn't have handicap room. When I talked to the lady over the phone, I was informed there will be a small bed for my daughter,6y.o, which wasn't the case. Not only that, we checked in at 5pm and they had no room but the handicap room for us. We couldn't find the light switch, I am not sure if all the rooms were like that. The view was nice but I am not used to these types of rooms to be honest. I just didn't like the room, I was expecting to have a better room.The tv wasn't that clear. That is odd, we are in SF people.There was construction in the reception area, don't be discouraged to stay in this hotel because of the constructions. Everything is running just smooth, a lot of staff in the main entrance to help...Really good location at the square, lots of shopping and great restaurants around.We tried the hotel restaurant on the 36th floor. Really nice breakfast and decent service, not too busy which is good for me.I have mixed feelings to be honest. I am not sure if I want to stay here again. I didn't make a complaint because the gentleman did apologize when checked in and told me that was th last room... So I wasn't willing to lose my money because of their refund and cancellation policy... Also I didn't want to call other hotels around because I wasn't sure what to expect anymoreI am just confused.

Right beside union square with all of the shops including high end stores and a nearby shopping mall. This was my first trip to San Francisco and this was a perfect location because all of the restaurants, sightseeing and shopping were right near the hotel. Literally walking distance which was so great. We stayed on one of the club floors which are clean, looked recently renovated (nice bathrooms). The rooms are smaller than I expected for the club floor but we didn't spend too much time there anyways and that's the only sort of negative comment I have about the room. The room was always clean and tidy by the time we came back to our room which was great. We had access to the club lounge which had spectacular views and really good finger foods and free drinks. The service there was impeccable as well. We enjoyed some lunches on the 36th floor in the Grandview restaurant and again can't say enough about the views. Definitely sit in the bar area for better views of the bay. The front lobby was a bit cramped and dark due to the renovations but I'll let that slide because we enjoyed our stay and would come again.

This hotel is very well located, very close to the Union Square, Macy's, Nike, and some fancy stores like Prada, Burberry, Louis Vitton etc. I chosen a Club Floor Room that provide me breakfast and snacks. The food and service is very good and I slept very well. I recommend!

Despite the more recent reviews, we found our room to be clean and comfortable. With floor-to-ceiling windows, there is plenty of light in the room (we had a bay view, with full views of San Francisco Bay and Alcatraz). The rooms are small, but this isn't Kansas.We did not eat at the Hyatt restaurant (Grandviews on 36th floor), but heard it was good.Pluses:1. Starbucks directly across the street.2. All the shops around Union Square at your back door (Nordstrom, Prada, Zara, Louis Vitton, Levi's, Macy's, Bloomingdales, etc.).3. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance.4. Leave the front door, turn left (Sutter), and at the next corner (Powell), you can take the purple cable car (Powell-Hyde) all the way to Ghiradelli Square for $6. Walk along the shoreline to Fort Mason (next door) and have lunch at Greens (vegetarian fare).5. San Francisco Chronicle is put out by the elevators in the mornings for you to take.Minuses:1. Room was noisy on Saturday night, but quiet on weeknights.2. Bar (also on the 36th floor) was always crowded, so we went elsewhere.

and looks bad.The rooms are small, depressing and ugly. The service is unfriendly. I just couldnt wait to leave the room as soon as I arrived.I still it competes very strongly with the New York Grand Hyatt for my worst Grand Hyatt experience.

Nice place located in Union Square, breakfast at the top of the tower. Downstairs there is a a starbucks just across the road (Seems very important for USA people ;) ... 10 minutes by walk from the ferrymarket, 5 from the Chinatown and from Market street and Yerba Buone (where you can find a very nice foodcourt as well)

Stayed here for a couple of nights in August: fabulous location, next to Union Square and not too hard of a walk from the Powell St. BART Station. Room was spacious enough and beds comfortable. Front desk very professional. Heard some street noise but don't think that can be avoided downtown. Had a band playing one night at Union Square and we could hear it from our room but it quieted down by the time we went to bed. Still doing some renovation but was barely noticeable. Booked a room that included breakfast for an additional $20 and boy, was it worth it. The buffet was excellent and I think I had the best french toast ever from their kitchen! Only thing is that I thought the internet was included and it wasn't but since I had an I-Phone, it was OK. Will clarify that detail next time. All in all, it was a great experience for us and I would highly recommend the Grand Hyatt.

The hotel lobby is under renovation, but you really wouldn't notice it as the areas affected are fully blocked off. The hotel location simply cannot be beat. It is across the street from Starbucks and just a block away from Sears Fine Dining which is a good option for breakfast. A Trolley stop is 1 block away as is the main drag that takes you to Union Square and the Trolley turnaround. Amazing Union Square shopping is steps away from your front door. We stayed in a "pure" room, high floor, which was beautifully remodeled in a very clean, modern style and included an air purifier. Room size is smallish but I think that's what you can expect in a downtown setting and for 2 adults and 2 children it was just fine.

Loved being in Union Square! This hotel is in walking distance to Chinatown, union square, cable cars...everything. Cabs are right out front, staff is helpful and friendly. Hotel is newer, nice rooms, very clean, nice view of city. Restaurant was good. Overall excellent experience and would absolutely stay at the Grand Hyatt again!

I have stayed at this location many times while traveling for business in San Francisco. Great location in Union Square. Unbelievable views - on clear days - from the restaurant on the top floor. My favorite meal is their clam chowder with sourdough bread while over looking the city. They offer tasty peppermint salt water taffy at the front desk. Often when I check out I put some in my coat pocket, and when I find them weeks later it is a nice reminder of the hotel. I will be traveling into San Francisco for an overnight with my husband in late September, and we will be staying at the Grand Hyatt. I highly recommend it for business or leisure travel.

The hotel is in the middle of a huge renovation. Because of this, the lobby is small and lots of parts are walled off due to construction. But the rooms have been redone, and they are quite nice. The bathroom is incredibly well lit. The rooms are a bit small, but to be expected for a place right off Union Sq. There is no gift shop or coffee bar in the hotel. YOu have to go across the street to the Starbucks. Parking is expensive, but again, you have to expect that for the location. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Location is great for shopping, site seeing, and dining. Lots of great restaurants w/in walking distance, including Chinatown. I would definitely consider staying here again, esp once they complete the reno.

The hotel is very nice, excellently located in the most centered square of San Francisco, walking distance from chinatown and little Italy where night life is. Also it is in a very nice shopping area and with very useful bus stop close by. The only non-good thing is actually the smell. I don't know if it is due to the works in the entrance, but once entering there was always the smell of dogs.

Spent three nights there recently. Very well located hotel, near all important locations in San Francisco. Service was excellent and everything at reasonable prices. Staff was especially helpful whenever a special need arose. All around outstanding experience at reasonable prices.

We booked through Expedia and booked a 'King bed and bay view' room. At check in we were given a double room. I produced my booking receipt and was told that I was getting a king room with a 'magnificent bay view'. The bay view turned out to be a glimpse of the bay past a few buildings with the other 95% being a view of the city. I complained and was told that it was both a bay view and city view room so I should be pleased with that. The view from the other side of the building gave a full panoroma of the bay.That was the bay view I believe that I paid for. The attitude was very disappointing. I specifically paid extra for a bay view and I was not given one. I am a member of the Hyatt 'gold passport' loyalty program and I will be cutting my card up. I also found the rooms very noisy (from other guests) and the breakfast very average.

We stayed 3 nights at Club Level. Checking in easy. The Manager Christopher could not have been more helpful over a booking mix up. Room ideal with great view. Location great for the Bay, shopping, restaurants, public transport and AT&T Park! All the staff we dealt with (cleaners, concierge etc) were helpful and David in the Club was first rate. Ok so the lobby is nearly complete but It did not affect our stay!

I recently spent four nights here for a conference. If I had the option, I would have given the hotel 4 1/2 stars. The property is in the heart of SF (not close to the water - you will need to take a trolley or cab unless you want a tough walk). The hotel is going through a pretty big renovation. The lobby area was pretty busy throughout the stay and always had a little wait for the main counter.I am a Hyatt Diamond member and used an upgrade certificate, so I got a two-room suite. The room was recently redone and very modern. Really enjoyed the comfort level. The Grand Club was really nice for breakfast and appetizers. The view from the Club are incredible - a similar view from the top bar/restaurant at the Hyatt. The pricing was pretty much what I expected for a Grand Hyatt in SF.

This is a newly renovated hotel, (the lobby is still being worked on) At first glance the new rooms are very modern and slick looking, but then it gets funky. The window shades are electrically powered, good luck finding the switch. The wireless service is very very slooow. So we opted for the wired, the Ethernet cable is not on the desk where it would make sense, but next to the night stand, so you have to work from your bed. The door to the bathroom was a pocket door, which is cool looking but doesn't move fluidly. The toilet paper holder is back behind the toilet seat, but I think there is a good yoga move to twist and grab it. All said, the bed was great, the towels nice. The breakfast is expensive, and not worth the price unless someone else is paying for it.The staff is amazingly friendly and helpful considering the lobby is so small. The location is very convenient to Union Square.

Double rooms very small. Not worth the money. Parking $32 a night . This room costed us $270 after tax and parking. The base price was $206.I think they should tell you about the parking up front before booking the room.

Great hotel right in the heart of the city. Perfect, modern room with great view. Staff was friendly and the concierge was very informative. As opposed to other reviews remodel was not a distraction and hardly noticeable. Will definitely stay again.

After reading many reviews from tripadvisor, I decided to stay near Union square in San Francisco. As Grand Hyatt was newly renovated and have received quite a number of good reviews, I decided to give it a try.The taxi from airport to hotel took around 15 mins and cost USD 50 ( including tips). Hotel lobby / reception area was rather small and was crowded maybe due to the fact that one side was still under renovation. There were people and luggages everywhere. Check in was smooth but kind of cold. It was kind of mechanical without any smiles nor word of welcome.I have requested high floors as suggested by some tripadvisor members and was given a room on the 19th floor so noise disturbance from the streets was minimal.My room was newly renovated and had 2 twin beds and a flat screen tv. Although it is not extremely spacious, I did not find it too small or cramped. It can still fit 2 big suitcases if you do not keep them open at all times. Beds are soft and comfortable and the down pillow and quilt are also very comfortable.The bathroom has a large sink and hand held rain shower head . Unfortunately my shower pressure was a bit weak. There is tooth paste and hand soap but no shower cap. ( shower cap is important for me as I have long hair ) No slippers nor bathrobes.Â The room fridge is completely empty so you need to remember to get your water or drinks from nearby Walgreen Â . There is coffee maker in room but no glass coffee pot with it. I dont really bother with it as I prefer to order my coffee or have it outside. However, there is no room service menu and we had to ask for one from housekeeping. And when we made the order, we were told that quite a few things were not available as that was the old menu. Not a big deal, just minor annoyance.In room wifi works well but can only connect only up to 3 devices.Location is wonderful . There is a small convenient store 'Walgreen ' Â 3 mins walk away ( when you get out from the hotel, goÂ left then turn left again when you reach traffic lights. Small diner ' Loris' is opposite Walgreen which is good for a quick bite or breakfast. Starbucks is 2 mins away.You do not need a car in San Francisco city as everything is pretty close by. Taxis are not that expensive. But of course if you are going to napa valley or Carmel , then it will be better to have your own car.If you plan to do shopping, this hotel will be a great choice as there are many shops and a few large department stores all around. Saks, Â Macy's and Barney's are 2 minutes away and Nordstrom and Bloomingdales are 5 mins away.Â And you do not have to wait long for taxi in front of the hotel.If you want to buy a prepaid sim card, walk straight down stockton ( exit hotel turn right) then turn left on market street walk about 3-4 mins then you will see AT &T . The prepaid sim card starts at US$10 or $2 per day.Overall I am quite happy with this hotel and I would definitely stay here again if I could get a high floor room .

Firstly the location was great as far as shopping was concerned for my wife and the staff were very helpful. We were on the 14th floor and would be very surprised if we were in one of the newly renovated rooms as ours really wasn't that fresh. My biggest issue with the room was the very thin walls that picked up a lot of noise even when our neighbours (and presumably us) were just doing standard things...talking, watching tv, leaving the room etc.Certainly wouldnt say that it's a bad hotel but would probably try one of the many other boutique hotels in the area as an alternative

This hotel is perfectly located and was everything I could have asked for in regards to comfort, cleanliness, and service. Each and every member of the staff acknowledged us at all times, with most remembering our names. Check-in was quick and painless, and our club level room was spacious and afforded a lovely view. My review's title refers to the fact that I would HIGHLY recommend paying the upcharge for the club level, as it saves you from buying botteld water/soda from a store, and you can truly make breakfast and dinner a out of the food that is offered. It's not that we are cheap, but it's nice to have the option of just grabbing a couple small plates of food in the lounge after a long day of sightseeing. And the spread that is put out for breakfast is more than anybody would truly need- and I'm a breakfast person!The only thing that keeps this from a 5-star review is the fact that I could not get the room cold enough for my liking. I set the thermo to 65 (the lowest it could be set) and had the fan on constantly and it never really felt that cold.

I stayed here in August 2012. There is currently construction / renovations of the building, expected to be completed near the end of the year. Overall the room was clean, mostly quiet and provided a good night sleep. There was some residual noise from the halls, kids staying on the floor were loud, but not enough to disturb me. Decent location in union square, lots of shopping, food and easy to get a taxi / tourist bus from the location. I would stay here again

Great, centrally located hotel; it is very close to Union Square, cable car and Chinatown. Rooms were a bit small but nicely decorated. The concierge and other staff were very helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Got club floor this time. Room feels much more spacious and view was excellent. Lounge has limited # of tables but selection was just good. Coffee serves throughout the day. Breakfast includes: Omulets, Oatmeal, Box of cereals, Strawberries, Bananas, Apples, Cantalope, Honeydew, Bagles, Toasts, Assorted Pastries & Muffins. Good selection of teas. Gas water, Perrier, Bottled Water, Cran Apple Juice, Apple Juice, Orange Juice, choice of milks, Sodas was available to take from the bottle. Grand Bed was super comfy, too.They are still doing lobby renovation and lobby has no place to sit. But service was good and fast, room is completely new and I like this hotel.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt S.F. in late July for my husband's Birthday. We had a fantastic time. We flew into Oakland Airport, took the BART to the station 2 blocks away and just walked to the hotel. We had tickets for 2 days that we purchased online for the "open top" sightseeing bus that particularly takes you over the Golden Gate Bridge (as opposed to others that do not). Also make sure to buy tickets with the new company that has the newer buses (concierge was very helpful with this info). The station to pick up the tour buses is right in front of Union Square - a hop, skip and a jump away!We had a lovely dinner at the Embarcadero at the Epic RoastHouse (also recommended by our concierge because she knew we had our 5 year old son with us) - great suggestion! We had a limo driver bring us back to the hotel.Our room was on the 32nd floor and we had club lounge access - a must - an very convenient with a child to always have access to drinks and snacks. The breakfast was delicious every morning also - it included continental pastries, breads, cheeses, juices, yoghurts, fresh cut fruits, berries, smoked salmon as well as a hot meal (ie. vegetable omelettes etc...) each and every day. We were not around for the appetizer hour, so I cannot comment on that. The deserts at night were bite size gourmet tarts,cheesecake, cookies, etc..... The selection of Tazo teas and coffee drinks was great too! The service was great and the attendants in the lounge are extremely friendly. The computers and printer were very handy to print out boarding passes as well.The room was spectacular. I must say it was small, but what do you expect in Union Square? We had a corner room which had an amazing view of the Coit Tower, the City as well as the Coast!!! Stay on as high a floor as you can because even on the 32nd floor you can hear the traffic down below! Not an issue for me, but if you are a light sleeper - can be an issue. The room had an empty mini fridge, electric blinds, cool lighting, hardwood floors, updated bathroom with a raised sink. The bathroom does not have a bath tub, but a nice size walk in shower. The closet space and drawers are limited. There is a nice size safe for those who have many tablets, netbooks and treasures :)). They delivered a DVD machine for our son to watch his DVDs.The service was great. The lobby was still in the process of renovations, but that did not bother me at all because we never spend much time in lobbies. This hotel does not have a swimming pool.We just felt that the cleanliness, service and the location is unbeatable. We walked through China Town to the Fisherman's Wharf! Had a lovely "loud" child friendly and fun dinner at The Rainforest Cafe and walked back.The tour bus was also very handy to take us to many sights and museums like the California Academy of the Sciences - which was awesome as it combined the Rainforest, Aquarium as well as Planetarium all in one museum!Will return to this hotel for sure if we come back to San Francisco!

I cannot find anything negative to say. Right upon checking in, a very friendly and attentive girl "Jazelle" had taken good care of us. She was aware of our 34th anniversary, and had champagne along with chocolate covered strawberries sent to our room. What a way to start an anniversary. So perfect! Our room on the 19th floor was cozy, comfortable, and very quiet. Best sleep. It had a great view of Union Sq. Thanks Jazelle! The location is close by to chinatown(5min. walk thru the tunnel). I continue walking north (10min. walk), and you can reach North Beach. There is a Starbucks across the St. and a 7-11 down the St. You can do some great shopping at the Westfield Mall, Largest Macy's, and much more. You can reach Japan Town within a 10-15 min. muni bus ride and ride back for free.About $2.00. Checkout is 12:00, but we requested a 1 Hour ext., and there was not a problem. The entire staff are always trying to assist your needs. Excellent hotel and service. Highly Recommend!

Very friendly staff, modern and clean room, perfect location for every most important touristic location, eay to eat around hotel, the valet is a lintel expensive, but you can ask about the self parking garage with a normal price for union square and with privileage of in and out.

It's hard to find fancy, upscale, romantic but not- overpriced accomodation in SF. I really wanted to book Four Seasons or Mandarin, but ended up booking Grand Hyatt and didn't regret! They had a nice package with included breakfast in their famous top view restaurant and valet parking. Everything was just perfect!

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco for a trip to see family and friends. Although I've visited San Francisco many times for business and leisure, this is the first chance I had to stay at the Grand Hyatt. I picked it for several reasons - location, desire for Hyatt points, a reasonable rate for a downtown SF hotel, and the ability to use Amex points for 2 of the 5 night stay. The rooms were recently renovated and the furnishings were fabulous and much to my taste. The customer service of everyone ranging from front desk to housekeeping staff was exceptional. One minor drawback was that the lobby was much smaller than usual due to renovation so it was packed all the time. But again, the staff made up for it by their friendly demeanor. The location couldn't be beat. I had decided not to rent a car because of the cost and I didn't regret my decision for an instant. I walked everywhere, took BART to Oakland to see friends, and took the cable car from Ghirardelli Square. I had a few minor issues that were resolved at checkout and through a follow-up contact to my survey responses. Very impressive!!! I look forward to staying there again on future trips to the Bay area.

I didn't expect much but we were very pleasantly surprised! They automatically put our room as a connecting room with our children. The rooms were perfect, great bathrooms. And the location is great! It's around the corner from union square. The concierge and other staff were very helpful.Breakfast is on the 36th floor, great view!! ( not included)So will definitely recommend this hotel!

Excellent accomodations, location, check in/out, valet and staff! Beautiful 360 degree view from 35th floor lounge and the rooms are very clean with a modern decor and everything you might need is already in the room, right down to the toothpaste!. Simply a very quiet and comfortable two-day stay with so many good restaurants and shops within easy walking distance of the hotel.

We were not very impressed with the lobby when we arrived. There is major renovation going on and the place is very dark, crowded with no where to even sit down. However, once we arrived at our room on the 30th floor, we were all very surprised. We asked for a connecting room and the front desk staff did try their best (even though it took a long time) to get us one. The view from the room is amazing. The newly renvoated rooms are very modern, trendy and spacious. Also make sure your try their gym, it is on the 35th floor, very modern equipment and excellent view with your work out.The location of this hotel is also excellent. It is right at union square with lots of shopping, restaruants and cafes nearby. I would not eat at their restaurant and pay $7 for an oatmeal when there are so many different diners and cafes nearby.Overall we are very happy with this hotel. Only one minor complaint is the $55 per day we have to pay for valet parking. The traffic is in sane in down town with all the renovations they are doing in building subways in downtown. It is actually quite difficult to do self parking.

This hotel is well located, as it is very close to Union Square. It is a couple of minutes walk away from China Town as well, which was very convenient. The rooms have all been recently renovated, and have blinds that open and close at the push of a button....very exciting for the child in you!! However, the room felt quite small (considering you are in San Francisco, it doesn't really make much of a difference).The concierge was very warm and friendly, offering lots of tips of the best places to check out in the city. Overall, a very pleasant stay. We will definitely be returning in the future!

I'll admit - this was my first time staying at a Grand Hyatt. I have stayed at other Hyatt porperties, though, so I had an idea of what to expect. Also, I got the rate through at bidding site, so my reference is a bit biased in that I saved quite a few $$$ from standard rates. The Grand Hyatt is located just off of Union Square. Chinatown is just steps away, and the Port of San Francisco (which I encourage people to visit) is only a 15 minute walk. The hotel is just down the street from numerous shopping venues, including large department stores. There are plenty of restaurants, bars, clubs, and lounges within walking distance. You're also around the corner from the cable car and other public transportation. The hotel itself is quite nice. The lobby is somewhat small for being called a "Grand" hotel. It wasn't crowded, though. Then again, I checked in at 4pm. Check-in was fast and efficient with all of my preferences being met (high floor, king-sized bed). The staff was attentive and encouraged me to contact them should anything come up. The hotel has 6 elevators and I never once waited for longer than 2 minutes for an elevator (going up or going down). The room itself is a bit small in comparison to other hotels in San Fran in this star rating. It was comfortable, though, and I found there was ample storage. There was also a sitting area next to the window and an office space. The bathroom was a decent size and feature a large sink (although, not a deep sink as they were going for aesthetics over function). The colours are burnt orange, browns, beige, whites, etc. Very stylish in my opinion and not overstated. I also found that the room was quite modern, which is part of their revitalization. I was very content with the bed and found I was able to sleep throughout the night without disturbance. During the stay, room service kept the space immaculate and were not intrusive at all. In fact, during my 3-night stay I did not see housekeping once yet my room was always made up in good time. There was one negative to the room. The room I had faced west. When I arrived, it felt like the room was overheating due to the sun beaming into the room. Even with the a/c running, it was like being outside in the sun and spraying yourself with mist...you can still feel the heat. And even though the a/c was on, I really couldn't tolerate the sun, so I had to put the shades down halfway. It was a shame as the room features floor-to-ceiling windows.Otherwise, the room was worth every penny. The location cannot be beat. The rooms are comfortable, modern, and clean. The level of attention to detail is very much what I would expect from an AAA Four Diamond hotel. Even with the issues from the sun, I would suggest this hotel to anyone looking for a great 4-star hotel in the heart of San Fran.

Great experience! Being a Hyatt, I knew that this hotel would be lovely, but it was even better than I expected. First of all, let me say that in San Fran hotel rooms all tend to be small. When you come to San Fran, just expect that to be the case in any of the hotels, so that you won't be disappointed. What's wonderful about this Hyatt is that they make wonderful use of the space. It's clean, crisp and elegantly understated. The rooms have just been renovated and they are truly delightful. I had an amazing view of the city, and it was just the perfect downtown San Fran experience. The lobby is still under renovation, but that's no big deal at all, and the graciousness of the entire staff more than makes up for it. I was checked in by the lovely, Ms. Nikita Smalls, and she was so charming and full of genuine kindness. I was checked out by Steve Nietschke, and I was so impressed by his loyalty to the Hyatt brand and his knowledge about the hotel, Hyatt, and San Francisco. Just a wonderful experience! Housekeeping did an incredible job on our room everyday! I always leave a tip because housekeeping works so hard and they tend to be so under appreciated. My best personal tip for traveling, is if you want your room to get a bit of extra attention, leave a tip each day, don't wait until the end. It doesn't have to be a big tip, just something each day, and you would be amazed at the service housekeeping will provide. Oh, one last thing, the newly renovated gym is outstanding! One of the best hotel gyms I have ever seen. Great equipment, gorgeous views of the city, cool, and comfortable! Security in the gym area was also excellent, in that a bunch of irritating kids (too young, and irresponsible to be in the gym alone) were there banging the equipment, and security called their parents right away and took care of the situation. Great group of people working for Hyatt!

We spent a night at this hotel last weekend and what a memorable stay it was.Things I loved about this hotel:- Very friendly concierge. As soon as we parked our car, there was someone waiting to park the car for us and offered help with our luggage.- The rooms are spacious and very well decorated. Loved the bed, big windows, clean bathroom, and best of all - an automatic switch to open/close the window shades.- Friendly staff- The rooftop bar with its great view of the city. The guy playing the piano was great too.Honestly, I wish my bedroom looked like the room at this hotel. I absolutely loved my stay. The hotel is right in the heart of Union Square, so just walk around the area, explore and have fun.Cannot wait to come back!!!!!

My Wife and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 5 nights after marrying in Las Vegas. They upgraded us to the Grand Club which was excellent and David went out of his way to make sure we were looked after! We paid for a Bay View Room and were amazed at how good the view was from our room on the 31st floor, breath taking! The Buffet breakfast was good and George looked after us well! My only recommendation would be more variety at breakfast, such as cured meats. As others have stated the location is great. I would highly recommend this hotel.

The rooms at The Hyatt are super, you don't need one of the highest floors to get a great view through the floor to ceiling windows but make sure you visit the sky bar for a drink because it really is a 'wow'. Beds are comfy, rooms have adequate space (could have been a bit more generous) and are spotlessly clean. I thought the design of the rooms was very attractive and hope that the lobby makeover is equally good.We arrived as a workers pay protest was about to start and whilst the bellboys were good I felt under huge pressure to get the cases out of the car, flung on a trolley, dump them in the lobby & get the car shifted pronto - that didn't create the best first impression. An email or text in advance warning me would have been helpful as I could have delayed our arrival a little to avoid the chaos.Reception team were welcoming & friendly. Concierge team helpful & answered our questions with great knowledge. Maids courteous and Mitch in the sky bar smashing! This was our second time in San Fran & I much preferred the Union Square location to Fishermans Wharf. The Wharf has been overrun with tacky tourist tat since our last visit but no worries, transport down to the Wharf on the Muni is easy and we found it walkable. My only doubt in terms of the Union Square location would be that work has just started digging up the road for what I understand relates to extending the underground, it's going to be going on for a while and did disturb us as work started early in the morning, light sleepers take your ear plugs just in case.I would recommend the Grand Hyatt to my friends, it was good value compared with hotels of a similar standard in the area.

Cannot say enough about the staff at the Grand Hyatt SF. From checking in to checking out, the staff was amazing. The room was great, bed was great, the room was clean and everything was great, but my favorite part about the hotel was the concierge...John was AWESOME! He was funny, sincere, very helpful, but also wanted to make sure that I was safe but had a good time. All of concierge was great, from Liz to Joanne to Susan to Mark. But the best member of the concierge team was John. I just cannot say enough good things about him and the staff.

We had a wonderful time at this Hotel, it is well placed central, the staff were awesome, the highlight was the breakfast buffet on the Top floor, we had a 360 view of the city.Would recommend this to anyone visiting San Fran.

This is a great hotel. Staff are very professional at all times: great to have a concierge who provided all the quick answers you need when you only have a short time. Because it is on Union Square we were close to China Town and the Powell Hyde Cable car line. The restaurant and piano bar on the 36th floor are must do because of the views but also the utterly professional hospitality. The food prices were no more than what we would pay at a decent pub back in Australia. Well done to the Grand Hyatt

We had high expectations of this site given our marvellous experience of GH San Diego (refer separate review). The location of this site is right on Union Square; for us this was fabulous. Close to fabulous shops, restaurants, Chinatown, cable cars. Slightly longer walk to Pier 39 (we did it comfortably). The following experience substantially coloured our views of this site.We finished up a tour here and booked and prepaid three extra nights; two under the tour and one in our own names. When we handed over the vouchers, I stressed that this was not straight forward and could GH confirm they had us checking out on the right day. All confirmed.Given this, imagine my disappointment when I get the draft invoice under the door expecting us to check out early than we had prepaid. Took it up with the front desk who had no record of us staying the extra night at all. Further, the address was wrong and there were a whole lot of additional charges for parking. Given that we were on tour this was clearly wrong.We managed to contact the US agent of our travel adviser (Gullivers Travels - can thoroughly commend them on their efficiency) who confirmed we had a room and gave us a Hyatt confirmation number. I gave this to the front desk who still were not able to locate our booking and confirm the fact that the extra night had been paid for (Why??).3 hours later and three trips to the front desk, and thanks to the persistence of the front desk, the voucher for the extra night was located and we were back on track.There is something fundamentally wrong with GH San Fran's systems.As noted on other reviews, the refurb of the lobby is underway. We had one night with jack hammers going to 9.00 pm. Not what we expected.Breakfasts not as extensive as GH San Diego.My sense is that when things work, GH San Fran would be great. This was just not our experience this time round.

My fiance and I just returned from our vacation and I just had to post what a fantastic stay we had at this property. Yes, the lobby is in the midst of a remodel, but it was no problem at all and a lot less problematic than I had anticipated--and I'm VERY picky. John, the concierge, was FANTASTIC. He gave us some great suggestions for a walking tour and casual dining where the locals go, which is always better in my opinion. When we passed by the desk the rest of our stay, he was always quick with a smile and a wave. And Mitch, our waiter in the bar on the 36th floor was great, too. When the bartender miss poured a black and tan (he didn't use the spoon!), Mitch was quick to correct him, show him the proper technique, and bring my fiance a new drink. Really, top-notch service. San Fran has a lot of hotels and most of them are expensive, but the Grand Hyatt is worth every penny.

I've stayed at the hotel several times......the new rooms are wonderful. Bed is also great! The lobby is getting remodeled and I'm sure will be nice as well. Just be warned if you park your car it can cost up to $49 per night!!

My husband and I stayed 7 nights at the Grand Hyatt. We actually spent very very little time at the hotel but overall it was a nice stay.Pros: location, comfy bed, hardwood floors in room, friendly and helpful staff, the views of the bay from the top floor barCons: LOUD (we were on the 31st floor overlooking union square and it was a party every night. Also you can hear attached neighbors every move and every word), lobby is a mess (yes, I know it's under renovation but it's still a bummer especially since these rooms are 300$ + a night!).All in all a good hotel in a amazing city!

After staying at each of the Hyatt's in the city, this ranks as my second favorite. The one at the Embarcadero has a better location for what I like. This hotel is still under remodeling work so the lobby was cramped, busy and small. However, our room on the 24th floor was new and clean. I like the new rooms.As always service was good, but not always prompt. The concierge was overwhelmed and there was a line. She booked tickets for me with a smile and was accommodating. Valet and the bellhop were friendly.The location was close to Union Square, shopping, and the cable cars. These things were in walking distance of the lobby.I think the hotel was overpriced for the overall condition of the hotel. Until the remodel is done, try to the Hyatt in the financial district.

We had a great 3-day stay at the grand Hyatt, which demonstrated excellence even before we got there! Two weeks prior to our visit, the second week in July, I realized the tickets to Alcatraz were sold out, I searched the Internet and had no success on any type of package. I called Elaine, one of the concierge prior to our stay. She was a lifesaver, and hooked us up in a combination hop on hop off tour combined with an Alcatraz trip trip that was terrific! We were also able to get an early check-in, a beautifully appointed room with floor-to-ceiling windows, motorized window shade, and beautiful city view. Contrary to other reviews, the room DID have a coffee maker, which is very important to me. The only hicup that we encountered our whole trip, was that in-room safe was not working at check-in. It took quite some time for it to be fixed, to compensate the manager says up a bottle of wine, cheese and antipasto meats, very nice!! The view from the lounge and restaurant on the top floor is beautiful. We enjoyed dinner one evening with nice piano accompaniment. We also enjoyed Buffet breakfast one morning. The 35th floor fitness center also shares the same stunning view as the restaurant, which made it very enjoyable to work out and look out on the city. The rooms have all been renovated very recently, which made my very fussy husband very happy. In addition to the bathroom, there is a separate make up area, which is very nice when you have two people sharing one bathroom. Location is great, close to Union Square and lots of transportation. Elaine, Liz, & the other concierge were all extremely helpful in suggestions for restaurants and getting around in San Francisco. They even set up a rental car, that was delivered directly to the hotel, making our exit to the Pacific Coast very easy. we were able to buy half-price tickets also, to a great musical Beach Blanket Babylon across the street at Union Square. As noted, the lobby is under construction. However, that really had no effect on our wonderful stay at the grand Hyatt San Francisco. Fantastic customer service, we would definitely return.

The Grand Hyatt has an upscale modern decor. (At the time of this writing they are however re-contructing the lobby) We had a room facing Union Square. The corner room is far more spacious than usual hotel fare.Our room included a comfy bed, automatic window shades, generous bath. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The Grand Hyatt is a great launching point for your vacation or business trip. The hotel is convenient to Union Square with its many shopping and dining destinations. Great spot to stay in San Francisco.

The Grand Hyatt is the probably one of the buildings that make up the gorgeous SF skyline. Unfortunately, my request for a room with a view was rewarded with one looking over a parking lot on the 7th floor. But no matter. The room was clean, the bed super comfortable, and the bathroom even had a rain shower, which was a real treat. What I loved about this hotel was that they had "Floor to ceiling windows with electronic blackout roller", which was perfect for my early bedtimes. The location of the hotel was top notch, and it was easy to find and walk to the restaurants and services that I needed. As expected in a place like this, prices of room service were very much over the top. It was a pity that the reception area was under construction, and I would be curious to see the renovated product. All in all a good experience.

My wife and I stayed in the Grand Hyatt for 3 nights from 21st June on our return to the UK from Hawaii. We thought San Fran would be a good place to stop on our return leg to break up the journey. We arrived just before midnight, but were checked in quickly and off to our room. We were immediately impressed by the room. It was spacious and very modern, and the bathroom was gleaming and very nicely laid out. Compared to rooms we had in the two Hyatt Regency Hotels we stayed in during our Hawaii trip, which were very good, the room in the Grand was light years ahead. The bed was wonderful and we slept really well. I canâ€™t say we had problems with noise either inside or outside, but we were up high enough to be remote from the traffic, and were never disturbed by our fellow residents. We had breakfast each morning in the Grandview restaurant and were impressed with the absolutely stunning views while we ate a very good breakfast. We had window seats every time. Breakfast was well stocked, with a very good choice. We spoke to reception and they were extremely helpful with arranging an Alcatraz Tour and booking tickets for the â€œHop On- Hop Offâ€ù bus tour of the City.
