The reception staff was brilliant at getting everything arranged in no time. Very professional and efficient. They also provided tips for good restaurants when we visited Fishermanâ€™s Wharf. We took their advice and were glad we did. The lobster and sea bass at the Fog Restaurant was delicious. The location of the Hotel is excellent, yards from Union Square and the big department stores. Easy walk to Chinatown, and great for local restaurants and bars. My wife and I are big fans of the excellent Cajun style meals at â€œThe Cheesecake Factoryâ€ù and that is right on Union Square. Only a 5 minute walk to dinner from the hotel, absolutely perfect. The Tour buses also stop at Union Square, so it is in a great location. One thing I personally liked was that there was an area external to the hotel which was sectioned off and set aside for smokers, which was remote and non interruptive for non-smokers, and was equipped with benches, and even outdoor heaters for chilly evenings, a very thoughtful touch. I wish more hotels gave a bit of thought for smokers. We had lunch once at the Grandview Bar which was very good, and also visited there each evening, where they have a resident piano player. The views from the bar are awesome, especially watching the fog roll in and roll out as the sun goes down. The staff in the bar is friendly and efficient and we enjoyed chilling out there in the evening after sightseeing the City all day. There is an ATM in the foyer which is handy, but what I especially liked was the automatic airline check-in service they have in reception. A touch screen computer has all the airlines listed and you can check-in online effortlessly. Another nice modern touch Iâ€™ve rarely seen in hotels worldwide. Our flight back to the UK was delayed by almost 5 hours, and the hotel stored our luggage till our revised pick up time while we set off round town for a last minute blitz. The concierge service is really top notch. I know the reception area was under renovation, but this really didnâ€™t detract from the excellent standards of the hotel, and itâ€™s highly professional staff. I would definitely stay in this hotel again, and would highly recommend it for a stay in San Francisco. I can be critical of hotels. When staying 4 and 5 star, you expect high standards, and the Grand Hyatt certainly did not disappoint.

I've stayed at this Hyatt now at least a dozen times, mostly for work. And I like it ... here's why.* REALLY reasonably priced, in my opinion (often under $200/night on Hyatt.com)* awesome location (Union Square, but also adjacent to Chinatown)* close to BART (same line as SFO)* clean* directly across the street from a Starbucks, and a block away from a Walgreen's* a few steps away from great shopping and streetcars * Internet allows for three devicesAlthough there were some hiccups with my stay this month:* the lobby is being renovated, so it's a bit of a mess* there are labor negotiations going on, and there was a VERY loud two-hour protest just under my window* our room faced Stockton street, and the incessant whistle that beckons the cabs gets old fast* the afghan at the foot of our bed had holes burned in itBut overall, the Hyatt -- along with the W and Taj Campton Place -- will always be my first choice when coming to San Fran.

By far the best view in San Francisco....Stunning! The hotel is still under construction in the lobby area so nothing to speak about here..the room was very comfortable, clean and recently renovated. Too bad that at $300 a night the shower had no water pressure and I had to squeeze against the wall to get the water to spray on me for a shower....that was really very surprising. I understand SF is water conscious, but this was ridiculous. All they really need to do is put a longer extension on the shower...I guess they think that because the guest can use it as a hand-held that it is sufficient, but it isn't. Sorry Hyatt-you really missed the mark here.

Beautiful, clean, rooms,new bathrooms, great views from all angles. Excellent resturant for dinner and breakfast with views of the city. Centrally located, few blocks from the first stop of the cable cars. Excellent conceierge services. Busy lobby, overcrowded, however, they are in the process of renovations.

One of our bucket list trips. We had a fantastic trip to San Francisco, I booked our flight and hotel through Price Line, they did a great job! We stayed in the Hyatt Regency on Stockton Street for an extra $50.00 we got all the treatment including a room on the 30th floor with a brilliant view of the Bay and Alcatraz. I also had a small car and drove to Sausolito one of our most favorite places in fact we drove there on two separate occasions. We went to Alcatraz, a boat trip under the Golden Gate Bridge, along the Pacific HWY, looked at the RedWoods, we did almost everything possible. Only had two things to gripe about, first the Bus Tour we wanted to take around the city payed $30 each for a 20 minute ride down to Fisherman's Wharf then wait there for another 20 minuets then drive back. After we got back and complained it was only then it was explained to us, the tickets were for two days and you can ride all or any Buses anywhere in the city, if we known this at the beginning of our visit it would have been cheeper for us to use the Bus system and saw more sites rather paying out high parking fees. The other issue was American Airlines they would not allow us to book our seats on line because we used Price Line. My money is as good as anyone else's it's not my fault they sell cheep tickets and I purchased them for that I'm discriminate.

The renovation is great and the hotel staff was excellent. Many of the employees have been working at the hotel for over 20 years .... and its shows. They are attentive, friendly and well informed. I stayed here during a big conference and the hotel was sold out and very busy. Believe me you wouldn't know it by the type of service that was shown by this team. Thanks to Micheal the valet and greeter out front, Ben the Bellman, Rafeal at the cafe. A few suggestions...1) The phone lines often rang without anyone picking up 2) keep the Club open a bit longer to accommodate the guests during big conferences

The Grand Hyatt is in the final stretches of a big renovation. The room design is very fresh and modern. I love the remote controlled blackout shade. Right from the bed! There is also an innovative scrim in front of the windows to allow for light and a modicum of privacy.King bed was comfortable and lighting was good in the bathroom. Very nice fixtures and furnishings throughout.A few concerns:Water pressure was AWFUL!Door was undercut to such a degree that hallway lights filled the room while I was trying to sleep.A/C unit was a rattle trap, though temperature was good.Overall a nice stay, but it didn't win my repeat business. I'll try something else next time just to see how it compares.

Pros:(1) room was fairly spacious and recently renovated(2) the wifi was free (Gold Passport member) and fast -- an important touch that distinguishes the Hyatt brand from Starwood and others, for me(3) the gym is nice and it has some fantastic views while using the cardio equipment(4) the food delivered by room service was very good(5) laundry service was very prompt (clothes returned the same day)Cons:(1) very noisy - you could hear everything from outside the hotel (32 floors down from my room), everything in the adjoining room, and everything in the hallway outside the room. It was made worse by the fact that the hotel rooms' doors do not close gently, so you are awoken in the morning by a series of slamming doors in your hall.(2) towards the end of my stay I started noticing small bumps that appeared to be bites on my skin (arms, ankles, chest), which I suspect may have been caused by an allergic reaction to laundry detergent used on my clothes or the bed sheets. (3) the TVs are nice, but they offer very few high definition channels, and limited programming in general when compared to many hotels(4) not a big fan of the soap/bathing products offered by the Hyatt chain

My husband and I stayed here last month. The hotel is in a great location in Union Square, within walking distance to shopping, Chinatown, and public transport. Was a bit surprised upon arrival at how small and basic the lobby was because of the renovations. But once we got to our room we were very happy with it. The room is really nicely renovated, pretty spacious for a SF hotel, the bathroom was very nice also. Everything seems really new so it was especially nice. Great desk area for business travelers, very efficient use of space in the design of the room. The bed was really comfy but maybe a little too soft? May not be good if you have a bad back. The products in the bathroom such as the shampoo and lotion smelled great. :) Also had a lovely view of the city with the Coit Tower and the Transamerica pyramid building, and the bay in the distance. We didn't utilize any of the hotel amenities like the restaurants or gym..didn't even look at them since we were only there for three days and wanted to get out and explore San Fran. When we got to the airport on the way home I realized I had forgotten my ipad in the hotel safe! Can't believe I did that. The safe is a bit hidden in a cabinet so it's easy to forget, it's not in the closet like at a lot of other hotels. However I called the hotel and was immediately patched to the Hotel Security. A very nice man in Security sent someone to check the room and arranged to have the ipad FedEx'ed back to me. The hotel didn't pay for the shipping but it was my fault so I didn't expect them to. The ipad arrived and was packed up very well with bubble wrap. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Grand Hyatt.

We stayed for 4 nights and felt as though our location to things was great. Aside from fisherman's wharf - we were able to walk everywhere we went. Plenty of restaurants and shops within a mile of the hotel. We were very pleased with the rooms and the friendliness and helpfullness of the staff.

Not bad. Perfectly accommodating and generous concierge service. A very early checkout (3am) meant the Concierge was forced out on the street to hail three cabs for our party without a complaint. One word of advice, if you do book the bay view you may like to check exactly how high up you are. Our view had glimpses of said bay (not withstanding the famous fog!) but nice enough non the less. WE got in early, the gentleman at the check in desk said our room was not ready but he could offer us a room a few floors down for showering after a long flight, I declined and said I'd rather wait for the allocated room but I suspect we were given the room on floor 20 non the less, but don't really know to be fair.By far this hotel's best feature is the bar on the top floor. Absolutely stunning, you will want to stay all day and night to watch the changing vista.Worth a stay!

I spent 7 nights a the Grand Hyatt and my room was exceptional. The rooms had recently been redone and were very modern and very friendly for business and CPAPs. They have very nice lighting where you need it and plug-ins in all the right places. The view from the 25th floor was great. They were remodeling the lobby, so that wasn't nice, but the pictures of what it was going to look like looked very nice. I would recommend this hotel. All staff were very helpful and attentive.

We stayed here while the reception was still being renovated. Our rooms was newly renovated and both the room and bathroom was nice. Not very big, but big enough. We had booked a special deal with parking included, which was nice since that's difficult and expensive in central SF. The hotel was next door to China Town and very nice shopping areas, so the location couldn't be better. 4th of July we spent in the bar at the top of the hotel. Very nice atmosphere, and nice views. For eating as well, I'd recommend the bar for value and views, compared to the next door restaurant.

The Grand Hyatt is very conveniently located in Union Square and i was thrilled to have my hotel room not only face the square, but look directly at the Cheesecake Factory sign! The room is well appointed and the bathroom appears to have been recently renovated. There is a fridge in the room which comes in handy, as well as a coffee maker. The room was quiet and enjoyable to be in. Was this the nicest hotel room ever?? No, but it was a nice Grand Hyatt. The lobby is undergoing renovations. Hotels are expensive in San Francisco and I think that we did well with the Hyatt.

This past weekend i stayed with my wife and two kids (7yrs and 1yr old) at this hotel and have nothing but good things to say about it. it was about a 20min drive from the airport and the key of this place among other things is the location. Its only 2 blocks from Macy's, the Disney Store, Union Square, 3 blocks from ChinaTown, 10 min walk to the Embarcadero and financial district and 1 block away from the train that you could take to fisherman's wharf (Pier 39 etc). It also had a starbucks across the street and a wallgreens a block away for what ever was need it. My daughter made us have breakfast everyday (i didnt use the hotel restaurant) at a dinner called Lori's a block away (great food, kids friendly and well priced) which as per her was oficially her favorite place in SF.Our room on the 15th floor had a great view and a pretty good blackout system because this time of the year the room can get pretty hot during the day. The hotel was very busy but had plenty of elevators (6) so waiting for one was never a long wait. The people working at the hotel was extremely friendly and helpful and when my wife requested a roll up bed for our daughter and a crib for our baby boy it didnt take them more than 5 min to come back with everything.Nothing but a good time and good service.Maybe the only "but" is the parking price (between $35-50) per night.. ouch... but i'm guessing that's probably the same in everyplace in down town.I would be happy to come back to this place.

Even though the hotel is under construction for renovation, the service and rooms were perfect! The staff was so helpful. We had great curb~side service, and check in was a breeze. The concierge helped with a map and pointed out some great ideas to see in the city. The also helped with booking some museums on our second day. Rooms were clean, modern and comfortable. You must go up to the 36th (top floor) floor for a drink and the best sites of San Francisco. The only thing I would recommend is a higher floor room. We stayed on 5th floor and the street is very noisy and busy.

My wife and I stayed 5 nights in early July. We had just gotten platinum status, so there was a complimentary upgrade to a Grand Club room.Good stuff: * Awesome views. One room was on the 29th, one on the 33rd floor. (more on that later) every direction had a spectacular view. * Renovated rooms are quite nice. See attached photos. * The grand club has lots of good stuff, and a wonderful view of coit tower. * Convenient location, less than a block from union square. Cons:* This was summer travel season, and the grand club was overrun with men, women and children. Not that Hyatt could do much about this, but it highlighted the fact that the club was too small for the occupancy of the floors it serves. * Nearly every room in the hotel has a "connecting room." Good for families, but bad for travelers that don't want to hear their neighbors. * Reduced elevator count due to the construction. But that should be better soon. Final anecdote (belongs in the pros section):When spent the first night on 29, we had an extremely loud neighbor. The front desk was very accommodating, and relocated us to 33. (They told us there are less than 10 non-connecting rooms in the hotel.) Unfortunately, the room they moved us to was *also* connecting. When they realized this mistake, they marked the room next to us as out of service do that we'd enjoy our stay. This shows exceptional service, as it's a very difficult thing to do during peak travel season. So, the service would get a Tripadvisor rating of "11", if we could give them that. :)

You can't really ask for a better location. I got a great deal on the room because the lobby was being renovated, so I was thrilled with the quality of the room, etc. The lounge on the top floor is fantastic, especially at sunset.

Our room was $289/night without a view. We stayed on the 6th floor, but could only really see the backs of buildings. Went back to check-in to see if any other rooms were available, but were told the hotel was sold out for the night- fair enough. The location itself is great, right on Union Square and convenient to everything. The lobby was under construction, but well-staffed. We had drinks at the bar on the top floor, where you are really paying for the view (over $50 for 3 drinks!). That bar was a little outdated, but the rooms were nice and updated with plenty of room.

Stayed here while lobby under renovation. Room 2826 very modern and comfortable. Nice king bed, electric shade, and fridge. IPod charger in room.Restaurat in hotel very nive for the view and worth a splurge. Spent $120 for 2 with no alcohol.Location is excellent. Close to everything union square has to offer.Try lori's dinner down the block for a cheap meal to take back to the room.

My husband and I flew in early to San Francisco, and at busier hotels in the city like this one, we are used to checking our luggage in with the hotel in order to be checked in around three. When we arrived at 10 a.m. to turn our bags over, the desk clerk told us that he had a room ready for us and that no wait was necessary. This gave us the full first day of exploring the city without having to plan around for the standard checkin hour, and it was the greatest convenience. We stayed three nights, and loved our time at the Hyatt. The room was affordable for the location and even though construction was going on, we never had to wait for an elevator or were at all inconvenienced by the renovation. Our room was lovely on the 16th floor- it really could not have been a better stay!

Great Hyatt right in the of town, with everything on your door step. We were in town for a concert, so only had 2 nights and 1 day. The hotel is ideally situated for most of the sights, and as a great walking city all within easy reach.The lobby is still work in progress, so the entrance doesn't instill too much confidence that you chose the right hotelAll rooms have been recently renovated and it's one of the best non Andaz or PH Hyatt's in the US I've stayed in. The views from the Regency Club are fantastic - ask one of the folks there how you can get outside for great photo's of the city and out to Alcatraz. The food in the club is better than most other RC's I've been in.A very good value hotel.Good suggestions from Anthony Bourdain's recent visit on Travel Channel's Layover, especially Blue Bottle coffee, which is a 10 min walk from the hotel.

Very convenient to downtown and Union Square. Stayed on a high floor, floor and room were both nicely redone (lobby still has a lot of work going on). Seemed like a recent, in-progress renovation - yet aspects of the room felt run down. Room design is very modern, bed was comfortable but pillows were too small and too soft. Bathroom is a nice size, though shower setup (half a glass wall, so you're afraid of splashing the rest of the bathroom) was a little odd. Fixtures are so modern that you can't figure out how they work quickly. Sink faucet was loose (which made it even harder to figure out how to turn on), desk chair was a great modern design but had a screw loose. Bed wasn't quite made - didn't tuck in sheets - which I've never seen in any hotel let alone one that thinks $259 is a "special rate." No matter how hard I tried, I could not read the details on the clock radio phone thing - even with my reading glasses on - so I did not actually set the alarm properly so it didn't go off. Room service breakfast was absurdly expensive with a 19%! service charge - though it did come quick. Gym was very small such a big hotel - every machine was full when I went up before work time. OK - so maybe I didn't really like this hotel :)

I stayed in room 523 for a long weekend. I requested a quiet room and while there was no view, it was very quiet. The rooms are newly decorated and beautiful. The beds are to die for. So comfy. Everything is clean, service is impeccable and friendly. Rayes are extremely reasonable for SF on Union Square. Sutter Stockton Parking lot is on next block. Union Square shopping is less than a block. Cable car and Chinatown one and a half block. Do yourself a favor and stay here. You won't regret it. Also, try breakfast or lunch at the 37th floor restaurant. Great view, good food.

Perfect location. You're right in the heart of the city, surrounded by all of the shops and restaurants. Cable cars are a couple of blocks away, as are the buses and f line team.The room was very clean and servicable. We were on the 26th floor so viewscwere great and there wa no noise issue. Lifts were very busy in the morning - coming own 26 floors stoppingvt every on was not unusual!We did not eat in the restaurant as the cost was ludicrous. We did think about going to th bar one night - but at $9 for a bottle of beer we thought better of it!One particular pain for us was the fact that wifi was no free but $10 a day. Given that we were paying top dollar for the room i found this a little galling. Thankfully starbucks across the road has free wifi so we were able to check reviews, itineraries etc before heading out or the day.Make sure that you go to uncle vito's pizza round the corner for takeout pizza - fantastic and cheap! We also bought stuff for breakfast from 7 11 also around the corner ad the room had a fridge.

This hotel has a great location, just down the street from Union Square where there is tonnes of great shopping. Also the perfect spot to hop on a bus tour. The hotel has just been extensively reno'd, with the hotel lobby yet to be completed. We had a view of Coight Tower from our hotel, and could see the bay when the cloud coverage passed (You need to be on a fairly high floor to see this). Our room was nice and clean with your standard amenities. Great value for the location.

Stayed here with my wife for 6 nights at the start of July.Had read many TA reviews beforehand so interested to find out for myself.First thing to say is that the location is superb. Just off Union Square and literally only 5-10 minutes walk to most of what you need to find in the area. To visit Chinatown is only 5 minutes away and we went to North Beach for dinner and that only took about 15 minutes.Rooms themselves are well appointed with VERY comfy beds. Shower OK though can understand some peoples comments about the pressure, not huge but allright. If you can, get on a higher floor as there's a lot of work going on at the moment (moreso the first couple of floors), but San Francisco can be noisy at night and you're insulted from this the higher up you go. And the views are stunning. Lobby area is currently under renovation so a right bloody mess but in a couple of months should be much improved. Service was efficient, if at times a little stiff. Had an issue with a charge at the top floor restaurant and the front desk guy was a little dismissive about it, but the manager at Grandviews (Gordon) really went out of his way to sort it out. Well done to him and this is an awesome establishment with a great view. Try the salads which are world class.In the local area there is a laundromat up Sutter Street, Starbucks across the road with free internet, and a 7-11 a minute away on Stockton Street towards the tunnel (with $1 cans of coke, bagels etc.).This hotel is a really good option for San Francisco and would not hesitate to stay there again.

I loved the modern feel if the room. The sliding door in the bathroom was a nice touch. Everything was clean which is a big plus. Steve at the front desk was very nice, hope to stay here next time I an in San Francisco.

First the good points. The staff were very helpful at check in. They even provided me with some free toiletries that I had forgotten to pack. The room was good, the wifi worked well. But for me, the big problem was the noise. Imagine stilletto heels on marble at the rate of a woodpecker going all night ... As I was deperately trying to recover from jetlag I called reception to complain and was told that this is normal. Its a side effect of the earthquake protection that the hotel is equipped with. When I stayed at the Grand Hyatt in Taipei I dont remember the same noises. Maybe I was just unlucky with my room.

Nicely located in Union Square, so great shopping in area. Cable cars 2 blocks away. Rooms are OK size, nice view. Bizarre oval sink in bathroom. Too low pressure in shower. Ice machine next to our room was noisy.Very clean rooms. Comfy beds.Extremely noisy bar on top floor. Very impersonal, mediocre drinks. Several people asked waitress where they could find a place to talk. She didn't help them. Skip the bar. Just no ambience.Good breakfast on 36th floor with great views. Typically overpriced.Lobby is being refurbished. Looks awful now. Hopefully pretty when done, but not now. Compared to the St. Francis down the street, it's kinda pathetic looking now.I've stayed in far nicer Hyatts, but it's not terrible. Just not great.

This hotel isin a great location, just off Union Square. The rooms were clean, modern and a relatively good size. The service in the hotel was spot on too. However I just can't give this place 5 stars as it was just lacking that something you feel when you go to somewhere properly good.

I stayed there for 3 nights. I've always stayed in hyatt or westin when i travel, but i think this is the smallest and lowest ceilling room hotel of all hyatt hotels i have ever stayed before. The service is also not so good. I travelled with 2 children, one is 4.5yo and the other one still 1.5yo. Thus i still need to make their milk all time then i requested for electric water kettle and the room service they don't have that kind of electric water kettle in the hotel and she offered me to deliver a hot water inside a regular water kettle. I was very dissapointed and told her that all hyatt hotels that i have stayed before always has electric water kettle. The she said she will talk to the manager. 10 minutes after i hang up with the room service, a hotel staff delivered a electric water kettle and said that's their last one. I was just wondering why would she lied to me in the first place. She could just have told me that they are out of it. Basically i think the hotel is just ok for hyatt standard, but for sure the hotel location is one of the best in union square sf after the westin st francis hotel.

We stayed four nights and loved every minute of it. Staff was very friendly, rooms were beautiful, Grand Club was beautiful with excellent food and service. Surprisingly quiet room, especially being at a Union Square. The room was immaculate. The beds were luxurious. Our car was brought around very quickly from the Valet. $50 for valet parking may seem high, but not for a big city. We will be back, and soon! Thank you Hyatt for a wonderful stay. This review is written by a mom with very particular preferences for hotel stays. Excellent reviews are the exception from this writer.

Very nice hotel in lower Nob Hill, usually stay at a Hilton in SFO, this far exceeded my expectations. Rooms were modern, comfortable and of good size. Had one small issue with a noisy a/c fan and they quickly moved me to another room. I will be back.

I recently stayed here on a business trip and was pleased with the hotel. This is a great place if you are looking for somewhere close to Union Square with plenty of shopping and restaurants just steps from the front door. The room was quite nice, with recently updated, modern, and stylish decor. The food at the restaurant was also surprisingly good -- much better than I tend to expect at chain hotels. And the view of the Bay from the restaurant/bar area is absolutely stunning (worth a look even if you don't stay for food/drinks). The concierge was very helpful in arranging taxis and airport shuttles, and the front desk staff were courteous. My only complaint at this hotel would be the lack of free wireless internet.

don't bother unless you get the government rate of $155 per room and the 32 floor lounge for an additional $45. the beds are great but the bathrooms have a horrible oval sink, the water pressure in the shower is poor and the airconditioning is noisy.

I stayed at this hotel while managing an event and I have never been greeted so cheerfully by members of staff from all departments! It was wonderful to be greeted by every staff member that walked by with smiles and hellos! I had everything I needed and everything ran smoothly and perfectly thanks to the glorious staff members here! The room was nice as well! Thank you!

My family and I spent six days/nights at the Gran Hyatt. The Hotel was clean and we felt very safe. The location is great and we were able to walk to many of the attractions in the area. The valet was very good and we had no problems getting our car in and out. We loved the lounge on the 36th floor, we stopped there at the end of each evening. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone visiting SF.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco for one night while traveling on business. The lobby area was going through a renovation during my stay (July 2012). Hotel is perfectly located very near Union Square. Valet parking is very expensive, but this is San Francisco. Staff was quite friendly. Club Lounge on 32nd floor is spacious and has great views. Rooms are recently upadated and very modern. The view from my room was amazing! This hotel is a definite recommendation if within your budget.

We have stayed at this hotel a number of times and we were always very satisfied with the whole experience. We were just there last week and found out they plan to close the restaurant and the lounge on the 36th floor. I am not a fan of hotel food, although we found the food at the restaurant to be very respectable. What really bothers me is the closing of the lounge, we always went up for a drink before dinner, and to take in the tremendous view. Very few hotels in the city have a bar with such great views, it will be missed. We were told it will become a room for business meetings, etc. I wish they would reconsider this move, it is one of the reasons we keep coming back.

We checked-in here with no trouble at all as they have these clever check-in machines (as well as people behind a desk) that give you your room keys and everything. The room was super nice. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable and room service was fantastic. We had partial views over Union Square which was nice. Probably one of the quietest hotels I have stayed at. Close to everything and far enough away from the Tenderloin area which is something I would recommend, especially for travelers who don't have an overwhelming amount of homelessness where they are from..........it was actually quite shocking the amount of homeless etc in San Francisco.
Great location; average rooms; no lobby during construction; restaurant was average; prefer Hyatt at Embarcadero
what can I say arrived great reception staff great room good for local bars came in early hours after a night out night staff great no complaints on this hotel

Just came back from a one night stay at the Grand Hyatt in San Fran. Did not spend much time at the hotel (basically to sleep) but the staff impressed me enough to write a review. From the valet parking attendant (the cost is highway robbery at $50 a night) to the gentleman who checked me in at the front desk - everyone was very professional and welcoming. Thank you. The room was average Hyatt but would have been good for staying several days. The hotel is down by the water which is a nice place to walk. There a good places to eat in the area. I decided on a restuarant I have been going to for years - Boulevard - which was again great.

I recently stayed here for 9 nights with my partner and overall was very impressed. For tourists to San Fran, the hotel could not be better located. It's right by Union Square so very close to all the shops and restaurants in the downtown area. It's also just down the road from the China Town area and well located for public transport (Powell St MUNI and BART stations are less than five minutes walkaway) so it really is a great base for exploring this fantastic city. The staff were friendly and generally helpful. I mentioned on check in that we were staying for my partner's 40th birthday and within ten minutes of arriving at our room, reception had sent up two cakes and a bottle of red wine. It was a lovely gesture! We were originally assigned a room on the 16th floor and it was a little noisy outside. When my partner mentioned this the following morning, we were switched to a room on a higher floor. This was perfectly quiet and of course, the views were much better! Our room was large and very clean. Make sure that you go to the bar on the 36th floor. The views are awesome and it's a lovely space to relax with a glass of wine after a hard day's sightseeing or shopping. The only downsides were that the hotel's lobby area was a bit cramped and chaotic but this was no doubt because that area of the hotel was in the middle of a renovation. Also there is no free WiFi, either in the rooms or reception. This is obviously a drawback in this day and age. But for this, the hotel would have received 5/5 from me. On the whole though, a great choice and I'd stay here again.

When we stayed at the hotel it's lobby was under renovation. So there is little on can say about that. But the rooms have been renovated and are nice and clean. The staff is really courteous and helpful. The roof top restaurant and bar is a great place. China town is just walking distance. The only thing that I thought needed improvement was the TV quality and the quality of programming. I would definitely stay here again.

I had a recent trip to San Fran and decided to bring the family so we could see the wonderful city - we primarily stayed here because I was speaking at a conference, which meant I got some pretty good room ratesWhat was good?- newly renovated rooms (a little small, but nice)- location - nice place to jump off to all the places we visited- nice views - go up and have breakfast or a drink on the top floor - beautiful!- the staff - very friendly and helpful - concierge staff were greatWhat could be better?- lobby was under renovation- parking in hotel was a fortune!- gym faces east and was really hot in the morningAll in all, we had a great time and enjoyed our stay - we did not use many of the hotel amenities (note no pool on premises) but enjoyed our stay

Our room was modern, clean, and had a great view of Union Square.This hotel is great. It's right on Union Square, so is a great location for transport and getting round the city. Market St is five minutes away for great shopping, and China Town is close.

one of the 10 hotels we stayed at during our 16 night group trip to west USA , 8 Harley's and 1 carstayed 2 nights here , booked through Priceline.com at a very good rateNice rooms , comfortable beds , all you would expect from a 4*We only had some discussions about the parking rates for our bikes It took us more than a 1/2 hour dicussion to finally pay less to the parking garage , which was independent from the hotel , than originally agreed by phone !the garage manager was very helpfull and friendlyLocation is great , right next to Union Square and all transportation , cablecars , etc...Had breakfast across the street in Starbuckswould come here again , but not on the regular rates which are to high

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for the weekend. We booked a package with parking and breakfast for two. The hotel is centrally located in Union Square. We walked to the Embarcadero, Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiradelli Square from the hotel. It was a bit of a walk and if you aren't in any hurry walking a great way to experience the city. We also took a cab down to Pier 39 one day and that was about $15. After leaving the car at the valet it wasn't really worth it to drive around the city since parking is at such a premium. The cable car line wasn't far but was always very busy so we never rode it. There is great shopping and dining close by the hotel. The staff at the hotel was great and very helpful with everything we asked. The restaurant on the 36th floor has great views of the city. Fey who works at the restaurant in the morning was very friendly and provided fantastic service. The room was very clean and modern. The view from the higher floors is fantastic and I'd recommend staying as high as you can. If you are a light sleeper, even on the 26th floor we heard sirens at night but that was not a big deal for us.

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights because I was attending a conference at the Moscone center. I had my daughter and husband with me and we were very comfortable in our room with 2 double-beds. We had a refrigerator, safe and coffee maker in the room. Remote controlled shades and the floor to ceiling window in the room is a wonderful treat as well. If you are coming to SF for a conference at the nearby Moscone center, it is an approximate 0.7 mile walk to the center. If you are in SF for sightseeing, this is a wonderful location for tourists. The cable car stop is right on Market street, about a block from the hotel. BART is close by and lots of options for bus stops as well. Taxis are very easy to come by. If you like to run, I suggest running along Market street and head down towards the ferry building on Embarcadero. I ran on Embarcadero all the way to Fisherman's wharf and back. The sidewalks are huge and lots of runners in the morning. San Fran is a huge city and there are a lot of homeless people every where. It was a little hard to explain to my child why these people had to live on the streets but then again, it helped her realize how lucky she was. The area around the hotel though is relatively safe. We oftentimes saw police officers patrolling the area on foot at night. We were usually out up until 10 pm and never felt unsafe walking back to our hotel. I would however suggest avoiding the Civic center/Tenderloin area at night. Lots of junkies there...For the shopaholics, tons of high end shops nearby. Macy's is right next door, Neiman Marcus, Louis Vuitton, Tiffany's and Ugg stores are all a block from the hotel. For the coffee addict, do not fear. There is literally a Starbucks in every corner. In fact, there are 2 on the same block the hotel is on. There are also a ton of good restaurants within walking distance from the hotel. It is also a 5-minute walk to the entrance of Chinatown. We ate breakfast at the Grandviews restaurant on the 36th floor every morning. It boasts a magnificent 180 degree view of the city (you can see the Golden Gate bridge and Alcatraz from the bar). I highly recommend getting the buffet ($25 per person) as this already includes your drinks (coffee, juice, etc). If you order ala carte, coffee is about $4.50, you might be better off getting your cup of joe from Starbucks. The Golden Gate omelet, one of their specials, was to die for. The fitness center on the 35th floor was well-equipped (about 4 treadmills and 4 ellipticals, weight machines, etc) and the view when you are on the treadmill is exceptional. All in all, I have very little negative things to say about my experience. Staff were very courteous and helpful. We had nothing but excellent customer service during our stay. One negative factor for me though is the internet connection. It is $10 for every 24 hours. In this day and age, you simply just expect that to be part of what you pay for the room. The bathroom also needs to be cleaned a little better. There was some mold on the tile grout in the shower. The only downside about this hotel was the fact that the lobby was under construction. It is a little messy around the elevators. Other than that, the hotel is wonderful and I would gladly recommend it to family and friends.
Fabulous room, great view & location. The lobby is currently under construction (June 2012), looks like it'll be nice when it's done.

Stayed for 5 nights due to business & booked this hotel primarily due to it's location, so that could also take in some of the sights in San Francisco.Needed a car, so knew that parking was going to be expensive regardless of which hotel I stayed at. Finding the hotel car park was not too easy, due to 2 reasons. First, directions given by hotel doorman (tall blonde guy) were not the best, found him quite "difficult" to be honest. Secondly, there was a truck parked in front of the turn-in ! Once you know where it is though it is fine, just around the corner from the hotel front door & the staff there were excellent.As has been said, lobby area is a little bit small at the moment, however it is not terrible and the check-in staff were friendly and efficient. Room allocated was on the 8th floor, upon entering (about 7pm-ish) I was immediately hit with the noise as I walked in, thought I'll need to shut that window, turns out it was shut ! Called down to reception but advised that not possible to change rooms unless I was willing to pay an increase in room rate. Unfortunately I couldn't so "adjusted". Room itself though was a good size & very nice, window view could have been better (overlooking buildings directly across the road from front of hotel) above Starbucks. Large LCD TV with enough choice. Very large & comfortable bed, decent lighting. Plenty of storage space. Bathroom was also a good size with a full bath & shower over. Shower was powerful and accurate temperature control. Only moan about the bathroom was the sink, fancy shallow thing which looks great but is difficult to shave in !Had room service on the first night, cost was on a par with what I expected but pleasantly surprised with the quality of the food. Did look at the breakfast menu but was put off by the prices, plenty of option within a block.Despite the noise I slept reasonably well every night, bed was really comfortable.Internet is not free, pretty expensive to be honest but the signal strength and speed was good.Have to agree per earlier posts reviews regarding the lifts, they take ages, especially at peak times, plan ahead.Location is good, both for Union Square and heading down to the pier area.Check-out was painless.Would stay here again (on a higher floor), although would maybe try someplace else the next time.

I stayed in this hotel while attending a conference. I was first impressed by the enormous lobby! I later found out that tour buses actually stop by this hotel just for tourists to take their pictures here (made me feel special staying in a tourist attaction!). We arrived pretty late but were treated really well - we were given apples and bottles of cold water right there at reception! plus access to Wifi for free for the duration of our stay. Our room overlooked the Bay Bridge, very accessible to all forms of public transportation and walking distance to many sights and restaurants. It was also very convenient to have the car rental in the same hotel when we decided to drive to Monterey, Vallejo and Concord. The cleaning lady was very helpful and nice. We were just disappointed that there was no pool.

We stayed here on our honeymoon. Marvin, was the guest services person at the desk. He was very helpful and made us feel very welcome. It is nice to feel that your business is appreciated!The room was clean and had a nice view of the city. There were food options very close to us. The breakfast buffet was pricey bit good. We were told several times to make sure that our car was free of valuables. This gave is a red flag of the area. No problems at all though. We had to pay for internet and parking. This hotel is upscale and we were happy with it.

As far as city hotels go , this one is okay. Location is great , easy walking distance to great shopping. Room has all the modern touches and i love the timber foors. Concierge in particular were very very friendly and helpful. We were a little disappointed as they had 2 attempts at getting our advanced paid bayview room check in correct and as we were celebrating our 15 year wedding anniversary I thought they might of acknowledged it with a congratulations but sadly no... Nothing.

The +'s: Rooms are modern, quiet and good sized compared to most metropolitan hotels. The location is close to attractions, BART, shopping, dining, Union Square is VERY nice. The layout of the hotel mostly eliminates the occasional stupidity that goes on in the hallways of large hotels. Staff was OKThe -'s: The lobby (under construction) is about the size of a postage stamp. The elevators are so overloaded during peak times that otherwise sane/rational guests turn ugly. Yesterday we had a middle aged couple literally SHOVE their way into a PACKED elevator because they'd been waiting '30 minutes' already. I was with my family and had my small kids with me, we got the hell out of there and tried the stairs.....since the couple displaced us on the 12th floor we figured it was a reasonable descent.....we were wrong. NONE of the stairwells empty into the lobby, only into restricted constructions areas....so after aruguing with a union constructoin guy we decided we had to go out thru the 'Emergency Exit' (alarm sounded) just to get out of the stairwell. No signs warn of not being able to access the lobby from the stairwells....there were 2 ladies wandering down there that we took under our wing and they walked thru the emergency doors with us. That was not something that should happen....the Management of a hotel needs to THINK LIKE A GUEST and keep folks informed of anything unexpected like this.Another minus, they informed us last night at 8pm that the water to our room would be shut off the next mornign from 10am until 2pm......14 hours notice for a 4 hour utility outage. Now I knew the lobby was under construction before I arrived but I phoned the property and asked if the construction would affect my stay, I was assured it would not.....it SIGNIFICANTLY affected my stay twice.

I am a newly minted Hyatt GP Diamond member and made trips to San Francisco over 3 consecutive weeks. The location and "price was right" for me at this property, so I gave it a shot. A great find indeed! Very nice rooms, and the upper level Bay-view rooms are great (had one floor 27 or higher 2 of the 3 trips). The rooms are not huge, but are well appointed. RFID roomkeys so you don't have to worry about your mobile phone "zapping" the key. Hardwood floors and robes in Grand Club rooms.The Grand Club, its amenities, and most of all, it's friendly staff, is as good as any I've been to, and far better than a lot of them. After the first of my 3 stays, some of the staff started greeting me by name - a nice touch. The view is spectacular! The breakfast provided could actually pass as a BREAKFAST (although the main hot course was similar enough day-to-day that I didn't look forward to it as much toward the end of 13 nights!). The lobby is compressed due to construction, which can be difficult to navigate if there are a lot of people congregating there. They have done a good job (at least during May) to mask the construction, so you just think they have a small lobby that is "always that way". The front desk staff at check in/out were great each time as well. Already have another trip planned, this time a combination work/family trip, and will likely make this my first choice on future business trips (walking distance to my employer is 0.8 miles).

Currently undergoing renovations so no ground floor lobby which is a shame. However the location is pretty unbeatable as long as you don't mind the usual city noises. The 35th floor gym is great for watching the sunrise and the bar on the 36th floor has outstanding views especially for watching the sunset over the bay. Get there early for a window seat. Great concierge service especially grateful for recommendation of Joseph Phelps Winery in Napa. Exceptional wines.

Our 4 night stay in May was great! The most comfortable beds we have ever slept in, including our own, staff was very friendly and very helpful. Impressive view from the restaurant/bar on the top floor. Restaurant was abit expensive.Fantastic location, within walking distance to Fishermans Warf, AT&T park and all the shopping you could dream of.

I recently stayed here and you really can't beat the location right off of Union Square. Plenty of shopping, walking distance to Chinatown and other areas. Most of the rooms have recently been renovated and they are beautiful - even though i was slightly disappointed that platinum status did not equal a room upgrade. The common areas are still under renovation and that creates a not so welcoming atmosphere in the lobby. For me, in SF, I do not normally plan to spend a lot of time in the hotel, so just give me a nice room and a nice bed in a good location and I am happy. The Hyatt met those needs. I would definitely stay there again.

This was our fourth and last stop on our honeymoon trip to California. We spent five nights at this hotel. When we checked in we learnt that we were booked into a room with two double beds instead of the one King bed we thought we were getting. Could have been our mistake and unfortunately, due to the Golf Open being played in San Francisco at the same time, the hotel was full so they couldn't give us another room. However the beds were super comfortable! We had an 8th floor room at the back of the hotel, unfortunately even 8 floors up the road noise was pretty loud and as there are constant fire engines tearing around the city I suggest you take some earplugs, at first we thought the window must've been open, but nope it was shut! The room itself has been recently refurbished, it's modern and bright. I was quite surprised however that they didn't supply bath robes. Also there is no free WiFi in this hotel, if you want WiFi you have to pay $10 a day! We've stayed at much smaller hotels that have provided free internet access, I think it's a a bit tight of them!The concierge service is helpful, they made some good suggestions for dinner nearby where we ate pretty well. The location is very good as the hotel is right in Union Square and near all transport services. We didn't eat at the hotel but did go up to the top floor bar for a drink, it's worth going up there just for the views!All in all we had a comfortable stay at the this hotel, however due to it's size it does feel very impersonal and I think they could offer a few more thoughtful inclusions for their guests, but it's a very convenient location for a trip to San Francisco.

I stayed three nights at this hotel to attend a professional conference. The room was very clean, comfortable and roomy (downright spacious compared to Manhattan hotels). The conference room rate seemed reasonable for a hotel of this fit and finish. The concierge service was extremely helpful in recommending local restaurants and walking tours. I like to walk and from this convenient location I was able to walk through Chinatown up to Coit Tower and back on the first afternoon before dinner.The breakfasts provided at the conference were superb. Fresh fruit, bagels, lox, great coffee.I did not try the hotel restaurant but a few blocks away had a fantastic meal at Cafe Tiramisu - but that, my friends, is for another review.

As this was a business stay with most time spent away from the hotel, I can't really comment much other than the idea location to shops in downtown SF and within short walking distance to Union Sq and Chinatown.I did notice that the rooms, no doubt adequately furnished, but could have been better considering that this is a "Grand Hyatt". The lobby, which is relatively small for a Grand Hyatt, gets a bit busy during peak hours.

Having lived in San Francisco and now travelling there frequently for work, I am very familiar with the city and have stayed in numerous hotels within Union Square as well as the entire bay area. This hotel is an average typical business hotel with all the ammenities one might expect: basic room, clean bathroom (larger than most in SF, as is the case with all Union Square business hotels - Parc 55, Westin, Hilton, etc), restaurant/bar, close to transportation. Whether travelling for business or leisure, the location is perfect. Right in the heart of Union Square and only a short walk to the BART, Chinatown, Muni, etc. I was in SF for business last week and due to the US Open, availabilities were limited so I was booked by my company's corporate travel at the Hyatt as opposed to Parc 55 (my preference for business trips). I had no complaints about the stay other than the fact that the lobby seems to always be packed with people and the hotel charges for wifi. The doorman was awesome and gets a cab for you in record time.I would have easily given this hotel an average to slightly above average score if not for the issues I had during check-out and the week following. I opted to check out at the front desk to ensure that my personal credit card was not charged for the room (the room was pre-paid on a corporate card). I am glad I did this because they were, in fact, charging my personal card rather than charging the corporate card which was on file (I even saw it in the book along with my reservation while sorting this out at the front desk). After 20 minutes of frustration (and now being late to a meeting), the girl at the front desk finally (allegedly) got the situation resolved and gave me a virtually blank piece of paper which was informing me my balance was $0. I was a bit suspicious so I checked my pending transactions on my credit card the following day and sure enough...there was a pending $800 charge from the Hyatt. I immediately called and was transferred to the accounting department. After another 30 minutes of frustration, I was told that it was now officially resolved and my credit card would be credited. 3 days later, I checked my card again. Now the charge was no longer pending but rather, an actual charge AND my statement closing date had occurred so I was getting charged interest on this charge. I called AGAIN and finally was able to get the charge removed however, the interest is still on my statement and I have to file a dispute with the cc company all because the of the Hyatt's incompetence. Overall, this hotel is nothing special (no historical significance like the Sir Francis Drake, not a see and be seen place like the Clift and certainly not the best business hotel out there) but it does the job and is in a good location. The Hyatt clearly need to get a little more organized and not cause their customers days of frustration over a simple 2 night stay. I certainly wouldn't recommend this hotel based on my experiece.

Three night stay in this city centre hotel. Friendly and attentive service throughout, especially in the hotel's Grand Views restaurant. Room was spacious, luxuriously appointed and with magnificent views of the city and the Bay beyond. Well equipped and maintained fitness room. In spite of its central location quality sound insulation made for a good night's sleep.

Hotel was perfectly located on Union Square & very accessible for all transport links & shops/restaurants.Very quite & fabulous views of the city from the bar & restaurant on the 36th floor.Rooms were very spacious with loads of hanging space & a dressing area.Did have to wait around for elevators but not for too long.

The hotel is located in Union Square and has many eating and shopping options within walking distance. They are renovating the lobby/entrance but it does not cause too much of a disturbance. My room was on the 26th floor so it had wonderful views of the city and bay. The room was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The food from Room Service was very good. The only downside was that they charge for internet. My opinion is that it should be included in the rate.

The hotel in a perfect area, and walking distance to everything. Stayed in the 6th floor and found the room to be a little small but the rooms were very quiet. Comfortable beds and great view from the 36th floor bar. Parking is a little pricey $55 for valet or around $35 for self parking. Personally I though valet was worth it since I didnt have to waste time looking for a parking garage. The lobby was still in construction but most of hotel is complete. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Also, highly recommend Lefty O'doul's breakfast, very good.

Outstanding location as it's right next to Union Square. Room was outstanding as well as very modern. Floor to ceiling windows made our room seem twice the size, as did the enormous bathroom and vanity dressing area outside of the closet. Elevators are extremely slow due to the height of the hotel but it's to be expected. Had an issue with room service as well as a double charge but management more than made up for it with Hyatt points credited to my account. Make sure you walk to all your locations in San Francisco as it is extremely walkable and friendly, plus if you are up to it take a jog to the waterfront and watch the Sunrise it is breathtaking.

Right next to union square this Hyatt hotel was worth staying ,though it was expensive but got a good deal with breakfast .we all loved it n ESP the breakfast Buffett was nice.on the whole we really had a wonderful stay at grand .

Earlier reviews noted the dilapidated state of the hotel and more recent reviews talked about the construction under way. As several recent reviewers have indicated, the hotel re-model is mostly complete. As of early June, 2012, there was still work being done in the lobby. The rooms are tastefully done in a toned-down modern way. The rooms have small (very small) refrigerators which are nice for cold drinks and a couple of snacks. No microwave but most hotels in this class don't have microwaves. Coffee pot in the room stocked with the standard coffee, powdered cream and 1/8th teaspoon packets of sugar (2 for each cup) (if you use sugar or cream, bring some -- no hotel ever understands that the mini-packets of same don't have enough of either to be of any use.) We didn't take a car -- which was a wise choice since valet is almost more per day than I have to pay for a corporate-rate rent car. Room service and restaurant menus are limited -- and the food is somewhat mediocre. Bread pudding (with whiskey sauce) at 830pm was so dry that it must have been a day or two old. We asked for extra sauce (not really 'extra' since there was none on it when served. Waiter first brought ice cream....we said, no, no, we want whiskey sauce....came back with what appeared and tasted like melted ice cream. As others have noted, the 36th floor bar and restaurant have great views. It was out understanding that the 36th floor would be converted to meeting space (suitable for wedding receptions, etc.) soon. A plus is that the hotel is within a block of 2 diners which serve reasonably price and fairly decent food. Overall, rooms are very nice, the location is great and the service was acceptable. (no pool or spa)

Went for the wine tasting and fell in love with San Francisco! The Grand Hyatt is exactly that, GRAND we were luck enough to get a room on the concierge level definitely worth it wonderful breakfast buffett each day appetizers in the early evening as well as desert in the late evening is all part of the concierge level the Grand Hyatt is in a great location you can walk to all of the great shops, Chinatown, and Union Square Park So many things to see and do in San Francisco The hop on hop off tour is great. You can go at your own pace spending more time where you want to and you are not tied to anyone's schedule. We took a wine tour to Sonoma. The tour first made a short stop in Muir Woods. We absolutely loved being able to stop here. We made four stops on the wine tour and that was plenty. Lunch was on our own which was nice. We stopped for pictures at the Golden Gate Bridge on the way back and the pictures were great. Can't wait to go back!

The Grand Hyatt is a great location just up Stockton Street from Union Square, putting it within walking distance of tons of restaurants, bars, and stores, and a quick cab ride from most of the things you'd like to do in The City. I understand that all the rooms were renovated in the Fall 2011, so it goes without saying that the room was well furnished and up-to-date. The views from the bar on the 36th Floor are amazing (with Coit Tower, the TransAmerica Building and Alcatraz all visible). The bar staff was a little reserved but the staff at the rest of the hotel were warm and accommodating.The lobby is being renovated until later this year, but it didn't present much of an issue for us. The valet parking fee is $50+ per night, which is shocking for most places but for San Francisco, seems to be the norm.Overall, a great hotel and definitely worth the stay.
The hotel was clean, staff were kind and everything was in walking distance.

Very clean and room recently renovated. Great location right on union square. Bar on the 36th floor has the best view of SF I have seen and a lovely place for a light dinner of homemade chicken noodle soup. I would definitely stay here again, a beautiful hotel. Floor to ceiling windows made my room seem twice the size, as did the HUGE bathroom and vanity dressing area outside of the closet. Ask for a room on a high floor, I lucked out and ended up on 32nd floor with a view of bay. Staff was exceptionally nice. Lobby was still under renovation, but that didn't matter.

The location of this hotel is very good! I have stayed there for at least 8 times during my trip to San Francisco.The location is just beside union square and 5 min walk to Chinatown.I ususally din include breakfast with the booking, I prefer to eat tim sum in the Chinatown.The room is clean but a little bit old. TV is normal CRT.

Very clean and room recently renovated. Great location right on union square. Bar on the 36th floor has the best view of SF I have seen. I would definitely stay here again, a beautiful hotel. Only complaint is that the WiFi signal was weak to non-existent in our room, even after we called the support desk.

My wife and I checked into the Grand Hyatt on May 31 for a two night stay. We live in the bay area and stayed in the hotel because of a meeting and a evening banquet. On Friday, June 1,I called for my car to drive to the meeting and was shocked to find that the car had beenramsacked. No signs of forced entry. City Parking which runs the valet service for Hyatt had the key. Lost business items and my registration. Checked out early and missed the meeting and banquet to go home to be sure that my house had not been compromised. We were lucky. Wehave stayed at the Grand Hyatt on several occasions in the past but will not repeat in the future.No car safety.
Per a random dude's advice on the street, my wife and I found ourselves on the 36th or 37th floor having drinks. It turned into a 4 hr late night party that we'll never remember!

We stayed here for two nights on a weekend and got a reasonable rate. The room we got overlooks Union Square and is lovely. The rooms have been recently renovated and have the sleek, modern, new "Hyatt look". The lobby is pretty much sealed off due to ongoing renovations, except for asmall area for check-in. I am sure it will be beautiful when its done. Staff very friendly and helpful and gave us complimentary late checkout. Large bathroom. The beds are comfortable and room was very quiet. Had great night of sleep! Walk to Union square, Westfield Mall, theaters and lots of restaurants in the area. Cable car stop also very closeby. There is a parking garage (valet) across the street on Sutter that offers a hotel parking special, and you are charged thru the hotel. Even though it is not the "official" parking garage for Hyatt, It can't be any closer to the hotel and it probably costs a lot less.

The room was very clean due to the recent renovations, but on the small side and poorly designed. There was very little drawer space, the bathroom sink (though nice and modern) took up most of the counter, you had to stand practically against the shower wall to get under the shower head, and the scent of the bath products was horrible. We kept joking that we were on a cruise ship because of the size of the room and the creaking noise (evidently caused by the building swaying in the wind) that woke us up during the night.  The housekeeping staff were excellent as well as the people who delivered room service and the doorman. I wish I could say the same for the front desk staff. They were not rude, but in no way were they friendly or welcoming.  The cleanliness of the room and the location made it a pleasant stay and the price was great too so I would possibly stay here again.

Stayed with my sister May 26 to May 31 in a Grand Club room (2 doubles) on the 31st floor. Our view was outstanding and even though we both will never see 55 again, we enjoyed playing with the electronic shades. ;)The lobby is â€“ temporarily â€“ very small as this Hyatt undergoes a final renovation to make the lobby what it should be and the restaurant is moved to a ground level location. Nevertheless, that should not deter you from staying here - the location, beautiful rooms, guest services and friendliness of the Hyatt staff are worth passing through the small lobby area.Grand Hyatt Staff were attentive - the bellstaff were prompt and helpful. We spent a fair bit of time in the Grand Club Lounge on the 32nd floor (amazing views) and the Lounge Staff â€“ all of them - (special mention to Kyle) were attentive and prompt in keeping such a lovely lounge in A1 condition.Also, a very special mention about David (Dave) in the Grand Club Lounge â€“ Dave was not only very friendly and personable, but provided consistent good service. Dave went out of his way to get me hummus dip for my cruditÃ©s (can't eat wheat - a component of many dips).  The days that we were there, the Lounge was open for Continental Breakfast from 5:30 to 9:30am M-F and from 7 to 10am on weekends (baked pastries, fruit, hot dish- example frittatas). Hors dâ€™oeuvres are from 5 to 7pm and dessert until 9pm nightly. The upgrade to Grand Club Lounge Service is worth it for the staff, the food and the views.This was our first stay in a hotel room with hardwood floors (small area rug). Overall, the room was very nice (as many have stated here) and came with single cup coffee maker (look on the shelf under the safe) small fridge, bathrobes, and very nice bathroom amenities.While there was a minor design flaw or two in the room, a major design flaw are only 2 hooks in the bathroom to hang things up! This conflicts with the wishes of the Hyatt and their guests to conserve resources by re-using towels. How do you re-use towels when you - for example -must layer your bath towel onto your damp hand towel? And unless you are a very tall or agile person, forget about hanging your towel over the shower curtain rod â€“ it's too high. Hopefully after the renovation is finished, Hyatt will turn their attention to addressing this deficiency. We had a very pleasant few days looking at the sights in San Francisco and we looked forward to returning to our room each day. Would definitely consider staying here again if in San Francisco.

Location is great to see the city. Easy to get a cab or catch a bus.Rooms were clean and standard. Upstairs bar offers a nice view and live music. Staff was friendly and helpful.Wish I had a coffee maker in the room and wireless Internet wasn't so expensive and spotty. I also found it odd that there was no fan in the bathroom. Most of these things I'd expect from a large hotel chain so may look at others in area before staying here again.

Stayed here over the Memorial Day weekend May 2012 and had a great time. This hotel is only 1/2 block from Union Square, easy access to shopping, restaurants, cable car, MUNI & BART. Second time staying here. Certainly will return.

I arrived late and was greeted by a panhandler - not the best beginning to my stay. I think a better run hotel would have either bribed the panhandler to go elsewhere, or at the very least, had the doorman/porter observant enough to greet me as I exited the taxi, as opposed to after I had checked in. The room was as others have described it - slick and modern - and had just about everything you could ask for. My only issue with the room was that the television reception was pretty fuzzy for a couple of the network stations (NBC and I think CBS). I know this can be an issue in a city, but I would have enjoyed my early morning routine with less static on the TV. Speaking of mornings, one morning there were 2 elevators out of service. After waiting for 20 minutes, and I'm not exagerating, I decided that I would have to walk down, rather than risk being late for my customer meeting. Fortunately, I was only on the 7th floor. I lugged my laptop down a couple of flights, only to be greeted by guests and a hotel employee heading back up. It seems we had all chosen the staircase to no where, and had to get to a floor with the correct access, and then were guided to the basement, and finally to an exit. Kudos for the employee, who did lug my laptop for me.Normally, I wouldn't even mention this last point, but I think it is indicative of the lack of attention paid to details. That was the erratic nature of newpaper delivery. One morning, the Wall Street Journal was outside my door. The next three mornings, no paper at my door, but copies of the San Francisco Chronicle near the elevator. The last morning, USA outside my door. As I say, this was no big deal, but highlights a lack of consistency in the hotel.

Our stay was very pleasant. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. And, yes, the view from the 36th floor is amazing! The location was central and made it easy to get to the sights. We were attending a wedding and the view was a bonus. The other hotels we stayed in on this extended trip included a continental breakfast and cost less. I do feel something could have been included in the cost. Also, the coffee machine was well hidden and not discovered until our 2nd night. I would like to make a suggestion - we wanted to reuse our towels to save on the environment, but there were no towel racks in the room to hang them to dry.

Friendly staff and easy check-in. Parking was very expensive - after taxes, the valet parking cost $54/day. Self-parking would have been slightly cheaper - by about $5 I think. Good location - easy to walk to my meetings. Wi-fi was included with the room - though the desk chair was way too low to be able to work comfortably with a laptop at the desk in the room. The room quickly got stuffy after I used the shower. Even though I had the A/C turned on, it would have been nice to be able to open a window or turn on a fan in the bathroom. I ate supper at the bar on the 36th floor. Friendly service. Not many food choices on the bar menu, especially if you wanted to try to have something healthy. Room service breakfast was pricey but quite good and delivered very quickly. Actually, one of the best room service meals I've had in a long time.

Overall great hotel.We considered this hotel because of its location in Union Square, which area itself has a lot to offer for tourists, accessible to almost everything - malls, cable cars, chinatown, stores, etc.Walking distance to public transport, the Muni and BART so getting to other parts of SF is no big problem.Staff are nice, room is clean, almost complete things one need in a hotel.Downside are the mattresses which are not that comfortable as I found it a bit too soft.Also wi-fi isn't free and it costs $10 for a 24-hour internet service.

The Grand Hyatt offers sensational value for money. The location is superb and most of the highlights are a hop and a skip away.We've stayed at other hotels around Union Square and this is the quietest and also the most modern.Beds are really comfortable, my only recommendation is if you are a light sleeper, request for a room on the higher floors as the city itself never sleeps.

I would like to preface this trip report by saying The Grand Hyatt San Francisco is one of the best hotels I have stayrd at in regards to recognition for Hyatt Gold Passport Diamond members. Properties such as the GHSF make me happy that I have chosen to be loyal to Hyatt.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------Just completed a stay at the Grand Hyatt San Francicisco and I have nothing but compliments for the way the staff handled our special needs during this trip.This was the first time traveling for my friend since she had a stroke a year ago.She has limited mobility now and requires an ADA room. I wanted to be close to here so we asked for an ADA room with and adjoining room for me.This was handled well by the Grand Hyatt San Francisco(I contacted them directly and they were very helpful)and I was sent an email confirmation listing my requests.There was some confusion with the reservation(which was caused by a third party calling to confirm our reservation)which had us in three rooms instead of two. This was taken care of with no trouble by the FDR with the third "phantom room "taken off the reservation with no problem.Our first room was on the 6th floor was exactly the set up requested. However it was very noisy so I asked to be moved. The hotel was full so I was told they would move us the next day to a higher floor=which they did.The second set of rooms did not have a roll in shower but Housekeeping brought up a bath bench which worked out pretty well. Both rooms were very clean and I really enjoyed the new bed in my room. It was much quieter.There is construction(new MUNI station) in the Union Square area that starts at 6 a.m. so the noise/road detours is going to be a problem for all the hotels in that areaA couple of standout staff members made our stay wonderful. First of was a Bellman named Hal. His kindness and consideration were remarkable. All the bellman and Valet staff were great but Hal went above and beyond and his help was much appriciated.Dave in the Grand Club makes all of the guests feel like returning friends.All of the staff members in the Grand Club are pretty great. One of the best I have been to in the USA.I am forwarding this to The General Manager of the Grand Hyatt San Francisco via Facebook with the hope that the staff memebers mentioned (as well as the entire staff)are commended for their great work.And to thank the hotel for helping to make a challenging stay comfortable.

The hotel's location is central and makes it very accessible to explore downtown San Francisco.We spent 4 nights here and were very impressed by the cleanliness of the rooms as well as the modern feel. Breakfast buffet is great - however, the service on the other hand was a little bias towards older guests and did not tend to us more than once. We pay the same price or maybe more so we expect the same service and treatment from the staff.The concierge's tips on which restaurants to go to and what to see were spot on. Overall, we can only recommend staying here!

This is a modern high-rise high-quality hotel. Location is excellent being right off Union Square and central to a lot of what San Francisco has to offer. Reception, concierge and restaurant staff were all polite and friendly.The rooms are recently refurbished and I had a bayview room on the 29th Floor. Great to open the electronically-operated blind in the mornings and take in the San Francisco bay view! The bed was great, the bathroom tasteful, the flatscreen TV new and modern.Breakfast buffet was good. Quality food, but not outstanding. The view from the 36th floor was spectacular however.Any gripes? Well the lobby is somewhat minimalist. Nowhere much to sit and wait for friends/colleagues. Also paying for wi-fi in a high-end establishment does grate on me. Seriously folks, it's time to realise that in a high-end hotel like the Grand Hyatt, wi-fi is not an add-on luxury but should be a complimentary essential.

Centrally located in Union Square. Very accessible by cab or bart (metro). The lobby is under refurbishment, there is just a small area for guest reception. The room was ok, clean and with a beautiful view over downtown San Francisco. The thing I did not appreciate was wi-fi connection. It was not for free (10 dollars/day) and overall slow and unstable. Nevertheless, this remains a good hotel.

I tend to avoid the big chain hotels as too impersonal, too cardboard-y, and too predictable. But I go to SF regularly for work and have to follow the rates my corporate site gives (the same room in SF can vary $400-500/night depending on what is going on in town that week). That led me to the Hyatt, which has a very convenient location, but has very little "curb appeal". The lobby and street level entrance is dark, small, and generally depressing, and gives a terrible first impression. But once you leave the lobby, the rest of the hotel is much better. The rooms are light, modern, well designed, and very pleasant, and I would happily stay in them again. The bar on the top floor is easily overlooked, but the views are fabulous (though the decor is dated and out-of-synch with the modern decor in the guest rooms), and it was a very pleasant spot. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and I might return, but will say that mgmt keeps the nice details of this hotel well hidden, and its hard to ignore those important first impressions that made me question whether this choice.

Hi there -- Would love some tripadvisor feedback. I'm staying there over memorial day weekend and booked a package that supposedly includes a few things, including breakfast -- however every time I call I get a different answer about what is included or not in the breakfast, what type of room I'm getting, and the last two times I was hung up on -- accidentally I know, but still a bit annoying! Should I be scared to stay here? It's my anniversarry weekend, so I'm hoping it will be very nice, but I'm now nervous. When I told the front desk it was my anniversary their first response was that they could sell me a higher floor room -- I know that it is their job to sell, but it felt not too welcoming. So, should I be nervous or excited about staying here?

On the corner of union square but no cable car noiseCheck in and out were fast and easy with friendly helpful staffThe room was large for a city hotel with plenty of room and extra furniture like a comfortable lounge chair and a dest with plugs. Nice bathroom. Good temperature control. Very clean.Nice interesting walk to the convention center, top of knob hill, china town, embark aero, theater district.

I am not handicapped but was in room 2117 which is an ADA room. The hotel appears to have gone under recent renovation. The room was clean comfortable and had ample room for anyone with a disability. The light switches were low set as was the closet rod for easy reach. Desk and bath counter would Accomodate a wheelchair. There was a regular bathtub shower combo so this would not accomorate easy wheelchair access.
