But it did have security railsBeautiful view but since had an adjoining room I could hear neighbors conversations if in a moderately loud voice. Convenient to downtown and Chinatown but a walk to the convention center. All staff helpful. Lobby not impressive and was very busy. Overall a good experience

We were pleasantly surprised by the rooms at the Grand Hyatt in SF. The lobby is undergoing renovations, so much of it is blocked off, however, our room was completely renovated in a tastefully modern but warm decor. The floor to ceiling windows give you an impressive view of the cityscape. I was very glad that I requested a high floor. The remote controlled shades were a nice touch too.The Union Sq. location was ideal for most of the popular attractions. We did not rent a car so the cable cars, cabs, buses and street cars were our main forms of transportation. The cable cars and street cars were a very pleasant and nostalgic way to travel the hilly streets of San Francisco. The Grandview Bar and restaurant boasts one of the best views of the city.The sevice was exceptional, from housekeeping to room service. The one complaint is they did not have a business center during my stay. Guests only have access to one public computer that has a $6 charge for every 15 minutes of internet connection. So for the price, the Grand Hyatt SF was a pleasant experience. The central location, the chic rooms, and the freindly service all contributed to a great trip!

I usually stay at the Grand Hyatt when I'm in San Francisco. It's location is great, just one block from Union Square, but the rooms overlook the square itself. The rooms are good size and their recent renovation has improved the hotel. One of the best parts of the hotel is their restaurant/bar, which is on the 36th floor and gives you a wonderful view of the city. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. I've never been to the breakfast buffet, but have ordered room service for breakfast many times. Food is good and they are generally quick to bring it up. You won't go wrong staying at the Grand Hyatt.

Location is great. Room is not so great or clean. I had to clean bathroom again, hair all over the place. Layout, vibe, comfort levelnot like other Hyatts I go to. And I can't believe a Hyatt makes you stand in a corner to use a computer, and they only have one! Many other hotels to choose from, skip this one.

Great location on the nicer side of Union Square, had room on a high floor with a great view. Room was modern and nicely furnished. Lobby was being refurbished but they've done a great job at the temporary setup - you could easily not notice anything was going on.
You will not go wrong here. It is close to Union Square, walking distance from many stores, nice restaurants and a good mall. Service is good, the concierge very friendly and helpful.

I have stayed at Gran Hyatt a few times in Hong Kong and Shanghai. Those stays were amazing. I wish I could say the same about the Grand Hyatt San Francisco.Unfortunately what was wrong with the hotel is not a short list.1. Hotel rooms have no furniture for clothing that is folded. There is only one small closet with one shelf2. The bathroom is large but poorly designed. The towel hooks\bars are 10 feet away from the shower3. My toilet leaked every time it was flushed and was never fixed4. The breakfast buffet is very poor - $25 and all they have is scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausage, bacon, fruit, and bread. No omelet station, no one cooking at a griddle station, ECT. The food they did have was very poorFor a hotel that charges over $300 a night this is very poor service and hotel. I paid muss less and got much better accommodations in AsiaI would avoid this hotel.

We spent 5 nights here 9th-13th May and had a great trip. The location is excellent, the staff were great, and the room was roomy with a nice bathroom and shower and the most comfortable king bed ever! We were sad to leave. The breakfast we ordered one day was great and even arrived a little early. I'd stay here again.

We stayed at the Hyatt for a week at the beginning of May. The location is unbeatable, right in the centre of town. The lobby is a little old-fashioned but the bedrooms are clean and modern with a great view.The amenities in the bedrooms were not amazing, no showercap or slippers, which i normally expect, but the staff was superb. I have to thank Susan again for making sure my mum got a treat for her birthday, she will never forget that.Parking is expensive but concierge was lovely and told us about cheaper alternatives nearby.All in all a great experience, I love Hyatts and I was not disappointed, will definitely stay there again when in SF.

Normally, I don't like to book a room through Priceline as I have had less than positive experiences in the past, but since we needed two rooms we decided to risk it. I was pleasantly surprised as I was quite worried with what we would end up with. The room had a stylish modern design. We didn't have much of a view although my daughter did, so at least some of us had a good view. There is a small refrigerator, a safe and a coffeepot with packets of coffee all inside the cabinets near the desk. However, you have to look in the closet to find a place to put your clothes. The dresser is in the closet. There is a button by the bed that automatically opens the blinds--very cool. There are reading lights by the bed that can be rather annoying as they hang right in your face. They can be bent out of the way without damage. I was afraid I might break them at first. The bathroom is also very modern. The large mirror with the light all around it was an interesting design. I have seen it in a Westin before and I like it. The sink is like a giant trough. I liked the design of the bathroom. Be careful with the pocket door as it can slam shut pretty easily. My daughter's boyfriend got his finger smashed in the door. He was alright but it hurt so be aware and close it slowly.I was worried we might have excessive noise because we were near the housekeeping supply closet, but it wasn't an issue. The hotel appears to be well insulated so there were no noise problems. We had requested a king bed but weren't able to get it but two queens worked out fine. If this was one of their lower end rooms, which I am assuming it was because we used Priceline, I can just imagine what the more expensive rooms are like.We went to the 36th floor where they have a bar with a panaramic view of the city. That was definitely worth doing. The Grand Hyatt is located right in Union Square so it's an easy walk to lots of shopping. We had gone to a concert and got back late so we were looking for food. We went to a diner nearby called Lori's Diner. I don't recommend it. Bad service and even worse food. The only positive I can say about the place is it is open really late at night. Find someplace else to go.Overall, I had a very pleasant stay and would come back to the Grand Hyatt the next time I decide to stay in San Francisco.

I go to San Francisco really often for work or leisure reasons and this time I wanted to make an hotel change. Before I went to Mandarin Oriental and then Westin St. Francis, both wonderful hotels but, this time, I've been really surprised by Grand Hyatt San Francisco. Starting from the hotel staff, helpful, kind and so professional. Anne S. and Oscar L. tks a lot for your warm welcome. The hotel is totally renewed, the rooms are amazing and the beds really comfortable. I had a room at the 28th floor and the view of the city skyline from my full-size window was stunning. The hotel is located in the best position in SF, near all the city tourist attractions or financial district if you're there for business. I'll be back! this is my new choice because... I left my heart in San Francisco and Grand Hyatt helped me on that.

An excellent hotel, very impressive and very accesable. Staff are friendly and facilites are brilliant. In the middle of downtown San Fran. Really made my visit brilliant!! I would reccomend this hotel to anyone visiting San Fran. Rooms are lovely and quite big. A grat place to stay!!

Very Convenient Location on Union Square.Nicely Renovated.Modern and Cozy.Surrounding Area surprisingly dark and quiet at night.Service could improve.They only give 200 Gold Passport points per stay??

I am just finishing up my stay at the Grand Hyatt and was very impressed with the rooms, the food and the exceptional service. The rooms appear to be recently renovated and are very well appointed for the business (or any) traveler. Some of the points that were a highlight:* Wireless access was very reasonably priced.* The remote controls for the shades and nightlights by the bed were a nice touch.* The toiletries were high quality and the addition of toothpaste was a nice touch.* Bed and furniture incredibly comfortable.* Great lighting* Wonderful shower with modern fixtures.* Very nice gym on the 35th floor - great views!The staff was exceptional. Every one greeted you and struck up a conversation on the elevator. One morning I was headed back to the room and my key no longer worked. I went downstairs but I didn't have a picture ID. They would NOT just give me a key, which is exactly what should have happened. Instead, the sent someone upstairs with me and kindly asked me to show my ID. That makes me feel very safe as a woman traveling alone.Finally, I had room service a couple of nights and the phone was excellent.This will be my destination of choice in SF for business or pleasure.

We stayed at Grand Hyatt San Francisco for three nights in April. And it was the full right decision.I did not found anything wrong, quite the contrary: ubication is perfect, touching Union Square, the place that can be considered the middle of the downtown; it is full of restaurants and there are plenty of shops nearby, such as Apple Store, Macy's, Oakley, and so on. Starbucks opposite.If you arrive driving, one option is valet parking (about 50$), or public car parks in Union Square.Taxi to Pier 33 (Alcatraz) or Pier 39 is about 10$.Reception: check-in and check-out very fast (I appreciate it so much), and staff very pleasant and always with a smile for us.Concierge service: excellent, all doubts and bookings we asked for were perfect, and their recommendations about restaurants were exactly what we were looking for.Rooms: do not hesitate and book a bay view room. Worth it absolutely. Located at the highest floors, an amazing view is offered from the room; in addition, blinds are automatic, so you can wake up in the morning opening the blinds from your bed and enjoy that dramatic scenery. Large rooms and with high quality furniture. Cleanliness is a highlight.We read some wrong reviews about the wifi signal. All we have to say is that we had a perfect wifi signal from reception to our room, and also in the Level 36 restaurant (highly recommended too, to have dinner or just to have a cocktail).I would emphasize specially on the kindness and efficiency of all the staff in the hotel. They convert our stay in San Francisco from good to excellent.Of course, when we come back again to San Francisco we will book this accommodation. Is one of the best hotels I have ever been.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 5 nights in April (22nd-27th) we were on the 19th floor which was lovely for views of the city and kept the noise out from the busy road. The room itself was lovely with everything you would expect. It was clean and well presented. The bed was amazingly comftable which made it very hard to get up in the morning. The staff were very helpful and the system which allows you to pre book back onto your flight home was great. The hotel was also in a fantastic location right next to Union Square! Very central. I would have no problems in recommeding this hotel to friends and family. Nice hotel in a great city!

My husband and I used a suite upgrade and, for the bargain price of just $199 a night in San Francisco, were given a very pleasant suite with a small living room and bedroom. Views from the high floor were beautiful over the city. The room was very clean and looked like it had just been redone. The bed was a typical, comfortable Hyatt bed. Housekeeping was always very efficient however, avoid the corner rooms because you will be woken up early in the morning as that is also where housekeeping has their supply closets. Public transportation is all around you and the tour bus companies all pick you up in Union Square. Go to the concierge for suggestions. One in particular was wonderful, I believe her name was Liz. She suggested a small tour company for a day long trip to the wine country. It was absolutely wonderful and with only 10 people in the small bus, everything was much more enjoyable. It also picked you up and dropped you off right at the hotel. I would have given this hotel a five had the club lounge had more of a selection in the evening. Breakfast was okay, nothing special but adequate albeit overcrowded. No real snacks offered during the day, a cash bar, and missing staff who couldn't answer any questions. Make sure to visit Alcatraz and book your tickets in advance if you are going during the busy season.

We stayed at this hotel in April 2012 for 3 nights. The location is perfect for access to tourist spots. Hop on/hop off bus leaves from Union Square. Plenty of great shops and restaurants within walking distance. Starbucks across the road. Our room was spacious and had everything we needed. We had a great view of union square from our floor to ceiling window.  One complaint was that it was very dusty. I actually had to dust the bedside table myself so I didn't sneeze all night!. Apart from that, the room was clean, bed comfortable and we were happy.Gym was good, great view while working out.There is a couple of laundries nearby that wash, dry and fold your clothes for $1 per pound.Internet was reasonably priced for a hotel.I would definately stay here again if returning to SF.

I stayed here four nights on a business trip. The Grand Hyatt is an old war horse of a hotel -- it's been around for decades now. This was my first stay. The lobby is not much more than the reception desks and then turn the corner to the banks of elevators. It makes it efficient because you won't run into families or folks milling around in a typical tourist lobby area. But if you want the grand, welcoming lobby experience -- you won't find it here. The banks of elevators are a godsend because the wait is short. I stayed in a standard king bedroom. The room was modernized and had more than enough space at about 300 sq ft. The bed was comfortable with clean, soft linens. There's a large flat screen TV. The window shades are electronic which is wonderful when one is too lazy to get up off the bed to close them. The bathroom had enough space to manuveur around without feeling claustophobic. There were high quality toiletries in use -- a great touch was the small tube of toothpaste that lasted all week.One thing to note: I had one of those rooms that had a door which connected to the adjacent room. There wasn't much soundproofing on the connecting door because I could hear my neighbors when I stood in front of the mirror at the side of the connecting door.

There is nothing bad to say about this hotel! The rooms were gorgeous, staff friendly and helpful, and the location is perfect. The BART is very close, cable car stop close, and all the tour buses stop at Union Square which is right across the street. You can walk to China town and there are tons of restaurants you can walk to as well.

Grand Hyatt was a Priceline win bid, based specially in the strategic location of Union Square, and that is the first good thing about it: it is located just steps away from the square. The hotel has partially attended my requests, since they have assined us adjoining rooms(four persons, two rooms), but not a special view, what I had asked informing them it was a special occasion. The view from our rooms in a lower to medium height floor facing the city was not bad, but not special. To have a nice view we went one morning to the restaurant on the top floor for breakfast, which was average in quality for the price. The rooms and bathroom are very clean, comfortable, with a nice size and decor. The lobby is small and bland, though. Value overall was great for us.

We arrived at the hotel after a long flight and were given access to our room early. Our room was on the 12th floor and had a great view of Union Square. The room was on the larger side with plenty of room for two suitcases. The bathroom is also quite large and has recently been updated. The room was clean, however, I did find a hair on one pillow.The location is perfect for the shopping and dining options in Union Square.The doorman/bellman (the morning shift) was the best employee we encountered at this hotel. He was conversational without being annoying and got everyone on their way quickly and efficiently.Unfortunately, that's the end of the good points about this hotel. The front office staff were rude on our checkout. We asked for some further information about their conference facilities and we instructed to look it up ourselves online. What, you can't give the slightest bit of information verbally?The room service was not up to scratch. The first night they forgot the OJ (but still charged me) and the second night they forgot the cheese on the burger!The wifi (that you have to pay for) is very slow. I could only pick up two bars in my room and it would constantly drop out. Not very good for a business hotel.Lastly, they charged my credit card without my authorization a day before I checked out. I wanted to discuss the Internet charges considering I couldn't get a signal half the time and shouldn't have to pay but I didn't get the chance since they already charged me. Not cool.

We stayed here last weekend. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is located very centrally. Shopping / Dining / Transit ...everything very close. We had great views from our room on the 30th floor.Only some rooms will have the view of the Golden gate bridge (we did not). However, many rooms on the higher floors will definitely have amazing views!We ate breakfast at Grandviews restaurant every day of our stay. We totally enjoyed the banana pancakes!!More than the pancakes...was the view from the restaurant....literally 360 degree view of the entire area!! We got great pictures!!On our departure day, we had a small misunderstanding about breakfast. But, the front desk staff went above and beyond and made sure we got our breakfast (since we had an early flight). The restaurant manager was already organized with what we wanted to eat. There was just a little miscommunication. We were happy it was sorted out quickly.We noticed a lot of families with kids (all ages) staying in this hotel. Also, we had one night where there was a noise problem from the next door room. This was solved by hotel security within ten minutes after calling the front desk. OVerall ..highly recommend this hotel if it is in your budget!I suggest getting the breakfast package. You will not regret it!!

Take a peek on Hyatt's website for their Hyatt Free Time Special. Stay 2 nights and get one free with daily breakfast for two. It's a deal that can't be beat and i know! (i booked on expedia for a different property only to cancel for the Hyatt through Hotel Planner only to cancel AGAIN for a better deal direct through the Hyatt website)Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Grand Hyatt. My boyfriend and I arrived at OAK and took the BART to the Powell Street station. The walk to the Grand Hyatt was a bit confusing for a SF first-timer due to the construction on the roads & Powell St station. Once we arrived, check-in was a breeze. The construction in the lobby area was unnoticeable. We were able to check-in early at around 2pm and were given a room on the 14th floor. The view wasn't great..but a room is a room and we were only there to sleep. Room Pros:- decor is lovely- modern, bright spacious room- sun blocking blinds - hdmi capabilities on the TV- reading lights that were adjustable on both sides of the beds in addition to the normal bedside table lamps- real fridge (instead of the mini bar ones that keep things cool but not cold) for our leftovers & drinks- magnifying mirror (i packed my own but this one was great!) i was tempted to ask where i could get one for home!- massive sink (i mean 3x the size of a standard bathroom)- glass table top in the bathroom (perfect for placing your hot hair tools without wrecking the counters)-4+ elevators (the wait was never long)Room Cons:- lack of drawer space in the closet (3 tiny tiny drawers)- not enough places to put your towels, there were a couple of hooks for your bath towels but no where to put your face/hand towelsBreakfast was held daily in their restaurant on the 36th floor. The view is to die for! Picturesque view of Coit Tower and the city. Try to go for breakfast early to guarantee one of the window views! I really enjoyed the options for breakfast: Full Breakfast Buffet or order off the menu (Most hotels only offer a breakfast buffet). The buffet had a wide variety of options and you were also able to order hot pancakes or waffles if you wanted them. Service was professional and friendly.One thing i have to comment on is that there were always staff readily available to assist you. You never had to look around for help. And thank you to the Concierge that stayed open a little longer than normal to arrange our shuttle service to the airport. The hotel also offers complimentary boarding pass print outs through the computers in the front desk area. Thanks for the wonderful stay! I will definitely think of the Grand Hyatt for future visits to San Francisco!
Great location, union square!!! Walking distance to all of the downtown sites like chinatown, market st and ect. The hotel is updated, clean and great service. My first choice for San Francisco!!!

Three night stay. Approx $200 per night. Noisy location. Only one Resturant on 36th floor with very poor staff and very expensive breakfast. No proper lobby to sit and have a coffee or snack. Many rooms have interconnecting doors which mean you need quiet neighbours if you need sleep following long distance flight.

Great location, and the rooms are generally clean. During my last three stays however the staff were on strike. This was unpleasant, and there were demonstrations, leaflets left in the room, and the service was much delayed. Generally the staff is rather rude. On one occasion the porter smashed my luggage (most likely an accident), breaking a toy a bought for my son. This was annoying, as I have just checked out and was heading to the airport. When you call on the phone them many times they just hang up :( The aircon is very loud, and you can smell cigaret smoke many times :(Otherwise, it is an OK hotel. I really like its location.

We are a family of 5 and stayed for 3 nights in April in interconnecting rooms. Overall the hotel was great. The staff were friendly and attentive, the rooms were good and the beds comfortable. There were a number of things that could have been done better, which I have described below but, if you don't have time to read the rest, our overall summary is that this is a good hotel in a great location.Having booked online a month in advance, with a confirmed reservation for rooms on the 20th floor or above, we didn't get off to a very good start on arrival. We were told that the only interconnecting rooms were on the 4th floor. In the rooms we found ourselves staring at the windows of the building opposite and decided to complain. The staff then 'discovered' they had interconnecting rooms on the 19th floor, not quite what we had booked, but a great view of Union Square. There are extensive overnight roadworks going on in Union Square at present, and the thin glazing on the windows allowed this work, and the traffic noise, to become quite intrusive, although we soon adjusted.The rooms are newly refurbished, and although the furniture and decorations are not lavish, they are smart, neat and largely functional. Little things could be improved, like the fact that the room is provided with an ice bucket, ice tongs, a bottle opener, but no glasses! The kids were upset that their tastes were not catered for in the choice of TV channels delievered free to the room but again, these are minor complaints.If you have a car, use the assisted parking at the garage across the street to save yourself valet charges. The restaurant on the 36th floor has fantastic views, the food is very good, and the waiting staff are friendly and helpful. We had a small problem with an undercooked dish, but were given a complimentary desert, which was very generous.We would stay at this hotel again and thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

If you want to experience everything that this city has to offer, there is no better hotel to stay at.The service is impeccable, the rates are great, and the views from the top floor bar are to die for.

Stayed 3 nights for work. Staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. (ex - called to get # for aiport shuttle - they offered to book it for me). My room was nice and bed was comfortable. Nice touch was little reading lights hooked to side of the bed - this was great since I spent most of my trip reading documents in my room (try to contain your jealousy over my exciting trip). My only complaint is same as a couple others - the lobby is currently under construction and it is NOISY! I was only on the 7th floor - may get better as you go up. But the construction started early and went on pretty late. Also, I am guessing due to construction there weren't any real quiet places to meet and talk with co-workers which would have been nice. That said - this was one of my better stays in SF.Also - although it is pretty pricey - the view from the restaurant/bar at the top is spectacular. Treat yourself to a cocktail at a table by the window.

We love this hotel and always stays there. This is the first time we have this problem. Great room on the 20th floor, facing the bay and Coit Tower. We were there for six nights. Had 4 sets of neighbors in adjoining room, two of these were incredibly loud and it was like they were in our room. All the noise came through the door between our rooms.First set of neighbors (1 night only), had loud, I mean top of lungs, arguments... first mid afternoon, with the women accusing of all kinds of things and speaking loudly, half crying, non-stop talk. Then around 1:30 in the morning it started again, woke us, this time both were arguing. The man kept saying he was leaving - I wish !-, then they started insulting each other with the F. word. It went on for 45 minutes. I finally called the Front Desk, but the arguing was intermittent, with sometimes 5 minutes of quiet, and Security missed it. They said they could not call or knock unless they hear something... Next day was calm with new neighbors. Then the two next nights, we had a young couple with a little girl. They were wild, playing for hours, running after each other, screaming and laughing. It is nice that they were happy, but again, we heard everything... It started again at night till past 11PM. Wow, impossible to sleep wondering if it was going to start again.. they were there two days.It has never happened to us before. The soundproofing between the rooms is non existent, totally inappropriate for a hotel of this quality. Now, we wonder if we will stay there again, because it really affected our enjoyment of the trip. Relaxing and sleeping well is part of a vacation. (they told us all rooms, but one per floor, had adjoining door)

We stayed there for a total of 3 nights and had a really enjoyable stay. The lobby was being renovated so there's not much seating place or anything really to look at.The rooms however were really well kept and clean, which is definitely more than I could say for some hotels we've stayed at recently.The pros:1. Room is clean and newly decorated.2. Location is very centralized, easy to get around Union Square area by foot.3. Staff is very helpful and courteous. From the front desk, bell, valet, room service.4. Starbucks right across the street and walgreens a block away. Easy to get to by foot for water, snacks, etc.5. Mini fridge in the hotel room... very nice.The cons:1. There's no lock on the bathroom door! What's up with that?2. There's only 1 way to get to this hotel by car... make sure you learn the map of the area or you'll be doing run arounds like we did the first couple of times.3. Parking is not cheap... then again what do you expect in SF Union Sq area.I definitely would stay here again no qualms about it.

Overall, the hotel was very good. Clean, comfy beds. What got to me was that the lobby is being remodeled and the rennovations can be quite loud. So the guy at the front desk puts me in a room on the third floor, so I can get as close to the construction noise as possible. I truly wondered what I did to offend him..It's nice that they make noise only from 9 to 5 during the rennovation. Too bad I was in the room trying to work from 9 to 12 noon. I couldn't hear myself think. They have a very nice restaurant on the top floor. Very nice view of the city. Other than the construction, it's not a bad hotel.

Great service, superb rooms, great food, awesome environment. Location the best in the world. Try the 32nd floor club room with the greatest view of the Bay and that's it. Beat stress , stay in this hotel for your San Francisco vacation. Everything within reach and food and shopping is as easy as 123...Unbeatable experience. The staff is one of the best I've experienced travelling all over the world.

Stayed in March 2012 for 1 night while on a business trip. The location, just off Union Square and the high-end shopping streets -- is unbeatable. The rooms are spacious and have just been renovated, which is great. The lobby was still being renovated and felt cramped, especially when many guests were checking in/out at the same time. Superb views towards the Bay and Alcatraz from the bar on the top floor, excellent cocktails. My room was on the 14 floor overlooking the street, so I could hear street noise well into the late hours. Ask for a room on an even higher floor, perhaps with a view to the square or the bay,

This hotel has just undergone a major renovation and the rooms are great. They are large, well appointed and very comfortable. The renovation is still progressing in the lobby area, but they have sealed it off so you hardly notice and certainly are not inconvenienced in any way. The location is fantastic, being one block to cable cars, and right next to Union Square shopping and sight seeing. All the hotel employees that we encountered were extremely helpful.

This Grand Hyatt has an excellent location with easy walking distance to cable cars, BART station, all kinds of bus stops. The top floor restaurant has a breathtaking view of SF. We didn't drive, but I imagine driving from/to this hotel would be challenging with all the traffic. Rooms are tastefully appointed, clean and comfortable, after all it is a Hyatt. Really close to shops. Suitable for people who don't mind walking a little and use public transportation.
Good hotel, great location in the commercial area of san franscicos. Nice bar at the top with great views, express check in.

Very unfriendly check in, waiters in the breakfast etc..espresso machine in the restaurants was out of order during my complete stay.Rooms are clean but windows are tin, so you can hear the city vibes rigth up to you room. They claim to had renovated the place but it was done very poor. Internet is charged and mega slow. I stayed at le meridien last time and will probably go back to that one.

Stayed here for 4 nights last September for a conference. Fantastic location with decent room service food. The views from some of the rooms are superb. They had a union strike going on while we were there which was really annoying and loud, but the staff went out of their way to make up for the distractions and this was most appreciated. They moved us to a higher floor to get us away from the noise. They did their best to shield guests getting in and out of the door from the protestors. i would certainly stay here again for business or pleasure.

My girlfriend and I stayed here last week and paid about $275 (with parking) during the week. The hotel was very clean and nicely kept but was less than I was expecting. I guess for that type of money I was expecting a little more. The lobby was smaller than I expected and wasn't all that flattering. Apparently, there is a really nice restaurant at the top of the hotel that has a great view of the city but we never did venture up there. The hotel is right in the heart of all the shopping. When traveling to San Francisco next, I won't be staying at the Grand Hyatt unless there is a really good deal on it.

This is my second visit to the Grand Hyatt.Pros:Friendly StaffNice, clean, spacious roomsNice view of the city from the bar on the top floorNice sized gymGood LocationCons:Not much, some of my colleagues compalined of street noise at night, but I had a high floor room and had no issues.Overall I would recommend this hotel.

stayed here again. newley rennovated rooms. very stylish with a modern look. great bathroom too and a great view of the financial area from our room. exceptional bed, so comfy.great cocktail lounge on the 36th floor with wonderful views.excellent breakfast too.when leaving ratherthan a taxi, gave us a town car at the same price to the airport.

This Hotel is amazing great location very close to most of San Francisco attractions Staff was really great had a room on a high floor and had a room facing the bay and Alcatraz Island we would defiantly be staying here again

This Hyatt is located in a great central location in a city where there is so much to see and do. Catching a bus or the BART is as simple as walking a couple blocks, restaurants are plentiful for a close place to eat and the hotel itself is very accommodating and clean.

This hotel is at the walking distance to union square, the heart of all the activities. The location is also quiet and pretty safe wherein you will not find homeless at the side of the streets. The lobby is not so big but it is contemporary designed. The room has automatic window shield.Amenities is good enough but has no shower cap and sandals. The hotel staff are helpfull. I was desparately in need of a camera charger at a very early in the morning and Irvin, one of the staff really made an extra effort to find the charger. He brought all the chargers the hotel had and tried to match it with what I need. I appreciate it so much.The hotel has a ready ticket for hop on and hop off city tour and can also help to book a ticket to alcatraz. Very efficient and that is what we need as a tourist.

First time to stay at this property, and I probably would return. However, there are a few things about the property that struck me as odd. First, there is no convenience store in the hotel, or even a little shop off the lobby that so many hotels are moving to. I had to go up to the restaurant and get them to make something for me for breakfast, to take back down to my room after a workout. The lobby itself is completely underwhelming and cramped. A Hyatt Place lobby blows it out of the water. The room, recently renovated, was very nice and comfortable, although I could not figure out how to turn the corner floor lamp on. Finally (and this is a growing pet peeve, albeit a First World problem), an HDTV looks pretty ridiculous when there are no digital signals from which to choose.

Staying on the 32nd floor in a newly renovated room with laminated hardwood floors. Generally clean and comfy but the water pressure for the shower is on the low side. Friendly check-in staff. Lobby is currently under renovation. Good location in SF.

Perhaps we have been spoilt as having always stayed in Grand Hyatts, primarily on Far East holidays, our expectations were very high, only to be rather disappointed. The stay was perfectly adequate - we stayed 6 nights.The plus points: convenient location off Union Square, rooms had nice decor, beds very comfortable, top floor restaurant has fabulous views and food was fine. The negatives: lobby is dull and front desk check-in experience was disappointing - served by a gentleman (rather unfriendly)... I asked if we could have a higher floor with a view if possible - he replied yes, nice room and good view. We ended up on the 12th floor with no view onto the back of a couple of buildings and some industrial centre roof. Woken at 4am each morning to some form of lorries unloading which we assumed took place underneath the industrial roof we could see below us - this only lasted about 30 mins each morning.Whilst in-room cleaning was fine with friendly, pleasant maids, glasses/trays were left outside various rooms on the 12th floor and we were astonished to see a couple of particular trays left for 3 days whilst we stayed which had food on! Very poor for this type of establishment.Grand view restaurant where we had the breakfast buffet each morning had beautiful views - staff were generally very pleasant and accommodating. Food was generally of a good standard, albeit, the hot buffet items did tend to be on the "lukewarm" side, so by the time back to your table, items often cold. Furniture items in bar/lounge area adjacent to restaurant were generally very tired and could do with a facelift.Check-out : front desk tried to charge us for 6 nights accommodation (which had already been pre-paid through Virgin holidays) - this was quickly rectified once I complained.Hence, our average rating ... admittedly, we did not complain to anyone about any of the issues we encountered ... provided our room was clean with comfortable beds, we were often not in the hotel long enough to worry about things as we were out enjoying the fantastic city of San Francisco.

Enjoyed our stay at Grand Hyatt Union Square, beds were very comfortable, staff helpful and despite hotel being busy with guests it was very quiet in the rooms. We faced the back of the hotel but had a great view over the city. Location was especially good, right in the heart of things in Union Square and shopping district, easy to get tours and close to cafe's. Would recommend Louis's Diner for breakfast, just around the corner from the hotel. Cheesecake Factory was great for meals too located at top of Macy's building 5mins walk away. Skybar in Hotel really nice and great cocktails in evening with lovely staff. Only a few minutes to cable car turnaround on Powell Street which takes you straight to Fisherman's Wharf. Alot of homeless in San Francisco but none of them were intrusive or dangerous and felt safe entire time we were there despite venturing out and walking around city alot. Would definitely stay at Grand Hyatt again they clearly conform to a high standard.

Our experience at this hotel was very good. The rooms are always spotless and in good repair.I hate to be picky however .......1. the shower head was terrible. No matter how I adjusted it I had to stand within inches of the head and on the drain to get water. Change the head so it shoots water out farther. I would probably not stay here again because of this.2. the location of the toilet paper roll is quite a distance behind you causing you to "twist around" in an uncomfortable position....why not use a portable holder?3. the toilets are the "highest" I have encountered which is good for a tall person like me however my wife's feet would not reach the floor.

Trip advisor does it again this hotel was a good choice because it is close to everything I thoroughly enjoyed my stay the only downside room was small. But that's how things are in San Francisco but they do maximize the use of space.

We were pleasantly surprised by this place. The new decor is very nice, and the room (especially the bed) was very comfortable. The location couldn't have been more ideal. If you stay be sure to visit the restaurant and bar on the top floor for an unprecidented view of the city and harbour.
Wonderful and beautiful hotel we go there every year because my mom grew up there. We look forward to going there every year. It is in a very great location it is right by union square.

The positives:1. Rooms are modern, clean, beautiful; beds lovely.2. Views are wonderful (we were on 31st floor).3. Concierge was extremely helpful with rental car, planning trips, etc. 4. Regency Club was AMAZING. I miss it already! (huge high-quality food selection, super clean, lots of space & areas to sit, very friendly & professional Regency Club staff). 5. As usual, the ventilation for the rooms was fantastic (typical Hyatt).6. Perfect Location!Negatives:1. Rooms a little on the small sideThank you Hyatt! You made our stay in San Francisco wonderful!

We stayed here before heading up hours north to go to a family wedding. Great time! Great people! Just a terrific experience. I absolutely recommend staying here for business or leisure. It's also in a convenient sport to access the rest of the city.

We stayed at this hotel for a whole week. It is very well located within short distance to the Cable Car stop, Union Square and Moscone Center. Rooms were impeccable - very well decorated, excellent beds and with a nice working desk. Bathroom amenities were also very nice. My wife accidentally dropped her earing in the sink and we were able to get the engineering team in the room at midnight to open the sink's piping and recover it! Great service! Be sure to visit the restaurant for a great view of San Francisco skyline.

We had not stayed here for a number of years. The hotel has just gone through a renovations. Our room was clean with a great view. All new items in the guest rooms and very comfortable beds. Had dinner first night in Grand View Restaurant on 36th floor. It was fantastic and Frank our waiter was wonderful as well as the Assistant Restaurant Manager. All the staff we encountered were extremely friendly and had a genuine desire to help you. Stay here you cannot go wrong.

I stayed at Grand Hyatt in the last week of March for 2 nights. First of all, the location was the most convenient! There is BURT, Muni bus station right down the street. We could go anywhere in the town of San Francisco from here. There are many shops around the hotel. My sister and my mom are from Japan (I live in Ohio) and they wanted to go specific brand name store. We could walk most of the stores and department stores from the hotel. We could go to China town to have some dim-sum (Yum!) The hotel room had a modern interior. Very clean. The beds were very comfortable. We stayed at 31st floor. The city view was incredible. I am glad we stayed at Grand Hyatt!

Grand Hyatt is @ the heart of San Francisco (Union Square). Very close to everything: shoppings, cable car which brings you Fisherman's Wharf, China town, etc... Service is excellent and staff very professional. Concierge services were great. There is a very nice view from the 36th floor where you can have breakfast, drinks & food. Very comfortable. I had a very good time while my stay despite a noisy night from my neighbors once next room.You have the sightseeing buses stop in front of the hotel in Union Square.

We stayed at the Hyatt in early November for 3 nights. The city view room we had was very comfortable and the beds were incredibly comfortable! The location is very convenient for many tourist attractions and shopping. San Francisco was an unbelievable culinary experience everywhere we went. Miette, the Ferry Building, Swan Oyster Depot, Zuni Cafe, Delphina, Mission Street Chinese and even the restaurant in the mall Cupola was amazing!

My room is practically brand new - the whole hotel has been re-done - except the lobby which is not finished yet - no signs of construction however as the lobby has been re-configured during construction. Room was great - location great - nice bathroom sink etc - great all around.

We stayed here for 3 nights with several other couples and all of us had a great experience. First off I have learned that travel websites aren't the cheapest route to go...we booked directly through the Hyatt and ended up changing our reservations 4 times because we kept finding better deals directly through them. That may aggravate some people but I check that kind of stuff all the time so I love it that you don't get penalized for making changes.Anyway, we went from $229 a night, down to $170 a night, then to a special where it was $209 a night but if you stayed 3 nights you got the third night free, plus breakfast for 2 each morning. So in the end we felt like we got a great deal. The hotel is right at Union Square, easy walk to trolley and BART. Nice location for shopping and dining. The rooms are accurately represented in posted photos. Not super huge but very chic and inviting. The bed was very comfy, there was a small fridge, coffee maker, bathroom well appointed and modern. No complaints at all. Maid service was very prompt in the mornings, we ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant every morning and it was wonderful. Servers and everyone we encountered were very friendly and helpful. In general San Francisco is a VERY NOISY place and I was woke up several times by trolley bells ringing but I didn't feel that was something the hotel could control. The lobby is currently being renovated but that didn't impact anything we did. Actually didn't hear any noise coming from there. I would stay here again and would definately recommend it to others.

Stayed here in March 2012 to attend a conference at the Moscone Center (convention center). The location is great. One block off of Union Square, and a 10 minute walk from the Moscone center. The rooms are spacious and modern, with beautiful views. Bedding was very comfortable. Good bathrooms. Tub with shower had decent water pressure. I had a room on the 20th floor. Room was right off of the corridor from the elevators, and I never heard a peep from the hallway. Occasionally heard the people in the adjacent room, but nothing out of the ordinary. Fitness center on 35th floor was spacious, with ellipticals, treadmills, stationary bikes, freeweights, plenty of machines, and a separate space for floorwork.Technology in room was acceptable, but if you're a technophile, you might be a little disappointed. 42" LCD TV and great channel selection, but no hi-def selections. HDMI and audio ports for easy connection of laptops or ipods to the tv. Alarm clock with ipod and 3.5 mm connectors. I paid for the premium internet service for the week. Had both wifi and ethernet connections in room, and a passcode to connect a mobile device. Speeds were good for browsing and email, but a bit slow for VPN connections. The reason I will be coming back to this hotel is because of the personal service. Reception staff was friendly and efficient. I checked in early (~1:30 pm, before the check-in time) on a Saturday afternoon, along with about 10 other people, and the staff moved us through. The bell staff has a great presence, always available to answer questions. The crown jewel of this place is the doorman, Michael. It rained the entire week that I was there, so he was the busiest man in San Francisco. Everyone who would normally be walking to the Moscone center was trying to catch a taxi, and he and his staff took care of each and every one of us, while also taking exquisite care of arriving guests, and people checking out.Overall, this is a good San Francisco hotel in a great location with an excellent staff. I'll be back in May for Bay to Breakers, and I'll be staying here again.

Stayed in one of the removed rooms on a pretty high floor. Still had a strange "refurbed rather than new" feel to it, maybe that's because it's such an eyesore from the outside which is a trait it shares with most Downtown Hotels in San Francisco, unfortunately. I personally didn't like the design of the room at all but that's a matter of taste. They went for a strange 70ies vintage style decor with lots of orange and stuff like it which reminds me of my parents' taste when I was a very young kid. Not my thing really and makes you wonder how people will feel about this in 5 or 10 years time...Worst grief for me was the staff, the check in area hasn't been renovated yet so you are greeted in one of those dimly lit, dark wooded lobbies from the 60ies. Right went I arrived, there were about 5 huge Latin families with their badly behaved screaming kids all over which was a nightmare but unfortunately, my check in lady also was not very friendly, disengaged and rather quick to get you out and done with.Room itself, as said, was quite nice depending on whether you like 70ies vintage or not. They had those strange snake-like reading lamps sticking out of the wall besides the bed which you used to have in old business class airplane seats-I hate those things, feels like some creepy alien coming out of your bed head but maybe that's meant to be part f the vintage style, who knows. Very vintage but absolutely not acceptable were the shower curtains. Shower curtains in a freshly renovated hotel- need I say more? Cummon, Hyatt, you can do better- they are yuck!Speaking about vintage... Obviously their wifi has also not made it to 2012 yet. The website claims high-speed Wifi and when you log in to accept the 10 Dollar charge a day (!!!), they tell you some blurb about extra bandwidth and so on. But the reality is: It is s-l-o-w. So slow that it drops out all the time and you need ten minutes alone to log onto your emails. I was close to throwing my IPad against the wall in anger, so bad and frustrating it was!Now, after all that, luckily my lady at check out made up for a lot of the negatives: Very unlike the check in lady, she wad friendly, helpful and pleasant. Took the Wifi charges off my bill instantly and was very apologetic. Apparently, people complain about this all the time and the hotel is investigating their options. We had a long chat about it and she told me that the Wifi antennas are located in the elevator shafts only (which explains why you get the best reception on the elevators) which she already knew was not ideal. Without her, the experience would have been really bad (for example, during my entire two-day stay, not a sinlge time one of the people at the door or any other staff would great me or, more even, open the door or something like they do at many other properties of this class)- like this, I would say it was mediocre.

Nicely renovated rooms and accommodating staff but the hotel lacks a lobby to sit down in (perhaps that will change after the public area renovations are complete) and no business center to print a document from. The internet connections are absolutely horrible and should be included in the room rate. For a fee - it should be fast, reliable service. It's almost impossible to do business from your room. Even the wired service is horrible. The Hotel restaurant is really just average even with its lovely views of San Francisco Bay. The hotel has a great location. You can walk to almost everything.

My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Grand Hyatt for our 5th anniversary. Now I am not a big fan of San Francisco, but I must say that our experience with the hotel and the location was superb! The rooms, service, and location were wonderful. I enjoyed talking to the staff and they suggested several places for dinner to celebrate the special occasion. The only complaint I have is the wireless internet (wi-fi) which you have to pay for. You would think it would be included with the rate of the room, although we did get a great deal on the price. All in all, we had a terrific time!

Staying in Grand Hyatt for business 2nd year in a row. Renovated rooms are just great, as well as the service and location of the hotel. The only complain is regarding hotel wi-fi. It's an absolute disaster. Even though you normally have to pay for it (except the conference packages where it's already included), it just doesn't worth any money at all - I would even say that Hyatt has to pay those guests who preferred their Internet as the stress is guaranteed. Me and my colleagues had to go to the Starbucks across the street or to some Hyatt public area where we could still catch Starbucks' wi-fi. How crazy is that considering the fact you paid for the opportunity to work/surf from your room?.. Guys, do something with it - it's a total shame.

My husband and I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt in SF twice and like the recently renovated accommodations. It is right in the shopping area and there are so many restaurants to choose from. We are walkers and sometimes we take the hilly route over to Fisherman's Wharf, but we can avoid the steep climb and take a flat route along the Embarcadero. We enjoy sipping our martinis with the spectacular view in the restaurant.

Had a fantastic stay at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco. The location is excellent, the room rates are fairly reasonable and the room with a view was just absolutely breathtaking. Staff was helpful. Felt very at home.

There are a few things you should know about my visit. 1. I'm extremely particular and travel extensively. 2. I don't visit San Francisco very often, but since I love this city and wanted this to be a great trip, I researched where I would stay extensively and even changed my mind a few times about where I would stay. I'm so happy to say that the Grand Hyatt was an excellent choice. Upon arrival, Alex at the front desk made sure that I knew that the room I booked (Bay View--totally worth it) was a particularly great view, but that it was next to the ice machine in case I thought this would be a problem. I took the room and the proximity of the ice machine didn't cause any problems, but I so appreciated that I was alerted to this so that I had the option of another room. It turns out the that proximity to the ice machine was actually a good thing--it meant that I only shared a wall with one other room and I was at the end of the hallway--so it was quiet. Others have commented on thin walls and I can see where this would be a problem--but my location minimized this issue. Alex at the front desk also told me that the majority of the rooms connect, but this room did not connect to another room which also minimized noise. I was in room 2505--so the 05 rooms are good--especially the high floors. This was a bay view room--I paid a bit more--and it was completely worth it--the view was outstanding--Alcatraz and the Bay! Others have also commented about street noise--and I did notice this but it wasn't a big deal--it's a city after all and this is to be expected. The room itself is a little small, but the layout is good and they did a great job on the renovation--so made up for size. It's an efficient use of space, had a mini-fridge and a great closet.The location is awesome--one and half blocks from Union Square Park and all the great Union Square shopping. It's a terrific area. Do yourself a favor and have a drink in the restaurant on the 36th floor-breathtaking views--walk all the way around the space and see panoramic views of the city--great!I'm so glad that I chose the Grand Hyatt--and I am really particular. The lobby is under renovation which didn't cause any problems, but it should be even nicer when this is complete. Great stay!

Attended course held at Grand Hyatt. Rooms were handsome and well-planned (with lots of guest friendly details) . Beds and pillows were very comfortable. Restaurant had wonderful view. Food was good. Location was great for shopping and site-seeing. Staff was very professional and courteous. Concierge was very helpful. Thoroughly enjoyed stay. Starbucks across the street is added bonus. Some ongoing construction in lobby.

I spent 3 days at the Grand Hyatt during a recent business trip to San Francisco. The rooms at the hotel were very modern and luxurious - and the bathrooms were appointed with high-end fixtures, tiles and lighting. The view from my room was spectacular with the ability to see the bay, Transamerica pyramid building and the downtown financial district. It really gave you a sense of being in 'the city'. The lobby in the hotel is pretty small and not somewhere that you can hang out, have a coffee and chat with business partners. While the 36th floor does have a bar area, it's a little more formal than just a place where you can sit in a comfy sofa and connect with colleagues. However, the views from the 36th floor are spectacular - and the service was very good.The gym at the hotel has quite a bit of good equipment (4-5 treadmills, 4-5 eliptical machines and 4 recumbant bikes - plus a variety of exercise machines for arms/legs/etc.). If you want to use the cardio equipment, you need to get to the gym around 5:30AM or you'll wait in line or simply need to use the other equipment. It's a big hotel - and there are lots of people who want to work out. Staff at the hotel was very friendly - and the hotel is in a PERFECT spot to walk to many of the parts of SFO that you'd want to visit for shopping, sights and meals. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again on future trips.

So we stayed here for one week. I don't have much time to write everything in much detail, so I would rather list in bullet points:- The rooms are newly renovated and very nice and contemporary- The lobby is small and the public space and restaurant on 36th floor are still old and dated- We used our Diamond upgrade for a suite, upon check in and arrival to our room, got an "accessible roll in shower" room - not what we wanted. The bellman kindly called the front desk, and the agent had the nerve to tell us that ALL suites were like the one we were in - really?- So the bellman, knowing I was upset, called Chris the manager, who was more than kind and accomodating- We got a regular suite which was nice until we went to take showers in BOTH bathrooms. The tubs were stopped up and within minutes of shower - we had 3 inches of water accumlated- It took 3 trips from maintenance to fix the problem- The next day - the ondemand movie system didn't work- The internet was intermittent and slow- We went to run at 7am up in the gym, surprised to find only 3 treadmills!!! All used - how can a hotel this big only have 3 treadmills!So, the location is great - the rooms look really great and bed was amazingly comfortable - but the systems in general were just not operable enough to provide a "worry-free" stay.
Held our Western leadership meetings at this property. Great experience. Workout facilities were nice. Make sure you get there early...no later than 5:30 am to get equipment.

Stayed at the Grand for three nights on a business trip. Excellent location, just off Union Square, close to China Town, easy 10 min walk to Moscone Center. Lots of great places to eat and shop. Std rooms offer great views, modern, luxurious, and clean. Minor issue - A blocked bath tub was quickly cleaned up and corrected by engineering. Make sure to visit the Grandviews bar and lounge on the 36th floor for spectacular views day and night. Food and drinks are a little overpriced but worth the opportunity to linger awhile. Check in and check out was quick and efficient. Use the online quick check out if you are the DIY type. Hotel offers a town car for rides to SFO airport for $50. The same ride in a taxi is around $45, so its a good deal if you want a little luxury. Paid $200 per night + $30 in taxes. Internet access was included because of a conference I was attending. Overall - good value for money and would definitely stay her again.

We stayed at this hotel for four nights and it is conveniently located right at one corner of Union Square, a great place to stay when in San Francisco! Nice stores and restaurants can be found all around. Market St is just a short walk, as well as the stop to get the cable car to FishermanÂ´s Wharf. If you are traveling by car, thereÂ´s a parking lot nearby (donÂ´t worry - hotel staff do all the job for you...). Although a bit "business-y", the rooms are modern and relatively spacious. Breakfast (very good, by the way...) is served on top floor, with an amazing view of the Golden Gate!

While I have lived in the Bay Area in the past, this was my first stay in the city. It is conveniently located to shopping and transportation and we found that it was also quiet. The views from the restaurant on the 36th floor were amazing and we thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast buffet while enjoying the scenery. The staff was very friendly and helpful but never pushy. The room was beautifully decorated and our room on the 16th floor had a wonderful view overlooking Union Square and beyond. The beds were comfortable and had handy reading lights. We all enjoyed the push button controlled window shade. Valet parking also was efficient and easy and getting to the main thoroughfares from this location was a breeze.I would happily stay here again.

I have spent time in many hotels in downtown San Francisco. For the last two trips I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt and it has become my favorite hotel in the area. The rooms are great--I like the design and they have several design touches that make the rooms very nice to stay in--things like reading lights, TVs with adjustable viewing angles and extensions, iphone charging through the clock radios, and interesting designs in the bathrooms.I do wish that the TV stations were in HD--they TVs are HD but the broadcasts are not updated yet...Looking forward to many more stays in the future at the Grand Hyatt.

I never write reviews but have always depended on them so I figured I would write one to help others. I read a lot of reviews and agree with them all. The staff was very friendly and the hotel itself was nice. They had staff to open the doors for you and check in was very simple while everyone was very willing to help. The rooms are very well kept and had a modern contemporary decor. The hotel on the 36th floor was nice and we enjoyed our stay...I would defiantly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco

I have stayed at many hotels near Union Square over the years but our recent stay at the Grand Hyatt was a real surprise! The rooms have been recently redone in a modern style that is very appealing. The location is superb for business or pleasure! The bar on the 35th floor has incredible views of Alcatraz and the Bay. Will definitely return.

We loved it here! The room is modern, with a panoramic view of the city and the San Francisco Bay from a floor-to-ceiling window. The hotel is ideally located on Union Square, so getting anywhere is a breeze. Using public transport is more convenient here. If you drove here, you can park at the garage next door. You'll get a discount as a Hyatt guest. Alternatively, you can always valet ;)We enjoyed dinner and a night view of the city at the Grandviews Restaurant. The restaurant boasts a fantastic view overlooking San Francisco. Even if you are not staying at the hotel, do come and have a meal here. The food is pretty good and you won't be disappointed with the view.

The beauty of staying at the Grand Hyatt is it's proximity to Union Square. There is something for everyone in the area. Even after having lived in San Francisco for a number of years, the appeal of downtown never grows old. Theatres, spa treatments, music, art museums, and of course, shopping are all within walking distance. The Grand Hyatt is in the process of renovation. The lobby is all boarded up and it is quite crowded as there is little space to hang around while checking in. I was told all that would go away by Summer. We were upgraded to a city-view Pure room which has a hypo-allergenic environment. There is a HEPA filtering machine in the room -- yes, you can hear it but it didn't interfere with my sleep. The room also has individual reading lamps with adjustable goosenecks. The furniture is modern and sleek --with an electronic window shade that you can operate from your bedside. Modern and clean and very comfortable bed. We went on a AAA package which included breakfast. The wait staff was harried and the food was okay...you can dine on better fare elsewhere. But really, what you're there for is the gorgeous view. And on a day like we had, it re-emphasized why San Francisco is one of the most beautiful cities in the world. It can get expensive so always be on the look-out for specials or packages. If you want to try something touristy but different, go to Mason and O'Farrell and try the GoCar tours. Guided by a GPS you ride in a 2-person car, powered by an engine with controls akin to a motorcycle. if you follow the tour route, especially the one that takes you beneath the Golden Gate bridge, you're treated to wonderful sites with an accompanying narrative. You can't go over 30 miles per hour and you have to crank up the volume to hear the tour over the sound of the motor -- but it is fun nonetheless. Be sure to wear warm clothes and gloves as it sometimes gets windy. The perspective is great because you're in an open-air vehicle.

The Grand Hyatt is in an outstanding location. Right at Union Square and by all the tourist hot spots. The property itself is all renovated, which means the rooms are new, nice and up-to-date. Overall the employees were top notch and delightful at every encounter. Would definitely stay here again!

Perfect place to view all San Francisco ,near Union Square , every stores and shops you wanna go , 1 block from chinatown , 1 block to catch cable car . Clean and large room , newly recent refurbished and staff very helpful all times

My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 4 days in July. We were given a room upgrade which had a great view of the city. The rooms were spacious and clean. The staff were very helpful at all times. Good location.

We chose the Grand Hyatt due to its central location and the fact that it had been very recently refurbished. It was a great choice. Its proximity to Union Square, the cable car, good restaurants and shops was fantastic. Our room felt brand new, spotlessly clean and fresh, and was stylish and well appointed. We had a very comfortable king size bed.I particularly liked their breakfasts served in the Grandviews on top floor. The view was amazing and they had some 'stayfit' menu items that were a good healthy choice. Also a yoghurt parfait - yum.Concierge was very helpful with maps and advice and the doormen were very adept at whistling taxis for us.Overall it was an excellent stay - the only thing I was a little disappointed with was that we had booked a Bay View King room and so I was expecting a view of the Bay. The view however was of buildings with a small patch of water visible if you stood right at the corner of the window and looked very hard to find the bay between the buildings. We did not complain though, as we visited the bridge and took a cruise to Sausalito and had a great bay experience.

If you want to be the heart of the action, this is where you stay. My family and I were there for 5 nights. Every day we had breakfast in one of the very many lovely places near by. The concierge service was brilliant. They were on top of things and made relevant and interesting suggestions. All the shops are at your door step. Many had said the hotel would be noisy but we never found this a problem. Highly recommend.

This property was the book end to a week-long business trip to California, with less than 12 hours on the grounds. Here are the highlights:- Valet parking is $49. Don't say no one told you. According to other reviewers, there are other, cheaper alternatives in the Union Square area.- There is no sundries shop at this property. Go out the main entrance, left turn, left turn, then a half a block straight ahead to the CVS. Say hi to the Drake hotel as you pass by.- Apparently the Hyatt reservations system has a problem when a customer reserves two rooms, then changes the name of the second room to a second party with a second credit card. The 2nd room retains the mailng address of the first customer. It gets even more complexicated when the 2nd customer has a Hyatt Gold Passport number. When the Hyatt Passport number is assigned, then, the orignial reservation reverts to the address of the Gold Passport holder. (Kind of like a Lucy episode, isn't it?)- The room was an outstanding contemporary design, very Euro. Of all of the hotels I've stayed at that have used energy saving lighting, this one was the brightest by far, probably because they use a combination of high-output and LED lights. The Baby Boomers and Generation X thank you.- I struggled with operation of the electric shades, mostly because there were no instructions; I almost ripped them off the top of the mount thinking they were roller shades. Country comes to town, I guess- The bathroom was well-lit, appointed with nice towels and tolietries. The sink was PERFECT for bathing a baby; the other guy I was traveling with found it so funny he e-mailed a pic back to his wife! The unecessairly large baby bath made for a cluttered sink area--no room to put my own shaving kit down over the tolietries and glasses.- The shower was good until the adjustable head came apart in my hand. Engineering was quickly dispatched, but the man making the repair struggled with the spring loaded thing-a-ma-bob that held tension on the main pole. I had to go to the hotel bar to go to the bathroom. Good call. . .- The bar was superb. Generous pour. SUPER view of SF and the Bay. Got to see the fog roll in over a bourbon.- Hotel is in the middle of the Union Square scene--you can't beat it's location or the pick of restaurants within a block--get out of the hotel and find yourself a great place to eat--it isn't hard.- The bed was excellent--not a lick of noise, and the blackout shade I almost trashed worked great.-If you plan a trip to the San Francisco area and want to be in the middle of the action, this property should be on your short list--especially if you're traveling with a significant other and no little ones--looks like it would make a nice getaway hotel. Like another hotel I rated recently, do not pay rack rate--aggressively search for a lower rate and beware the packages with breakfasts included

My family recently stayed here for 3 nights. It was a great location, which is why we chose it. We were happy enough with the renovated room and amenities that the hotel had to offer. The staff were also very helpful.This isn't top notch luxury, it's not a huge room, and the lobby is still undergoing renos, but overall it was a good stay. As my title says, the location is great, close to Chinatown and Union Square. For us, this was key to our weekend.

I stayed at this hotel with family back in early December. We rented two rooms which were connecting. This was really nice as we were able to freely move between the two rooms. There was an initial hiccup with the automatic blind as it wouldn't lower properly. The guy that came to fix it was not very friendly but did manage to fix it. Then we had to call again to have them fix the drain in the bathroom sink as it was draining quite slow. They came and fixed the sink while we were gone for dinner. But when we returned the sink was not draining so I called again and the same guy came and he seemed rather put out that he had to come up again. Being that it was a modern fancy sink I did not realize that you had to push the stopper to open it (what a disgusting design and why didn't the guy leave it open when he came the first time?)Anyway, after all the maintenance was taken care of we really enjoyed our stay. The room is very clean. The bathroom is really nice too. The hotel is just about a block from Union Square which was really nice to not have to take your car out of the garage.I would recommend this hotel to others and infact I will be staying here again next month - hopefully without the maintenance issues.

About a month ago I decided to spend a week in San Francisco with my wife at the beginning of April 2012. I selected the Grand Hyatt as our Hotel after some extensive research. I phoned the Hotel and was offered a suitable booking with a package which offered â€œtwo-breakfasts-for-the-price-of-oneâ€ù. Total cost â€_ a not unreasonable $1,700. When the email confirmation arrived there was only one breakfast shown. I then exchanged about five emails with the Hotel to try to have them honour their original offer. They responded each time in a most curmudgeonly way - offering alternatives that were all less attractive than the original offer. After a month of emails I decided they were simply not going to give this particular potential customer a taste of their â€œexpect nothing less than spectacularâ€ù slogan.I finally cancelled the booking and booked an alternative hotel in San Francisco.The purpose of this review is to give people a flavour of the Hyatt Hotel policy towards guests. I donâ€™t know if the original offer was a mistake or not. No one in Hyatt referred to it in any of the exchanges. However, once made, the Hilton Staff should have set about making a potential customer happy. For the marginal cost of a breakfast they lost at least $1700 worth of business and released a dissatisfied customer into the travel world, without even having stayed at their Hotel.What a great dayâ€™s work!

This hotel is located right in the financial district, within a block of Chinatown, luxury shops, two blocks to the cable car stop and wonderful restaurants. Taxi ride is a short distance to Harris's Steakhouse restaurant, one of the best.

General SUMMARY: Center of it all location, renovated rooms, efficient + friendly service and wonderful views...totally satisfied.CHECK-IN: Smooth, uncomplicated and recognized as rewards program members. Only shortfall, would have beneficial for agent to ask about whether I was parking, as I called ahead and apparently given incorrect parking information.F&B: Ah...Only had a chance to enjoy breakfast buffet, but what a setting. Gorgeous views of the bay, fair value for upscale hotels and overall a really nice assortment of offerings. Not sure if there were other dining options at the hotel besides main restaurant, but plenty to choose from outside the front doors.AMENITIES: Gym was modern and set atop one of the higher floors, so once again fantastic views. I was pretty much alone, but could see it getting pretty packed at peak period. Great equipment though. LOCATION: Excellent, heart of the city on the corner of Union Square...convenient access to the Trolley, BART, public bus, and city parking. Upscale and most popular stores/shops and Chinatown are are stone's throw. Couldn't be better.ACCOMMODATIONS: Recently Renovated and gorgeous. Warm brown/orange tones, great linens and mattress. Flawless technology and electrically controlled shades. Bath was clean and super modern; nice toiletries...and the first vessel sink I actually liked...large enough to bathe a baby in. One caveat, water pressure in the shower was a little soft, so room for improvement there. Nice clean/fresh scent.SHORTFALLS: Water Pressure in the shower. Small lobby that is under renovation and can get annoyingly congested at peak check-in/check/out times. Rates encroach into luxury territory.RECOMMENDATION: One of the best upscale hotels in down San Francisco. Weekend rates were about $400 that weekend, so not cheap and at the price, you were really paying a premium, but not there was a NFL playoff game in town that weekend. Would love to stay here again, but ask for either Union Square or Bay View (Premium Rate). Also if parking, make sure to pull up to valet first and if you want to self park, they will provide you directions and a ticket. Self park is literally across the street.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt last weekend and there is only way to describe our experience 'Just Excellent'. They have a great restaurant for breakfast and their location was very convenient for our needs. Our room was great and I like the amenities and thick towels. We would recommend this Hotel to anyone who would like to stay in a quality establishment.

Stayed here for 5 nights and chose this one for 2 reasons - its location and our previous great stays at Hyatt properties throughout the world. I have to say we were left disappointed in some respects.The front desk staff seemed more attentive to their business customers than us. Perhaps they are more at ease with people wearing suits just like them - I don't know. I do know that when you are waiting for service and someone turns their back on you to talk on the phone, it isn't good manners. Again, waiting for service without being acknowledged - it's just poor training. If there was only one person trying to service the front desk you might forgive them - but more often there were 4 - 6 staff.There was also the issue of Hyatt's method of rating your stay that needs some detailing. Unless you email Hyatt directly with your observations to the contrary, they rate your stay as "exceptional." I find this presumption rather rude. I did pass on other concerns via email and, to be fair these matters were addressed. However, one thing remains - it is a Hyatt property and I have always preferred them - I expected a great deal better and hopefully their training methods improve.

I had a great stay. Was there for a meeting.My room was a bit small but that is to be expected in a standard room in the city.Location was great. Within walking distance to local restaurants and shopping.

The location is terrific. Within walking distance of lots of shopping and great dinning. The hotel is also only a couple of blocks from BART which makes getting there from the airport easy and cheap. The rooms are great and clean. The hotel is large with several towers so each tower feels like you are in a smaller property. The Starbucks in the lobby is very well used and convenient. Their scones were always very fresh. There are street people close by once you leave, but typical urban hotel issues. I never felt in any danger from the street people and tell them to leave you alone and they will.

Location: Great location right next to Union Square. Room: I got a newly renovated suite. It was a very impressive looking room with dark hardwood floors. The room had automatic blinds and two large flat screen TVs. There was also two full bathrooms. My only grip about the bathrooms was the water pressure or the lack there of.Room View: I was on the 18th room. The view was 'ok', but nothing amazing. Club Lounge/View: We spent good amount of time in the lounge of the hotel. The view from here is VERY nice. You could see more of the Bay including Alcatraz. Diamond member get access to the lounge for free, but you can get access via certain rate plans. Well worth it if you don't have the status. The breakfast and evening h'orderves are very good. You can also get wine, beer, or anything from the bar for a very reasonable price.Parking: Is quite expensive. $32 for self parking You can park at Union Square for $27.On a side note: I could hear traffic from my room. So people on lower floors beware.

Reaction here is a crap hole. Needs totally gutted. Grubby carpets grubby lifts. Room a bit better but small. Accessible room had no spy hole at wheelchair height. Shower would work when I used it. Lots of better hotels nearby. Wifi that you have to pay for gave me dial up speeds. No water in room and empty fridge.
