Location: Great location next to Union Square. Room View: I don't recommend paying the premium to have a view of Union Square from this hotel or the other surrounding hotels. We got a "high" room, but we aimed "West" - I think you want to aim North or East. Anyway, it was a nice room - clean, etc. everything you'd expect from Hyatt.Hotel View: We spent significant time up in the lounge of the hotel - it is BREATHTAKING. Get a glass of wine and sit overlooking an extra-wide array of windows beautifully framing what feels like the entire SF Bay, including Alcatraz front and center.Parking: Don't park with the hotel if you want to save money. When you pull up they ask you if you want something like "assisted parking". That means nothing more than they verbally tell you in which nearby garage to park, and then you drop your car off at that garage. The one upside is that you can get unlimited in and out. If you are mostly on foot or public transit, then there is no upside.Everything Else: Good quality Hyatt stuff. Its a big hotel, so you don't get the boutique quaintness, etc.

The hotel is a very short half block from Union Square. So glad we chose this hotel! China Town's main entrance is only several blocks from the hotel and within easy walking distance. The rooms are newly renovated and very nice. Size is a bit small but we didn't spend much time in the rooms. Beds and bedding are top quality. It was like sleeping on a cloud. The staff was VERY accommodating and could not have been nicer in every way. The bar and restaurant on the top floor have the most beautiful views of the bay and Alcatraz! It's breathtaking to watch the fog roll in and over the bay and rock. What a view !!Food? Honestly, it was typical hotel food. Not terrible but not great. Mixed drinks were expensive but to be expected. Highly recommend!

This hotel located in Union Square is very conveniently and centrally located in San Francisco. While we were there there were many Improvements being made, especially in the lobby area. I found the staff to be helpful when in need of a taxi or advice for a nice restaurant. The room we stayed in was on the 11th floor overlooking Union Square and the bay in the distance. While we did not eat at the hotel I suggest you check out the views from the restaurant on the 36th floor. The rooms are newly updated and I found the bed and linens to be quite comfortable. I loved the automatic shade for the window. There is a great breakfast restaraunt named Honey Honey that the concierege turned us on to, it's about 4-5 blocks away. I was a little disappointed that there was not a pool or hot tub as we walked a lot and could've used a refreshing dip. We would definitely stay at this hotel again when visiting San Francisco. I should also mention I booked though Priceline for $135 a night!!! Rooms like ours were going for $301. This made the stay even that more enjoyable.

Just loved this hotel even though they were refurbishing the lobby level. All the staff we had contact with were excellent, showing courtesy and respect. They were also happy to help. The room was on the 28th floor and modernly furnished and the full length windows on such a high level allowed for a spectacular view day and night. The location was excellent just adjacent to Union Square, lots of good shopping around.

The hotel is in a great location in San Francisco. You are able to get on the cable cars, buses and BART in a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Rooms are spacious and they provided robes on request. The gym is pretty good size and head phones and towels are provided. The concierge's were very busy and not always as patient as one would like. Shopping is great and is readily available from the hotel. Doormen were always helpful in securing a cab for guests.

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco has all the trappings of a busy tourist hotel as demonstrated by the large masses of tourists coming and going from the lobby throughout the day. Nonetheless, it was a good stay. It appears that the lobby level is under renovation, but that didn't affect our stay. We stayed in a suite which appears to have been recently renovated so it was large, clean and nicely decorated. It honestly felt like we were staying in a fun little apartment as opposed to a corporate hotel. One downside to our room was the noise--(a) as high up as we were, you could still hear the frequent doorman whistles hailing cabs; and (b) our room was right next to a housekeeping closet so everytime someone went in that closet to get supplies or the vacuum, you could hear that noise too.The Grand Club was large and very busy and the staff there was attentive and welcoming. The fitness center is large by hotel standards with enough new equipment (cardio, machine weights and dumbbells) to keep any gym rat happy. The property is on Union Square, so it's close to many attractions and shopping. The staff were good about acknowledging our Diamond Gold Passport status at check-in and the housekeeping staff we encountered was always super pleasant and on top of everything. Basically this isn't the type of property where you come to get pampered--when we called for a bucket of ice, we were pleasantly told we could get it ourselves at the ice machine down the hall. Also, it seems that some of the staff could use some better training to know their hotel's amenities and to respect guest wishes. For example, we asked a front desk person for the nearest ATM and she gave me an odd look and pointed to the ATM right behind me in the lobby. I had to point out to her the large "Out of Order" sign on the ATM. Another example, when we have the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door, the hotel shouldn't then call and disturb us to ask when can they make up the room. These are little issues that I wouldn't expect at a Hyatt. Overall, it was a good stay without any major incidents or notable events. We'll be back.

I booked this hotel as part of a surprise trip for my wife's birthday. The reviews for the hotel tempted me and I was not disappointed! I really couldn't fault this hotel and would not hesitate to recommend it. It has a great location, only a 2 minute walk from Union Square and close to lot's of restaurants and bars. The concierge service at the hotel is excellent and they can't do enough to help you. The rooms are very comfortable and I can't wait to go back here one day. Get a 3 or 5 day pass for the cablecars from Walgreen's nearby, that's the most cost effective way of using this most entertaining form of transport. Lori's Diner nearby is really good for breakfast. If you're going to SF, book this hotel. You'll love it.
We were in Grand Hyatt San Francisco last December for few nights, but the hotel is nothing beyond the basics, unlike what we expect this type of hotel.

We stayed here for a second time and were rather disappointed. We booked a Club Level room primarily to have a quiet place to go after spending the day out in busy SF and for having breakfast. Every time we were in there is was filled with young children and / or teenagers doing what kids do. Parents were using the lounge at night to feed their families dinner. The food offerings were not labeled so you had to continually ask the attendant and seating was limited. The staff in the lounge seemed overwhelmed. Breakfast was so limited the only cereal offered was granola and the only hot entree every day we were there was scrambled eggs with a type of mystery meat in it. This was not our experience during our previous stay. It was not worth the additional expense at all. Housekeeping did a great job in our room each day. Although we love the location of the hotel given the small rooms, high cost and disappointing club lounge I doubt we will return.

Were it not for the room noise, I would have given this hotel 5 stars. The rooms are recently refurbished, and are very nice, with excellent bathrooms, great styling and superb views from the upper floors. The location is hard to beat - lots of good restaurants nearby, about a 1 minute walk to the cable cars, handy to transport in general and just a few minutes walk from the huge Westfield mall.Unfortunately the sound insulation between rooms is poor. On the first night we were disturbed several times by a barking dog in an adjacent room, not what you expect in a hotel of this quality. On the last night the guests in an adjacent room were quite loud, and all the noise carried right into our room. This is a great pity as in all other respects, we loved this hotel.

I stayed here for a few nights on business and could not have been happier. The location is excellent, right in Union Square, close to Cable Cars, BART, Market St. StreetCar, and good food/shopping. Room size was average, it was very clean, my king bed was very comfortable, and the service at the hotel was top notch. I ordered Chinese take out the day I arrived which was delivered by a local eatery nearby, but they forgot silverware in my bag. I called down to room service with my odd request for a fork and a spoon, and in within what seemed like 2 mins, they sent me up a plate, glass, full set of silverware, and linens to my room. The front desk staff was nice, and I like that I was able to check out using the kiosk to expedite my departure. Computer was available in the lobby to print boarding passes. It seemed really slow, but so be it - I got the convenience I needed. I ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant, GrandViews, which lived up to its name, offering amazing morning views of San Fran, Golden Gate Bridge, and Coit Tower. The food was good, but pricey, and no complaints about the service. When I booked this hotel it was mainly because of location for business, but I'm glad I did, because the location is just one of many reasons why this place was great. I would stay again on my next trip to SFO, and recommend you try it out.

My wife and I spent one night in a king size - bay view -room up on the 27th floor. We could see the city and the bay from our room which was lovely. The room itslef was very nice. Comfortable and with a pillow menu. We signed up for the amour package and got a champagne and chocolate covered strwberries - breakfast - and late checkout. I thought it was a really nice deal..If driving. park in the stockton garage. Other wise its almost 40 USD a night.Only issue (minor) - noisy neghbors - thinnish walls.

I stayed here for two nights and was excellent. Top of the list is the location then followed very closely by the comfortable rooms, well fitted bathrooms, mod cons and mostly great staff. The only negative is the rooms are a bit on the small side and at check-in I had a run in with a receptionist who was not satisfied with identification. I'll put that down to a clash of personalities as the rest of the recpetion and staff were very nice and see no reason to hold the hotel for blame for this as everything else was great.

For my family, this hotel represented excellent value. Considering we stayed over the new year period, the pricing was even more astounding.As we are a family of five, two rooms are required. The first room was charged at $220/night. The second room, however, was charged at half-price - $110/night. $330 for two rooms was awesome for us. For the evening of NYE, the rate went up by $50 for the first room, and $25 for the second.Throw in the fact that breakfast was included in the rate, and we had very well-priced accommodation for the NY period. We stayed a total of five nights.Final tip: Use the parking structure on the diagonally-opposite corner of Suttor and Stockton, for reasonably-priced parking in SF.

Upon arrival very pleasant and efficient front desk promptly check in. Though the room size was smaller but had an excellent view of city and the bay. The hotel location makes it very desirable place to stay. The staff was very helpful. Overall this is an excellent hotel.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco off Union Square just after Christmas. We stayed here about 4 years ago and at least the room we stayed in had been tansformed since the last visit. We enjoyed the hotel before but the new room was beautiful. the full length windows give you an amazing view, Ask for a room as high as possible. If you can upgrade to a club room those are on the higher floors. I used Hyatt points.The after holiday shopping was great and there were sales at all the stores around Union Square.

We are on our way home but stayed a couple of days here at the Hyatt. No better spot in this city for a central point. No need to make dinner reservations. We had a romantic dinner served in our room set up next to the large windows overlooking the Square. Must be the best dining experience ever! Hyatt's are always nice and clean and great value if you hit the weekends with good discounts.

I stayed at the Hyatt during Columbus day weekend of this year for a few days before a business trip began. All of the rooms in the hotel were remodeled and the rooms were really nice. There is a excellent view of the city from the upper floors and the hotel is in walking distance of Union Square, the tram to fisherman's wharf as well as the subway. It is a few blocks away from Chinatown. Cabs are easy to catch from the hotel if you don't feel like utilizing public transportation. For business it is a good hotel. If you are in town for leisure and into clubs/lounges there is a club across the street as well as a club right around the corner. There are also a bunch of small bars & other nightlife places in the immediate area as well. Because of the new room designs and the relatively cheap price as compared to some of the other hotels in the area I would highly recommend this hotel.

After staying in many hotels around the world, I can conclude that Hyatt is one of the best big hotel chains out there. For my latest visit to San Francisco, California, I chose the Grand Hyatt again after an amazing experience back in August: Spacious, modern and CLEAN room; amazing staff, nice food. Unfortunately, my recent visit was very dissapointing. My room on the 28th floor was not clean at all. Yu can see the the cleaning service did not do their job well because the batroom toilet had "residues" from the guests before me and the bathroom sink was visibly dirty. I would recommend paying more attention to the cleaning and the cleaning service.

i planned an event for my company in San Francisco and we stayed at the Grand Hyatt on Union Square. The Lobby is not very open but i understand they are making some changes there. The reno at the hotel was great - the rooms were nicely appointed. We had over 50 people on our room block - this is a great hotel for groups! The sales staff is outstanding and they are very eager to show your group a nice time. They are friendly, professional and responsive and they truly function as a team both in preparation and onsite. The food and service was impeccable. The area is currently undergoing some construction so it can be a bit noisy but that doesn't take away from the hotel at all. if you happen to get rooms overlooking Union Square, you'll seem some great sites both day and night. I recommend it.

Paid for standard city view room. Stayed in room 2715 for four days (12/18-12/21/11) with wife and 7 and 4 year-old daughters. Nice view of the city, but not facing the Golden Gate Bridge. The hotel's location for shopping is excellent. One block from cable car access. Used room service daily and was impressed with the efficient service. Tried the restaurant for dinner and breakfast, but service was slow at each (very nice view though.) The room was clean except for a vent intake in the bathroom, near the ceiling, that was covered with mold and lint. The shower pressure was low to medium. There weren't many TV channels for my girls. They were pretty much limited to the Cartoon Channel, which they dont care for. Internet access is a rip-off since it charges a minimum of $9.95 per day PER DEVICE. With 2 iPads, 2 iPhones, and an iPod touch, there was no way I was going to pay that. Fortunately, 3 of the devices were on 3G.

Poor Internet, poor shower , good breakfast with excellent view. We stay with a good family rate but if you pay for standard rate, it doesn't worth it. Only worth $150/ day not more than that. Good location. TV channel not enough. I will stay somewhere if I visit San Francisco again.

Stayed 2 nights in December. Room: Looks newly updated. Modern, stylish, comfortable. Bathroom: Great big sink, spacious.Staff: Friendly and courteous.Lobby: Kind of small. Don't have Grand Hyatt wow feeling.Club lounge: Too many people and hard to find seats. Location: Right next to Union Sq. and convenient to train, bus, cale car.Overall great hotel and highly recommended.

Was at the Grand Hyatt on Union Square from 12-16-2011 to 12-18-2011. Stayed in a non-smoking king room on the 19th floor. This property has been recently remodeled and and it shows: the: the rooms are fresh and the decor is current. The lobby can only be characterized as functional. The staff were as friendly as a major hotel in big city can afford. There are plenty of elevators, so waiting to get to your room is bearable. The rooms are large and comfortable, lots of decent lighting, no coffee maker, poor analog TV. Nice views with handy retractable window shades for privacy. You can still hear all the racket from the street and you can hear your neighbors come and go. The resturant on the 36 th floor is lovely with decent food and service. Free wifi only in selected downstairs areas, otherwise big charge for access in your room. Hotel location very handy for forays into nearby city attractions and then being able to retreat into room when it all gets to be too much. Overall, very decent and, if you shop around a little bit, you can get a decent room with breakfast included for around $160.00 US dollars per night.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt SF for three nights in October. The Grand Hyatt SF is located right next to Union Square. It's a convenient location as it's right near major shopping destinations, Chinatown, and the business district. It is also a close walk to the Port of San Francisco (which is a must if you enjoy good oysters and like a market atmosphere). The hotel is also a block away from the Canal streetcar, which is worth the ride if you've never done it before. The stay itself was very pleasant. The rooms are well appointed and modern, the staff are friendly, and the hotel is cleaner than most in its category. The room is a bit smaller than average, but there was plenty of storage and closet space to make up for it. One recommendation: If you're facing east or west, you will want to put the sunscreen down either in the am or pm, depending on when you get sun. I found that during the afternoon (we were facing west) the sun really heated up the room. Overall, I would definitely return to the hotel. I usually expect quite a bit from a hotel of this class, and they delivered and then some.

Our review should have been higher, say 4.4, but as they do in the Olympics, some point-deductions on technicals. Our final rating: 4.1We've stayed many times at this Grand Hyatt, and always enjoyed our stays. The service was good, with comfortable rooms, convenient location, and some good views from our rooms. There was a major refurbishment and updating just completed in 2011 to the entire hotel, updating the rooms, hallways, elevators, etc.. For the most part, it was done well. Color schemes are pleasing and style is more modern, contemporary. The hotel is busy as ever, as we stayed during December ... a week+ before Christmas. Enough generalities, let's go to the details of our review:The Good: The best feature of this hotel is its location. Literally, it is right across the street to the uber-popular Union Square with all its shopping, a short walk to Chinatown, and all other points by taxi/bus/walk. During this time of year, Union Square had an ice-skating rink and Christmas tree put up, making the area even more festive. Getting back to the hotel, the front-desk staff was very friendly, efficient, and accommodating. The rooms have undergone a complete update, including the bathroom, closets, credenza/desk, lights, TVs, etc.. The rooms remain fairly standard size, not large, but not small. The color tones are primarily brown, orange, silver and shades therein, giving it an earth-ier tone. The style is contemporary, Crate & Barrel-ish, with simple lines and minimalist decor. They've added some books and glass vases (glued down of course) on shelves, and vase with long branches to accent, making it warmer and homey(?). New lounge chair + leg-rest/ottomon makes for comfortable seating while reading or gazing out onto SF. The bedding was very comfortable, with a first layer of soft padding. The usual accoutrements are included, such as in-room safe, basic toiletries, good-size credenza/desk to work on, as well as some refinements to others. Specifically, our room had good-sized double-door closets, with built-in drawers, separate dressing area with large mirror, table and chair (for the ladies), and fancy boat-shaped sink in the bathroom. We of course, are grateful for the flat-screen TVs, as we vividly remember the bulky, old TVs a few months back. Also,there is a small refrigerator now, with no more mini-bar. The views were terrific. We stayed in 2 different rooms, due to our request (we noted why below), with one room facing East & South = could see Transamerica building, and downtown financial area, Market St, etc.. The other view was South, which gives tremendous view of Union Square below us and SoMA. See attached pictures.The Bad: As we noted above, some point-deductions on "technicals". Although just minor issues, we must include. The first room we were in was generally clean. On closer look, some small issues we noted: the desk chair had brown stains (we're not sure of what, so did not sit on), and found a discarded cough drop wrapper on the lounge chair. It made us think of prior guest being sick, so yuck. Additionally, the fancy sink is pretty to look at, but practically, eh..... had a slow drain and was not very deep for best utilization. The depth made it easier to splash water everywhere when using to wash up. Also, we noted there is no longer glassware with the ice bucket. We were provided only (2) glasses, from the bathroom. This was true for both rooms, but very odd for us, for this level of hotel .. .should be an above-average hotel. We did request to change our room, due to a noisy A/C-heat fan, when it was on auto-high...not so loud when on auto-low. Woke us up a couple of times. Please note: if you get a connecting room, you will hear your neighbors talking, and other noises .. especially if any young kids, including crying, running, talking, etc.. We dealt with it, as not a major issue or on-going. We tested the housekeeper one day by taking the pen from the room, and noticed it was not replaced. I know... you think we're nuts, but we noticed when we changed rooms, and did same, as well as some other hotels, the pen was replaced. This reflects their attention to details. The desk chair in our 2nd room was cleaner, and used it (vs the first room with dirty chair), but noticed it was not very comfortable to sit in, especially for longer than a few minutes. This is probably due to its low back, and we did not see any obvious way to adjust its height. Style over function we guess. Again, all these "bads" are not major, in our book ... lead to slight reduction of our rating, but worth noting.Summary: Stay here, whether for business, pleasure, family. It's a very large, corporate/convention/meeting-event driven hotel, but very convenient, comfortable and with refurbishment, modern and stylish ... in a safe kind of way. No wild colors, design eye-poppers, but respectful and soothing. The service is good at front-desk, and housekeeping needs a little refresher on details (may just be one person), but not a major concern. Although we did not utilize room service, we noticed how friendly they were for our neighbors. We recommend this hotel without hesitation ... Enjoy!Happy Hotel-ing !!

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco stands on Union Square and so is in a great location. It's a very pleasant hotel. My room was clean and nicely furnished. All the staff were very helpful and nice throughout my stay and the concierge was most helpful in finding me a place to purchase emergency eyeglass replacements. My only complaint is that there are really rather few amenities. There is a smallish fitness center on the 35th floor and a rather small bar and dining room on the 36th floor. The view is great but it feels rather cramped. The food was just ok both dinner and breakfast. There's no lobby to speak of and no gift shop to buy even a bottle of water (I walked across the street to Starbucks for that). I've also stayed at the Westin Saint Francis also on Union Square and find that it really has more amenities for the same price. So overall I liked the hotel an can recommend it if you don't mind the lack of amenities.

Stayed here 3 nights after two nights at the hyatt regency SF. Really liked the hotel stayed in a suite on 30 something floor. Since we were a family group we booked two large suites with amazing amazing view!wow! Service at high level and excellent concierge. The refurbish was due, but now excellent interiors. The design of the Grand & Regency is rather cool if you'r into contemporary architecture. You will indeed find moore personal hotels but I would stay again for sure. The lounge was comfortable with good selections. Ok gym and excellent to travel here with children.

Rooms are nicely renovated but a little small. Breakfast was at top of hotel which had beautiful views of san Francisco. We love the view. Location is good, just a block away from union square where all the shopping is. Reception and bell service was good. However as we needed some help in deciding what to do, the service at concierge wasn't as helpful or friendly. The stay would have been much better if the service we encounter at concierge could be better. Hotel rates considered high for the room size. Would recommend if location is main consideration without regard for room size.

Great hotel by Union square. It is very conveniently located to all retsuarants, attractions and near the convention center. One of the best amenities here is the use of the Regency club. this lounge is open for breakfast and then is open for coffee and soft drinks all day. in the evening there are hors doeurves and drinks (small charge). A lovely hotel

Let me first state that the renovated room is very beautiful. You can find all the beautiful features stated in other reviews. These upgraded rooms and the service offered at this hotel are the reasons that I will stay at this hotel again in the future if the rate is acceptable. However, there are some issues during my stay.I booked a room with a conference. The rate was very reasonable and the internet was included for all the conference attendees who stayed at this hotel. The check-in was very quick; got a key but no paper to sign and was told that internet was included. Being a platinum Gold Passport member, I usually got free internet. Thus, I assumed that the hotel did have my GP member. I found it otherwise when I saw the bill before checkout. This also explained that I was not offered an upgrade to a higher floor room. At the night before checkout, I complained to front desk about the slow internet and too-bleached towels. I received a complimentary breakfast for the next morning without asking for. However, I found at checkout that that person did not put this offer on my room. I explained to this different person and was quickly credited for the breakfast. Even though I was assigned to a 10th floor room, the water from the shower is very slow. I did not have this problem in other days when showering before 6:00 am. One more thing is that you should get a breakfast somewhere else if it is not included in your rate. It is expensive (but good views from 36th floor) and the fruits are so so.Why do I give it a five stars? It is the unbeatable location and the service!

This is a fine Hyatt hotel â€“ unless the weather is bad â€“ then forget it! The rooms were remodeled in 2010 and 2011 and are typical Hyatt so no issues with that. All have comfortable beds, flat panel TVâ€™s, convenient electrical outlets, wireless internet and so on. I stayed at this property 8 times this year and each stay was fine EXCEPT for my most recent visit. I was on the 26th floor and the wind picked up about 2 in the morning and the room creaked like one would imagine an old wooden sailing ship. It was so loud that sleep was very difficult. I complained to the front desk and they immediately offered to move me to the 7th floor saying that all rooms on high floors had creaking noises when the winds picked up. So, off to the seventh floor I went. But, the next night same issue occurred. I even found a letter from the Front Office Manager in the room. The letter said: â€œDear Grand Hyatt Guest, â€_Due to severe weather conditions and high winds, you may experience intermittent sounds in your guest room. Please be assured, this is common in high-rise buildings shifting with the pressure of the windâ€_..â€ùWhat? Are you kidding me? Wake up, Hyatt - all high rises don't creak in the wind! Bottom line: check the weather forecast before you decide to stay here.

I recently attended a conference that was being held at the Grand Hyatt, so for convenience booked a 2 night stay at the hotel. I usually like to stay at boutique hotels for a more personal touch. I was a bit wary that the Grand Hyatt would be like a "convention center" type hotel, but had a really wonderful time.  The location is perfect. I was fortunate to get a room overlooking Union square with the Christmas tree and ice-rink in view. Macys, Saks, and Barneys are just down the street and so cute to see the SPCA dogs and cats up for adoption in the windows of Macys. It is a few blocks north of the Montgomery BART stop. The room was spacious, modern and bright. Instead of drapery, there was a button operated window screen. I felt so relaxed. The only thing that I disliked was that one could hear the wind, but I was so tired that once I fell asleep, it wasn't an issue. The restaurant on the 37th floor has panoramic views of the bay and city. Unfortunately the area reserved for happy hour is limited, so it was packed at 5pm. With so many great restaurants in San Francisco including those with Michelin stars, I ended up eating outside the restaurant. I am definitely looking forward to returning to San Francisco and a stay at the Grand Hyatt!

This newly refurbished Grand Hyatt is very comfortable, well located, with a professional staff. Accommodations are very contemporary, with clean lines and relaxing colors. Our room was a good size for a city hotel. Every hotel and cruise ship seems to love those duvets on the (very comfortable) bed. They look lovely but are so hot and you can't turn down the thermostat low enough to be comfortable. That aside, I enjoyed having a great choice of pillow comfort on the bed - from soft to very firm - take your pick. Bathroom was clean, comfortable and well-laid out. A small "dressing" area was located between the bath and the room, opposite the large closet. There was some noisy construction going on across the street, a higher floor would have been a good choice (at a higher price) another time. This 36 story hotel has a very nice restaurant on the 36th floor with spectacular views, good menu, food, and attentive staff. We had both dinner and breakfast there. Prices were in line with any nice city restaurant. Super Shuttle service from the airport was fast and priced at $17 per person. We look forward to staying at the Grand Hyatt again in the near future.

Excellent location for shopping in Union Square, located on the same street as Niketown, Disney Store, Macy's, and Neiman Marcus. However, the central location perhaps is also a weakness, as it is close to the sounds of traffic. I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights for business. The front desk upgraded my room to a higher floor with a better view, which was a nice touch and completely unexpected. My room was right next to the ice machine - I initially worried that it might be noisy, but actually I could not hear any noise in the room, which was great. In terms of outside noise, a slightly different situation. On the first night it was difficult to fall asleep as there were construction sounds going on all night. No issue on the second night. The room and bathroom are spacious and clean, and recently refurbished and so appears very new and modern. The amenities are also very nice. I did use the in-room coffee machine as I didn't have time to run to Starbucks in the morning, and I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the coffee. The hotel does not provide any complimentary bottles of water, which I found unusual for such a class of hotel such as this one. I would definitely recommend this hotel for tourists or business-people who are visiting SF and would like a central location. I may suggest to request the highest floor rooms possible to have a quiet night of sleep.PLEASE NOTE : The staff at the Grand Hyatt are all very warm, friendly, and prompt. I was very impressed at the speed which the valet retrieved my car from parking and had it ready for me. I also was impressed at how they remembered me and greeted me as I returned back at the hotel. I did not expect this from such a large hotel in a big city. The front desk was equally impressive. A definite positive!

My sister and I stayed here in July 2010 during our annual "Baseball Vacation" - each year we follow the Yankees to a different away city, see a couple of games and explore a new city along the way. The Grand Hyatt was the perfect base for explorations around San Francisco. Just off Market Street, the convenient location allowed us to walk down Market Street each morning, enjoy a coffee and then head down to Fisherman's Wharf. We loved having access to restaurants, nice stores for shopping and a Walgreen's that became our go-to store each night after sightseeing!The hotel itself is very nice. The lobby is lovely and the concierges are among the best I've encountered. The rooms are reasonably large and we had a very nice view of the city from our windows. Very comfortable beds (this is a key issue for me while traveling) and bedding. The hotel was nice enough to bring a mini-bar fridge up to our room so that we could store drinks and snacks for our five-day vacation. Overall, I was very pleased with the service and accommodations and felt that (for once) the rate was very reasonable. If/when I return to S.F., the Grand Hyatt will be my first choice.

The Grand Hyatt had nicely renovated, modern rooms. There are electric shades, which makes waking up easy- just flip the switch built into the headboard for natural light, while still having privacy from the perforated metallic vertical shades. There are plenty of outlets for recharging your electronics, including outlets built right into the headboard, which allows for reading, etc., on your ipad while plugged in. There is a dock/ recharger for ipods built into the clock radio. The minibar was thankfully empty, which meant you could use it without being charged for moving anything. There is a Walgreens nearby for loading up on drinks and snacks inexpensively. That Walgreens even stocks salads and fresh fruit. The bathroom was modern and there was a dressing table area, which was nice. The only thing was that there were eye pencil shavings from the previous guest left underneath it, on the floor, which remained there for my multi day stay, so one is left to wonder how thorough the cleaning is. There were also dried makeup smudges on the makeup mirror on the dressing table which was also not cleaned during my stay.The check-in was fast and courteous; however, I realized afterwards that the rate was different than what I had confirmed online. When I went down to ask why, I was told that I had received some of the paid-for upgrades they now offer online. Okay the extra few $ for a higher floor room; however, I was also charged a hefty upgrade fee for a Club Room, which I didn't receive. I also didn't receive access to the Club Lounge or notification from the check-in person that I had been upgraded. After about 15 minutes, the front desk attendant agreed to remove the upgrade fee for the Club Room. If I hadn't been alert, I would not only have been charged, but also never received either the Club Room or Lounge access. The concierge was very polite and responsive to a recommendation for a good sushi restaurant. When I went there, though, I thought that the sushi was just mediocre. I will trust Tripadvisor and Zagat reviews next time.The location is terrific for pedestrians and a nightmare for cars. It is next to Union Square and shopping and restaurants. It is close enough that you can make multiple trips to the big department stores and back to the hotel to drop off purchases. There is construction going on in the area which, combined with traffic, can lead to long delays in taxis. All in all, with a few minor glitches, the stay was enjoyable, with nice rooms and an unbeatable location for shopping and food.

All personnel were extremely pleasant and knowledgeable. Great service from doormen, to check-in, to cleaning staff. Newly redecorated room with flat screen TV. Rewired with easy access to outlets to charge electronic gear, plug in iPod to telephone speaker system, USB port, etc. Unfortunately, room has very little drawer space, which is OK if u are here for 1 night. We were here for a week. Do hotel room designers ever stay in a hotel room? They charge for WiFi access & busn ctr! Seems they are stuck in the 90s. Why is it that lower priced hotels provide these necessities free while more expensive hotels want to nickel & dime u [I mean $5 and $10 u]? Location 1 block N of Union Sq, Macy's, Geary St art galleries, 2 blocks N of Westfield Mall & 1 block W of Gump's is great.

Ok it may have been partly due to jetlag but the super large bed at the Grand Hyatt was luxurious! Our room had traditional decor and was spacious with ample wardrobe space, drawer and desk space and coffee machine. Our views were good and if you want a suer view without paying the price for the restaurant just go up to the top floor bar and order .... for me, a cocktail thanks! Was lovely! We did visit the restaurant on the final night of our stay and the view was....clouds mainly! The meal was lovely although priced to match! This hotel has an ideal location and Id suggest that if you are staying even just a few days go for this location over the pier/seafront - you can easily get the wooden cable car right down to the seafront from here. Even better its a quality location with a super "square" - Union Square which often has dancing/music on its little stage - nice little benches to sit and watch the world go by. Fantastic shops in the vicinity - Ugg, Tiffany, all the high end "stores" to try out makeup, clothing, etc and a super indoor shopping mall with an Abercrombie and Fitch down the road at much cheaper than New York prices! Do try out the cable cars - you really have to experience it! We went to Teattro Zinzanni and it was one of the best theatre/entertainment experiences we have ever had. Do Alcatraz, go on a wine tour - oh theres so much to do I just want to go back! Take clothing to suit any weather as the seafront really can be blowy. Being Scottish I am quite used to it but if you are not, you will feel the chill! Then up at Union Square roasting sunshine! Layers I believe are the way to go! Enjoy San Fransisco!

Room is great for price and number of stars. Lobby is cold. Breakfast is very good. Gym is superb, bar at the top is somewhat stylish with great views bud bad service. Location is amazing. Valet parking is expensive but there is cheap alternative across the street.First night the room on lower floor was very noisy (they did get the insulation wrong) so we had to move at 3am to a higher floor which had no problems with noise (rubbish men lingered below our window for more than an hour). Second day the room was not cleaned and we realised at 9pm by which time it was too late for them to clean. They did give us free breakfast (and also offered to waive the rate for one night but our rate was prepaid) .Would give it 4 stars for the price etc. but they lose a star for insulation and bad housekeeping on one day (to be fair the room was spotless for the rest of the days)

This hotel has everything you expect from a Grand Hyatt. Nice location. Great rooms. Fun bar. Decent food. Where this hotel stood out was the service. The staff members were very helpful and efficient. I used the concierge A LOT (I don't spend much time in SF, so I had several questions and needed assistance and advice). Every concierge I used was top notch. They were efficient. They were helpful. They were accommodating. They never tried to put me off or discourage me from seeking help (I find some concierges do this ... they try to discourage your use of them by being off-putting). The concierges were great. Even better than the hotel itself ... which says a lot!

Nice hotel at a great location. However service could be better. At check-in I was told the room they reserved for me was a handicap room and asked if I wanted to change to a different room. I said fine but he ended up giving me a 5th floor room! No view and the drain for the bathtub didn't even work! The electric curtains were nice though.

As a diamond member, I would of expected a slightly better service. but I guess being treated as a single guest and looking quite young - there was some form of assessment they got wrong.The food from the upper restraunt was ok, service was ok, and the rooms you guessed it.There was lots of maintenance work going on in the and around the building and I wasn't made aware of that prior to the booking. Next time, I'll try another location.

The rooms have been sleekly redone, lots of counterspace and our room was quite large with good lighting. We had a high floor and a view over the city to the bay which was very nice, better than I have had at other SF hotels. The closet was awkward and a little small with little drawer room unfortunately and the bathroom was on the smallish size.Excellent location, only a block from Union Square. The lobby however has few places to sit and is cold and somewhat confusing. Personnel were friendly for the most part but we did not use many of the services.San Francisco is an expensive hotel city and this space is no different. I would however stay again, at least in a view room

A very nice weekend stay at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco. The hotel is in a great location, next to all the major shopping in Union Square, most of the live theaters, easy walk to Chinatown, North Beach, Ferry Building and Fisherman's Wharf.The rooms have been completely remodeled since my last stay two years ago. Very nice rooms, the higher floors have great views of the city.

Still here writing the review from out crappy room with no view. We are on our honeymoon and the previous three hotels we stayed in made us feel welcome and gave us great room one even gave us a bottle of wine. Check in was average guy was not friendly at all. The last thing you want after a flight from Chicago. This is our last stop before returning to Australia. We were hoping it would e the Best hotel yet. I think if the guy had have cared when we were checking in things may have been better. Our room is small with no view. Staff are friendly but don't go out of their way like the previous hotels. Location is great. The restaurant is ok for breakfast but I would not recommend dinner there. Overall a disappointing last stop.

This is a good but pricey option for tourists not business travelers - i think i did not call to housekeeping as often anywhere I stayed as in this hotel. You need to ask for everything - water, shoe horn (!), vanity set ... I just cant name everything that was not in the room!The seemed refurbished the hotel but not everything - for example the doors remain very old, may be as a consequence you can hear how your next door guest is taking a shower...The breakfast - you don't really want it in the hotel - try to find it outside, even Starbucks will be better and be open earlier then a restaurant in the hotel.Try to avoid if you can...

The location of the Grand Hyatt is pretty much perfect - less than 100yds from Union Square, 5 minutes walk from Chinatown, perhaps 15 minutes walk or so to North Beach, and within 2 blocks of the cable car terminus.The hotel is very large, but the service is excellent. I would say that this is obviously a business hotel, but is also great for the leisure traveller if you can secure a decent rate (as we did).Rooms are quite small, especially the bathrooms, but are recently and stylishly refurbished and very comfortable indeed. Every amenity is provided and of good quality. Huge windows (with electric blinds - cool!) offer great views, so be sure to try to get a room on a high floor, preferably with bay or Union Sq view.The restaurant and bar on the top floor afford magnificent views of the bay, and have a great atmosphere.There is valet parking or assisted self service at nearly garages, but expect to pay a minimum of $34/night for the latter (and over $50 I think for valet). If you don't need a car whilst in SF, it may be better to collect from a downtown location on your departure from the city.My only suggestions for improvement would be:WiFi - come on, even basic roadside inns now offer this free and this was the only hotel in my week long trip that charged.I enjoyed my stay at the Grand Hyatt and would highly recommend.

This was a beautiful, classic hotel. The rooms have some amazing views of the city, but also feature electric shades that will completely block out all the light for when you're ready to sleep. Pretty good sized rooms for the price. Very high quality and clean!Great customer service. Will print your plane tickets home for free. In a great location -- far enough away from the Fisherman's Wharf that it doesn't feel too, too touristy, without being too far to walk to attractions. Only two complaints: - The business center that they advertise is NOT free. You must pay to use their two, extremely slow, computers. Had I known I would've brought my own laptop for when I needed to look up attractions.- They have this auto HVAC unit... I'm not sure if ours was broken but it must have been motion sensored because when we would go to sleep it would completely shut off and then every time one of us would move or get up to use the bathroom it would kick on and then shut off 5 minutes later. Extremely disruptive.

My wife and I stayed here for our 10 yr anniversay. Neither of us had ever been to SF so it was nervous to book not really knowing the city. After reading other reviews that talked about location, I booked and so glad I did. We looked at other cheaper hotels but so very happy we decided to book at the Grand Hyatt. This was our 10 yr anniversay and Glietz at the Front Desk made us feel welcome from the get go. They upgraded our room to a higher floor with a awesome city view. They also offered us a bottle of wine and choice of a food item. Nice touch and very much appreciated. There are plenty of staff in the lobby area ready to assist with any needs. The Concierge was very friendly and helpful. It rained most of the weekend and they even offered us the use of an umbrella the entire weekend. This might be the norm for a 4 or 5 star hotel but i had never experienced this before and it was very much appreciated. It kept us dry while we walked around the entire city! Right next to plenty of shopping, Chinatown or a Cable car or Street Car. I did read some reviews about street noise but i guess that would be common in a "City" type of atmosphere with tall buildings echoing sounds. I don't have any complaints about the hotel. The rooms were very nice and the beds were extremely comfortable. I didn't realize there was a small fridge or coffee maker in the room until the day we checked out but oh well. Starbucks is directly accross the street.North Beach (Italian neighborhood is with in walking distance) We ate breakfast at Lori's a block away from the hotel and it was very good. I recommend Tony's Pizza in North Beach. Very good pizza!We stayed 2 days and could not get it all in. If you stay on pleasure, it is worth the Open Air Bus tour of the city. It hits all the major sites and you can get on and off at your leisure. And the price is reasonable.Thank you to all the great staff that made our stay such a nice and memorable one! Perfect Location too!

The Grand Hyatt is on the nicer end of Hyatts. There are plenty of people working in the lobby, so employees are always available, helpful and friendly. The rooms were reasonably stylish. It's not the quietest hotel, but it is right in the middle of the city and it's not bad. The room and bathroom were not huge, but comfortable enough. It doesn't have a wow factor, so to help you expect the right thing I'd say that it's a clean city hotel, some trendy elements, and nicer than most Hyatts. I was staying for business and it was perfect. It's a short walk (maybe 4 blocks) from the Powell Street public transport station (both Bart and Muni), so getting to other parts of the city or the airport is fairly easy. Plus the hotel has bellmen (bell people?) to get cabs.

Having just spent a long weekend at the Grand Hyatt Union Square there are certainly a lot of great things about this hotel - the staff, the view and the location, but a few things let down the hotel for us.I had Hyatt points to spend, so I booked three nights for my family of 2 adults and 2 kids (8 and 10) in a Club room. I had thought (mistakenly) that the rooms with two beds were king/king - so on arrival I was very surprised to find that the rooms were actually double/double and in fact - tiny. We had an adjoining King room for other family members and the King, same size as the double, really seemed a lot roomier. To the hotel's credit my husband spoke with a member of staff who showed him a number of different rooms and allocated us a Bay view room for our 2nd and 3rd nights, with a complementary bottle of wine for the inconvenience, but the room was still the same small size. Bathrooms are also small but well fitted, big sink, modern fittings - but the shower is over the bath, even on the Club rooms. The hotel has no real lobby to speak of but the decor around the hotel is updated, modern and very clean.The Club dining room has a fabulous view of San Francisco and the Bay - and the staff in the evening were incredibly polite and helpful. Wine is self-service on an 'honor' system for $3 per glass and staff ordered a very reasonable bottle of bubbly for us on the first night. The food in the Club was ok, but compared to other Hyatt Clubs (or the Ritz Clubs) was only really average. Breakfast was mostly pastries and fruits and a different dried up egg dish each day. In the evening two appetizers were served with a block of cheese (that was not renewed). Soft drinks and coffee/teas were amply supplied.The location of the hotel is great, just a short walk from the BART station, a cable car stop and within a stone's throw of major shopping, restaurants and Union Square.All-in-all great staff, great view - still tiny room!

Stayed here late Oct 2011, for sister's weekend birthday celebration. Hotel was sold out while we where there but check-in was friendly & easy; desk clerk was very helpful getting us 2 nearby rooms on same floor, both with excellent city views. Status upgrades were also given from standard to high floor deluxe, with Club room access. Newly renovated rooms are very nice; king corner rooms are quite spacious with separate dressing area from room & large bath. Really liked the new decor & modern tech amenities (all is very much like their website photos & descriptions.) Excellent AC - was quite hot for SF at that time of year.Hotel valet parking is reasonable for SF but directly across the street is parking garage that is $26 for 24 hrs; so drop your bags with bellman & then park it yourself.

This is a pretty fancy hotel right in downtown San Francisco. The rooms are pretty small, but beautifully done in a the "moderne" minimalist style. The flat screet TVs are a waste since they only have analog low res quality and only a handful of channels. Internet is not free, not even in the business center. No coffee maker or fridge. Good location right on the edge of Chinatown and close to everything.

The Hyatt is simply the perfect choice for any traveller to San Francisco. I loved our suite, it had a balcony overlooking the bay, two bathrooms (one even had a flat screen tv !!) the living room had a huge TV and my kids loved our 5 day stay. The hotel lobby was beautiful, the staff very helpful and even upgraded one of our rooms. There was wi fi everywhere, the gym was well positioned and the views were great !!! It was a great great holiday !!

This hotel was a great place to stay while we were in San Francisco! We were there for a food festival and everything was so convenient for all of us. A few went one way and the others scattered in the several directions to sight see. Great view, from our 16th floor window, of all of Union Square and the bay!! I would definitely stay here again!

We loved our room at the Grand Hyatt. It was spacious and clean with a nice view of downtown. The bed was so comfortable. The concierges were also fantastic. They were able to arrange for a last minute rental car for us as well as give us some great guidance about our destinations of Sausalito and Muir Woods.Small issues were that the first night it was windy so the building was creaking - nothing the hotel could do about this and it didn't end up keeping us up like we had feared it would - so not too big of a deal. Also, the window shade is controlled by switches next to the bed and door. I must have put it up to far when we got in to the room because when we tried to put it down when we got back it jammed. The hotel sent someone up very quickly to resolve the issue.Due to a business trip and room availability we stayed in 3 different hotels while in San Francisco. This was the first and we just kept wishing to come back to this hotel.

I just returned from a 5-night stay at this lovely hotel in San Francisco's Union Square. The hotel is very nicely situated in the heart of Union Square, just steps away from all the shopping and great restaurants this neighborhood is known for. It's also just a few blocks from Chinatown, and a metro/bus ride to almost anywhere in the city. I was in town for a conference at the Moscone Center, which was an easy 8-minute walk away. The location is one of the best features of this hotel.The hotel itself is very nice. The rooms are very comfortable, with modern decor and lots of great practical elements like a big desk, lots of easy to reach outlets and internet connections (and not just at the desk, but next to the bed as well), and a very nice bathroom with one of the best lit mirrors I've seen (great for makeup application). The view from my room was great- mostly city, with peeks of the bay behind the buildings. I would highly recommend you try to get a bay-view room on as high a floor as possible for the best view. The only issue I ran into during my stay was the lack of sound insulation in my room. There was a connecting door with the adjacent room, which was closed the entire time, but which let a surprising amount of noise from the other room into mine (and vice versa I imagine). I could hear conversations from the other room clearly from mine, and I did feel a bit self conscious that everything that I was saying could be heard by my neighbor as well. It didn't bother me enough to switch rooms, but if you're a light sleeper or are bothered by this, I would request a room without a connecting door. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay. The service was great (super fast room service), the rooms were very comfortable, the restaurant on the 36th floor had spectacular views, and the location is really ideal. I would definitely return to this hotel, and would recommend it highly to others.

Travelled to SF in July 2011 with my sister.This hotel is spectacular. We requested a double room very early on, a high floor and a renovated room - they gave us all 3.The rest of the hotel, e.g. the bar and the lobby, needs updating to bring it in line with the rooms.The hotel is ridiculously central. 5mins from China Town, another 10 mins from China Town to North Beach. So very central to everything else - like the shops around Union Sq. It's close to all kinds of cafes and restaruants too, and a stroll away from Zara/H&M/Levis/T&Co. The service is great and the concierges were ridiculously helpful with directions to EVERYTHING! They helped us with public transport, bus routes, cable cars etc. No need to feel like a novice / research your trip with concierges like this! Although they did give us one bad restaurant recommendation in North Beach.

Had a pleasant stay at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco. Was in town for the Nike Women's Marathon and this hotel is steps away from Union Square. Upon check-in, I was offered a room on a high floor with stunning views of the bay, but unfortunately, the room was next to an ice machine. I am sensitive to noise, so reluctantly I asked if I could be switched to another room. Fortunately, they were able to offer a similar room on a high floor with a great city/partial bay view, and the staff member made an extra effort to show me access to an unbostructed view of the city and the bay. Nice touch. Room is not large, but this being a business hotel, layout is practical and convenient. Had access to the Regency Lounge and this premium amenity is a nice luxury! Full breakfast buffet in the mornings, dessert pastries in the evenings, plenty of beverage options, honor bar for wine and liquor, all while enjoying gorgeous views of the city. A pleasant stay overall. Would consider coming back here again.

Please note: this review is from my stay in an Executive Suite, and may not be 100% applicable to the hotel in general.Room: The Executive Suite was excellent. It contained a spacious bedroom and a separate business / living room area with a couch, chair, TV, and plenty of desk space. The bed was very comfortable. One of the best features was that the suite had two full bathrooms, which I found very handy for getting ready in the morning. Our room faced east, with some decent views into the Bay.Location: The hotel is located a block north of Union Square, which serves as an excellent location for tourists. It is only a block away from the famous cable car line and a few blocks away from the south end of Chinatown. Most of the public transportation options are available within a few blocks, with a BART station a few blocks south an a number of bus lines in the area, making it very easy to get to all areas of the city and the airport.Service: The service at the hotel was very good. The staff were generally friendly and helpful. The hotel also has the very convenient Hyatt system for checking into your flight and printing tickets.The only downside was that the in room internet did not initially work. However, the hotel staff was very helpful in getting the problem fixed, even offering a bottle of wine and some snacks as an apology.

Located bang at union square the out appearance isnt very great but once you're in the hotel its a totally different world......when i checked in I got a room facing the other side (of union square) and spent a night there but there were some quirky noises coming for some reasons and one complaining the same I was given a room on a higher floor facing the union square which was truly a great experience. Also, they kind of surprised us when we returned back in the evening to find a nice bottle of wine and freshly cut fruits as a courtesy.....didnt try any of the restaurants in the hotel but i will never forget my stay here....3 cheers!

Stayed at the Grand Hyatt last week for a conference. Room was very clean and loved the remote blinds feature. What was the best part about the hotel? The concierge desk went above and beyond with suggestions and recommendations that absolutely made our "off time" great! Simply stopped by to get directions for a good place to eat dinner and ended up going to the opening night of the Broadway play "Hair", front row seats, for a great price thanks to the wonderful concierge desk! In my opinion, this kind of service is what sets this hotel apart from the rest.

Very large hotel, with friendly staff. Right in the center of Union Square and easy to get to from SFO via the BART train ($8 train trip as opposed to a $50 cab ride). Easy to walk to many great places in San Fran, including lots of hills. The rooms were lovely, clean and amazing views of the city and/or bay. The only negative was noise that made it hard to sleep. Of course there's city street noise, nothing can be done about that. However, the first night I was in a room that was a "connecting room" and I could hear my inconsiderate, loud neighbors as if they were in the room with me. The second night I changed rooms and heard a loud mechanical noise all night long that I imagine was the elevator. Bring ear plugs and all will be perfect.

I stayed at the Hyatt for 4 nights in September and had a wonderful time. I requested for a room without bath tub as I am pregnant and did not want to risk climbing in and out. They very nicely gave me a room on the club floor - 32nd. Although it did not face Union Square, it was nicely renovated, clean and comfortable. The beds were awesome - very soft and big. There was ample space in the room for laying out our luggage and a lounge chair as well.Location is fantastic. Right off Union Square and 2 blocks from Chinatown. Transport was a breeze - cable car around the corner, muni buses nearby. Loads of shopping and food options just minutes away.My rate came with in-room internet, but for those who don't want to pay, there are so many free wifi spots! Right outside the hotel is Starbucks.There is no fault I could find with the Hyatt. It made my babymoon a memorable and lovely vacation.

My husband and I recently extended a business trip to San Francisco into a short vacation, and stayed at the Grand Hyatt on Stockton Ave. It was a great experience. The room was modern, large enough for our comfort. The staff was very helpful. The location was great--just across the street from Union Square. A great value, particularly since the rates we got through Trip Advisor were better than I was quoted by our local travel agent. I highly recommend it. Our next trip to SF will include a stay at the Grand Hyatt.

Just stayed at the fully remodeled Grand Hyatt in SF last weekend and really liked the new look of the rooms. We had a room on the 24th floor with views of the Starlight room and the city. The room was a generous size with a great bed, good linens, Ipod docking station, marble bathroom, etc. My sisters corner room on the same floor was even larger with a separate dressing area. The bar & restaurant on the top floor has excellent views of the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, Coit Tower and the Bay. I live in the Bay Area and have to say this is one of the best views in the city. The easy parking across the street at the Stockton Street garage was $26 for 24 hours (no in or out). The Grand Hyatt is on the corner above Union Square so shopping, great restaurants, Theaters, etc are all easy walking distance. The main entrance to Chinatown is one block away. A car is not needed unless you want to go out to the DeYoung Museum, etc.

Spent 3 nights at the Grand Hyatt, SF. Rooms have been completely re-done and are VERY nice. Super comfy king beds, nice large flat screen TV's, and very modern. The lounge on the 36th floor offers great views for drinks in the evening and then again at breakfast. Close to everything. Staff was great and very helpful.

I recently stayed for 5 nights on a holiday with my mother. The hotel was terrific from check in to check out. We had a georgeous room on the 25th floor, newly renovated with top notch ammenities. Being on the 25th floor we did not find noise to be an issue, and we never had to wait for an elevator. The location is superb right in the heart of Union Square, close to shopping, restaurants, streetcars and cablecars. The concierge desk was fantastic about giving us tips and pointers on what to do in SF. I would highly recommend this hotel, and would be happy to stay again at the Grand Hyatt SF.

We spent a long weekend here recently and were very pleasantly surprised, Since our last visit, the rooms have been updated, new and better beds installed, and an overall facelift was conducted with excellent results. Anyone visiting SF or the first time should strongly consider staying in the Union Square area. First, it is arguably the city's center and close to everything, including the iconic cable car (literally one block from this hotel). Second, one is within walking distance of Chinatown, great restaurants and shopping. Buy an all-day pass if you take the cable car as it can be used on the city's excellent bus system.

great room, I was on the 10th floor (not the best view I would say) for the nike womens marathon. Union square is pretty much right out the door. great shopping near by. Public transporation was easy to get to and get around with. The conceirge desk was extremely helpful in directing to activties, places to eat and transporation. the bed alone will make you never want to leave very comfortable.

Newly renovated room was great - modern and clean with a huge bathroom. This is a very convenient location with Starbucks right across the street, Union Square and shopping all around and easy access to Chinatown. The gym is also a standout. It has all of the expected cardio machines, which by the way, offer an amazing view from the 35th floor. In addition, it has a lot of free weights, exercise balls, mats, etc. The only reason I gave this hotel 4 stars instead of 5 is that the lobby is nothing special. There's really no place to sit and visit. Also, the choice of bars and restaurants within the hotel is very limited. There is a bar/restaurant on the top floor with spectacular views. However, the menu is limited and pricy. There are many fine restaurants and bars within walking distance, though.

i recently stayed here for 6-day business trip. I was given a corner room on 17th floor - #1708. While i loved my stay, comfy, cozy.. having starbucks across the street, union square 1-block away, macy's cheesecake factory and rice-a-roni trolley cars, the one negative is that dam whistle. Oh well, someone has to keep earplugs in business.Definitely check out the AMAZING gym on the 35th floor (turn left and go thru doors to get into gym). Also, must have drink on the 36th floor - little pricey but awesome views.Enjoy!

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt the second week of October, 2011 with my husband and 4 year old son. I had stayed here years ago and must say that the renovations are amazing. The hotel interior is stunning. If you are into the ultra modern style - this is the place for you. Our room was on the 32nd floor club level and was gorgeous. It was not huge, but we had laminate floors and a view of the bay. The bathroom lacked a tub which I always wish for, but I think space is limited in these tower like hotel structures in the city. The bathroom was ultra modern with the raised sink and plentiful Portico toiletries. The bed was very comfortable. The flat panel TV and all amenities were perfect, including the electric sun shade on the ceiling to floor windows, and modern bed lamps attached to the bed posts. They delivered a DVD player for our son at no charge.The problems: Oh Boy! We picked a terrible time to go there since they had an employee strike every day that we were there. The employees were shouting (no screaming) on the street level - and we could hear it from our room on the 32nd floor up until 10pm!!!! It was terrible! They actually even ran into my husband on two separate occasions when we exited the hotel! They shouted at us not to check in on the 1st day too. They kept crossing the line that was drawn out for them on the pavement. It was very rude and unruly!The DVD Player took 2 hours to arrive at our room. The front desk lied to us - (as admitted by their own engineer who said he told them he could not find a DVD player and was looking for one). They told us he would be there in 10 minutes. Well try explaining the lies to a 4 year old 2 hours later as we are stuck waiting in the room! The room service was not the greatest either. This was obviously an exception since we have never had this kind of problem in the past - and they were seriously low on staff with everyone picketing outside. They should have just been honest about things. We also got our room 2 hours after we arrived with the manager's apologies. The club lounge was wonderful. It had private areas to get work done, have a private meeting or just relax. It is beautifully designed. The breakfasts were delicious, as well as the evening snacks and drinks. We also had dinner at the GrandViews Restaurant. They have a breathtaking view, and the service was wonderful. They were extremely accomodating in finding us a perfect table. We had invited another family to have dinner with us. The food was extremely disappointing though. I am not a picky eater, but the pasta was like simple boiled pasta with canned tomato stew on top, and the fish dishes were embarrassing! If you read my other reviews you will see that I can eat at the Four Seasons or McDonalds - again I am not picky, BUT the food we were served was truly pathetic. We were in a great location with good friends and good service, so I never complained. The location of the hotel is PERFECT! We were close to everything. The friendly concierge helped us with all reservations including the open top blue bus tour for 2 days which enabled us to see and tour everywhere.. Whether you are into shopping, dining or touring - this is the location to be. Absent the strike of the employees - we were very happy and would return in a heart beat!

I was ther with twenty clients. They all loved the place/decor/breakfasts,location and atmosphere. It was a first class stay. A tram stops nearby and for 75 cents senior citizens can travel a very long way, It was safe enough at night to walk around.

We had a king size bed on the 6th floor. The room was very modern. The washroom pieces were very modern. The shower head could not be adjusted to spray water out to the middle of the tub. I had to bend my head right next to the wall to get wet.The room was small but acceptable. The view was poor. We looked out at the side of a white building. The was a french balcony, but the sliding door could not open.The room was clean and quiet. We found the mattress was too soft. It caused some back aches.The internet was under $20 per 48 hours which is pretty standard.The gym was on the top floor and had a great view. It was a 1st class gym with very good equipment. There is no extra cost for the gym.The housekeeping was good and the front desk staff was fine. The kids loved the candies that were at the front desk. There was a housekeeping strike while we were there, but it did not affect us.Parking is scary expensive. Its in a building across the street.The location of the hotel is ideal. There are lots of shops and restaurants right at the door.Market street,Macy's,Saks,Union square are less than a 5 minute walk away.

Stayed at the hotel for a work event in October. Large room, great design, very comfortable. I liked the design so much I took some pics for decorating ideas at home. Staff were helpful and prompt. Great location as well. We have stayed at the Westin St Francis in the past and the Hyatt is considerably nicer in my book.

I found the service impeccable, from valet service, to entering the lobby, to checking in, to being shown the way to the elevators, to everyone in the restaurant and lounge. I was surprisingly pleased with how modern the room was -- very nice. It included electrically-controlled blinds, headboard with reading lamps, and very stylish hardware in the bathroom.
We loved the modern yet natural decor. Super cozy and comfy beds. Beautiful modern bathroom Friendly staff

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Loved it!Recently renovated rooms provided comfortable beds and decor, lovely modern bathroom; albeit the shower pressure was poor and merely trickled water- not an issue in the slightest really. The size of the rooms were also good.The staff here were incredibly friendly and always went out there way to help us.Would recommend the rooftop bar, great food and drinks and reasonably priced.The location of the hotel is simply fantastic and I would definitely stay here again and recommend it.

I liked the hotel and the rooms and lobby were modern and new. Do not miss the floor from the top floor.. absolutely great. There are only few smallish reasons this hotel did not get 4 or 5 stars. First and foremost there were sewer vapors coming from one of the bathroom fixtures resulting a quite foul odor. As long as I kept the bathroom door closed the rest of the room was okay. Price was another issue. We had a group corporate rate for a function being held in the hotel. Despite this we still paid what I would have consider to be top dollar. Other than that the stay was great. The bed was one of the best I have come across in a hotel.

Stayed at this hotel for a conference at the convention center... having stayed at several downtown San Francisco hotels over the last year for various conferences I can say that this hotel was excellent. 4 people working the check in on a very busy weekend. The Nike womens marathon was happening down the street and the Hyatt was one of the main hotels. Check in was smooth and seamless. My room was ready at noon and early check in was no problem. The room was clean and spacious, plenty of room for our bags in the closet. King bed with 6 pillows, desk area, sitting chair with ottoman, nice bathroom, very clean and well maintained, large closet for bags. Room was a standard king room, the bed extremely comfortable and came with a mini fridge, and coffee maker. The floor to ceiling windows gave us a wonderful view of the park where the marathon stuff was going on and the view of the city at night was breathtaking. Our room was cleaned every day promptly and nothing was stolen or "misplaced". The hotel restaurant has good food and a killer view of the bay. The service is excellent but as you suspect a little pricey, but most things are in San Francisco! Worth going up for cocktails at night their bar area is hopping with the best views of the city, and they make killer drinks!Doormen are very exceptional, hailing cabs, giving directions, and in general being interested in making your stay excellent!!Room service- on time and food was hot.Only detraction from this hotel is that wi-fi is NOT free.Overall I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

My family and I stayed here for 6 nights. I used a suite upgrade and was given an awesome hospitality suite on the 32nd floor with views to the east. The room was nicely appointed and clean. The one bad thing the suite had no bath tub. I asked the front desk about this as I was traveling with an 11 month old and later that afternoon a Hyatt employee knocked on our door with a baby bath tub filled with toys and accessories. AWESOME! The location is great too, walking distance to everything and great public transportation.

Remodeled room was excellent and comfy. They put me in handicap accessible room without asking me first. I hate when they do that. Those high toilets are uncomfortable. The elevators are really slow, couldn't figure out why. The dining room on the 36th floor was decent for breakfast and reasonable for what goes these days. The front desk was mostly helpful, but sometimes copped an attitude. For such a nice place, they need to finish getting their act together.

Stayed here five nights on business.The good:Very very clean room, just renovated; clean, modern decor with starched white high count linens. Neutral wood, tan/orange colors with just enough touches to make it not sterile, but not so much that it's overpowering. I had a corner room, which was quite spacious for SF for the price. On the 21st floor, I didn't have any noise problems, except the rare noise when my neighbors came in and out of their rooms -- I could definitely hear that. Otherwise, it was very quiet. I slept well every night. There are two power outlets built into the bedside tables in a convenient location on each side of the bed; extra airline-style positionable reading lights. Lots of new white good size towels. The refrigerator is a nice touch; no mini-bar, but you can bring home leftovers from dinner. There are bedside controls to raise and lower the black-out shades -- it was pitch-dark at night (except for the clock-radio/phone), and it was nice to raise the shades and see the city-scape in the morning before getting up. Service was polite without being cloying. Nice bath amenities -- I tip housekeeping well, but I got extras every day. The bathroom was spacious; the bathroom door was opaque glass, and it slides open/closed -- the effect creates extra space. The elevators were very fast; I never waited more than a minute, going up or down.One minor critique -- the sinks are shaped like a baby's bath, with a shallow end to the left away from the faucet; very attractive, but not practical.The ONLY thing that keeps me from giving this hotel a 5 is the following: the internet service is not free, and the WiFi is painfully slow and erratic. I've been using the wired connection instead all week. I truly object to high-end hotels charging for WiFi. Kimptons have always provided free wifi, and it's one of the reasons I'm loyal to them.Otherwise, great stay in a comfortable, clean, modern, upscale hotel.

This hotel is perfect in terms of it's location. The gym is up to date with new equipment and has an amazing view of downtown San Francisco from the 35th floor. The restaurant on the 36th floor has great food and an even better panoramic view. The rooms were a touch on the small side, but we only needed it for sleep so it wasn't a problem for us. The front door men were always so friendly, accommodating and knowledgable. This hotel was very central and at max. a 10 minute cab ride to anywhere we wanted to go. The housekeeping staff were very friendly. We really enjoyed our stay.

We stayed here for two nights in Oct 2011. While this hotel has been updated recently, you can tell it's a bit aged underneath it all. Our room was very comfortable, except for the constant construction surrounding Union Sq, which our room overlooked. We're talking 2:30 a.m. construction noise. Yeah, we were not impressed at all! If you are staying here after construction has finished (no idea when that will be, it's a big project) then you'll probably be happy. Until then, make sure they do not put you in any of the rooms overlooking the square.
