After calling down at 2:30 they offered to comp our bar charges, which was nice, but the issue remains for the next guest and the next. We gave them 4/5 here because of the quick response to the complaint, and because they very kindly let us store bags with them for an afternoon/evening two days after we checked out. That was really fantastic. Also, taxis were a slight pain because consutrction made the area a mess, and depending on which direction you were going it could be slow. Sometimes it was better to walk a block or so and catch one on the next street up to avoid sitting in traffic for a long time.

I recommend the Grand Hyatt to anyone going to San Fran. The accommodations are very current, the staff is exceptional, and the location couldn't be better.This hotel is perfect for personal or business

I stayed at the hyatt for almost a week. The location is great and the concierge and front desk try their best. When I made the reservation it mentioned 5 stars; but: roomservice is not available 24 hoursminibars are emptyhousekeeping is very slow and not very detailedI am truly disapointed, I have stayed at other hyatt properties and the service is trully 5 stars.I feel I was charged a 5 star price for a 31/2 star service.

Lovely, comfortable and perfectly situated at Union Square. You can walk most places or take the trollies and tour busses that stop at the Square. We were on the 32nd floor. Restaurant and work out rooms are on the higher floors so you won't miss the breathtaking views even if your room is lower. Prepare for sticker shock. At less expensive hotels you can expect free wi fi, breakfast and parking. Here you can expect to pay $75/day for these three things in addition to $300+/day for the room itself unless you're on a lower floor. There was a union organized walk out complete with picketers, blowing horns and megaphones at the main entrance when we arrived however we couldn't imagine any better service than what we received and the show outside had entertainment value. For me the experience was worth every penny. This was a business trip that my husband and I combined with extra days for pleasure.

we arrived very early in the morning after a night flight from hawaii and did not expect to be able to check in early, but the gentlemen behind the desk said our rooms were ready and not a problem. Our room was great with fantastic views of the city with floor to sealing windows, the bed was amazing and just what we needed after a 7hr flight with no sleep.the room is a very good size and the bathroom was well appointed and they had nice touches like complimentary toothpaste. The first morning we ventured out it was raining so we asked for an umbrella which was no problem we had a choice of large or small again a very nice touch. The bar on the 36th floor has the most amazing views of the city and is well worth a visit at sundown although i think the drinks are a bit expensive it was $28 for two cocktails and $36 for a bottle of wine, but a guess this is on par with most other large city's.the hotel is in a good location and a 30min walk from the fisherman's wharf and china town is just 5mins away. i will definitely be staying at this hotel again

Our room was very nice; however, we had to ask for a kingside bed as they had booked us into 2 doubles, despite our reservation. The hotel just underwent renovation and updates and it is apparent as soon as you enter the actual room. We had a corner room which was spacious, minimal, and clean. The refrigerator is a nice touch as well. The lobby needs work. There are very few places to sit and wait for people or rides & in a city of this size, many people are traveling with family or groups. There are no bathrooms available on main lobby floor & the restrooms downstairs were crowded due to conference attendees. Desk staff is, for the most part, not to friendly & seem to want to just get you to move on, even when slow. Baggage staff not much better, & though there are considerate staff, they are overshadowed by the others. The location is very good..great shopping, convenient transportation, and great restaurants.

You can't ask for more. The Hyatt is centrally located, in Union Square, a block from the cable car stop, a few blocks from BART and on several main bus routes. The rooms were gorgeous. Recently renovated, we were completely impressed by the decor and spent a little too much time mesmerized by the window shades that were controlled by a button in the end table. Room also came with a minifridge (no mini bar, which I prefer because then you can't fit anything into the fridge!) We were also very excited by the view, until we were told about the restaurant on the 36th floor. Amazing!!! I didn't have too much interaction with the staff, but the little I did was wonderful. Everyone was pleasant and helpful. I'm trying hard to think of a negative to add, and am struggling to think of one. I'm not someone who gives 5 stars out easily, so please know that I was very impressed and would most definitely go back.

The newly-renovated Grand Hyatt was clean, comfortable, welcoming, and perfectly located. The newly-renovated rooms are stylish and warm. The staff was helpful at all times, even with three demonstrations happening on their doorstep. The bar on the 36th floor had an incredible view and was an excellent way to end a long day out sight-seeing. An even better end to a long day was the luxurious, king-sized bed! It was like slipping into a cloud every night and made it hard to get up and start the next day. We just wanted to stay in that bed!

We have spent quite a bit of time traveling this summer. We have been up and down the California coast as well as Canada. This stay was a gift from our best friends and included golf at Harding Park. We arrived at 10:30 a.m. Much too early for checking into our rooms. Our hope was to valet our car and leave our bags with the bellman. We were greeted by an enthusiastic bellman who quickly unloaded all our bags and valeted our car. To our amazement we were told our rooms were ready and we were able to go straight up!!!Our rooms were immaculate. The view stunning. But the COMFORT of our room was by far the most superior of any hotel room we have stayed in. The mattress was wonderful with pillows to match. Towels were lush and thick. The shower was well appointed and water pressure was great.There is noise from the street, but you are in Union Square in San Francisco!!! We were able to walk to Mortons Steak House for an awesome dinner. Shopping all day in Union Square was great. Breakfast one day was room service and the next day was at the Cheesecake Factory in Macy's....a 4 minute walk across Union Square.Can't remember a better time in SF and the October sunshine was perfect.

We stayed for 4 nights at the Grand Hyatt. We had a great view of the skyline and the bay.We were celebrating a birthday that weekend and the Hyatt sent us a complimentary bottle of wine and food platter the 1st night. That kicked off 4 great days. We were lucky and caught a fleet week air show over the bay and a Columus Day Parade in North Beach. The rooms have been updated since we were here in 2008 and the Hyatt did a great job. The room was very clean and the front desk was very helpful. It is a great location and good hotel

Location is excellent and the views from the Grandview Restaurant and Lounge are breathtaking. The recent renovation is well done- love the remote control windowshade and the babybath size sink. We were on a lower floor- room 606 and unlike other reviewers weren't bothered by noise of neighbors and fully expect to hear city noises in a city.Prices in the Grandview lounge are relatively reasonable for a bar menu that equates to lunch-size portions. Wish that there were a couple more eating options like a coffee/breakfast/snack bar. Also there aren't any vending machines in the hotel, so hard to grab a bottle of water or a soft drink before setting out for a day of sightseeing.

The location is great. The rooms are extremely nice and well appointed. The only complain would be the noise. The walls are paper thin. We could hear everything in the hallways every time someone was near our room. Street noise was also bothersome, but likely due to our being on a low floor. Overall, it's a good hotel if you go the Priceline route, but not worth the standard rate compared to other hotels in the area.

Surprisingly good experience at this large hotel right off Union Square. Set at the top of Stockton Street and surrounded by great shopping and dining, this is the choice among the big chain hotels in the downtown/financial district area at this service category. The staff are very curteous and pleasant, from the reception desk to the concierge team. The rooms, though not large, have been nicely and comfortably renovated and feature nice amenities like a fridge, large flat panel TV, window shades that work, and great bath products. The hotel property is definitely showing its age and despite the renovation, which has not yet extended to the public areas, doesn't feel as crisp or fresh as other Hyatt properties but if you're looking for a great location with many of the city's top locations within easy walking distance and great views (be sure to check out the bar on the 36th floor), this is the place to stay.

I stayed here on business last week and was not disappointed. First of all, the location is wonderful - a short walk from a lot of attractions, close to the financial district, and just a nice central spot overall.The rooms have been completely renovated, and while a little too modern for my personal taste, they are very nice and well appointed. Pretty good sized too given the location, and mine was immaculate - I don't recall the last time I stayed in a room that felt so clean! Comfy bed, nice TV - a nice place to stay. My only complaint about the room was the shower. It had the worst water pressure and the nozzle was lousy in my opinion. Other than that, great rooms!Service was friendly and everyone was really accomodating. I have stayed in several hotels in the area and plan to make this my home base from now on because the location is really THAT great! I am really anxious to see the renovations of the 1980s lobby and the rest of the place.I almost forgot - the fitness center on the 36th floor is OUTSTANDING! Easily one of the nicest hotel gyms I have seen - it was huge, well equipped with really nice, new stuff, and the view was spectacular!

Had an excellent three night stay here, the room was clean and quiet and all of my interactions with the staff were excellent. The floors are divided into four sectors or clusters of rooms so you don't get that oppressive long-hallway hotel feel, which is nice. My only complaint is that the room layout is a little weird but other than that it was recently redone with modern finishes and looked great.

Stayed july 2011. Excellent location if you want down town. wonderfully, relaxing rooms. Reception desk staff were distant and standoffish. Must see veiw from top floor restaurant/bar.Messed up my credit card by charging too many things on one day so bank stopped it, then they charged me twice! Writing this on 11 oct and still no refund. Not impressed with the customer service either. Lovely hotel spoilt by people who work there. I will update this when I get a refund.

I liked everything about this hotel. It has recently been renovated so the rooms are clean and bright. There is lots of storage space, a small fridge, a safe big enough to hold both of our laptops, nice big windows. The bed was comfortable, the location is fantastic...just steps away from Union Square. The staff were all friendly and accommodating. The room was made up promptly each day. The only very, very minor annoyance was the noise through the adjoining door. If you can get a room without one of those it would be as close to perfect as a hotel can get!

We are a family with 2 young children, so we decided to stay in the heart of this beaufitul city of San Francisco, as this was our firt trip to USA. We picked to stay at Grand Hyatt simply becasue it was affordable and after reading many of the reviews if was an easy decission. SO here is what we though about our stay at Grand Hyatt. Staff at the hotel was outstanding, very helpfull and always willing and able to answer all of out questions. Concierge staff we especially helpfull (one in partucular, from memory i think his name was Tom), he helped us organise our day tours and tickets to the Alkatraz. Rooms: We had a pleasure at staying in one of high flood rooms (2919) and we loved it. The view was just breath taking overlooking Union Square. Decor was modern and very sleek. Beds were very comfourtable which really help to have a good nights rest after a very long day of exploaring the city. Each morning we had our breakfast at the floor restaurant and the food was fantastic. Service was just as great. And the view amazing!!!! So thank you to everyone at Grand Hyatt for the start to our holiday to be one very unfogetfull and plasurable experience. If we come again to San Francisco we will definitelly be choosing Grand Hyatt as our accomodation. We loved every day we spent there!!!! Thank you!

Stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 3 nights in July this year. We had a newly renovated room and it was simply amazing! The view was superb. The hotel staff were very helpful and were always on top of all our requests. In terms of location it is very central. You literally step out the door and find yourself metres away from all the large department stores, boutiques and designer clothing. My husband and I loved every moment of it. The only downside was the parking as it was quite pricey being around the $40 mark for 24hours. Other than that, could not fault the hotel.

I stayed here for business for two nights at the end of September. The location is great--right next to Union Square (I could see it from my window) and great shopping, yet close to the financial district, good restaurants and a short taxi ride from the Ferry Terminal. Fisherman's Wharf was a few minutes by taxi. The cable car was just a few blocks away.Check in was great-- ultra friendly and helpful. My room was on a high floor and had a fantastic view over Union Square and could see bits of the bay. They have these new electronic window shades which were really cool. The room was obviously recently refurbished--flat screen TV, funky orange and beige bathroom (the sink looked like a baby bathtub sitting on the orange glass counter). The decor was in beiges and oranges and was crisp and modern. There was even a clock radio (it may have been an iPod docking station also but I didn't have an iPod so did not really notice). The only thing that was a little disappointing was that there was a balcony but I could not open the door. I callled downstairs and they said someone could come up and open it for me. It seemed that this was the only way to access the balcony. Since I just wanted to snap a photo I declined. I think the balconies are from the 80s or something and the railings appear to be kind of low so it seemed like a safety issue. But really, the view from the nearly floor to ceiling window was spectacular enough without going out on the balcony so I did not mind. One evening my colleagues and I went upstairs to the bar on the 36th floor for drinks-- great view from up there!I did not eat in the hotel so could not comment on that.Taxis were readily available upon checkout. The doorman tried to get us to "upgrade" to a black town car and it seemed like he had some sort of "arrangement" with these cars but we just took a yellow taxi.I would highly recommend this hotel and the city of San Francisco!

We stayed at this hotel for four nights and paid extra to use the "Club" facilities.The room we were allocated was on the 31st floor and was newly refurbished to a high standard.The hotel is well located for both shopping and access to the MUNI transport system. ( We paid $21 for a three day pass)The club area is located on the 26th floor and has full length windows overlooking the Bay and Alcatraz.Breakfast was freshly prepared and of the continental type. Tea, coffee and soft drinks were available all day and from 5pm until 9pm canapes followed by desserts are served.Alcoholic drinks are available from an honesty bar. Wine and beer cost $3 while spirits cost $4.After a long day sightseeing it was a welcome respite to relax and have a nibble and a drink while enjoying the views of The Bay.

Stayed here for 1 night for business. Location is right in the middle of Union Square so it is convenient to all. The hotel itself is very nice and staff is very friendly and helpful. The decor is updated with nice amenities. I had a fantastic view of the square and the noise level was very minimal. I do plan on returning to this location so that I may enjoy all that they have to offer.

Right on Union Square, in the heart of downtown San Francisco. Easy to get to anywhere in the city from the Grand Hyatt - there is a BART station at Union Square, and the cable car line is across the street.The hotel itself is very nice. Rooms are recently renovated, nice workout facilities, and a bar on the top floor with nice views of downtown.The only potential downside I could see for people staying at this hotel is that since the hotel is in a high-traffic area, there is a lot of street noise that can be heard from your hotel room (we were on the 12th floor). On our vacation we also stayed a few nights in Fisherman's Wharf and it was much quieter there.

The hotel has been newly renovated and the location is excellent if you want to indulge in some retail therapy.Check-in was efficient but not at all friendly. Check out however was both friendly and efficient.We booked a king club room directly with the hotel and were pleasantly surprised to find it was a large, attractive, sunny room with a floor to ceiling windows with a great view of the city and the bay in the distance. The bathroom fittings were very modern with a large sink and walk in shower. There is no bath which didnt bother us at all. A good quality, powerful hair dryer was also welcome. The only thing I didn't like about the bathroom was it had only a single hook on which to hang wet towels and no where to hang the hand towels.  We had a pair of men's trousers cleaned at the hotel and they didn't appear to have been cleaned at all. When I mentioned this at checkout, they immediately credited the cost back to our account. while we hadn't asked for this, it was much appreciated. Having stayed in Club rooms in other Hyatt hotels previously, I don't think this one warrants the additional cost given you need to pay for alcohol in the club room and while the soft drinks were gratis, there was a poor selection (and pepsi rather than coke) and the nibbles were limited and very uninspiring. Overall though an excellent hotel and will be my first choice next time I'm in San Francisco.

The experience matches the expectation. You expect a great hotel, a great room and a receptive and friendly staff. You get all of this with a central downtown location. Modern decor and amenities in the refurbished room I had on the 14th floor including iPhone and USB ports on the bedside radio and lots of charging outlets. Will definitely be back!

Usual high-end corporate luxury hotel, very comfortable. That said it suits holiday makers as well who do not feel out of place. Location is great, right on Union Square, so all the major shopping outlets in SF are no more than 2 blocks walk any direction (Macy's, Barney's designer stores). We had no need of a car when staying here for 3 days, it is one block from a stop on 2 SF cable car routes and on bus routes as well. 5 mins walk to Market Street where many department stores are situated, and a further bus routes to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 etc. To get to the waterfront at Pier 39 on public Transport takes 20 minutes including waiting and walking to bus / cable car stops! The down-town car hire return area for all firms, is an easy 3 blocks walk from the hotel.Don't breakfast in hotel, a Lori's diner is 1 block away and this is great value and fun, use it! Dinner should be in any one of a huge choice of restaurants within 2 blocks of this hotel, but use the hotel bar on the 36th floor before you go out. Fantastic views ove rthe whole city right down to the bay and Alcatraz (and the GG bridge if you crane your neck!), it has a good feeling to itStaff were friendly and helpful, probably more so than usual because we arrived on day 7 of a strike of housemaids which had a noisy demonstration outside the hotel for a few hours.Overal a great location for SF city, and a $16 shuttle ride to SFO airport.

Stayed here for 3 nights in June 2011. The room was small, but it was updated very well and had great views of the city. We tried to print our boarding passes but were told we had to pay :( Overall the stay was pleasent and we had no problems

I can't comment on pricing (was there on business) but the location was amazing. Right beside Union Square with walking distance to all kinds of shopping and amazing restaurants. There was a strike going on but the staff on site worked hard to ensure that guests weren't disrupted. The Concierge desk was very helpful and provided great advice on local eateries, etc. The on site gym is very good with everything you could need. The service in the lounge on the top floor did leave something to be desired so would not recommend spending any time/money there - especially given the fact that there are so many great bars and restaurants within easy walking distance.

We got a great deal on this hotel on Priceline and I was not disappointed. The room wasn't huge but was nice and we had a great view of the city and water (when it wasn't cloudy). We had a slight issue with our room when we got there but the hotel responded quickly and well and comped us breakfast in their top floor restaurant. Overall would definitely stay here again!
Love this hotel and I work for their competitor!! There was a strike going on and I cannot say enough about how accommodating the staff was.

Great location although a little overpriced for this hotel. It has been recently renovated which was nice however the rooms are very small.Was not happy about the staff striking outside of the hotel from 6am to 10.30pm eachday! We could hear the noise which woke me up & delayed us getting to sleep at night, the best staff could offer were ear plugs which I thought was poor customer service!

This hotel offered every thing we were looking for in our vacation. The location on Union Square was ideal, the newly renovated rooms were spacious, and our view on the 27th floor was perfect. I loved the remote control shade in the room...Superb idea!

I stayed in the recently renovated hotel. Most of the renovations are great. In addition to comfortable beds and directed bed reading lights, the window shade can be operated from the bed. There were a few negatives, especially in the bath. The sink takes up a lot of the counter and there are no drawers, so the vanity can get cluttered with toiletry items. The rain shower head can not be tilted, so you end up standing very close to the wall to get the full stream of water.Perhaps the biggest issue was the lack of drawer space in the room. What looks like a chest of drawers contains a small refrigerator and a safe. There are 3 very small drawers in the closet, which takes up room that could hold suitcases. So the suitcases end up in the room.

Chose the Grand Hyatt for extra miles on my airlines Visa card and a Welcome credit, check their website for details, but it was so much more than just saving a buck! Newly renovated, the room impressed me. On top of that, every employee was pleasant, helpful, and not so stuck in the "be professional" mode that impresses some. When a tour company left me high and dry in the woods (literally), I desperately called the front desk, who immediately made calls and checked the internet, finally making arrangements with other tour groups so that I could board their bus and make it back to the hotel. I won't stay anywhere else!

Unable to secure reservations at the nearby Hyatt Regency Embarcadero because of a convention, my husband and I opted to give the Grand Hyatt a try. Having booked 2 award nights, we were only entitled to a standard 2-double bedded room on a low floor. Upon arrival however, our Platinum level membership in the Hyatt Gold Passport program was acknowledged and we were upgraded to a king-bedded room-with-a-view on the 30th floor. Any lingering disappointment we may felt with settling for our second choice hotel disappeared. The recently-renovated room served as a plush eyrie for the finale of our California vacation. We enjoyed our stay, although the high tech room fittings may need some adjustments; you can control lights and the electric window shade from both bedsides; during the wee hours of our second night, we were awakened twice by the lights coming on and shade going up inexplicably. We could find no way that either one of us had tripped the buttons, but since we were departing at an ungodly hour for an early flight, we never pursued it further beyond a post-stay email to management to note the glitch.

Strange hotel with no lobby so to speak - friends meeting me at the hotel had to stand up near the doorway. Fabulous location in the heart of Union Square shopping district. The room is very nice and the view is spectacular. I did not have breakfast nor use room service. The hotel is totally overpriced, very impersonal as is the staff.

We took BART from the airport to Powell Street and then walked the 4 blocks to the hotel- very convenient. Rooms are very well-appointed and have been recently redone. Appreciated having a coffee maker and refrigerator in the room and having the reading lights by the side of the bed and the darkening shade for the window that was controlled from the bedside. We had a nice view of Union Square from our 24th floor room and could have also seen the water if the fog had not been so thick!!! We booked a AAA rate that included breakfast which ended up to be a $50 credit each day for breakfast. That more than covered the cost of the buffet plus part of the tip. I think the buffet was about $23 pp, but was very good and included eggs, meats, cereals, fruits, oatmeal, yogurt, granola and breads with french toast, pancakes and waffles made to order. They had a scrambled egg with chorizo that was wonderful. There was also a separate breakfast menu to order from. I tried the Orange Brioche French Toast one morning that I can still taste. Also, complimentary papers each morning by the elevators. Everything about the hotel, including the location, is perfect.

Was here for a conference in late August. Nicely located just off Union Square. Given a room on the 32nd floor which offered nice views, although the views are much better on the side facing east. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Wi-fi about $10/day.

We have been fans of the Hyatt for a long time - and despite checking in on the very first day of the week-long noisy and disruptive picket line by hotel staff who were members of the Local 2 union at the Grand Hyatt Union Square, our stay was very pleasant, and service continued seamlessly to the same high standards expected of a Hyatt. There may have been minor hiccups, but these were understandable as the Hotel had to deploy temp workers, with Hyatt staff coming in to support from other locations. On the flip side, we benefited from the excellent assistance extended by the many managers and executives who were on the hotel floor and at the entrance!Once the regular staff were back to work, we also certainly could not fault their service either!The renovated rooms are wonderful. We had a corner room, with the bathroom located on the inner side (rather than right by the entrance passageway), and a vanity table as well. There were many thoughtful touches - from the bedside electronic controls for the black-out screen, as well as the flexi-reading lamp that could be adjusted to just what you need and the many AC points throughout the room. A special word about the concierges who assisted us - Joanna, you are a gem and you even helped our new-found friends solve their last minute car rental! Anne and Elaine - equally knowlegeable, quick on the take and with generous doling out of practical and honest advise! A big THANK YOU!!Now that all the rooms have been renovated, we were told that the lobby and restaurant will also be renovated / remodelled in the next year or so. We certainly look forward to returning soon!

We stayed here for 4 nights in August/Sept while my husband attended a conference. We went for the "Regency Club" rooms, so that I would have a place to go for breakfast in the mornings, and they had a cocktail setup there in the evenings. I recommend paying a little more for this - a nice lounge, great breakfast buffet, and appetizers/desserts in the evening.Our first night at the hotel, we had the misfortune of having a crying baby in the next room on the other side of a connecting door! Admittedly, not the hotel's fault, but at my request, they did move us to another room on the same floor the next day. It had a connecting door, too, but that was to a suite that was not in use, so it was blissfully quiet and looked down on Union Square and out at Mount Sutro with a sliver of a Bay view. My biggest complaint about this hotel is their elevators. Usually, buildings that are as many floors have two banks of elevators - one for the lower floors and one for the upper floors. The Hyatt has 8 or 10 elevators, and they all go to the 30-something floors.Also, don't bring a car and valet park. It was something we had to do with plans ahead of and behind our stay here, but we paid for it. The first night, we did valet, and after that, it was put at the self-park option.The staff at the hotel was unfailingly wonderful, from the front desk people, to the servers upstairs, the concierge, and the room attendants --- all top notch and all noticeably happy to be working there. Kudos to John, the concierge and the front desk person from Peru (was his name Roberto -no, but it was something like that-sorry for forgetting) for giving that little extra bit of service that made us feel special! The young man from Peru even took me back into my old room to search for a missing item, which I later found tucked into something I had packed. What an asset he is to Hyatt!

I have stayed here on business several times and it is perfectly adequate. I find breakfast to be rediculously expensive...The rooms are fine. Location is excellent, and it is very close to the Ferry Building which has some nice places to eat and a great wine bar.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt on a recent business trip. My expectations were high going into my stay and the Grand Hyatt met my expectations. I was greeted promptly at check-in and welcomed by the desk staff; very personable and friendly. My room was on the 27th floor overlooking Union Square...great view through the floor to ceiling windows! Amenities were good, room was clean, bed was comfortable. My only small complaint was the bathtub and shower head. Hotels in a similar class often have deep soaking tubs which are nice after the walking you are likely to do in San Francisco. Shower left a bit to be desired, not sure if it was the shower head or the water pressure.Top floor restaurant and bar was nice; average food, strong drinks, great views in every direction.Overall I would stay at the Grand Hyatt again and would recommend for others, particularly business travelers or couples.

We had a corner room on a low floor. It only had a view of the street but the room and the bathroom had recently been renovated. It was very nicely done. The staff was also very helpful in helping us print boarding passes, hail cabs, etc. We really enjoyed our stay.

Really enjoyed our stay here,judging by some of the previous comments was a bit worried about what we were about to find.It's a modern high rise and we were on the 26th floor.the room looked brand new with the furnishings and wide screen tv. Staff were helpful and the hotel is ideally situated just off Union Sq. We walked down to Fishermans Wharf and caught the cable car back which dropped us just around the corner of the hotel.would definatly stay here again and would recommend to anyone.Ps large modern gym on the 32nd floor with amazing views across the bay onto Alcatraz.

My husband and I stayed here after fretting for weeks over which hotel to choose in San Francisco. I knew it was a chain and wouldn't have "local flavor", but also knew it would have good size rooms and we'd avoid the "boutique but tiny" conditions at some others. I am happy with my decision. The rooms are newly remodeled and very comfortable. Having an in-room fridge is also a nice benefit not found in many others. We got a great deal here through AAA that included the buffet breakfast daily, which normally would have been @$25/person. The buffet was nice and you could also order pancakes, belgian waffles, or eggs to order if desired. Filling up on this meal allowed us to go without lunch and saved us a bundle! Great location, as much of San Francisco is within walking distance. Concierge staff was most helpful and pleasant. You can't go wrong staying here.

I stayed here for two nights during Labor Day weekend with my boyfriend. The front desk staff happily accommodated our request for a room near our friends. We stayed on the 26th floor, which had great views. The rooms facing the Bay are probably the best, but the view of Union Square is also very cool. Loved the bathroom sinks, reading lights, ipod charger plugs and the electric window shade that you can easily open and close while laying on the bed. Also really liked the modern decor and remodeled bathroom, with separate vanity area. The only con is how long it took to get an elevator Saturday morning around 10am. It took about 15 minutes, maybe longer. If you run into the same problem, just get on one that's going up and ride it back down to the lobby. That finally worked for us.

Location Location Location! Nice rooms, very clean. Excellent view, loved the balcony. A balcony is a treat in San Fran. Out the door and you are in a great spot. Ferry building right there. Liked that we were left alone. You only saw staff if you needed something and then they were right there. Would stay again if my budget allowed, it is a little expensive.

We stayed at this hotel for four days the first week of August. The hotel was renovated and is very nice. The rooms are clean and very nice, with all of the amenities you need, and while not huge, they are certainly not small. We found a great deal on Costco for the Hyatt Hotels, and so you received a discount rate, plus if you stayed 2 nights, the 3rd night was free, and upon check-in, we had a room on the 25th Floor overlooking Union Square. The location is really nice, being right at Union Square and a half a block from the cable car stop, plus about 2 blocks to Chinatown. All of the hotel personnel were very nice, always offering to help in any way possible, from the front desk to the doormen, and the people at the concierge desk were terrific in helping us to find restaurants and the best way to get to places on our list of places to go (and suggesting some additional ones). Wi-fi is available, but there is a charge (and should be included in a hotel of this class), but if you really want to avoid that, Starbucks is directly across from the front door of the hotel. If you have time, there is a great fitness which occupies an entire floor of the hotel.
Great hotel, gentle staff and very nice view. Complimentary coffee and amenities. The view of the top-floor bar and restaurant is amazing. Downside: the wi-fi is not free.
The rooms have been redone since the last time we stayed here. They are very modern and well appointed. The hotel is quiet and comfortable despite being busy. The staff was very courteous.

Faultless stay at the Hyatt! We had a lovely room that had recently been refurbished so was very modern and clean, with the best bed ever!Great location too, good for shopping and restaurants, although because of our long day we ate in the Hotel restaurant on the top floor and were not disappointed. The service from Frank and team was fantastic, and the piano player in the bar afterwards was brilliant.Will definitely recommend this Hotel to anyone!
Enjoyed my stay here, very good hotel in good location. Would definitely recommend it to everyone.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for six nights in June this year, and had a fab time. Our room was on the 25th floor, giving us great views across the city. The room was spacious and had everything we needed. The Portico toiletries were replenished daily - I couldn't get enough of them! Bed was huge and there was a good selection of tv channels (if you can find time to watch tv!). My other half enjoyed playing with the electric blind on the huge floor-to-ceiling window.The hotel charges for wifi, so if we wanted to check emails, etc we just went to the Starbucks across the street and used their free wifi while enjoying a coffee. The hotel is in a great location. It's within very easy walking distance of the main shopping area and Chinatown. We also walked to City Hall and Fisherman's Wharf (though this wouldn't have been as pleasant in cold or wet weather. Public transport is easily accessible from the hotel too and I don't think it's too far from the business district.We ate in the hotel's restaurant on our last night, and had a beautiful meal which wasn't overly expensive. The views from up there are amazing.Overall, I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again on my next visit to San Fran.

We stay at the hyatt for 4 nights from the 22nd to the 25th Aug, we are a family of 4 and our standard room was a good size for a city hotel, on checking in we asked for a room with a view and 'Ryan' was so helpful. We had a room on the 27th Floor with great views over the city and the bar on the top floor is a must for a late night drink the views are outstanding. All the staff that we dealt with were very helpful, the hotel is clean, the rooms are quite and the beds just so comfortable. The location is fantastic for restaurants, shopping, tram-line, we really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel we can't wait to go back!

We stayed at the Grand hyatt from 22nd -27th August, it was fabulous right from the start! Check in was quick and easy, we had a fabulous room on the 23rd floor, overlooking the city. Our room was recently refurbished, the room was very spacious with lovely matching bedding and curtains. We had an electronic blind which was super. Everywhere was lovely and clean. The bathroom was maybe a little small but that didnt really bother us. Plenty of hanging space for our clothes. The hotel itself was very clean, the lobby was very pleasant. All of the staff were very polite and helpful especially Elaine the conciege, who was very helpful to us. The location of the hotel was perfect, just a block away from Macys, saks, tiffanys and lots of great resturants nearby. China town was very close, we had an easy walk through Chinatown and on to Northbeach from there we found Lombard street, which we walked up and got some wonderful views of the city. I would definetly recommend the sightseeing hop on hop off bus, this was a great way of seeing the city highlights.Recommended restuarants: Lories diner, Maxs, Bubba Gumps and the Hard rock cafe. With such a fabulous city to explore it was great to know we had a lovely comfy bed to fall into at the end of a very busy and fun day. We would definetly stay at this hotel again it was brilliant!

We have stayed in hotels all over the world and I must say the Hyatts are always number one hands down! This one location was in the middle of everything! Don't rent a car because not needed and parking is outrageous. Service was very impressive. Concierge really knowledgeable and seemed caring. The city itself was awesome and we will definitely go back again.

had 5 nts in this lovely hotel. excellent service, large very comfortable room, spotlessly clean. our room on the 8th floor had quite good views but not exceptional. The food and service on the 36th floor dining room was very good, and not much more expensive than some of the cheapish diners in the area. the hotel is only a block from Powell street, union square, and about 5 flat (ie no hills) blocks from chinatown leading into little italy.tip. buy the 7 day pass if you plan to use the cable cars-which charge $3.95 per journey. the Pass allows unlimited cable car rides and most of the trolley buses for the week.tip.if you want breakfast away from the hotel, go to Mamas, on the corner of Washington Square. It is quite a walk from the Hyatt, but the food is superb, prices are very reasonable. But-it is small and gets crowded. we had to wait for an hour to get in, and this was 10 in the morning.tip. lots of ways to get from SFO to city centre. we recommend just taking a standard taxi, which although will cost a bit more, is worth it as it will take you direct to your hotel in half the time of one of the other transfer methods.we would certainly go back to this hotel.

This is a great, clean hotel in a prime location for shopping and other attractions. My friend and I received a renovated room with ample room. The bathroom was well lit, the beds were comfortable and the room was outfitted with the latest electronic gadgets. Hotel staff and concierge were all very friendly. The hotel has a lounge on the top floor with great views. It's a must see.

We stayed here for 4 nights in a 10th floor room:Positives:1) Location - fantastic!! close to all the shops of union square and walkable to all attractions including Pier 33 for Alcatraz (approx 40 mins)2) Clean room which had everything you needed3) Helpful concierge - provided useful maps and books (which had discount vouchers for local stores)Negatives:1) Check in took a long time as the woman serving us was rather confused about what she was doing and took a while to get the roomOverall a very positive experience and a fantastic location for walking through a wonderful city.

I enjoyed my stay at the hotel and the service was up to Hyatt standards. As a Diamond member I was treated very well, however, they were very busy and not able to check us in for quite some time. The only downfall was the $42 valet parking. I will admit the valets were quick with getting you your car, but it is still not worth the money.

We took the subway from the airport to the powell st station(9 bucks) and walked the 4 blocks to the hotel. We stayed in room 3105 a grand club room with access to the grand club on the 32nd floor. The view from our room on the 31st floor faced directly at the fishermans wharf, alcatraz island and bay which was awesome. The same view you get from the restaurant on the 36th floor. Check in was quick and efficient. Any of the 6 elevators are fast ! The room looked just as beautiful as the hyatt website which included a mini fridge, safe, full closet, very comfortable bed and electric shade controlled by a button by the bed and door. If you get a grand club room, you will have access to the grand club concierge room on the 32nd floor which opens at 6am to 9pm. It provides free hot breakfast with fresh fruit as well as beverages, in fact you can get coffee tea soda and juices all day. From 5-7pm there is hot hor duerves , vegetables, cheeses, bread and about 10 name brand liquors including beer and wine. Aside from the food, its a nice room to relax and enjoy the view of the bay. The staff out front will hail cabs for you. There is a starbucks across the st and another starbucks one block away on powell st across from the 24 hr walgreens that sells sandwhiches and grocery store type food. The cable car is one block away(powell/hyde line) and will take you to ghiradelli square/fishermans wharf district. We met numerous other people on the various tours we took and not too many liked thier hotel but, they all knew the grand hyatt was wonderful. Oh yeah, the water pressure was fine on the 31st floor. Personally, I think the lobby looks good no need to remodel it next year. The exercise room on the 35th floor was awesome with 4 treadmills 3-4 bikes and all new equipment for every muscle group, 30 to 40 dumbell free weights and TV screens everywhere and head sets and towels provided along with a small fridge next to the elevator of rolled chilled towelettes to wipe off the face and body after working out. We enjoyed the friendly concierge downstairs as well as the ones on the 32nd floor grand club. Thanks for a great vacation !

This was our first time to San Francisco and I went with my wife and 4 kids. The hotel was very centrally located to various shopping districts and restaurants, all within walking distance. The cable cars were simply 2 blocks away so we were never far away from too much. Check in and check out were easy and efficient and room was really perfect with 2 adjoining rooms. The only item that was missing was a pool - not sure why they didnt include one. Other than that, gym and restaurant on top floor were great too. Highly recommended ......

My husband and I stayed at the newly refurbished Grand Hyatt for one night on our way to the car races at Monterey. Our next door neighbors were so noisy and disruptive that the hotel management not only put us in the Club section of the hotel, but staff moved all our luggage quickly and efficiently. The location is wonderful for enjoying this special city.

The location was very good because Union Square is at walking distance. People were very polite and the service was good and effective. The rooms all have a plasma TV (which is important for some people). The view was my favorite part because you had a view of the buildings of San Francisco and The Transamerican Building

At the last minute, I booked a room at the Grand Hyatt. They've recently renovated with a clean, european lines but with a touch of Asian inspired colors and deco. Clean, comfy and fantastic service. Plus, I got a marvelous view of Union Square from my room. Great amenities like convenient bedside plugs; wireless internet (for a fee) and a push button electric shade for the windows.

This is an awesome hotel. The location is perfect. Easy access to subway, bus, taxi, any other way you like to get around! Located in Union Square, there are many shops and restaurants within walking distance. The concierge desk was very helpful with planning tours and recommending restaurants/bars. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The beds are SOOO comfortable! The room made us feel like we could just relax. They had automatic window shades that you can activate from the bed! All employees we encountered were very nice, polite and helpful. Definitely a "Grand" Hyatt! Some negatives - the hotel is pricey (but I guess you get what you pay for). Breakfast is not included. They charge for w-fi / internet service. Overall, I would definitely stay here again.

Just returned from a weeks stay in this hotel, we booked a bay view room, the view was stunning, over the city to Alcatraz. The bed was ultra comfortable, best one we've ever had in a hotel. Location and staff were fantastic. Only thig we can grumble about is the ten dollar per day charge for wifi which when we all rely on it these days seems very expensive

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt August 17-21, 2011 as a family traveling with another family.. We couldn't be happier! The location at Union Square was perfect and was within walking distance of Chinatown and the Powell Street cable car. While each family had issues with our rooms, the managers not only gave credit to our accounts but also moved us to better rooms, and we were very happy. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again!

My son and i stayed here last week on the second half of our vacation to the west coast..It has been recently remodeled in a modern decor.Rooms are a tad small- but typical for a big city- Better than New York anyway! Beds were excellent and Comfortable. THere was a refrigerator and flat screen TV. The sink in the Bathroom was unique and looked like a mini porcelain tub! You got Floor to ceiling windows with Push Button Shades- we were on a higher floor so had great views! The views from those windows are A very nice feature. There is a great bar on the 36th floor and some evenings they have a piano player to entertain you. . The staff here was Great- The concierge staff particularly are knowledgeable, efficient, Friendly and helpful- Particularly Joanna and Ann- they were great! The location of this hotel is very convenient as it is only a block or 2 from the big department stores and only one block up to Powell St to the Cable car stop and Sears Restaurant . You can walk into Chinatown from here too! The Union Square area is the more traditional historic area to stay in when in SanFrancisco as opposed to the other main tourist area which is Fisherman's Wharf. I prefer this area of town over the wharf which is very touristy and crowded.Stay here and visit the wharf on one of the Two Cable Car lines.When you get back in the evening walk over a couple of blocks to Lefty Odouls bar and restaurant for a lively piano bar and Karoake!

This hotel is pricey. Just like most luxury hotels they charge for everything other than your room- wi-fi, parking, in room movies, whatever. If you accept that going into your stay, chances are you will love this hotel! (if not, just look elsewhere, you will not be happy here.) I had a room on the 31st floor with a spectacular view...loved it. If you don't get a room with a water view, take yourself up to the 36th floor and splurge on a cocktail, breakfast, lunch, or even coffee and dessert. Worth whatever it costs - I particularly like breakfast, as you can watch the fog roll in/out over Alcatraz. Service throughout the hotel is courteous and professional...but be aware, this is not a small boutique hotel where everybody knows your name. It is huge hotel, and it may feel a little impersonal, but I thought I paid for excellent service and received it. For me, the location is all - easy to get everywhere, lots of fab shopping, great dining within a few blocks, EZ walk to Chinatown...I just don't think it can be beat. And when it is all said and done, that's what I am paying for - LOCATION. A helpful hint...price a room with access to the Club Lounge. It will cost, but includes breakfast, snacks, hor d'eourves, dessert and coffee, etc. There's even a cappuccino machine! When you add it all up, you may find the extra cost is more than worth it. An added benefit - the club is on the corner of the 32nd floor with 2 full walls of windows...spectacular view!

We stayed here for the Bay to Breakers race. Had a blast! Upgraded to a 1 br. suite (with second bathroom!). It had a lovely long balcony from which we could gaze at the clock tower and Bay Bridge. The standout memory though, was the customer service. In a property that big, it is nice when workers remember your name and greet you as you pull in to valet parking, or are just passing through the lobby. Nice touch! Also, the lobby bar had an excellent menu, and good mixologists, so we ended up spending more time there than we originally planned.

My family and I stayed here as a first stop in our California vacation. The hotel is beautiful, clean and modern. We had two connecting rooms, and with the doors opened felt like a nice family suite. There is a restaurant on the top floor with panoramic views of the city and Alcatraz Island. We had a very nice lunch on the day we arrived, and the prices were reasonable. The breakfast buffet is $22.50, but if you don't feel like splurging there is a Starbucks across the street, a bagel store down the block and Lori's Diner a few blocks away. The gym is clean but small so get there early if you want to secure a treadmill or elliptical. There are a few free weights and weight machines as well.The hotel is in a perfect location. It is within walking distance to a major shopping area, and the trolley. The staff at the front desk was so helpful. They printed walking directions for us to a Chinese restaurant, Fang, which wasn't so great. Also, Santorini, which is within walking distance wasn't good at all either.For a fun tour of the city check out Mr.Toad's Tours. A boat ride to Alcatraz can also be combined with the tour. Don't miss Ghiradelli Square or Fisherman's Wharf. While at the Square have lunch at McCormick & Kulleto's. The restaurant is in a great location and although a bit pricey, very good. At Fisherman's Wharf you can dine at In n' Out Burger, Hard Rock Cafe, Bubba Gump Shrimp and many other options. Also, make sure you make the drive to Muir Woods. Absolutely breathtaking. On the way back stop at Sausalito for some ice cream and a stoll at the marina.

My boyfriend and I just stayed here for 6 nights in the beginning of August 2011. We had a corner room on the 33 floor the view was beautiful and the room was fabulous. We were in a recently renovated room with a king bed. We have absolutely no complaints about the hotel, and heard very little noise at night. The concierge was very helpful and pointed us in the right direction for anything we needed help with. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

The hotel is situated on the corner of Union Square and a minute from Chinatown. It is in the heart of everything. Close to restaraunts, shops, and the transportation (trolley and the cable cars). The rooms are small but very clean. And the views are amazing. Note: currently the end of the lobby beyond the elevators is undergoing construction...so if you are traveling with kids there's NO lobby restroom to use so you have to go back to your room. That was the only thing that annoyed me. And of course they say "oh there's one on the 36 floor" while your kid is ready to pee everywhere. Anyway, service was quick and efficient. They were helpful staff. Of course valet is overpriced but its the same everywhere. $50. You are walking distance to market street where you can pick up a cable car. And Powell is right around the corner where you can pick up the trolley. Shower pressure is low so don't expect the water to be shooting out at you. They provide a blow dryer which is awesome and a refigerator at no extra cost which is totally great for bringing snacks and drinks.I would definetely stay here again when in San Francisco. I would not stay near the Wharf even though it was fun to walk around there best to stay where all the action is in Union Square.

I decided to book the Grand Hyatt after an excellent stay at the Grand Hyatt in NYC. We loved our stay and were really looking forward to the same kind of experience in San Francisco. First impressions were good, the hotel is in a brilliant location and the staff were wonderful. The room was as expected for a 4* hotel; really comfy beds, flat screen TV and a great view. However, after getting unpacked a few things became clear... Firstly, the owner of this particular hotel is clearly intent on squeezing every last cent out of his guests. During our trip we had stayed in much cheaper hotels and motels, and had saved the best for last, or so we thought. We had enjoyed free Internet access and a huge variety of TV channels on our road trip, so imagine our disappointment when we learned that we would be charged $10 per day for Wifi. This was a joke, and how any right-minded person can think it's acceptable to charge for something that is nowadays a basic necessity is quite beyond me. We had to go across the road to Starbucks to use their free Wifi, and it's fair to say that their coffee was a lot cheaper than our hotel room. My girls and I like to stay in our room at night and watch TV, but once again we were hugely disappointed to discover that there were only a very small number of free TV channels available. This is penny-pinching at its very worst, and is definitely not what I would expect from such an esteemed chain of hotels. The safe in the room was not functioning, and the famed American power shower was a feeble dribble. The room had been recently renovated and I have no idea why a room on the 18th floor cannot get decent water pressure, especially when every fitting is brand new. They did send up an engineer to look at the shower, but even after he'd tinkered the shower was still feeble. I made my disappointment known to the hotel management and the lady in charge of guest services was a delight. She was most apologetic but it was clear that the owner of this particular Hyatt does not think it necessary to offer guests the same standard of amenities that other hotels in the chain enjoy.In conclusion, I would like to commend the hotel's staff as they were faultless, but would also like to voice my sadness that what should have been a memorable stay in a luxury hotel was spoiled by the miserly attitude of the owners.This stay has put me off staying at a Hyatt hotel in future, which is really sad.

Beds were great..... so comfortable.Under construction? - I knew this beforehand and was a bit worried, we never even saw a glimpse of evidence! Fantastic location - able to walk everywhere: Coit Tower, Fishermans' Wharf, Ghiradelli, China Town, Union Square, and Starbucks right across the street. THAT was awesome!Our service was excellent - the bell hop, the staff, the roomservice, and consierge - all were so helpful and kind.And the main thing? It was completely CLEAN and COMFY!
On Union Square, amazing location, good service, great room, wonderful view from the restaurant. I don't have anything else to say but RECOMMENDED! Much better than Westin St Francis. ;)

The restaurant views from the 36th floor were aweome. The food and menu was also very good. The room was very comfortable except the shower was alittle week. The sheets were great the beds were very comfortable. The room decor was very contempory.The location was great. We were able to walk to China town within a few blocks, we walked to the Embarcadero and climbed Coit tower on the way. We did lots of San Francisco on foot and it was great.Grammy Sharon
Really nice place to stay. The service couldn't have been better. Very close to Union Square.

It's difficult to be objective about a hotel that takes your booking, takes your money and then decides to give your room to someone else because you don't check in until later than they might expect.The stay at the Grand Hyatt was part of a pacy business trip covering a lot of the west coast of the US, and we had only a single night's stay booked there. We expected to be arriving there late in the day from LA, staying overnight and then moving on to Seattle on the following night. Given the activity during this trip a good night's sleep was essential so we didn't scrimp on hotel costs.We arrived at the Hyatt shortly before 11pm and were told that the hotel had no rooms left. We pointed out that we had booked - and had confirmations for - three rooms. The staff apologised for "a mix up" when it was very clear that they had decided we were going to be no-shows and thus sold our rooms on again. As you can imagine this was far from ideal given the time of night and the need for us to be away again the following day.After a fair amount of heated discussion we were found three rooms, all much less than we'd paid for, and all with sofa beds rather than actual beds. We were in no real position to turn these down and while the Hyatt promised to refund our credit cards with the difference in price, the fact is that this is a pretty shoddy business practise all round.Apologies were made, but it really is not good enough and not what one would expect from a hotel with the reputation of the Hyatt.

Just returned from the Grand Hyatt San Francisco, Aug. 13. First impression...not great as the lobby is small and underwhelming. Not much room to sit if waiting to meet ppl. Loved the fact that Hyatt guarantees connecting rooms with their "family plan" and a discount on the 2nd room to boot!! Rooms were small, but nicely done. Beds oh-so-comfortable! Actually that was the best thing about the hotel. Had brunch upstairs 4 out of the 7 days there with my family. Ok...nothing great. Wait staff very friendly along with the concierges and doormen. Starbucks everywhere as the location was great for shopping and coffee! We did not rent a car instead choose to walk, cab it or take some form of public transportation. Overall a very good hotel.

Stayed here for a family trip out to San Fran. Location is great, the service team was wonderful and took care of all our needs quickly and effectively. The room we received (upgraded due to diamond status) was great. Newly renovated, clean, well decorated, great electronic and room features and fantastic bed. The breakfast upstairs was delicious and the lounge was nice as well (was a bit small due to the usual lounge under construction currently). Would recommend and would go again. Was only about 4 blocks or so from subway station and was an easy walk even with luggage. Area was safe as well. We got the stay at our corporate rate so was very afforable.

Stayed here for three nights. Very modern room that had been renovated. As the room was on the third floor there was alot of street noise and no view. The view from the restaurant was amazing. We found the staff to be more than willing to go out of the way to help you. Great hotel We will be back, just next time asking for a high floor.

We stayed here for 3 nights and although the room was small it was clean and comfortable and the location was superb. The staff were very welcoming and the concierges were really helpful and their recommendations were fabulous. The breakfast was buffet style hot or cold with a view of the city which was breath taking. Can highly recommend the hop on/off bus suggested by the hotel and take a cable car ride from Union Square down to Fishermans Wharf. The hotel is next door to the Levis flagship store on Union Square so you can't get closer than that and the Westfield shopping centre is a couple of mins walk.

We stayed at the Hyatt while we were attending a conference in San Francisco. We liked the location in Union Square, near to where we wanted to be. The rooms were also very nice and the staff was good.

The dark, cramped lobby of this hotel makes an underwhelming impression, as does the the lackluster service. It took several minutes for someone at the front desk to provide me with a replacement key, and she didn't acknowledge my obvious impatience. And the next morning at a breakfast with colleagues, my food came about five minutes after everyone else's, with no explanation or acknowledgment. The breakfast itself? Average.So if you're on a business trip, on a tight schedule and used to polished service, this isn't going to be your top choice. Not surprisingly, most of the guests looked like families on vacation, and price was probably a bigger consideration for them.The rooms are quiet and nicely redone--although my mattress had a pronounced sag on one side. There's free wi-fi. And the view from the restaurant on the 36th floor is great.

We stayed here for two nights. Everyone from the front desk to the balers to the concierge were incredibly helpful. The highlight of our stay was the breakfast buffet both mornings. The selection of food items was magnificent and the taste exceptional! However, it was the service we received from our waiter Danny that made the time special. He waited on us the first morning and was especially attentive. Danny asked us how long we were staying so he knew when we arrived the next morning that we were anxious to get to Yosemite. He made sure that our food arrived quickly as well as providing to go cups for our coffee! Since we were traveling with our three boys, I booked connecting rooms for a FANTASTIC price. It was heaven having the extra space. If only there was free wi fi as well.

Cannot beat the location, just off Union Square! The front desk upon check-in was efficient but not too friendly or welcoming (late evening staff). The front desk upon departure was very friendly (daytime). So, I guess it depends upon the individual. The rooms are modern and comfortable. The beds are very comfortable and we slept very well while staying here for 4 nights. The rooms are clean and well maintained which you would expect for a Hyatt. The only thing we did not like was the fairly sizable gap under the room door. We could hear everything in the hallway due to this. So, we put a blanket across the bottom of the door and it was ok then.We had a reasonable corporate rate so it made this very good value for us. Overall this hotel was great. I would definitely stay here again.

the location of the best ,right in the center of Union Square which is perfect to who likes to shopping. lots of shops around. view of the restaurants also excellent.staffs was friendly ,tried to help

After pouring over Tripadvisor reviews, I was torn between several hotels. I eventually chose the Grand Hyatt (due to conversing with concierge Susan) and I feel we definitely made an excellent choice. Our room was on the 29th floor overlooking the bay and Alcatraz. The views were incredible and the three days we stayed were clearer than normal, so we really had beautiful scenery. The beds were comfortable, and we liked the renovations made to the room/bathroom with the oversided sink. Location to everywhere we wanted to go: trolley cars, shopping, Starbucks, Chinatown, etc. was very convenient! The conceirge Joanne was exceptional and got us everywhere we needed to go easily! We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Location and view was great, however the room had uncomfortable chairs to sit on. Self parking was a pain as the communication between the garage and hotel forced me to go back and forth across the street a few times. There is nothing fancy about the rooms, small, average design, But great location. We walked all over the city and this is a great central location to be at.

Just completed the room renovation so room is brand new. But lobby was so old, and no security. Anybody can jump in to the elevator. Standard room only comes with one chair by the work table, no other place to sit other than the beds. If the rates are good I would stay here again but if the rates are higher I would rather be Intercontinental SF or St.Regis.

I chose to stay at the Grand Hyatt San Francisco because of the reviews on TripAdvisor. I also chose it because it had a shuttle bus running from the hotel to the trade show I was going to at Moscone Center. The hotel is contemporary and modern. The staff was friendly and helpful. What I like about the hotel was its location. It was walking distance to a lot of shopping centers, restaurants and around Union Square. It was close to Chinatown. I only had three minor problems while at this hotel. The first was that they put us at a handicap room. When I questioned them about it they stated that the room had good views. But it was just odd that they did this considering I did not request for a handicap room. I know for a fact that there were other rooms available that also had good views. Needless to say I still accepted it as the room was comfortable and clean. My second issue was the air conditioner unit. When I arrived it was not working. An engineer came to fix it but when he left it did not work again. The second time he came it finally worked. However, the unit made some noises which kept my partner up one night. Third, was the elevator. There was a total of six elevators yet the wait time was horrendous. There was one time I was at the lobby waiting for a good five minutes.But overall the hotel was great. What I like most about the hotel was the location, the views, the clean/contemporary look/feel, the comfortable bed, the exercise room, the toiletries (shampoo/soap has a great scent), room service, and the breakfast buffet.The parking was $36 self-park and $55 valet - per day. Knowing that it was San Francisco, I actually expected the high price set for parking. Make sure you bring walking shoes as you will surely walk around this beautiful city.

This hotel is our destination hotel in San Francisco. It is situated right on Union Square, within easy walking distance of Chinatown, shopping, the cable car and great restaurants. We believe that this is the best location in the city. In addition to the location, the Hyatt has the best bar in San Francisco---overlooking the Golden Gate and Alcatraz, I believe only available on the Club level.

Even though the hotel is in the midst of renovation, it is still a wonderful place. Try to get the restaurant view on the top before they, sadly, move it to the mezzanine. Ask for a high floor, the views are spectacular!

Located in downtown San Francisco, ideal place. Near Powell cable car line, at the base of Nob Hill.Unimpressed with lobby, rooms are small. Bathrooms are adequate.Good breakfast upstairs with amazing views. Service is as expected for this class of hotel. Prepared to pay over $300/night.

We had problems nearly every time trying to use the hotel elevator. We were on the 7th floor and by the time the elevator reached us 85% of the time it was already full (during normal hours) and it took usually around 7 minutes of waiting just to show up. Most of the time we just trekked on down the stairs, but they really should have a better system. Maybe they stop using some of the elevators during the weekdays, but it was ridiculous.I found the beds to be very comfortable! The bathrooms are odd and there is a sliding door that never really closes all the way so you can hear everything out in the bedroom if you know what I mean. The location is excellent. There is a Starbucks right across the street, Union Square, Chinatown and North Beach are all within walking distance. Be careful. The hotel charges $56 a day for parking. We just used the Sutter Stockton garage on the corner and it ended up averaging out at $21 a day.

My husband and I stayed for five nights and it was wonderful. We used the AAA rate which included breakfast. Our room was on the 23rd floor and we had a fantastic view of Coit Tower and Alcatraz. Breakfast on the 36th floor every morning was excellent and you could get french toast, waffles, or eggs to order in addition to the buffet. The room had been recently refurbished and it was very modern with wonderful shades that could be raised or lowered from the bed. But the best part was the wonderful staff: front desk, bellman, housekeeping, waiters, and the concierge desk. Two in particular, Joanne and I believe Lisa, were not just helpful, but also very patient in providing daily maps outlining the transit options. We will definitely be back!

I was in San Francisco for another business trip and decided to try a different Hyatt in SF (instead of Hyatt Regency San Francisco by Embarcadero Center). The Grand Hyatt was right at Union Sqaure and closed to everything - shopping, food, cable car and yes.... financial district. Folks at the front desk was very helpful and the checkin was very fast.

We stayed here three nights during the last weekend in July and had adjoining rooms for our party of four. The room had a fantastic view which was a great start. The problem was the housekeeping and the staff in general. The housekeeping started knocking on doors at 8am on a Saturday and Sunday morning to see if they could clean the room. 8AM !! on a weekend!On day we put the privacy out to keep them from knocking and then they didn't clean the rooms at all. For the price and the hype, I expected better staff.

The Hyatt was recently refurbished and the rooms are very comfortable. Everyone was smiley and extremely helpful. The views from the rooms are wonderful and we were fortunate enough to overlook Union Square. They also provide a fridge in the room as well as coffee facilities. They charge for wifi.The location is in the centre of everything. We had breakfast in the dining room which is on the thirty something floor where we again were fortunate enough to have a table by the window. The service,by George, was impeccable and made breakfast that much more enjoyable. No point in going out for breakfast when it is this good with this view where you are! The only disappoinment is the bathroom where the towels and toiletries are not particularly good. Of course we will stay there again!

My fiance and I stayed here for 2 nights, the location is right next to Union Square (only less than 1 block from Macys. It's a block from Chinatown in a very lively area. This hotel recently underwent a $38million renovation project and the rooms has flat screen TVs, contemporary designed rooms. It's a decent size for being in the city, bathroom is spacious. Self parking structure is very convenient just right across the street, it's about $38 i think. it's expensive but parking in SF is expensive no matter where you go. The bed is comfortable as we had great night sleep. Room is nice and clean. i would come back and stay here again.
Very nice place, close to lots of amenities, family friendly.Even on 16 fl can hear some street noise, if you have the City view.

The Grand Hyatt has an awesome location, right by all of the shops and restaraunts. The area was very safe and I could get everywhere I needed by car. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, as far as concierges go one was awesome and one didn't really help me much so if you don't get the answers you want, go back and try again when someone else is working.Rooms were very nice, roomy, and clean. Nice small touches, like free tooth paste in the room! Doesn't seem like a big deal, but it was important to me since I forgot mine! My only complaint about the room was the shower which had extremely low water pressure. If you're on a low floor, chances are you won't have a view of anything but the building next door but if you go up to the upper floors the views are amazing. The work out center was extremely nice with lots of equipment to choose from and had by far the best view I've ever seen from a gym. I wanted to keep going back to work out just for the view! We only ate at the hotel once (for breakfast), we ate the buffet since we were in a hurry but it was over priced and not that good. French toast was tasty though, and again... the view was worth it. Even if you just get a snack or a drink, make sure you go up there! I took some amazing pictures through the windows (turn off your flash), and no one would ever know that I took them from inside the building.

I had stayed there 6 days. Near all. Shops, restaurants, transport. It was a great location.Safe. I had breakfast included. excellent. Hotel`s staff great. Value very reasonable. I surely recomend this hotel.

I stayed at Grand Hyatt with a group of friends for four nights in June.... really enjoyed the hotel and all SF has to offer. The rooms are clean and modern, check in was a breeze... loved the salt water taffy at the front desk- nice touch! We had a little mishap with the swipe system on our door- we were locked out of our room completely and it took several maintenance men to fix the problem. Despite the inconvenience they offered us another room to use while we could not get in ours and had the problem fixed in about a half hour. Was grumpy about that after a tiring full day of tours but they did their best to resolve the problem quickly and professionally. The top level lounge offered beautiful views and some tasty appetizers. The concierge was very helpful when asked for advice on places to eat or best means of transportation. Overall I really enjoyed this hotel, the location is fantastic and with the new upgrades its a very comfortable, enjoyable place to stay while visiting beautiful San Francisco!
Centrally located, great room with mini refrigerator and wonderful views.We also dined in the Grand View restaurant and the food was good and the views were 'grand'.

This hotel has the most amazing views of San Francisco. The top floor bar and restaurant is a must see. Room are very nice and big enough. Service was also more than decent. Very important to business travelers, internet connection. No issues there either. I would most certainly book this hotel again.

I have stayed at 3 different properties at Union Square and the Grand Hyatt has been my favorite in the past. And, now that they are nearly complete on amazing renovations, they are over the top. They have great windows, basically floor to ceiling, so the city/bay views are fantastic. And, with the recently redone rooms, the comfort and ambience is spectacular and many push button features including curtains, lights, etc. I highly recommend this hotel as it has the typical Hyatt courtesies, plus with the new renovation, it is just the best. Am staying again at the end of September.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt during the week of July 18, 2011. The room was great and was decorated with modern yet comfortable furnishings. The bathroom had this really funky looking vessell sink. The only thing was the sink was a bit shallow and I would splash water everywhere when using it.The hotel location was right in the midst of some really great shopping and was within about a mile to a mile and a half to the water front. We walked to the waterfront a couple of times. It was a good and easy walk but be prepared for it to be chilly in the evening.The only drawback to the stay was on our arrival, the bellman was a bit aggressive in trying to set expectations about how long it takes to get a taxi. My co-worker and I had just arrived and was trying to pay our taxi driver, get our stuff out of the car and figure out how much time we had before our first meeting. I assume that the bellman was trying to be helpful and set expectations but he didn't allow us to get out of the cab good before he began bombarding us with the drawbacks of the taxi situation in San Francisco.We were guests of the hotel when a pretty major union was picketing. Though I support the picketers, I do have to commend the hotel lobby and bellman staff for how they tried to make the hotel guests feel safe, secure and avoid the picket as much as possible. On the day of the picket, they were all organized, in large numbers and escorted guests from the curb to the elevators. They definitely took extra care noting the inconvenience to the guests but remained calm and in control.I would definitely stay there again and would recommend this hotel. Good price and service.

Great hotel for business stay - close proximity to everything, expansive conference facilities. Rooms are clean, pleasantly-appointed and well-proportioned. The concierge is very efficient and courteous. The only wrinkle (apart from my pet peeve of SF hotels blocking the free city-provided Wi-Fi access, which I think is ridiculous) is the noise that the entire structure was emanating. According to the hotel management, due to high winds, many buildings creak in the same way. It might be true, but when you're on the 6th floor of a modern hotel building, and it sounds like you're on deck of a Flying Dutchman, it is bound to scare the Bejaysus out of ya. I can only gasp and guess what the noise was for the higher-floor guests.

I highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the Union Square area.
