It's location has easy access to transportation to cable cars or street cars (2 - 4 blocks walking) We were able to check in early which made our arrival very nice. The hotel is decorated in a very simple classy style. The hotel desk help and all around personnel were very pleasant. Room size was okay and the view (12th floor) was okay. We could see a peek of the bay in the distance. We were never disturbed by hearing other hotel guests in other rooms. I would have thought we were the only ones on our floor if I didn't see the used food service trays outside. Being on the 12th floor we did still hear a lot of the street traffic noise (all night). Room was very clean. During our stay there, the Hyatt hotel cleaning staff had a demonstration outside the hotel one afternoon. We were worried that we could not enter the hotel. I would have expected the hotel to offer us some kind of discount in hotel bill or restaurant to help assuage the situation, but did not. As others have reported the view from the 36th floor is pretty incredible. You do have to pick a time of day though when the fog has not rolled in tho! Also there is not a lobby area where you can sit and relax. The hotel has close proximity to many many restaurants. Most are a bit pricey but we were able to find some them that were more moderately priced.

We rented a car traffic was very busy they like to honk a lot!. There's not much time to make right turns due to all the pedestrians. We will definitely take taxis next time or ride the trolleys. Mass transist system is convenient to the hotel.

As frequent SF visitors we have passed this hotel numerous times and finally decided to give it a try. We were so pleased!! The newly renovated room was beautiful, unusual and the bed was so-o comfortable. Everyone at the holel could not have been more accommodating. Housekeeping did an outstanding job and we were never inconvenienced. We had one minor problem which was handled quickly and to our satisfaction. This hotel has the best location for what we enjoy doing when in San Francisco (and it's not shopping). We are so glad we stayed here and look forward to returning.

The room was fully renovated and absolutely immaculate and gorgeous. We had a King size bed that was very comfortable. We were on the 7th floor and had no street noise. We ate breakfast and lunch in the restaurant at the top of the hotel, it was delicious with a beautiful view of the city. The concierge was very helpful and suggested several great places to eat within walking distance. We took a double decker bus tour out to the Golden Gate Bridge which was excellent and reasonably priced. We are Platinum members so there was no charge for the internet service, if you are not in Hyatt's loyalty program, then sign up, it is free. This is our third time staying at this hotel and we have never been disappointed.

The hotel is all renovated and the rooms are very clean and well maintained. The hotel is by Union Square so it is create for transportation and dining etc. We were travelling as a family of 4 and found that the storage space was limited. The space that would typically be used as drawers for clothing were replaced with a fridge and a safe. I was also suprised how noisy the hotel was. You could hear the movement in the hall and outside the window. The internet was sooo slow. We called for assistance and someone even came to our room but they could not make it any faster. The service was great. All staff were very friendly and provided great service. So overall great room and location but a few things I would change.

Excellent location! Stayed here on a long labor day weekend back in 2006 but still remember the great location of this hotel! Nice room, clean and comfortable bed. It looks like more of a business hotel but still a great hotel for a stay in San Francisco. Right in Union Square and walking distance to so much including good shopping, trolley ride, Chinatown, etc. Only problem we had was as soon as we checked in, we went up to our room and were laying on the bed when one of the staff came into our hotel room on accident. Guess they didn't know anyone was in there?

2 day July stay was very nice-well appointed rooms-brand new. Clean, quiet, state of the art. Bar on 35th floor fantastic-lively, fun! Views are crazy good.Bell staff most helpful. Plenty of reasons to return again

we were in SFO for the 4th of July wknd and stayed the grand hyatt for 3 nights. locaion was great, central location. we took the bart train from the airport to the powell st station and the hotel was a 10 min walk from there ( 4 blocks). we could also walk to Coit tower (through china town and north beach) and to fishermans warf. lots of great restaurants in the neighbourhood too. the grand view restaurant on the 36th floor has great views of SF sky line, alcatraz and city. The rooms we stayed in were the updated/new rooms and was very comfortable and contemporary. fast internet connection helped as well. all in all great stay and will repeat at this hotel again.

Definately would return and enjoyed the entire experience.There was an initial problem finding availability for the type of room reserved, but the front desk clerk was most accommadating by providing a complimentary breakfast each morning. Staff members were professional, curtious, and ready to help right away if needed.The room was well appointed, very clean, modern, and had wonderful mattresses and linens. The view from the room was great but the view from the 36th floor restaurant was spectacular, especially at sunset. The hotel was centrally located at Union Square and not far from public transportation, but a tip for catching a cab.... start early... it's not easy to get a cab like in other cities.

My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a weekend getaway to San Francisco. We loved it! The location was terrific. It's right in the heart of the shopping area, it's surrounded by great restaurants and Chinatown is just a few blocks away. We had considered staying near Fisherman's wharf and after seeing the area, I'm so glad we didn't. The rooms looked newly renovated and he hotel was very clean We would definitely recommend the Grand Hyatt.

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt San Fran last week for our wedding anniversary, and loved every minute of it. When we arrived, we were able to quickly check in. (favorite part of the front desk was the salt water taffy mints that i reguarly helped myself to!!!!) We had a lovely freshly rennovated king sized room on the 16th floor. Amazing bed! The only thing I didnt like in the hotel room was the smell of the hand soap, shampoo, and conditioner, but i had some of my own, so if you are particular, bring your own supplies! The concerge staff was 100% amazing in helping us make our plans.... one was nicer than the next in helping us with whatever questions we had. The other great thing about this hotel is the location..... steps away from wonerful shopping stores, the MUNI (bus and underground) and cable cars. A few blocks away and you stumble into Chinatown. i felt very safe here in the Union Square area...... can't say that about other "districts" or neighborhoods we visited. There was nothing lavish about this hotel, but it just meet all of my needs of being in a great loaction, being super clean, and having insanely nice people helping me. But beware, dont bother to ask for an upgrade if you book your stay through any site other than their own. My husband emailed someone before we left (trying to make our trip a little more special) and was, in my opinion, rather rudely denied because we booked through Travelocity. It just kinda made me feel "second-class". I almost would have prefered being lied to that no rooms were available. So then when we did check in, i felt like there was a big mark by our name that said "discount-website trash checking in" Alright, I dramatize a little. I just needed to get that off my chest. I would still stay here again, and truely suggest you do to, because again: it's in the perfect location, the place is immaculately clean, and the concerge staff were amazing. A few quick thoughts on San Fran in general..... it's cold! I guess especially in July/August.... so bring a jacket and pants! The sun is brutal and will burn you instantaneusly, so wear your sunscreen and wear a hat! The city is a bunch of wicked steep hills, so bring and wear the most comfortably shoes you have---- fashion be damned, those hills are evil! Food is super expensive and really not that good. Public transportation is cheaper in San Fran than Chicago- even taxi's! Bus fare is 2 bucks and it's good for 2 hours! Cable cars are a rip off 6 bucks for one ride, but most of the time they never ask you for money! I highly reccomend a hop on hop off bus tour when you first get there to get your bearings. Again, beware: when you cross over the Golden Gate Bridge, IT WILL BE COLD! And finally, if you are looking for a tour of Sonoma and the Wine country, please take the GREEN DREAMS TOUR with Ellie, it's the best.Sorry this is so long, and I really hope this helps someone. Please stay at the Grand Hyatt, it was a very nice clean safe place to stay!

This is the second time I've stayed here, and the first since the guestrooms were renovated. I got a great rate and was overall quite pleased with my experience. Pluses: Fabulously comfortable bed. Floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking Union Square. Nice 24-hour fitness room, immaculately maintained and with top-notch cardio equipment. Friendly and helpful staff, including concierges, front desk, doormen. Convenient location in Union Square, near cable cars, shopping, Theater District, North Beach, etc.Minuses: I could hear a bit of hammering where they were doing some work. But it wasn't too loud. Bathrobes: A hotel of this calibre should provide bathrobes, as well as shower caps. Not crazy about the Portico bath amenities - don't like the fragrance, but no big deal. And, of course, the usual gripe: They shouldn't charge for Wi-Fi!
The only issue We had is the wifi is not free ?!?! Really. ??? Ok but we loved it

The wonderful room with breath-taking views made our recent trip to SF a special one! The newly remodeled rooms with elegant, modern furnishings were spectacular. The gorgeously appointed bathroom with top-of-the-line fixtures and stone was extravagant! We booked through AAA, and a full breakfast was included with our stay (a delicious deal). The hotel is located within walking distance to the underground, Chinatown and close by shopping. After an exhausting day of business, movies, drinks AND a Giant's game, we dropped into a deep sleep in the decadent bed. Slept soundly and comfortably. Would definately recommend staying here!

We had a pleasant one night stay here. It's been renovated recently, which is nice, but I can see how for some, the smell of new paint and decor might be bothersome. If you are sensitive to that, wait a while to stay here! I absolutely loved the mini-bathtub sink, as I find that sinks at most hotels are too small. Wifi is available in the room, but I believe it's USD10.00. The good thing is that there's a Starbucks right across from the hotel, so you could go there.

Union Square is a great location to use a home base for a stay in San Francisco! We asked for, and got, a high level room (25th floor, out of 36, not bad), and although it was a west looking view, it was very nice! The room itself was redone and very modern! A bit of a negative was how thin the walls seemed to be ... the people in the next room sounded like they were actually in our room ... not what you'd expect from a high-end hotel.I was very impressed by the conceirge service! We hadn't been to San Francisco for many years and needed some direction with local restaurants and sights. Joanna Husk (Concierge and Member of Les Clefs d'Or USA Ltd.) was possibly the best conceirge I've ever dealt with. She took the time to understand what we were interested in and provided us with maps, site-seeing suggestions, and an extensive list of restaurants within walking distance ... then she gave us specific recommendations to meet our interests. It's this type of service that makes you want to come back to a hotel!As far as location, it was ideal. Easy to walk just about anywhere, as long as you have the time and stamina, up and down the hills! We walked to Nob Hill, Telegraph Hill, Fisherman's Wharf, and Ghiradelli Square. A beautiful city!!One of the great features of the hotel is Grandviews restaurant, on the 36th floor. I probably wouldn't recommend it for dinner, but what a great view for breakfast!!! Our room rate included breakfast for 2 each day (anything you want) ... all you have to pay for is the tip ... a good deal!Parking is another issue, but I'd recommend passing on the valet parking (way overpriced!) and park at the garage on the opposite corner of Stockton and Sutter streets ... right across from the hotel. Although it wasn't cheep, it was very convenient and much less than valet. We spent a day over in Golden Gate Park, and then over to the Golden Gate Bridge (which are too far to walk) and it was great to have the car accessable.I know it's still "par for the course" at high-end hotels, but why do they charge for internet service? I'd highly recommend that they make this a free service, just like they do at most lower level and business hotels!All in all a very pleasureable experience!

I've stayed here a few times and every time was a great experience. Great location and everything in the hotel is up to date and modern. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated. The gym is spacious with modern equipment. The price is obviously a little high, but they sometimes have good deals even during peak season.

The staff treated you like you were at the Ritz Carlton! Exceptional customer service. Would highly recommend staying there. Rooms have recently been redone--beautiful with beautiful views of the city and bay....Again, the staff went out of their way to may our stay exceptional!! Only thing I would change is they need to offer free internet!!

I stayed in a newly refurbished room. Very well appointed.The concierge service at this hotel was wonderful. Like a private guide looking after your every need. Once the teamunderstood what experiences I was looking for, they never missed the mark. Restaurant recommendations and bookings in particular.Thanks team, I'll be back.

Hyatt Grand is a great hotel if you want to stay right in the heart of SF. Steps away from Union Square...you can't beat the location.Service was great during my stay. Rooms seem recently renovated and were very nice. The only complaint was you could hear a bit of street noise. All in All a great place to stay in SF.

Highly recommend this hotel for a San Fransisco Stay. Great location for shopping, restaurants and site seeing. Our room was newly renovated and very clean. All of the staff from the Valet to the Housekeeping Staff was very helpful.

The Grand Hyatt hotel rooms have been newly renovated. The concierge was so helpful and nice! The cleaning staff was also nice. Although we had to call maintenance 3 separate times for a few plumbing issues, it didn't change our views of the hotel. Even the maintenance men were as nice as could be! Check in and out was a breeze. It's located in the heart of Union Square with a Walgreen's around the corner for anything you may need or forgotten. Restaurants & shopping galore. Easy walk to cable cars & public transportation. Room was elegant. Loved it!!! We stayed a week and it was barely enough time to see everything we wanted to. Great family vacation with teens & young adults.

My wife and I spent two nights at this hotel and enjoyed our stay. Location was convenient within walking distance of shopping, restaurants and the Muni and BART. The staff was friendly and accomodating from the moment we exited our car to check in as the valet moved our car out of traffic. The check-in process was smooth and kiosks were available to issue room keys if you check in online. We checked out online due to an early flight and the process was also very easy. Room was clean and decorated with contemporary flair. The AC was nice since the temp reached 86 during our trip. We also enjoyed the 35th floor exercise facility. Good cardio equipment and a great view.

A great stay from the moment we arrived. Doormen were so happy and polite, always had time to chat.Checkin was fast and professional, as we were early were given an upgrade to a room on a higher level, wow the view was amazing. Looking down to union square or out to the Golden Gate Bridge it never ceased to amaze. The room wa small but very nicely appointed and comfortable and the location for walkig around was brilliant. The restaurant on the top floor at night was brilliant, had to be one of the best views in the city. Gym was good as well.

The Grand Hyatt is a good hotel in an excellent location just off Union Square, and walking distance from Chinatown. The Continental Breakfast was excellent and (for a major city centre0 not too expensive, and the view from the top floor restaurant spectacular. We stayed in a refurbished room which looked splendid, but for a couple staying more than one night it lacked storage space (drawers particularly) and the bathroom had a large elongated basin ( could have bathed a small baby) which detracted from space for toiletries etc. Also there was nowhere to hang towels, making the "green" admonishment to reuse towels unworkable - no good leaving them in a soggy heap!Useful facility to print boarding passes for onward flights in the lobby.

couple of nights stay here. room fairly standard chain type placeroom clean and tidy ok view, not great.comfy bed and very quiet hotel.the bar at the top of the hotel was great and had great views and better cocktails!staff were very friendly.excellent location just off union square and with the rate we got which worked out at about Â£85 a night, fantastic value.

Took a few rooms out during the busy season mid-June with some friends. I wanted to give this hotel 4 stars but just couldn't justify it on a few factors. See below:PROS- Superb location at Union Square- Renovated rooms nice quality, modern fitouts- Excellent concierges- Good housekeeping staff- Reasonable prompt responses to service callsCONS- Takes some work to get bell hops to help with bags (they need to staff more for such a busy hotel)- Checkin at front desk had a long wait and was slow (again, they need to staff more)- Breakfast buffet is expensive and is not good value for what you get- Parking is absurdly priced- Internet is an extra $10/day when it should be complimentary- Room service menu is minimalBottom line is that this hotel has great potential given it's superb Union Square location and newly renovated rooms which bring the facility up to what you expect from a flagship Grand Hyatt property in San Fran. However, I had difficulty feeling I was getting good value for money given all the extras they charge for and some of the noticable shortcomings as listed above.

My business partner and I were in San Francisco for a business conference this month. Though the event was held at the Westin Market, we decided to try out the Grand Hyatt a few blocks away.We couldn't have been happier with the experience. We got an AAA rate that included breakfast, which was quite a steal, as the hotel restaurant on the 36th floor is very impressive. The breakfast buffet was slightly above average, nothing to write home about but perfectly adequate.Upon check-in, make sure to request a renovated room. From the looks of it, they're almost done with the upgrades, but parts of the hotel are still out of service. Our room was great with a nice view of the Transamerica Pyramid and surrounding areas.Note to those who care: The club is currently out of service for renovations.This hotel does charge for internet, just like every other property in its class in San Francisco. Acting shocked about it won't change anything. ;-)

The hotel was clean, modern and had great views. The location cannot be beat if you're looking to be close to Union Square, Chinatown and the action of the City life. The front desk staff was pleasant and kind... but there was a wait of about 5-10 minutes at both check-in and check-out. The front desk agents were spot on and apologized for the wait and took care of us very efficiently and with great service.My only real disappointment came at the concierge desk. It was very, very busy and after a couple of unsuccessful calls and a 10 minute wait at the desk, I was a little disappointed in the service and attention (that I did not end up with) for a simple question. Thankfully, I'm pretty familiar with the City and it was only an inconvenience, not something that ruined our trip by any means. I found another way to get the information elsewhere. All in all, it was a nice stay.
Great location, customer service and clean. I think I will continue to stay at the Grand Hyatt.

I stayed June 5th, 2011, in a King room on the 17th floor. Everything was brand new, clean, and gorgeous. Super comfy bed, great lighting options on the headboard, big TV, good chairs. Loved the curtains, pillows, white ginger soaps. I would certainly return should I need to spend time in San Francisco.Only gripes: Shower water-pressure a little feeble, breakfast not included, and I resent paying a dollar to make a land-line phone call. Oh, and leave your car at home. Parking charges downtown are exorbitant.

I stayed for 5 nights at the hotel. I travel to SFO three times a year staying nomally at Westin St. Francis or Sir Francis Drake. And will return to one of those going forward. The room was very old..the furniture was scrathed up. The TV was archaic. The construction noise started each moring at 630a. I travel frequently and the bed was not good at all. I ended up with a sore neck which never happens even at selective service hotels.The hotel service was adequate. There is no gift shop which then requires you exit hotel to Walgreens.I was charged for an upgraded room post my hotel stay but they did refund the second charge when I called.Room service was fine.

I stayed here for two nights and found this to be an ideal base during my trip to San Francisco. Even though it is a big hotel, check-in was done in under 5 minutes thanks to the automated kiosk! My room was big for a city hotel with a great view of downtown (although I had asked for a bay view..I guess the tiny sliver of water out towards Oakland was supposed to count). The bed was super comfortable and the room had a nice size flat screen TV, comfy lounge chair and ample desk space for laptop etc. There was also a mini-fridge which was great for storing drinks and snacks. The bathroom was very clean and everything worked well in there. I am not a huge fan of the sliding doors that seem to be so popular now - I know they save space, but I prefer more privacy... Room service was quick and really tasty. I also appreciated that all staff at the hotel referred to me by name. All of them from the housekeeping staff to the front desk were very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is great - smack dab in Union Square where you can find plenty of breakfast spots and of course tons of shopping. BART stations, cable cars, taxis are easy to reach for when you want to explore other parts of the city. Definitely a great spot and would recommend it to anyone staying in San Francisco who wants a classy but not snobby place to stay.

We stayed here because we got a great deal on the room but there not really much else to this hotel. This is a four star hotel thats' standard rooms are tiny, beds are small and not all that comfortable and the front desk doesn't make you feel all that welcome. I guess it was the rate I got, but it's still money isn't it? They offer absolutely nothing complimentary not even internet service, which I think is ridiculous. You even have to pay to use the business center. The hotel is in a decent location with many fine places to eat within walking distance. The support staff was good and the concierge was great, especially Liz. But if this is a four star hotel, I'll stay with the two and three star locales because at least they respect the money your spending and offer you some extras besides a great looking lobby. Not recommended.

While searching on various OTAs for a place to stay over Memorial Day weekend, I chanced upon a 48hr sale advertised by the Grand Hyatt, and thought it was worth a try. My husband and I arrived earlier than normal check-in time and were prepared to have our bag stored prior to receiving a room key; but not only was the room ready, our request for a higher floor had been granted. Furthermore, the front desk associate presented us with a couple of room options to make sure we received what we truly wanted. The room was absolutely stunning, very cosmopolitan, very chic. Totally adored the contemporary decor and furnishings that capture a loft-style, urban residence luxury. Appreciated the chic features like the window shade and personal bedside reading lights. The Grandviews Lounge has a wonderful ambiance, great music, and exudes serenity despite it being full. The door/bell staff were most pleasant and very attentive, always made sure we were comfortable and checked if we needed assistance. We're glad to have found a favorite place to stay in Union Square. Keep up the great work!

Very updated rooms in this hotel. The room darkens with an electric shade. Hardwood flooring and very modern light fixtures. The customer care provided from the bell staff to the front desk shows that they are well trained and these employees like their job!!.Noise is a problem in the middle of the city with all the horns and sirens....but it is San Francisco.

We picked this hotel because it was reasonably priced and in a good location. We chose a Club Room because of the free breakfast and the nice ambiance. Anyway, after we reserved the room, we found out the hotel was undergoing renovation and the club level rooms weren't renovated yet. So we chose to stay in a renovated regular room. The bed was very comfortable. However, the new decor was beautiful -- very modern but a little cold -- just not my style. Great TV and absolutely enough plugs (very important to me for charging cell phone/laptop/etc.) The "club room" was set up in a regular room -- good choices and good service, but it was really a disappointment. This was a beginning of a special vacation from us -- we should have chosen better. Also, some of the halls had a terrible turpentine (?) smell -- from paint? Anyway, I won't stay there again.

Visited San Francisco on the 4th May for 5 nights as part of a trip along with Hawaii and New York. Arrived tired 7 hours later than expected due to delayed flight, we were checked in very efficiently and in a friendly manner and went to our renovated room on the 23rd floor. The beds were the most comfortable I have slept in ( I have a memory foam at home and it was better than mine). Elaine at the concierge desk booked trips for us and went out of her way to be helpful and friendly, visited the restaurant on 36th floor, views fantastic and cocktails in bar good too. Would certainly stay here again and highly recommend a visit

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for a week from April 16. We had a great stay. We arrived at the hotel around 11pm and check in was swift. The location was very convinient. Starbucks is just across the street, Walgreens is a block away and Chinatown is close by. Shopping is all over. The hallways to the rooms were nicely decorated. The newly renovated rooms were a bit small but comfortable. I like the way the bathrooms were done. I read in one review that it was alittle noisy especially if you stayed in rooms facing Sutter. Well, when we were there we had that problem the night after we arrived the rest of nights was quiet. I think it was also because they were fixing the roads outside and they were working at night. The all staffs very very friendly and helpful. I haven't had a chance to check out the coffee shop on the top floor but I heard it has great views of the city. We also used the internet. We had to pay for it but the connections were ok.

My wife and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 5 nights at the end of April 2011. We were dealt with by a very professional and friendly member of staff who checked us in and welcomed us. We were given a renovated room on the 11th floor which overlooked Union Square. The renovated rooms are brilliant. Extremely clean and modern with lots of nice little touches to make your stay comfortable. We had a room with 1 king bed which provided 5 of the best nights sleep I have ever had. Whilst I never saw one of the older rooms, I would definitely request one of the renovated rooms when you check in. Location is perfect with easy access to the main bus and street car routes on Market Street and also the Cable Cars. It is also right in the centre of the main shopping areas with Macys over the square and Westfield Mall about a 10 minute walk.We went to the 36th floor bar on our last night for cocktails and the views are stunning. We got a seat in the window and was there just in time to see the last bit of the sun sinking into the bay. The drinks were pretty good too!!Throughout our stay, whenever we needed anything, I found the staff to be helpful, efficient and extremely polite. I would definitely recommend this hotel and if I am ever fortunate enough to be back in beautiful San Francisco, I will stay at the Grand Hyatt.

Located just off union square, location great, nice view but a bit pricey but maybe thats just San Francisco prices. Food and drinks in the bar good but bit expensive but nice bar and great view of the city and Alcatraz.Room service breakfast was lovely, good size room and bathroom and very clean.Had to pay for wireless internet which I think was a bit unfair given the price we paid for the room. Free wireless internet would have increased the rating I give here

My husband and I spent 3 nights in this hotel as part of our honeymoon. We had a room on the 29th floor so we had a fantastic view of the city. We did think at first that the room, although clean, was in need of modernisation. It then became apparent at around 7.30am the next morning that the hotel was being renovated when we were awoken by drilling and banging from either the floor above or the floor below. Not exactly perfect for a honeymoon destination! We mentioned the noise at reception and were told that the workmen did not usually start until 9am so we were asked to call down and ask to speak to the manager the next day if the noise started earlier than this. There was no noise the next day which was fine. However, on our last morning, the drilling noise and associated banging began at 7.45 and was so loud that eventually I felt that I had to leave the room without drying my hair or packing my suitcase properly. We complained at reception once more and were offered lunch or dinner as compensation. As we are from the Uk, this was completely unsuitable and after checking with her supervisor, the receptionist kindly refunded us for one night's stay. Although we had a less than comfortable experience at this hotel, I think we were just unlucky. The modernised floors look great and the location is perfect. The fact that we were here on honeymoon made our experience worse. Had either of us been on business, we would have left the room before the renovation work began so would have been unaffected by it.

It was our first stay in San Francisco and wow what an impression it left. from the moment we arrived we were well looked after. The receptionist was great and gave us a lovely room, the card machine wasn't working at the time so couldn't give us a key to our room but arranged a member of staff to take us to the room and let us in. The room itself was gorgeous, on the 30th floor with great views. The room was spotlessly clean and each day the housekeeping team done a wonderful job to maintain this fact. The conciege team were FANTASTIC! they recommended some great places to eat, told us how to get around and answered all our questions... and we had quite a few. I can not thank them enough and the whole Hyatt team for a fantastic stay.

We chose the lowest rate and got a beautiful room, 16th floor, over Union Square. The remodeling is well done, loved the unusual panels, in place of sheer curtains, and the automated shades. The built in bed headboards and built in desk/tv/etc... made much better use of the space that in the old-style rooms and gave more room to move around.The front desk and concierge staff were courteous and efficient, and our phone requests for extra things were filled immediately.We found the hotel perfect in every way, and the location cannot be beat.

This is by far one of the worst Hyatt's. Yes, they are renovating their rooms - this is long overdue for this hotel. The level of customer service is not up to par with the other Grand Hyatt's I have stayed at. The management approach at this property is clearly different from the others. The front desk staff is the worst. They appear to really care less about whether you have an enjoyable stay or not. Renovated room or not, the walls are paper thin and you very likely will not be getting a good nights sleep. I am a Diamond Member with Hyatt and always try to stay at Hyatt to maintain my status. Not here though...I've switched to the Fairmont on Nob Hill. Fantastic hotel, great service, and great location.

The hotel was in a great location, the room was very nice and comfortable, and the staff excelled at customer service. Elaine the concierge helped us book a fantastic napa trip after the one I booked online canceled the evening before. The rest of the staff genuinely cared to make sure we were happy. The thirty sixth floor restaurant and bar had awesome views of the city. The gym is on the next floor down and had the same views with brand new equipment.

The location of the Grand Hyatt is just about perfect. The newly updated rooms are done very well. They obviously paid attention to how people travel today. There are very adequate and accessible places to plug in electronics, an iHome station to recharge and use your iPhone, a safe which accommodates a laptop, a mini fridge and toothpaste as an amenity in the bathroom. The new furnishings are comfortable an having the shade electronically controlled from the bedside is great. The only downside to the hotel is that it's really only a place to sleep. But everything you could want is close by (restaurants, shopping, spas etc). The restaurant/lounge on the top floor needs an update. It has great potential with its beautiful views. It's definitely my go to hotel in San Francisco.

We were at the 12th floor, I liked the view from our room. The room was totally renovated, bath was beautiful, very modern, the bed was comfy, the staff was very kind and helpful. The location is great, but you can hear the street noise during the night. It was a great week, thank you for everything! :)

Agree with an earlier poster about requesting renovated rooms ONLY. This is an older property and therefore has it ups/downs. The location is great - only one block off Union Square and four blocks from the BART Station (which means you can come in from the airport for $8.10 instead of a $40 cab ride). The renovated rooms have all new furnishings, although the bathroom design is indicative of a renovation (small, tight). You can hear some noise through the walls, but you'll still sleep well due to the new beds. The lobby and elevators look worn, but once you arrive on your renovated floor it will be like stepping into a new hotel. The Executive Lounge was beautiful and had a breakfast serving fit for a king - definitely one of the nicest lounges I've seen in a long time. I would stay here again, but this time will request a renovated room upon making a reservation!

I stayed here for 3 weeknights in March 2011. At that time the hotel was undergoing renovations in places. I was given the choice of a renovated room or a room with a great view. I took the view (30th floor of 36). The room did indeed have a great view toward the bay and financial district but it did need some modernization. Tube TV, dated curtains, worn dressers/doors, straight shower curtain bar, and worn carpeting were some of the items needing an update. However, everything worked, the bed was comfortable, the shower had great pressure and plenty of hot water, and the room was quiet. So for this yet-to-be-renovated room the pluses outweighed the minuses.I had a car and parked it in a garage around the corner from the hotel for $35/day which is high but not as much as the hotel valet service. That garage by the way, is clean and the attendants are courteous and professional.The restaurant on the top floor has fantastic views of the city and beyond. The service was top notch and not rushed if you didn't want to be rushed. The full breakfast buffet with gratuity was $22-$24 which was about the same price as a late evening burger, beer, and gratuity.Lots of dining of all types within a five minute walk - Starbucks across the street, cafes on Union Square 1/2 block away, Lori's Diner (50s theme) is a block or so away, and many others.Overall a very nice hotel and I'd recommend it to anyone.

When I book a hotel, I look for one thing: value for my dollar. I got all I could ask for and more from the Grand Hyatt. The service was amazing. We brought our bags to the Hyatt at 7am to be stowed for the day while we did some sightseeing, but the front desk told us that they would go ahead and give us a room so we could get settled in.We had a wonderful view of Union Square, and the bed was very comfortable. I definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone seeking high-class treatment and service at an affordable and reasonable price! (Especially in San Francisco!)
This was a great hotel. Great service! Great rooms! Great Value! Great View! Great location!!! Will stay again at the right price!! Hehehe

We checked in and they held our bags right away when we came back in they took our bags right up and our rooms were newly renovated with huge king beds...even more amazing was the dark curtain to keep out light and the bathroom vanity..we discovered our bathroom door was off track so they send someone right up to fix it. I had gotten two rooms because we went with friends and had the room joined so a moment after we checked in the slid a paper under our friends door and it was information on 9 different web sited where my friend could replace her broken handle on her vintage suitcase. We were very impressed from the in room safes to the coffee set up and the amazing use of space. The only issue was not being told they were putting a hold on my card for 25 dollars on each room which took 4 days to fall off my account but other then that small snafu the entire trip was perfect I would recommend this place to anyone wanting a lovely room and a great location...

Imagine a panoramic view of San Francisco from the 36th Floor of this Grand Hyatt hotel. Add a club atmosphere, intimate bar and grill with yummy burgers and refeshing wine; Dining on the same floor includes a separate dining room for breakfast brunch, lunch and full menu dinner. Attentive and polite servers put you at ease. Located near great shopping, this hotel has our vote for return visits. Enjoy!

I have stayed in many hotels in San Fran on business trips, this is one of the best, especially for the price. I hate big cities, they are loud! When you are trying to sleep this is especially ANNOYING!! I only stayed one night, but missing at night here were the loud sirens, jack hammers and yelling people I am used to hearing in SF. I forgot my iphone charger, but after a couple beers and some great chowder at the restaurant (didn't have a great food selection) on the 36th floor I realized the phone had an ipod charger attached to the back of the in-room phone! Hopefully they have all of the rooms upgraded soon because I doubt the others had this. The phones even have speakers so you can play your ipod. The beds headboard had reading lights attached. Didn't use the gym but it appears they will get you gym clothes if you need them. FOrget toothpaste? Its provided in the bathroom. There is A LOT of shopping near. Worst part of this hotel was thin walls. I could hear high heels clomping around and my neighbors ironing board being opened and closed.

We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Easy walk to great restaurants, the cable cars, the best shopping and local sights around the city. You would think that at the prices they charge you would get free wireless - oh well. We had a recently renovated and stylishly decorated room, overlooking Union Square. Our only issue with the room was the bathroom door (sliding door) which did little to offer privacy from the rest of the others in the room. Otherwise, the bed and the pillows were really comfortable and the room was, well roomy. The lounge on the top floor had a great view and the muchie menu was really good.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco on the 5th of March 2011, and I can't praise them enough. The location couldn't be better, as it is very central and close to many local attractions. When I arrived, my room had not been cleaned, but the staff was incredibly helpful and friendly, and upgraded me to a bigger room at no extra charge. The room itself was extremely nice and comfortable, the view from the 26th floor was great, and I slept really well in the extra comfy bed. The Club provided me with a lovely breakfast the next morning. I would like to thank all the staff that I was in contact with for being so helpful and friendly, and I would particularly like to thank Mr John Satre from the Concierge Desk for his kindness and all his extra help. My stay at the Hyatt was excellent in every way, and I will definitely choose this hotel again in the future, as well as recommending it to friends. Thank you for everything!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We were in one of the newly renovated rooms, and they were beautiful. Being on a lower floor left us with a mediocre view, but having a renovated room made up for it. Great service in every area of the hotel. Did not try out the restaurant, lounge, or fitness area, but the front desk staff was courteous, as were the gentlemen outside in valet and cab service. Booked through priceline for a great price. No complaints!

Hotel rooms are being renovated now. Therefore some of them (already renovated ones) are absolutely great and the old ones are... well, really old (furniture and all interior, bathrooms, conditioning system, etc.) especially when you've seen the others. Location and service are totally great, it's just a huge diffeence that you can get for the same value.

We decided to spend a long weekend in San Francisco based on a great rate we found at the Grand Hyatt. The location is amazing! We took BART in from the airport and the hotel was an easy two-block walk from the Powell Station. Itâ€™s right on Union Square, making it close to all of the shopping in that area. Itâ€™s one block from the cable car and just a five minute walk from Chinatown. Itâ€™s a very short cab ride from the restaurants in North Beach or the sights in Fishermanâ€™s Wharf. The sidewalks around the hotel were draped in scaffolding, which was a bit of a drag. They mustâ€™ve been doing some sort of renovations or other work to the exterior. The lobby is a bit dark and drab. Nothing special and certainly not inviting. The front desk agents, while extremely friendly and helpful, were slow. We frequently noticed long lines waiting for service, even with several agents working.But the room was quite comfortable and provided a great place to stay. The hotel is currently undergoing interior renovations. From what we were told by the front desk staff and what we saw, the lower floors have already been renovated. Since we requested a view, we were on an upper floor which had not yet been renovated. So for now, you can choose between a great view or a renovated room, but it appears that you canâ€™t have both. When the elevator stopped on the renovated floors, they appear to have been completely overhauled â€“ new flooring, wall coverings, furnishings, lighting, etc. If the hallway is any indication, the newly renovated rooms must be amazing.Though our room had not yet been renovated, it was still very comfortable. They furniture and some of the fixtures are a bit tired, but Hyattâ€™s Grand Bed provides for a great nightâ€™s sleep. And ultimatelyâ€_ thatâ€™s really all we needed out of the hotel. We had a city view â€“ our room looked right across into the financial district. In fact, we even slept with the curtains open, lulled to sleep by the soft lights of the cityâ€™s skyline. That skyline also provided the perfect backdrop for the lounge on the upper floor. The workout facility was awesome â€“ again, taking advantage of that amazing view. Though it didnâ€™t have showers, or a steam room/sauna/Jacuzzi, it was the most well stocked hotel gym Iâ€™ve ever seen. Every piece of cardio equipment you could imagine, along with weight machines, free weights, benches, exercise balls, TVs, towels, etc. Very easy to get in a complete workout, no matter what your routine.As platinum members, we enjoyed free WiFi in our room. I didnâ€™t notice what the normal charge is, but Iâ€™m sure itâ€™s exorbitant. The connection was a bit slow, but it worked for what we needed. Had I been trying to work with that connection, it couldâ€™ve been somewhat frustrating. We never ate at the hotel, nor did we park there, so I canâ€™t speak to those aspects. There didnâ€™t appear to be anywhere to get coffee in the lobby. And it was excruciatingly slow and very difficult to get a cab for dinner on a Friday night. Thatâ€™s certainly not the fault of the hotel, but something worth noting if youâ€™re seeking a cab.All things considered, the Grand Hyatt was certainly not the nicest place weâ€™ve ever stayed, but it was comfortable, safe and you canâ€™t beat the location. It was a great base for our long weekend in San Francisco.

The Grand Hyatt's newly renovated rooms are really nice, have a very contemporary feel. Really liked the style, feels like a brand new hotel. Location can't be beat. It was raining the whole time we were there but walks to so many things were short so we didn't mind. Had breakfast at the Grandviews restaurant. Really good foot, nice portions, with spectacular views.

My sister surprised me with a stay at the Grand Hyatt when she took me to San Francisco for my first time. The front desk agent that helped us, Mylene, did a fabulous job getting us into a fantastic room that we really enjoyed. Beautiful views and extra comfortable beds made our stay really fun! The concierge got us on the preferred waiting list at the Cheesecake Factory for dinner (super convenient!) and we loved falling asleep looking at the lights of the city from our room. The only thing that bothered me was the amount of time I was placed on hold when I had to call the front desk a few times. I work at a resort myself, so I know the importance of answering guest's calls. Also, parking costs a fortune so we ended up using the Macy's lot down the way and there is no pool (for the price paid there should be one) These were only instances where I felt the Grand Hyatt could've improved. I would not let that stop me from staying at this hotel though - no major complaints, try it out!

When an out of town guest tells the front desk that they did not sleep well because of certain situations in the room, the response should not be " wear earplugs" the staff not only represents the entire hyatt brand but also the city they are in. Grand hyatt San Francisco did a POOR job of representing the hyatt name and the city of San Francisco. Any guest who tells a hotel staff that they have a problem should be addressed " how can I make your stay more comfortable" or " I'm sorry you had a problem let me see what we can do for you" Not met with a Rude response. I, my co-workers, company, Family and Friends will no longer consider hyatt hotels as a viable choice of stay.

I had a meeting planned in San Francisco at the Grand Hyatt in January. It also happened to be my 35th wedding anniversary weekend. So my wife and I had our two sons join us from NYC to celebrate. San Francisco and the hotel were wonderful but our concierge Elizabeth Baca-Pryfogle made our trip one to remember. She recommended a great restaurant based on her personal experience. The next day we came back from a tour of Alcatraz to find a bottle of champagne with a note attached wishing us a happy anniversary and the following day she sent a fruit basket for us to enjoy. Although she was very busy she took the time to treat us like we were family. If you go to San Francisco stay at the Grand Hyatt and go see Elizabeth she is amazing.Virgil, Terri, Nick & Stephen

Our impressions with the hotel started before we arrived: super-helpful reservation staff who helped us with all of our questions and requests.We arrived Christmas afternoon with 2 sick children (the long haul from Sydney had taken it's toll), but our room was beautiful (super-comfy beds). Furthermore, one of the lovely staff, who happily took table photos at our Christmas dinner in the restaurant), took in the fact that our oldest child barely ate due to illness and did not charge us for his meal.Every single staff person we came across smiled and said hello. Front Desk & Concierge were fantastic.And the location? Terrific! Wish we were back there now!

I stayed one night at the end of January. It was a Monday night so I was easily upgraded to a room with a view of the city. The reception staff was very polite and ultra obliging. The room was small with two double beds. Walking in the room was difficult due to too much furntiure in the room which led to a cramped feeling. There was a large armoire jutting into the room with an old fashioned TV. There was also a place for the mini bar but no mini bar. The two club chairs were too large for the room also. The beds were very comfortable though. The bath towels however were threadbare at best. They were so bad it was funny. As I was checking out my daughter struck up a conversation with a manager who told her the hotel was in the midst of a renovation and only half of the rooms were completed. Obviously not ours.Breakfast at the restaurant on top of the hotel was wonderful. The food on the buffet was fresh and delicious. The real treat was the view. This restaurant and bar at night have 360 degree views of the city. The morning we were there the weather was sunny and clear, so the city was beautiful

We recently stayed at this property in late January for 5 nights. The trip was 3 days of business and two days of sightseeing. I can't say enough wonderful things about the entire stay or staff. It started wth the very gracious check in for a room with a wonderful view of the bay and Alcatraz.The room was wonderful, clean, comfortable nicely furnished (and this wasn't one of the brand new renovated rooms) I understand they are renovating the hotel and rooms. However this room was nearly perfect. The highlight for me was breakfast each morning in the Grandviews restaurant on the 36th floor. The breakfast buffet is awesome and the breakfast staff was so friendly each day, even offered me help with directions when they saw me looking at a map at the table.Joanna at the concierge desk is one of the most hospitable and helpful individuals I've run into in the hospitality industry. She offered great selections of restaurants and sights to see and helped arrange tickets for the alcatraz and bus tours.The location of the hotel is perfect for just about anything. I had a short 5 minute walk to my conference hotel each day, my fiance spent her free time walking all over the city. From Union Square to The Embarcodaro, to Westfields Shopping. She felt comfortable the entire time and never felt in danger or worried.We hope to go back to San Francisco when we have more time to visit and we will certainly not consider any other hotel.

I stayed at the Grand Hyatt for approx. 140 USD/night in a room with two queen beds (corporate rate). Nothing special, but a good deal for San Francisco. Bathroom was okay (US standard). The location cannot be better in my opinion, as you always come across MacyÂ´s on your way to Moscone Center. The room was clean and looked after quite well. The beds are very comfortable with thick mattrasses. Good value.

The renovation that's going on with the hotel is fantastic. Rooms are now fresh and very comfortable. With regards to available space in the room it's very spacious (compared to other SF hotels). There is now a blackout blind over the main windows, in place of heavy blinds, and you will easily sleep late with how dark it makes everything. Nicely done Hyatt

The hotel is in a great location right in Union Square, but that pretty much summed up all the good things I had to say about it.I have stayed at at least 10 different Grand Hyatts around the world, without counting the Park Hyatt stays, so it's safe to say that I know what the Grand Hyatt standards should be.As a Hyatt GPP Diamond member, I have always been guaranteed room upgrade to the next room category with welcome fruit baskets and wine and a personal note from the GM of the hotel already in the room before I check in almost every time I visit a Hyatt property. I might have been spoiled, but when I do spend so much time and money in their hotels I definitely expect more than average service and treatment. I wasn't quite impressed with the room assignment at check-in already. I was assigned a very small room that is not on the Club floor at first and didn't even get Club Lounge access. Front desk staff didn't seem to have any clue about my membership status until I inquired about it. I would expect that they should have been able to pull out this information from their system.Rooms are old and definitely require remodeling which I understand is underway. I have taken a look at both the renovated and non-renovated rooms and eventually picked the old room for the better view as the renovated room looked out to the back of the adjacent building.Room amenities were next to nonexistent. I had to call housekeeping to request for very basic amenities such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, slippers and bathrobes, which are normally complimentary in a Grand Hyatt elsewhere.Housekeeping was sloppy. The ironing board was left in the bathroom throughout the entire duration of our stay after we used it on the first day. The iron was left next to the sink in the bathroom and was not put away after our use. The half-empty takeout coffee from the Club Lounge was left on the top of the cabinet in my room for days until I disposed it myself.One day I left the "Private" sign on the door before I headed out and when I came back to the room that evening my room was cleaned up nonetheless. If I requested for privacy, I would expect the housekeeping staff to first confirm with me whether the sign was left there intentionally before breaking into my room while I wasn't there.The walls were paper thin. I could hear conversations going on in my neighbours' rooms and every morning I was woken up at 6am when the guests next door got up.I stayed at the St Regis during my last visit to SF a few months ago and I didn't have any of the problems I mentioned above, granted I'm also Platinum SPG member. Most importantly, I felt that I was treated like a valued guest while I was staying at the St Regis which is what every hotel should strive to achieve.My overall experience at Grand Hyatt SF was more like that of a no frills hotel, except I paid a lot more than what I would have had to pay for Motel 6. The top management of this hotel seems to have little appreciation of what managing a Grand Hyatt property should mean to the guests. Understand the hotel is undergoing a major upgrade on the hardware but I would suggest management also consider improving on their software so that the service and overall experience would be on par with the rest of the Grand Hyatt properties.

I took my daughter and her four friends to San Francisco for her 18th birthday. For the girls, we booked an executive suite, which was large (2 doubles and a queen sofa bed + two bathrooms) on the 20th floor with an unbelievable view. We had dinner in the Grandview Restaurant. The food was good, not exception, but the waiters were top notch. Some of us had steak, which was cooked to perfection. Needless to say, the view from the restaurant was spectacular. My daughter wasn't feeling well, so they made her chicken soup - very thoughtful.All rooms were very clean. The staff were all friendly and courteous. Everyone seemed to go out of their way to make sure our stay was wonderful. They are renovating some of the downstairs of the hotel, but it had no impact on us at all.We have stayed here a few times and have always had a wonderful time. They now really have my loyalty after handling my daughter's party so well, especially while she wasn't feeling the best. The following day we had a color consultation with Donna Fujii. The girls took their color fans with them shopping for the rest of the trip. It was a wonderful weekend to remember!

First time at the hotel and will stay here in future on visits to San Francisco. We have stayed in some others in the past, but this is by fart he best for location, service and comfort. The most comfortable bed I have ever slept in and the bay views from the room were just amazing and allowed us to enjoy the New Year fireworks. The overall service from the staff was very good and the check in was quick and easy, just what you need after travelling for 14 / 15 hours. Really loved the hotel and love the city, its the best place in the world! Thanks

Perfect location for first timers to SF. Loved the shopping nearby and the trams that were so close.The room was more then adequate in size with 2 double beds and good size bathroom facilities. The Wifi was a little expensive. But overall very enjoyable..

Its a good Hyatt with all that entails. Excellent serice and a great loaction in San Fran. Rooms are maybe getting a little dated and I never undertand why the bathtubs are so small in the States but hey ho. I stay in this Hotel every year for a few days before heading onwards. Great connections for the airport, great shopping location, away from the tourist tat of Fishermans Wharf and plenty of good restraunts nearby.

I had an amazing stay at Grand Hyatt San Francisco earlier this week. After a busy week at work I just wanted to get a way and relax and enjoy the city. I went to the hotel with my dog and I had a fabulous time. Everything about the hotel was perfect from the time I arrived at the front drive until I checked out of the hotel. Customer service at this hotel is exceptional. Mylene and Ron at the front desk are awesome. They went out of their way to make sure my pet and I had a perfect stay. My dog was so excited when she entered the room, there were doggie treats and doggie bowls and very nice comfortable bed for her. Housekeeping staff did a fantastic job taking care of the room and my stay was perfect. I will make sure to tell all my friends Grand Hyatt San Francisco.

San Francisco was our first stop in our four-weeks U.S. vacation for husband, I and our two kids. We chose Grand Hyatt and really love this hotel. We stayed here two years ago and this time we were given their newly renovated rooms. They are nicely done, with flat screen tv, functional workdesk and extremely comfortable and spacious twin beds. Love the location. Easy access to all the main shops - Macys, Neimann Marcus, Bloomingdales and many more. The Grand Club lounge at this hotel has a small but nice buffet and evening spreads. Worth paying the difference, especially if you are travelling with two kids. Reception staff, housekeeping and especially the doormen were very friendly and extremely helpful.

Above average rooms with great views. Bathrooms need work but if you are going away on businsess this is my favorite hotel in the city so far. Everything you need is right around the corner and service is great.

This was the second time in 2 yrs that we stayed here. It is located right off Union Square so one can walk to SFMOMA, Westfield Mall & all the galleries & upscale shopping in and around Union Square. We booked room early because it was Thanksgiving week. The rate was lower than at the nearby Hilton & smaller, lower quality hotels surrounding Union Sq & it included very good buffet or cooked to order breakfast on the 36 floor with a great view of SF, Golden Gate, etc. Staff were all personable, knowledgeable and efficient. There is a full-time concierge to answer your questions rather than just front desk clerks. Room had all the amenities except they have not put in flat screen TV yet. There was some exterior construction around the front entrance but there was no disruption or noise. We still don't understand why inexpensive hotels provide free WiFi &/or ethernet, but more expensive chains charge >$10/day for internet connection.

My original reservation rate at my conference rate was not "captured" by the hotel computer, they called it a computer glitch but they did have my check in and out dates. I did have my confirmation so they reluctantly agreed to honor that price. They also charged me for an extra night because again there was a computer "Glitch" and they did not receive my check in change date that I did have a confirmation for. Again they reluctantly removed the extra charge. That was settled the first night I was there, or so I thought. The higher rate and exra night stayed on my credit card for the 4 days I was there and I had to go over all of the hassles when I checked out and they still billed me for everything they were supposed to remove. You must review all of the charges before you leave!! And always have your confirmation! Otherwise the hotel is located in a great spot for shopping and public transportation. The conference facility was great, no problems there and the food was excellent! Don't suggest the hotel restaurant though, overpriced average tasting food.

We are frequent visitors here. We went down to shop for Christmas on 12/3. Building is being refurnished to update rooms. Hope they do a good job for reasons posted on this board. Noise was not a problem. Cannot beat the location for shopping purposes. After Fairmont, Carnelian Room, and Hilton closed their top floor restaurants/bars, the Grand Hyatt is one of the few left with Mark Hopkins. BUT we heard a rumor they want to move the restaurant to ground level. We had very good staff services this trip. Agree with comments that this has always been geared as a business hotel. Wish they would have coffee out in the morning instead of forcing everyone across the street to Starbucks.

I am a loyal Hyatt fan and had read recent reviews so knew this would not be a great stay this time but I was so disappointed.We arrived in a taxi and had quite a bit of luggage.There was no one to help us.So we dragged our luggage into the front foyer.Front desk were abrupt, unfriendly and not helpful.Rooms were OKClub staff were great! The hotel is in a great position but I doubt I will stay here again.

If you want to be close to Union Square this is perfect! However, the towels were thin and scratchy; even on higher level floors street noise was quite apparent. Noisy air condictioning system and worse yet- the room CREAKED all night in a bad rain storm! The bed linens were VERY clean and comfortable. This facility is in need of a remodel which they have started. We were not made aware of the remodel until check-in as well as the subsequent noise. Requests for adjoining rooms and a refrigerator were not accomodated. The highlight of the hotel is the 36th floor bar! The food was quite good, staff was very attentive and pleasant- wonderful views! Overall, hotel staff were not very warm and welcoming. Concierge staff were very helpful. Wiould I recommend? possibly....

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt in San Francisco to enjoy a nice "4 Star" hotel. What we got was lucky to be even a 3 Star experience that made a Motel 6 so much more appealing!First off, the hotel rooms are small and, as many have said, very outdated. This we could understand, San Francisco has limited space and obviously they can't expand outwards. So it was already expected for the size.BUT... what wasn't expected was the quality of the building and bed. We never thought we'd say this, but can't they afford to buy a new mattress? At an average of $200 a night for a room, you'd figure on sleeping on a comfortable mattress and not something that looks like it's been there since they opened the hotel 40 years ago. The king-size mattress had giant pits (I'd like to say dips, but they were way too deep) on both sides of the bed where people lay each evening. Only by placing one of the extra pillows into each crevice could the bed be made level to sleep on. This was TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE for a hotel of this quality!! Come on, the mattress could have been replaced for the cost of a single night's stay. Not worthy of a so-called "4 Star" hotel.And the building... sure, it's a high-rise 36 story building and is bound to sway in the wind. But we were kept awake by the constant creeking, snapping and popping sounds that it made as it swayed in the breeze. We were waiting for the final loud pop before it collapsed on us. Other guests in the bar also complained of the same loud noises. Perhaps a building inspector should take a look before something bad happens?Then there was the refrigerator and mini-bar. If you're going to stay in the room expecting to use the refrigerator, think again. It was packed top to bottom with beer, soda and wines that if moved at all, you're IMMEDIATELY charged for. That's one high tech refrigerator.. but they can't even put in a flat screen tv? We called the front desk and they were very nice and said to go ahead and remove bottles to make the room we needed and they'd remove them off our bill. They did, no problem (at least not yet, we have not seen our credit card statement). The mini-bar lady came by before checkout to review the contents and noticed one bottle missing in the door of the refrigerator. We figured it was the only place they left for someone to put a drink, but apparently it wasn't fully stocked and was missing a bottle of wine. Good thing we found out, it was also removed from our bill. Note to those wanting a drink.. it's $9.00 for a can of beer. The shelves on the dresser/TV unit were also dedicated to fast grab snacks, so don't expect to use it for storing your clothes. They had mouse-trap like devices with candy bars in them. We'd hate to see the prices for those!!Everyone from the staff was very nice, unlike some comments we read on here. Staff made it feel like a 4-5 Star hotel, but the room was maybe a 2 Star, bar was okay and fitness gym was up to date.Now for parking... we didn't pay the $50+ parking fee for the hotel parking. Instead, we parked across the street at the Sutter-Stockton garage and paid a fraction the price the hotel wanted to charge. We arrived around 1 p.m. on Saturday and left at noon on Sunday. Paid only $28 parking. We highly recommend the Sutter-Stockton public parking garage. It's just a short walk and is diagonally across from the hotel.

The Grand Hyatt San Francisco would be a fantastic hotel in a lot of other cities in the world. Unfortunately, it's in San Francisco.I travel frequently to San Francisco, and have stayed frequently at other hotels; however, needing a one-night stay I decided to try out the Grand Hyatt. I should admit that there was nothing particularly wrong with my stay -- I had a perfectly adequate room on a high floor, with a nice view.However, as a Hyatt Diamond, I wasn't particularly impressed with the room -- based on the room map, it appears to have been one of the smallest in the hotel, and though high up, it wasn't on the same floor as the Grand Club. Furnishings were high quality, but a bit tired, with a worn counter in the bath. The bed was comfortable, and the room was very quiet. I didn't get a chance to check out the Grand Club, but it's not on the top floor of the hotel, which costs it a few points in my book. The cocktail lounge, which is on the top floor, has a nice northerly view of Coit Tower and the Transamerica, but it's kind of tight, and noisy, and the music from the private event next door kept intruding. Staff everywhere was pleasant, but not exceptional.All in all, I'd be perfectly happy with this property if there weren't so many other good options in the area. However, the Hyatt Regency is nicer for Hyatt loyalists, and the Westin is a better hotel in Union Square if you're a Starwood elite. And at the northeast corner of Union Square, it's a bit of a hike to transit compared to other nearby properties. So at the end of the day -- stay here if you get a deal, and you'll be perfectly happy, but don't pay a premium for the Grand Hyatt name.

We arrived at the hotel and found it surrounded by scaffolding but it did not put us off at all. We had booked a Bay View room but when we arrived the reception staff suggested that we have a City view room. We took their advice which was lucky really as the Bay was obscured for most of our stay by fog/low cloud. The city view from the 22nd floor was magnificent, especially at night.The room and hotel was spotlessly clean, the staff were very courteous, very helpful and knowledgeable.The hotel was very quiet where ever you went which was great so it was very easy to get a good nights sleep.We flew with Virgin and got two free nights which meant the hotel was very good value for money, if not cheap. However, if you factor in the location and quality of the hotel we were pleased overall.My only gripe was that I thought the bathroom should have been larger but that's me just being picky.I've kept the best until last. On the top floor of the hotel you'll find the restaurant and bar. The views are to die for.I would highly recommend this hotel.

S Fco has three Hyatt hotels. The Grand Hyatt is the oldest I believe and it shows.Everything - rooms, facilities is just adequate. Location is great, just a step from Union Square, a couple of blocks to Market St to the nearest BART (Bay Area Rapid Transport) station. The no.30 bus takes you to Fishermans Wharf/Ghirardelli - as senior it cost me all of 75 cts.Cons: Breakfast buffet is overpriced (w/tips/ tax close to $30) and below standards of other Hyatt hotels I've stayed in. Go one block towards Chinatown and you'll find the Cafe de la Presse - great.Hotel has no pool, hot tub etc. There is no food other than breakfast, not even a sandwich but rooms have a bar fridge where you can keep some stuff if you take the cans etc out..S Fco is not great on corner shops, the nearest 7/11 is a couple of blocks away. Don't try to make tea with the coffeee maker- it will taste nothing like, I missed the plain kettle we have in any Australian hotel.Rates in Nov.2010 about US 200 (1-2 people)Internet - wired & wireless will cost you $10/day - cross street to Starbucks and you can log in for free.Finally, staff is very nice, friendly and helpful.

Wow-- not what I expected from a Hyatt. The rooms are way tacky/80s decor. Rooms are small, and while the views are nice, the windows are cramped due to the non-functional balconies blocking part of your view. This is definitely NOT how hotels are built today.There was a strange odor in our room as well as in the lobby. Like incense. I think they were covering up for something else. Our room also smelled like a smoker's room at times.Service was fine-- friendly and nice. $10/day for wi-fi? really?Was very disappointed b/c I know there are lots of better places to stay for the same price in town. Oh well.

This will be our 4th stay this year (another scheduled) at the Grand Hyatt in Union Square, and wanted to let all the "TA viewers" know that this hotel is still pleasant and comfortable enough for us to continue to patronize ... we've stayed at many other SF hotels, including the Hyatt Regency, the Meridian, the Hiltons, etc... The Grand Hyatt is not THE BEST, but does the job = convenient, comfortable, service. There are some good and some sorta bad ... please read on:The Goods: Service. During one stay, I requested a high floor, got it, and the views were very nice. We wanted a non-connecting room, and requested a change ... and Sebastian/Night Manager was terrific in helping move us to a different room, even upgrading us. Thank you Sebastian! The new view cleared all the surrounding buildings, and had a nice Northern view of SF Bay & Coit Tower. Comfort: The room was comfortable, as expected ... clean, with a very comfortable bed, and very quiet. Convenient: Union Square shopping and Chinatown, along with all sorts of transportation options were right outside the hotel. The 'bads': The hotel is clearly primarily a business/convention hotel. If you're looking for an intimate, warm, elegant, trendy or boutique/small hotel ... forget it! The staff was however, generally nice, and greeted us always. Make no mistake though ... this is the classic large, downtown business hotel (approx 36 floors), with a 'ga-jillion' rooms along with a semi-large gym/fitness center (no pool), as well as ballrooms/conference rooms, etc.. The rooms do need some updating: flat-screen TV needed, desk/table worn, aging tub, worn cabinets. It sounds worse than reality, so don't let this deter you (as many of the areas hotels have similar issues), but it's time for some updating.Overall: We didn't spend huge amounts of time in the room. We wanted to enjoy SF and surrounding areas. So, if all you need is a fairly comfortable, convenient hotel with enough amenities to make the stay enjoyable, you should be fine here. Get past the size, semi-warm staff, and basic-decorated rooms, you'll be fine. We recommend it for general use, but not necessarily for a romantic stay. PS - High speed internet free if Platinum member of their loyalty program.Happy Hotel-ing!

I am ALL about DEALS, COUPONS, etc. I try not to pay full price for just about anything. And this is my favorite deal that I take advantage of the most often! We live in Sacramento, so we go to San Francisco very often. Whether it's a weekend trip with just my husband and I, or just about anytime our family and friends come to visit-- we stay a night or two in San Fran. This is the BEST deal. Just "name your own price" on Priceline for Union Square in San Francisco. Keep it at the HIGHEST amount of stars. We've gotten weeknights for $80, weekends for $90-100. Their parking is way overpriced. If you're traveling with a handicap person (my mom is) parking is free! If not, park at a local garage for better pricing. The rooms are great, the service is great (ask the concierge in the lobby for advice and reservations!) It's walking distance from everything in Union Square. We LOVE it!!!! Ask for a room with a view!

absolutely wonderful views from grandviews on 36th floor. our room was on 23 floor and we had great view of city. staff were super helpful and friendly. everything is within easy reach and we would definately stay there again.definate praise for all staff.
Stayed on 20th floor overlooking Union Square. Great views from dining room and fitness center. Great fitness center! Would stay there on my next visit to SF.

Although the furniture in room 2109 was a tad dated and had worn areas, we found no real complaints except the pricey valet parking rate. Front desk staff were efficient, doormen very personable and valet speedy. Location is first rate and close to shopping.

We stayed in Grand Hyatt with my family in October 2010.Next to Union Square, the hotel is currently renovated, but this made no difference to our stay. Rooms are a bit outdated and need the renovation, but the hotel staff is in excellent location, staff are simply wonderful and this was one of the most value for money hotels I have stayed.Nothing negative to talk about, I would certainly stay there again and again and again (especially following renovations).

Jackhammers begin at 9 am, and the front desk treats us like we're unreasonable to want to sleep in on our vacation. Then a strange man leaps onto our balcony and begins painting it at 11 am with NO WARNING! We were supposed to stay a week and we're checking out today!

We have experienced the best of hospitality at Grand Hyatt and we wish all of you planning a visit to this hotel experience it too. I was surprised as well when I had reviews of this hotel earlier as they were not very positive, but absolutely it is an excellent place to be in. 1. proximity to the best shopping and restaurants.2. Wonderfully concierge. Very helpful and informative.3. Excellent Regency club lounge on 33 floor.4. Well connected to local sights.

This hotel is well located, but very tired. My room was very warn--almost everything was chipped, scuffed, or scratched. The bath products (maybe standard at hyatt in the US? Not in Asia/Australia) smelled disgusting, like artificial melon bubble gum. The location is very handy--but there are lots of hotels (at least 30) nearby, so this isn't such a selling point. The views are very nice, and the bones of the building are cool enough. I think this hotel could be amazingly renovated. I can easily imagine it becoming as hip as the Standard in New York. Even if it didn't take a hip turn, it could be brought up to speed with other better hyatts...probably with so many amazing hotels in SF, there just isn't demand for another top tier hotel in the current economy. Until it is renovated, I'll be sleeping (and eating) elsewhere when I visit San Francisco.

Have been guest at the Grand Hyatt for a couple of days in early May. The rooms in the upper follors are very large with a great view over Union Square and the skyline of Sand Francisco, which I really liked. But the hotel overall has not been too exciting and they also have forgotten about crediting me the Hyatt points, which I have earned there. As a private guest I would rather stay at another hotel around Union square for a fraction of the price.

We stayed one night at this hotel. It was in an excellent location for us to walk to so many different sites throughout the city. The room was well equiped with all the basics. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was very nice and helpful. Great views of the city from the restaurant at the top too.

My husband and I spent a few days here is September 2007. The hotel is nice and modern and the location is perfect. We walked everywhere! The staff is friendly and we would definitely stay here again.

Stayed here for 4 nights in September 2010. The location, just off Union Square, is excellent with Market Street just a few minutes away for access to the MUNI and BART transport systems. For shopaholics, loads of fine shops around. Plenty of restaurants in the immediate vicinity and Chinatown is barely a 5 minute walk away. The rooms were surprisingly large, with a fine, large comfortable bed. The standard of cleanliness and housekeeping was also good. We heard no street noise on the 26th floor, excepting occasional emergency vehicle sirens.
